
project<,>/ˈprɒdʒekt/<,>/ˈprɑːdʒekt/<,>n.工程/n.课题/n.作业<,>The new highway project will start next month.<,>新的高速公路工程将于下个月开工。<,>Our group is working on a science project.<,>我们小组正在做一个科学课题。<,>She spent all weekend finishing her art project.<,>她花了整个周末完成她的美术作业。<,>pro(向前)+ject(投掷)→向前投→规划的项目<,>reject(v.拒绝)/inject(v.注射)/object(n.物体)

intention<,>/ɪnˈtenʃn/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnʃən/<,>n.打算/n.意图<,>He announced his intention to resign.<,>他宣布了辞职的打算。<,>Her good intentions didn't lead to good results.<,>她的善意意图并未带来好结果。<,>I have no intention of changing my plans.<,>我没有改变计划的意图。<,>in(进入)+tent(伸展)+ion→内心的伸展→意图<,>attention(n.注意力)/invention(n.发明)/extension(n.延伸)

equivalence<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələns/<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələns/<,>n.等值/n.相等<,>There's no exact equivalence between the two currencies.<,>这两种货币之间没有完全等值。<,>The equivalence of their test scores surprised everyone.<,>他们考试成绩的相等性让所有人惊讶。<,>Scientists proved the chemical equivalence of the compounds.<,>科学家证明了这些化合物的化学等价性。<,>equi(相等)+val(价值)+ence→等值<,>ambivalence(n.矛盾心理)/prevalence(n.流行)/vigilance(n.警觉)

negotiate<,>/nɪˈɡəʊʃieɪt/<,>/nɪˈɡoʊʃieɪt/<,>v.谈判/v.协商/v.交涉<,>The union will negotiate with management tomorrow.<,>工会明天将与资方谈判。<,>She successfully negotiated a higher salary.<,>她通过协商获得了更高薪资。<,>We're negotiating the terms of the contract.<,>我们正在交涉合同条款。<,>neg(否定)+oti(空闲)+ate→不让空闲→忙着协商<,>navigate(v.导航)/mitigate(v.减轻)/irritate(v.激怒)

disappointing<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɔɪntɪŋ/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɔɪntɪŋ/<,>adj.令人失望的<,>The movie's ending was disappointing.<,>这部电影的结局令人失望。<,>His test results were disappointing compared to last time.<,>与上次相比，他的考试成绩令人失望。<,>The restaurant service was disappointing despite the high prices.<,>尽管价格高昂，餐厅服务却令人失望。<,>dis(否定)+appoint(任命)+ing→不被任命→失望的<,>appointing(adj.指定的)/disappointed(adj.感到失望的)/disappointment(n.失望)

alternative<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːnətɪv/<,>/ɔlˈtɝnətɪv/<,>n.代替品<,>We need to find an alternative energy source.<,>我们需要找到替代能源。<,>There's no alternative but to wait.<,>除了等待别无选择。<,>She chose the vegetarian alternative at the restaurant.<,>她在餐厅选择了素食替代品。<,>alter(改变)+native(本地的)→改变原本的→替代品<,>alternate(adj.交替的)/alteration(n.改变)/native(adj.本地的)

generous<,>/ˈdʒenərəs/<,>/ˈdʒɛnərəs/<,>adj.慷慨的<,>She's always generous with her time.<,>她总是慷慨地付出时间。<,>The generous donation helped build the new hospital wing.<,>慷慨的捐款帮助建造了医院新翼楼。<,>He gave a generous tip to the waiter.<,>他给了服务员丰厚的小费。<,>gener(产生)+ous(多)→产生很多→慷慨的<,>genius(n.天才)/genuine(adj.真实的)/generate(v.产生)

biological<,>/ˌbaɪəˈlɒdʒɪkəl/<,>/ˌbaɪəˈlɑːdʒɪkəl/<,>adj.生物的<,>Biological research has made great progress.<,>生物研究取得了巨大进展。<,>She studies biological sciences at university.<,>她在大学学习生物科学。<,>The museum has an interesting biological exhibit.<,>博物馆有个有趣的生物展览。<,>bio(生命)+log(学科)+ical→关于生命的学科→生物的<,>geological(adj.地质的)/psychological(adj.心理的)/ecological(adj.生态的)

strategy<,>/ˈstrætədʒi/<,>/ˈstrætədʒi/<,>n.策略/n.战略<,>The company needs a new marketing strategy.<,>公司需要新的营销策略。<,>His strategy for winning the game was brilliant.<,>他赢得比赛的策略很出色。<,>Military strategy requires careful planning.<,>军事战略需要周密计划。<,>strat(层)+egy(引导)→分层引导→策略<,>tactics(n.战术)/stratagem(n.计谋)/strategic(adj.战略的)
paradox<,>/ˈpærədɒks/<,>/ˈpærədɑːks/<,>n.悖论/n.自相矛盾<,>The statement 'I always lie' is a classic paradox.<,>“我总是说谎”是一个经典的悖论。<,>It's a paradox that standing is more tiring than walking.<,>站着比走路更累是一个矛盾的现象。<,>Her success is a paradox of hard work and luck.<,>她的成功是努力与运气并存的矛盾体。<,>para(旁边)+dox(观点)→矛盾观点<,>orthodox(adj.正统的)/paradigm(n.范例)  

primary<,>/ˈpraɪməri/<,>/ˈpraɪmeri/<,>adj.主要的/adj.基本的<,>Primary education is compulsory in most countries.<,>初级教育在大多数国家是强制性的。<,>The primary reason for his resignation was health issues.<,>他辞职的主要原因是健康问题。<,>Red, blue and yellow are primary colors.<,>红、蓝、黄是三原色。<,>prim(第一)+ary→首要的<,>preliminary(adj.初步的)/prime(adj.最好的)  

standpoint<,>/ˈstændpɔɪnt/<,>/ˈstændpɔɪnt/<,>n.立场<,>From an economic standpoint, the policy is flawed.<,>从经济角度来看，这个政策有缺陷。<,>Her standpoint on the issue was clearly stated.<,>她对这个问题的立场表述得很清楚。<,>We need to consider this from a historical standpoint.<,>我们需要从历史角度考虑这一点。<,>stand(站立)+point(点)→立足点<,>viewpoint(n.观点)/perspective(n.视角)  

grab<,>/ɡræb/<,>/ɡræb/<,>v.抢先/v.抢占/v.抢夺<,>He grabbed the last piece of cake.<,>他抢到了最后一块蛋糕。<,>The headline grabbed everyone's attention.<,>这个标题吸引了所有人的注意。<,>Let's grab a coffee before the meeting.<,>我们开会前抓紧喝杯咖啡吧。<,>拟声词，类似抓握的声音<,>grasp(v.抓紧)/snatch(v.夺走)  

crucial<,>/ˈkruːʃl/<,>/ˈkruːʃl/<,>adj.至关重要的<,>This decision is crucial to our future.<,>这个决定对我们的未来至关重要。<,>Timing is crucial in comedy.<,>喜剧中时机把握至关重要。<,>The witness provided crucial evidence.<,>目击者提供了关键证据。<,>cruc(十字形)+ial→处在十字路口的→关键的<,>critical(adj.批判的)/essential(adj.必要的)  

flaw<,>/flɔː/<,>/flɑː/<,>n.缺点/n.错误<,>There's a flaw in your logic.<,>你的逻辑有漏洞。<,>The diamond has a tiny flaw.<,>这颗钻石有个微小瑕疵。<,>Pride was his fatal flaw.<,>傲慢是他的致命缺点。<,>与flow(流动)对比记忆<,>defect(n.缺陷)/fault(n.过错)  

depressed<,>/dɪˈprest/<,>/dɪˈprest/<,>adj.萧条的/adj.沮丧的<,>She felt depressed after the failure.<,>失败后她感到沮丧。<,>The depressed area needs economic aid.<,>这个萧条的地区需要经济援助。<,>His voice sounded depressed.<,>他的声音听起来很消沉。<,>de(向下)+press(压)→情绪被压下<,>oppressed(adj.受压迫的)/suppressed(adj.被抑制的)  

obstacle<,>/ˈɒbstəkl/<,>/ˈɑːbstəkl/<,>n.阻碍<,>Lack of education is an obstacle to success.<,>缺乏教育是成功的障碍。<,>They overcame every obstacle.<,>他们克服了所有阻碍。<,>The fallen tree was an obstacle on the road.<,>倒下的树成了路障。<,>ob(反对)+sta(站立)+cle→站在反方向的东西<,>hindrance(n.妨碍)/barrier(n.屏障)  

automatic<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk/<,>adj.自动的<,>The doors are automatic.<,>这些门是自动的。<,>Breathing is an automatic process.<,>呼吸是自动的过程。<,>She got an automatic promotion.<,>她获得了自动晋升。<,>auto(自己)+mat(思考)+ic→自己思考的<,>automated(adj.自动化的)/manual(adj.手动的)  

passionate<,>/ˈpæʃənət/<,>/ˈpæʃənət/<,>adj.热情的<,>He's passionate about music.<,>他对音乐充满热情。<,>She gave a passionate speech.<,>她发表了激情演讲。<,>Their passionate kiss surprised everyone.<,>他们热烈的吻让所有人惊讶。<,>passion(激情)+ate→充满激情的<,>compassionate(adj.有同情心的)/impassioned(adj.激昂的)
gambling<,>/ˈɡæmblɪŋ/<,>/ˈɡæmblɪŋ/<,>n.赌博<,>Gambling is illegal in many countries.<,>赌博在许多国家是非法的。<,>He lost all his money through gambling.<,>他因赌博输光了所有的钱。<,>Online gambling can be addictive.<,>网络赌博可能会上瘾。<,>gam(game游戏)+bling(bling金钱)→用金钱玩游戏→赌博<,>gamble(v.赌博)/rambling(adj.漫无边际的/n.漫步)  

logic<,>/ˈlɒdʒɪk/<,>/ˈlɑːdʒɪk/<,>n.逻辑<,>Your argument lacks logic.<,>你的论点缺乏逻辑。<,>She has a logical mind.<,>她有一个逻辑清晰的头脑。<,>The detective used logic to solve the case.<,>侦探用逻辑推理破案。<,>log(言语/思维)+ic(学科)→思维的学科→逻辑<,>magic(n.魔术/魔法)/analogic(adj.类推的)  

theory<,>/ˈθɪəri/<,>/ˈθiːəri/<,>n.理论<,>Einstein's theory of relativity changed physics.<,>爱因斯坦的相对论改变了物理学。<,>In theory, this plan should work.<,>理论上这个计划应该可行。<,>Her research supports the theory.<,>她的研究支持这个理论。<,>theo(神)+ry→神的启示→理论<,>theorem(n.定理)/theology(n.神学)  

download<,>/ˌdaʊnˈləʊd/<,>/ˌdaʊnˈloʊd/<,>v.下载<,>You can download the app for free.<,>你可以免费下载这个应用。<,>The file is downloading slowly.<,>文件下载得很慢。<,>Download the document before the meeting.<,>开会前下载好文件。<,>down(向下)+load(装载)→向下装载→下载<,>upload(v.上传)/unload(v.卸货)  

signal<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>n.信号/v.发信号/打信号/示意<,>The traffic signal turned red.<,>交通信号灯变红了。<,>She signaled me to come closer.<,>她示意我靠近些。<,>The satellite sends signals to Earth.<,>卫星向地球发送信号。<,>sign(标记)+al→标记物→信号<,>signature(n.签名)/significant(adj.重要的)  

authoritative<,>/ɔːˈθɒrɪtətɪv/<,>/əˈθɔːrəteɪtɪv/<,>adj.权威的<,>This is an authoritative source of information.<,>这是权威的信息来源。<,>He spoke in an authoritative tone.<,>他用权威的语气说话。<,>The book provides authoritative guidance.<,>这本书提供权威指导。<,>author(作者)+itative→作者般的→权威的<,>authoritarian(adj.专制的)/authority(n.权威)  

smooth<,>/smuːð/<,>/smuːð/<,>adj.光滑的<,>The table has a smooth surface.<,>桌子表面很光滑。<,>She has smooth skin.<,>她的皮肤很光滑。<,>The car ride was very smooth.<,>乘车过程非常平稳。<,>smo(似"丝")+ooth(发音似"丝绸")→如丝绸般光滑<,>soothe(v.安抚)/tooth(n.牙齿)  

institution<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃən/<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtuːʃən/<,>n.社会公共机构/制度/设立/制定<,>Harvard is a prestigious institution.<,>哈佛是一所著名学府。<,>Marriage is a social institution.<,>婚姻是一种社会制度。<,>The institution of new rules caused controversy.<,>新规则的制定引发了争议。<,>in(进入)+stitute(建立)+ion→建立起来的体系→机构<,>constitution(n.宪法)/substitution(n.替代)  

vehicle<,>/ˈviːəkəl/<,>/ˈviːhɪkəl/<,>n.车辆<,>Electric vehicles are environmentally friendly.<,>电动车对环境友好。<,>The truck is a large vehicle.<,>卡车是大型车辆。<,>Language is a vehicle for communication.<,>语言是交流的工具。<,>veh(运送)+icle(小东西)→运送的小东西→车辆<,>vessel(n.船只)/vesicle(n.小囊泡)  

plague<,>/pleɪɡ/<,>/pleɪɡ/<,>v.使困扰<,>The problem has plagued the company for years.<,>这个问题困扰公司多年。<,>Mosquitoes plagued the campers.<,>蚊子困扰着露营者。<,>He was plagued by doubts.<,>他被疑虑所困扰。<,>plag(打击)+ue→不断打击→困扰<,>plaque(n.匾额)/vague(adj.模糊的)
psychological<,>/ˌsaɪkəˈlɒdʒɪkəl/<,>/ˌsaɪkəˈlɑːdʒɪkəl/<,>adj.心理上的<,>Psychological factors can influence physical health.<,>心理因素会影响身体健康。<,>She is studying psychological development in children.<,>她正在研究儿童心理发展。<,>The book explores the psychological effects of war.<,>这本书探讨了战争的心理影响。<,>psycho(心理)+logical(学科的)→心理学的<,>physiological(adj.生理的)/psychiatric(adj.精神病的)  

shade<,>/ʃeɪd/<,>/ʃeɪd/<,>n.阴凉处<,>Let's sit in the shade to avoid the sun.<,>我们坐在阴凉处避暑吧。<,>The trees provided welcome shade on a hot day.<,>树木在炎热天气里提供了宜人的阴凉。<,>She wore sunglasses to protect her eyes from the shade.<,>她戴太阳镜保护眼睛免受强光。<,>sha(谐音"遮")+de(的)→遮阳的地方→阴凉处<,>shadow(n.阴影)/shed(n.棚屋))  

persistent<,>/pəˈsɪstənt/<,>/pərˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.持续的/坚持的<,>Her persistent efforts finally led to success.<,>她坚持不懈的努力最终带来了成功。<,>He has a persistent cough that won't go away.<,>他咳嗽持续不好。<,>The persistent rain caused flooding in some areas.<,>持续的降雨导致部分地区洪水。<,>per(贯穿)+sist(站立)+ent→始终站立的→坚持的<,>insistent(adj.坚持的)/consistent(adj.一致的)  

voluntary<,>/ˈvɒləntri/<,>/ˈvɑːlənteri/<,>adj.自愿的/主动的<,>She does voluntary work at the local hospital.<,>她在当地医院做志愿工作。<,>Participation in the study is completely voluntary.<,>参与这项研究是完全自愿的。<,>He made a voluntary confession to the police.<,>他向警方主动坦白。<,>vol(意志)+untary→意志决定的→自愿的<,>involuntary(adj.非自愿的)/volunteer(n.志愿者))  

tolerance<,>/ˈtɒlərəns/<,>/ˈtɑːlərəns/<,>n.宽容/容忍<,>We should show tolerance towards different cultures.<,>我们应该对不同文化表现出宽容。<,>His tolerance for pain is remarkable.<,>他对疼痛的忍耐力惊人。<,>The plant has a high tolerance to drought.<,>这种植物耐旱性强。<,>toler(容忍)+ance(名词后缀)→容忍<,>intolerance(n.不宽容)/tolerate(v.容忍))  

senior<,>/ˈsiːniə(r)/<,>/ˈsiːnjər/<,>n.老年人<,>The senior citizens enjoy discounts at this store.<,>老年人在这家商店享受折扣。<,>She is a senior member of the research team.<,>她是研究团队的高级成员。<,>The senior class organized a charity event.<,>高年级班级组织了一次慈善活动。<,>sen(老)+ior→年长的<,>junior(adj.年少的)/senile(adj.衰老的))  

individual<,>/ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>n.个人<,>Each individual has unique talents.<,>每个人都有独特的天赋。<,>We treat every individual with respect.<,>我们尊重每一个人。<,>The rights of the individual are protected by law.<,>个人权利受法律保护。<,>in(不)+divid(分开)+ual→不可分割的→个体<,>indivisible(adj.不可分割的)/collective(adj.集体的))  

contemporary<,>/kənˈtemprəri/<,>/kənˈtempəreri/<,>adj.当代的/现代的<,>Contemporary art often challenges traditional ideas.<,>当代艺术常常挑战传统观念。<,>She studies contemporary literature.<,>她研究现代文学。<,>This building combines contemporary and classical styles.<,>这座建筑融合了现代和古典风格。<,>con(共同)+tempor(时间)+ary→同时代的<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/contemporaneous(adj.同时期的))  

opposite<,>/ˈɒpəzɪt/<,>/ˈɑːpəzɪt/<,>adj.相反的<,>They live on opposite sides of the street.<,>他们住在街道的两侧。<,>Hot and cold are opposite sensations.<,>热和冷是相反的感觉。<,>Her opinion is opposite to mine.<,>她的观点与我的相反。<,>op(反)+pos(放置)+ite→反着放的→相反的<,>oppose(v.反对)/opposition(n.反对))  

specialize<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>v.专业从事<,>This restaurant specializes in Italian cuisine.<,>这家餐厅专营意大利菜。<,>He specializes in environmental law.<,>他专攻环境法。<,>The company specializes in high-tech products.<,>这家公司专营高科技产品。<,>special(特殊的)+ize(使)→使成为专门的<,>specialist(n.专家)/generalize(v.概括))
content<,>/ˈkɒntent/<,>/ˈkɑːntent/<,>n.内容<,>The content of the book is very informative.<,>这本书的内容非常丰富。<,>She was satisfied with the content of the email.<,>她对邮件的内容感到满意。<,>The website updates its content daily.<,>这个网站每天更新内容。<,>con(共同)+tent(保持)→共同保持的东西→内容<,>contend(v.竞争/v.主张)/context(n.上下文/n.背景)  

philosopher<,>/fɪˈlɒsəfə(r)/<,>/fɪˈlɑːsəfər/<,>n.哲学家<,>Socrates was a famous Greek philosopher.<,>苏格拉底是著名的希腊哲学家。<,>She aspires to be a philosopher one day.<,>她渴望有一天成为哲学家。<,>The philosopher's ideas influenced many people.<,>这位哲学家的思想影响了很多人。<,>philo(爱)+soph(智慧)+er(人)→爱智慧的人→哲学家<,>philosophy(n.哲学)/sophisticated(adj.复杂的/adj.老练的)  

unrest<,>/ʌnˈrest/<,>/ʌnˈrest/<,>n.不安定/n.动荡<,>Political unrest spread across the country.<,>政治动荡在全国蔓延。<,>The economic crisis caused social unrest.<,>经济危机引发了社会不安。<,>There was unrest among the workers after the pay cuts.<,>减薪后工人中出现了骚动。<,>un(否定)+rest(休息)→无法休息→动荡<,>arrest(v.逮捕/n.拘留)/interest(n.兴趣/v.使感兴趣)  

startle<,>/ˈstɑːtl/<,>/ˈstɑːrtl/<,>v.吃惊<,>The loud noise startled the baby.<,>巨大的声响吓到了婴儿。<,>She was startled by the sudden knock on the door.<,>突然的敲门声让她吓了一跳。<,>His unexpected appearance startled everyone.<,>他的突然出现让所有人都很吃惊。<,>star(星星)+tle→像看到流星一样吃惊<,>start(v.开始/n.开端)/stark(adj.完全的/adj.荒凉的)  

emission<,>/ɪˈmɪʃn/<,>/ɪˈmɪʃn/<,>n.排放/n.辐射<,>The factory reduced its carbon emissions.<,>这家工厂减少了碳排放。<,>Car emissions contribute to air pollution.<,>汽车尾气导致空气污染。<,>The device measures light emissions.<,>这个设备测量光辐射。<,>e(出)+miss(发送)+ion→发送出来→排放<,>mission(n.任务/n.使命)/admission(n.承认/n.入场费)  

overweight<,>/ˌəʊvəˈweɪt/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈweɪt/<,>adj.超重的<,>The doctor said I'm slightly overweight.<,>医生说我有点超重。<,>Overweight luggage incurs extra fees.<,>超重的行李需要额外付费。<,>He's been overweight since childhood.<,>他从小体重就超标。<,>over(超过)+weight(重量)→超过重量→超重的<,>overwhelm(v.压倒/v.淹没)/underweight(adj.体重不足的)  

occupation<,>/ˌɒkjuˈpeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːkjuˈpeɪʃn/<,>n.职业/n.工作<,>Teaching is her chosen occupation.<,>教书是她选择的职业。<,>Please state your occupation on the form.<,>请在表格上填写你的职业。<,>The building was under enemy occupation.<,>这座建筑曾被敌人占领。<,>oc(加强)+cup(拿)+ation→牢牢拿住→职业<,>preoccupation(n.全神贯注)/occupancy(n.占用/n.居住)  

mainstream<,>/ˈmeɪnstriːm/<,>/ˈmeɪnstriːm/<,>n.主流<,>This idea is now part of the mainstream.<,>这个观点现在已成为主流。<,>Mainstream media often ignores minority voices.<,>主流媒体经常忽视少数群体的声音。<,>She prefers mainstream music over indie.<,>比起独立音乐，她更喜欢主流音乐。<,>main(主要的)+stream(流)→主流<,>upstream(adv.向上游/adj.逆流的)/downstream(adv.向下游/adj.顺流的)  

scholarship<,>/ˈskɒləʃɪp/<,>/ˈskɑːlərʃɪp/<,>n.奖学金<,>She won a scholarship to Harvard.<,>她获得了哈佛大学的奖学金。<,>His scholarship covers tuition and living expenses.<,>他的奖学金包括学费和生活费。<,>They established a scholarship for underprivileged students.<,>他们为贫困学生设立了奖学金。<,>scholar(学者)+ship(状态)→学者的资助→奖学金<,>fellowship(n.友谊/n.研究员职位)/leadership(n.领导能力/n.领导层)  

contract<,>/ˈkɒntrækt/<,>/ˈkɑːntrækt/<,>n.合同<,>They signed a five-year contract.<,>他们签了一份五年合同。<,>Read the contract carefully before signing.<,>签署前请仔细阅读合同。<,>The contract specifies all the terms.<,>合同明确了所有条款。<,>con(共同)+tract(拉)→把双方拉到一起→合同<,>contact(n.接触/v.联系)/contrast(n.对比/v.形成对比)
cheek<,>/tʃiːk/<,>/tʃik/<,>n.脸颊<,>She kissed him on the cheek.<,>她亲了亲他的脸颊。<,>A tear rolled down his cheek.<,>一滴眼泪顺着他的脸颊滑落。<,>He has a dimple on his left cheek.<,>他左脸颊上有个酒窝。<,>发音类似"吃一颗"，想象吃糖果时鼓起脸颊<,>cheer(n.欢呼)/cheeky(adj.厚脸皮的)/chew(v.咀嚼)  

interdependence<,>/ˌɪntədɪˈpendəns/<,>/ˌɪntərdɪˈpendəns/<,>n.相互依靠<,>Economic interdependence promotes global peace.<,>经济相互依存促进世界和平。<,>The ecosystem shows delicate interdependence.<,>生态系统展现出精妙的相互依存关系。<,>Team success relies on interdependence among members.<,>团队成功依赖于成员间的相互依存。<,>inter(相互)+depend(依赖)+ence(名词后缀)<,>independent(adj.独立的)/dependence(n.依赖)/interconnect(v.互连)  

import<,>/ɪmˈpɔːt/<,>/ˈɪmpɔːrt/<,>n.进口/v.进口<,>The country imports crude oil from the Middle East.<,>该国从中东进口原油。<,>Import taxes affect product prices significantly.<,>进口税显著影响产品价格。<,>This software can import various file formats.<,>这个软件可以导入多种文件格式。<,>im(进入)+port(港口)→从港口进来<,>export(n.出口/v.出口)/important(adj.重要的)/port(n.港口)  

fiction<,>/ˈfɪkʃən/<,>/ˈfɪkʃən/<,>n.小说/虚构的文学作品<,>He writes science fiction in his spare time.<,>他在业余时间写科幻小说。<,>Her excuse was pure fiction.<,>她的借口纯属虚构。<,>The line between fact and fiction is blurred.<,>事实与虚构之间的界限很模糊。<,>发音联想"飞神"，想象小说里会飞的神仙<,>friction(n.摩擦)/faction(n.派系)/figment(n.虚构物)  

upbringing<,>/ˈʌpbrɪŋɪŋ/<,>/ˈʌpˌbrɪŋɪŋ/<,>n.养育/培养/教养<,>Her strict upbringing shaped her disciplined character.<,>她严格的教养塑造了她自律的性格。<,>Cultural upbringing influences one's worldview.<,>文化培养影响一个人的世界观。<,>He credits his success to his parents' upbringing.<,>他将成功归功于父母的养育。<,>up(向上)+bring(培养)+ing→从小培养长大<,>bringing(n.带来)/upward(adj.向上的)/offspring(n.后代)  

preserve<,>/prɪˈzɜːv/<,>/prɪˈzɝːv/<,>v.保护<,>We must preserve endangered species.<,>我们必须保护濒危物种。<,>This method helps preserve food longer.<,>这种方法有助于更长时间保存食物。<,>The museum preserves ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆保存着古代文物。<,>pre(预先)+serve(保存)→提前保存好<,>reserve(v.预留/n.储备)/persevere(v.坚持)/conserve(v.节约)  

vitally<,>/ˈvaɪtəli/<,>/ˈvaɪt̬əli/<,>adv.极其重要地<,>Sleep is vitally important for health.<,>睡眠对健康极其重要。<,>This document is vitally confidential.<,>这份文件极其机密。<,>Early detection vitally affects treatment outcomes.<,>早期发现极其影响治疗效果。<,>vital(重要的)+ly(副词后缀)<,>vitality(n.活力)/vitamin(n.维生素)/fatally(adv.致命地)  

masculine<,>/ˈmæskjəlɪn/<,>/ˈmæskjələn/<,>adj.男性的<,>He has a deep, masculine voice.<,>他有深沉的男性嗓音。<,>Some cultures associate blue with masculine traits.<,>某些文化将蓝色与男性特质联系起来。<,>The design balances feminine and masculine elements.<,>这个设计平衡了女性化和男性化元素。<,>masc(雄性)+uline(形容词后缀)<,>feminine(adj.女性的)/muscular(adj.肌肉发达的)/mask(n.面具)  

advocate<,>/ˈædvəkeɪt/<,>/ˈædvəˌkeɪt/<,>v.倡导/n.提倡者/拥护者/鼓吹者<,>She advocates for environmental protection.<,>她倡导环境保护。<,>He works as a child rights advocate.<,>他从事儿童权利倡导工作。<,>The lawyer advocated for her client's innocence.<,>律师为委托人的清白辩护。<,>ad(加强)+voc(声音)+ate→大声疾呼<,>vocabulary(n.词汇)/evoke(v.唤起)/provoke(v.激怒)  

dust<,>/dʌst/<,>/dʌst/<,>n.灰尘<,>The furniture was covered with dust.<,>家具上积满了灰尘。<,>She dusts the shelves every morning.<,>她每天早晨掸去架子上的灰尘。<,>A cloud of dust rose from the dirt road.<,>土路上扬起一片尘土。<,>发音类似"打死它"，想象打死灰尘<,>rust(n.锈/v.生锈)/must(v.必须)/crust(n.外壳)
track<,>/træk/<,>/træk/<,>n.足迹/v.追踪/v.循着踪迹找寻<,>The hunter followed the animal's tracks in the snow.<,>猎人追踪着雪地上动物的足迹。<,>Scientists are tracking the migration patterns of birds.<,>科学家正在追踪鸟类的迁徙模式。<,>The detective tracked the suspect to a small apartment.<,>侦探循着线索找到了嫌疑人的小公寓。<,>tr(痕迹)+ack(后缀)→留下的痕迹→足迹<,>trace(n.痕迹/v.追踪)/tract(n.大片土地)/truck(n.卡车)

confidence<,>/ˈkɒnfɪdəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnfɪdəns/<,>n.信心<,>She spoke with confidence during the presentation.<,>她在演讲时充满自信。<,>Lack of confidence can hold you back from success.<,>缺乏信心会阻碍你取得成功。<,>He has complete confidence in his team's abilities.<,>他对团队的能力充满信心。<,>con(完全)+fid(信任)+ence(状态)→完全信任的状态→信心<,>confident(adj.自信的)/confidant(n.知己)/confidential(adj.机密的)

riotous<,>/ˈraɪətəs/<,>/ˈraɪətəs/<,>adj.狂暴的<,>The riotous crowd overturned cars and set fires.<,>暴乱的人群掀翻汽车并纵火。<,>His riotous behavior got him expelled from school.<,>他狂暴的行为导致他被学校开除。<,>The storm brought riotous winds that damaged many houses.<,>暴风雨带来了破坏性的狂风，毁坏了许多房屋。<,>riot(暴乱)+ous(形容词后缀)→暴乱的→狂暴的<,>quiet(adj.安静的)/riot(n.暴乱/v.参加暴乱)

sophisticated<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.世故的<,>The device uses sophisticated technology.<,>这个设备采用了复杂的技术。<,>She has a sophisticated taste in art.<,>她对艺术有着高雅的品味。<,>His sophisticated manners impressed everyone at the party.<,>他世故的举止给派对上的每个人留下了深刻印象。<,>soph(智慧)+ist(人)+icated→有智慧的人→世故的<,>simple(adj.简单的)/sophomore(n.大学二年级学生)

similar<,>/ˈsɪmɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈsɪmələr/<,>adj.相似的<,>The two sisters look very similar.<,>这对姐妹看起来非常相似。<,>We have similar interests in music.<,>我们在音乐方面有相似的兴趣。<,>The test results were similar to last year's.<,>测试结果与去年的相似。<,>simil(相同)+ar(形容词后缀)→相同的→相似的<,>same(adj.相同的)/simile(n.明喻)/similarity(n.相似性)

transform<,>/trænsˈfɔːm/<,>/trænsˈfɔːrm/<,>v.改变<,>The caterpillar transformed into a butterfly.<,>毛毛虫变成了蝴蝶。<,>New technology has transformed our way of life.<,>新技术改变了我们的生活方式。<,>The old factory was transformed into a modern art gallery.<,>旧工厂被改造成了现代艺术画廊。<,>trans(跨越)+form(形状)→跨越形状→改变<,>transfer(v.转移/n.转换)/transmit(v.传输)/transparent(adj.透明的)

approve<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>v.赞成/v.同意<,>The committee approved the new policy.<,>委员会批准了新政策。<,>My parents don't approve of my career choice.<,>我父母不赞成我的职业选择。<,>The plan was approved by the board of directors.<,>该计划获得了董事会的批准。<,>ap(向)+prove(证明)→向...证明→赞成<,>improve(v.改进)/prove(v.证明)/disapprove(v.不赞成)

session<,>/ˈseʃn/<,>/ˈseʃən/<,>n.开会/n.会议<,>The court is in session until 5 p.m.<,>法庭开庭到下午5点。<,>We have a training session tomorrow morning.<,>我们明天上午有个培训会议。<,>The therapy sessions helped him overcome his anxiety.<,>治疗会议帮助他克服了焦虑。<,>sess(坐)+ion(名词后缀)→坐在一起→会议<,>season(n.季节)/cession(n.割让)/session(n.学期)

awareness<,>/əˈweənəs/<,>/əˈwernəs/<,>n.意识<,>Public awareness of environmental issues has increased.<,>公众对环境问题的意识提高了。<,>The campaign aims to raise awareness about mental health.<,>该活动旨在提高人们对心理健康的认识。<,>She has no awareness of her own mistakes.<,>她没有意识到自己的错误。<,>a(加强)+ware(注意)+ness(名词后缀)→注意的状态→意识<,>beware(v.当心)/unaware(adj.未意识到的)

exhaust<,>/ɪɡˈzɔːst/<,>/ɪɡˈzɔːst/<,>v.使筋疲力尽<,>The long hike exhausted all the children.<,>长途远足使所有孩子都筋疲力尽。<,>Don't exhaust yourself by working too hard.<,>不要工作太辛苦而累坏自己。<,>The marathon runners were completely exhausted at the finish line.<,>马拉松选手在终点线时已经完全筋疲力尽了。<,>ex(出)+haust(抽)→把力气抽出来→使筋疲力尽<,>exhaust(n.废气)/exhaustive(adj.彻底的)/exhaustion(n.疲惫)
subsidize<,>/ˈsʌbsɪdaɪz/<,>/ˈsʌbsɪˌdaɪz/<,>v.提供补贴<,>The government plans to subsidize renewable energy projects.<,>政府计划为可再生能源项目提供补贴。<,>Farmers are often subsidized to keep food prices stable.<,>农民经常获得补贴以保持食品价格稳定。<,>Some companies are subsidized to encourage innovation.<,>一些公司获得补贴以鼓励创新。<,>sub(下)+sid(坐)+ize(动词后缀)→在下面支持→补贴<,>subsidy(n.补贴)/subside(v.平息)/residue(n.残余)

grocery<,>/ˈɡrəʊsəri/<,>/ˈɡroʊsəri/<,>n.杂货店<,>I need to stop by the grocery to buy some milk.<,>我需要去杂货店买些牛奶。<,>She works part-time at a local grocery.<,>她在当地一家杂货店兼职。<,>Online groceries are becoming more popular.<,>网上杂货店越来越受欢迎。<,>groc(大量)+ery(场所)→卖大量商品的地方→杂货店<,>grocer(n.杂货商)/gross(adj.总的)/glory(n.荣耀)

ignorance<,>/ˈɪɡnərəns/<,>/ˈɪɡnərəns/<,>n.无知/愚昧<,>Ignorance of the law is no excuse.<,>对法律的无知不能成为借口。<,>His ignorance about the topic was surprising.<,>他对这个话题的无知令人惊讶。<,>Education helps to reduce ignorance.<,>教育有助于减少无知。<,>ig(不)+nor(知道)+ance(名词后缀)→不知道→无知<,>ignore(v.忽视)/ignoramus(n.无知的人)/arrogance(n.傲慢)

intelligence<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒəns/<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒəns/<,>n.智力/智慧/理解力<,>Artificial intelligence is changing our world.<,>人工智能正在改变我们的世界。<,>She has remarkable emotional intelligence.<,>她有出色的情商。<,>The spy gathered military intelligence.<,>间谍收集了军事情报。<,>intel(在...之间)+lig(选择)+ence→在信息间选择的能力→智力<,>intellect(n.智力)/intelligent(adj.聪明的)/intelligentsia(n.知识分子)

tiny<,>/ˈtaɪni/<,>/ˈtaɪni/<,>adj.微小的<,>She found a tiny shell on the beach.<,>她在海滩上发现了一个微小的贝壳。<,>The apartment has a tiny kitchen.<,>这套公寓有个小厨房。<,>There's a tiny chance of rain tomorrow.<,>明天下雨的几率很小。<,>tin(锡)+y→像锡粒一样小→微小的<,>teeny(adj.极小的)/tinny(adj.金属声的)/tinge(n.微量)

praise<,>/preɪz/<,>/preɪz/<,>v.赞扬/赞美<,>The teacher praised her for excellent work.<,>老师表扬她作业完成得出色。<,>He received praise from his colleagues.<,>他得到了同事的赞扬。<,>Praise can motivate children to learn.<,>表扬能激励孩子学习。<,>prais(价值)+e→给予价值评价→赞扬<,>appraise(v.评估)/prize(n.奖品)/phrase(n.短语)

memorize<,>/ˈmeməraɪz/<,>/ˈmeməˌraɪz/<,>v.熟记/牢记<,>Students need to memorize multiplication tables.<,>学生需要熟记乘法表。<,>He memorized all the lines for the play.<,>他背下了剧本的所有台词。<,>It's easier to memorize information in chunks.<,>分块记忆信息更容易。<,>memor(记忆)+ize(使)→使记忆→牢记<,>memory(n.记忆)/memorial(adj.纪念的)/memorandum(n.备忘录)

relative<,>/ˈrelətɪv/<,>/ˈrelətɪv/<,>adj.相对的/n.亲戚<,>All things are relative in physics.<,>在物理学中，一切都是相对的。<,>She visited her relatives during the holidays.<,>假期里她拜访了亲戚。<,>The price is relative to the quality.<,>价格与质量相关。<,>relat(关系)+ive→有关系的→相对的/亲戚<,>relation(n.关系)/relativity(n.相对性)/correlative(adj.相关的)

breakthrough<,>/ˈbreɪkθruː/<,>/ˈbreɪkˌθru/<,>n.突破<,>Scientists made a major breakthrough in cancer research.<,>科学家在癌症研究方面取得了重大突破。<,>The new drug represents a medical breakthrough.<,>这种新药代表了一项医学突破。<,>Her invention was a technological breakthrough.<,>她的发明是一项技术突破。<,>break(打破)+through(通过)→打破障碍通过→突破<,>breakup(n.分手)/breakdown(n.故障)/breakout(n.爆发)

incidence<,>/ˈɪnsɪdəns/<,>/ˈɪnsɪdəns/<,>n.几率/发生率<,>The incidence of flu increases in winter.<,>冬季流感发生率上升。<,>Researchers studied the incidence of the disease.<,>研究人员研究了这种疾病的发生率。<,>There's a high incidence of accidents at this intersection.<,>这个十字路口事故发生率很高。<,>in(上)+cid(落下)+ence→落在某范围的情况→发生率<,>incident(n.事件)/coincidence(n.巧合)/accident(n.事故)
scratch<,>/skrætʃ/<,>/skrætʃ/<,>n.抓/n.划痕<,>There's a scratch on my new phone.<,>我的新手机上有一道划痕。<,>The cat gave me a scratch when I tried to pet it.<,>当我试图抚摸那只猫时，它抓了我一下。<,>He heard a scratch at the door.<,>他听到门口有抓挠声。<,>s(蛇)+cratch(catch抓)→蛇抓→抓痕<,>snatch(v.抢夺/n.片段)/sketch(n.草图/v.素描)  

harmful<,>/ˈhɑːmfl/<,>/ˈhɑːrmfl/<,>adj.有害的<,>Smoking is harmful to your health.<,>吸烟有害健康。<,>These chemicals can be harmful to the environment.<,>这些化学物质对环境有害。<,>Too much screen time is harmful to children's eyes.<,>过多的屏幕时间对孩子的眼睛有害。<,>harm(伤害)+ful(形容词后缀)→造成伤害的<,>harmless(adj.无害的)/hurtful(adj.伤感情的)  

undergo<,>/ˌʌndəˈɡəʊ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈɡoʊ/<,>v.承受/v.经历<,>She had to undergo surgery last week.<,>她上周不得不接受手术。<,>The company is undergoing major changes.<,>公司正在经历重大变革。<,>This material can undergo extreme temperatures.<,>这种材料能承受极端温度。<,>under(在...下)+go(走)→在困境中前行→承受<,>underline(v.强调)/undertake(v.承担)  

recession<,>/rɪˈseʃn/<,>/rɪˈseʃn/<,>n.衰退/n.经济萧条<,>The country is in an economic recession.<,>该国正处于经济衰退中。<,>Many businesses closed during the recession.<,>许多企业在经济衰退期间倒闭了。<,>The recession caused widespread unemployment.<,>经济衰退导致大规模失业。<,>re(回)+cess(走)+ion→经济后退→衰退<,>concession(n.让步)/procession(n.行列)  

extraordinary<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːdnri/<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːrdəneri/<,>adj.非凡的/adj.特别的<,>She has an extraordinary talent for music.<,>她在音乐方面有非凡的天赋。<,>The team made extraordinary efforts to finish the project.<,>团队为完成项目付出了非凡的努力。<,>It was an extraordinary coincidence that we met there.<,>我们在那里相遇真是个特别的巧合。<,>extra(超出)+ordinary(普通)→超出普通→非凡的<,>ordinary(adj.普通的)/extraterrestrial(adj.外星球的)  

improper<,>/ɪmˈprɒpə(r)/<,>/ɪmˈprɑːpər/<,>adj.不合适的/adj.不适当的<,>It would be improper to discuss this matter here.<,>在这里讨论这件事不合适。<,>He was fired for improper conduct at work.<,>他因工作中的不当行为被解雇。<,>Wearing shorts to the wedding is considered improper.<,>穿短裤参加婚礼被认为是不合适的。<,>im(不)+proper(适当)→不适当的<,>proper(adj.适当的)/improve(v.改进)  

marginalize<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪnəlaɪz/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪnəlaɪz/<,>v.边缘化/v.排斥<,>The new policy may marginalize minority groups.<,>新政策可能会边缘化少数群体。<,>Some students feel marginalized in the classroom.<,>有些学生在课堂上感到被排斥。<,>We should not marginalize people with disabilities.<,>我们不应该排斥残障人士。<,>margin(边缘)+alize(使...化)→使边缘化<,>centralize(v.集中)/minimize(v.最小化)  

vital<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>adj.重要的/adj.必不可少的<,>Water is vital for all living things.<,>水对所有生物都至关重要。<,>This document contains vital information.<,>这份文件包含重要信息。<,>Regular exercise is vital to maintaining good health.<,>定期锻炼对保持健康至关重要。<,>vit(生命)+al→与生命有关的→重要的<,>vitality(n.活力)/fatal(adj.致命的)  

fortunately<,>/ˈfɔːtʃənətli/<,>/ˈfɔːrtʃənətli/<,>adv.幸运地<,>Fortunately, no one was hurt in the accident.<,>幸运的是，事故中没有人受伤。<,>I forgot my umbrella, but fortunately it didn't rain.<,>我忘了带伞，但幸运的是没有下雨。<,>Fortunately, we arrived just in time for the show.<,>幸运的是，我们刚好赶上演出。<,>fortunate(幸运的)+ly(副词后缀)→幸运地<,>unfortunately(adv.不幸地)/fortune(n.运气)  

commencement<,>/kəˈmensmənt/<,>/kəˈmensmənt/<,>n.毕业典礼/n.开始<,>The commencement will be held in the main auditorium.<,>毕业典礼将在主礼堂举行。<,>She gave a speech at her son's commencement.<,>她在儿子的毕业典礼上发表了演讲。<,>This marks the commencement of a new era.<,>这标志着一个新时代的开始。<,>com(共同)+mence(开始)+ment→大家一起开始的仪式→毕业典礼<,>commend(v.称赞)/comment(n.评论)
fetch<,>/fetʃ/<,>/fɛtʃ/<,>v.取回<,>Could you fetch me a glass of water?<,>你能帮我拿杯水吗？<,>The dog fetched the ball and brought it back.<,>狗狗叼回了球。<,>She fetched her coat from the closet.<,>她从衣柜里取出外套。<,>谐音“飞驰”→快速取回<,>catch(v.抓住)/match(n.比赛/v.匹配)  

clumsy<,>/ˈklʌmzi/<,>/ˈklʌmzi/<,>adj.笨拙的/adj.不圆滑的<,>He dropped the vase because of his clumsy hands.<,>他笨手笨脚地把花瓶摔了。<,>Her clumsy apology made things worse.<,>她生硬的道歉让事情更糟。<,>The clumsy panda tripped over its own feet.<,>笨拙的熊猫被自己绊倒了。<,>clum(谐音“卡壳”)+sy→卡壳的样子→笨拙<,>clump(n.丛/v.形成丛)/gloomy(adj.阴暗的)  

establishment<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃmənt/<,>/əˈstæblɪʃmənt/<,>n.确立/n.机构<,>The establishment of new laws took three years.<,>新法律的制定花了三年。<,>This restaurant is a well-known establishment.<,>这家餐厅是知名老店。<,>He opposed the political establishment.<,>他反对当权派。<,>establish(建立)+ment(名词后缀)<,>accomplishment(n.成就)/settlement(n.解决)  

emit<,>/iˈmɪt/<,>/ɪˈmɪt/<,>v.发出/v.排出<,>The machine emits a strange noise.<,>机器发出怪声。<,>Volcanoes emit sulfur dioxide.<,>火山喷发二氧化硫。<,>Her eyes emitted a warm glow.<,>她眼中流露出温暖的光芒。<,>e(出)+mit(送)→送出去→发出<,>omit(v.省略)/admit(v.承认)  

entertaining<,>/ˌentəˈteɪnɪŋ/<,>/ˌɛntɚˈtenɪŋ/<,>adj.有趣的/adj.使人愉快的<,>The magician gave an entertaining performance.<,>魔术师的表演很有趣。<,>This book is both educational and entertaining.<,>这本书寓教于乐。<,>His jokes were highly entertaining.<,>他的笑话特别逗乐。<,>entertain(娱乐)+ing→娱乐的<,>interesting(adj.有趣的)/amusing(adj.逗笑的)  

irregular<,>/ɪˈreɡjələ(r)/<,>/ɪˈrɛɡjəlɚ/<,>adj.不规律的/adj.不规则的<,>Her heartbeat was irregular.<,>她的心跳不规律。<,>These shoes have irregular shapes.<,>这些鞋子形状不规则。<,>He works irregular hours.<,>他的工作时间不固定。<,>ir(不)+regular(规则的)→不规则的<,>regular(adj.规则的)/illegal(adj.非法的)  

psychologist<,>/saɪˈkɒlədʒɪst/<,>/saɪˈkɑːlədʒɪst/<,>n.心理学家<,>The psychologist studied human behavior.<,>心理学家研究人类行为。<,>She consulted a child psychologist.<,>她咨询了儿童心理专家。<,>Famous psychologists often write books.<,>著名心理学家常著书立说。<,>psycho(心理)+logist(学者)→心理学者<,>psychiatrist(n.精神科医生)/physiologist(n.生理学家)  

era<,>/ˈɪərə/<,>/ˈɪrə/<,>n.纪元/n.年代<,>The dinosaur era ended millions of years ago.<,>恐龙时代结束于数百万年前。<,>We live in the digital era.<,>我们生活在数字时代。<,>The Victorian era saw many changes.<,>维多利亚时代经历了许多变革。<,>对比“area(区域)”少一个a→划分时间的区域<,>epoch(n.纪元)/age(n.时代)  

triumph<,>/ˈtraɪʌmf/<,>/ˈtraɪəmf/<,>n.胜利<,>Their triumph was celebrated nationwide.<,>他们的胜利举国欢庆。<,>The vaccine was a medical triumph.<,>该疫苗是医学上的胜利。<,>She smiled in triumph.<,>她露出胜利的微笑。<,>tri(三)+umph(拟声欢呼)→三次欢呼→胜利<,>trumpet(n.小号)/trophy(n.奖杯)  

detection<,>/dɪˈtekʃn/<,>/dɪˈtɛkʃən/<,>n.侦查/n.察觉<,>Early detection of cancer saves lives.<,>癌症早期检测能救命。<,>The detection of lies requires skill.<,>识破谎言需要技巧。<,>Smoke detection systems are mandatory.<,>烟雾探测系统是强制安装的。<,>de(去掉)+tect(覆盖)+ion→揭开覆盖→察觉<,>inspection(n.检查)/protection(n.保护)
cozy<,>/ˈkəʊzi/<,>/ˈkoʊzi/<,>adj.舒适的<,>The blanket is so cozy that I fell asleep immediately.<,>这条毯子太舒适了，我立刻就睡着了。<,>She made a cozy corner for reading in her room.<,>她在房间里布置了一个舒适的阅读角。<,>On winter nights, we sit by the cozy fireplace.<,>冬夜里，我们坐在舒适的壁炉旁。<,>联想：couch（沙发）+ lazy（懒散的）→ 躺在沙发上懒散的状态→舒适的<,>comfy（adj.舒服的）/toasty（adj.温暖舒适的）/snug（adj.温暖舒适的）  

gallery<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>n.美术馆<,>We visited the National Gallery last weekend.<,>我们上周末参观了国家美术馆。<,>The gallery exhibits works by young artists.<,>这个美术馆展出了年轻艺术家的作品。<,>She works as a curator in an art gallery.<,>她在一家艺术画廊担任策展人。<,>gall（走廊）+ ery（场所）→ 展示艺术的长廊→美术馆<,>museum（n.博物馆）/exhibition（n.展览）/studio（n.工作室）  

enormous<,>/ɪˈnɔːməs/<,>/ɪˈnɔːrməs/<,>adj.巨大的<,>An enormous elephant stood near the tree.<,>一头巨大的大象站在树旁。<,>They made an enormous effort to complete the project.<,>他们付出了巨大的努力来完成这个项目。<,>The cake was enormous, enough for fifty people.<,>这个蛋糕巨大，足够五十个人吃。<,>e（出）+ norm（标准）+ ous（…的）→超出标准的→巨大的<,>immense（adj.极大的）/gigantic（adj.巨大的）/tremendous（adj.极大的）  

obtain<,>/əbˈteɪn/<,>/əbˈteɪn/<,>v.获得<,>He obtained a scholarship to study abroad.<,>他获得了出国留学的奖学金。<,>This information is difficult to obtain.<,>这个信息很难获得。<,>You need to obtain permission before entering.<,>进入前你需要获得许可。<,>ob（加强）+ tain（拿住）→ 拿到→获得<,>attain（v.达到）/retain（v.保留）/abstain（v.戒除）  

desert<,>/dɪˈzɜːt/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrt/<,>v.抛弃<,>He deserted his family and went abroad.<,>他抛弃了家人去了国外。<,>The soldier was punished for deserting his post.<,>这名士兵因擅离职守而受到惩罚。<,>Many plants can survive in the desert.<,>许多植物能在沙漠中生存。<,>de（去掉）+ sert（加入）→ 不再加入→抛弃<,>dessert（n.甜点）/deserted（adj.荒废的）/deserter（n.逃兵）  

aviate<,>/ˈeɪvieɪt/<,>/ˈeɪvieɪt/<,>v.驾驶飞机<,>He learned to aviate at a young age.<,>他年轻时学会了驾驶飞机。<,>The pilot aviates the aircraft smoothly.<,>飞行员平稳地驾驶着飞机。<,>To aviate professionally requires rigorous training.<,>专业驾驶飞机需要严格的训练。<,>avi（鸟）+ ate（动词后缀）→ 像鸟一样飞行→驾驶飞机<,>aviation（n.航空）/aviator（n.飞行员）/aerial（adj.空中的）  

determine<,>/dɪˈtɜːmɪn/<,>/dɪˈtɜːrmɪn/<,>v.决定；下决心<,>She determined to finish the work by Friday.<,>她决心在周五前完成工作。<,>Genes determine many of our physical traits.<,>基因决定了我们的许多身体特征。<,>The judge will determine the outcome of the case.<,>法官将决定案件的结果。<,>de（加强）+ termine（界限）→ 划定界限→决定<,>terminate（v.终止）/terminal（n.终点站）/predetermine（v.预先决定）  

disappear<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪə(r)/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪr/<,>v.不见，消失<,>The sun disappeared behind the clouds.<,>太阳消失在云层后面。<,>My keys have disappeared from the table.<,>我的钥匙从桌子上不见了。<,>Many species are disappearing due to habitat loss.<,>许多物种因栖息地丧失而消失。<,>dis（不）+ appear（出现）→ 不出现→消失<,>appear（v.出现）/vanished（adj.消失的）/fade（v.逐渐消失）  

entitle<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>v.使具有权利，使具有资格<,>This ticket entitles you to a free drink.<,>这张票使你有资格获得一杯免费饮料。<,>She is entitled to a pension after retirement.<,>她退休后有资格领取养老金。<,>The book is entitled "The Great Adventure".<,>这本书名为《伟大的冒险》。<,>en（使）+ title（头衔）→ 给予头衔→使有资格<,>enable（v.使能够）/empower（v.授权）/right（n.权利）  

relieve<,>/rɪˈliːv/<,>/rɪˈliːv/<,>v.解除，减轻，缓解<,>This medicine will relieve your pain.<,>这种药会缓解你的疼痛。<,>He was relieved of his duties last month.<,>他上个月被解除了职务。<,>The good news relieved her anxiety.<,>这个好消息缓解了她的焦虑。<,>re（再）+ lieve（轻）→ 再次变轻→减轻<,>believe（v.相信）/relief（n.缓解）/alleviate（v.减轻）
generosity<,>/ˌdʒenəˈrɒsəti/<,>/ˌdʒenəˈrɑːsəti/<,>n.慷慨/n.大方<,>Her generosity knows no bounds.<,>她的慷慨无边无际。<,>We were moved by his generosity.<,>我们被他的慷慨所感动。<,>She showed great generosity to the homeless.<,>她对无家可归者表现出极大的慷慨。<,>gener(产生)+osity(名词后缀)→不断产生→慷慨<,>generous(adj.慷慨的)/genius(n.天才)/genuine(adj.真实的)  

colleague<,>/ˈkɒliːɡ/<,>/ˈkɑːliːɡ/<,>n.同事<,>My colleague helped me with the project.<,>我的同事帮我完成了这个项目。<,>She had lunch with her colleagues.<,>她和同事们共进午餐。<,>He is a trusted colleague.<,>他是一位值得信赖的同事。<,>col(共同)+league(联盟)→共同联盟的人→同事<,>college(n.学院)/collage(n.拼贴画)/collaborate(v.合作)  

undertake<,>/ˌʌndəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌʌndərˈteɪk/<,>v.承担<,>He undertook the responsibility willingly.<,>他心甘情愿地承担了这个责任。<,>We undertook a challenging project.<,>我们承担了一个具有挑战性的项目。<,>She undertook to finish the work on time.<,>她承诺按时完成工作。<,>under(在...下)+take(拿)→在下面拿住→承担<,>overtake(v.超过)/undertaker(n.承办人)/understand(v.理解)  

convenient<,>/kənˈviːniənt/<,>/kənˈviːnjənt/<,>adj.方便的<,>Is this time convenient for you?<,>这个时间对你方便吗？<,>The hotel is conveniently located.<,>这家酒店位置便利。<,>Online shopping is very convenient.<,>网上购物非常方便。<,>con(共同)+ven(来)+ient→大家都能来的→方便的<,>convention(n.惯例)/convenience(n.便利)/inconvenient(adj.不便的)  

preferentially<,>/ˌprefəˈrenʃəli/<,>/ˌprefəˈrenʃəli/<,>adv.优先地<,>Members are treated preferentially.<,>会员享有优先待遇。<,>The system allocates resources preferentially.<,>该系统优先分配资源。<,>He was given preferential treatment.<,>他受到了优先对待。<,>pre(前)+fer(带来)+ential→先带来的→优先的<,>preference(n.偏爱)/referential(adj.参考的)/inferential(adj.推论的)  

column<,>/ˈkɒləm/<,>/ˈkɑːləm/<,>n.专栏<,>She writes a weekly column for the newspaper.<,>她为报纸撰写每周专栏。<,>The article appeared in the sports column.<,>这篇文章出现在体育专栏。<,>He reads the financial column every morning.<,>他每天早上都阅读财经专栏。<,>col(共同)+umn→共同竖立的东西→圆柱→专栏<,>volume(n.体积)/solemn(adj.庄严的)/columnist(n.专栏作家)  

affectionate<,>/əˈfekʃənət/<,>/əˈfekʃənət/<,>adj.深情的/adj.柔情的<,>She gave him an affectionate hug.<,>她给了他一个深情的拥抱。<,>The cat is very affectionate towards its owner.<,>这只猫对主人非常亲昵。<,>He wrote an affectionate letter to his daughter.<,>他给女儿写了一封充满柔情的信。<,>affect(影响)+ion+ate→充满感情的→深情的<,>affection(n.喜爱)/effective(adj.有效的)/defective(adj.有缺陷的)  

issue<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>v.发表〔声明〕/n.问题<,>The government issued a statement.<,>政府发表了一份声明。<,>This is a controversial issue.<,>这是一个有争议的问题。<,>They discussed environmental issues.<,>他们讨论了环境问题。<,>is(出)+sue(跟随)→跟随而出→发出→发表<,>tissue(n.纸巾)/sue(v.起诉)/pursue(v.追求)  

inquire<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪər/<,>v.询问<,>I'll inquire about the train schedule.<,>我会询问火车时刻表。<,>She inquired after his health.<,>她询问了他的健康状况。<,>The police are inquiring into the matter.<,>警方正在调查此事。<,>in(内)+quire(寻求)→向内寻求→询问<,>acquire(v.获得)/require(v.要求)/enquire(v.询问)  

groundlessly<,>/ˈɡraʊndləsli/<,>/ˈɡraʊndləsli/<,>adv.无缘无故地/adv.无根据地<,>He was groundlessly accused of theft.<,>他被无端指控偷窃。<,>Her fears proved groundless.<,>她的恐惧被证明是毫无根据的。<,>They spread groundless rumors.<,>他们散布毫无根据的谣言。<,>ground(基础)+less(无)+ly→没有基础地→无根据地<,>grounded(adj.接地的)/grounding(n.基础训练)/groundwork(n.基础工作)
independently<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendəntli/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendəntli/<,>adv.独立地<,>She learned to solve problems independently.<,>她学会了独立解决问题。<,>The research was conducted independently by the team.<,>这项研究由团队独立完成。<,>Children should be encouraged to think independently.<,>应该鼓励孩子独立思考。<,>in(不)+dependent(依赖的)+ly(副词后缀)→不依赖地<,>dependent(adj.依赖的)/independence(n.独立)  

approach<,>/əˈprəʊtʃ/<,>/əˈproʊtʃ/<,>v.靠近/n.方法<,>The cat slowly approached the bird.<,>猫慢慢靠近那只鸟。<,>We need a new approach to solve this issue.<,>我们需要新方法来解决这个问题。<,>His teaching approach is very effective.<,>他的教学方法很有效。<,>ap(向)+proach(接近)→向...接近<,>reproach(v.责备/n.耻辱)/approximate(adj.近似的)  

administration<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>n.管理/n.政府<,>The school administration handles all disciplinary matters.<,>学校管理部门处理所有纪律问题。<,>The Obama administration implemented new healthcare policies.<,>奥巴马政府实施了新的医疗政策。<,>She studied public administration at university.<,>她在大学学习公共管理。<,>administer(管理)+ation(名词后缀)→管理行为<,>minister(n.部长/v.辅助)/administrative(adj.行政的)  

adversity<,>/ədˈvɜːsəti/<,>/ædˈvɜːrsəti/<,>n.逆境/n.不幸<,>He showed great courage in the face of adversity.<,>他在逆境中表现出巨大勇气。<,>Adversity often brings out the best in people.<,>逆境往往能激发人的潜能。<,>They overcame financial adversity together.<,>他们一起克服了财务困境。<,>ad(朝向)+vers(转)+ity→转向不好的一面→逆境<,>adverse(adj.不利的)/diversity(n.多样性)  

technician<,>/tekˈnɪʃn/<,>/tekˈnɪʃn/<,>n.技术员/n.技师<,>The lab technician analyzed the samples carefully.<,>实验室技术员仔细分析了样本。<,>We need an experienced computer technician.<,>我们需要一位有经验的电脑技师。<,>The sound technician adjusted the microphone levels.<,>音响技师调整了麦克风音量。<,>techn(技术)+ician(专业人员)→技术专家<,>technique(n.技术)/technical(adj.技术的)  

regular<,>/ˈreɡjələ(r)/<,>/ˈreɡjələr/<,>adj.有规律的/adj.经常的<,>He keeps regular working hours.<,>他保持着规律的工作时间。<,>She's a regular customer at this café.<,>她是这家咖啡店的常客。<,>Take the medicine at regular intervals.<,>定期服药。<,>reg(统治)+ular→受规则统治的→规律的<,>irregular(adj.不规则的)/regulate(v.调节)  

miscalculation<,>/ˌmɪskælkjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌmɪskælkjuˈleɪʃn/<,>n.算错/n.误算<,>The rocket's failure was due to a miscalculation.<,>火箭失败是由于计算错误。<,>His miscalculation cost the company millions.<,>他的误算让公司损失数百万。<,>Even a small miscalculation can have big consequences.<,>即使小的计算错误也可能导致严重后果。<,>mis(错误)+calculation(计算)→错误计算<,>calculate(v.计算)/misjudgment(n.误判)  

hinder<,>/ˈhɪndə(r)/<,>/ˈhɪndər/<,>v.阻碍<,>Bad weather hindered the rescue efforts.<,>恶劣天气阻碍了救援工作。<,>Don't let fear hinder your progress.<,>别让恐惧阻碍你的进步。<,>The construction hindered traffic flow.<,>施工阻碍了交通流量。<,>hind(后面)+er→拖在后面→阻碍<,>hindrance(n.障碍)/behind(prep.在...后面)  

selection<,>/sɪˈlekʃn/<,>/sɪˈlekʃn/<,>n.选择/n.挑选<,>The store offers a wide selection of books.<,>这家书店提供大量图书选择。<,>Natural selection drives evolution.<,>自然选择推动进化。<,>Her selection for the team was unexpected.<,>她被选入团队出乎意料。<,>select(选择)+ion(名词后缀)→选择行为<,>election(n.选举)/selection(adj.精选的)  

tide<,>/taɪd/<,>/taɪd/<,>n.潮水<,>The tide comes in twice a day.<,>潮水每天涨两次。<,>They walked along the beach at low tide.<,>他们在退潮时沿海滩散步。<,>The rising tide flooded the coastal road.<,>涨潮淹没了沿海公路。<,>tide(时间)→按时到来的潮水<,>tidy(adj.整洁的)/tied(v.系，绑)
superior<,>/suːˈpɪəriə(r)/<,>/suːˈpɪriər/<,>adj.上级的/adj.较高的/n.上级/n.长官<,>Her superior knowledge impressed the team.<,>她丰富的知识给团队留下了深刻印象。<,>He reported the issue to his superior.<,>他向他的上级汇报了这个问题。<,>This product is superior in quality.<,>这个产品质量上乘。<,>super(超)+ior(比较级后缀)→超过一般的→较高的<,>inferior(adj.下级的/n.下级)/prior(adj.优先的)/senior(adj.年长的/n.长辈)  

matter<,>/ˈmætə(r)/<,>/ˈmætər/<,>v.要紧/v.重要<,>It doesn't matter if you're late.<,>你迟到也没关系。<,>What matters most is your health.<,>最重要的是你的健康。<,>This matter requires immediate attention.<,>这件事需要立即处理。<,>mat(物质)+ter→实质内容→重要<,>material(n.材料)/mutter(v.嘀咕)/mattress(n.床垫)  

passively<,>/ˈpæsɪvli/<,>/ˈpæsɪvli/<,>adv.消极地<,>He listened passively to the lecture.<,>他消极地听讲座。<,>She accepted the criticism passively.<,>她消极地接受了批评。<,>The crowd watched passively as the event unfolded.<,>人群消极地看着事件发展。<,>pass(忍受)+ive(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→消极忍受地<,>actively(adv.积极地)/passion(n.激情)/passive(adj.被动的)  

grant<,>/ɡrɑːnt/<,>/ɡrænt/<,>v.授予/v.允许<,>The university granted her a scholarship.<,>大学授予她奖学金。<,>I grant you permission to leave early.<,>我允许你提前离开。<,>The government granted the request.<,>政府批准了这个请求。<,>gran(颗粒)+t→给予颗粒→授予<,>grand(adj.宏伟的)/grasp(v.抓住)/grunt(v.咕哝)  

liberation<,>/ˌlɪbəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌlɪbəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.解放<,>The liberation of the city was celebrated.<,>人们庆祝城市的解放。<,>Women's liberation changed society.<,>妇女解放改变了社会。<,>He fought for the liberation of his people.<,>他为人民的解放而战。<,>liber(自由)+ation(名词后缀)→解放<,>liberty(n.自由)/deliberation(n.深思)/liberal(adj.自由的)  

observe<,>/əbˈzɜːv/<,>/əbˈzɜːrv/<,>v.遵守<,>Drivers must observe traffic rules.<,>司机必须遵守交通规则。<,>She observed the traditions carefully.<,>她认真遵守传统。<,>It's important to observe the law.<,>遵守法律很重要。<,>ob(加强)+serve(保持)→保持遵守<,>reserve(v.保留)/deserve(v.应得)/conserve(v.保存)  

institute<,>/ˈɪnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈɪnstɪtuːt/<,>v.建立/n.机构/n.学院/n.研究院<,>They instituted a new policy.<,>他们制定了一项新政策。<,>She works at a research institute.<,>她在一家研究所工作。<,>The institute offers various courses.<,>该学院提供各种课程。<,>in(进入)+stit(建立)+ute→建立<,>constitute(v.组成)/substitute(n.替代品)/destitute(adj.贫困的)  

dormitory<,>/ˈdɔːmətri/<,>/ˈdɔːrmətɔːri/<,>n.宿舍<,>Students share a dormitory.<,>学生们共用一间宿舍。<,>The dormitory has strict rules.<,>宿舍有严格的规定。<,>He returned to the dormitory late.<,>他晚归宿舍。<,>dorm(睡眠)+itory(场所)→睡觉的地方→宿舍<,>dormant(adj.休眠的)/dormer(n.天窗)/dormouse(n.睡鼠)  

awful<,>/ˈɔːfl/<,>/ˈɔːfl/<,>adj.可怕的/adj.骇人的<,>The accident was awful.<,>这起事故很可怕。<,>She had an awful dream.<,>她做了一个可怕的梦。<,>The weather is awful today.<,>今天天气糟透了。<,>aw(e)(敬畏)+ful(充满)→充满敬畏的→可怕的<,>awesome(adj.极好的)/lawful(adj.合法的)/awfully(adv.非常)  

emergency<,>/iˈmɜːdʒənsi/<,>/iˈmɜːrdʒənsi/<,>n.紧急情况<,>Call 911 in case of emergency.<,>遇到紧急情况请拨打911。<,>The hospital has an emergency room.<,>医院设有急诊室。<,>We have an emergency plan.<,>我们有应急预案。<,>e(出)+merg(沉)+ency→突然浮出→紧急情况<,>emerge(v.出现)/submerge(v.淹没)/mergency(拼写错误，正确为emergency)
stress<,>/stres/<,>/strɛs/<,>n.压力/n.重音<,>Too much stress can harm your health.<,>压力过大会损害健康。<,>The stress in the word "record" falls on the first syllable.<,>单词“record”的重音在第一个音节。<,>She's under a lot of stress at work.<,>她工作压力很大。<,>s+tress(发音似“踹死”)→压力大时想踹人<,>distress(n.悲痛)/compress(v.压缩)/suppress(v.镇压)  

launch<,>/lɔːntʃ/<,>/lɔntʃ/<,>v.发动<,>The company will launch a new product next month.<,>该公司下月将发布新产品。<,>They launched an attack at dawn.<,>他们在黎明发动了进攻。<,>The rocket was successfully launched into space.<,>火箭成功发射升空。<,>laun(谐音“浪”)+ch→浪起来→发动<,>lunch(n.午餐)/lynch(v.私刑)/ranch(n.牧场)  

suppose<,>/səˈpəʊz/<,>/səˈpoʊz/<,>v.料想/v.以为/v.假定/v.期望<,>I suppose he'll be late again.<,>我猜他又要迟到了。<,>Suppose it rains tomorrow, what shall we do?<,>假如下雨，我们怎么办？<,>You're supposed to finish the report by Friday.<,>你应该在周五前完成报告。<,>sup(下)+pose(放)→放下想法→假定<,>propose(v.提议)/dispose(v.处理)/oppose(v.反对)  

remove<,>/rɪˈmuːv/<,>/rɪˈmuv/<,>v.消除/v.移除<,>Please remove your shoes before entering.<,>进屋前请脱鞋。<,>The stain was difficult to remove.<,>这个污渍很难清除。<,>He was removed from his position as manager.<,>他被免去了经理职务。<,>re(再)+move(移动)→移走<,>move(v.移动)/approve(v.批准)/improve(v.改善)  

exposure<,>/ɪkˈspəʊʒə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspoʊʒər/<,>n.暴露/n.揭露<,>Long exposure to sunlight can damage your skin.<,>长时间暴露在阳光下会损伤皮肤。<,>The documentary led to the exposure of corruption.<,>这部纪录片揭露了腐败行为。<,>Her performance gained her much media exposure.<,>她的表演使她获得大量媒体曝光。<,>ex(出)+pos(放)+ure→暴露在外<,>disclosure(n.披露)/enclosure(n.围场)/composure(n.镇静)  

promote<,>/prəˈməʊt/<,>/prəˈmoʊt/<,>v.促进/v.提升/v.推销<,>Exercise promotes good health.<,>锻炼促进健康。<,>She was promoted to senior manager.<,>她被提升为高级经理。<,>They're promoting the new movie on social media.<,>他们正在社交媒体上宣传新电影。<,>pro(向前)+mot(动)+e→向前推动→促进<,>demote(v.降级)/remote(adj.遥远的)/commotion(n.骚动)  

engage<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>v.从事/v.吸引<,>He engages in volunteer work on weekends.<,>他周末从事志愿工作。<,>The toy didn't engage the child's interest for long.<,>这个玩具没能长久吸引孩子的兴趣。<,>They got engaged last Christmas.<,>他们在去年圣诞节订婚了。<,>en(使)+gage(抵押)→用承诺抵押→订婚→从事<,>enrage(v.激怒)/mortgage(n.抵押)/garage(n.车库)  

uncertain<,>/ʌnˈsɜːtn/<,>/ʌnˈsɜrtn/<,>adj.不确定的<,>I'm uncertain about the meeting time.<,>我不确定会议时间。<,>The weather forecast is uncertain for tomorrow.<,>明天的天气预报不确定。<,>She gave an uncertain answer to the question.<,>她对这个问题给出了不确定的回答。<,>un(不)+certain(确定的)→不确定的<,>certain(adj.确定的)/ascertain(v.查明)/concert(n.音乐会)  

accommodate<,>/əˈkɒmədeɪt/<,>/əˈkɑmədeɪt/<,>v.为…提供住宿<,>The hotel can accommodate 500 guests.<,>这家酒店可容纳500位客人。<,>We need to accommodate his special dietary needs.<,>我们需要满足他的特殊饮食需求。<,>The theater accommodates wheelchair users.<,>剧院为轮椅使用者提供便利。<,>ac(向)+com(共同)+mod(方式)+ate→使适应方式→容纳<,>commodity(n.商品)/moderate(adj.适度的)/commode(n.衣柜)  

slave<,>/sleɪv/<,>/sleɪv/<,>n.奴隶<,>In ancient times, slaves built the pyramids.<,>古时候奴隶建造了金字塔。<,>She's been a slave to fashion all her life.<,>她一生都是时尚的奴隶。<,>Don't be a slave to your phone.<,>不要成为手机的奴隶。<,>s+la(拉)+ve→被拉着干活的人→奴隶<,>save(v.拯救)/shave(v.剃须)/sleeve(n.袖子)
mature<,>/məˈtʃʊə(r)/<,>/məˈtʃʊr/<,>adj.成熟的<,>She is very mature for her age.<,>就她的年龄而言，她非常成熟。<,>The wine needs time to mature.<,>这葡萄酒需要时间陈酿。<,>He showed a mature understanding of the situation.<,>他对局势表现出成熟的理解。<,>mat(母亲)+ure(状态)→像母亲一样的状态→成熟的<,>immature(adj.不成熟的)/nature(n.自然)

contrast<,>/ˈkɒntrɑːst/<,>/ˈkɑːntræst/<,>n.对照物/v.对比<,>There is a sharp contrast between the two brothers.<,>这两兄弟形成鲜明对比。<,>Contrast these two pictures carefully.<,>仔细对比这两张图片。<,>The white walls contrast with the black furniture.<,>白色的墙壁与黑色家具形成对比。<,>contra(相反)+st(站立)→站在对立面→对比<,>contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/contest(n.比赛/v.争辩)

clinic<,>/ˈklɪnɪk/<,>/ˈklɪnɪk/<,>n.诊所<,>She works at a dental clinic.<,>她在一家牙科诊所工作。<,>The university has a free student clinic.<,>大学设有免费的学生诊所。<,>He was admitted to the clinic for observation.<,>他被收治入院观察。<,>clin(倾斜)+ic(场所)→病人需要倾斜休息的场所→诊所<,>clinical(adj.临床的)/climax(n.高潮)

award<,>/əˈwɔːd/<,>/əˈwɔːrd/<,>v.授予/v.判给/n.奖(金)<,>She was awarded the Nobel Prize.<,>她被授予诺贝尔奖。<,>The court awarded him damages.<,>法庭判给他损害赔偿金。<,>He won the Employee of the Year award.<,>他获得了年度最佳员工奖。<,>a(加强)+ward(看)→经过仔细看后给予→授予<,>reward(n.报酬/v.奖励)/awkward(adj.笨拙的)

worthwhile<,>/ˌwɜːθˈwaɪl/<,>/ˌwɜːrθˈwaɪl/<,>adj.有价值的<,>It's worthwhile to visit the museum.<,>参观这个博物馆很值得。<,>This is a worthwhile investment.<,>这是一项值得的投资。<,>She found the course very worthwhile.<,>她发现这门课程非常有用。<,>worth(价值)+while(时间)→值得花时间的→有价值的<,>worthless(adj.无价值的)/worthy(adj.值得的)

cruelty<,>/ˈkruːəlti/<,>/ˈkruːəlti/<,>n.残暴/n.残酷<,>The cruelty of war is unimaginable.<,>战争的残酷难以想象。<,>Animal cruelty is a serious crime.<,>虐待动物是严重罪行。<,>He showed great cruelty to his enemies.<,>他对敌人表现出极大的残忍。<,>cruel(残酷的)+ty(名词后缀)→残酷<,>cruel(adj.残酷的)/crude(adj.粗糙的)

threaten<,>/ˈθretn/<,>/ˈθretn/<,>v.威胁<,>He threatened to call the police.<,>他威胁要报警。<,>Dark clouds threatened rain.<,>乌云预示着要下雨。<,>The disease threatens millions of lives.<,>这种疾病威胁着数百万人的生命。<,>threat(威胁)+en(动词后缀)→威胁<,>treat(v.对待/n.款待)/thread(n.线/v.穿线)

chemical<,>/ˈkemɪkl/<,>/ˈkemɪkl/<,>adj.化学的/n.化学制品<,>The chemical reaction produces heat.<,>这个化学反应会产生热量。<,>Handle these chemicals with care.<,>小心处理这些化学品。<,>She works in the chemical industry.<,>她在化工行业工作。<,>chem(化学)+ical(形容词后缀)→化学的<,>chemistry(n.化学)/chemist(n.化学家)

consistent<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.一致的<,>His story is consistent with the facts.<,>他的说法与事实一致。<,>She shows consistent improvement.<,>她表现出持续的进步。<,>We need a consistent approach to this problem.<,>我们需要一个一致的方法来解决这个问题。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)+ent(形容词后缀)→共同站立的→一致的<,>persistent(adj.坚持的)/insistent(adj.坚持的)

renew<,>/rɪˈnjuː/<,>/rɪˈnuː/<,>v.〔中止后〕重新开始/v.继续<,>I need to renew my passport.<,>我需要续签护照。<,>They renewed their friendship after many years.<,>多年后他们重续友谊。<,>The contract will be renewed next month.<,>合同将于下个月续签。<,>re(重新)+new(新的)→重新开始<,>renovate(v.翻新)/resume(v.重新开始)
takeoff<,>/ˈteɪkɒf/<,>/ˈteɪkɔːf/<,>n.起飞<,>The plane's takeoff was delayed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，飞机起飞延误了。<,>His career really took off after that movie.<,>出演那部电影后，他的事业真正起飞了。<,>The comedian did a perfect takeoff of the president's speech.<,>这位喜剧演员完美模仿了总统的演讲。<,>take(拿)+off(离开)→拿离地面→起飞<,>takeout(n.外卖)/takeover(n.接管)/takeup(n.吸收)  

innocent<,>/ˈɪnəsənt/<,>/ˈɪnəsənt/<,>adj.无辜的/adj.天真的<,>The jury found him innocent of all charges.<,>陪审团判定他所有指控均不成立。<,>She gave him an innocent smile.<,>她向他露出天真的微笑。<,>Don't play innocent—I know you ate the last cookie.<,>别装无辜了，我知道是你吃了最后一块饼干。<,>in(不)+noc(伤害)+ent→未造成伤害的→无辜的<,>ignorant(adj.无知的)/indecent(adj.下流的)/incessant(adj.持续不断的)  

currently<,>/ˈkʌrəntli/<,>/ˈkɜːrəntli/<,>adv.当前/adv.一般地<,>She is currently working on a new novel.<,>她目前正在创作一部新小说。<,>Currently, the project is under review.<,>目前该项目正在审核中。<,>This method is currently the most effective.<,>这种方法目前是最有效的。<,>current(流动的)+ly→如水流般→当前<,>urgently(adv.紧急地)/curiously(adv.好奇地)/concurrently(adv.同时地)  

dropout<,>/ˈdrɒpaʊt/<,>/ˈdrɑːpaʊt/<,>n.辍学者<,>He became a high school dropout at 16.<,>他16岁时就从高中辍学了。<,>The program helps dropouts get their GED.<,>该项目帮助辍学者获得普通教育文凭。<,>College dropouts often face employment challenges.<,>大学辍学者常面临就业困难。<,>drop(掉落)+out(出去)→从教育体系掉出的人<,>drop-in(n.偶然来访)/drop-off(n.下降)/dropkick(n.倒钩踢球)  

replace<,>/rɪˈpleɪs/<,>/rɪˈpleɪs/<,>v.代替<,>We need to replace the broken window.<,>我们需要更换破损的窗户。<,>Can robots replace human teachers?<,>机器人能取代人类教师吗？<,>She replaced sugar with honey in the recipe.<,>她在食谱中用蜂蜜代替了糖。<,>re(重新)+place(放置)→重新放置→替换<,>displace(v.置换)/misplace(v.放错)/replay(v.重播)  

sightseeing<,>/ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ/<,>/ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ/<,>n.观光<,>We went sightseeing in Paris last summer.<,>去年夏天我们在巴黎观光。<,>The tour includes three hours of sightseeing.<,>这次旅行包含三小时的观光时间。<,>Sightseeing buses depart from the main square.<,>观光巴士从主广场发车。<,>sight(景色)+see(看)+ing→看风景的活动<,>sightline(n.视线)/sight-read(v.视奏)/insight(n.洞察力)  

honor<,>/ˈɒnə(r)/<,>/ˈɑːnər/<,>n.荣誉/n.崇敬<,>It's an honor to meet you.<,>很荣幸见到您。<,>The soldier was buried with full military honors.<,>这名士兵以全套军礼下葬。<,>We honor our ancestors with this ceremony.<,>我们通过这个仪式敬奉祖先。<,>hon(尊敬)+or→值得尊敬的事物<,>honorary(adj.名誉的)/honesty(n.诚实)/honorarium(n.酬金)  

imitate<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>v.模仿<,>Parrots can imitate human speech.<,>鹦鹉能模仿人类说话。<,>He imitated his teacher's accent perfectly.<,>他完美模仿了老师的口音。<,>The product was designed to imitate leather.<,>该产品被设计成仿皮革材质。<,>imit(像)+ate(使)→使相似→模仿<,>intimate(adj.亲密的)/irritate(v.激怒)/innovate(v.创新)  

installment<,>/ɪnˈstɔːlmənt/<,>/ɪnˈstɑːlmənt/<,>n.分期付款<,>I bought the phone with six monthly installments.<,>我分六期购买了这部手机。<,>The novel was published in weekly installments.<,>这部小说以周刊形式连载。<,>The final installment of the loan is due next month.<,>贷款最后一期还款下月到期。<,>in(进入)+stall(放置)+ment→分批放置→分期<,>installation(n.安装)/instalment(英式拼写)/reinstate(v.恢复)  

personality<,>/ˌpɜːsəˈnæləti/<,>/ˌpɜːrsəˈnæləti/<,>n.个性/n.性格<,>Her cheerful personality makes her popular.<,>她开朗的性格很受欢迎。<,>The test measures different personality traits.<,>该测试衡量不同的性格特征。<,>He developed a split personality after the trauma.<,>经历创伤后他出现了人格分裂。<,>person(人)+ality(性质)→人的特性<,>personal(adj.个人的)/personnel(n.员工)/personify(v.拟人化)
headquarter<,>/ˌhɛdˈkwɔːtə/<,>/ˌhɛdˈkwɔːrtər/<,>v.设立总部/v.在…设立总部<,>The company will headquarter its operations in London.<,>该公司将在伦敦设立总部。<,>They decided to headquarter the new division in Singapore.<,>他们决定在新加坡设立新部门的总部。<,>The tech giant headquartered its research team in Silicon Valley.<,>这家科技巨头将其研究团队总部设在硅谷。<,>head(头)+quarter(区域)→总部所在地<,>headquarters(n.总部)/headland(n.岬角)/headlock(n.头部固定)

ingredient<,>/ɪnˈɡriːdiənt/<,>/ɪnˈɡridiənt/<,>n.成分/n.原料<,>Flour is the main ingredient in bread.<,>面粉是面包的主要成分。<,>This sauce contains natural ingredients only.<,>这种酱汁只含天然原料。<,>Trust is an essential ingredient for a successful relationship.<,>信任是成功关系的必要要素。<,>in(进入)+gred(走)+ient→走进去的东西→成分<,>gradient(n.坡度)/congredient(adj.组合的)/ingress(n.进入)

revenue<,>/ˈrevənjuː/<,>/ˈrevənuː/<,>n.收入<,>Tax revenue increased by 15% this year.<,>今年税收收入增长了15%。<,>The company's annual revenue reached $2 billion.<,>该公司年收入达到20亿美元。<,>Tourism generates significant revenue for the island.<,>旅游业为该岛带来可观收入。<,>re(回)+ven(来)+ue→回来的钱→收入<,>avenue(n.大街)/revenge(n.报复)/venue(n.场地)

sensitive<,>/ˈsensətɪv/<,>/ˈsensətɪv/<,>adj.敏感的<,>She has sensitive skin that reacts to most soaps.<,>她的皮肤很敏感，对大多数肥皂都会过敏。<,>This is a politically sensitive issue.<,>这是个政治敏感问题。<,>The equipment is sensitive to temperature changes.<,>该设备对温度变化很敏感。<,>sens(感觉)+itive→容易感觉的→敏感的<,>sensible(adj.明智的)/sensory(adj.感觉的)/sensational(adj.轰动的)

particular<,>/pəˈtɪkjʊlə/<,>/pərˈtɪkjʊlər/<,>adj.特别的/adj.特指的/adj.讲究的/adj.挑剔的<,>She's particular about food quality.<,>她对食物质量很讲究。<,>Pay particular attention to this paragraph.<,>要特别注意这一段。<,>There was nothing particular about that day.<,>那天没什么特别的。<,>part(部分)+icular→强调某部分→特别的<,>particle(n.微粒)/participate(v.参加)/partition(n.分隔)

tumor<,>/ˈtjuːmə/<,>/ˈtuːmər/<,>n.瘤<,>The doctor found a benign tumor during the scan.<,>医生在扫描中发现了一个良性肿瘤。<,>Early detection of tumors increases treatment success.<,>早期发现肿瘤可提高治疗成功率。<,>He underwent surgery to remove the brain tumor.<,>他接受了脑瘤切除手术。<,>tum(肿胀)+or→肿胀物→瘤<,>rumor(n.谣言)/humor(n.幽默)/tumult(n.骚乱)

consequence<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwens/<,>n.结果/n.成果<,>His actions had serious consequences.<,>他的行为产生了严重后果。<,>This discovery is of great consequence to science.<,>这一发现对科学意义重大。<,>You must consider the potential consequences.<,>你必须考虑潜在后果。<,>con(共同)+sequ(跟随)+ence→跟随而来的→结果<,>sequence(n.序列)/subsequent(adj.随后的)/eloquence(n.雄辩)

explicitly<,>/ɪkˈsplɪsɪtli/<,>/ɪkˈsplɪsɪtli/<,>adv.直接地/adv.明确地<,>The rules were explicitly stated in the contract.<,>规则在合同中被明确说明。<,>She explicitly denied the allegations.<,>她明确否认了这些指控。<,>The instructions must be followed explicitly.<,>必须严格按照说明操作。<,>ex(出)+plic(折叠)+itly→完全展开地→明确地<,>implicitly(adv.含蓄地)/explicate(v.解释)/complicit(adj.同谋的)

sway<,>/sweɪ/<,>/sweɪ/<,>v.影响<,>His speech swayed public opinion.<,>他的演讲影响了公众舆论。<,>The trees swayed gently in the breeze.<,>树木在微风中轻轻摇曳。<,>Don't let emotions sway your judgment.<,>不要让情绪影响你的判断。<,>s(看作swing摇摆)+way(路)→摇摆着前进→影响<,>swear(v.发誓)/sweep(v.清扫)/swan(n.天鹅)

technical<,>/ˈteknɪkəl/<,>/ˈteknɪkəl/<,>adj.技术的<,>He has strong technical skills in programming.<,>他拥有很强的编程技术能力。<,>The manual contains technical specifications.<,>手册包含技术规格说明。<,>This is a purely technical problem.<,>这纯粹是个技术问题。<,>techn(技术)+ical→技术的<,>technique(n.技巧)/technician(n.技师)/technocracy(n.技术统治)
expert<,>/ˈekspɜːt/<,>/ˈɛkspɜrt/<,>adj.熟练的/adj.内行的<,>She is an expert in ancient history.<,>她是古代历史方面的专家。<,>He gave an expert opinion on the matter.<,>他就此事给出了专业意见。<,>Her expert hands repaired the delicate vase.<,>她灵巧的双手修复了那个精致的花瓶。<,>ex(出)+pert(尝试)→尝试过很多→熟练的<,>export(n.出口/v.输出)/exert(v.运用/v.施加)  

harm<,>/hɑːm/<,>/hɑrm/<,>n.损害/n.危害/n.伤害/v.伤害/v.损害<,>Smoking can harm your health.<,>吸烟会危害你的健康。<,>The storm did great harm to the crops.<,>暴风雨对庄稼造成了巨大损害。<,>I meant no harm by my comments.<,>我的评论并无恶意。<,>harm(谐音"害")+ful(形容词后缀)→有害的<,>arm(n.手臂/v.武装)/charm(n.魅力/v.迷住)  

imaginary<,>/ɪˈmædʒɪnəri/<,>/ɪˈmædʒəˌnɛri/<,>adj.虚构的/adj.想象的<,>The story is set in an imaginary world.<,>这个故事设定在一个虚构的世界。<,>Her imaginary friend kept her company.<,>她想象中的朋友陪伴着她。<,>The threat was purely imaginary.<,>这种威胁纯属想象。<,>image(图像)+ary(形容词后缀)→想象的<,>imagination(n.想象力)/imaginative(adj.富有想象力的)  

contaminate<,>/kənˈtæmɪneɪt/<,>/kənˈtæməˌneɪt/<,>v.污染/v.弄脏<,>The river was contaminated with industrial waste.<,>这条河被工业废料污染了。<,>Don't contaminate the samples with bare hands.<,>不要用裸手污染样品。<,>The scandal contaminated his reputation.<,>丑闻玷污了他的名声。<,>con(共同)+tamin(接触)+ate(动词后缀)→共同接触→污染<,>contain(v.包含)/contemplate(v.沉思)  

soar<,>/sɔː(r)/<,>/sɔr/<,>v.猛增<,>Prices soared during the crisis.<,>危机期间物价飞涨。<,>Eagles soar high above the mountains.<,>鹰在高山上空翱翔。<,>Her spirits soared when she heard the good news.<,>听到好消息后她精神振奋。<,>soar(谐音"嗖")→快速上升<,>sore(adj.疼痛的)/roar(v.咆哮)  

solely<,>/ˈsəʊlli/<,>/ˈsoʊlli/<,>adv.单独地/adv.唯一地<,>He is solely responsible for the project.<,>他独自负责这个项目。<,>This decision was based solely on facts.<,>这个决定完全基于事实。<,>She lives solely for her art.<,>她只为艺术而活。<,>sole(单独的)+ly(副词后缀)→单独地<,>soul(n.灵魂)/solar(adj.太阳的)  

tremendous<,>/trəˈmendəs/<,>/trəˈmɛndəs/<,>adj.巨大的<,>The project required a tremendous amount of work.<,>这个项目需要巨大的工作量。<,>We had a tremendous time at the party.<,>我们在聚会上玩得非常开心。<,>She has made tremendous progress in her studies.<,>她在学习上取得了巨大进步。<,>trem(颤抖)+endous→大得让人颤抖→巨大的<,>tremor(n.震颤)/tremble(v.发抖)  

civilization<,>/ˌsɪvəlaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌsɪvələˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.文明<,>Ancient Egyptian civilization fascinates historians.<,>古埃及文明令历史学家着迷。<,>The spread of civilization changed human life.<,>文明的传播改变了人类生活。<,>He studies the civilizations of Mesoamerica.<,>他研究中美洲文明。<,>civil(公民的)+ization(名词后缀)→文明<,>civilian(n.平民)/civilize(v.使文明)  

tough<,>/tʌf/<,>/tʌf/<,>adj.困难的<,>It was a tough decision to make.<,>这是个艰难的决定。<,>The steak was too tough to chew.<,>这块牛排太硬咬不动。<,>He's been through some tough times.<,>他经历了一些艰难时期。<,>tough(谐音"他服")→困难得让人服气<,>rough(adj.粗糙的)/though(conj.虽然)  

gift<,>/ɡɪft/<,>/ɡɪft/<,>n.礼物/n.天赋<,>She has a gift for languages.<,>她有语言天赋。<,>He gave me a beautiful birthday gift.<,>他送给我一份漂亮的生日礼物。<,>Your presence is gift enough.<,>你的出席就是最好的礼物。<,>gift(谐音"给富")→给富人送礼物<,>lift(v.举起)/shift(v.改变)
scale<,>/skeɪl/<,>/skeɪl/<,>n.规模/n.比例<,>The scale of the problem is much bigger than we thought.<,>这个问题的规模比我们想象的要大得多。<,>This map is drawn to scale.<,>这张地图是按比例绘制的。<,>She practices the piano on a large scale every day.<,>她每天大规模地练习钢琴。<,>s+cal(计算)+e→计算范围→规模<,>scan(v.扫描/n.审视)/scare(v.惊吓/n.恐慌)/scalp(n.头皮/v.倒卖)  

injure<,>/ˈɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ˈɪndʒər/<,>v.使受伤<,>He injured his knee while playing football.<,>他踢足球时膝盖受伤了。<,>The criticism injured her pride.<,>批评伤害了她的自尊。<,>Smoking can injure your health.<,>吸烟会损害你的健康。<,>in(不)+jure(法律)→不合法→伤害<,>insure(v.投保)/incur(v.招致)/inject(v.注射)  

embrace<,>/ɪmˈbreɪs/<,>/ɪmˈbreɪs/<,>v.拥抱/v.欣然接受<,>She embraced her daughter warmly.<,>她热情地拥抱了女儿。<,>The company embraced new technology quickly.<,>公司迅速接受了新技术。<,>He embraced the opportunity to study abroad.<,>他欣然接受了出国留学的机会。<,>em(进入)+brace(手臂)→进入手臂→拥抱<,>embarrass(v.使尴尬)/embroider(v.刺绣)/embody(v.体现)  

seldom<,>/ˈseldəm/<,>/ˈseldəm/<,>adv.很少/adv.罕见<,>He seldom eats meat.<,>他很少吃肉。<,>Such cases are seldom reported.<,>这类案件很少被报道。<,>She seldom goes to the cinema.<,>她很少去看电影。<,>sel(单独)+dom(领域)→单独领域→罕见<,>often(adv.经常)/always(adv.总是)/frequently(adv.频繁地)  

performance<,>/pəˈfɔːməns/<,>/pərˈfɔːrməns/<,>n.演出/n.履行/n.表现<,>The orchestra gave a brilliant performance.<,>管弦乐队进行了精彩的演出。<,>His job performance has improved.<,>他的工作表现有所改善。<,>The car's performance is excellent.<,>这辆车的性能非常出色。<,>perform(执行)+ance(名词后缀)→表现<,>performer(n.表演者)/perfume(n.香水)/perforate(v.穿孔)  

violate<,>/ˈvaɪəleɪt/<,>/ˈvaɪəleɪt/<,>v.违反<,>The company violated environmental laws.<,>该公司违反了环境法。<,>His actions violated her privacy.<,>他的行为侵犯了她的隐私。<,>Don't violate the school rules.<,>不要违反校规。<,>viol(暴力)+ate(动词后缀)→用暴力破坏→违反<,>violent(adj.暴力的)/violet(n.紫罗兰)/violin(n.小提琴)  

associate<,>/əˈsəʊsieɪt/<,>/əˈsoʊsieɪt/<,>v.联系/v.交往<,>People often associate rain with sadness.<,>人们常把雨和悲伤联系起来。<,>She associates with influential people.<,>她与有影响力的人交往。<,>The smell is associated with my childhood.<,>这种气味让我联想到童年。<,>as(加强)+soci(同伴)+ate→成为同伴→交往<,>appreciate(v.欣赏)/appropriate(adj.合适的)/approximate(adj.近似的)  

privacy<,>/ˈprɪvəsi/<,>/ˈpraɪvəsi/<,>n.隐私<,>Everyone has the right to privacy.<,>每个人都有隐私权。<,>She values her privacy greatly.<,>她非常重视自己的隐私。<,>The new law protects online privacy.<,>新法律保护网络隐私。<,>priv(私人)+acy(状态)→隐私<,>privilege(n.特权)/private(adj.私人的)/pirate(n.海盗)  

choke<,>/tʃəʊk/<,>/tʃoʊk/<,>v.使窒息<,>The smoke made him choke.<,>烟雾使他窒息。<,>She choked on a piece of bread.<,>她被一块面包噎住了。<,>Anger choked his words.<,>愤怒让他说不出话来。<,>cho(谐音"呛")+ke→呛咳→窒息<,>joke(n.玩笑)/poke(v.戳)/cloak(n.斗篷)  

capable<,>/ˈkeɪpəbl/<,>/ˈkeɪpəbl/<,>adj.能干的/adj.有能力的<,>She is capable of handling difficult situations.<,>她有能力处理困难情况。<,>This robot is capable of complex tasks.<,>这个机器人能完成复杂任务。<,>He proved himself capable as a leader.<,>他证明了自己是个能干的领导者。<,>cap(抓住)+able(能)→能抓住的→有能力的<,>capacity(n.容量)/captive(adj.被俘虏的)/capital(n.首都)
appeal<,>/əˈpiːl/<,>/əˈpil/<,>n.呼吁/v.吸引/v.呼吁/v.恳请<,>The charity made an appeal for donations.<,>该慈善机构呼吁捐款。<,>His artwork appeals to young people.<,>他的艺术作品对年轻人很有吸引力。<,>She appealed to the judge for mercy.<,>她向法官恳求宽恕。<,>ap(向)+peal(驱动)→驱动别人→吸引<,>peel(v.剥皮/n.果皮)/appal(v.使惊骇)  

careless<,>/ˈkeələs/<,>/ˈkɛrləs/<,>adj.粗心的<,>He made a careless mistake in the exam.<,>他在考试中犯了一个粗心的错误。<,>Careless driving causes many accidents.<,>粗心驾驶导致许多事故。<,>She's careless with her belongings.<,>她对个人物品很粗心。<,>care(关心)+less(少)→关心少→粗心的<,>carefree(adj.无忧无虑的)/caretaker(n.看管人)  

hit<,>/hɪt/<,>/hɪt/<,>n.成功/n.命中/v.击中<,>The song became an instant hit.<,>这首歌立即走红。<,>He scored a direct hit on the target.<,>他准确命中目标。<,>The boxer hit his opponent hard.<,>拳击手重重击中了对手。<,>拟声词，模仿击打声<,>hot(adj.热的)/hut(n.小屋)/hint(n.暗示)  

swallow<,>/ˈswɒləʊ/<,>/ˈswɑloʊ/<,>v.咽下/v.吞下<,>She swallowed her medicine with water.<,>她用水吞下了药。<,>The whale swallowed tons of plankton.<,>鲸鱼吞食了大量浮游生物。<,>He swallowed his pride and apologized.<,>他放下骄傲道了歉。<,>s+wall(墙)+ow→像穿过墙一样咽下<,>shallow(adj.浅的)/swan(n.天鹅)  

consult<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>v.咨询<,>You should consult a doctor about that pain.<,>你应该就那个疼痛咨询医生。<,>He consulted the dictionary for the meaning.<,>他查字典找词义。<,>The committee will consult with experts.<,>委员会将与专家商议。<,>con(共同)+sult(坐)→坐在一起商讨<,>insult(v.侮辱)/result(n.结果)  

preservation<,>/ˌprezəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɛzɚˈveɪʃən/<,>n.保存/n.保留<,>The preservation of ancient artifacts is important.<,>保存古代文物很重要。<,>Food preservation techniques have improved.<,>食品保鲜技术已改进。<,>He works in wildlife preservation.<,>他从事野生动物保护工作。<,>pre(前)+serve(保持)+ation→提前保持→保存<,>reservation(n.预订)/conservation(n.保护)  

distance<,>/ˈdɪstəns/<,>/ˈdɪstəns/<,>n.距离<,>The distance between the two cities is 200km.<,>两座城市相距200公里。<,>He kept his distance from the angry dog.<,>他与发怒的狗保持距离。<,>Long-distance relationships are challenging.<,>异地恋很有挑战性。<,>di(分开)+st(站)+ance→分开站立→距离<,>instance(n.实例)/substance(n.物质)  

plastic<,>/ˈplæstɪk/<,>/ˈplæstɪk/<,>adj.塑料的<,>Plastic bottles are recyclable.<,>塑料瓶可回收利用。<,>She wore a plastic raincoat.<,>她穿了件塑料雨衣。<,>This toy is made of plastic.<,>这个玩具是塑料制的。<,>plas(塑造)+tic→可塑的→塑料的<,>elastic(adj.有弹性的)/fantastic(adj.极好的)  

predict<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>v.预言/v.预测<,>The weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow.<,>天气预报预测明天下雨。<,>No one could predict the outcome.<,>没人能预测结果。<,>She predicted he would become famous.<,>她预言他会成名。<,>pre(前)+dict(说)→提前说→预测<,>addict(v.使沉迷)/verdict(n.裁决)  

submit<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>v.提交<,>You must submit your application by Friday.<,>你必须在周五前提交申请。<,>He submitted his resignation letter.<,>他递交了辞职信。<,>Students submit assignments online.<,>学生在线提交作业。<,>sub(下)+mit(送)→从下送上→提交<,>summit(n.顶峰)/admit(v.承认)
entertainment<,>/ˌen.təˈteɪn.mənt/<,>/ˌen.t̬ɚˈteɪn.mənt/<,>n.娱乐<,>The city offers a variety of entertainment options.<,>这座城市提供多种娱乐选择。<,>He works in the entertainment industry.<,>他在娱乐行业工作。<,>Watching movies is my favorite form of entertainment.<,>看电影是我最喜欢的娱乐方式。<,>enter(进入)+tain(保持)+ment→保持兴趣的活动→娱乐<,>amusement(n.消遣)/recreation(n.休闲)/enjoyment(n.享受)  

critical<,>/ˈkrɪt.ɪ.kəl/<,>/ˈkrɪt̬.ɪ.kəl/<,>adj.批评的/adj.爱挑剔的<,>She is very critical of his work.<,>她对她的工作非常挑剔。<,>The report was highly critical of the government's policies.<,>该报告对政府的政策提出了严厉批评。<,>We are at a critical stage in the project.<,>我们正处于项目的关键阶段。<,>crit(判断)+ical→喜欢判断的→挑剔的<,>crucial(adj.至关重要的)/critic(n.批评家)/criticism(n.批评)  

transaction<,>/trænˈzæk.ʃən/<,>/trænˈzæk.ʃən/<,>n.交易/n.业务/n.事务<,>The bank charges a fee for each transaction.<,>银行对每笔交易收取费用。<,>The transaction was completed smoothly.<,>这笔交易顺利完成。<,>He handles all the financial transactions for the company.<,>他负责公司的所有财务业务。<,>trans(跨越)+action(行动)→跨界的行动→交易<,>interaction(n.互动)/transition(n.过渡)/transmission(n.传输)  

via<,>/ˈvaɪ.ə/<,>/ˈvaɪ.ə/<,>prep.通过<,>We flew to Paris via London.<,>我们经伦敦飞往巴黎。<,>I sent the document via email.<,>我通过电子邮件发送了文件。<,>The message was delivered via courier.<,>这条信息是通过快递送达的。<,>vi(路)+a→经由某条路→通过<,>via(n.道路)/vie(v.竞争)/visa(n.签证)  

insist<,>/ɪnˈsɪst/<,>/ɪnˈsɪst/<,>v.主张/v.坚持<,>She insisted on paying for the meal.<,>她坚持要付饭钱。<,>He insists that he is innocent.<,>他坚称自己是无辜的。<,>They insisted on seeing the manager.<,>他们坚持要见经理。<,>in(加强)+sist(站立)→坚决站立→坚持<,>persist(v.坚持)/consist(v.组成)/resist(v.抵抗)  

distract<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>/dɪˈstrækt/<,>v.分心<,>The noise distracted me from my work.<,>噪音让我无法专心工作。<,>Don't distract the driver while he's driving.<,>司机开车时不要让他分心。<,>She was distracted by her phone during the meeting.<,>她在开会时被手机分心了。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)→把注意力拉开→分心<,>attract(v.吸引)/extract(v.提取)/contract(n.合同)  

subdivision<,>/ˈsʌb.dɪˌvɪʒ.ən/<,>/ˈsʌb.dɪˌvɪʒ.ən/<,>n.分支/n.分部<,>The company has several subdivisions across the country.<,>该公司在全国有几个分部。<,>This chapter is further divided into subdivisions.<,>这一章进一步分为若干小节。<,>The land was sold as a subdivision for housing.<,>这块地被划分成住宅区出售。<,>sub(下面)+division(划分)→下面的划分→分支<,>division(n.部门)/sublet(v.转租)/submerge(v.淹没)  

yield<,>/jiːld/<,>/jiːld/<,>v.产生/v.得出〔结果、答案或资料〕/n.产量<,>The experiment yielded surprising results.<,>实验得出了令人惊讶的结果。<,>This field yields a high crop every year.<,>这块田地每年都有高产量。<,>He yielded to pressure and resigned.<,>他迫于压力辞职了。<,>yield与field押韵→田地产生产量<,>wield(v.挥舞)/shield(n.盾牌)/field(n.田地)  

misunderstand<,>/ˌmɪs.ʌn.dəˈstænd/<,>/ˌmɪs.ʌn.dɚˈstænd/<,>v.误解<,>Don't misunderstand me; I'm not blaming you.<,>别误会，我不是在责怪你。<,>There was a misunderstanding between them.<,>他们之间产生了误会。<,>She often misunderstands his intentions.<,>她经常误解他的意图。<,>mis(错误)+understand(理解)→错误理解→误解<,>mislead(v.误导)/misinterpret(v.曲解)/mistake(n.错误)  

detail<,>/ˈdiː.teɪl/<,>/ˈdiː.teɪl/<,>n.细节<,>Please pay attention to the details.<,>请注意细节。<,>He explained the plan in detail.<,>他详细解释了计划。<,>The report contains all the necessary details.<,>报告包含了所有必要的细节。<,>de(加强)+tail(切割)→切分得很细→细节<,>retail(n.零售)/entail(v.需要)/tailor(n.裁缝)
immeasurable<,>/ɪˈmeʒərəbl/<,>/ɪˈmeʒərəbəl/<,>adj.无法估量的<,>The universe is of immeasurable size.<,>宇宙的大小是无法估量的。<,>Her contribution to the project was immeasurable.<,>她对项目的贡献是无法估量的。<,>He felt immeasurable joy when he saw his newborn baby.<,>当他看到刚出生的孩子时，他感到无比喜悦。<,>im(不)+measure(测量)+able(能…的)→无法测量的<,>immense(adj.巨大的)/measurable(adj.可测量的)  

convincing<,>/kənˈvɪnsɪŋ/<,>/kənˈvɪnsɪŋ/<,>adj.令人信服的<,>She gave a convincing speech at the conference.<,>她在会议上发表了令人信服的演讲。<,>The evidence presented in court was very convincing.<,>法庭上提供的证据非常有说服力。<,>His arguments were so convincing that everyone agreed with him.<,>他的论点如此有说服力，以至于每个人都同意他的观点。<,>con(完全)+vinc(征服)+ing→完全征服人心的<,>convince(v.说服)/persuasive(adj.有说服力的)  

donate<,>/dəʊˈneɪt/<,>/ˈdoʊneɪt/<,>v.捐赠<,>He decided to donate blood to help the injured.<,>他决定献血以帮助伤者。<,>Many people donated money to the charity.<,>许多人向慈善机构捐款。<,>She donated her old clothes to the homeless shelter.<,>她把旧衣服捐给了无家可归者收容所。<,>don(给予)+ate(动词后缀)→给予别人<,>donation(n.捐赠)/donor(n.捐赠者)  

compare<,>/kəmˈpeə(r)/<,>/kəmˈper/<,>v.比较/对照<,>Teachers often compare students' work to assess their progress.<,>老师经常比较学生的作业以评估他们的进步。<,>It's unfair to compare her singing to a professional singer's.<,>将她的歌声与专业歌手的相比是不公平的。<,>He compared the two products before making a decision.<,>他在做决定前比较了这两种产品。<,>com(共同)+pare(平等)→放在一起看是否平等→比较<,>comparison(n.比较)/comparable(adj.可比较的)  

item<,>/ˈaɪtəm/<,>/ˈaɪtəm/<,>n.〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项/一件/一条<,>Please check each item on the list carefully.<,>请仔细核对清单上的每一项。<,>The first item on the agenda is the budget discussion.<,>议程上的第一项是预算讨论。<,>She bought several items of clothing at the mall.<,>她在商场买了几件衣服。<,>联想：I tem(拼音“特们”)→特别的一条<,>agenda(n.议程)/inventory(n.清单)  

concrete<,>/ˈkɒŋkriːt/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkriːt/<,>adj.具体的<,>We need concrete evidence to support our claim.<,>我们需要具体的证据来支持我们的主张。<,>She gave us concrete examples to illustrate her point.<,>她给我们举了具体的例子来说明她的观点。<,>The plan is still abstract; we need more concrete details.<,>这个计划还很抽象，我们需要更具体的细节。<,>con(共同)+crete(生长)→共同生长→具体化<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/specific(adj.明确的)  

govern<,>/ˈɡʌvn/<,>/ˈɡʌvərn/<,>v.管理/支配<,>Laws are made to govern the behavior of citizens.<,>法律是为了管理公民的行为而制定的。<,>He governed the country with wisdom and fairness.<,>他以智慧和公平治理国家。<,>The committee governs all financial decisions.<,>委员会管理所有的财务决策。<,>govern(谐音“管我”)→管理我<,>government(n.政府)/governor(n.州长)  

classify<,>/ˈklæsɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈklæsɪfaɪ/<,>v.把…分类/把…分级<,>Scientists classify animals into different species.<,>科学家将动物分类为不同的物种。<,>The library classifies books by subject.<,>图书馆按主题对图书进行分类。<,>This document is classified as confidential.<,>这份文件被列为机密。<,>class(类别)+ify(使…)→使成类别<,>classification(n.分类)/clarify(v.澄清)  

restrict<,>/rɪˈstrɪkt/<,>/rɪˈstrɪkt/<,>v.限制/限定<,>The new law will restrict smoking in public places.<,>新法律将限制在公共场所吸烟。<,>His parents restrict his screen time to two hours a day.<,>他的父母限制他每天使用电子设备的时间为两小时。<,>The diet restricts the intake of sugar and fat.<,>这种饮食限制了糖和脂肪的摄入。<,>re(回)+strict(严格的)→拉回去严格限制<,>restriction(n.限制)/constrict(v.压缩)  

establish<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>v.建立/创办/设立<,>They established a new company last year.<,>他们去年创办了一家新公司。<,>The school was established in 1905.<,>这所学校成立于1905年。<,>We need to establish clear rules for the project.<,>我们需要为这个项目制定明确的规则。<,>e(出)+stabl(稳定)+ish(使)→使稳定出来→建立<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/institute(v.设立)
counseling<,>/ˈkaʊnsəlɪŋ/<,>/ˈkaʊnsəlɪŋ/<,>n.咨询服务<,>She sought counseling to deal with her anxiety.<,>她寻求咨询服务来应对焦虑。<,>School counseling can help students with career choices.<,>学校咨询服务能帮助学生进行职业选择。<,>The company offers free counseling for employees.<,>该公司为员工提供免费咨询服务。<,>counsel(建议)+ing(名词后缀)→提供建议的服务<,>consulting(n.咨询)/therapy(n.治疗)/guidance(n.指导)  

majority<,>/məˈdʒɒrəti/<,>/məˈdʒɔːrəti/<,>n.多数<,>The majority of voters supported the new policy.<,>多数选民支持这项新政策。<,>He won the election by a slim majority.<,>他以微弱多数赢得了选举。<,>In the majority of cases, the treatment is effective.<,>在大多数情况下，这种治疗是有效的。<,>major(主要的)+ity(名词后缀)→主要部分→多数<,>minority(n.少数)/plurality(n.相对多数)/superiority(n.优越性)  

contact<,>/ˈkɒntækt/<,>/ˈkɑːntækt/<,>n.联系/n.接触/v.联系<,>Please contact me if you have any questions.<,>如有任何问题请与我联系。<,>Skin contact with the chemical should be avoided.<,>应避免皮肤接触该化学品。<,>We lost contact after graduation.<,>毕业后我们失去了联系。<,>con(共同)+tact(接触)→共同接触→联系<,>contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/content(n.内容)/contaminate(v.污染)  

virtual<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəl/<,>adj.虚拟的<,>The meeting will be held in virtual reality.<,>会议将在虚拟现实中举行。<,>She is the virtual leader of the team.<,>她是团队的实际领导者。<,>Online classes create a virtual learning environment.<,>在线课程创造了虚拟学习环境。<,>virt(力量)+ual(形容词后缀)→具有仿真力量的→虚拟的<,>visual(adj.视觉的)/verbal(adj.口头的)/viral(adj.病毒性的)  

simplicity<,>/sɪmˈplɪsəti/<,>/sɪmˈplɪsəti/<,>n.简单<,>The simplicity of the design makes it user-friendly.<,>简洁的设计使其易于使用。<,>He explained the theory with remarkable simplicity.<,>他以惊人的简洁解释了该理论。<,>There's an elegant simplicity in her writing style.<,>她的写作风格有一种优雅的简约。<,>simpl(简单)+icity(名词后缀)→简单状态<,>complexity(n.复杂性)/duplicity(n.表里不一)/multiplicity(n.多样性)  

enrollment<,>/ɪnˈrəʊlmənt/<,>/ɪnˈroʊlmənt/<,>n.入学人数<,>The university saw a record enrollment this year.<,>该大学今年入学人数创纪录。<,>Early enrollment for the course is recommended.<,>建议尽早报名该课程。<,>Enrollment figures have been declining since 2020.<,>自2020年以来入学人数一直在下降。<,>en(使)+roll(名单)+ment(名词后缀)→使进入名单→注册<,>engagement(n.订婚)/employment(n.就业)/endorsement(n.认可)  

programming<,>/ˈprəʊɡræmɪŋ/<,>/ˈproʊɡræmɪŋ/<,>n.程序编写/n.程序设计/n.节目策划<,>He's studying computer programming at university.<,>他在大学学习计算机编程。<,>Television programming has become more diverse.<,>电视节目编排变得更加多样化。<,>The festival's programming includes films from 30 countries.<,>电影节的节目策划包含来自30个国家的影片。<,>pro(前)+gram(写)+ing(名词后缀)→提前写好的内容→编程<,>progress(n.进步)/diagram(n.图表)/telegram(n.电报)  

device<,>/dɪˈvaɪs/<,>/dɪˈvaɪs/<,>n.装置/n.设备<,>The device automatically measures blood pressure.<,>该设备可自动测量血压。<,>All electronic devices must be turned off during takeoff.<,>起飞期间所有电子设备必须关闭。<,>This clever device can save up to 30% energy.<,>这个巧妙装置可节省高达30%的能源。<,>de(加强)+vice(代替)→代替人工的工具→设备<,>devise(v.设计)/advice(n.建议)/divide(v.分开)  

previous<,>/ˈpriːviəs/<,>/ˈpriːviəs/<,>adj.之前的<,>She had no previous experience in teaching.<,>她之前没有教学经验。<,>The previous owner took good care of the house.<,>前房主把房子维护得很好。<,>As mentioned in the previous chapter...<,>如前一章所述...<,>pre(前)+vi(路)+ous(形容词后缀)→走在前面的一之前的<,>precious(adj.珍贵的)/envious(adj.嫉妒的)/obvious(adj.明显的)  

alter<,>/ˈɔːltə(r)/<,>/ˈɔːltər/<,>v.改变<,>We had to alter our plans due to the weather.<,>由于天气原因我们不得不改变计划。<,>The dress needs to be altered to fit properly.<,>这件连衣裙需要修改才能合身。<,>Nothing can alter the fact that we succeeded.<,>什么也改变不了我们成功的事实。<,>alt(高)+er(动词后缀)→提高→改变<,>alternate(adj.交替的)/altar(n.祭坛)/alert(adj.警觉的)
coach<,>/kəʊtʃ/<,>/koʊtʃ/<,>n.教练/v.当…的教练/v.训练/v.培训<,>The football coach trained the team rigorously.<,>足球教练严格训练球队。<,>She coaches young entrepreneurs in business skills.<,>她为年轻企业家提供商业技能培训。<,>He hired a life coach to improve his productivity.<,>他聘请了一位人生教练来提高效率。<,>联想：汽车(coach)载着教练→教练车<,>couch(n.长沙发)/coax(v.哄骗)/cloak(n.斗篷)  

crisis<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>n.危机<,>The country faced an economic crisis during the pandemic.<,>疫情期间该国面临经济危机。<,>She handled the family crisis with great composure.<,>她非常冷静地处理了家庭危机。<,>Climate change is a global crisis.<,>气候变化是全球性危机。<,>cri(哭喊)+sis(情况)→需要哭喊的情况→危机<,>critic(n.评论家)/cruise(v.巡航)/crisp(adj.脆的)  

interconnect<,>/ˌɪntəkəˈnekt/<,>/ˌɪntərkəˈnekt/<,>v.相互联系<,>All departments must interconnect for the project to succeed.<,>所有部门必须相互联系才能确保项目成功。<,>The internet interconnects billions of devices worldwide.<,>互联网将全球数十亿设备相互连接。<,>These issues are deeply interconnected.<,>这些问题密切相关。<,>inter(相互)+connect(连接)→相互连接<,>interact(v.互动)/intersect(v.交叉)/internal(adj.内部的)  

enrich<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>/ɪnˈrɪtʃ/<,>v.丰富/v.使富有<,>Reading enriches your vocabulary.<,>阅读能丰富你的词汇量。<,>The fertilizer enriches the soil.<,>这种肥料能使土壤肥沃。<,>Cultural exchanges enrich our lives.<,>文化交流丰富我们的生活。<,>en(使)+rich(富有)→使富有<,>entrench(v.牢固确立)/enrage(v.激怒)/enlarge(v.扩大)  

poll<,>/pəʊl/<,>/poʊl/<,>n.民意调查<,>The latest poll shows a lead for the incumbent.<,>最新民调显示现任者领先。<,>They conducted a poll about consumer habits.<,>他们就消费习惯进行了民意调查。<,>The poll results were published yesterday.<,>民意调查结果昨天公布了。<,>pol(政治)+l→与政治相关的调查<,>pole(n.极点)/pool(n.水池)/pollen(n.花粉)  

consent<,>/kənˈsent/<,>/kənˈsent/<,>v.允许/v.同意/n.同意/n.赞同<,>She consented to the surgery after careful consideration.<,>她经过慎重考虑后同意手术。<,>Silence does not imply consent.<,>沉默不等于同意。<,>Written consent is required for data sharing.<,>数据共享需要书面同意。<,>con(共同)+sent(感觉)→共同感觉→同意<,>content(n.内容)/consent(v.同意)/concert(n.音乐会)  

utility<,>/juːˈtɪləti/<,>/juːˈtɪləti/<,>n.公用事业<,>The storm damaged water and electricity utilities.<,>暴风雨损坏了水电设施。<,>Utility bills have increased this winter.<,>今年冬季公用事业费用上涨了。<,>This room combines beauty with utility.<,>这个房间兼具美观与实用。<,>util(使用)+ity→可使用的东西→公用事业<,>utopia(n.乌托邦)/utilize(v.利用)/unity(n.团结)  

poisonous<,>/ˈpɔɪzənəs/<,>/ˈpɔɪzənəs/<,>adj.有毒的/adj.有害的<,>That mushroom is highly poisonous.<,>那种蘑菇有剧毒。<,>The factory released poisonous gases into the air.<,>工厂向空气中排放有毒气体。<,>Their relationship became poisonous over time.<,>他们的关系逐渐变得有害。<,>poison(毒)+ous(形容词后缀)→有毒的<,>porous(adj.多孔的)/precious(adj.珍贵的)/ponderous(adj.笨重的)  

collision<,>/kəˈlɪʒən/<,>/kəˈlɪʒən/<,>n.冲突/n.抵触<,>The collision between two trucks caused a traffic jam.<,>两辆卡车相撞导致交通堵塞。<,>There was a collision of opinions at the meeting.<,>会议上出现了意见冲突。<,>The ship avoided a collision with an iceberg.<,>船只避开了与冰山的碰撞。<,>col(共同)+lis(打击)+ion→共同打击→碰撞<,>collusion(n.共谋)/corrosion(n.腐蚀)/explosion(n.爆炸)  

rank<,>/ræŋk/<,>/ræŋk/<,>v.具有…等级/n.军衔/n.阶层<,>He ranks among the top scientists in his field.<,>他是该领域顶尖科学家之一。<,>The colonel was promoted to a higher rank.<,>这位上校被提升到更高军衔。<,>Social rank was very important in feudal society.<,>封建社会里社会阶层非常重要。<,>ran(排列)+k→排列顺序→等级<,>rant(v.咆哮)/rink(n.溜冰场)/ranch(n.牧场)
fundamentally<,>/ˌfʌndəˈmentəli/<,>/ˌfʌndəˈmɛntəli/<,>adv.根本上<,>Their approach is fundamentally different from ours.<,>他们的方法与我们的根本不同。<,>The theory is fundamentally flawed.<,>这个理论从根本上就有缺陷。<,>He disagreed fundamentally with the proposal.<,>他从根本上反对这个提议。<,>fundamental(基础的)+ly(副词后缀)→根本上<,>basically(adv.基本上)/essentially(adv.本质上)  

inflation<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃən/<,>n.通货膨胀<,>The government is trying to control inflation.<,>政府正试图控制通货膨胀。<,>High inflation reduces purchasing power.<,>高通胀会削弱购买力。<,>Inflation has risen by 2% this year.<,>今年通货膨胀率上升了2%。<,>in(进入)+flat(吹)+ion→像吹气一样膨胀→通胀<,>deflation(n.通货紧缩)/reflation(n.通货再膨胀)  

secure<,>/sɪˈkjʊə(r)/<,>/sɪˈkjʊr/<,>v.确保……安全<,>They secured the building with alarms.<,>他们用警报器确保大楼安全。<,>She secured a loan for her business.<,>她为生意获得了贷款。<,>Make sure to secure your seatbelt.<,>请务必系好安全带。<,>se(分开)+cure(关心)→分开关心→保护<,>assure(v.保证)/ensure(v.确保)/insure(v.投保)  

interpret<,>/ɪnˈtɜːprɪt/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrprɪt/<,>v.解释<,>Can you interpret this ancient text?<,>你能解释这段古代文字吗？<,>His silence was interpreted as agreement.<,>他的沉默被理解为同意。<,>She interprets for the UN.<,>她为联合国做口译。<,>inter(在…之间)+pret(表达)→在双方间表达→翻译<,>interrupt(v.打断)/intervene(v.干预)  

criticize<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsaɪz/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsaɪz/<,>v.批评/评论<,>He criticized the plan as unrealistic.<,>他批评该计划不切实际。<,>Don't criticize others too harshly.<,>不要过于严厉地批评他人。<,>The book was criticized for its bias.<,>这本书因偏见受到评论。<,>crit(判断)+ic+ize(动词后缀)→作出判断<,>critique(n.评论)/complain(v.抱怨)  

arrest<,>/əˈrest/<,>/əˈrɛst/<,>v.逮捕<,>The police arrested the suspect at dawn.<,>警方在黎明逮捕了嫌疑人。<,>His development was arrested by illness.<,>他的发育因疾病停滞。<,>The bright colors arrested my attention.<,>鲜艳的色彩吸引了我的注意。<,>ar(加强)+rest(停留)→强行停留→逮捕<,>detain(v.拘留)/stop(v.阻止)  

afford<,>/əˈfɔːd/<,>/əˈfɔːrd/<,>v.负担得起<,>We can't afford a vacation this year.<,>我们今年负担不起度假。<,>This tree affords shade in summer.<,>这棵树夏天提供阴凉。<,>He couldn't afford to lose focus.<,>他承受不起分心的代价。<,>af(向)+ford(前进)→能向前→有能力<,>offer(v.提供)/effort(n.努力)  

implementation<,>/ˌɪmplɪmenˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪmplɪmɛnˈteɪʃən/<,>n.实现/履行<,>The implementation of the policy took months.<,>该政策的实施花了数月。<,>Technical issues delayed implementation.<,>技术问题延迟了实施。<,>Effective implementation requires teamwork.<,>有效执行需要团队合作。<,>implement(工具)+ation→使用工具→实施<,>execution(n.执行)/application(n.应用)  

initiate<,>/ɪˈnɪʃieɪt/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃiˌeɪt/<,>v.开始/发起<,>She initiated a conversation with the stranger.<,>她主动和陌生人交谈。<,>The company initiated a new project.<,>公司启动了一个新项目。<,>He was initiated into the secret society.<,>他被接纳进入秘密社团。<,>in(进入)+it(走)+iate→走入→开始<,>begin(v.开始)/commence(v.着手)  

enable<,>/ɪˈneɪbl/<,>/ɪˈneɪbəl/<,>v.使能够<,>This software enables faster calculations.<,>这个软件能加快计算速度。<,>The scholarship enabled her to study abroad.<,>奖学金使她得以出国留学。<,>The new law enables stricter punishments.<,>新法律允许更严厉的惩罚。<,>en(使)+able(能够)→使能够<,>able(adj.能够的)/unable(adj.不能的)
narrow<,>/ˈnærəʊ/<,>/ˈnæroʊ/<,>adj.狭窄的<,>The road is too narrow for two cars to pass.<,>这条路太窄，两辆车无法同时通过。<,>She has a narrow view of the world.<,>她对世界的看法很狭隘。<,>He narrowly escaped the accident.<,>他险些遭遇事故。<,>nar(接近)+row(排)→排得很近→狭窄的<,>borrow(v.借)/harrow(n.耙/v.使痛苦)  

overcharge<,>/ˌəʊvəˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈtʃɑːrdʒ/<,>v.向……多收费<,>The taxi driver tried to overcharge the tourist.<,>出租车司机试图向游客多收费。<,>Check your bill to ensure they didn't overcharge you.<,>检查账单确保他们没有多收费。<,>They were fined for overcharging customers.<,>他们因多收顾客费用被罚款。<,>over(过度)+charge(收费)→收费过多<,>overload(v.超载)/overdue(adj.过期的)  

shortcut<,>/ˈʃɔːtkʌt/<,>/ˈʃɔːrtkʌt/<,>n.捷径/近路<,>Taking this shortcut will save us 10 minutes.<,>走这条捷径能节省10分钟。<,>There's no shortcut to success.<,>成功没有捷径。<,>He created a desktop shortcut for the program.<,>他为程序创建了桌面快捷方式。<,>short(短)+cut(切)→缩短的路径<,>shorthand(n.速记)/shortlist(n.入围名单)  

leisure<,>/ˈleʒə(r)/<,>/ˈliːʒər/<,>n.悠闲/空闲<,>She enjoys reading in her leisure time.<,>她喜欢在闲暇时阅读。<,>The resort offers various leisure activities.<,>度假村提供各种休闲活动。<,>They strolled at leisure along the beach.<,>他们悠闲地在海滩散步。<,>lei(谐音"累")+sure(肯定)→累后肯定需要休闲<,>pleasure(n.愉悦)/measure(n.措施)
