original<,>/əˈrɪdʒənl/<,>/əˈrɪdʒənl/<,>adj.原始的/最初的<,>This is the original version of the painting.<,>这是这幅画的原始版本。<,>She has very original ideas.<,>她的想法很有独创性。<,>Keep the original receipt for returns.<,>保留原始收据以便退货。<,>origin(起源)+al(形容词后缀)→起源的<,>abnormal(adj.异常的)/oriental(adj.东方的)  

density<,>/ˈdensəti/<,>/ˈdensəti/<,>n.密度<,>The population density here is very high.<,>这里的人口密度很高。<,>Lead has a higher density than aluminum.<,>铅的密度比铝高。<,>They measured the density of the liquid.<,>他们测量了液体的密度。<,>dens(密集的)+ity(名词后缀)→密集程度<,>intensity(n.强度)/destiny(n.命运)  

sphere<,>/sfɪə(r)/<,>/sfɪr/<,>n.球体/范围<,>The Earth is not a perfect sphere.<,>地球不是完美的球体。<,>This topic is outside my sphere of knowledge.<,>这个话题超出了我的知识范围。<,>They decorated with glass spheres.<,>他们用玻璃球装饰。<,>spher(球)+e→球形物<,>atmosphere(n.大气)/hemisphere(n.半球)  

margin<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪn/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪn/<,>n.页边空白/边缘<,>Write your notes in the margin.<,>把你的笔记写在页边空白处。<,>They won by a narrow margin.<,>他们以微弱优势获胜。<,>Don't print too close to the margin.<,>打印不要太靠近边缘。<,>marg(标记)+in→标记的空白处<,>marine(n.海军/adj.海洋的)/margarine(n.人造黄油)  

department<,>/dɪˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/dɪˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.部门<,>She works in the marketing department.<,>她在市场营销部门工作。<,>The toy department is on the third floor.<,>玩具部在三楼。<,>He heads the research department.<,>他主管研究部门。<,>depart(分开)+ment→分开的职能区域<,>apartment(n.公寓)/compartment(n.隔间)  

desire<,>/dɪˈzaɪə(r)/<,>/dɪˈzaɪər/<,>n.渴望/欲望<,>He has a strong desire to succeed.<,>他有着强烈的成功欲望。<,>Her greatest desire is to travel the world.<,>她最大的愿望是环游世界。<,>They finally got their heart's desire.<,>他们终于得到了心中所愿。<,>de(加强)+sire(星星)→像渴望星星一样<,>resire(v.重新渴望)/despair(n.绝望)
legend<,>/ˈledʒənd/<,>/ˈlɛdʒənd/<,>n.传奇/传说<,>The story of King Arthur is a famous legend.<,>亚瑟王的故事是一个著名的传奇。<,>He became a legend in the music industry.<,>他成了音乐界的传奇人物。<,>Local legends say this forest is haunted.<,>当地传说这片森林闹鬼。<,>leg(法律)+end(结束)→法律终结者→传奇<,>allegend(n.寓言)/legion(n.军团)/legendary(adj.传奇的)  

dictator<,>/dɪkˈteɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈdɪkteɪtər/<,>n.独裁者/专制者<,>The dictator ruled the country with an iron fist.<,>独裁者用铁腕统治国家。<,>He was accused of behaving like a dictator.<,>他被指责行为像独裁者。<,>The military overthrew the dictator.<,>军队推翻了独裁者。<,>dict(说)+ator(人)→发号施令的人<,>dictation(n.听写)/predict(v.预测)/indict(v.起诉)  

diversity<,>/daɪˈvɜːsəti/<,>/dɪˈvɝːsəti/<,>n.多样性/差异<,>Cultural diversity makes cities more vibrant.<,>文化多样性让城市更有活力。<,>The university promotes diversity in its student body.<,>该大学促进学生群体的多样性。<,>Biodiversity is crucial for ecosystems.<,>生物多样性对生态系统至关重要。<,>di(分开)+vers(转)+ity→转向不同方向→多样性<,>divert(v.转移)/adversity(n.逆境)/university(n.大学)  

quit<,>/kwɪt/<,>/kwɪt/<,>v.放弃/退出/辞职<,>She quit her job to travel the world.<,>她辞职去环游世界了。<,>I quit smoking last year.<,>我去年戒烟了。<,>Don't quit when things get tough.<,>情况艰难时不要放弃。<,>谐音"愧他"→因愧疚而放弃<,>quiet(adj.安静的)/quite(adv.相当)/quilt(n.被子)  

outgoing<,>/ˌaʊtˈɡəʊɪŋ/<,>/ˈaʊtɡoʊɪŋ/<,>adj.开朗的/外向的/外出的<,>Her outgoing personality makes her popular.<,>她外向的性格让她很受欢迎。<,>The outgoing president gave his final speech.<,>即将离任的总统发表了最后演讲。<,>All outgoing mail is processed here.<,>所有外发邮件都在此处理。<,>out(外)+going(走)→向外走的<,>income(n.收入)/ongoing(adj.持续的)/outgrow(v.长得比...大)  

solution<,>/səˈluːʃn/<,>/səˈluːʃən/<,>n.解决/解答/解决办法<,>We need to find a solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的解决方法。<,>The solution to the puzzle was simple.<,>这个谜题的解答很简单。<,>Salt water is a natural solution for sore throats.<,>盐水是治疗喉咙痛的自然方法。<,>solu(松开)+tion→松开问题→解决<,>resolution(n.决心)/dissolve(v.溶解)/absolute(adj.绝对的)  

revenge<,>/rɪˈvendʒ/<,>/rɪˈvɛndʒ/<,>n.报仇/报复<,>He sought revenge for his brother's death.<,>他为兄弟的死寻求报复。<,>The movie is about a tale of revenge.<,>这部电影讲述了一个复仇故事。<,>Revenge is a dish best served cold.<,>复仇是一道最好冷吃的菜(君子报仇十年不晚)。<,>re(回)+venge(惩罚)→回击惩罚<,>avenge(v.报仇)/revengeful(adj.报复的)/vengeance(n.复仇)  

reverse<,>/rɪˈvɜːs/<,>/rɪˈvɝːs/<,>n.相反情况/正相反 adj.相反的<,>Please write your name in reverse order.<,>请倒着写你的名字。<,>The car went into reverse and hit the wall.<,>汽车倒车时撞到了墙。<,>The results were the reverse of what we expected.<,>结果与我们预期的相反。<,>re(回)+vers(转)→转回去<,>diverse(adj.多样的)/converse(v.交谈)/universe(n.宇宙)  

enroll<,>/ɪnˈrəʊl/<,>/ɪnˈroʊl/<,>v.注册/登记/入学<,>She enrolled in a French course.<,>她报名参加了法语课程。<,>The school enrolls 500 new students each year.<,>这所学校每年招收500名新生。<,>You must enroll before the deadline.<,>你必须在截止日期前注册。<,>en(进入)+roll(名单)→进入名单<,>enlist(v.征募)/enclosure(n.围场)/unroll(v.展开)  

logically<,>/ˈlɒdʒɪkli/<,>/ˈlɑːdʒɪkli/<,>adv.合乎情理地/符合逻辑地<,>He argued his point logically.<,>他合乎逻辑地论证了自己的观点。<,>The theory is logically sound.<,>这个理论在逻辑上是合理的。<,>Think logically about the consequences.<,>用逻辑思维考虑后果。<,>logic(逻辑)+ally(副词后缀)<,>biological(adj.生物的)/geological(adj.地质的)/psychological(adj.心理的)
rental<,>/ˈrɛntl/<,>/ˈrɛntl/<,>n.租金<,>The monthly rental for the apartment is $1200.<,>这套公寓的月租金是1200美元。<,>He couldn't afford the car rental fees.<,>他支付不起汽车租赁费用。<,>Rental prices in the city center are very high.<,>市中心的租金价格非常高。<,>rent(租)+al(名词后缀)→租金<,>mental(adj.精神的)/dental(adj.牙齿的)  

component<,>/kəmˈpəʊnənt/<,>/kəmˈpoʊnənt/<,>n.成分/部件<,>Each component of the machine is carefully tested.<,>机器的每个部件都经过仔细测试。<,>Trust is a key component in any relationship.<,>信任是任何关系中的关键成分。<,>The chemical components of this solution are listed on the label.<,>这种溶液的化学成分列在标签上。<,>com(共同)+pon(放置)+ent→共同放置的东西→成分<,>opponent(n.对手)/proponent(n.支持者)  

quotation<,>/kwəʊˈteɪʃən/<,>/kwoʊˈteɪʃən/<,>n.引文/报价<,>She began her speech with a quotation from Shakespeare.<,>她以莎士比亚的一句引文开始了演讲。<,>Can you give me a quotation for repairing the roof?<,>你能给我一个修理屋顶的报价吗？<,>The book is full of interesting quotations from famous authors.<,>这本书充满了著名作家的有趣引文。<,>quote(引用)+ation(名词后缀)→引文<,>notation(n.符号)/rotation(n.旋转)  

faith<,>/feɪθ/<,>/feɪθ/<,>n.信任/信仰<,>I have complete faith in your ability to succeed.<,>我对你成功的能力完全信任。<,>People of different faiths live together peacefully in this community.<,>不同信仰的人们在这个社区和平共处。<,>She kept her faith despite all the difficulties.<,>尽管困难重重，她仍保持信仰。<,>音似"face"(面对)→面对困难需要faith(信念)<,>fate(n.命运)/fake(adj.假的)  

invalid<,>/ɪnˈvælɪd/<,>/ɪnˈvælɪd/<,>adj.无效的<,>Your passport will become invalid after its expiration date.<,>你的护照在过期后将失效。<,>The contract was declared invalid by the court.<,>法院宣布该合同无效。<,>Without a signature, the document is invalid.<,>没有签名，文件是无效的。<,>in(不)+valid(有效的)→无效的<,>valid(adj.有效的)/invaluable(adj.无价的)  

invade<,>/ɪnˈveɪd/<,>/ɪnˈveɪd/<,>v.侵入/侵略<,>The army was ordered not to invade the neighboring country.<,>军队奉命不得入侵邻国。<,>Tourists invade this small town every summer.<,>每年夏天游客都会涌入这个小镇。<,>Privacy should not be invaded without good reason.<,>没有正当理由不应侵犯隐私。<,>in(进入)+vade(走)→走进去→入侵<,>evade(v.逃避)/pervade(v.弥漫)  

separately<,>/ˈsɛpərətli/<,>/ˈsɛpərətli/<,>adv.分别地/另行<,>They arrived at the party separately.<,>他们是分别到达派对的。<,>These items should be packed separately.<,>这些物品应该分开包装。<,>The twins were raised separately after their parents' divorce.<,>这对双胞胎在父母离婚后被分开抚养。<,>separate(分开的)+ly(副词后缀)→分别地<,>desperately(adv.绝望地)/deliberately(adv.故意地)  

strain<,>/streɪn/<,>/streɪn/<,>v.扭伤/拉伤<,>He strained his back while lifting heavy boxes.<,>他在搬重箱子时拉伤了背部。<,>Don't strain your eyes by reading in poor light.<,>不要在光线差的地方看书，以免眼睛疲劳。<,>The athlete strained a muscle during the competition.<,>这名运动员在比赛中拉伤了肌肉。<,>s(死)+train(火车)→死命拉火车→拉伤<,>restrain(v.抑制)/constrain(v.强迫)  

accessible<,>/əkˈsɛsɪbl/<,>/əkˈsɛsəbl/<,>adj.易接近的/可获得的<,>The museum is easily accessible by public transport.<,>乘公共交通工具很容易到达博物馆。<,>This information should be made accessible to everyone.<,>这些信息应该让每个人都能获得。<,>The beach is accessible only by boat.<,>这片海滩只能乘船到达。<,>access(接近)+ible(能够)→能够接近的<,>acceptable(adj.可接受的)/admissible(adj.可采纳的)  

lap<,>/læp/<,>/læp/<,>n.〔坐着时的〕大腿部<,>The cat curled up in her lap.<,>猫蜷缩在她的腿上。<,>He balanced the laptop on his lap.<,>他把笔记本电脑放在腿上保持平衡。<,>She held the baby gently in her lap.<,>她轻轻地把婴儿抱在腿上。<,>与"lab"(实验室)对比记忆→实验室里坐着工作用lap<,>slap(v.拍打)/flap(v.拍动)
character<,>/ˈkærəktə(r)/<,>/ˈkærəktər/<,>n.角色/n.性格/n.字符<,>He played the main character in the movie.<,>他在电影中扮演主角。<,>Her cheerful character makes her popular.<,>她开朗的性格让她很受欢迎。<,>The document contains special characters.<,>这份文件包含特殊字符。<,>char(炭)+actor(演员)→像炭笔勾勒的角色形象<,>characteristic(adj.典型的)/characterize(v.描绘)/charcoal(n.木炭)  

widespread<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>adj.普遍的/adj.广泛的<,>There is widespread support for the new policy.<,>新政策获得了广泛支持。<,>The disease caused widespread panic.<,>这种疾病引发了普遍恐慌。<,>Widespread use of smartphones changed communication.<,>智能手机的广泛使用改变了沟通方式。<,>wide(宽)+spread(传播)→广泛传播的<,>widespread≠narrowcast(小范围传播)/widespread≠limited(有限的)  

rearrange<,>/ˌriːəˈreɪndʒ/<,>/ˌriːəˈreɪndʒ/<,>v.重新安排/v.调整顺序<,>Let's rearrange the furniture in the living room.<,>我们重新布置客厅的家具吧。<,>She rearranged her schedule to attend the meeting.<,>她调整了日程来参加会议。<,>The letters can be rearranged to form a new word.<,>这些字母可以重新排列组成新词。<,>re(再)+arrange(安排)→再次安排<,>arrange(v.安排)/derange(v.扰乱)/prearrange(v.预先安排)  

hospitalize<,>/ˈhɒspɪtəlaɪz/<,>/ˈhɑːspɪtəlaɪz/<,>v.就医/v.住院治疗<,>The accident hospitalized him for two weeks.<,>那次事故让他住院两周。<,>Severe cases may need to be hospitalized.<,>重症患者可能需要住院治疗。<,>She was hospitalized with pneumonia.<,>她因肺炎住院治疗。<,>hospital(医院)+ize(动词后缀)→使住院<,>hospitality(n.好客)/hospice(n.临终关怀)/hostel(n.旅社)  

avail<,>/əˈveɪl/<,>/əˈveɪl/<,>v.有益/v.有帮助/n.效用<,>His advice availed us little in the crisis.<,>他的建议在危机中对帮助不大。<,>All our efforts availed nothing.<,>我们所有的努力都徒劳无功。<,>The medicine is of no avail against this disease.<,>这种药对这种病无效。<,>a(加强)+vail(价值)→使有价值→有用<,>available(adj.可获得的)/prevail(v.盛行)/veil(n.面纱)  

instant<,>/ˈɪnstənt/<,>/ˈɪnstənt/<,>adj.立即的/adj.紧急的/adj.速溶的<,>She felt instant relief after taking the medicine.<,>服药后她立即感到缓解。<,>This is a matter of instant importance.<,>这是件紧急重要的事。<,>Instant coffee is convenient but less flavorful.<,>速溶咖啡方便但风味较差。<,>in(不)+stant(站)→不站着等→立即的<,>instance(n.实例)/constant(adj.持续的)/instantaneous(adj.瞬间的)  

democratic<,>/ˌdeməˈkrætɪk/<,>/ˌdeməˈkrætɪk/<,>adj.民主的/adj.平等的<,>The country has a democratic government.<,>这个国家有民主政府。<,>Democratic decision-making takes more time.<,>民主决策需要更多时间。<,>They run the company in a democratic way.<,>他们以民主方式管理公司。<,>demo(人民)+crat(统治)→人民统治的<,>democracy(n.民主)/autocratic(adj.专制的)/bureaucratic(adj.官僚的)  

barely<,>/ˈbeəli/<,>/ˈberli/<,>adv.仅仅/adv.几乎不<,>He could barely see the road in the fog.<,>他在雾中几乎看不清路。<,>She barely passed the exam.<,>她勉强通过了考试。<,>There was barely enough food for everyone.<,>食物勉强够每个人分。<,>bare(赤裸的)+ly→赤裸到几乎没有<,>barely≠fairly(相当地)/barely≠completely(完全地)  

vanish<,>/ˈvænɪʃ/<,>/ˈvænɪʃ/<,>v.消失/v.灭绝<,>The magician made the coin vanish.<,>魔术师让硬币消失了。<,>Many species have vanished due to pollution.<,>许多物种因污染而灭绝。<,>Her smile vanished when she heard the news.<,>听到消息后她的笑容消失了。<,>van(空)+ish(动词后缀)→变空→消失<,>vanish≠banish(流放)/vanish≠varnish(清漆)  

caregiver<,>/ˈkeəɡɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈkerɡɪvər/<,>n.照料者/n.看护人<,>The caregiver bathed the elderly patient gently.<,>看护人员轻柔地为老年患者洗澡。<,>Professional caregivers need special training.<,>专业护理人员需要特殊培训。<,>She quit her job to become a full-time caregiver.<,>她辞职成为全职看护人。<,>care(照顾)+give(给予)+er(人)→给予照顾的人<,>caretaker(n.看管人)/carefree(adj.无忧无虑的)/careworn(adj.忧心忡忡的)
harsh<,>/hɑːʃ/<,>/hɑːrʃ/<,>adj.严酷的/adj.刺耳的/adj.严厉的<,>The harsh winter made survival difficult for the animals.<,>严酷的冬天使动物们难以生存。<,>His harsh words hurt her feelings.<,>他刺耳的话语伤害了她的感情。<,>The teacher gave a harsh punishment for cheating.<,>老师对作弊行为给予了严厉的惩罚。<,>har(看作hard)+sh→坚硬刺耳→严酷的<,>hash(n.剁碎的食物)/hush(v.安静)/marsh(n.沼泽)  

reliable<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbl/<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbəl/<,>adj.可靠的/adj.可信赖的<,>She is a reliable friend who always keeps her promises.<,>她是个可靠的朋友，总是信守承诺。<,>This car is reliable even in extreme weather.<,>这辆车即使在极端天气下也很可靠。<,>The news source is known to be reliable.<,>这个新闻来源以可靠著称。<,>re(再)+li(看作lie依赖)+able→可反复依赖的<,>liable(adj.有责任的)/reliant(adj.依赖的)/relief(n.缓解)  

massive<,>/ˈmæsɪv/<,>/ˈmæsɪv/<,>adj.(尺寸、数量、规模)非常大的/adj.结实的/adj.严重的<,>They built a massive stadium for the Olympics.<,>他们为奥运会建造了一个巨大的体育场。<,>She suffered massive injuries in the accident.<,>她在事故中受了重伤。<,>The project requires massive funding.<,>这个项目需要大量资金。<,>mass(大量)+ive→大量的<,>passive(adj.被动的)/missive(n.公函)/mass(n.质量)  

alcohol<,>/ˈælkəhɒl/<,>/ˈælkəhɔːl/<,>n.酒精/n.含酒精饮料<,>The doctor cleaned the wound with alcohol.<,>医生用酒精清洗伤口。<,>Excessive alcohol consumption is harmful.<,>过量饮酒是有害的。<,>This perfume contains a high percentage of alcohol.<,>这款香水含有高浓度酒精。<,>al(阿拉伯语冠词)+cohol(精炼)→酒精<,>alcoholic(adj.酒精的)/aldehyde(n.醛)/alchemy(n.炼金术)  

pregnant<,>/ˈpreɡnənt/<,>/ˈpreɡnənt/<,>adj.怀孕的/adj.意义深长的<,>She is three months pregnant with twins.<,>她怀双胞胎三个月了。<,>His words were pregnant with meaning.<,>他的话意味深长。<,>The pregnant woman needed special care.<,>这位孕妇需要特殊照顾。<,>pre(前)+gn(生育)+ant→生育前的状态<,>poignant(adj.辛酸的)/pregnable(adj.易攻克的)/impregnate(v.使怀孕)  

adapt<,>/əˈdæpt/<,>/əˈdæpt/<,>v.适应于/v.改编<,>It took him months to adapt to the new environment.<,>他花了几个月适应新环境。<,>The novel was adapted into a successful movie.<,>这部小说被改编成了成功的电影。<,>These plants have adapted to desert conditions.<,>这些植物已适应沙漠环境。<,>ad(加强)+apt(适合)→使适合<,>adept(adj.熟练的)/adopt(v.采纳)/apt(adj.恰当的)  

bogus<,>/ˈbəʊɡəs/<,>/ˈboʊɡəs/<,>adj.假冒的/adj.伪造的<,>He was arrested for selling bogus tickets.<,>他因出售假票被捕。<,>The website turned out to be bogus.<,>这个网站原来是假的。<,>She gave a bogus excuse for being late.<,>她为迟到编造了虚假借口。<,>联想：bog(沼泽)+us→陷在沼泽里的东西→假的<,>bonus(n.奖金)/bolus(n.大药丸)/bog(n.沼泽)  

slippery<,>/ˈslɪpəri/<,>/ˈslɪpəri/<,>adj.滑的/adj.模糊的/adj.不明确的<,>The floor was slippery after the rain.<,>雨后地板很滑。<,>He gave a slippery answer to avoid responsibility.<,>他给出模糊回答以逃避责任。<,>This is a slippery concept to grasp.<,>这是个难以把握的模糊概念。<,>slip(滑)+pery→滑的<,>slither(v.滑动)/flippery(adj.轻浮的)/slapper(n.拍打者)  

current<,>/ˈkʌrənt/<,>/ˈkɜːrənt/<,>adj.当前的/n.水流/n.电流<,>The current situation requires immediate action.<,>当前形势需要立即采取行动。<,>Strong currents make swimming dangerous here.<,>这里水流湍急，游泳很危险。<,>This wire carries electric current.<,>这根导线输送电流。<,>curr(跑)+ent→跑动的→当前的<,>currency(n.货币)/currant(n.醋栗)/recurrent(adj.复发的)  

overwhelm<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelm/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelm/<,>v.压倒/v.战胜/v.使不知所措<,>The floodwaters overwhelmed the village.<,>洪水淹没了村庄。<,>She was overwhelmed by the generous gift.<,>这份慷慨的礼物让她不知所措。<,>Our team overwhelmed the opponents 5-0.<,>我们队5-0大胜对手。<,>over(过度)+whelm(淹没)→过度淹没→压倒<,>underwhelm(v.未达预期)/whelm(v.淹没)/overhaul(v.彻底检修)
stressful<,>/ˈstresfl/<,>/ˈstresfəl/<,>adj.充满压力的/adj.紧张的<,>Moving to a new city can be a stressful experience.<,>搬到一个新城市可能是一段充满压力的经历。<,>She finds her job very stressful.<,>她觉得她的工作非常紧张。<,>The exam period is always stressful for students.<,>考试期对学生来说总是充满压力的。<,>stress(压力)+ful(形容词后缀)→充满压力的<,>stress(n.压力/v.强调)/restful(adj.宁静的)/distress(n.痛苦/v.使痛苦)  

toothache<,>/ˈtuːθeɪk/<,>/ˈtuθˌeɪk/<,>n.牙痛/n.牙疼<,>I couldn't sleep last night because of a terrible toothache.<,>因为牙疼得厉害，我昨晚睡不着。<,>She went to the dentist to treat her toothache.<,>她去牙医那里治疗牙痛。<,>Eating ice cream sometimes helps relieve toothache.<,>吃冰淇淋有时有助于缓解牙疼。<,>tooth(牙齿)+ache(疼痛)→牙痛<,>headache(n.头痛)/stomachache(n.胃痛)/heartache(n.心痛)  

eliminate<,>/ɪˈlɪmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈlɪməˌneɪt/<,>v.消除/v.淘汰<,>The new policy aims to eliminate poverty.<,>新政策旨在消除贫困。<,>Our team was eliminated in the first round.<,>我们队在第一轮就被淘汰了。<,>This medicine helps eliminate toxins from the body.<,>这种药有助于消除体内毒素。<,>e(出)+limin(界限)+ate(动词后缀)→消除界限→消除<,>illuminate(v.照亮)/dominate(v.支配)/nominate(v.提名)  

terminal<,>/ˈtɜːmɪnl/<,>/ˈtɜrmənəl/<,>n.终点站/n.航空站<,>Please wait for me at the bus terminal.<,>请在公交终点站等我。<,>The airport terminal was crowded with passengers.<,>机场航站楼挤满了乘客。<,>This train's terminal is New York.<,>这列火车的终点站是纽约。<,>termin(界限)+al(名词后缀)→终点界限→终点站<,>terminate(v.终止)/determine(v.决定)/germinal(adj.萌芽的)  

severe<,>/sɪˈvɪə(r)/<,>/səˈvɪr/<,>adj.严重的/adj.严厉的<,>The patient is in severe pain.<,>病人处于严重的疼痛中。<,>The teacher gave him a severe warning.<,>老师给了他严厉的警告。<,>This region faces severe water shortages.<,>这个地区面临严重的水资源短缺。<,>sever(切断)+e→像被切断一样严重→严重的<,>persevere(v.坚持)/sever(v.切断)/several(adj.几个的)  

immobile<,>/ɪˈməʊbaɪl/<,>/ɪˈmoʊbəl/<,>adj.稳定的/adj.不变的<,>After the accident, his leg was immobile for weeks.<,>事故后，他的腿好几个星期不能动。<,>The statue remained immobile for centuries.<,>这座雕像几个世纪以来一直未动。<,>She sat immobile, lost in thought.<,>她一动不动地坐着，陷入沉思。<,>im(不)+mobile(移动的)→不动的→稳定的<,>mobile(adj.移动的)/immobilize(v.使不动)/automobile(n.汽车)  

diplomatic<,>/ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk/<,>adj.外交的/adj.圆滑的<,>He has a diplomatic way of handling conflicts.<,>他处理冲突的方式很圆滑。<,>The two countries established diplomatic relations.<,>两国建立了外交关系。<,>She gave a diplomatic answer to the sensitive question.<,>她对敏感问题给出了圆滑的回答。<,>diplomat(外交官)+ic(形容词后缀)→外交的<,>diploma(n.文凭)/diplomat(n.外交官)/automatic(adj.自动的)  

candidate<,>/ˈkændɪdət/<,>/ˈkændɪˌdeɪt/<,>n.申请求职者/n.投考者/n.候选人<,>There are three candidates for the position.<,>这个职位有三名候选人。<,>She is a strong candidate for the scholarship.<,>她是奖学金的强力竞争者。<,>All candidates must pass a written test.<,>所有考生必须通过笔试。<,>candid(白色)+ate→古罗马穿白袍的候选人→候选人<,>candid(adj.坦率的)/candied(adj.糖渍的)/candle(n.蜡烛)  

fund<,>/fʌnd/<,>/fʌnd/<,>n.基金/n.储备/v.提供资金<,>The government set up a fund for disaster relief.<,>政府设立了救灾基金。<,>We need to fund this project properly.<,>我们需要为这个项目提供充足的资金。<,>She has a fund of knowledge about art history.<,>她有丰富的艺术史知识储备。<,>fund(基础)→基金是基础→基金<,>found(v.建立)/fundamental(adj.基本的)/refund(v.退款)  

complacency<,>/kəmˈpleɪsnsi/<,>/kəmˈpleɪsənsi/<,>n.自满/n.满足<,>Success should not lead to complacency.<,>成功不应导致自满。<,>His complacency about his health worries his family.<,>他对健康的自满让家人担忧。<,>There's no room for complacency in this competitive market.<,>在这个竞争激烈的市场中没有自满的余地。<,>com(完全)+plac(满意)+ency(名词后缀)→完全满意→自满<,>complacent(adj.自满的)/complaint(n.抱怨)/placebo(n.安慰剂)
delight<,>/dɪˈlaɪt/<,>/dɪˈlaɪt/<,>n.高兴<,>The children's laughter was a delight to hear.<,>孩子们的笑声听起来令人高兴。<,>She took great delight in painting.<,>她从绘画中获得了极大的快乐。<,>To his delight, the cake turned out perfectly.<,>令他高兴的是，蛋糕做得非常完美。<,>de(加强)+light(光)→心里亮堂→高兴<,>light(n.光/adj.轻的)/delicate(adj.精致的)/deliver(v.递送)  

inadequate<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwət/<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwɪt/<,>adj.不足的/不够的<,>The safety measures were clearly inadequate.<,>安全措施明显不足。<,>His income is inadequate to support his family.<,>他的收入不足以养家。<,>She felt inadequate for the job.<,>她觉得自己无法胜任这份工作。<,>in(不)+adequate(足够的)→不足的<,>adequate(adj.足够的)/inaccurate(adj.不准确的)/inappropriate(adj.不合适的)  

steady<,>/ˈstedi/<,>/ˈstedi/<,>adj.稳定的/逐步的<,>He kept a steady hand while performing the surgery.<,>做手术时他的手很稳。<,>The company has shown steady growth over the years.<,>该公司多年来稳步增长。<,>She is his steady girlfriend.<,>她是他的固定女友。<,>stead(站立)+y(形容词后缀)→稳稳站立的→稳定的<,>ready(adj.准备好的)/study(v.学习)/steadfast(adj.坚定的)  

accurate<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>/ˈækjərɪt/<,>adj.精确的/准确的<,>The thermometer gives an accurate reading.<,>温度计显示精确的读数。<,>Her description was remarkably accurate.<,>她的描述非常准确。<,>We need accurate data to make the right decision.<,>我们需要准确的数据来做出正确决定。<,>ac(加强)+cur(关心)+ate→一再关心→精确的<,>acute(adj.尖锐的)/account(n.账户)/accuse(v.指责)  

identification<,>/aɪˌdentɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/aɪˌdɛntəfɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.身份证明/鉴定/识别/认同<,>You'll need to show identification at the airport.<,>在机场你需要出示身份证明。<,>The identification of the suspect took several weeks.<,>识别嫌疑人花了几周时间。<,>She has a strong identification with her cultural roots.<,>她对自己的文化根源有强烈认同。<,>ident(相同)+ification(过程)→确认相同的过程→识别<,>identity(n.身份)/identical(adj.相同的)/certification(n.认证)  

previously<,>/ˈpriːviəsli/<,>/ˈpriviəsli/<,>adv.事先<,>He had previously worked as a teacher.<,>他之前当过老师。<,>The document was previously classified as top secret.<,>这份文件之前被列为绝密。<,>As previously mentioned, the meeting is postponed.<,>如前所述，会议推迟了。<,>previous(之前的)+ly(副词后缀)→事先<,>precious(adj.珍贵的)/precisely(adv.精确地)/presumably(adv.大概)  

identical<,>/aɪˈdentɪkl/<,>/aɪˈdɛntɪkəl/<,>adj.相同的<,>The twins are genetically identical.<,>这对双胞胎基因完全相同。<,>Her dress is identical to mine.<,>她的裙子和我的完全一样。<,>The two documents contained identical information.<,>这两份文件信息完全一致。<,>ident(相同)+ical(形容词后缀)→相同的<,>identity(n.身份)/identification(n.识别)/indentical(拼写错误对比)  

retirement<,>/rɪˈtaɪəmənt/<,>/rɪˈtaɪɚmənt/<,>n.退休<,>He's planning for his retirement at 65.<,>他计划65岁退休。<,>The company offers a good retirement package.<,>公司提供优厚的退休福利。<,>She took up gardening after retirement.<,>退休后她开始从事园艺。<,>retire(退休)+ment(名词后缀)→退休<,>requirement(n.要求)/replacement(n.替换)/retreat(n.撤退)  

commit<,>/kəˈmɪt/<,>/kəˈmɪt/<,>v.犯罪/承担义务<,>He refused to commit to a long-term contract.<,>他拒绝签订长期合同。<,>She committed herself to the project wholeheartedly.<,>她全心全意投入这个项目。<,>The man committed a serious crime.<,>这个人犯了重罪。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)→一起送出→承担责任<,>committee(n.委员会)/admit(v.承认)/omit(v.省略)  

element<,>/ˈelɪmənt/<,>/ˈɛləmənt/<,>n.要素/元素<,>Honesty is a key element in any relationship.<,>诚实是任何关系中的关键要素。<,>Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen elements.<,>水由氢氧元素组成。<,>There's an element of truth in his story.<,>他的故事有几分真实性。<,>ele(基本)+ment(名词后缀)→基本成分→元素<,>elementary(adj.基本的)/implement(v.实施)/compliment(n.称赞)

assess<,>/əˈses/<,>/əˈsɛs/<,>v.评价<,>Teachers need to assess students' progress regularly.<,>教师需要定期评估学生的进步。<,>The company will assess the damage caused by the storm.<,>公司将评估风暴造成的损失。<,>It's difficult to assess the impact of the new policy.<,>很难评估新政策的影响。<,>as(强调)+sess(坐)→坐下来评判→评价<,>access(n.接近/v.获取)/excess(n.过量/adj多余的)/assert(v.断言)  

hire<,>/ˈhaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈhaɪɚ/<,>v.雇佣<,>We need to hire more staff for the busy season.<,>我们需要为旺季雇佣更多员工。<,>She was hired as a marketing manager last month.<,>她上个月被聘为市场经理。<,>The company hires temporary workers during peak periods.<,>公司在高峰期雇佣临时工。<,>hi(high)+re(反复)→高价请人→雇佣<,>fire(v.解雇/n.火)/tire(v.疲劳/n.轮胎)/wire(n.电线)  

represent<,>/ˌreprɪˈzent/<,>/ˌrɛprɪˈzɛnt/<,>v.代表<,>This painting represents the artist's childhood memories.<,>这幅画代表了艺术家的童年回忆。<,>The lawyer will represent you in court.<,>律师将在法庭上代表你。<,>The red color in the flag represents courage.<,>旗帜上的红色代表勇气。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)→再次呈现→代表<,>present(adj.现在的/n.礼物)/resident(n.居民)/president(n.总统)  

overestimate<,>/ˌəʊvərˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˌoʊvɚˈɛstəˌmeɪt/<,>v.对(数量)估计过高<,>Don't overestimate your abilities in this competition.<,>不要在这场比赛中高估自己的能力。<,>We overestimated the number of attendees for the conference.<,>我们高估了会议的出席人数。<,>It's easy to overestimate the time needed for this task.<,>很容易高估完成这个任务所需的时间。<,>over(过度)+estimate(估计)→估计过高<,>underestimate(v.低估)/estimate(v.估计/n.估价)/overstate(v.夸大)  

supervision<,>/ˌsuːpəˈvɪʒn/<,>/ˌsupɚˈvɪʒən/<,>n.监督<,>Children need adult supervision when using sharp tools.<,>儿童使用锋利工具时需要成人监督。<,>The construction work is under strict supervision.<,>施工工作受到严格监督。<,>Her thesis was completed under the professor's supervision.<,>她的论文是在教授的监督下完成的。<,>super(在上面)+vis(看)+ion→在上面看着→监督<,>vision(n.视力/n.视野)/supervisor(n.监督人)/superior(adj.优越的)  

expose<,>/ɪkˈspəʊz/<,>/ɪkˈspoʊz/<,>v.暴露<,>The investigation exposed corruption in the government.<,>调查揭露了政府中的腐败。<,>Don't expose your skin to strong sunlight for too long.<,>不要让皮肤长时间暴露在强阳光下。<,>The documentary exposed the truth about the factory's pollution.<,>这部纪录片揭露了工厂污染的真相。<,>ex(出)+pose(放置)→放到外面→暴露<,>impose(v.强加)/compose(v.组成)/oppose(v.反对)  

seemingly<,>/ˈsiːmɪŋli/<,>/ˈsimɪŋli/<,>adv.表面上看<,>Seemingly, the problem was simple, but it was actually complex.<,>表面上看问题很简单，但实际上很复杂。<,>He was seemingly happy, but I knew he was upset.<,>他看起来很高兴，但我知道他很难过。<,>The seemingly perfect plan had many flaws.<,>这个看似完美的计划有很多缺陷。<,>seem(看似)+ing+ly→表面上<,>seem(v.似乎)/seeing(conj.鉴于)/seam(n.接缝)  

assignment<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>n.作业<,>The teacher gave us a challenging writing assignment.<,>老师给我们布置了一个有挑战性的写作作业。<,>I need to finish this assignment by Friday.<,>我需要在周五前完成这个作业。<,>The assignment requires extensive research.<,>这个作业需要进行广泛的研究。<,>assign(分配)+ment→分配的任务→作业<,>alignment(n.对齐)/appointment(n.约会)/achievement(n.成就)  

preference<,>/ˈprefrəns/<,>/ˈprɛfərəns/<,>n.偏爱<,>She has a preference for classical music.<,>她偏爱古典音乐。<,>Students can indicate their course preferences online.<,>学生可以在网上表明他们的课程偏好。<,>The hotel gives preference to returning guests.<,>酒店优先考虑回头客。<,>pre(预先)+fer(拿)+ence→预先选择→偏爱<,>reference(n.参考)/difference(n.区别)/inference(n.推论)  

energetic<,>/ˌenəˈdʒetɪk/<,>/ˌɛnɚˈdʒɛtɪk/<,>adj.精力充沛的<,>The energetic puppy ran around the yard all day.<,>这只精力充沛的小狗整天在院子里跑来跑去。<,>She's always energetic in the morning.<,>她早上总是精力充沛。<,>The team needs more energetic players.<,>这个团队需要更多精力充沛的球员。<,>energy(能量)+etic→充满能量的→精力充沛的<,>sympathetic(adj.同情的)/pathetic(adj.可怜的)/genetic(adj.基因的)
application<,>/ˌæplɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>/ˌæplɪˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.申请/n.应用<,>He submitted an application for the job.<,>他提交了这份工作的申请。<,>This software has many practical applications.<,>这个软件有许多实际应用。<,>Her application to the university was successful.<,>她的大学申请成功了。<,>apply(申请)+cation(名词后缀)→申请/应用<,>applicant(n.申请人)/appliance(n.器具)  

moral<,>/ˈmɒrəl/<,>/ˈmɔːrəl/<,>adj.精神上的/adj.道德的<,>She always gives me moral support.<,>她总是给我精神上的支持。<,>It's a moral obligation to help those in need.<,>帮助有需要的人是道德义务。<,>The story teaches a moral lesson.<,>这个故事传达了道德教训。<,>mor(习俗)+al(形容词后缀)→道德的<,>morale(n.士气)/morality(n.道德)  

dispute<,>/dɪˈspjuːt/<,>/dɪˈspjuːt/<,>n.辩论/n.争论/v.辩论/v.争论<,>There was a dispute over the property rights.<,>关于产权问题存在争议。<,>They disputed the decision for hours.<,>他们对这个决定争论了几个小时。<,>The border dispute remains unresolved.<,>边界争端仍未解决。<,>dis(分开)+pute(思考)→分开思考→争论<,>repute(n.名誉)/compute(v.计算)  

influence<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>n.影响/v.影响<,>Her work has a great influence on me.<,>她的作品对我影响很大。<,>Parents influence their children's behavior.<,>父母影响着孩子的行为。<,>He used his influence to get the job.<,>他利用自己的影响力得到了这份工作。<,>in(进入)+flu(流动)+ence→流入其中→影响<,>affluence(n.富裕)/confluence(n.汇合)  

illegal<,>/ɪˈliːɡəl/<,>/ɪˈliːɡəl/<,>adj.非法的<,>It's illegal to park here.<,>在这里停车是违法的。<,>They were involved in illegal activities.<,>他们参与了非法活动。<,>The police arrested him for illegal possession of weapons.<,>警察因他非法持有武器而逮捕了他。<,>il(不)+legal(合法的)→非法的<,>legal(adj.合法的)/legitimate(adj.合法的)  

esteem<,>/ɪˈstiːm/<,>/ɪˈstiːm/<,>n.自尊<,>She has great self-esteem.<,>她有很强的自尊心。<,>He is held in high esteem by his colleagues.<,>他深受同事的尊敬。<,>Losing the match hurt his esteem.<,>输掉比赛伤害了他的自尊。<,>es(加强)+teem(价值)→高度评价→自尊<,>estimate(v.估计)/steam(n.蒸汽)  

abundant<,>/əˈbʌndənt/<,>/əˈbʌndənt/<,>adj.大量的/adj.丰富的<,>The region has abundant natural resources.<,>这个地区有丰富的自然资源。<,>We have abundant evidence to support our claim.<,>我们有大量证据支持我们的主张。<,>Her garden is abundant with flowers.<,>她的花园里开满了鲜花。<,>ab(离开)+und(波浪)+ant→像波浪一样多→丰富的<,>redundant(adj.多余的)/abound(v.大量存在)  

survey<,>/ˈsɜːveɪ/<,>/ˈsɜːrveɪ/<,>v.调查/v.审视/n.调查/n.勘测<,>They conducted a survey of public opinion.<,>他们进行了一项民意调查。<,>He surveyed the damage after the storm.<,>他查看了风暴过后的损失情况。<,>The land survey took three weeks.<,>土地勘测花了三周时间。<,>sur(在上面)+vey(看)→从上往下看→调查<,>surveillance(n.监视)/convey(v.传达)  

extensively<,>/ɪkˈstensɪvli/<,>/ɪkˈstensɪvli/<,>adv.广泛地<,>She has traveled extensively in Europe.<,>她在欧洲广泛旅行过。<,>The book covers the topic extensively.<,>这本书广泛涵盖了这个主题。<,>The drug has been extensively tested.<,>这种药物已经过广泛测试。<,>extensive(广泛的)+ly(副词后缀)→广泛地<,>intensively(adv.集中地)/expensively(adv.昂贵地)  

deserve<,>/dɪˈzɜːv/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrv/<,>v.值得<,>You deserve a break after working so hard.<,>这么努力工作后你值得休息一下。<,>He deserves praise for his honesty.<,>他的诚实值得表扬。<,>The team deserves to win the championship.<,>这支队伍值得赢得冠军。<,>de(加强)+serve(服务)→值得服务→值得<,>reserve(v.保留)/preserve(v.保存)
crash<,>/kræʃ/<,>/kræʃ/<,>v.坠落/v.坠毁/v.撞击/n.撞车事故/n.坠毁/n.失事<,>The plane crashed into the mountain.<,>飞机撞上了山。<,>There was a car crash on the highway.<,>高速公路上发生了一起车祸。<,>He crashed his bike into a tree.<,>他骑着自行车撞到了树上。<,>cr(碰撞)+ash(灰烬)→撞击后化为灰烬→坠毁<,>clash(v.冲突/n.碰撞)/smash(v.粉碎/n.破碎声)

affirm<,>/əˈfɜːm/<,>/əˈfɜːrm/<,>v.断言/v.声明<,>She affirmed her innocence in court.<,>她在法庭上坚称自己是无辜的。<,>The witness affirmed that he saw the accident.<,>证人确认他目睹了事故。<,>I affirm that this statement is true.<,>我声明这个陈述是真实的。<,>af(加强)+firm(坚定)→非常坚定地说→断言<,>confirm(v.确认)/inform(v.通知)/reform(v.改革)

reputation<,>/ˌrepjuˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌrepjəˈteɪʃn/<,>n.名气/n.名声/n.名誉<,>He has a reputation for being honest.<,>他以诚实著称。<,>The company's reputation was damaged by the scandal.<,>公司的声誉因丑闻受损。<,>She earned a reputation as a talented artist.<,>她赢得了天才艺术家的名声。<,>re(反复)+put(思考)+ation→反复被思考的东西→名声<,>repetition(n.重复)/computation(n.计算)/deputation(n.代表团)

degree<,>/dɪˈɡriː/<,>/dɪˈɡriː/<,>n.程度<,>To what degree do you agree with this statement?<,>你在多大程度上同意这个说法？<,>The pain was of such a high degree that he couldn't sleep.<,>疼痛程度如此之高，他无法入睡。<,>She has a degree in psychology.<,>她拥有心理学学位。<,>de(向下)+gree(走)→向下走的程度→程度<,>agree(v.同意)/disagree(v.不同意)/decree(n.法令)

fade<,>/feɪd/<,>/feɪd/<,>v.逐渐消失<,>The colors of the painting have faded over time.<,>随着时间的推移，这幅画的颜色已经褪色。<,>Her smile faded when she heard the bad news.<,>听到坏消息时，她的笑容消失了。<,>The sound of the music faded into the distance.<,>音乐声渐渐消失在远处。<,>f(风)+ade(谐音"爱的")→风把爱吹走了→逐渐消失<,>face(n.脸/v.面对)/fake(adj.假的/n.赝品)/fame(n.名声)

competitor<,>/kəmˈpetɪtə(r)/<,>/kəmˈpetɪtər/<,>n.竞争者/n.对手<,>Our main competitor has released a new product.<,>我们的主要竞争对手发布了一款新产品。<,>She was a strong competitor in the race.<,>她是比赛中的强劲对手。<,>All competitors must register before the event.<,>所有参赛者必须在活动前注册。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+itor→共同追求某个目标的人→竞争者<,>complete(v.完成/adj.完整的)/compute(v.计算)/compete(v.竞争)

confuse<,>/kənˈfjuːz/<,>/kənˈfjuːz/<,>v.使混淆/v.迷惑<,>The instructions confused me.<,>这些说明让我很困惑。<,>Don't confuse these two similar-looking words.<,>不要混淆这两个看起来相似的单词。<,>His strange behavior confused everyone.<,>他奇怪的行为让所有人都很困惑。<,>con(共同)+fuse(倒)→倒在一起→混淆<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/diffuse(v.扩散/adj.分散的)/fuse(n.保险丝/v.融合)

task<,>/tɑːsk/<,>/tæsk/<,>n.任务/n.工作<,>Completing this task will take several hours.<,>完成这项任务需要几个小时。<,>She was given the task of organizing the event.<,>她被分配了组织活动的任务。<,>The teacher assigned us a difficult task.<,>老师给我们布置了一项困难的任务。<,>t(提)+ask(问)→提问的任务→任务<,>tank(n.坦克/n.水箱)/tack(n.大头钉/v.改变航向)/mask(n.面具/v.掩饰)

lessen<,>/ˈlesn/<,>/ˈlesn/<,>v.减少<,>Taking medicine should lessen your pain.<,>服药应该能减轻你的疼痛。<,>We need to lessen our expenses.<,>我们需要减少开支。<,>The storm's intensity lessened as it moved inland.<,>风暴向内陆移动时强度减弱了。<,>less(更少)+en(使)→使更少→减少<,>lesson(n.课程)/listen(v.听)/loosen(v.松开)

admit<,>/ədˈmɪt/<,>/ədˈmɪt/<,>v.承认/v.容许<,>He admitted his mistake.<,>他承认了自己的错误。<,>This ticket admits two people to the museum.<,>这张票允许两个人进入博物馆。<,>She was admitted to the university.<,>她被大学录取了。<,>ad(向)+mit(送)→向...送→允许进入→承认<,>omit(v.省略)/commit(v.犯罪/v.承诺)/emit(v.发出)
bow<,>/baʊ/<,>/boʊ/<,>v.鞠躬<,>He gave a deep bow to the audience after his performance.<,>表演结束后，他向观众深深鞠了一躬。<,>She bowed her head in respect.<,>她低头表示敬意。<,>The trees bowed under the weight of the snow.<,>树木被积雪压弯了腰。<,>发音类似“抱”→鞠躬时身体前倾如拥抱状<,>bow(n.弓/v.弯曲)/blow(v.吹/n.打击)

division<,>/dɪˈvɪʒən/<,>/dɪˈvɪʒən/<,>n.除法/n.部门<,>The division of the company into smaller units improved efficiency.<,>公司将部门细分后效率提高了。<,>Long division can be tricky for young students.<,>长除法对小学生来说可能比较难。<,>There was a clear division of opinion among the team members.<,>团队成员间意见分歧明显。<,>divide(分割)+sion(名词后缀)→分割的结果→部门/除法<,>vision(n.视力/n.远见)/decision(n.决定)

literature<,>/ˈlɪtərɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪtərətʃər/<,>n.文学/n.文学作品/n.文献<,>English literature was my favorite subject in college.<,>英国文学是我大学时最喜欢的科目。<,>There is extensive literature on this research topic.<,>关于这个研究课题有大量文献。<,>She has contributed significantly to children's literature.<,>她对儿童文学做出了重要贡献。<,>liter(文字)+ature(状态)→文字作品→文学<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literacy(n.读写能力)

consultant<,>/kənˈsʌltənt/<,>/kənˈsʌltənt/<,>n.顾问<,>The company hired a marketing consultant to improve their strategy.<,>公司聘请了营销顾问来改进策略。<,>She works as a financial consultant for small businesses.<,>她为小企业提供财务咨询服务。<,>The hospital brought in a specialist consultant for the difficult case.<,>医院为这个疑难病例请来了专科顾问医生。<,>consult(咨询)+ant(人)→提供咨询的人→顾问<,>counselor(n.顾问)/consultation(n.咨询会)

penalty<,>/ˈpenəlti/<,>/ˈpenəlti/<,>n.惩罚<,>There is a penalty for late payment of the bill.<,>账单逾期未付会有罚款。<,>The player received a penalty for rough play.<,>这名球员因动作粗野被罚。<,>The death penalty is controversial in many countries.<,>死刑在许多国家存在争议。<,>pen(惩罚)+alty→惩罚<,>penal(adj.刑罚的)/penance(n.忏悔)

comment<,>/ˈkɒment/<,>/ˈkɑːment/<,>n.评论<,>She made an insightful comment about the novel.<,>她对这部小说发表了深刻的评论。<,>The article attracted many online comments.<,>这篇文章引来了很多网友评论。<,>No comment is sometimes the best comment.<,>有时不评论就是最好的评论。<,>com(共同)+ment(思考)→共同思考→评论<,>commend(v.称赞)/commence(v.开始)

major<,>/ˈmeɪdʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmeɪdʒər/<,>adj.主要的/v.主修<,>English was her major subject in university.<,>英语是她在大学的主修专业。<,>There has been a major breakthrough in cancer research.<,>癌症研究取得了重大突破。<,>He decided to major in computer science.<,>他决定主修计算机科学。<,>maj(大)+or→较大的→主要的<,>minor(adj.次要的/n.辅修)/mayor(n.市长)

option<,>/ˈɒpʃən/<,>/ˈɑːpʃən/<,>n.选择<,>You have the option to pay monthly or annually.<,>你可以选择按月或按年付款。<,>Keeping your options open is sometimes wise.<,>有时保留选择权是明智的。<,>The vegetarian option is clearly marked on the menu.<,>菜单上明确标有素食选择。<,>opt(选择)+ion→选择<,>opinion(n.意见)/optical(adj.视觉的)

socialize<,>/ˈsəʊʃəlaɪz/<,>/ˈsoʊʃəlaɪz/<,>v.交往/v.联谊<,>Puppies need to socialize with other dogs.<,>小狗需要和其他狗交往。<,>The club organizes events to help members socialize.<,>俱乐部组织活动帮助会员联谊。<,>It's important to socialize with colleagues outside work.<,>工作之余与同事交往很重要。<,>social(社会的)+ize(使)→使社会化→交往<,>socialism(n.社会主义)/sociable(adj.好交际的)

bureau<,>/ˈbjʊərəʊ/<,>/ˈbjʊroʊ/<,>n.局<,>She works at the Federal Bureau of Investigation.<,>她在联邦调查局工作。<,>The weather bureau issued a storm warning.<,>气象局发布了暴风雨预警。<,>The travel bureau can help you plan your trip.<,>旅游局可以帮助你规划行程。<,>发音类似“必入”→重要部门必入<,>bureaucracy(n.官僚主义)/bureaucrat(n.官僚)
budget<,>/ˈbʌdʒɪt/<,>/ˈbʌdʒɪt/<,>n.预算/v.编预算<,>We need to stick to our monthly budget.<,>我们需要坚持每月的预算。<,>The government has increased the education budget.<,>政府增加了教育预算。<,>She budgets carefully to save money.<,>她仔细做预算以节省开支。<,>bud(花蕾)+get(得到)→控制开支才能得到想要的东西<,>bid(n.出价/v.投标)/badge(n.徽章)/budge(v.移动)  

pop<,>/pɒp/<,>/pɑːp/<,>v.突然出现/v.跳出<,>The rabbit popped out of the hole.<,>兔子突然从洞里跳出来。<,>A new coffee shop has popped up in our neighborhood.<,>我们社区突然新开了一家咖啡店。<,>He popped the question during dinner.<,>他在晚餐时突然求婚。<,>拟声词，模仿突然出现的声音<,>pip(n.种子)/pope(n.教皇)/pomp(n.盛况)  

position<,>/pəˈzɪʃən/<,>/pəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.职位<,>She was offered a management position.<,>她获得了一个管理职位。<,>He is in a good position to get promoted.<,>他处于有利的晋升位置。<,>The company has positions available in marketing.<,>公司市场部有空缺职位。<,>posit(放置)+ion→被安置的地方→职位<,>deposition(n.沉积物)/opposition(n.反对)/composition(n.组成)  

unaffordable<,>/ˌʌnəˈfɔːdəbl/<,>/ˌʌnəˈfɔːrdəbl/<,>adj.买不起的/adj.负担不起的<,>The rent in this area is unaffordable for most young people.<,>这个地区的租金对大多数年轻人来说负担不起。<,>Healthcare has become unaffordable for many families.<,>医疗保健对许多家庭来说已经负担不起了。<,>Luxury cars are unaffordable to average workers.<,>豪华车对普通工人来说是买不起的。<,>un(不)+afford(负担得起)+able(能...的)<,>affordable(adj.负担得起的)/unapproachable(adj.难以接近的)/unattainable(adj.难以达到的)  

function<,>/ˈfʌŋkʃən/<,>/ˈfʌŋkʃən/<,>n.功能/v.运行<,>The main function of this button is to save the file.<,>这个按钮的主要功能是保存文件。<,>The machine stopped functioning properly.<,>这台机器停止正常运转了。<,>Liver has many important functions in the body.<,>肝脏在身体中有许多重要功能。<,>funct(做)+ion→做出来的效果→功能<,>junction(n.连接点)/malfunction(v.发生故障)/dysfunction(n.功能障碍)  

perceive<,>/pəˈsiːv/<,>/pərˈsiːv/<,>v.察觉<,>I perceived a slight change in his attitude.<,>我察觉到他态度有轻微变化。<,>Dogs can perceive sounds that humans can't.<,>狗能察觉到人类听不到的声音。<,>She perceived the hidden meaning in his words.<,>她察觉到他话中的隐含意思。<,>per(完全)+ceive(拿)→完全拿到信息→察觉<,>conceive(v.构思)/receive(v.接收)/deceive(v.欺骗)  

reserve<,>/rɪˈzɜːv/<,>/rɪˈzɜːrv/<,>v.留出/v.预定<,>I've reserved a table for two at the restaurant.<,>我在餐厅预定了一张两人桌。<,>We should reserve some money for emergencies.<,>我们应该留出一些钱应急。<,>These seats are reserved for VIP guests.<,>这些座位是为VIP客人预留的。<,>re(再)+serve(保持)→再次保持→保留<,>preserve(v.保存)/deserve(v.值得)/conserve(v.保护)  

innovation<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃən/<,>/ˌɪnəˈveɪʃən/<,>n.改革/n.创新<,>Technological innovation drives economic growth.<,>科技创新推动经济增长。<,>The company is known for its culture of innovation.<,>这家公司以其创新文化闻名。<,>This product represents a major innovation in design.<,>这款产品代表了设计上的重大创新。<,>in(进入)+nov(新)+ation→进入新状态→创新<,>renovation(n.翻新)/novation(n.更新)/novel(adj.新奇的)  

alert<,>/əˈlɜːt/<,>/əˈlɜːrt/<,>v.提醒/v.使意识到/adj.机警的<,>The alarm alerted us to the fire.<,>警报提醒我们发生了火灾。<,>Stay alert while walking alone at night.<,>晚上独自走路时要保持警觉。<,>The teacher alerted students to the upcoming test.<,>老师提醒学生即将到来的考试。<,>al(加强)+ert(观察)→加强观察→警觉的<,>inert(adj.惰性的)/avert(v.转移)/assert(v.断言)  

cautious<,>/ˈkɔːʃəs/<,>/ˈkɔːʃəs/<,>adj.谨慎的<,>Be cautious when crossing the busy street.<,>穿过繁忙的街道时要谨慎。<,>She gave a cautious reply to the sensitive question.<,>她对敏感问题给出了谨慎的回答。<,>Investors are being cautious in the current market.<,>投资者在当前市场中很谨慎。<,>caut(小心)+ious(多...的)→多小心的<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/captious(adj.吹毛求疵的)/carnivorous(adj.食肉的)
document<,>/ˈdɒkjʊmənt/<,>/ˈdɑːkjʊmənt/<,>n.文件<,>Please sign the document before submitting it.<,>请在提交前签署这份文件。<,>This document contains important information.<,>这份文件包含重要信息。<,>He lost the original document and had to request a copy.<,>他丢失了原始文件，不得不申请一份副本。<,>doc(教)+u+ment(名词后缀)→教导用的东西→文件<,>doctrine(n.教条)/dominant(adj.支配的)/documentary(n.纪录片)  

characterize<,>/ˈkærəktəraɪz/<,>/ˈkærɪktəraɪz/<,>v.以……特点<,>The novel characterizes the protagonist as a brave warrior.<,>这部小说将主人公刻画为一名勇敢的战士。<,>His paintings are characterized by bold colors.<,>他的画作以大胆的色彩为特点。<,>This period was characterized by rapid technological advancement.<,>这个时期的特点是技术快速进步。<,>character(特征)+ize(动词后缀)→赋予特征<,>character(n.性格)/characteristic(n.特征)/charisma(n.魅力)  

achieve<,>/əˈtʃiːv/<,>/əˈtʃiːv/<,>v.完成/v.实现<,>She worked hard to achieve her goals.<,>她努力工作以实现自己的目标。<,>The team achieved great success last season.<,>这支队伍上个赛季取得了巨大成功。<,>It's important to set realistic goals that you can achieve.<,>设定可实现的实际目标很重要。<,>a(强调)+chieve(chief,头)→做到头→完成<,>retrieve(v.取回)/deceive(v.欺骗)/conceive(v.构想)  

address<,>/əˈdres/<,>/əˈdres/<,>v.解决<,>The mayor addressed the issue of pollution in his speech.<,>市长在演讲中解决了污染问题。<,>We need to address this problem immediately.<,>我们需要立即解决这个问题。<,>The new policy aims to address income inequality.<,>新政策旨在解决收入不平等问题。<,>ad(向)+dress(指向)→指向问题→解决<,>redress(v.纠正)/addressee(n.收件人)/adore(v.崇拜)  

inspiration<,>/ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnspəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.灵感<,>The beautiful scenery was her inspiration for the painting.<,>这美丽的景色是她绘画的灵感来源。<,>He found inspiration in classical music.<,>他从古典音乐中找到了灵感。<,>Her speech was full of inspiration and hope.<,>她的演讲充满灵感和希望。<,>in(进入)+spir(呼吸)+ation→吸入灵气→灵感<,>aspiration(n.渴望)/respiration(n.呼吸)/spiritual(adj.精神的)  

agency<,>/ˈeɪdʒənsi/<,>/ˈeɪdʒənsi/<,>n.机构<,>She works at a travel agency.<,>她在一家旅行社工作。<,>The environmental agency monitors pollution levels.<,>环境机构监测污染水平。<,>The advertising agency created a successful campaign.<,>这家广告公司策划了一次成功的活动。<,>ag(做)+ency(名词后缀)→做事的组织→机构<,>agent(n.代理人)/agenda(n.议程)/agile(adj.敏捷的)  

formulate<,>/ˈfɔːmjʊleɪt/<,>/ˈfɔːrmjʊleɪt/<,>v.规定/v.制定<,>The committee formulated a new set of rules.<,>委员会制定了一套新规则。<,>Scientists formulated a theory to explain the phenomenon.<,>科学家们提出了一个理论来解释这一现象。<,>It took months to formulate the company's strategy.<,>制定公司战略花了数月时间。<,>form(形式)+ulate(动词后缀)→形成规定<,>formula(n.公式)/formation(n.形成)/informative(adj.信息丰富的)  

fate<,>/feɪt/<,>/feɪt/<,>n.命运<,>He believed in fate and destiny.<,>他相信命运和天命。<,>The fate of the project is still uncertain.<,>这个项目的命运仍不确定。<,>They met by fate at the small café.<,>他们在小咖啡馆命中注定地相遇了。<,>fat(说)+e→神说的话→命运<,>fatal(adj.致命的)/fated(adj.命中注定的)/fateful(adj.重大的)  

surf<,>/sɜːf/<,>/sɜːrf/<,>v.冲浪<,>He loves to surf in Hawaii during the summer.<,>他喜欢夏天在夏威夷冲浪。<,>She learned to surf when she was twelve.<,>她十二岁时学会了冲浪。<,>The waves are perfect for surfing today.<,>今天的浪非常适合冲浪。<,>sur(超过)+f→超越海浪→冲浪<,>surface(n.表面)/surge(v.汹涌)/serf(n.农奴)  

steer<,>/stɪə(r)/<,>/stɪr/<,>v.驾驶<,>He steered the boat carefully through the narrow channel.<,>他小心地驾驶船只通过狭窄的航道。<,>She steered the conversation away from the sensitive topic.<,>她把谈话从敏感话题上引开。<,>You need both hands to steer the truck properly.<,>你需要双手才能正确驾驶卡车。<,>st(站)+eer(人)→站着控制方向的人→驾驶<,>steel(n.钢铁)/stereo(n.立体声)/stern(adj.严厉的)
structure<,>/ˈstrʌk.tʃər/<,>/ˈstrʌk.tʃɚ/<,>n.结构<,>The Eiffel Tower has a unique steel structure.<,>埃菲尔铁塔拥有独特的钢结构。<,>The company is reorganizing its management structure.<,>公司正在重组其管理结构。<,>The molecular structure of water is H2O.<,>水的分子结构是H2O。<,>struct(建造)+ure(名词后缀)→建造物→结构<,>construct(v.建造)/destruction(n.破坏)/infrastructure(n.基础设施)  

architect<,>/ˈɑː.kɪ.tekt/<,>/ˈɑːr.kɪ.tekt/<,>n.建筑师<,>The architect designed a modern glass skyscraper.<,>这位建筑师设计了一座现代玻璃摩天楼。<,>Frank Lloyd Wright was a famous American architect.<,>弗兰克·劳埃德·赖特是美国著名建筑师。<,>She works as an architect in a design firm.<,>她在一家设计公司担任建筑师。<,>arch(首要)+tect(建造者)→首要建造者→建筑师<,>architecture(n.建筑学)/architectural(adj.建筑的)/archaeology(n.考古学)  

frame<,>/freɪm/<,>/freɪm/<,>n.框架<,>The photo looks nice in this wooden frame.<,>这张照片在这个木制相框里很好看。<,>The building's steel frame was completed last month.<,>这座建筑的钢框架上个月完工了。<,>She wore glasses with thin metal frames.<,>她戴着细金属框的眼镜。<,>fram(框架)+e→框架<,>framework(n.框架结构)/framer(n.制定者)/fame(n.名声)  

amaze<,>/əˈmeɪz/<,>/əˈmeɪz/<,>v.使吃惊<,>His magic tricks never fail to amaze the audience.<,>他的魔术总能令观众惊叹。<,>I was amazed by her knowledge of ancient history.<,>她对古代历史的了解让我惊讶。<,>The technological advances amaze scientists every day.<,>科技进步每天都让科学家们感到惊奇。<,>a(加强)+maze(迷宫)→像迷宫般令人迷惑→使吃惊<,>amazing(adj.惊人的)/amazement(n.惊奇)/maze(n.迷宫)  

affirmation<,>/ˌæf.əˈmeɪ.ʃən/<,>/ˌæf.ɚˈmeɪ.ʃən/<,>n.断言/肯定<,>Her smile was an affirmation of her happiness.<,>她的微笑是对她快乐的肯定。<,>The court required a signed affirmation of the facts.<,>法庭要求对事实进行签字确认。<,>Positive affirmations can boost your confidence.<,>积极的肯定能增强你的信心。<,>af(加强)+firm(坚定)+ation→坚定地声明→肯定<,>confirm(v.确认)/affirmative(adj.肯定的)/information(n.信息)  

intelligent<,>/ɪnˈtel.ɪ.dʒənt/<,>/ɪnˈtel.ə.dʒənt/<,>adj.有智慧的/聪明的/悟性强的<,>Dolphins are highly intelligent marine animals.<,>海豚是非常聪明的海洋动物。<,>She asked an intelligent question during the lecture.<,>她在讲座中提出了一个很有见地的问题。<,>The AI system is becoming more intelligent every year.<,>这个人工智能系统每年都变得更聪明。<,>intel(在...之间)+lig(选择)+ent→能在事物间做出选择的→聪明的<,>intelligence(n.智力)/intellectual(adj.智力的)/diligent(adj.勤奋的)  

code<,>/kəʊd/<,>/koʊd/<,>n.代码/密码<,>Programmers write code to create software.<,>程序员编写代码来创建软件。<,>The spy sent messages using a secret code.<,>间谍用密码发送信息。<,>Please enter your access code to continue.<,>请输入您的访问代码继续。<,>cod(写)+e→写下的符号→代码<,>encode(v.编码)/decode(v.解码)/barcode(n.条形码)  

burden<,>/ˈbɜː.dən/<,>/ˈbɝː.dən/<,>n.重担/负担<,>Carrying heavy bags is a burden for travelers.<,>携带沉重的行李对旅行者来说是个负担。<,>The tax increase will be a burden on low-income families.<,>增税将成为低收入家庭的负担。<,>She shouldn't bear this burden alone.<,>她不应该独自承担这个重担。<,>burd(承载)+en→承载的东西→负担<,>burdensome(adj.繁重的)/overburden(v.使负担过重)/birthing(n.分娩)  

absorb<,>/əbˈzɔːb/<,>/əbˈzɔːrb/<,>v.吸收(液体、气体等)<,>Plants absorb sunlight for photosynthesis.<,>植物吸收阳光进行光合作用。<,>The sponge quickly absorbed the spilled water.<,>海绵迅速吸收了洒出的水。<,>She was completely absorbed in her book.<,>她完全沉浸在书中。<,>ab(离开)+sorb(吸)→吸走→吸收<,>absorption(n.吸收)/adsorb(v.吸附)/sorbet(n.果汁冰糕)  

instruction<,>/ɪnˈstrʌk.ʃən/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌk.ʃən/<,>n.用法说明/操作指南/命令/指示<,>Read the instructions before assembling the furniture.<,>组装家具前请阅读说明书。<,>The teacher gave clear instructions for the experiment.<,>老师对实验给出了明确的指示。<,>Soldiers must follow their commander's instructions.<,>士兵必须服从指挥官的命令。<,>in(进入)+struct(建造)+ion→指导如何建造→说明<,>instruct(v.指导)/instructional(adj.教学的)/construction(n.建设)
admission<,>/ədˈmɪʃn/<,>/ədˈmɪʃən/<,>n.承认/n.准许进入/n.入场费<,>His admission of guilt surprised everyone.<,>他认罪让所有人都感到惊讶。<,>The admission fee for the museum is $10.<,>博物馆的入场费是10美元。<,>She gained admission to the prestigious university.<,>她被那所著名大学录取了。<,>ad(向)+miss(送)+ion→准许进入<,>mission(n.任务)/permission(n.许可)/commission(n.佣金)

additional<,>/əˈdɪʃənl/<,>/əˈdɪʃənəl/<,>adj.额外的<,>We need additional information to complete the report.<,>我们需要额外的信息来完成报告。<,>There will be an additional charge for luggage.<,>行李将额外收费。<,>Additional staff were hired for the busy season.<,>为旺季雇佣了额外员工。<,>add(增加)+ition+al→额外的<,>additive(n.添加剂)/addition(n.增加)/edition(n.版本)

prejudice<,>/ˈpredʒudɪs/<,>/ˈprɛdʒədɪs/<,>n.偏见/v.使有偏见<,>He has a prejudice against foreign workers.<,>他对外国工人有偏见。<,>The media coverage prejudiced the jury.<,>媒体报道影响了陪审团的判断。<,>We must overcome our prejudices to work together.<,>我们必须克服偏见才能合作。<,>pre(前)+judice(判断)→预先判断→偏见<,>judge(n.法官)/justice(n.正义)/prejudicial(adj.不利的)

process<,>/ˈprəʊses/<,>/ˈprɑːses/<,>n.过程/n.工序/v.处理<,>The manufacturing process takes three days.<,>制造过程需要三天。<,>We're still processing your application.<,>我们仍在处理你的申请。<,>Learning is a gradual process.<,>学习是一个渐进的过程。<,>pro(向前)+cess(走)→向前走的过程<,>procedure(n.程序)/procession(n.队伍)/access(n.入口)

elegant<,>/ˈelɪɡənt/<,>/ˈɛləɡənt/<,>adj.优雅的<,>She wore an elegant black dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件优雅的黑色礼服参加派对。<,>His elegant solution saved the company millions.<,>他巧妙的解决方案为公司节省了数百万。<,>The hotel lobby has an elegant design.<,>酒店大堂设计优雅。<,>e(出)+leg(选择)+ant→精心挑选出的→优雅的<,>elevate(v.提升)/element(n.元素)/eloquent(adj.雄辩的)

hospitable<,>/hɒˈspɪtəbl/<,>/hɑːˈspɪtəbəl/<,>adj.热情友好的<,>The locals were very hospitable to tourists.<,>当地人对游客非常热情。<,>She runs a hospitable bed and breakfast.<,>她经营着一家热情好客的民宿。<,>The climate here is hospitable to many plants.<,>这里的气候适合多种植物生长。<,>hospital(医院)+able→像医院般照顾人的→好客的<,>hospitality(n.好客)/hostile(adj.敌对的)/host(n.主人)

refreshing<,>/rɪˈfreʃɪŋ/<,>/rɪˈfrɛʃɪŋ/<,>adj.恢复活力的<,>The cold drink was refreshing on a hot day.<,>热天喝冷饮让人神清气爽。<,>His honesty was refreshing in politics.<,>他的诚实为政界带来清新之风。<,>A refreshing breeze came from the sea.<,>海上吹来一阵清新的微风。<,>re(再)+fresh(新鲜)+ing→再次新鲜的<,>refresh(v.使恢复)/fresh(adj.新鲜的)/refrigerate(v.冷藏)

ensure<,>/ɪnˈʃɔː(r)/<,>/ɪnˈʃʊr/<,>v.确保<,>Please ensure all windows are closed before leaving.<,>离开前请确保所有窗户都关好了。<,>This medicine will ensure a good night's sleep.<,>这种药能保证你睡个好觉。<,>We must ensure the safety of our employees.<,>我们必须确保员工的安全。<,>en(使)+sure(确定)→使确定<,>insure(v.保险)/assure(v.保证)/secure(adj.安全的)

frighten<,>/ˈfraɪtn/<,>/ˈfraɪtən/<,>v.使惊恐<,>The loud noise frightened the baby.<,>巨大的声响吓到了婴儿。<,>Don't frighten me like that!<,>别那样吓我！<,>The horror movie frightened the audience.<,>恐怖电影吓到了观众。<,>fright(恐惧)+en(使)→使恐惧<,>frightful(adj.可怕的)/fright(n.惊吓)/bright(adj.明亮的)

civilized<,>/ˈsɪvəlaɪzd/<,>/ˈsɪvəˌlaɪzd/<,>adj.文明的<,>We should try to resolve conflicts in a civilized manner.<,>我们应该以文明的方式解决冲突。<,>This is a highly civilized society.<,>这是一个高度文明的社会。<,>Civilized people don't litter in public places.<,>文明人不会在公共场所乱扔垃圾。<,>civil(公民的)+ize(使)+ed→使成为公民的→文明的<,>civilization(n.文明)/civil(adj.公民的)/uncivilized(adj.未开化的)
approval<,>/əˈpruːvl/<,>/əˈpruvəl/<,>n.批准/n.认可/n.赞成/n.同意<,>The project needs the manager's approval before we can proceed.<,>这个项目需要经理的批准才能继续进行。<,>She nodded her head in approval of the idea.<,>她点头表示赞同这个想法。<,>His approval means a lot to me.<,>他的认可对我很重要。<,>approve(批准)+al(名词后缀)→批准<,>disapproval(n.不赞成)/approve(v.批准)/prove(v.证明)  

publicize<,>/ˈpʌblɪsaɪz/<,>/ˈpʌblɪˌsaɪz/<,>v.宣布<,>The company will publicize the new product next week.<,>公司将在下周宣布新产品。<,>They used social media to publicize the event.<,>他们用社交媒体宣传这次活动。<,>The government publicized the new policy yesterday.<,>政府昨天公布了新政策。<,>public(公开的)+ize(动词后缀)→使公开→宣布<,>publish(v.出版)/publicity(n.宣传)/public(n.公众)  

resident<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>/ˈrɛzɪdənt/<,>n.居民<,>The residents of the neighborhood organized a clean-up day.<,>社区的居民组织了一次清洁日。<,>He has been a resident of this city for ten years.<,>他在这座城市住了十年。<,>The hotel offers discounts for local residents.<,>这家酒店为当地居民提供折扣。<,>reside(居住)+ent(人)→居民<,>president(n.总统)/residence(n.住所)/resident(adj.居住的)  

considerate<,>/kənˈsɪdərət/<,>/kənˈsɪdərɪt/<,>adj.体贴的/adj.考虑周到的<,>It was very considerate of you to bring an umbrella for me.<,>你为我带伞真是考虑周到。<,>She is always considerate of other people's feelings.<,>她总是体贴他人的感受。<,>Being considerate can make others feel valued.<,>体贴能让别人感到被重视。<,>consider(考虑)+ate(形容词后缀)→考虑周到的<,>considerable(adj.相当大的)/consideration(n.考虑)/inconsiderate(adj.不体贴的)  

twist<,>/twɪst/<,>/twɪst/<,>v.扭曲/v.使弯曲<,>She twisted her ankle while running.<,>她在跑步时扭伤了脚踝。<,>He twisted the cap off the bottle.<,>他拧开了瓶盖。<,>The road twists through the mountains.<,>这条路蜿蜒穿过群山。<,>twi(两)+st(站)→两股力量对抗→扭曲<,>wrist(n.手腕)/twister(n.旋风)/twisty(adj.弯曲的)  

citizen<,>/ˈsɪtɪzn/<,>/ˈsɪtɪzən/<,>n.市民/n.城镇居民/n.公民<,>Every citizen has the right to vote.<,>每个公民都有投票权。<,>She is a proud citizen of this country.<,>她是这个国家骄傲的公民。<,>The city provides free healthcare for its citizens.<,>这座城市为市民提供免费医疗。<,>city(城市)+zen(人)→市民<,>resident(n.居民)/civilian(n.平民)/citizenship(n.公民身份)  

stake<,>/steɪk/<,>/steɪk/<,>n.风险<,>He has a high stake in this business deal.<,>他在这笔生意中承担了很高的风险。<,>The stakes are too high to ignore.<,>风险太高，不容忽视。<,>She was willing to gamble with high stakes.<,>她愿意冒高风险赌博。<,>s(死)+take(拿)→拿命去赌→风险<,>steak(n.牛排)/stack(n.堆)/stake(v.下注)  

keenly<,>/ˈkiːnli/<,>/ˈkinli/<,>adv.敏锐地<,>He observed the situation keenly.<,>他敏锐地观察了形势。<,>She listened keenly to every word he said.<,>她敏锐地倾听他说的每一个字。<,>The dog sniffed the air keenly.<,>狗敏锐地嗅着空气。<,>keen(敏锐的)+ly(副词后缀)→敏锐地<,>kindly(adv.友好地)/keen(adj.敏锐的)/keenness(n.敏锐)  

superficial<,>/ˌsuːpəˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌsupərˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.肤浅的<,>His knowledge of the subject is superficial.<,>他对这个主题的了解很肤浅。<,>She only made a superficial effort to help.<,>她只是肤浅地帮忙。<,>Don't judge people by their superficial appearance.<,>不要以肤浅的外表评判他人。<,>super(上)+fic(面)+ial(形容词后缀)→在表面上的→肤浅的<,>superficiality(n.肤浅)/superficies(n.表面)/artificial(adj.人工的)  

flexibility<,>/ˌfleksəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌflɛksəˈbɪlɪti/<,>n.灵活性/n.适应性<,>Yoga improves your flexibility.<,>瑜伽能提高你的灵活性。<,>The job requires a lot of flexibility.<,>这份工作需要很强的适应性。<,>She showed great flexibility in handling the situation.<,>她在处理情况时表现出极大的灵活性。<,>flex(弯曲)+ibility(能力)→灵活性<,>flexible(adj.灵活的)/inflexibility(n.不灵活)/reflex(n.反射)
favorable<,>/ˈfeɪvərəbl/<,>/ˈfeɪvərəbəl/<,>adj.赞同的<,>The weather was favorable for our picnic.<,>天气很适合我们的野餐。<,>He received a favorable response from the committee.<,>他得到了委员会的赞同回应。<,>The terms of the agreement are favorable to both parties.<,>协议的条款对双方都有利。<,>favor(喜爱)+able(能…的)→能让人喜爱的→赞同的<,>unfavorable(adj. 不赞同的)/favorite(adj. 最喜欢的)

competent<,>/ˈkɒmpɪtənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmpɪtənt/<,>adj.胜任的/adj.有能力的<,>She is competent in handling complex projects.<,>她有能力处理复杂的项目。<,>The lawyer proved to be highly competent in court.<,>这位律师在法庭上表现得非常胜任。<,>Only competent candidates will be considered for the position.<,>只有有能力的候选人会被考虑这个职位。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+ent(…的)→共同追求→有能力的<,>competitive(adj. 竞争的)/incompetent(adj. 无能力的)

emotional<,>/ɪˈməʊʃənl/<,>/ɪˈmoʊʃənl/<,>adj.情绪(上)的/adj.情感(上)的/adj.激起感情的/adj.敏感的/adj.情绪激动的<,>She gave an emotional speech at the ceremony.<,>她在仪式上发表了情绪激动的演讲。<,>Music can evoke strong emotional responses.<,>音乐能激起强烈的情感反应。<,>He's been very emotional since the accident.<,>自从事故后他一直很情绪化。<,>e(出)+mot(动)+ion(状态)+al(…的)→情感流露的→情绪的<,>emotion(n. 情感)/motional(adj. 运动的)

pioneer<,>/ˌpaɪəˈnɪə(r)/<,>/ˌpaɪəˈnɪr/<,>v.开拓/v.开发<,>They pioneered a new approach to education.<,>他们开创了一种新的教育方法。<,>This company pioneered the use of solar energy.<,>这家公司率先使用了太阳能。<,>He pioneered research in genetic engineering.<,>他开拓了基因工程的研究。<,>pion(步兵)+eer(人)→走在前面的人→开拓者<,>pioneer(n. 先驱者)/engineer(n. 工程师)

sustain<,>/səˈsteɪn/<,>/səˈsteɪn/<,>n.维持<,>Proper nutrition is essential to sustain good health.<,>适当的营养对维持健康至关重要。<,>The economy cannot sustain such high growth rates.<,>经济无法维持如此高的增长率。<,>We need to find ways to sustain our natural resources.<,>我们需要找到维持自然资源的方法。<,>sus(在…下面)+tain(保持)→在下面保持→维持<,>sustainable(adj. 可持续的)/retain(v. 保留)

gloomy<,>/ˈɡluːmi/<,>/ˈɡlumi/<,>adj.阴沉的/adj.沮丧的<,>The weather has been gloomy all week.<,>整个星期的天气都很阴沉。<,>He felt gloomy about his future prospects.<,>他对未来的前景感到沮丧。<,>The room was dark and gloomy.<,>房间又暗又阴沉。<,>gloom(阴暗)+y(…的)→阴暗的→阴沉的<,>bloom(v. 开花)/gloom(n. 阴暗)

convince<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>v.使相信<,>She convinced me to change my mind.<,>她说服我改变了主意。<,>The evidence convinced the jury of his innocence.<,>证据使陪审团相信他是无辜的。<,>I'm trying to convince him to join our team.<,>我正试图说服他加入我们的团队。<,>con(完全)+vince(征服)→完全征服对方→使相信<,>convict(v. 定罪)/convincing(adj. 令人信服的)

profitable<,>/ˈprɒfɪtəbl/<,>/ˈprɑːfɪtəbl/<,>adj.有利可图的/adj.有益的<,>The business became highly profitable last year.<,>去年这家企业变得非常有利可图。<,>Reading is a profitable way to spend your free time.<,>阅读是度过空闲时间的有益方式。<,>They made a profitable investment in real estate.<,>他们在房地产上做了有利可图的投资。<,>profit(利润)+able(能…的)→能产生利润的→有利可图的<,>profit(n. 利润)/prophet(n. 先知)

routinely<,>/ruːˈtiːnli/<,>/ruˈtiːnli/<,>adv.例行公事地<,>The equipment is routinely checked every morning.<,>设备每天早上都例行检查。<,>She routinely works late hours.<,>她经常工作到很晚。<,>These tests are routinely performed on all patients.<,>这些测试在所有病人身上例行进行。<,>routine(例行公事)+ly(…地)→例行公事地<,>routine(n. 例行公事)/route(n. 路线)

phenomenon<,>/fəˈnɒmɪnən/<,>/fəˈnɑːmɪnən/<,>n.现象<,>The northern lights are a natural phenomenon.<,>北极光是一种自然现象。<,>This social phenomenon deserves further study.<,>这种社会现象值得进一步研究。<,>The sudden popularity of the app is an interesting phenomenon.<,>这款应用的突然流行是个有趣的现象。<,>phen(出现)+omen(征兆)+on→出现的征兆→现象<,>phenomena(n. 现象复数)/phenomenal(adj. 非凡的)
variety<,>/vəˈraɪəti/<,>/vəˈraɪəti/<,>n.多样<,>The garden has a variety of flowers.<,>花园里有各种各样的花。<,>She enjoys reading a variety of books.<,>她喜欢阅读各种书籍。<,>The store offers a variety of products.<,>这家商店提供多种产品。<,>vari(变化)+ety(名词后缀)→多样性<,>vary(v.变化)/variable(adj.可变的)/variance(n.差异)  

gum<,>/ɡʌm/<,>/ɡʌm/<,>n.牙龈<,>Chewing gum can help clean your teeth and gums.<,>嚼口香糖有助于清洁牙齿和牙龈。<,>His gums were bleeding after brushing too hard.<,>他刷牙太用力导致牙龈出血。<,>Gum disease can lead to tooth loss.<,>牙龈疾病可能导致牙齿脱落。<,>gum(胶)+牙齿周围组织→牙龈<,>gun(n.枪)/gumption(n.进取心)/gummy(adj.粘的)  

criticism<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsɪzəm/<,>n.批评<,>He accepted the criticism and improved his work.<,>他接受了批评并改进了工作。<,>Her criticism of the project was constructive.<,>她对项目的批评是有建设性的。<,>The film received mixed criticism.<,>这部电影的评价褒贬不一。<,>critic(批评家)+ism(名词后缀)→批评<,>critic(n.批评家)/critique(n.评论)/critical(adj.关键的)  

fatal<,>/ˈfeɪtl/<,>/ˈfeɪtl/<,>adj.致命的/攸关的<,>The accident was fatal to the driver.<,>这次事故对司机来说是致命的。<,>Making a fatal mistake can cost you the game.<,>犯一个致命的错误可能会让你输掉比赛。<,>The decision was fatal to the company's future.<,>这个决定对公司的未来至关重要。<,>fat(命运)+al(形容词后缀)→致命的<,>fate(n.命运)/fatalism(n.宿命论)/fatality(n.死亡)  

delightful<,>/dɪˈlaɪtfəl/<,>/dɪˈlaɪtfəl/<,>adj.高兴的<,>The party was absolutely delightful.<,>这个派对非常令人愉快。<,>She has a delightful personality.<,>她性格讨人喜欢。<,>The weather was delightful for a picnic.<,>天气非常适合野餐。<,>delight(高兴)+ful(形容词后缀)→令人高兴的<,>delight(n.高兴)/delighted(adj.高兴的)/delightfully(adv.令人愉快地)  

tedious<,>/ˈtiːdiəs/<,>/ˈtiːdiəs/<,>adj.单调沉闷的<,>The lecture was so tedious that I fell asleep.<,>这个讲座太沉闷了，我睡着了。<,>Filling out these forms is a tedious task.<,>填写这些表格是一项单调的任务。<,>The journey became tedious after hours of driving.<,>开了几个小时车后，旅程变得沉闷起来。<,>ted(厌倦)+ious(形容词后缀)→令人厌倦的<,>tedium(n.沉闷)/tediously(adv.沉闷地)/tediousness(n.沉闷)  

flexible<,>/ˈfleksəbl/<,>/ˈfleksəbəl/<,>adj.灵活的<,>She has a flexible schedule.<,>她的时间安排很灵活。<,>The material is flexible and durable.<,>这种材料柔韧耐用。<,>We need to be flexible in our approach.<,>我们需要在方法上保持灵活。<,>flex(弯曲)+ible(能够)→能够弯曲的→灵活的<,>flexibility(n.灵活性)/inflexible(adj.不灵活的)/reflect(v.反射)  

considerably<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbli/<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbli/<,>adv.相当地/非常地<,>The price has increased considerably.<,>价格大幅上涨了。<,>Her health has improved considerably.<,>她的健康状况大为改善。<,>The project is considerably more complex than we thought.<,>这个项目比我们想象的要复杂得多。<,>consider(考虑)+able(能够)+ly(副词后缀)→相当地<,>considerable(adj.相当大的)/considerate(adj.体贴的)/consideration(n.考虑)  

efficiently<,>/ɪˈfɪʃəntli/<,>/ɪˈfɪʃəntli/<,>adv.有效地<,>She manages her time efficiently.<,>她有效地管理时间。<,>The machine works very efficiently.<,>这台机器工作效率很高。<,>We need to use resources more efficiently.<,>我们需要更有效地利用资源。<,>efficient(有效率的)+ly(副词后缀)→有效地<,>efficiency(n.效率)/effective(adj.有效的)/effectively(adv.有效地)  

appearance<,>/əˈpɪərəns/<,>/əˈpɪrəns/<,>n.外表/外观/出现<,>His appearance has changed a lot over the years.<,>这些年来他的外表变化很大。<,>The appearance of the building is impressive.<,>这座建筑的外观令人印象深刻。<,>She made an appearance at the party.<,>她在派对上露了面。<,>appear(出现)+ance(名词后缀)→出现/外表<,>appear(v.出现)/disappearance(n.消失)/apparent(adj.明显的)
album<,>/ˈælbəm/<,>/ˈælbəm/<,>n.粘贴簿/n.集邮簿/n.册<,>She keeps all her photos in a family album.<,>她把所有照片都保存在家庭相册里。<,>I bought a new stamp album for my collection.<,>我为我的集邮买了本新集邮册。<,>The band released their latest album last month.<,>这个乐队上个月发行了他们最新的专辑。<,>alb(白色)+um(物品)→空白本子→粘贴簿<,>alum(n.明矾)/alarm(n.警报/v.警告)  

optimistic<,>/ˌɒptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌɑːptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.乐观的<,>Despite the difficulties, he remains optimistic.<,>尽管有困难，他仍然保持乐观。<,>She has an optimistic view of the future.<,>她对未来持乐观看法。<,>The team is optimistic about winning the championship.<,>团队对赢得冠军持乐观态度。<,>optim(最好)+istic(…的)→认为最好的→乐观的<,>pessimistic(adj.悲观的)/optimum(adj.最优的)  

clue<,>/kluː/<,>/kluː/<,>n.线索<,>The detective found a crucial clue at the crime scene.<,>侦探在犯罪现场发现了关键线索。<,>I don't have a clue how to solve this problem.<,>我完全不知道如何解决这个问题。<,>Her diary might give us some clues about her disappearance.<,>她的日记可能给我们提供一些关于她失踪的线索。<,>发音类似"刻录"→线索像被刻录的痕迹<,>glue(n.胶水/v.粘合)/cue(n.提示/v.暗示)  

grief<,>/ɡriːf/<,>/ɡriːf/<,>n.悲伤<,>She was overcome with grief when her pet died.<,>她的宠物去世时，她悲痛欲绝。<,>Time heals all griefs.<,>时间能治愈一切悲伤。<,>He expressed his grief through poetry.<,>他通过诗歌表达悲伤。<,>g(拼音"哥")+rief(看作relief"安慰")→哥哥需要安慰→悲伤<,>brief(adj.简短的)/relief(n.缓解)  

synthetic<,>/sɪnˈθetɪk/<,>/sɪnˈθetɪk/<,>adj.合成的/adj.人造的<,>This jacket is made of synthetic fibers.<,>这件夹克是用合成纤维做的。<,>Synthetic diamonds are cheaper than natural ones.<,>人造钻石比天然钻石便宜。<,>Many medicines contain synthetic compounds.<,>许多药物含有合成化合物。<,>syn(共同)+thet(放)+ic→放在一起的→合成的<,>authentic(adj.真正的)/sympathetic(adj.同情的)  

resistance<,>/rɪˈzɪstəns/<,>/rɪˈzɪstəns/<,>n.抵御/n.抵抗/n.抵抗力<,>The troops met with fierce resistance.<,>部队遇到了猛烈抵抗。<,>Exercise can boost your resistance to illness.<,>锻炼可以增强你对疾病的抵抗力。<,>There's growing resistance to the new policy.<,>对新政策的抵制越来越多。<,>re(反)+sist(站)+ance→反着站→抵抗<,>assistance(n.援助)/persistence(n.坚持)  

install<,>/ɪnˈstɔːl/<,>/ɪnˈstɔːl/<,>v.安装<,>We need to install a new air conditioner.<,>我们需要安装一台新空调。<,>The software installs in just a few minutes.<,>这个软件只需几分钟就能安装好。<,>He was installed as the new manager yesterday.<,>他昨天被任命为新经理。<,>in(进入)+stall(站立)→使站立进去→安装<,>stall(n.货摊/v.拖延)/instance(n.例子)  

pledge<,>/pledʒ/<,>/pledʒ/<,>n.保证/n.誓言<,>They made a pledge to protect the environment.<,>他们立誓要保护环境。<,>He gave his pledge that he would repay the loan.<,>他保证会偿还贷款。<,>The company pledged to reduce carbon emissions.<,>公司承诺减少碳排放。<,>pl(看作"please")+edge(边缘)→请站在道德边缘发誓→誓言<,>ledge(n.壁架)/allege(v.宣称)  

unique<,>/juːˈniːk/<,>/juːˈniːk/<,>adj.独特的/adj.唯一的<,>Each person's fingerprints are unique.<,>每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。<,>This vase is a unique piece of art.<,>这个花瓶是件独特的艺术品。<,>She has a unique perspective on the issue.<,>她对这个问题有独到的见解。<,>uni(单一)+que(形容词后缀)→唯一的<,>unite(v.联合)/unity(n.团结)  

stock<,>/stɒk/<,>/stɑːk/<,>n.股票/n.库存<,>He invested all his money in tech stocks.<,>他把所有钱都投资在了科技股上。<,>We're running low on stock for this product.<,>这个产品的库存不多了。<,>The store keeps a large stock of winter clothes.<,>这家店存有大量冬装。<,>s(看作"store")+tock(看作"lock")→锁在仓库里的东西→库存<,>stack(n.堆/v.堆积)/shock(n.震惊/v.使震惊)
disadvantage<,>/ˌdɪsədˈvɑːntɪdʒ/<,>/ˌdɪsədˈvæntɪdʒ/<,>n.不利情况/n.缺点<,>Lack of experience is a major disadvantage for him.<,>缺乏经验是他的主要劣势。<,>Being short can be a disadvantage in basketball.<,>个子矮在篮球运动中可能是个劣势。<,>The disadvantage of this plan is its high cost.<,>这个计划的缺点是成本高。<,>dis(否定)+advantage(优势)→不利情况<,>advantage(n.优势)/disagree(v.不同意)/disability(n.残疾)

compensate<,>/ˈkɒmpənseɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːmpənseɪt/<,>v.弥补/v.补偿<,>The company compensated him for the accident.<,>公司为事故对他进行了补偿。<,>Hard work can compensate for lack of talent.<,>努力工作可以弥补天赋的不足。<,>She was compensated with extra vacation days.<,>她获得了额外的假期作为补偿。<,>com(共同)+pens(支付)+ate→共同支付→补偿<,>compensation(n.补偿)/recompense(v.报酬)/pension(n.养老金)

rescue<,>/ˈreskjuː/<,>/ˈrɛskju/<,>v.营救/v.援救<,>The firefighters rescued the family from the burning building.<,>消防员从燃烧的建筑物中救出了这家人。<,>He rescued the drowning child.<,>他救起了溺水的孩子。<,>The organization works to rescue abandoned animals.<,>该组织致力于救助被遗弃的动物。<,>re(重新)+scue(安全)→重新获得安全→营救<,>secure(adj.安全的)/pursue(v.追求)/rescuee(n.被营救者)

monitor<,>/ˈmɒnɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈmɑːnɪtər/<,>v.监控/v.监听<,>Teachers monitor students' progress closely.<,>老师密切监控学生的学习进度。<,>The doctor is monitoring his heart rate.<,>医生正在监测他的心率。<,>Security cameras monitor the building 24/7.<,>监控摄像头24小时监控着大楼。<,>mon(警告)+itor→警告者→监控<,>mentor(n.导师)/moderator(n.主持人)/monitory(adj.警告的)

refusal<,>/rɪˈfjuːzl/<,>/rɪˈfjuːzl/<,>n.拒绝<,>Her refusal to cooperate surprised everyone.<,>她拒绝合作让所有人都很惊讶。<,>I got a refusal letter from the university.<,>我收到了大学的拒信。<,>His refusal was polite but firm.<,>他的拒绝礼貌但坚定。<,>re(反)+fus(倾倒)+al→倒回去→拒绝<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/confuse(v.混淆)/diffuse(v.扩散)

exile<,>/ˈeksaɪl/<,>/ˈɛɡzaɪl/<,>n.流放/n.放逐<,>The poet spent years in exile.<,>这位诗人流亡多年。<,>The king was sent into exile.<,>国王被流放了。<,>Living in exile was difficult for her.<,>流亡生活对她来说很艰难。<,>ex(出)+ile(走)→走出去→流放<,>exit(n.出口)/exhale(v.呼气)/exemplify(v.例证)

encourage<,>/ɪnˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>v.鼓励<,>His words encouraged me to keep trying.<,>他的话鼓励我继续尝试。<,>Teachers should encourage students to ask questions.<,>老师应该鼓励学生提问。<,>The coach encouraged the team after the loss.<,>教练在比赛失利后鼓励了球队。<,>en(使)+courage(勇气)→使有勇气→鼓励<,>discourage(v.使气馁)/courage(n.勇气)/encouragement(n.鼓励)

concept<,>/ˈkɒnsept/<,>/ˈkɑːnsept/<,>n.观点/n.观念<,>The concept of time varies in different cultures.<,>时间观念在不同文化中各不相同。<,>She explained the basic concept clearly.<,>她清楚地解释了这个基本概念。<,>This design is based on a simple concept.<,>这个设计基于一个简单的理念。<,>con(共同)+cept(拿)→共同拿住的想法→概念<,>conception(n.概念)/precept(n.规则)/accept(v.接受)

render<,>/ˈrendə(r)/<,>/ˈrɛndər/<,>v.给予<,>The jury rendered its verdict.<,>陪审团作出了裁决。<,>He rendered assistance to the victims.<,>他向受害者提供了帮助。<,>The song was rendered beautifully.<,>这首歌演唱得很优美。<,>ren(回)+der(给)→给回去→给予<,>surrender(v.投降)/tender(adj.温柔的)/gender(n.性别)

trait<,>/treɪt/<,>/treɪt/<,>n.性格<,>Honesty is one of her best traits.<,>诚实是她最好的性格特点之一。<,>Genetic traits are passed from parents to children.<,>遗传特征从父母传给子女。<,>His most noticeable trait is his sense of humor.<,>他最显著的特点是幽默感。<,>trait(拉)→拉出来的特征→性格<,>trace(n.痕迹)/treat(v.对待)/retreat(v.撤退)
feature<,>/ˈfiːtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfiːtʃər/<,>n.特点<,>The new phone has many advanced features.<,>这款新手机有许多先进的特点。<,>Her eyes are her best feature.<,>她的眼睛是她最突出的特点。<,>This software lacks some important features.<,>这个软件缺少一些重要的功能。<,>feat(功绩)+ure(名词后缀)→特点<,>creature(n.生物)/nature(n.自然)/texture(n.质地)

reframe<,>/ˌriːˈfreɪm/<,>/ˌriːˈfreɪm/<,>v.再构造(图画、照片等)<,>The artist decided to reframe the painting.<,>艺术家决定重新装裱这幅画。<,>We need to reframe the problem to find a solution.<,>我们需要重新构建这个问题来找到解决方案。<,>She reframed the photo in a modern style.<,>她用现代风格重新装裱了这张照片。<,>re(重新)+frame(框架)→重新构造<,>reform(v.改革)/refresh(v.刷新)/refrain(v.克制)

identify<,>/aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/<,>/aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/<,>v.认出，识别/视为<,>Can you identify this plant?<,>你能认出这种植物吗？<,>She identified the man as her attacker.<,>她认出那个男人就是袭击她的人。<,>He identifies strongly with his cultural heritage.<,>他非常认同自己的文化遗产。<,>ident(相同)+ify(使)→识别<,>identity(n.身份)/identical(adj.相同的)/indemnify(v.赔偿)

impose<,>/ɪmˈpəʊz/<,>/ɪmˈpoʊz/<,>v.强加<,>The government imposed new taxes.<,>政府征收了新税。<,>Don't impose your views on others.<,>不要把你的观点强加于人。<,>The school imposes strict rules on students.<,>学校对学生实行严格的规定。<,>im(在...上)+pose(放置)→强加<,>compose(v.组成)/oppose(v.反对)/expose(v.暴露)

snack<,>/snæk/<,>/snæk/<,>n.零食，小吃<,>I like to have a snack in the afternoon.<,>我喜欢在下午吃点零食。<,>The vending machine sells various snacks.<,>自动售货机出售各种小吃。<,>We prepared some snacks for the party.<,>我们为聚会准备了一些小吃。<,>sn(蛇)+ack(acknowledge)→蛇承认爱吃零食<,>snake(n.蛇)/snack(v.吃零食)/stack(n.堆)

require<,>/rɪˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkwaɪər/<,>v.要求，命令<,>This job requires patience.<,>这份工作需要耐心。<,>The law requires drivers to wear seat belts.<,>法律要求司机系安全带。<,>The recipe requires three eggs.<,>这个食谱需要三个鸡蛋。<,>re(再)+quire(寻求)→要求<,>acquire(v.获得)/inquire(v.询问)/request(n.请求)

donation<,>/dəʊˈneɪʃn/<,>/doʊˈneɪʃn/<,>n.捐赠<,>They made a large donation to the hospital.<,>他们向医院捐赠了一大笔钱。<,>Blood donation saves lives.<,>献血能挽救生命。<,>The charity relies on public donations.<,>这个慈善机构依靠公众捐赠。<,>don(给予)+ation(名词后缀)→捐赠<,>donor(n.捐赠者)/denotation(n.表示)/domination(n.支配)

equal<,>/ˈiːkwəl/<,>/ˈiːkwəl/<,>adj.相等的，平等的<,>All people are equal before the law.<,>法律面前人人平等。<,>Divide the cake into equal parts.<,>把蛋糕分成相等的几份。<,>Women demand equal pay for equal work.<,>女性要求同工同酬。<,>equ(平等)+al(形容词后缀)→平等的<,>equate(v.等同)/equator(n.赤道)/equity(n.公平)

rare<,>/reə(r)/<,>/rer/<,>adj.罕有的，少见的<,>This is a rare opportunity.<,>这是个难得的机会。<,>Pandas are rare animals.<,>熊猫是稀有动物。<,>He collects rare stamps.<,>他收集稀有邮票。<,>r(人)+are(是)→人是罕见的<,>rear(n.后面)/raw(adj.生的)/rate(n.比率)

specify<,>/ˈspesɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈspesɪfaɪ/<,>v.指定，具体说明<,>Please specify your requirements.<,>请具体说明你的要求。<,>The contract specifies the delivery date.<,>合同规定了交货日期。<,>The recipe doesn't specify the cooking time.<,>食谱没有具体说明烹饪时间。<,>speci(种类)+fy(使)→具体说明<,>special(adj.特殊的)/specific(adj.具体的)/species(n.物种)
constant<,>/ˈkɒnstənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstənt/<,>adj.不断的/adj.持续的<,>She was in constant pain after the accident.<,>事故后她一直感到疼痛。<,>The constant noise from the construction site was unbearable.<,>建筑工地持续不断的噪音令人难以忍受。<,>He has been a constant source of support for me.<,>他一直是我坚定的支持者。<,>con(共同)+stant(站立)→一直站在一起→持续的<,>instant(adj.立即的)/distant(adj.遥远的)

standardize<,>/ˈstændədaɪz/<,>/ˈstændərdaɪz/<,>v.使标准化<,>We need to standardize our testing procedures.<,>我们需要将测试程序标准化。<,>The industry is working to standardize safety regulations.<,>该行业正在努力使安全法规标准化。<,>All parts must be standardized for mass production.<,>所有零件必须标准化以进行大规模生产。<,>standard(标准)+ize(使...化)→使标准化<,>normalize(v.使正常化)/stabilize(v.使稳定)

consume<,>/kənˈsjuːm/<,>/kənˈsuːm/<,>v.消费/v.消耗<,>The fire quickly consumed the wooden house.<,>大火迅速吞噬了木屋。<,>Americans consume more energy per capita than Europeans.<,>美国人均能源消耗量高于欧洲人。<,>He was consumed by jealousy.<,>他被嫉妒心所吞噬。<,>con(完全)+sume(拿取)→全部拿走→消耗<,>presume(v.假定)/resume(v.重新开始)

status<,>/ˈsteɪtəs/<,>/ˈsteɪtəs/<,>n.地位<,>Her status as a celebrity gives her certain privileges.<,>她作为名人的身份赋予她某些特权。<,>What's your marital status?<,>你的婚姻状况如何？<,>The status of the project will be reviewed next week.<,>项目状态将在下周进行审查。<,>stat(站立)+us→站立的位置→地位<,>statue(n.雕像)/stature(n.身高)

complement<,>/ˈkɒmplɪment/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪment/<,>v.补充<,>The wine complements the cheese perfectly.<,>这款酒与奶酪完美搭配。<,>The new curtains complement the furniture nicely.<,>新窗帘与家具相得益彰。<,>This course will complement your previous studies.<,>这门课程将补充你之前的学习。<,>com(共同)+ple(满)+ment→共同填满→补充<,>compliment(n.赞美)/implement(v.实施)

lengthy<,>/ˈleŋθi/<,>/ˈleŋθi/<,>adj.长的/adj.漫长的<,>We had a lengthy discussion about the issue.<,>我们就这个问题进行了长时间的讨论。<,>The report was too lengthy to read in one sitting.<,>这份报告太长，无法一口气读完。<,>The legal process can be lengthy and expensive.<,>法律程序可能漫长且昂贵。<,>length(长度)+y(形容词后缀)→长的<,>length(n.长度)/lengthways(adv.纵向地)

embarrassed<,>/ɪmˈbærəst/<,>/ɪmˈbærəst/<,>adj.尴尬的/adj.窘迫的<,>I was embarrassed when I forgot her name.<,>当我忘记她的名字时，我感到很尴尬。<,>He looked embarrassed by the compliment.<,>他因受到赞美而显得窘迫。<,>She felt embarrassed about her mistake.<,>她对自己的错误感到尴尬。<,>em(进入)+barr(障碍)+ass→陷入障碍中→尴尬的<,>embarrassing(adj.令人尴尬的)/embarrassment(n.尴尬)

rational<,>/ˈræʃənəl/<,>/ˈræʃənəl/<,>adj.神智清楚的<,>He gave a rational explanation for his behavior.<,>他对自己的行为给出了合理的解释。<,>In a rational world, this wouldn't happen.<,>在一个理性的世界里，这不会发生。<,>She remained rational despite the crisis.<,>尽管处于危机中，她仍保持理智。<,>rat(计算)+ion+al→会计算的→理性的<,>irrational(adj.不理性的)/national(adj.国家的)

distant<,>/ˈdɪstənt/<,>/ˈdɪstənt/<,>adj.遥远的<,>The mountains looked distant in the fog.<,>群山在雾中显得遥远。<,>She has a distant relationship with her father.<,>她与父亲关系疏远。<,>The sound of distant thunder could be heard.<,>可以听到远处的雷声。<,>di(分开)+stant(站立)→分开站立的→遥远的<,>instant(adj.立即的)/constant(adj.持续的)

homemaker<,>/ˈhəʊmmeɪkə(r)/<,>/ˈhoʊmmeɪkər/<,>n.主妇<,>She chose to be a homemaker after having children.<,>生完孩子后，她选择成为家庭主妇。<,>Modern homemakers often balance work and family.<,>现代主妇常常要平衡工作和家庭。<,>Being a homemaker is a full-time job.<,>做家庭主妇是一份全职工作。<,>home(家)+maker(制造者)→家的制造者→主妇<,>housewife(n.家庭主妇)/housekeeper(n.管家)
exception<,>/ɪkˈsepʃn/<,>/ɪkˈsepʃən/<,>n.例外<,>There is an exception to every rule.<,>每个规则都有例外。<,>She made an exception for her best friend.<,>她为自己的好朋友破例了一次。<,>No one is above the law—there are no exceptions.<,>法律面前人人平等，没有例外。<,>ex(出)+cept(拿)+ion→拿出去→例外<,>except(conj.除了/prep.除…外)/exemption(n.免除)  

sustainable<,>/səˈsteɪnəbl/<,>/səˈsteɪnəbəl/<,>adj.可持续的<,>Sustainable development is crucial for our future.<,>可持续发展对我们的未来至关重要。<,>We need to find sustainable energy sources.<,>我们需要找到可持续的能源。<,>The company adopted sustainable business practices.<,>该公司采用了可持续的商业实践。<,>sustain(维持)+able(能…的)→能维持的→可持续的<,>maintainable(adj.可维持的)/sustenance(n.生计)  

trigger<,>/ˈtrɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈtrɪɡər/<,>v.引发/v.引起<,>The loud noise triggered her anxiety.<,>巨大的噪音引发了她的焦虑。<,>His comment triggered a heated debate.<,>他的评论引发了一场激烈的辩论。<,>The incident triggered a series of investigations.<,>该事件引发了一系列调查。<,>tri(三)+gger→扣动扳机需要三个手指→引发<,>tiger(n.老虎)/tricker(n.骗子)  

intend<,>/ɪnˈtend/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnd/<,>v.打算<,>I intend to finish the project by Friday.<,>我打算周五前完成这个项目。<,>They intend to travel around the world.<,>他们打算环游世界。<,>This book is intended for beginners.<,>这本书是为初学者准备的。<,>in(向)+tend(伸展)→向某个方向伸展→打算<,>extend(v.延伸)/pretend(v.假装)  

spread<,>/spred/<,>/sprɛd/<,>v.扩散/v.传播<,>The virus spread rapidly across the country.<,>病毒在全国迅速扩散。<,>She spread butter on the toast.<,>她把黄油涂在吐司上。<,>The news spread like wildfire.<,>消息像野火般传播开来。<,>s+pre(前)+ad→向前铺开→传播<,>spree(n.狂欢)/spray(v.喷溅)  

estimate<,>/ˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˈɛstəˌmeɪt/<,>v.估计<,>They estimate the cost to be around $500.<,>他们估计费用约为500美元。<,>It's difficult to estimate how long it will take.<,>很难估计需要多长时间。<,>The estimated time of arrival is 3 PM.<,>预计到达时间是下午3点。<,>est(存在)+im+ate→对存在的事物进行评估→估计<,>esteem(n.尊重)/overestimate(v.高估)  

technique<,>/tekˈniːk/<,>/tɛkˈnik/<,>n.技巧/n.手艺/n.技术/n.技能<,>She has mastered the technique of oil painting.<,>她掌握了油画技巧。<,>Modern surgical techniques are less invasive.<,>现代外科技术创伤更小。<,>This athlete has perfect running technique.<,>这位运动员有完美的跑步技术。<,>techn(技术)+ique→技术<,>technology(n.科技)/tactics(n.战术)  

include<,>/ɪnˈkluːd/<,>/ɪnˈklud/<,>v.包含<,>The price includes breakfast and dinner.<,>价格包含早餐和晚餐。<,>Please include your contact information.<,>请包含你的联系方式。<,>The tour includes a visit to the museum.<,>这次旅行包含参观博物馆。<,>in(入)+clud(关闭)+e→关在里面→包含<,>exclude(v.排除)/conclude(v.结束)  

academic<,>/ˌækəˈdemɪk/<,>/ˌækəˈdɛmɪk/<,>adj.学术的<,>She has a brilliant academic record.<,>她有出色的学术成绩。<,>The conference attracted many academic researchers.<,>这次会议吸引了许多学术研究者。<,>This is purely an academic discussion.<,>这纯粹是学术讨论。<,>academ(学院)+ic→学院的→学术的<,>academy(n.学院)/adamant(adj.固执的)  

distinctive<,>/dɪˈstɪŋktɪv/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋktɪv/<,>adj.独特的/adj.与众不同的<,>She has a distinctive laugh.<,>她有独特的笑声。<,>The building has distinctive architectural features.<,>这座建筑有独特的建筑特色。<,>This brand has a distinctive logo.<,>这个品牌有独特的标志。<,>di(分开)+stinct(刺)+ive→能分开刺的→独特的<,>distinct(adj.明显的)/instinctive(adj.本能的)
consist<,>/kənˈsɪst/<,>/kənˈsɪst/<,>v.由……组成<,>The team consists of five members.<,>这个团队由五名成员组成。<,>Water consists of hydrogen and oxygen.<,>水由氢和氧组成。<,>The book consists of three parts.<,>这本书由三部分组成。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)→共同站在一起→组成<,>insist(v.坚持)/resist(v.抵抗)/persist(v.持续)  

bid<,>/bɪd/<,>/bɪd/<,>n.出价/n.投标/v.出价/v.投标<,>He made a bid of $500 for the painting.<,>他出价500美元买这幅画。<,>Our company will bid for the construction project.<,>我们公司将投标这个建设项目。<,>She bid farewell to her friends.<,>她向朋友们告别。<,>b(钱)+id(身份证)→用钱证明身份→投标<,>bad(adj.坏的)/bed(n.床)/bud(n.芽)  

benefit<,>/ˈbenɪfɪt/<,>/ˈbɛnəfɪt/<,>v.有益于/v.有助于<,>Exercise benefits your health.<,>运动有益于你的健康。<,>This program will benefit many students.<,>这个项目将使许多学生受益。<,>We benefit from his experience.<,>我们从他的经验中获益。<,>bene(好)+fit(做)→做好事→有益<,>profit(n.利润)/bonus(n.奖金)/beneficial(adj.有益的)  

downsize<,>/ˈdaʊnsaɪz/<,>/ˈdaʊnˌsaɪz/<,>v.裁员<,>The company had to downsize due to financial problems.<,>由于财务问题，公司不得不裁员。<,>They downsized the workforce by 20%.<,>他们将员工人数减少了20%。<,>After the merger, many departments were downsized.<,>合并后，许多部门都进行了裁员。<,>down(向下)+size(规模)→缩小规模→裁员<,>upsize(v.扩大)/resize(v.调整大小)/capsize(v.翻船)  

avoid<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>v.避免<,>Try to avoid making the same mistake.<,>尽量避免犯同样的错误。<,>He avoided answering the question.<,>他避而不答这个问题。<,>We took a detour to avoid traffic.<,>我们绕道以避开交通拥堵。<,>a(不)+void(空的)→不让事情落空→避免<,>void(adj.空的)/avid(adj.渴望的)/ovoid(adj.卵形的)  

gender<,>/ˈdʒendə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒɛndər/<,>n.性别<,>Gender equality is an important issue.<,>性别平等是一个重要问题。<,>Please specify your gender on the form.<,>请在表格上注明你的性别。<,>The study examines gender differences in learning.<,>这项研究探讨了学习中的性别差异。<,>gen(产生)+der→与生俱来的特征→性别<,>generation(n.一代)/general(adj.一般的)/genre(n.类型)  

interracial<,>/ˌɪntəˈreɪʃl/<,>/ˌɪntərˈreɪʃəl/<,>adj.种族间的<,>They are an interracial couple.<,>他们是一对跨种族夫妻。<,>The school promotes interracial harmony.<,>学校促进种族间的和谐。<,>Interracial marriage has become more common.<,>跨种族婚姻已变得更普遍。<,>inter(在...之间)+racial(种族的)→种族间的<,>intraracial(adj.种族内的)/international(adj.国际的)/interactive(adj.互动的)  

complaint<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>n.抱怨/n.投诉<,>She made a complaint about the noise.<,>她就噪音问题提出了投诉。<,>We received many complaints about the service.<,>我们收到了许多关于服务的投诉。<,>He always has some complaint or other.<,>他总是有这样那样的抱怨。<,>com(完全)+plaint(抱怨)→完全抱怨→投诉<,>plaintive(adj.哀伤的)/plain(adj.简单的)/explain(v.解释)  

pattern<,>/ˈpætn/<,>/ˈpætərn/<,>n.模式<,>This fabric has a floral pattern.<,>这种布料有花卉图案。<,>His behavior follows a predictable pattern.<,>他的行为遵循可预测的模式。<,>The weather pattern is changing.<,>天气模式正在变化。<,>pat(拍)+tern(三)→拍三下形成规律→模式<,>partner(n.伙伴)/patter(v.喋喋不休)/patent(n.专利)  

mood<,>/muːd/<,>/mud/<,>n.心情<,>She's in a good mood today.<,>她今天心情很好。<,>His mood suddenly changed.<,>他的心情突然变了。<,>The music matches my mood.<,>这音乐很符合我的心情。<,>moon(月亮)+d→月亮影响情绪→心情<,>mode(n.模式)/food(n.食物)/wood(n.木头)
sympathy<,>/ˈsɪmpəθi/<,>/ˈsɪmpəθi/<,>n.同情心<,>She showed great sympathy for the homeless.<,>她对无家可归者表现出极大的同情。<,>I have no sympathy for people who don't even try.<,>我对那些连尝试都不愿意的人毫无同情。<,>His words were full of sympathy.<,>他的话充满了同情。<,>sym(共同)+path(感觉)+y→共同感受→同情<,>apathy(n.冷漠)/empathy(n.共情)

discount<,>/ˈdɪskaʊnt/<,>/ˈdɪskaʊnt/<,>n.折扣<,>We offer a 20% discount for students.<,>我们为学生提供20%的折扣。<,>This item is available at a discount price.<,>这件商品可以以折扣价购买。<,>Don't discount the importance of this meeting.<,>不要低估这次会议的重要性。<,>dis(不)+count(计算)→不算在内→折扣<,>account(n.账户)/recount(v.叙述)

value<,>/ˈvæljuː/<,>/ˈvæljuː/<,>v.重视<,>I value your opinion greatly.<,>我非常重视你的意见。<,>This company values innovation.<,>这家公司重视创新。<,>We should value every opportunity.<,>我们应该珍惜每个机会。<,>val(价值)+ue→重视价值<,>evaluate(v.评估)/devalue(v.贬值)

altitude<,>/ˈæltɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈæltɪtuːd/<,>n.海拔/n.高度<,>The plane is flying at an altitude of 10,000 meters.<,>飞机正在一万米的高空飞行。<,>Altitude sickness is common in the mountains.<,>高原反应在山区很常见。<,>The city has an average altitude of 500 meters.<,>这座城市平均海拔500米。<,>alt(高)+itude(状态)→高度<,>attitude(n.态度)/latitude(n.纬度)

groundsheet<,>/ˈɡraʊndʃiːt/<,>/ˈɡraʊndʃiːt/<,>n.防潮布<,>Don't forget to bring the groundsheet for camping.<,>别忘了带露营用的防潮布。<,>The groundsheet kept our sleeping bags dry.<,>防潮布让我们的睡袋保持干燥。<,>Spread the groundsheet before setting up the tent.<,>搭帐篷前先铺好防潮布。<,>ground(地面)+sheet(布)→地面用的布<,>bedsheet(n.床单)/worksheet(n.工作表)

evolutionary<,>/ˌiːvəˈluːʃənəri/<,>/ˌɛvəˈluʃəˌnɛri/<,>adj.进化的/adj.演变的<,>This is an important stage in evolutionary biology.<,>这是进化生物学的重要阶段。<,>The theory explains evolutionary changes in species.<,>这个理论解释了物种的进化变化。<,>Language has undergone evolutionary development.<,>语言经历了演变发展。<,>evolution(进化)+ary(形容词后缀)→进化的<,>revolutionary(adj.革命的)/involutionary(adj.退化的)

implement<,>/ˈɪmplɪment/<,>/ˈɪmpləˌmɛnt/<,>v.实施/v.执行<,>We need to implement this plan immediately.<,>我们需要立即实施这个计划。<,>The new policy will be implemented next month.<,>新政策将于下个月实施。<,>They failed to implement the agreement properly.<,>他们没有妥善执行协议。<,>im(进入)+ple(满)+ment→使圆满→实施<,>complement(n.补充)/supplement(n.增补)

dominant<,>/ˈdɒmɪnənt/<,>/ˈdɑːmɪnənt/<,>adj.占优势的<,>The dominant team won the match easily.<,>占优势的队伍轻松赢得了比赛。<,>This gene is dominant in the population.<,>这个基因在种群中占优势。<,>She has a dominant personality in the group.<,>她在团队中性格强势。<,>dom(统治)+in+ant(形容词后缀)→统治的→占优势的<,>predominant(adj.主要的)/dominate(v.支配)

scope<,>/skəʊp/<,>/skoʊp/<,>n.范围<,>This research is beyond the scope of our study.<,>这项研究超出了我们的研究范围。<,>The project has a wide scope of application.<,>这个项目有广泛的应用范围。<,>We need to define the scope of work clearly.<,>我们需要明确界定工作范围。<,>scop(看)+e→看到的范围<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/telescope(n.望远镜)

suspect<,>/səˈspekt/<,>/səˈspɛkt/<,>v.怀疑/v.猜想/n.嫌疑犯<,>I suspect he's not telling the truth.<,>我怀疑他没有说实话。<,>The police arrested the main suspect.<,>警方逮捕了主要嫌疑犯。<,>She suspected something was wrong immediately.<,>她立即察觉到有些不对劲。<,>sus(下)+pect(看)→向下看→怀疑<,>inspect(v.检查)/respect(v.尊重)
confrontation<,>/ˌkɒnfrʌnˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌkɑːnfrənˈteɪʃən/<,>n.冲突/n.对抗<,>The confrontation between the two leaders was intense.<,>两位领导人之间的对抗非常激烈。<,>He avoided a direct confrontation with his boss.<,>他避免与老板直接冲突。<,>The protest led to a violent confrontation with the police.<,>抗议活动导致与警方的暴力冲突。<,>con(共同)+front(前面)+ation→面对面→对抗<,>conflict(n.冲突)/confront(v.面对)/confrontational(adj.对抗的)  

puzzle<,>/ˈpʌzl/<,>/ˈpʌzəl/<,>v.迷惑/n.难解之事/n.谜<,>Her behavior puzzles me.<,>她的行为让我感到迷惑。<,>He solved the crossword puzzle in five minutes.<,>他五分钟内解出了填字游戏。<,>The mystery remains a puzzle to scientists.<,>这个谜团对科学家来说仍是个难题。<,>puzz(困惑)+le→令人困惑的东西→谜<,>mystery(n.谜)/riddle(n.谜语)/baffle(v.使困惑)  

critic<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>n.批评家/n.评论家<,>The film critic gave the movie a bad review.<,>这位影评人给这部电影打了差评。<,>She is a harsh critic of government policies.<,>她是政府政策的严厉批评者。<,>He works as an art critic for a magazine.<,>他在一家杂志担任艺术评论家。<,>crit(判断)+ic→做出判断的人→评论家<,>critical(adj.批评的)/criticism(n.批评)/critique(n.评论)  

apartment<,>/əˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/əˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.公寓<,>She rents a small apartment downtown.<,>她在市中心租了一间小公寓。<,>The apartment has a beautiful view of the city.<,>这间公寓可以看到美丽的城市景色。<,>They moved into a new apartment last month.<,>他们上个月搬进了新公寓。<,>apart(分开)+ment→分隔开的房间→公寓<,>flat(n.公寓)/condominium(n.公寓)/studio(n.单间公寓)  

analyze<,>/ˈænəlaɪz/<,>/ˈænəˌlaɪz/<,>v.分析<,>Scientists will analyze the data collected.<,>科学家们将分析收集到的数据。<,>He analyzed the problem carefully before making a decision.<,>他在做决定前仔细分析了问题。<,>The report analyzes the causes of the economic crisis.<,>这份报告分析了经济危机的原因。<,>ana(向上)+lyze(松开)→分解开来→分析<,>analysis(n.分析)/analytical(adj.分析的)/synthesize(v.合成)  

maintain<,>/meɪnˈteɪn/<,>/meɪnˈteɪn/<,>v.维持/v.主张<,>It's important to maintain a healthy lifestyle.<,>保持健康的生活方式很重要。<,>He maintains that he is innocent.<,>他坚称自己是无辜的。<,>The company maintains high standards of quality.<,>公司保持着高质量标准。<,>main(手)+tain(持有)→用手握住→维持<,>sustain(v.维持)/retain(v.保留)/obtain(v.获得)  

curb<,>/kɜːb/<,>/kɜːrb/<,>v.控制/n.控制<,>The government introduced measures to curb inflation.<,>政府出台了控制通货膨胀的措施。<,>Parking is not allowed at the curb.<,>路边不允许停车。<,>She tried to curb her anger during the argument.<,>她在争论中试图控制自己的怒气。<,>curb原指"马勒"，引申为"控制"<,>restrain(v.抑制)/control(v.控制)/curbstone(n.路缘石)  

version<,>/ˈvɜːʃən/<,>/ˈvɜːrʒən/<,>n.版本<,>This is the latest version of the software.<,>这是该软件的最新版本。<,>The film is based on the novel but is a very different version.<,>这部电影基于小说，但版本大不相同。<,>She gave her version of what happened that night.<,>她讲述了她对那晚发生的事情的说法。<,>vers(转)+ion→转换形式→版本<,>edition(n.版本)/variant(n.变体)/diversion(n.转移)  

rival<,>/ˈraɪvəl/<,>/ˈraɪvəl/<,>n.对手<,>The two companies are fierce rivals in the market.<,>这两家公司在市场上是激烈的竞争对手。<,>He defeated his rival in the tennis match.<,>他在网球比赛中击败了对手。<,>She has no rival when it comes to singing.<,>在唱歌方面，她无人能敌。<,>riv(河)+al→住在河对岸的人→对手<,>competitor(n.竞争者)/opponent(n.对手)/adversary(n.敌手)  

beneficial<,>/ˌbenɪˈfɪʃəl/<,>/ˌbenɪˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.有利的/adj.有益的<,>Regular exercise is beneficial to your health.<,>定期锻炼对健康有益。<,>The new policy will be beneficial to small businesses.<,>新政策将对小企业有利。<,>Sunlight is beneficial for plant growth.<,>阳光对植物生长有益。<,>bene(好)+fic(做)+ial→带来好处的→有益的<,>advantageous(adj.有利的)/profitable(adj.有利可图的)/detrimental(adj.有害的)
