substantial<,>/səbˈstænʃəl/<,>/səbˈstænʃəl/<,>adj.大量的<,>She received a substantial amount of money from her inheritance.<,>她从遗产中获得了大量的钱。<,>The project requires substantial funding to be completed.<,>这个项目需要大量的资金才能完成。<,>He made substantial progress in his studies.<,>他在学业上取得了巨大的进步。<,>sub(下面)+stant(站立)+ial→站在下面的→大量的<,>substantive(adj.实质的)/substantiate(v.证实)/substantially(adv.大体上)

recover<,>/rɪˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkʌvər/<,>v.恢复/v.重新获得/v.寻回<,>It took him months to recover from the illness.<,>他花了几个月时间从疾病中恢复。<,>The police recovered the stolen goods.<,>警方找回了被盗物品。<,>She is trying to recover her lost confidence.<,>她正在努力重拾失去的信心。<,>re(重新)+cover(覆盖)→重新覆盖→恢复<,>discover(v.发现)/uncover(v.揭露)/recovery(n.恢复)

diploma<,>/dɪˈpləʊmə/<,>/dɪˈploʊmə/<,>n.文凭<,>She received her diploma after four years of hard work.<,>经过四年的努力，她获得了文凭。<,>A high school diploma is required for this job.<,>这份工作需要高中文凭。<,>He framed his diploma and hung it on the wall.<,>他把文凭裱起来挂在墙上。<,>di(双)+ploma(折叠)→古代对折的文件→文凭<,>diplomat(n.外交官)/diplomacy(n.外交)/diplomatic(adj.外交的)

carpenter<,>/ˈkɑːpəntə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːrpəntər/<,>n.木匠<,>The carpenter is building a new bookshelf for us.<,>木匠正在为我们做一个新书架。<,>My grandfather was a skilled carpenter.<,>我祖父是个技术娴熟的木匠。<,>We hired a carpenter to repair the wooden floor.<,>我们雇了个木匠来修理木地板。<,>car(车)+pent(篷)+er(人)→造车篷的人→木匠<,>carpentry(n.木工)/carpet(n.地毯)/cart(n.马车)

circumstance<,>/ˈsɜːkəmstəns/<,>/ˈsɜːrkəmstæns/<,>n.环境/n.境遇<,>Under normal circumstances, this wouldn't happen.<,>在正常情况下，这不会发生。<,>His financial circumstances improved after getting the new job.<,>得到新工作后他的经济状况改善了。<,>We need to consider all possible circumstances.<,>我们需要考虑所有可能的情况。<,>circum(周围)+stance(站立)→站在周围的事物→环境<,>circumvent(v.规避)/circumspect(adj.谨慎的)/circumference(n.圆周)

canteen<,>/kænˈtiːn/<,>/kænˈtiːn/<,>n.食堂<,>The school canteen serves healthy meals.<,>学校食堂提供健康的膳食。<,>Let's meet at the canteen for lunch.<,>我们午餐在食堂见吧。<,>He forgot his wallet in the canteen yesterday.<,>他昨天把钱包忘在食堂了。<,>cant(唱)+een(小地方)→工人们唱歌吃饭的地方→食堂<,>canton(n.行政区)/cantata(n.清唱剧)/canter(n.慢跑)

advocator<,>/ˈædvəkeɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈædvəkeɪtər/<,>n.主张者/n.倡导者<,>She is a strong advocator for animal rights.<,>她是动物权利的坚定倡导者。<,>The professor is an advocator of free education.<,>这位教授是免费教育的倡导者。<,>Many advocators gathered to support the new policy.<,>许多倡导者聚集起来支持新政策。<,>ad(向)+voc(声音)+ator(人)→为...发声的人→倡导者<,>advocate(v.主张)/vocation(n.职业)/vociferous(adj.喧嚷的)

disorderly<,>/dɪsˈɔːdəli/<,>/dɪsˈɔːrdərli/<,>adj.杂乱的<,>The room was left in a disorderly state.<,>房间被弄得乱七八糟。<,>Police arrested him for disorderly conduct.<,>他因行为不检而被捕。<,>The papers were scattered in a disorderly fashion.<,>文件杂乱地散落着。<,>dis(不)+order(秩序)+ly→没有秩序的→杂乱的<,>orderly(adj.有序的)/disorder(n.混乱)/disorganized(adj.无组织的)

essentially<,>/ɪˈsenʃəli/<,>/ɪˈsenʃəli/<,>adv.本质上/adv.根本上<,>Essentially, the two theories are the same.<,>本质上，这两种理论是一样的。<,>He is essentially a kind person.<,>他本质上是个善良的人。<,>This is essentially a matter of personal choice.<,>这本质上是个人的选择问题。<,>essent(本质)+ial+ly→本质上<,>essential(adj.本质的)/essence(n.本质)/inessential(adj.非本质的)

prevent<,>/prɪˈvent/<,>/prɪˈvent/<,>v.预防<,>Vaccination helps prevent many diseases.<,>接种疫苗有助于预防许多疾病。<,>We must take measures to prevent accidents.<,>我们必须采取措施预防事故。<,>Nothing could prevent him from achieving his goal.<,>没有什么能阻止他实现目标。<,>pre(前)+vent(来)→在...之前来→预防<,>invent(v.发明)/convent(n.修道院)/venture(n.冒险)
ceremony<,>/ˈser.ɪ.mə.ni/<,>/ˈser.əˌmoʊ.ni/<,>n.典礼/n.仪式<,>The wedding ceremony was held in a beautiful garden.<,>婚礼仪式在一个美丽的花园里举行。<,>He received an award at the graduation ceremony.<,>他在毕业典礼上获得了奖项。<,>The opening ceremony of the Olympics was spectacular.<,>奥运会的开幕式非常壮观。<,>cere(神圣)+mony(状态)→神圣的状态→仪式<,>celebration(n.庆祝)/ritual(n.仪式)/ceremonial(adj.仪式的)

assume<,>/əˈsjuːm/<,>/əˈsuːm/<,>v.假定/v.认为<,>I assume you have already finished the report.<,>我认为你已经完成了报告。<,>Don't assume everyone will agree with you.<,>不要假定所有人都会同意你。<,>She assumed the role of team leader last month.<,>上个月她担任了团队领导的角色。<,>as(加强)+sume(拿)→拿住观点→假定<,>presume(v.假定)/consume(v.消耗)/resume(v.恢复)

demand<,>/dɪˈmɑːnd/<,>/dɪˈmænd/<,>n.需求/n.要求/v.要求<,>There is a high demand for skilled workers.<,>对熟练工人的需求很高。<,>The workers demanded better working conditions.<,>工人们要求更好的工作条件。<,>This job demands great attention to detail.<,>这份工作要求对细节非常关注。<,>de(加强)+mand(命令)→强烈命令→要求<,>command(v.命令)/remand(v.遣回)/diamond(n.钻石)

principle<,>/ˈprɪn.sə.pəl/<,>/ˈprɪn.sə.pəl/<,>n.原则/n.原理<,>He always sticks to his principles.<,>他总是坚持自己的原则。<,>The basic principles of physics are important to understand.<,>理解物理学的基本原理很重要。<,>This decision goes against our company's principles.<,>这个决定违背了我们公司的原则。<,>prin(第一)+cip(拿)+le→第一要抓住的东西→原则<,>principal(adj.主要的)/discipline(n.纪律)/particle(n.粒子)

reception<,>/rɪˈsep.ʃən/<,>/rɪˈsep.ʃən/<,>n.接待/n.反响<,>The hotel reception is open 24 hours.<,>酒店前台24小时开放。<,>The new policy received a warm reception from the public.<,>新政策受到了公众的热烈欢迎。<,>There will be a wedding reception after the ceremony.<,>仪式结束后会有婚宴。<,>re(回)+cept(拿)+ion→拿回→接待<,>conception(n.概念)/perception(n.感知)/deception(n.欺骗)

transfer<,>/trænsˈfɜːr/<,>/trænsˈfɝː/<,>v.转换/v.调换/n.转换/n.调换<,>I need to transfer some money to my savings account.<,>我需要转一些钱到我的储蓄账户。<,>The player was transferred to another team.<,>这名球员被转会到另一支球队。<,>There will be a transfer of power next month.<,>下个月将会有权力交接。<,>trans(跨越)+fer(带)→带到另一边→转移<,>transform(v.转变)/transmit(v.传输)/transact(v.交易)

preventable<,>/prɪˈven.tə.bəl/<,>/prɪˈven.t̬ə.bəl/<,>adj.可预防的<,>Most accidents are preventable with proper safety measures.<,>大多数事故通过适当的安全措施是可以预防的。<,>This disease is preventable through vaccination.<,>这种疾病可以通过接种疫苗来预防。<,>Many workplace injuries are preventable.<,>许多工伤是可以预防的。<,>pre(前)+vent(来)+able(能)→能提前阻止的→可预防的<,>prevent(v.预防)/predictable(adj.可预测的)/presentable(adj.体面的)

anticipate<,>/ænˈtɪs.ɪ.peɪt/<,>/ænˈtɪs.ə.peɪt/<,>v.预感<,>We anticipate a large crowd at the event.<,>我们预计活动会有很多人参加。<,>She anticipated his question and prepared an answer.<,>她预感到他的问题并准备了答案。<,>The company anticipates increased sales next quarter.<,>公司预计下个季度销售额会增加。<,>anti(前)+cip(拿)+ate→提前拿到→预感<,>participate(v.参与)/emancipate(v.解放)/incapacitate(v.使无能)

assumption<,>/əˈsʌmp.ʃən/<,>/əˈsʌmp.ʃən/<,>n.假定/n.假设<,>Your argument is based on a false assumption.<,>你的论点基于一个错误的假设。<,>We made the assumption that everyone would attend.<,>我们假设所有人都会参加。<,>The theory relies on several key assumptions.<,>这个理论依赖于几个关键假设。<,>as(加强)+sumpt(拿)+ion→拿住的想法→假设<,>consumption(n.消耗)/presumption(n.假定)/resumption(n.恢复)

prescription<,>/prɪˈskrɪp.ʃən/<,>/prɪˈskrɪp.ʃən/<,>n.处方<,>You need a doctor's prescription to buy this medicine.<,>你需要医生的处方才能买这种药。<,>The pharmacist filled my prescription quickly.<,>药剂师很快配好了我的处方药。<,>He forgot to bring his eyeglass prescription.<,>他忘记带眼镜处方了。<,>pre(前)+script(写)+ion→提前写好的→处方<,>description(n.描述)/subscription(n.订阅)/inscription(n.题词)
evolution<,>/ˌiːvəˈluːʃn/<,>/ˌɛvəˈluʃən/<,>n.演变/n.进化<,>The evolution of technology has changed our lives.<,>科技的演变改变了我们的生活。<,>Darwin's theory of evolution is widely accepted.<,>达尔文的进化论被广泛接受。<,>The company has undergone a significant evolution in recent years.<,>近年来，该公司经历了重大演变。<,>e(出)+volut(滚)+ion→向外滚动→进化<,>revolution(n.革命)/devolution(n.权力下放)/involve(v.包含)  

annoy<,>/əˈnɔɪ/<,>/əˈnɔɪ/<,>v.使反感/v.厌烦<,>The loud music annoyed the neighbors.<,>吵闹的音乐让邻居们很反感。<,>It annoys me when people are late.<,>人们迟到时我会很烦。<,>Stop annoying your sister!<,>别再烦你姐姐了！<,>an(加强)+noy(恨)→使厌烦<,>alloy(n.合金)/enjoy(v.享受)/annul(v.废除)  

unintended<,>/ˌʌnɪnˈtendɪd/<,>/ˌʌnɪnˈtɛndɪd/<,>adj.意想不到的<,>The law had unintended consequences.<,>这项法律产生了意想不到的后果。<,>His joke caused unintended offense.<,>他的玩笑无意中冒犯了别人。<,>This was an unintended side effect of the medication.<,>这是药物意想不到的副作用。<,>un(不)+intend(打算)+ed→没有打算的→意外的<,>intended(adj.故意的)/untended(adj.无人照料的)/unattended(adj.无人看管的)  

origin<,>/ˈɒrɪdʒɪn/<,>/ˈɔːrɪdʒɪn/<,>n.起源<,>The origin of this tradition is unclear.<,>这个传统的起源不明。<,>She is of French origin.<,>她有法国血统。<,>The word has its origin in Latin.<,>这个词源于拉丁语。<,>ori(升起)+gin→事物升起的地方→起源<,>original(adj.原始的)/orient(n.东方)/organ(n.器官)  

qualify<,>/ˈkwɒlɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈkwɑːlɪfaɪ/<,>v.使...有资格<,>This certificate qualifies you to teach English.<,>这个证书使你有资格教英语。<,>His experience qualifies him for the job.<,>他的经验使他胜任这份工作。<,>You need to qualify for the loan first.<,>你需要先获得贷款资格。<,>quali(质量)+fy(使)→使达到质量→使合格<,>quality(n.质量)/quantify(v.量化)/clarify(v.澄清)  

emergence<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒəns/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒəns/<,>n.出现/n.发生<,>The emergence of new technologies is exciting.<,>新技术的出现令人兴奋。<,>We witnessed the emergence of a new star.<,>我们见证了一位新星的诞生。<,>The sudden emergence of the problem surprised everyone.<,>问题的突然出现让所有人惊讶。<,>e(出)+merg(沉)+ence→从沉没中出来→出现<,>emergency(n.紧急情况)/merge(v.合并)/submerge(v.淹没)  

complain<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>v.抱怨<,>She complained about the poor service.<,>她抱怨服务质量差。<,>Customers have the right to complain.<,>顾客有权投诉。<,>He's always complaining about something.<,>他总是抱怨这抱怨那。<,>com(加强)+plain(捶胸)→捶胸顿足地抱怨<,>explain(v.解释)/plain(adj.简单的)/compliance(n.服从)  

merit<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>/ˈmɛrɪt/<,>n.优点/n.成绩/v.值得<,>The proposal has considerable merit.<,>这个提议很有价值。<,>She was promoted on merit.<,>她因成绩突出获得晋升。<,>This case merits further investigation.<,>这个案件值得进一步调查。<,>mer(值得)+it→值得的东西→优点<,>demerit(n.缺点)/inherit(v.继承)/merry(adj.愉快的)  

forum<,>/ˈfɔːrəm/<,>/ˈfɔːrəm/<,>n.论坛<,>This online forum discusses environmental issues.<,>这个在线论坛讨论环境问题。<,>The conference provided a forum for debate.<,>会议提供了辩论的平台。<,>I posted my question on the student forum.<,>我在学生论坛上发布了问题。<,>for(为了)+um(地方)→为了讨论的地方→论坛<,>form(n.形式)/from(prep.从)/fora(n.论坛复数形式)  

arrange<,>/əˈreɪndʒ/<,>/əˈreɪndʒ/<,>v.安排/v.筹划<,>She arranged the flowers beautifully.<,>她把花布置得很漂亮。<,>We need to arrange a meeting.<,>我们需要安排一次会议。<,>He arranged for a taxi to pick us up.<,>他安排了一辆出租车来接我们。<,>ar(加强)+range(排列)→有顺序地排列→安排<,>range(n.范围)/arrangement(n.安排)/derange(v.扰乱)
determination<,>/dɪˌtɜːmɪˈneɪʃən/<,>/dɪˌtɜːrmɪˈneɪʃən/<,>n.意志<,>Her determination to succeed is inspiring.<,>她成功的决心令人鼓舞。<,>With determination, he overcame all obstacles.<,>凭借坚定的意志，他克服了所有障碍。<,>His determination never wavered despite the challenges.<,>尽管面临挑战，他的决心从未动摇。<,>determine(决定)+ation(名词后缀)→决心<,>destination(n.目的地)/termination(n.终止)

bargain<,>/ˈbɑːɡən/<,>/ˈbɑːrɡən/<,>n.便宜货/n.减价品<,>I found a great bargain at the flea market.<,>我在跳蚤市场淘到了便宜货。<,>She loves to hunt for bargains during sales.<,>她喜欢在促销期间寻找特价商品。<,>It's a real bargain at half the original price.<,>以原价一半的价格买到真是划算。<,>bar(酒吧)+gain(获得)→在酒吧获得便宜货<,>bargain(v.讨价还价)/bargainer(n.讨价还价者)

appetite<,>/ˈæpɪtaɪt/<,>/ˈæpɪtaɪt/<,>n.胃口/n.欲望<,>He has a healthy appetite after exercise.<,>运动后他胃口很好。<,>The movie whetted my appetite for adventure.<,>这部电影激发了我对冒险的渴望。<,>She lost her appetite due to stress.<,>由于压力，她失去了食欲。<,>appet(渴望)+ite(名词后缀)→胃口<,>appetizer(n.开胃菜)/appetizing(adj.开胃的)

neutral<,>/ˈnjuːtrəl/<,>/ˈnuːtrəl/<,>adj.中立的<,>The country remained neutral during the conflict.<,>该国在冲突期间保持中立。<,>He tried to maintain a neutral stance in the debate.<,>他试图在辩论中保持中立立场。<,>The judge must be neutral in all cases.<,>法官在所有案件中都必须保持中立。<,>neutr(中性)+al(形容词后缀)→中立的<,>natural(adj.自然的)/neutralize(v.使中立化)

primitive<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>adj.原始的/adj.简单的/adj.简陋的<,>Primitive humans lived in caves.<,>原始人类住在洞穴里。<,>The tools were primitive but effective.<,>这些工具虽然简陋但很有效。<,>She prefers the primitive beauty of nature.<,>她更喜欢大自然的原始美。<,>prim(第一)+itive(形容词后缀)→最初的→原始的<,>primary(adj.主要的)/primate(n.灵长类动物)

therapy<,>/ˈθerəpi/<,>/ˈθerəpi/<,>n.疗法/n.治疗<,>Physical therapy helped him recover quickly.<,>物理治疗帮助他快速康复。<,>Music can be a form of therapy.<,>音乐可以作为一种治疗方式。<,>She is undergoing therapy for anxiety.<,>她正在接受焦虑治疗。<,>therap(治疗)+y(名词后缀)→治疗<,>therapist(n.治疗师)/therapeutic(adj.治疗的)

conscience<,>/ˈkɒnʃəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəns/<,>n.良心<,>His conscience wouldn't let him lie.<,>他的良心不允许他说谎。<,>She acted according to her conscience.<,>她凭良心行事。<,>A guilty conscience needs no accuser.<,>做贼心虚。<,>con(共同)+science(知识)→共同的知识→良心<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/conscientious(adj.尽责的)

define<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.确定/v.下定义<,>Can you define this scientific term?<,>你能给这个科学术语下定义吗？<,>The boundaries need to be clearly defined.<,>边界需要明确界定。<,>Her smile defines her personality.<,>她的笑容体现了她的个性。<,>de(加强)+fine(界限)→划出界限→下定义<,>refine(v.精炼)/confine(v.限制)

creativity<,>/ˌkriːeɪˈtɪvəti/<,>/ˌkriːeɪˈtɪvəti/<,>n.创造力<,>Children's creativity should be encouraged.<,>应该鼓励孩子们的创造力。<,>The project requires great creativity.<,>这个项目需要很大的创造力。<,>Art is an expression of human creativity.<,>艺术是人类创造力的表达。<,>create(创造)+ivity(名词后缀)→创造力<,>creation(n.创造)/creative(adj.创造性的)

tailor<,>/ˈteɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈteɪlər/<,>v.调整使适应<,>We can tailor the program to your needs.<,>我们可以根据您的需求调整方案。<,>The course is tailored for beginners.<,>这门课程是为初学者量身定制的。<,>He tailored his speech to the audience.<,>他根据听众调整了演讲内容。<,>tail(剪裁)+or(人)→裁缝→调整<,>tailor(n.裁缝)/retailer(n.零售商)
dramatically<,>/drəˈmætɪkli/<,>/drəˈmætɪkli/<,>adv.戏剧性地/adv.引人注目地<,>Her performance improved dramatically after the training.<,>经过训练后，她的表现有了显著提高。<,>The weather changed dramatically overnight.<,>天气在一夜之间发生了剧变。<,>Prices have risen dramatically in the past year.<,>过去一年物价大幅上涨。<,>drama(戏剧)+tical(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→戏剧性地<,>dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)/drastic(adj.激烈的)/dynamic(adj.动态的)  

panic<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>n.惊恐<,>There was a panic when the fire alarm went off.<,>火警响起时一片恐慌。<,>She felt a sudden panic when she couldn't find her passport.<,>找不到护照时她突然感到恐慌。<,>The crowd was in a state of panic after the explosion.<,>爆炸后人群陷入恐慌状态。<,>pan(潘神)+ic→潘神引起的恐惧→惊恐<,>picnic(n.野餐)/panic(adj.恐慌的)/panacea(n.万能药)  

motivation<,>/ˌməʊtɪˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌmoʊtɪˈveɪʃn/<,>n.激励/n.刺激<,>His main motivation is to provide for his family.<,>他的主要动力是养家糊口。<,>The teacher gave the students some motivation to study harder.<,>老师给学生一些激励让他们更努力学习。<,>Lack of motivation can affect work performance.<,>缺乏动力会影响工作表现。<,>motiv(动机)+ation(名词后缀)→激励<,>motive(n.动机)/motivate(v.激励)/emotion(n.情绪)  

durable<,>/ˈdjʊərəbl/<,>/ˈdʊrəbl/<,>adj.持久的/adj.耐用的<,>This material is very durable and can last for years.<,>这种材料非常耐用，可以使用多年。<,>They are looking for a durable solution to the problem.<,>他们正在寻找问题的持久解决方案。<,>The peace agreement needs to be durable.<,>和平协议需要持久有效。<,>dur(持续)+able(能…的)→能持续的→持久的<,>duration(n.持续时间)/endure(v.忍受)/during(prep.在…期间)  

remedy<,>/ˈremədi/<,>/ˈrɛmədi/<,>n.药物<,>This herbal remedy is good for colds.<,>这种草药对感冒很有效。<,>There is no simple remedy for this complex issue.<,>这个复杂的问题没有简单的解决办法。<,>The best remedy for stress is relaxation.<,>缓解压力的最好方法是放松。<,>re(再)+medy(治疗)→再次治疗→药物<,>medicine(n.医学)/remedial(adj.治疗的)/remember(v.记得)  

inevitable<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbl/<,>/ɪnˈɛvɪtəbl/<,>adj.不可避免的<,>Death is an inevitable part of life.<,>死亡是生命中不可避免的一部分。<,>It was inevitable that they would meet again.<,>他们再次相遇是不可避免的。<,>Conflict is sometimes inevitable in relationships.<,>关系中有时冲突是不可避免的。<,>in(不)+evitable(可避免的)→不可避免的<,>evitable(adj.可避免的)/inevitability(n.必然性)/event(n.事件)  

diverse<,>/daɪˈvɜːs/<,>/dɪˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.各种各样的<,>The city has a diverse population.<,>这个城市人口多样化。<,>We need to consider diverse opinions before making a decision.<,>我们需要考虑各种意见再做决定。<,>The ecosystem is incredibly diverse.<,>生态系统极其多样化。<,>di(分开)+verse(转)→转向不同方向→各种各样的<,>diversity(n.多样性)/divert(v.转移)/verse(n.诗)  

context<,>/ˈkɒntekst/<,>/ˈkɑːntekst/<,>n.背景/n.环境<,>You need to understand the historical context of the event.<,>你需要了解事件的历史背景。<,>The word has different meanings in different contexts.<,>这个词在不同语境中有不同含义。<,>The decision was made in the context of financial difficulties.<,>这个决定是在财政困难的背景下做出的。<,>con(共同)+text(编织)→共同编织→背景<,>text(n.文本)/contextual(adj.上下文的)/contest(n.比赛)  

prominent<,>/ˈprɒmɪnənt/<,>/ˈprɑːmɪnənt/<,>adj.杰出的/adj.突出的/adj.凸起的<,>He is a prominent scientist in his field.<,>他是该领域的杰出科学家。<,>The house is in a prominent position on the hill.<,>房子位于山上显眼的位置。<,>She has prominent cheekbones.<,>她的颧骨很突出。<,>pro(向前)+min(突出)+ent(形容词后缀)→突出的<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/eminence(n.卓越)/prominence(n.突出)  

witness<,>/ˈwɪtnəs/<,>/ˈwɪtnəs/<,>n.目击者/n.目击<,>The police are looking for witnesses to the accident.<,>警方正在寻找事故的目击者。<,>She witnessed the whole incident.<,>她目击了整个事件。<,>History has witnessed many great changes.<,>历史见证了许多重大变革。<,>wit(知道)+ness(名词后缀)→知道情况的人→目击者<,>wit(n.智慧)/witty(adj.机智的)/witness(v.目击)
save<,>/seɪv/<,>/seɪv/<,>v.节省<,>She tries to save money by cooking at home.<,>她尽量在家做饭以节省钱。<,>He saved a lot of time by taking the shortcut.<,>他走捷径节省了很多时间。<,>We need to save water during the drought.<,>干旱期间我们需要节约用水。<,>s(像存钱罐)+ave(拉丁语"救")→节省<,>safe(adj.安全的)/savor(v.品尝)

inherit<,>/ɪnˈherɪt/<,>/ɪnˈhɛrɪt/<,>v.继承<,>She inherited a large fortune from her grandfather.<,>她从祖父那里继承了一大笔财产。<,>He inherited his father's business after graduation.<,>毕业后他继承了父亲的生意。<,>The child inherited his mother's musical talent.<,>这个孩子继承了母亲的音乐天赋。<,>in(内)+her(继承)+it→继承<,>inhabit(v.居住)/inhibit(v.抑制)

occasion<,>/əˈkeɪʒn/<,>/əˈkeɪʒən/<,>n.场合<,>This is a formal occasion, so please dress appropriately.<,>这是个正式场合，请穿着得体。<,>I only wear this dress on special occasions.<,>我只在特殊场合穿这条裙子。<,>His birthday was the occasion for a big party.<,>他的生日是举办大型聚会的场合。<,>oc(强调)+cas(落)+ion→事情落下的时刻→场合<,>accident(n.事故)/occupation(n.职业)

initiative<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/<,>n.主动权/n.自主权<,>She took the initiative to organize the meeting.<,>她主动组织了这次会议。<,>The company encourages employees to show initiative.<,>公司鼓励员工发挥主动性。<,>This program gives students more initiative in learning.<,>这个项目给学生更多学习自主权。<,>init(开始)+iative→主动开始→主动权<,>initial(adj.最初的)/native(adj.本地的)

insight<,>/ˈɪnsaɪt/<,>/ˈɪnˌsaɪt/<,>n.洞察力/n.洞悉<,>His book provides deep insight into human nature.<,>他的书对人性有深刻洞察。<,>The therapist had great insight into my problems.<,>治疗师对我的问题有很好的洞悉。<,>Her research offers new insights into climate change.<,>她的研究为气候变化提供了新的见解。<,>in(内)+sight(看)→向内看→洞察<,>incite(v.煽动)/inside(n.内部)

misguided<,>/ˌmɪsˈɡaɪdɪd/<,>/ˌmɪsˈɡaɪdɪd/<,>adj.被误导的<,>His misguided attempt to help only made things worse.<,>他试图帮忙但被误导了，结果让事情更糟。<,>It was a misguided decision to invest all the money in one stock.<,>把所有钱投资在一支股票上是个被误导的决定。<,>Their misguided loyalty led them to support the wrong cause.<,>他们被误导的忠诚使他们支持了错误的事业。<,>mis(错误)+guided(引导)→被错误引导的<,>misgiven(adj.疑虑的)/misguidedly(adv.被误导地)

sponsor<,>/ˈspɒnsə(r)/<,>/ˈspɑːnsər/<,>v.赞助<,>The company sponsors several sports teams.<,>这家公司赞助了几支运动队。<,>She sponsored a child's education in Africa.<,>她赞助了一个非洲孩子的教育。<,>This event is sponsored by a local bank.<,>这个活动由当地一家银行赞助。<,>spons(承诺)+or(人)→承诺支持的人→赞助者<,>respond(v.回应)/spontaneous(adj.自发的)

porter<,>/ˈpɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈpɔːrtər/<,>n.搬运工<,>The porter carried our luggage to the room.<,>搬运工把我们的行李搬到了房间。<,>Hotel porters are usually very helpful.<,>酒店搬运工通常很乐于助人。<,>He worked as a porter at the train station.<,>他在火车站当搬运工。<,>port(搬运)+er(人)→搬运的人<,>reporter(n.记者)/poster(n.海报)

loyalty<,>/ˈlɔɪəlti/<,>/ˈlɔɪəlti/<,>n.忠诚/n.忠实<,>His loyalty to the company never wavered.<,>他对公司的忠诚从未动摇。<,>Dogs are known for their loyalty to their owners.<,>狗以对主人的忠诚著称。<,>She questioned his loyalty when he started working for a competitor.<,>当他开始为竞争对手工作时，她质疑他的忠诚。<,>loy(法律)+alty→遵守法律→忠诚<,>royalty(n.皇室)/legal(adj.合法的)

overwhelming<,>/ˌəʊvəˈwelmɪŋ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈwelmɪŋ/<,>adj.压倒性的<,>There was overwhelming support for the new policy.<,>新政策获得了压倒性的支持。<,>The evidence against him was overwhelming.<,>对他不利的证据是压倒性的。<,>She felt an overwhelming sense of relief when the exam was over.<,>考试结束时她感到一种压倒性的解脱感。<,>over(过度)+whelm(淹没)+ing→过度淹没的→压倒性的<,>underwhelming(adj.令人失望的)/overbearing(adj.专横的)
appreciation<,>/əˌpriːʃiˈeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/əˌpriːʃiˈeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>n.感激<,>I would like to express my appreciation for your help.<,>我想对你的帮助表示感激。<,>Her appreciation of art is remarkable.<,>她对艺术的欣赏非常出色。<,>He showed no appreciation for the gift.<,>他对礼物没有表现出感激之情。<,>appreciate(欣赏)+tion(名词后缀)→感激<,>apprehension(n.忧虑/n.理解)/appropriation(n.拨款/n.挪用)

setting<,>/ˈsɛtɪŋ/<,>/ˈsɛtɪŋ/<,>n.背景/n.环境<,>The novel has a beautiful coastal setting.<,>这部小说的背景是一个美丽的海滨。<,>The restaurant provides a romantic setting for dinner.<,>这家餐厅为晚餐提供了浪漫的环境。<,>The play's setting is 19th century London.<,>这部戏剧的背景是19世纪的伦敦。<,>set(放置)+ing(名词后缀)→背景/环境<,>settle(v.解决/v.定居)/settlement(n.解决/n.定居点)

display<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>n.展览/v.展览<,>The museum has a new display of ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆有一个新的古代文物展览。<,>She displayed her paintings at the gallery.<,>她在画廊展出了她的画作。<,>The computer displays the information clearly.<,>电脑清晰地显示信息。<,>dis(分开)+play(播放)→展览<,>dispose(v.处理/v.布置)/displease(v.使不悦)

deliver<,>/dɪˈlɪvə(r)/<,>/dɪˈlɪvər/<,>v.发表<,>He delivered a powerful speech at the conference.<,>他在会议上发表了有力的演讲。<,>The postman delivers mail every morning.<,>邮递员每天早上投递邮件。<,>She delivered a baby boy last night.<,>她昨晚生下了一个男婴。<,>de(加强)+liver(自由)→发表<,>delivery(n.递送/n.分娩)/diver(n.潜水员)

astonish<,>/əˈstɒnɪʃ/<,>/əˈstɑːnɪʃ/<,>v.使惊讶/v.使大为吃惊<,>Her performance astonished the audience.<,>她的表演让观众大为吃惊。<,>I was astonished by the news.<,>我被这个消息震惊了。<,>The magician's tricks astonished the children.<,>魔术师的把戏让孩子们惊讶不已。<,>a(加强)+ston(石头)+ish(动词后缀)→像石头一样震惊→使惊讶<,>astonishment(n.惊讶)/astound(v.使震惊)

adequate<,>/ˈædɪkwət/<,>/ˈædɪkwət/<,>adj.足够的<,>We have adequate supplies for the trip.<,>我们有足够的旅行用品。<,>His explanation was not adequate.<,>他的解释不够充分。<,>The room is adequate for our needs.<,>这个房间足够满足我们的需求。<,>ad(加强)+equ(平等)+ate(形容词后缀)→足够的<,>inadequate(adj.不足的)/equate(v.等同)

consumption<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃ(ə)n/<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃ(ə)n/<,>n.消费/n.消耗<,>Fuel consumption has increased this year.<,>今年的燃料消耗增加了。<,>Excessive consumption of sugar is unhealthy.<,>过量消费糖是不健康的。<,>The film is not suitable for public consumption.<,>这部电影不适合公众消费。<,>con(完全)+sumpt(拿)+ion(名词后缀)→消费/消耗<,>assumption(n.假设)/presumption(n.假定)

abuse<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>v.虐待/v.滥用<,>He was accused of abusing his power.<,>他被指控滥用权力。<,>Child abuse is a serious crime.<,>虐待儿童是严重的罪行。<,>Drug abuse can lead to health problems.<,>滥用药物会导致健康问题。<,>ab(偏离)+use(使用)→滥用<,>accuse(v.指责)/disabuse(v.纠正)

broad<,>/brɔːd/<,>/brɔːd/<,>adj.宽的<,>The river is very broad at this point.<,>河流在这里非常宽阔。<,>She has a broad knowledge of history.<,>她有广泛的历史知识。<,>He gave a broad smile.<,>他露出了灿烂的笑容。<,>b(像)+road(路)→像路一样宽→宽的<,>abroad(adv.在国外)/board(n.木板)

inappropriate<,>/ˌɪnəˈprəʊpriət/<,>/ˌɪnəˈproʊpriət/<,>adj.不合适的<,>His comments were inappropriate for the occasion.<,>他的评论不适合这个场合。<,>Wearing shorts to a formal event is inappropriate.<,>穿短裤参加正式活动是不合适的。<,>The teacher addressed the student's inappropriate behavior.<,>老师指出了学生的不当行为。<,>in(不)+appropriate(合适的)→不合适的<,>appropriate(adj.合适的)/inadequately(adv.不充分地)
worldwide<,>/ˈwɜːldwaɪd/<,>/ˈwɜːrldwaɪd/<,>adv.全世界范围地<,>The company has offices worldwide.<,>该公司在全球各地设有办事处。<,>This product is sold worldwide.<,>这个产品在全球范围内销售。<,>The news spread worldwide in minutes.<,>这个消息几分钟内就传遍了全世界。<,>world(世界)+wide(广泛的)→全世界范围的<,>world-class(adj.世界级的)/worldly(adj.世俗的)  

strict<,>/strɪkt/<,>/strɪkt/<,>adj.严格的<,>The teacher is very strict with her students.<,>这位老师对她的学生非常严格。<,>There are strict rules against smoking here.<,>这里有严格的禁烟规定。<,>He follows a strict diet.<,>他遵循严格的饮食计划。<,>str(街道)+ict(约束)→在街道上约束行为→严格的<,>restrict(v.限制)/district(n.区域)  

means<,>/miːnz/<,>/minz/<,>n.方法<,>Email is a quick means of communication.<,>电子邮件是一种快速的通讯方式。<,>He found a means to solve the problem.<,>他找到了解决问题的方法。<,>The ends justify the means.<,>目的正当可以不择手段。<,>mean(意味)+s→实现目的的方法<,>meaning(n.意义)/meant(v.意味)  

reveal<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>/rɪˈvil/<,>v.揭露/v.揭示<,>The investigation revealed new evidence.<,>调查揭示了新的证据。<,>She revealed her true feelings at last.<,>她最终表露了自己的真实感受。<,>The curtain rose to reveal a beautiful scene.<,>幕布升起，展现出一幅美丽的场景。<,>re(再次)+veal(面纱)→再次揭开面纱→揭露<,>conceal(v.隐藏)/veil(n.面纱)  

confirm<,>/kənˈfɜːm/<,>/kənˈfɜrm/<,>v.证实<,>Please confirm your attendance by Friday.<,>请于周五前确认您的出席。<,>The test results confirmed the diagnosis.<,>检测结果证实了诊断。<,>I can confirm that the meeting is at 3 pm.<,>我可以确认会议是在下午3点。<,>con(共同)+firm(坚定)→共同坚定→证实<,>affirm(v.断言)/inform(v.通知)  

consensus<,>/kənˈsensəs/<,>/kənˈsɛnsəs/<,>n.一致意见<,>The committee reached a consensus on the issue.<,>委员会就该问题达成了一致意见。<,>There is a general consensus that changes are needed.<,>人们普遍认为需要做出改变。<,>The consensus among experts is clear.<,>专家们的共识很明确。<,>con(共同)+sens(感觉)+us→共同的感觉→共识<,>census(n.人口普查)/consent(v.同意)  

agent<,>/ˈeɪdʒənt/<,>/ˈeɪdʒənt/<,>n.代理商<,>She works as a real estate agent.<,>她是一名房地产经纪人。<,>The travel agent booked our flights.<,>旅行社代理为我们预订了机票。<,>FBI agents investigated the case.<,>联邦调查局特工调查了这个案件。<,>ag(做)+ent(人)→做事的人→代理人<,>agency(n.代理机构)/agenda(n.议程)  

neighborhood<,>/ˈneɪbəhʊd/<,>/ˈneɪbərˌhʊd/<,>n.地区<,>It's a quiet neighborhood with good schools.<,>这是一个有优质学校的安静社区。<,>The whole neighborhood heard the news.<,>整个街区都听说了这个消息。<,>There's a new café in the neighborhood.<,>附近新开了一家咖啡馆。<,>neighbor(邻居)+hood(状态)→邻居们所在的区域<,>neighbor(n.邻居)/brotherhood(n.兄弟情谊)  

participate<,>/pɑːˈtɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/pɑrˈtɪsəˌpeɪt/<,>v.参与/v.参加<,>All students are encouraged to participate.<,>鼓励所有学生参与。<,>She participated in the marathon last year.<,>她去年参加了马拉松比赛。<,>We want more people to participate in the discussion.<,>我们希望更多人参与讨论。<,>part(部分)+icip(拿)+ate→拿一部分→参与<,>anticipate(v.预期)/particle(n.粒子)  

valid<,>/ˈvælɪd/<,>/ˈvælɪd/<,>adj.有效的<,>The ticket is valid for one month.<,>这张票一个月内有效。<,>You need a valid reason to request leave.<,>你需要一个有效的理由来请假。<,>His argument was valid and convincing.<,>他的论点有效且令人信服。<,>val(价值)+id→有价值的→有效的<,>invalid(adj.无效的)/valiant(adj.勇敢的)
initially<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəli/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəli/<,>adv.最初/adv.起初<,>Initially, he was reluctant to join the project.<,>最初，他不愿意加入这个项目。<,>She was initially very shy, but soon became more confident.<,>她起初很害羞，但很快就变得自信起来。<,>Initially, the plan seemed perfect, but problems arose later.<,>起初，这个计划看起来很完美，但后来出现了问题。<,>in(进入)+it(走)+ial(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→最初<,>originally(adv.最初)/primarily(adv.主要地)  

slightly<,>/ˈslaɪtli/<,>/ˈslaɪtli/<,>adv.轻微地<,>The temperature dropped slightly overnight.<,>温度在夜间轻微下降。<,>He was slightly injured in the accident.<,>他在事故中受了轻伤。<,>She smiled slightly when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，她微微一笑。<,>slight(轻微的)+ly(副词后缀)→轻微地<,>lightly(adv.轻轻地)/barely(adv.几乎不)  

objection<,>/əbˈdʒekʃn/<,>/əbˈdʒekʃən/<,>n.反对<,>He raised an objection to the proposal.<,>他对这个提议提出了反对。<,>There was no objection to the new policy.<,>没有人反对这项新政策。<,>Her objection was based on ethical grounds.<,>她的反对是基于道德理由。<,>ob(反对)+ject(扔)+ion(名词后缀)→反对<,>rejection(n.拒绝)/injection(n.注射)  

atmosphere<,>/ˈætməsfɪə(r)/<,>/ˈætməsfɪr/<,>n.气氛/n.大气/n.空气<,>The atmosphere in the room was tense.<,>房间里的气氛很紧张。<,>Earth's atmosphere protects us from harmful radiation.<,>地球的大气层保护我们免受有害辐射。<,>The hotel had a cozy and welcoming atmosphere.<,>这家酒店有一种温馨而热情的氛围。<,>atmo(空气)+sphere(球体)→大气层<,>biosphere(n.生物圈)/hemisphere(n.半球)  

assign<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>v.布置/v.分配<,>The teacher assigned homework for the weekend.<,>老师布置了周末的家庭作业。<,>They assigned him to a new department.<,>他们把他分配到一个新的部门。<,>Each team member was assigned a specific task.<,>每个团队成员都被分配了一项具体任务。<,>as(强调)+sign(标记)→分配<,>design(v.设计)/resign(v.辞职)  

evidence<,>/ˈevɪdəns/<,>/ˈevɪdəns/<,>n.根据/n.证据/n.迹象<,>There is no evidence to support his claim.<,>没有证据支持他的说法。<,>The police found evidence at the crime scene.<,>警方在犯罪现场发现了证据。<,>Her smile was evidence of her happiness.<,>她的微笑是她快乐的迹象。<,>e(出)+vid(看)+ence(名词后缀)→证据<,>evident(adj.明显的)/provide(v.提供)  

racially<,>/ˈreɪʃəli/<,>/ˈreɪʃəli/<,>adv.种族上地<,>The community is racially diverse.<,>这个社区在种族上是多样化的。<,>Racially motivated crimes are unacceptable.<,>出于种族动机的犯罪是不可接受的。<,>The policy aims to reduce racially based discrimination.<,>这项政策旨在减少基于种族的歧视。<,>racial(种族的)+ly(副词后缀)→种族上地<,>racist(adj.种族主义的)/racialism(n.种族主义)  

exclude<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>v.排除/v.不包括<,>The price excludes taxes and fees.<,>这个价格不包括税费。<,>They excluded him from the meeting.<,>他们把他排除在会议之外。<,>No one should be excluded because of their background.<,>任何人都不应因为背景而被排除在外。<,>ex(出)+clud(关闭)+e→排除<,>include(v.包括)/conclude(v.结束)  

available<,>/əˈveɪləbl/<,>/əˈveɪləbl/<,>adj.可利用的/adj.现有的/adj.可获得的<,>The book is available in the library.<,>这本书在图书馆可以借到。<,>Are there any tickets available for the concert?<,>还有音乐会的票吗？<,>The manager is not available at the moment.<,>经理现在没空。<,>avail(有益)+able(可…的)→可获得的<,>unavailable(adj.不可获得的)/availability(n.可用性)  

puzzling<,>/ˈpʌzlɪŋ/<,>/ˈpʌzlɪŋ/<,>adj.令人困惑的<,>His behavior was quite puzzling.<,>他的行为相当令人困惑。<,>The instructions were puzzling and unclear.<,>这些说明令人困惑且不清楚。<,>She gave me a puzzling look.<,>她给了我一个困惑的眼神。<,>puzzle(谜)+ing(形容词后缀)→令人困惑的<,>puzzled(adj.困惑的)/baffling(adj.令人困惑的)
evaluation<,>/ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃən/<,>/ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃən/<,>n.评价/n.评估<,>The teacher gave a fair evaluation of the student's performance.<,>老师对学生的表现给出了公正的评价。<,>The evaluation of the project will take several weeks.<,>这个项目的评估需要几周时间。<,>We need a thorough evaluation before making a decision.<,>我们需要在做出决定前进行彻底的评估。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ation(名词后缀)→评估出价值→评价<,>valuation(n.估价)/evolution(n.进化)/elevation(n.海拔)

irritate<,>/ˈɪrɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪrɪˌteɪt/<,>v.激怒<,>Loud noises irritate me when I'm trying to concentrate.<,>当我试图集中注意力时，噪音会激怒我。<,>His constant complaining really irritates his coworkers.<,>他不断的抱怨真的让同事们很恼火。<,>Don't irritate the dog or it might bite.<,>不要激怒那只狗，否则它可能会咬人。<,>ir(进入)+rit(摩擦)+ate(动词后缀)→进入摩擦状态→激怒<,>irrigate(v.灌溉)/irritant(n.刺激物)/irritable(adj.易怒的)

distinguished<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃt/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃt/<,>adj.显著的/adj.杰出的<,>He is a distinguished professor at the university.<,>他是这所大学的一位杰出教授。<,>She has a distinguished career in medicine.<,>她在医学领域有着杰出的职业生涯。<,>The building has a distinguished architectural style.<,>这座建筑有着显著的建筑风格。<,>dis(分开)+tinguish(标记)+ed(形容词后缀)→被标记出来的→杰出的<,>extinguished(熄灭的)/distinguishable(可区分的)/distinguishing(区分的)

depressing<,>/dɪˈpresɪŋ/<,>/dɪˈpresɪŋ/<,>adj.令人沮丧的<,>The news about the accident was very depressing.<,>关于事故的消息非常令人沮丧。<,>It's depressing to see so much poverty in the world.<,>看到世界上有这么多贫困令人沮丧。<,>The weather has been depressing lately.<,>最近的天气令人沮丧。<,>de(向下)+press(压)+ing(形容词后缀)→情绪被压下去的→令人沮丧的<,>impressing(给人印象深刻的)/oppressing(压迫的)/expressing(表达的)

mutually<,>/ˈmjuːtʃuəli/<,>/ˈmjuːtʃuəli/<,>adv.互相地<,>The two countries agreed to mutually beneficial trade terms.<,>两国同意互惠互利的贸易条款。<,>They came to a mutually acceptable solution.<,>他们达成了双方都能接受的解决方案。<,>Love should be mutually respectful.<,>爱应该是互相尊重的。<,>mut(改变)+ual(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→互相改变地→互相地<,>mutual(adj.相互的)/mutable(adj.易变的)/immutable(adj.不可变的)

mission<,>/ˈmɪʃən/<,>/ˈmɪʃən/<,>n.使命/n.任务/n.代表团<,>The soldiers were sent on a dangerous mission.<,>士兵们被派去执行一项危险的任务。<,>Her mission in life is to help the poor.<,>她的人生使命是帮助穷人。<,>A trade mission will visit China next month.<,>一个贸易代表团将于下月访问中国。<,>miss(发送)+ion(名词后缀)→被派出去的任务→使命<,>commission(n.委员会)/submission(n.提交)/admission(n.承认)

migration<,>/maɪˈɡreɪʃən/<,>/maɪˈɡreɪʃən/<,>n.迁移/n.移民<,>Bird migration is a fascinating natural phenomenon.<,>鸟类迁徙是一种迷人的自然现象。<,>The migration of people from rural to urban areas is increasing.<,>从农村到城市的人口迁移正在增加。<,>Scientists study the migration patterns of whales.<,>科学家研究鲸鱼的迁移模式。<,>migr(移动)+ation(名词后缀)→移动的行为→迁移<,>immigration(n.移入)/emigration(n.移出)/migratory(adj.迁移的)

site<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>n.场所/n.地址<,>They chose a beautiful site for their wedding.<,>他们选择了一个美丽的场所举行婚礼。<,>The construction site was busy with workers.<,>建筑工地上工人们忙忙碌碌。<,>Please visit our website at this site.<,>请访问我们在这个地址的网站。<,>sit(坐)+e→坐落地→场所<,>cite(v.引用)/sight(n.视力)/suite(n.套房)

expectation<,>/ˌekspekˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌɛkspɛkˈteɪʃən/<,>n.期望<,>The movie didn't live up to my expectations.<,>这部电影没有达到我的期望。<,>She has high expectations for her children's education.<,>她对孩子的教育抱有很高的期望。<,>Managing customer expectations is important in business.<,>在商业中管理客户期望很重要。<,>ex(出)+pect(看)+ation(名词后缀)→向外看→期望<,>expectation(n.期望)/expectant(adj.期待的)/unexpected(adj.意外的)

update<,>/ʌpˈdeɪt/<,>/ˈʌpˌdeɪt/<,>v.更新/v.使现代化<,>I need to update my computer's operating system.<,>我需要更新电脑的操作系统。<,>The company updates its website every week.<,>公司每周更新其网站。<,>They're updating the old building to modern standards.<,>他们正在按照现代标准翻新这座旧建筑。<,>up(向上)+date(日期)→使日期向上→更新<,>upgrade(v.升级)/upload(v.上传)/update(n.最新消息)
gear<,>/ɡɪə(r)/<,>/ɡɪr/<,>n.齿轮/v.使合适<,>The bicycle's gears need to be adjusted.<,>这辆自行车的齿轮需要调整。<,>We need to gear our products to the needs of the market.<,>我们需要使产品适应市场需求。<,>He geared up for the important meeting.<,>他为重要会议做好了准备。<,>g(齿轮形状)+ear(耳朵)→像耳朵形状的齿轮<,>fear(n.害怕)/tear(v.撕开)/shear(v.剪羊毛)

reproductive<,>/ˌriːprəˈdʌktɪv/<,>/ˌriprəˈdʌktɪv/<,>adj.生殖的/adj.再生的<,>The reproductive system is complex in mammals.<,>哺乳动物的生殖系统很复杂。<,>This plant has remarkable reproductive abilities.<,>这种植物有惊人的再生能力。<,>Scientists studied the reproductive cycle of the species.<,>科学家研究了该物种的生殖周期。<,>re(再)+productive(生产的)→再生产的<,>productive(adj.多产的)/reduction(n.减少)/reproduce(v.繁殖)

incredible<,>/ɪnˈkredəbl/<,>/ɪnˈkredəbəl/<,>adj.不可思议的<,>The view from the top was incredible.<,>从顶部看到的景色令人难以置信。<,>She has an incredible memory for details.<,>她对细节有着惊人的记忆力。<,>The team made an incredible comeback.<,>这支队伍实现了不可思议的反败为胜。<,>in(不)+cred(相信)+ible(能)→不能相信的<,>credible(adj.可信的)/incredulous(adj.怀疑的)/edible(adj.可食用的)

backward<,>/ˈbækwəd/<,>/ˈbækwərd/<,>adv.向后<,>He took a step backward in surprise.<,>他惊讶地向后退了一步。<,>The country is moving backward economically.<,>这个国家经济正在倒退。<,>She glanced backward over her shoulder.<,>她回头向后看了一眼。<,>back(后面)+ward(方向)→向后的方向<,>forward(adv.向前)/awkward(adj.笨拙的)/afterward(adv.后来)

raise<,>/reɪz/<,>/reɪz/<,>v.提高/v.筹款/v.抚养<,>The company decided to raise prices.<,>公司决定提高价格。<,>They raised $10,000 for charity.<,>他们为慈善机构筹集了1万美元。<,>It's hard to raise children in the city.<,>在城市里抚养孩子很困难。<,>rai(谐音"日")+se(色)→日子久了颜色会提高<,>rise(v.上升)/arise(v.出现)/raze(v.夷为平地)

prohibit<,>/prəˈhɪbɪt/<,>/proʊˈhɪbɪt/<,>v.禁止/v.阻止/v.防止<,>Smoking is prohibited in this area.<,>这个区域禁止吸烟。<,>The law prohibits discrimination.<,>法律禁止歧视。<,>Bad weather prohibited our departure.<,>恶劣天气阻止了我们出发。<,>pro(向前)+hibit(拿住)→在前面拿住→阻止<,>exhibit(v.展览)/inhibit(v.抑制)/habit(n.习惯)

bother<,>/ˈbɒðə(r)/<,>/ˈbɑːðər/<,>v.麻烦/v.打扰<,>Don't bother me while I'm working.<,>我工作时别打扰我。<,>It bothers me when people are late.<,>人们迟到让我很困扰。<,>I didn't want to bother you with my problems.<,>我不想用我的问题麻烦你。<,>both(两者)+er→两者都来→打扰<,>brother(n.兄弟)/bottle(n.瓶子)/bathe(v.洗澡)

pose<,>/pəʊz/<,>/poʊz/<,>v.摆姿势/v.装腔作势/n.姿势<,>The model posed for the photographer.<,>模特为摄影师摆姿势。<,>He's always posing as an expert.<,>他总是装出一副专家的样子。<,>She held a graceful pose.<,>她保持着优雅的姿势。<,>pos(放)+e→摆放→摆姿势<,>position(n.位置)/oppose(v.反对)/dispose(v.处理)

instrument<,>/ˈɪnstrəmənt/<,>/ˈɪnstrəmənt/<,>n.仪器/n.器械/n.工具<,>The doctor used a special instrument.<,>医生使用了一种特殊器械。<,>Violin is a musical instrument.<,>小提琴是一种乐器。<,>This is an important measuring instrument.<,>这是一种重要的测量仪器。<,>in(内)+stru(建造)+ment→内部建造的工具<,>instruction(n.指示)/structure(n.结构)/implement(n.工具)

mask<,>/mɑːsk/<,>/mæsk/<,>v.掩饰<,>She masked her disappointment with a smile.<,>她用微笑掩饰失望。<,>The thief wore a mask to hide his face.<,>小偷戴着面具遮住脸。<,>The flavor masks the bitterness of the medicine.<,>这种味道掩盖了药的苦味。<,>ma(妈)+sk(时刻)→妈妈时刻掩饰自己的疲惫<,>task(n.任务)/bask(v.晒太阳)/cask(n.木桶)
essential<,>/ɪˈsenʃl/<,>/ɪˈsenʃl/<,>adj.必须的/adj.本质的<,>Water is essential for life.<,>水是生命必需的。<,>The essential point of the argument was missed.<,>争论的本质要点被忽略了。<,>She has the essential qualities of a good leader.<,>她具备优秀领导者的基本素质。<,>es(加强)+sent(感觉)+ial→必须感受到的→必须的<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/fundamental(adj.基本的)

harvest<,>/ˈhɑːvɪst/<,>/ˈhɑːrvɪst/<,>n.丰收/n.收获<,>The farmers celebrated the bountiful harvest.<,>农民们庆祝丰收。<,>It's time to harvest the wheat.<,>是收割小麦的时候了。<,>The research project yielded a rich harvest of data.<,>这个研究项目获得了大量数据。<,>har(军队)+vest(衣服)→军队收获战利品(衣服)<,>crop(n.庄稼)/yield(n.产量)

reject<,>/rɪˈdʒekt/<,>/rɪˈdʒɛkt/<,>v.拒绝/v.驳回<,>The committee rejected his proposal.<,>委员会拒绝了他的提议。<,>Her body rejected the transplanted organ.<,>她的身体排斥移植的器官。<,>Don't reject an idea without considering it first.<,>不要未经考虑就拒绝一个想法。<,>re(回)+ject(扔)→扔回去→拒绝<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/decline(v.婉拒)/eject(v.喷射)

advancement<,>/ədˈvɑːnsmənt/<,>/ədˈvænsmənt/<,>n.进步/n.提升<,>Technological advancement has changed our lives.<,>技术进步改变了我们的生活。<,>She was promoted for her career advancement.<,>她因职业发展而获得晋升。<,>The advancement of medical science is crucial.<,>医学的进步至关重要。<,>advance(前进)+ment(名词后缀)→前进的状态→进步<,>progress(n.进步)/promotion(n.晋升)

skyrocket<,>/ˈskaɪrɒkɪt/<,>/ˈskaɪrɑːkɪt/<,>v.突升/v.猛涨<,>Prices have skyrocketed in recent months.<,>最近几个月价格猛涨。<,>Her popularity skyrocketed after the movie.<,>电影上映后她的知名度飙升。<,>The company's stocks skyrocketed overnight.<,>公司股票一夜暴涨。<,>sky(天空)+rocket(火箭)→像火箭升空一样猛涨<,>soar(v.高飞)/plummet(v.骤降)

characteristic<,>/ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/<,>/ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/<,>n.特点<,>Honesty is one of his defining characteristics.<,>诚实是他的显著特点之一。<,>The stripes are a characteristic feature of tigers.<,>条纹是老虎的特征。<,>This behavior is characteristic of him.<,>这种行为是他的典型表现。<,>character(性格)+istic(形容词后缀)→性格特征<,>feature(n.特征)/trait(n.特性)

implication<,>/ˌɪmplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪmplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.含义/n.暗示<,>The implications of the discovery are far-reaching.<,>这一发现的含义深远。<,>She didn't realize the implication of her words.<,>她没有意识到自己话中的暗示。<,>There are political implications to this decision.<,>这个决定有政治含义。<,>im(进入)+plic(折叠)+ation→折叠在内的东西→暗示<,>inference(n.推论)/connotation(n.内涵)

measure<,>/ˈmeʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmɛʒər/<,>n.分量/v.测量<,>We need to measure the room before buying furniture.<,>买家具前我们需要测量房间。<,>Success isn't only measured by wealth.<,>成功不仅仅用财富来衡量。<,>She poured two measures of flour into the bowl.<,>她往碗里倒了两份面粉。<,>meas(测量)+ure→测量的结果<,>gauge(v.测量)/quantity(n.数量)

replacement<,>/rɪˈpleɪsmənt/<,>/rɪˈplesmənt/<,>n.代替<,>We need to find a replacement for the broken part.<,>我们需要找到损坏零件的替代品。<,>He was hired as a replacement for the retired teacher.<,>他被聘用来接替退休的老师。<,>The replacement battery lasts longer.<,>替换电池续航更久。<,>replace(代替)+ment(名词后缀)→代替的状态<,>substitute(n.替代品)/alternate(n.替代者)

easygoing<,>/ˌiːziˈɡəʊɪŋ/<,>/ˌiziˈɡoʊɪŋ/<,>adj.脾气随和的/adj.温和的<,>He's very easygoing about most things.<,>他对大多数事情都很随和。<,>Her easygoing nature makes her popular.<,>她随和的性格使她受欢迎。<,>We need an easygoing approach to this problem.<,>我们需要用温和的方式处理这个问题。<,>easy(容易的)+going(进行的)→容易相处的<,>relaxed(adj.放松的)/strict(adj.严格的)
squeeze<,>/skwiːz/<,>/skwiz/<,>v.压/v.榨<,>She squeezed the juice from the oranges.<,>她从橙子里榨出果汁。<,>He squeezed her hand reassuringly.<,>他安慰地捏了捏她的手。<,>The children squeezed into the small car.<,>孩子们挤进了那辆小车。<,>squeak(吱吱声)+eze→挤压时发出的声音<,>sneeze(v.打喷嚏)/breeze(n.微风)/freeze(v.冻结)

exhibition<,>/ˌeksɪˈbɪʃn/<,>/ˌɛksəˈbɪʃən/<,>n.展览<,>The art exhibition attracted thousands of visitors.<,>这次艺术展览吸引了数千名参观者。<,>She won first prize in the science exhibition.<,>她在科学展览会上获得了一等奖。<,>The museum is hosting a special dinosaur exhibition.<,>博物馆正在举办一个特别的恐龙展览。<,>ex(出)+hibit(持有)+ion→把东西拿出来展示<,>inhibition(n.抑制)/prohibition(n.禁止)/habitation(n.居住)

responsibility<,>/rɪˌspɒnsəˈbɪləti/<,>/rɪˌspɑːnsəˈbɪləti/<,>n.责任<,>It's your responsibility to lock the doors at night.<,>晚上锁门是你的责任。<,>She takes her responsibilities as a teacher very seriously.<,>她非常认真地对待自己作为教师的责任。<,>With great power comes great responsibility.<,>能力越大，责任越大。<,>response(回应)+ability(能力)→能够回应的能力→责任<,>response(n.回应)/responsible(adj.负责的)/irresponsible(adj.不负责任的)

enhance<,>/ɪnˈhɑːns/<,>/ɪnˈhæns/<,>v.提高/v.加强/v.增加<,>The new software will enhance our productivity.<,>新软件将提高我们的生产力。<,>Good lighting can enhance the appearance of a room.<,>良好的照明可以提升房间的外观。<,>Regular exercise enhances your overall health.<,>定期锻炼能增强你的整体健康。<,>en(使)+hance(高)→使变高→提高<,>hence(adv.因此)/hance(n.机会)/advance(v.前进)

retain<,>/rɪˈteɪn/<,>/rɪˈteɪn/<,>v.保留/v.留用<,>The company decided to retain all its current employees.<,>公司决定留用所有现有员工。<,>This soil retains water well.<,>这种土壤保水性很好。<,>I can't retain all this information in my memory.<,>我无法记住所有这些信息。<,>re(再)+tain(保持)→再次保持→保留<,>contain(v.包含)/maintain(v.维持)/obtain(v.获得)

convey<,>/kənˈveɪ/<,>/kənˈveɪ/<,>v.传达/v.传递<,>Words cannot convey how grateful I am.<,>言语无法表达我的感激之情。<,>The painting conveys a sense of loneliness.<,>这幅画传达出一种孤独感。<,>Please convey my apologies to your mother.<,>请代我向你母亲道歉。<,>con(共同)+vey(路)→共同上路→传递<,>survey(v.调查)/vehicle(n.车辆)/voyage(n.航行)

regulation<,>/ˌreɡjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛɡjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.管理/n.规则<,>Safety regulations must be followed at all times.<,>必须始终遵守安全规则。<,>The new regulation will take effect next month.<,>新规定将于下月生效。<,>Government regulation of the industry is necessary.<,>政府对行业的监管是必要的。<,>regular(规则的)+ation→规则化→管理<,>regular(adj.规则的)/irregular(adj.不规则的)/legislation(n.立法)

integrity<,>/ɪnˈteɡrəti/<,>/ɪnˈtɛɡrəti/<,>n.完整<,>The integrity of the building was compromised by the earthquake.<,>地震破坏了建筑物的完整性。<,>He is a man of great personal integrity.<,>他是个品德高尚的人。<,>We must protect the integrity of our data.<,>我们必须保护数据的完整性。<,>integer(整数)+ity→完整的状态<,>integrate(v.整合)/disintegrate(v.瓦解)/integral(adj.完整的)

combine<,>/kəmˈbaɪn/<,>/kəmˈbaɪn/<,>v.联合/v.结合<,>Combine the flour and eggs to make a dough.<,>把面粉和鸡蛋混合做成面团。<,>The two companies combined to form a larger corporation.<,>两家公司合并成了一家更大的企业。<,>His work combines art and technology.<,>他的作品结合了艺术和技术。<,>com(共同)+bine(二)→两个合在一起→结合<,>comb(n.梳子)/combat(n.战斗)/combust(v.燃烧)

impermanency<,>/ɪmˈpɜːmənənsi/<,>/ɪmˈpɜːmənənsi/<,>n.非永久性<,>Buddhism teaches the impermanency of all things.<,>佛教教导万物皆无常。<,>The artist explores the theme of impermanency in his work.<,>这位艺术家在他的作品中探索无常的主题。<,>We must accept the impermanency of life.<,>我们必须接受生命的无常。<,>im(不)+permanent(永久的)+cy→非永久性<,>permanent(adj.永久的)/impermanent(adj.非永久的)/permanence(n.永久性)
catalogue<,>/ˈkætəlɒɡ/<,>/ˈkætəlɔːɡ/<,>v.把……编入目录<,>She spent the afternoon cataloguing the new books.<,>她花了一下午时间把新书编入目录。<,>The museum has a vast catalogue of artifacts.<,>博物馆有大量文物目录。<,>He catalogued his stamp collection by country.<,>他按国家分类编目了他的邮票收藏。<,>cata(完全)+logue(说)→详细列出→编目<,>category(n.类别)/log(n.日志)/dialogue(n.对话)  

council<,>/ˈkaʊnsəl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsəl/<,>n.议会<,>The city council approved the new budget.<,>市议会通过了新预算。<,>She was elected to the student council.<,>她被选入学生会。<,>The council meets every Tuesday.<,>议会每周二开会。<,>coun(共同)+cil(召集)→共同商议的机构→议会<,>counsel(n.建议/v.劝告)/console(v.安慰)/cancel(v.取消)  

prepare<,>/prɪˈpeə(r)/<,>/prɪˈper/<,>v.做准备<,>We need to prepare for the exam.<,>我们需要为考试做准备。<,>She prepared a delicious meal.<,>她准备了一顿美味的饭菜。<,>He's preparing his speech for tomorrow.<,>他正在准备明天的演讲。<,>pre(前)+pare(安排)→提前安排→准备<,>repair(v.修理)/compare(v.比较)/pare(v.削皮)  

inquiry<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪəri/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪri/<,>n.询问<,>The police made inquiries about the accident.<,>警方对事故进行了询问。<,>She sent an inquiry to the university.<,>她向大学发出了询问。<,>All inquiries should be directed to the manager.<,>所有询问都应转给经理。<,>in(进入)+quire(寻求)→深入寻求→询问<,>require(v.要求)/acquire(v.获得)/enquire(v.询问)  

tension<,>/ˈtenʃn/<,>/ˈtenʃən/<,>n.紧张<,>There was tension in the air before the match.<,>比赛前气氛很紧张。<,>She felt the tension in her shoulders.<,>她感到肩膀紧绷。<,>The tension between them was obvious.<,>他们之间的紧张很明显。<,>ten(伸展)+sion→拉紧的状态→紧张<,>extension(n.延伸)/intention(n.意图)/attention(n.注意)  

prompt<,>/prɒmpt/<,>/prɑːmpt/<,>adj.迅速的/立刻的/及时的/v.促使/激励<,>She gave a prompt reply.<,>她迅速给出了回复。<,>The alarm prompted everyone to evacuate.<,>警报促使所有人疏散。<,>His teacher's praise prompted him to work harder.<,>老师的表扬激励他更加努力。<,>pro(向前)+mpt(拿)→立即拿出的→迅速的<,>promote(v.促进)/prone(adj.倾向于)/pomp(n.盛况)  

attendance<,>/əˈtendəns/<,>/əˈtendəns/<,>n.出席人数<,>Attendance at the meeting was mandatory.<,>会议出席是强制性的。<,>The concert had a record attendance.<,>音乐会出席人数创纪录。<,>Teacher takes attendance every morning.<,>老师每天早晨点名。<,>attend(出席)+ance(状态)→出席的状态→出席人数<,>attendant(n.服务员)/attention(n.注意)/intend(v.打算)  

retail<,>/ˈriːteɪl/<,>/ˈriːteɪl/<,>n.零售/v.零售<,>He works in retail sales.<,>他从事零售销售。<,>This shirt retails for $50.<,>这件衬衫零售价50美元。<,>They retail organic products.<,>他们零售有机产品。<,>re(再)+tail(切)→切成小块卖→零售<,>detail(n.细节)/entail(v.需要)/tailor(n.裁缝)  

image<,>/ˈɪmɪdʒ/<,>/ˈɪmɪdʒ/<,>n.形象/声誉/印象<,>The company wants to improve its image.<,>公司想改善形象。<,>She has a positive public image.<,>她有积极的公众形象。<,>The mirror reflected his image.<,>镜子映出他的影像。<,>im(像)+age→成像→形象<,>imagine(v.想象)/imitate(v.模仿)/impact(n.影响)  

quantity<,>/ˈkwɒntəti/<,>/ˈkwɑːntəti/<,>n.量/数量<,>We need a large quantity of paper.<,>我们需要大量纸张。<,>Quality is more important than quantity.<,>质量比数量更重要。<,>They measured the quantity of water.<,>他们测量了水量。<,>quant(数量)+ity→数量<,>quality(n.质量)/quaint(adj.古雅的)/quantum(n.量子)
inspector<,>/ɪnˈspektə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈspektər/<,>n.检查员<,>The inspector checked the quality of the products.<,>检查员检查了产品的质量。<,>An inspector will visit the school next week.<,>一名检查员下周将访问学校。<,>The food inspector found violations in the restaurant.<,>食品检查员在餐厅发现了违规行为。<,>in(内)+spect(看)+or(人)→向内看的人→检查员<,>inspect(v.检查)/spectator(n.观众)/respect(v.尊重)

endurance<,>/ɪnˈdjʊərəns/<,>/ɪnˈdʊrəns/<,>n.耐力<,>Marathon runners need great endurance.<,>马拉松运动员需要很强的耐力。<,>His endurance was tested during the long hike.<,>在长途徒步中他的耐力受到了考验。<,>She showed remarkable endurance in difficult times.<,>她在困难时期表现出非凡的耐力。<,>endure(忍受)+ance(名词后缀)→耐力<,>duration(n.持续时间)/insurance(n.保险)/assurance(n.保证)

simplify<,>/ˈsɪmplɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɪmpləˌfaɪ/<,>v.简化<,>We need to simplify the instructions.<,>我们需要简化说明。<,>The app simplifies the process of online shopping.<,>这个应用程序简化了网购流程。<,>Can you simplify this complex theory for me?<,>你能为我简化这个复杂的理论吗？<,>simple(简单的)+ify(使)→使简单→简化<,>amplify(v.放大)/clarify(v.澄清)/classify(v.分类)

range<,>/reɪndʒ/<,>/reɪndʒ/<,>n.范围/v.在范围内变化<,>The store offers a wide range of products.<,>这家商店提供多种多样的产品。<,>Prices range from $10 to $100.<,>价格从10美元到100美元不等。<,>Her interests range from art to science.<,>她的兴趣从艺术到科学都有涉猎。<,>与"arrange"(安排)对比记忆<,>change(n.变化)/arrange(v.安排)/strange(adj.奇怪的)

accomplish<,>/əˈkʌmplɪʃ/<,>/əˈkɑːmplɪʃ/<,>v.完成<,>We accomplished our mission successfully.<,>我们成功地完成了任务。<,>It takes time to accomplish great things.<,>完成伟大的事业需要时间。<,>She accomplished all her goals for the year.<,>她完成了全年的所有目标。<,>ac(强调)+compl(完成)+ish(动词后缀)→完成<,>complete(adj.完全的)/compliment(n.赞美)/comply(v.遵从)

treatment<,>/ˈtriːtmənt/<,>/ˈtriːtmənt/<,>n.治疗/n.对待<,>He is receiving treatment for his illness.<,>他正在接受疾病治疗。<,>The treatment of animals in this farm is cruel.<,>这个农场对待动物的方式很残忍。<,>This new treatment shows promising results.<,>这种新疗法显示出良好的效果。<,>treat(对待/治疗)+ment(名词后缀)→对待/治疗<,>retreat(n.撤退)/entreat(v.恳求)/mistreat(v.虐待)

spare<,>/speə(r)/<,>/sper/<,>adj.空闲的<,>Do you have any spare time this weekend?<,>你这个周末有空闲时间吗？<,>I keep a spare key in my office.<,>我在办公室放了一把备用钥匙。<,>He has no spare money to invest.<,>他没有闲钱投资。<,>与"share"(分享)对比记忆<,>spear(n.矛)/square(n.广场)/scare(v.惊吓)

welfare<,>/ˈwelfeə(r)/<,>/ˈwelfer/<,>n.幸福/n.福利<,>The government should care about people's welfare.<,>政府应该关心人民的福利。<,>Animal welfare is an important issue.<,>动物福利是一个重要问题。<,>She works for a child welfare organization.<,>她为一个儿童福利组织工作。<,>well(好)+fare(状况)→好的状况→福利<,>farewell(n.告别)/warfare(n.战争)/seafarer(n.海员)

boost<,>/buːst/<,>/buːst/<,>n.推动/v.促使，促进<,>The tax cut will boost the economy.<,>减税将促进经济发展。<,>Coffee gives me an energy boost in the morning.<,>咖啡在早上给我能量提升。<,>We need to boost our sales this quarter.<,>我们需要提升本季度的销售额。<,>与"roast"(烘烤)对比记忆<,>coast(n.海岸)/boast(v.自夸)/toast(n.吐司)

consciousness<,>/ˈkɒnʃəsnəs/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəsnəs/<,>n.意识<,>He lost consciousness after the accident.<,>事故后他失去了意识。<,>Environmental consciousness is increasing.<,>环保意识正在提高。<,>She regained consciousness in the hospital.<,>她在医院恢复了意识。<,>conscious(有意识的)+ness(名词后缀)→意识<,>conscience(n.良心)/subconscious(adj.潜意识的)/unconscious(adj.无意识的)
patiently<,>/ˈpeɪʃəntli/<,>/ˈpeɪʃəntli/<,>adv.耐心地<,>She waited patiently for her turn.<,>她耐心地等待轮到她。<,>He listened patiently to all my problems.<,>他耐心地听我倾诉所有问题。<,>The teacher explained the concept patiently to the students.<,>老师耐心地向学生们解释这个概念。<,>pati(忍耐)+ent(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→耐心地<,>impatiently(adv.不耐烦地)/patient(adj.耐心的)  

decent<,>/ˈdiːsnt/<,>/ˈdiːsənt/<,>adj.正派的/adj.体面的<,>He comes from a decent family.<,>他出身于一个体面的家庭。<,>She always wears decent clothes to work.<,>她总是穿着得体的衣服去上班。<,>It's hard to find decent people these days.<,>如今很难找到正派的人。<,>dec(十)+ent(形容词后缀)→十分好的→体面的<,>descent(n.下降)/recent(adj.最近的)  

review<,>/rɪˈvjuː/<,>/rɪˈvju/<,>n.回顾/v.复习<,>Let's review what we learned yesterday.<,>我们来复习一下昨天学的内容。<,>The movie received mixed reviews.<,>这部电影的评价褒贬不一。<,>He wrote a review of the new restaurant.<,>他写了一篇关于新餐厅的评论。<,>re(再)+view(看)→再看一遍→复习<,>preview(v.预览)/interview(n.面试)  

considerable<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbl/<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbəl/<,>adj.相当大(或多)的<,>She has considerable experience in this field.<,>她在这个领域有相当丰富的经验。<,>The project requires a considerable amount of time.<,>这个项目需要相当多的时间。<,>There was considerable damage after the storm.<,>风暴过后造成了相当大的破坏。<,>consider(考虑)+able(能...的)→值得考虑的→相当大的<,>considerate(adj.体贴的)/inconsiderable(adj.微不足道的)  

misguide<,>/ˌmɪsˈɡaɪd/<,>/ˌmɪsˈɡaɪd/<,>v.误导<,>His advice misguided many young people.<,>他的建议误导了许多年轻人。<,>Don't be misguided by false information.<,>不要被虚假信息误导。<,>The misleading advertisement misguided consumers.<,>这个误导性的广告误导了消费者。<,>mis(错误)+guide(引导)→错误引导→误导<,>mislead(v.误导)/guide(v.引导)  

foundation<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃn/<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.地基/n.基础/n.基金会<,>The foundation of the building is very strong.<,>这座建筑的地基非常牢固。<,>She works for a charitable foundation.<,>她在一家慈善基金会工作。<,>Education is the foundation of success.<,>教育是成功的基础。<,>found(建立)+ation(名词后缀)→建立的基础→地基<,>fundation(错误拼写)/fundamental(adj.基本的)  

postgraduate<,>/ˌpəʊstˈɡrædʒuət/<,>/ˌpoʊstˈɡrædʒuət/<,>n.研究生<,>He is doing postgraduate studies at Harvard.<,>他正在哈佛大学攻读研究生。<,>She got a postgraduate degree in biology.<,>她获得了生物学研究生学位。<,>Postgraduate education requires dedication.<,>研究生教育需要奉献精神。<,>post(后)+graduate(毕业生)→毕业后的学生→研究生<,>undergraduate(n.本科生)/graduate(n.毕业生)  

prevail<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>v.流行/v.盛行<,>This custom still prevails in some areas.<,>这个习俗在一些地区仍然盛行。<,>Justice will prevail in the end.<,>正义终将战胜一切。<,>A sense of optimism prevailed among the team.<,>团队中弥漫着乐观的情绪。<,>pre(前)+vail(价值)→价值在前→盛行<,>prevent(v.防止)/avail(v.利用)  

solid<,>/ˈsɒlɪd/<,>/ˈsɑːlɪd/<,>adj.扎实的/adj.坚实的<,>He has a solid knowledge of mathematics.<,>他有扎实的数学知识。<,>The table is made of solid wood.<,>这张桌子是用实木做的。<,>We need solid evidence to prove this theory.<,>我们需要确凿的证据来证明这个理论。<,>sol(太阳)+id(形容词后缀)→像太阳一样稳固→坚实的<,>liquid(n.液体)/gas(n.气体)  

counsel<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsəl/<,>v.忠告/v.建议<,>The lawyer counseled his client carefully.<,>律师仔细地为他的客户提供建议。<,>She counseled me on career choices.<,>她就职业选择给了我建议。<,>Parents should counsel their children wisely.<,>父母应该明智地给孩子们建议。<,>coun(共同)+sel(说)→共同商议→建议<,>council(n.委员会)/consult(v.咨询)
maximum<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>n.最大值/n.最大量/adj.最大值的/adj.最大量的<,>The maximum speed limit on this road is 60 mph.<,>这条路的最高限速是每小时60英里。<,>She achieved the maximum score in the test.<,>她在考试中取得了最高分。<,>The maximum capacity of the stadium is 50,000 people.<,>这个体育场的最大容量是5万人。<,>max(最大)+imum(拉丁语最高级后缀)→最大值<,>minimum(n.最小值/adj.最小的)/maximal(adj.最大的)/maximize(v.最大化)

abstract<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>/ˈæbˌstrækt/<,>adj.抽象的<,>Modern art often uses abstract forms.<,>现代艺术经常使用抽象形式。<,>His ideas are too abstract for most people to understand.<,>他的想法太抽象，大多数人无法理解。<,>The concept of love is somewhat abstract.<,>爱情的概念有些抽象。<,>abs(离开)+tract(拉)→从具体中拉出来→抽象的<,>extract(v.提取/n.摘录)/contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/distract(v.分散注意力)

realistic<,>/rɪəˈlɪstɪk/<,>/ˌriəˈlɪstɪk/<,>adj.现实的/adj.实际的<,>We need to set realistic goals for the project.<,>我们需要为这个项目设定现实的目标。<,>Her expectations about the job were very realistic.<,>她对这份工作的期望非常实际。<,>The movie's special effects look very realistic.<,>这部电影的特效看起来非常逼真。<,>real(真实的)+istic(形容词后缀)→现实的<,>idealistic(adj.理想主义的)/pessimistic(adj.悲观的)/optimistic(adj.乐观的)

ban<,>/bæn/<,>/bæn/<,>v.禁止<,>The government decided to ban smoking in public places.<,>政府决定禁止在公共场所吸烟。<,>The school bans students from using mobile phones in class.<,>学校禁止学生在课堂上使用手机。<,>This pesticide has been banned in many countries.<,>这种杀虫剂在许多国家已被禁止。<,>与"pan(平底锅)"对比记忆→禁止用平底锅<,>bar(n.酒吧/v.禁止)/fan(n.风扇/n.粉丝)/bang(n.巨响/v.猛击)

ashamed<,>/əˈʃeɪmd/<,>/əˈʃeɪmd/<,>adj.羞耻的/adj.内疚的/adj.惭愧的<,>He felt ashamed of his behavior at the party.<,>他为自己在派对上的行为感到羞愧。<,>She was ashamed to admit her mistake.<,>她羞于承认自己的错误。<,>You should be ashamed of lying to your parents.<,>你应该为对父母撒谎感到惭愧。<,>a(加强)+shame(羞耻)+ed→感到羞耻的<,>shameful(adj.可耻的)/shameless(adj.无耻的)/blamed(adj.被责备的)

solve<,>/sɒlv/<,>/sɑːlv/<,>v.解决<,>Scientists are working hard to solve this environmental problem.<,>科学家们正在努力解决这个环境问题。<,>Can you help me solve this math problem?<,>你能帮我解决这道数学题吗？<,>The detective finally solved the mysterious case.<,>侦探终于破解了这个神秘案件。<,>sol(松开)+ve→松开难题→解决<,>resolve(v.决心解决)/dissolve(v.溶解)/absolve(v.免除责任)

reinforce<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>v.加强/v.强化<,>The army sent more troops to reinforce the border.<,>军队派出更多部队加强边境防御。<,>Positive feedback can reinforce good behavior.<,>积极的反馈可以强化良好行为。<,>We need to reinforce the bridge's structure.<,>我们需要加强桥梁的结构。<,>re(再次)+in(进入)+force(力量)→再次加入力量→加强<,>enforce(v.强制执行)/reinforcement(n.增援)/force(n.力量/v.强迫)

applicant<,>/ˈæplɪkənt/<,>/ˈæplɪkənt/<,>n.申请人<,>There were over 100 applicants for the position.<,>这个职位有超过100名申请人。<,>The university will notify all applicants by next week.<,>大学将在下周通知所有申请人。<,>Successful applicants will receive an email confirmation.<,>成功的申请人将收到电子邮件确认。<,>apply(申请)+cant(人)→申请人<,>application(n.申请)/applicable(adj.适用的)/appliance(n.器具)

tuition<,>/tjuˈɪʃn/<,>/tuˈɪʃn/<,>n.学费<,>The university raised its tuition fees this year.<,>这所大学今年提高了学费。<,>Her parents are saving money for her college tuition.<,>她的父母正在为她的大学学费存钱。<,>Private school tuition is usually very expensive.<,>私立学校的学费通常很贵。<,>tuit(教导)+ion→教导的费用→学费<,>intuition(n.直觉)/tutor(n.导师/v.辅导)/institution(n.机构)

persistence<,>/pəˈsɪstəns/<,>/pərˈsɪstəns/<,>n.坚持不懈<,>Her persistence finally paid off when she got the job.<,>她的坚持不懈最终得到了回报，她获得了这份工作。<,>Success requires talent and persistence.<,>成功需要天赋和坚持。<,>The scientist's persistence led to an important discovery.<,>这位科学家的坚持导致了一项重要发现。<,>per(完全)+sist(站立)+ence→完全站立不动→坚持<,>insistence(n.坚持)/consistency(n.一致性)/resist(v.抵抗)
overcome<,>/ˌəʊvəˈkʌm/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈkʌm/<,>v.战胜/v.克服<,>She worked hard to overcome her fear of public speaking.<,>她努力克服对公开演讲的恐惧。<,>They overcame many difficulties to achieve success.<,>他们克服了许多困难才取得成功。<,>Love can overcome all obstacles.<,>爱能战胜一切障碍。<,>over(超过)+come(来)→超越而来→克服<,>overdo(v. 做得过火)/overcast(adj.阴天的)/overlook(v.忽视)  

bride<,>/braɪd/<,>/braɪd/<,>n.新娘<,>The bride looked beautiful in her white dress.<,>新娘穿着白色婚纱看起来很漂亮。<,>The bride and groom exchanged rings at the ceremony.<,>新娘和新郎在仪式上交换了戒指。<,>Her parents gave the bride a special gift.<,>她的父母给了新娘一份特别的礼物。<,>b(beautiful)+ride(骑马)→美丽的新娘骑马而来<,>bribe(n.贿赂)/bridegroom(n.新郎)/bridle(n.马笼头)  

engagement<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒmənt/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒmənt/<,>n.婚约<,>They announced their engagement at the party.<,>他们在聚会上宣布了订婚的消息。<,>The engagement ring had a beautiful diamond.<,>订婚戒指上有一颗美丽的钻石。<,>Their engagement lasted for two years before marriage.<,>他们的婚约持续了两年才结婚。<,>engage(订婚)+ment(名词后缀)→婚约<,>endanger(v.危及)/enlarge(v.扩大)/enrage(v.激怒)  

household<,>/ˈhaʊshəʊld/<,>/ˈhaʊshoʊld/<,>n.家庭/n.一家人<,>This product is used in every household.<,>这个产品在每个家庭中都有使用。<,>She comes from a wealthy household.<,>她来自一个富裕的家庭。<,>Our household consists of four people.<,>我们家有四口人。<,>house(房子)+hold(容纳)→容纳一个家的地方→家庭<,>housewife(n.家庭主妇)/housework(n.家务)/housekeeper(n.管家)  

evaluate<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>v.评价<,>Teachers need to evaluate students' performance.<,>老师需要评估学生的表现。<,>We will evaluate the results of the experiment.<,>我们将评估实验的结果。<,>It's difficult to evaluate his true intentions.<,>很难评价他的真实意图。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ate(动词后缀)→评估出价值→评价<,>estimate(v.估计)/value(n.价值)/validate(v.验证)  

saint<,>/seɪnt/<,>/seɪnt/<,>n.圣人<,>Saint Patrick is the patron saint of Ireland.<,>圣帕特里克是爱尔兰的守护神。<,>She has the patience of a saint.<,>她有圣人般的耐心。<,>The church was named after a local saint.<,>这座教堂以当地一位圣人的名字命名。<,>saint与paint(绘画)形似，但意思完全不同<,>sane(adj.理智的)/taint(v.污染)/faint(adj.微弱的)  

delay<,>/dɪˈleɪ/<,>/dɪˈleɪ/<,>v.推迟/v.延期<,>The flight was delayed due to bad weather.<,>航班因恶劣天气延误了。<,>Don't delay making the important decision.<,>不要推迟做这个重要决定。<,>The project has been delayed for three months.<,>这个项目已经被推迟了三个月。<,>de(向下)+lay(放置)→向下放→推迟<,>decay(v.腐烂)/relay(v.转播)/display(v.展示)  

private<,>/ˈpraɪvət/<,>/ˈpraɪvət/<,>adj.私人的<,>This is a private conversation.<,>这是一次私人谈话。<,>He has a private jet.<,>他有一架私人飞机。<,>Please respect my private life.<,>请尊重我的私人生活。<,>priv(私人的)+ate(形容词后缀)→私人的<,>privacy(n.隐私)/privilege(n.特权)/deprive(v.剥夺)  

definition<,>/ˌdefɪˈnɪʃn/<,>/ˌdefɪˈnɪʃn/<,>n.定义<,>Can you give me the definition of this word?<,>你能给我这个词的定义吗？<,>The legal definition may differ from common usage.<,>法律定义可能与日常用法不同。<,>Clear definitions are important in academic writing.<,>在学术写作中，清晰的定义很重要。<,>define(定义)+ition(名词后缀)→定义<,>definite(adj.明确的)/definitive(adj.决定性的)/indefinite(adj.模糊的)  

influential<,>/ˌɪnfluˈenʃl/<,>/ˌɪnfluˈenʃl/<,>adj.有影响力的<,>He is an influential leader in the industry.<,>他是这个行业中有影响力的领导者。<,>This was an influential book in my life.<,>这本书对我的人生有很大影响。<,>Social media has become increasingly influential.<,>社交媒体变得越来越有影响力。<,>influence(影响)+ial(形容词后缀)→有影响力的<,>fluent(adj.流利的)/affluent(adj.富裕的)/confluent(adj.汇合的)
recommend<,>/ˌrekəˈmend/<,>/ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd/<,>v.推荐/v.劝告/v.使受欢迎<,>I recommend this book to all my students.<,>我向所有学生推荐这本书。<,>The doctor recommended a healthy diet.<,>医生建议健康饮食。<,>Her kindness recommends her to everyone.<,>她的善良使她受到大家的喜爱。<,>re(再)+commend(赞扬)→再次赞扬→推荐<,>command(v.命令/n.指挥)/commend(v.赞扬/v.推荐)/demand(v.要求/n.需求)

frontier<,>/ˈfrʌntɪə(r)/<,>/frʌnˈtɪr/<,>n.边境<,>They crossed the frontier at dawn.<,>他们在黎明时穿越了边境。<,>The frontier town was bustling with traders.<,>这个边境小镇挤满了商人。<,>Space is the final frontier for exploration.<,>太空是探索的最后疆域。<,>front(前面)+ier(表地方)→前面的地方→边境<,>border(n.边界)/boundary(n.分界线)/fringe(n.边缘)

concern<,>/kənˈsɜːn/<,>/kənˈsɜrn/<,>n.重要的事情/v.与…有关/v.关于<,>Environmental protection is a major concern.<,>环境保护是重要议题。<,>This matter doesn't concern you.<,>这件事与你无关。<,>She expressed concern about the delay.<,>她对延误表示担忧。<,>con(共同)+cern(分离)→共同分离→关心<,>discern(v.辨别)/concert(n.音乐会)/concrete(adj.具体的)

organ<,>/ˈɔːɡən/<,>/ˈɔrɡən/<,>n.器官<,>The heart is a vital organ.<,>心脏是重要器官。<,>He plays the organ in church.<,>他在教堂演奏管风琴。<,>The newspaper is an organ of public opinion.<,>报纸是舆论的喉舌。<,>org(工作)+an→工作的部分→器官<,>organism(n.生物体)/organization(n.组织)/organic(adj.有机的)

cite<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>v.引用<,>The scholar cited several sources in his paper.<,>学者在论文中引用了多个来源。<,>The lawyer cited precedent cases.<,>律师引用了判例。<,>She was cited for bravery.<,>她因勇敢受到表彰。<,>cit(唤起)+e→唤起别人的话→引用<,>site(n.地点)/sight(n.视力)/suite(n.套房)

mechanism<,>/ˈmekənɪzəm/<,>/ˈmɛkəˌnɪzəm/<,>n.机制/n.机能<,>The clock's mechanism needs repair.<,>这个钟的机械装置需要修理。<,>The body has defense mechanisms against disease.<,>身体有对抗疾病的防御机制。<,>They established a new mechanism for dispute resolution.<,>他们建立了新的争端解决机制。<,>mechan(机器)+ism→机器的工作原理→机制<,>machine(n.机器)/mechanical(adj.机械的)/machination(n.阴谋)

contest<,>/ˈkɒntest/<,>/ˈkɑntɛst/<,>n.比赛<,>She won first prize in the singing contest.<,>她在歌唱比赛中获得一等奖。<,>They contested the election results.<,>他们对选举结果提出异议。<,>The legal contest lasted for months.<,>这场法律诉讼持续了数月。<,>con(共同)+test(测试)→共同测试→比赛<,>context(n.上下文)/content(n.内容)/contact(n.接触)

symptom<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>n.症状<,>Fever is a symptom of many illnesses.<,>发烧是许多疾病的症状。<,>The doctor asked about all my symptoms.<,>医生询问了我所有的症状。<,>These problems are symptoms of a deeper issue.<,>这些问题是一个更深层次问题的表现。<,>sym(共同)+ptom(降临)→同时降临的表现→症状<,>symbol(n.符号)/sympathy(n.同情)/symphony(n.交响乐)

deadline<,>/ˈdedlaɪn/<,>/ˈdɛdˌlaɪn/<,>n.最后期限<,>The project deadline is next Friday.<,>项目截止日期是下周五。<,>I'm working hard to meet the deadline.<,>我正在努力赶在截止日期前完成。<,>She extended the deadline by two days.<,>她把截止日期延长了两天。<,>dead(死)+line(线)→死亡线→最后期限<,>headline(n.标题)/guideline(n.指导方针)/timeline(n.时间线)

domination<,>/ˌdɒmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌdɑməˈneɪʃən/<,>n.主导<,>The team's domination of the league continued.<,>这支球队在联赛中的主导地位持续着。<,>They fought against foreign domination.<,>他们反抗外国统治。<,>Her domination of the conversation annoyed others.<,>她主导谈话让其他人感到不快。<,>domin(统治)+ation→统治状态→主导<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/dominate(v.支配)/domain(n.领域)
figure<,>/ˈfɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪɡjər/<,>n.人物/n.数字<,>He is a key figure in the company.<,>他是公司里的关键人物。<,>The figure shows a steady increase in sales.<,>图表显示销售额稳步增长。<,>She has a slender figure.<,>她身材苗条。<,>fig(形状)+ure→形状→人物/数字<,>finger(n.手指)/fibre(n.纤维)/fever(n.发烧)

imply<,>/ɪmˈplaɪ/<,>/ɪmˈplaɪ/<,>v.暗示/v.意味<,>His silence implied agreement.<,>他的沉默意味着同意。<,>Are you implying that I lied?<,>你是在暗示我撒谎了吗？<,>The report implies a need for change.<,>报告暗示需要改变。<,>im(进入)+ply(折叠)→把意思折叠在里面→暗示<,>apply(v.申请/v.应用)/reply(v.回答)/supply(v.供应)

curiosity<,>/ˌkjʊəriˈɒsəti/<,>/ˌkjʊriˈɑːsəti/<,>n.好奇心<,>Her curiosity led her to explore the cave.<,>好奇心驱使她探索洞穴。<,>The child's curiosity is insatiable.<,>这孩子的好奇心永无止境。<,>The book aroused my curiosity about ancient cultures.<,>这本书引起了我对古代文化的好奇。<,>cur(关心)+iostiy→关心的事物→好奇心<,>cure(v.治愈)/curious(adj.好奇的)/currency(n.货币)

induce<,>/ɪnˈdjuːs/<,>/ɪnˈduːs/<,>v.引诱<,>The advertisement is designed to induce people to buy.<,>这个广告旨在引诱人们购买。<,>Nothing could induce her to change her mind.<,>什么都不能引诱她改变主意。<,>The drug can induce sleep.<,>这种药能诱发睡眠。<,>in(进入)+duce(引导)→引导进入→引诱<,>reduce(v.减少)/deduce(v.推断)/produce(v.生产)

acknowledge<,>/əkˈnɒlɪdʒ/<,>/əkˈnɑːlɪdʒ/<,>v.承认(…的权威)<,>He acknowledged his mistake.<,>他承认了自己的错误。<,>The government acknowledged the problem.<,>政府承认了这个问题。<,>She acknowledged receiving the letter.<,>她确认收到了信件。<,>ac(强调)+knowledge(知识)→承认知识→承认权威<,>knowledge(n.知识)/acknowledgement(n.承认)/edge(n.边缘)

gym<,>/dʒɪm/<,>/dʒɪm/<,>n.体育馆/n.健身房<,>I go to the gym three times a week.<,>我每周去健身房三次。<,>The school has a new gym.<,>学校有个新体育馆。<,>He works out at the gym every morning.<,>他每天早上在健身房锻炼。<,>gymnasium的缩写<,>gem(n.宝石)/gum(n.口香糖)/jam(n.果酱)

chef<,>/ʃef/<,>/ʃef/<,>n.厨师<,>The chef prepared a delicious meal.<,>厨师准备了一顿美味的饭菜。<,>She trained to become a chef.<,>她接受培训成为厨师。<,>The restaurant has a famous French chef.<,>这家餐厅有位著名的法国厨师。<,>chief(首领)的变体，厨房的首领<,>chief(n.首领)/cheek(n.脸颊)/cheer(v.欢呼)

sensible<,>/ˈsensəbl/<,>/ˈsensəbl/<,>adj.明智的<,>That's a sensible decision.<,>那是个明智的决定。<,>Wear sensible shoes for hiking.<,>穿合适的鞋子去远足。<,>It's sensible to save money for emergencies.<,>为紧急情况存钱是明智的。<,>sens(感觉)+ible→能感觉到的→明智的<,>sensitive(adj.敏感的)/sensory(adj.感觉的)/sensational(adj.轰动的)

outline<,>/ˈaʊtlaɪn/<,>/ˈaʊtlaɪn/<,>n.梗概/n.提纲/n.草稿/n.要点<,>He gave an outline of his plan.<,>他给出了计划的概要。<,>Write an outline before you start the essay.<,>写文章前先写提纲。<,>The outline of the mountain was clear against the sky.<,>山的轮廓在天空下很清晰。<,>out(外面)+line(线)→外面的线→轮廓<,>online(adj.在线的)/underline(v.强调)/headline(n.标题)

react<,>/riˈækt/<,>/riˈækt/<,>v.对……作出反应<,>How did she react to the news?<,>她对这个消息有什么反应？<,>The chemicals react violently when mixed.<,>这些化学物质混合时会剧烈反应。<,>He reacted angrily to the criticism.<,>他对批评愤怒地作出反应。<,>re(回)+act(行动)→行动回去→反应<,>act(v.行动)/interact(v.互动)/retract(v.收回)
committee<,>/kəˈmɪti/<,>/kəˈmɪti/<,>n.委员会<,>The committee will meet next week to discuss the budget.<,>委员会将于下周开会讨论预算。<,>She was elected to the school committee.<,>她被选入学校委员会。<,>The committee members have different opinions on this issue.<,>委员会成员对这个问题的意见不一。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)+ee(人)→共同被委派的人→委员会<,>commission(n.委员会/v.委托)/commit(v.承诺/v.犯罪)/commute(v.通勤/v.减刑)  

civilian<,>/sɪˈvɪliən/<,>/səˈvɪljən/<,>n.平民/百姓<,>The soldiers were ordered not to harm civilians.<,>士兵们被命令不得伤害平民。<,>He returned to civilian life after serving in the army.<,>他退伍后回归平民生活。<,>Civilian casualties must be avoided in the conflict.<,>冲突中必须避免平民伤亡。<,>civil(公民的)+ian(人)→公民→平民<,>militant(n.激进分子/adj.好战的)/civilized(adj.文明的)/civil(adj.公民的)  

domestic<,>/dəˈmestɪk/<,>/dəˈmɛstɪk/<,>adj.国内的/家庭的<,>Domestic flights are cheaper than international ones.<,>国内航班比国际航班便宜。<,>She prefers domestic cats to wild ones.<,>比起野猫，她更喜欢家猫。<,>Domestic violence is a serious social issue.<,>家庭暴力是一个严重的社会问题。<,>dome(房子)+stic→房子里的→家庭的<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/exotic(adj.异国的)/dormant(adj.休眠的)  

complex<,>/ˈkɒmpleks/<,>/kəmˈplɛks/<,>adj.复杂的/n.综合体<,>The problem is more complex than we thought.<,>这个问题比我们想象的更复杂。<,>She lives in a large apartment complex.<,>她住在一个大型公寓综合体中。<,>Human emotions are complex and hard to understand.<,>人类情感复杂且难以理解。<,>com(共同)+plex(折叠)→多重折叠→复杂的<,>perplex(v.使困惑)/duplex(n.复式住宅)/simplex(adj.简单的)  

locate<,>/ləʊˈkeɪt/<,>/ˈloʊkeɪt/<,>v.位于/定位<,>The company is located in downtown.<,>公司位于市中心。<,>Can you locate your hometown on this map?<,>你能在这张地图上找到你的家乡吗？<,>The police are trying to locate the missing child.<,>警方正在努力寻找失踪的孩子。<,>loc(地方)+ate(使)→使有地方→位于<,>allocate(v.分配)/relocate(v.搬迁)/local(adj.当地的)  

tighten<,>/ˈtaɪtn/<,>/ˈtaɪtn/<,>v.使变紧/收紧<,>Please tighten the screws before using the machine.<,>使用机器前请拧紧螺丝。<,>The government decided to tighten security measures.<,>政府决定加强安全措施。<,>She tightened her grip on the rope.<,>她抓紧了绳子。<,>tight(紧的)+en(使)→使变紧<,>brighten(v.变亮)/lighten(v.减轻)/frighten(v.使害怕)  

physics<,>/ˈfɪzɪks/<,>/ˈfɪzɪks/<,>n.物理/物理学<,>Physics was my favorite subject in high school.<,>物理是我高中时最喜欢的科目。<,>He won the Nobel Prize in Physics.<,>他获得了诺贝尔物理学奖。<,>The laws of physics explain many natural phenomena.<,>物理定律解释了许多自然现象。<,>phys(自然)+ics(学科)→研究自然的学科→物理学<,>physique(n.体格)/metaphysics(n.形而上学)/physician(n.内科医生)  

foothold<,>/ˈfʊthəʊld/<,>/ˈfʊtˌhoʊld/<,>n.立足处/立足点<,>The climber searched for a secure foothold.<,>登山者寻找安全的立足点。<,>The company gained a foothold in the Asian market.<,>该公司在亚洲市场站稳了脚跟。<,>Education provides a foothold for social mobility.<,>教育为社会流动提供了立足点。<,>foot(脚)+hold(抓住)→脚能抓住的地方→立足处<,>handhold(n.把手)/stronghold(n.据点)/threshold(n.门槛)  

discharge<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑrdʒ/<,>v.释放/排出/批准离开/命令离开<,>The factory was fined for discharging pollutants into the river.<,>这家工厂因向河流排放污染物而被罚款。<,>The patient was discharged from the hospital yesterday.<,>病人昨天出院了。<,>The battery discharges quickly in cold weather.<,>电池在寒冷天气下放电很快。<,>dis(不)+charge(装载)→不再装载→释放<,>recharge(v.再充电)/overcharge(v.要价过高)/charge(n.费用/v.充电)  

advanced<,>/ədˈvɑːnst/<,>/ədˈvænst/<,>adj.高级的/先进的<,>This course is for advanced learners.<,>这门课程是为高级学习者开设的。<,>The country has advanced technology in this field.<,>该国在这一领域拥有先进技术。<,>She is taking an advanced mathematics class.<,>她正在上高等数学课。<,>advance(前进)+ed→已经前进的→高级的<,>advantage(n.优势)/adventure(n.冒险)/advancement(n.进步)
complicated<,>/ˈkɒmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.难懂的<,>The instructions were too complicated for me to understand.<,>这些说明太复杂了，我无法理解。<,>Their relationship is complicated by past misunderstandings.<,>他们的关系因过去的误会而变得复杂。<,>This is a complicated mathematical problem.<,>这是一道复杂的数学题。<,>com(一起)+plic(折叠)+ated→全部折叠在一起→复杂的<,>complex(adj.复杂的)/simplify(v.简化)  

needy<,>/ˈniːdi/<,>/ˈniːdi/<,>adj.贫穷的<,>The charity provides food for needy families.<,>这家慈善机构为贫困家庭提供食物。<,>She comes from a needy background.<,>她出身贫寒。<,>Needy children often lack access to education.<,>贫困儿童常常缺乏受教育的机会。<,>need(需要)+y(形容词后缀)→需要帮助的→贫穷的<,>greedy(adj.贪婪的)/needed(v.需要)  

stale<,>/steɪl/<,>/steɪl/<,>adj.乏味的/adj.没有新意的<,>The bread has gone stale.<,>面包已经不新鲜了。<,>His jokes are getting stale.<,>他的笑话越来越没新意了。<,>The air in the room was stale and stuffy.<,>房间里的空气沉闷不流通。<,>s(死)+tale(故事)→死气沉沉的故事→乏味的<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/scale(n.规模)  

casual<,>/ˈkæʒuəl/<,>/ˈkæʒuəl/<,>adj.漫不经心的/adj.随便的/adj.偶然的<,>He wore casual clothes to the party.<,>他穿着便装去参加聚会。<,>They had a casual conversation about the weather.<,>他们随便聊了聊天气。<,>It was just a casual remark, not meant to offend.<,>这只是随口一说，并非有意冒犯。<,>cas(落下)+ual→偶然落下的→偶然的<,>causal(adj.因果的)/usual(adj.通常的)  

conform<,>/kənˈfɔːm/<,>/kənˈfɔːrm/<,>v.相一致/v.遵守<,>All students must conform to the school rules.<,>所有学生都必须遵守校规。<,>His behavior does not conform to social norms.<,>他的行为不符合社会规范。<,>The product conforms to international standards.<,>该产品符合国际标准。<,>con(共同)+form(形状)→形成共同形状→相一致<,>confirm(v.确认)/reform(v.改革)  

recharge<,>/ˌriːˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/ˌriːˈtʃɑːrdʒ/<,>v.再充电<,>I need to recharge my phone battery.<,>我需要给手机电池充电。<,>Let's stop to recharge our energy.<,>我们停下来补充能量吧。<,>The solar panels recharge during the day.<,>太阳能电池板在白天充电。<,>re(再)+charge(充电)→再次充电<,>discharge(v.放电)/overcharge(v.过度充电)  

annually<,>/ˈænjuəli/<,>/ˈænjuəli/<,>adv.每年/adv.一年一次<,>The conference is held annually in June.<,>这个会议每年六月举行一次。<,>She receives a bonus annually.<,>她每年都会收到奖金。<,>The flowers bloom annually in spring.<,>这些花每年春天都会开放。<,>annual(每年的)+ly(副词后缀)→每年地<,>monthly(adv.每月)/daily(adv.每日)  

frown<,>/fraʊn/<,>/fraʊn/<,>v.皱眉<,>She frowned when she heard the news.<,>她听到这个消息时皱起了眉头。<,>He frowned at the messy room.<,>他看着凌乱的房间皱起了眉头。<,>The teacher frowned upon students being late.<,>老师对学生迟到表示不满。<,>frown→发音似"烦恼"→皱眉表示烦恼<,>brown(adj.棕色的)/crown(n.王冠)  

decline<,>/dɪˈklaɪn/<,>/dɪˈklaɪn/<,>v.下降/v.减少/v.拒绝<,>The number of students has declined this year.<,>今年学生人数有所下降。<,>She declined the invitation politely.<,>她礼貌地拒绝了邀请。<,>The quality of the product has declined recently.<,>最近产品质量有所下降。<,>de(向下)+cline(倾斜)→向下倾斜→下降<,>incline(v.倾斜)/recline(v.斜靠)  

originate<,>/əˈrɪdʒɪneɪt/<,>/əˈrɪdʒɪneɪt/<,>v.开始<,>The tradition originates from ancient times.<,>这个传统源于古代。<,>The idea originated in a brainstorming session.<,>这个想法源于一次头脑风暴会议。<,>The river originates in the mountains.<,>这条河发源于山区。<,>origin(起源)+ate(动词后缀)→开始<,>original(adj.原始的)/abbreviate(v.缩写)
prospect<,>/ˈprɒspekt/<,>/ˈprɑːspekt/<,>n.前景/n.前途<,>The job offers excellent career prospects.<,>这份工作提供了极好的职业前景。<,>There is a prospect of rain tomorrow.<,>明天有可能下雨。<,>He was excited about the prospect of traveling abroad.<,>他对出国旅行的前景感到兴奋。<,>pro(向前)+spect(看)→向前看→前景<,>perspective(n.视角/n.观点)/prosper(v.繁荣/v.成功)  

curious<,>/ˈkjʊəriəs/<,>/ˈkjʊriəs/<,>adj.好奇的<,>She was curious about the new student in class.<,>她对班上新来的学生感到好奇。<,>The cat gave me a curious look.<,>那只猫好奇地看了我一眼。<,>He has a curious habit of collecting bottle caps.<,>他有一个奇怪的收集瓶盖的习惯。<,>cur(关心)+ious(形容词后缀)→关心的→好奇的<,>furious(adj.愤怒的)/curiosity(n.好奇心)  

incentive<,>/ɪnˈsentɪv/<,>/ɪnˈsentɪv/<,>n.动机/n.刺激<,>The company offers financial incentives for good performance.<,>公司为表现优秀的员工提供经济奖励。<,>There is little incentive for him to work harder.<,>他没有什么动力去更努力工作。<,>Tax incentives were introduced to encourage investment.<,>政府推出了税收激励政策来鼓励投资。<,>in(进入)+cent(唱歌)+ive→让人心里"唱起歌"→激励<,>incense(n.香/v.激怒)/intensive(adj.密集的)  

virus<,>/ˈvaɪrəs/<,>/ˈvaɪrəs/<,>n.病毒<,>The flu virus spreads quickly in winter.<,>流感病毒在冬季传播得很快。<,>His computer was infected by a virus.<,>他的电脑感染了病毒。<,>Scientists are studying the structure of the virus.<,>科学家们正在研究这种病毒的结构。<,>vir(毒)+us→病毒<,>viral(adj.病毒性的)/virulent(adj.剧毒的)  

cultivate<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>v.培养/v.养成<,>She cultivated a love of reading in her children.<,>她培养了孩子们对阅读的热爱。<,>He has cultivated good relationships with his colleagues.<,>他与同事们建立了良好的关系。<,>This land has been cultivated for centuries.<,>这片土地已经被耕种了几个世纪。<,>cult(培养)+ivate(动词后缀)→培养<,>culture(n.文化)/agriculture(n.农业)  

potential<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>n.潜力/adj.有可能的/adj.潜在的<,>She has the potential to become a great leader.<,>她有成为伟大领袖的潜力。<,>There is potential danger in this plan.<,>这个计划存在潜在危险。<,>The potential benefits of the project are enormous.<,>这个项目的潜在收益是巨大的。<,>potent(有力的)+ial→有力量的→潜力<,>essential(adj.必要的)/influential(adj.有影响力的)  

reluctant<,>/rɪˈlʌktənt/<,>/rɪˈlʌktənt/<,>adj.不愿意的/adj.勉强的<,>He was reluctant to admit his mistake.<,>他不愿意承认自己的错误。<,>She gave a reluctant smile.<,>她勉强地笑了笑。<,>They were reluctant participants in the project.<,>他们是这个项目的勉强参与者。<,>re(反)+luct(挣扎)+ant→反着挣扎→不情愿的<,>relevant(adj.相关的)/resultant(adj.作为结果的)  

miserable<,>/ˈmɪzrəbl/<,>/ˈmɪzrəbl/<,>adj.痛苦的<,>He looked miserable after hearing the bad news.<,>听到坏消息后，他看起来很痛苦。<,>They lived in miserable conditions.<,>他们生活在悲惨的条件下。<,>I had a miserable cold last week.<,>上周我得了重感冒，很难受。<,>mis(坏)+erable(可...的)→可悲的<,>miser(n.吝啬鬼)/miracle(n.奇迹)  

persuasion<,>/pəˈsweɪʒn/<,>/pərˈsweɪʒn/<,>n.劝说<,>After much persuasion, she agreed to come with us.<,>经过多次劝说，她同意和我们一起来。<,>He has great powers of persuasion.<,>他有很强的说服力。<,>They used gentle persuasion to change his mind.<,>他们用温和的劝说改变了他的想法。<,>per(完全)+suas(劝告)+ion→完全劝告→说服<,>permission(n.许可)/pervasion(n.扩散)  

competitiveness<,>/kəmˈpetətɪvnəs/<,>/kəmˈpetətɪvnəs/<,>n.竞争力<,>The company's competitiveness in the market is declining.<,>公司在市场上的竞争力正在下降。<,>Education can enhance a country's competitiveness.<,>教育可以提高一个国家的竞争力。<,>His natural competitiveness makes him a good athlete.<,>他与生俱来的竞争意识使他成为一名优秀的运动员。<,>compet(e)(竞争)+itive+ness→竞争力<,>competence(n.能力)/competition(n.比赛)
restriction<,>/rɪˈstrɪkʃn/<,>/rɪˈstrɪkʃən/<,>n.限制/n.限定<,>There are strict restrictions on smoking in public places.<,>公共场所对吸烟有严格的限制。<,>The new law imposes restrictions on the use of plastic bags.<,>新法律对塑料袋的使用施加了限制。<,>Travel restrictions were lifted after the pandemic.<,>疫情过后旅行限制被取消了。<,>re(回)+strict(严格的)+ion(名词后缀)→限制<,>constriction(n.压缩)/restraint(n.克制)/constraint(n.约束)

minor<,>/ˈmaɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪnɚ/<,>adj.小的<,>He suffered only minor injuries in the accident.<,>他在事故中只受了轻伤。<,>This is a minor problem that we can easily solve.<,>这是一个我们可以轻松解决的小问题。<,>She made some minor changes to the document.<,>她对文件做了一些小的修改。<,>min(小)+or(比较级后缀)→较小的<,>major(adj.主要的)/minority(n.少数)/miner(n.矿工)

grain<,>/ɡreɪn/<,>/ɡreɪn/<,>n.谷物/n.粮食<,>Farmers are harvesting grains in the field.<,>农民们正在田里收割谷物。<,>Whole grain bread is healthier than white bread.<,>全麦面包比白面包更健康。<,>The country imports grains to meet its food needs.<,>该国进口粮食以满足食品需求。<,>gr(生长)+ain(名词后缀)→生长出来的东西→谷物<,>grape(n.葡萄)/grainy(adj.粒状的)/granary(n.谷仓)

rate<,>/reɪt/<,>/reɪt/<,>n.比率/n.速率<,>The unemployment rate has dropped this year.<,>今年失业率下降了。<,>The car was traveling at a high rate of speed.<,>汽车以高速行驶。<,>What's the exchange rate between dollars and euros?<,>美元和欧元的汇率是多少？<,>rat(计算)+e→计算出来的结果→比率<,>ratio(n.比例)/rating(n.评级)/ratify(v.批准)

radically<,>/ˈrædɪkli/<,>/ˈrædɪkli/<,>adv.完全地/adv.彻底地<,>Her opinion has changed radically over the years.<,>这些年来她的观点彻底改变了。<,>We need to radically reform our education system.<,>我们需要彻底改革我们的教育体系。<,>The new treatment approach is radically different.<,>新的治疗方法完全不同。<,>radic(根)+al(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→从根本上地<,>radical(adj.激进的)/radicle(n.胚根)/eradicate(v.根除)

distinct<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>adj.明显的/adj.有区别的<,>There's a distinct smell of coffee in the room.<,>房间里有明显的咖啡气味。<,>These two species are quite distinct from each other.<,>这两个物种彼此区别很大。<,>She has a distinct way of speaking.<,>她有独特的说话方式。<,>di(分开)+stinct(刺)→刺出标记→明显的<,>distinctive(adj.独特的)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)/instinct(n.本能)

equality<,>/iˈkwɒləti/<,>/iˈkwɑːləti/<,>n.平等<,>We should strive for gender equality in the workplace.<,>我们应该努力实现工作场所的性别平等。<,>The law guarantees equality for all citizens.<,>法律保障所有公民的平等。<,>Economic equality is still a distant goal in many countries.<,>经济平等在许多国家仍然是一个遥远的目标。<,>equal(平等的)+ity(名词后缀)→平等<,>equity(n.公平)/equation(n.等式)/equivalent(adj.等价的)

hardworking<,>/ˌhɑːdˈwɜːkɪŋ/<,>/ˌhɑːrdˈwɜːrkɪŋ/<,>adj.苦干的/adj.不辞辛劳的<,>She is one of the most hardworking students in the class.<,>她是班上最勤奋的学生之一。<,>Hardworking employees are often promoted quickly.<,>勤奋的员工往往晋升很快。<,>His hardworking attitude impressed his boss.<,>他勤奋的态度给老板留下了深刻印象。<,>hard(努力)+working(工作)→努力工作的<,>hardheaded(adj.精明的)/hardhearted(adj.无情的)/hardware(n.硬件)

qualification<,>/ˌkwɒlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌkwɑːlɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.资格(证明)/n.合格证书<,>You need proper qualifications to apply for this job.<,>你需要适当的资格才能申请这份工作。<,>She has all the necessary teaching qualifications.<,>她拥有所有必要的教学资格证书。<,>The course leads to a professional qualification.<,>该课程可获得专业资格证书。<,>qualify(使合格)+ication(名词后缀)→资格<,>qualifier(n.限定词)/qualitative(adj.定性的)/quality(n.质量))

bacteria<,>/bækˈtɪəriə/<,>/bækˈtɪriə/<,>n.细菌<,>Washing hands helps kill harmful bacteria.<,>洗手有助于杀死有害细菌。<,>Some bacteria are beneficial to human health.<,>有些细菌对人体健康有益。<,>The lab is studying antibiotic-resistant bacteria.<,>实验室正在研究抗药性细菌。<,>bacter(细菌)+ia(复数后缀)→细菌<,>bacterium(n.细菌单数)/bacterial(adj.细菌的)/antibacterial(adj.抗菌的)
corporate<,>/ˈkɔːpərət/<,>/ˈkɔːrpərət/<,>adj.团体的/adj.法人的<,>The corporate culture here is very inclusive.<,>这里的公司文化非常包容。<,>He is a corporate lawyer specializing in mergers.<,>他是一名专攻并购的公司律师。<,>The decision was made at the corporate level.<,>这个决定是在公司层面做出的。<,>corpor(团体)+ate(形容词后缀)→团体的<,>cooperate(v.合作)/incorporate(v.合并)  

undermine<,>/ˌʌndəˈmaɪn/<,>/ˌʌndərˈmaɪn/<,>v.逐渐削弱/v.逐渐动摇<,>Constant criticism can undermine a person's confidence.<,>持续的批评会削弱一个人的信心。<,>The scandal undermined public trust in the government.<,>这起丑闻动摇了公众对政府的信任。<,>Water has undermined the foundations of the house.<,>水逐渐侵蚀了房子的地基。<,>under(下面)+mine(挖)→在下面挖→削弱<,>underline(v.强调)/mine(n.矿井)  

selfish<,>/ˈselfɪʃ/<,>/ˈselfɪʃ/<,>adj.自私的<,>It was selfish of him to take the last piece of cake.<,>他拿走最后一块蛋糕太自私了。<,>Her selfish behavior ruined the team spirit.<,>她自私的行为破坏了团队精神。<,>Don't be selfish - share your toys with your brother.<,>别自私—和弟弟分享你的玩具。<,>self(自己)+ish(形容词后缀)→自私的<,>selfless(adj.无私的)/fish(n.鱼)  

cater<,>/ˈkeɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈkeɪtər/<,>v.迎合<,>The restaurant caters to vegetarian customers.<,>这家餐厅迎合素食顾客。<,>TV programs should cater to different age groups.<,>电视节目应该迎合不同年龄群体。<,>We can cater for up to 200 guests at the wedding.<,>我们可以为多达200位婚礼宾客提供餐饮服务。<,>cat(猫)+er→猫喜欢被迎合→迎合<,>caterpillar(n.毛毛虫)/later(adv.稍后)  

survival<,>/səˈvaɪvl/<,>/sərˈvaɪvl/<,>n.幸存<,>The survival rate for this disease has improved.<,>这种疾病的存活率已经提高。<,>Basic survival skills are taught in the military.<,>军队教授基本的生存技能。<,>The survival of the species depends on conservation efforts.<,>这个物种的生存取决于保护工作。<,>sur(超过)+viv(活)+al→活得超过别人→幸存<,>revival(n.复兴)/arrival(n.到达)  

favor<,>/ˈfeɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈfeɪvər/<,>v.偏好/v.较喜欢<,>I favor the first proposal over the second one.<,>比起第二个方案，我更喜欢第一个。<,>The weather favored our outdoor event.<,>天气对我们的户外活动很有利。<,>Would you do me a favor and pass the salt?<,>你能帮我递一下盐吗？<,>fav(喜爱)+or→偏好<,>flavor(n.味道)/fever(n.发烧)  

conflict<,>/ˈkɒnflɪkt/<,>/ˈkɑːnflɪkt/<,>v.冲突<,>Their opinions conflict on this issue.<,>他们在这个问题上意见冲突。<,>The schedule conflicts with my doctor's appointment.<,>这个时间表和我的医生预约冲突了。<,>Armed conflict broke out in the region.<,>该地区爆发了武装冲突。<,>con(共同)+flict(打击)→互相打击→冲突<,>inflict(v.使遭受)/afflict(v.折磨)  

client<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>n.客户<,>The lawyer met with his client this morning.<,>律师今早会见了他的客户。<,>Our company values every client's feedback.<,>我们公司重视每位客户的反馈。<,>The bank has many high-net-worth clients.<,>这家银行有许多高净值客户。<,>cli(依靠)+ent(人)→依靠的人→客户<,>customer(n.顾客)/patient(n.病人)  

garage<,>/ˈɡærɑːʒ/<,>/ɡəˈrɑːʒ/<,>n.车库<,>Please park your car in the garage.<,>请把你的车停在车库里。<,>He converted his garage into a home office.<,>他把车库改造成了家庭办公室。<,>My bike is in the garage getting repaired.<,>我的自行车在车库里修理。<,>gar(保护)+age(场所)→保护车的场所→车库<,>garbage(n.垃圾)/carriage(n.马车)  

fatigue<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>n.疲劳/n.疲乏<,>After the long hike, we all felt extreme fatigue.<,>长途徒步后，我们都感到极度疲劳。<,>Pilot fatigue is a serious safety concern.<,>飞行员疲劳是一个严重的安全问题。<,>The soldiers marched despite their fatigue.<,>士兵们不顾疲劳继续行军。<,>fat(胖)+igue→胖人容易疲劳→疲劳<,>vague(adj.模糊的)/intrigue(n.阴谋)
plant<,>/plɑːnt/<,>/plænt/<,>n.工厂<,>The new car plant will create thousands of jobs.<,>新的汽车工厂将创造数千个就业机会。<,>This chemical plant produces fertilizers.<,>这家化工厂生产肥料。<,>He works at a power plant.<,>他在发电厂工作。<,>plan(计划)+t(站立)→计划建造站立的东西→工厂<,>planet(n.行星)/plank(n.木板)/plantain(n.车前草)

endanger<,>/ɪnˈdeɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈdeɪndʒər/<,>v.危及/v.危害/v.濒临危险<,>Pollution can endanger marine life.<,>污染会危及海洋生物。<,>His reckless driving endangered passengers.<,>他鲁莽的驾驶危及乘客安全。<,>This species is endangered due to habitat loss.<,>由于栖息地丧失，这个物种濒临危险。<,>en(使)+danger(危险)→使处于危险中→危及<,>endear(v.使受喜爱)/engage(v.从事)/enlarge(v.扩大)

operation<,>/ˌɒpəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːpəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.手术/n.行动<,>The patient is recovering from a heart operation.<,>病人正在从心脏手术中恢复。<,>Military operations were conducted at night.<,>军事行动在夜间进行。<,>The rescue operation lasted three days.<,>救援行动持续了三天。<,>oper(工作)+ation(名词后缀)→工作过程→手术/行动<,>cooperation(n.合作)/operative(adj.操作的)/operator(n.操作员)

handle<,>/ˈhændl/<,>/ˈhændl/<,>v.处理<,>She knows how to handle difficult customers.<,>她知道如何处理难缠的顾客。<,>This software can handle large amounts of data.<,>这个软件能处理大量数据。<,>He couldn't handle the pressure and resigned.<,>他无法处理压力而辞职了。<,>hand(手)+le(小)→用手操作→处理<,>handful(n.一把)/handicap(n.障碍)/handshake(n.握手)

laborious<,>/ləˈbɔːriəs/<,>/ləˈbɔːriəs/<,>adj.费力的<,>Writing a thesis is a laborious process.<,>写论文是个费力的过程。<,>The laborious task took them a whole week.<,>这项费力的工作花了他们整整一周。<,>She made laborious progress in learning Chinese.<,>她学习中文进步缓慢而费力。<,>labor(劳动)+ious(形容词后缀)→需要很多劳动的→费力的<,>laboratory(n.实验室)/labor(n.劳动)/collaborate(v.合作)

passion<,>/ˈpæʃn/<,>/ˈpæʃn/<,>n.热情/n.激情<,>He plays football with great passion.<,>他踢足球充满热情。<,>Her passion for art is inspiring.<,>她对艺术的激情令人鼓舞。<,>They argued with passion about politics.<,>他们热烈地争论政治问题。<,>pass(感觉)+ion(名词后缀)→强烈的感觉→激情<,>passive(adj.被动的)/compassion(n.同情)/passionate(adj.热情的)

cooperative<,>/kəʊˈɒpərətɪv/<,>/koʊˈɑːpərətɪv/<,>adj.合作的<,>The students were very cooperative during the project.<,>学生们在项目中非常合作。<,>We need a cooperative effort to solve this problem.<,>我们需要共同努力来解决这个问题。<,>She has a cooperative attitude at work.<,>她在工作中态度合作。<,>co(共同)+oper(工作)+ative(形容词后缀)→共同工作的→合作的<,>operate(v.操作)/cooperation(n.合作)/operator(n.操作员)
