inflate<,>/ɪnˈfleɪt/<,>/ɪnˈfleɪt/<,>v.(使)膨胀<,>They used a pump to inflate the balloons.<,>他们用泵给气球充气。<,>The media tends to inflate minor issues.<,>媒体倾向于夸大次要问题。<,>Economic bubbles inflate and then burst.<,>经济泡沫膨胀然后破裂。<,>in(进入)+flate(吹)→吹入空气→膨胀<,>deflate(v.放气)/flat(adj.平的)/inflation(n.通货膨胀)

resourceful<,>/rɪˈsɔːsfl/<,>/rɪˈsɔːrsfl/<,>adj.机智的<,>She was resourceful in solving the problem.<,>她机智地解决了问题。<,>The resourceful boy made a toy from scraps.<,>这个机智的男孩用废料做了个玩具。<,>We need resourceful people in emergencies.<,>在紧急情况下我们需要机智的人。<,>resource(资源)+ful(充满)→充满资源的→机智的<,>source(n.来源)/course(n.课程)/force(n.力量)

exaggerate<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>v.夸张<,>Don't exaggerate - it wasn't that bad.<,>别夸张，没那么糟糕。<,>He tends to exaggerate his achievements.<,>他倾向于夸大自己的成就。<,>The media often exaggerates the facts.<,>媒体经常夸大事实。<,>ex(出)+agger(堆积)+ate(动词后缀)→堆积过多→夸张<,>aggregate(v.聚集)/generation(n.一代人)/accelerate(v.加速)
loan<,>/ləʊn/<,>/loʊn/<,>n.贷款<,>He took out a loan to buy a new car.<,>他贷款买了一辆新车。<,>The bank approved her loan application.<,>银行批准了她的贷款申请。<,>Repaying the loan will take five years.<,>还清贷款需要五年时间。<,>loan(发音类似"漏")→钱"漏"出去→贷款<,>lend(v.借出)/borrow(v.借入)/own(v.拥有)

vocabulary<,>/vəˈkæbjələri/<,>/voʊˈkæbjəleri/<,>n.词汇<,>Reading books can expand your vocabulary.<,>阅读书籍可以扩大你的词汇量。<,>She has an impressive vocabulary for a five-year-old.<,>对于一个五岁的孩子来说，她的词汇量令人印象深刻。<,>This dictionary contains over 50,000 vocabulary entries.<,>这本词典包含超过5万个词汇条目。<,>voc(声音)+abul(能够)+ary→能够发声的东西→词汇<,>voluntary(adj.自愿的)/vocal(adj.声音的)/vocational(adj.职业的)

illustrate<,>/ˈɪləstreɪt/<,>/ˈɪləˌstreɪt/<,>v.说明/阐明<,>The professor used diagrams to illustrate his point.<,>教授用图表来说明他的观点。<,>This story illustrates the importance of honesty.<,>这个故事阐明了诚实的重要性。<,>Let me illustrate my idea with an example.<,>让我用一个例子来说明我的想法。<,>il(进入)+lustr(光)+ate→使明白→说明<,>demonstrate(v.演示)/explain(v.解释)/illuminate(v.阐明)

overflow<,>/ˌəʊvəˈfləʊ/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈfloʊ/<,>v.溢出/淹没<,>The river overflowed after heavy rains.<,>大雨过后河水泛滥了。<,>Her heart overflowed with joy.<,>她心中充满了喜悦。<,>The bathtub is about to overflow!<,>浴缸快要溢出来了!<,>over(过度)+flow(流)→流得过多→溢出<,>overfly(v.飞越)/overcome(v.克服)/overload(v.超载)

fantasize<,>/ˈfæntəsaɪz/<,>/ˈfæntəˌsaɪz/<,>v.想象/幻想<,>She often fantasizes about traveling the world.<,>她经常幻想环游世界。<,>Don't fantasize about winning the lottery.<,>别幻想中彩票了。<,>He fantasized about becoming a famous actor.<,>他幻想着成为著名演员。<,>fantasy(幻想)+ize(动词后缀)→幻想<,>fantastic(adj.极好的)/fantasy(n.幻想)/fancy(v.想象)

amusing<,>/əˈmjuːzɪŋ/<,>/əˈmjuːzɪŋ/<,>adj.有趣的/好玩的<,>The clown's performance was very amusing.<,>小丑的表演非常有趣。<,>That's an amusing story you told.<,>你讲的故事真有趣。<,>I find his jokes quite amusing.<,>我觉得他的笑话很好玩。<,>a(使)+muse(缪斯)+ing→像缪斯女神一样使人快乐→有趣的<,>amazed(adj.惊讶的)/amusingly(adv.有趣地)/amusement(n.娱乐)

universal<,>/ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːsl/<,>/ˌjuːnɪˈvɜːrsl/<,>adj.宇宙的/全世界的/普遍的<,>English is becoming a universal language.<,>英语正在成为一种世界性语言。<,>This is a universal truth.<,>这是一个普遍真理。<,>The film has universal appeal.<,>这部电影具有普遍的吸引力。<,>uni(单一)+vers(转)+al→转向一体的→宇宙的<,>universe(n.宇宙)/university(n.大学)/uniform(adj.统一的)

generate<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>/ˈdʒenəˌreɪt/<,>v.产生<,>The dam generates electricity for the whole region.<,>大坝为整个地区发电。<,>This machine generates a lot of heat.<,>这台机器产生大量热量。<,>Their discussion generated many good ideas.<,>他们的讨论产生了许多好主意。<,>gener(产生)+ate(动词后缀)→产生<,>generator(n.发电机)/generation(n.一代)/degenerate(v.退化)

schedule<,>/ˈʃedjuːl/<,>/ˈskedʒuːl/<,>n.日程表<,>What's your schedule for tomorrow?<,>你明天的日程安排是什么?<,>I have a tight schedule this week.<,>这周我的日程很紧。<,>Please check the train schedule.<,>请查看火车时刻表。<,>sched(纸)+ule(小)→小纸片→日程表<,>schema(n.图解)/scheme(n.计划)/school(n.学校)

backslide<,>/ˈbækslaɪd/<,>/ˈbækˌslaɪd/<,>v.倒退/退步<,>After quitting smoking, he backslid and started again.<,>戒烟后他又退步了，重新开始吸烟。<,>Her grades have backslid this semester.<,>这学期她的成绩退步了。<,>The country's economy is backsliding.<,>这个国家的经济正在倒退。<,>back(向后)+slide(滑动)→向后滑→倒退<,>backward(adj.向后的)/backfire(v.事与愿违)/backlash(n.强烈反对)
particle<,>/ˈpɑːtɪkl/<,>/ˈpɑːrtɪkl/<,>n.微粒<,>Dust particles floated in the sunlight.<,>灰尘微粒在阳光下漂浮。<,>A particle of sand got stuck in my eye.<,>一粒沙子进了我的眼睛。<,>Scientists are studying subatomic particles.<,>科学家正在研究亚原子粒子。<,>part(部分)+icle(小)→微小的部分<,>article(n.文章)/particular(adj.特别的)  

menu<,>/ˈmenjuː/<,>/ˈmɛnju/<,>n.菜单<,>Could I see the dessert menu, please?<,>请给我看看甜点菜单好吗？<,>The restaurant updates its menu seasonally.<,>这家餐厅按季节更新菜单。<,>He scrolled through the software's dropdown menu.<,>他浏览了软件的下拉菜单。<,>men(人)+u→给人选择的东西<,>manual(n.手册)/manure(n.肥料)  

reward<,>/rɪˈwɔːd/<,>/rɪˈwɔrd/<,>n.报答/n.奖赏/v.报答/v.奖赏<,>She received a reward for her bravery.<,>她因勇敢行为获得了奖励。<,>Good grades are the reward for hard work.<,>好成绩是努力学习的回报。<,>The company rewards employees with bonuses.<,>公司用奖金奖励员工。<,>re(回)+ward(方向)→回报<,>award(n.奖品)/forward(adv.向前)  

reproduce<,>/ˌriːprəˈdjuːs/<,>/ˌriːprəˈduːs/<,>v.复制<,>This printer can reproduce colors accurately.<,>这台打印机能精确复制颜色。<,>Some animals can reproduce lost limbs.<,>有些动物能再生失去的肢体。<,>The documentary reproduces historical events vividly.<,>这部纪录片生动再现了历史事件。<,>re(再)+produce(生产)→再生产<,>product(n.产品)/reduce(v.减少)  

worsen<,>/ˈwɜːsn/<,>/ˈwɜːrsn/<,>v.(使)变得更坏<,>His condition worsened overnight.<,>他的病情一夜之间恶化了。<,>The traffic situation continues to worsen.<,>交通状况持续恶化。<,>Lack of sleep can worsen your mood.<,>睡眠不足会恶化你的情绪。<,>worse(更坏)+en(使)→使更坏<,>worship(v.崇拜)/woolen(adj.羊毛的)  

feedback<,>/ˈfiːdbæk/<,>/ˈfiːdbæk/<,>n.反馈<,>We appreciate your feedback on our service.<,>我们重视您对服务的反馈。<,>The teacher gave constructive feedback on my essay.<,>老师对我的论文提出了建设性反馈。<,>The microphone produced loud feedback.<,>麦克风产生了刺耳的反馈音。<,>feed(供给)+back(回)→回馈<,>feed(v.喂养)/backfeed(n.回授)  

equivalent<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>adj.相等的/adj.相当的<,>This amount is equivalent to a month's salary.<,>这笔钱相当于一个月的工资。<,>The word has no equivalent in English.<,>这个词在英语中没有对应词。<,>They offered equivalent value in exchange.<,>他们提供了等值的交换物。<,>equi(相等)+val(价值)+ent→价值相等的<,>equator(n.赤道)/ambivalent(adj.矛盾的)  

resign<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>v.辞职<,>She resigned from her position as manager.<,>她辞去了经理职务。<,>The minister resigned amid the scandal.<,>部长在丑闻中辞职了。<,>He resigned himself to his fate.<,>他听天由命了。<,>re(离开)+sign(签字)→签字离开<,>design(v.设计)/re-sign(v.重新签约)  

motivate<,>/ˈməʊtɪveɪt/<,>/ˈmoʊtɪveɪt/<,>v.促动/v.激发/v.诱导<,>The coach knows how to motivate players.<,>教练懂得如何激励队员。<,>What motivated you to apply for this job?<,>是什么促使你申请这份工作？<,>Bonus schemes motivate employees to work harder.<,>奖金制度激励员工更努力工作。<,>motiv(动机)+ate(使)→使有动机<,>motive(n.动机)/motivation(n.动力)  

compel<,>/kəmˈpel/<,>/kəmˈpɛl/<,>v.强迫<,>The law compels companies to disclose this information.<,>法律强制公司披露这些信息。<,>His illness compelled him to retire early.<,>疾病迫使他提前退休。<,>I feel compelled to tell the truth.<,>我觉得必须说出真相。<,>com(共同)+pel(推)→一起推→强迫<,>repel(v.击退)/expel(v.驱逐)
revise<,>/rɪˈvaɪz/<,>/rɪˈvaɪz/<,>v.修订<,>I need to revise my essay before submitting it.<,>我需要在提交前修订我的文章。<,>The teacher asked us to revise our answers.<,>老师要求我们修改答案。<,>He revised his opinion after hearing the new evidence.<,>听到新证据后他修正了自己的观点。<,>re(重新)+vis(看)+e→重新看→修订<,>review(v. 复习/n.评论)/devise(v.设计/n.遗赠)

dampen<,>/ˈdæmpən/<,>/ˈdæmpən/<,>v.抑制<,>The rain dampened our enthusiasm for the picnic.<,>下雨抑制了我们野餐的热情。<,>Bad news can dampen one's spirits.<,>坏消息会抑制人的情绪。<,>She tried to dampen the noise with a pillow.<,>她试图用枕头抑制噪音。<,>damp(潮湿的)+en(使)→使潮湿→抑制<,>damp(adj.潮湿的)/damper(n.消音器)

prosperity<,>/prɒˈsperəti/<,>/prɑːˈsperəti/<,>n.繁荣<,>The country enjoyed a period of great prosperity.<,>这个国家经历了一段繁荣时期。<,>Economic prosperity benefits all citizens.<,>经济繁荣惠及所有公民。<,>Their business brought prosperity to the family.<,>他们的生意给家庭带来了繁荣。<,>pro(向前)+sper(希望)+ity→向前有希望→繁荣<,>prosper(v.繁荣)/posterity(n.后代)

flow<,>/fləʊ/<,>/floʊ/<,>n.流动/v.流动<,>The flow of traffic was smooth this morning.<,>今早交通流动很顺畅。<,>Tears began to flow down her cheeks.<,>泪水开始顺着她的脸颊流下。<,>Electricity flows through the wires.<,>电流通过电线流动。<,>f(风)+low(低)→风在低处流动<,>flaw(n.瑕疵)/flew(v.飞，fly过去式)

humanity<,>/hjuːˈmænəti/<,>/hjuːˈmænəti/<,>n.人类〔总称〕/n.人性<,>Advances in medicine benefit all humanity.<,>医学进步造福全人类。<,>He showed great humanity in helping the refugees.<,>他在帮助难民时表现出极大的人性。<,>The museum celebrates human creativity and humanity.<,>这个博物馆颂扬人类的创造力和人性。<,>human(人)+ity→人类/人性<,>humane(adj.人道的)/humidity(n.湿度)

sideways<,>/ˈsaɪdweɪz/<,>/ˈsaɪdweɪz/<,>adv.向侧面<,>He glanced sideways at his friend.<,>他向侧面瞥了一眼他的朋友。<,>The crab moves sideways.<,>螃蟹横着走。<,>She slipped and fell sideways.<,>她滑倒向侧面摔去。<,>side(边)+ways(方向)→向边的方向→向侧面<,>sidewalk(n.人行道)/sidekick(n.助手)

pursue<,>/pəˈsjuː/<,>/pərˈsuː/<,>v.追求<,>She decided to pursue a career in medicine.<,>她决定追求医学事业。<,>The police pursued the thief through the streets.<,>警察在街上追捕小偷。<,>He pursued his dream of becoming an artist.<,>他追求成为艺术家的梦想。<,>pur(完全)+sue(跟随)→完全跟随→追求<,>pursuit(n.追求)/purser(n.事务长)

innovate<,>/ˈɪnəveɪt/<,>/ˈɪnəveɪt/<,>v.创新/v.革新<,>The company needs to innovate to stay competitive.<,>公司需要创新以保持竞争力。<,>They innovated a new production method.<,>他们革新了新的生产方法。<,>Young people often bring fresh ideas and innovate.<,>年轻人经常带来新想法并创新。<,>in(进入)+nov(新)+ate→使进入新状态→创新<,>innovation(n.创新)/renovate(v.翻新)

mill<,>/mɪl/<,>/mɪl/<,>n.工厂<,>There's an old paper mill by the river.<,>河边有家老造纸厂。<,>Flour is produced in a flour mill.<,>面粉在面粉厂生产。<,>He worked in a steel mill for twenty years.<,>他在钢铁厂工作了二十年。<,>m(磨)+ill(病)→工厂里长期磨东西会生病<,>meal(n.膳食)/mild(adj.温和的)

promotional<,>/prəˈməʊʃənl/<,>/prəˈmoʊʃənl/<,>adj.促销的<,>The company is running a promotional campaign.<,>公司正在进行促销活动。<,>We got these mugs as promotional items.<,>我们得到这些杯子作为促销品。<,>She works in the promotional department.<,>她在促销部门工作。<,>promotion(促销)+al→促销的<,>promotion(n.晋升)/demotional(adj.情绪化的)
dump<,>/dʌmp/<,>/dʌmp/<,>v.扔下/v.倾倒/v.倾销<,>He dumped all his old books in the trash.<,>他把所有旧书都扔进了垃圾桶。<,>The company was accused of dumping cheap products in the market.<,>这家公司被指控在市场上倾销廉价产品。<,>She dumped her boyfriend after the argument.<,>争吵后她甩了她的男朋友。<,>dum(笨重)+p(动作)→笨重地扔下<,>damp(adj.潮湿的)/dumpster(n.垃圾箱)/jump(v.跳跃)

resist<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>v.抵抗/v.抗拒<,>The protesters resisted the police with all their might.<,>抗议者们全力抵抗警察。<,>I can't resist the temptation of chocolate.<,>我无法抗拒巧克力的诱惑。<,>This material resists heat very well.<,>这种材料非常耐热。<,>re(反)+sist(站)→反着站→抵抗<,>persist(v.坚持)/insist(v.坚持)/desist(v.停止)

source<,>/sɔːs/<,>/sɔːrs/<,>n.来源<,>The river is the main source of water for the city.<,>这条河是该市的主要水源。<,>She cited several sources in her research paper.<,>她在研究论文中引用了多个来源。<,>The news came from a reliable source.<,>这消息来自可靠来源。<,>sour(酸)+ce→源头可能发酸→来源<,>sauce(n.酱汁)/resource(n.资源)/sous(adj.在...之下)

legal<,>/ˈliːɡl/<,>/ˈliːɡəl/<,>adj.法律的<,>You should seek legal advice before signing the contract.<,>在签合同前你应该寻求法律建议。<,>Is it legal to park here?<,>在这里停车合法吗？<,>The company operates within legal boundaries.<,>公司在法律范围内运营。<,>leg(法律)+al(形容词后缀)→法律的<,>illegal(adj.非法的)/legacy(n.遗产)/loyal(adj.忠诚的)

picky<,>/ˈpɪki/<,>/ˈpɪki/<,>adj.挑剔的<,>She's very picky about her food.<,>她对食物非常挑剔。<,>The director is picky when choosing actors.<,>导演在选演员时很挑剔。<,>Don't be so picky - just choose one!<,>别这么挑剔了，随便选一个吧！<,>pick(挑选)+y(形容词后缀)→爱挑选的→挑剔的<,>sticky(adj.粘的)/tricky(adj.狡猾的)/pecky(adj.有斑点的)

steal<,>/stiːl/<,>/stil/<,>v.偷窃<,>Someone stole my wallet on the bus.<,>有人在公交车上偷了我的钱包。<,>He was caught stealing from the store.<,>他在商店行窃时被抓。<,>Time steals away when you're having fun.<,>欢乐时光总是过得很快。<,>steel(钢)→偷东西需要钢铁般的胆量→偷窃<,>steel(n.钢铁)/seal(n.海豹)/stale(adj.不新鲜的)

despite<,>/dɪˈspaɪt/<,>/dɪˈspaɪt/<,>prep.尽管<,>Despite the rain, we went for a walk.<,>尽管下雨，我们还是去散步了。<,>He succeeded despite all the difficulties.<,>尽管困难重重，他还是成功了。<,>Despite her age, she's very active.<,>尽管年纪大了，她还是很活跃。<,>de(向下)+spite(恶意)→放下恶意→尽管<,>despise(v.鄙视)/spite(n.恶意)/respite(n.暂缓)

explosion<,>/ɪkˈspləʊʒn/<,>/ɪkˈsploʊʒn/<,>n.爆炸<,>The explosion could be heard miles away.<,>爆炸声几英里外都能听到。<,>There was a gas explosion in the building.<,>大楼里发生了瓦斯爆炸。<,>The population explosion is a serious problem.<,>人口爆炸是个严重问题。<,>ex(出)+plode(鼓掌)+sion→突然爆发出声音→爆炸<,>erosion(n.侵蚀)/explore(v.探索)/exploit(v.剥削)

gap<,>/ɡæp/<,>/ɡæp/<,>n.缝隙/n.缺口/n.差距<,>There's a gap in the fence where the dog escaped.<,>篱笆上有个缺口，狗就是从那里逃走的。<,>The generation gap causes many misunderstandings.<,>代沟导致许多误解。<,>She took a gap year before starting college.<,>她在上大学前休了一年空档年。<,>cap(帽子)→帽子戴不好会有缝隙→缝隙<,>gasp(v.喘息)/grab(v.抓取)/gag(n.塞口物)

relevant<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>/ˈrɛləvənt/<,>adj.有关的/adj.切题的<,>Please provide only relevant information.<,>请只提供相关信息。<,>His experience is highly relevant to the job.<,>他的经验与这份工作高度相关。<,>That's not relevant to our discussion.<,>那与我们的讨论无关。<,>re(再)+lev(举起)+ant→再次举起的→相关的<,>irrelevant(adj.无关的)/elevate(v.提升)/relieve(v.缓解)
ignore<,>/ɪɡˈnɔː(r)/<,>/ɪɡˈnɔːr/<,>v.忽视/v.不顾<,>He chose to ignore her advice.<,>他选择忽视她的建议。<,>You can't ignore the facts.<,>你不能不顾事实。<,>She ignored the noise and kept working.<,>她不顾噪音继续工作。<,>ig(不)+nore(知道)→不知道→忽视<,>neglect(v.疏忽)/disregard(v.漠视)/ignorant(adj.无知的)

complete<,>/kəmˈpliːt/<,>/kəmˈpliːt/<,>v.完成/adj.完整的/adj.彻底的<,>I need one more day to complete the project.<,>我还需要一天来完成这个项目。<,>This is a complete set of tools.<,>这是一套完整的工具。<,>The police made a complete search of the area.<,>警方对该地区进行了彻底的搜查。<,>com(全部)+plete(填满)→全部填满→完成<,>finish(v.完成)/entire(adj.全部的)/complement(n.补充物)

sufficient<,>/səˈfɪʃ(ə)nt/<,>/səˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.足够的<,>We have sufficient evidence to prove his guilt.<,>我们有足够的证据证明他有罪。<,>The food was sufficient for all the guests.<,>食物足够所有客人食用。<,>Her explanation was not sufficient to convince me.<,>她的解释不足以说服我。<,>suf(在下面)+fic(做)+ient→在下面做足了→足够的<,>adequate(adj.充足的)/enough(adj.足够的)/deficient(adj.不足的)

switch<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>v.转变/v.改变<,>He switched jobs last month.<,>他上个月换了工作。<,>Can you switch the light off?<,>你能把灯关掉吗？<,>The conversation suddenly switched to politics.<,>谈话突然转向政治。<,>s(蛇)+witch(女巫)→蛇女巫变身→转变<,>shift(v.转移)/change(v.改变)/swap(v.交换)

request<,>/rɪˈkwest/<,>/rɪˈkwest/<,>n.要求<,>She made a request for more information.<,>她要求获得更多信息。<,>Your request has been denied.<,>你的要求被拒绝了。<,>At the customer's request, we extended the warranty.<,>应顾客要求，我们延长了保修期。<,>re(再)+quest(寻求)→再次寻求→要求<,>require(v.需要)/demand(n.要求)/inquire(v.询问)

stereotype<,>/ˈsteriətaɪp/<,>/ˈsteriətaɪp/<,>n.老套/n.固定模式<,>He doesn't fit the stereotype of a professor.<,>他不符合教授的刻板印象。<,>We should avoid gender stereotypes.<,>我们应该避免性别刻板印象。<,>The movie challenges racial stereotypes.<,>这部电影挑战了种族刻板印象。<,>stereo(立体的)+type(类型)→固定的类型→老套<,>archetype(n.原型)/cliche(n.陈词滥调)/prejudice(n.偏见)

couple<,>/ˈkʌp(ə)l/<,>/ˈkʌpəl/<,>n.夫妻/n.情侣<,>The couple has been married for 30 years.<,>这对夫妻已经结婚30年了。<,>We invited a young couple to dinner.<,>我们邀请了一对年轻情侣共进晚餐。<,>They make a lovely couple.<,>他们是可爱的一对。<,>coup(打击)+le(小)→互相打击的小团体→夫妻<,>pair(n.一对)/duo(n.二人组)/spouse(n.配偶)

honesty<,>/ˈɒnəsti/<,>/ˈɑːnəsti/<,>n.诚实<,>Honesty is the best policy.<,>诚实是最好的策略。<,>I appreciate your honesty.<,>我欣赏你的诚实。<,>There was no doubt about his honesty.<,>他的诚实毋庸置疑。<,>hon(荣誉)+esty→荣誉的品质→诚实<,>integrity(n.正直)/sincerity(n.真诚)/dishonesty(n.不诚实)

transportation<,>/ˌtrænspɔːˈteɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌtrænspərˈteɪʃən/<,>n.运输<,>Public transportation is convenient in this city.<,>这个城市的公共交通很方便。<,>The goods are ready for transportation.<,>货物已准备好运输。<,>Air transportation is the fastest way.<,>航空运输是最快的方式。<,>trans(跨越)+port(港口)+ation→跨越港口的活动→运输<,>transit(n.运输)/shipment(n.装运)/conveyance(n.运送)

physical<,>/ˈfɪzɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈfɪzɪkəl/<,>adj.身体上的<,>Regular physical exercise is important.<,>定期体育锻炼很重要。<,>He had a physical examination yesterday.<,>他昨天做了体检。<,>The injury caused physical pain.<,>受伤造成了身体上的疼痛。<,>phys(自然)+ical→与自然身体有关的→身体上的<,>mental(adj.精神的)/bodily(adj.身体的)/physiological(adj.生理的)
screen<,>/skriːn/<,>/skrin/<,>v.筛查<,>The doctor will screen you for any health issues.<,>医生会为你做健康筛查。<,>She screened the calls before answering.<,>她在接电话前先进行了筛选。<,>Airport security screens all passengers.<,>机场安检对所有乘客进行筛查。<,>scr(筛选)+een→筛选的工具→筛查<,>scene(n.场景)/scream(v.尖叫)/scrutiny(n.详细检查)

interruption<,>/ˌɪntəˈrʌpʃn/<,>/ˌɪntəˈrʌpʃən/<,>n.打扰；中断<,>Sorry for the interruption during your speech.<,>抱歉打断了你的演讲。<,>There was a brief interruption in the power supply.<,>电力供应短暂中断了。<,>Constant interruptions make it hard to focus.<,>不断的打扰让人难以集中注意力。<,>inter(在...之间)+rupt(打破)+ion→在中间打断→中断<,>eruption(n.爆发)/corruption(n.腐败)/disruption(n.扰乱)

dishwasher<,>/ˈdɪʃwɒʃə(r)/<,>/ˈdɪʃˌwɔʃər/<,>n.洗碗机<,>We bought a new dishwasher for the kitchen.<,>我们为厨房买了台新洗碗机。<,>The dishwasher makes cleaning up after meals easier.<,>洗碗机让餐后清洁更轻松。<,>Don't put wooden utensils in the dishwasher.<,>不要把木制餐具放进洗碗机。<,>dish(盘子)+washer(清洗机)→洗盘子的机器→洗碗机<,>laundry washer(洗衣机)/dish soap(洗洁精)/dish rack(碗碟架)

promising<,>/ˈprɒmɪsɪŋ/<,>/ˈprɑːmɪsɪŋ/<,>adj.有希望的，有前途的<,>She is a promising young scientist.<,>她是位有前途的年轻科学家。<,>The initial test results look promising.<,>初步测试结果看起来很有希望。<,>He showed promising talent in music.<,>他在音乐方面展现出有前途的天赋。<,>promise(承诺)+ing→能兑现承诺的→有前途的<,>compromising(adj.妥协的)/promissory(adj.约定的)/promote(v.促进)

vary<,>/ˈveəri/<,>/ˈvɛri/<,>v.不同；变化<,>Prices vary depending on the season.<,>价格随季节而变化。<,>Opinions vary greatly on this issue.<,>对这个问题的看法差异很大。<,>Her mood varies from day to day.<,>她的情绪每天都在变化。<,>var(变化)+y→变化<,>very(adv.非常)/variety(n.多样性)/variable(adj.可变的)

permanent<,>/ˈpɜːmənənt/<,>/ˈpɜːrmənənt/<,>adj.永久的<,>They are looking for a permanent home.<,>他们在寻找一个永久的家。<,>The tattoo is a permanent mark on his skin.<,>纹身是他皮肤上的永久印记。<,>She got a permanent position at the company.<,>她在公司获得了永久职位。<,>per(贯穿)+man(停留)+ent→一直停留的→永久的<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/permeate(v.渗透)/permission(n.许可)

manufacture<,>/ˌmænjuˈfæktʃə(r)/<,>/ˌmænjəˈfæktʃər/<,>v.制造，生产<,>The company manufactures electronic components.<,>这家公司生产电子元件。<,>This plant manufactures over 10,000 cars annually.<,>这家工厂每年生产超过1万辆汽车。<,>They manufacture high-quality furniture.<,>他们制造高品质的家具。<,>manu(手)+fact(做)+ure→用手做→制造<,>manual(adj.手工的)/factory(n.工厂)/manufacturer(n.制造商)
fussy<,>/ˈfʌsi/<,>/ˈfʌsi/<,>adj.爱挑剔的<,>She is very fussy about her food.<,>她对食物非常挑剔。<,>The baby is fussy and won't stop crying.<,>这个婴儿很烦躁，哭个不停。<,>He's fussy about his clothes.<,>他对穿着很讲究。<,>fuss(大惊小怪)+y(形容词后缀)→爱挑剔的<,>fuzzy(adj.模糊的)/hussy(n.轻佻女子)

dictate<,>/dɪkˈteɪt/<,>/ˈdɪkteɪt/<,>v.命令/v.规定/n.命令/n.规定<,>The teacher dictated the rules to the class.<,>老师向全班宣布了规则。<,>The law dictates that all citizens must pay taxes.<,>法律规定所有公民必须纳税。<,>He dictated a letter to his secretary.<,>他向秘书口述了一封信。<,>dict(说)+ate(动词后缀)→命令<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/dictum(n.格言)

professional<,>/prəˈfeʃənl/<,>/prəˈfeʃənl/<,>adj.专业的<,>She is a professional photographer.<,>她是一名专业摄影师。<,>His work shows professional skill.<,>他的工作显示出专业技巧。<,>We need professional advice on this matter.<,>这件事我们需要专业建议。<,>profession(职业)+al(形容词后缀)→专业的<,>personal(adj.个人的)/professor(n.教授)

prosper<,>/ˈprɒspə(r)/<,>/ˈprɑːspər/<,>v.繁荣<,>The business began to prosper after the new management took over.<,>新管理层接手后，生意开始繁荣起来。<,>May your family prosper in the new year.<,>祝您全家在新的一年兴旺发达。<,>The country prospered under wise leadership.<,>这个国家在英明领导下繁荣昌盛。<,>pro(向前)+sper(希望)→繁荣<,>prospect(n.前景)/proper(adj.适当的)

exchange<,>/ɪksˈtʃeɪndʒ/<,>/ɪksˈtʃeɪndʒ/<,>n.交换/n.交流/v.交换/v.交流<,>We exchanged phone numbers at the party.<,>我们在聚会上交换了电话号码。<,>The cultural exchange program was very successful.<,>这次文化交流项目非常成功。<,>I'd like to exchange this shirt for a larger size.<,>我想把这件衬衫换成大一号的。<,>ex(出)+change(改变)→交换<,>excuse(v.原谅)/extend(v.延伸)

concentration<,>/ˌkɒnsnˈtreɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsnˈtreɪʃn/<,>n.集中<,>This job requires great concentration.<,>这项工作需要高度集中注意力。<,>The concentration of students in the library was impressive.<,>图书馆里学生专注学习的样子令人印象深刻。<,>He lost his concentration when the phone rang.<,>电话响起时他分心了。<,>con(共同)+centr(中心)+ation(名词后缀)→集中<,>consideration(n.考虑)/conservation(n.保护)

gesture<,>/ˈdʒestʃə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒestʃər/<,>n.手势/n.姿势<,>He made a rude gesture at the other driver.<,>他向另一个司机做了个粗鲁的手势。<,>A simple gesture can sometimes mean a lot.<,>有时一个简单的手势能表达很多。<,>She gestured for me to come closer.<,>她做手势让我靠近些。<,>gest(携带)+ure(名词后缀)→手势<,>lecture(n.讲座)/posture(n.姿势)

deliberate<,>/dɪˈlɪbərət/<,>/dɪˈlɪbərət/<,>adj.故意的<,>That was a deliberate insult.<,>那是蓄意侮辱。<,>He took deliberate steps toward his goal.<,>他朝着目标谨慎前进。<,>The fire was started by deliberate action.<,>这场火灾是人为故意纵火。<,>de(完全)+liber(权衡)+ate(形容词后缀)→故意的<,>liberate(v.解放)/delicate(adj.精致的)

contribution<,>/ˌkɒntrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːntrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>n.贡献/n.捐款<,>His contribution to science was significant.<,>他对科学的贡献很大。<,>We appreciate your generous contribution.<,>我们感谢您的慷慨捐赠。<,>Everyone can make a contribution to society.<,>每个人都能为社会做贡献。<,>con(共同)+tribute(给予)+ion(名词后缀)→贡献<,>distribution(n.分配)/attribution(n.归因)

bless<,>/bles/<,>/bles/<,>v.保佑/v.祝福<,>God bless you!<,>愿上帝保佑你！<,>The priest blessed the newlyweds.<,>牧师为新婚夫妇祝福。<,>May you be blessed with good health.<,>愿你拥有健康。<,>b(看作be)+less(少)→少灾少难→保佑<,>bleed(v.流血)/bliss(n.极乐)
detective<,>/dɪˈtektɪv/<,>/dɪˈtɛktɪv/<,>n.侦探<,>The detective solved the case in just two days.<,>侦探仅用两天就破案了。<,>She hired a private detective to follow her husband.<,>她雇了一名私家侦探跟踪她丈夫。<,>The detective found some crucial evidence at the crime scene.<,>侦探在犯罪现场发现了一些关键证据。<,>detect(侦查)+ive(人)→侦查的人→侦探<,>detect(v. 发现)/defective(adj.有缺陷的)

evident<,>/ˈevɪdənt/<,>/ˈɛvɪdənt/<,>adj.明显的<,>It was evident that he was lying.<,>很明显他在撒谎。<,>Her happiness was evident from her smile.<,>从她的笑容可以看出她很开心。<,>There is evident progress in his work.<,>他的工作有明显的进步。<,>e(出)+vid(看)+ent→看得出来的→明显的<,>evidence(n.证据)/evidently(adv.明显地)

retreat<,>/rɪˈtriːt/<,>/rɪˈtrit/<,>v.退避/v.后退/v.撤退<,>The army was forced to retreat.<,>军队被迫撤退。<,>He retreated to his room when guests arrived.<,>客人到来时他退避到自己房间。<,>The tide is retreating from the shore.<,>潮水正从岸边退去。<,>re(回)+treat(处理)→处理回去→撤退<,>retreat(n.撤退)/retrace(v.折返)/retract(v.收回)

responsible<,>/rɪˈspɒnsəbl/<,>/rɪˈspɑːnsəbl/<,>adj.负责的/adj.有责任的<,>You are responsible for this project.<,>你负责这个项目。<,>Parents are responsible for their children's safety.<,>父母对孩子的安全负有责任。<,>He is a very responsible employee.<,>他是个非常负责任的员工。<,>response(回应)+ible(能...的)→能回应的→负责的<,>responsive(adj.反应迅速的)/irresponsible(adj.不负责任的)

identity<,>/aɪˈdentəti/<,>/aɪˈdɛntəti/<,>n.身份<,>Please show your identity card.<,>请出示你的身份证。<,>She is struggling with her cultural identity.<,>她正在为自己的文化身份而挣扎。<,>The police are trying to establish the victim's identity.<,>警方正在努力确认受害者的身份。<,>ident(相同)+ity(状态)→相同状态→身份<,>identification(n.鉴定)/identical(adj.相同的)

statistics<,>/stəˈtɪstɪks/<,>/stəˈtɪstɪks/<,>n.统计学/n.数据<,>He is good at statistics.<,>他擅长统计学。<,>The statistics show a rise in unemployment.<,>数据显示失业率上升。<,>We need to analyze these statistics carefully.<,>我们需要仔细分析这些数据。<,>stat(国家)+istics(学科)→国家数据的学科→统计学<,>static(adj.静态的)/statistician(n.统计学家)

appreciate<,>/əˈpriːʃieɪt/<,>/əˈpriʃiˌeɪt/<,>v.感激/v.欣赏<,>I really appreciate your help.<,>我非常感激你的帮助。<,>She appreciates classical music.<,>她欣赏古典音乐。<,>We appreciate the importance of this discovery.<,>我们认识到这一发现的重要性。<,>ap(加强)+preci(价值)+ate→给予价值→欣赏<,>depreciate(v.贬值)/appreciation(n.欣赏)

insult<,>/ɪnˈsʌlt/<,>/ɪnˈsʌlt/<,>v.侮辱<,>His words insulted her deeply.<,>他的话深深侮辱了她。<,>It's illegal to insult someone in public.<,>当众侮辱他人是违法的。<,>Don't insult my intelligence!<,>别侮辱我的智商！<,>in(进入)+sult(跳)→跳进去骂→侮辱<,>result(n.结果)/consult(v.咨询)

neglect<,>/nɪˈɡlekt/<,>/nɪˈɡlɛkt/<,>v.疏忽/v.忽视<,>He neglected his duties.<,>他玩忽职守。<,>Don't neglect your health.<,>不要忽视你的健康。<,>The building has been neglected for years.<,>这栋建筑多年来无人维护。<,>neg(不)+lect(选择)→不选择→忽视<,>select(v.选择)/collect(v.收集)

primarily<,>/ˈpraɪmərəli/<,>/praɪˈmɛrəli/<,>adv.主要地/adv.首先<,>This book is primarily for beginners.<,>这本书主要面向初学者。<,>We're primarily concerned with safety.<,>我们主要关注安全问题。<,>The disease affects primarily children.<,>这种疾病主要影响儿童。<,>primary(主要的)+ly(副词后缀)→主要地<,>primary(adj.主要的)/preliminary(adj.初步的)
long<,>/lɒŋ/<,>/lɔːŋ/<,>v.渴望<,>She longed for a peaceful vacation.<,>她渴望一个宁静的假期。<,>He longed to see his family again.<,>他渴望再次见到家人。<,>The child longed for a new toy.<,>孩子渴望一个新玩具。<,>联想: long(长)→长时间的等待→渴望<,>belong(v.属于)/along(prep.沿着)

incline<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>v.倾向于<,>I incline to agree with your opinion.<,>我倾向于同意你的观点。<,>The road inclines steeply at this point.<,>这条路在这里陡峭地倾斜。<,>She inclined her head in greeting.<,>她点头致意。<,>in(向内)+cline(倾斜)→内心倾斜→倾向于<,>decline(v.下降/v.婉拒)/recline(v.斜靠)

asset<,>/ˈæset/<,>/ˈæsɛt/<,>n.有价值的人(或物)/资产<,>Good communication skills are an asset in any job.<,>良好的沟通技巧在任何工作中都是财富。<,>The company's main asset is its talented employees.<,>公司的主要资产是其有才华的员工。<,>She proved to be a valuable asset to the team.<,>她证明了自己是团队的宝贵财富。<,>as(加强)+set(放置)→放置好的东西→资产<,>assess(v.评估)/access(n.入口)

overtake<,>/ˌəʊvəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈteɪk/<,>v.超车<,>The truck overtook us on the highway.<,>卡车在高速公路上超过了我们。<,>Don't try to overtake on this narrow road.<,>不要在这条狭窄的路上超车。<,>Events have overtaken our original plans.<,>事态发展超出了我们最初的计划。<,>over(超过)+take(拿)→超过<,>undertake(v.承担)/overlook(v.忽视)

extension<,>/ɪkˈstenʃn/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnʃən/<,>n.分机<,>Please dial extension 123 for customer service.<,>请拨打123分机联系客服。<,>I need an extension cord for my lamp.<,>我需要一个延长线来连接台灯。<,>They applied for an extension of their visa.<,>他们申请了签证延期。<,>ex(出)+tens(伸展)+ion→伸展出去→分机/延长<,>extent(n.程度)/intention(n.意图)

engine<,>/ˈendʒɪn/<,>/ˈɛndʒɪn/<,>n.引擎/发动机<,>The car's engine needs repair.<,>汽车的发动机需要修理。<,>He works as an engine driver.<,>他是一名火车司机。<,>Innovation is the engine of economic growth.<,>创新是经济增长的引擎。<,>en(使)+gin(产生)→使产生动力的装置<,>engineer(n.工程师)/gin(n.杜松子酒)

emphasize<,>/ˈemfəsaɪz/<,>/ˈɛmfəˌsaɪz/<,>v.强调<,>The teacher emphasized the importance of punctuation.<,>老师强调了标点符号的重要性。<,>He emphasized his point with a gesture.<,>他用手势强调了他的观点。<,>The report emphasizes the need for change.<,>报告强调了变革的必要性。<,>em(使)+phas(显示)+ize→使显示出来→强调<,>emphasis(n.强调)/empathize(v.共情)

genuine<,>/ˈdʒenjuɪn/<,>/ˈdʒɛnjuɪn/<,>adj.真正的<,>This is a genuine antique, not a fake.<,>这是真正的古董，不是赝品。<,>She showed genuine concern for his welfare.<,>她对他的幸福表现出真诚的关心。<,>His apology seemed genuine.<,>他的道歉似乎是真诚的。<,>gen(产生)+uine→自然产生的→真正的<,>ingenious(adj.聪明的)/genius(n.天才)

fascination<,>/ˌfæsɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌfæsəˈneɪʃən/<,>n.魅力/入迷<,>She has a fascination with ancient history.<,>她对古代历史很着迷。<,>The city holds a special fascination for tourists.<,>这座城市对游客有特殊的魅力。<,>I watched in fascination as the magician performed.<,>我入迷地看着魔术师表演。<,>fascin(迷住)+ation→迷住的状态<,>fascinate(v.使着迷)/fashion(n.时尚)

lodge<,>/lɒdʒ/<,>/lɑːdʒ/<,>v.住宿/暂住<,>We lodged at a small inn for the night.<,>我们在一家小旅馆过夜。<,>He lodged a complaint with the manager.<,>他向经理提出了投诉。<,>Snow lodged in the branches of the trees.<,>雪堆积在树枝上。<,>联想: lodge→谐音"落脚"→暂住<,>lodging(n.寄宿)/ledge(n.壁架)
cheat<,>/tʃiːt/<,>/tʃiːt/<,>v.欺骗/v.作弊<,>He was caught cheating on the exam.<,>他在考试中作弊被抓。<,>Don't cheat your customers with fake products.<,>不要用假货欺骗你的顾客。<,>She felt guilty after cheating in the game.<,>她在游戏中作弊后感到内疚。<,>cheat与"欺骗"发音相似<,>cheap(adj.便宜的)/treat(v.对待)/sheet(n.床单)

security<,>/sɪˈkjʊərəti/<,>/səˈkjʊrəti/<,>n.安全/n.安保<,>The airport has strict security measures.<,>机场有严格的安保措施。<,>He works in cyber security.<,>他从事网络安全工作。<,>Financial security is important for retirement.<,>财务安全对退休很重要。<,>secure(安全的)+ity(名词后缀)<,>safety(n.安全)/privacy(n.隐私)/liberty(n.自由)

painful<,>/ˈpeɪnfl/<,>/ˈpeɪnfl/<,>adj.痛苦的/adj.疼痛的/adj.令人不快的<,>The injury was very painful.<,>这个伤很疼。<,>It was a painful decision to make.<,>这是个痛苦的决定。<,>The breakup was emotionally painful.<,>分手在情感上是痛苦的。<,>pain(疼痛)+ful(形容词后缀)<,>painless(adj.无痛的)/gainful(adj.有收益的)/playful(adj.爱玩的)

emerge<,>/iˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/iˈmɜːrdʒ/<,>v.出现<,>The sun emerged from behind the clouds.<,>太阳从云层后面出现了。<,>New evidence emerged during the investigation.<,>调查中出现了新证据。<,>A new leader emerged after the election.<,>选举后出现了一位新领导人。<,>e(出)+merge(浸入)→从浸入中出来→出现<,>merge(v.合并)/submerge(v.淹没)/immerge(v.浸入)

instance<,>/ˈɪnstəns/<,>/ˈɪnstəns/<,>n.情况/n.例子<,>This is a typical instance of poor management.<,>这是管理不善的典型例子。<,>In this instance, we'll make an exception.<,>在这种情况下，我们会破例。<,>There have been several instances of theft recently.<,>最近发生了好几起盗窃事件。<,>in(在)+stance(站立)→站立的情况→实例<,>instant(adj.立即的)/distance(n.距离)/substance(n.物质)

steep<,>/stiːp/<,>/stiːp/<,>adj.陡峭的/adj.急剧升/降的<,>The hill was too steep to climb.<,>这座山太陡峭了，爬不上去。<,>There was a steep increase in prices.<,>价格急剧上涨。<,>The learning curve is quite steep.<,>学习曲线非常陡峭。<,>steep与"step"(台阶)发音相似<,>deep(adj.深的)/sleep(v.睡觉)/sweep(v.打扫)

rigorous<,>/ˈrɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈrɪɡərəs/<,>adj.严格的<,>The training program is very rigorous.<,>这个训练计划非常严格。<,>They conducted a rigorous investigation.<,>他们进行了严格的调查。<,>The school has rigorous academic standards.<,>学校有严格的学术标准。<,>rigor(严格)+ous(形容词后缀)<,>vigorous(adj.精力充沛的)/rigid(adj.僵硬的)/generous(adj.慷慨的)

persuade<,>/pəˈsweɪd/<,>/pərˈsweɪd/<,>v.说服<,>I tried to persuade him to change his mind.<,>我试图说服他改变主意。<,>She was persuaded to join the team.<,>她被说服加入团队。<,>No one could persuade the stubborn child.<,>没人能说服这个固执的孩子。<,>per(完全)+suade(劝告)→完全劝告→说服<,>dissuade(v.劝阻)/pervade(v.弥漫)/invade(v.入侵)

procedure<,>/prəˈsiːdʒə(r)/<,>/prəˈsiːdʒər/<,>n.程序<,>Follow the correct safety procedure.<,>遵循正确的安全程序。<,>The medical procedure was successful.<,>这个医疗程序很成功。<,>There's a standard procedure for complaints.<,>投诉有标准程序。<,>pro(向前)+ced(走)+ure(名词后缀)→向前走的过程→程序<,>process(n.过程)/precede(v.先于)/proceed(v.继续进行)

signature<,>/ˈsɪɡnətʃə(r)/<,>/ˈsɪɡnətʃər/<,>n.签名<,>Please put your signature on the document.<,>请在文件上签名。<,>His signature was hard to read.<,>他的签名很难辨认。<,>The painting bears the artist's signature.<,>这幅画有艺术家的签名。<,>sign(标记)+ature(名词后缀)→做的标记→签名<,>signal(n.信号)/significant(adj.重要的)/assign(v.分配)
surpass<,>/səˈpɑːs/<,>/sərˈpæs/<,>v.超过<,>Her performance surpassed all expectations.<,>她的表现超出了所有人的预期。<,>He surpassed his previous record in the race.<,>他在比赛中超越了自己之前的记录。<,>The new model surpasses the old one in every aspect.<,>新模型在各方面都超越了旧模型。<,>sur(超过)+pass(通过)→超过<,>surpass(v.超过)/surplus(n.过剩/adj.过剩的)/surpassing(adj.卓越的)

campaign<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>n.活动<,>The charity launched a campaign to raise funds.<,>慈善机构发起了一项筹款活动。<,>He is leading the election campaign.<,>他正在领导选举活动。<,>The advertising campaign was very successful.<,>这次广告活动非常成功。<,>camp(田野)+aign→原指军事行动，现泛指活动<,>campaign(n.活动)/champagne(n.香槟)/companion(n.同伴)

advance<,>/ədˈvɑːns/<,>/ədˈvæns/<,>n.提前/v.前进<,>Please let me know in advance if you can't come.<,>如果你不能来，请提前告诉我。<,>The troops advanced towards the enemy position.<,>部队向敌军阵地前进。<,>She made great advances in her studies.<,>她在学业上取得了很大进步。<,>ad(向)+vance(走)→向前走→前进<,>advance(v.前进)/advantage(n.优势)/advanced(adj.先进的)

charity<,>/ˈtʃærəti/<,>/ˈtʃærəti/<,>n.慈善机构<,>She donated all her money to charity.<,>她把所有的钱都捐给了慈善机构。<,>The charity provides food for the homeless.<,>这家慈善机构为无家可归者提供食物。<,>He works for a children's charity.<,>他在一家儿童慈善机构工作。<,>char(爱)+ity→慈善<,>charity(n.慈善)/clarity(n.清晰)/chastity(n.纯洁)

average<,>/ˈævərɪdʒ/<,>/ˈævərɪdʒ/<,>adj.平常的<,>His grades are about average for the class.<,>他的成绩在班里属于中等水平。<,>The average temperature in July is 30°C.<,>七月的平均气温是30摄氏度。<,>She has an average height for her age.<,>她的身高在同龄人中属于平均水平。<,>aver(鸟)+age→原指鸟的损伤赔偿，后引申为平均<,>average(adj.平常的)/averse(adj.反对的)/avert(v.避免)

indispensable<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbl/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbl/<,>adj.必不可少的<,>Water is indispensable to life.<,>水对生命是必不可少的。<,>He is an indispensable member of our team.<,>他是我们团队中不可或缺的一员。<,>This tool is indispensable for the job.<,>这个工具对这项工作必不可少。<,>in(不)+dis(分开)+pens(衡量)+able→不能分开衡量的→必不可少的<,>indispensable(adj.必不可少的)/dispensable(adj.可有可无的)/indisposed(adj.不舒服的)

irrationally<,>/ɪˈræʃənəli/<,>/ɪˈræʃənəli/<,>adv.不合理地，无理性地<,>He acted irrationally in that situation.<,>他在那种情况下表现得毫无理性。<,>She was crying irrationally for no apparent reason.<,>她毫无理由地无理取闹地哭泣。<,>The decision was made irrationally without proper consideration.<,>这个决定是在没有适当考虑的情况下不合理地做出的。<,>ir(不)+rational(理性的)+ly→不合理地<,>irrationally(adv.不合理地)/rationally(adv.理性地)/irrational(adj.不合理的)

accompany<,>/əˈkʌmpəni/<,>/əˈkʌmpəni/<,>v.陪伴<,>She accompanied me to the hospital.<,>她陪我去医院。<,>The singer was accompanied by a pianist.<,>歌手由一位钢琴家伴奏。<,>Children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult.<,>12岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。<,>ac(向)+company(陪伴)→陪伴<,>accompany(v.陪伴)/company(n.公司)/companion(n.同伴)

aviation<,>/ˌeɪviˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌeɪviˈeɪʃn/<,>n.航空<,>He works in the aviation industry.<,>他在航空业工作。<,>Aviation technology has advanced rapidly.<,>航空技术发展迅速。<,>The museum has a collection of historic aviation artifacts.<,>博物馆收藏有历史性的航空文物。<,>avi(鸟)+ation→像鸟一样飞行→航空<,>aviation(n.航空)/aviary(n.鸟舍)/aviator(n.飞行员)

distress<,>/dɪˈstres/<,>/dɪˈstres/<,>v.使痛苦，悲痛<,>The news distressed her greatly.<,>这个消息让她非常痛苦。<,>He was in obvious distress after the accident.<,>事故后他显然很痛苦。<,>The ship sent out a distress signal.<,>那艘船发出了求救信号。<,>dis(分开)+stress(压力)→被压力分开→痛苦<,>distress(v.使痛苦)/stress(n.压力)/distressed(adj.痛苦的)
invariably<,>/ɪnˈveəriəbli/<,>/ɪnˈvɛriəbli/<,>adv.不变地/adv.一直<,>She is invariably late for meetings.<,>她开会总是迟到。<,>The results were invariably the same.<,>结果总是一样的。<,>He invariably takes the same route to work.<,>他总是走同一条路去上班。<,>in(不)+variable(可变的)+ly(副词后缀)→不变地<,>variable(adj.可变的)/variety(n.多样性)/vary(v.变化)

invest<,>/ɪnˈvest/<,>/ɪnˈvɛst/<,>v.投资<,>He decided to invest in the stock market.<,>他决定投资股票市场。<,>They invested a lot of time in the project.<,>他们在这个项目上投入了大量时间。<,>It's wise to invest in education.<,>投资教育是明智的。<,>in(进入)+vest(衣服)→把钱放进衣服里→投资<,>invent(v.发明)/invite(v.邀请)/infest(v.骚扰)

approximately<,>/əˈprɒksɪmətli/<,>/əˈprɑːksɪmətli/<,>adv.大约<,>The trip will take approximately three hours.<,>这次旅行大约需要三个小时。<,>There are approximately 50 students in the class.<,>班上大约有50名学生。<,>The cost is approximately $100.<,>费用大约是100美元。<,>approximate(adj.近似的)+ly(副词后缀)→大约<,>exactly(adv.精确地)/proximity(n.接近)/proximate(adj.最近的)

conservation<,>/ˌkɒnsəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.保护/n.保存<,>Wildlife conservation is important for the environment.<,>野生动物保护对环境很重要。<,>Energy conservation can reduce costs.<,>节约能源可以降低成本。<,>The museum focuses on art conservation.<,>这个博物馆专注于艺术品保存。<,>con(共同)+serv(保持)+ation(名词后缀)→共同保持→保护<,>reservation(n.预订)/preservation(n.保存)/observation(n.观察)

ease<,>/iːz/<,>/iz/<,>n.轻松/n.舒适<,>He completed the task with ease.<,>他轻松地完成了任务。<,>The medicine brought her some ease.<,>这药让她舒服了一些。<,>She moved with grace and ease.<,>她动作优雅而轻松。<,>easy(adj.容易的)的名词形式<,>disease(n.疾病)/tease(v.取笑)/lease(n.租约)

extracurricular<,>/ˌekstrəkəˈrɪkjələ(r)/<,>/ˌekstrəkəˈrɪkjələr/<,>adj.课外的<,>Extracurricular activities are important for students.<,>课外活动对学生很重要。<,>She participates in many extracurricular clubs.<,>她参加了很多课外俱乐部。<,>The school offers various extracurricular programs.<,>学校提供各种课外项目。<,>extra(额外的)+curricular(课程的)→课外的<,>curriculum(n.课程)/extracorporeal(adj.体外的)/extraneous(adj.外来的)

undoubtedly<,>/ʌnˈdaʊtɪdli/<,>/ʌnˈdaʊtɪdli/<,>adv.无疑<,>He is undoubtedly the best candidate.<,>他无疑是最佳人选。<,>This is undoubtedly a great achievement.<,>这无疑是一个伟大的成就。<,>She will undoubtedly succeed.<,>她无疑会成功。<,>un(不)+doubt(怀疑)+ed+ly(副词后缀)→无疑地<,>doubtful(adj.可疑的)/doubtless(adv.无疑地)/redoubtable(adj.可敬畏的)

excellent<,>/ˈeksələnt/<,>/ˈɛksələnt/<,>adj.卓越的/adj.杰出的/adj.极好的<,>She did an excellent job on the project.<,>她在这个项目上做得非常出色。<,>The food at the restaurant was excellent.<,>这家餐厅的食物非常棒。<,>He has excellent communication skills.<,>他有出色的沟通技巧。<,>excel(v.超过)+lent(形容词后缀)→卓越的<,>excellence(n.卓越)/excel(v.超过)/exceptional(adj.例外的)

investigate<,>/ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt/<,>/ɪnˈvɛstɪɡeɪt/<,>v.调查<,>The police will investigate the crime.<,>警方将调查这起犯罪。<,>Scientists investigate the causes of the disease.<,>科学家们研究这种疾病的成因。<,>We need to investigate this matter further.<,>我们需要进一步调查这件事。<,>in(进入)+vestigate(追踪)→深入追踪→调查<,>investigation(n.调查)/investigator(n.调查员)/investiture(n.授权)

judgement<,>/ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/<,>/ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/<,>n.判断/n.决定<,>He showed good judgement in that situation.<,>他在那种情况下表现出良好的判断力。<,>The court will pass judgement tomorrow.<,>法庭明天将作出判决。<,>I trust your judgement on this matter.<,>在这件事上我相信你的判断。<,>judge(v.判断)+ment(名词后缀)→判断<,>judicial(adj.司法的)/prejudice(n.偏见)/adjudicate(v.判决)
struggle<,>/ˈstrʌɡl/<,>/ˈstrʌɡəl/<,>v.搏斗<,>He struggled to free himself from the ropes.<,>他挣扎着想要挣脱绳索。<,>She struggled with her conscience before making the decision.<,>她在做决定之前内心挣扎了很久。<,>The team struggled to keep up with the competition.<,>这支队伍努力跟上比赛的节奏。<,>stru(看作strength,力量)+ggle→用力量搏斗<,>strangle(v.扼杀)/shuffle(v.拖曳)/scuffle(n.混战)  

prohibitively<,>/prəˈhɪbɪtɪvli/<,>/proʊˈhɪbɪtɪvli/<,>adv.过分地/adv.非常地<,>The cost of living in the city is prohibitively high.<,>这个城市的生活成本高得离谱。<,>The rules were prohibitively strict for new members.<,>这些规定对新成员来说过于严格。<,>Prohibitively expensive tickets kept fans away.<,>票价贵得离谱，把粉丝都吓跑了。<,>prohibit(禁止)+ive(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→禁止到极端程度→过分地<,>prohibitive(adj.禁止的)/permissive(adj.许可的)/inhibitive(adj.抑制的)  

military<,>/ˈmɪlɪtri/<,>/ˈmɪlɪteri/<,>adj.军队的/adj.军事的<,>He comes from a long line of military officers.<,>他出身于军人世家。<,>The country increased its military spending.<,>该国增加了军费开支。<,>Military training is rigorous and demanding.<,>军事训练严格而苛刻。<,>milit(军事)+ary(形容词后缀)→军事的<,>militia(n.民兵)/militate(v.产生影响)/militarism(n.军国主义)  

consequently<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwəntli/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwentli/<,>adv.结果<,>He didn't study, and consequently failed the exam.<,>他没有学习，结果考试不及格。<,>The roads were icy; consequently, many accidents occurred.<,>路面结冰了，结果发生了多起事故。<,>She was late and consequently missed the opening speech.<,>她迟到了，结果错过了开幕致辞。<,>con(共同)+sequ(跟随)+ent(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→跟随而来的结果<,>subsequently(adv.随后)/consequence(n.结果)/sequential(adj.连续的)  

suffer<,>/ˈsʌfə(r)/<,>/ˈsʌfər/<,>v.受苦/v.遭受（痛苦）<,>Many people suffered during the war.<,>许多人在战争中受苦。<,>She suffers from chronic back pain.<,>她患有慢性背痛。<,>The company suffered heavy losses last year.<,>公司去年遭受了重大损失。<,>suf(在...下面)+fer(承受)→在下面承受→遭受<,>buffer(n.缓冲)/supper(n.晚餐)/suffrage(n.选举权)  

visible<,>/ˈvɪzəbl/<,>/ˈvɪzəbəl/<,>adj.看得见的<,>The stars are clearly visible tonight.<,>今晚星星清晰可见。<,>There was visible relief on her face.<,>她脸上明显露出宽慰的表情。<,>The damage is visible to the naked eye.<,>损伤肉眼可见。<,>vis(看)+ible(可...的)→看得见的<,>invisible(adj.看不见的)/vision(n.视力)/visual(adj.视觉的)  

swift<,>/swɪft/<,>/swɪft/<,>adj.迅速的<,>He gave a swift response to the question.<,>他对问题迅速作出了回应。<,>The river has a swift current.<,>这条河水流湍急。<,>Swift action is needed to solve this problem.<,>需要迅速采取行动来解决这个问题。<,>sw(看作speed,速度)+ift→快速的<,>shift(v.移动)/sift(v.筛选)/swiftly(adv.迅速地)  

battle<,>/ˈbætl/<,>/ˈbætl/<,>n.战争/n.战役<,>The battle lasted for three days.<,>这场战役持续了三天。<,>They are fighting a legal battle.<,>他们正在进行一场法律斗争。<,>The Battle of Waterloo was decisive.<,>滑铁卢战役具有决定性意义。<,>bat(打)+tle→打仗→战役<,>bottle(n.瓶子)/cattle(n.牛)/rattle(v.发出咔嗒声)  

liability<,>/ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>n.责任<,>The company accepts no liability for lost items.<,>公司对丢失物品概不负责。<,>His poor English is a liability in this job.<,>他英语不好是这份工作的一个不利条件。<,>She has limited liability as a shareholder.<,>作为股东，她承担有限责任。<,>li(看作lie,躺)+ability(能力)→躺在能力上→责任<,>reliability(n.可靠性)/pliability(n.柔韧性)/viability(n.可行性)  

resistant<,>/rɪˈzɪstənt/<,>/rɪˈzɪstənt/<,>adj.抵抗的/adj.抵制的<,>This material is heat resistant.<,>这种材料耐热。<,>The bacteria are resistant to antibiotics.<,>这种细菌对抗生素有抗药性。<,>She was resistant to change at first.<,>起初她抵制变革。<,>re(反)+sist(站)+ant(形容词后缀)→反着站→抵抗的<,>persistent(adj.坚持的)/insistent(adj.坚持的)/consistent(adj.一致的)
nutritious<,>/njuːˈtrɪʃəs/<,>/nuːˈtrɪʃəs/<,>adj.营养的<,>Eating nutritious food is essential for good health.<,>吃有营养的食物对健康至关重要。<,>This meal is both delicious and nutritious.<,>这顿饭既美味又营养。<,>Children need a nutritious diet to grow properly.<,>孩子们需要营养的饮食才能健康成长。<,>nutri(营养)+tious(形容词后缀)→营养的<,>nutrition(n.营养)/malnourished(adj.营养不良的)

constantly<,>/ˈkɒnstəntli/<,>/ˈkɑːnstəntli/<,>adv.不断地/adv.时常地<,>She is constantly checking her phone for messages.<,>她不断地查看手机信息。<,>The weather here is constantly changing.<,>这里的天气时常变化。<,>He works constantly to improve his skills.<,>他不断地工作以提高技能。<,>constant(持续的)+ly(副词后缀)→不断地<,>consistent(adj.一致的)/inconsistent(adj.不一致的)

familiar<,>/fəˈmɪliə(r)/<,>/fəˈmɪljɚ/<,>adj.熟悉的<,>This place looks familiar to me.<,>这个地方对我来说很熟悉。<,>Are you familiar with this software?<,>你熟悉这个软件吗？<,>His face was familiar, but I couldn't remember his name.<,>他的脸很熟悉，但我想不起他的名字。<,>family(家庭)+iar→像家人一样熟悉<,>similar(adj.相似的)/familial(adj.家庭的)

terribly<,>/ˈterəbli/<,>/ˈterəbli/<,>adv.可怕地/adv.非常<,>I'm terribly sorry for being late.<,>我非常抱歉迟到了。<,>The accident was terribly tragic.<,>这次事故非常悲惨。<,>She felt terribly lonely after her friend moved away.<,>朋友搬走后，她感到非常孤独。<,>terrible(可怕的)+ly(副词后缀)→可怕地/非常<,>horribly(adv.可怕地)/terrific(adj.极好的)

restore<,>/rɪˈstɔː(r)/<,>/rɪˈstɔːr/<,>v.修复<,>They are working to restore the old castle.<,>他们正在修复这座古老的城堡。<,>This treatment can help restore your energy.<,>这种治疗可以帮助恢复你的精力。<,>The government promised to restore peace in the region.<,>政府承诺恢复该地区的和平。<,>re(重新)+store(储存)→重新储存→修复<,>store(v.储存)/restrain(v.抑制)

refine<,>/rɪˈfaɪn/<,>/rɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.改善/v.精炼<,>They refined the design to make it more efficient.<,>他们改进了设计使其更高效。<,>Crude oil needs to be refined before use.<,>原油在使用前需要精炼。<,>She is constantly refining her cooking skills.<,>她不断改善自己的烹饪技巧。<,>re(再)+fine(好的)→使更好→改善/精炼<,>define(v.定义)/confine(v.限制)

inspire<,>/ɪnˈspaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈspaɪr/<,>v.激发/v.鼓舞/v.使产生灵感<,>His speech inspired the whole team.<,>他的演讲鼓舞了整个团队。<,>The beautiful scenery inspired her to write a poem.<,>美丽的风景激发她写了一首诗。<,>Great teachers can inspire their students.<,>伟大的老师能激发学生的灵感。<,>in(进入)+spire(呼吸)→注入精神→鼓舞<,>expire(v.到期)/aspire(v.渴望)

comply<,>/kəmˈplaɪ/<,>/kəmˈplaɪ/<,>v.遵从<,>All employees must comply with company rules.<,>所有员工必须遵守公司规定。<,>The building doesn't comply with safety regulations.<,>这栋建筑不符合安全规定。<,>He refused to comply with their demands.<,>他拒绝遵从他们的要求。<,>com(共同)+ply(折叠)→共同折叠→遵从<,>apply(v.申请)/reply(v.回答)

justice<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>n.公正<,>We must fight for justice and equality.<,>我们必须为公正和平等而战。<,>The judge is known for his sense of justice.<,>这位法官以公正著称。<,>There can be no peace without justice.<,>没有公正就没有和平。<,>just(公正的)+ice(名词后缀)→公正<,>injustice(n.不公正)/adjust(v.调整)

district<,>/ˈdɪstrɪkt/<,>/ˈdɪstrɪkt/<,>n.区<,>She lives in the business district of the city.<,>她住在城市的商业区。<,>This is the oldest district in town.<,>这是镇上最古老的区。<,>The school district has announced new policies.<,>学区宣布了新政策。<,>di(分开)+strict(严格的)→严格划分的区域→区<,>strict(adj.严格的)/restrict(v.限制)
installation<,>/ˌɪnstəˈleɪʃən/<,>/ˌɪnstəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.安装/n.就职/n.就职仪式<,>The installation of the new software took only a few minutes.<,>新软件的安装只需几分钟。<,>His installation as president was a grand ceremony.<,>他的总统就职仪式非常隆重。<,>The art installation attracted many visitors.<,>这个艺术装置吸引了许多参观者。<,>in(进入)+stall(放置)+ation(名词后缀)→安装<,>install(v.安装)/instance(n.例子)/insulation(n.绝缘)

marvelous<,>/ˈmɑːvələs/<,>/ˈmɑːrvələs/<,>adj.引起惊异的<,>The view from the top of the mountain was marvelous.<,>从山顶看到的景色令人惊叹。<,>She did a marvelous job on the project.<,>她在这个项目上做得非常出色。<,>It's marvelous how quickly the children learned the language.<,>孩子们这么快就学会了语言，真是不可思议。<,>marvel(惊奇)+ous(形容词后缀)→令人惊奇的<,>marvel(n.奇迹)/miraculous(adj.奇迹般的)/marginal(adj.边缘的)

provoke<,>/prəˈvəʊk/<,>/prəˈvoʊk/<,>v.激起/v.挑起<,>His rude remarks provoked an angry response.<,>他粗鲁的言论激起了愤怒的反应。<,>The article was intended to provoke discussion.<,>这篇文章旨在引发讨论。<,>Don't provoke the dog, it might bite you.<,>别招惹那只狗，它可能会咬你。<,>pro(向前)+voke(喊叫)→向前喊叫→激起<,>evoke(v.唤起)/revoke(v.撤销)/convoke(v.召集)

lobby<,>/ˈlɒbi/<,>/ˈlɑːbi/<,>n.大堂/v.游说<,>We'll meet you in the hotel lobby at 7 pm.<,>我们晚上7点在酒店大堂见你。<,>The group is lobbying for stricter environmental laws.<,>这个团体正在游说制定更严格的环境法。<,>He spent years lobbying Congress to change the policy.<,>他花了多年时间游说国会改变政策。<,>lob(球)+by(场所)→像球一样人来人往的地方→大堂<,>hobby(n.爱好)/rob(v.抢劫)/blob(n.一滴)

interview<,>/ˈɪntəvjuː/<,>/ˈɪntərvjuː/<,>n.面谈（试）/n.会见/v.采访/v.面试<,>She has a job interview tomorrow morning.<,>她明天上午有个工作面试。<,>The journalist interviewed the president for an hour.<,>记者采访了总统一个小时。<,>During the interview, he asked about my previous experience.<,>在面试中，他询问了我以前的经验。<,>inter(相互)+view(看)→相互看→面试<,>review(v.复习)/preview(n.预览)/overview(n.概述)

release<,>/rɪˈliːs/<,>/rɪˈliːs/<,>v.释放/v.发布<,>The company will release a new product next month.<,>公司下个月将发布一款新产品。<,>The prisoner was released after serving 10 years.<,>这名囚犯在服刑10年后被释放。<,>They decided to release the movie in theaters first.<,>他们决定先在影院上映这部电影。<,>re(重新)+lease(放松)→释放<,>lease(n.租约)/relieve(v.缓解)/relent(v.变温和)

explore<,>/ɪkˈsplɔː(r)/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔːr/<,>v.探索<,>They set out to explore the Amazon rainforest.<,>他们出发去探索亚马逊雨林。<,>The book explores the theme of identity.<,>这本书探讨了身份的主题。<,>Scientists are exploring new ways to treat the disease.<,>科学家正在探索治疗这种疾病的新方法。<,>ex(出)+plore(流出)→流出来→探索<,>explode(v.爆炸)/exploit(v.开采)/export(v.出口)

profound<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>/prəˈfaʊnd/<,>adj.深厚的<,>His death had a profound effect on her.<,>他的去世对她产生了深远的影响。<,>The book contains some profound insights.<,>这本书包含一些深刻的见解。<,>She has a profound knowledge of ancient history.<,>她对古代历史有深厚的知识。<,>pro(向前)+found(基础)→深入基础的→深厚的<,>found(v.建立)/confound(v.混淆)/propound(v.提出)

exploit<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>v.开采<,>The company exploits natural resources in the region.<,>该公司开采该地区的自然资源。<,>He was accused of exploiting his workers.<,>他被指控剥削工人。<,>New technologies allow us to exploit solar energy more efficiently.<,>新技术使我们能更高效地利用太阳能。<,>ex(出)+ploit(折叠)→折叠出来→开采<,>explore(v.探索)/export(v.出口)/explicit(adj.明确的)

startup<,>/ˈstɑːtʌp/<,>/ˈstɑːrtʌp/<,>n.启动/n.开办<,>He works for a tech startup in Silicon Valley.<,>他在硅谷的一家科技初创公司工作。<,>The startup costs for the business were quite high.<,>开办这家企业的启动成本相当高。<,>Many startups fail within the first two years.<,>许多初创企业在头两年内就失败了。<,>start(开始)+up(向上)→向上开始→启动<,>setup(n.设置)/startle(v.惊吓)/stature(n.身高)
constructive<,>/kənˈstrʌktɪv/<,>/kənˈstrʌktɪv/<,>adj.建设的/adj.建设性的<,>She gave some constructive suggestions for the project.<,>她为这个项目提出了一些建设性的建议。<,>His criticism was always constructive and helpful.<,>他的批评总是建设性且有益的。<,>The meeting ended with constructive discussions.<,>会议以建设性的讨论结束。<,>con(共同)+struct(建造)+ive(形容词后缀)→共同建造的→建设性的<,>destructive(adj.破坏性的)/instructive(adj.有教育意义的)  

unbearable<,>/ʌnˈbeərəbl/<,>/ʌnˈbɛrəbəl/<,>adj.无法忍受的<,>The pain was unbearable after the surgery.<,>手术后疼痛难以忍受。<,>The summer heat in this city is unbearable.<,>这个城市的夏日酷热令人难以忍受。<,>Her grief at the loss was unbearable to watch.<,>她失去亲人后的悲痛让人不忍目睹。<,>un(否定)+bear(忍受)+able(能够)→无法忍受的<,>bearable(adj.可忍受的)/unbearably(adv.难以忍受地)  

laundry<,>/ˈlɔːndri/<,>/ˈlɔndri/<,>n.要洗的衣服/n.刚洗过的衣物/n.洗衣房<,>I need to do my laundry this weekend.<,>这个周末我需要洗衣服。<,>She folded the laundry fresh from the dryer.<,>她把刚从烘干机拿出来的衣服叠好。<,>The hotel has a laundry service for guests.<,>酒店为客人提供洗衣服务。<,>laund(洗)+ry(场所)→洗衣的地方→洗衣房<,>launder(v.洗熨)/laundress(n.洗衣女工)  

seize<,>/siːz/<,>/siz/<,>v.抓住<,>The police seized the stolen goods.<,>警方缴获了赃物。<,>She seized the opportunity to study abroad.<,>她抓住了出国留学的机会。<,>He seized my arm to stop me from falling.<,>他抓住我的手臂防止我摔倒。<,>谐音"谁抓"→谁抓住了→抓住<,>cease(v.停止)/size(n.尺寸)  

poison<,>/ˈpɔɪzn/<,>/ˈpɔɪzən/<,>v.使中毒<,>Someone tried to poison the king's food.<,>有人试图在国王的食物里下毒。<,>The chemical can poison the water supply.<,>这种化学品会污染水源。<,>She was poisoned by eating wild mushrooms.<,>她因食用野生蘑菇而中毒。<,>poi(谐音"怕")+son(儿子)→怕儿子中毒→毒药<,>prison(n.监狱)/person(n.人)  

bakery<,>/ˈbeɪkəri/<,>/ˈbeɪkəri/<,>n.面包店<,>I bought fresh bread from the bakery this morning.<,>今天早上我从面包店买了新鲜面包。<,>The bakery on the corner makes delicious pastries.<,>街角的面包店做的糕点很好吃。<,>She works at a local bakery on weekends.<,>她周末在当地一家面包店工作。<,>bake(烘焙)+ry(场所)→烘焙的地方→面包店<,>banker(n.银行家)/baker(n.面包师)  

tent<,>/tent/<,>/tɛnt/<,>n.帐篷<,>We pitched our tent by the lake.<,>我们在湖边搭起了帐篷。<,>The circus tent was brightly colored.<,>马戏团的帐篷颜色鲜艳。<,>They slept in a small tent during the camping trip.<,>露营期间他们睡在小帐篷里。<,>ten(十)+t(形似帐篷)→十个帐篷<,>tend(v.倾向于)/tint(n.色调)  

wedding<,>/ˈwedɪŋ/<,>/ˈwɛdɪŋ/<,>n.婚礼<,>They're planning a summer wedding.<,>他们正在筹划夏季婚礼。<,>The wedding ceremony was beautiful.<,>婚礼仪式很美好。<,>Over 200 guests attended their wedding.<,>200多位宾客参加了他们的婚礼。<,>wed(结婚)+ding(谐音"定")→定下结婚→婚礼<,>weeding(n.除草)/wedded(adj.已婚的)  

fair<,>/feə(r)/<,>/fɛr/<,>n.集市<,>The annual country fair starts next week.<,>一年一度的乡村集市下周开始。<,>We bought handmade crafts at the fair.<,>我们在集市上买了手工艺品。<,>The science fair showcased students' projects.<,>科学展览会展出了学生们的项目。<,>f(谐音"发")+air(空气)→发现空气中有集市的热闹气息→集市<,>fare(n.车费)/fear(n.恐惧)  

geographic<,>/ˌdʒiːəˈɡræfɪk/<,>/ˌdʒiəˈɡræfɪk/<,>adj.地理的<,>The country's geographic features are diverse.<,>这个国家的地理特征多样。<,>This map shows geographic boundaries clearly.<,>这张地图清晰地显示了地理边界。<,>Geographic factors influence climate patterns.<,>地理因素影响气候模式。<,>geo(地球)+graph(写)+ic(形容词后缀)→描写地球的→地理的<,>geography(n.地理学)/geological(adj.地质的)
comprehensive<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>adj.综合的/adj.全面的<,>The book provides a comprehensive overview of world history.<,>这本书全面概述了世界历史。<,>She has a comprehensive knowledge of the subject.<,>她对这个学科有全面的了解。<,>We need a comprehensive plan to solve this problem.<,>我们需要一个全面的计划来解决这个问题。<,>com(全部)+prehend(抓住)+sive→全部抓住→全面的<,>comprehensible(adj.可理解的)/apprehensive(adj.忧虑的)

riot<,>/ˈraɪət/<,>/ˈraɪət/<,>n.暴乱<,>The protest turned into a violent riot.<,>抗议演变成了暴力骚乱。<,>The police were called to control the riot.<,>警察被叫来控制暴乱。<,>Riots broke out in several cities after the verdict.<,>判决宣布后几个城市爆发了骚乱。<,>riot(联想right反写)→暴乱是不对的<,>route(n.路线)/rot(v.腐烂)

conspicuous<,>/kənˈspɪkjuəs/<,>/kənˈspɪkjuəs/<,>adj.显著的<,>Her red dress was very conspicuous in the crowd.<,>她的红色连衣裙在人群中非常显眼。<,>He made a conspicuous effort to improve his grades.<,>他做出了显著的努力来提高成绩。<,>The error was conspicuous to everyone in the room.<,>这个错误对房间里的每个人都很明显。<,>con(共同)+spic(看)+uous→大家都看得见的→显著的<,>suspicious(adj.可疑的)/perspicuous(adj.明白的)

block<,>/blɒk/<,>/blɑːk/<,>v.阻碍/n.街区<,>A fallen tree blocked the road.<,>一棵倒下的树挡住了道路。<,>Let's meet at the coffee shop on the next block.<,>我们在下一个街区的咖啡店见面吧。<,>The new policy may block progress in this area.<,>新政策可能会阻碍这个领域的进展。<,>block(积木)→像积木一样挡住<,>black(adj.黑色的)/bloc(n.集团)

acute<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>adj.敏锐的<,>Dogs have an acute sense of smell.<,>狗有敏锐的嗅觉。<,>She has an acute understanding of human nature.<,>她对人性有敏锐的理解。<,>The patient is suffering from acute pain.<,>病人正遭受剧痛。<,>a+cute(聪明)→一个聪明的人→敏锐的<,>cute(adj.可爱的)/acuity(n.敏锐)

endure<,>/ɪnˈdjʊə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈdʊr/<,>v.忍耐/v.容忍<,>She endured years of hardship to raise her children.<,>她忍受了多年的艰辛来抚养孩子。<,>I can't endure this noise any longer.<,>我再也无法忍受这种噪音了。<,>These traditions have endured for centuries.<,>这些传统已经延续了几个世纪。<,>en(使)+dure(持久)→使持久→忍耐<,>endurance(n.耐力)/ensure(v.确保)

assembly<,>/əˈsembli/<,>/əˈsembli/<,>n.装配<,>The car assembly line runs 24 hours a day.<,>汽车装配线每天24小时运转。<,>All the parts are ready for assembly.<,>所有零件都已准备好进行装配。<,>The school holds a weekly assembly for all students.<,>学校每周为所有学生举行一次集会。<,>as(朝向)+semble(相似)→把相似的零件放到一起→装配<,>resemble(v.相似)/ensemble(n.整体)

opponent<,>/əˈpəʊnənt/<,>/əˈpoʊnənt/<,>n.对手<,>He defeated his opponent in the chess match.<,>他在象棋比赛中击败了对手。<,>The senator's main opponent in the election was inexperienced.<,>参议员在选举中的主要对手缺乏经验。<,>She shook hands with her opponent after the game.<,>比赛后她和对手握了手。<,>op(反)+pon(放)+ent→放在对立面的人→对手<,>component(n.部件)/proponent(n.支持者)

confront<,>/kənˈfrʌnt/<,>/kənˈfrʌnt/<,>v.面对<,>You need to confront your fears to overcome them.<,>你需要面对恐惧才能克服它们。<,>The protesters confronted the police outside the building.<,>抗议者在大楼外与警察对峙。<,>We are confronted with a difficult decision.<,>我们面临一个艰难的决定。<,>con(共同)+front(前面)→一起站到前面→面对<,>confine(v.限制)/confess(v.承认)

stir<,>/stɜː(r)/<,>/stɜːr/<,>v.搅动/v.煽动/v.激起<,>Stir the soup gently to prevent burning.<,>轻轻搅动汤以防烧焦。<,>His speech stirred the crowd to action.<,>他的演讲煽动人群采取行动。<,>The news stirred memories of her childhood.<,>这个消息激起了她对童年的回忆。<,>st(站)+ir(人)→站着的人搅动<,>star(n.星星)/stair(n.楼梯)
rocket<,>/ˈrɒkɪt/<,>/ˈrɑːkɪt/<,>n.火箭/v.猛增<,>The rocket was launched into space.<,>火箭被发射到太空。<,>Prices have rocketed in recent months.<,>最近几个月物价猛涨。<,>He watched the rocket disappear into the clouds.<,>他看着火箭消失在云层中。<,>rock(岩石)+et(小)→像小石头一样快速上升→火箭<,>pocket(n.口袋)/socket(n.插座)/bucket(n.桶)  

attribute<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>v.归因于<,>She attributes her success to hard work.<,>她把成功归因于努力工作。<,>The painting was attributed to an unknown artist.<,>这幅画被归因于一位不知名的艺术家。<,>He attributes his good health to regular exercise.<,>他把身体健康归因于经常锻炼。<,>at(加强)+tribute(给予)→把…给予→归因于<,>contribute(v.贡献)/distribute(v.分配)/retribution(n.报应)  

sentence<,>/ˈsentəns/<,>/ˈsentəns/<,>n.判决/v.判决<,>The judge passed a severe sentence on the criminal.<,>法官对罪犯作出了严厉的判决。<,>The court sentenced him to five years in prison.<,>法庭判处他五年监禁。<,>This sentence is too long and complicated.<,>这个句子太长太复杂了。<,>sent(感觉)+ence(名词后缀)→表达感觉的话→判决<,>sequence(n.顺序)/essence(n.本质)/absence(n.缺席)  

tempting<,>/ˈtemptɪŋ/<,>/ˈtemptɪŋ/<,>adj.诱人的/吸引人的<,>The cake looked very tempting.<,>这个蛋糕看起来非常诱人。<,>It's tempting to stay in bed on cold mornings.<,>寒冷的早晨赖在床上很诱人。<,>He refused the tempting offer.<,>他拒绝了那个诱人的提议。<,>tempt(诱惑)+ing(形容词后缀)→诱人的<,>attempting(v.尝试)/contempt(n.轻视)/exempt(v.免除)  

commitment<,>/kəˈmɪtmənt/<,>/kəˈmɪtmənt/<,>n.承诺/保证<,>She has a strong commitment to her job.<,>她对工作有很强的承诺。<,>Marriage is a lifelong commitment.<,>婚姻是一生的承诺。<,>We need your commitment to finish the project on time.<,>我们需要你的保证按时完成项目。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)+ment(名词后缀)→共同送出→承诺<,>committee(n.委员会)/admit(v.承认)/emit(v.发出)  

feasible<,>/ˈfiːzəbl/<,>/ˈfiːzəbl/<,>adj.可行的/可能的/可用的<,>Is it feasible to finish the work today?<,>今天完成这项工作可行吗？<,>The plan sounds feasible in theory.<,>这个计划在理论上听起来可行。<,>We need to find a feasible solution.<,>我们需要找到一个可行的解决方案。<,>feas(做)+ible(能…的)→能做的→可行的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/flexible(adj.灵活的)/incredible(adj.难以置信的)  

outcome<,>/ˈaʊtkʌm/<,>/ˈaʊtkʌm/<,>n.结果<,>We are waiting for the outcome of the negotiations.<,>我们正在等待谈判的结果。<,>The outcome of the experiment was surprising.<,>实验的结果令人惊讶。<,>What was the final outcome of the discussion?<,>讨论的最终结果是什么？<,>out(出)+come(来)→出来的东西→结果<,>income(n.收入)/overcome(v.克服)/become(v.成为)  

diligent<,>/ˈdɪlɪdʒənt/<,>/ˈdɪlɪdʒənt/<,>adj.勤奋的<,>She is a diligent student who always does her homework.<,>她是个勤奋的学生，总是做作业。<,>The diligent worker was promoted quickly.<,>这个勤奋的工人很快得到了晋升。<,>Diligent efforts will lead to success.<,>勤奋的努力会带来成功。<,>di(分开)+lig(选择)+ent(形容词后缀)→认真选择的→勤奋的<,>intelligent(adj.聪明的)/negligent(adj.疏忽的)/eloquent(adj.雄辩的)  

deprive<,>/dɪˈpraɪv/<,>/dɪˈpraɪv/<,>v.剥夺/夺去/使丧失<,>The court deprived him of his civil rights.<,>法庭剥夺了他的公民权利。<,>They were deprived of food for three days.<,>他们被剥夺食物三天。<,>Sleep deprivation can affect your health.<,>睡眠剥夺会影响你的健康。<,>de(去掉)+prive(私人)→去掉私人权利→剥夺<,>derive(v.获得)/deprive(v.剥夺)/arrive(v.到达)  

grid<,>/ɡrɪd/<,>/ɡrɪd/<,>n.输电网<,>The city's power grid was damaged in the storm.<,>城市的电网在风暴中受损。<,>They are building a new electricity grid.<,>他们正在建设一个新的电网。<,>The solar panels are connected to the main grid.<,>太阳能电池板连接到主电网。<,>g(形似电网结构)+rid(去掉)→去掉杂乱的电线→电网<,>bid(v.出价)/kid(n.小孩)/lid(n.盖子)
distribute<,>/dɪˈstrɪbjuːt/<,>/dɪˈstrɪbjuːt/<,>v.分发<,>They distribute food to the homeless every weekend.<,>他们每个周末都会向无家可归者分发食物。<,>The teacher distributed the test papers to the students.<,>老师把试卷分发给学生。<,>The company distributes its products worldwide.<,>这家公司的产品销往全球。<,>dis(分开)+tribute(给予)→分开给予→分发<,>attribute(v.归因于)/contribute(v.贡献)/retribute(v.报答)  

destruction<,>/dɪˈstrʌkʃən/<,>/dɪˈstrʌkʃən/<,>n.破坏<,>The hurricane caused widespread destruction in the city.<,>飓风给这座城市造成了大规模的破坏。<,>The fire led to the destruction of the historic building.<,>大火导致这座历史建筑被毁。<,>Pollution is causing the destruction of marine life.<,>污染正在导致海洋生物的毁灭。<,>de(向下)+struct(建造)+ion→把建造的东西向下推倒→破坏<,>construction(n.建设)/instruction(n.指导)/obstruction(n.阻碍)  

divide<,>/dɪˈvaɪd/<,>/dɪˈvaɪd/<,>v.分开<,>The river divides the city into two parts.<,>这条河将城市分成两部分。<,>We divided the cake equally among all the children.<,>我们把蛋糕平均分给所有的孩子。<,>The issue divided public opinion.<,>这个问题使公众意见产生了分歧。<,>di(分开)+vide(分开)→分开<,>divider(n.分隔物)/individual(adj.个别的)/subdivide(v.再分)  

highlight<,>/ˈhaɪlaɪt/<,>/ˈhaɪˌlaɪt/<,>v.突出；强调/n.突出的部分<,>She used a yellow marker to highlight the important points.<,>她用黄色标记笔标出了重点。<,>The report highlights the need for better education.<,>报告强调了改善教育的必要性。<,>The sunset was the highlight of our trip.<,>日落是我们旅途中最大的亮点。<,>high(高)+light(光)→把光线打在高处→突出<,>spotlight(n.聚光灯)/lowlight(n.暗淡部分)/highlighted(adj.突出的)  

justify<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈdʒʌstəˌfaɪ/<,>v.证明……正当<,>Can you justify your decision?<,>你能证明你的决定是正当的吗？<,>The evidence justifies further investigation.<,>这些证据证明有必要进行进一步调查。<,>He tried to justify his actions with excuses.<,>他试图用借口为自己的行为辩解。<,>just(正义的)+ify(使)→使……正义→证明正当<,>justice(n.正义)/adjust(v.调整)/justifiable(adj.可辩解的)  

announce<,>/əˈnaʊns/<,>/əˈnaʊns/<,>v.宣布，声称<,>The principal announced the winner of the competition.<,>校长宣布了比赛的获胜者。<,>They announced their engagement at the party.<,>他们在聚会上宣布了订婚的消息。<,>The company announced a new product launch.<,>公司宣布将推出新产品。<,>an(向)+nounce(报告)→向公众报告→宣布<,>pronounce(v.发音)/denounce(v.谴责)/renounce(v.放弃)  

proposal<,>/prəˈpəʊzəl/<,>/prəˈpoʊzəl/<,>n.提议<,>He made a proposal to improve the system.<,>他提出了一个改进系统的建议。<,>The committee rejected the budget proposal.<,>委员会否决了预算提案。<,>She accepted his marriage proposal.<,>她接受了他的求婚。<,>pro(向前)+pos(放)+al→向前放出的想法→提议<,>disposal(n.处理)/oppose(v.反对)/compose(v.组成)  

advisory<,>/ədˈvaɪzəri/<,>/ədˈvaɪzəri/<,>n.报告，警告<,>The government issued a travel advisory for the region.<,>政府发布了该地区的旅行警告。<,>The committee provides advisory services to farmers.<,>该委员会为农民提供咨询服务。<,>He works in an advisory capacity for the company.<,>他以顾问身份为公司工作。<,>ad(向)+vis(看)+ory→提供看法的→顾问的<,>advisor(n.顾问)/revise(v.修订)/supervise(v.监督)  

mystery<,>/ˈmɪstəri/<,>/ˈmɪstəri/<,>n.迷，神秘的事物<,>The disappearance of the plane remains a mystery.<,>飞机的失踪仍然是个谜。<,>She loves reading mystery novels.<,>她喜欢读悬疑小说。<,>The ancient artifact is shrouded in mystery.<,>这件古代文物充满了神秘色彩。<,>my(我的)+story(故事)→我的故事很神秘→谜<,>history(n.历史)/mastery(n.掌握)/ministry(n.部门)  

punctual<,>/ˈpʌŋktʃuəl/<,>/ˈpʌŋktʃuəl/<,>adj.准时的<,>She is always punctual for meetings.<,>她开会总是很准时。<,>Punctual arrival is required for the exam.<,>考试要求准时到达。<,>The train was remarkably punctual today.<,>今天火车非常准时。<,>punct(点)+ual→卡在点上的→准时的<,>punctuate(v.加标点)/puncture(n.刺孔)/punch(n.打孔)
derive<,>/dɪˈraɪv/<,>/dɪˈraɪv/<,>v.得到/v.导出<,>She derives great pleasure from reading.<,>她从阅读中获得极大的乐趣。<,>This word is derived from Latin.<,>这个词源自拉丁语。<,>We can derive the formula from these equations.<,>我们可以从这些方程中推导出这个公式。<,>de(向下)+rive(河流)→从河流中获取→得到<,>deprive(v.剥夺)/arrive(v.到达)/drive(v.驾驶)

harmony<,>/ˈhɑːməni/<,>/ˈhɑːrməni/<,>n.和谐<,>The choir sang in perfect harmony.<,>合唱团唱得非常和谐。<,>We should live in harmony with nature.<,>我们应该与自然和谐相处。<,>There was harmony between the two communities.<,>两个社区之间很和谐。<,>harm(伤害)+ony(名词后缀)→没有伤害→和谐<,>harmonica(n.口琴)/harmonic(adj.和声的)/harmonize(v.使和谐)

unwilling<,>/ʌnˈwɪlɪŋ/<,>/ʌnˈwɪlɪŋ/<,>adj.不愿意的<,>He was unwilling to admit his mistake.<,>他不愿意承认自己的错误。<,>She gave an unwilling smile.<,>她不情愿地笑了笑。<,>They were unwilling participants in the project.<,>他们是这个项目的不情愿参与者。<,>un(不)+willing(愿意的)→不愿意的<,>willing(adj.愿意的)/unwillingly(adv.不情愿地)/unwillingness(n.不情愿)

view<,>/vjuː/<,>/vjuː/<,>v.看待<,>How do you view this situation?<,>你如何看待这种情况？<,>She views the world differently now.<,>她现在以不同的方式看待世界。<,>The film is viewed as a masterpiece.<,>这部电影被视为杰作。<,>vi(看)+ew→看的方式→看待<,>review(v.复习/n.评论)/interview(n.面试/v.采访)/preview(n.预览/v.预演)

financial<,>/faɪˈnænʃəl/<,>/faɪˈnænʃəl/<,>adj.财政的/adj.经济的<,>He is in financial difficulties.<,>他陷入了财政困难。<,>The company provides financial services.<,>该公司提供金融服务。<,>This decision has financial implications.<,>这个决定有经济影响。<,>finance(财政)+ial(形容词后缀)→财政的<,>fiscal(adj.财政的)/monetary(adj.货币的)/economic(adj.经济的)

priority<,>/praɪˈɒrəti/<,>/praɪˈɔːrəti/<,>n.优先/n.优先权<,>Safety is our top priority.<,>安全是我们的首要任务。<,>You need to set your priorities straight.<,>你需要明确你的优先事项。<,>This project has priority over others.<,>这个项目比其他项目有优先权。<,>prior(优先的)+ity(名词后缀)→优先权<,>superiority(n.优越)/inferiority(n.低劣)/posteriority(n.在后)

impermanent<,>/ɪmˈpɜːmənənt/<,>/ɪmˈpɜːrmənənt/<,>adj.非永久(性)的/adj.不持久的/adj.暂时的<,>All things are impermanent in this world.<,>世间万物都是无常的。<,>Their happiness was impermanent.<,>他们的幸福是短暂的。<,>This is just an impermanent solution.<,>这只是个暂时的解决方案。<,>im(不)+permanent(永久的)→不永久的<,>permanent(adj.永久的)/temporary(adj.临时的)/transient(adj.短暂的)

symbolize<,>/ˈsɪmbəlaɪz/<,>/ˈsɪmbəlaɪz/<,>v.象征<,>The dove symbolizes peace.<,>鸽子象征和平。<,>This color symbolizes purity.<,>这种颜色象征纯洁。<,>The ceremony symbolizes a new beginning.<,>这个仪式象征着新的开始。<,>symbol(符号)+ize(动词后缀)→用符号表示→象征<,>symbol(n.符号)/symbology(n.象征学)/symbolic(adj.象征性的)

bankrupt<,>/ˈbæŋkrʌpt/<,>/ˈbæŋkrʌpt/<,>adj.破产的/adj.倒闭的<,>The company went bankrupt last year.<,>这家公司去年破产了。<,>He was declared bankrupt by the court.<,>法院宣布他破产。<,>The economic crisis left many businesses bankrupt.<,>经济危机使许多企业倒闭。<,>bank(银行)+rupt(破裂)→银行账户破裂→破产<,>corrupt(adj.腐败的)/disrupt(v.扰乱)/erupt(v.爆发)

intake<,>/ˈɪnteɪk/<,>/ˈɪnteɪk/<,>n.摄入<,>You should reduce your sugar intake.<,>你应该减少糖的摄入。<,>The daily calorie intake varies by person.<,>每日卡路里摄入量因人而异。<,>The school has a large intake of students this year.<,>今年学校的招生人数很多。<,>in(进入)+take(拿)→拿进去→摄入<,>uptake(n.吸收)/outtake(n.删除部分)/undertake(v.承担)
addiction<,>/əˈdɪkʃ(ə)n/<,>/əˈdɪkʃən/<,>n.上瘾<,>His addiction to video games is affecting his studies.<,>他对电子游戏的上瘾正在影响他的学习。<,>She sought help for her drug addiction.<,>她为她的毒瘾寻求帮助。<,>Addiction to social media is a growing problem.<,>对社交媒体的上瘾是一个日益严重的问题。<,>add(增加)+dict(说)+ion→不断说→上瘾<,>affliction(n.痛苦)/addition(n.增加)/dedication(n.奉献)  

productive<,>/prəˈdʌktɪv/<,>/prəˈdʌktɪv/<,>adj.富有成效的<,>She had a very productive day at work.<,>她今天工作非常高效。<,>A productive meeting led to new ideas.<,>一次富有成效的会议带来了新的想法。<,>The team was productive and finished the project early.<,>团队效率很高，提前完成了项目。<,>pro(向前)+duct(引导)+ive→向前引导→有成效的<,>reproductive(adj.生殖的)/destructive(adj.破坏性的)/conductive(adj.传导的)  

admire<,>/ədˈmaɪə(r)/<,>/ədˈmaɪər/<,>v.钦佩/v.称赞<,>I admire her dedication to her work.<,>我钦佩她对工作的奉献精神。<,>He stopped to admire the beautiful sunset.<,>他停下来欣赏美丽的日落。<,>Everyone admires his honesty and integrity.<,>每个人都钦佩他的诚实和正直。<,>ad(加强)+mir(惊奇)+e→让人惊奇→钦佩<,>adore(v.崇拜)/admit(v.承认)/adhere(v.坚持)  

reflect<,>/rɪˈflekt/<,>/rɪˈflekt/<,>v.反映<,>The report reflects the current economic situation.<,>这份报告反映了当前的经济形势。<,>Her actions reflect her true character.<,>她的行为反映了她的真实性格。<,>The lake reflects the surrounding mountains.<,>湖水映照着周围的山峦。<,>re(回)+flect(弯曲)→光线弯曲返回→反映<,>deflect(v.偏转)/inflect(v.弯曲)/flexible(adj.灵活的)  

underline<,>/ˌʌndəˈlaɪn/<,>/ˌʌndərˈlaɪn/<,>v.强调<,>She underlined the key points in the document.<,>她在文件中标出了关键点。<,>His speech underlined the importance of education.<,>他的演讲强调了教育的重要性。<,>The report underlines the need for immediate action.<,>报告强调了立即采取行动的必要性。<,>under(在...下)+line(线)→在下面画线→强调<,>underline(n.下划线)/underlie(v.构成基础)/underling(n.下属)  

representative<,>/ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/<,>/ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/<,>n.代表<,>She is the representative of our company at the conference.<,>她是我们在会议上的公司代表。<,>The survey is representative of the general population.<,>这项调查具有普遍代表性。<,>He was elected as the student representative.<,>他被选为学生代表。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)+ative→再次呈现的人→代表<,>presentation(n.展示)/represent(v.代表)/resident(n.居民)  

blame<,>/bleɪm/<,>/bleɪm/<,>v.指责/v.责怪<,>Don't blame others for your mistakes.<,>不要因为你的错误而责怪别人。<,>He blamed the bad weather for the delay.<,>他把延误归咎于糟糕的天气。<,>She was blamed for the accident.<,>她因这起事故受到指责。<,>b(不)+lame(跛的)→不跛的人被责怪<,>flame(n.火焰)/frame(n.框架)/lame(adj.跛的)  

retrain<,>/ˌriːˈtreɪn/<,>/ˌriːˈtreɪn/<,>v.再教育/v.再训练<,>Workers were retrained to use the new equipment.<,>工人们接受了再培训以使用新设备。<,>He decided to retrain as a teacher.<,>他决定再培训成为一名教师。<,>The company offers courses to retrain employees.<,>公司提供课程对员工进行再培训。<,>re(再)+train(训练)→再次训练<,>retain(v.保留)/restrain(v.抑制)/retreat(v.撤退)  

tasteless<,>/ˈteɪstləs/<,>/ˈteɪstləs/<,>adj.无味的<,>The soup was tasteless and needed more salt.<,>这汤淡而无味，需要再加点盐。<,>He made a tasteless joke that offended everyone.<,>他开了一个无趣的玩笑，冒犯了所有人。<,>The decoration was tasteless and overdone.<,>装饰毫无品味且过分夸张。<,>taste(味道)+less(无)→无味的<,>tasteful(adj.有品味的)/tasty(adj.美味的)/wasteful(adj.浪费的)  

excessive<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>adj.过度的<,>Excessive drinking is harmful to your health.<,>过度饮酒有害健康。<,>She was criticized for her excessive spending.<,>她因过度消费而受到批评。<,>The noise from the party was excessive.<,>派对的噪音太大了。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)+ive→走出去的→过度的<,>access(n.入口)/success(n.成功)/process(n.过程)
dishonest<,>/dɪsˈɒnɪst/<,>/dɪsˈɑːnɪst/<,>adj.不诚实的<,>He was fired for being dishonest with his clients.<,>他因为对客户不诚实而被解雇了。<,>Dishonest behavior can damage your reputation.<,>不诚实的行为会损害你的声誉。<,>She gave a dishonest answer to avoid trouble.<,>她给出了一个不诚实的回答以避免麻烦。<,>dis(否定前缀)+honest(诚实的)→不诚实的<,>honest(adj.诚实的)/honesty(n.诚实)/dishonesty(n.不诚实)  

caution<,>/ˈkɔːʃn/<,>/ˈkɔːʃn/<,>n.小心/n.谨慎/v.警告/v.告诫<,>Proceed with caution when walking on icy sidewalks.<,>在结冰的人行道上行走时要小心。<,>The police officer cautioned the driver about speeding.<,>警察警告司机不要超速行驶。<,>She handled the fragile vase with great caution.<,>她非常小心地拿着那个易碎的花瓶。<,>caut(小心)+ion(名词后缀)→小心<,>precaution(n.预防措施)/cautious(adj.谨慎的)/incautious(adj.不谨慎的)  

glorious<,>/ˈɡlɔːriəs/<,>/ˈɡlɔːriəs/<,>adj.辉煌的<,>The team celebrated their glorious victory.<,>团队庆祝了他们辉煌的胜利。<,>The sunset painted a glorious sky.<,>夕阳描绘了一片辉煌的天空。<,>She described her trip as a glorious experience.<,>她把这次旅行描述为一次辉煌的经历。<,>glory(荣耀)+ous(形容词后缀)→辉煌的<,>glory(n.荣耀)/inglorious(adj.不光彩的)/glorify(v.赞美)  

pointless<,>/ˈpɔɪntləs/<,>/ˈpɔɪntləs/<,>adj.无意义的<,>Arguing with him is pointless; he never listens.<,>和他争论毫无意义，他从来不听。<,>The meeting was completely pointless.<,>这次会议完全没有意义。<,>She felt her efforts were pointless.<,>她觉得自己的努力毫无意义。<,>point(意义)+less(否定后缀)→无意义的<,>pointed(adj.尖锐的)/pointer(n.指针)/appoint(v.任命)  

significant<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>adj.重要的<,>This discovery is significant for scientific research.<,>这一发现对科学研究很重要。<,>She made a significant contribution to the project.<,>她对这个项目做出了重要贡献。<,>There was a significant increase in sales last month.<,>上个月的销售额有显著增长。<,>sign(标记)+i+fic(做)+ant(形容词后缀)→重要的<,>signify(v.表示)/insignificant(adj.不重要的)/significance(n.重要性)  

mutual<,>/ˈmjuːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈmjuːtʃuəl/<,>adj.相互的<,>They have a mutual respect for each other.<,>他们彼此相互尊重。<,>The agreement was based on mutual benefit.<,>该协议基于互利。<,>Their mutual dislike was obvious.<,>他们彼此的不喜欢很明显。<,>mut(改变)+ual(形容词后缀)→相互的<,>commute(v.通勤)/immutable(adj.不可改变的)/mutate(v.突变)  

temptation<,>/tempˈteɪʃn/<,>/tempˈteɪʃn/<,>n.诱惑/n.引诱<,>He resisted the temptation to eat the chocolate.<,>他抵制住了吃巧克力的诱惑。<,>The temptation to cheat was strong, but he stayed honest.<,>作弊的诱惑很强，但他保持了诚实。<,>She gave in to temptation and bought the expensive dress.<,>她经不住诱惑，买了那条昂贵的裙子。<,>tempt(诱惑)+ation(名词后缀)→诱惑<,>attempt(v.尝试/n.企图)/contempt(n.轻视)/tempting(adj.诱人的)  

passive<,>/ˈpæsɪv/<,>/ˈpæsɪv/<,>adj.被动的<,>He took a passive role in the discussion.<,>他在讨论中采取了被动的角色。<,>Her passive attitude annoyed her boss.<,>她消极的态度惹恼了她的老板。<,>The sentence is written in the passive voice.<,>这个句子是用被动语态写的。<,>pass(忍受)+ive(形容词后缀)→被动的<,>active(adj.主动的)/passion(n.激情)/passport(n.护照)  

evolve<,>/ɪˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪˈvɑːlv/<,>v.使发展<,>The company has evolved over the years.<,>这家公司多年来不断发展。<,>The theory evolved from years of research.<,>这个理论是从多年的研究中发展而来的。<,>Birds evolved from dinosaurs.<,>鸟类是从恐龙进化而来的。<,>e(出)+volve(转)→转出来→发展<,>involve(v.包含)/revolve(v.旋转)/evolution(n.进化)  

treasure<,>/ˈtreʒə(r)/<,>/ˈtreʒər/<,>v.珍爱<,>She treasures the necklace her grandmother gave her.<,>她珍爱祖母送给她的项链。<,>He treasures every moment with his family.<,>他珍视与家人在一起的每一刻。<,>The old letters are treasured memories.<,>这些旧信件是珍贵的回忆。<,>treas(财富)+ure(名词后缀)→珍爱<,>pleasure(n.快乐)/measure(v.测量/n.措施)/leisure(n.闲暇)
shock<,>/ʃɒk/<,>/ʃɑːk/<,>v.感到震惊<,>The news of his sudden death shocked everyone.<,>他突然去世的消息震惊了所有人。<,>She was shocked to hear the loud explosion.<,>听到巨大的爆炸声，她感到震惊。<,>His rude behavior shocked the guests at the party.<,>他粗鲁的行为让派对上的宾客感到震惊。<,>sh(声音)+ock(像"哦"的惊讶声)→震惊<,>stock(n.股票/v.储存)/sock(n.短袜)/mock(v.嘲笑)

disservice<,>/dɪsˈsɜːvɪs/<,>/dɪsˈsɜːrvɪs/<,>n.伤害/n.帮倒忙<,>Spreading rumors does a great disservice to the community.<,>传播谣言对社区造成很大伤害。<,>His poor advice was a disservice to the team.<,>他糟糕的建议给团队帮了倒忙。<,>Removing the warning labels would be a disservice to consumers.<,>移除警告标签会对消费者造成伤害。<,>dis(否定)+service(服务)→不好的服务→帮倒忙<,>service(n.服务/v.维修)/disserve(v.损害)/deserve(v.应得)

ambitious<,>/æmˈbɪʃəs/<,>/æmˈbɪʃəs/<,>adj.有雄心的/adj.野心勃勃的<,>She has ambitious plans to start her own company.<,>她有雄心勃勃的计划要创办自己的公司。<,>The ambitious young man worked day and night to achieve his goals.<,>这个有雄心的年轻人日夜工作以实现目标。<,>Their ambitious project aims to solve world hunger.<,>他们野心勃勃的项目旨在解决世界饥饿问题。<,>ambi(两边)+tious(形容词后缀)→两边都想要→有野心的<,>ambiguous(adj.模糊的)/amiable(adj.友好的)/amphibious(adj.两栖的)

fancy<,>/ˈfænsi/<,>/ˈfænsi/<,>adj.华丽的/adj.别致的<,>She wore a fancy dress to the ball.<,>她穿着一件华丽的礼服参加舞会。<,>The restaurant had fancy decorations and expensive furniture.<,>这家餐厅有华丽的装饰和昂贵的家具。<,>He bought a fancy watch with intricate designs.<,>他买了一块有复杂设计的别致手表。<,>fan(粉丝)+cy→粉丝喜欢的东西→华丽的<,>fantasy(n.幻想)/faint(adj.微弱的)/finance(n.金融)

accumulate<,>/əˈkjuːmjəleɪt/<,>/əˈkjuːmjəleɪt/<,>v.积累/v.增加<,>Dust tends to accumulate in unused rooms.<,>灰尘容易在闲置的房间里积累。<,>He has accumulated a large collection of rare books.<,>他积累了大量珍本书籍。<,>Over time, small savings can accumulate into a significant amount.<,>随着时间的推移，小额储蓄可以积累成可观的金额。<,>ac(加强)+cumul(堆积)+ate(动词后缀)→不断堆积→积累<,>cumulative(adj.累积的)/accommodate(v.容纳)/accurate(adj.精确的)

fuss<,>/fʌs/<,>/fʌs/<,>n.大惊小怪<,>She made a big fuss over a small scratch on her car.<,>她为车上一个小划痕大惊小怪。<,>Don't make such a fuss about the minor mistake.<,>别为这个小错误大惊小怪。<,>There was a lot of fuss when the celebrity arrived.<,>名人到达时引起了大惊小怪。<,>fu(拼音"负")+ss(像两条蛇)→负面情绪像蛇一样缠绕→大惊小怪<,>fuse(n.保险丝/v.融合)/fuzzy(adj.模糊的)/fussbudget(n.大惊小怪的人)

ultimately<,>/ˈʌltɪmətli/<,>/ˈʌltɪmətli/<,>adv.最后/adv.最终<,>Ultimately, the decision is yours to make.<,>最终，决定权在你。<,>All their hard work ultimately led to success.<,>他们所有的努力最终带来了成功。<,>The investigation will ultimately reveal the truth.<,>调查最终会揭示真相。<,>ultim(最后)+ate(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→最终地<,>ultimate(adj.最终的)/ultimatum(n.最后通牒)/penultimate(adj.倒数第二的)

showmanship<,>/ˈʃəʊmənʃɪp/<,>/ˈʃoʊmənʃɪp/<,>n.主持演出的技巧<,>His natural showmanship made him a great host.<,>他天生的主持技巧使他成为优秀的主持人。<,>The magician's showmanship captivated the audience.<,>魔术师的表演技巧吸引了观众。<,>Good showmanship can make even an average performance exciting.<,>好的表演技巧能让普通的表演也变得精彩。<,>show(表演)+man(人)+ship(技巧)→表演者的技巧<,>showman(n.演出主持人)/showroom(n.陈列室)/showcase(n.展示柜)

cancel<,>/ˈkænsl/<,>/ˈkænsl/<,>v.取消<,>They had to cancel the meeting due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，他们不得不取消会议。<,>The airline canceled all flights because of the strike.<,>航空公司因罢工取消了所有航班。<,>I need to cancel my subscription to the magazine.<,>我需要取消杂志订阅。<,>can(能)+cel(拼音"撤了")→能撤了→取消<,>cancer(n.癌症)/candle(n.蜡烛)/canal(n.运河)

regulate<,>/ˈreɡjəleɪt/<,>/ˈreɡjəleɪt/<,>v.管理<,>The government regulates the sale of alcohol.<,>政府管理酒精饮料的销售。<,>This device helps regulate the temperature in the room.<,>这个装置帮助调节室内温度。<,>Strict laws regulate the use of pesticides in farming.<,>严格的法律规范农业中杀虫剂的使用。<,>reg(统治)+ul+ate(动词后缀)→统治管理<,>regular(adj.规则的)/regulation(n.规章)/regulator(n.调节器)
peer<,>/pɪə(r)/<,>/pɪr/<,>n.同龄人<,>She enjoys spending time with her peers.<,>她喜欢和同龄人在一起。<,>Peer pressure can influence teenagers' behavior.<,>同龄人的压力会影响青少年的行为。<,>He was respected by his peers for his honesty.<,>他因诚实而受到同龄人的尊重。<,>peer(看)→同龄人互相看齐<,>pier(n.码头)/pear(n.梨)/peerless(adj.无与伦比的)

calculate<,>/ˈkælkjuleɪt/<,>/ˈkælkjəˌleɪt/<,>v.计算<,>Can you calculate the total cost for me?<,>你能帮我计算总成本吗？<,>Scientists calculate the distance between stars.<,>科学家们计算恒星之间的距离。<,>She calculated the risks before making a decision.<,>她在做决定前计算了风险。<,>calcul(计算)+ate(动词后缀)→计算<,>calculator(n.计算器)/speculate(v.推测)/accumulate(v.积累)

virtually<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəli/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəli/<,>adv.几乎/差不多<,>The project is virtually complete.<,>这个项目几乎完成了。<,>Virtually all students passed the exam.<,>差不多所有学生都通过了考试。<,>We're virtually neighbors since we live so close.<,>我们住得很近，几乎是邻居。<,>virtual(虚拟的)+ly(副词后缀)→几乎<,>actually(adv.实际上)/visually(adv.视觉上)/virtue(n.美德)

accustom<,>/əˈkʌstəm/<,>/əˈkʌstəm/<,>v.使习惯<,>It takes time to accustom yourself to a new environment.<,>适应新环境需要时间。<,>She accustomed her eyes to the darkness.<,>她使自己的眼睛适应了黑暗。<,>The soldiers were accustomed to harsh conditions.<,>士兵们习惯了恶劣的条件。<,>ac(强调)+custom(习惯)→使习惯<,>custom(n.习惯)/customer(n.顾客)/accustomed(adj.习惯的)

retailer<,>/ˈriːteɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈriːteɪlər/<,>n.零售商<,>This retailer offers a wide range of products.<,>这家零售商提供多种产品。<,>The local retailer is having a sale this weekend.<,>本地零售商本周末有促销活动。<,>Online retailers are becoming more popular.<,>在线零售商越来越受欢迎。<,>retail(零售)+er(人)→零售商<,>wholesaler(n.批发商)/detailer(n.细节处理者)/tailor(n.裁缝)

programmer<,>/ˈprəʊɡræmə(r)/<,>/ˈproʊɡræmər/<,>n.程序设计员<,>He works as a computer programmer.<,>他是一名计算机程序员。<,>The programmer fixed the bug in the software.<,>程序员修复了软件中的错误。<,>She is learning to become a programmer.<,>她正在学习成为一名程序员。<,>program(程序)+mer(人)→程序设计员<,>grammar(n.语法)/diagram(n.图表)/telegram(n.电报)

advice<,>/ədˈvaɪs/<,>/ədˈvaɪs/<,>n.建议<,>I need your advice on this matter.<,>我需要你对此事的建议。<,>Her advice helped me solve the problem.<,>她的建议帮我解决了问题。<,>He gave me some good financial advice.<,>他给了我一些很好的财务建议。<,>ad(向)+vice(看)→向别人看齐→建议<,>advise(v.建议)/device(n.设备)/vice(n.恶习)

admiration<,>/ˌædməˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌædməˈreɪʃən/<,>n.钦佩/称赞<,>She looked at him with admiration.<,>她钦佩地看着他。<,>His courage won the admiration of everyone.<,>他的勇气赢得了所有人的钦佩。<,>I have great admiration for her work.<,>我非常钦佩她的工作。<,>admire(钦佩)+ation(名词后缀)→钦佩<,>admission(n.承认)/admonition(n.警告)/adoration(n.崇拜)

courageous<,>/kəˈreɪdʒəs/<,>/kəˈreɪdʒəs/<,>adj.有勇气的<,>The firefighters were very courageous.<,>消防员们非常勇敢。<,>It was courageous of her to speak out.<,>她敢于说出来很有勇气。<,>He made a courageous decision to change careers.<,>他做出了换工作的勇敢决定。<,>courage(勇气)+ous(形容词后缀)→有勇气的<,>outrageous(adj.骇人的)/advantageous(adj.有利的)/courteous(adj.有礼貌的)

respectful<,>/rɪˈspektfl/<,>/rɪˈspektfəl/<,>adj.有礼貌的/尊重的<,>Be respectful to your elders.<,>要尊敬长辈。<,>He was always respectful towards his teachers.<,>他对老师总是很尊敬。<,>The audience was respectful during the performance.<,>观众在演出期间很有礼貌。<,>respect(尊重)+ful(形容词后缀)→尊重的<,>respective(adj.各自的)/respectable(adj.值得尊敬的)/disrespectful(adj.无礼的)
makeup<,>/ˈmeɪkʌp/<,>/ˈmeɪkˌʌp/<,>n.化妆品<,>She bought some new makeup for the party.<,>她为聚会买了一些新化妆品。<,>Makeup can enhance your natural beauty.<,>化妆品可以提升你的自然美。<,>He doesn’t like wearing makeup.<,>他不喜欢化妆。<,>make(制造)+up(向上)→制造出美丽→化妆品<,>makeup artist(化妆师)/makeup remover(卸妆水)  

reservation<,>/ˌrezəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌrezərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.预定<,>I made a reservation at the restaurant for tonight.<,>我在餐厅预定了今晚的位子。<,>Do you have a hotel reservation?<,>你订好酒店了吗？<,>The reservation was canceled due to bad weather.<,>由于天气不好，预定被取消了。<,>re(再)+serve(保留)+ation(名词后缀)→保留位子→预定<,>preservation(n.保存)/conservation(n.保护)  

apply<,>/əˈplaɪ/<,>/əˈplaɪ/<,>v.申请/v.应用<,>She applied for a job at the company.<,>她申请了这家公司的工作。<,>This rule doesn’t apply to everyone.<,>这条规则并不适用于所有人。<,>He applied the ointment to the wound.<,>他把药膏涂在伤口上。<,>ap(强调)+ply(折叠)→反复使用→应用<,>supply(v.供应/n.补给)/reply(v.回答/n.答复)  

demonstrate<,>/ˈdemənstreɪt/<,>/ˈdɛmənˌstreɪt/<,>v.证明/v.展示<,>The scientist demonstrated the experiment to the students.<,>科学家向学生们展示了实验。<,>The data demonstrates the effectiveness of the treatment.<,>数据证明了治疗的有效性。<,>She demonstrated how to use the machine.<,>她演示了如何使用这台机器。<,>de(完全)+monstrate(显示)→完全显示→展示<,>illustrate(v.说明)/manifest(v.表明)  

generation<,>/ˌdʒenəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌdʒɛnəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.一代人/n.产生<,>This book appeals to the younger generation.<,>这本书吸引年轻一代。<,>Solar power is a clean method of energy generation.<,>太阳能是一种清洁的能源产生方式。<,>There is a generation gap between parents and children.<,>父母和孩子之间存在代沟。<,>gene(基因)+ration(名词后缀)→一代人<,>degeneration(n.退化)/regeneration(n.再生)  

chat<,>/tʃæt/<,>/tʃæt/<,>v.聊天<,>They chatted over coffee for hours.<,>他们边喝咖啡边聊了几个小时。<,>I often chat with my friends online.<,>我经常和朋友在线聊天。<,>She stopped to chat with her neighbor.<,>她停下来和邻居聊天。<,>cat(猫)+h→像猫一样轻松地交谈→聊天<,>chit(n.便条)/chatter(v.喋喋不休)  

ancient<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>adj.古代的<,>We visited the ancient ruins of Rome.<,>我们参观了罗马的古遗址。<,>Ancient civilizations had advanced knowledge.<,>古代文明拥有先进的知识。<,>This tradition dates back to ancient times.<,>这个传统可以追溯到古代。<,>anci(古老)+ent(形容词后缀)→古代的<,>antique(adj.古老的/n.古董)/ancestor(n.祖先)  

evil<,>/ˈiːvl/<,>/ˈiːvəl/<,>n.邪恶/n.罪恶<,>The story is about the battle between good and evil.<,>这个故事讲述了善与恶的斗争。<,>He was accused of evil deeds.<,>他被指控做了邪恶的事。<,>She believes money is the root of all evil.<,>她认为金钱是万恶之源。<,>live(生活)反过来→邪恶的生活→罪恶<,>devil(n.魔鬼)/vile(adj.卑鄙的)  

indifferent<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>adj.冷漠的<,>He seemed indifferent to her problems.<,>他对她的问题显得漠不关心。<,>The audience was indifferent to the performance.<,>观众对这场表演无动于衷。<,>She gave an indifferent shrug.<,>她冷漠地耸了耸肩。<,>in(不)+different(不同的)→不关心差异→冷漠的<,>different(adj.不同的)/indifference(n.冷漠)  

namely<,>/ˈneɪmli/<,>/ˈneɪmli/<,>adv.即/adv.也就是<,>Three students passed the exam, namely Tom, Jack, and Lily.<,>三名学生通过了考试，即汤姆、杰克和莉莉。<,>We discussed two topics, namely finance and marketing.<,>我们讨论了两个话题，即财务和营销。<,>She has one hobby, namely painting.<,>她有一个爱好，也就是绘画。<,>name(名字)+ly(副词后缀)→点名指出→即<,>namely vs. specifically(具体来说)/namely vs. that is(也就是说)
effect<,>/ɪˈfekt/<,>/ɪˈfɛkt/<,>n.影响<,>The new policy had a positive effect on the economy.<,>新政策对经济产生了积极影响。<,>The medicine took effect quickly.<,>药物很快见效了。<,>Her speech had a profound effect on the audience.<,>她的演讲对观众产生了深远的影响。<,>ef(出)+fect(做)→做出来→影响<,>affect(v.影响)/defect(n.缺陷)/infect(v.传染)

devote<,>/dɪˈvəʊt/<,>/dɪˈvoʊt/<,>v.奉献/v.致力于<,>She devoted her life to helping the poor.<,>她一生致力于帮助穷人。<,>He devotes two hours a day to studying English.<,>他每天花两小时学习英语。<,>This chapter is devoted to the analysis of data.<,>这一章专门用于数据分析。<,>de(加强)+vote(发誓)→发誓做→奉献<,>vote(v.投票)/denote(v.表示)/devout(adj.虔诚的)

appointment<,>/əˈpɔɪntmənt/<,>/əˈpɔɪntmənt/<,>n.约会<,>I have an appointment with the dentist at 3 pm.<,>我下午3点约了牙医。<,>She made an appointment to see the manager.<,>她预约了见经理。<,>He missed his job interview appointment.<,>他错过了工作面试的预约。<,>ap(向)+point(点)+ment→指向某个时间点→约会<,>disappointment(n.失望)/appoint(v.任命)/point(n.点)

appoint<,>/əˈpɔɪnt/<,>/əˈpɔɪnt/<,>v.任命/v.委派/v.约定/v.确定/v.指定<,>The board appointed her as the new CEO.<,>董事会任命她为新任CEO。<,>They appointed a time for the meeting.<,>他们确定了会议时间。<,>The teacher appointed a team leader for the project.<,>老师为这个项目指定了组长。<,>ap(向)+point(点)→指向某人→任命<,>anoint(v.涂油)/account(n.账户)/point(n.点)

resemble<,>/rɪˈzembl/<,>/rɪˈzɛmbəl/<,>v.像/v.相似<,>The twins resemble each other closely.<,>这对双胞胎长得很像。<,>This building resembles a castle.<,>这座建筑像一座城堡。<,>His writing style resembles that of Hemingway.<,>他的写作风格类似海明威。<,>re(再)+semble(类似)→再次类似→相似<,>assemble(v.集合)/dissemble(v.掩饰)/semblance(n.外表)

assemble<,>/əˈsembl/<,>/əˈsɛmbəl/<,>v.集合/v.组装/v.聚集<,>The students assembled in the auditorium.<,>学生们在礼堂集合。<,>It took him an hour to assemble the furniture.<,>他花了一小时组装家具。<,>A crowd assembled to watch the performance.<,>人群聚集观看表演。<,>as(向)+semble(一起)→使到一起→集合<,>resemble(v.相似)/ensemble(n.全体)/dissemble(v.掩饰)

expressiveness<,>/ɪkˈspresɪvnəs/<,>/ɪkˈsprɛsɪvnəs/<,>n.表达<,>Her expressiveness in dance is remarkable.<,>她在舞蹈中的表现力很出色。<,>The painting shows great expressiveness of emotion.<,>这幅画表现出强烈的情感表达。<,>His speech lacked expressiveness.<,>他的演讲缺乏表现力。<,>express(表达)+ive(的)+ness(性质)→表达性<,>impressiveness(n.令人印象深刻)/expression(n.表达)/depressiveness(n.抑郁)

visibility<,>/ˌvɪzəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌvɪzəˈbɪləti/<,>n.能见度<,>The fog reduced visibility on the road.<,>大雾降低了道路能见度。<,>The new lighting improved visibility in the hallway.<,>新的照明改善了走廊的能见度。<,>High visibility clothing is important for road workers.<,>高能见度服装对道路工人很重要。<,>vis(看)+ibility(能力)→能见度<,>invisibility(n.隐形)/visibility(n.知名度)/visitation(n.访问)

distracted<,>/dɪˈstræktɪd/<,>/dɪˈstræktɪd/<,>adj.分心的<,>He was distracted by the noise outside.<,>他被外面的噪音分散了注意力。<,>The students seemed distracted during the lecture.<,>学生们在讲座期间似乎心不在焉。<,>She felt distracted by her personal problems.<,>她被个人问题搞得心烦意乱。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)+ed→注意力被拉开→分心的<,>attracted(adj.被吸引的)/extracted(adj.提取的)/distract(v.分散注意力)

debt<,>/det/<,>/dɛt/<,>n.债务<,>He is struggling to pay off his debts.<,>他正在努力偿还债务。<,>The company has accumulated a large debt.<,>公司积累了巨额债务。<,>She felt a debt of gratitude towards her teacher.<,>她对老师怀有感恩之情。<,>deb(欠)+t→债务<,>debit(n.借方)/doubt(n.怀疑)/debut(n.初次登场)
substitute<,>/ˈsʌbstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈsʌbstɪtuːt/<,>n.代替者/v.代替<,>He was brought on as a substitute in the second half.<,>他在下半场作为替补上场。<,>You can substitute olive oil for butter in this recipe.<,>在这个食谱中，你可以用橄榄油代替黄油。<,>She substituted for the regular teacher who was ill.<,>她代替了生病的正式老师。<,>sub(下面)+stitute(站立)→站在下面备用→代替<,>institute(n.学院/v.建立)/constitute(v.组成/v.设立)
