insecure<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈkjʊə(r)/<,>/ˌɪnsɪˈkjʊr/<,>adj.不安全的<,>She felt insecure about her job after the company downsized.<,>公司裁员后，她对工作感到不安。<,>The bridge looks insecure and might collapse.<,>这座桥看起来不安全，可能会倒塌。<,>He has always been insecure about his appearance.<,>他一直对自己的外表缺乏自信。<,>in(不)+secure(安全的)→不安全的<,>secure(adj.安全的/v.保护)/insure(v.投保/v.确保)  

chap<,>/tʃæp/<,>/tʃæp/<,>n.小伙子/小家伙/家伙<,>He's a nice chap, always willing to help.<,>他是个好小伙子，总是乐于助人。<,>The old chap at the corner sells newspapers.<,>街角那个老家伙卖报纸。<,>Poor chap, he lost his job last week.<,>可怜的家伙，他上周失业了。<,>联想：chap→chop(砍)→小伙子砍柴<,>chop(v.砍/n.排骨)/chip(n.碎片/v.削)  

selective<,>/sɪˈlektɪv/<,>/sɪˈlɛktɪv/<,>adj.选择的/精选的<,>The school is very selective in its admissions.<,>这所学校在招生方面非常挑剔。<,>She has a selective memory for good things.<,>她对好事有选择性记忆。<,>Be selective about the information you share online.<,>对你在网上分享的信息要有所选择。<,>select(选择)+ive(形容词后缀)→选择的<,>elective(adj.选修的/n.选修课)/collective(adj.集体的/n.集体)  

compensation<,>/ˌkɒmpenˈseɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmpenˈseɪʃn/<,>n.弥补/补偿<,>He received compensation for his injuries at work.<,>他因工伤获得了赔偿。<,>The company offered financial compensation for the delay.<,>公司为延误提供了经济补偿。<,>No amount of money can be compensation for the loss of a loved one.<,>多少钱都无法弥补失去亲人的痛苦。<,>com(一起)+pens(支付)+ation→一起支付→补偿<,>pension(n.养老金)/recompense(n.报酬/v.酬谢)  

dilemma<,>/dɪˈlemə/<,>/dɪˈlɛmə/<,>n.困境<,>She faced the dilemma of choosing between career and family.<,>她面临着在事业和家庭之间做出选择的困境。<,>It's a moral dilemma whether to tell the truth or not.<,>是否说出真相是一个道德困境。<,>The doctor was in a dilemma about the best treatment.<,>医生对最佳治疗方案感到左右为难。<,>di(二)+lemma(假设)→两个假设→进退两难<,>lemma(n.引理)/dilettante(n.业余爱好者)  

foreseeable<,>/fɔːˈsiːəbl/<,>/fɔːrˈsiːəbl/<,>adj.可以预见的<,>In the foreseeable future, robots may replace many jobs.<,>在可预见的未来，机器人可能会取代许多工作。<,>The problem was foreseeable and could have been avoided.<,>这个问题是可以预见的，本来可以避免。<,>There are no major changes foreseeable in the policy.<,>政策方面没有可预见的重大变化。<,>fore(前)+see(看)+able(能)→能提前看到的<,>unforeseeable(adj.无法预见的)/foresight(n.先见之明)  

inadequacy<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwəsi/<,>/ɪnˈædɪkwəsi/<,>n.不足<,>The report highlighted the inadequacy of current safety measures.<,>报告强调了当前安全措施的不足。<,>He has a sense of inadequacy when comparing himself to others.<,>与他人相比时，他有一种不足感。<,>The inadequacy of the budget led to project delays.<,>预算不足导致项目延误。<,>in(不)+adequate(足够的)+cy→不足<,>adequacy(n.足够)/inadequate(adj.不足的)  

guarantee<,>/ˌɡærənˈtiː/<,>/ˌɡærənˈti/<,>v.担保/n.保证/担保<,>The watch comes with a two-year guarantee.<,>这块手表有两年的保修期。<,>I can guarantee that you'll love this product.<,>我可以保证你会喜欢这个产品。<,>Hard work is no guarantee of success.<,>努力工作并不保证成功。<,>guard(守卫)+antee→像守卫一样保证<,>warranty(n.保修)/guarantor(n.担保人)  

discrimination<,>/dɪˌskrɪmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/dɪˌskrɪmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.歧视<,>Laws prohibit discrimination based on race or gender.<,>法律禁止基于种族或性别的歧视。<,>She faced discrimination when applying for the job.<,>她在申请工作时遇到了歧视。<,>Age discrimination in the workplace is a serious issue.<,>职场中的年龄歧视是一个严重问题。<,>dis(分开)+crimin(分辨)+ation→区别对待→歧视<,>discriminate(v.区分/v.歧视)/indiscriminate(adj.不加选择的)
intense<,>/ɪnˈtens/<,>/ɪnˈtɛns/<,>adj.强烈的<,>She felt an intense pain in her back.<,>她感到背部一阵剧痛。<,>The competition was intense.<,>竞争非常激烈。<,>He has an intense dislike for cold weather.<,>他非常讨厌寒冷的天气。<,>in(不)+tense(拉紧)→拉紧到极限→强烈的<,>tense(adj.紧张的)/intensive(adj.密集的)  

facilitate<,>/fəˈsɪlɪteɪt/<,>/fəˈsɪləˌteɪt/<,>v.使便利/v.促进<,>The new software will facilitate data analysis.<,>新软件将便于数据分析。<,>Good communication facilitates teamwork.<,>良好的沟通促进团队合作。<,>The bridge facilitates the crossing of the river.<,>这座桥使过河更加便利。<,>facil(容易)+itate(使)→使容易<,>felicitate(v.祝贺)/facility(n.设施)  

mislead<,>/ˌmɪsˈliːd/<,>/ˌmɪsˈlid/<,>v.误导<,>The advertisement misled consumers about the product's benefits.<,>广告误导了消费者对该产品功效的认识。<,>Don't be misled by appearances.<,>不要被表象所迷惑。<,>His vague answers misled the investigators.<,>他含糊的回答误导了调查人员。<,>mis(错误)+lead(引导)→错误引导<,>mislead(v.误导)/misled(过去式)  

reassess<,>/ˌriːəˈses/<,>/ˌriəˈsɛs/<,>v.重新评估<,>We need to reassess our marketing strategy.<,>我们需要重新评估营销策略。<,>The doctor reassessed the patient's condition.<,>医生重新评估了患者的病情。<,>After the failure, he reassessed his approach.<,>失败后，他重新评估了自己的方法。<,>re(再)+assess(评估)→再次评估<,>reassure(v.使安心)/assessment(n.评估)  

response<,>/rɪˈspɒns/<,>/rɪˈspɑːns/<,>n.反应<,>There was no response to my email.<,>我的邮件没有得到回复。<,>Her response to the news was unexpected.<,>她对这消息的反应出人意料。<,>The emergency response team arrived quickly.<,>应急反应小组迅速赶到。<,>re(回)+sponse(承诺)→回应<,>responsible(adj.负责的)/respond(v.回应)  

essay<,>/ˈeseɪ/<,>/ˈɛseɪ/<,>n.散文/n.文章<,>He wrote an essay on environmental protection.<,>他写了一篇关于环境保护的文章。<,>The book contains a collection of her essays.<,>这本书收录了她的散文集。<,>Your essay should be at least 500 words.<,>你的文章至少要500字。<,>es(出)+say(说)→说出观点→文章<,>assay(v.化验)/easy(adj.容易的)  

stimulate<,>/ˈstɪmjʊleɪt/<,>/ˈstɪmjəˌleɪt/<,>v.刺激<,>The coffee helped to stimulate his mind.<,>咖啡帮助他提神醒脑。<,>Exercise stimulates blood circulation.<,>运动促进血液循环。<,>The teacher used questions to stimulate discussion.<,>老师用问题激发讨论。<,>stimul(刺)+ate(使)→刺激<,>simulate(v.模拟)/stipulate(v.规定)  

dessert<,>/dɪˈzɜːt/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrt/<,>n.甜点<,>We had ice cream for dessert.<,>我们吃了冰淇淋作为甜点。<,>The restaurant offers a variety of desserts.<,>这家餐厅提供多种甜点。<,>She loves chocolate desserts.<,>她喜欢巧克力甜点。<,>des(离开)+sert(服务)→饭后上的食物<,>desert(n.沙漠/v.抛弃)/dissert(v.论述)  

peaceful<,>/ˈpiːsfʊl/<,>/ˈpisfəl/<,>adj.平静的/adj.和平的<,>It's so peaceful by the lake.<,>湖边非常宁静。<,>They hope for a peaceful resolution to the conflict.<,>他们希望冲突能和平解决。<,>She has a peaceful temperament.<,>她性情平和。<,>peace(和平)+ful(充满)→充满和平的<,>peaceable(adj.温和的)/peacetime(n.和平时期)  

regularly<,>/ˈreɡjʊləli/<,>/ˈrɛɡjələrli/<,>adv.定期地/adv.有规律地<,>He exercises regularly.<,>他定期锻炼。<,>The magazine is published regularly.<,>这本杂志定期出版。<,>She takes her medicine regularly.<,>她有规律地服药。<,>regular(规律的)+ly(副词后缀)→有规律地<,>irregularly(adv.不规则地)/regulation(n.规章)
fascinate<,>/ˈfæsɪneɪt/<,>/ˈfæsəˌneɪt/<,>v.强烈地吸引/v.迷住<,>The magician's tricks fascinated the audience.<,>魔术师的戏法让观众着迷。<,>She was fascinated by the history of ancient Egypt.<,>她对古埃及的历史非常着迷。<,>The idea of traveling to space fascinates many people.<,>去太空旅行的想法吸引了许多人。<,>fas(看作fast,快速)+cinate→快速吸引→迷住<,>fascination(n. 迷恋)/fascinating(adj. 迷人的)/fascinator(n. 迷人的人或物)  

durability<,>/ˌdjʊərəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌdʊrəˈbɪləti/<,>n.持久<,>The durability of this material makes it ideal for outdoor furniture.<,>这种材料的耐久性使其非常适合户外家具。<,>They tested the durability of the new product under extreme conditions.<,>他们在极端条件下测试了新产品的耐久性。<,>The durability of their friendship was remarkable.<,>他们友谊的持久性令人称奇。<,>dur(持续)+ability(能力)→持久性<,>durable(adj. 耐用的)/duration(n. 持续时间)/endurance(n. 耐力)  

discover<,>/dɪˈskʌvə(r)/<,>/dɪˈskʌvər/<,>v.发现<,>Columbus discovered America in 1492.<,>哥伦布于1492年发现了美洲。<,>Scientists have discovered a new species of butterfly.<,>科学家发现了一种新的蝴蝶物种。<,>She discovered a hidden talent for painting.<,>她发现自己有绘画的隐藏天赋。<,>dis(不)+cover(覆盖)→揭开覆盖→发现<,>discovery(n. 发现)/discoverer(n. 发现者)/recover(v. 恢复)  

constitute<,>/ˈkɒnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstɪtuːt/<,>v.组成<,>Twelve months constitute a year.<,>十二个月组成一年。<,>These actions constitute a breach of contract.<,>这些行为构成了违约。<,>The committee is constituted of experts from various fields.<,>委员会由来自不同领域的专家组成。<,>con(共同)+stitute(站立)→共同站立→组成<,>constitution(n. 宪法)/constituent(n. 成分)/institute(n. 学院)  

administrative<,>/ədˈmɪnɪstrətɪv/<,>/ədˈmɪnɪstreɪtɪv/<,>adj.管理的<,>She has strong administrative skills.<,>她有很强的管理能力。<,>The administrative costs of the project were too high.<,>该项目的管理成本太高了。<,>He works in the administrative department of a large company.<,>他在一家大公司的行政部门工作。<,>administer(管理)+ative(形容词后缀)→管理的<,>administration(n. 管理)/administrator(n. 管理员)/minister(n. 部长)  

tremble<,>/ˈtrembl/<,>/ˈtrɛmbəl/<,>v.颤抖<,>Her voice trembled with emotion.<,>她的声音因激动而颤抖。<,>The leaves trembled in the breeze.<,>树叶在微风中颤动。<,>He was trembling with fear.<,>他害怕得发抖。<,>trem(颤抖)+ble→颤抖<,>tremor(n. 震颤)/tremulous(adj. 颤抖的)/tremendous(adj. 巨大的)  

ignorant<,>/ˈɪɡnərənt/<,>/ˈɪɡnərənt/<,>adj.无知的<,>He was ignorant of the basic facts.<,>他对基本事实一无所知。<,>It's better to be silent and thought ignorant than to speak and remove all doubt.<,>宁可沉默显得无知，也不要开口消除所有疑虑。<,>She was ignorant about the customs of the country.<,>她对那个国家的习俗一无所知。<,>i(不)+gnor(知道)+ant→不知道的→无知的<,>ignore(v. 忽视)/ignorance(n. 无知)/recognize(v. 认出)  

decorate<,>/ˈdekəreɪt/<,>/ˈdɛkəreɪt/<,>v.装饰<,>They decorated the room with balloons for the party.<,>他们用气球装饰房间准备派对。<,>The cake was beautifully decorated with icing flowers.<,>蛋糕用糖霜花朵装饰得很漂亮。<,>He was decorated for bravery in the war.<,>他因在战争中的勇敢而被授予勋章。<,>decor(装饰)+ate(动词后缀)→装饰<,>decoration(n. 装饰)/decorative(adj. 装饰的)/decorator(n. 装饰者)  

acquire<,>/əˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/əˈkwaɪər/<,>v.获得<,>She acquired a taste for classical music.<,>她培养了对古典音乐的爱好。<,>The company was acquired by a larger corporation.<,>这家公司被一家更大的企业收购了。<,>It takes time to acquire new skills.<,>获得新技能需要时间。<,>ac(加强)+quire(追求)→不断追求→获得<,>acquisition(n. 获得)/acquirement(n. 获得物)/inquire(v. 询问)  

annual<,>/ˈænjuəl/<,>/ˈænjuəl/<,>adj.每年的<,>The company holds its annual meeting in December.<,>公司在十二月举行年度会议。<,>We pay an annual fee for the service.<,>我们为这项服务支付年费。<,>The garden show is an annual event in our town.<,>花园展览是我们镇上的年度活动。<,>ann(年)+ual(形容词后缀)→每年的<,>annually(adv. 每年)/anniversary(n. 周年纪念)/biannual(adj. 一年两次的)
due<,>/djuː/<,>/duː/<,>adj.到期的<,>The rent is due next Monday.<,>房租下周一到期。<,>Her baby is due in June.<,>她的宝宝预计六月份出生。<,>The report is due by the end of the day.<,>报告今天下班前必须提交。<,>d(日期)+ue(谐音"到期")→到期的<,>dew(n.露水)/duel(n.决斗)/duke(n.公爵)

situation<,>/ˌsɪtʃuˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌsɪtʃuˈeɪʃn/<,>n.情况<,>The current economic situation is unstable.<,>当前经济形势不稳定。<,>She handled the difficult situation very well.<,>她很好地处理了这个困难局面。<,>Let me explain the situation in detail.<,>让我详细说明一下情况。<,>sit(坐)+uation(状态)→所处状态→情况<,>location(n.位置)/position(n.位置)/condition(n.条件)

archive<,>/ˈɑːkaɪv/<,>/ˈɑːrkaɪv/<,>n.档案馆/档案室/档案<,>Historical documents are kept in the national archive.<,>历史文件保存在国家档案馆。<,>She spent months researching in the newspaper archives.<,>她在报纸档案室研究了数月。<,>We need to archive these important emails.<,>我们需要把这些重要邮件存档。<,>arch(拱形)+ive→古代拱形建筑→档案馆<,>architect(n.建筑师)/archaic(adj.古老的)/archetype(n.原型)

incomparable<,>/ɪnˈkɒmpərəbl/<,>/ɪnˈkɑːmpərəbl/<,>adj.无比的/无可匹敌的<,>Her beauty is incomparable.<,>她的美貌无与伦比。<,>The view from the mountaintop is incomparable.<,>从山顶看到的景色无与伦比。<,>He has incomparable skills in chess.<,>他的国际象棋技艺无人能敌。<,>in(不)+comparable(可比较的)→无法比较的<,>comparable(adj.可比较的)/incompatible(adj.不兼容的)/incompetent(adj.无能的)

perspective<,>/pəˈspektɪv/<,>/pərˈspektɪv/<,>n.视角/观点/远景<,>From my perspective, the decision was wrong.<,>从我的角度来看，这个决定是错误的。<,>The painting shows excellent perspective.<,>这幅画展现了出色的透视效果。<,>Let's look at this issue from a different perspective.<,>让我们从不同角度来看这个问题。<,>per(通过)+spect(看)+ive→通过...看→视角<,>prospective(adj.预期的)/respective(adj.各自的)/retrospective(adj.回顾的)

compete<,>/kəmˈpiːt/<,>/kəmˈpiːt/<,>v.竞争<,>Athletes from all over the world will compete in the Olympics.<,>来自世界各地的运动员将在奥运会上竞争。<,>Our company competes with several large corporations.<,>我们公司与几家大公司竞争。<,>She refused to compete against her best friend.<,>她拒绝与最好的朋友竞争。<,>com(共同)+pete(追求)→共同追求→竞争<,>complete(v.完成)/compute(v.计算)/compel(v.强迫)

joint<,>/dʒɔɪnt/<,>/dʒɔɪnt/<,>adj.联合的<,>They opened a joint bank account.<,>他们开了一个联名银行账户。<,>The two companies formed a joint venture.<,>两家公司成立了合资企业。<,>He has pain in his knee joint.<,>他的膝关节疼痛。<,>join(连接)+t→连接在一起的→联合的<,>point(n.点)/joist(n.托梁)/joust(v.马上长矛比武)

overload<,>/ˌəʊvəˈləʊd/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈloʊd/<,>n.负担太重<,>The electrical system experienced an overload.<,>电力系统超负荷了。<,>Information overload can cause stress.<,>信息过载会导致压力。<,>Don't overload the washing machine with clothes.<,>不要把洗衣机塞太多衣服。<,>over(过度)+load(装载)→装载过度→超载<,>overlord(n.霸主)/overlook(v.忽视)/overlap(v.重叠)

mechanic<,>/məˈkænɪk/<,>/məˈkænɪk/<,>n.机械师<,>The mechanic fixed my car in just one hour.<,>机械师只用一小时就修好了我的车。<,>He's training to become an aircraft mechanic.<,>他正在接受飞机机械师的培训。<,>The mechanic explained the problem with the engine.<,>机械师解释了发动机的问题。<,>mechan(机器)+ic(人)→操作机器的人→机械师<,>machine(n.机器)/mechanism(n.机制)/mechanical(adj.机械的)

distinguish<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>v.区别/区分<,>It's hard to distinguish the twins apart.<,>很难区分这对双胞胎。<,>He distinguished himself in the field of science.<,>他在科学领域表现突出。<,>Can you distinguish between these two colors?<,>你能区分这两种颜色吗？<,>di(分开)+sting(刺)+uish→用刺分开→区分<,>extinguish(v.熄灭)/distinct(adj.明显的)/distinguish(v.区分)
vote<,>/vəʊt/<,>/voʊt/<,>v.投票/v.选举<,>Citizens will vote in the upcoming election.<,>公民将在即将到来的选举中投票。<,>She voted for the new policy.<,>她投票支持新政策。<,>Everyone has the right to vote.<,>每个人都有投票权。<,>vo(voice)+te→用声音表达→投票<,>veto(v.否决/n.否决权)/note(n.笔记/v.注意)  

everlasting<,>/ˌevəˈlɑːstɪŋ/<,>/ˌevərˈlæstɪŋ/<,>adj.永恒的<,>Their love is everlasting.<,>他们的爱是永恒的。<,>The mountains seem everlasting.<,>这些山似乎永恒不变。<,>He gave an everlasting speech.<,>他做了一个没完没了的演讲。<,>ever(永远)+last(持续)+ing→永远持续的<,>lasting(adj.持久的)/enduring(adj.持久的)  

construction<,>/kənˈstrʌkʃn/<,>/kənˈstrʌkʃən/<,>n.建筑<,>The construction of the bridge took two years.<,>这座桥的建设花了两年时间。<,>He works in the construction industry.<,>他在建筑行业工作。<,>The building is under construction.<,>这栋建筑正在施工中。<,>con(共同)+struct(建造)+ion→共同建造→建筑<,>destruction(n.破坏)/instruction(n.指导)  

aggressive<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>adj.挑衅的/adj.好斗的/adj.有上进心的<,>He has an aggressive personality.<,>他性格好斗。<,>She is aggressive in pursuing her goals.<,>她积极追求自己的目标。<,>The company took aggressive marketing measures.<,>公司采取了激进的营销措施。<,>ag(向)+gress(走)+ive→走向冲突的→好斗的<,>progressive(adj.进步的)/digressive(adj.离题的)  

classification<,>/ˌklæsɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌklæsəfəˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.分类/n.级别<,>The classification of books is based on subjects.<,>书籍按主题分类。<,>This animal belongs to a rare classification.<,>这种动物属于稀有类别。<,>They revised the classification system.<,>他们修改了分类系统。<,>class(类别)+ify(使...化)+ation→分类<,>clarification(n.澄清)/identification(n.识别)  

melt<,>/melt/<,>/melt/<,>v.融化<,>The ice cream began to melt in the sun.<,>冰淇淋在阳光下开始融化。<,>Her heart melted when she saw the puppy.<,>看到小狗时她的心软化了。<,>The snow will melt by noon.<,>雪将在中午前融化。<,>m(水)+elt→与水有关→融化<,>smelt(v.熔炼)/weld(v.焊接)  

detect<,>/dɪˈtekt/<,>/dɪˈtekt/<,>v.觉察/v.检测<,>The test can detect early signs of disease.<,>这个测试能检测疾病的早期迹象。<,>I detected a note of sadness in her voice.<,>我察觉到她声音中的悲伤。<,>Security systems detect unauthorized entry.<,>安全系统检测未经授权的进入。<,>de(去掉)+tect(掩盖)→去掉掩盖→发现<,>defect(n.缺陷)/protect(v.保护)  

discourage<,>/dɪsˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>v.阻止/v.使气馁<,>Bad weather discouraged us from going out.<,>恶劣的天气使我们不愿外出。<,>Don't let failure discourage you.<,>不要让失败使你气馁。<,>The high cost discourages investment.<,>高昂的成本阻碍了投资。<,>dis(不)+courage(勇气)→使失去勇气<,>encourage(v.鼓励)/courage(n.勇气)  

combination<,>/ˌkɒmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmbɪˈneɪʃən/<,>n.联合/n.结合<,>The dish is a combination of sweet and sour flavors.<,>这道菜是酸甜口味的结合。<,>They won through a combination of skill and luck.<,>他们凭借技巧和运气的结合获胜。<,>The safe requires a combination to open.<,>这个保险箱需要密码组合才能打开。<,>com(一起)+bin(两个)+ation→两个放在一起→结合<,>separation(n.分离)/donation(n.捐赠)  

grave<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>n.坟墓<,>They visited their grandfather's grave.<,>他们去祭拜了祖父的坟墓。<,>The cemetery has many ancient graves.<,>这个墓地有许多古老的坟墓。<,>He was buried in an unmarked grave.<,>他被葬在一个无名的坟墓里。<,>gr(地)+ave→地下的地方→坟墓<,>gravel(n.砂砾)/gravy(n.肉汁)
malfunction<,>/ˌmælˈfʌŋkʃn/<,>/ˌmælˈfʌŋkʃən/<,>n.失灵/n.故障<,>The machine stopped working due to a malfunction.<,>机器因故障停止运转。<,>A software malfunction caused the system to crash.<,>软件故障导致系统崩溃。<,>The pilot handled the engine malfunction expertly.<,>飞行员专业地处理了发动机故障。<,>mal(坏)+function(功能)→功能失常→故障<,>function(n.功能/v.运行)/malnutrition(n.营养不良)/malpractice(n.玩忽职守)  

reduce<,>/rɪˈdjuːs/<,>/rɪˈduːs/<,>v.减少<,>We need to reduce our energy consumption.<,>我们需要减少能源消耗。<,>The company reduced its workforce by 20%.<,>公司裁员20%。<,>This medicine helps reduce inflammation.<,>这种药有助于减轻炎症。<,>re(回)+duce(引导)→往回引→减少<,>deduce(v.推断)/induce(v.引诱)/produce(v.生产)  

respectively<,>/rɪˈspektɪvli/<,>/rɪˈspektɪvli/<,>adv.各自地<,>John and Mary are 25 and 30 years old respectively.<,>约翰和玛丽分别是25岁和30岁。<,>The first and second prizes went to Alice and Bob respectively.<,>一等奖和二等奖分别由爱丽丝和鲍勃获得。<,>The red and blue teams scored 10 and 15 points respectively.<,>红队和蓝队分别得了10分和15分。<,>respect(方面)+ive+ly→各自方面地→分别地<,>respectful(adj.恭敬的)/respective(adj.各自的)/irrespective(adj.不考虑的)  

forefinger<,>/ˈfɔːfɪŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈfɔːrfɪŋɡər/<,>n.食指<,>He pointed at the map with his forefinger.<,>他用食指指着地图。<,>The baby grabbed my forefinger tightly.<,>婴儿紧紧抓住我的食指。<,>She wore a ring on her forefinger.<,>她在食指上戴了一枚戒指。<,>fore(前)+finger(手指)→最前面的手指→食指<,>middle finger(n.中指)/ring finger(n.无名指)/little finger(n.小指)  

wise<,>/waɪz/<,>/waɪz/<,>adj.聪明的/adj.有智慧的<,>It would be wise to save some money for emergencies.<,>为紧急情况存些钱是明智的。<,>The wise old man gave us valuable advice.<,>那位智慧的老人给了我们宝贵的建议。<,>She made a wise decision to invest in education.<,>她做出了投资教育的明智决定。<,>wis(知道)+e→知道的→聪明的<,>wiser(adj.更聪明的)/wisdom(n.智慧)/unwise(adj.不明智的)  

background<,>/ˈbækɡraʊnd/<,>/ˈbækˌɡraʊnd/<,>n.背景<,>She comes from a wealthy background.<,>她出身富裕家庭。<,>The photo shows a mountain background.<,>照片以山为背景。<,>His medical background helped him understand the report.<,>他的医学背景帮助他理解报告。<,>back(后)+ground(地面)→后面的地面→背景<,>foreground(n.前景)/underground(adj.地下的)/playground(n.操场)  

symbol<,>/ˈsɪmbl/<,>/ˈsɪmbəl/<,>n.象征/n.标志<,>The dove is a symbol of peace.<,>鸽子是和平的象征。<,>This symbol represents danger.<,>这个标志代表危险。<,>The ring was a symbol of their love.<,>这枚戒指是他们爱情的象征。<,>sym(共同)+bol(投掷)→共同投掷的标志→象征<,>cymbal(n.钹)/simple(adj.简单的)/symptom(n.症状)  

quality<,>/ˈkwɒləti/<,>/ˈkwɑːləti/<,>n.品质<,>This product is of high quality.<,>这个产品质量很高。<,>She has many good qualities.<,>她有许多优秀品质。<,>Air quality has improved in the city.<,>城市空气质量有所改善。<,>qual(性质)+ity→性质→品质<,>quantity(n.数量)/qualify(v.使合格)/qualified(adj.合格的)  

repave<,>/ˌriːˈpeɪv/<,>/ˌriˈpeɪv/<,>v.再铺/v.重新铺砌<,>The city will repave this road next month.<,>市政府将于下个月重新铺设这条路。<,>They repaved the parking lot with asphalt.<,>他们用沥青重新铺砌了停车场。<,>It's expensive to repave the entire driveway.<,>重新铺设整个车道很昂贵。<,>re(再)+pave(铺)→再铺<,>pave(v.铺设)/repaint(v.重新粉刷)/rebuild(v.重建)  

downfall<,>/ˈdaʊnfɔːl/<,>/ˈdaʊnˌfɔːl/<,>n.大下特下/n.垮台<,>The heavy downfall caused flooding in the streets.<,>大雨导致街道积水。<,>His downfall began when he lost his job.<,>他的落魄始于失业。<,>Greed was the downfall of many politicians.<,>贪婪是许多政客垮台的原因。<,>down(下)+fall(落)→落下→大雨/垮台<,>rainfall(n.降雨量)/waterfall(n.瀑布)/fall down(短语.跌倒)
ring<,>/rɪŋ/<,>/rɪŋ/<,>n.拳击台/n.戒指/n.环形物<,>The fighters entered the ring for the championship match.<,>拳击手们进入拳击台参加冠军赛。<,>She wore a beautiful diamond ring on her finger.<,>她手指上戴着一枚漂亮的钻戒。<,>The children sat in a ring around the teacher.<,>孩子们围着老师坐成一圈。<,>ring(环形)→拳击台是环形场地<,>bring(v.带来)/wring(v.拧)/king(n.国王)

planet<,>/ˈplænɪt/<,>/ˈplænɪt/<,>n.行星/n.地球(特指)<,>Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.<,>木星是我们太阳系中最大的行星。<,>We must protect our planet from pollution.<,>我们必须保护我们的地球免受污染。<,>The telescope can detect planets orbiting distant stars.<,>这台望远镜可以探测到围绕遥远恒星运行的行星。<,>plane(平面)+t→行星在平面轨道上运行<,>plant(n.植物/v.种植)/plan(n.计划)/panel(n.面板)

pension<,>/ˈpenʃn/<,>/ˈpenʃən/<,>n.养老金/n.退休金<,>He receives a monthly pension after retirement.<,>退休后他每月领取养老金。<,>The company offers a good pension scheme.<,>公司提供很好的养老金计划。<,>She lives on her state pension.<,>她靠国家养老金生活。<,>pens(支付)+ion→定期支付的款项<,>tension(n.紧张)/dimension(n.维度)/extension(n.延伸)

perception<,>/pəˈsepʃn/<,>/pərˈsepʃən/<,>n.感知/n.看法/n.洞察力<,>His perception of colors changed after the accident.<,>事故后他对颜色的感知发生了变化。<,>Public perception of the policy is negative.<,>公众对这项政策的看法是负面的。<,>She has a keen perception of human nature.<,>她对人性有敏锐的洞察力。<,>per(完全)+cept(拿取)+ion→完全获取信息→感知<,>conception(n.概念)/reception(n.接待)/deception(n.欺骗)

facility<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>n.设施/n.才能/n.便利<,>The sports facility is open to the public.<,>这个体育设施对公众开放。<,>She has a facility for learning languages.<,>她有学习语言的天赋。<,>The hotel offers laundry facilities for guests.<,>酒店为客人提供洗衣便利。<,>fac(做)+ility→能够做事的地方→设施<,>felicity(n.幸福)/fragility(n.脆弱)/fertility(n.肥沃)

proportion<,>/prəˈpɔːʃn/<,>/prəˈpɔːrʃən/<,>n.比例/n.部分/n.均衡<,>The proportion of women in the workforce has increased.<,>劳动力中女性的比例增加了。<,>Add water in the correct proportions.<,>按正确比例加水。<,>The punishment should be in proportion to the crime.<,>惩罚应与罪行成比例。<,>pro(向前)+portion(部分)→各部分的关系→比例<,>portion(n.部分)/proposition(n.提议)/preposition(n.介词)

involve<,>/ɪnˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪnˈvɑːlv/<,>v.卷入/v.包含/v.需要<,>Don't involve me in your problems.<,>别把我卷进你的问题里。<,>The job involves frequent travel.<,>这份工作需要经常出差。<,>The recipe involves several complicated steps.<,>这个食谱包含几个复杂的步骤。<,>in(进入)+volve(卷)→卷入<,>evolve(v.进化)/revolve(v.旋转)/resolve(v.解决)

attempt<,>/əˈtempt/<,>/əˈtempt/<,>n.尝试/v.试图/n.努力<,>He made an attempt to break the record.<,>他尝试打破纪录。<,>They attempted to climb the mountain.<,>他们试图攀登那座山。<,>Her first attempt at baking failed.<,>她第一次尝试烘焙失败了。<,>at(加强)+tempt(尝试)→努力尝试<,>tempt(v.诱惑)/contempt(n.轻视)/exempt(v.免除)

conventional<,>/kənˈvenʃənl/<,>/kənˈvenʃənl/<,>adj.传统的/adj.常规的/adj.惯例的<,>They prefer conventional medicine to alternative treatments.<,>他们更喜欢传统医学而非替代疗法。<,>It's conventional to shake hands when meeting someone.<,>见面握手是常规礼节。<,>The design is too conventional for my taste.<,>这个设计对我的品味来说太传统了。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ion+al→大家共同遵循的→传统的<,>conversational(adj.会话的)/convention(n.惯例)/invention(n.发明)

detailed<,>/ˈdiːteɪld/<,>/ˈdiːteɪld/<,>adj.详细的/adj.细致的/adj.详尽的<,>She gave a detailed description of the event.<,>她对事件进行了详细描述。<,>The report contains detailed analysis of the data.<,>报告包含对数据的细致分析。<,>Please provide more detailed instructions.<,>请提供更详尽的说明。<,>detail(细节)+ed→充满细节的→详细的<,>detained(v.拘留)/retail(n.零售)/entail(v.需要)
interpretation<,>/ɪnˌtɜːprɪˈteɪʃən/<,>/ɪnˌtɜːrprɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.阐释/n.说明<,>The interpretation of the poem varies among scholars.<,>这首诗的阐释在学者间各不相同。<,>His interpretation of the data was quite insightful.<,>他对数据的说明很有见地。<,>The judge's interpretation of the law was controversial.<,>法官对法律的阐释引发了争议。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)+ation→在不同表达间转换→阐释<,>interruption(n.打断)/intervention(n.干预)

guilt<,>/ɡɪlt/<,>/ɡɪlt/<,>n.有罪/n.犯罪行为<,>He admitted his guilt in court.<,>他在法庭上承认了自己的罪行。<,>Her face showed signs of guilt.<,>她脸上露出了愧疚的表情。<,>The evidence proved his guilt beyond doubt.<,>证据确凿地证明了他的罪行。<,>gui(归)+lt→归咎→有罪<,>gilt(n.镀金物)/guild(n.行会)

connectivity<,>/kəˌnekˈtɪvɪti/<,>/kəˌnekˈtɪvəti/<,>n.连接/n.联系<,>The new router improves WiFi connectivity.<,>新路由器改善了无线连接。<,>Brain connectivity is crucial for cognitive functions.<,>大脑联系对认知功能至关重要。<,>The city's public transport lacks connectivity.<,>这个城市的公共交通缺乏衔接。<,>connect(连接)+ivity(状态)→连接状态<,>activity(n.活动)/sensitivity(n.敏感)

behave<,>/bɪˈheɪv/<,>/bɪˈheɪv/<,>v.表现<,>Children should behave properly in public.<,>孩子们在公共场合应该表现得体。<,>The material behaves differently under high pressure.<,>这种材料在高压下表现不同。<,>How did the new employee behave during the meeting?<,>新员工在会议中表现如何？<,>be(使)+have(有)→使有(规矩)→表现<,>belief(n.信念)/behalf(n.代表)

instruct<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkt/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkt/<,>v.指导/v.教授/v.通知/v.命令<,>The manual instructs users on proper operation.<,>手册指导用户正确操作。<,>She was instructed to wait outside.<,>她被命令在外面等候。<,>The professor instructs graduate students in physics.<,>这位教授指导研究生物理。<,>in(进入)+struct(建造)→指导建造<,>construct(v.建造)/obstruct(v.阻碍)

infinite<,>/ˈɪnfɪnət/<,>/ˈɪnfənət/<,>adj.无限的<,>The universe may be infinite in size.<,>宇宙的大小可能是无限的。<,>Her patience seems infinite with children.<,>她对孩子似乎有无限的耐心。<,>The possibilities are infinite in this field.<,>这个领域的可能性是无限的。<,>in(不)+fin(界限)+ite→无界限的<,>definite(adj.明确的)/indefinite(adj.模糊的)

hazard<,>/ˈhæzəd/<,>/ˈhæzərd/<,>n.危险<,>Smoking is a serious health hazard.<,>吸烟是严重的健康危害。<,>The icy roads pose a hazard to drivers.<,>结冰的道路对司机构成危险。<,>Chemical hazards must be clearly labeled.<,>化学危险品必须明确标注。<,>haz(机会)+ard→碰运气的事→危险<,>haphazard(adj.随意的)/hazardous(adj.危险的)

undervalue<,>/ˌʌndəˈvæljuː/<,>/ˌʌndərˈvæljuː/<,>v.低估<,>Don't undervalue your own abilities.<,>不要低估自己的能力。<,>The property was undervalued in the assessment.<,>这处房产在评估中被低估了。<,>Many artists were undervalued during their lifetime.<,>许多艺术家在世时被低估了。<,>under(低于)+value(价值)→价值低于实际<,>overvalue(v.高估)/evaluate(v.评估)

specific<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>adj.特定的/adj.具体的<,>Please provide specific examples.<,>请提供具体的例子。<,>The medicine is for specific symptoms.<,>这种药针对特定症状。<,>We need to address specific issues.<,>我们需要解决具体问题。<,>speci(种类)+fic(做)→按种类做的→特定的<,>special(adj.特别的)/specimen(n.标本)

appealing<,>/əˈpiːlɪŋ/<,>/əˈpiːlɪŋ/<,>adj.吸引人的<,>The job offer was very appealing.<,>这个工作机会很吸引人。<,>She has an appealing personality.<,>她个性很有吸引力。<,>The dessert looks appealing but is too sweet.<,>这个甜点看起来诱人但太甜了。<,>appeal(吸引)+ing→吸引人的<,>appalling(adj.骇人听闻的)/appearing(v.出现)
fitness<,>/ˈfɪtnəs/<,>/ˈfɪtnəs/<,>n.健康<,>Regular exercise improves your fitness.<,>定期锻炼能提高你的健康水平。<,>She has a high level of fitness due to her active lifestyle.<,>由于积极的生活方式，她的健康状况很好。<,>Fitness is important for both physical and mental well-being.<,>健康对身心健康都很重要。<,>fit(适合)+ness(名词后缀)→适合的状态→健康<,>illness(n.疾病)/weakness(n.虚弱)/wellness(n.健康)

conclusion<,>/kənˈkluːʒn/<,>/kənˈkluːʒən/<,>n.结论<,>He came to the conclusion that she was right.<,>他得出的结论是她是对的。<,>Let's not jump to conclusions without all the facts.<,>让我们不要在没有所有事实的情况下妄下结论。<,>The conclusion of the meeting was that more research was needed.<,>会议的结论是需要更多的研究。<,>con(共同)+clus(关闭)+ion→共同关闭→结论<,>confusion(n.混淆)/inclusion(n.包含)/exclusion(n.排除)

absent<,>/ˈæbsənt/<,>/ˈæbsənt/<,>adj.缺席的<,>She was absent from school yesterday.<,>她昨天没来上学。<,>An absent look on his face suggested he wasn't listening.<,>他脸上心不在焉的表情表明他没在听。<,>The absent employee will need to provide a doctor's note.<,>缺席的员工需要提供医生证明。<,>ab(离开)+sent(存在)→离开存在→缺席的<,>present(adj.在场的)/absentee(n.缺席者)/absence(n.缺席)

antique<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>n.古玩/古董<,>She collects antique furniture.<,>她收藏古董家具。<,>The shop specializes in 18th century antiques.<,>这家店专营18世纪的古董。<,>That vase is a genuine antique, not a reproduction.<,>那个花瓶是真正的古董，不是复制品。<,>anti(前)+que→以前的东西→古董<,>unique(adj.独特的)/ancient(adj.古老的)/vintage(adj.经典的)

myth<,>/mɪθ/<,>/mɪθ/<,>n.神话<,>The myth of Hercules is well-known.<,>赫拉克勒斯的神话很有名。<,>It's a myth that carrots improve your eyesight.<,>胡萝卜能改善视力是个神话。<,>Many cultures have creation myths.<,>许多文化都有创世神话。<,>myth(神话)→与"迷思"发音相似<,>legend(n.传说)/fable(n.寓言)/folklore(n.民间传说)

intervention<,>/ˌɪntəˈvenʃn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈvenʃən/<,>n.干涉<,>Government intervention saved the failing company.<,>政府干预拯救了这家濒临倒闭的公司。<,>Early medical intervention can prevent complications.<,>早期医疗干预可以预防并发症。<,>The teacher's intervention stopped the fight.<,>老师的干预制止了这场打架。<,>inter(在...之间)+vent(来)+ion→来到中间→干涉<,>prevention(n.预防)/invention(n.发明)/convention(n.惯例)

trace<,>/treɪs/<,>/treɪs/<,>n.痕迹<,>There was no trace of the missing documents.<,>失踪的文件没有任何痕迹。<,>Archaeologists found traces of an ancient civilization.<,>考古学家发现了古代文明的痕迹。<,>A faint trace of perfume lingered in the air.<,>空气中残留着淡淡的香水味。<,>trace(痕迹)→与"追踪"同词源<,>track(n.踪迹)/trail(n.足迹)/vestige(n.遗迹)

protest<,>/prəˈtest/<,>/ˈproʊtest/<,>v.抗议<,>Workers protested against the pay cuts.<,>工人们抗议减薪。<,>She protested her innocence throughout the trial.<,>她在整个审判过程中都坚称自己无罪。<,>Thousands gathered to protest the new law.<,>数千人聚集抗议新法律。<,>pro(前)+test(作证)→在前面作证→抗议<,>contest(v.竞争)/detest(v.憎恶)/attest(v.证明)

refuel<,>/ˌriːˈfjuːəl/<,>/ˌriːˈfjuːəl/<,>v.(给)加油/加燃料<,>We need to refuel the car before our long trip.<,>在我们长途旅行前需要给车加油。<,>The plane stopped to refuel in Dubai.<,>飞机在迪拜停下来加油。<,>It's important to refuel your body after exercise.<,>锻炼后给身体补充能量很重要。<,>re(再)+fuel(燃料)→再加燃料<,>refill(v.再装满)/recharge(v.再充电)/renew(v.更新)

tackle<,>/ˈtækl/<,>/ˈtækəl/<,>v.处理<,>We need to tackle this problem immediately.<,>我们需要立即处理这个问题。<,>She tackled the difficult assignment with enthusiasm.<,>她热情地处理了这个困难的任务。<,>The government is tackling unemployment.<,>政府正在处理失业问题。<,>tack(钉)+le→像钉住问题一样处理<,>handle(v.处理)/attack(v.攻击)/stack(v.堆积)
finance<,>/ˈfaɪnæns/<,>/ˈfaɪnæns/<,>n.财政/v.资助<,>The government needs to improve its finance management.<,>政府需要改进其财政管理。<,>They decided to finance the project themselves.<,>他们决定自己资助这个项目。<,>She works in the finance department.<,>她在财务部门工作。<,>fin(结束)+ance→资金周转→财政<,>fine(adj.好的/v.罚款)/fiance(n.未婚夫)

fine<,>/faɪn/<,>/faɪn/<,>v.罚款<,>The police fined him for speeding.<,>警察因他超速而罚款。<,>You will be fined if you park here.<,>如果你在这里停车会被罚款。<,>He was fined $200 for littering.<,>他因乱扔垃圾被罚款200美元。<,>fin(结束)+e→终结错误→罚款<,>finance(n.财政/v.资助)/refine(v.精炼)

indicate<,>/ˈɪndɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈɪndɪkeɪt/<,>v.表明<,>The sign indicates the direction to the hospital.<,>这个标志指示去医院的方向。<,>His tone indicated his displeasure.<,>他的语气表明了他的不满。<,>Research indicates that exercise improves mood.<,>研究表明运动能改善情绪。<,>in(内)+dic(说)+ate→向内说→表明<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/predicate(n.谓语)

dissatisfy<,>/dɪsˈsætɪsfaɪ/<,>/dɪsˈsætɪsfaɪ/<,>v.不满意<,>The poor service dissatisfied the customers.<,>糟糕的服务让顾客不满意。<,>He was dissatisfied with the exam results.<,>他对考试成绩不满意。<,>Many workers are dissatisfied with their salaries.<,>许多工人对他们的工资不满意。<,>dis(不)+satisfy(满意)→不满意<,>satisfy(v.满足)/dissatisfaction(n.不满)

expand<,>/ɪkˈspænd/<,>/ɪkˈspænd/<,>v.扩大<,>The company plans to expand its business overseas.<,>公司计划将业务扩展到海外。<,>Metals expand when heated.<,>金属受热会膨胀。<,>She wants to expand her knowledge of art.<,>她想扩大自己的艺术知识。<,>ex(出)+pand(伸展)→向外伸展→扩大<,>expend(v.花费)/extend(v.延伸)

spontaneous<,>/spɒnˈteɪniəs/<,>/spɑːnˈteɪniəs/<,>adj.自发的<,>The crowd burst into spontaneous applause.<,>人群自发地爆发出掌声。<,>She made a spontaneous decision to travel alone.<,>她自发决定独自旅行。<,>His offer of help was completely spontaneous.<,>他的帮助完全是自发的。<,>spont(自愿)+aneous→自发的<,>simultaneous(adj.同时的)/instantaneous(adj.瞬间的)

offense<,>/əˈfens/<,>/əˈfɛns/<,>n.犯罪；冒犯<,>Drunk driving is a serious offense.<,>酒驾是严重犯罪。<,>I meant no offense by my comment.<,>我的评论无意冒犯。<,>The team's offense scored three goals.<,>球队的进攻得了三分。<,>of(反对)+fense(打击)→冒犯<,>defense(n.防御)/fence(n.栅栏)

abruptly<,>/əˈbrʌptli/<,>/əˈbrʌptli/<,>adv.突然地<,>The meeting ended abruptly.<,>会议突然结束了。<,>He left the room abruptly without explanation.<,>他突然离开房间没有解释。<,>The road turns abruptly to the left.<,>这条路突然向左转弯。<,>ab(离开)+rupt(断裂)+ly→突然断裂地<,>corruptly(adv.腐败地)/erupt(v.爆发)

recycle<,>/ˌriːˈsaɪkl/<,>/ˌriːˈsaɪkl/<,>v.循环，再利用<,>We should recycle paper to save trees.<,>我们应该回收纸张以拯救树木。<,>This plastic bottle can be recycled.<,>这个塑料瓶可以回收利用。<,>The city has improved its recycling program.<,>城市改进了回收计划。<,>re(再)+cycle(循环)→再循环<,>bicycle(n.自行车)/cycle(n.周期)

rude<,>/ruːd/<,>/ruːd/<,>adj.粗鲁的<,>It's rude to interrupt people.<,>打断别人是粗鲁的。<,>He gave a rude reply to the teacher.<,>他对老师做了粗鲁的回复。<,>Don't be rude to the waiter.<,>不要对服务员粗鲁。<,>rud(原始)+e→原始的→粗鲁的<,>crude(adj.粗糙的)/prude(n.拘谨的人)
contribute<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>v.捐款/v.贡献<,>She contributes to charity every month.<,>她每月都向慈善机构捐款。<,>His research contributed greatly to the field.<,>他的研究对该领域贡献很大。<,>Everyone should contribute to environmental protection.<,>每个人都应该为环境保护做贡献。<,>con(共同)+tribute(给予)→共同给予→贡献<,>distribute(v.分配)/attribute(v.归因于)/retribution(n.报应)

embarrass<,>/ɪmˈbærəs/<,>/ɪmˈbærəs/<,>v.尴尬<,>He was embarrassed by his mistake.<,>他因自己的错误而感到尴尬。<,>Her question embarrassed the speaker.<,>她的问题让演讲者很尴尬。<,>Don't embarrass me in public.<,>别在公共场合让我难堪。<,>em(进入)+bar(r)(障碍)+ass→陷入障碍→尴尬<,>embassy(n.大使馆)/embargo(n.禁运)/embrace(v.拥抱)

weaken<,>/ˈwiːkən/<,>/ˈwiːkən/<,>v.减少/v.减弱<,>The storm weakened as it moved inland.<,>风暴向内陆移动时减弱了。<,>Lack of sleep weakens the immune system.<,>睡眠不足会削弱免疫系统。<,>The team was weakened by injuries.<,>球队因伤病而实力减弱。<,>weak(弱的)+en(使)→使变弱<,>waken(v.醒来)/strengthen(v.加强)/soften(v.软化)

mineral<,>/ˈmɪnərəl/<,>/ˈmɪnərəl/<,>n.矿物<,>This water contains essential minerals.<,>这种水含有必需的矿物质。<,>The region is rich in mineral resources.<,>该地区矿产资源丰富。<,>She takes mineral supplements daily.<,>她每天服用矿物质补充剂。<,>mine(矿)+ral→矿物<,>miner(n.矿工)/mineralogy(n.矿物学)/mineralize(v.矿化)

sticky<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>adj.粘的<,>The tape is very sticky.<,>这个胶带很粘。<,>His fingers were sticky with jam.<,>他的手指沾满了果酱，黏糊糊的。<,>We're in a sticky situation.<,>我们处境很棘手。<,>stick(粘)+y(形容词后缀)→粘的<,>tricky(adj.狡猾的)/slick(adj.光滑的)/stocky(adj.结实的)

challenge<,>/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/<,>/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/<,>n.挑战/v.质疑<,>This job presents a new challenge.<,>这份工作带来了新的挑战。<,>She challenged the referee's decision.<,>她对裁判的决定提出质疑。<,>The mountain climb was a real challenge.<,>这次登山是真正的挑战。<,>chall(喊叫)+enge→叫阵→挑战<,>change(n.变化)/charge(v.充电)/chancellor(n.校长)

excess<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>n.过量/n.过度<,>Don't drink to excess.<,>不要过量饮酒。<,>The company has excess inventory.<,>公司库存过剩。<,>Excess sugar is bad for health.<,>过量糖分对健康有害。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)→走出界限→过量<,>access(n.入口)/success(n.成功)/process(n.过程)

recruit<,>/rɪˈkruːt/<,>/rɪˈkruːt/<,>v.招募/v.吸收/n.新兵/n.新成员<,>The army is recruiting new soldiers.<,>军队正在招募新兵。<,>We need to recruit more staff.<,>我们需要招聘更多员工。<,>She's the newest recruit to the team.<,>她是团队最新招募的成员。<,>re(再)+cruit(生长)→再次生长→补充新成员<,>recruitment(n.招聘)/recruiter(n.招聘人员)/recreate(v.娱乐)

overstate<,>/ˌəʊvəˈsteɪt/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈsteɪt/<,>v.夸张/v.夸大<,>Don't overstate your qualifications.<,>不要夸大你的资历。<,>The media often overstates the risks.<,>媒体经常夸大风险。<,>He overstated his income on the form.<,>他在表格上虚报了收入。<,>over(过度)+state(陈述)→过度陈述→夸大<,>understate(v.轻描淡写)/restate(v.重申)/overstay(v.逗留过久)

generalization<,>/ˌdʒenrəlaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌdʒenrələˈzeɪʃn/<,>n.概括<,>This is just a broad generalization.<,>这只是个粗略的概括。<,>Avoid making sweeping generalizations.<,>避免做笼统的概括。<,>His theory is an overgeneralization.<,>他的理论过于概括化了。<,>general(一般的)+ization(名词后缀)→概括<,>specialization(n.专门化)/globalization(n.全球化)/realization(n.实现)
hub<,>/hʌb/<,>/hʌb/<,>n.中心<,>London is a major hub for international flights.<,>伦敦是国际航班的主要枢纽。<,>The city has become a hub of cultural activity.<,>这座城市已成为文化活动的中心。<,>The internet hub connects all the computers in the office.<,>网络集线器连接着办公室里的所有电脑。<,>发音类似"哈勃"→像宇宙中心哈勃望远镜<,>hut(n.小屋)/hug(v.拥抱)/hubcap(n.轮毂盖)

conservative<,>/kənˈsɜːvətɪv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrvətɪv/<,>adj.保守的/adj.传统的<,>He has very conservative views on education.<,>他对教育持非常保守的观点。<,>The design is conservative but elegant.<,>这个设计传统但优雅。<,>She comes from a conservative family background.<,>她来自一个思想保守的家庭。<,>con(共同)+serve(保持)→共同保持→保守的<,>preservative(n.防腐剂)/conservation(n.保护)/conserve(v.保存)

restock<,>/ˌriːˈstɒk/<,>/ˌriːˈstɑːk/<,>v.重新进货/v.再储存<,>We need to restock the shelves before the weekend.<,>我们需要在周末前重新给货架补货。<,>The supermarket restocks fresh produce every morning.<,>超市每天早上都会补充新鲜农产品。<,>After the sale, it took two days to restock the store.<,>促销活动后，商店花了两天时间重新进货。<,>re(重新)+stock(库存)→重新进货<,>restart(v.重新开始)/restore(v.恢复)/stockpile(n.储备)

convict<,>/kənˈvɪkt/<,>/kənˈvɪkt/<,>v.证明...有罪<,>The jury convicted him of murder.<,>陪审团判定他犯有谋杀罪。<,>She was convicted of fraud last year.<,>她去年因诈骗罪被判刑。<,>DNA evidence helped convict the criminal.<,>DNA证据帮助定了罪犯的罪。<,>con(完全)+vict(征服)→完全征服→定罪<,>evict(v.驱逐)/victory(n.胜利)/convince(v.说服)

deepen<,>/ˈdiːpən/<,>/ˈdiːpən/<,>v.使加深/v.加剧<,>The crisis has deepened economic problems.<,>危机加剧了经济问题。<,>Their friendship deepened over the years.<,>他们的友谊随着岁月加深。<,>We need to deepen the hole for the foundation.<,>我们需要把地基的坑挖得更深。<,>deep(深的)+en(使...)→使加深<,>darken(v.变暗)/sharpen(v.削尖)/weaken(v.削弱)

tank<,>/tæŋk/<,>/tæŋk/<,>n.油箱/n.水箱<,>The car's fuel tank is almost empty.<,>汽车的油箱几乎空了。<,>We keep tropical fish in a large tank.<,>我们在一个大水箱里养热带鱼。<,>The water tank on the roof supplies the whole building.<,>屋顶的水箱为整栋楼供水。<,>发音类似"坦克"→坦克需要油箱<,>bank(n.银行)/sank(v.下沉)/thank(v.感谢)

negative<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>adj.消极的/adj.否定的<,>He has a very negative attitude towards work.<,>他对工作持非常消极的态度。<,>The test results came back negative.<,>检测结果呈阴性。<,>Don't always focus on the negative aspects.<,>不要总是关注消极方面。<,>neg(否定)+ative(形容词后缀)→否定的<,>positive(adj.积极的)/native(adj.本地的)/narrative(n.叙述)

accelerate<,>/əkˈseləreɪt/<,>/ækˈseləreɪt/<,>v.加速<,>The car accelerated as it went downhill.<,>汽车下坡时加速了。<,>The company plans to accelerate production.<,>公司计划加快生产速度。<,>Global warming is accelerating climate change.<,>全球变暖正在加速气候变化。<,>ac(向)+celer(速度)+ate(使)→使加快<,>decelerate(v.减速)/celebrate(v.庆祝)/celerity(n.迅速)

territory<,>/ˈterətri/<,>/ˈterətɔːri/<,>n.领土/n.领域<,>This island is part of Australian territory.<,>这个岛屿是澳大利亚领土的一部分。<,>He is an expert in the territory of neuroscience.<,>他是神经科学领域的专家。<,>Wild animals mark their territory with scent.<,>野生动物用气味标记自己的领地。<,>terr(土地)+itory(名词后缀)→领土<,>terror(n.恐怖)/terrain(n.地形)/terrace(n.平台)

impact<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>n.影响<,>The new law will have a major impact on businesses.<,>新法律将对商业产生重大影响。<,>The meteor's impact created a huge crater.<,>陨石的撞击造成了一个巨大的坑。<,>Her speech made a profound impact on the audience.<,>她的演讲给观众留下了深刻印象。<,>im(进入)+pact(压)→压进去→影响<,>compact(adj.紧凑的)/impair(v.损害)/impulse(n.冲动)
distraction<,>/dɪˈstrækʃn/<,>/dɪˈstrækʃən/<,>n.分心/n.消遣<,>Noise is a distraction when I'm trying to study.<,>当我试图学习时，噪音会让我分心。<,>Watching movies is my favorite distraction.<,>看电影是我最喜欢的消遣。<,>The magician created a distraction to perform his trick.<,>魔术师制造了一个分心物来表演他的戏法。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)+ion→注意力被拉开→分心<,>attraction(n.吸引)/extraction(n.提取)/retraction(n.收回)

resolve<,>/rɪˈzɒlv/<,>/rɪˈzɑːlv/<,>v.解决/v.下决心<,>We need to resolve this issue as soon as possible.<,>我们需要尽快解决这个问题。<,>She resolved to study harder this semester.<,>她决心这学期更加努力学习。<,>The conflict was resolved through peaceful negotiation.<,>冲突通过和平谈判得到了解决。<,>re(再)+solve(解决)→再次解决→下决心<,>dissolve(v.溶解)/absolve(v.免除)/revolve(v.旋转)

refuse<,>/rɪˈfjuːz/<,>/rɪˈfjuːz/<,>v.拒绝<,>He refused to answer the question.<,>他拒绝回答这个问题。<,>The company refused my application.<,>公司拒绝了我的申请。<,>She refused the offer politely.<,>她礼貌地拒绝了提议。<,>re(反)+fuse(流)→反流→拒绝<,>confuse(v.混淆)/diffuse(v.扩散)/infuse(v.注入)

soluble<,>/ˈsɒljəbl/<,>/ˈsɑːljəbl/<,>adj.可溶的/adj.可以解决的<,>Sugar is soluble in water.<,>糖可溶于水。<,>This problem is soluble with some effort.<,>这个问题通过一些努力是可以解决的。<,>The medicine comes in soluble tablets.<,>这种药是可溶性片剂。<,>solu(松)+ble(能)→能松开→可溶的<,>insoluble(adj.不溶的)/solvable(adj.可解决的)/solution(n.解决方案)

brave<,>/breɪv/<,>/breɪv/<,>adj.勇敢的/adj.极好的<,>The brave firefighter saved the child.<,>勇敢的消防员救了那个孩子。<,>What a brave performance!<,>多么精彩的表演！<,>She was brave enough to speak the truth.<,>她勇敢地说出了真相。<,>brav(勇敢)+e→勇敢的<,>grave(adj.严肃的)/bravo(int.好极了)/bravado(n.虚张声势)

hat<,>/hæt/<,>/hæt/<,>n.帽子（一般指有边的）<,>He tipped his hat politely.<,>他礼貌地轻触帽檐致意。<,>She bought a new sun hat for the beach.<,>她为海滩买了一个新的遮阳帽。<,>Keep your hat on, it's cold outside.<,>戴着帽子，外面很冷。<,>hat→hot(热)→天热要戴帽子<,>cap(n.无檐帽)/hood(n.兜帽)/helmet(n.头盔)

beach<,>/biːtʃ/<,>/biːtʃ/<,>n.海滩/n.湖滩/n.河滩<,>We spent the day at the beach.<,>我们在海滩度过了一天。<,>The children built sandcastles on the beach.<,>孩子们在海滩上堆沙堡。<,>The river beach is perfect for picnics.<,>河滩是野餐的完美场所。<,>beach→peach(桃子)→海滩上吃桃子<,>shore(n.岸)/coast(n.海岸)/seaside(n.海滨)

authority<,>/ɔːˈθɒrəti/<,>/əˈθɔːrəti/<,>n.当局/n.官方/n.权力<,>The local authority approved the new building plan.<,>地方当局批准了新的建筑计划。<,>He speaks with authority on this subject.<,>他在这个主题上有权威发言权。<,>She has the authority to make decisions.<,>她有做决定的权力。<,>author(作者)+ity→作者有权威<,>authentic(adj.真实的)/authorize(v.授权)/authoritarian(adj.专制的)

roast<,>/rəʊst/<,>/roʊst/<,>v.烤/v.炙/v.烘<,>She roasted the chicken for dinner.<,>她烤了鸡当晚餐。<,>The coffee beans are roasted before grinding.<,>咖啡豆在研磨前要先烘烤。<,>We roasted marshmallows over the campfire.<,>我们在篝火上烤棉花糖。<,>roast→toast(吐司)→烤面包<,>boast(v.自夸)/coast(n.海岸)/rooster(n.公鸡)

amplify<,>/ˈæmplɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈæmplɪfaɪ/<,>v.放大/v.扩大/v.增强<,>We need to amplify the sound for the audience.<,>我们需要为观众放大声音。<,>The microscope amplifies tiny objects.<,>显微镜放大了微小的物体。<,>Her speech amplified our enthusiasm.<,>她的演讲增强了我们的热情。<,>ampl(大)+ify(使)→使变大→放大<,>simplify(v.简化)/exemplify(v.例证)/amplitude(n.振幅)
bulk<,>/bʌlk/<,>/bʌlk/<,>n.大部分/n.体积/n.块头<,>The bulk of the work has already been completed.<,>大部分工作已经完成。<,>He lifted the bulk of the heavy box with ease.<,>他轻松地抬起了那个沉重的大箱子。<,>The bulk of the crowd gathered in the town square.<,>人群的大部分聚集在镇广场上。<,>bul(大)+k(块)→大块头→体积<,>hulk(n.巨大笨重的物体)/buck(n.美元/v.抵制)

put<,>/pʊt/<,>/pʊt/<,>v.放/v.摆/v.使处于<,>She put the book on the table.<,>她把书放在桌子上。<,>Put yourself in my shoes for a moment.<,>设身处地为我想一想。<,>The news put him in a good mood.<,>这个消息让他心情很好。<,>pu(扑)+t(他)→扑向他→放<,>cut(v.切)/but(conj.但是)/pot(n.锅)

stable<,>/ˈsteɪbəl/<,>/ˈsteɪbəl/<,>adj.稳定的/adj.不变的<,>The patient's condition is now stable.<,>病人的情况现在稳定了。<,>They built a stable relationship over the years.<,>多年来他们建立了稳定的关系。<,>The price of gold has remained stable this month.<,>这个月黄金价格保持稳定。<,>sta(站)+ble(能)→能站稳的→稳定的<,>table(n.桌子)/staple(n.主食)

certificate<,>/səˈtɪfɪkət/<,>/sərˈtɪfɪkət/<,>n.证书/n.证件/n.执照/n.文凭/n.合格证书<,>She received a certificate for completing the course.<,>她获得了完成课程的证书。<,>You'll need to show your birth certificate.<,>你需要出示出生证明。<,>He framed his graduation certificate and hung it on the wall.<,>他把毕业证书装裱起来挂在墙上。<,>cert(确定)+i+fic(做)+ate→确定做事的文件→证书<,>certify(v.证明)/certitude(n.确信)

dragon<,>/ˈdræɡən/<,>/ˈdræɡən/<,>n.龙<,>The dragon in the story breathes fire.<,>故事中的龙会喷火。<,>Chinese dragons are symbols of power and good luck.<,>中国龙是权力和好运的象征。<,>He has a dragon tattoo on his back.<,>他背上有一个龙纹身。<,>drag(拖)+on(上)→拖着长尾巴的动物→龙<,>wagon(n.四轮马车)/dragonfly(n.蜻蜓)

capable<,>/ˈkeɪpəbəl/<,>/ˈkeɪpəbəl/<,>adj.有能力的/adj.有才能的<,>She is capable of handling the project alone.<,>她有能力独自处理这个项目。<,>This car is capable of reaching high speeds.<,>这辆车能达到很高的速度。<,>He proved himself capable in many fields.<,>他在许多领域证明了自己的能力。<,>cap(抓)+able(能)→能抓住的→有能力的<,>capacity(n.容量)/capability(n.能力)

criticism<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/<,>n.批评/n.批判/n.评论<,>He accepted the criticism with an open mind.<,>他以开放的心态接受了批评。<,>Her book received mixed criticism from the press.<,>她的书得到了媒体褒贬不一的评论。<,>Constructive criticism can help you improve.<,>建设性的批评可以帮助你进步。<,>crit(判断)+ic+ism→做出判断→批评<,>critic(n.评论家)/critical(adj.关键的)

accommodation<,>/əˌkɒməˈdeɪʃən/<,>/əˌkɑːməˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.住处/n.工作场所<,>We found comfortable accommodation in the city center.<,>我们在市中心找到了舒适的住处。<,>The university provides accommodation for international students.<,>大学为国际学生提供住宿。<,>The hotel has accommodation for 500 guests.<,>这家酒店可容纳500位客人。<,>ac(向)+com(共同)+mod(方式)+ation→共同居住的方式→住处<,>commodity(n.商品)/accompany(v.陪伴)

imply<,>/ɪmˈplaɪ/<,>/ɪmˈplaɪ/<,>v.暗示/v.意指<,>His silence implied agreement.<,>他的沉默暗示着同意。<,>What are you implying by that remark?<,>你说这话是什么意思？<,>The study implies a link between diet and health.<,>这项研究暗示了饮食与健康之间的联系。<,>im(里)+ply(折叠)→话里有话→暗示<,>apply(v.申请)/reply(v.回答)

December<,>/dɪˈsembə(r)/<,>/dɪˈsembər/<,>n.十二月<,>Christmas is celebrated in December.<,>圣诞节在十二月庆祝。<,>December is the last month of the year.<,>十二月是一年中的最后一个月。<,>We're planning a trip for next December.<,>我们正在计划明年十二月的旅行。<,>decem(十)+ber→古罗马历法的第十个月→十二月<,>November(n.十一月)/remember(v.记住)
president<,>/ˈprɛzɪdənt/<,>/ˈprɛzɪdənt/<,>n.总统/n.（某组织的）最高权力人<,>The president will give a speech tonight.<,>总统今晚将发表演讲。<,>She was elected president of the student union.<,>她被选为学生会主席。<,>The company president made an important decision.<,>公司总裁做出了一个重要决定。<,>pre(前)+sid(坐)+ent(人)→坐在前面的人→总统<,>resident(n.居民)/precedent(n.先例)

lately<,>/ˈleɪtli/<,>/ˈleɪtli/<,>adv.最近/adv.不久前<,>Have you seen her lately?<,>你最近见过她吗？<,>I've been feeling tired lately.<,>我最近一直感觉很累。<,>He hasn't called lately.<,>他最近没有打电话来。<,>late(晚的)+ly(副词后缀)→最近<,>later(adv.稍后)/latest(adj.最新的)

down<,>/daʊn/<,>/daʊn/<,>adv.向下/adv.在下面<,>Please sit down.<,>请坐下。<,>The sun goes down in the evening.<,>太阳在傍晚落下。<,>He looked down at his shoes.<,>他低头看自己的鞋子。<,>d(向下)+own(拥有)→向下<,>dawn(n.黎明)/drown(v.淹没)

matter<,>/ˈmætə/<,>/ˈmætər/<,>n.事情/n.物质/v.要紧<,>What's the matter with you?<,>你怎么了？<,>This is a serious matter.<,>这是件严肃的事情。<,>It doesn't matter if you're late.<,>你迟到也没关系。<,>mat(垫子)+ter→垫子上的东西→物质<,>material(n.材料)/mutter(v.嘀咕)

lake<,>/leɪk/<,>/leɪk/<,>n.湖<,>We went swimming in the lake.<,>我们去湖里游泳了。<,>The lake is very deep here.<,>这里的湖水很深。<,>There are many fish in this lake.<,>这个湖里有很多鱼。<,>la(拉)+ke(可)→可以拉船的→湖<,>like(v.喜欢)/leak(v.泄漏)

nor<,>/nɔː/<,>/nɔːr/<,>conj.既不...也不.../conj.也不<,>I neither smoke nor drink.<,>我既不抽烟也不喝酒。<,>He can't swim, nor can I.<,>他不会游泳，我也不会。<,>She didn't call, nor did she write.<,>她既没打电话也没写信。<,>no(不)+r(人)→也不<,>or(conj.或者)/not(adv.不)

bench<,>/bentʃ/<,>/bɛntʃ/<,>n.长凳/n.条凳<,>Let's sit on the bench.<,>我们坐在长凳上吧。<,>The park has many wooden benches.<,>公园里有很多木制长凳。<,>He sat alone on the bench for hours.<,>他独自在长凳上坐了几个小时。<,>ben(弯曲)+ch→弯曲的座位→长凳<,>beach(n.海滩)/branch(n.树枝)

draw<,>/drɔː/<,>/drɔ/<,>v.画/v.划<,>She likes to draw pictures.<,>她喜欢画画。<,>Please draw a line here.<,>请在这里划一条线。<,>He drew a map of the area.<,>他画了一张这个地区的地图。<,>dr(大人)+aw(啊)→大人啊会画画<,>drew(v.draw过去式)/drain(v.排水)

scale<,>/skeɪl/<,>/skeɪl/<,>n.天平/n.磅秤/n.秤<,>Please weigh the fruit on the scale.<,>请用磅秤称一下这些水果。<,>The map was drawn to scale.<,>这张地图是按比例绘制的。<,>Fish scales glittered in the sunlight.<,>鱼鳞在阳光下闪闪发光。<,>scal(爬)+e→爬升需要衡量→秤<,>scan(v.扫描)/scare(v.惊吓)/scarf(n.围巾)

outline<,>/ˈaʊtlaɪn/<,>/ˈaʊtˌlaɪn/<,>n.轮廓/n.略图/n.大纲<,>She drew the outline of a tree.<,>她画了一棵树的轮廓。<,>Please submit an outline of your paper first.<,>请先提交你的论文大纲。<,>The mountains were just visible in outline.<,>群山的轮廓依稀可见。<,>out(外)+line(线)→外面的线→轮廓<,>online(adj.在线的)/underline(v.强调)/timeline(n.时间线)

quiet<,>/ˈkwaɪət/<,>/ˈkwaɪət/<,>adj.安静的/adj.寂静的<,>The library is usually very quiet.<,>图书馆通常非常安静。<,>She spoke in a quiet voice.<,>她用安静的声音说话。<,>After the storm, the sea became quiet.<,>暴风雨过后，大海变得平静。<,>qui(休息)+et(小)→需要休息的小地方→安静的<,>quite(adv.相当)/quilt(n.被子)/quit(v.退出)

water<,>/ˈwɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈwɔːtər/<,>n.水/v.使湿/v.灌溉<,>Plants need water to grow.<,>植物需要水才能生长。<,>She watered the flowers every morning.<,>她每天早晨给花浇水。<,>His eyes watered from the smoke.<,>他的眼睛被烟熏得流泪。<,>wat(看)+er→看起来透明→水<,>waiter(n.服务员)/wander(v.漫步)/winter(n.冬天)

nervous<,>/ˈnɜːvəs/<,>/ˈnɜːrvəs/<,>adj.神经的/adj.易激动的<,>He felt nervous before the exam.<,>考试前他感到紧张。<,>She has a nervous disposition.<,>她性格容易紧张。<,>The nervous system controls body functions.<,>神经系统控制身体功能。<,>nerv(神经)+ous(多...的)→神经的<,>nerve(n.神经)/novel(n.小说)/numerous(adj.许多的)

nevertheless<,>/ˌnevəðəˈles/<,>/ˌnevərðəˈles/<,>conj.然而/adv.仍然<,>It was raining; nevertheless, we went out.<,>虽然下着雨，但我们还是出去了。<,>He was tired; nevertheless, he kept working.<,>他很累，但仍然继续工作。<,>The plan has risks; nevertheless, it's worth trying.<,>这个计划有风险，但仍然值得一试。<,>never(从不)+the+less(更少)→从不减少→仍然<,>nonetheless(adv.尽管如此)/notwithstanding(prep.尽管)

assembly<,>/əˈsembli/<,>/əˈsembli/<,>n.集合/n.集会/n.装配<,>The school assembly starts at 8 am.<,>学校集会早上8点开始。<,>This car is made in an assembly plant.<,>这辆车是在装配厂制造的。<,>The assembly of experts discussed the issue.<,>专家集会讨论了这个问题。<,>as(加强)+sembl(类似)+y→把类似的东西放一起→集合<,>assemble(v.集合)/resemble(v.相似)/ensemble(n.全体)

fight<,>/faɪt/<,>/faɪt/<,>v.打(仗)/v.斗争<,>They fought bravely in the war.<,>他们在战争中英勇作战。<,>We must fight against injustice.<,>我们必须与不公正作斗争。<,>The two boys were fighting over a toy.<,>两个男孩在为一个玩具打架。<,>f(看作"斧")+ight(看作"night")→夜晚持斧战斗<,>flight(n.飞行)/fright(n.惊吓)/tight(adj.紧的)

missing<,>/ˈmɪsɪŋ/<,>/ˈmɪsɪŋ/<,>adj.失去的/adj.缺掉的<,>My keys are missing.<,>我的钥匙不见了。<,>There is a page missing from the book.<,>这本书缺了一页。<,>The search continues for the missing child.<,>对失踪儿童的搜寻仍在继续。<,>miss(错过)+ing→错过的东西→失去的<,>mess(n.混乱)/mixing(v.混合)/kissing(v.亲吻)
lift<,>/lɪft/<,>/lɪft/<,>v.提起/v.提高/n.电梯<,>Can you help me lift this heavy box?<,>你能帮我提起这个重箱子吗？<,>She took the lift to the 10th floor.<,>她乘电梯到了10楼。<,>Regular exercise can lift your mood.<,>经常锻炼能提升你的情绪。<,>li(力)+ft(脚)→用脚发力→提起<,>shift(v.移动/n.轮班)/gift(n.礼物)/loft(n.阁楼)

refrigerator<,>/rɪˈfrɪdʒəreɪtə(r)/<,>/rɪˈfrɪdʒəreɪtər/<,>n.冰箱/n.冷藏库<,>Put the milk back in the refrigerator.<,>把牛奶放回冰箱。<,>The laboratory has a special refrigerator for samples.<,>实验室有存放样品的专用冷藏库。<,>I need to defrost the refrigerator this weekend.<,>这周末我需要给冰箱除霜。<,>re(再)+friger(冷)+ator(器具)→制冷器具<,>fridge(冰箱简写)/generator(n.发电机)/radiator(n.散热器)

dirty<,>/ˈdɜːti/<,>/ˈdɜːrti/<,>adj.脏的/adj.下流的<,>Wash your dirty hands before eating.<,>吃饭前先洗洗你的脏手。<,>He told a dirty joke at the party.<,>他在聚会上讲了个下流笑话。<,>The river is dirty because of pollution.<,>这条河因为污染变得很脏。<,>dirt(灰尘)+y(形容词后缀)→有灰尘的<,>dusty(adj.布满灰尘的)/dirt(n.灰尘)/diet(n.饮食)

rent<,>/rent/<,>/rɛnt/<,>n.租金/v.出租<,>How much is the monthly rent for this apartment?<,>这套公寓的月租金是多少？<,>They decided to rent a car for their trip.<,>他们决定租辆车去旅行。<,>He can't afford the rent in this expensive city.<,>他负担不起这个昂贵城市的租金。<,>run(跑)+ent→跑着找住处→租金<,>lend(v.借出)/tent(n.帐篷)/sent(v.发送过去式)

convince<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>v.使确信/v.使信服<,>Her arguments convinced me to change my mind.<,>她的论点说服我改变了主意。<,>I'm convinced of his innocence.<,>我相信他是无辜的。<,>It's hard to convince stubborn people.<,>很难说服固执的人。<,>con(完全)+vince(征服)→完全征服对方思想<,>convict(v.定罪/n.囚犯)/convivial(adj.欢乐的)

abroad<,>/əˈbrɔːd/<,>/əˈbrɔd/<,>adv.在国外<,>She's studying abroad in Australia.<,>她在澳大利亚留学。<,>Have you ever lived abroad?<,>你在国外生活过吗？<,>This product is popular both at home and abroad.<,>这个产品在国内外都很受欢迎。<,>a(在...)+broad(宽广的)→在宽广的地方→国外<,>aboard(adv.在船上)/broad(adj.宽广的)

offend<,>/əˈfend/<,>/əˈfɛnd/<,>v.冒犯/v.犯罪<,>I didn't mean to offend you with my words.<,>我不是有意用言语冒犯你。<,>He offended against the law by stealing.<,>他因偷窃而触犯了法律。<,>Some jokes may offend certain people.<,>有些笑话可能会冒犯某些人。<,>of(反对)+fend(打击)→打击对方→冒犯<,>defend(v.防御)/fence(n.围栏)

belong<,>/bɪˈlɒŋ/<,>/bɪˈlɔːŋ/<,>v.属于<,>This book belongs to the library.<,>这本书属于图书馆。<,>I feel like I don't belong in this group.<,>我觉得我不属于这个团体。<,>Where do these keys belong?<,>这些钥匙是哪儿用的？<,>be(使)+long(长)→使长期拥有→属于<,>below(prep.在...下面)/along(prep.沿着)

arouse<,>/əˈraʊz/<,>/əˈraʊz/<,>v.引起/v.唤起/v.唤醒<,>The loud noise aroused the sleeping baby.<,>巨大的声响吵醒了熟睡的宝宝。<,>His speech aroused great interest among students.<,>他的演讲引起了学生们的极大兴趣。<,>The smell of coffee aroused my appetite.<,>咖啡的香味唤起了我的食欲。<,>a(加强)+rouse(唤醒)→强烈唤醒<,>rise(v.上升)/rouse(v.唤醒)

admission<,>/ədˈmɪʃn/<,>/ædˈmɪʃən/<,>n.承认/n.允许进入<,>Admission to the museum is free on Sundays.<,>周日博物馆免费入场。<,>Her silence was an admission of guilt.<,>她的沉默就是承认有罪。<,>He gained admission to Harvard University.<,>他获得了哈佛大学的入学许可。<,>ad(向)+miss(送)+ion→允许送入→准入<,>mission(n.任务)/permission(n.许可)
modify<,>/ˈmɒdɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈmɑːdɪfaɪ/<,>v.更改/v.修改<,>You need to modify your behavior to fit in.<,>你需要改变行为以适应环境。<,>The software allows users to modify the settings.<,>该软件允许用户修改设置。<,>He modified his original plan to include more details.<,>他修改了原计划以包含更多细节。<,>mod(模式)+ify(使)→使改变模式→修改<,>modest(adj.谦虚的)/modulate(v.调节)/modish(adj.流行的)  

express<,>/ɪkˈsprɛs/<,>/ɪkˈsprɛs/<,>v.表示/n.快车/n.快递<,>She expressed her gratitude with a smile.<,>她用微笑表达了感激之情。<,>I sent the package by express delivery.<,>我用快递寄出了包裹。<,>The express train reaches the city in two hours.<,>特快列车两小时到达城市。<,>ex(出)+press(压)→压出来→表达<,>impress(v.留下印象)/suppress(v.压制)/depress(v.使沮丧)  

imagine<,>/ɪˈmædʒɪn/<,>/ɪˈmædʒɪn/<,>v.想象/v.设想<,>Can you imagine living on Mars?<,>你能想象在火星上生活吗？<,>I imagined myself winning the competition.<,>我幻想自己赢得了比赛。<,>He couldn't imagine life without music.<,>他无法想象没有音乐的生活。<,>image(图像)+ine→在脑中形成图像→想象<,>imagination(n.想象力)/imaginary(adj.虚构的)/imaginative(adj.富有想象力的)  

infinite<,>/ˈɪnfɪnɪt/<,>/ˈɪnfənɪt/<,>adj.无限的/adj.无数的<,>The universe is infinite and mysterious.<,>宇宙是无限而神秘的。<,>She has infinite patience with children.<,>她对孩子有无限的耐心。<,>There are infinite possibilities in life.<,>生活中有无数种可能性。<,>in(不)+fin(结束)+ite→没有结束的→无限的<,>definite(adj.明确的)/finite(adj.有限的)/infinity(n.无限)  

barrier<,>/ˈbærɪə(r)/<,>/ˈbɛriər/<,>n.障碍/n.栅栏/n.屏障<,>Language can be a barrier to communication.<,>语言可能成为沟通的障碍。<,>The police set up barriers to control the crowd.<,>警察设置了栅栏控制人群。<,>The Great Barrier Reef is a natural wonder.<,>大堡礁是自然奇观。<,>bar(栏杆)+rier→像栏杆一样阻挡→障碍<,>bar(n.酒吧)/barren(adj.贫瘠的)/barrister(n.律师)  

lane<,>/leɪn/<,>/leɪn/<,>n.(乡间)小路/n.跑道<,>We walked down a narrow country lane.<,>我们沿着一条狭窄的乡间小路行走。<,>The athlete stayed in his lane during the race.<,>运动员在比赛中保持在自己的跑道。<,>This is a bicycle lane, not for walking.<,>这是自行车道，不能步行。<,>lan(看作land)+e→地上的小道→小路<,>plain(n.平原)/plane(n.飞机)/planet(n.行星)  

notebook<,>/ˈnəʊtbʊk/<,>/ˈnoʊtbʊk/<,>n.笔记本/n.期票簿<,>She wrote her ideas in a notebook.<,>她把想法写在笔记本里。<,>I need to buy a new notebook for school.<,>我需要买本新笔记本上学用。<,>The accountant checked the notebook of bills.<,>会计核对了期票簿。<,>note(笔记)+book(本子)→记笔记的本子→笔记本<,>notable(adj.显著的)/notice(v.注意到)/notion(n.概念)  

realm<,>/relm/<,>/relm/<,>n.领域/n.王国/n.国土<,>This discovery opened new realms of science.<,>这一发现开辟了科学新领域。<,>The king ruled over a vast realm.<,>国王统治着广阔的王国。<,>In the realm of art, he is a master.<,>在艺术领域，他是大师。<,>real(真实的)+m→真实的统治区域→王国<,>ream(n.令纸)/reclaim(v.收回)/realmless(adj.无领域的)  

lever<,>/ˈliːvə(r)/<,>/ˈlɛvər/<,>n.控制杆/n.杠杆/n.杆<,>Pull the lever to start the machine.<,>拉动控制杆启动机器。<,>Archimedes said he could move the earth with a lever.<,>阿基米德说他能用杠杆撬动地球。<,>The brake lever is on the right handlebar.<,>刹车杆在右把手处。<,>lev(举起)+er→能举起东西的工具→杠杆<,>level(n.水平)/leveret(n.小野兔)/leverage(n.杠杆作用)  

midst<,>/mɪdst/<,>/mɪdst/<,>n.中部/n.中间/n.当中<,>A church stands in the midst of the village.<,>一座教堂矗立在村庄中央。<,>We found ourselves in the midst of a storm.<,>我们发现自己身处风暴中心。<,>In the midst of chaos, she remained calm.<,>在混乱中，她保持冷静。<,>mid(中间)+st→中间的状态→中部<,>middle(n.中间)/amidst(prep.在...中)/midterm(n.期中)
pilot<,>/ˈpaɪlət/<,>/ˈpaɪlət/<,>n.飞行员/n.领航员<,>The pilot skillfully landed the plane during the storm.<,>飞行员在暴风雨中熟练地降落了飞机。<,>He works as a river pilot guiding ships through dangerous waters.<,>他是一名河道领航员，引导船只通过危险水域。<,>The young girl dreams of becoming a commercial pilot one day.<,>这个小女孩梦想有一天能成为商业飞行员。<,>pi(拼音"飞")+lot(很多)→飞很多→飞行员<,>plot(n.情节/v.密谋)/pivot(n.枢轴/v.旋转)

direct<,>/dɪˈrekt/<,>/dəˈrekt/<,>adj.直接的/adj.直率的<,>She gave me direct instructions on how to complete the task.<,>她直接告诉我如何完成这项任务。<,>I appreciate his direct manner of speaking.<,>我欣赏他直率的说话方式。<,>The sunlight came through the window in a direct line.<,>阳光以直线透过窗户照射进来。<,>di(分开)+rect(直)→分开直走→直接的<,>indirect(adj.间接的)/director(n.导演)/direction(n.方向)

prejudice<,>/ˈpredʒʊdɪs/<,>/ˈprɛdʒədɪs/<,>n.偏见/n.成见<,>We should judge people without prejudice.<,>我们应该不带偏见地评判他人。<,>Her past experiences created a prejudice against foreign products.<,>她过去的经历让她对外国产品产生了成见。<,>The court case was dismissed due to the judge's obvious prejudice.<,>由于法官明显的偏见，这个案件被驳回。<,>pre(前)+judice(判断)→预先判断→偏见<,>judge(n.法官/v.判断)/justice(n.正义)/prejudicial(adj.有害的)

tour<,>/tʊə(r)/<,>/tʊr/<,>n.旅行/n.旅游/v.旅游/v.游历<,>We went on a guided tour of the ancient castle.<,>我们参加了古堡的导游之旅。<,>She plans to tour Europe next summer.<,>她计划明年夏天游历欧洲。<,>The band is currently on a world tour.<,>这个乐队正在进行世界巡演。<,>tour(音似"途")→旅途→旅行<,>tourism(n.旅游业)/tourist(n.游客)/detour(n.绕道)

tolerance<,>/ˈtɒlərəns/<,>/ˈtɑːlərəns/<,>n.忍受/n.容忍<,>The medicine helps increase pain tolerance.<,>这种药物有助于提高对疼痛的忍受力。<,>We should show tolerance towards different cultures.<,>我们应该对不同文化表现出宽容。<,>His tolerance for noise is very low.<,>他对噪音的容忍度很低。<,>toler(忍受)+ance(名词后缀)→忍受<,>intolerance(n.不宽容)/tolerate(v.容忍)/tolerant(adj.宽容的)

discourage<,>/dɪsˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>v.使泄气/v.使灰心<,>Don't let one failure discourage you.<,>不要因为一次失败就灰心。<,>The bad weather discouraged us from going out.<,>糟糕的天气使我们打消了外出的念头。<,>His negative comments discouraged the whole team.<,>他的负面评论让整个团队都泄气了。<,>dis(否定)+courage(勇气)→使失去勇气→使泄气<,>encourage(v.鼓励)/courage(n.勇气)/discouragement(n.沮丧)

get<,>/ɡet/<,>/ɡɛt/<,>v.获得/v.得到/v.到达/v.变成<,>I need to get some milk from the store.<,>我需要从商店买些牛奶。<,>What time will you get to the airport?<,>你什么时候能到机场？<,>It's getting dark outside.<,>外面天渐渐黑了。<,>get(音似"给")→得到<,>forget(v.忘记)/beget(v.产生)/target(n.目标)

advertisement<,>/ədˈvɜːtɪsmənt/<,>/ˌædvərˈtaɪzmənt/<,>n.广告<,>I saw your advertisement in the newspaper.<,>我在报纸上看到了你们的广告。<,>This TV advertisement is very creative.<,>这个电视广告很有创意。<,>Online advertisements are becoming more targeted.<,>网络广告变得越来越精准。<,>ad(强调)+vert(转)+ise(动词后缀)+ment(名词后缀)→广告<,>advertise(v.做广告)/advertising(n.广告业)/advertiser(n.广告商)

ribbon<,>/ˈrɪbən/<,>/ˈrɪbən/<,>n.缎带/n.丝带/n.带<,>She tied her hair with a red ribbon.<,>她用红色丝带扎头发。<,>The gift was wrapped with a golden ribbon.<,>礼物用金色缎带包装。<,>He won a blue ribbon in the competition.<,>他在比赛中赢得了蓝丝带。<,>rib(肋骨)+bon(法语"好")→像肋骨一样的好东西→缎带<,>rib(n.肋骨)/ribbed(adj.有棱纹的)/ribbonlike(adj.带状的)

differ<,>/ˈdɪfə(r)/<,>/ˈdɪfər/<,>v.不同/v.相异<,>Our opinions differ greatly on this matter.<,>我们在这个问题上的意见大不相同。<,>The two versions differ in several key aspects.<,>这两个版本在几个关键方面有所不同。<,>French differs from English in pronunciation.<,>法语和英语在发音上不同。<,>dif(分开)+fer(带来)→带来不同→相异<,>defer(v.推迟)/infer(v.推断)/refer(v.参考)

public<,>/ˈpʌblɪk/<,>/ˈpʌblɪk/<,>adj.公众的/n.公众<,>Public opinion strongly supports the new policy.<,>公众舆论强烈支持这项新政策。<,>The museum is open to the public on weekends.<,>博物馆周末对公众开放。<,>He made a public apology for his mistake.<,>他为自己的错误公开道歉。<,>publ(人民)+ic→公众的<,>publication(n.出版)/publicity(n.宣传)/republic(n.共和国)
