pulse<,>/pʌls/<,>/pʌls/<,>n.脉搏/n.脉动/n.脉冲<,>The doctor checked the patient's pulse.<,>医生检查了病人的脉搏。<,>The city has a vibrant cultural pulse.<,>这座城市有着活跃的文化脉动。<,>Electronic pulses control the device.<,>电子脉冲控制着这个设备。<,>puls(驱动)+e→脉搏<,>impulse(n.冲动)/repulse(v.击退)/compulsion(n.强迫)  

immediately<,>/ɪˈmiːdiətli/<,>/ɪˈmiːdiətli/<,>adv.立即/adv.直接地<,>She left immediately after the meeting.<,>会议结束后她立即离开了。<,>The fire was immediately put out.<,>火被立即扑灭了。<,>He was immediately involved in the project.<,>他直接参与了这个项目。<,>im(不)+mediate(中间)+ly→不经过中间→立即<,>intermediately(adv.中间地)/immediacy(n.直接性)/mediate(v.调解)  

cow<,>/kaʊ/<,>/kaʊ/<,>n.母牛/n.奶牛/n.母兽<,>The farmer milks the cows every morning.<,>农夫每天早上给奶牛挤奶。<,>A cow was grazing in the field.<,>一头母牛在田里吃草。<,>The lioness is the cow of the pride.<,>母狮是狮群中的雌兽。<,>cow(牛)→母牛<,>now(adv.现在)/how(adv.如何)/bow(v.鞠躬)
private<,>/ˈpraɪvɪt/<,>/ˈpraɪvɪt/<,>adj.私人的/adj.私下的<,>She has a private tutor for math.<,>她有一位私人数学家教。<,>They had a private conversation in the garden.<,>他们在花园里私下交谈。<,>Please respect my private space.<,>请尊重我的私人空间。<,>priv(私人)+ate(形容词后缀)→私人的<,>public(adj.公共的)/privacy(n.隐私)

toast<,>/təʊst/<,>/toʊst/<,>n.烤面包/v.烘/v.烤<,>I like my toast with butter and jam.<,>我喜欢涂黄油和果酱的烤面包。<,>Let's toast the bread for breakfast.<,>我们烤面包当早餐吧。<,>They toasted the newlyweds with champagne.<,>他们用香槟向新人敬酒。<,>to(到)+ast(火)→放到火上→烤<,>roast(v.烤)/boast(v.自夸)/coast(n.海岸)

scenery<,>/ˈsiːnəri/<,>/ˈsinəri/<,>n.风景/n.舞台布景<,>The scenery in the mountains is breathtaking.<,>山里的风景令人叹为观止。<,>The play had beautiful scenery.<,>这出戏的舞台布景很美。<,>We stopped to admire the coastal scenery.<,>我们停下来欣赏海岸风景。<,>scene(场景)+ry(名词后缀)→风景<,>scene(n.场景)/scenic(adj.风景优美的)

fun<,>/fʌn/<,>/fʌn/<,>n.乐趣/n.娱乐/n.玩笑<,>We had so much fun at the party.<,>我们在派对上玩得很开心。<,>It's all in good fun.<,>这只是开个善意的玩笑。<,>Swimming is great fun in summer.<,>夏天游泳是很大的乐趣。<,>谐音"欢"→欢乐→乐趣<,>fan(n.风扇/n.粉丝)/funny(adj.有趣的)

living<,>/ˈlɪvɪŋ/<,>/ˈlɪvɪŋ/<,>adj.活的/n.生活/n.生计<,>All living things need water.<,>所有生物都需要水。<,>He earns his living as a teacher.<,>他以教书为生。<,>The cost of living is high in this city.<,>这个城市的生活成本很高。<,>live(生活)+ing→生活的<,>alive(adj.活着的)/lively(adj.活泼的)

Mediterranean<,>/ˌmedɪtəˈreɪniən/<,>/ˌmɛdɪtəˈreɪniən/<,>n.地中海/adj.地中海的<,>We took a cruise on the Mediterranean.<,>我们在地中海乘船游览。<,>Mediterranean cuisine is very healthy.<,>地中海饮食非常健康。<,>The Mediterranean climate is mild.<,>地中海气候温和。<,>medi(中间)+terr(土地)+anean→中间的土地→地中海<,>medium(n.媒介)/territory(n.领土)

worth<,>/wɜːθ/<,>/wɜrθ/<,>adj.值...的/n.价值<,>This painting is worth a fortune.<,>这幅画价值连城。<,>The book is worth reading.<,>这本书值得一读。<,>He proved his worth to the team.<,>他向团队证明了自己的价值。<,>wor(工作)+th→工作的回报→价值<,>worthy(adj.值得的)/worship(v.崇拜)

conquer<,>/ˈkɒŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkər/<,>v.征服/v.战胜<,>They conquered the enemy in battle.<,>他们在战斗中征服了敌人。<,>She conquered her fear of public speaking.<,>她战胜了公开演讲的恐惧。<,>The team conquered all challenges.<,>团队战胜了所有挑战。<,>con(完全)+quer(寻求)→完全寻求→征服<,>conquest(n.征服)/conqueror(n.征服者)

absorb<,>/əbˈsɔːb/<,>/əbˈsɔːrb/<,>v.吸收/v.使专心<,>Plants absorb sunlight for photosynthesis.<,>植物吸收阳光进行光合作用。<,>The sponge absorbed all the water.<,>海绵吸收了所有的水。<,>He was absorbed in his book.<,>他全神贯注地看书。<,>ab(离开)+sorb(吸)→吸走→吸收<,>adsorb(v.吸附)/sorbet(n.果汁冰糕)

enthusiasm<,>/ɪnˈθjuːziæzəm/<,>/ɪnˈθuːziæzəm/<,>n.热情/n.热心/n.热忱<,>She showed great enthusiasm for the project.<,>她对项目表现出极大的热情。<,>His enthusiasm is contagious.<,>他的热情很有感染力。<,>They worked with enthusiasm.<,>他们满怀热忱地工作。<,>en(使)+thus(神)+iasm→使有神一样的状态→热情<,>enthusiast(n.热心者)/enthusiastic(adj.热情的)
brood<,>/bruːd/<,>/brud/<,>n.同窝幼鸟/v.孵（蛋）<,>The hen broods over her eggs.<,>母鸡在孵蛋。<,>A brood of chicks followed their mother.<,>一窝小鸡跟着它们的妈妈。<,>He brooded over his mistakes all night.<,>他整夜都在想着他的错误。<,>brood(联想：breed养育)→孵蛋<,>blood(n.血液)/breed(v.繁殖/n.品种)  

tip<,>/tɪp/<,>/tɪp/<,>v.轻击/v.给小费<,>She tipped the waiter generously.<,>她慷慨地给了服务员小费。<,>He tipped the glass and spilled the water.<,>他轻轻碰了一下杯子，水洒了出来。<,>The arrow tipped the target but didn't stick.<,>箭头轻触了靶子但没有射中。<,>tip(顶端)→轻触顶端→轻击<,>tap(v.轻拍/n.水龙头)/trip(n.旅行/v.绊倒)  

accompany<,>/əˈkʌmpəni/<,>/əˈkʌmpəni/<,>v.陪伴/v.伴随<,>She accompanied me to the hospital.<,>她陪我去医院。<,>Thunder usually accompanies lightning.<,>雷声通常伴随着闪电。<,>The singer was accompanied by a pianist.<,>歌手由一位钢琴家伴奏。<,>ac(强调)+company(陪伴)→陪同<,>company(n.公司/n.陪伴)/companion(n.同伴)  

execute<,>/ˈeksɪkjuːt/<,>/ˈɛksɪˌkjut/<,>v.将…处死/v.实施<,>The sentence was executed at dawn.<,>死刑在黎明时执行。<,>He executed the plan perfectly.<,>他完美地执行了计划。<,>The software executes commands quickly.<,>这个软件能快速执行命令。<,>ex(出)+secute(跟随)→跟随到底→执行<,>executive(adj.执行的/n.高管)/persecute(v.迫害)  

conceal<,>/kənˈsiːl/<,>/kənˈsil/<,>v.把…隐藏起来<,>He concealed his disappointment with a smile.<,>他用微笑掩饰失望。<,>The treasure was concealed under the floor.<,>宝藏被藏在地板下。<,>She couldn't conceal her excitement.<,>她掩饰不住兴奋。<,>con(完全)+ceal(隐藏)→完全隐藏<,>reveal(v.揭露)/concede(v.让步)  

certain<,>/ˈsɜːtn/<,>/ˈsɜrtn/<,>adj.肯定的/adj.确实的<,>I'm certain he will come.<,>我确信他会来。<,>There's no certain cure for this disease.<,>这种病没有确切的治疗方法。<,>She spoke with a certain hesitation.<,>她说话时有些犹豫。<,>cert(确定)+ain→确定的<,>curtain(n.窗帘)/certify(v.证明)  

apparent<,>/əˈpærənt/<,>/əˈpærənt/<,>adj.明显的/adj.表面上的<,>Her happiness was apparent to everyone.<,>大家都看得出她很开心。<,>The apparent simplicity of the design is deceptive.<,>这个设计表面简单，实则不然。<,>For no apparent reason, he left the party early.<,>他无缘无故早早离开了聚会。<,>ap(加强)+par(出现)+ent→明显出现的<,>transparent(adj.透明的)/parent(n.父母)  

messenger<,>/ˈmesɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmɛsəndʒɚ/<,>n.送信者/n.信使<,>The messenger delivered an important letter.<,>信使送来了一封重要的信。<,>In ancient times, messengers traveled by horse.<,>古时候信使骑马送信。<,>Hormones act as chemical messengers in the body.<,>激素在体内充当化学信使。<,>message(信息)+er(人)→送信息的人<,>passenger(n.乘客)/manager(n.经理)  

merit<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>/ˈmɛrɪt/<,>n.长处/n.优点<,>The plan has considerable merit.<,>这个计划很有价值。<,>Promotion should be based on merit.<,>晋升应该基于优点。<,>Her artistic merits are widely recognized.<,>她的艺术才华广受认可。<,>mer(值得)+it→值得的东西→优点<,>demerit(n.缺点)/marry(v.结婚)  

youth<,>/juːθ/<,>/juθ/<,>n.青春/n.青年们/n.青年<,>He spent his youth in the countryside.<,>他在乡村度过了青春时光。<,>The youth of today face many challenges.<,>当今的年轻人面临许多挑战。<,>She works with troubled youth.<,>她从事问题青年的工作。<,>you(你)+th→你的年华→青春<,>mouth(n.嘴)/truth(n.真相)
naval<,>/ˈneɪvəl/<,>/ˈneɪvəl/<,>adj.海军的/adj.军舰的<,>The naval officer was in charge of the fleet.<,>这位海军军官负责舰队。<,>They visited a naval base yesterday.<,>他们昨天参观了一个海军基地。<,>The country has a strong naval force.<,>这个国家拥有一支强大的海军力量。<,>nav(船)+al(形容词后缀)→与船有关的→海军的<,>navy(n.海军)/naval(adj.海军的)/navigate(v.航行)  

downward<,>/ˈdaʊnwəd/<,>/ˈdaʊnwərd/<,>adj.向下的/adv.向下地<,>The downward slope made cycling difficult.<,>下坡让骑车变得困难。<,>Prices have been moving downward recently.<,>最近价格一直在下降。<,>He looked downward to avoid eye contact.<,>他向下看以避免眼神接触。<,>down(下)+ward(方向)→向下的<,>upward(adv.向上地)/forward(adv.向前)/backward(adv.向后)  

fact<,>/fækt/<,>/fækt/<,>n.事实/n.实际/n.实情<,>It's a fact that the Earth revolves around the Sun.<,>地球围绕太阳转是一个事实。<,>In fact, I was there when it happened.<,>事实上，事情发生时我在场。<,>The report is based on hard facts.<,>这份报告是基于确凿的事实。<,>fac(做)+t→做出来的事→事实<,>factor(n.因素)/faction(n.派系)/fictitious(adj.虚构的)  

hut<,>/hʌt/<,>/hʌt/<,>n.小屋/n.棚屋<,>They built a small hut in the woods.<,>他们在树林里建了一个小屋。<,>The fisherman's hut stood by the lake.<,>渔夫的小屋坐落在湖边。<,>We took shelter in a mountain hut during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间我们在山上的小屋里躲避。<,>hut→发音类似"哈特"→小屋<,>hut(n.小屋)/hut(n.棚屋)/hut(n.茅舍)  

namely<,>/ˈneɪmli/<,>/ˈneɪmli/<,>adv.即/adv.也就是<,>Three students were absent, namely Tom, Jack, and Lily.<,>三名学生缺席，即汤姆、杰克和莉莉。<,>He loves fruits, namely apples and bananas.<,>他喜欢水果，也就是苹果和香蕉。<,>We need two things, namely time and money.<,>我们需要两样东西，即时间和金钱。<,>name(名字)+ly(副词后缀)→即，也就是<,>namely(adv.即)/name(n.名字)/nameless(adj.无名的)  

monument<,>/ˈmɒnjumənt/<,>/ˈmɑːnjumənt/<,>n.纪念碑/n.纪念馆<,>They visited the Washington Monument last summer.<,>他们去年夏天参观了华盛顿纪念碑。<,>The monument was built to honor the war heroes.<,>这座纪念碑是为了纪念战争英雄而建的。<,>This ancient monument attracts many tourists.<,>这座古老的纪念碑吸引了许多游客。<,>monu(提醒)+ment(名词后缀)→提醒人们记住的东西→纪念碑<,>monument(n.纪念碑)/moment(n.时刻)/document(n.文件)  

cool<,>/kuːl/<,>/kuːl/<,>adj.凉的/adj.冷静的<,>The evening breeze felt cool on my face.<,>晚风吹在脸上很凉爽。<,>He remained cool under pressure.<,>他在压力下保持冷静。<,>Let's find a cool place to rest.<,>我们找个凉快的地方休息吧。<,>cool→发音类似"酷"→凉爽的/冷静的<,>cool(adj.凉的)/cold(adj.寒冷的)/chill(adj.寒冷的)  

governor<,>/ˈɡʌvənə(r)/<,>/ˈɡʌvərnər/<,>n.州长/n.主管人员<,>The governor will give a speech tomorrow.<,>州长明天将发表演讲。<,>He was appointed governor of the bank.<,>他被任命为银行的主管。<,>The school governor made an important decision.<,>学校的主管人员做出了一个重要决定。<,>govern(管理)+or(人)→管理者→州长/主管<,>governor(n.州长)/government(n.政府)/govern(v.管理)  

program<,>/ˈprəʊɡræm/<,>/ˈproʊɡræm/<,>n.程序/n.节目单<,>She is learning to write computer programs.<,>她正在学习编写计算机程序。<,>What's on the program for tonight?<,>今晚的节目单上有什么？<,>The TV program starts at 8 pm.<,>这个电视节目晚上8点开始。<,>pro(前)+gram(写)→预先写好的东西→程序/节目单<,>program(n.程序)/diagram(n.图表)/telegram(n.电报)  

illness<,>/ˈɪlnəs/<,>/ˈɪlnəs/<,>n.病/n.疾病<,>He was absent from school due to illness.<,>他因病缺课。<,>The doctor diagnosed her illness quickly.<,>医生很快诊断出了她的疾病。<,>Mental illness should be taken seriously.<,>精神疾病应该被认真对待。<,>ill(生病的)+ness(名词后缀)→疾病<,>illness(n.疾病)/sickness(n.疾病)/wellness(n.健康)
normal<,>/ˈnɔːməl/<,>/ˈnɔːrməl/<,>adj.正常的/adj.普通的<,>It's normal to feel nervous before a test.<,>考试前感到紧张是正常的。<,>She leads a normal life in the small town.<,>她在这个小镇过着普通的生活。<,>The temperature is back to normal now.<,>现在温度恢复正常了。<,>norm(标准)+al(形容词后缀)→符合标准的→正常的<,>formal(adj.正式的)/abnormal(adj.反常的)

population<,>/ˌpɒpjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌpɑːpjuˈleɪʃn/<,>n.人口/n.全体居民<,>The population of this city is over 10 million.<,>这个城市的人口超过1000万。<,>The local population is very friendly to tourists.<,>当地居民对游客非常友好。<,>We need to control the population growth.<,>我们需要控制人口增长。<,>popul(人民)+ation(名词后缀)→人口<,>popular(adj.流行的)/populate(v.居住于)

frontier<,>/ˈfrʌntɪə(r)/<,>/frʌnˈtɪr/<,>n.边境/n.边疆/n.新领域<,>They crossed the frontier at midnight.<,>他们在午夜穿越了边境。<,>Space exploration is the final frontier.<,>太空探索是最后的新领域。<,>The frontier town was full of adventurers.<,>这个边疆小镇满是冒险者。<,>front(前面)+ier→前面的边界→边境<,>border(n.边界)/boundary(n.分界线)

quantity<,>/ˈkwɒntəti/<,>/ˈkwɑːntəti/<,>n.量/n.数量/n.分量<,>Quality is more important than quantity.<,>质量比数量更重要。<,>We need a large quantity of flour for baking.<,>我们需要大量面粉来烘焙。<,>The exact quantity is not known yet.<,>确切数量尚不清楚。<,>quant(数量)+ity(名词后缀)→数量<,>quality(n.质量)/quantify(v.量化)

order<,>/ˈɔːdə(r)/<,>/ˈɔːrdər/<,>n.次序/n.整齐/v.命令<,>Please keep your room in order.<,>请保持房间整洁。<,>The general gave the order to attack.<,>将军下达了进攻命令。<,>The names are listed in alphabetical order.<,>名字按字母顺序排列。<,>ord(顺序)+er→次序<,>border(n.边界)/disorder(n.混乱)

learning<,>/ˈlɜːnɪŋ/<,>/ˈlɜːrnɪŋ/<,>n.学问/n.知识/n.学习<,>Learning a new language takes time.<,>学习一门新语言需要时间。<,>He is a man of great learning.<,>他是个学识渊博的人。<,>Online learning has become popular.<,>在线学习变得流行起来。<,>learn(学习)+ing(名词后缀)→学习<,>earn(v.赚得)/yearn(v.渴望)

everywhere<,>/ˈevriweə(r)/<,>/ˈevriwer/<,>adv.到处/adv.处处<,>I've looked everywhere for my keys.<,>我到处找我的钥匙。<,>Spring flowers are blooming everywhere.<,>春天的花朵处处绽放。<,>Technology is everywhere these days.<,>如今科技无处不在。<,>every(每)+where(地方)→每个地方→到处<,>anywhere(adv.任何地方)/nowhere(adv.无处)

stage<,>/steɪdʒ/<,>/steɪdʒ/<,>n.阶段/n.舞台<,>The project is still in its early stages.<,>这个项目仍处于早期阶段。<,>She was nervous before going on stage.<,>上台前她很紧张。<,>The disease was detected at an early stage.<,>这个疾病在早期阶段就被发现了。<,>st(站立)+age(名词后缀)→站立的地方→舞台<,>stair(n.楼梯)/stake(n.赌注)

everyone<,>/ˈevriwʌn/<,>/ˈevriwʌn/<,>pron.每人/pron.人人<,>Everyone is welcome to join the party.<,>欢迎每个人都来参加聚会。<,>Everyone has their own opinion.<,>人人都有自己的观点。<,>Is everyone ready for the test?<,>大家都准备好考试了吗?<,>every(每)+one(一个人)→每个人<,>everybody(pron.每个人)/everything(pron.每件事)

sting<,>/stɪŋ/<,>/stɪŋ/<,>v.刺/v.刺痛/n.刺<,>A bee stung me on the arm.<,>一只蜜蜂蜇了我的手臂。<,>His words stung her deeply.<,>他的话深深刺痛了她。<,>The jellyfish's sting can be painful.<,>水母的刺会很疼。<,>st(刺)+ing→刺<,>sing(v.唱歌)/swing(v.摇摆)
hatch<,>/hætʃ/<,>/hætʃ/<,>v.（蛋）孵化/v.孵出<,>The eggs will hatch in about two weeks.<,>这些蛋大约两周后孵化。<,>The bird hatched three chicks.<,>这只鸟孵出了三只小鸟。<,>We watched the baby turtles hatch and crawl to the sea.<,>我们看着小海龟孵化并爬向大海。<,>hat(帽子)+ch→像帽子一样覆盖孵化<,>match(n.比赛/v.匹配)/patch(n.补丁/v.修补)  

honey<,>/ˈhʌni/<,>/ˈhʌni/<,>n.蜜/n.蜂蜜<,>She added a spoonful of honey to her tea.<,>她在茶里加了一勺蜂蜜。<,>Bees collect nectar to make honey.<,>蜜蜂采集花蜜酿蜜。<,>This honey has a light floral flavor.<,>这款蜂蜜有淡淡的花香。<,>hon(诚实)+ey→甜蜜如真诚的感情<,>money(n.钱)/funny(adj.有趣的)  

nest<,>/nest/<,>/nɛst/<,>n.巢/n.窝/n.穴<,>The bird built a nest in the tree.<,>鸟儿在树上筑巢。<,>We found a mouse nest in the attic.<,>我们在阁楼发现了一个老鼠窝。<,>The turtle returned to its nesting site.<,>海龟回到了它的筑巢地。<,>net(网)+s→像网一样的结构→巢穴<,>next(adj.下一个)/rest(n.休息)  

degree<,>/dɪˈɡriː/<,>/dɪˈɡri/<,>n.度/n.学位<,>Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.<,>水在100摄氏度沸腾。<,>She earned a master's degree in biology.<,>她获得了生物学硕士学位。<,>To what degree do you agree with this statement?<,>你在多大程度上同意这个说法？<,>de(向下)+gree(走)→逐步达到的程度<,>agree(v.同意)/decree(n.法令)  

equivalent<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>adj.相等的/adj.等量的<,>This amount is equivalent to two cups.<,>这个量相当于两杯。<,>The two words are roughly equivalent in meaning.<,>这两个词的意思大致相同。<,>What's the dollar equivalent of 100 euros?<,>100欧元相当于多少美元？<,>equi(相等)+val(价值)+ent→价值相等的<,>equipment(n.设备)/eloquent(adj.雄辩的)  

calendar<,>/ˈkælɪndə(r)/<,>/ˈkæləndər/<,>n.日历/n.历书/n.历法<,>Mark the date on your calendar.<,>在你的日历上标记这个日期。<,>The lunar calendar is used for traditional festivals.<,>农历用于传统节日。<,>This calendar shows all the holidays.<,>这个日历显示所有节假日。<,>cal(呼叫)+end(结束)+ar→标记时间开始和结束的工具<,>calculator(n.计算器)/colander(n.滤器)  

manual<,>/ˈmænjuəl/<,>/ˈmænjuəl/<,>adj.体力的/n.手册<,>Manual labor can be exhausting.<,>体力劳动可能很累人。<,>Read the instruction manual carefully.<,>仔细阅读说明书。<,>He prefers manual transmission cars.<,>他更喜欢手动挡汽车。<,>manu(手)+al→用手操作的<,>annual(adj.每年的)/manure(n.肥料)  

cabinet<,>/ˈkæbɪnət/<,>/ˈkæbənət/<,>n.内阁/n.橱/n.柜<,>The cabinet meets every Tuesday.<,>内阁每周二开会。<,>Store the dishes in the kitchen cabinet.<,>把餐具放在厨房橱柜里。<,>She collects antique medicine cabinets.<,>她收藏古董药柜。<,>cabin(小屋)+et(小)→像小房间的柜子<,>cabin(n.船舱)/cable(n.电缆)  

steady<,>/ˈstedi/<,>/ˈstɛdi/<,>adj.稳固的/v.使稳定<,>Hold the ladder steady while I climb.<,>我爬梯子时扶稳它。<,>She has a steady income.<,>她有稳定的收入。<,>He steadied the trembling glass.<,>他稳住了颤抖的玻璃杯。<,>stead(位置)+y→保持在固定位置的<,>ready(adj.准备好的)/study(v.学习)  

more<,>/mɔː(r)/<,>/mɔr/<,>adj.更多的/adv.更<,>I need more time to finish the work.<,>我需要更多时间完成工作。<,>She is more intelligent than her brother.<,>她比她哥哥更聪明。<,>The more you practice, the better you'll get.<,>你练习得越多，就会做得越好。<,>mo(磨)+re(热)→越磨越热→更多<,>most(adj.最多的)/moor(n.沼泽)
apple<,>/ˈæp(ə)l/<,>/ˈæpəl/<,>n.苹果<,>She ate an apple for breakfast.<,>她早餐吃了一个苹果。<,>An apple a day keeps the doctor away.<,>一天一苹果，医生远离我。<,>He gave me a red apple.<,>他给了我一个红苹果。<,>ap(接近)+ple(水果)→接近水果→苹果<,>applet(n.小程序)/ample(adj.充足的)/apply(v.申请)  

never<,>/ˈnevə(r)/<,>/ˈnɛvər/<,>adv.永不/adv.决不/adv.不<,>I will never forget your kindness.<,>我永远不会忘记你的好意。<,>He never arrives on time.<,>他从不准时到。<,>Never say never.<,>永不言弃。<,>n(否定)+ever(曾经)→从未<,>ever(adv.曾经)/nevertheless(adv.然而)/forever(adv.永远)  

instruction<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkʃ(ə)n/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkʃən/<,>n.命令/n.教学/n.教训<,>Follow the instructions carefully.<,>仔细按照说明操作。<,>She gives piano instructions.<,>她教授钢琴课。<,>The incident was a good instruction for him.<,>这次事件对他是个很好的教训。<,>in(进入)+struct(建造)+ion→指导建造→教学<,>construction(n.建筑)/destruction(n.破坏)/structure(n.结构)  

laughter<,>/ˈlɑːftə(r)/<,>/ˈlæftər/<,>n.笑/n.笑声<,>The room was full of laughter.<,>房间里充满了笑声。<,>Her laughter is contagious.<,>她的笑声很有感染力。<,>Laughter is the best medicine.<,>笑是最好的良药。<,>laugh(笑)+ter(名词后缀)→笑声<,>slaughter(n./v.屠杀)/daughter(n.女儿)/afters(n.甜点)  

appeal<,>/əˈpiːl/<,>/əˈpil/<,>n.呼吁/n.申述/v.呼吁/v.申述<,>The charity made an appeal for donations.<,>慈善机构呼吁捐款。<,>He decided to appeal the court's decision.<,>他决定对法院的判决提出上诉。<,>The idea has great appeal to young people.<,>这个想法对年轻人很有吸引力。<,>ap(向)+peal(驱动)→向...驱动→呼吁<,>peel(v.剥皮)/peal(n.钟声)/appall(v.使惊骇)  

idiom<,>/ˈɪdiəm/<,>/ˈɪdiəm/<,>n.习语/n.成语<,>"Break a leg" is an English idiom meaning good luck.<,>"Break a leg"是英语习语，意思是祝你好运。<,>Learning idioms can be challenging.<,>学习成语可能很有挑战性。<,>This Chinese idiom comes from an ancient story.<,>这个中国成语来源于一个古老的故事。<,>idio(独特的)+m→独特的表达方式→习语<,>idiot(n.白痴)/ideal(adj.理想的)/idle(adj.闲置的)  

impressive<,>/ɪmˈpresɪv/<,>/ɪmˈprɛsɪv/<,>adj.给人印象深刻的<,>Her speech was very impressive.<,>她的演讲令人印象深刻。<,>The view from the top is impressive.<,>从顶部看到的景色令人惊叹。<,>He has an impressive collection of stamps.<,>他收藏的邮票令人印象深刻。<,>im(进入)+press(压)+ive→压入脑海的→印象深刻的<,>impress(v.留下印象)/expression(n.表达)/depress(v.使沮丧)  

fourteen<,>/ˌfɔːˈtiːn/<,>/ˌfɔrˈtin/<,>num.十四<,>There are fourteen students in our class.<,>我们班有十四名学生。<,>She will be fourteen next month.<,>她下个月就十四岁了。<,>Page fourteen contains the answer.<,>答案在第十四页。<,>four(四)+teen(十几)→十四<,>forty(num.四十)/fourth(num.第四)/fortnight(n.两星期)  

on<,>/ɒn/<,>/ɑn/<,>prep.在...上<,>The book is on the table.<,>书在桌子上。<,>She put a ring on her finger.<,>她把戒指戴在手指上。<,>Turn on the light, please.<,>请开灯。<,>简单介词，表示接触表面<,>in(prep.在...里)/at(prep.在...处)/onto(prep.到...上)  

stack<,>/stæk/<,>/stæk/<,>n.堆/n.垛/v.堆积<,>There's a stack of papers on your desk.<,>你桌上有一堆文件。<,>Please stack the chairs after the meeting.<,>会议结束后请把椅子堆起来。<,>The chimney was stacked with bricks.<,>烟囱是用砖块堆砌的。<,>st(站立)+ack→站立在一起→堆积<,>stock(n.库存)/stuck(v.粘住)/stake(n.桩)
imitate<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪmɪˌteɪt/<,>v.模仿/v.仿效/v.仿制<,>Children often imitate their parents' behavior.<,>孩子们经常模仿父母的行为。<,>He can imitate the sound of a bird perfectly.<,>他能完美地模仿鸟的叫声。<,>The artist imitated the style of the old masters.<,>这位艺术家模仿了古代大师的风格。<,>imit(模仿)+ate(动词后缀)→模仿<,>intimate(adj.亲密的)/irritate(v.激怒)/emulate(v.竞争)

cast<,>/kɑːst/<,>/kæst/<,>v.投/v.扔/v.抛/v.浇铸<,>He cast a stone into the pond.<,>他把一块石头扔进了池塘。<,>The statue was cast in bronze.<,>这座雕像是用青铜浇铸的。<,>She cast a glance at the stranger.<,>她瞥了那个陌生人一眼。<,>c(抓)+ast(扔)→投掷<,>caste(n.种姓)/castle(n.城堡)/cost(n.成本)

pump<,>/pʌmp/<,>/pʌmp/<,>n.泵/v.用抽机抽<,>We need to pump water from the well.<,>我们需要从井里抽水。<,>The heart pumps blood throughout the body.<,>心脏将血液泵送到全身。<,>She pumped air into the bicycle tire.<,>她给自行车轮胎打气。<,>p(拍打)+ump(隆起)→像泵一样拍打<,>plump(adj.丰满的)/bump(n.肿块)/jump(v.跳跃)

animal<,>/ˈænɪməl/<,>/ˈænəməl/<,>n.动物/n.兽/adj.兽欲/adj.动物本能<,>Lions are wild animals.<,>狮子是野生动物。<,>He has animal instincts when it comes to survival.<,>在生存方面他有动物本能。<,>She felt an animal urge to protect her child.<,>她有一种保护孩子的本能冲动。<,>anim(生命)+al(形容词后缀)→有生命的→动物<,>animate(v.使有生气)/inanimate(adj.无生命的)/annual(adj.每年的)

mend<,>/mend/<,>/mɛnd/<,>v.修补/v.缝补/v.修理<,>She mended the hole in the sock.<,>她补好了袜子上的洞。<,>It's never too late to mend.<,>亡羊补牢，为时未晚。<,>He's trying to mend his broken relationship.<,>他正在努力修复破裂的关系。<,>men(手)+d(做)→用手做→修补<,>amend(v.修正)/blend(v.混合)/send(v.发送)

dozen<,>/ˈdʌzn/<,>/ˈdʌzən/<,>n.一打/n.十二个<,>I bought a dozen eggs.<,>我买了一打鸡蛋。<,>She has dozens of friends.<,>她有很多朋友。<,>There were about two dozen people at the party.<,>派对上有大约二十四人。<,>doz(十二)+en(后缀)→一打<,>dozing(v.打盹)/dizzy(adj.头晕的)/doe(n.母鹿)

bathe<,>/beɪð/<,>/beɪð/<,>v.给...洗澡<,>She bathes her baby every evening.<,>她每天晚上都给宝宝洗澡。<,>The river is perfect for bathing.<,>这条河很适合洗澡。<,>The sunlight bathed the room in warmth.<,>阳光使房间充满温暖。<,>bath(洗澡)+e(动词后缀)→洗澡<,>breath(n.呼吸)/bother(v.打扰)/beneath(prep.在...之下)

means<,>/miːnz/<,>/minz/<,>n.方法/n.手段/n.工具<,>The Internet is a means of communication.<,>互联网是一种通讯手段。<,>He achieved success by fair means.<,>他通过正当手段取得了成功。<,>This is the only means to solve the problem.<,>这是解决问题的唯一方法。<,>mean(中间)+s(复数)→中间手段<,>meant(v.意味)/mends(v.修补)/mains(n.主要部分)

emphasis<,>/ˈemfəsɪs/<,>/ˈɛmfəsɪs/<,>n.强调/n.重点/n.重要性<,>The teacher put emphasis on pronunciation.<,>老师强调了发音的重要性。<,>The emphasis should be on quality, not quantity.<,>重点应该放在质量上，而不是数量上。<,>His speech laid great emphasis on education.<,>他的演讲非常强调教育。<,>em(在...上)+phasis(显示)→在上面显示→强调<,>emphatic(adj.强调的)/empathy(n.同理心)/empire(n.帝国)

shortage<,>/ˈʃɔːtɪdʒ/<,>/ˈʃɔrtɪdʒ/<,>n.不足/n.缺少/n.不足额<,>There is a shortage of water in this area.<,>这个地区缺水。<,>The company faces a shortage of skilled workers.<,>公司面临技术工人短缺的问题。<,>A shortage of funds delayed the project.<,>资金不足延误了项目。<,>short(短)+age(状态)→短缺状态<,>storage(n.存储)/shorten(v.缩短)/shortly(adv.不久)
contrary<,>/ˈkɒntrəri/<,>/ˈkɑːntreri/<,>adj.相反的/n.相反<,>Contrary to popular belief, cats are not always aloof.<,>与普遍看法相反，猫并不总是高冷的。<,>He took the contrary view in the debate.<,>他在辩论中持相反观点。<,>The results were contrary to our expectations.<,>结果与我们的预期相反。<,>contra(反对)+ary(形容词后缀)→相反的<,>contradict(v.反驳)/contrast(n.对比)/controversy(n.争议)  

tunnel<,>/ˈtʌnl/<,>/ˈtʌnl/<,>n.隧道/n.坑道/n.地道<,>The train sped through the mountain tunnel.<,>火车飞速穿过山间隧道。<,>They dug a tunnel to escape from prison.<,>他们挖了一条地道越狱。<,>The rabbit disappeared into its burrow like a tunnel.<,>兔子像钻进隧道般消失在地洞里。<,>tun(桶)+nel→桶状通道→隧道<,>channel(n.通道)/funnel(n.漏斗)/tureen(n.汤碗)  

visible<,>/ˈvɪzəbl/<,>/ˈvɪzəbl/<,>adj.可见的/adj.看得见的<,>The ship became visible on the horizon.<,>船在地平线上变得可见。<,>Her disappointment was visible in her eyes.<,>她的失望在眼神中清晰可见。<,>There's no visible damage to the package.<,>包裹没有明显损坏。<,>vis(看)+ible(可…的)→可见的<,>invisible(adj.看不见的)/vision(n.视力)/visual(adj.视觉的)  

minimum<,>/ˈmɪnɪməm/<,>/ˈmɪnɪməm/<,>n.最小量/adj.最小的<,>We need a minimum of three people to start the tour.<,>我们至少需要三人才能开始游览。<,>The minimum wage will increase next month.<,>最低工资下个月将上调。<,>Keep noise to a minimum during the exam.<,>考试期间请将噪音控制在最低限度。<,>mini(小)+mum→最小的量<,>maximum(n.最大值)/minimal(adj.极小的)/diminish(v.减少)  

hedge<,>/hedʒ/<,>/hedʒ/<,>n.篱笆/n.树篱<,>The garden was surrounded by a tall hedge.<,>花园被高高的树篱环绕。<,>He hedged his bets by investing in multiple stocks.<,>他通过投资多支股票来对冲风险。<,>The politician hedged when asked about the scandal.<,>政客被问及丑闻时闪烁其词。<,>h(形似篱笆形状)+edge(边缘)→边缘的围栏→树篱<,>ledge(n.壁架)/wedge(n.楔子)/pledge(n.誓言)  

bundle<,>/ˈbʌndl/<,>/ˈbʌndl/<,>n.捆/n.包/n.束/n.包袱<,>She carried a bundle of firewood on her back.<,>她背着一捆柴火。<,>The baby was wrapped in a soft bundle.<,>婴儿被裹在柔软的襁褓中。<,>They offered a bundle of services at a discount.<,>他们提供一整套折扣服务。<,>bund(绑)+le(小)→绑起来的小东西→捆<,>bunch(n.串)/bound(v.捆绑)/bungle(v.搞砸)  

stretch<,>/stretʃ/<,>/stretʃ/<,>v.伸展/v.伸/n.伸展<,>I like to stretch my legs after long flights.<,>长途飞行后我喜欢伸展双腿。<,>The elastic band lost its stretch after repeated use.<,>橡皮筋反复使用后失去了弹性。<,>The desert stretches for hundreds of miles.<,>沙漠绵延数百英里。<,>street(街道)+ch→在街道上伸展身体<,>sketch(n.草图)/scratch(v.抓)/stitch(n.针脚)  

electrical<,>/ɪˈlektrɪkl/<,>/ɪˈlektrɪkl/<,>adj.电的/adj.电气科学的<,>He's studying electrical engineering at university.<,>他在大学学习电气工程。<,>Check all electrical appliances before leaving.<,>离开前检查所有电器。<,>The storm caused widespread electrical failures.<,>暴风雨导致大面积停电。<,>electr(电的)+ical(形容词后缀)→电的<,>electronic(adj.电子的)/electric(adj.电动的)/electrode(n.电极)  

artificial<,>/ˌɑːtɪˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌɑːrtɪˈfɪʃl/<,>adj.人工的/adj.娇揉造作的<,>The lake is stocked with artificial fish habitats.<,>湖里放置了人工鱼礁。<,>Her smile seemed artificial and forced.<,>她的笑容显得做作勉强。<,>Artificial intelligence is changing our world.<,>人工智能正在改变我们的世界。<,>art(艺术)+i+fic(做)+ial→人工制作的<,>authentic(adj.真实的)/artistic(adj.艺术的)/artifact(n.人工制品)  

grateful<,>/ˈɡreɪtfl/<,>/ˈɡreɪtfl/<,>adj.感激的<,>I'm deeply grateful for your timely help.<,>我非常感激你的及时帮助。<,>She gave him a grateful smile.<,>她向他报以感激的微笑。<,>We should be grateful for what we have.<,>我们应该感恩现有的一切。<,>grate(高兴)+ful(充满…的)→充满感激的<,>graceful(adj.优雅的)/gratitude(n.感激)/great(adj.伟大的)
classmate<,>/ˈklɑːsmeɪt/<,>/ˈklæsmeɪt/<,>n.同班同学<,>I met my old classmate at the reunion.<,>我在同学聚会上遇到了我的老同学。<,>She is my classmate from high school.<,>她是我高中的同班同学。<,>We were classmates in the same English class.<,>我们曾在同一个英语班上课。<,>class(班级)+mate(伙伴)→同班同学<,>roommate(n.室友)/teammate(n.队友)

assess<,>/əˈses/<,>/əˈsɛs/<,>v.对(财产等)估价/v.评估<,>The insurance company will assess the damage to your car.<,>保险公司将评估你车辆的损坏情况。<,>It's difficult to assess the impact of the new policy.<,>很难评估新政策的影响。<,>Teachers need to assess students' progress regularly.<,>教师需要定期评估学生的进步情况。<,>as(朝向)+sess(坐)→坐下来评估<,>access(n.入口/v.访问)/excess(n.过量)/asset(n.资产)

personal<,>/ˈpɜːsənəl/<,>/ˈpɜːrsənəl/<,>adj.个人的/adj.本人的<,>This is my personal opinion, not the company's.<,>这是我个人的观点，不代表公司。<,>She keeps her personal life private.<,>她对自己的私生活保密。<,>Please check your personal belongings before leaving.<,>离开前请检查个人物品。<,>person(人)+al(形容词后缀)→个人的<,>personnel(n.全体人员)/personable(adj.风度好的)

qualify<,>/ˈkwɒlɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈkwɑːlɪfaɪ/<,>v.使具有资格<,>This certificate qualifies you to teach English.<,>这个证书使你有资格教英语。<,>His experience qualifies him for the position.<,>他的经验使他胜任这个职位。<,>She qualified as a doctor last year.<,>她去年获得了医生资格。<,>quali(质量)+fy(使)→使达到质量要求→使合格<,>quality(n.质量)/quantify(v.量化)

shift<,>/ʃɪft/<,>/ʃɪft/<,>v.替换/v.转移/n.转换<,>He shifted the heavy box to the other side.<,>他把重箱子移到另一边。<,>The night shift starts at 10 pm.<,>夜班从晚上10点开始。<,>Public opinion has shifted on this issue.<,>公众对这个问题的看法已经转变。<,>sh(移动)+ift→转移<,>lift(v.举起)/drift(v.漂流)

preceding<,>/prɪˈsiːdɪŋ/<,>/prɪˈsiːdɪŋ/<,>adj.在前的/adj.在先的<,>The preceding chapter was about grammar.<,>前一章是关于语法的。<,>In the preceding years, the company made huge profits.<,>在前几年，公司获得了巨大利润。<,>Check the preceding paragraph for more details.<,>查看前一段获取更多细节。<,>pre(前)+cede(走)+ing→走在前面的→在前的<,>proceeding(n.进程)/precedent(n.先例)

board<,>/bɔːd/<,>/bɔːrd/<,>n.板/v.上(船、车等)<,>Please write your name on the whiteboard.<,>请把你的名字写在白板上。<,>We'll board the plane in 30 minutes.<,>我们30分钟后登机。<,>The notice was pinned to the bulletin board.<,>通知被钉在公告板上。<,>b(板)+oar(桨)+d→船板→上船<,>aboard(adv.在船上)/broad(adj.宽阔的)

custom<,>/ˈkʌstəm/<,>/ˈkʌstəm/<,>n.习惯/n.风俗/n.海关<,>It's a local custom to bow when greeting.<,>鞠躬问候是当地的习俗。<,>We had to go through customs at the airport.<,>我们必须在机场通过海关检查。<,>It's his custom to drink tea every afternoon.<,>他习惯每天下午喝茶。<,>cus(习惯)+tom(惯例)→风俗习惯<,>customer(n.顾客)/costume(n.服装)

patch<,>/pætʃ/<,>/pætʃ/<,>n.补丁/n.斑/v.修补<,>She sewed a patch on her jeans.<,>她在牛仔裤上缝了个补丁。<,>There's a patch of blue in the cloudy sky.<,>多云的天空中有一小块蓝天。<,>We need to patch the hole in the roof.<,>我们需要修补屋顶的洞。<,>p(补)+atch(atch同"补")→补丁<,>batch(n.一批)/hatch(v.孵化)

jar<,>/dʒɑː(r)/<,>/dʒɑːr/<,>n.罐子/n.坛子/n.广口瓶<,>She keeps cookies in a glass jar.<,>她把饼干放在玻璃罐里。<,>The sound of the door slamming jarred my nerves.<,>门砰的一声让我的神经紧张。<,>This jar of honey is almost empty.<,>这罐蜂蜜快用完了。<,>j(形状像罐子)+ar→罐子<,>car(n.汽车)/bar(n.酒吧)
defeat<,>/dɪˈfiːt/<,>/dɪˈfit/<,>v.战胜/v.击败/v.挫败<,>They defeated the enemy in a fierce battle.<,>他们在一场激烈的战斗中击败了敌人。<,>His plan was defeated by lack of funding.<,>他的计划因缺乏资金而受挫。<,>She defeated all her opponents in the debate competition.<,>她在辩论比赛中战胜了所有对手。<,>de(向下)+feat(做)→把对方做下去→击败<,>feat(n.功绩)/defect(n.缺点)/defer(v.推迟)

child<,>/tʃaɪld/<,>/tʃaɪld/<,>n.小孩/n.儿童/n.儿子/女儿<,>The child was playing with a toy car.<,>那个孩子正在玩玩具车。<,>They have three children: two boys and a girl.<,>他们有三个孩子：两个男孩和一个女孩。<,>Every child has the right to education.<,>每个儿童都有受教育的权利。<,>ch(谐音"吃")+ild(看作old)→小孩子总在吃东西<,>children(n.孩子们)/childish(adj.幼稚的)/childhood(n.童年)

education<,>/ˌedʒuˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɛdʒəˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.教育/n.训导<,>She received her education at Harvard University.<,>她在哈佛大学接受教育。<,>Physical education is an important part of school curriculum.<,>体育教育是学校课程的重要组成部分。<,>Parents play a key role in a child's education.<,>父母在孩子的教育中起着关键作用。<,>e(出)+duc(引导)+ation→引导出来→教育<,>educate(v.教育)/educational(adj.教育的)/educator(n.教育者)

stair<,>/steə(r)/<,>/stɛr/<,>n.楼梯<,>Be careful when going down the stairs.<,>下楼梯时要小心。<,>She sat on the bottom stair waiting for him.<,>她坐在最下面的楼梯上等他。<,>The old building has a spiral staircase.<,>这栋老建筑有一个螺旋楼梯。<,>st(站立)+air(空气)→站在空气中上升→楼梯<,>stare(v.凝视)/staircase(n.楼梯间)/upstairs(adv.在楼上)

ornament<,>/ˈɔːnəmənt/<,>/ˈɔrnəmənt/<,>n.装饰物/n.装饰<,>The Christmas tree was covered with shiny ornaments.<,>圣诞树上挂满了闪亮的装饰品。<,>She wore a simple dress without any ornament.<,>她穿了一件没有任何装饰的简单连衣裙。<,>The palace is famous for its architectural ornaments.<,>这座宫殿以其建筑装饰而闻名。<,>orn(装饰)+a+ment(名词后缀)→装饰物<,>adorn(v.装饰)/ornate(adj.装饰华丽的)/ornamental(adj.装饰性的)

downstairs<,>/ˌdaʊnˈsteəz/<,>/ˌdaʊnˈstɛrz/<,>adv.在楼下/adj.楼下的<,>Please wait for me downstairs.<,>请在楼下等我。<,>The downstairs neighbor complained about the noise.<,>楼下的邻居抱怨噪音。<,>She fell while running downstairs.<,>她跑下楼时摔倒了。<,>down(下)+stairs(楼梯)→在楼下<,>upstairs(adv.在楼上)/downward(adj.向下的)/downsize(v.缩小规模)

hare<,>/heə(r)/<,>/hɛr/<,>n.野兔<,>The hare ran swiftly across the field.<,>野兔飞快地跑过田野。<,>In the fable, the tortoise beats the hare in a race.<,>在寓言中，乌龟在赛跑中战胜了野兔。<,>We saw several hares during our countryside walk.<,>我们在乡间散步时看到了几只野兔。<,>hare(谐音"黑耳")→野兔有黑色的耳朵<,>hair(n.头发)/harp(n.竖琴)/harebrained(adj.轻率的)

brook<,>/brʊk/<,>/brʊk/<,>n.小河/n.溪流<,>A small brook runs through the village.<,>一条小溪流过村庄。<,>Children were playing by the brook.<,>孩子们在小溪边玩耍。<,>The sound of the brook is very soothing.<,>小溪的声音非常舒缓。<,>b(不)+rook(谐音"入坑")→不会入坑的小水流→小溪<,>book(n.书)/crook(n.弯曲部分)/brooklet(n.小溪)

procedure<,>/prəˈsiːdʒə(r)/<,>/prəˈsidʒər/<,>n.程序/n.手续/n.过程<,>Follow the correct procedure when applying for a visa.<,>申请签证时要遵循正确的程序。<,>The medical procedure took about two hours.<,>这个医疗过程大约花了两个小时。<,>We need to simplify the bureaucratic procedures.<,>我们需要简化官僚手续。<,>pro(向前)+ced(走)+ure→向前走的过程→程序<,>process(n.过程)/proceed(v.进行)/precede(v.先于)

employ<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪ/<,>/ɛmˈplɔɪ/<,>v.雇用/v.用/v.使忙于<,>The company employs over 500 people.<,>这家公司雇用了500多名员工。<,>She employed all her skills to solve the problem.<,>她运用了所有技能来解决这个问题。<,>He was employed in writing his novel.<,>他正忙于写小说。<,>em(进入)+ploy(折叠)→进入折叠状态→被雇用<,>employee(n.雇员)/employer(n.雇主)/employment(n.就业)
may<,>/meɪ/<,>/meɪ/<,>modal verb.可能/modal verb.可以/modal verb.祝愿<,>You may leave now if you wish.<,>如果你愿意，现在可以离开了。<,>May you have a happy birthday!<,>祝你生日快乐！<,>It may rain later today.<,>今天晚些时候可能会下雨。<,>与"might"对比，表示可能性<,>maybe(adv. 也许)/might(modal verb. 可能)  

province<,>/ˈprɒvɪns/<,>/ˈprɑːvɪns/<,>n.省/n.领域/n.部门<,>He works in the province of education.<,>他在教育领域工作。<,>This decision is outside my province.<,>这个决定超出了我的职权范围。<,>Hunan Province is famous for its spicy food.<,>湖南省以其辣味食物闻名。<,>pro(向前)+vince(征服)→被征服的地区→省份<,>provincial(adj. 省的；偏狭的)/prince(n. 王子)  

freeze<,>/friːz/<,>/friːz/<,>v.冻结/v.结冰<,>The lake freezes in winter.<,>这个湖冬天会结冰。<,>Please freeze the meat for later use.<,>请把肉冷冻起来以备后用。<,>I froze with fear when I saw the snake.<,>看到蛇时我吓得呆住了。<,>与"free"(adj. 自由的)对比记忆<,>breeze(n. 微风)/sneeze(v. 打喷嚏)  

artistic<,>/ɑːˈtɪstɪk/<,>/ɑːrˈtɪstɪk/<,>adj.艺术的/adj.艺术家的<,>She comes from an artistic family.<,>她来自一个艺术世家。<,>I admire his artistic talent.<,>我钦佩他的艺术才能。<,>The decoration is very artistic.<,>这个装饰很有艺术性。<,>artist(艺术家)+ic(形容词后缀)<,>artificial(adj. 人造的)/autistic(adj. 自闭的)  

combination<,>/ˌkɒmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.结合/n.联合/n.混合<,>The combination of these colors is perfect.<,>这些颜色的搭配很完美。<,>A combination of factors led to his success.<,>多种因素共同促成了他的成功。<,>This lock opens with a combination of numbers.<,>这把锁需要用数字组合打开。<,>com(一起)+bine(捆绑)+ation→绑在一起→结合<,>combination lock(密码锁)/combinatorial(adj. 组合的)  

adapt<,>/əˈdæpt/<,>/əˈdæpt/<,>v.使适应/v.改编<,>It took me a while to adapt to the new environment.<,>我花了一些时间适应新环境。<,>The novel was adapted into a movie.<,>这部小说被改编成了电影。<,>Some animals can adapt to climate change.<,>有些动物能适应气候变化。<,>ad(加强)+apt(适合)→使适合<,>adept(adj. 熟练的)/adopt(v. 采用)  

ambulance<,>/ˈæmbjələns/<,>/ˈæmbjələns/<,>n.救护车<,>Call an ambulance immediately!<,>立即叫救护车！<,>The ambulance arrived within five minutes.<,>救护车五分钟内就赶到了。<,>He works as an ambulance driver.<,>他是一名救护车司机。<,>ambul(行走)+ance→行走的医院→救护车<,>ambulance chaser(专办交通案件的律师)  

burden<,>/ˈbɜːdn/<,>/ˈbɜːrdn/<,>n.担子/n.重担<,>The financial burden is too heavy for him.<,>经济负担对他来说太重了。<,>Don't burden yourself with unnecessary worries.<,>不要让自己背负不必要的忧虑。<,>She bore the burden of caring for her sick mother.<,>她承担了照顾生病母亲的重担。<,>bur(=bear 承受)+den→承受的东西→负担<,>burdensome(adj. 繁重的)/burdock(n. 牛蒡)  

innocent<,>/ˈɪnəsnt/<,>/ˈɪnəsnt/<,>adj.清白的/adj.天真的<,>He was proved innocent of the crime.<,>他被证明无罪。<,>She has an innocent smile.<,>她有着天真的笑容。<,>Don't play the innocent with me!<,>别跟我装无辜！<,>in(不)+noc(伤害)+ent→未受伤害的→无辜的<,>innocence(n. 无辜)/noxious(adj. 有害的)  

option<,>/ˈɒpʃn/<,>/ˈɑːpʃn/<,>n.选择/n.选择权<,>You have the option to accept or refuse.<,>你有接受或拒绝的选择权。<,>What are my options in this situation?<,>在这种情况下我有哪些选择？<,>The software provides various printing options.<,>这个软件提供多种打印选项。<,>opt(选择)+ion→选择<,>optional(adj. 可选择的)/adoption(n. 采用)
fee<,>/fiː/<,>/fiː/<,>n.费/n.酬金/n.赏金<,>There is an entrance fee for the museum.<,>博物馆需要门票费。<,>He received a hefty fee for his legal services.<,>他因法律服务获得了一笔丰厚的酬金。<,>The hunter offered a fee for the capture of the wolf.<,>猎人悬赏捉拿那只狼。<,>fee发音类似“费”→费用<,>free(adj.免费的)/flee(v.逃跑)  

greeting<,>/ˈɡriːtɪŋ/<,>/ˈɡriːtɪŋ/<,>n.问候/n.招呼/n.致敬<,>She gave me a warm greeting when I arrived.<,>我到达时她热情地向我问候。<,>A simple greeting can make someone's day.<,>一句简单的问候能让人开心一整天。<,>The soldiers exchanged greetings before the mission.<,>士兵们在任务前互相致敬。<,>greet(欢迎)+ing(名词后缀)→问候<,>meeting(n.会议)/greet(v.欢迎)  

sincere<,>/sɪnˈsɪə(r)/<,>/sɪnˈsɪr/<,>adj.真诚的/adj.真挚的<,>His apology sounded sincere.<,>他的道歉听起来很真诚。<,>She has a sincere desire to help others.<,>她真心实意地想帮助他人。<,>Their friendship is based on sincere trust.<,>他们的友谊建立在真挚的信任上。<,>sin(罪)+cere(谐音“舍”)→舍去虚伪→真诚的<,>insincere(adj.不真诚的)/since(conj.自从)  

steel<,>/stiːl/<,>/stiːl/<,>n.钢/n.钢铁<,>The bridge is made of steel.<,>这座桥是用钢铁建造的。<,>He has a will of steel.<,>他有钢铁般的意志。<,>Steel production is vital for the economy.<,>钢铁生产对经济至关重要。<,>steel发音类似“still”→静止如钢铁般坚固<,>steal(v.偷窃)/still(adv.仍然)  

guard<,>/ɡɑːd/<,>/ɡɑːrd/<,>v.守卫/v.看守/n.卫兵<,>The soldiers guard the palace at night.<,>士兵们夜间守卫宫殿。<,>She guarded her emotions carefully.<,>她小心翼翼地控制着自己的情绪。<,>The security guard checked our IDs.<,>保安检查了我们的身份证。<,>gu(拼音“固”)+ard(后缀)→固定保护→守卫<,>guide(n.向导)/guilt(n.内疚)  

worthy<,>/ˈwɜːði/<,>/ˈwɜːrði/<,>adj.值得尊敬的/adj.值得的<,>He is a worthy opponent.<,>他是个值得尊敬的对手。<,>This cause is worthy of support.<,>这项事业值得支持。<,>She proved herself worthy of the award.<,>她证明了自己配得上这个奖项。<,>worth(价值)+y(形容词后缀)→有价值的<,>worthless(adj.无价值的)/worry(v.担心)  

breakfast<,>/ˈbrekfəst/<,>/ˈbrekfəst/<,>n.早饭/n.早餐<,>I usually have eggs for breakfast.<,>我早餐通常吃鸡蛋。<,>Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.<,>早餐是一天中最重要的一餐。<,>They served a continental breakfast at the hotel.<,>酒店提供欧式早餐。<,>break(打破)+fast(禁食)→打破禁食→早餐<,>lunch(n.午餐)/dinner(n.晚餐)  

sympathize<,>/ˈsɪmpəθaɪz/<,>/ˈsɪmpəθaɪz/<,>v.同情/v.同感/v.共鸣<,>I sympathize with your situation.<,>我同情你的处境。<,>They sympathized with each other's struggles.<,>他们彼此对对方的困境感同身受。<,>The audience sympathized with the main character.<,>观众与主角产生了共鸣。<,>sym(共同)+path(感情)+ize(动词后缀)→有共同感情→同情<,>apologize(v.道歉)/empathize(v.共情)  

gallery<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>n.美术馆/n.画廊/n.长廊/n.走廊<,>We visited an art gallery yesterday.<,>我们昨天参观了一个美术馆。<,>The hotel has a beautiful gallery with paintings.<,>酒店有一条挂满画作的漂亮长廊。<,>She exhibited her photos in a local gallery.<,>她在当地画廊展出了自己的照片。<,>gal(女孩)+lery(谐音“廊”)→女孩喜欢的画廊<,>alley(n.小巷)/valley(n.山谷)  

notice<,>/ˈnəʊtɪs/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪs/<,>v.注意/n.注意/n.通知<,>Did you notice the change in her behavior?<,>你注意到她行为的变化了吗？<,>The notice on the wall explains the rules.<,>墙上的通知说明了规则。<,>He gave me a month's notice before leaving.<,>他离开前提前一个月通知了我。<,>not(笔记)+ice(冰)→把重要的事记在冰上引人注意<,>note(n.笔记)/notify(v.通知)
percentage<,>/pəˈsentɪdʒ/<,>/pərˈsentɪdʒ/<,>n.百分比/n.百分率<,>The percentage of students who passed the exam was 85%.<,>通过考试的学生百分比是85%。<,>What percentage of the population owns a car?<,>人口中有多少百分比拥有汽车？<,>He calculated the percentage increase in sales.<,>他计算了销售额增长的百分比。<,>per(每)+cent(百)+age(名词后缀)→每一百的比例→百分比<,>percent(n.百分之...)/percentile(n.百分位数)/proportion(n.比例)

money<,>/ˈmʌni/<,>/ˈmʌni/<,>n.货币/n.金钱/n.财富<,>He saved a lot of money by cooking at home.<,>他通过在家做饭省了很多钱。<,>Time is money.<,>时间就是金钱。<,>She inherited a large sum of money from her uncle.<,>她从叔叔那里继承了一大笔钱。<,>mon(提醒)+ey(名词后缀)→提醒人们交易的东西→金钱<,>currency(n.货币)/cash(n.现金)/wealth(n.财富)

best<,>/best/<,>/best/<,>adj.最好的/adj.最大的<,>This is the best movie I've ever seen.<,>这是我看过的最好的电影。<,>Wishing you the best of luck!<,>祝你好运！<,>He did his best to finish the project on time.<,>他尽了最大努力按时完成项目。<,>good的最高级形式→最好的<,>better(adj.较好的)/good(adj.好的)/finest(adj.最优秀的)

meet<,>/miːt/<,>/mit/<,>v.遇见<,>Let's meet at the coffee shop tomorrow.<,>我们明天在咖啡店见面吧。<,>I'd like you to meet my parents.<,>我想让你见见我的父母。<,>The two rivers meet near the city.<,>这两条河在城市附近汇合。<,>m(见面)+eet(眼睛对视)→遇见<,>meat(n.肉)/mete(v.分配)/melt(v.融化)

crown<,>/kraʊn/<,>/kraʊn/<,>n.王冠/n.冕/n.花冠<,>The queen wore a golden crown at the ceremony.<,>女王在仪式上戴了一顶金王冠。<,>He won the crown in the chess tournament.<,>他在象棋比赛中赢得了冠军。<,>Flowers formed a natural crown on her head.<,>鲜花在她头上形成了一个自然的花冠。<,>cr(弯曲)+own(拥有)→弯曲的拥有物→王冠<,>clown(n.小丑)/crow(n.乌鸦)/grown(adj.长大的)

beginning<,>/bɪˈɡɪnɪŋ/<,>/bɪˈɡɪnɪŋ/<,>n.开始/n.开端/n.起源<,>This is just the beginning of our journey.<,>这只是我们旅程的开始。<,>At the beginning of the book, there's an interesting prologue.<,>书的开头有一个有趣的序言。<,>The beginning of spring is my favorite time of year.<,>春天的开始是我一年中最喜欢的时间。<,>begin(开始)+ning(名词后缀)→开始<,>ending(n.结尾)/origin(n.起源)/commencement(n.开始)

mathematical<,>/ˌmæθəˈmætɪkəl/<,>/ˌmæθəˈmætɪkəl/<,>adj.数学的/adj.数学上的<,>He has a great mathematical mind.<,>他有很强的数学头脑。<,>This problem requires mathematical precision.<,>这个问题需要数学上的精确性。<,>She enjoys solving mathematical puzzles.<,>她喜欢解数学谜题。<,>mathe(学习)+matic(与...相关的)+al(形容词后缀)→与学习相关的→数学的<,>arithmetic(n.算术)/geometry(n.几何)/algebra(n.代数)

juice<,>/dʒuːs/<,>/dʒus/<,>n.汁/n.液<,>I'd like a glass of orange juice, please.<,>请给我一杯橙汁。<,>She squeezed the juice from the lemons.<,>她把柠檬汁挤出来。<,>This meat needs more juice to stay moist.<,>这块肉需要更多汁液保持湿润。<,>ju(发音似"汁")+ice(冰)→冰镇果汁→汁液<,>sauce(n.酱汁)/syrup(n.糖浆)/nectar(n.花蜜)

meadow<,>/ˈmedəʊ/<,>/ˈmedoʊ/<,>n.草地/n.牧草地<,>Cows were grazing in the meadow.<,>奶牛在草地上吃草。<,>We had a picnic in the sunny meadow.<,>我们在阳光明媚的草地上野餐。<,>Wildflowers covered the meadow in spring.<,>春天野花覆盖了草地。<,>mea(发音似"美")+dow(发音似"草")→美丽的草地→草地<,>lawn(n.草坪)/pasture(n.牧场)/grassland(n.草原)

district<,>/ˈdɪstrɪkt/<,>/ˈdɪstrɪkt/<,>n.地区/n.区域/n.区<,>This is the business district of the city.<,>这是城市的商业区。<,>She represents the 5th district in Congress.<,>她在国会中代表第五选区。<,>The school district announced new policies.<,>学区宣布了新政策。<,>di(分开)+strict(严格的)→严格划分的区域→地区<,>region(n.地区)/zone(n.地带)/area(n.区域)
fish<,>/fɪʃ/<,>/fɪʃ/<,>n.鱼/n.鱼肉/v.钓鱼<,>I caught a big fish yesterday.<,>我昨天钓到了一条大鱼。<,>She doesn't eat fish on Fridays.<,>她周五不吃鱼。<,>He loves to fish in the lake.<,>他喜欢在湖里钓鱼。<,>f(像鱼钩)+ish(像鱼尾)→鱼<,>dish(n.盘子)/wish(v.希望)/fin(n.鱼鳍)

incorrect<,>/ˌɪnkəˈrekt/<,>/ˌɪnkəˈrɛkt/<,>adj.不正确的/adj.错误的<,>Your answer is incorrect.<,>你的答案是错误的。<,>He gave incorrect directions.<,>他指了错误的方向。<,>The report contains incorrect information.<,>这份报告包含不准确的信息。<,>in(不)+correct(正确)→不正确<,>correct(adj.正确的)/inaccurate(adj.不精确的)/indirect(adj.间接的)

lose<,>/luːz/<,>/luz/<,>v.失去/v.迷失/v.输掉<,>Don't lose your keys.<,>别把你的钥匙弄丢了。<,>I always lose my way in this city.<,>我在这座城市总是迷路。<,>Our team lost the game.<,>我们队输掉了比赛。<,>lo(谐音"落")+se(谐音"失")→丢失<,>loose(adj.松的)/loss(n.损失)/lost(adj.迷路的)

man<,>/mæn/<,>/mæn/<,>n.男人/n.人/n.人类<,>That man is my teacher.<,>那个男人是我的老师。<,>Man has explored the moon.<,>人类已经探索过月球。<,>Every man has his faults.<,>人无完人。<,>ma(拼音"妈")+n(拼音"男")→男人<,>men(n.男人复数)/woman(n.女人)/human(n.人类)

mere<,>/mɪə(r)/<,>/mɪr/<,>adj.仅仅的/adj.纯粹的<,>It's a mere coincidence.<,>这仅仅是个巧合。<,>She's a mere child.<,>她只是个孩子。<,>The mere thought of it makes me happy.<,>光是想到这个就让我开心。<,>me(我)+re(拼音"热")→仅仅是我热→纯粹的<,>merely(adv.仅仅)/merge(v.合并)/merit(n.优点)

bell<,>/bel/<,>/bɛl/<,>n.钟/n.铃/n.门铃/n.钟声<,>The school bell rings at 8.<,>学校钟声8点响起。<,>Please ring the door bell.<,>请按门铃。<,>The church bells are beautiful.<,>教堂的钟声很美。<,>be(是)+ll(像钟的形状)→钟<,>ball(n.球)/bill(n.账单)/belle(n.美女)

mean<,>/miːn/<,>/min/<,>v.作...解释/v.意指<,>What does this word mean?<,>这个词是什么意思？<,>I mean what I say.<,>我说话算话。<,>The red light means stop.<,>红灯意味着停止。<,>me(我)+an(一个)→我一个意思→意指<,>means(n.手段)/meaning(n.意义)/meant(v.mean的过去式)

surrender<,>/səˈrendə(r)/<,>/səˈrɛndər/<,>v.交出/v.投降<,>The army was forced to surrender.<,>军队被迫投降。<,>He surrendered his passport.<,>他交出了护照。<,>Never surrender your dreams.<,>永远不要放弃你的梦想。<,>sur(上)+render(给予)→向上给予→投降<,>render(v.提供)/surreptitious(adj.秘密的)/surround(v.包围)

complicate<,>/ˈkɒmplɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪkeɪt/<,>v.使复杂/v.使陷入<,>Don't complicate the problem.<,>别把问题复杂化。<,>The situation is complicated.<,>情况很复杂。<,>His explanation only complicated matters.<,>他的解释只会让事情更复杂。<,>com(共同)+plic(折叠)+ate→一起折叠→使复杂<,>complex(adj.复杂的)/complication(n.并发症)/duplicate(v.复制)

English<,>/ˈɪŋɡlɪʃ/<,>/ˈɪŋɡlɪʃ/<,>n.英语/adj.英国人的<,>She speaks perfect English.<,>她说一口流利的英语。<,>English breakfast is famous.<,>英式早餐很有名。<,>I'm studying English literature.<,>我正在学习英国文学。<,>Eng(拼音"英")+lish(拼音"历史")→英国历史→英语<,>England(n.英格兰)/Englishman(n.英国人)/Anglo(前缀表示英国的)
gardener<,>/ˈɡɑːdnə(r)/<,>/ˈɡɑːrdnər/<,>n.园丁/n.花匠<,>The gardener is planting flowers in the garden.<,>园丁正在花园里种花。<,>My grandfather was a skilled gardener.<,>我的祖父是一位技艺娴熟的园丁。<,>She hired a gardener to maintain her backyard.<,>她雇了一位园丁来打理她的后院。<,>garden(花园)+er(人)→花园里的人→园丁<,>guardian(n.监护人)/gardening(n.园艺)

call<,>/kɔːl/<,>/kɔl/<,>v.把...叫做/v.叫/v.喊<,>Please call me when you arrive.<,>你到了请给我打电话。<,>They call this place "Paradise".<,>他们称这个地方为"天堂"。<,>She called for help when she saw the accident.<,>看到事故时她大声呼救。<,>c(see看见)+all(全部)→叫大家都看见<,>cell(n.细胞)/calm(adj.平静的)/coal(n.煤)

pleasant<,>/ˈpleznt/<,>/ˈplɛzənt/<,>adj.令人愉快的/adj.舒适的<,>We had a pleasant conversation yesterday.<,>昨天我们进行了愉快的交谈。<,>The weather is quite pleasant today.<,>今天天气相当宜人。<,>She has a very pleasant personality.<,>她的性格非常讨人喜欢。<,>please(使高兴)+ant(形容词后缀)→令人愉快的<,>present(n.礼物/adj.现在的)/peasant(n.农民)

conversion<,>/kənˈvɜːʃn/<,>/kənˈvɜːrʒn/<,>n.转变/n.转化/n.改变<,>The conversion of the old factory into apartments is complete.<,>旧工厂改造成公寓的工作已完成。<,>Religious conversion is a deeply personal experience.<,>宗教信仰转变是一种深刻的个人体验。<,>They are studying the conversion of energy in the system.<,>他们正在研究系统中能量的转换。<,>con(共同)+vers(转)+ion(名词后缀)→共同转变→转化<,>conversation(n.谈话)/version(n.版本)

adopt<,>/əˈdɒpt/<,>/əˈdɑːpt/<,>v.收养/v.采用/v.采取<,>They decided to adopt a child from overseas.<,>他们决定从海外收养一个孩子。<,>The company will adopt new technologies next year.<,>公司明年将采用新技术。<,>We need to adopt a different approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要采取不同的方法来解决这个问题。<,>ad(加强)+opt(选择)→选择收养或采用<,>adapt(v.适应)/adept(adj.熟练的)

master<,>/ˈmɑːstə(r)/<,>/ˈmæstər/<,>n.能手/n.主人/n.硕士<,>He is a master of chess.<,>他是国际象棋大师。<,>The dog obeyed its master's commands.<,>狗服从主人的命令。<,>She is pursuing a master's degree in psychology.<,>她正在攻读心理学硕士学位。<,>mast(桅杆)+er(人)→站在桅杆上的人→主人<,>mister(n.先生)/muster(v.召集)

pipe<,>/paɪp/<,>/paɪp/<,>n.管子/n.导管/n.烟斗<,>The plumber fixed the leaking pipe.<,>水管工修好了漏水的管子。<,>He enjoys smoking a pipe in the evening.<,>他喜欢在晚上抽烟斗。<,>Water flows through the pipes to every apartment.<,>水通过管道流向每个公寓。<,>pi(拼音"排")+pe(拼音"排")→排排的管子<,>pope(n.教皇)/pine(n.松树)

recover<,>/rɪˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkʌvər/<,>v.重新获得/v.挽回<,>It took him months to recover from the illness.<,>他花了几个月时间才从疾病中恢复。<,>The police recovered the stolen jewelry.<,>警方找回了被盗的珠宝。<,>She is trying to recover her lost confidence.<,>她正试图重拾失去的信心。<,>re(重新)+cover(覆盖)→重新覆盖→恢复<,>discover(v.发现)/uncover(v.揭露)

communicate<,>/kəˈmjuːnɪkeɪt/<,>/kəˈmjuːnɪkeɪt/<,>v.通讯/v.传达<,>We communicate via email every day.<,>我们每天通过电子邮件交流。<,>Good leaders know how to communicate effectively.<,>优秀的领导者知道如何有效沟通。<,>Dolphins communicate through sounds and gestures.<,>海豚通过声音和动作交流。<,>com(共同)+muni(公共)+cate(动词后缀)→共同公共化→交流<,>commute(v.通勤)/community(n.社区)

bike<,>/baɪk/<,>/baɪk/<,>n.自行车/v.骑自行车<,>I ride my bike to work every morning.<,>我每天早上骑自行车上班。<,>She bought a new mountain bike last week.<,>她上周买了一辆新的山地自行车。<,>Let's bike to the park this weekend.<,>这个周末我们骑车去公园吧。<,>bi(二)+ke(拼音"轲")→两个轲→自行车<,>hike(v.徒步旅行)/like(v.喜欢)
classify<,>/ˈklæsɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈklæsəˌfaɪ/<,>v.把…分类<,>Scientists classify animals into different groups based on their characteristics.<,>科学家根据动物的特征将它们分类。<,>The librarian will classify the new books by subject.<,>图书管理员将按主题对新书进行分类。<,>We need to classify these documents before filing them.<,>我们需要在归档前对这些文件进行分类。<,>class(类别)+ify(使…化)→使分类<,>clarify(v.澄清)/specify(v.指定)  

trumpet<,>/ˈtrʌmpɪt/<,>/ˈtrʌmpət/<,>n.喇叭/n.小号<,>He played a beautiful melody on his trumpet.<,>他用小号演奏了一首优美的旋律。<,>The sound of the trumpet echoed through the valley.<,>喇叭声在山谷中回荡。<,>She took trumpet lessons every Saturday.<,>她每周六都上小号课。<,>trump(王牌)+et(小)→像王牌一样响亮的小乐器<,>trombone(n.长号)/cornet(n.短号)  

canoe<,>/kəˈnuː/<,>/kəˈnu/<,>n.独木舟/n.皮艇/n.划子<,>We paddled our canoe across the lake.<,>我们划着独木舟穿过湖泊。<,>The native people used canoes for fishing and transportation.<,>当地人用独木舟捕鱼和运输。<,>They capsized their canoe in the rapids.<,>他们的独木舟在急流中翻了。<,>can(能)+o(圈)+e→能浮在水面的圆形物<,>kayak(n.皮划艇)/rowboat(n.划艇)  

entertain<,>/ˌentəˈteɪn/<,>/ˌɛntərˈteɪn/<,>v.使欢乐/v.招待<,>The clown entertained the children with funny tricks.<,>小丑用滑稽的把戏逗乐孩子们。<,>We'll entertain our guests with a home-cooked meal.<,>我们将用家常菜招待客人。<,>She entertained the idea of moving abroad.<,>她考虑过移居国外的想法。<,>enter(进入)+tain(保持)→把快乐保持在心中<,>retain(v.保留)/contain(v.包含)  

campaign<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>n.运动/n.战役<,>The presidential campaign lasted for months.<,>总统竞选活动持续了数月。<,>The army launched a new campaign against the rebels.<,>军队对叛军发动了新战役。<,>She's leading a campaign to clean up the beaches.<,>她正在领导一场清理海滩的运动。<,>camp(营地)+aign→在营地进行的活动<,>champagne(n.香槟)/companion(n.同伴)  

abandon<,>/əˈbændən/<,>/əˈbændən/<,>v.丢弃/v.放弃/v.抛弃<,>They had to abandon the sinking ship.<,>他们不得不放弃正在下沉的船。<,>She abandoned her studies to pursue her dream.<,>她放弃了学业去追求梦想。<,>The abandoned puppy looked very sad.<,>被遗弃的小狗看起来很伤心。<,>a(不)+band(绑)+on→不再绑住→放弃<,>abundant(adj.丰富的)/bandon(虚构词)  

lorry<,>/ˈlɒri/<,>/ˈlɔːri/<,>n.运货汽车/n.卡车<,>The lorry was carrying a heavy load of bricks.<,>卡车上载着沉重的砖块。<,>There was a long queue of lorries at the border.<,>边境排着长长的卡车队伍。<,>My uncle drives a lorry for a living.<,>我叔叔以开卡车为生。<,>lor(看)+ry→看起来很庞大的车<,>lorry(英式)/truck(美式)  

congress<,>/ˈkɒŋɡres/<,>/ˈkɑːŋɡrəs/<,>n.大会/n.国会/n.议会<,>The annual congress will be held in June.<,>年度大会将在六月举行。<,>Congress passed the new law after much debate.<,>经过多次辩论后国会通过了新法律。<,>Scientists from all over the world attended the medical congress.<,>来自世界各地的科学家参加了医学大会。<,>con(共同)+gress(走)→走到一起开会<,>progress(n.进步)/aggress(v.侵略)  

double<,>/ˈdʌbl/<,>/ˈdʌbəl/<,>adj.双的/adj.两倍的<,>She ordered a double espresso.<,>她点了一杯双份浓缩咖啡。<,>The room has double windows for insulation.<,>这个房间有双层窗户用于隔热。<,>His salary is double what I earn.<,>他的薪水是我收入的两倍。<,>dou(二)+ble→双的<,>trouble(n.麻烦)/bubble(n.泡沫)  

confident<,>/ˈkɒnfɪdənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnfɪdənt/<,>adj.确信的/adj.自信的<,>She sounded very confident during the interview.<,>她在面试中表现得非常自信。<,>I'm confident that we'll succeed.<,>我确信我们会成功。<,>His confident manner impressed everyone.<,>他自信的态度给大家留下了深刻印象。<,>con(完全)+fid(信任)+ent→完全信任的<,>confidant(n.知己)/confidential(adj.机密的)
extreme<,>/ɪkˈstriːm/<,>/ɪkˈstrim/<,>adj.极度的/adj.尽头的<,>The weather conditions were extreme during the expedition.<,>探险期间的天气条件非常极端。<,>They live in the extreme north of the country.<,>他们住在国家的最北端。<,>His extreme views often cause controversy.<,>他的极端观点经常引起争议。<,>ex(超出)+treme(边界)→超出边界→极度的<,>supreme(adj.最高的/n.至高)/extend(v.延伸/v.扩大)/extremity(n.末端/n.极端)

frequency<,>/ˈfriːkwənsi/<,>/ˈfrikwənsi/<,>n.屡次/n.次数/n.频率<,>The frequency of earthquakes in this region is alarming.<,>这个地区地震的频率令人担忧。<,>He visits his parents with increasing frequency.<,>他越来越频繁地看望父母。<,>The radio station broadcasts on a frequency of 98.5 MHz.<,>这个电台以98.5兆赫的频率广播。<,>frequ(频繁)+ency(状态)→频繁状态→频率<,>sequence(n.顺序/n.序列)/consequence(n.结果/n.重要性)/frequent(adj.频繁的/v.常去)

confess<,>/kənˈfes/<,>/kənˈfɛs/<,>v.供认/v.承认/v.坦白<,>He finally confessed to stealing the money.<,>他终于承认偷了钱。<,>I must confess that I don't like this movie.<,>我必须承认我不喜欢这部电影。<,>She confessed her feelings to him.<,>她向他坦白了自己的感情。<,>con(完全)+fess(说)→完全说出来→坦白<,>profess(v.声称/v.宣称)/confine(v.限制/n.界限)/confuse(v.混淆/v.使困惑)

lodge<,>/lɒdʒ/<,>/lɑːdʒ/<,>v.暂住/v.借宿/v.投宿<,>We lodged at a small inn for the night.<,>我们在一家小旅馆过夜。<,>He lodged a complaint with the manager.<,>他向经理提出了投诉。<,>Snow lodged in the branches of the trees.<,>雪堆积在树枝上。<,>谐音"落脚"→临时落脚→暂住<,>lode(n.矿脉/n.水路)/ledge(n.壁架/n.暗礁)/lodger(n.房客/n.寄宿者)

apartment<,>/əˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/əˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.一套公寓房间<,>She rents a small apartment downtown.<,>她在市中心租了一套小公寓。<,>The apartment has a beautiful view of the park.<,>这套公寓可以俯瞰公园的美景。<,>They're looking for a two-bedroom apartment.<,>他们正在寻找一套两居室的公寓。<,>apart(分开)+ment(名词后缀)→分成独立单元→公寓<,>department(n.部门/n.系)/compartment(n.隔间/n.车厢)/apparent(adj.明显的/adj.表面上的)

elevator<,>/ˈelɪveɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈɛləˌveɪtər/<,>n.电梯/n.升降机<,>Take the elevator to the 10th floor.<,>乘电梯到10楼。<,>The grain elevator stores thousands of tons of wheat.<,>这个谷物升降机储存着数千吨小麦。<,>The elevator was out of order, so we had to use the stairs.<,>电梯坏了，我们只好走楼梯。<,>elevate(提升)+or(工具)→提升的工具→电梯<,>escalator(n.自动扶梯)/levitate(v.飘浮/v.升起)/elevation(n.海拔/n.提升)

kilogram<,>/ˈkɪləɡræm/<,>/ˈkɪləˌɡræm/<,>n.千克/n.公斤<,>This package weighs about five kilograms.<,>这个包裹重约五公斤。<,>The baby weighed 3.5 kilograms at birth.<,>这个婴儿出生时体重3.5公斤。<,>Flour is sold by the kilogram in this store.<,>这家商店的面粉是按公斤出售的。<,>kilo(千)+gram(克)→一千克→公斤<,>kilometer(n.千米)/kilowatt(n.千瓦)/grammar(n.语法/n.文法)

industrial<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəl/<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəl/<,>adj.工业的/adj.产业的<,>This city was once an industrial center.<,>这座城市曾经是工业中心。<,>The industrial revolution changed the world.<,>工业革命改变了世界。<,>They are studying industrial design at university.<,>他们在大学学习工业设计。<,>industry(工业)+al(形容词后缀)→工业的<,>industrious(adj.勤奋的)/industry(n.工业/n.产业)/industrialize(v.工业化)

explosive<,>/ɪkˈspləʊsɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsploʊsɪv/<,>n.炸药/adj.会爆炸的<,>The police found explosives in the suspect's car.<,>警方在嫌疑人的车里发现了炸药。<,>The situation was politically explosive.<,>这个情况在政治上非常敏感。<,>He has an explosive temper.<,>他脾气暴躁。<,>ex(出)+plos(爆炸)+ive(性质)→会爆炸的<,>explode(v.爆炸/v.爆发)/implosive(adj.内爆的)/explosion(n.爆炸/n.爆发)

challenge<,>/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/<,>/ˈtʃæləndʒ/<,>n.挑战<,>This job presents many new challenges.<,>这份工作带来了许多新的挑战。<,>He challenged me to a game of chess.<,>他向我挑战下国际象棋。<,>The mountain climb was a real challenge.<,>这次登山是一次真正的挑战。<,>谐音"挑战"→直接对应中文意思<,>change(n.变化/v.改变)/champion(n.冠军/v.支持)/chancel(n.圣坛/n.高坛)
swear<,>/sweə(r)/<,>/swer/<,>v.宣誓/v.诅咒<,>He had to swear an oath of loyalty.<,>他必须宣誓效忠。<,>Don't swear in front of the children.<,>别在孩子面前说脏话。<,>She swore she would never speak to him again.<,>她发誓再也不和他说话了。<,>s(死)+wear(穿)→穿丧服发誓→宣誓<,>sweat(v.出汗/n.汗水)/swear(v.宣誓/v.诅咒)

departure<,>/dɪˈpɑːtʃə(r)/<,>/dɪˈpɑːrtʃər/<,>n.离开/n.出发/n.起程<,>What's the departure time of your flight?<,>你的航班什么时候起飞？<,>His sudden departure surprised everyone.<,>他的突然离开让大家都很惊讶。<,>The train's departure was delayed by an hour.<,>火车出发时间延迟了一小时。<,>de(离开)+part(部分)+ure(状态)→离开的状态→离开<,>department(n.部门)/depart(v.离开)/parture(错误拼写)

elastic<,>/ɪˈlæstɪk/<,>/ɪˈlæstɪk/<,>n.松紧带/adj.有弹性的<,>She tied her hair with an elastic.<,>她用橡皮筋扎头发。<,>Rubber is an elastic material.<,>橡胶是一种有弹性的材料。<,>The rules are not elastic and cannot be changed.<,>这些规则没有弹性，不能更改。<,>e(出)+last(持续)+ic(形容词后缀)→能持续拉伸的→有弹性的<,>plastic(n.塑料)/elastic(n.松紧带)/fantastic(adj.极好的)

break<,>/breɪk/<,>/breɪk/<,>v.打破/v.损坏/v.破坏<,>Be careful not to break the glass.<,>小心别打碎玻璃。<,>The news broke his heart.<,>这个消息让他心碎。<,>Let's take a short break.<,>我们休息一会儿吧。<,>b(不)+reak(发音同"wreck"破坏)→破坏<,>brake(n.刹车)/break(v.打破)/brick(n.砖块)

capital<,>/ˈkæpɪtl/<,>/ˈkæpɪtl/<,>n.首都/n.资本/n.资金<,>Beijing is the capital of China.<,>北京是中国的首都。<,>We need more capital to start the business.<,>我们需要更多资金来开展业务。<,>Write your name in capital letters.<,>用大写字母写你的名字。<,>cap(头)+ital(形容词后缀)→首脑所在→首都<,>capitol(n.国会大厦)/capital(n.首都)/captain(n.船长)

adequate<,>/ˈædɪkwət/<,>/ˈædɪkwət/<,>adj.足够的/adj.可以胜任的<,>The food was adequate for ten people.<,>这些食物足够十个人吃。<,>Her English is adequate for the job.<,>她的英语足以胜任这份工作。<,>They didn't have adequate time to prepare.<,>他们没有足够的时间准备。<,>ad(加强)+equ(平等)+ate(形容词后缀)→达到平等标准的→足够的<,>adequate(adj.足够的)/equate(v.等同)/inadequate(adj.不足的)

progress<,>/ˈprəʊɡres/<,>/ˈprɑːɡres/<,>n.前进/n.进展/n.进步<,>She's making good progress in her studies.<,>她在学习上取得了很大进步。<,>The project is now in progress.<,>这个项目正在进行中。<,>Technological progress has changed our lives.<,>技术进步改变了我们的生活。<,>pro(向前)+gress(走)→向前走→进步<,>progress(n.进步)/process(n.过程)/congress(n.国会)

paste<,>/peɪst/<,>/peɪst/<,>n.糊/n.酱/n.糨糊<,>She spread tomato paste on the bread.<,>她在面包上涂了番茄酱。<,>Use glue paste to stick the paper.<,>用胶水粘贴纸张。<,>Toothpaste helps keep your teeth clean.<,>牙膏有助于保持牙齿清洁。<,>past(过去)+e→过去常用的粘合剂→糨糊<,>paste(n.糨糊)/taste(v.品尝)/waste(n.浪费)

relevant<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>adj.有关的/adj.贴切的<,>Please provide relevant documents.<,>请提供相关文件。<,>His comments were not relevant to the topic.<,>他的评论与主题无关。<,>This experience is highly relevant to the job.<,>这个经验与工作高度相关。<,>re(再)+lev(举)+ant(形容词后缀)→再次举起的→有关的<,>relevant(adj.相关的)/irrelevant(adj.不相关的)/elevate(v.提升)

exam<,>/ɪɡˈzæm/<,>/ɪɡˈzæm/<,>n.考试/n.检查/n.细查<,>I have a math exam tomorrow.<,>我明天有数学考试。<,>The doctor will perform a physical exam.<,>医生将进行体检。<,>The customs officer examined my luggage carefully.<,>海关官员仔细检查了我的行李。<,>ex(出)+am(拿)→拿出知识来→考试<,>exam(n.考试)/example(n.例子)/examine(v.检查)
conservative<,>/kənˈsɜːvətɪv/<,>/kənˈsɜːrvətɪv/<,>adj.保守的/n.保守的人<,>He holds very conservative views on education.<,>他对教育持非常保守的观点。<,>The party is divided into liberal and conservative factions.<,>该党分为自由派和保守派。<,>She dressed in a conservative style for the interview.<,>她面试时穿着保守。<,>con(共同)+serv(保持)+ative→共同保持→保守的<,>preservative(n.防腐剂/adj.防腐的)/reserve(v.保留/n.储备)  

inhabit<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪt/<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪt/<,>v.居住于/v.栖息于<,>Various birds inhabit the forest.<,>各种鸟类栖息在这片森林里。<,>The island is mainly inhabited by fishermen.<,>这个岛主要居住着渔民。<,>These caves were once inhabited by ancient tribes.<,>这些洞穴曾居住着古代部落。<,>in(进入)+habit(居住)→住在里面→栖息<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/inhibit(v.抑制/v.禁止)  

ministry<,>/ˈmɪnɪstri/<,>/ˈmɪnɪstri/<,>n.（政府的）部<,>He works at the Ministry of Defense.<,>他在国防部工作。<,>The Ministry of Education issued new guidelines.<,>教育部发布了新指南。<,>She was appointed to the Ministry of Health.<,>她被任命到卫生部任职。<,>mini(小)+stry→管理小范围事务的部门→部<,>minister(n.部长/v.伺候)/administer(v.管理/v.执行)  

stem<,>/stem/<,>/stem/<,>n.茎/n.（树）干/v.起源<,>Cut the stem of the flower at an angle.<,>斜着剪断花茎。<,>The problem stems from poor communication.<,>这个问题源于沟通不畅。<,>Maple syrup comes from the sap of the tree stem.<,>枫糖浆来自树干的汁液。<,>ste(站立)+m→植物站立的部分→茎干<,>steam(n.蒸汽/v.蒸)/stamp(n.邮票/v.跺脚)  

margin<,>/ˈmɑːdʒɪn/<,>/ˈmɑːrdʒɪn/<,>n.页边的空白/n.边缘/n.边缘<,>Write your notes in the margin of the book.<,>把你的笔记写在书的页边空白处。<,>They won by a narrow margin.<,>他们以微弱优势获胜。<,>The house stands on the margin of the lake.<,>房子坐落在湖边。<,>marg(标记)+in→标记的区域→边缘<,>marine(adj.海洋的/n.舰队)/marginal(adj.边缘的/adj.微小的)  

core<,>/kɔː(r)/<,>/kɔːr/<,>n.果实的心/n.核心<,>Remove the core before eating the apple.<,>吃苹果前去掉果核。<,>This is the core issue we need to address.<,>这是我们需要解决的核心问题。<,>The Earth's core is extremely hot.<,>地核非常热。<,>cor(心)+e→中心部分→核心<,>corn(n.玉米)/cord(n.绳索)/corps(n.军团)  

correspondent<,>/ˌkɒrəˈspɒndənt/<,>/ˌkɔːrəˈspɑːndənt/<,>n.通讯员/n.通信者<,>He works as a foreign correspondent for CNN.<,>他是CNN的驻外记者。<,>They have been regular correspondents for years.<,>他们多年来一直保持通信。<,>The newspaper sent a correspondent to cover the event.<,>报社派记者去报道这个事件。<,>cor(共同)+respond(回应)+ent→互相回应的人→通信者<,>respondent(n.应答者)/corresponding(adj.相应的)  

possibly<,>/ˈpɒsəbli/<,>/ˈpɑːsəbli/<,>adv.可能地/adv.也许<,>Could you possibly help me with this?<,>你能帮我这个忙吗？<,>It may possibly rain tomorrow.<,>明天可能会下雨。<,>She is possibly the best candidate for the job.<,>她可能是这个职位的最佳人选。<,>poss(能力)+ibly→有能力地→可能地<,>possible(adj.可能的)/impossibly(adv.不可能地)  

roll<,>/rəʊl/<,>/roʊl/<,>v.滚动/v.转动<,>The ball rolled down the hill.<,>球滚下了山坡。<,>She rolled the dough flat.<,>她把面团擀平。<,>Tears rolled down her cheeks.<,>泪水顺着她的脸颊滚落。<,>rol(轮子)+l→像轮子一样运动→滚动<,>role(n.角色)/poll(n.投票/v.获得选票)  

repair<,>/rɪˈpeə(r)/<,>/rɪˈper/<,>v.修理/n.修理/v.修补/n.修补<,>He repaired the broken window.<,>他修理了破碎的窗户。<,>The car is in the garage for repairs.<,>汽车在修理厂维修。<,>She repaired the torn dress skillfully.<,>她熟练地修补了撕破的裙子。<,>re(重新)+pair(准备)→重新准备好→修理<,>prepare(v.准备)/repairman(n.修理工)
moral<,>/ˈmɒrəl/<,>/ˈmɔːrəl/<,>adj.道德的/adj.合乎道德的<,>He made a moral decision to return the lost wallet.<,>他做出了道德的决定，归还了丢失的钱包。<,>The story teaches a moral lesson about honesty.<,>这个故事教会了关于诚实的道德课。<,>She is known for her strong moral principles.<,>她以强烈的道德原则而闻名。<,>mor(习俗)+al(形容词后缀)→符合习俗的→道德的<,>morale(n.士气)/morality(n.道德)/immoral(adj.不道德的)

broken<,>/ˈbrəʊkən/<,>/ˈbroʊkən/<,>adj.被打碎的/adj.骨折的<,>Be careful with the broken glass on the floor.<,>小心地上的碎玻璃。<,>He suffered a broken leg in the accident.<,>他在事故中腿部骨折。<,>The toy was broken beyond repair.<,>这个玩具坏得无法修理了。<,>break(打破)+en(过去分词)→被打碎的<,>break(v.打破)/brake(n.刹车)/broke(adj.破产的)

steer<,>/stɪə(r)/<,>/stɪr/<,>v.驾驶<,>He learned how to steer a boat at summer camp.<,>他在夏令营学会了如何驾驶船只。<,>She carefully steered the car through the narrow alley.<,>她小心地驾驶汽车穿过狭窄的小巷。<,>The captain steered the ship away from the storm.<,>船长驾驶船只远离风暴。<,>st(站立)+eer(人)→站立驾驶的人→驾驶<,>steel(n.钢铁)/stereo(n.立体声)/stern(adj.严厉的)

wax<,>/wæks/<,>/wæks/<,>n.蜡/n.蜂蜡<,>She used wax to seal the envelope.<,>她用蜡封住了信封。<,>The candle is made of beeswax.<,>这支蜡烛是用蜂蜡制成的。<,>He applied wax to the wooden table for protection.<,>他给木桌打蜡以作保护。<,>w(形状像波浪)+ax(斧头)→斧头砍波浪状的蜡<,>wane(v.减弱)/wan(adj.苍白的)/wax(v.增大)

centimetre<,>/ˈsentɪmiːtə(r)/<,>/ˈsɛntəˌmitər/<,>n.公分/n.厘米<,>The ruler is 30 centimetres long.<,>这把尺子有30厘米长。<,>She grew two centimetres taller this year.<,>她今年长高了两厘米。<,>The gap must be less than one centimetre.<,>缝隙必须小于一厘米。<,>centi(百分之一)+metre(米)→百分之一米→厘米<,>millimeter(n.毫米)/kilometer(n.千米)/century(n.世纪)

gaseous<,>/ˈɡæsiəs/<,>/ˈɡæsiəs/<,>adj.气体的/adj.气态的<,>Water becomes gaseous at 100°C.<,>水在100摄氏度时变成气态。<,>The laboratory studies gaseous reactions.<,>这个实验室研究气体反应。<,>Jupiter is mainly composed of gaseous elements.<,>木星主要由气态元素组成。<,>gas(气体)+eous(形容词后缀)→气体的<,>gas(n.气体)/liquid(adj.液态的)/solid(adj.固体的)

equal<,>/ˈiːkwəl/<,>/ˈikwəl/<,>adj.相等的/adj.平等的<,>All men are created equal.<,>人人生而平等。<,>Divide the cake into equal parts.<,>把蛋糕分成相等的几份。<,>They have equal rights in this matter.<,>他们在这件事上有平等的权利。<,>equ(平等)+al(形容词后缀)→平等的<,>equate(v.等同)/equality(n.平等)/inequality(n.不平等)

lecture<,>/ˈlektʃə(r)/<,>/ˈlɛktʃər/<,>n.演讲/n.讲课/v.演讲/v.讲课<,>The professor gave a lecture on quantum physics.<,>教授做了一个关于量子物理的演讲。<,>She lectures at the university twice a week.<,>她每周在大学讲课两次。<,>I attended an interesting lecture about ancient history.<,>我参加了一个关于古代历史的有趣讲座。<,>lect(读)+ure(名词后缀)→读出来的内容→演讲<,>lecturer(n.讲师)/lectern(n.讲台)/legacy(n.遗产)

recommendation<,>/ˌrekəmenˈdeɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛkəmənˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.推荐/n.介绍/n.劝告<,>I got the job based on my teacher's recommendation.<,>我得到了这份工作是基于老师的推荐。<,>Do you have any restaurant recommendations?<,>你有什么餐厅推荐吗？<,>The doctor's recommendation was to rest for a week.<,>医生的建议是休息一周。<,>re(再次)+commend(称赞)+ation(名词后缀)→再次称赞→推荐<,>commend(v.称赞)/recommend(v.推荐)/command(v.命令)

bleed<,>/bliːd/<,>/blid/<,>v.出血/v.流血<,>His nose started to bleed after the accident.<,>事故后他的鼻子开始流血。<,>The wound is still bleeding slightly.<,>伤口还在轻微出血。<,>She nearly fainted when she saw the blood bleeding.<,>看到流血她差点晕倒。<,>b(不)+leed(lead领导)→不受领导控制→流血<,>breed(v.繁殖)/bleak(adj.荒凉的)/blend(v.混合)
kid<,>/kɪd/<,>/kɪd/<,>n.小孩/n.儿童/n.少年<,>The kid is playing in the park.<,>那个小孩正在公园里玩耍。<,>She has two kids, a boy and a girl.<,>她有两个孩子，一个男孩和一个女孩。<,>He was just a kid when he started acting.<,>他开始演戏时还是个少年。<,>联想：kind(善良的) + id(身份证)→善良的小孩<,>kitten(n.小猫)/kind(n.种类/adj.善良的)  

become<,>/bɪˈkʌm/<,>/bɪˈkʌm/<,>v.变得/v.变成/v.成为<,>She wants to become a doctor.<,>她想成为一名医生。<,>The weather became colder.<,>天气变得更冷了。<,>He became famous overnight.<,>他一夜成名。<,>be(是) + come(来)→成为<,>befall(v.降临)/behave(v.表现)  

rid<,>/rɪd/<,>/rɪd/<,>v.使摆脱/v.使去掉<,>I want to rid myself of bad habits.<,>我想改掉坏习惯。<,>They rid the house of mice.<,>他们清除了屋里的老鼠。<,>It's hard to rid your mind of these thoughts.<,>很难从脑海中摆脱这些想法。<,>red(红色)去掉e→摆脱红色<,>ride(v.骑)/rigid(adj.僵硬的)  

land<,>/lænd/<,>/lænd/<,>n.土地/n.陆地/v.上岸<,>They bought a piece of land to build a house.<,>他们买了块地来建房子。<,>The plane landed safely.<,>飞机安全着陆了。<,>We'll land at the next port.<,>我们将在下一个港口上岸。<,>l(站立) + and(和)→站立的地方→陆地<,>lend(v.借出)/lane(n.小巷)  

bold<,>/bəʊld/<,>/boʊld/<,>adj.大胆的/adj.冒失的<,>He made a bold decision.<,>他做了一个大胆的决定。<,>That was a bold move.<,>那是个冒失的举动。<,>She wore a bold red dress.<,>她穿了一件鲜艳的红裙子。<,>b(不) + old(老的)→不老的心态→大胆的<,>bald(adj.秃头的)/bond(n.债券)  

prison<,>/ˈprɪzn/<,>/ˈprɪzən/<,>n.监狱/n.监禁<,>He was sent to prison for theft.<,>他因盗窃入狱。<,>The prison has high walls.<,>监狱有高墙。<,>She visited her brother in prison.<,>她去监狱探望弟弟。<,>pri(首要) + son(儿子)→首要任务是看管犯人<,>poison(n.毒药)/person(n.人)  

modest<,>/ˈmɒdɪst/<,>/ˈmɑːdɪst/<,>adj.谦虚的/adj.不太大的/adj.不很贵的<,>She is modest about her achievements.<,>她对自己的成就很谦虚。<,>They live in a modest house.<,>他们住在一栋不大的房子里。<,>The price is quite modest.<,>价格相当实惠。<,>mode(模式) + st(街道)→谦虚的生活方式<,>modern(adj.现代的)/moist(adj.潮湿的)  

leather<,>/ˈleðə(r)/<,>/ˈleðər/<,>n.皮革/n.皮革制品<,>He wears a leather jacket.<,>他穿着一件皮夹克。<,>The sofa is made of genuine leather.<,>沙发是真皮制作的。<,>She bought a leather handbag.<,>她买了一个皮手袋。<,>lea(草地) + ther(thermos)→草地上的热水瓶皮套<,>feather(n.羽毛)/weather(n.天气)  

length<,>/leŋθ/<,>/leŋθ/<,>n.长/n.长度/n.一段<,>What's the length of the rope?<,>绳子有多长？<,>She wore her hair at shoulder length.<,>她留着齐肩长度的头发。<,>He spoke at length about his plans.<,>他详细讲述了他的计划。<,>leng(long的变体) + th(名词后缀)→长度<,>strength(n.力量)/lengthen(v.延长)  

academic<,>/ˌækəˈdemɪk/<,>/ˌækəˈdɛmɪk/<,>adj.学院的/adj.学术的<,>She has an academic degree.<,>她拥有学位。<,>This is an academic discussion.<,>这是学术讨论。<,>He works in an academic environment.<,>他在学术环境中工作。<,>academy(学院) + ic(形容词后缀)→学院的<,>economic(adj.经济的)/atomic(adj.原子的)
prosperous<,>/ˈprɒspərəs/<,>/ˈprɑːspərəs/<,>adj.繁荣的/adj.昌盛的<,>The prosperous city attracted many investors.<,>这座繁荣的城市吸引了许多投资者。<,>His business became prosperous after years of hard work.<,>经过多年的努力，他的生意变得兴旺发达。<,>The country enjoyed a prosperous economy.<,>这个国家经济繁荣。<,>pro(向前)+sper(希望)+ous→充满希望的→繁荣的<,>preposterous(adj.荒谬的)/prospect(n.前景/v.勘探)  

grammatical<,>/ɡrəˈmætɪkl/<,>/ɡrəˈmætɪkəl/<,>adj.语法上的<,>This sentence is not grammatical.<,>这个句子不符合语法规则。<,>She has a strong grasp of grammatical structures.<,>她对语法结构掌握得很好。<,>The teacher corrected the grammatical errors in my essay.<,>老师纠正了我文章中的语法错误。<,>grammar(语法)+tical→语法上的<,>gramophone(n.留声机)/graphic(adj.图形的)  

physics<,>/ˈfɪzɪks/<,>/ˈfɪzɪks/<,>n.物理学<,>He is studying physics at university.<,>他在大学学习物理学。<,>The laws of physics explain natural phenomena.<,>物理定律解释了自然现象。<,>Quantum physics is a challenging subject.<,>量子物理学是一门具有挑战性的学科。<,>phys(自然)+ics(学科)→研究自然的学科→物理学<,>physique(n.体格)/metaphysics(n.形而上学)  

turbine<,>/ˈtɜːbaɪn/<,>/ˈtɜːrbaɪn/<,>n.叶轮机/n.汽轮机<,>The wind turbine generates electricity.<,>风力涡轮机发电。<,>They installed a new turbine in the power plant.<,>他们在发电厂安装了一台新的涡轮机。<,>The jet engine contains a high-speed turbine.<,>喷气发动机包含一个高速涡轮。<,>turb(搅动)+ine→搅动的机器→涡轮机<,>turbid(adj.浑浊的)/disturb(v.打扰)  

contempt<,>/kənˈtempt/<,>/kənˈtɛmpt/<,>n.轻蔑/n.藐视/n.受辱<,>She looked at him with contempt.<,>她轻蔑地看着他。<,>His behavior brought contempt upon himself.<,>他的行为使他蒙受羞辱。<,>The judge held the offender in contempt.<,>法官藐视违法者。<,>con(共同)+tempt(轻视)→共同轻视→轻蔑<,>tempt(v.诱惑)/contemplate(v.沉思)  

settlement<,>/ˈsetlmənt/<,>/ˈsɛtəlmənt/<,>n.解决/n.殖民地<,>The two parties reached a settlement.<,>双方达成了和解。<,>This was one of the earliest European settlements in America.<,>这是欧洲在美洲最早的殖民地之一。<,>The insurance company offered a fair settlement.<,>保险公司提出了一个公平的解决方案。<,>settle(安顿)+ment→安顿的地方→殖民地<,>settler(n.移民)/resettlement(n.重新安置)  

label<,>/ˈleɪbl/<,>/ˈleɪbəl/<,>n.标签/n.标记<,>Please read the label before taking the medicine.<,>服药前请阅读标签。<,>He labeled all the boxes clearly.<,>他清楚地标记了所有的箱子。<,>The product carries an eco-friendly label.<,>这个产品带有环保标志。<,>lab(实验室)+el→实验室里的标记→标签<,>libel(n.诽谤)/lapel(n.翻领)  

dew<,>/djuː/<,>/duː/<,>n.露/n.露水<,>The grass was wet with morning dew.<,>草上沾满了晨露。<,>Dew drops glistened on the spider's web.<,>露珠在蜘蛛网上闪闪发光。<,>The flowers were refreshed by the night dew.<,>花朵被夜露滋润。<,>d(低)+ew(水)→低处的水→露水<,>due(adj.到期的)/sew(v.缝纫)  

professor<,>/prəˈfesə(r)/<,>/prəˈfɛsər/<,>n.教授<,>The professor gave an interesting lecture.<,>教授做了一个有趣的讲座。<,>She was appointed professor of biology.<,>她被任命为生物学教授。<,>My physics professor won the Nobel Prize.<,>我的物理学教授获得了诺贝尔奖。<,>pro(向前)+fess(说)+or→在前面说话的人→教授<,>professional(adj.专业的)/confessor(n.忏悔者)  

nothing<,>/ˈnʌθɪŋ/<,>/ˈnʌθɪŋ/<,>n.没有东西/adv.毫不<,>There is nothing in the box.<,>盒子里什么也没有。<,>He said nothing about the incident.<,>他对这件事只字未提。<,>She meant nothing by her comment.<,>她的评论毫无恶意。<,>no(无)+thing(东西)→没有东西<,>noting(v.注意)/anything(pron.任何事物)
palm<,>/pɑːm/<,>/pɑːm/<,>n.手掌/n.手心<,>She held the coin in the palm of her hand.<,>她把硬币放在手掌心里。<,>The baby grasped my palm tightly.<,>婴儿紧紧抓住我的手掌。<,>He wiped his sweaty palms on his trousers.<,>他在裤子上擦了擦汗湿的手掌。<,>联想：palm(棕榈树)的叶子形状像手掌<,>calm(adj.平静的)/balm(n.香脂)/psalm(n.赞美诗)

limit<,>/ˈlɪmɪt/<,>/ˈlɪmɪt/<,>n.限度/n.限制/n.范围<,>There's a speed limit on this road.<,>这条路上有限速。<,>We must set a time limit for the project.<,>我们必须为这个项目设定时间限制。<,>Her patience has reached its limit.<,>她的耐心已经到了极限。<,>lim(界限)+it→限制<,>limited(adj.有限的)/limitation(n.限制)/preliminary(adj.初步的)

crude<,>/kruːd/<,>/kruːd/<,>adj.简陋的/adj.天然的<,>They built a crude shelter from branches.<,>他们用树枝搭了个简陋的棚子。<,>Crude oil prices are rising again.<,>原油价格再次上涨。<,>His manners were rather crude.<,>他的举止相当粗鲁。<,>crud(粗糙)+e→粗糙的→简陋的<,>rude(adj.粗鲁的)/cruel(adj.残酷的)/cruise(v.巡航)

cold<,>/kəʊld/<,>/koʊld/<,>adj.冷的/adj.冷淡的/n.冷<,>She poured herself a cup of cold water.<,>她给自己倒了杯冷水。<,>He gave me a cold stare.<,>他冷冷地看了我一眼。<,>I caught a bad cold last week.<,>上周我得了重感冒。<,>cold(寒冷)→让人想"扣"(谐音)紧衣服<,>cool(adj.凉爽的)/bold(adj.大胆的)/gold(n.黄金)

frank<,>/fræŋk/<,>/fræŋk/<,>adj.坦白的/adj.直率的<,>To be frank, I don't like your plan.<,>坦白说，我不喜欢你的计划。<,>She was frank about her feelings.<,>她坦率地表达了自己的感受。<,>Let's have a frank discussion.<,>让我们开诚布公地谈谈。<,>Frank(人名"弗兰克")通常被认为是直率的人<,>blank(adj.空白的)/flank(n.侧面)/prank(n.恶作剧)

forget<,>/fəˈɡet/<,>/fərˈɡet/<,>v.忘记/v.遗忘<,>Don't forget to call your mother.<,>别忘了给你妈妈打电话。<,>I forgot my password again.<,>我又忘记密码了。<,>He has forgotten most of his French.<,>他已经忘记大部分法语了。<,>for(否定)+get(得到)→没有得到→忘记<,>forgive(v.原谅)/forgo(v.放弃)/forgetful(adj.健忘的)

bean<,>/biːn/<,>/biːn/<,>n.豆/n.蚕豆<,>I planted some beans in my garden.<,>我在花园里种了些豆子。<,>She made a soup with black beans.<,>她用黑豆做了汤。<,>Coffee beans are actually seeds.<,>咖啡豆其实是种子。<,>bean(豆)→谐音"饼"，豆子可以做豆饼<,>lean(v.倾斜)/mean(v.意思是)/dean(n.系主任)

appear<,>/əˈpɪə(r)/<,>/əˈpɪr/<,>v.似乎/v.出现/v.来到<,>He appeared suddenly at the door.<,>他突然出现在门口。<,>She appears to be very tired.<,>她看起来非常疲惫。<,>The sun appeared from behind the clouds.<,>太阳从云层后面露出来了。<,>ap(向)+pear(出现)→出现<,>disappear(v.消失)/appeal(v.呼吁)/apparel(n.服装)

price<,>/praɪs/<,>/praɪs/<,>n.价格/n.价钱/n.代价<,>What's the price of this jacket?<,>这件夹克多少钱？<,>The price of gasoline keeps rising.<,>汽油价格不断上涨。<,>He paid a high price for his mistake.<,>他为自己的错误付出了高昂代价。<,>price(价格)→谐音"普莱斯"(常见姓氏)<,>prize(n.奖品)/pride(n.骄傲)/prime(adj.主要的)

emotion<,>/ɪˈməʊʃn/<,>/ɪˈmoʊʃn/<,>n.情感/n.感情/n.激动<,>She couldn't control her emotions.<,>她无法控制自己的情绪。<,>Love is a powerful emotion.<,>爱是一种强烈的情感。<,>His voice was full of emotion.<,>他的声音充满感情。<,>e(出)+mot(动)+ion→情感波动<,>motion(n.运动)/promotion(n.晋升)/devotion(n.奉献)
worst<,>/wɜːst/<,>/wɜːrst/<,>adj.最坏的/adv.最坏地<,>This is the worst movie I have ever seen.<,>这是我看过最糟糕的电影。<,>He behaved worst at the party.<,>他在派对上的表现最差。<,>The weather turned worst in the evening.<,>晚上天气变得最恶劣。<,>wor(战争)+st(最高级)→战争中最坏的<,>worse(adj.更坏的)/best(adj.最好的)

moan<,>/məʊn/<,>/moʊn/<,>n.呻吟声/v.呻吟<,>She let out a low moan of pain.<,>她发出一声低沉的痛苦呻吟。<,>The wind moaned through the trees.<,>风在树林中呜咽。<,>He moaned about his workload.<,>他抱怨工作量太大。<,>mo(摸)+an(一个)→摸到一个痛处→呻吟<,>groan(n./v.呻吟)/mourn(v.哀悼)

terrible<,>/ˈterəbl/<,>/ˈterəbəl/<,>adj.可怕的/adj.极度的<,>That was a terrible accident.<,>那是一场可怕的事故。<,>I have a terrible headache.<,>我头疼得厉害。<,>He's in terrible trouble.<,>他遇到了极大的麻烦。<,>terr(恐怖)+ible(可...的)→可怕的<,>horrible(adj.可怕的)/tangible(adj.可触摸的)

dollar<,>/ˈdɒlə(r)/<,>/ˈdɑːlər/<,>n.元〔美国、加拿大、澳大利亚等国的货币单位〕<,>This book costs twenty dollars.<,>这本书要二十美元。<,>She earns six dollars an hour.<,>她每小时赚六美元。<,>The dollar has fallen against the euro.<,>美元对欧元贬值了。<,>doll(玩具娃娃)+ar→像玩具娃娃一样可爱的钱<,>yuan(n.人民币元)/euro(n.欧元)

answer<,>/ˈɑːnsə(r)/<,>/ˈænsər/<,>v.回答/v.响应<,>Please answer the question.<,>请回答这个问题。<,>She answered the door.<,>她去应门。<,>No one answered my call for help.<,>没有人回应我的求助。<,>an(一个)+swer(发誓)→发誓给出一个回应<,>reply(v.回答)/respond(v.响应)

barn<,>/bɑːn/<,>/bɑːrn/<,>n.谷仓/n.牲口棚<,>We stored the hay in the barn.<,>我们把干草储存在谷仓里。<,>The cows are kept in the barn.<,>牛被关在牲口棚里。<,>They converted the old barn into a house.<,>他们把旧谷仓改造成了房子。<,>bar(酒吧)+n(门)→像酒吧门一样的谷仓门<,>barnacle(n.藤壶)/barrel(n.桶)

conclusion<,>/kənˈkluːʒn/<,>/kənˈkluːʒən/<,>n.结论/n.推论/n.结尾<,>What's your conclusion?<,>你的结论是什么？<,>He came to the wrong conclusion.<,>他得出了错误的推论。<,>The story has a happy conclusion.<,>这个故事有个圆满的结尾。<,>con(共同)+clus(关闭)+ion→共同关闭→结论<,>inclusion(n.包含)/exclusion(n.排除)

demand<,>/dɪˈmɑːnd/<,>/dɪˈmænd/<,>v.要求/v.询问/v.需要<,>They demanded higher wages.<,>他们要求更高的工资。<,>"Where is he?" she demanded.<,>"他在哪？"她质问道。<,>This work demands great patience.<,>这项工作需要极大的耐心。<,>de(向下)+mand(命令)→向下命令→要求<,>command(v.命令)/remand(v.遣回)

learn<,>/lɜːn/<,>/lɜːrn/<,>v.学/v.学习<,>Children learn quickly.<,>孩子们学得很快。<,>I'm learning to drive.<,>我正在学开车。<,>We learned that lesson the hard way.<,>我们付出了代价才学到那个教训。<,>ear(耳朵)+n(门)→打开耳朵这扇门来学习<,>teach(v.教)/study(v.学习)

rival<,>/ˈraɪvl/<,>/ˈraɪvəl/<,>n.竞争者/adj.竞争的<,>He defeated his business rival.<,>他击败了商业竞争对手。<,>The two teams are rival candidates.<,>这两支队伍是竞争候选队。<,>This product has no rival in quality.<,>这个产品在质量上无可匹敌。<,>riv(河)+al(人)→隔河相望的人→竞争者<,>rivalry(n.竞争)/arrival(n.到达)
industry<,>/ˈɪndəstri/<,>/ˈɪndəstri/<,>n.工业/n.产业/n.勤劳<,>The automobile industry is booming in this region.<,>这个地区的汽车工业正在蓬勃发展。<,>She works in the fashion industry.<,>她在时尚产业工作。<,>His success is due to his industry and perseverance.<,>他的成功归功于他的勤劳和毅力。<,>indus(内部)+try(尝试)→内部尝试→工业<,>industrial(adj. 工业的)/industrious(adj. 勤劳的)/indulge(v. 放纵)  

concern<,>/kənˈsɜːn/<,>/kənˈsɜːrn/<,>n.关心/n.挂念/n.重要的事<,>His health is our main concern.<,>他的健康是我们最关心的事。<,>This matter doesn't concern you.<,>这件事与你无关。<,>Environmental concerns are growing worldwide.<,>全球对环境问题的关注正在增加。<,>con(共同)+cern(分离)→共同分离→关心<,>concert(n. 音乐会)/discern(v. 辨别)/concerto(n. 协奏曲)  

friendly<,>/ˈfrendli/<,>/ˈfrendli/<,>adj.友好的/adj.友谊的<,>Our neighbors are very friendly.<,>我们的邻居非常友好。<,>They had a friendly chat over coffee.<,>他们边喝咖啡边友好地聊天。<,>The two countries maintain friendly relations.<,>这两个国家保持着友好关系。<,>friend(朋友)+ly(形容词后缀)→友好的<,>fiend(n. 恶魔)/friendship(n. 友谊)/unfriendly(adj. 不友好的)  

pale<,>/peɪl/<,>/peɪl/<,>adj.苍白的/adj.浅的<,>She turned pale when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时她脸色变得苍白。<,>The walls were painted a pale blue.<,>墙壁被漆成淡蓝色。<,>His performance was pale in comparison.<,>相比之下他的表现黯然失色。<,>联想：pail(桶)→桶里的水是浅的<,>pail(n. 桶)/peel(v. 剥皮)/pole(n. 极点)  

dramatic<,>/drəˈmætɪk/<,>/drəˈmætɪk/<,>adj.戏剧的/adj.引人注目的<,>There was a dramatic change in the weather.<,>天气发生了剧变。<,>She made a dramatic entrance in a red dress.<,>她穿着红裙引人注目地入场。<,>He's studying dramatic arts at university.<,>他在大学学习戏剧艺术。<,>drama(戏剧)+tic(形容词后缀)→戏剧的<,>dynamic(adj. 动态的)/traumatic(adj. 创伤的)/drastic(adj. 激烈的)  

rhythm<,>/ˈrɪðəm/<,>/ˈrɪðəm/<,>n.韵律/n.格律/n.节奏<,>The poem has a beautiful rhythm.<,>这首诗有优美的韵律。<,>She can't dance to the rhythm.<,>她跟不上节奏跳舞。<,>The rhythm of the rain helped me sleep.<,>雨的节奏帮助我入睡。<,>联想：rhyme(韵律)→rhythm(节奏)<,>rhyme(n. 韵律)/arithmetic(n. 算术)/rheum(n. 稀黏液)  

local<,>/ˈləʊkl/<,>/ˈloʊkl/<,>adj.地方的/adj.局部的<,>We buy our vegetables from local farmers.<,>我们从当地农民那里购买蔬菜。<,>There will be local elections next month.<,>下个月将举行地方选举。<,>She has a local anesthetic for the procedure.<,>她在手术中使用了局部麻醉。<,>loc(地方)+al(形容词后缀)→地方的<,>locale(n. 场所)/locate(v. 定位)/locust(n. 蝗虫)  

nuclear<,>/ˈnjuːkliə(r)/<,>/ˈnuːkliər/<,>adj.原子核的<,>Nuclear energy is a controversial topic.<,>核能是一个有争议的话题。<,>They are conducting nuclear research.<,>他们正在进行核研究。<,>The country has nuclear capabilities.<,>这个国家拥有核能力。<,>nucle(核)+ar(形容词后缀)→原子核的<,>nucleus(n. 核心)/nucleic(adj. 核的)/nucleon(n. 核子)  

gentleman<,>/ˈdʒentlmən/<,>/ˈdʒentlmən/<,>n.绅士/n.有教养的人<,>He behaved like a true gentleman.<,>他的举止像个真正的绅士。<,>"Ladies and gentlemen," the speaker began.<,>"女士们先生们，"演讲者开始说道。<,>He's an old-fashioned gentleman.<,>他是个老派的绅士。<,>gentle(温和的)+man(人)→绅士<,>gentlewoman(n. 淑女)/gentility(n. 文雅)/gentle(adj. 温和的)  

exactly<,>/ɪɡˈzæktli/<,>/ɪɡˈzæktli/<,>adv.确切地/adv.恰恰正是<,>That's exactly what I meant.<,>这正是我的意思。<,>The train arrived exactly on time.<,>火车准点到达。<,>Tell me exactly what happened.<,>确切地告诉我发生了什么。<,>exact(精确的)+ly(副词后缀)→确切地<,>exact(adj. 精确的)/exacting(adj. 严格的)/exaction(n. 强求)
shield<,>/ʃiːld/<,>/ʃild/<,>n.盾/n.防护物/v.保护<,>The knight raised his shield to block the attack.<,>骑士举起盾牌挡住了攻击。<,>She used her umbrella as a shield against the rain.<,>她用雨伞挡雨。<,>Parents try to shield their children from harm.<,>父母尽力保护孩子免受伤害。<,>shield音似"护ield"(护+field)→防护领域→盾牌<,>yield(v.屈服/n.产量)/field(n.领域/v.接球)  

hawk<,>/hɔːk/<,>/hɔk/<,>n.鹰/n.隼<,>A hawk circled high above the hunting ground.<,>一只鹰在猎场上空盘旋。<,>He has the sharp eyes of a hawk.<,>他有着鹰一般锐利的眼睛。<,>The hawk swooped down to catch its prey.<,>老鹰俯冲下来捕捉猎物。<,>hawk发音似"好克"→好克敌→猛禽<,>hack(v.砍劈/n.雇佣文人)/hock(n.典当/v.抵押)  

network<,>/ˈnetwɜːk/<,>/ˈnɛtˌwɝk/<,>n.网状物/n.网络<,>The spider spun an intricate network of webs.<,>蜘蛛织出了复杂的蛛网。<,>She expanded her professional network at the conference.<,>她在会议上拓展了职业人脉。<,>Our computer network crashed yesterday.<,>我们的计算机网络昨天崩溃了。<,>net(网)+work(运作)→网络运作<,>framework(n.框架)/meshwork(n.网状组织)  

disease<,>/dɪˈziːz/<,>/dɪˈziz/<,>n.病/n.疾病/n.病害<,>The doctor diagnosed a rare disease.<,>医生诊断出一种罕见疾病。<,>Prevention is better than curing disease.<,>预防胜于治疗。<,>The crops were affected by a fungal disease.<,>庄稼感染了真菌病害。<,>dis(不)+ease(舒适)→不舒适→疾病<,>decease(n.死亡)/release(v.释放/n.发行)  

French<,>/frentʃ/<,>/frɛntʃ/<,>adj.法国的/n.法国人<,>She bought a French baguette for breakfast.<,>她买了法式长棍面包当早餐。<,>The French are known for their cuisine.<,>法国人以美食闻名。<,>He speaks fluent French.<,>他法语说得很流利。<,>France(法国)+ch→法国的<,>franchise(n.特许权)/frenzy(n.疯狂)  

indicate<,>/ˈɪndɪkeɪt/<,>/ˈɪndɪˌket/<,>v.标示/v.表示/v.表明<,>The sign indicates the direction to the hospital.<,>标志指示去医院的方向。<,>Her smile indicated approval.<,>她的微笑表示赞同。<,>Studies indicate that exercise improves memory.<,>研究表明运动能增强记忆力。<,>in(内)+dic(说)+ate→内部说明→表明<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/vindicate(v.辩护)  

aural<,>/ˈɔːrəl/<,>/ˈɔrəl/<,>adj.耳的/adj.听觉的<,>The test includes both written and aural sections.<,>测试包括笔试和听力部分。<,>She has excellent aural skills in music.<,>她有极好的音乐听觉能力。<,>Earphones provide an immersive aural experience.<,>耳机提供沉浸式听觉体验。<,>aur(耳)+al→耳朵的<,>oral(adj.口头的)/aerial(adj.空中的)  

basket<,>/ˈbɑːskɪt/<,>/ˈbæskɪt/<,>n.篮/n.篓/n.筐<,>She carried a basket of fresh fruits.<,>她提着一篮新鲜水果。<,>Throw the paper into the wastepaper basket.<,>把纸扔进废纸篓里。<,>The basketball went through the basket.<,>篮球穿过了篮筐。<,>bas(基础)+ket→基础容器→篮子<,>bucket(n.水桶)/casket(n.首饰盒)  

interpreter<,>/ɪnˈtɜːprɪtə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈtɝprɪtɚ/<,>n.译员/n.口译者<,>The interpreter translated the speech simultaneously.<,>口译员同步翻译了演讲。<,>She works as a sign language interpreter.<,>她是一名手语翻译。<,>We need an interpreter for this international meeting.<,>这次国际会议我们需要口译员。<,>interpret(解释)+er(人)→解释者<,>translator(n.笔译者)/interrupt(v.打断)  

mountain<,>/ˈmaʊntɪn/<,>/ˈmaʊntən/<,>n.山/n.山岳/n.山脉<,>They climbed the highest mountain in Africa.<,>他们攀登了非洲最高峰。<,>The village is surrounded by mountains.<,>村庄被群山环绕。<,>It's just a mountain of paperwork.<,>这只是一大堆文书工作。<,>mount(山)+ain→山脉<,>fountain(n.喷泉)/captain(n.船长)
obtain<,>/əbˈteɪn/<,>/əbˈteɪn/<,>v.获得/v.得到/v.买到<,>He obtained a rare book from the antique shop.<,>他从古董店买到了一本珍本书。<,>She obtained her degree with honors.<,>她以优异成绩获得了学位。<,>It's difficult to obtain tickets for the concert.<,>很难买到这场音乐会的票。<,>ob(加强)+tain(拿住)→牢牢拿住→获得<,>attain(v.达到)/retain(v.保留)/abstain(v.戒除)

lung<,>/lʌŋ/<,>/lʌŋ/<,>n.肺脏/n.肺<,>Smoking can damage your lungs.<,>吸烟会损害你的肺。<,>The doctor listened to his lungs with a stethoscope.<,>医生用听诊器听了他的肺部。<,>She took a deep breath, filling her lungs with fresh air.<,>她深吸一口气，让肺部充满新鲜空气。<,>lung与long(长)形似，肺是长条状器官<,>lunge(n.猛冲)/tongue(n.舌头)/flung(v.抛掷)

throughout<,>/θruːˈaʊt/<,>/θruːˈaʊt/<,>prep.遍及/adv.到处<,>The news spread throughout the school.<,>消息传遍了整个学校。<,>She remained calm throughout the crisis.<,>在整个危机期间她都保持冷静。<,>The museum has security cameras throughout the building.<,>博物馆在整个大楼都安装了监控摄像头。<,>through(穿过)+out(外面)→穿过所有外面→遍及<,>throughway(n.高速公路)/breakthrough(n.突破)/throughput(n.吞吐量)

measurable<,>/ˈmeʒərəbl/<,>/ˈmeʒərəbəl/<,>adj.可测量的<,>The experiment produced measurable results.<,>实验产生了可测量的结果。<,>There has been measurable progress in his English.<,>他的英语有了明显的进步。<,>The impact of the policy is not easily measurable.<,>这项政策的影响不容易衡量。<,>measure(测量)+able(能...的)→可测量的<,>immeasurable(adj.不可测量的)/measurably(adv.显著地)/measurement(n.测量)

clasp<,>/klɑːsp/<,>/klæsp/<,>n.扣子/n.钩子/n.别针<,>She fastened the clasp of her necklace.<,>她扣上了项链的搭扣。<,>The baby tightly clasped his mother's finger.<,>婴儿紧紧抓住妈妈的手指。<,>He wore a military cloak with a silver clasp.<,>他披着一件带银扣的军用斗篷。<,>cl(抓住)+asp(蛇)→像抓住蛇一样抓紧→扣住<,>grasp(v.抓住)/clash(n.冲突)/clamp(n.夹钳)

spring<,>/sprɪŋ/<,>/sprɪŋ/<,>v.跳/v.跃/n.泉/n.跳跃<,>The cat sprang onto the table.<,>猫跳上了桌子。<,>Hot springs are popular tourist attractions.<,>温泉是受欢迎的旅游景点。<,>He sprang to his feet when he heard the news.<,>听到消息他一下子跳了起来。<,>s(蛇)+pring(看作bring带来)→蛇带来春天→泉水<,>sprint(v.冲刺)/sprang(v.跳跃过去式)/springy(adj.有弹性的)

clock<,>/klɒk/<,>/klɑk/<,>n.钟/n.仪表<,>The clock on the wall is five minutes slow.<,>墙上的钟慢了五分钟。<,>Check the fuel gauge clock regularly.<,>定期检查燃油表。<,>He clocked in at 8:00 am sharp.<,>他早上8点整打卡上班。<,>clo(close关闭)+ck→古代用关闭城门报时→钟<,>watch(n.手表)/timer(n.计时器)/chronometer(n.精密计时器)

domestic<,>/dəˈmestɪk/<,>/dəˈmɛstɪk/<,>adj.本国的/adj.家庭的<,>Domestic flights are often cheaper.<,>国内航班通常更便宜。<,>She enjoys domestic chores like cooking.<,>她喜欢做饭等家务活。<,>This is a domestic issue, not international.<,>这是国内问题，不是国际问题。<,>dome(家)+stic(形容词后缀)→家庭的<,>international(adj.国际的)/foreign(adj.外国的)/household(adj.家庭的 n.家庭)
