doubt<,>/daʊt/<,>/daʊt/<,>n.怀疑/n.疑虑/v.怀疑<,>I have no doubt about his honesty.<,>我对他的诚实毫不怀疑。<,>She doubted whether he would come.<,>她怀疑他是否会来。<,>There's reasonable doubt in this case.<,>这个案件存在合理怀疑。<,>dou(double双)+bt→双面想法→怀疑<,>suspect(v.怀疑)/distrust(v.不信任)/question(v.质疑)

fork<,>/fɔːk/<,>/fɔrk/<,>n.餐叉/n.叉/n.分叉<,>Put the fork on the left side of the plate.<,>把餐叉放在盘子左边。<,>The road forks ahead; take the right path.<,>前方道路分叉，走右边。<,>He dug the garden with a fork.<,>他用叉子翻花园的土。<,>for(为了)+k(形状像叉子)→餐叉<,>spoon(n.勺子)/knife(n.刀子)/division(n.分叉)

course<,>/kɔːs/<,>/kɔrs/<,>n.课程/n.过程/n.一道菜<,>I'm taking a French course this semester.<,>这学期我在上法语课。<,>The main course will be served soon.<,>主菜马上就来。<,>In the course of time, things will improve.<,>随着时间的推移，情况会好转。<,>cour(run跑)+se→跑的过程→过程<,>class(n.班级)/lesson(n.课程)/process(n.过程)

intense<,>/ɪnˈtens/<,>/ɪnˈtɛns/<,>adj.强烈的/adj.紧张的<,>The intense heat made everyone uncomfortable.<,>强烈的热度让每个人都不舒服。<,>She has an intense personality.<,>她个性强烈。<,>The competition was intense.<,>竞争非常激烈。<,>in(里面)+tense(拉紧)→内部拉紧→紧张的<,>tense(adj.紧张的)/strong(adj.强烈的)/fierce(adj.激烈的)

advice<,>/ədˈvaɪs/<,>/ædˈvaɪs/<,>n.劝告/n.忠告/n.意见<,>I need your advice on this matter.<,>这件事我需要你的建议。<,>She gave me some good advice.<,>她给了我一些好建议。<,>Take my advice and study harder.<,>听我的劝告，更加努力学习。<,>ad(向)+vice(看)→向...看→建议<,>suggestion(n.建议)/counsel(n.忠告)/recommendation(n.推荐)

virtually<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəli/<,>/ˈvɜrtʃuəli/<,>adv.实际上/adv.事实上<,>Virtually all students passed the exam.<,>实际上所有学生都通过了考试。<,>The project is virtually complete.<,>这个项目事实上已经完成了。<,>We're virtually neighbors.<,>我们其实是邻居。<,>virtual(虚拟的)+ly(副词后缀)→实际上<,>actually(adv.实际上)/practically(adv.几乎)/essentially(adv.本质上)
envy<,>/ˈenvi/<,>/ˈɛnvi/<,>v.妒忌/v.羡慕/n.妒忌/n.羡慕<,>She couldn't help but envy her friend's success.<,>她忍不住羡慕朋友的成功。<,>His new car is the envy of all his colleagues.<,>他的新车让所有同事都羡慕不已。<,>Envy is a destructive emotion that can ruin relationships.<,>嫉妒是一种会破坏人际关系的负面情绪。<,>en(使)+vy(看)→看到别人有而自己没有→嫉妒<,>enemy(n.敌人)/entry(n.进入)/envoy(n.使者)

duck<,>/dʌk/<,>/dʌk/<,>n.鸭/n.雌鸭/n.鸭肉<,>The duck is swimming in the pond.<,>鸭子在池塘里游泳。<,>We're having roast duck for dinner tonight.<,>我们今晚晚餐吃烤鸭。<,>She's feeding the ducks by the lake.<,>她正在湖边喂鸭子。<,>d(低头)+uck(发音似"鸭")→低头吃食的动物→鸭子<,>luck(n.运气)/tuck(v.卷起)/buck(n.雄鹿)

remark<,>/rɪˈmɑːk/<,>/rɪˈmɑrk/<,>n.评论/n.谈论/v.评论/v.谈论<,>He made a rude remark about her appearance.<,>他对她的外表发表了粗鲁的评论。<,>She remarked that the weather was unusually warm.<,>她评论说天气异常温暖。<,>The professor's remarks were very insightful.<,>教授的评论非常有见地。<,>re(再)+mark(标记)→再次标记→评论<,>mark(n.标记)/remarkable(adj.显著的)/demark(v.划界)

native<,>/ˈneɪtɪv/<,>/ˈneɪtɪv/<,>adj.本土的/n.本地人<,>He is a native English speaker.<,>他是以英语为母语的人。<,>This plant is native to South America.<,>这种植物原产于南美洲。<,>She returned to her native country after 10 years abroad.<,>在国外生活10年后，她回到了祖国。<,>nat(出生)+ive(形容词后缀)→出生地的→本地的<,>naive(adj.天真的)/nature(n.自然)/nation(n.国家)

purchase<,>/ˈpɜːtʃəs/<,>/ˈpɜrtʃəs/<,>n.买/n.购买/v.买<,>They made a large purchase at the department store.<,>他们在百货公司进行了大采购。<,>You can purchase tickets online or at the door.<,>你可以在网上或现场购票。<,>The house purchase took several months to complete.<,>房屋购买花了几个月才完成。<,>pur(完全)+chase(追逐)→完全追逐到手→购买<,>purpose(n.目的)/pursue(v.追求)/purchaser(n.购买者)

explode<,>/ɪkˈspləʊd/<,>/ɪkˈsploʊd/<,>v.使爆炸<,>The bomb exploded with a loud bang.<,>炸弹轰的一声爆炸了。<,>His anger exploded when he heard the news.<,>听到这个消息，他勃然大怒。<,>The population has exploded in recent years.<,>近年来人口激增。<,>ex(出)+plode(拍手)→像拍手一样突然爆发→爆炸<,>explore(v.探索)/exploit(v.剥削)/explosion(n.爆炸)

tragedy<,>/ˈtrædʒədi/<,>/ˈtrædʒədi/<,>n.惨事/n.惨案/n.悲剧<,>The plane crash was a terrible tragedy.<,>这次飞机失事是个可怕的悲剧。<,>Shakespeare wrote many famous tragedies.<,>莎士比亚写了许多著名的悲剧。<,>It's a tragedy that so many people lost their homes in the fire.<,>这么多人在火灾中失去家园，真是悲剧。<,>trag(山羊)+edy(歌)→古希腊悲剧演员穿羊皮→悲剧<,>comedy(n.喜剧)/tradition(n.传统)/tragic(adj.悲剧的)

scissors<,>/ˈsɪzəz/<,>/ˈsɪzərz/<,>n.剪刀/n.剪子<,>Could you pass me the scissors, please?<,>请把剪刀递给我好吗？<,>These scissors are too dull to cut paper.<,>这把剪刀太钝了，剪不了纸。<,>She used scissors to trim the fabric.<,>她用剪刀修剪布料。<,>s(形似剪刀形状)+ciss(切)+ors(工具)→切割工具→剪刀<,>cistern(n.水箱)/scissor(v.剪)/cis(前缀表示"切")

atom<,>/ˈætəm/<,>/ˈætəm/<,>n.原子/n.微粒/n.微量<,>An atom is the smallest unit of matter.<,>原子是物质的最小单位。<,>There isn't an atom of truth in his story.<,>他的故事没有一点真实性。<,>The scientist studied the structure of the atom.<,>这位科学家研究了原子的结构。<,>a(不)+tom(切割)→不可再分割的最小单位→原子<,>atomic(adj.原子的)/anatomy(n.解剖)/tomato(n.番茄)

suck<,>/sʌk/<,>/sʌk/<,>v.吸/v.吮/v.啜<,>The baby is sucking its thumb.<,>婴儿正在吮吸大拇指。<,>This vacuum cleaner sucks up dirt very well.<,>这个吸尘器吸尘效果很好。<,>Don't suck on the straw too hard.<,>别太用力吸吸管。<,>s(形似吸管)+uck(发音似"吸")→吸的动作<,>sock(n.袜子)/sunk(v.下沉)/suckle(v.哺乳)
flag<,>/flæɡ/<,>/flæɡ/<,>n.旗/n.旗帜<,>They raised the flag at dawn.<,>他们在黎明时分升起了旗帜。<,>She waved a small flag during the parade.<,>她在游行时挥舞着小旗子。<,>The flag fluttered in the breeze.<,>旗帜在微风中飘扬。<,>fl(飞)+ag(行动)→飘扬的旗帜<,>frag(n.碎片)/flak(n.高射炮)/flame(n.火焰)

person<,>/ˈpɜːsn/<,>/ˈpɜːrsn/<,>n.人/n.人身/n.本人<,>She's a very kind person.<,>她是个非常善良的人。<,>Each person has their own opinion.<,>每个人都有各自的看法。<,>The contract must be signed in person.<,>合同必须本人签署。<,>per(每)+son(声音)→每个人都有声音→人<,>parson(n.牧师)/persona(n.人物角色)/personal(adj.个人的)

essay<,>/ˈeseɪ/<,>/ˈɛseɪ/<,>n.短文/n.散文/n.小品文<,>He wrote an essay about climate change.<,>他写了一篇关于气候变化的短文。<,>Her essays are always thought-provoking.<,>她的散文总是发人深省。<,>This literary essay won first prize.<,>这篇文学小品文获得了一等奖。<,>es(出)+say(说)→说出想法→短文<,>assay(v.化验)/essence(n.本质)/easy(adj.容易的)

cliff<,>/klɪf/<,>/klɪf/<,>n.悬崖/n.峭壁<,>The castle stands on a high cliff.<,>城堡矗立在高高的悬崖上。<,>They climbed the steep cliff carefully.<,>他们小心地攀爬陡峭的悬崖。<,>Birds nest on the cliff face.<,>鸟儿在悬崖面上筑巢。<,>cli(倾斜)+ff(锋利)→陡峭的悬崖<,>cliffhanger(n.悬念)/clink(v.叮当响)/cliffy(adj.多悬崖的)

perspective<,>/pəˈspektɪv/<,>/pərˈspektɪv/<,>n.透视/n.远景/n.观点<,>The painting shows excellent perspective.<,>这幅画展现了出色的透视技法。<,>From this perspective, the city looks beautiful.<,>从这个角度看，城市很美。<,>We need to consider different perspectives.<,>我们需要考虑不同的观点。<,>per(完全)+spect(看)+ive→完全看到→透视<,>prospective(adj.预期的)/respective(adj.各自的)/inspective(adj.检查的)

inquiry<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪəri/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪri/<,>n.询问/n.打听/n.调查<,>I made an inquiry about the train schedule.<,>我询问了火车时刻表。<,>The police conducted a thorough inquiry.<,>警方进行了彻底调查。<,>She answered all inquiries politely.<,>她有礼貌地回答了所有询问。<,>in(进入)+quir(问)+y→深入询问<,>enquiry(n.询问)/require(v.要求)/inquire(v.询问)

hair<,>/heə(r)/<,>/her/<,>n.头发/n.毛发/n.毛<,>She has long blonde hair.<,>她有一头金色长发。<,>There's a hair in my soup!<,>我汤里有根头发！<,>The cat left hairs all over the sofa.<,>猫在沙发上留下了很多毛。<,>h(高)+air(空气)→飘在空中的头发<,>hare(n.野兔)/heir(n.继承人)/hairy(adj.多毛的)

clever<,>/ˈklevə(r)/<,>/ˈklevər/<,>adj.聪明的/adj.机敏的<,>That was a clever solution to the problem.<,>那是个解决问题的聪明办法。<,>The clever fox escaped the trap.<,>机敏的狐狸逃出了陷阱。<,>She's clever with her hands.<,>她手很巧。<,>cle(干净)+ver(真实)→思路清晰的→聪明的<,>clover(n.三叶草)/cleaver(n.切肉刀)/cleave(v.劈开)

scratch<,>/skrætʃ/<,>/skrætʃ/<,>v.搔/v.抓/n.搔/n.抓<,>The cat scratched the furniture.<,>猫抓坏了家具。<,>Don't scratch your mosquito bites.<,>别抓你的蚊子包。<,>There's a scratch on my new phone.<,>我新手机上有道划痕。<,>sc(切割)+ratch(抓挠)→抓挠<,>snatch(v.抢夺)/screech(n.尖叫声)/scorch(v.烧焦)

insist<,>/ɪnˈsɪst/<,>/ɪnˈsɪst/<,>v.坚持/v.坚持要求<,>I insist that you take this gift.<,>我坚持要你收下这个礼物。<,>She insisted on paying the bill.<,>她坚持要付账。<,>They insist the report is accurate.<,>他们坚持认为报告是准确的。<,>in(进入)+sist(站立)→站定立场→坚持<,>consist(v.组成)/persist(v.坚持)/resist(v.抵抗)
chimney<,>/ˈtʃɪmni/<,>/ˈtʃɪmni/<,>n.烟囱/n.烟筒<,>The smoke from the chimney indicated that someone was home.<,>烟囱冒出的烟说明家里有人。<,>Santa Claus is said to come down the chimney on Christmas Eve.<,>据说圣诞老人会在圣诞夜从烟囱下来。<,>The old house had a tall brick chimney.<,>那座老房子有一个高高的砖砌烟囱。<,>chim(烟)+ney(地方)→冒烟的地方→烟囱<,>chimpanzee(n.黑猩猩)/channel(n.频道/v.引导)  

orphan<,>/ˈɔːf(ə)n/<,>/ˈɔːrfən/<,>n.孤儿<,>The kind couple adopted an orphan from the war-torn country.<,>这对善良的夫妇收养了一个来自战乱国家的孤儿。<,>After the accident, the boy became an orphan.<,>事故发生后，这个男孩成了孤儿。<,>The orphanage provides shelter for many orphans.<,>孤儿院为许多孤儿提供庇护所。<,>or(没有)+phan(父母)→没有父母的人→孤儿<,>often(adv.经常)/option(n.选择)  

plane<,>/pleɪn/<,>/pleɪn/<,>n.飞机/n.平面<,>The plane will take off in twenty minutes.<,>飞机将在二十分钟后起飞。<,>The carpenter smoothed the wood with a plane.<,>木匠用刨子把木头刨平。<,>All points on this plane are equidistant from the center.<,>这个平面上的所有点到中心的距离都相等。<,>plan(计划)+e→飞机是按计划飞行的<,>plain(adj.简单的/n.平原)/planet(n.行星)  

accomplish<,>/əˈkʌmplɪʃ/<,>/əˈkɑːmplɪʃ/<,>v.达到(目的)/v.完成<,>She accomplished her goal of running a marathon.<,>她完成了跑马拉松的目标。<,>The team accomplished the project ahead of schedule.<,>团队提前完成了项目。<,>It's amazing what you can accomplish with determination.<,>有决心就能完成惊人的事情。<,>ac(强调)+com(完全)+plish(完成)→完全完成→实现<,>complete(v.完成/adj.完整的)/accompany(v.陪伴)  

queen<,>/kwiːn/<,>/kwiːn/<,>n.女王/n.王后<,>The queen addressed the nation on television.<,>女王在电视上向全国发表讲话。<,>In chess, the queen is the most powerful piece.<,>在国际象棋中，皇后是最强大的棋子。<,>She was crowned queen at the age of 25.<,>她在25岁时加冕为女王。<,>que(追求)+en(人)→追求权力的人→女王<,>queer(adj.奇怪的)/quench(v.解渴)  

really<,>/ˈrɪəli/<,>/ˈriːəli/<,>adv.真正地/adv.实在<,>I really appreciate your help.<,>我真的很感谢你的帮助。<,>Did you really see a ghost?<,>你真的看到鬼了吗？<,>This cake is really delicious.<,>这个蛋糕实在太好吃了。<,>real(真实的)+ly(副词后缀)→真实地<,>rarely(adv.很少)/readily(adv.乐意地)

recognition<,>/ˌrekəɡˈnɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌrekəɡˈnɪʃən/<,>n.承认/n.认出/n.识别<,>He received recognition for his outstanding work.<,>他因出色的工作而获得认可。<,>Facial recognition technology is widely used today.<,>人脸识别技术如今被广泛应用。<,>She nodded in recognition when she saw her old friend.<,>看到老朋友时，她点头表示认出。<,>re(再)+cogn(知道)+ition→再次知道→认出<,>recommendation(n.推荐)/reconciliation(n.和解)

preliminary<,>/prɪˈlɪmɪn(ə)ri/<,>/prɪˈlɪmɪneri/<,>adj.预备的/adj.初步的<,>The team made a preliminary analysis of the data.<,>团队对数据做了初步分析。<,>Preliminary results show that the experiment was successful.<,>初步结果显示实验是成功的。<,>We need to do some preliminary research before starting the project.<,>在开始项目前我们需要做些预备研究。<,>pre(前)+limin(门槛)+ary→在门槛前的→预备的<,>primary(adj.主要的)/premier(adj.首要的)

quick<,>/kwɪk/<,>/kwɪk/<,>adj.快的/adj.敏捷的<,>She gave a quick response to the question.<,>她对这个问题作出了快速回应。<,>Be quick, or we'll miss the train!<,>快点，否则我们会错过火车！<,>He has a quick mind and learns things fast.<,>他思维敏捷，学东西很快。<,>qu(追求)+ick→追求速度→快的<,>quickly(adv.迅速地)/quicken(v.加快)/quirk(n.怪癖)

hunger<,>/ˈhʌŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈhʌŋɡər/<,>n.饿/n.饥饿/n.渴望<,>Many people suffer from hunger in poor countries.<,>在贫穷国家，许多人遭受饥饿。<,>He has a hunger for knowledge.<,>他渴望知识。<,>The smell of food increased my hunger.<,>食物的香味让我更饿了。<,>hung(悬挂)+er→胃空荡荡地悬挂→饥饿<,>hungry(adj.饥饿的)/anger(n.愤怒)/hanger(n.衣架)

fearful<,>/ˈfɪəfl/<,>/ˈfɪrfl/<,>adj.害怕的/adj.可怕的<,>She was fearful of walking alone at night.<,>她害怕晚上独自走路。<,>The storm was a fearful experience.<,>这场暴风雨是一次可怕的经历。<,>He gave me a fearful look.<,>他给了我一个可怕的眼神。<,>fear(害怕)+ful(充满)→充满害怕的<,>fearless(adj.无畏的)/cheerful(adj.快乐的)/tearful(adj.含泪的)

suspicion<,>/səˈspɪʃn/<,>/səˈspɪʃən/<,>n.怀疑/n.疑心/n.猜疑<,>I have a suspicion that he's not telling the truth.<,>我怀疑他没有说实话。<,>Her behavior aroused my suspicion.<,>她的行为引起了我的怀疑。<,>He was arrested on suspicion of theft.<,>他因涉嫌盗窃被捕。<,>sus(在...下面)+pic(看)+ion→在下面看→怀疑<,>suspicious(adj.可疑的)/suspect(v.怀疑/n.嫌疑犯)/inspicion(无此词)

knowledge<,>/ˈnɒlɪdʒ/<,>/ˈnɑːlɪdʒ/<,>n.知识/n.学识/n.知道<,>Knowledge is power.<,>知识就是力量。<,>He has a good knowledge of French.<,>他精通法语。<,>To my knowledge, she has never been abroad.<,>据我所知，她从未出过国。<,>know(知道)+ledge(状态)→知道的状态→知识<,>acknowledge(v.承认)/know-how(n.专门知识)/unknown(adj.未知的)

dish<,>/dɪʃ/<,>/dɪʃ/<,>n.碟/n.盘子/n.菜肴<,>Please pass me that dish.<,>请把那个盘子递给我。<,>This is my favorite dish.<,>这是我最喜欢的菜。<,>She broke a dish while washing up.<,>她在洗碗时打碎了一个盘子。<,>di(分开)+sh→分开盛放食物的器具→盘子<,>disk(n.磁盘)/fish(n.鱼)/wish(v.希望)

amuse<,>/əˈmjuːz/<,>/əˈmjuːz/<,>v.逗...乐/v.给...娱乐<,>The clown amused the children.<,>小丑逗乐了孩子们。<,>I need something to amuse myself during the flight.<,>我需要些东西在飞行途中自娱自乐。<,>His jokes never fail to amuse me.<,>他的笑话总能逗我笑。<,>a(使)+muse(缪斯女神)→使像缪斯女神一样有灵感→娱乐<,>amusement(n.娱乐)/museum(n.博物馆)/music(n.音乐)

cheque<,>/tʃek/<,>/tʃek/<,>n.支票<,>He wrote a cheque for $100.<,>他开了一张100美元的支票。<,>I'd like to pay by cheque, please.<,>我想用支票付款。<,>The cheque bounced due to insufficient funds.<,>由于资金不足，支票被退票了。<,>check(检查)的变体，因需要检查金额→支票<,>check(v.检查/n.支票)/chequer(n.棋子)/cheek(n.脸颊)

orchestra<,>/ˈɔːkɪstrə/<,>/ˈɔːrkɪstrə/<,>n.管弦乐队<,>The orchestra performed Beethoven's Symphony No.5.<,>管弦乐队演奏了贝多芬的第五交响曲。<,>She plays violin in the school orchestra.<,>她在学校管弦乐队拉小提琴。<,>The conductor led the orchestra with great passion.<,>指挥充满激情地领导着管弦乐队。<,>orche(舞蹈)+stra→为舞蹈伴奏的乐队→管弦乐队<,>orchestrate(v.精心安排)/orchestration(n.管弦乐编曲)/chorus(n.合唱队)
favourite<,>/ˈfeɪvərɪt/<,>/ˈfeɪvərɪt/<,>adj.特别受喜爱的<,>This is my favourite book.<,>这是我最喜欢的书。<,>What's your favourite colour?<,>你最喜欢的颜色是什么？<,>She is the teacher's favourite student.<,>她是老师最喜欢的学生。<,>favour(喜爱)+ite(形容词后缀)→特别受喜爱的<,>favor(n.偏爱/v.偏爱)/favourable(adj.有利的)/favourite(adj.特别受喜爱的)

centre<,>/ˈsentə(r)/<,>/ˈsentər/<,>n.中心/n.中枢/v.集中<,>The city centre is very busy.<,>市中心非常繁忙。<,>Please centre the text on the page.<,>请将文本居中。<,>The discussion centred on the new policy.<,>讨论集中在新政策上。<,>centr(中心)+e→中心<,>center(美式拼写)/central(adj.中心的)/century(n.世纪)

come<,>/kʌm/<,>/kʌm/<,>v.来/v.来到/v.出现<,>Come here, please.<,>请过来。<,>Spring comes after winter.<,>冬天过后是春天。<,>The solution came to me suddenly.<,>我突然想到了解决办法。<,>com(共同)+e→一起来→来<,>go(v.去)/become(v.变成)/overcome(v.克服)

lion<,>/ˈlaɪən/<,>/ˈlaɪən/<,>n.狮子/n.勇猛的人<,>The lion is the king of the jungle.<,>狮子是丛林之王。<,>He fought like a lion in the battle.<,>他在战斗中像狮子一样勇猛。<,>We saw a lion at the zoo.<,>我们在动物园看到了一只狮子。<,>lio(狮子)+n→狮子<,>tiger(n.老虎)/leopard(n.豹子)/lioness(n.母狮子)

berry<,>/ˈberi/<,>/ˈberi/<,>n.浆果（如草莓等）<,>She picked some berries in the forest.<,>她在森林里摘了一些浆果。<,>This jam is made from mixed berries.<,>这种果酱是用混合浆果制成的。<,>Blueberries are my favourite berries.<,>蓝莓是我最喜欢的浆果。<,>berr(浆果)+y→浆果<,>cherry(n.樱桃)/strawberry(n.草莓)/blackberry(n.黑莓)

edition<,>/ɪˈdɪʃn/<,>/ɪˈdɪʃn/<,>n.版本/n.版/n.版次<,>This is the latest edition of the dictionary.<,>这是这本词典的最新版本。<,>The first edition was published in 1990.<,>第一版出版于1990年。<,>I collect rare book editions.<,>我收藏珍本书籍版本。<,>edit(编辑)+ion(名词后缀)→版本<,>editor(n.编辑)/edition(n.版本)/addition(n.加法)

hatred<,>/ˈheɪtrɪd/<,>/ˈheɪtrɪd/<,>n.憎恶/n.憎恨/n.仇恨<,>She felt a deep hatred for her enemy.<,>她对敌人怀有深深的仇恨。<,>Hatred leads to violence.<,>仇恨导致暴力。<,>His eyes were full of hatred.<,>他的眼中充满了憎恨。<,>hate(恨)+red(红色)→仇恨<,>love(n.爱)/hate(v.恨)/hatred(n.憎恨)

poverty<,>/ˈpɒvəti/<,>/ˈpɑːvərti/<,>n.贫穷/n.贫困<,>Many people live in poverty in this country.<,>这个国家很多人生活在贫困中。<,>Poverty is a serious social problem.<,>贫困是一个严重的社会问题。<,>He grew up in poverty.<,>他在贫困中长大。<,>pover(贫穷)+ty(名词后缀)→贫穷<,>wealth(n.财富)/rich(adj.富有的)/poverty(n.贫穷)

type<,>/taɪp/<,>/taɪp/<,>n.型/n.类型/v.打字<,>What type of music do you like?<,>你喜欢什么类型的音乐？<,>She types very fast.<,>她打字很快。<,>This is a new type of car.<,>这是一种新型汽车。<,>typ(类型)+e→类型<,>kind(n.种类)/sort(n.种类)/type(n.类型)

process<,>/ˈprəʊses/<,>/ˈprɑːses/<,>n.过程/n.工序/v.加工<,>The manufacturing process is complex.<,>制造过程很复杂。<,>We need to process the data.<,>我们需要处理这些数据。<,>Learning is a gradual process.<,>学习是一个渐进的过程。<,>pro(向前)+cess(走)→向前走→过程<,>progress(n.进步)/process(n.过程)/procedure(n.程序)
pleasure<,>/ˈpleʒə(r)/<,>/ˈplɛʒər/<,>n.愉快/n.快乐/n.乐事<,>It gives me great pleasure to announce the winner.<,>我很高兴宣布获胜者。<,>Reading is one of life's greatest pleasures.<,>阅读是人生最大的乐趣之一。<,>She took pleasure in helping others.<,>她乐于助人。<,>pleas(高兴)+ure(名词后缀)→愉快<,>pressure(n.压力)/measure(n.措施/v.测量)  

banner<,>/ˈbænə(r)/<,>/ˈbænər/<,>n.横幅/n.旗/n.旗帜<,>The protesters carried banners demanding justice.<,>抗议者举着要求正义的横幅。<,>The website displayed a banner ad at the top.<,>网站在顶部显示横幅广告。<,>The team's banner flew high during the championship.<,>球队的旗帜在锦标赛期间高高飘扬。<,>ban(禁止)+n+er(物)→横幅(原指禁令布告)<,>manner(n.方式)/dinner(n.晚餐)  

experiment<,>/ɪkˈsperɪmənt/<,>/ɪkˈspɛrəmənt/<,>n.实验/n.试验<,>The science experiment produced unexpected results.<,>这个科学实验产生了意想不到的结果。<,>They conducted an experiment to test the theory.<,>他们进行了实验来验证这个理论。<,>It was just an experiment in new cooking techniques.<,>这只是新烹饪技术的尝试。<,>ex(出)+peri(尝试)+ment→实验<,>experience(n.经验)/expert(n.专家)  

pear<,>/peə(r)/<,>/pɛr/<,>n.梨子/n.梨树<,>She packed a pear in her lunchbox.<,>她在午餐盒里装了一个梨子。<,>The pear tree in our garden bears fruit every summer.<,>我们花园里的梨树每年夏天都结果。<,>This juice is made from pressed pears.<,>这种果汁是用压榨的梨子制成的。<,>对比记忆：pear(梨)/pair(一对)/peel(果皮)<,>bear(n.熊/v.忍受)/peer(n.同龄人/v.凝视)  

Marxism<,>/ˈmɑːksɪzəm/<,>/ˈmɑrksɪzəm/<,>n.马克思主义<,>Marxism has profoundly influenced modern political thought.<,>马克思主义深刻影响了现代政治思想。<,>He wrote his thesis on the principles of Marxism.<,>他的论文写的是马克思主义原理。<,>The party's ideology is rooted in Marxism.<,>该党的意识形态植根于马克思主义。<,>Marx(马克思)+ism(主义)→马克思主义<,>materialism(n.唯物主义)/capitalism(n.资本主义)  

drip<,>/drɪp/<,>/drɪp/<,>v.滴下/v.漏水/n.水滴<,>Water began to drip from the leaky faucet.<,>水开始从漏水的龙头滴下。<,>The patient was put on a saline drip.<,>病人被挂上了生理盐水点滴。<,>Listen to the steady drip of rain on the roof.<,>听着雨水持续滴在屋顶上的声音。<,>拟声词，模拟水滴声<,>drop(n.滴/v.掉落)/drab(adj.单调的)  

dictation<,>/dɪkˈteɪʃn/<,>/dɪkˈteɪʃən/<,>n.口授笔录/n.听写<,>The secretary took dictation from her boss.<,>秘书记录老板的口述。<,>We had a French dictation test today.<,>今天我们进行了法语听写测试。<,>The teacher gave us a dictation exercise.<,>老师给我们做了听写练习。<,>dict(说)+ation(名词后缀)→口授<,>diction(n.措辞)/addiction(n.上瘾)  

advisable<,>/ədˈvaɪzəbl/<,>/ədˈvaɪzəbəl/<,>adj.明智的/adj.可取的<,>It's advisable to book tickets in advance.<,>提前订票是明智的。<,>Getting vaccinated is highly advisable.<,>接种疫苗是非常可取的。<,>Is it advisable to invest in this market now?<,>现在投资这个市场可取吗?<,>advise(建议)+able(可...的)→可取的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/available(adj.可获得的)  

tide<,>/taɪd/<,>/taɪd/<,>n.潮/n.潮汐/n.潮流<,>The tide comes in twice a day here.<,>这里每天有两次涨潮。<,>We collected shells when the tide was out.<,>我们在退潮时捡贝壳。<,>She swims against the tide of popular opinion.<,>她逆着舆论潮流而行。<,>tide本义"时间"(与time同源)，因潮汐按时而来<,>tidy(adj.整洁的)/tied(v.系牢)  

mind<,>/maɪnd/<,>/maɪnd/<,>n.头脑/n.理智/n.记忆<,>He has a brilliant scientific mind.<,>他有着杰出的科学头脑。<,>The accident kept playing on her mind.<,>事故不断在她脑海中重现。<,>I can't recall the name - it's slipped my mind.<,>我想不起名字了——我忘记了。<,>mind与mental(精神的)同源<,>mend(v.修理)/mine(pron.我的)


blow<,>/bləʊ/<,>/bloʊ/<,>v.吹/v.吹动/v.吹响<,>The wind will blow away the leaves.<,>风会把树叶吹走。<,>He can blow the trumpet very well.<,>他小号吹得很好。<,>The storm blew down several trees.<,>暴风雨吹倒了几棵树。<,>bl(象声词，吹气声)+ow(后缀)→吹<,>bow(n.弓/v.鞠躬)/flow(v.流动/n.流量)  

model<,>/ˈmɒd(ə)l/<,>/ˈmɑːd(ə)l/<,>n.模型/n.模特儿<,>She works as a fashion model.<,>她是一名时装模特。<,>He built a model of the Eiffel Tower.<,>他做了一个埃菲尔铁塔的模型。<,>This car is the latest model.<,>这辆车是最新款。<,>mod(模式)+el(小)→小模式→模型<,>modal(adj.形式的)/modem(n.调制解调器)  

compass<,>/ˈkʌmpəs/<,>/ˈkʌmpəs/<,>n.罗盘/n.指南针/n.圆规<,>The hiker used a compass to find his way.<,>徒步者用指南针找路。<,>Draw a circle with a compass.<,>用圆规画个圆。<,>The compass needle points north.<,>罗盘指针指向北方。<,>com(共同)+pass(通过)→共同通过的工具→指南针<,>compass(v.包围)/compass(n.范围)  

germ<,>/dʒɜːm/<,>/dʒɜːrm/<,>n.微生物/n.细菌/n.幼芽<,>Wash your hands to kill germs.<,>洗手杀菌。<,>The germ of an idea formed in his mind.<,>他脑中萌生了一个想法。<,>These seeds contain the germ of life.<,>这些种子含有生命的胚芽。<,>ger(生长)+m(微小)→微小生长物→细菌<,>gem(n.宝石)/term(n.术语)  

probably<,>/ˈprɒbəbli/<,>/ˈprɑːbəbli/<,>adv.或许/adv.大概<,>She will probably arrive at 8 pm.<,>她大概晚上8点到。<,>It will probably rain tomorrow.<,>明天可能会下雨。<,>He probably forgot the meeting.<,>他或许忘了开会。<,>prob(测试)+ably(能…地)→能测试地→大概<,>possible(adj.可能的)/probable(adj.很可能的)  

library<,>/ˈlaɪbrəri/<,>/ˈlaɪbreri/<,>n.图书馆/n.藏书<,>I borrowed this book from the library.<,>我从图书馆借了这本书。<,>His house has a huge library.<,>他家有大量藏书。<,>The digital library is very convenient.<,>数字图书馆很方便。<,>libr(书)+ary(场所)→藏书场所<,>librarian(n.图书管理员)/liberal(adj.自由的)  

advance<,>/ədˈvɑːns/<,>/ədˈvæns/<,>v.前进/v.提高/n.进展<,>The troops advanced towards the enemy.<,>部队向敌军推进。<,>She advanced her career quickly.<,>她职业发展很快。<,>This is a major scientific advance.<,>这是重大科学进展。<,>ad(向)+vance(走)→向前走<,>advantage(n.优势)/advanced(adj.先进的)  

my<,>/maɪ/<,>/maɪ/<,>det.我的<,>This is my favorite book.<,>这是我最爱的书。<,>My phone is out of battery.<,>我手机没电了。<,>My brother is a doctor.<,>我哥哥是医生。<,>简单词，与"I"相关<,>mine(pron.我的)/may(aux.v.可能)  

beloved<,>/bɪˈlʌvd/<,>/bɪˈlʌvd/<,>adj.为…所爱的/n.爱人<,>She is my beloved wife.<,>她是我挚爱的妻子。<,>The poem is dedicated to his beloved.<,>这首诗献给他的爱人。<,>This park is a beloved landmark.<,>这个公园是深受喜爱的地标。<,>be(被)+loved(爱)→被爱的<,>belove(v.爱)/below(prep.在...下面)  

nephew<,>/ˈnefjuː/<,>/ˈnefjuː/<,>n.侄子/n.外甥<,>My nephew is five years old.<,>我侄子5岁了。<,>She bought gifts for her nephew.<,>她给外甥买了礼物。<,>His nephew looks just like him.<,>他外甥长得像他。<,>nep(云)+hew(砍)→云中砍出的亲人→侄子<,>niece(n.侄女)/nepotism(n.裙带关系)
aluminium<,>/ˌæl.jʊˈmɪn.i.əm/<,>/əˈluː.mə.nəm/<,>n.铝<,>Aluminium is widely used in packaging and construction.<,>铝广泛用于包装和建筑。<,>The frame of the window is made of aluminium.<,>窗框是铝制的。<,>Recycling aluminium saves energy.<,>回收铝可以节约能源。<,>alumin(铝)+ium(元素后缀)→铝<,>alumina(n.氧化铝)/aluminum(美式拼写)  

rarely<,>/ˈreə.li/<,>/ˈrer.li/<,>adv.很少/难得<,>She rarely eats fast food.<,>她很少吃快餐。<,>He is rarely late for meetings.<,>他开会很少迟到。<,>Such opportunities rarely come by.<,>这样的机会难得一见。<,>rare(稀有的)+ly(副词后缀)→很少地<,>barely(adv.几乎不)/scarcely(adv. scarcely)  

subsequent<,>/ˈsʌb.sɪ.kwənt/<,>/ˈsʌb.sɪ.kwənt/<,>adj.随后的/后来的<,>Subsequent events proved her right.<,>随后的事件证明她是对的。<,>The subsequent chapters discuss advanced topics.<,>后续章节讨论高级主题。<,>Subsequent to the meeting, he resigned.<,>会议之后他辞职了。<,>sub(在...下)+sequ(跟随)+ent→随后发生的<,>consequent(adj.随之发生的)/sequential(adj.连续的)  

charity<,>/ˈtʃær.ə.ti/<,>/ˈtʃer.ə.t̬i/<,>n.慈善事业/施舍<,>She donated half her salary to charity.<,>她把一半工资捐给了慈善机构。<,>The charity provides food for the homeless.<,>该慈善机构为无家可归者提供食物。<,>He gave money out of charity, not pity.<,>他出于善心而非怜悯给钱。<,>char(关爱)+ity(名词后缀)→慈善<,>clarity(n.清晰)/chastity(n.贞洁)  

itself<,>/ɪtˈself/<,>/ɪtˈself/<,>pron.它自己/自身<,>The cat washed itself.<,>猫给自己洗澡。<,>The device turns itself off automatically.<,>设备会自动关闭。<,>The truth speaks for itself.<,>事实不言自明。<,>it(它)+self(自己)→自身<,>himself(pron.他自己)/herself(pron.她自己)  

clue<,>/kluː/<,>/kluː/<,>n.线索/提示<,>The detective found a crucial clue.<,>侦探发现了关键线索。<,>I have no clue how to solve this puzzle.<,>我不知道如何解这个谜题。<,>Her smile gave me a clue to her feelings.<,>她的微笑透露了她的感受。<,>发音类似"刻录"→线索像刻录的信息<,>glue(n.胶水)/cue(n.提示信号)  

jewish<,>/ˈdʒuː.ɪʃ/<,>/ˈdʒuː.ɪʃ/<,>adj.犹太人的<,>Jewish traditions are rich and ancient.<,>犹太传统丰富而古老。<,>They celebrate Jewish holidays together.<,>他们一起庆祝犹太节日。<,>The museum exhibits Jewish artifacts.<,>博物馆展出犹太文物。<,>Jew(犹太人)+ish(形容词后缀)→犹太人的<,>Spanish(adj.西班牙的)/British(adj.英国的)  

current<,>/ˈkʌr.ənt/<,>/ˈkɝː.ənt/<,>adj.当前的/通用的<,>Check the current weather forecast.<,>查看当前天气预报。<,>This is the current edition of the textbook.<,>这是教材的最新版。<,>The current situation requires attention.<,>当前形势需要关注。<,>curr(流动)+ent→正在流动的→当前的<,>currency(n.货币)/currant(n.醋栗)  

journey<,>/ˈdʒɜː.ni/<,>/ˈdʒɝː.ni/<,>n.旅行/旅程<,>Their journey around the world took a year.<,>他们的环球旅行花了一年。<,>The train journey was comfortable.<,>火车旅程很舒适。<,>Life is a long journey of learning.<,>人生是漫长的学习之旅。<,>journ(日)+ey→每日行程→旅程<,>tour(n.观光旅行)/voyage(n.航海旅行)  

sustain<,>/səˈsteɪn/<,>/səˈsteɪn/<,>v.支撑/忍受/供养<,>Pillars sustain the ancient roof.<,>柱子支撑着古老的屋顶。<,>She couldn't sustain the pain any longer.<,>她再也无法忍受疼痛。<,>This farm sustains three families.<,>这个农场供养着三个家庭。<,>sus(在...下)+tain(握住)→在下面握住→支撑<,>retain(v.保留)/abstain(v.戒除)
enormous<,>/ɪˈnɔːməs/<,>/ɪˈnɔːrməs/<,>adj.巨大的/adj.庞大的<,>The elephant was enormous compared to the other animals.<,>与其他动物相比，这头大象体型巨大。<,>They spent an enormous amount of money on the project.<,>他们在这个项目上花费了巨额资金。<,>Her influence on the industry is enormous.<,>她对行业的影响是巨大的。<,>e(出)+norm(标准)+ous(形容词后缀)→超出标准→巨大的<,>enormity(n. 暴行/n.巨大)/abnormal(adj.反常的)/normal(adj.正常的)  

bite<,>/baɪt/<,>/baɪt/<,>v.咬/v.叮/v.刺穿<,>The dog might bite if you provoke it.<,>如果你激怒它，狗可能会咬人。<,>Mosquito bites can cause itching and swelling.<,>蚊子叮咬会引起瘙痒和肿胀。<,>The drill bit can bite through metal.<,>钻头可以穿透金属。<,>bit(e)(咬)→与"bit(n.一点)"同源→咬一小口<,>byte(n.字节)/bit(n.一点)/bait(n.诱饵)  

gift<,>/ɡɪft/<,>/ɡɪft/<,>n.礼物/n.天赋<,>She received a beautiful gift for her birthday.<,>她收到了一份漂亮的生日礼物。<,>He has a natural gift for music.<,>他有音乐天赋。<,>The scholarship was a gift that changed her life.<,>奖学金是改变她人生的馈赠。<,>gif(给予)+t→给予的东西→礼物<,>present(n.礼物)/talent(n.才能)/grant(v.授予)  

bullet<,>/ˈbʊlɪt/<,>/ˈbʊlɪt/<,>n.子弹/n.弹丸<,>The bullet missed the target by inches.<,>子弹差几英寸就击中目标了。<,>He loaded the gun with six bullets.<,>他给枪装了六发子弹。<,>Bullet points make the presentation clearer.<,>项目符号使演示更清晰。<,>bull(球)+et(小)→小球状物→子弹<,>ballot(n.选票)/pellet(n.小球)/billet(n.短棍)  

history<,>/ˈhɪstri/<,>/ˈhɪstəri/<,>n.历史/n.个人经历<,>We studied ancient history in school.<,>我们在学校学习了古代史。<,>His medical history was carefully reviewed.<,>他的病历被仔细查阅。<,>She made history as the first female CEO.<,>她作为首位女性CEO创造了历史。<,>his(他的)+story(故事)→他的故事→历史<,>story(n.故事)/historian(n.历史学家)/historical(adj.历史的)  

list<,>/lɪst/<,>/lɪst/<,>n.目录/v.列举<,>Make a shopping list before going to the store.<,>去商店前列个购物清单。<,>The book lists all the endangered species.<,>这本书列出了所有濒危物种。<,>Her name was on the guest list.<,>她的名字在宾客名单上。<,>lis(线)+t→成行的项目→列表<,>lust(n.欲望)/last(adj.最后的)/lost(adj.丢失的)  

behave<,>/bɪˈheɪv/<,>/bɪˈheɪv/<,>v.表现/v.举止<,>Children should behave properly in public.<,>孩子在公共场合应该举止得体。<,>The material behaves differently under heat.<,>这种材料在受热时表现不同。<,>How did the new employee behave during the meeting?<,>新员工在会议中表现如何？<,>be(使)+have(有)→使自己有(规矩)→表现<,>behavior(n.行为)/behalf(n.代表)/haven(n.避难所)  

new<,>/njuː/<,>/nuː/<,>adj.新的/adj.新近出现的<,>She bought a new dress for the party.<,>她为聚会买了条新裙子。<,>This technology is new to the market.<,>这项技术对市场来说是新的。<,>He made new friends at the conference.<,>他在会议上结识了新朋友。<,>new(新)→与"knew(v.知道)"对比记忆<,>knew(v.知道)/now(adv.现在)/news(n.新闻)  

van<,>/væn/<,>/væn/<,>n.大篷车/n.运货车<,>The band traveled in a tour van.<,>乐队乘坐巡演大篷车旅行。<,>Delivery vans are common in the city.<,>送货货车在城市里很常见。<,>They converted an old van into a camper.<,>他们把旧货车改装成了露营车。<,>van(前)→前面有空间的车辆→货车<,>can(aux.能)/fan(n.风扇)/pan(n.平底锅)  

amount<,>/əˈmaʊnt/<,>/əˈmaʊnt/<,>n.总数/n.数量<,>The amount of rainfall this year is unusual.<,>今年的降雨量很不寻常。<,>She donated a large amount to charity.<,>她向慈善机构捐了一大笔钱。<,>No amount of money can buy happiness.<,>再多的钱也买不到幸福。<,>a(到)+mount(山)→达到山顶→总计<,>mount(v.爬上)/account(n.账户)/paramount(adj.最重要的)
calculate<,>/ˈkælkjuleɪt/<,>/ˈkælkjəˌleɪt/<,>v.计算/v.估计<,>Scientists calculate the distance between stars.<,>科学家计算恒星之间的距离。<,>We need to calculate the budget carefully.<,>我们需要仔细估算预算。<,>He calculated the risk before making the decision.<,>他在做决定前估算了风险。<,>calcul(计算)+ate(动词后缀)→计算<,>calculator(n.计算器)/formulate(v.规划)/speculate(v.推测)  

generous<,>/ˈdʒenərəs/<,>/ˈdʒɛnərəs/<,>adj.慷慨的/adj.宽厚的<,>She gave a generous donation to the charity.<,>她向慈善机构慷慨捐赠。<,>He has a generous heart and always helps others.<,>他心胸宽广，总是帮助他人。<,>The boss is generous with employee benefits.<,>老板在员工福利方面很慷慨。<,>gener(产生)+ous(多)→产生很多→慷慨的<,>genius(n.天才)/genuine(adj.真正的)/general(adj.普遍的)  

conventional<,>/kənˈvenʃənl/<,>/kənˈvɛnʃənl/<,>adj.普通的/adj.习惯的<,>This is a conventional method of teaching.<,>这是一种传统的教学方法。<,>She prefers conventional medicine over alternative therapies.<,>她更喜欢常规药物而非替代疗法。<,>His views are quite conventional.<,>他的观点相当保守。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ion+al→大家共同遵循的→惯例的<,>convenient(adj.方便的)/invention(n.发明)/prevention(n.预防)  

early<,>/ˈɜːli/<,>/ˈɜrli/<,>adv.早/adj.早的/adj.早期的<,>Birds sing early in the morning.<,>鸟儿清晨早早鸣叫。<,>She is an early riser.<,>她是个早起的人。<,>We visited the museum in the early afternoon.<,>我们在午后早些时候参观了博物馆。<,>ear(耳朵)+ly→用耳朵听清晨的声音→早的<,>earn(v.赚取)/pearly(adj.珍珠般的)/yearly(adj.每年的)  

number<,>/ˈnʌmbə(r)/<,>/ˈnʌmbər/<,>n.数字/n.号码<,>Write down your phone number here.<,>在这里写下你的电话号码。<,>The number of participants is limited.<,>参与者人数有限。<,>She has a lucky number.<,>她有一个幸运数字。<,>numb(麻木)+er→数字多到让人麻木→数字<,>numerous(adj.许多的)/numeral(n.数字)/numb(adj.麻木的)  

hint<,>/hɪnt/<,>/hɪnt/<,>n.暗示/n.建议<,>She gave me a hint about the surprise party.<,>她向我暗示了惊喜派对的事。<,>There was a hint of sadness in his voice.<,>他声音中有一丝悲伤。<,>Can you give me a hint to solve this riddle?<,>你能给我提示解这个谜语吗？<,>hin(看作hin"后")+t→在后面悄悄说→暗示<,>hunt(v.狩猎)/hent(n.柄)/hinter(n.暗示者)  

fashionable<,>/ˈfæʃnəbl/<,>/ˈfæʃənəbəl/<,>adj.流行的/adj.时髦的<,>This dress is very fashionable this season.<,>这条裙子本季非常流行。<,>They live in a fashionable neighborhood.<,>他们住在时髦的社区。<,>Wearing sunglasses indoors is not fashionable.<,>在室内戴太阳镜并不时髦。<,>fashion(时尚)+able(可…的)→时尚的<,>passionable(adj.充满激情的)/mashable(adj.可捣碎的)/flashable(adj.可刷新的)  

tolerate<,>/ˈtɒləreɪt/<,>/ˈtɑːləreɪt/<,>v.忍受/v.容忍/v.宽恕<,>I can't tolerate loud noises at night.<,>我无法忍受夜晚的噪音。<,>The plant can tolerate drought conditions.<,>这种植物能耐旱。<,>We should tolerate different opinions.<,>我们应该容忍不同意见。<,>toler(容忍)+ate(动词后缀)→容忍<,>tolerance(n.宽容)/intolerable(adj.无法忍受的)/tolerable(adj.可容忍的)  

condense<,>/kənˈdens/<,>/kənˈdɛns/<,>v.压缩/v.使缩短<,>The report was condensed into two pages.<,>报告被压缩成两页。<,>Steam condenses into water when cooled.<,>蒸汽冷却时凝结成水。<,>He condensed his speech for the time limit.<,>由于时间限制他缩短了演讲。<,>con(共同)+dense(密集)→使一起变密集→压缩<,>dense(adj.密集的)/condenser(n.冷凝器)/condescend(v.屈尊)  

technician<,>/tekˈnɪʃn/<,>/tɛkˈnɪʃən/<,>n.技术员/n.技师<,>The technician repaired my computer quickly.<,>技术员很快修好了我的电脑。<,>She works as a laboratory technician.<,>她是一名实验室技术员。<,>We need an experienced technician for this job.<,>我们需要有经验的技师来做这项工作。<,>techn(技术)+ician(人)→技术专业人员<,>technique(n.技术)/technical(adj.技术的)/technocracy(n.技术统治)
flash<,>/flæʃ/<,>/flæʃ/<,>n.闪光/v.闪/v.闪烁<,>The lightning flash illuminated the night sky.<,>闪电的光芒照亮了夜空。<,>She flashed a smile at the audience.<,>她向观众露出一个灿烂的笑容。<,>The camera flash was too bright.<,>相机的闪光灯太亮了。<,>fl(飞)+ash(灰)→像飞灰一样转瞬即逝→闪光<,>flesh(n.肉)/flush(v.冲洗)/slash(v.砍)  

flour<,>/ˈflaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈflaʊər/<,>n.面粉/n.粉/n.粉状物质<,>She sifted the flour before baking.<,>她在烘焙前筛了面粉。<,>The recipe calls for two cups of flour.<,>食谱需要两杯面粉。<,>Dust the surface with flour to prevent sticking.<,>撒些面粉防粘。<,>flour(flower花)→面粉像花瓣一样细腻<,>flower(n.花)/floor(n.地板)/flour(古语"花")  

catch<,>/kætʃ/<,>/kætʃ/<,>v.捉住/v.赶上/v.领会<,>The cat tried to catch the mouse.<,>猫试图捉住老鼠。<,>Hurry up to catch the last train.<,>快赶末班车。<,>I didn't catch your meaning.<,>我没听懂你的意思。<,>cat(猫)+ch→猫抓老鼠的动作<,>match(n.比赛)/patch(n.补丁)/hatch(v.孵化)  

purple<,>/ˈpɜːpl/<,>/ˈpɜːrpl/<,>n.紫色/adj.紫的<,>She wore a beautiful purple dress.<,>她穿了条漂亮的紫色连衣裙。<,>The sunset turned the sky purple.<,>夕阳把天空染成紫色。<,>Purple symbolizes royalty in some cultures.<,>紫色在某些文化象征王权。<,>pur(纯)+ple(plethora过量)→纯粹的浓郁色彩<,>pebble(n.鹅卵石)/pepper(n.胡椒)/pimple(n.痘痘)  

feed<,>/fiːd/<,>/fiːd/<,>v.喂/v.吃饲料<,>Remember to feed the dog twice a day.<,>记得每天喂狗两次。<,>Cows feed mainly on grass.<,>牛主要以草为食。<,>This river feeds into the Pacific Ocean.<,>这条河注入太平洋。<,>fee(费)+d(的)→喂养需要花费的<,>feel(v.感觉)/flee(v.逃跑)/seed(n.种子)  

league<,>/liːɡ/<,>/liːɡ/<,>n.联合会/n.同盟<,>He plays in the premier league.<,>他在顶级联赛踢球。<,>The nations formed a defense league.<,>这些国家组成了防御联盟。<,>She's in a league of her own.<,>她独树一帜。<,>lea(草地)+gue(谐音"哥")→草地上结盟的哥们<,>leak(v.泄漏)/leap(v.跳跃)/legume(n.豆类)  

exert<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːt/<,>/ɪɡˈzɜːrt/<,>v.运用/v.尽力<,>He exerted all his strength to move the rock.<,>他用尽全力搬动石头。<,>Don't exert pressure on children.<,>不要给孩子施加压力。<,>The medicine exerts a calming effect.<,>这药有镇定效果。<,>ex(出)+ert(插入)→把力量插进去<,>expert(n.专家)/exalt(v.提升)/exhale(v.呼气)  

finding<,>/ˈfaɪndɪŋ/<,>/ˈfaɪndɪŋ/<,>n.发现/n.调查结果<,>The research findings were published.<,>调查结果已发表。<,>Archaeologists announced a new finding.<,>考古学家宣布新发现。<,>The finding contradicts previous theories.<,>该发现与先前理论矛盾。<,>find(找)+ing(进行)→正在找到的东西<,>funding(n.资金)/founding(n.建立)/finer(adj.更好的)  

foreign<,>/ˈfɒrən/<,>/ˈfɔːrən/<,>adj.外国的/adj.外来的<,>She speaks three foreign languages.<,>她会说三门外语。<,>The policy restricts foreign investment.<,>该政策限制外资。<,>This plant is foreign to our region.<,>这种植物在我们地区是外来的。<,>for(为了)+eign(谐音"嗯")→为了(出国)嗯...<,>forfeit(v.丧失)/forego(v.放弃)/forge(v.锻造)  

shave<,>/ʃeɪv/<,>/ʃeɪv/<,>v.剃/v.刮<,>He shaves every morning.<,>他每天早晨刮胡子。<,>The barber will shave your beard.<,>理发师会帮你修面。<,>She accidentally shaved off her eyebrow.<,>她不小心刮掉了眉毛。<,>sha(杀)+ve(谐音"毛")→杀掉毛发<,>shove(v.推挤)/shame(n.羞愧)/shale(n.页岩)
assume<,>/əˈsjuːm/<,>/əˈsuːm/<,>v.假定/v.承担/v.呈现<,>We can't assume that everyone will agree.<,>我们不能假定所有人都会同意。<,>She will assume the role of CEO next month.<,>她下个月将担任CEO的职位。<,>The situation assumed a new level of complexity.<,>局势呈现出新的复杂性。<,>as(加强)+sume(拿)→拿住观点→假定<,>consume(v.消耗)/presume(v.假设)/resume(v.恢复)

response<,>/rɪˈspɒns/<,>/rɪˈspɑːns/<,>n.响应/n.作答/n.回答<,>He gave no response to my question.<,>他没有回答我的问题。<,>The emergency team was quick in their response.<,>应急小组反应迅速。<,>Her response to the criticism was measured.<,>她对批评的回应很谨慎。<,>re(回)+sponse(承诺)→回应承诺→回答<,>responsible(adj.负责的)/responsive(adj.反应迅速的)

refine<,>/rɪˈfaɪn/<,>/rɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.精炼/v.提纯<,>They refine crude oil into gasoline.<,>他们将原油精炼成汽油。<,>Her writing style has refined over the years.<,>她的写作风格这些年变得精炼了。<,>We need to refine our search criteria.<,>我们需要优化搜索条件。<,>re(再)+fine(好的)→再次变好→精炼<,>define(v.定义)/confine(v.限制)

following<,>/ˈfɒləʊɪŋ/<,>/ˈfɑːloʊɪŋ/<,>adj.接着的/adj.下列的<,>The following day was rainy.<,>第二天是雨天。<,>Please answer the following questions.<,>请回答下列问题。<,>He has a large following on social media.<,>他在社交媒体上有大量粉丝。<,>follow(跟随)+ing→接着的<,>follower(n.追随者)/hollow(adj.空心的)

play<,>/pleɪ/<,>/pleɪ/<,>v.玩/v.游戏/v.演奏<,>Children play in the park every afternoon.<,>孩子们每天下午在公园玩耍。<,>She plays the violin beautifully.<,>她小提琴拉得很美。<,>The team played defensively in the second half.<,>球队下半场采取防守策略。<,>pl(动作)+ay(场所)→在场所里动作→玩耍<,>player(n.玩家)/plate(n.盘子)

steamer<,>/ˈstiːmə(r)/<,>/ˈstiːmər/<,>n.轮船/n.汽船<,>The steamer departed at dawn.<,>汽船黎明时分启航。<,>We took a steamer across the lake.<,>我们乘汽船渡过湖泊。<,>Ancient steamers used coal as fuel.<,>古老的轮船以煤为燃料。<,>steam(蒸汽)+er(物)→用蒸汽驱动的船<,>steel(n.钢铁)/stream(n.溪流)

lump<,>/lʌmp/<,>/lʌmp/<,>n.团/n.块/n.肿块<,>There's a lump of sugar in my tea.<,>我茶里有块方糖。<,>She found a lump in her breast.<,>她发现乳房有个肿块。<,>The clay was formed into lumps.<,>黏土被捏成块状。<,>lum(光)+p→光下可见的突起物→肿块<,>bump(n.隆起)/plump(adj.丰满的)

prince<,>/prɪns/<,>/prɪns/<,>n.王子/n.亲王<,>The prince will inherit the throne.<,>王子将继承王位。<,>Prince William attended the ceremony.<,>威廉亲王出席了仪式。<,>He behaved like a prince at the party.<,>他在派对上举止像个王子。<,>prin(第一)+ce→第一等的人→王子<,>princess(n.公主)/price(n.价格)

formation<,>/fɔːˈmeɪʃn/<,>/fɔːrˈmeɪʃn/<,>n.形成/n.构成/n.形成物<,>Cloud formation indicates changing weather.<,>云的形成预示天气变化。<,>The team lined up in a 4-4-2 formation.<,>球队排成4-4-2阵型。<,>Rock formations in the canyon are spectacular.<,>峡谷里的岩层非常壮观。<,>form(形状)+ation→形成形状<,>information(n.信息)/reformation(n.改革)

inward<,>/ˈɪnwəd/<,>/ˈɪnwərd/<,>adj.内心的/adv.向内<,>She turned her attention inward.<,>她把注意力转向内心。<,>The door opens inward.<,>这门是向内开的。<,>His outward calm hid inward turmoil.<,>他外表的平静掩盖了内心的混乱。<,>in(内)+ward(方向)→向内的<,>outward(adj.向外的)/onward(adv.向前)
plentiful<,>/ˈplentɪfl/<,>/ˈplɛntɪfəl/<,>adj.丰富的/adj.富裕的<,>The region is plentiful in natural resources.<,>这个地区自然资源丰富。<,>She comes from a plentiful family.<,>她出身于一个富裕的家庭。<,>The harvest was plentiful this year.<,>今年丰收了。<,>plenty(大量)+ful(形容词后缀)→大量的→丰富的<,>plenteous(adj.丰富的)/bountiful(adj.慷慨的)  

mutual<,>/ˈmjuːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈmjutʃuəl/<,>adj.相互的/adj.共同的<,>Their mutual respect strengthened their friendship.<,>他们相互尊重，增进了友谊。<,>We have mutual interests in art.<,>我们在艺术方面有共同的兴趣。<,>The agreement was for mutual benefit.<,>这份协议是为了双方互利。<,>mut(改变)+ual→彼此改变适应→相互的<,>reciprocal(adj.互惠的)/common(adj.共有的)  

insurance<,>/ɪnˈʃʊərəns/<,>/ɪnˈʃʊrəns/<,>n.保险/n.保险费<,>He bought travel insurance before the trip.<,>他在旅行前购买了旅游保险。<,>The insurance covers fire damage.<,>这份保险涵盖火灾损失。<,>She pays her car insurance monthly.<,>她按月支付汽车保险费。<,>insure(投保)+ance(名词后缀)→保险<,>assurance(n.保证)/coverage(n.保险范围)  

humorous<,>/ˈhjuːmərəs/<,>/ˈhjumərəs/<,>adj.富于幽默的/adj.诙谐的<,>His humorous speech made everyone laugh.<,>他幽默的演讲逗笑了所有人。<,>She has a humorous way of telling stories.<,>她讲故事的方式很诙谐。<,>The movie is full of humorous scenes.<,>这部电影充满了幽默场景。<,>humor(幽默)+ous(形容词后缀)→幽默的<,>witty(adj.机智幽默的)/comical(adj.滑稽的)  

dissolve<,>/dɪˈzɒlv/<,>/dɪˈzɑːlv/<,>v.使溶解/v.解散<,>Salt dissolves easily in water.<,>盐易溶于水。<,>The assembly dissolved after the vote.<,>投票后议会解散了。<,>Sugar will dissolve faster in hot tea.<,>糖在热茶中溶解更快。<,>dis(分开)+solve(解决)→分解→溶解<,>melt(v.融化)/disperse(v.分散)  

prior<,>/ˈpraɪə(r)/<,>/ˈpraɪɚ/<,>adj.在先的/adj.优先的<,>Prior knowledge is required for this course.<,>这门课程需要先修知识。<,>She had a prior engagement that day.<,>她那天有约在先。<,>Safety must take prior consideration.<,>安全必须优先考虑。<,>pri(前)+or→在前的<,>previous(adj.先前的)/preceding(adj.前面的)  

farther<,>/ˈfɑːðə(r)/<,>/ˈfɑrðɚ/<,>adv.更远地/adj.更远的<,>We walked farther than planned.<,>我们走得比计划更远。<,>The farther shore was barely visible.<,>对岸几乎看不见。<,>His house is farther from the school.<,>他家离学校更远。<,>far(远)+ther(比较级)→更远<,>further(adv.进一步)/farthest(adj.最远的)  

liner<,>/ˈlaɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈlaɪnɚ/<,>n.班船/n.班机<,>The ocean liner will depart at noon.<,>这艘远洋班轮将在中午启航。<,>We took a luxury liner to Hawaii.<,>我们乘豪华班机去夏威夷。<,>This liner operates weekly between the two cities.<,>这趟班船每周在两城间往返一次。<,>line(航线)+er(物)→班机/班船<,>ferry(n.渡轮)/cruise(n.游轮)  

mist<,>/mɪst/<,>/mɪst/<,>n.薄雾<,>The morning mist covered the valley.<,>晨雾笼罩着山谷。<,>Her glasses fogged up in the mist.<,>她的眼镜在雾气中起雾了。<,>A light mist was falling over the lake.<,>湖面飘着蒙蒙薄雾。<,>联想miss(错过)+t→薄雾让人看不清易错过<,>fog(n.浓雾)/haze(n.霾)  

abuse<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>/əˈbjus/<,>v.滥用/v.虐待/n.滥用<,>He abused his power as a manager.<,>他滥用经理职权。<,>Child abuse is a serious crime.<,>虐待儿童是严重罪行。<,>Drug abuse can ruin lives.<,>滥用药物会毁掉人生。<,>ab(偏离)+use(使用)→不正常使用→滥用<,>misuse(v.误用)/accuse(v.指控)
exceedingly<,>/ɪkˈsiːdɪŋli/<,>/ɪkˈsiːdɪŋli/<,>adv.极端地/adv.非常<,>The weather was exceedingly hot last summer.<,>去年夏天天气极其炎热。<,>She was exceedingly kind to everyone she met.<,>她对遇到的每个人都极为友善。<,>His performance was exceedingly good.<,>他的表现非常出色。<,>exceed(超过)+ing+ly→超出一般地→非常<,>excessively(adv.过度地)/extremely(adv.极其)  

coil<,>/kɔɪl/<,>/kɔɪl/<,>n.(一)卷/n.线圈/v.卷<,>She coiled her hair into a bun.<,>她把头发盘成一个发髻。<,>The snake coiled around the branch.<,>蛇缠绕在树枝上。<,>There was a coil of rope on the deck.<,>甲板上有一卷绳子。<,>联想：oil(油)→线圈需要润滑油才能顺畅转动<,>curl(v.卷曲)/spiral(n.螺旋)  

foundation<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃn/<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃn/<,>n.基础/n.地基/n.基金<,>The foundation of the building is very solid.<,>这座建筑的地基非常坚固。<,>She works for a charitable foundation.<,>她为一家慈善基金会工作。<,>This theory lacks a scientific foundation.<,>这个理论缺乏科学基础。<,>found(建立)+ation→建立的基础<,>fundament(n.基础)/fund(n.资金)  

wit<,>/wɪt/<,>/wɪt/<,>n.智力/n.才智/n.智能<,>He's a man of great wit and humor.<,>他是个机智幽默的人。<,>The play was full of sparkling wit.<,>这部戏剧充满了妙语连珠。<,>She had the wit to call for help immediately.<,>她机智地立即呼救。<,>联想：wit→win it(赢得它)→靠才智赢得<,>wisdom(n.智慧)/intelligence(n.智力)  

spin<,>/spɪn/<,>/spɪn/<,>v.使旋转/v.纺/n.旋转<,>The dancer spun around gracefully.<,>舞者优雅地旋转着。<,>She spins wool into yarn.<,>她把羊毛纺成纱线。<,>The car went into a spin on the icy road.<,>汽车在结冰的路面上打滑旋转。<,>联想：pin(针)→纺纱需要针<,>twirl(v.快速旋转)/rotate(v.旋转)  

noise<,>/nɔɪz/<,>/nɔɪz/<,>n.喧闹声/n.响声/n.噪声<,>The noise from the construction site was unbearable.<,>建筑工地的噪音让人难以忍受。<,>She could hear a strange noise in the attic.<,>她听到阁楼里有奇怪的响声。<,>Don't make so much noise when others are sleeping.<,>别人睡觉时不要这么吵闹。<,>联想：nose(鼻子)→噪音刺鼻<,>sound(n.声音)/voice(n.嗓音)  

anticipate<,>/ænˈtɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/ænˈtɪsəˌpeɪt/<,>v.预料/v.预期/v.期望<,>We didn't anticipate so many people coming.<,>我们没预料到会来这么多人。<,>She anticipated his question by preparing answers in advance.<,>她提前准备好答案，预见到了他的问题。<,>I'm anticipating a promotion this year.<,>我期待今年能升职。<,>anti(前)+cip(拿)+ate→提前拿→预料<,>expect(v.期待)/predict(v.预测)  

masterpiece<,>/ˈmɑːstəpiːs/<,>/ˈmæstərpiːs/<,>n.杰作/n.名著<,>Mona Lisa is considered da Vinci's masterpiece.<,>《蒙娜丽莎》被认为是达·芬奇的杰作。<,>This novel is a masterpiece of modern literature.<,>这部小说是现代文学的杰作。<,>The symphony was the composer's final masterpiece.<,>这首交响曲是作曲家的最后杰作。<,>master(大师)+piece(作品)→大师的作品<,>masterwork(n.杰作)/magnum opus(n.代表作)  

illustration<,>/ˌɪləˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪləˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.说明/n.图解/n.例证<,>The book contains many beautiful illustrations.<,>这本书里有许多精美的插图。<,>He gave an illustration of how the machine works.<,>他举例说明了机器的工作原理。<,>This case serves as an illustration of the problem.<,>这个案例可以作为问题的例证。<,>illustrate(说明)+ion→说明<,>demonstration(n.示范)/example(n.例子)  

recent<,>/ˈriːsnt/<,>/ˈriːsənt/<,>adj.新近的/adj.最近的<,>In recent years, technology has advanced rapidly.<,>近年来，技术发展迅速。<,>This is a photograph of my recent vacation.<,>这是我最近度假的照片。<,>Have you read his recent articles?<,>你读过他最近的文章吗？<,>re(再)+cent(百)→百年一遇→最近的<,>current(adj.当前的)/modern(adj.现代的)
laundry<,>/ˈlɔːndri/<,>/ˈlɔːndri/<,>n.洗衣房/n.洗衣店<,>I need to do my laundry this weekend.<,>这个周末我需要洗衣服。<,>She works at a laundry near the train station.<,>她在火车站附近的一家洗衣店工作。<,>The hotel offers laundry services for guests.<,>酒店为客人提供洗衣服务。<,>laun(洗)+dry(干)→洗衣后烘干→洗衣房<,>launch(v.发射/n.下水)/lounge(n.休息厅/v.闲逛)  

compute<,>/kəmˈpjuːt/<,>/kəmˈpjut/<,>v.计算/v.估计/v.估算<,>Scientists computed the trajectory of the rocket.<,>科学家计算了火箭的轨迹。<,>It's hard to compute the exact cost without more data.<,>没有更多数据很难估算出确切成本。<,>The software can compute complex equations in seconds.<,>这个软件能在几秒内完成复杂计算。<,>com(共同)+put(思考)+e→共同思考→计算<,>computer(n.计算机)/repute(n.名誉/v.认为)/dispute(v.争论/n.纠纷)  

difficulty<,>/ˈdɪfɪkəlti/<,>/ˈdɪfɪˌkʌlti/<,>n.困难/n.难事/n.困境<,>She overcame great difficulty to learn English.<,>她克服了巨大困难学习英语。<,>The climbers faced technical difficulties on the mountain.<,>登山者在山上遇到技术性难题。<,>Financial difficulties forced him to sell his house.<,>经济困境迫使他卖掉房子。<,>dif(不)+ficul(做)+ty(名词后缀)→难做的事→困难<,>different(adj.不同的)/deficit(n.赤字)/efficiency(n.效率)  

representative<,>/ˌreprɪˈzentətɪv/<,>/ˌrɛprɪˈzɛntətɪv/<,>adj.代表性的/n.代表<,>This painting is representative of his early style.<,>这幅画代表了他早期的风格。<,>We elected a new student representative yesterday.<,>我们昨天选出了新的学生代表。<,>The survey used a representative sample of the population.<,>调查使用了具有代表性的人口样本。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)+ative→再次呈现的人→代表<,>presentation(n.展示)/resident(n.居民)/repetitive(adj.重复的)  

electricity<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɪsəti/<,>/ɪˌlɛkˈtrɪsɪti/<,>n.电/n.电学/n.电流<,>The storm caused an electricity outage in the whole city.<,>暴风雨导致全市停电。<,>He studies electricity and magnetism at university.<,>他在大学研究电学和磁学。<,>Static electricity made her hair stand on end.<,>静电让她的头发竖了起来。<,>electr(电的)+icity(状态)→电的状态→电<,>electronic(adj.电子的)/electric(adj.电动的)/eccentric(adj.古怪的)  

past<,>/pɑːst/<,>/pæst/<,>adj.过去的/n.过去<,>In past years, this river was much cleaner.<,>过去几年这条河干净得多。<,>We can't change the past, but we can shape the future.<,>我们无法改变过去，但能塑造未来。<,>She walked past the store without noticing it.<,>她走过商店却没注意到它。<,>pas(通过)+t→已经通过的时间→过去<,>pass(v.通过)/paste(n.糨糊)/pasta(n.意大利面)  

alloy<,>/ˈælɔɪ/<,>/ˈælɔɪ/<,>n.合金/n.(金属的)成色<,>Steel is an alloy of iron and carbon.<,>钢是铁和碳的合金。<,>The ring is made of a gold-silver alloy.<,>这枚戒指由金银合金制成。<,>They tested the alloy's resistance to corrosion.<,>他们测试了这种合金的抗腐蚀性。<,>al(加强)+loy(绑)→金属绑定在一起→合金<,>ally(n.盟友/v.结盟)/annoy(v.惹恼)/allot(v.分配)  

temple<,>/ˈtempl/<,>/ˈtɛmpəl/<,>n.圣堂/n.神殿/n.庙宇<,>The ancient temple was discovered in the jungle.<,>这座古老神庙在丛林中被发现。<,>We visited the Temple of Heaven in Beijing.<,>我们参观了北京的天坛。<,>Buddhist temples often have intricate carvings.<,>佛教寺庙常有精美的雕刻。<,>tem(切割)+ple→划出的神圣区域→庙宇<,>tempo(n.节奏)/tempt(v.引诱)/temper(n.脾气)  

feast<,>/fiːst/<,>/fist/<,>n.盛宴/n.筵席/n.节日<,>The wedding feast lasted until midnight.<,>婚宴持续到午夜。<,>Christmas is a feast celebrated worldwide.<,>圣诞节是全球庆祝的节日。<,>They prepared a feast for the returning heroes.<,>他们为归来的英雄准备了盛宴。<,>fea(做)+st→做很多食物→盛宴<,>festival(n.节日)/beast(n.野兽)/least(adj.最少的)  

invitation<,>/ˌɪnvɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnvɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.邀请/n.招待/n.请柬<,>I received an invitation to the art exhibition.<,>我收到了艺术展的邀请函。<,>The golden ticket was an invitation to the chocolate factory.<,>金券是参观巧克力工厂的邀请。<,>She declined the invitation politely.<,>她礼貌地拒绝了邀请。<,>in(向内)+vit(生命)+ation→注入活力的请求→邀请<,>investigate(v.调查)/invent(v.发明)/invisible(adj.隐形的)
group<,>/ɡruːp/<,>/ɡrup/<,>n.小组/n.群/v.聚集<,>She joined a study group to prepare for the exam.<,>她加入了一个学习小组来备考。<,>The birds grouped together on the wire.<,>鸟儿们在电线上聚集成群。<,>We need to group these items by category.<,>我们需要按类别将这些物品分组。<,>gr(ground)+oup(看作oup汤)→一群人围坐喝汤→小组<,>grope(v.摸索)/grope(n.摸索)/troop(n.军队)  

visual<,>/ˈvɪʒ.u.əl/<,>/ˈvɪʒ.u.əl/<,>adj.视觉的/adj.视力的<,>The film has stunning visual effects.<,>这部电影有令人惊叹的视觉效果。<,>She has good visual memory.<,>她有良好的视觉记忆力。<,>This chart provides a visual representation of the data.<,>这张图表提供了数据的可视化呈现。<,>vis(看)+ual(形容词后缀)→视觉的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/auditory(adj.听觉的)/tactile(adj.触觉的)  

atmospheric<,>/ˌæt.məsˈfer.ɪk/<,>/ˌæt.məsˈfɛr.ɪk/<,>adj.大气的/adj.大气层的<,>The atmospheric pressure is dropping.<,>大气压正在下降。<,>This song has an atmospheric quality.<,>这首歌很有氛围感。<,>Scientists study atmospheric conditions.<,>科学家研究大气状况。<,>atmo(空气)+sphere(球体)+ic→大气层的<,>cosmic(adj.宇宙的)/hydrospheric(adj.水圈的)/lithospheric(adj.岩石圈的)  

annual<,>/ˈæn.ju.əl/<,>/ˈæn.ju.əl/<,>adj.每年的/n.年报<,>We hold an annual meeting in December.<,>我们每年十二月召开年会。<,>The plant is an annual that blooms in summer.<,>这种植物是夏季开花的一年生植物。<,>Check the company's annual for financial data.<,>查看公司年报获取财务数据。<,>ann(年)+ual(形容词后缀)→每年的<,>annuity(n.年金)/biannual(adj.一年两次的)/perennial(adj.多年生的)  

stranger<,>/ˈstreɪn.dʒər/<,>/ˈstreɪn.dʒɚ/<,>n.陌生人/n.新来者<,>Don't talk to strangers on the street.<,>不要和街上的陌生人说话。<,>He was a stranger in the big city.<,>在这座大城市里他是个新来者。<,>The kind stranger helped me with directions.<,>好心的陌生人帮我指了路。<,>strange(陌生)+er(人)→陌生人<,>foreigner(n.外国人)/wanderer(n.流浪者)/passenger(n.乘客)  

present<,>/ˈprez.ənt/<,>/ˈprɛz.ənt/<,>adj.现在的/n.目前<,>Be fully present in the moment.<,>要完全活在当下。<,>The present situation requires immediate action.<,>当前形势需要立即采取行动。<,>At present, we have no vacancies.<,>目前我们没有空缺职位。<,>pre(前)+sent(存在)→现在存在的→目前的<,>presence(n.存在)/present(v.呈现/n.礼物)/absent(adj.缺席的)  

frog<,>/frɒɡ/<,>/frɑːɡ/<,>n.蛙<,>A frog jumped into the pond.<,>一只青蛙跳进了池塘。<,>We dissected a frog in biology class.<,>我们在生物课上解剖了一只青蛙。<,>The frog's croak echoed in the night.<,>青蛙的叫声在夜晚回荡。<,>fr(看作free自由)+og(看作dog狗)→像狗一样自由跳的动物→蛙<,>fog(n.雾)/frug(adj.节俭的)/frock(n.连衣裙)  

music<,>/ˈmjuː.zɪk/<,>/ˈmju.zɪk/<,>n.音乐/n.乐曲/n.乐谱<,>She listens to classical music every morning.<,>她每天早晨听古典音乐。<,>Can you read music?<,>你会看乐谱吗？<,>He composed beautiful music for the film.<,>他为这部电影创作了优美的乐曲。<,>Muse(缪斯女神)+ic→缪斯女神的艺术→音乐<,>musical(adj.音乐的)/museum(n.博物馆)/mosaic(n.马赛克)  

simply<,>/ˈsɪm.pli/<,>/ˈsɪm.pli/<,>adv.简单地/adv.朴素地<,>Just simply tell me the truth.<,>就简单地告诉我真相。<,>She dresses simply but elegantly.<,>她穿着朴素但优雅。<,>The instructions are simply written.<,>说明书写得很简单明了。<,>simple(简单的)+ly(副词后缀)→简单地<,>sample(n.样品)/simper(v.傻笑)/simplex(adj.单纯的)  

heart<,>/hɑːt/<,>/hɑːrt/<,>n.心/n.内心/n.勇气<,>Her heart was beating fast.<,>她的心跳得很快。<,>He has a kind heart.<,>他有一颗善良的心。<,>Don't lose heart, keep trying!<,>别灰心，继续努力！<,>hear(听)+t(谐音"它")→倾听它的跳动→心脏<,>hearth(n.炉床)/hearty(adj.衷心的)/hart(n.雄鹿)
substitute<,>/ˈsʌbstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈsʌbstɪtuːt/<,>n.代替人/v.用…代替<,>Tofu can be a great substitute for meat.<,>豆腐可以很好地代替肉类。<,>She substituted honey for sugar in the recipe.<,>她在食谱中用蜂蜜代替了糖。<,>No substitute can replace genuine friendship.<,>任何替代品都无法取代真正的友谊。<,>sub(替代)+stitute(站立)→替代者<,>institute(n.学院/v.建立)/constitute(v.组成/n.成分)  

easily<,>/ˈiːzɪli/<,>/ˈiːzəli/<,>adv.容易地<,>This puzzle can be easily solved.<,>这个谜题很容易解开。<,>She easily won the first prize.<,>她轻松赢得了第一名。<,>The app allows you to easily track expenses.<,>这个应用能让你轻松追踪开支。<,>easy(容易的)+ly(副词后缀)<,>eagerly(adv.热切地)/uneasily(adv.不安地)  

suspend<,>/səˈspend/<,>/səˈspɛnd/<,>v.吊/v.悬/v.推迟<,>A lamp was suspended from the ceiling.<,>一盏灯从天花板上垂下来。<,>The meeting was suspended due to power outage.<,>会议因停电被推迟。<,>He got suspended from school for a week.<,>他被停学一周。<,>sus(下)+pend(悬挂)→悬挂在下<,>append(v.附加)/depend(v.依赖)  

burn<,>/bɜːn/<,>/bɜːrn/<,>v.烧/v.燃烧/n.烧伤<,>Dry wood burns easily.<,>干木头容易燃烧。<,>She suffered minor burns while cooking.<,>她在做饭时受了轻微烧伤。<,>The candle burned all night.<,>蜡烛燃烧了一整夜。<,>联想：turn(转动)时火苗burn(燃烧)<,>born(adj.天生的)/burden(n.负担)  

workman<,>/ˈwɜːkmən/<,>/ˈwɜːrkmən/<,>n.工人/n.劳动者/n.工匠<,>The workman repaired the roof skillfully.<,>工匠熟练地修好了屋顶。<,>Every workman is proud of his craft.<,>每个工匠都为自己的手艺自豪。<,>Workmen installed new windows in the building.<,>工人们给大楼安装了新窗户。<,>work(工作)+man(人)<,>workforce(n.劳动力)/workplace(n.工作场所)  

leadership<,>/ˈliːdəʃɪp/<,>/ˈliːdərʃɪp/<,>n.领导<,>Her leadership inspired the whole team.<,>她的领导力激励了整个团队。<,>The company flourished under his leadership.<,>公司在他的领导下蓬勃发展。<,>Leadership requires both vision and courage.<,>领导力需要远见和勇气。<,>leader(领导者)+ship(表状态)→领导地位<,>fellowship(n.伙伴关系)/ownership(n.所有权)  

jealous<,>/ˈdʒeləs/<,>/ˈdʒɛləs/<,>adj.妒忌的<,>He felt jealous of his friend's success.<,>他对朋友的成功感到嫉妒。<,>The jealous boyfriend checked her messages.<,>善妒的男友检查了她的短信。<,>She gave him a jealous look.<,>她妒忌地看了他一眼。<,>谐音"嫉了死"→嫉妒到死<,>zealous(adj.热心的)/envious(adj.羡慕的)  

can<,>/kæn/<,>/kæn/<,>n.罐头/n.听头/n.容器<,>She opened a can of beans for dinner.<,>她开了一罐豆子当晚餐。<,>Paint cans were stacked in the garage.<,>车库堆放着油漆罐。<,>This can holds two liters of water.<,>这个容器能装两升水。<,>同音词：情态动词can(能)<,>pan(n.平底锅)/van(n.厢式货车)  

cotton<,>/ˈkɒtn/<,>/ˈkɑːtn/<,>n.棉/n.棉线/n.棉布<,>She prefers cotton clothes in summer.<,>夏天她更喜欢棉质衣服。<,>The quilt is filled with pure cotton.<,>被子里填充的是纯棉。<,>Cotton is grown extensively in this region.<,>这个地区广泛种植棉花。<,>谐音"扣疼"→棉扣子勒得疼<,>nylon(n.尼龙)/button(n.纽扣)  

European<,>/ˌjʊərəˈpiːən/<,>/ˌjʊrəˈpiːən/<,>adj.欧洲的/n.欧洲人<,>European culture is richly diverse.<,>欧洲文化丰富多样。<,>She married a European businessman.<,>她嫁给了一位欧洲商人。<,>The European Union has 27 member states.<,>欧盟有27个成员国。<,>Europe(欧洲)+an(表人或形容词后缀)<,>African(adj.非洲的/n.非洲人)/American(adj.美洲的/n.美洲人)
explain<,>/ɪkˈspleɪn/<,>/ɪkˈspleɪn/<,>v.解释/v.为…辩解<,>Can you explain how this machine works?<,>你能解释一下这台机器的工作原理吗？<,>She tried to explain her absence to the teacher.<,>她试图向老师解释她缺席的原因。<,>He explained the rules of the game clearly.<,>他清楚地解释了游戏规则。<,>ex(出)+plain(平的)→把意思平铺出来→解释<,>exclaim(v.呼喊)/explicit(adj.明确的)/explanation(n.解释)  

natural<,>/ˈnætʃrəl/<,>/ˈnætʃərəl/<,>adj.自然界的/adj.天然的<,>She has a natural talent for music.<,>她在音乐方面有天赋。<,>This park is a natural habitat for many birds.<,>这个公园是许多鸟类的自然栖息地。<,>We should use natural resources wisely.<,>我们应该明智地使用自然资源。<,>nat(出生)+ural(形容词后缀)→与生俱来的→自然的<,>neutral(adj.中立的)/nature(n.自然)/nurture(v.培育)  

clean<,>/kliːn/<,>/klin/<,>adj.清洁的/adj.纯洁的<,>Please keep your room clean and tidy.<,>请保持房间整洁。<,>He has a clean criminal record.<,>他没有犯罪记录。<,>The air is clean after the rain.<,>雨后的空气很清新。<,>cl(擦)+ean→擦干净→清洁的<,>clear(adj.清楚的)/cleans(v.清洁)/lean(v.倾斜)  

rebel<,>/ˈrebəl/<,>/ˈrɛbəl/<,>v.造反/n.造反者<,>The people rebelled against the unjust law.<,>人民反抗不公正的法律。<,>She was a rebel in her youth.<,>她年轻时是个叛逆者。<,>The rebel forces captured the city.<,>叛军占领了这座城市。<,>re(反)+bel(战争)→反战→造反<,>repel(v.击退)/revel(v.狂欢)/label(n.标签)  

enable<,>/ɪˈneɪbl/<,>/ɪˈneɪbəl/<,>v.使能够/v.使可能<,>This software enables users to edit videos easily.<,>这个软件使用户能够轻松编辑视频。<,>The scholarship enabled him to go to college.<,>奖学金使他能够上大学。<,>Good planning enables success.<,>好的计划有助于成功。<,>en(使)+able(能够)→使能够<,>unable(adj.不能的)/disable(v.使失去能力)/table(n.桌子)  

evident<,>/ˈevɪdənt/<,>/ˈɛvɪdənt/<,>adj.明显的/adj.明白的<,>It was evident that she was unhappy.<,>很明显她不高兴。<,>There is evident progress in his work.<,>他的工作有明显进步。<,>The damage to the car was evident.<,>汽车的损坏很明显。<,>e(出)+vid(看)+ent→能看出来的→明显的<,>evidence(n.证据)/evidently(adv.明显地)/provide(v.提供)  

rain<,>/reɪn/<,>/ren/<,>n.雨/n.雨水/v.下雨<,>Don't forget to take an umbrella in case it rains.<,>别忘了带伞以防下雨。<,>The rain lasted for three days.<,>雨持续了三天。<,>She likes walking in the rain.<,>她喜欢在雨中散步。<,>r(像雨滴形状)+ain→雨<,>rein(n.缰绳)/ruin(v.毁坏)/train(n.火车)  

management<,>/ˈmænɪdʒmənt/<,>/ˈmænɪdʒmənt/<,>n.管理/n.经营/n.处理<,>Good management is key to a company's success.<,>良好的管理是公司成功的关键。<,>She studies business management at university.<,>她在大学学习企业管理。<,>The management of time is important for students.<,>时间管理对学生很重要。<,>manage(管理)+ment(名词后缀)→管理<,>manager(n.经理)/mismanagement(n.管理不善)/engagement(n.订婚)  

eighth<,>/eɪtθ/<,>/etθ/<,>num.第八/n.八分之一<,>He finished in eighth place in the race.<,>他在比赛中获得第八名。<,>Cut the cake into eighths.<,>把蛋糕切成八份。<,>August is the eighth month of the year.<,>八月是一年中的第八个月。<,>eight(八)+th(序数词后缀)→第八<,>height(n.高度)/weight(n.重量)/faith(n.信仰)  

bread<,>/bred/<,>/brɛd/<,>n.面包/n.食物/n.粮食<,>She bought a loaf of bread from the bakery.<,>她从面包店买了一条面包。<,>Bread is a staple food in many countries.<,>面包是许多国家的主食。<,>He earns his bread as a teacher.<,>他靠当老师谋生。<,>b(像面包形状)+read(读)→边读边吃面包<,>breed(v.繁殖)/broad(adj.宽广的)/break(v.打破)
sorrow<,>/ˈsɒrəʊ/<,>/ˈsɑːroʊ/<,>n.悲痛/n.悲哀/n.悲伤<,>She felt deep sorrow after losing her pet.<,>失去宠物后她感到深深的悲痛。<,>His face was full of sorrow when he heard the news.<,>听到消息时他满脸悲伤。<,>The poem expresses the sorrow of unrequited love.<,>这首诗表达了单恋的悲哀。<,>sor(痛苦)+row(排)→排解痛苦→悲伤<,>borrow(v.借)/sorrowful(adj.悲伤的)  

cattle<,>/ˈkætl/<,>/ˈkætl/<,>n.牛/n.牲口/n.家畜<,>The cattle are grazing in the field.<,>牛群正在田野里吃草。<,>We raise cattle for both milk and meat.<,>我们饲养牛既为产奶也为吃肉。<,>The farmer vaccinated all his cattle yesterday.<,>昨天农夫给他所有的牛打了疫苗。<,>cat(猫)+tle→像猫一样温顺的动物→牛<,>battle(n.战斗)/kettle(n.水壶)  

inspect<,>/ɪnˈspekt/<,>/ɪnˈspekt/<,>v.检查/v.审查/v.检阅<,>The mechanic will inspect the car engine.<,>机械师将检查汽车发动机。<,>Customs officers inspected our luggage at the airport.<,>海关官员在机场检查了我们的行李。<,>The general inspected the troops before the parade.<,>将军在阅兵前检阅了部队。<,>in(内)+spect(看)→向内仔细看→检查<,>expect(v.期待)/respect(v.尊重)  

mental<,>/ˈmentl/<,>/ˈmentl/<,>adj.精神的/adj.智力的<,>She has excellent mental arithmetic skills.<,>她有出色的心算能力。<,>Playing chess is good for mental development.<,>下棋有益于智力发展。<,>He suffered from mental exhaustion after the exam.<,>考试后他精神疲惫。<,>ment(心智)+al(的)→心智的<,>metal(n.金属)/dental(adj.牙齿的)  

mushroom<,>/ˈmʌʃrʊm/<,>/ˈmʌʃruːm/<,>n.蘑菇/n.菌类植物<,>These wild mushrooms are poisonous.<,>这些野生蘑菇有毒。<,>Mushroom soup is her favorite dish.<,>蘑菇汤是她最爱的菜。<,>The startup grew like a mushroom after funding.<,>获得投资后这家初创公司迅速壮大。<,>mush(软块)+room(房间)→像小房间的软块→蘑菇<,>broom(n.扫帚)/groom(v.照料)  

review<,>/rɪˈvjuː/<,>/rɪˈvjuː/<,>v.再检查/n.复习<,>Let's review the lesson before the test.<,>考试前我们一起复习功课吧。<,>The manager will review your proposal tomorrow.<,>经理明天会审核你的提案。<,>I wrote a book review for the school magazine.<,>我为校刊写了书评。<,>re(再)+view(看)→反复看→复习<,>preview(v.预习)/interview(n.面试)  

beautiful<,>/ˈbjuːtɪfl/<,>/ˈbjuːtɪfl/<,>adj.美的/adj.美丽的<,>The sunset over the ocean was breathtakingly beautiful.<,>海上的日落美得令人窒息。<,>She wore a beautiful dress to the party.<,>她穿了条漂亮的裙子去参加派对。<,>This garden is beautiful in all seasons.<,>这个花园四季皆美。<,>beaut(美)+i+ful(充满)→充满美的<,>dutiful(adj.尽职的)/plentiful(adj.丰富的)  

descend<,>/dɪˈsend/<,>/dɪˈsend/<,>v.下来/v.下降/v.下倾<,>The airplane began to descend for landing.<,>飞机开始下降准备着陆。<,>We descended the mountain before sunset.<,>我们在日落前下了山。<,>She is descended from a noble family.<,>她出身贵族世家。<,>de(向下)+scend(爬)→向下爬→下降<,>ascend(v.上升)/transcend(v.超越)  

Fahrenheit<,>/ˈfærənhaɪt/<,>/ˈfærənhaɪt/<,>n.华氏温度<,>Water boils at 212 degrees Fahrenheit.<,>水在212华氏度时沸腾。<,>The thermometer shows 98.6°F, which is normal body temperature.<,>温度计显示98.6华氏度，这是正常体温。<,>Most Americans use the Fahrenheit scale.<,>大多数美国人使用华氏温标。<,>源自发明者Daniel Gabriel Fahrenheit的姓氏<,>Celsius(n.摄氏温度)/Kelvin(n.开尔文温标)  

freedom<,>/ˈfriːdəm/<,>/ˈfriːdəm/<,>n.自由/n.自主<,>The bird regained its freedom when we opened the cage.<,>我们打开笼子时，鸟儿重获自由。<,>Freedom of speech is a basic human right.<,>言论自由是基本人权。<,>Teenagers crave more freedom from their parents.<,>青少年渴望从父母那里获得更多自主权。<,>free(自由)+dom(状态)→自由状态<,>wisdom(n.智慧)/kingdom(n.王国)
grave<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>/ɡreɪv/<,>n.坟墓/adj.严重的<,>They visited their grandfather's grave.<,>他们去给祖父扫墓。<,>The situation is grave and requires immediate action.<,>情况严重，需要立即采取行动。<,>She spoke in a grave tone about the accident.<,>她用严肃的语气谈论这起事故。<,>grav(重)+e→沉重的→严重的<,>gravel(n.碎石)/brave(adj.勇敢的)/grieve(v.使悲伤)  

lumber<,>/ˈlʌmbə(r)/<,>/ˈlʌmbər/<,>n.木材/木料/制材<,>The truck was loaded with lumber for construction.<,>卡车上装满了建筑用的木材。<,>He works at a lumber yard.<,>他在一家木材场工作。<,>The old house has beautiful lumber floors.<,>这栋老房子有漂亮的木地板。<,>lumb(木头)+er→木材<,>slumber(n.睡眠)/plumber(n.水管工)/number(n.数字)  

encounter<,>/ɪnˈkaʊntə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkaʊntər/<,>v.遭遇/遇到/n.遭遇<,>They encountered many difficulties during the journey.<,>他们在旅途中遇到了许多困难。<,>Her encounter with the famous writer inspired her.<,>她与那位著名作家的相遇激励了她。<,>The soldiers prepared to encounter the enemy.<,>士兵们准备迎战敌人。<,>en(使)+counter(相反)→使相对→遭遇<,>count(v.计算)/account(n.账户)/discount(n.折扣)  

atmosphere<,>/ˈætməsfɪə(r)/<,>/ˈætməsfɪr/<,>n.气氛/大气/空气<,>The atmosphere in the room was tense.<,>房间里的气氛很紧张。<,>Earth's atmosphere protects us from harmful radiation.<,>地球的大气层保护我们免受有害辐射。<,>The restaurant has a romantic atmosphere.<,>这家餐厅氛围浪漫。<,>atmo(空气)+sphere(球体)→大气层<,>sphere(n.球体)/hemisphere(n.半球)/biosphere(n.生物圈)  

toe<,>/təʊ/<,>/toʊ/<,>n.脚趾/足尖<,>She stubbed her toe on the table leg.<,>她的脚趾撞到了桌腿。<,>He stood on his toes to reach the shelf.<,>他踮起脚去够架子。<,>The baby wiggled its tiny toes.<,>婴儿扭动着它的小脚趾。<,>发音类似"头"→脚趾是脚的"头"<,>tow(v.拖拽)/ton(n.吨)/toad(n.蟾蜍)  

touch<,>/tʌtʃ/<,>/tʌtʃ/<,>v.触摸/触动/感动/n.触<,>Don't touch the wet paint.<,>不要碰未干的油漆。<,>Her kindness touched his heart.<,>她的善良触动了他的心。<,>He felt a light touch on his shoulder.<,>他感觉到有人轻轻碰了他的肩膀。<,>tou(透)+ch(接触)→透过接触→触摸<,>tough(adj.坚韧的)/torch(n.火炬)/couch(n.沙发)  

troublesome<,>/ˈtrʌblsəm/<,>/ˈtrʌblsəm/<,>adj.令人烦恼的/麻烦的<,>This math problem is quite troublesome.<,>这道数学题相当麻烦。<,>He's a troublesome student who often breaks rules.<,>他是个经常违反纪律的麻烦学生。<,>The noise from construction is troublesome.<,>施工的噪音很烦人。<,>trouble(麻烦)+some(形容词后缀)→麻烦的<,>handsome(adj.英俊的)/lonesome(adj.孤独的)/wholesome(adj.有益健康的)  

congratulation<,>/kənˌɡrætʃuˈleɪʃn/<,>/kənˌɡrætʃəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.祝贺/祝贺词<,>Congratulations on your graduation!<,>祝贺你毕业！<,>They sent congratulations on our wedding.<,>他们为我们的婚礼发来了贺词。<,>He received congratulations from all his colleagues.<,>他收到了所有同事的祝贺。<,>con(共同)+grat(高兴)+ulation→共同高兴→祝贺<,>gratitude(n.感激)/graduate(v.毕业)/gratify(v.使满足)  

package<,>/ˈpækɪdʒ/<,>/ˈpækɪdʒ/<,>n.包裹/包/捆<,>I received a package from my friend.<,>我收到了朋友寄来的包裹。<,>The software comes in a complete package.<,>这个软件是完整套装。<,>She tied the package with a ribbon.<,>她用丝带捆扎包裹。<,>pack(打包)+age(名词后缀)→包裹<,>packet(n.小包)/page(n.页)/passage(n.通道)  

part<,>/pɑːt/<,>/pɑːrt/<,>n.一部分/零件<,>This is only part of the story.<,>这只是故事的一部分。<,>He ordered a replacement part for his car.<,>他为汽车订购了替换零件。<,>She played the part of Juliet in the play.<,>她在剧中扮演朱丽叶。<,>par(相等)+t→平等分割→部分<,>apart(adv.分开)/depart(v.离开)/impart(v.传授)
credit<,>/ˈkredɪt/<,>/ˈkrɛdɪt/<,>n.信用贷款/n.信用<,>He bought the car on credit.<,>他用信用贷款买了这辆车。<,>Her credit score is very high.<,>她的信用评分很高。<,>They gave him credit for his honesty.<,>他们因他的诚实而赞扬他。<,>cred(相信)+it→信任→信用<,>debit(n.借方)/creed(n.信条)/credible(adj.可信的)  

judge<,>/dʒʌdʒ/<,>/dʒʌdʒ/<,>n.法官/n.裁判员<,>The judge declared the verdict.<,>法官宣布了判决。<,>She will judge the singing competition.<,>她将担任歌唱比赛的评委。<,>Don't judge a book by its cover.<,>不要以貌取人。<,>jud(法律)+ge→执法者→法官<,>jury(n.陪审团)/justice(n.正义)/judicial(adj.司法的)  

original<,>/əˈrɪdʒənl/<,>/əˈrɪdʒənəl/<,>adj.最初的/adj.新颖的<,>This is the original manuscript.<,>这是原始手稿。<,>Her ideas are always original.<,>她的想法总是很有新意。<,>The painting is an original Picasso.<,>这幅画是毕加索的真迹。<,>origin(起源)+al→最初的<,>abnormal(adj.异常的)/oriental(adj.东方的)/originate(v.起源)  

decision<,>/dɪˈsɪʒn/<,>/dɪˈsɪʒən/<,>n.决定/n.决心/n.果断<,>She made a quick decision.<,>她迅速做出了决定。<,>It was a difficult decision to make.<,>这是个艰难的决定。<,>His decision saved the company.<,>他的果断挽救了公司。<,>de(强调)+cis(切)+ion→切断犹豫→决定<,>incision(n.切口)/precision(n.精确)/concise(adj.简明的)  

compose<,>/kəmˈpəʊz/<,>/kəmˈpoʊz/<,>v.创作/v.组成/v.构成<,>Mozart composed many symphonies.<,>莫扎特创作了许多交响曲。<,>Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.<,>水由氢和氧组成。<,>She composed herself before speaking.<,>她在发言前让自己镇定下来。<,>com(一起)+pose(放)→放到一起→组成<,>dispose(v.处理)/expose(v.暴露)/propose(v.提议)  

rag<,>/ræɡ/<,>/ræɡ/<,>n.破布/n.碎布/n.抹布<,>He cleaned the floor with a rag.<,>他用抹布擦了地板。<,>The flag was torn to rags.<,>旗帜被撕成了碎布。<,>She wore clothes made from rags.<,>她穿着用破布做的衣服。<,>联想：drag(拖)→破布总是被拖着用<,>rug(n.小地毯)/tag(n.标签)/rage(n.愤怒)  

satellite<,>/ˈsætəlaɪt/<,>/ˈsæt̬əlaɪt/<,>n.人造卫星/n.卫星<,>The satellite orbits the Earth.<,>这颗卫星绕地球运行。<,>They launched a communications satellite.<,>他们发射了一颗通信卫星。<,>Satellite TV offers many channels.<,>卫星电视提供许多频道。<,>satell(随从)+ite→地球的"随从"→卫星<,>planet(n.行星)/stellar(adj.恒星的)/astronaut(n.宇航员)  

transport<,>/trænˈspɔːt/<,>/ˈtrænspɔːrt/<,>v.运输/n.运输<,>The goods will be transported by truck.<,>货物将由卡车运输。<,>Public transport is convenient here.<,>这里的公共交通很方便。<,>The ship transports oil across the ocean.<,>这艘船运输石油横跨大洋。<,>trans(跨越)+port(港口)→跨越港口运输<,>import(v.进口)/export(v.出口)/portable(adj.便携的)  

drawing<,>/ˈdrɔːɪŋ/<,>/ˈdrɔɪŋ/<,>n.图画/n.素描/n.绘图<,>She showed me her latest drawing.<,>她给我看了她最新的画作。<,>Technical drawing requires precision.<,>技术绘图需要精确。<,>He took drawing lessons as a child.<,>他小时候上过素描课。<,>draw(画)+ing→绘画的结果→图画<,>painting(n.油画)/sketch(n.草图)/draft(n.草稿)  

protective<,>/prəˈtektɪv/<,>/prəˈtɛktɪv/<,>adj.保护的/adj.防护的<,>Wear protective gloves when handling chemicals.<,>处理化学品时要戴防护手套。<,>She has a protective attitude toward her brother.<,>她对弟弟有保护欲。<,>The vaccine provides protective immunity.<,>疫苗提供保护性免疫。<,>protect(保护)+ive→保护的<,>productive(adj.多产的)/predictive(adj.预测的)/perspective(n.观点)
ago<,>/əˈɡəʊ/<,>/əˈɡoʊ/<,>adv.以前<,>I met her three years ago.<,>我三年前见过她。<,>He left the company long ago.<,>他很久以前就离开了公司。<,>The event happened ages ago.<,>这件事发生在很久以前。<,>a(表时间)+go(走)→时间流逝→以前<,>before(adv. 以前)/after(adv. 以后)/since(conj. 自从)  

signature<,>/ˈsɪɡnətʃə(r)/<,>/ˈsɪɡnətʃər/<,>n.署名/n.签字/n.签名<,>Please put your signature on the dotted line.<,>请在虚线处签名。<,>His signature is hard to imitate.<,>他的签名很难模仿。<,>The contract requires two witnesses' signatures.<,>这份合同需要两位见证人签字。<,>sign(签字)+ature(名词后缀)→签名<,>autograph(n. 亲笔签名)/initial(n. 首字母签名)/endorse(v. 背书)  

primary<,>/ˈpraɪməri/<,>/ˈpraɪmeri/<,>adj.基本的/adj.最初的<,>The primary colors are red, blue and yellow.<,>原色是红、蓝、黄。<,>Her primary concern is the children's safety.<,>她最关心的是孩子们的安全。<,>This is the primary source of the problem.<,>这是问题的最初来源。<,>prim(第一)+ary(形容词后缀)→最初的<,>prime(adj. 主要的)/primitive(adj. 原始的)/preliminary(adj. 初步的)  

poem<,>/ˈpəʊɪm/<,>/ˈpoʊəm/<,>n.诗/n.韵文/n.诗体文<,>She recited a beautiful poem at the ceremony.<,>她在仪式上朗诵了一首美丽的诗。<,>This ancient poem has been passed down for centuries.<,>这首古诗已经流传了几个世纪。<,>He writes poems to express his feelings.<,>他写诗来表达情感。<,>poe(创作)+m(名词后缀)→创作的作品→诗<,>poetry(n. 诗歌总称)/prose(n. 散文)/verse(n. 诗句)  

hear<,>/hɪə(r)/<,>/hɪr/<,>v.听见/v.听说/v.审讯<,>Can you hear the birds singing?<,>你能听到鸟儿在唱歌吗？<,>I heard that you got a promotion.<,>我听说你升职了。<,>The judge will hear the case next week.<,>法官将于下周审理此案。<,>ear(耳朵)+h→用耳朵听<,>listen(v. 倾听)/overhear(v. 无意中听到)/hearing(n. 听力)  

overall<,>/ˌəʊvərˈɔːl/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈɔːl/<,>n.工装裤/adj.全面的<,>He wore blue overalls to work.<,>他穿着蓝色工装裤去工作。<,>The overall situation is improving.<,>整体情况正在改善。<,>We need to consider the overall costs.<,>我们需要考虑总体成本。<,>over(全部)+all(所有)→全面的<,>overcoat(n. 大衣)/overview(n. 概述)/overhead(adj. 头顶的)  

freely<,>/ˈfriːli/<,>/ˈfriːli/<,>adv.自由地/adv.直率地<,>You can speak freely here.<,>你可以在这里自由发言。<,>Money circulates freely in the market.<,>货币在市场上自由流通。<,>She gave freely to charity.<,>她慷慨地向慈善机构捐款。<,>free(自由的)+ly(副词后缀)→自由地<,>frankly(adv. 坦率地)/liberally(adv. 大方地)/boldly(adv. 大胆地)  

creature<,>/ˈkriːtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈkriːtʃər/<,>n.生物/n.动物<,>Dolphins are intelligent creatures.<,>海豚是聪明的生物。<,>Mythical creatures appear in many stories.<,>神话生物出现在许多故事中。<,>Every living creature needs water.<,>每个生物都需要水。<,>creat(创造)+ure(名词后缀)→被创造物→生物<,>creation(n. 创造物)/creator(n. 创造者)/critter(n. 生物，俚语)  

specify<,>/ˈspesɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈspesɪfaɪ/<,>v.详细说明/v.指定<,>Please specify your requirements clearly.<,>请明确说明你的要求。<,>The contract specifies the delivery date.<,>合同规定了交货日期。<,>He didn't specify which color he preferred.<,>他没有具体说明更喜欢哪种颜色。<,>speci(种类)+fy(使)→使明确种类→详细说明<,>special(adj. 特殊的)/specific(adj. 具体的)/specimen(n. 样本)  

combine<,>/kəmˈbaɪn/<,>/kəmˈbaɪn/<,>v.使结合/v.兼有<,>We need to combine theory with practice.<,>我们需要将理论与实践相结合。<,>The two companies combined last year.<,>这两家公司去年合并了。<,>This dish combines sweet and sour flavors.<,>这道菜结合了酸甜口味。<,>com(共同)+bine(捆绑)→绑在一起→结合<,>merge(v. 合并)/blend(v. 混合)/fuse(v. 熔合)
solar<,>/ˈsəʊlə(r)/<,>/ˈsoʊlər/<,>adj.太阳的/adj.日光的<,>Solar energy is a renewable resource.<,>太阳能是一种可再生资源。<,>They installed solar panels on the roof.<,>他们在屋顶安装了太阳能电池板。<,>The solar system consists of eight planets.<,>太阳系由八颗行星组成。<,>sol(太阳)+ar(形容词后缀)→太阳的<,>lunar(adj.月亮的)/polar(adj.极地的)  

sort<,>/sɔːt/<,>/sɔːrt/<,>n.种类/n.类别/v.整理<,>What sort of music do you like?<,>你喜欢哪种音乐？<,>She sorted the books by genre.<,>她按类型整理了书籍。<,>This is the sort of opportunity we need.<,>这正是我们需要的那种机会。<,>sor(种类)+t→种类<,>sore(adj.疼痛的)/port(n.港口)  

dishonour<,>/dɪsˈɒnə(r)/<,>/dɪsˈɑːnər/<,>n.不光彩/n.丢脸的人<,>His actions brought dishonour to the family.<,>他的行为给家族蒙羞。<,>Resigning would be a dishonour to his team.<,>辞职会让他的团队蒙羞。<,>They consider bankruptcy a dishonour.<,>他们认为破产是一种耻辱。<,>dis(否定)+honour(荣誉)→不光彩<,>honour(n.荣誉)/dishonest(adj.不诚实的)  

permit<,>/pəˈmɪt/<,>/pərˈmɪt/<,>v.允许/n.执照<,>Smoking is not permitted here.<,>此处禁止吸烟。<,>You need a permit to park in this area.<,>你需要许可证才能在这个区域停车。<,>The teacher permitted us to leave early.<,>老师允许我们提前离开。<,>per(通过)+mit(送)→允许通过<,>admit(v.承认)/submit(v.提交)  

magnificent<,>/mæɡˈnɪfɪsnt/<,>/mæɡˈnɪfɪsənt/<,>adj.壮丽的/adj.华丽的<,>The view from the mountain was magnificent.<,>从山上看到的景色非常壮丽。<,>She wore a magnificent gown to the ball.<,>她穿了一件华丽的礼服参加舞会。<,>The palace is a magnificent example of Baroque architecture.<,>这座宫殿是巴洛克建筑的华丽典范。<,>magn(大)+i+fic(做)+ent→做得很大→壮丽的<,>significant(adj.重要的)/munificent(adj.慷慨的)  

drift<,>/drɪft/<,>/drɪft/<,>v.漂流/v.漂泊/n.趋势/n.流动<,>The boat began to drift downstream.<,>船开始顺流而下。<,>He drifted from job to job for years.<,>他多年来漂泊不定地换工作。<,>There's a drift towards healthier eating habits.<,>有一种向更健康饮食习惯发展的趋势。<,>dri(滴落)+ft→像水滴一样流动→漂流<,>shift(v.移动)/gift(n.礼物)  

investigate<,>/ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt/<,>/ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt/<,>v.调查<,>The police are investigating the crime.<,>警方正在调查这起犯罪。<,>Scientists investigated the effects of the drug.<,>科学家们调查了这种药物的效果。<,>We need to investigate all possible options.<,>我们需要调查所有可能的选项。<,>in(进入)+vestig(足迹)+ate→追踪足迹→调查<,>invest(v.投资)/interrogate(v.审问)  

proper<,>/ˈprɒpə(r)/<,>/ˈprɑːpər/<,>adj.适合的/adj.合乎体统的<,>Wear proper attire for the interview.<,>面试时要穿合适的服装。<,>It's not proper to speak with your mouth full.<,>嘴里含着食物说话是不礼貌的。<,>This is the proper way to hold the tool.<,>这是使用这个工具的正确方式。<,>pro(向前)+per(每个)→每个都向前→合适的<,>property(n.财产)/prosper(v.繁荣)  

lame<,>/leɪm/<,>/leɪm/<,>adj.跛的/adj.瘸的/adj.残废的<,>The lame dog couldn't keep up with the others.<,>那只瘸腿的狗跟不上其他狗。<,>He walked with a lame leg after the accident.<,>事故后他走路一瘸一拐的。<,>That's a lame excuse for being late.<,>那个迟到的借口站不住脚。<,>la(拉)+me(我)→拉着我走→跛的<,>blame(v.责备)/flame(n.火焰)  

mechanical<,>/məˈkænɪkl/<,>/məˈkænɪkəl/<,>adj.机械的/adj.力学的<,>The toy has mechanical moving parts.<,>这个玩具有机械活动部件。<,>He has a very mechanical way of thinking.<,>他的思维方式非常机械。<,>Mechanical engineering is his field of study.<,>机械工程是他的研究领域。<,>mechan(机械)+ical(形容词后缀)→机械的<,>manual(adj.手工的)/medical(adj.医学的)
vital<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>adj.生命的/adj.有生命力的<,>The heart is a vital organ.<,>心脏是维持生命的器官。<,>She played a vital role in the project.<,>她在这个项目中发挥了关键作用。<,>Vitamins are vital for good health.<,>维生素对健康至关重要。<,>vit(生命)+al(形容词后缀)→与生命有关的<,>vitality(n.活力)/vitalize(v.赋予生命)/vitamin(n.维生素)  

clumsy<,>/ˈklʌmzi/<,>/ˈklʌmzi/<,>adj.笨拙的/adj.愚笨的<,>The clumsy waiter dropped the tray.<,>笨手笨脚的服务员打翻了托盘。<,>His clumsy apology made things worse.<,>他拙劣的道歉让事情更糟。<,>She felt clumsy in high heels.<,>她穿高跟鞋时行动笨拙。<,>clum(似笨重声)+sy(形容词后缀)→笨拙的<,>clumsily(adv.笨拙地)/clumsiness(n.笨拙)/clump(n.笨重的脚步声)  

relieve<,>/rɪˈliːv/<,>/rɪˈliːv/<,>v.减轻/v.解除<,>This medicine will relieve your pain.<,>这种药会缓解你的疼痛。<,>He was relieved of his duties.<,>他被免除了职务。<,>The good news relieved her anxiety.<,>好消息缓解了她的焦虑。<,>re(再)+lieve(轻)→再次变轻→减轻<,>relief(n.缓解)/reliever(n.缓解物)/believe(v.相信)  

describe<,>/dɪˈskraɪb/<,>/dɪˈskraɪb/<,>v.形容/v.描写/v.描绘<,>Can you describe the suspect?<,>你能描述一下嫌疑人吗？<,>The poem describes a beautiful sunset.<,>这首诗描绘了美丽的日落。<,>Words cannot describe my joy.<,>言语无法形容我的喜悦。<,>de(下)+scribe(写)→写下来→描述<,>description(n.描述)/prescribe(v.开处方)/subscribe(v.订阅)  

author<,>/ˈɔːθə(r)/<,>/ˈɔθər/<,>n.作者/n.作家<,>The author signed copies of her book.<,>作者为她的书签名。<,>He is the author of several bestsellers.<,>他是多本畅销书的作者。<,>The author's style is unique.<,>这位作者的风格独特。<,>auth(创造)+or(人)→创造者→作者<,>authority(n.权威)/authentic(adj.真实的)/autobiography(n.自传)  

happy<,>/ˈhæpi/<,>/ˈhæpi/<,>adj.快乐的/adj.幸福的<,>The children look very happy.<,>孩子们看起来很开心。<,>I'm happy to help you.<,>我很乐意帮助你。<,>Happy birthday to you!<,>祝你生日快乐！<,>hap(运气)+py(形容词后缀)→有好运的→快乐的<,>happiness(n.幸福)/happen(v.发生)/unhappy(adj.不快乐的)  

glide<,>/ɡlaɪd/<,>/ɡlaɪd/<,>v.滑动/n.滑行<,>Swans glide gracefully on the lake.<,>天鹅在湖面上优雅地滑行。<,>The plane began to glide down.<,>飞机开始滑翔下降。<,>She glided across the dance floor.<,>她在舞池中滑步。<,>g(光滑)+lide(似slide滑动)→滑动<,>glider(n.滑翔机)/slide(v.滑动)/collide(v.碰撞)  

drain<,>/dreɪn/<,>/dreɪn/<,>v.排去/v.放水/n.耗竭<,>Don't forget to drain the pasta.<,>别忘了把意大利面沥干。<,>The war drained the country's resources.<,>战争耗尽了国家的资源。<,>She felt emotionally drained.<,>她感到精神疲惫。<,>dr(似水流声)+ain→排水<,>drainage(n.排水系统)/drained(adj.精疲力尽的)/train(n.火车)  

pen<,>/pen/<,>/pen/<,>n.钢笔/n.自来水笔<,>She wrote the letter with a fountain pen.<,>她用钢笔写了这封信。<,>The contract requires a pen signature.<,>合同需要钢笔签名。<,>He always carries a pen in his pocket.<,>他口袋里总是带着一支笔。<,>pen(羽毛)→古代用羽毛笔→钢笔<,>pencil(n.铅笔)/penny(n.便士)/open(v.打开)  

fatigue<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>/fəˈtiɡ/<,>n.疲劳/n.劳累<,>He was pale with fatigue.<,>他累得脸色苍白。<,>Muscle fatigue is common after exercise.<,>运动后肌肉疲劳很常见。<,>The soldiers marched despite their fatigue.<,>士兵们不顾疲劳继续行军。<,>fat(胖)+igue(音似"累个")→胖人容易累→疲劳<,>fatigued(adj.疲劳的)/fatigues(n.工作服)/fatal(adj.致命的)
nonsense<,>/ˈnɒns(ə)ns/<,>/ˈnɑːnsens/<,>n.胡说/n.废话<,>Don't talk nonsense!<,>别胡说八道！<,>His explanation was pure nonsense.<,>他的解释完全是废话。<,>She dismissed the rumor as nonsense.<,>她认为这个谣言是无稽之谈。<,>non(无)+sense(意义)→无意义的话<,>senseless(adj.无意义的)/commonsense(n.常识)/nonsensical(adj.荒谬的)

absolute<,>/ˈæbsəluːt/<,>/ˈæbsəˌlut/<,>adj.纯粹的/adj.绝对的<,>She has absolute trust in her doctor.<,>她对医生绝对信任。<,>The room was in absolute darkness.<,>房间里一片漆黑。<,>It's an absolute miracle that he survived.<,>他能活下来简直是奇迹。<,>ab(离开)+solut(松开)+e→完全松开的一绝对的<,>obsolete(adj.淘汰的)/resolute(adj.坚决的)/dissolute(adj.放纵的)

sack<,>/sæk/<,>/sæk/<,>n.袋/n.麻袋/v.开除<,>He carried a sack of potatoes on his back.<,>他背着一袋土豆。<,>Three workers got the sack yesterday.<,>昨天有三名工人被解雇了。<,>She sacked the groceries into paper bags.<,>她把食品杂货装进纸袋。<,>sack原指"粗布"，引申为"布袋"<,>pack(n.包裹/v.打包)/stack(n.堆/v.堆积)/slack(adj.松弛的)

apparatus<,>/ˌæpəˈreɪtəs/<,>/ˌæpəˈrætəs/<,>n.器械/n.仪器/n.器官<,>The lab has sophisticated apparatus.<,>实验室有精密仪器。<,>The breathing apparatus saved the diver.<,>呼吸器救了潜水员。<,>The government apparatus is inefficient.<,>政府机构效率低下。<,>ap(加强)+par(准备)+atus→准备好的工具<,>apparel(n.服装)/apparent(adj.明显的)/paraphernalia(n.随身用具)

next<,>/nekst/<,>/nɛkst/<,>adj.紧接的/adj.贴近的<,>The next train leaves at 9:15.<,>下一班火车9:15发车。<,>She sat next to me at dinner.<,>晚餐时她坐在我旁边。<,>What's your next move?<,>你下一步打算怎么办？<,>nex(连接)+t→紧接着的<,>text(n.文本)/context(n.上下文)/annex(v.附加)

grace<,>/ɡreɪs/<,>/ɡreɪs/<,>n.优美/n.文雅/n.雅致<,>She moved with natural grace.<,>她举止自然优雅。<,>He had the grace to admit his mistake.<,>他有雅量承认错误。<,>The dancers performed with grace.<,>舞者们表演得很优雅。<,>grac(感恩)+e→优雅源于感恩之心<,>gracious(adj.亲切的)/disgrace(n.耻辱)/graceful(adj.优雅的)

preface<,>/ˈprefəs/<,>/ˈprɛfəs/<,>n.序言/n.前言/n.引语<,>The preface explains the book's purpose.<,>前言说明了本书的宗旨。<,>He wrote a preface to the new edition.<,>他为新版写了序言。<,>Her speech served as a preface to the discussion.<,>她的发言是讨论的开场白。<,>pre(前)+face(面)→写在正文前面的内容<,>surface(n.表面)/deface(v.损坏外观)/efface(v.抹去)

tone<,>/təʊn/<,>/toʊn/<,>n.音/n.腔调/n.声调<,>Her tone was sharp and critical.<,>她的语气尖锐而挑剔。<,>The doctor's tone was reassuring.<,>医生的语气令人安心。<,>This violin has a mellow tone.<,>这把小提琴音色圆润。<,>ton(声音)+e→音调<,>tune(n.曲调)/stone(n.石头)/atone(v.赎罪)

stove<,>/stəʊv/<,>/stoʊv/<,>n.炉头/n.炉子<,>She put the kettle on the stove.<,>她把水壶放在炉子上。<,>We bought a new gas stove.<,>我们买了新煤气灶。<,>The soup is simmering on the stove.<,>汤在炉子上煨着。<,>st(站立)+ove→固定放置的炊具<,>stovepipe(n.烟囱)/stovetop(n.炉灶面)/stave(n.桶板)

identical<,>/aɪˈdentɪk(ə)l/<,>/aɪˈdɛntɪkəl/<,>adj.完全相同的/adj.同一的<,>The twins are nearly identical.<,>这对双胞胎几乎一模一样。<,>This copy is identical to the original.<,>这份复印件与原件完全相同。<,>We stayed at identical hotels in different cities.<,>我们在不同城市住了相同的酒店。<,>ident(相同)+ical→完全一样的<,>identity(n.身份)/identify(v.识别)/dentical(无此词，注意拼写)
adjective<,>/ˈædʒɪktɪv/<,>/ˈædʒɪktɪv/<,>n.形容词<,>"Happy" is an adjective that describes a feeling.<,>“快乐”是描述感受的形容词。<,>She listed all the adjectives she could think of.<,>她列出了所有能想到的形容词。<,>Adjectives usually come before nouns in English.<,>英语中形容词通常位于名词前。<,>ad-(添加)+ject(投掷)+ive→投加到名词上的词→形容词<,>adjoin(v.毗连)/adjust(v.调整)/adjudge(v.判决)  

knee<,>/niː/<,>/ni/<,>n.膝/膝盖/膝关节<,>He fell and scraped his knee.<,>他摔倒了，擦伤了膝盖。<,>She knelt on one knee to propose.<,>她单膝跪地求婚。<,>The baby crawled on its hands and knees.<,>婴儿用双手和膝盖爬行。<,>kn(像弯曲的膝盖)+ee(眼睛形状)→膝盖<,>kneel(v.跪下)/knit(v.编织)/knob(n.球形把手)  

artist<,>/ˈɑːtɪst/<,>/ˈɑːrtɪst/<,>n.艺术家/美术家<,>Van Gogh was a famous Dutch artist.<,>梵高是著名的荷兰艺术家。<,>She works as a freelance artist.<,>她是自由职业艺术家。<,>The gallery features local artists.<,>这家画廊展示本地艺术家的作品。<,>art(艺术)+ist(人)→从事艺术的人<,>artisan(n.工匠)/artistic(adj.艺术的)/artifice(n.诡计)  

choke<,>/tʃəʊk/<,>/tʃoʊk/<,>v.使窒息/塞满<,>The smoke made him choke.<,>烟雾让他窒息。<,>She choked on a piece of bread.<,>她被一块面包噎住了。<,>The roads were choked with traffic.<,>道路被交通堵塞。<,>谐音“凑克”→凑近克住喉咙→窒息<,>chalk(n.粉笔)/chock(n.楔子)/chuckle(v.轻声笑)  

regardless<,>/rɪˈɡɑːdləs/<,>/rɪˈɡɑːrdləs/<,>adv.不顾一切地<,>He continued regardless of the danger.<,>他不顾危险继续前进。<,>She smiled regardless of her pain.<,>她不顾疼痛微笑着。<,>The event will proceed regardless of weather.<,>活动将不顾天气照常进行。<,>regard(关心)+less(否定)→不关心→不顾<,>regardful(adj.留心的)/disregard(v.忽视)/regarding(prep.关于)  

reader<,>/ˈriːdə(r)/<,>/ˈriːdər/<,>n.读者/读物<,>This magazine has thousands of readers.<,>这本杂志有数千读者。<,>She is a fast reader.<,>她阅读速度很快。<,>The book comes with a beginner's reader.<,>这本书配有初学者读物。<,>read(读)+er(人)→阅读的人<,>leader(n.领导者)/feeder(n.饲养员)/seeder(n.播种机)  

horizontal<,>/ˌhɒrɪˈzɒntl/<,>/ˌhɔːrɪˈzɑːntl/<,>adj.地平的/水平的<,>Draw a horizontal line across the page.<,>在页面上画一条水平线。<,>The phone has a horizontal display mode.<,>手机有横向显示模式。<,>Keep the camera horizontal when taking photos.<,>拍照时保持相机水平。<,>horizon(地平线)+tal→地平线的<,>vertical(adj.垂直的)/diagonal(adj.对角线的)/parallel(adj.平行的)  

acceptable<,>/əkˈseptəbl/<,>/əkˈseptəbl/<,>adj.可接受的/合意的<,>This solution is acceptable to everyone.<,>这个解决方案大家都能接受。<,>The food was barely acceptable.<,>食物勉强能接受。<,>His behavior is not socially acceptable.<,>他的行为不被社会接受。<,>accept(接受)+able(能…的)→可接受的<,>accessible(adj.可进入的)/exceptable(不存在此词)/receptacle(n.容器)  

mail<,>/meɪl/<,>/meɪl/<,>n.邮件/v.邮寄<,>I received your mail yesterday.<,>我昨天收到了你的邮件。<,>Please mail the documents by Friday.<,>请周五前邮寄文件。<,>She checks her mail every morning.<,>她每天早晨查邮件。<,>谐音“妹儿”→电子邮件像小妹传递信息<,>male(adj.男性的)/maim(v.使残废)/maize(n.玉米)  

cloud<,>/klaʊd/<,>/klaʊd/<,>n.云/云状物/阴影<,>White clouds floated across the sky.<,>白云飘过天空。<,>There's a cloud of dust behind the car.<,>车后扬起一片尘土。<,>The scandal cast a cloud over his career.<,>丑闻给他的职业生涯蒙上阴影。<,>c(形状像云)+loud(大声)→云像无声的“大声”<,>clout(n.影响力)/clod(n.土块)/crowd(n.人群)
busy<,>/ˈbɪzi/<,>/ˈbɪzi/<,>adj.忙的/adj.繁忙的<,>She is too busy to attend the meeting.<,>她太忙了，无法参加会议。<,>The streets are always busy during rush hour.<,>高峰时段街道总是很繁忙。<,>He kept himself busy with various projects.<,>他用各种项目让自己保持忙碌。<,>谐音“必急”→繁忙的人必然着急<,>business(n.商业)/lazy(adj.懒惰的)  

secretary<,>/ˈsekrətri/<,>/ˈsekrəteri/<,>n.秘书/n.书记/n.大臣<,>The secretary typed the report quickly.<,>秘书迅速打好了报告。<,>He was appointed Secretary of State.<,>他被任命为国务大臣。<,>She works as a legal secretary.<,>她担任法律秘书。<,>secret(秘密)+ary(人)→处理机密事务的人<,>library(n.图书馆)/sanctuary(n.避难所)  

deadly<,>/ˈdedli/<,>/ˈdɛdli/<,>adj.致命的/adj.死一般的<,>The snake's venom is deadly.<,>这种蛇的毒液是致命的。<,>There was a deadly silence in the room.<,>房间里一片死寂。<,>They are in deadly danger.<,>他们处于极度危险中。<,>dead(死亡)+ly(形容词后缀)→致死的<,>deathly(adj.死一般的)/deadline(n.截止日期)  

harbour<,>/ˈhɑːbə(r)/<,>/ˈhɑːrbər/<,>n.海港/v.庇护<,>The ship entered the harbour at dawn.<,>船只黎明时分进入港口。<,>It's illegal to harbour criminals.<,>窝藏罪犯是违法的。<,>This bay forms a natural harbour.<,>这个海湾形成了天然港口。<,>har(看作hard)+bour(音似“泊”)→坚固的泊位→港口<,>arbor(n.树荫处)/harbinger(n.预兆)  

bloom<,>/bluːm/<,>/blum/<,>n.花/n.开花期<,>The roses are in full bloom.<,>玫瑰正值盛花期。<,>Her talent bloomed late in life.<,>她的才华在晚年才绽放。<,>Spring brings cherry blossoms into bloom.<,>春天让樱花盛开。<,>bl(看作“碧”)+oom(想象花开的声音)→花开<,>gloom(n.忧郁)/broom(n.扫帚)  

retain<,>/rɪˈteɪn/<,>/rɪˈteɪn/<,>v.保持/v.保留<,>This wall retains heat well.<,>这堵墙保温性能很好。<,>She retained her championship title.<,>她保住了冠军头衔。<,>The cloth retains its color after washing.<,>这种布料洗后不褪色。<,>re(再)+tain(拿住)→再次拿住→保留<,>detain(v.拘留)/sustain(v.维持)  

contest<,>/ˈkɒntest/<,>/ˈkɑːntest/<,>v.争夺/v.辩驳<,>They contested the election results.<,>他们对选举结果提出异议。<,>Athletes from 50 countries will contest the title.<,>来自50个国家的运动员将角逐冠军。<,>She decided to contest the will in court.<,>她决定对遗嘱提出法律诉讼。<,>con(共同)+test(测试)→共同测试→竞争<,>context(n.上下文)/protest(v.抗议)  

output<,>/ˈaʊtpʊt/<,>/ˈaʊtˌpʊt/<,>n.产量/n.输出量<,>The factory increased its daily output.<,>工厂提高了日产量。<,>Check the computer's audio output.<,>检查电脑的音频输出。<,>Agricultural output has declined this year.<,>今年农业产量下降了。<,>out(出)+put(放)→放出来的量→输出<,>input(n.输入)/outlet(n.出口)  

railroad<,>/ˈreɪlrəʊd/<,>/ˈreɪlroʊd/<,>n.铁路<,>They built a railroad across the continent.<,>他们修建了横贯大陆的铁路。<,>The old railroad was converted into a bike trail.<,>旧铁路被改造成了自行车道。<,>He works for a railroad company.<,>他在铁路公司工作。<,>rail(铁轨)+road(路)→铁轨铺成的路<,>railway(英式n.铁路)/highroad(n.公路)  

institution<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃn/<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtuːʃn/<,>n.协会/n.制度<,>Harvard is a prestigious educational institution.<,>哈佛是享有盛誉的教育机构。<,>Marriage is a social institution.<,>婚姻是一种社会制度。<,>She was committed to a mental institution.<,>她被送进了精神病院。<,>in(进入)+stitute(建立)+ion→建立起来的体系<,>constitution(n.宪法)/destitution(n.贫困)
engine<,>/ˈendʒɪn/<,>/ˈɛndʒən/<,>n.发动机/n.引擎/n.机车<,>The engine of the car is very powerful.<,>这辆车的发动机非常强劲。<,>He works as a train engine driver.<,>他是一名火车机车司机。<,>This software is the engine behind the application.<,>这个软件是应用程序背后的引擎。<,>en(使)+gin(产生)→产生动力的装置→发动机<,>ingenious(adj.机灵的)/gin(n.杜松子酒)  

flesh<,>/fleʃ/<,>/flɛʃ/<,>n.肉/n.肌肉/n.肉体<,>The tiger tore the flesh of its prey.<,>老虎撕开了猎物的肉。<,>He is more than just flesh and blood.<,>他不仅仅是血肉之躯。<,>The wound exposed the flesh beneath the skin.<,>伤口露出了皮下的肌肉。<,>fresh(新鲜的)去掉r→肉不新鲜会腐烂<,>flash(v.闪光/n.闪光)/flush(v.冲洗/adj.齐平的)  

brother<,>/ˈbrʌðə(r)/<,>/ˈbrʌðɚ/<,>n.兄弟/n.同事/n.同胞<,>My brother is two years older than me.<,>我哥哥比我大两岁。<,>We are brothers in arms.<,>我们是战友。<,>All men are brothers under the skin.<,>四海之内皆兄弟。<,>bro(兄弟)+ther(人)→兄弟<,>bother(v.打扰)/brethren(n.弟兄们)  

inch<,>/ɪntʃ/<,>/ɪntʃ/<,>n.英寸<,>The screen is 15 inches diagonally.<,>屏幕对角线为15英寸。<,>He didn't give an inch in the negotiation.<,>他在谈判中寸步不让。<,>She was within an inch of falling off the cliff.<,>她差点从悬崖上掉下去。<,>1 inch=2.54cm<,>itch(v.发痒)/pinch(v.捏)  

aeroplane<,>/ˈeərəpleɪn/<,>/ˈɛrəˌplen/<,>n.飞机<,>The aeroplane took off smoothly.<,>飞机平稳地起飞了。<,>I prefer travelling by aeroplane.<,>我更喜欢乘飞机旅行。<,>The aeroplane was delayed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，飞机延误了。<,>aero(空气)+plane(平面)→在空气中飞行的平面→飞机<,>airplane(n.飞机[美式])/helicopter(n.直升机)  

coffee<,>/ˈkɒfi/<,>/ˈkɔfi/<,>n.咖啡/n.咖啡茶<,>I drink a cup of coffee every morning.<,>我每天早上喝一杯咖啡。<,>Would you like some coffee or tea?<,>你想喝咖啡还是茶？<,>The coffee shop is always crowded.<,>这家咖啡店总是很拥挤。<,>cof(fee)发音类似"靠飞"→靠咖啡提神才能飞起<,>toffee(n.太妃糖)/cafe(n.咖啡馆)  

emit<,>/iˈmɪt/<,>/ɪˈmɪt/<,>v.散发/v.发射/v.发表<,>The chimney emits thick black smoke.<,>烟囱排放出浓密的黑烟。<,>The radio station emits signals 24 hours a day.<,>这个广播电台24小时发射信号。<,>He emitted a sigh of relief.<,>他松了一口气。<,>e(出)+mit(送)→送出去→发射<,>omit(v.省略)/admit(v.承认)
