as<,>/æz/<,>/æz/<,>conj.当...的时候<,>As I was leaving, the phone rang.<,>正当我要离开时，电话响了。<,>She sang as she worked.<,>她一边工作一边唱歌。<,>As the sun rose, the fog disappeared.<,>太阳升起时，雾就散了。<,>对比：as(同时)/when(当...时)/while(在...期间)<,>ass(n.驴)/ash(n.灰烬)  

elementary<,>/ˌelɪˈmentri/<,>/ˌɛləˈmɛntəri/<,>adj.基本的/adj.初级的<,>He has only an elementary knowledge of physics.<,>他只有初级的物理知识。<,>This is an elementary principle of economics.<,>这是经济学的基本原理。<,>She teaches at an elementary school.<,>她在小学教书。<,>element(元素)+ary→像元素一样基础的<,>elemental(adj.自然力的)/complementary(adj.补充的)  

editor<,>/ˈedɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈɛdɪtɚ/<,>n.编辑/n.编者/n.校订者<,>The editor checked the manuscript carefully.<,>编辑仔细检查了手稿。<,>He is the chief editor of the newspaper.<,>他是这家报纸的主编。<,>The film editor worked all night.<,>电影剪辑师工作了一整夜。<,>edit(编辑)+or(人)→编辑者<,>auditor(n.审计员)/creditor(n.债权人)
coin<,>/kɔɪn/<,>/kɔɪn/<,>n.硬币/v.铸造（硬币）<,>He flipped a coin to decide who would go first.<,>他抛硬币决定谁先走。<,>The government plans to coin new commemorative coins next year.<,>政府计划明年铸造新的纪念币。<,>She collects rare coins from around the world.<,>她收集来自世界各地的稀有硬币。<,>co(共同)+in(里面)→金属共同在里面→硬币<,>join(v.参加)/coil(n.线圈/v.盘绕)

definite<,>/ˈdefɪnət/<,>/ˈdefənət/<,>adj.明确的/adj.肯定的<,>We need a definite answer by tomorrow.<,>我们需要明天之前得到明确的答复。<,>There's a definite improvement in her performance.<,>她的表现有明显进步。<,>He was very definite about his plans.<,>他对自己的计划非常肯定。<,>de(下)+fin(界限)+ite→划下界限→明确的<,>definitive(adj.决定性的)/infinite(adj.无限的)

skim<,>/skɪm/<,>/skɪm/<,>v.掠过/v.擦过/v.略读<,>Birds skimmed the surface of the lake.<,>鸟儿掠过湖面。<,>She skimmed through the newspaper during breakfast.<,>她吃早餐时浏览了报纸。<,>The stone skimmed across the water.<,>石头在水面上打水漂。<,>ski(滑雪)+m→像滑雪一样快速滑过<,>scan(v.扫描)/slim(adj.苗条的)

tourist<,>/ˈtʊərɪst/<,>/ˈtʊrɪst/<,>n.旅游者/n.观光者<,>The city attracts millions of tourists every year.<,>这座城市每年吸引数百万游客。<,>Tourist information centers can provide maps and guides.<,>旅游信息中心可以提供地图和指南。<,>We saw many tourist buses near the museum.<,>我们在博物馆附近看到许多旅游大巴。<,>tour(旅行)+ist(人)→旅行的人<,>terrorist(n.恐怖分子)/journalist(n.记者)

flourish<,>/ˈflʌrɪʃ/<,>/ˈflɜːrɪʃ/<,>v.繁荣/v.茂盛/v.兴旺<,>The plants flourished in the sunny spot.<,>植物在阳光充足的地方长势茂盛。<,>His business flourished after the new investment.<,>获得新投资后他的生意蒸蒸日上。<,>She flourished her diploma proudly.<,>她自豪地挥舞着她的毕业证书。<,>flour(面粉)+ish→像发酵的面粉一样膨胀→繁荣<,>flour(n.面粉)/nourish(v.滋养)

taste<,>/teɪst/<,>/teɪst/<,>n.味觉/n.品味<,>This soup has a strange taste.<,>这汤有种奇怪的味道。<,>She has excellent taste in fashion.<,>她对时尚很有品味。<,>I've lost my sense of taste due to a cold.<,>因为感冒我失去了味觉。<,>t(舌头)+aste(看作east东方)→东方美食讲究味觉<,>waste(n.废物)/haste(n.匆忙)

ending<,>/ˈendɪŋ/<,>/ˈendɪŋ/<,>n.结尾/n.结局<,>The movie had a surprising ending.<,>这部电影有个出人意料的结局。<,>I'm reading a book with a happy ending.<,>我正在读一本结局圆满的书。<,>The story's ending left many questions unanswered.<,>故事的结局留下了许多未解之谜。<,>end(结束)+ing→结尾<,>bending(adj.弯曲的)/mending(n.修补)

confirm<,>/kənˈfɜːm/<,>/kənˈfɜːrm/<,>v.证实/v.肯定/v.批准<,>Please confirm your attendance by Friday.<,>请于周五前确认是否出席。<,>The test results confirmed the initial diagnosis.<,>检测结果证实了最初的诊断。<,>The Senate confirmed the new ambassador.<,>参议院批准了新大使的任命。<,>con(完全)+firm(坚定)→完全坚定→证实<,>affirm(v.断言)/conform(v.符合)

nearly<,>/ˈnɪəli/<,>/ˈnɪrli/<,>adv.差不多<,>I nearly missed my train this morning.<,>我今天早上差点错过火车。<,>The project is nearly finished.<,>这个项目差不多完成了。<,>We've been waiting for nearly an hour.<,>我们已经等了将近一个小时。<,>near(接近)+ly→差不多<,>early(adv.早)/yearly(adj.每年的)

away<,>/əˈweɪ/<,>/əˈweɪ/<,>adv.离开/adv.远离/adv....去<,>He walked away without saying goodbye.<,>他没说再见就走了。<,>The beach is only five minutes away.<,>海滩只有五分钟路程。<,>Put your toys away when you finish playing.<,>玩完后把玩具收好。<,>a(在...)+way(路)→在路上→离开<,>always(adv.总是)/sway(v.摇摆)
puzzle<,>/ˈpʌz(ə)l/<,>/ˈpʌzəl/<,>n.难题/n.谜/v.使迷惑<,>This crossword puzzle is quite challenging.<,>这个填字游戏相当有挑战性。<,>Her behavior puzzles me.<,>她的行为让我感到迷惑。<,>He solved the puzzle in just five minutes.<,>他仅用五分钟就解开了这个谜题。<,>puzz(困惑)+le(表反复动作)→不断让人困惑→谜题<,>muzzle(n.口套/v.使缄默)/drizzle(n.细雨/v.下毛毛雨)  

lawyer<,>/ˈlɔːjə(r)/<,>/ˈlɔɪər/<,>n.律师/n.法学家<,>The lawyer defended his client in court.<,>律师在法庭上为他的当事人辩护。<,>She consulted a lawyer about the contract.<,>她就合同问题咨询了律师。<,>He is a prominent international lawyer.<,>他是著名的国际法专家。<,>law(法律)+yer(人)→从事法律工作的人<,>bowler(n.打保龄球的人)/sawyer(n.锯木工)  

precision<,>/prɪˈsɪʒ(ə)n/<,>/prɪˈsɪʒən/<,>n.精确/n.精密/n.精密度<,>The machine operates with high precision.<,>这台机器以高精度运行。<,>Scientific measurements require absolute precision.<,>科学测量需要绝对精确。<,>Her speech lacked precision in wording.<,>她的演讲措辞不够精确。<,>pre(预先)+cis(切)+ion→提前切分好→精确<,>decision(n.决定)/incision(n.切口)  

debt<,>/det/<,>/dɛt/<,>n.债/n.债务/n.欠债<,>He finally paid off his student debt.<,>他终于还清了学生贷款。<,>The company is struggling with massive debts.<,>该公司正面临巨额债务问题。<,>National debt has reached a record high.<,>国债已达到历史新高。<,>deb(欠)+t→欠的东西→债务<,>doubt(n.怀疑)/debit(n.借方)  

promote<,>/prəˈməʊt/<,>/prəˈmoʊt/<,>v.促进/v.发扬/v.提升<,>This campaign aims to promote cultural exchange.<,>该活动旨在促进文化交流。<,>She was promoted to manager last month.<,>她上个月被提升为经理。<,>Green tea promotes digestion.<,>绿茶有助于消化。<,>pro(向前)+mot(移动)+e→推动向前→促进<,>demote(v.降级)/remote(adj.遥远的)  

gasp<,>/ɡɑːsp/<,>/ɡæsp/<,>v.气喘/v.喘息<,>She gasped for air after running.<,>跑步后她气喘吁吁。<,>The audience gasped at the magic trick.<,>观众对魔术表演发出惊叹。<,>He gasped out the shocking news.<,>他喘着气说出这个惊人消息。<,>grasp(抓住)少个r→喘不过气<,>grasp(v.抓住)/haste(n.匆忙)  

publish<,>/ˈpʌblɪʃ/<,>/ˈpʌblɪʃ/<,>v.出版/v.发表/v.公布<,>The research will be published next month.<,>这项研究将于下个月发表。<,>They publish a weekly magazine.<,>他们出版一份周刊。<,>The government published new regulations.<,>政府公布了新法规。<,>publ(人民)+ish(使)→使公众知晓→出版<,>punish(v.惩罚)/polish(v.磨光)  

cubic<,>/ˈkjuːbɪk/<,>/ˈkjubɪk/<,>adj.立方形的/adj.立方的<,>The room is 10 cubic meters in size.<,>这个房间有10立方米大小。<,>Ice crystals form cubic structures.<,>冰晶形成立方体结构。<,>This sculpture has cubic elements.<,>这个雕塑包含立方体元素。<,>cube(立方体)+ic→立方体的<,>public(adj.公共的)/rubric(n.标题)  

smart<,>/smɑːt/<,>/smɑrt/<,>adj.聪颖的/adj.机灵的<,>That was a smart solution to the problem.<,>那是解决问题的聪明办法。<,>Smart devices are becoming more popular.<,>智能设备越来越受欢迎。<,>She's smart enough to avoid the trap.<,>她很机灵，避开了这个陷阱。<,>s(像蛇)+mart(市场)→市场里像蛇一样灵活→机灵的<,>start(v.开始)/smear(v.涂抹)  

floor<,>/flɔː(r)/<,>/flɔr/<,>n.地板/n.楼层<,>Please mop the kitchen floor.<,>请拖一下厨房地板。<,>Her office is on the fifth floor.<,>她的办公室在五楼。<,>The dancer spun across the floor.<,>舞者在地板上旋转。<,>fl(流动)+oor(口)→液体流经的表面→地板<,>flour(n.面粉)/flood(n.洪水)
dispute<,>/dɪˈspjuːt/<,>/dɪˈspjuːt/<,>v.争论/v.争执/n.争论<,>The two countries are in dispute over the border.<,>两国在边界问题上存在争议。<,>She disputed the charges on her bill.<,>她对账单上的费用提出异议。<,>The dispute was settled out of court.<,>这场纠纷在庭外和解了。<,>dis(否定)+pute(思考)→想法不同→争论<,>refute(v.驳斥)/disrepute(n.坏名声)/compute(v.计算)  

blackboard<,>/ˈblækbɔːd/<,>/ˈblækbɔːrd/<,>n.黑板<,>The teacher wrote the assignment on the blackboard.<,>老师把作业写在黑板上。<,>Please erase the blackboard after class.<,>下课后请擦黑板。<,>He drew a diagram on the blackboard.<,>他在黑板上画了一个示意图。<,>black(黑色)+board(板)→黑板<,>whiteboard(n.白板)/keyboard(n.键盘)/cardboard(n.硬纸板)  

install<,>/ɪnˈstɔːl/<,>/ɪnˈstɔːl/<,>v.安装/v.设置<,>They will install the new software tomorrow.<,>他们明天会安装新软件。<,>The plumber is installing a new shower.<,>水管工正在安装新淋浴器。<,>She was installed as the new CEO last week.<,>她上周就任新CEO。<,>in(进入)+stall(放置)→放入设备→安装<,>installation(n.安装)/uninstall(v.卸载)/stall(n.摊位/v.拖延)  

deceit<,>/dɪˈsiːt/<,>/dɪˈsiːt/<,>n.欺骗/n.欺诈<,>His deceit was finally uncovered.<,>他的欺骗行为最终被揭露。<,>She used deceit to get what she wanted.<,>她用欺诈手段得到想要的东西。<,>The novel explores themes of love and deceit.<,>这部小说探讨了爱与欺骗的主题。<,>de(离开)+ceit(拿)→用不正当手段拿取→欺骗<,>deceive(v.欺骗)/conceit(n.自负)/receipt(n.收据)  

forecast<,>/ˈfɔːkɑːst/<,>/ˈfɔːrkæst/<,>n.预测/n.预报/v.预示<,>The weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow.<,>天气预报说明天有雨。<,>Economists forecast a recession.<,>经济学家预测会出现经济衰退。<,>Dark clouds forecast a storm.<,>乌云预示着暴风雨。<,>fore(前面)+cast(投掷)→提前投出信息→预测<,>broadcast(v.广播)/recast(v.重铸)/overcast(adj.阴天的)  

now<,>/naʊ/<,>/naʊ/<,>adv.现在/adv.立刻<,>I need an answer now.<,>我现在就要答复。<,>Now is the perfect time to invest.<,>现在是投资的绝佳时机。<,>She was now a famous actress.<,>她现在成了著名演员。<,>与know(知道)发音相同<,>know(v.知道)/how(adv.如何)/vow(n.誓言)  

believe<,>/bɪˈliːv/<,>/bɪˈliːv/<,>v.相信/v.认为<,>I believe you're telling the truth.<,>我相信你说的是实话。<,>Do you believe in ghosts?<,>你相信有鬼吗？<,>He believes that hard work pays off.<,>他认为努力会有回报。<,>be(使)+lieve(爱)→使产生爱的信任→相信<,>relieve(v.缓解)/deceive(v.欺骗)/conceive(v.构想)  

mile<,>/maɪl/<,>/maɪl/<,>n.英里<,>The airport is 10 miles away.<,>机场在10英里外。<,>She can run a mile in 6 minutes.<,>她6分钟能跑一英里。<,>They walked the extra mile to help us.<,>他们不遗余力地帮助我们。<,>与smile(微笑)结尾相同<,>smile(n.微笑)/pile(n.堆)/tile(n.瓷砖)  

gap<,>/ɡæp/<,>/ɡæp/<,>n.缺口/n.间隔/n.差距<,>There's a gap in the fence.<,>篱笆上有个缺口。<,>The generation gap causes misunderstandings.<,>代沟导致误解。<,>Bridging the wealth gap is challenging.<,>缩小贫富差距具有挑战性。<,>与cap(帽子)押韵<,>map(n.地图)/tap(v.轻拍)/nap(n.小睡)  

occur<,>/əˈkɜː(r)/<,>/əˈkɜːr/<,>v.发生/v.出现/v.存在<,>When did the accident occur?<,>事故是什么时候发生的？<,>Mistakes will occur in any process.<,>任何流程都会出现错误。<,>This species occurs only in Australia.<,>这个物种仅存在于澳大利亚。<,>oc(朝向)+cur(跑)→跑向某处→发生<,>recur(v.复发)/concur(v.同意)/incur(v.招致)
glove<,>/ɡlʌv/<,>/ɡlʌv/<,>n.手套<,>She wore a pair of leather gloves to keep her hands warm.<,>她戴了一副皮手套保暖。<,>He caught the ball with his baseball glove.<,>他用棒球手套接住了球。<,>The magician pulled a rabbit out of his glove.<,>魔术师从手套里变出一只兔子。<,>g(拼音：哥)+love(爱)→哥哥爱戴手套<,>groove(n. 凹槽)/grove(n. 小树林)

graduate<,>/ˈɡrædʒuət/<,>/ˈɡrædʒuˌeɪt/<,>n.毕业生/v.大学毕业<,>She will graduate from Harvard next month.<,>她下个月将从哈佛大学毕业。<,>The graduate received a job offer from a top company.<,>这位毕业生收到了顶级公司的工作邀请。<,>After you graduate, you can apply for a master's degree.<,>毕业后你可以申请硕士学位。<,>grad(等级)+uate→完成等级→毕业<,>undergraduate(n.本科生)/postgraduate(n.研究生)

club<,>/klʌb/<,>/klʌb/<,>n.〔职业体育的〕俱乐部/n.俱乐部/n.夜总会<,>He joined a local football club.<,>他加入了当地的足球俱乐部。<,>The book club meets every Wednesday evening.<,>读书俱乐部每周三晚上聚会。<,>They danced all night at the jazz club.<,>他们在爵士乐夜总会跳了一整晚。<,>c(形状像高尔夫球杆)+lub(谐音：乐部)→俱乐部<,>clue(n.线索)/clump(n.丛/v.丛生)

fierce<,>/fɪəs/<,>/fɪrs/<,>adj.凶猛的/adj.狂热的<,>The tiger gave us a fierce look.<,>老虎凶狠地瞪了我们一眼。<,>There was fierce competition for the scholarship.<,>奖学金的竞争非常激烈。<,>She is a fierce supporter of animal rights.<,>她是动物权利的狂热支持者。<,>fire(火)+ce→像火一样→凶猛的<,>pierce(v.刺穿)/fiesta(n.节日)

dump<,>/dʌmp/<,>/dʌmp/<,>v.倾卸/v.倾倒/v.倾销<,>They dumped the waste into the river.<,>他们把废物倾倒进河里。<,>The company was accused of dumping cheap products.<,>该公司被指控倾销廉价产品。<,>He dumped all his old books in the recycling bin.<,>他把所有旧书扔进了回收箱。<,>du(拼音：堵)+mp(拼音：满盆)→堵满盆→倾倒<,>bump(n.肿块/v.碰撞)/jump(v.跳跃)

lag<,>/læɡ/<,>/læɡ/<,>v.落后/v.走得慢<,>Our team is lagging behind in the competition.<,>我们队在比赛中落后了。<,>The old computer lags when running new software.<,>这台旧电脑运行新软件时很慢。<,>Don't lag behind or you'll get lost.<,>别走得太慢，否则你会迷路的。<,>la(拼音：拉)+g(拼音：哥)→拉着哥哥→走得慢<,>leg(n.腿)/log(n.原木/v.记录)

hammer<,>/ˈhæmə(r)/<,>/ˈhæmər/<,>n.锤/n.榔头/v.锤击<,>He hit the nail with a hammer.<,>他用锤子敲钉子。<,>The blacksmith hammered the hot metal into shape.<,>铁匠将烧红的金属锤打成形。<,>My heart was hammering with excitement.<,>我的心因兴奋而怦怦直跳。<,>ham(火腿)+mer(拼音：么)→火腿么？用锤子敲！<,>hummer(n.蜂鸟)/hamper(v.阻碍)

congratulate<,>/kənˈɡrætʃuleɪt/<,>/kənˈɡrætʃəˌleɪt/<,>v.祝贺/v.向…道喜<,>I congratulated her on winning the award.<,>我祝贺她获奖。<,>We congratulated the newlyweds at their wedding.<,>我们在婚礼上向新婚夫妇道喜。<,>Let me congratulate you on your promotion.<,>恭喜你升职。<,>con(共同)+grat(感激)+ulate→共同感激→祝贺<,>aggregate(v.聚集/n.总数)/graceful(adj.优雅的)

storage<,>/ˈstɔːrɪdʒ/<,>/ˈstɔrɪdʒ/<,>n.贮藏/n.贮藏量<,>We need more storage space for our files.<,>我们需要更多空间来存储文件。<,>The grain is kept in cold storage.<,>谷物被保存在冷藏库里。<,>This device has 256GB of storage.<,>这个设备有256GB的存储容量。<,>store(储存)+age(状态)→储存状态→贮藏<,>stage(n.舞台)/storeroom(n.储藏室)

guess<,>/ɡes/<,>/ɡɛs/<,>v.猜测/v.推测/n.猜测/n.推测<,>Can you guess how old I am?<,>你能猜出我多大吗？<,>I guess we'll have to wait for the results.<,>我想我们得等待结果了。<,>Her guess was surprisingly accurate.<,>她的猜测出奇地准确。<,>gu(拼音：姑)+ess(拼音：爱思)→姑姑爱思考→猜测<,>guest(n.客人)/gush(v.涌出)

desirable<,>/dɪˈzaɪərəbl/<,>/dɪˈzaɪrəbəl/<,>adj.值得向往的/adj.可取的<,>It is desirable to have good communication skills in this job.<,>在这份工作中，良好的沟通技巧是可取的。<,>She is a highly desirable candidate for the position.<,>她是这个职位非常值得向往的候选人。<,>A quiet neighborhood is desirable for raising children.<,>安静的社区适合养育孩子。<,>desire(渴望)+able(能…的)→值得渴望的<,>desired(adj.渴望的)/undesirable(adj.不受欢迎的)  

critic<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>n.批评家/n.爱挑剔的人<,>The film critic gave the movie a poor review.<,>这位电影批评家给这部电影打了差评。<,>He is his own harshest critic.<,>他是对自己最苛刻的批评者。<,>She has a reputation for being a tough critic of modern art.<,>她以对现代艺术苛刻的批评而闻名。<,>crit(判断)+ic(人)→做判断的人→批评家<,>critical(adj.批评的)/critique(n.评论)/hypocrite(n.伪君子)  

bottom<,>/ˈbɒtəm/<,>/ˈbɑːtəm/<,>n.底/n.底部/n.根基<,>The keys fell to the bottom of the bag.<,>钥匙掉到了包的底部。<,>We need to get to the bottom of this mystery.<,>我们需要弄清这个谜团的真相。<,>He started his business from the bottom up.<,>他从零开始创业。<,>bot(基础)+tom(名词后缀)→最基础的部分→底部<,>bottoms(n.裤子)/bottomless(adj.无底的)/top(n.顶部)
bud<,>/bʌd/<,>/bʌd/<,>n.芽/n.萌芽/n.蓓蕾<,>The rose bush is covered in tiny buds.<,>玫瑰丛上长满了小花蕾。<,>Spring is the time when plants start to bud.<,>春天是植物开始发芽的季节。<,>She carefully removed a bud from the stem.<,>她小心地从茎上摘下一个蓓蕾。<,>联想：bud(蓓蕾)与bed(床)形似，想象床单上开出了花蕾<,>bug(n.虫子/v.窃听)/bun(n.小圆面包)/bump(n.肿块/v.碰撞)

Australia<,>/ɒˈstreɪliə/<,>/ɔːˈstreɪljə/<,>n.澳大利亚<,>I have always wanted to visit Australia.<,>我一直想去澳大利亚旅游。<,>Kangaroos are native to Australia.<,>袋鼠是澳大利亚的本土动物。<,>Australia is famous for its beautiful beaches.<,>澳大利亚以其美丽的海滩而闻名。<,>Aus(南方)+trail(踪迹)+ia(地区)→南方的踪迹之地<,>Austria(n.奥地利)/Australian(adj.澳大利亚的/n.澳大利亚人)/Australasia(n.澳大拉西亚)
resident<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>/ˈrɛzɪdənt/<,>adj.居住的/n.居民<,>She is a resident of New York City.<,>她是纽约市的居民。<,>The resident doctor is on call tonight.<,>住院医生今晚值班。<,>This building is for resident use only.<,>这座建筑仅供居民使用。<,>re(反复)+sid(坐)+ent(人)→一直坐着的人→居民<,>president(n.总统/n.校长)/residence(n.住宅/n.居住)/residual(adj.剩余的/n.剩余物)

choose<,>/tʃuːz/<,>/tʃuz/<,>v.选择/v.挑选/v.情愿<,>You can choose any color you like.<,>你可以选择任何你喜欢的颜色。<,>She chose to stay home instead of going out.<,>她情愿待在家里也不愿出门。<,>We must choose between these two options.<,>我们必须在这两个选项之间做出选择。<,>ch(音似"选")+oose(oose形似"选项")→选择<,>choice(n.选择/adj.精选的)/chose(v.choose的过去式)/chew(v.咀嚼/n.咀嚼物)

meanwhile<,>/ˈmiːnwaɪl/<,>/ˈminˌhwaɪl/<,>adv.同时/adv.当时<,>She was cooking dinner; meanwhile, her husband was setting the table.<,>她在做晚饭，与此同时，她丈夫在摆餐具。<,>The main event starts at 8pm; meanwhile, there will be pre-show entertainment.<,>主活动晚上8点开始，同时会有预热表演。<,>He was studying law; meanwhile, he also worked part-time.<,>他当时在学习法律，同时也在做兼职。<,>mean(中间)+while(时间)→在中间的时间→同时<,>meantime(adv.同时/n.其间)/mean(adj.卑鄙的/v.意味)/meaning(n.意义/adj.意味深长的)
exclude<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>v.把…排除在外<,>They decided to exclude him from the meeting.<,>他们决定不让他参加会议。<,>This policy excludes people under 18.<,>这项政策将18岁以下的人排除在外。<,>Please exclude personal opinions from the report.<,>请在报告中排除个人观点。<,>ex(出)+clud(关闭)+e→关在外面→排除<,>include(v.包括)/conclude(v.结束)/preclude(v.阻止)

convenience<,>/kənˈviːniəns/<,>/kənˈviːnjəns/<,>n.便利/n.方便/n.厕所<,>The hotel offers great convenience for travelers.<,>这家酒店为旅客提供了极大的便利。<,>There's a public convenience near the park.<,>公园附近有个公共厕所。<,>Online shopping is all about convenience.<,>网上购物就是为了方便。<,>con(共同)+ven(来)+ience→一起来到方便之处→便利<,>convention(n.大会/n.惯例)/convenient(adj.方便的)/inconvenience(n.不便)
rank<,>/ræŋk/<,>/ræŋk/<,>n.排/n.横行/n.社会阶层<,>He holds a high rank in the company.<,>他在公司里职位很高。<,>The soldiers stood in neat ranks.<,>士兵们整齐地站成排。<,>She comes from a noble rank.<,>她出身贵族阶层。<,>ran(跑)+k(king国王)→国王跑在前面→等级<,>range(n.范围/v.排列)/rant(v.咆哮/n.狂言)/bank(n.银行/v.堆积)

nowadays<,>/ˈnaʊədeɪz/<,>/ˈnaʊəˌdeɪz/<,>adv.现今/adv.现在<,>Nowadays, people rely heavily on technology.<,>现今人们非常依赖科技。<,>Kids nowadays grow up too fast.<,>现在的孩子成长得太快了。<,>Nowadays, it's hard to find a payphone.<,>现在很难找到公用电话了。<,>now(现在)+a+day(天)+s→现在的日子→现今<,>nowhere(adv.无处/n.不存在)/anyways(adv.无论如何)/always(adv.总是)

fall<,>/fɔːl/<,>/fɔl/<,>v.落下/v.跌倒/v.陷落<,>Leaves fall from the trees in autumn.<,>秋天树叶从树上落下。<,>She fell down the stairs.<,>她从楼梯上跌倒了。<,>The city fell to the enemy.<,>这座城市陷落了。<,>fal(错误)+l→犯错导致跌落→跌倒<,>fail(v.失败/n.失误)/full(adj.满的)/fell(v.砍伐/adj.凶猛的)

furious<,>/ˈfjʊəriəs/<,>/ˈfjʊriəs/<,>adj.狂怒的/adj.狂暴的<,>He was furious when he heard the news.<,>他听到消息时暴怒。<,>A furious storm hit the coast.<,>猛烈的风暴袭击了海岸。<,>She gave him a furious look.<,>她愤怒地看了他一眼。<,>fury(愤怒)+ous(形容词后缀)→愤怒的<,>curious(adj.好奇的)/serious(adj.严肃的)/futile(adj.无用的)

tap<,>/tæp/<,>/tæp/<,>n.轻叩/v.轻叩<,>There was a gentle tap on the door.<,>门上传来轻轻的叩击声。<,>She tapped him on the shoulder.<,>她轻轻拍了拍他的肩膀。<,>He tapped his fingers impatiently.<,>他不耐烦地轻敲手指。<,>t(动作)+ap(apple苹果)→轻拍苹果→轻叩<,>top(n.顶部/v.超过)/tip(n.尖端/v.倾斜)/trap(n.陷阱/v.诱捕)

immediate<,>/ɪˈmiːdiət/<,>/ɪˈmidiət/<,>adj.立即的/adj.直接的<,>We need an immediate response.<,>我们需要立即得到回复。<,>He's in the immediate vicinity.<,>他就在附近。<,>The medicine had an immediate effect.<,>这药立即见效了。<,>im(不)+mediate(中间)→没有中间环节→直接的<,>intermediate(adj.中间的)/mediate(v.调解)/immense(adj.巨大的)

bruise<,>/bruːz/<,>/bruz/<,>n.青肿/n.伤痕/n.擦伤<,>She had a nasty bruise on her arm.<,>她手臂上有严重的淤青。<,>The apple was covered in bruises.<,>苹果上满是碰伤的痕迹。<,>His ego was bruised by the criticism.<,>批评伤了他的自尊心。<,>br(break打破)+uise→皮肤"打破"→淤青<,>cruise(v.巡航/n.航行)/breeze(n.微风/v.轻松完成)/braise(v.炖煮)

be<,>/biː/<,>/bi/<,>v.是/v.在<,>To be or not to be, that is the question.<,>生存还是毁灭，这是个问题。<,>She wants to be a doctor.<,>她想成为一名医生。<,>The keys are on the table.<,>钥匙在桌子上。<,>最简单的动词<,>bee(n.蜜蜂)/by(prep.通过)/buy(v.购买)

politics<,>/ˈpɒlətɪks/<,>/ˈpɑːlətɪks/<,>n.政治/n.政纲/n.政治学<,>He's studying politics at university.<,>他在大学学习政治学。<,>Office politics can be exhausting.<,>职场政治可能让人精疲力尽。<,>She entered politics at a young age.<,>她年轻时就从政了。<,>poli(城市)+tics(学科)→管理城市的学问→政治<,>policy(n.政策)/polite(adj.礼貌的)/police(n.警察)

define<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>/dɪˈfaɪn/<,>v.给...下定义/v.限定<,>Can you define this word for me?<,>你能为我定义这个词吗？<,>The boundaries are clearly defined.<,>边界被明确限定。<,>This moment defined his career.<,>这一刻决定了他的职业生涯。<,>de(下)+fine(界限)→划下界限→定义<,>refine(v.精炼)/confine(v.限制)/defile(v.玷污/n.峡谷)
heavily<,>/ˈhevɪli/<,>/ˈhɛvəli/<,>adv.重重地/adv.大量地<,>It rained heavily last night.<,>昨晚雨下得很大。<,>She was heavily involved in the project.<,>她大量参与了这个项目。<,>He was breathing heavily after running.<,>跑步后他重重地喘着气。<,>heavy(重的)+ly(副词后缀)→重重地<,>hardly(adv.几乎不)/heavenly(adj.天堂的)

pat<,>/pæt/<,>/pæt/<,>v.轻拍/n.轻拍<,>She gave the dog a pat on the head.<,>她轻轻拍了拍狗的头。<,>He patted his pockets looking for the keys.<,>他轻拍口袋找钥匙。<,>The teacher patted the student on the back for good work.<,>老师轻拍学生的背表扬他做得好。<,>拟声词，模仿轻拍的声音<,>pet(n.宠物)/pad(n.垫子)/patent(n.专利)

dose<,>/dəʊs/<,>/doʊs/<,>n.剂量/n.一剂<,>Take one dose of medicine every four hours.<,>每四小时服一剂药。<,>The doctor prescribed a high dose of antibiotics.<,>医生开了大剂量的抗生素。<,>An overdose can be dangerous.<,>过量服用可能有危险。<,>do(做)+se(拼音"色")→做色剂→剂量<,>doze(v.打盹)/hose(n.软管)/rose(n.玫瑰)

operate<,>/ˈɒpəreɪt/<,>/ˈɑːpəreɪt/<,>v.操作/v.施行手术<,>Do you know how to operate this machine?<,>你知道怎么操作这台机器吗？<,>The surgeon will operate on his knee tomorrow.<,>外科医生明天将给他的膝盖做手术。<,>The company operates in several countries.<,>这家公司在多个国家运营。<,>oper(工作)+ate(动词后缀)→操作<,>cooperate(v.合作)/operator(n.操作员)/opera(n.歌剧)

observe<,>/əbˈzɜːv/<,>/əbˈzɜːrv/<,>v.看到/v.遵守/v.说<,>We must observe the traffic rules.<,>我们必须遵守交通规则。<,>Did you observe anything unusual?<,>你注意到什么异常了吗？<,>He observed that the plan was risky.<,>他说这个计划有风险。<,>ob(强调)+serve(保持)→保持注意→观察<,>reserve(v.保留)/deserve(v.值得)/preserve(v.保存)

auxiliary<,>/ɔːɡˈzɪliəri/<,>/ɔːɡˈzɪliəri/<,>adj.辅助的<,>An auxiliary engine provides backup power.<,>辅助发动机提供备用电源。<,>She works as an auxiliary nurse.<,>她是一名助理护士。<,>The auxiliary troops arrived later.<,>援军稍后到达。<,>aux(增加)+iliary(形容词后缀)→增加的→辅助的<,>auxin(n.生长素)/axis(n.轴)/axle(n.轮轴)

proportion<,>/prəˈpɔːʃn/<,>/prəˈpɔːrʃn/<,>n.部分/n.比率<,>The proportion of women in the team is increasing.<,>团队中女性的比例在增加。<,>Mix the ingredients in the right proportions.<,>按正确比例混合配料。<,>A large proportion of the budget was spent on marketing.<,>预算的很大一部分花在了营销上。<,>pro(向前)+portion(部分)→各部分之间的关系→比例<,>portion(n.部分)/apportion(v.分配)/portion(n.部分)

record<,>/ˈrekɔːd/<,>/ˈrekərd/<,>n.记录/n.履历/v.记录<,>She broke the world record.<,>她打破了世界纪录。<,>Please record your name here.<,>请在这里记录你的名字。<,>He has a good employment record.<,>他有良好的工作履历。<,>re(再)+cord(心)→再次记在心里→记录<,>accord(v.一致)/concord(n.和谐)/discord(n.不和)

groan<,>/ɡrəʊn/<,>/ɡroʊn/<,>v.呻吟/n.呻吟<,>He groaned in pain.<,>他痛苦地呻吟。<,>The old floor groaned under our weight.<,>旧地板在我们的重量下发出吱呀声。<,>She let out a groan of disappointment.<,>她发出了失望的呻吟。<,>拟声词，模仿呻吟的声音<,>grown(adj.长大的)/groin(n.腹股沟)/grain(n.谷物)

meat<,>/miːt/<,>/mit/<,>n.肉<,>I prefer to eat lean meat rather than fatty meat.<,>我更喜欢吃瘦肉而不是肥肉。<,>She cooked the meat with some herbs and spices.<,>她用一些香草和香料烹饪了肉。<,>The meat was so tender that it melted in my mouth.<,>肉非常嫩，入口即化。<,>me(我)+at(在)→我在吃肉<,>meet(v. 遇见)/meal(n. 餐)/meek(adj. 温顺的)

harden<,>/ˈhɑːdn/<,>/ˈhɑrdn/<,>v.使变硬<,>The cold weather will harden the ground.<,>寒冷的天气会使地面变硬。<,>He hardened his heart against their pleas.<,>他对他们的恳求无动于衷。<,>The clay will harden when it dries.<,>黏土干燥后会变硬。<,>hard(硬的)+en(使)→使变硬<,>harden(v. 使变硬)/hardship(n. 困苦)/hardware(n. 硬件)

particular<,>/pəˈtɪkjələ(r)/<,>/pərˈtɪkjələr/<,>adj.特定的/adj.特殊的<,>She is very particular about her clothes.<,>她对衣服非常挑剔。<,>There was nothing in particular to discuss at the meeting.<,>会议上没有什么特别的事情要讨论。<,>He took particular care of his grandmother.<,>他特别照顾他的祖母。<,>part(部分)+icular(形容词后缀)→特定的部分→特定的<,>particle(n. 微粒)/participate(v. 参与)/partition(n. 分割)

arm<,>/ɑːm/<,>/ɑrm/<,>n.臂/n.臂状物/n.武器<,>He broke his arm in the accident.<,>他在事故中摔断了手臂。<,>The company is the research arm of the government.<,>这家公司是政府的研究机构。<,>They were armed with guns.<,>他们配备了枪支。<,>arm(手臂)→像手臂一样的东西→臂状物<,>alarm(n. 警报)/harm(n. 伤害)/farm(n. 农场)

lip<,>/lɪp/<,>/lɪp/<,>n.嘴唇<,>She bit her lip nervously.<,>她紧张地咬着嘴唇。<,>He had a cut on his lower lip.<,>他的下嘴唇有一道伤口。<,>The words were just on the tip of her lips.<,>话就在她的嘴边。<,>lip(嘴唇)→发音时嘴唇的动作<,>slip(v. 滑倒)/clip(n. 夹子)/flip(v. 翻转)

fable<,>/ˈfeɪbl/<,>/ˈfeɪbəl/<,>n.寓言/n.虚构的故事<,>Aesop's Fables are famous all over the world.<,>伊索寓言闻名世界。<,>The story is just a fable, not a real event.<,>这个故事只是个寓言，不是真实事件。<,>He told a fable about a clever fox.<,>他讲了一个关于聪明狐狸的寓言。<,>fab(说)+le→说出来的故事→寓言<,>fable(n. 寓言)/fabulous(adj. 极好的)/fabric(n. 织物)

excuse<,>/ɪkˈskjuːs/<,>/ɪkˈskjus/<,>v.原谅/v.免除/n.借口<,>Excuse me, can I ask you a question?<,>打扰一下，我能问你一个问题吗？<,>He made an excuse for being late.<,>他为迟到找了个借口。<,>She was excused from jury duty.<,>她被免除了陪审团义务。<,>ex(出)+cuse(原因)→给出原因→借口<,>accuse(v. 指控)/because(conj. 因为)/cause(n. 原因)

discharge<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑrdʒ/<,>v.释放/v.排出/n.释放<,>The factory discharges waste into the river.<,>这家工厂把废水排入河里。<,>He was discharged from the hospital yesterday.<,>他昨天出院了。<,>The battery is fully discharged.<,>电池已经完全放电了。<,>dis(不)+charge(装载)→不装载→释放<,>charge(v. 充电)/recharge(v. 再充电)/overcharge(v. 要价过高)

cellar<,>/ˈselə(r)/<,>/ˈsɛlər/<,>n.地窑/n.地下室<,>They store wine in the cellar.<,>他们在地窖里储存葡萄酒。<,>The cellar was dark and damp.<,>地下室又黑又潮湿。<,>He went down to the cellar to get some potatoes.<,>他下到地窖去拿一些土豆。<,>cell(小房间)+ar→地下的房间→地窖<,>cell(n. 细胞)/collar(n. 衣领)/caller(n. 打电话者)

noisy<,>/ˈnɔɪzi/<,>/ˈnɔɪzi/<,>adj.喧闹的/adj.嘈杂的<,>The children were being very noisy.<,>孩子们非常吵闹。<,>It's too noisy here to have a conversation.<,>这里太吵了，没法交谈。<,>The noisy crowd cheered for their team.<,>喧闹的人群为他们的队伍欢呼。<,>noise(噪音)+y(形容词后缀)→嘈杂的<,>noise(n. 噪音)/nose(n. 鼻子)/nosy(adj. 爱管闲事的)
systematic<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk/<,>adj.有系统的/adj.有计划的<,>She has a systematic approach to solving problems.<,>她有一套系统性的解决问题的方法。<,>The research was conducted in a systematic manner.<,>这项研究是以系统的方式进行的。<,>He keeps his files in a systematic order.<,>他把文件整理得井井有条。<,>system(系统)+atic(形容词后缀)→有系统的<,>systemic(adj. 全身的)/sympathetic(adj. 同情的)

trail<,>/treɪl/<,>/treɪl/<,>n.小径/n.痕迹/v.跟踪<,>We followed a narrow trail through the forest.<,>我们沿着一条狭窄的小径穿过森林。<,>The detective trailed the suspect for hours.<,>侦探跟踪了嫌疑人好几个小时。<,>There was a trail of footprints in the snow.<,>雪地上有一串脚印。<,>t+rail(栏杆)→像栏杆一样延伸的小径<,>tail(n.尾巴/v.跟踪)/train(n.火车/v.训练)

her<,>/hɜː(r)/<,>/hɜːr/<,>pron.(宾格)她/det.她的<,>I gave her the book yesterday.<,>我昨天把书给了她。<,>Her dress is very beautiful.<,>她的裙子非常漂亮。<,>Can you see her in the crowd?<,>你能在人群中看到她吗？<,>he(他)+r→她<,>his(det.他的)/hers(pron.她的(东西))

rather<,>/ˈrɑːðə(r)/<,>/ˈræðər/<,>adv.相当/adv.宁可，宁愿<,>I would rather stay home than go out tonight.<,>今晚我宁愿呆在家里也不愿出去。<,>It's rather cold today, isn't it?<,>今天相当冷，不是吗？<,>She'd rather die than surrender.<,>她宁死不屈。<,>rat(老鼠)+her(她)→老鼠和她都宁愿躲起来<,>whether(conj.是否)/father(n.父亲)

liquid<,>/ˈlɪkwɪd/<,>/ˈlɪkwɪd/<,>n.液体/adj.液体的<,>Water is the most common liquid on Earth.<,>水是地球上最常见的液体。<,>The medicine comes in liquid form.<,>这种药是液体形态的。<,>She poured the liquid into a glass.<,>她把液体倒入玻璃杯中。<,>liqu(流动)+id→流动的东西→液体<,>solid(n.固体/adj.固体的)/liquor(n.烈酒)

indirect<,>/ˌɪndəˈrekt/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈrekt/<,>adj.间接的/adj.不坦率的<,>He gave me an indirect answer to my question.<,>他对我的问题给出了一个间接的回答。<,>We took an indirect route to avoid traffic.<,>我们走了一条迂回路线以避开交通拥堵。<,>Her criticism was indirect but clear.<,>她的批评很委婉但很清楚。<,>in(不)+direct(直接的)→间接的<,>direct(adj.直接的)/incorrect(adj.不正确的)

meantime<,>/ˈmiːntaɪm/<,>/ˈmiːntaɪm/<,>n.其时，其间/adv.当时<,>In the meantime, let's have some coffee.<,>在此期间，我们喝点咖啡吧。<,>She continued working in the meantime.<,>她在此期间继续工作。<,>The repairs will take a week; meantime we'll have to manage without the car.<,>修理需要一周时间；在此期间我们得设法不用车。<,>mean(中间)+time(时间)→中间时间→其间<,>meanwhile(adv.同时)/meant(v.意味着)

portion<,>/ˈpɔːʃn/<,>/ˈpɔːrʃn/<,>n.一部分/n.一份<,>She only ate a small portion of her meal.<,>她只吃了一小部分饭菜。<,>A large portion of the budget goes to education.<,>预算的一大部分用于教育。<,>Could you give me a portion of that cake?<,>你能给我一份那个蛋糕吗？<,>port(部分)+ion→一部分<,>proportion(n.比例)/partition(n.分割)

dinner<,>/ˈdɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈdɪnər/<,>n.正餐，主餐/n.宴会<,>We usually have dinner at 7 o'clock.<,>我们通常7点吃晚餐。<,>They invited us to a formal dinner.<,>他们邀请我们参加一个正式宴会。<,>What's for dinner tonight?<,>今晚吃什么？<,>din(噪音)+ner→晚餐时家人团聚的喧闹声<,>diner(n.用餐者)/dine(v.进餐)

distribution<,>/ˌdɪstrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>/ˌdɪstrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>n.分发，分配/n.分布<,>The distribution of food to the refugees began yesterday.<,>昨天开始向难民分发食物。<,>This map shows the population distribution in the country.<,>这张地图显示了该国的人口分布。<,>We need to improve our distribution network.<,>我们需要改进我们的分销网络。<,>dis(分开)+tribute(给予)+ion→分发<,>contribution(n.贡献)/attribution(n.归因)
African<,>/ˈæfrɪkən/<,>/ˈæfrɪkən/<,>adj.非洲的/n.非洲人<,>African wildlife is diverse and beautiful.<,>非洲的野生动物多样而美丽。<,>He is an African who moved to Europe.<,>他是移居欧洲的非洲人。<,>The African continent has a rich cultural heritage.<,>非洲大陆拥有丰富的文化遗产。<,>Africa(非洲)+n(形容词后缀)→非洲的<,>America(n.美洲)/Asia(n.亚洲)/Europe(n.欧洲)

emphasize<,>/ˈemfəsaɪz/<,>/ˈɛmfəˌsaɪz/<,>v.强调/v.着重<,>The teacher emphasized the importance of homework.<,>老师强调了家庭作业的重要性。<,>He emphasized his point by raising his voice.<,>他提高声音来强调他的观点。<,>She emphasized that safety comes first.<,>她强调安全第一。<,>em(使)+phas(显示)+ize(动词后缀)→使显示→强调<,>emphasis(n.强调)/emphatic(adj.强调的)/sympathize(v.同情)

kill<,>/kɪl/<,>/kɪl/<,>v.杀死/v.扼杀/v.消磨<,>Hunting can kill endangered animals.<,>狩猎会杀死濒危动物。<,>Boredom can kill time but not creativity.<,>无聊能消磨时间但不能扼杀创造力。<,>The frost killed the flowers.<,>霜冻把花冻死了。<,>k+ill(病)→杀死<,>skill(n.技能)/mill(n.磨坊)/pill(n.药丸)

cough<,>/kɒf/<,>/kɔːf/<,>v.咳/v.咳嗽/n.咳嗽<,>Cover your mouth when you cough.<,>咳嗽时要捂住嘴。<,>She has a persistent cough.<,>她咳嗽一直不好。<,>The medicine helps relieve cough.<,>这种药有助于缓解咳嗽。<,>cough(拟声词)→咳嗽的声音<,>rough(adj.粗糙的)/tough(adj.坚韧的)/though(conj.虽然)

restraint<,>/rɪˈstreɪnt/<,>/rɪˈstreɪnt/<,>n.抑制/n.遏制/n.克制<,>He showed great restraint in difficult situations.<,>他在困境中表现出极大的克制。<,>The government imposed restraints on trade.<,>政府对贸易实施了限制。<,>She broke free from all restraints.<,>她摆脱了所有束缚。<,>re(回)+strain(拉紧)+t→拉回来→克制<,>constraint(n.约束)/strain(v.拉紧)/restrict(v.限制)

composition<,>/ˌkɒmpəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmpəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.构成/n.作品/n.写作<,>The composition of air includes oxygen and nitrogen.<,>空气的构成包括氧气和氮气。<,>She wrote a beautiful composition.<,>她写了一篇优美的作文。<,>Mozart's compositions are world-famous.<,>莫扎特的作品举世闻名。<,>com(共同)+posit(放置)+ion→放在一起→构成<,>composite(adj.复合的)/deposition(n.沉积)/opposition(n.反对)

porter<,>/ˈpɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈpɔːrtər/<,>n.搬运工人<,>The porter carried our luggage to the room.<,>搬运工把我们的行李搬到了房间。<,>He works as a porter at the railway station.<,>他在火车站当搬运工。<,>The hotel porter was very helpful.<,>酒店行李员非常乐于助人。<,>port(搬运)+er(人)→搬运的人<,>report(v.报告)/import(v.进口)/export(v.出口)

verify<,>/ˈverɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈvɛrəˌfaɪ/<,>v.证实/v.查证/v.证明<,>Please verify your email address.<,>请验证您的电子邮件地址。<,>The police verified his alibi.<,>警方核实了他的不在场证明。<,>We need to verify these facts.<,>我们需要核实这些事实。<,>ver(真实)+ify(使)→使真实→证实<,>verification(n.验证)/certify(v.证明)/testify(v.作证)

it<,>/ɪt/<,>/ɪt/<,>pron.这/pron.那/pron.它<,>It is raining outside.<,>外面在下雨。<,>I can't find my book - where is it?<,>我找不到我的书-它在哪里？<,>It's important to drink enough water.<,>喝足够的水很重要。<,>it(最简单的代词)→它<,>its(pron.它的)/bit(n.一点)/fit(v.适合)

comb<,>/kəʊm/<,>/koʊm/<,>n.梳子/v.梳理<,>She combed her hair before going out.<,>她出门前梳了头发。<,>I lost my favorite comb.<,>我丢了我最喜欢的梳子。<,>The dog needs to be combed regularly.<,>这只狗需要定期梳理毛发。<,>comb(形状像梳子)→梳子<,>bomb(n.炸弹)/tomb(n.坟墓)/womb(n.子宫)
conquest<,>/ˈkɒŋkwest/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkwest/<,>n.攻取/n.征服/n.克服<,>The conquest of this mountain was a great achievement.<,>征服这座山是一项伟大的成就。<,>He spoke about the conquest of his fears.<,>他谈到了如何克服恐惧。<,>The Roman conquest changed the course of history.<,>罗马的征服改变了历史进程。<,>con(共同)+quest(寻求)→共同寻求→征服<,>request(n.请求/v.要求)/question(n.问题/v.询问)

bristle<,>/ˈbrɪs(ə)l/<,>/ˈbrɪsəl/<,>n.短而硬的毛/n.鬃毛<,>The brush is made of boar bristles.<,>这把刷子是用野猪鬃毛制成的。<,>His beard was full of bristles.<,>他的胡须又短又硬。<,>The cat's back bristled when it saw the dog.<,>猫看到狗时背上的毛都竖起来了。<,>brist(硬毛)+le(小)→小硬毛<,>whistle(n.口哨/v.吹口哨)/rustle(n.沙沙声/v.发出沙沙声)

especially<,>/ɪˈspeʃ(ə)li/<,>/əˈspeʃəli/<,>adv.尤其/adv.特别/adv.格外<,>I love all fruits, especially apples.<,>我喜欢所有水果，尤其是苹果。<,>She looked especially beautiful tonight.<,>她今晚看起来格外美丽。<,>This rule applies especially to new employees.<,>这条规则特别适用于新员工。<,>e(出)+special(特别的)+ly(副词后缀)→特别地<,>special(adj.特别的)/specifically(adv.具体地)

absent<,>/ˈæbs(ə)nt/<,>/ˈæbsənt/<,>adj.不在场的/adj.缺乏的<,>He was absent from school yesterday.<,>他昨天没来上学。<,>An absent expression crossed her face.<,>她脸上露出心不在焉的表情。<,>Love was conspicuously absent from his childhood.<,>他的童年明显缺乏关爱。<,>ab(离开)+sent(存在)→离开存在→缺席的<,>present(adj.在场的)/absence(n.缺席)

bottle<,>/ˈbɒt(ə)l/<,>/ˈbɑːtəl/<,>n.瓶/n.酒瓶/n.一瓶<,>She put the message in a bottle and threw it into the sea.<,>她把纸条放进瓶子扔进了大海。<,>He drank a whole bottle of wine.<,>他喝了一整瓶酒。<,>The baby was drinking from his bottle.<,>婴儿正在用奶瓶喝奶。<,>bot(容器)+tle(小)→小容器→瓶子<,>battle(n.战斗)/bottle(v.把...装入瓶中)

crush<,>/krʌʃ/<,>/krʌʃ/<,>v.压碎/v.碾碎/v.镇压<,>Don't crush the eggs when packing them.<,>包装鸡蛋时不要压碎它们。<,>The government crushed the rebellion.<,>政府镇压了叛乱。<,>She had a crush on her teacher.<,>她暗恋她的老师。<,>cru(压)+sh(动作)→压的动作→压碎<,>crash(v.碰撞/n.撞车)/brush(n.刷子/v.刷)

delegation<,>/ˌdelɪˈɡeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌdɛləˈɡeɪʃən/<,>n.代表团<,>A Chinese delegation visited our company.<,>一个中国代表团访问了我们公司。<,>The delegation will attend the conference next week.<,>代表团将参加下周的会议。<,>He was part of the official delegation.<,>他是官方代表团的一员。<,>de(离开)+leg(派遣)+ation(名词后缀)→被派遣出去的团体→代表团<,>delegate(n.代表/v.委派)/legation(n.公使馆)

ourselves<,>/aʊəˈselvz/<,>/ɑːrˈselvz/<,>pron.我们自己<,>We must take care of ourselves.<,>我们必须照顾好自己。<,>We built this house ourselves.<,>我们自己建造了这座房子。<,>Let's introduce ourselves.<,>让我们自我介绍一下。<,>our(我们的)+selves(自己)→我们自己<,>myself(我自己)/yourself(你自己)

civilization<,>/ˌsɪvɪlaɪˈzeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌsɪvələˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.文明/n.文化/n.开化<,>Ancient Egyptian civilization was highly advanced.<,>古埃及文明非常先进。<,>The spread of civilization took centuries.<,>文明的传播花了几个世纪。<,>He wrote a book about Western civilization.<,>他写了一本关于西方文明的书。<,>civil(公民的)+ization(名词后缀)→公民化→文明<,>civil(adj.公民的)/civilian(n.平民)

objective<,>/əbˈdʒektɪv/<,>/əbˈdʒektɪv/<,>adj.客观的/adj.无偏见的<,>We need an objective opinion on this matter.<,>我们需要对此事的客观意见。<,>The reporter tried to remain objective.<,>记者试图保持客观。<,>What's the objective of this project?<,>这个项目的目标是什么？<,>object(物体)+ive(形容词后缀)→像物体一样实在的→客观的<,>subjective(adj.主观的)/object(n.物体/v.反对)
sulphur<,>/ˈsʌlfə(r)/<,>/ˈsʌlfər/<,>n.硫（磺）/n.硫黄<,>The smell of sulphur filled the air near the volcano.<,>火山附近的空气中弥漫着硫磺的气味。<,>Sulphur is used in the production of matches.<,>硫磺被用于火柴的生产。<,>Some hot springs contain high levels of sulphur.<,>一些温泉含有高浓度的硫磺。<,>sul(硫)+phur(音似"fur")→硫磺的气味像毛皮燃烧<,>sulfur(美式拼写)/sulphate(n.硫酸盐)

request<,>/rɪˈkwest/<,>/rɪˈkwɛst/<,>n.请求/n.要求/v.请求/v.要求<,>She made a request for more information.<,>她请求获取更多信息。<,>The manager denied his request for leave.<,>经理拒绝了他的休假请求。<,>I request that you keep this confidential.<,>我要求你对此保密。<,>re(再)+quest(寻求)→再次寻求→请求<,>require(v.需要)/inquire(v.询问)/conquest(n.征服)

talent<,>/ˈtælənt/<,>/ˈtælənt/<,>n.才能/n.天才/n.人才<,>She has a remarkable talent for painting.<,>她在绘画方面有非凡的才能。<,>The company is looking for young talent.<,>公司正在寻找年轻人才。<,>Mozart showed musical talent at an early age.<,>莫扎特在很小的时候就展现出了音乐天赋。<,>tal(高)+ent(人)→高人→天才<,>talon(n.猛禽的爪)/tall(adj.高的)/latent(adj.潜在的)

physical<,>/ˈfɪzɪkl/<,>/ˈfɪzɪkəl/<,>adj.物质的/adj.物理的<,>Physical exercise is important for health.<,>体育锻炼对健康很重要。<,>There is no physical evidence to support the claim.<,>没有物质证据支持这一说法。<,>He teaches physical science at the university.<,>他在大学教授物理科学。<,>phys(自然)+ical(形容词后缀)→自然的→物理的<,>physician(n.医生)/metaphysical(adj.形而上学的)/psychical(adj.心灵的)

appliance<,>/əˈplaɪəns/<,>/əˈplaɪəns/<,>n.用具/n.器具/n.器械<,>The kitchen is equipped with modern appliances.<,>厨房配备了现代化的器具。<,>This appliance consumes too much electricity.<,>这个电器耗电量太大。<,>He repaired the broken appliance himself.<,>他自己修理了坏掉的器械。<,>ap(加强)+pli(折叠)+ance→折叠使用的工具→器具<,>application(n.申请)/compliance(n.顺从)/applause(n.掌声)

inspection<,>/ɪnˈspekʃn/<,>/ɪnˈspɛkʃən/<,>n.检阅/n.检查/n.审查<,>The building failed the safety inspection.<,>这栋建筑未能通过安全检查。<,>The general conducted an inspection of the troops.<,>将军对部队进行了检阅。<,>All products undergo strict inspection before shipping.<,>所有产品在发货前都要经过严格检查。<,>in(内)+spect(看)+ion→向内看→检查<,>introspection(n.内省)/retrospection(n.回顾)/perspective(n.观点)

bang<,>/bæŋ/<,>/bæŋ/<,>n.巨响/n.枪声/n.猛击<,>The door shut with a loud bang.<,>门砰的一声关上了。<,>We heard a bang and then saw smoke.<,>我们听到一声巨响，然后看到了烟。<,>He gave the table a bang with his fist.<,>他用拳头猛击了一下桌子。<,>象声词，模拟撞击声<,>banger(n.香肠)/bangle(n.手镯)/ban(n.禁令)

reflect<,>/rɪˈflekt/<,>/rɪˈflɛkt/<,>v.反射/v.反映/v.思考<,>The mirror reflects light perfectly.<,>镜子完美地反射光线。<,>Her actions reflect her upbringing.<,>她的行为反映了她的教养。<,>I need time to reflect on this decision.<,>我需要时间思考这个决定。<,>re(回)+flect(弯曲)→光线弯曲返回→反射<,>deflect(v.偏转)/inflect(v.弯曲)/reflection(n.反射)

happiness<,>/ˈhæpinəs/<,>/ˈhæpinəs/<,>n.幸福/n.幸运/n.快乐<,>Money doesn't always bring happiness.<,>金钱并不总能带来幸福。<,>She found happiness in simple things.<,>她在简单的事物中找到了快乐。<,>Wishing you health and happiness in the new year.<,>祝你在新的一年里健康快乐。<,>happy(快乐)+ness(名词后缀)→快乐的状态<,>happen(v.发生)/harp(n.竖琴)/hippiness(n.嬉皮风格)

attention<,>/əˈtenʃn/<,>/əˈtɛnʃən/<,>n.注意/n.留心/n.注意力<,>Please pay attention to the teacher.<,>请注意听老师讲课。<,>The accident attracted much attention.<,>这起事故引起了很多关注。<,>He has trouble maintaining attention in class.<,>他在课堂上难以保持注意力。<,>at(向)+tent(伸展)+ion→向某处伸展→注意<,>intention(n.意图)/extension(n.延伸)/retention(n.保留)
January<,>/ˈdʒænjuəri/<,>/ˈdʒænjuˌɛri/<,>n.一月<,>My birthday is in January.<,>我的生日在一月。<,>January is the first month of the year.<,>一月是一年的第一个月。<,>We usually have snow in January.<,>我们通常在一月有雪。<,>Janus(罗马神话中的门神)+ary→一月是辞旧迎新的月份<,>February(n.二月)/December(n.十二月)  

venture<,>/ˈventʃə(r)/<,>/ˈvɛntʃər/<,>n.冒险/v.敢于<,>They ventured into the unknown forest.<,>他们冒险进入未知的森林。<,>It was a risky business venture.<,>这是一次冒险的商业投资。<,>Don't venture out in this storm.<,>不要在这场暴风雨中冒险外出。<,>vent(来)+ure→冒险而来<,>adventure(n.冒险)/advent(n.到来)  

input<,>/ˈɪnpʊt/<,>/ˈɪnˌpʊt/<,>n.输入/n.投入的资金<,>Please provide your input for the project.<,>请为这个项目提供你的意见。<,>The computer needs an input device.<,>电脑需要一个输入设备。<,>We need more input to solve this problem.<,>我们需要更多投入来解决这个问题。<,>in(进入)+put(放)→放进去→输入<,>output(n.输出)/impute(v.归咎于)  

roar<,>/rɔː(r)/<,>/rɔr/<,>v.吼叫/v.呼喊/n.吼<,>The lion roared in the jungle.<,>狮子在丛林中吼叫。<,>The crowd roared with laughter.<,>人群爆发出笑声。<,>We heard the roar of the ocean.<,>我们听到了海洋的咆哮。<,>象声词，模拟吼叫声<,>soar(v.高飞)/boar(n.野猪)  

faithful<,>/ˈfeɪθfl/<,>/ˈfeθfəl/<,>adj.忠诚的/adj.如实的<,>He has been a faithful friend for years.<,>多年来他一直是个忠实的朋友。<,>The movie is faithful to the book.<,>这部电影忠实于原著。<,>She gave a faithful account of the event.<,>她对事件做了如实描述。<,>faith(信念)+ful(充满)→充满信念的<,>fateful(adj.重大的)/fruitful(adj.多产的)  

monkey<,>/ˈmʌŋki/<,>/ˈmʌŋki/<,>n.猴子/n.猿<,>The monkey climbed up the tree quickly.<,>猴子迅速爬上了树。<,>Don't monkey around with the equipment.<,>不要乱动设备。<,>He made a monkey of himself at the party.<,>他在聚会上出丑了。<,>monk(和尚)+ey→像和尚一样聪明的动物<,>donkey(n.驴)/turkey(n.火鸡)  

behalf<,>/bɪˈhɑːf/<,>/bɪˈhæf/<,>n.代表某人<,>I'm speaking on behalf of the team.<,>我代表团队发言。<,>She accepted the award on his behalf.<,>她代表他领奖。<,>Don't worry, I'll take care of it on your behalf.<,>别担心，我会代表你处理这件事。<,>be(成为)+half(一半)→成为某人的一部分→代表<,>behave(v.表现)/behold(v.看见)  

operator<,>/ˈɒpəreɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈɑpəˌreɪtər/<,>n.接线员/n.操作人员<,>The operator connected me to the right department.<,>接线员帮我转接到了正确的部门。<,>He is a skilled machine operator.<,>他是个熟练的机器操作员。<,>The telephone operator was very helpful.<,>电话接线员非常乐于助人。<,>operate(操作)+or(人)→操作的人<,>operand(n.操作数)/operation(n.操作)  

humble<,>/ˈhʌmbl/<,>/ˈhʌmbəl/<,>adj.谦逊的/adj.地位低下的<,>Despite his success, he remained humble.<,>尽管成功了，他依然保持谦逊。<,>She comes from a humble background.<,>她出身卑微。<,>He lived in a humble cottage.<,>他住在一间简陋的小屋里。<,>hum(地)+ble→接近地面的→谦卑的<,>fumble(v.摸索)/tumble(v.跌倒)  

manufacturer<,>/ˌmænjuˈfæktʃərə(r)/<,>/ˌmænjəˈfæktʃərər/<,>n.制造商/n.制造厂<,>This car manufacturer is world-famous.<,>这家汽车制造商世界闻名。<,>The manufacturer recalled the faulty products.<,>制造商召回了有缺陷的产品。<,>He works for a clothing manufacturer.<,>他为一家服装制造厂工作。<,>manu(手)+fact(做)+ure→用手制作→制造<,>manufacture(v.制造)/manuscript(n.手稿)
mug<,>/mʌɡ/<,>/mʌɡ/<,>n.大杯<,>She poured the coffee into a large mug.<,>她把咖啡倒进了一个大杯子里。<,>He drank his tea from a favorite mug.<,>他用最喜欢的杯子喝茶。<,>The mug was filled with hot chocolate.<,>杯子里装满了热巧克力。<,>mug(杯子)与bug(虫子)形似<,>cup(n.杯子)/jug(n.水壶)/muggy(adj.闷热的)  

goat<,>/ɡəʊt/<,>/ɡoʊt/<,>n.山羊<,>The goat climbed up the rocky hill.<,>山羊爬上了多石的山丘。<,>She keeps a goat for its milk.<,>她养了一只山羊来获取羊奶。<,>The goat was grazing in the field.<,>山羊在田野里吃草。<,>goat(山羊)与boat(船)形似<,>sheep(n.绵羊)/ram(n.公羊)/lamb(n.羔羊)  

democracy<,>/dɪˈmɒkrəsi/<,>/dɪˈmɑːkrəsi/<,>n.民主制/民主<,>Greece is the birthplace of democracy.<,>希腊是民主的发源地。<,>The country transitioned to democracy peacefully.<,>这个国家和平过渡到了民主制。<,>Democracy allows citizens to vote for their leaders.<,>民主制度允许公民投票选举领导人。<,>demo(人民)+cracy(统治)→人民统治→民主<,>autocracy(n.独裁)/bureaucracy(n.官僚)/aristocracy(n.贵族统治)  

represent<,>/ˌreprɪˈzent/<,>/ˌrɛprɪˈzɛnt/<,>v.代表/v.象征/v.描绘<,>This painting represents a famous battle.<,>这幅画描绘了一场著名的战役。<,>The lawyer will represent you in court.<,>这位律师将在法庭上代表你。<,>The dove represents peace in many cultures.<,>在许多文化中，鸽子象征和平。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)→再次呈现→代表<,>present(v.呈现/n.礼物)/repress(v.压制)/reproach(v.责备)  

accustom<,>/əˈkʌstəm/<,>/əˈkʌstəm/<,>v.使习惯<,>It took time to accustom myself to the new schedule.<,>我花了一些时间才适应新的时间表。<,>She accustomed her eyes to the darkness.<,>她使自己的眼睛适应了黑暗。<,>You must accustom the child to waking up early.<,>你必须让孩子习惯早起。<,>ac(强调)+custom(习惯)→使习惯<,>custom(n.习惯)/accustomed(adj.习惯的)/customer(n.顾客)  

city<,>/ˈsɪti/<,>/ˈsɪti/<,>n.城市/都市<,>New York is a bustling city.<,>纽约是一个繁华的城市。<,>They moved from the countryside to the city.<,>他们从乡下搬到了城市。<,>The city skyline was impressive at night.<,>夜晚的城市天际线令人印象深刻。<,>city(城市)与citizen(市民)相关<,>town(n.城镇)/village(n.村庄)/metropolis(n.大都市)  

spoil<,>/spɔɪl/<,>/spɔɪl/<,>v.损坏/v.糟蹋/v.宠坏<,>The rain spoiled our picnic plans.<,>下雨破坏了我们的野餐计划。<,>Don't spoil your dinner with snacks.<,>别吃零食糟蹋了你的晚餐。<,>Grandparents often spoil their grandchildren.<,>祖父母常常宠坏他们的孙辈。<,>spoil(损坏)与soil(土壤)形似<,>ruin(v.毁坏)/indulge(v.纵容)/mar(v.破坏)  

packet<,>/ˈpækɪt/<,>/ˈpækɪt/<,>n.小包/小捆<,>She handed me a packet of seeds.<,>她递给我一包种子。<,>The packet contained important documents.<,>这个小包里装着重要文件。<,>He bought a packet of cigarettes.<,>他买了一包香烟。<,>pack(打包)+et(小)→小包<,>package(n.包裹)/parcel(n.邮包)/pack(n.背包)  

object<,>/ˈɒbdʒɪkt/<,>/ˈɑːbdʒɪkt/<,>n.物/n.物体/n.目的<,>The strange object fell from the sky.<,>这个奇怪的物体从天上掉下来。<,>His object was to win the competition.<,>他的目的是赢得比赛。<,>She picked up the shiny object.<,>她捡起了那个闪亮的物体。<,>ob(反)+ject(投)→反向投掷→物体<,>subject(n.主题)/project(n.项目)/reject(v.拒绝)  

rate<,>/reɪt/<,>/reɪt/<,>n.比率/n.速度/n.价格<,>The unemployment rate has decreased.<,>失业率已经下降。<,>He drove at a steady rate.<,>他以稳定的速度驾驶。<,>What's the rate for a single room?<,>单人间价格是多少？<,>rate(比率)与date(日期)形似<,>ratio(n.比例)/speed(n.速度)/fee(n.费用)
American<,>/əˈmerɪkən/<,>/əˈmɛrɪkən/<,>adj.美洲的/n.美国人<,>She is an American citizen.<,>她是一位美国公民。<,>American culture is diverse and vibrant.<,>美洲文化多元且充满活力。<,>He loves American football.<,>他喜欢美式橄榄球。<,>Ameri(America)+can(能)→美洲的/美国人<,>Canadian(adj.加拿大的/n.加拿大人)  

pull<,>/pʊl/<,>/pʊl/<,>v.拉/v.拖/n.拉/n.拉力<,>He pulled the door open.<,>他把门拉开了。<,>The pull of gravity keeps us on the ground.<,>重力使我们保持在地面上。<,>She gave the rope a sharp pull.<,>她猛地拉了一下绳子。<,>pu(扑)+ll(拉)→扑过去拉<,>push(v.推/n.推力)/poll(n.投票/v.获得选票)  

mixture<,>/ˈmɪkstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪkstʃər/<,>n.混合/n.混合物<,>The cake is a mixture of flour and eggs.<,>蛋糕是面粉和鸡蛋的混合物。<,>His feelings were a mixture of joy and sorrow.<,>他的心情悲喜交加。<,>Stir the mixture well before cooking.<,>烹饪前要充分搅拌混合物。<,>mix(混合)+ture(名词后缀)→混合物<,>mature(adj.成熟的/v.成熟)/texture(n.质地/n.纹理)  

October<,>/ɒkˈtəʊbə(r)/<,>/ɑːkˈtoʊbər/<,>n.十月<,>October is the tenth month of the year.<,>十月是一年中的第十个月。<,>The leaves turn red in October.<,>树叶在十月变红。<,>Her birthday is in October.<,>她的生日在十月。<,>Octo(八)+ber→古罗马历法的第八月<,>November(n.十一月)/December(n.十二月)  

pigeon<,>/ˈpɪdʒɪn/<,>/ˈpɪdʒən/<,>n.鸽子<,>A pigeon was cooing on the windowsill.<,>一只鸽子在窗台上咕咕叫。<,>He keeps racing pigeons as a hobby.<,>他养赛鸽作为爱好。<,>The pigeon delivered the message across the city.<,>这只鸽子把信息送到了城市另一端。<,>pig(猪)+eon(看作on)→猪上站着鸽子<,>dove(n.鸽子，尤指白鸽)/pidgin(n.混杂语言)  

conversely<,>/ˈkɒnvɜːsli/<,>/ˈkɑːnvɜːrsli/<,>adv.相反地<,>Conversely, cold weather makes the metal contract.<,>相反，寒冷的天气会使金属收缩。<,>Some people love spicy food; conversely, others hate it.<,>有些人爱吃辣，相反地，有些人讨厌辣。<,>He thought it would fail, but conversely, it succeeded.<,>他以为会失败，但相反地，它成功了。<,>con(共同)+verse(转)+ly→向相反方向转<,>converse(adj.相反的/n.逆向)/reverse(v.逆转/n.反面)  

multiply<,>/ˈmʌltɪplaɪ/<,>/ˈmʌltəplaɪ/<,>v.乘/v.使增加<,>Multiply 5 by 3 to get 15.<,>5乘以3得15。<,>Rabbits multiply rapidly.<,>兔子繁殖得很快。<,>The problems seem to multiply every day.<,>问题似乎每天都在增加。<,>multi(多)+ply(折叠)→多次折叠→增加<,>multiple(adj.多重的/n.倍数)/magnify(v.放大/v.夸大)  

divorce<,>/dɪˈvɔːs/<,>/dɪˈvɔːrs/<,>n.离婚/n.离异/v.离婚<,>Their divorce was finalized last month.<,>他们的离婚上个月正式生效。<,>She decided to divorce her husband.<,>她决定与丈夫离婚。<,>The divorce rate has increased in recent years.<,>近年来离婚率上升了。<,>di(分开)+vorce(转)→分开转→离婚<,>divide(v.分开/n.分歧)/diverse(adj.多样的)  

tray<,>/treɪ/<,>/treɪ/<,>n.托盘/n.碟/n.(浅)盘<,>She carried the tea on a silver tray.<,>她用银托盘端茶。<,>Please put your used dishes in the tray.<,>请把用过的餐具放在托盘里。<,>The waiter dropped a tray of glasses.<,>服务员打翻了一托盘玻璃杯。<,>tr(看作try)+ay→试着用托盘端<,>tray(托盘)/tread(v.踩/n.步态)/treat(v.对待/n.款待)  

contrast<,>/ˈkɒntrɑːst/<,>/ˈkɑːntræst/<,>n.对比/n.对照/n.悬殊<,>The contrast between the two paintings is striking.<,>这两幅画的对比非常鲜明。<,>In contrast to his brother, he is very quiet.<,>与他兄弟相反，他很安静。<,>There's a sharp contrast between rich and poor.<,>贫富差距悬殊。<,>contra(相反)+st(站)→相对而立→对比<,>contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/contest(n.竞赛/v.争辩)
mad<,>/mæd/<,>/mæd/<,>adj.发疯的/adj.恼火的<,>He went mad after the accident.<,>他在事故后疯了。<,>She was mad at him for forgetting her birthday.<,>她因为他忘记她的生日而生气。<,>The crowd went mad with excitement.<,>人群兴奋得发狂。<,>联想：mad与bad（坏的）形似，疯狂的行为往往是坏的。<,>angry（adj.生气的）/crazy（adj.疯狂的）

sacrifice<,>/ˈsækrɪfaɪs/<,>/ˈsækrəˌfaɪs/<,>n.牺牲/n.献祭/v.牺牲/v.献祭<,>They made a great sacrifice for their country.<,>他们为国家做出了巨大的牺牲。<,>Ancient people used to sacrifice animals to the gods.<,>古人过去常常向神献祭动物。<,>She sacrificed her career to take care of her family.<,>她牺牲了自己的事业来照顾家庭。<,>sacr（神圣）+i+fice（做）→做神圣的事→献祭<,>offer（v.提供/n.提议）/victim（n.受害者）

various<,>/ˈveəriəs/<,>/ˈvɛriəs/<,>adj.各种各样的/adj.不同的<,>There are various ways to solve this problem.<,>解决这个问题有多种方法。<,>She has worked in various countries.<,>她在不同的国家工作过。<,>The store sells various kinds of fruits.<,>这家商店出售各种各样的水果。<,>vari（变化）+ous（形容词后缀）→变化的→各种各样的<,>different（adj.不同的）/diverse（adj.多样的）

stuff<,>/stʌf/<,>/stʌf/<,>n.东西/v.装/v.填/v.塞<,>There's a lot of stuff in the attic.<,>阁楼里有很多东西。<,>She stuffed the turkey with herbs.<,>她用香草填塞火鸡。<,>He stuffed his clothes into the suitcase.<,>他把衣服塞进手提箱。<,>联想：stuff与stiff（僵硬的）形似，塞满东西后变得僵硬。<,>fill（v.填满）/things（n.物品）

rely<,>/rɪˈlaɪ/<,>/rɪˈlaɪ/<,>v.依赖/v.依靠/v.信赖<,>You can rely on me to keep your secret.<,>你可以信赖我保守你的秘密。<,>She relies on public transport to get to work.<,>她依赖公共交通工具去上班。<,>Don't rely too much on others.<,>不要太依赖别人。<,>re（再次）+ly（绑）→再次绑住→依赖<,>depend（v.依赖）/trust（v.信任）

diameter<,>/daɪˈæmɪtə(r)/<,>/daɪˈæmɪtər/<,>n.直径<,>The diameter of the circle is 10 cm.<,>这个圆的直径是10厘米。<,>Measure the diameter of the pipe.<,>测量管子的直径。<,>The tree has a diameter of two meters.<,>这棵树的直径有两米。<,>dia（穿过）+meter（测量）→穿过圆心的测量→直径<,>radius（n.半径）/circumference（n.周长）

boss<,>/bɒs/<,>/bɔs/<,>n.老板/n.上司/v.指挥<,>My boss is very strict.<,>我的老板非常严格。<,>He bosses everyone around.<,>他指挥所有人。<,>She was promoted to boss last year.<,>她去年被提升为上司。<,>联想：boss与loss（损失）形似，老板的决策可能导致损失。<,>leader（n.领导）/manager（n.经理）

dying<,>/ˈdaɪɪŋ/<,>/ˈdaɪɪŋ/<,>adj.垂死的/adj.临终的<,>The dying man whispered his last words.<,>垂死的人低声说出了他的遗言。<,>She visited her dying grandmother in the hospital.<,>她去医院看望她临终的祖母。<,>The dying embers of the fire glowed faintly.<,>即将熄灭的火炭发出微弱的光。<,>die（死）+ing（进行时）→正在死的→垂死的<,>dead（adj.死的）/death（n.死亡）

indeed<,>/ɪnˈdiːd/<,>/ɪnˈdid/<,>adv.确实/adv.真正地<,>It is indeed a beautiful day.<,>今天确实是个美丽的日子。<,>He is indeed a talented musician.<,>他确实是个有才华的音乐家。<,>Thank you very much indeed.<,>真的非常感谢你。<,>in（在...内）+deed（行为）→在行为内→确实<,>really（adv.真正地）/truly（adv.真实地）

ignorant<,>/ˈɪɡnərənt/<,>/ˈɪɡnərənt/<,>adj.不知道的/adj.无知的<,>He is ignorant of the facts.<,>他不知道事实。<,>She was ignorant about the topic.<,>她对这个话题一无所知。<,>Ignorant people often make mistakes.<,>无知的人经常犯错。<,>i（不）+gnor（知道）+ant（形容词后缀）→不知道的→无知的<,>unaware（adj.未意识到的）/stupid（adj.愚蠢的）
occasionally<,>/əˈkeɪʒnəli/<,>/əˈkeɪʒnəli/<,>adv.偶然/adv.非经常地<,>She occasionally visits her grandparents.<,>她偶尔会去看望她的祖父母。<,>He only drinks alcohol occasionally.<,>他只是偶尔喝酒。<,>It occasionally rains in the desert.<,>沙漠里偶尔会下雨。<,>oc(强调)+cas(落下)+ion(名词后缀)+ally(副词后缀)→偶然落下→偶尔<,>frequently(adv.频繁地)/regularly(adv.定期地)

decent<,>/ˈdiːsnt/<,>/ˈdiːsənt/<,>adj.体面的/adj.正派的<,>He comes from a decent family.<,>他出身于一个体面的家庭。<,>That was a decent performance.<,>那是个相当不错的表演。<,>Please wear decent clothes to the interview.<,>请穿得体衣服去面试。<,>de(强调)+cent(百)→百分百→体面的<,>descent(n.下降)/recent(adj.最近的)

human<,>/ˈhjuːmən/<,>/ˈhjuːmən/<,>adj.人的/adj.人类的/n.人<,>Human beings are capable of great things.<,>人类能够成就伟大的事情。<,>She has a very human reaction to the news.<,>她对这消息的反应很人性化。<,>This is a basic human right.<,>这是基本人权。<,>hum(土)+an(形容词后缀)→上帝用土造人→人类<,>humane(adj.仁慈的)/inhuman(adj.残忍的)

glitter<,>/ˈɡlɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈɡlɪtər/<,>v.闪闪发光/n.闪光<,>The stars glitter in the night sky.<,>星星在夜空中闪烁。<,>Her eyes glittered with excitement.<,>她的眼睛因兴奋而闪闪发光。<,>The stage was covered in glitter.<,>舞台上铺满了闪光粉。<,>gl(光)+itter(重复)→反复发光→闪烁<,>glisten(v.闪烁)/glare(v.闪耀)

receipt<,>/rɪˈsiːt/<,>/rɪˈsiːt/<,>n.收条/n.收据/n.收到<,>Please keep your receipt as proof of purchase.<,>请保留收据作为购买凭证。<,>I haven't received receipt of the payment yet.<,>我还没有收到付款的收据。<,>The receipt of your letter made me happy.<,>收到你的信让我很高兴。<,>re(回)+ceipt(拿)→拿回来的凭证→收据<,>recipe(n.食谱)/reception(n.接待)

adventure<,>/ədˈventʃə(r)/<,>/ədˈventʃər/<,>n.冒险/n.惊险活动<,>They went on an adventure in the Amazon.<,>他们去亚马逊河冒险。<,>Life is full of adventures.<,>生活充满冒险。<,>He told us about his latest adventure.<,>他告诉我们他最近的冒险经历。<,>ad(加强)+vent(来)+ure(名词后缀)→来到危险处→冒险<,>venture(n.冒险)/invent(v.发明)

lover<,>/ˈlʌvə(r)/<,>/ˈlʌvər/<,>n.情人/n.情侣/n.爱好者<,>He is a great lover of classical music.<,>他是古典音乐的狂热爱好者。<,>The young lovers walked hand in hand.<,>这对年轻情侣手牵手走着。<,>She met her lover in Paris.<,>她在巴黎遇见了她的情人。<,>love(爱)+er(人)→爱人<,>liver(n.肝脏)/lower(adj.较低的)

infant<,>/ˈɪnfənt/<,>/ˈɪnfənt/<,>n.婴儿/adj.婴儿的<,>The infant was sleeping peacefully.<,>婴儿正在安静地睡觉。<,>She works in an infant school.<,>她在幼儿园工作。<,>Infant mortality has decreased in recent years.<,>近年来婴儿死亡率有所下降。<,>in(不)+fant(说话)→不会说话的人→婴儿<,>infantry(n.步兵)/infantryman(n.步兵)

muddy<,>/ˈmʌdi/<,>/ˈmʌdi/<,>adj.多泥的/adj.泥泞的<,>The path was muddy after the rain.<,>雨后小路变得泥泞不堪。<,>His shoes were muddy from walking in the field.<,>他的鞋子因为走在田地里而沾满了泥。<,>Don't wear those nice shoes in the muddy garden.<,>别穿那双好鞋去泥泞的花园。<,>mud(泥)+dy(形容词后缀)→泥泞的<,>mud(n.泥)/muddle(v.弄乱)

beast<,>/biːst/<,>/biːst/<,>n.兽/n.野兽<,>The lion is known as the king of beasts.<,>狮子被称为百兽之王。<,>He fought like a wild beast.<,>他像野兽一样战斗。<,>The beauty and the beast is a famous fairy tale.<,>美女与野兽是个著名的童话故事。<,>be(存在)+ast(最高级)→最原始的存在→野兽<,>feast(n.盛宴)/breast(n.胸部)
faint<,>/feɪnt/<,>/feɪnt/<,>adj.微弱的/adj.虚弱的<,>She gave a faint smile.<,>她微微一笑。<,>He felt faint after standing for hours.<,>站了几个小时后他感到虚弱。<,>The sound of the music was faint in the distance.<,>远处音乐声微弱。<,>faint与paint(油漆)发音相似<,>feint(n.假动作/adj.假的)/flint(n.燧石)/saint(n.圣人)

alarm<,>/əˈlɑːm/<,>/əˈlɑːrm/<,>n.警报/n.惊恐/n.忧虑<,>The fire alarm went off at midnight.<,>午夜时分火警警报响了。<,>She looked at him in alarm.<,>她惊恐地看着他。<,>He felt a growing sense of alarm about the situation.<,>他对局势越来越感到忧虑。<,>al(全部)+arm(武器)→全副武装→警报<,>alert(adj.警觉的)/allay(v.减轻)/armada(n.舰队)

convention<,>/kənˈvenʃn/<,>/kənˈvɛnʃən/<,>n.习俗/n.惯例/n.公约<,>It's a social convention to shake hands when meeting someone.<,>见面握手是一种社会习俗。<,>The company follows conventional business practices.<,>公司遵循常规的商业惯例。<,>Many countries signed the Geneva Convention.<,>许多国家签署了日内瓦公约。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ion→大家共同遵守的→惯例<,>invention(n.发明)/intervention(n.干预)/conventional(adj.传统的)

durable<,>/ˈdjʊərəbl/<,>/ˈdʊrəbəl/<,>adj.耐久的/adj.耐用的<,>This material is highly durable.<,>这种材料非常耐用。<,>They built a durable friendship over the years.<,>多年来他们建立了持久的友谊。<,>The shoes are made of durable leather.<,>这双鞋是用耐用的皮革制成的。<,>dur(持续)+able(能...的)→能持续的→耐用的<,>endurable(adj.可忍受的)/duration(n.持续时间)/durability(n.耐久性)

bed<,>/bed/<,>/bɛd/<,>n.床/n.床位/n.苗圃/n.河床<,>She went to bed early last night.<,>她昨晚很早就上床睡觉了。<,>The hospital has over 500 beds.<,>这家医院有500多张床位。<,>The river bed was dry in summer.<,>夏天河床干涸了。<,>bed与red(红色)押韵<,>bid(v.出价)/bud(n.芽)/bend(v.弯曲)

silent<,>/ˈsaɪlənt/<,>/ˈsaɪlənt/<,>adj.寂静无声的/adj.沉默的<,>The library was completely silent.<,>图书馆里鸦雀无声。<,>He remained silent during the meeting.<,>他在会议期间保持沉默。<,>The silent night was broken by a sudden scream.<,>寂静的夜晚被一声尖叫打破。<,>sil(安静)+ent(形容词后缀)→安静的<,>salient(adj.显著的)/silicon(n.硅)/solvent(adj.有溶解力的)

dislike<,>/dɪsˈlaɪk/<,>/dɪsˈlaɪk/<,>v.不喜爱/v.厌恶/n.不喜爱/n.厌恶<,>I dislike getting up early.<,>我不喜欢早起。<,>She has a strong dislike for spiders.<,>她非常讨厌蜘蛛。<,>His dislike of vegetables is well known.<,>他不爱吃蔬菜是出了名的。<,>dis(不)+like(喜欢)→不喜欢<,>unlike(prep.不像)/disclose(v.揭露)/dislodge(v.驱逐)

greatly<,>/ˈɡreɪtli/<,>/ˈɡreɪtli/<,>adv.大大地/adv.非常<,>I was greatly impressed by her performance.<,>她的表演给我留下了深刻印象。<,>The situation has greatly improved.<,>情况已经大大改善。<,>We greatly appreciate your help.<,>我们非常感谢你的帮助。<,>great(大的)+ly(副词后缀)→大大地<,>gratefully(adv.感激地)/gracefully(adv.优雅地)/gradually(adv.逐渐地)

quotation<,>/kwəʊˈteɪʃn/<,>/kwoʊˈteɪʃən/<,>n.引用/n.引文/n.报价单<,>He began his speech with a quotation from Shakespeare.<,>他以引用莎士比亚的话开始演讲。<,>The book contains many interesting quotations.<,>这本书包含许多有趣的引文。<,>Could you give me a quotation for the repairs?<,>你能给我一个修理的报价吗？<,>quot(引用)+ation(名词后缀)→引文<,>quota(n.配额)/notation(n.符号)/rotation(n.旋转)

pity<,>/ˈpɪti/<,>/ˈpɪti/<,>n.遗憾/n.怜悯/v.同情<,>It's a pity you can't come to the party.<,>你不能来参加聚会真遗憾。<,>She looked at the homeless dog with pity.<,>她怜悯地看着那只流浪狗。<,>I pity those who have to work in such conditions.<,>我同情那些不得不在这种条件下工作的人。<,>pit(坑)+y→掉进坑里需要同情<,>petty(adj.琐碎的)/pretty(adj.漂亮的)/piety(n.虔诚)

panel<,>/ˈpænl/<,>/ˈpænl/<,>n.专门小组/n.面/n.板<,>The panel discussed the new policy.<,>专门小组讨论了新政策。<,>She sat on the advisory panel.<,>她坐在顾问小组里。<,>The control panel is easy to use.<,>这个控制面板很容易使用。<,>pan(平底锅)+el→像平底锅一样平的→面板<,>pane(n.窗格玻璃)/penal(adj.刑罚的)

wrap<,>/ræp/<,>/ræp/<,>v.裹/v.包/v.捆/n.披肩<,>She wrapped the gift in colorful paper.<,>她用彩色纸包装礼物。<,>He wrapped a scarf around his neck.<,>他在脖子上围了一条围巾。<,>She wore a beautiful silk wrap.<,>她披着一条漂亮的丝质披肩。<,>wr(看作write)+ap(看作app, 应用)→用包装纸"写"出礼物外观<,>rap(n.说唱/v.敲击)/warp(v.弯曲/n.弯曲)

organic<,>/ɔːˈɡænɪk/<,>/ɔːrˈɡænɪk/<,>adj.有机体的/adj.器官的<,>We buy organic vegetables.<,>我们购买有机蔬菜。<,>The heart is an organic part of the body.<,>心脏是身体的一个器官部分。<,>Organic farming is better for the environment.<,>有机农业对环境更好。<,>organ(器官)+ic(形容词后缀)→器官的<,>organize(v.组织)/organism(n.生物体)

easy<,>/ˈiːzi/<,>/ˈiːzi/<,>adj.容易的/adj.安逸的<,>This puzzle is easy to solve.<,>这个谜题很容易解决。<,>He leads an easy life in retirement.<,>他退休后过着安逸的生活。<,>Take it easy and don't worry.<,>放轻松，别担心。<,>east(东方)+y→东方人被认为生活安逸→安逸的<,>eager(adj.渴望的)/earn(v.赚取)

frequent<,>/ˈfriːkwənt/<,>/ˈfriːkwənt/<,>adj.时常发生的/adj.经常的<,>He makes frequent trips to London.<,>他经常去伦敦。<,>Frequent headaches can be a sign of stress.<,>频繁头痛可能是压力大的表现。<,>This bus makes frequent stops.<,>这辆公交车停靠频繁。<,>fre(自由)+quent(来)→经常来的<,>frequency(n.频率)/infrequent(adj.不频繁的)/sequence(n.顺序)

fox<,>/fɒks/<,>/fɑːks/<,>n.狐狸/n.狡猾的人<,>The fox ran across the field.<,>狐狸跑过田野。<,>Don't trust him, he's a sly fox.<,>别相信他，他是个狡猾的人。<,>Fox hunting is controversial in some countries.<,>猎狐在一些国家有争议。<,>fox(狐狸)→狡猾的象征<,>ox(n.公牛)/box(n.盒子)/fix(v.固定)
