infer<,>/ɪnˈfɜː(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɜːr/<,>v.推论/v.推断/v.猜想<,>From his tone, I inferred that he was unhappy.<,>从他的语气，我推断他不高兴。<,>What can we infer from these data?<,>我们能从这些数据中推断出什么？<,>She inferred that he was lying.<,>她推断他在说谎。<,>in(内)+fer(带来)→从内部带来结论→推断<,>refer(v.参考)/differ(v.不同)/offer(v.提供)

steam<,>/stiːm/<,>/stiːm/<,>n.蒸汽/v.蒸发/v.蒸<,>Steam rose from the hot cup of tea.<,>热气从热茶杯中升起。<,>She steamed the vegetables for dinner.<,>她为晚餐蒸了蔬菜。<,>The engine runs on steam power.<,>这台发动机靠蒸汽动力运行。<,>steam(蒸汽)→水加热后的气体<,>steel(n.钢铁)/stream(n.溪流)/steep(adj.陡峭的)
file<,>/faɪl/<,>/faɪl/<,>n.档案/v.把…归档<,>Please file these documents in the cabinet.<,>请把这些文件归档到柜子里。<,>She filed a complaint with the manager.<,>她向经理提交了一份投诉。<,>He keeps all his receipts in a single file.<,>他把所有的收据都放在一个文件夹里。<,>fil(线)+e→把文件串起来→档案<,>fill(v.填满)/flee(v.逃跑)/fiber(n.纤维)

midnight<,>/ˈmɪdnaɪt/<,>/ˈmɪdˌnaɪt/<,>n.午夜/子夜/夜半<,>The party lasted until midnight.<,>派对一直持续到午夜。<,>He woke up at midnight feeling thirsty.<,>他在午夜醒来，感到口渴。<,>The train departs at midnight sharp.<,>火车在午夜准时出发。<,>mid(中间)+night(夜晚)→夜晚的中间→午夜<,>midday(n.正午)/midterm(n.期中)/midway(adv.在中途)

scientific<,>/ˌsaɪənˈtɪfɪk/<,>/ˌsaɪənˈtɪfɪk/<,>adj.科学（上）的<,>This is a scientific breakthrough.<,>这是一个科学突破。<,>She has a very scientific approach to problem-solving.<,>她解决问题的方法非常科学。<,>The results were published in a scientific journal.<,>结果发表在一本科学期刊上。<,>scien(知道)+tific(形容词后缀)→与知识有关的→科学的<,>fiction(n.小说)/fictitious(adj.虚构的)/scientist(n.科学家)

oil<,>/ɔɪl/<,>/ɔɪl/<,>n.油/石油/v.加油于<,>She fried the fish in vegetable oil.<,>她用植物油煎鱼。<,>The country exports a lot of crude oil.<,>这个国家出口大量原油。<,>Remember to oil the hinges of the door.<,>记得给门的铰链上油。<,>oil(油)→与液体燃料相关<,>boil(v.煮沸)/soil(n.土壤)/foil(n.箔/v.挫败)

instruct<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkt/<,>/ɪnˈstrʌkt/<,>v.指示/教/通知<,>The teacher instructed the students to be quiet.<,>老师指示学生们保持安静。<,>He instructed me in the art of negotiation.<,>他教我谈判的技巧。<,>The manual instructs users on how to assemble the furniture.<,>手册指导用户如何组装家具。<,>in(进入)+struct(建造)→把知识建进去→教导<,>construct(v.建造)/destruct(v.破坏)/structure(n.结构)

protest<,>/ˈprəʊtest/<,>/ˈproʊˌtɛst/<,>n.抗议/v.抗议<,>The workers went on strike to protest against low wages.<,>工人们罢工抗议低工资。<,>She filed a protest with the authorities.<,>她向当局提交了抗议。<,>The crowd protested loudly outside the building.<,>人群在大楼外大声抗议。<,>pro(向前)+test(证明)→站出来证明→抗议<,>contest(n.比赛/v.争夺)/detest(v.憎恶)/attest(v.证明)

cancer<,>/ˈkænsə(r)/<,>/ˈkænsər/<,>n.癌/癌症/肿瘤<,>He was diagnosed with lung cancer.<,>他被诊断出患有肺癌。<,>Research into cancer treatments is ongoing.<,>对癌症治疗的研究正在进行中。<,>Early detection can improve cancer survival rates.<,>早期发现可以提高癌症存活率。<,>cancer(癌)→与疾病相关<,>cancel(v.取消)/candle(n.蜡烛)/canal(n.运河)

instantly<,>/ˈɪnstəntli/<,>/ˈɪnstəntli/<,>adv.立即/即刻<,>She recognized him instantly.<,>她立刻认出了他。<,>The pain disappeared instantly after taking the medicine.<,>服药后疼痛立刻消失了。<,>He responded to the email almost instantly.<,>他几乎立即回复了邮件。<,>instant(立即的)+ly(副词后缀)→立即地<,>instance(n.例子)/instant(adj.立即的)/constant(adj.持续的)

Chinese<,>/ˌtʃaɪˈniːz/<,>/ˌtʃaɪˈniːz/<,>adj.中国的/n.中国人<,>She is learning Chinese culture.<,>她正在学习中国文化。<,>Many Chinese tourists visit this place every year.<,>每年都有许多中国游客参观这个地方。<,>He speaks fluent Chinese.<,>他说一口流利的中文。<,>China(中国)+ese(…的人)→中国人<,>Japan(n.日本)/Japanese(adj.日本的/n.日本人)/chili(n.辣椒)

remedy<,>/ˈremədi/<,>/ˈrɛmədi/<,>n.治疗/补救/v.治疗/补救<,>This herb is a good remedy for colds.<,>这种草药是治疗感冒的好方法。<,>They are trying to remedy the situation.<,>他们正在努力补救这种情况。<,>The court ordered a remedy for the unfair treatment.<,>法院下令对这种不公平待遇进行补救。<,>re(再)+med(治疗)+y→再次治疗→补救<,>medicine(n.药物)/medical(adj.医学的)/remedial(adj.补救的)
good<,>/ɡʊd/<,>/ɡʊd/<,>adj.好的/adj.有本事的<,>She is a good teacher.<,>她是一位好老师。<,>He is good at playing the piano.<,>他擅长弹钢琴。<,>This is a good opportunity for you.<,>这对你来说是个好机会。<,>goo(谐音“够”)+d(的)→够好的<,>god(n.神)/goods(n.货物)/gold(n.黄金)  

method<,>/ˈmeθəd/<,>/ˈmɛθəd/<,>n.方法/n.办法/n.教学法<,>This is an effective method to solve the problem.<,>这是解决问题的有效方法。<,>He introduced a new teaching method.<,>他介绍了一种新的教学方法。<,>What's your method for staying focused?<,>你保持专注的方法是什么？<,>meth(测量)+od(路)→测量路径的方法<,>mode(n.模式)/medium(n.媒介)/medal(n.奖牌)  

monthly<,>/ˈmʌnθli/<,>/ˈmʌnθli/<,>adj.每月的/adv.每月<,>We have a monthly meeting.<,>我们每月开一次会。<,>The magazine is published monthly.<,>这本杂志每月出版一期。<,>She pays her rent monthly.<,>她每月付房租。<,>month(月)+ly(形容词/副词后缀)→每月的<,>yearly(adj.每年的)/weekly(adj.每周的)/daily(adj.每日的)  

dream<,>/driːm/<,>/drim/<,>n.梦/n.梦想/v.做梦<,>I had a strange dream last night.<,>昨晚我做了一个奇怪的梦。<,>She dreams of becoming a doctor.<,>她梦想成为一名医生。<,>He was dreaming when the phone rang.<,>电话响时他正在做梦。<,>d(的)+ream(大量)→大量的想象→梦想<,>drama(n.戏剧)/cream(n.奶油)/deem(v.认为)  

load<,>/ləʊd/<,>/loʊd/<,>v.装/v.装满/n.负载<,>They loaded the truck with goods.<,>他们把货物装上卡车。<,>The washing machine has a heavy load.<,>洗衣机负载很重。<,>She loaded the software onto her computer.<,>她把软件装到电脑上。<,>lo(谐音“落”)+ad(广告)→落下广告→装载<,>loan(n.贷款)/lord(n.领主)/lead(v.领导)  

fuel<,>/ˈfjuːəl/<,>/ˈfjuəl/<,>n.燃料/v.给…加燃料<,>The plane needs more fuel.<,>飞机需要更多燃料。<,>This debate will fuel the controversy.<,>这场辩论将加剧争议。<,>He fueled the car before the trip.<,>他在出发前给车加了油。<,>f(谐音“发”)+uel(谐音“油”)→发油→燃料<,>fool(n.傻瓜)/full(adj.满的)/file(n.文件)  

modern<,>/ˈmɒdn/<,>/ˈmɑːdərn/<,>adj.现代的/adj.近代的<,>Modern technology has changed our lives.<,>现代科技改变了我们的生活。<,>She prefers modern art.<,>她更喜欢现代艺术。<,>This is a modern version of the story.<,>这是故事的现代版本。<,>mod(模式)+ern(形容词后缀)→新模式→现代的<,>modest(adj.谦虚的)/model(n.模型)/modify(v.修改)  

common<,>/ˈkɒmən/<,>/ˈkɑːmən/<,>adj.普通的/adj.共同的<,>This is a common mistake.<,>这是个常见错误。<,>We have common interests.<,>我们有共同的兴趣。<,>It's common knowledge that smoking is harmful.<,>吸烟有害是常识。<,>com(共同)+mon(看作“man”)→共同的人→共同的<,>comment(n.评论)/command(n.命令)/communism(n.共产主义)  

recommend<,>/ˌrekəˈmend/<,>/ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd/<,>v.劝告/v.推荐/v.介绍<,>I recommend this book to you.<,>我向你推荐这本书。<,>The doctor recommended rest.<,>医生建议休息。<,>Can you recommend a good restaurant?<,>你能推荐一家好餐厅吗？<,>re(再)+commend(赞扬)→一再赞扬→推荐<,>command(v.命令)/commend(v.表扬)/recommit(v.再犯)  

produce<,>/prəˈdjuːs/<,>/prəˈduːs/<,>v.产生/v.生产/v.展现<,>This factory produces cars.<,>这家工厂生产汽车。<,>Hard work produces good results.<,>努力工作产生好结果。<,>He produced a letter from his pocket.<,>他从口袋里掏出一封信。<,>pro(向前)+duce(引导)→向前引导→生产<,>product(n.产品)/reduce(v.减少)/introduce(v.介绍)
definition<,>/ˌdefɪˈnɪʃn/<,>/ˌdɛfəˈnɪʃən/<,>n.定义/n.释义/n.定界<,>The dictionary provides a clear definition of the word.<,>词典提供了这个词的清晰定义。<,>The legal definition of theft varies by country.<,>盗窃的法律定义因国家而异。<,>We need to establish the definition of the project scope.<,>我们需要明确项目范围的定义。<,>de(加强)+fin(结束)+ition→明确界限→定义<,>definite(adj.明确的)/definitive(adj.决定性的)/refine(v.精炼)

castle<,>/ˈkɑːsl/<,>/ˈkæsəl/<,>n.城堡/n.巨大建筑物<,>The children built a sandcastle on the beach.<,>孩子们在海滩上建了一座沙堡。<,>Windsor Castle is one of the Queen's residences.<,>温莎城堡是女王的住所之一。<,>The old castle stands majestically on the hill.<,>古老的城堡雄伟地矗立在小山上。<,>cast(扔)+le(小)→投石防御的小建筑→城堡<,>cattle(n.牛)/chisel(n.凿子)/vassal(n.封臣)

supreme<,>/suːˈpriːm/<,>/səˈprim/<,>adj.最高的/adj.最大的<,>The Supreme Court is the highest judicial body.<,>最高法院是最高司法机关。<,>She showed supreme confidence in her abilities.<,>她对自己的能力表现出极大的信心。<,>This dish requires supreme cooking skills.<,>这道菜需要极高的烹饪技巧。<,>supre(超过)+me→超越一切的→最高的<,>super(adj.超级的)/superior(adj.上级的)/extreme(adj.极端的)

ask<,>/ɑːsk/<,>/æsk/<,>v.问/v.要求/v.邀请<,>May I ask you a question?<,>我可以问你一个问题吗？<,>She asked for a glass of water.<,>她要了一杯水。<,>They asked us to join their party.<,>他们邀请我们参加他们的聚会。<,>a(加强语气)+sk(寻求)→寻求答案→问<,>task(n.任务)/mask(n.面具)/bask(v.晒太阳)

dumb<,>/dʌm/<,>/dʌm/<,>adj.哑的/adj.无言的<,>The accident left him dumb.<,>那次事故使他变成了哑巴。<,>She was dumb with astonishment.<,>她惊讶得说不出话来。<,>That was a dumb mistake to make.<,>那是个愚蠢的错误。<,>du(堵)+mb(嘴巴)→堵住嘴巴→哑的<,>numb(adj.麻木的)/drum(n.鼓)/dump(v.倾倒)

pin<,>/pɪn/<,>/pɪn/<,>n.针/n.饰针/v.别住<,>She fastened her hair with a pin.<,>她用发夹把头发固定住。<,>Please pin the notice on the board.<,>请把通知钉在布告板上。<,>He was pinned under the fallen tree.<,>他被压在倒下的树下。<,>pi(尖)+n→尖的东西→针<,>pen(n.钢笔)/pan(n.平底锅)/pine(n.松树)

attain<,>/əˈteɪn/<,>/əˈten/<,>v.获得/v.达到<,>He attained the rank of general.<,>他获得了将军的军衔。<,>It took years to attain this level of skill.<,>达到这个技能水平花了好几年。<,>The team attained its fundraising goal.<,>团队达到了筹款目标。<,>at(加强)+tain(拿住)→牢牢拿住→获得<,>obtain(v.获得)/retain(v.保留)/contain(v.包含)

curtain<,>/ˈkɜːtn/<,>/ˈkɝːtn/<,>n.帘/n.窗帘/n.幕<,>She drew the curtains to block the sunlight.<,>她拉上窗帘挡住阳光。<,>The curtain rises at 8 pm.<,>晚上8点幕布升起。<,>A curtain of rain hid the mountains.<,>雨幕遮住了群山。<,>cur(覆盖)+tain→覆盖物→帘子<,>certain(adj.确定的)/captain(n.船长)/carton(n.纸箱)

raise<,>/reɪz/<,>/rez/<,>v.举起/v.引起/v.提高<,>He raised his hand to ask a question.<,>他举手提问。<,>The news raised many concerns.<,>这个消息引起了许多担忧。<,>They raised prices by 10%.<,>他们把价格提高了10%。<,>rai(升起)+se→使升起→举起<,>rise(v.上升)/arise(v.出现)/raze(v.夷平)

fog<,>/fɒɡ/<,>/fɔɡ/<,>n.雾/n.烟雾/n.尘雾<,>Dense fog delayed all flights.<,>浓雾延误了所有航班。<,>The valley was covered in morning fog.<,>山谷被晨雾笼罩。<,>His mind was in a fog after the accident.<,>事故后他的头脑一片混沌。<,>fo(覆盖)+g→覆盖物→雾<,>frog(n.青蛙)/log(n.原木)/fag(n.苦工)
rotten<,>/ˈrɒt(ə)n/<,>/ˈrɑːt(ə)n/<,>adj.腐烂的/adj.发臭的<,>The fruit has gone rotten and smells terrible.<,>水果已经腐烂，闻起来很臭。<,>He left the meat outside and it became rotten.<,>他把肉放在外面，结果肉变质了。<,>The wooden floor was rotten and needed to be replaced.<,>木地板已经腐烂，需要更换。<,>rot(腐烂)+ten(形容词后缀)→腐烂的<,>rot(v.腐烂)/rust(n.锈/v.生锈)  

mysterious<,>/mɪˈstɪərɪəs/<,>/mɪˈstɪriəs/<,>adj.神秘的/adj.难以理解的<,>She received a mysterious letter with no return address.<,>她收到了一封没有回信地址的神秘信件。<,>The disappearance of the ancient civilization remains mysterious.<,>这个古代文明的消失仍然是个谜。<,>He has a mysterious smile that makes people curious.<,>他有一种神秘的微笑，让人感到好奇。<,>mystery(神秘)+ious(形容词后缀)→神秘的<,>mystic(adj.神秘的)/myth(n.神话)  

diary<,>/ˈdaɪəri/<,>/ˈdaɪəri/<,>n.日记/n.日记簿<,>She keeps a diary to record her daily thoughts.<,>她写日记记录每天的想法。<,>I found my grandmother's old diary in the attic.<,>我在阁楼找到了祖母的旧日记本。<,>He forgot to bring his diary to the meeting.<,>他忘记带日记本去开会了。<,>di(日)+ary(名词后缀)→日记<,>dairy(n.乳制品)/daily(adj.每日的)  

survive<,>/səˈvaɪv/<,>/sərˈvaɪv/<,>v.幸免于/v.活下来<,>Only a few people survived the earthquake.<,>只有少数人在地震中幸存下来。<,>Plants need water and sunlight to survive.<,>植物需要水和阳光才能存活。<,>He survived the accident with minor injuries.<,>他在事故中幸存，只受了轻伤。<,>sur(超过)+viv(生命)+e→活下来<,>revive(v.复活)/vivid(adj.生动的)  

bicycle<,>/ˈbaɪsɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈbaɪsɪk(ə)l/<,>n.自行车/n.脚踏车<,>She rides her bicycle to work every day.<,>她每天骑自行车上班。<,>He bought a new bicycle for his son's birthday.<,>他为儿子的生日买了一辆新自行车。<,>The bicycle race will take place next Sunday.<,>自行车比赛将在下周日举行。<,>bi(双)+cycle(轮)→自行车<,>tricycle(n.三轮车)/motorcycle(n.摩托车)  

sausage<,>/ˈsɒsɪdʒ/<,>/ˈsɔːsɪdʒ/<,>n.香肠/n.腊肠<,>We had sausages and mashed potatoes for dinner.<,>我们晚餐吃了香肠和土豆泥。<,>She prefers spicy sausages over mild ones.<,>比起清淡的香肠，她更喜欢辣的。<,>The sausage sizzled in the frying pan.<,>香肠在煎锅里滋滋作响。<,>saus(盐腌)+age(名词后缀)→香肠<,>sauce(n.酱汁)/sandwich(n.三明治)  

attack<,>/əˈtæk/<,>/əˈtæk/<,>v.攻击/v.进攻/n.攻击/n.进攻<,>The lion attacked its prey suddenly.<,>狮子突然攻击了猎物。<,>The city was under attack by enemy forces.<,>城市遭到了敌军的进攻。<,>He suffered a heart attack last year.<,>他去年心脏病发作。<,>at(向)+tack(钉)→攻击<,>attach(v.附加)/tackle(v.处理)  

saw<,>/sɔː/<,>/sɔː/<,>n.锯子/v.锯/v.锯开<,>He used a saw to cut the wooden plank.<,>他用锯子锯开了木板。<,>She sawed the branch off the tree.<,>她把树枝从树上锯了下来。<,>The carpenter sharpened his saw before starting work.<,>木匠开工前磨了锯子。<,>saw(锯)→与see(看见)的过去式同形<,>sew(v.缝纫)/sow(v.播种)  

indication<,>/ˌɪndɪˈkeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈkeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>n.指示/n.表示/n.表明<,>There was no indication of trouble before the accident.<,>事故发生前没有任何征兆。<,>Her smile was an indication of her happiness.<,>她的微笑表示她很开心。<,>The test results give a clear indication of his health.<,>检测结果清楚地表明了他的健康状况。<,>in(内)+dic(说)+ation(名词后缀)→指示<,>index(n.索引)/indicate(v.指示)  

attempt<,>/əˈtempt/<,>/əˈtempt/<,>v.尝试/v.试图/n.企图<,>He attempted to climb the mountain but failed.<,>他试图攀登那座山，但失败了。<,>Her first attempt at baking a cake was successful.<,>她第一次尝试烤蛋糕就成功了。<,>The police foiled the robbery attempt.<,>警方挫败了抢劫企图。<,>at(向)+tempt(尝试)→尝试<,>tempt(v.诱惑)/contempt(n.轻视)
submarine<,>/ˌsʌbməˈriːn/<,>/ˈsʌbməˌrin/<,>adj.水下的/n.潜水艇<,>The submarine can dive to great depths.<,>这艘潜水艇可以潜到很深的地方。<,>They discovered a submarine cave.<,>他们发现了一个水下洞穴。<,>Submarine cables connect continents.<,>海底电缆连接各大洲。<,>sub(在...下)+marine(海洋的)→水下的<,>submerge(v.淹没)/subterranean(adj.地下的)  

revolution<,>/ˌrevəˈluːʃn/<,>/ˌrɛvəˈluʃən/<,>n.革命/n.旋转<,>The French Revolution changed history.<,>法国大革命改变了历史。<,>The Earth completes one revolution around the sun in a year.<,>地球绕太阳一周需要一年时间。<,>This new invention caused a revolution in technology.<,>这项新发明引发了技术革命。<,>re(重新)+volut(转)+ion→旋转/革命<,>evolution(n.进化)/resolution(n.决议)  

overseas<,>/ˌəʊvəˈsiːz/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈsiːz/<,>adv.海外/adj.在海外的<,>He works for an overseas company.<,>他在一家海外公司工作。<,>Many students choose to study overseas.<,>许多学生选择出国留学。<,>We export our products to overseas markets.<,>我们把产品出口到海外市场。<,>over(越过)+seas(海洋)→海外<,>overseer(n.监督者)/oversea(adj.海外的)  

oriental<,>/ˌɔːriˈentl/<,>/ˌɔriˈɛntl/<,>adj.东方的/adj.东方国家的<,>She collects oriental art.<,>她收藏东方艺术品。<,>The oriental culture fascinates me.<,>东方文化让我着迷。<,>This restaurant serves oriental cuisine.<,>这家餐厅提供东方美食。<,>orient(东方)+al(形容词后缀)→东方的<,>occidental(adj.西方的)/orientation(n.方向)  

for<,>/fɔː(r)/<,>/fɔr/<,>prep.给/prep.为/prep.因为<,>This gift is for you.<,>这个礼物是给你的。<,>She works hard for her family.<,>她为家庭努力工作。<,>He was late for the meeting.<,>他开会迟到了。<,>与four(四)同音不同义<,>fore(adj.前面的)/fro(adv.来回地)  

manufacture<,>/ˌmænjuˈfæktʃə(r)/<,>/ˌmænjəˈfæktʃər/<,>v.制造/n.制造/n.产品<,>The factory manufactures car parts.<,>这家工厂生产汽车零件。<,>This is a local manufacture.<,>这是本地产品。<,>The manufacture of these goods requires precision.<,>这些产品的制造需要精确度。<,>manu(手)+fact(做)+ure→用手做→制造<,>manufacturer(n.制造商)/manual(adj.手工的)  

healthy<,>/ˈhelθi/<,>/ˈhɛlθi/<,>adj.健康的/adj.有益健康的<,>She maintains a healthy lifestyle.<,>她保持着健康的生活方式。<,>This is a healthy meal option.<,>这是一个健康的饮食选择。<,>The doctor said I'm perfectly healthy.<,>医生说我非常健康。<,>health(健康)+y(形容词后缀)→健康的<,>wealthy(adj.富有的)/hearty(adj.衷心的)  

multiple<,>/ˈmʌltɪpl/<,>/ˈmʌltəpəl/<,>adj.多的/adj.多种的<,>He suffered multiple injuries in the accident.<,>他在事故中多处受伤。<,>This device has multiple functions.<,>这个设备有多种功能。<,>She wears multiple hats in the company.<,>她在公司身兼数职。<,>multi(多)+ple(折叠)→多种的<,>multiply(v.乘/繁殖)/multitude(n.大量)  

cock<,>/kɒk/<,>/kɑk/<,>n.公鸡/n.雄禽/n.旋塞<,>The cock crows at dawn.<,>公鸡在黎明啼叫。<,>He turned the cock to stop the water flow.<,>他转动旋塞停止水流。<,>This is a game cock.<,>这是一只斗鸡。<,>与clock(钟表)形似<,>cocky(adj.骄傲自大的)/cocker(n.斗鸡者)  

actress<,>/ˈæktrəs/<,>/ˈæktrəs/<,>n.女演员<,>The actress won an Oscar for her performance.<,>这位女演员因表演获得奥斯卡奖。<,>She dreams of becoming a famous actress.<,>她梦想成为著名女演员。<,>The actress appeared in many popular films.<,>这位女演员出演过许多热门电影。<,>act(表演)+ress(女性)→女演员<,>actor(n.男演员)/actressy(adj.做作的)
strap<,>/stræp/<,>/stræp/<,>n.带子/v.捆扎<,>She tightened the strap on her backpack.<,>她拉紧了背包的带子。<,>He strapped the boxes together for easy carrying.<,>他把箱子捆在一起以便搬运。<,>The watch has a leather strap.<,>这块手表有一条皮革表带。<,>s(蛇)+trap(陷阱)→像蛇一样缠绕的带子<,>strip(n.条带/v.剥去)/scrap(n.碎片/v.废弃)  

economic<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪk/<,>/ˌɛkəˈnɑːmɪk/<,>adj.经济的/adj.经济学的<,>The country is facing economic challenges.<,>这个国家正面临经济挑战。<,>She studied economic theory at university.<,>她在大学学习经济理论。<,>The government introduced new economic policies.<,>政府出台了新的经济政策。<,>eco(生态)+nom(管理)+ic→管理生态的→经济的<,>economical(adj.节约的)/economics(n.经济学)  

solution<,>/səˈluːʃn/<,>/səˈluːʃən/<,>n.解决/n.解答/n.溶解<,>We need to find a solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的解决方案。<,>The solution to the puzzle was quite simple.<,>这个谜题的解答相当简单。<,>Salt dissolves easily in water to form a solution.<,>盐很容易在水中溶解形成溶液。<,>solu(松开)+tion→松开问题→解决<,>resolution(n.决心/n.分辨率)/solvent(adj.有偿付能力的/n.溶剂)  

barrel<,>/ˈbærəl/<,>/ˈbærəl/<,>n.桶/n.圆筒/n.枪管<,>They stored wine in oak barrels.<,>他们把酒储存在橡木桶里。<,>The gun barrel was polished to a shine.<,>枪管被擦得锃亮。<,>Oil prices are often quoted per barrel.<,>石油价格通常按桶报价。<,>bar(棒)+rel→像棒一样的圆筒<,>barrier(n.障碍物)/barren(adj.贫瘠的)  

hand<,>/hænd/<,>/hænd/<,>n.手/n.指针<,>She raised her hand to ask a question.<,>她举手提问。<,>The clock's hour hand was broken.<,>时钟的时针坏了。<,>He writes with his left hand.<,>他用左手写字。<,>与"land"(土地)对比记忆<,>handle(v.处理/n.把手)/handy(adj.方便的)  

partly<,>/ˈpɑːtli/<,>/ˈpɑːrtli/<,>adv.部分地/adv.不完全地<,>The failure was partly due to bad weather.<,>失败部分是由于天气不好。<,>The room was partly furnished.<,>这个房间部分配备了家具。<,>I agree with you partly.<,>我部分同意你的观点。<,>part(部分)+ly(副词后缀)<,>partially(adv.部分地)/particle(n.微粒)  

paw<,>/pɔː/<,>/pɔː/<,>n.脚爪/n.爪子<,>The dog left muddy paw prints on the floor.<,>狗在地板上留下了泥泞的爪印。<,>The cat gently pawed at the ball of yarn.<,>猫轻轻地用爪子拨弄毛线球。<,>Bears have large, powerful paws.<,>熊有巨大有力的爪子。<,>与"saw"(锯子)对比记忆<,>claw(n.爪/v.抓)/palm(n.手掌)  

upset<,>/ʌpˈset/<,>/ʌpˈset/<,>v.弄翻/v.打翻/v.倾覆<,>He accidentally upset the glass of water.<,>他不小心打翻了那杯水。<,>The strong wind upset several small boats.<,>大风吹翻了几艘小船。<,>Don't upset the delicate balance of nature.<,>不要破坏大自然的微妙平衡。<,>up(上)+set(放)→把东西放倒→打翻<,>reset(v.重置)/offset(v.抵消)  

plunge<,>/plʌndʒ/<,>/plʌndʒ/<,>v.使投入/v.使陷入<,>He plunged into the cold water without hesitation.<,>他毫不犹豫地跳入冷水中。<,>The company plunged into financial difficulties.<,>公司陷入了财务困境。<,>She plunged her hands into the flour.<,>她把双手插入面粉中。<,>pl(扑棱)+unge→扑棱一下跳入<,>plunder(v.掠夺/n.战利品)/plunge与dive(潜水)对比  

injury<,>/ˈɪndʒəri/<,>/ˈɪndʒəri/<,>n.损害/n.伤害/n.受伤处<,>He suffered a serious injury in the accident.<,>他在事故中受了重伤。<,>The injury to his reputation was irreparable.<,>对他名誉的损害是无法弥补的。<,>Apply ointment to the injury twice a day.<,>在受伤处每天涂抹两次药膏。<,>in(不)+jur(法律)+y→不合法→伤害<,>insult(n.侮辱)/injustice(n.不公正)
hopeless<,>/ˈhəʊpləs/<,>/ˈhoʊpləs/<,>adj.没有希望的/adj.绝望的<,>He felt hopeless after losing his job.<,>失业后他感到绝望。<,>The situation seems hopeless, but we must keep trying.<,>情况看似无望，但我们必须继续努力。<,>She gave him a hopeless look.<,>她给了他一个绝望的眼神。<,>hope(希望)+less(无)→没有希望的<,>hopeful(adj.有希望的)/helpless(adj.无助的)

escape<,>/ɪˈskeɪp/<,>/ɪˈskeɪp/<,>v.逃跑/v.逸出/n.逃跑<,>The prisoner managed to escape from jail.<,>囚犯成功从监狱逃脱。<,>Gas was escaping from the pipe.<,>气体正从管道中逸出。<,>Her book provides an escape from reality.<,>她的书提供了逃离现实的方式。<,>es(出)+cape(披肩)→像脱掉披肩一样逃脱<,>elude(v.躲避)/evade(v.逃避)/excuse(n.借口)

philosophy<,>/fɪˈlɒsəfi/<,>/fəˈlɑːsəfi/<,>n.哲学/n.哲理/n.人生观<,>He studied philosophy at university.<,>他在大学学习哲学。<,>My philosophy is to live and let live.<,>我的人生观是待人宽容如待己。<,>The book explores the philosophy of happiness.<,>这本书探讨了幸福的哲理。<,>philo(爱)+sophy(智慧)→爱智慧→哲学<,>psychology(n.心理学)/theology(n.神学)

thrive<,>/θraɪv/<,>/θraɪv/<,>v.兴旺/v.繁荣/v.旺盛<,>Plants thrive in this fertile soil.<,>植物在这肥沃的土壤中茁壮成长。<,>The business began to thrive after the new management took over.<,>新管理层接手后，业务开始兴旺。<,>Children thrive when given proper care.<,>得到适当照顾的孩子会茁壮成长。<,>thr(three)+ive→三倍增长→繁荣<,>strive(v.努力)/derive(v.源自)

fireman<,>/ˈfaɪəmən/<,>/ˈfaɪərmən/<,>n.消防队员<,>The fireman rescued the child from the burning building.<,>消防队员从燃烧的建筑物中救出了孩子。<,>My uncle has been a fireman for 20 years.<,>我叔叔当了20年消防员。<,>Firemen risk their lives to save others.<,>消防队员冒着生命危险救人。<,>fire(火)+man(人)→灭火的人<,>policeman(n.警察)/postman(n.邮递员)

awfully<,>/ˈɔːfəli/<,>/ˈɔːfəli/<,>adv.令人畏惧的/adv.很<,>It's awfully cold today.<,>今天非常冷。<,>She was awfully sorry for being late.<,>她对迟到感到非常抱歉。<,>The storm was awfully destructive.<,>这场风暴破坏力极大。<,>awful(可怕的)+ly→非常地<,>awful(adj.可怕的)/awesome(adj.极好的)

golden<,>/ˈɡəʊldən/<,>/ˈɡoʊldən/<,>adj.金色的/adj.极好的<,>She wore a golden dress to the party.<,>她穿着金色礼服参加派对。<,>This is a golden opportunity you shouldn't miss.<,>这是个你不该错过的绝佳机会。<,>The fields were golden in the sunset.<,>田野在夕阳下呈现金色。<,>gold(金)+en(形容词后缀)→金色的<,>gold(n.黄金)/gilded(adj.镀金的)

technical<,>/ˈteknɪkəl/<,>/ˈteknɪkəl/<,>adj.技术的/adj.工艺的<,>The manual contains technical specifications.<,>手册包含技术规格。<,>She faced some technical difficulties with the software.<,>她在软件方面遇到了一些技术困难。<,>This school offers technical training.<,>这所学校提供工艺培训。<,>techn(技术)+ical→技术的<,>technique(n.技术)/technician(n.技师)

carrot<,>/ˈkærət/<,>/ˈkærət/<,>n.胡萝卜<,>Rabbits love to eat carrots.<,>兔子喜欢吃胡萝卜。<,>Carrot juice is good for your eyes.<,>胡萝卜汁对眼睛有好处。<,>She chopped some carrots for the soup.<,>她切了些胡萝卜做汤。<,>car(车)+rot(腐烂)→车里腐烂的胡萝卜<,>parrot(n.鹦鹉)/carat(n.克拉)

concerning<,>/kənˈsɜːnɪŋ/<,>/kənˈsɜːrnɪŋ/<,>prep.关于<,>I have some questions concerning your report.<,>关于你的报告我有几个问题。<,>The police are investigating matters concerning national security.<,>警方正在调查涉及国家安全的事项。<,>She wrote a letter concerning the school policy.<,>她写了一封关于学校政策的信。<,>concern(关心)+ing→关于<,>considering(prep.考虑到)/regarding(prep.关于)
lot<,>/lɒt/<,>/lɑːt/<,>pron.许多，大量/n.抽签，抓阄<,>There are a lot of books on the shelf.<,>书架上有许多书。<,>They drew lots to decide who would go first.<,>他们抽签决定谁先走。<,>He has a lot of experience in this field.<,>他在这个领域有很多经验。<,>lo(老)+t(特)→老特多→许多<,>plot(n.情节/v.密谋)/slot(n.狭缝/v.插入)

unlikely<,>/ʌnˈlaɪkli/<,>/ʌnˈlaɪkli/<,>adj.未必的，未必可能的<,>It's unlikely to rain today.<,>今天不太可能下雨。<,>She is unlikely to attend the meeting.<,>她不太可能参加会议。<,>An unlikely event happened yesterday.<,>昨天发生了一件不太可能的事。<,>un(不)+likely(可能的)→不太可能的<,>likely(adj.可能的)/unlike(prep.不像)

liar<,>/ˈlaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈlaɪər/<,>n.说谎的人<,>He is a notorious liar.<,>他是个臭名昭著的骗子。<,>Don't trust him; he's a liar.<,>别相信他，他是个骗子。<,>The boy was caught being a liar.<,>这个男孩说谎被抓住了。<,>lie(说谎)+ar(人)→说谎的人<,>layer(n.层)/lier(n.躺着的人)

family<,>/ˈfæməli/<,>/ˈfæməli/<,>n.家，家庭；家族<,>My family is very supportive.<,>我的家人非常支持我。<,>She comes from a wealthy family.<,>她来自一个富裕的家庭。<,>The whole family went on vacation together.<,>全家人一起度假。<,>fam(家)+ily(名词后缀)→家庭<,>familiar(adj.熟悉的)/familial(adj.家庭的)

hay<,>/heɪ/<,>/heɪ/<,>n.干草<,>The farmer stored hay for the winter.<,>农民储存干草过冬。<,>Cows are eating hay in the barn.<,>牛在谷仓里吃干草。<,>He made a bed out of hay.<,>他用干草做了一张床。<,>hay(嗨)→干草堆得很高，让人惊叹"嗨"<,>haystack(n.干草堆)/hey(interj.嘿)

stress<,>/stres/<,>/stres/<,>n.压力；重音/v.着重<,>She is under a lot of stress at work.<,>她在工作中压力很大。<,>Stress the importance of this point.<,>强调这一点的重要性。<,>The word has stress on the first syllable.<,>这个词的重音在第一个音节上。<,>s(死)+tress(压力)→压力大得要死<,>distress(n.苦恼)/press(v.压)

many<,>/ˈmeni/<,>/ˈmeni/<,>det.许多的/pron.许多人<,>Many people attended the concert.<,>许多人参加了音乐会。<,>How many books do you have?<,>你有多少本书？<,>Many of them agreed with the proposal.<,>他们中许多人同意这个提议。<,>man(人)+y(形容词后缀)→许多人<,>any(pron.任何)/money(n.钱)

goal<,>/ɡəʊl/<,>/ɡoʊl/<,>n.目的；球门；得分<,>His goal is to become a doctor.<,>他的目标是成为一名医生。<,>The team scored a goal in the last minute.<,>球队在最后一分钟进了一球。<,>She achieved her career goals.<,>她实现了职业目标。<,>go(去)+al(全部)→全部去追求→目标<,>gaol(n.监狱)/goad(v.刺激)

indefinite<,>/ɪnˈdefɪnət/<,>/ɪnˈdefɪnət/<,>adj.不明确的；不定的<,>He gave an indefinite answer.<,>他给了一个含糊的回答。<,>The project has an indefinite timeline.<,>这个项目的时间表不确定。<,>She was granted an indefinite leave.<,>她被准予无限期休假。<,>in(不)+definite(明确的)→不明确的<,>definite(adj.明确的)/infinite(adj.无限的)

inner<,>/ˈɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈɪnər/<,>adj.内部的；内心的<,>The inner walls of the house need painting.<,>房子的内墙需要粉刷。<,>She struggled with her inner demons.<,>她与内心的恶魔作斗争。<,>The inner circle of the organization makes all decisions.<,>组织的核心圈子做出所有决定。<,>in(里面)+er(比较级)→更里面的→内部的<,>inter(prefix.相互)/infer(v.推断)
bear<,>/beə(r)/<,>/ber/<,>n.熊/n.粗鲁的人<,>The bear was searching for food in the forest.<,>那只熊正在森林里寻找食物。<,>Don't be such a bear in the morning!<,>早上别这么粗鲁！<,>He looks like a big teddy bear when he smiles.<,>他笑起来像只大泰迪熊。<,>发音类似"贝尔"→联想到熊<,>bare(adj.赤裸的)/beard(n.胡须)

pretty<,>/ˈprɪti/<,>/ˈprɪti/<,>adj.漂亮的/adj.标致的<,>She wore a pretty dress to the party.<,>她穿了一条漂亮的裙子去参加派对。<,>The garden looks pretty in spring.<,>春天里花园看起来很美丽。<,>That's a pretty good idea!<,>那是个相当不错的主意！<,>pet(宠物)+try(尝试)→宠物尝试打扮→漂亮<,>petty(adj.琐碎的)/pity(n.遗憾)

therefore<,>/ˈðeəfɔː(r)/<,>/ˈðerfɔːr/<,>adv.因此/adv.所以<,>He was tired; therefore he went to bed early.<,>他很累，所以早早上床睡觉了。<,>It rained all day, therefore the match was canceled.<,>下了一整天雨，因此比赛取消了。<,>She studied hard, therefore she passed the exam.<,>她努力学习，所以通过了考试。<,>there(那里)+fore(前面)→因此<,>therefor(adv.为此)/thereafter(adv.此后)

goose<,>/ɡuːs/<,>/ɡus/<,>n.鹅/n.雌鹅<,>A goose was swimming in the pond.<,>一只鹅在池塘里游泳。<,>She's the goose that lays golden eggs.<,>她是会下金蛋的鹅。<,>Don't be such a silly goose!<,>别这么傻乎乎的！<,>发音类似"古斯"→鹅的叫声<,>moose(n.驼鹿)/loose(adj.松散的)

afford<,>/əˈfɔːd/<,>/əˈfɔːrd/<,>v.担负得起/v.提供<,>We can't afford a new car right now.<,>我们现在买不起新车。<,>The tree affords shade in summer.<,>这棵树在夏天提供阴凉。<,>I can't afford to waste any more time.<,>我不能再浪费时间了。<,>a(一个)+ford(福特汽车)→买得起一辆福特<,>effort(n.努力)/award(n.奖品)

pupil<,>/ˈpjuːpl/<,>/ˈpjuːpəl/<,>n.学生/n.小学生<,>The pupils were listening carefully to the teacher.<,>学生们正在认真听老师讲课。<,>She was the brightest pupil in the class.<,>她是班上最聪明的学生。<,>The pupil's eyes dilated in the dark.<,>瞳孔在黑暗中放大。<,>pup(小狗)+il→像小狗一样的学生<,>people(n.人们)/purple(adj.紫色的)

dairy<,>/ˈdeəri/<,>/ˈderi/<,>n.牛奶场/adj.乳制品的<,>We buy our milk from the local dairy.<,>我们从当地牛奶场买牛奶。<,>She can't eat dairy products because she's lactose intolerant.<,>她不能吃乳制品，因为乳糖不耐受。<,>The dairy industry is important in this region.<,>乳制品业在这个地区很重要。<,>daily(每日)+air(空气)→牛奶场需要每日新鲜空气<,>diary(n.日记)/daisy(n.雏菊)

boundary<,>/ˈbaʊndri/<,>/ˈbaʊndəri/<,>n.分界线/n.边界<,>The river forms the boundary between the two countries.<,>这条河是两国的分界线。<,>We need to set clear boundaries in our relationship.<,>我们需要在关系中设定明确的界限。<,>The ball went over the boundary line.<,>球越过了边界线。<,>bound(绑)+ary(场所)→绑定的地方→边界<,>bounty(n.慷慨)/bounden(adj.有义务的)

afterward<,>/ˈɑːftəwəd/<,>/ˈæftərwərd/<,>adv.后来/adv.以后<,>We had dinner and afterward watched a movie.<,>我们吃了晚饭，后来看了场电影。<,>He felt much better afterward.<,>他后来感觉好多了。<,>I'll call you afterward to discuss the details.<,>我稍后会打电话和你讨论细节。<,>after(之后)+ward(方向)→之后的方向→后来<,>afterwards(adv.后来)/forward(adv.向前)

fan<,>/fæn/<,>/fæn/<,>n.狂热爱好者<,>He's a big fan of basketball.<,>他是个篮球狂热爱好者。<,>The singer has millions of fans worldwide.<,>这位歌手在全球有数百万粉丝。<,>Turn on the fan, it's too hot in here.<,>打开风扇，这里太热了。<,>fun(乐趣)+an(一个)→一个带来乐趣的人→粉丝<,>fun(n.乐趣)/fin(n.鱼鳍)
election<,>/ɪˈlekʃ(ə)n/<,>/ɪˈlɛkʃən/<,>n.选举/n.当选<,>The election results will be announced tomorrow.<,>选举结果将于明天公布。<,>He won the election by a narrow margin.<,>他以微弱优势赢得了选举。<,>She is running for election as mayor.<,>她正在竞选市长。<,>elect(选择)+ion(名词后缀)→选举<,>selection(n.选择)/erection(n.建造)/rejection(n.拒绝)

wheat<,>/wiːt/<,>/hwit/<,>n.小麦<,>This bread is made from whole wheat flour.<,>这个面包是用全麦面粉做的。<,>The wheat fields are ready for harvest.<,>麦田已经可以收割了。<,>Wheat is a staple crop in many countries.<,>小麦是许多国家的主要农作物。<,>wh(白色)+eat(吃)→白色的可食用谷物→小麦<,>heat(n.热量)/wait(v.等待)/whet(v.刺激)

plant<,>/plɑːnt/<,>/plænt/<,>n.植物/n.工厂/v.栽种<,>She waters the plants every morning.<,>她每天早上给植物浇水。<,>The new car plant will create many jobs.<,>新汽车工厂将创造许多就业机会。<,>We planted some flowers in the garden.<,>我们在花园里种了些花。<,>plan(计划)+t→有计划地种植→栽种<,>planet(n.行星)/plaint(n.抱怨)/pant(v.气喘)

page<,>/peɪdʒ/<,>/peɪdʒ/<,>n.页<,>Please turn to page 45 in your textbook.<,>请翻到课本第45页。<,>He bookmarked an important page.<,>他给重要的一页做了标记。<,>The story continues on the next page.<,>故事在下一页继续。<,>pag(固定)+e→固定文字的东西→页<,>rage(n.愤怒)/cage(n.笼子)/wage(n.工资)

spite<,>/spaɪt/<,>/spaɪt/<,>n.不顾/n.恶意/n.怨恨/v.刁难/v.欺侮<,>He did it out of spite.<,>他出于恶意做了这件事。<,>In spite of the rain, we went for a walk.<,>尽管下雨，我们还是去散步了。<,>She always tries to spite her neighbors.<,>她总是想方设法刁难邻居。<,>spit(吐)+e→像吐口水一样→恶意<,>spit(v.吐痰)/site(n.地点)/sprite(n.精灵)

relationship<,>/rɪˈleɪʃ(ə)nʃɪp/<,>/rɪˈleɪʃənˌʃɪp/<,>n.关系/n.联系<,>They have a good working relationship.<,>他们有良好的工作关系。<,>The relationship between the two countries has improved.<,>两国关系有所改善。<,>She's in a long-distance relationship.<,>她正处于异地恋中。<,>relate(关联)+tion+ship(状态)→关联状态→关系<,>relative(n.亲戚)/relativity(n.相对性)/relaxation(n.放松)

grape<,>/ɡreɪp/<,>/ɡreɪp/<,>n.葡萄/n.葡萄藤<,>She was eating a bunch of grapes.<,>她正在吃一串葡萄。<,>The grape harvest was excellent this year.<,>今年葡萄收成很好。<,>They make wine from these grapes.<,>他们用这些葡萄酿酒。<,>gr(生长)+ape(猿)→猿猴喜欢吃的生长物→葡萄<,>grasp(v.抓住)/grace(n.优雅)/grate(n.炉栅)

restrain<,>/rɪˈstreɪn/<,>/rɪˈstreɪn/<,>v.抑制/v.遏制/v.限制<,>He could barely restrain his anger.<,>他几乎控制不住自己的愤怒。<,>The police restrained the violent protesters.<,>警察制止了暴力抗议者。<,>She restrained herself from laughing.<,>她强忍住不笑。<,>re(回)+strain(拉紧)→拉回来→抑制<,>retain(v.保留)/refrain(v.克制)/constrain(v.强迫)

dimension<,>/daɪˈmenʃ(ə)n/<,>/dɪˈmɛnʃən/<,>n.尺寸/n.尺度/n.面积<,>The room has generous dimensions.<,>这个房间面积很大。<,>We need to consider all dimensions of the problem.<,>我们需要考虑问题的各个方面。<,>The painting has unusual dimensions.<,>这幅画的尺寸很特别。<,>di(分开)+mens(测量)+ion→分开测量→尺寸<,>mention(v.提及)/dementia(n.痴呆)/dismember(v.肢解)

observer<,>/əbˈzɜːvə(r)/<,>/əbˈzɜːrvər/<,>n.观察员/n.观测者<,>The UN sent an observer to monitor the election.<,>联合国派遣了一名观察员监督选举。<,>She is a keen observer of human behavior.<,>她是一个敏锐的人类行为观察者。<,>The scientist acted as an observer during the experiment.<,>科学家在实验中充当了观察者。<,>ob(加强)+serv(服务)+er(人)→提供服务的人→观察员<,>observatory(n.天文台)/servant(n.仆人)/conserve(v.保存)

happen<,>/ˈhæpən/<,>/ˈhæpən/<,>v.发生/v.碰巧/v.恰好<,>What will happen if we're late?<,>如果我们迟到了会怎样？<,>I happened to meet my old friend at the mall.<,>我碰巧在商场遇到了老朋友。<,>It happens that we have the same birthday.<,>恰好我们同一天生日。<,>hap(运气)+pen(笔)→用笔写下运气→发生<,>happy(adj.快乐的)/happiness(n.幸福)/perhaps(adv.也许)

kick<,>/kɪk/<,>/kɪk/<,>v.踢/n.踢<,>The baby kicked his legs happily.<,>宝宝开心地踢着腿。<,>He gave the ball a powerful kick.<,>他给了球有力的一踢。<,>She got a kick out of skydiving.<,>她从跳伞中获得了刺激。<,>k(开)+ick(病)→开病→踢走疾病<,>pick(v.挑选)/lick(v.舔)/tick(n.滴答声)

chemistry<,>/ˈkemɪstri/<,>/ˈkɛmɪstri/<,>n.化学<,>She has a degree in chemistry.<,>她有化学学位。<,>The chemistry between the actors was amazing.<,>演员之间的化学反应很棒。<,>We did a chemistry experiment in class today.<,>今天我们课堂上做了化学实验。<,>chem(炼金术)+ist(人)+ry(学科)→炼金术士的学科→化学<,>alchemy(n.炼金术)/chemist(n.化学家)/chemical(adj.化学的)

interaction<,>/ˌɪntərˈækʃn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈækʃən/<,>n.相互作用/n.干扰<,>The interaction between the two drugs can be dangerous.<,>这两种药物的相互作用可能很危险。<,>Social interaction is important for children's development.<,>社交互动对儿童发展很重要。<,>There was little interaction between the two groups.<,>两组之间几乎没有互动。<,>inter(相互)+act(行动)+ion(状态)→相互行动→互动<,>action(n.行动)/reaction(n.反应)/transaction(n.交易)

evil<,>/ˈiːvl/<,>/ˈivəl/<,>n.祸害/n.邪恶/adj.坏的<,>The story is about the battle between good and evil.<,>这个故事是关于善与恶的斗争。<,>He had an evil plan to cheat people.<,>他有个欺骗人们的邪恶计划。<,>Drug abuse is a great social evil.<,>吸毒是一大社会祸害。<,>live(生活)反过来→邪恶的生活<,>devil(n.魔鬼)/veil(n.面纱)/vile(adj.卑鄙的)

sponsor<,>/ˈspɒnsə(r)/<,>/ˈspɑːnsər/<,>n.发起者/v.发起<,>The company will sponsor the sports event.<,>这家公司将赞助体育赛事。<,>He sponsored a bill in Congress.<,>他在国会发起了一项法案。<,>We need a sponsor for our charity project.<,>我们的慈善项目需要一个发起者。<,>spon(海绵)+sor(人)→像海绵一样吸收支持的人→赞助者<,>respond(v.回应)/correspond(v.符合)/despondent(adj.沮丧的)

satisfactory<,>/ˌsætɪsˈfæktəri/<,>/ˌsætɪsˈfæktəri/<,>adj.令人满意的/adj.良好的<,>The test results were satisfactory.<,>测试结果令人满意。<,>He gave a satisfactory explanation.<,>他给出了令人满意的解释。<,>The service was far from satisfactory.<,>服务远不能令人满意。<,>satis(足够)+fact(做)+ory→做得足够好→令人满意的<,>satisfaction(n.满足)/satisfy(v.满足)/factory(n.工厂)  

particularly<,>/pəˈtɪkjələli/<,>/pərˈtɪkjələrli/<,>adv.特别/adv.尤其/adv.格外<,>I particularly like this painting.<,>我特别喜欢这幅画。<,>She was particularly good at math.<,>她尤其擅长数学。<,>The weather was particularly cold today.<,>今天天气格外冷。<,>particular(特别的)+ly(副词后缀)→特别地<,>partially(adv.部分地)/particle(n.颗粒)/participate(v.参与)  

distribute<,>/dɪˈstrɪbjuːt/<,>/dɪˈstrɪbjuːt/<,>v.分发/v.分送/v.分布<,>They distributed food to the poor.<,>他们向穷人分发食物。<,>The company distributes products nationwide.<,>这家公司在全国范围内分销产品。<,>These plants are widely distributed in Asia.<,>这些植物广泛分布于亚洲。<,>dis(分开)+tribute(给予)→分开给予→分发<,>contribute(v.贡献)/attribute(v.归因于)/retribution(n.报应)

sour<,>/saʊə(r)/<,>/ˈsaʊɚ/<,>adj.酸的/adj.脾气坏的<,>The milk has turned sour.<,>牛奶变酸了。<,>He gave me a sour look.<,>他给了我一个不悦的眼神。<,>The grapes tasted sour.<,>这些葡萄尝起来很酸。<,>sou(馊)+r→发馊的→酸的<,>sore(adj.疼痛的)/soul(n.灵魂)/sourness(n.酸味)

disadvantage<,>/ˌdɪsədˈvɑːntɪdʒ/<,>/ˌdɪsədˈvæntɪdʒ/<,>n.不利/n.不利地位<,>His lack of education was a disadvantage when applying for jobs.<,>他缺乏教育，这在求职时是个不利条件。<,>Being short can be a disadvantage in basketball.<,>个子矮在篮球运动中可能是个劣势。<,>The new law puts small businesses at a disadvantage.<,>新法律使小企业处于不利地位。<,>dis(不)+advantage(优势)→不利<,>advantage(n.优势)/disadvantaged(adj.处于不利地位的)/disadvantageous(adj.不利的)

minor<,>/ˈmaɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪnɚ/<,>adj.较小的/adj.较次要的<,>She suffered only minor injuries in the accident.<,>她在事故中只受了轻伤。<,>This is a minor problem compared to what we're facing.<,>与我们面临的相比，这只是个小问题。<,>He played a minor role in the play.<,>他在剧中扮演一个次要角色。<,>min(小)+or→较小的<,>major(adj.主要的)/minus(prep.减)/miner(n.矿工)

canvas<,>/ˈkænvəs/<,>/ˈkænvəs/<,>n.粗帆布/n.一块油画布<,>The tent is made of heavy canvas.<,>帐篷是用厚帆布做的。<,>She painted a beautiful landscape on the canvas.<,>她在画布上画了一幅美丽的风景画。<,>The artist prepared a new canvas for his next painting.<,>艺术家为下一幅画准备了一块新画布。<,>can(能)+vas(走)→能走在上面的→帆布<,>canvass(v.游说)/can(n.罐头)/canvasback(n.帆布背鸭)

medical<,>/ˈmedɪkl/<,>/ˈmɛdɪkəl/<,>adj.医学的/adj.内科的<,>He needs immediate medical attention.<,>他需要立即就医。<,>She is studying medical science at university.<,>她在大学学习医学。<,>The hospital has excellent medical facilities.<,>这家医院有优良的医疗设施。<,>med(治疗)+ical→医学的<,>medicinal(adj.药用的)/medicine(n.医学)/medieval(adj.中世纪的)

economical<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪkl/<,>/ˌɛkəˈnɑmɪkəl/<,>adj.节约的/adj.经济的<,>This car is very economical on fuel.<,>这辆车非常省油。<,>She is economical with her words.<,>她说话很简洁。<,>We need to find a more economical way to heat the house.<,>我们需要找到更经济的房屋取暖方式。<,>eco(家)+nom(管理)+ical→管理家庭的→节约的<,>economic(adj.经济上的)/economics(n.经济学)/economy(n.经济)

could<,>/kʊd/<,>/kʊd/<,>modal.能/modal.会/modal.可以(can的过去式)<,>I could swim when I was five.<,>我五岁时就会游泳了。<,>Could you please pass me the salt?<,>你能把盐递给我吗？<,>She said she could finish the work by Friday.<,>她说她能在周五前完成工作。<,>can的过去式<,>would(modal.将)/should(modal.应该)/might(modal.可能)

oppress<,>/əˈpres/<,>/əˈprɛs/<,>v.压迫/v.压制/v.压抑<,>The dictator oppressed his people for decades.<,>独裁者压迫了他的人民几十年。<,>The heat was beginning to oppress me.<,>炎热开始让我感到压抑。<,>She felt oppressed by the strict rules.<,>严格的规则让她感到压抑。<,>op(反)+press(压)→压迫<,>press(v.压)/express(v.表达)/depress(v.使沮丧)

acute<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>/əˈkjut/<,>adj.敏锐的<,>Dogs have an acute sense of smell.<,>狗有敏锐的嗅觉。<,>She has an acute understanding of human nature.<,>她对人性有敏锐的理解。<,>The patient is suffering from acute pain.<,>病人正遭受剧痛。<,>acu(尖)+te→尖锐的→敏锐的<,>cute(adj.可爱的)/accurate(adj.精确的)/acuity(n.敏锐)
Latin<,>/ˈlætɪn/<,>/ˈlætɪn/<,>adj.拉丁的/n.拉丁语<,>She is studying Latin literature.<,>她正在学习拉丁文学。<,>Latin is the root of many modern languages.<,>拉丁语是许多现代语言的根源。<,>The Latin alphabet is used in many languages.<,>拉丁字母在许多语言中使用。<,>Lat(拉丁)+in(后缀)→拉丁的<,>Latino(n.拉丁美洲人)/Latinize(v.拉丁化)  

rough<,>/rʌf/<,>/rʌf/<,>adj.表面不平的/adj.粗略的<,>The road was rough and bumpy.<,>这条路崎岖不平。<,>He gave a rough estimate of the cost.<,>他给出了一个粗略的成本估算。<,>Her hands were rough from hard work.<,>她的手因辛苦劳作而粗糙。<,>rou(谐音"肉")+gh(拼音"光滑")→肉不光滑→粗糙的<,>tough(adj.坚韧的)/cough(v.咳嗽)  

merchant<,>/ˈmɜːtʃənt/<,>/ˈmɜːrtʃənt/<,>n.商人/n.零售商<,>The merchant sold spices from the East.<,>这个商人出售来自东方的香料。<,>She is a successful online merchant.<,>她是一名成功的网络零售商。<,>The merchant ship carried goods across the ocean.<,>这艘商船运载货物横渡大洋。<,>merc(商业)+hant(人)→商人<,>merchandise(n.商品)/mercenary(adj.唯利是图的)  

other<,>/ˈʌðə(r)/<,>/ˈʌðər/<,>adj.另外的/adj.其余的<,>Do you have any other questions?<,>你还有其他问题吗？<,>Some students stayed, while others left.<,>一些学生留下来，其余的离开了。<,>The other book is more interesting.<,>另外那本书更有趣。<,>oth(谐音"偶的")+er(后缀)→其他的<,>another(adj.另一个)/otherwise(adv.否则)  

progressive<,>/prəˈɡresɪv/<,>/prəˈɡresɪv/<,>adj.进步的/adj.向前进的<,>She has progressive ideas about education.<,>她对教育有进步的观点。<,>The disease shows progressive worsening.<,>这种疾病呈现渐进性恶化。<,>We made progressive improvements to the system.<,>我们对系统进行了逐步改进。<,>pro(向前)+gress(走)+ive(形容词后缀)→前进的<,>aggressive(adj.侵略的)/regressive(adj.退步的)  

heal<,>/hiːl/<,>/hiːl/<,>v.治愈/v.使和解<,>Time will heal your wounds.<,>时间会治愈你的创伤。<,>The medicine helped heal his injury.<,>这种药帮助治愈了他的伤。<,>They finally healed their friendship after the argument.<,>争吵后他们终于修复了友谊。<,>heal(谐音"希尔")→希尔医生能治愈<,>heel(n.脚后跟)/health(n.健康)  

competition<,>/ˌkɒmpəˈtɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmpəˈtɪʃn/<,>n.竞争/n.比赛<,>There is fierce competition for the job.<,>这份工作的竞争很激烈。<,>She won first prize in the singing competition.<,>她在歌唱比赛中获得一等奖。<,>Healthy competition can improve performance.<,>健康的竞争能提高表现。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+ition(名词后缀)→竞争<,>composition(n.作文)/completion(n.完成)  

court<,>/kɔːt/<,>/kɔːrt/<,>n.法院/n.法庭/n.庭院<,>The case was heard in the Supreme Court.<,>这个案子在最高法院审理。<,>They played tennis on the court.<,>他们在球场上打网球。<,>The royal court was full of intrigue.<,>宫廷里充满了阴谋。<,>cour(跑)+t(地方)→跑动的地方→球场<,>quart(n.夸脱)/cohort(n.同伙)  

drink<,>/drɪŋk/<,>/drɪŋk/<,>v.饮/n.饮料<,>Would you like something to drink?<,>你想喝点什么吗？<,>He drank three cups of coffee this morning.<,>他今早喝了三杯咖啡。<,>This drink is too sweet for my taste.<,>这种饮料对我来说太甜了。<,>dr(拼音"大人")+ink(墨水)→大人喝墨水→喝<,>drunk(adj.喝醉的)/drank(v.喝过去式)  

ball<,>/bɔːl/<,>/bɔːl/<,>n.球/n.球状物/n.舞会<,>The children are playing with a ball.<,>孩子们正在玩球。<,>She wore a beautiful dress to the ball.<,>她穿着漂亮的礼服参加舞会。<,>Roll the dough into small balls.<,>把面团揉成小球。<,>ba(拼音"把")+ll(形状像球)→把球<,>bell(n.铃)/bull(n.公牛)
organize<,>/ˈɔːɡənaɪz/<,>/ˈɔːrɡənaɪz/<,>v.组织/v.编组<,>She helped organize the charity event.<,>她帮助组织了这次慈善活动。<,>We need to organize our thoughts before the meeting.<,>我们需要在会议前整理好思路。<,>He organized the books by genre.<,>他按类型整理了这些书。<,>organ(器官)+ize(使)→使各部分像器官一样协调→组织<,>origin(n.起源)/organ(n.器官)/organic(adj.有机的)

remain<,>/rɪˈmeɪn/<,>/rɪˈmeɪn/<,>v.剩下/v.余留/v.保持<,>Only a few apples remain in the basket.<,>篮子里只剩下几个苹果了。<,>Please remain seated during takeoff.<,>起飞时请保持坐姿。<,>The question remains unanswered.<,>这个问题仍然没有答案。<,>re(再)+main(留)→再次留下→剩余<,>remind(v.提醒)/remainder(n.剩余部分)/retain(v.保留)

chart<,>/tʃɑːt/<,>/tʃɑːrt/<,>n.图/n.图表/n.海图<,>The sales chart shows a steady increase.<,>销售图表显示稳定增长。<,>He studied the nautical chart before sailing.<,>他在航行前研究了航海图。<,>This pie chart represents market shares.<,>这个饼图代表了市场份额。<,>chart(纸片)→在纸上画的图形→图表<,>charm(n.魅力)/cart(n.手推车)/charter(n.宪章)

interference<,>/ˌɪntəˈfɪərəns/<,>/ˌɪntərˈfɪrəns/<,>n.干涉/n.干预/n.阻碍<,>The radio signal suffers from interference.<,>无线电信号受到干扰。<,>Parental interference can harm a child's development.<,>父母的干预可能损害孩子的发展。<,>They accused the government of interference.<,>他们指责政府干涉。<,>inter(在...之间)+fer(带来)+ence→带到中间来→干涉<,>inference(n.推论)/difference(n.差异)/reference(n.参考)

dock<,>/dɒk/<,>/dɑːk/<,>n.船坞/n.码头<,>The ship is in dry dock for repairs.<,>这艘船在干船坞进行维修。<,>We met at the dock at sunset.<,>我们在日落时在码头见面。<,>The cargo was unloaded at the dock.<,>货物在码头卸下。<,>dock(尾巴)→像尾巴一样伸入水中的建筑→码头<,>duck(n.鸭子)/deck(n.甲板)/doc(n.医生)

anchor<,>/ˈæŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈæŋkər/<,>n.锚/v.抛锚/v.停泊<,>They dropped anchor in the bay.<,>他们在海湾抛锚。<,>The news anchor reported the story.<,>新闻主播报道了这个故事。<,>This theory needs more evidence to anchor it.<,>这个理论需要更多证据来支撑。<,>anch(弯曲)+or→弯曲的固定装置→锚<,>anger(n.愤怒)/ancient(adj.古代的)/angel(n.天使)

breast<,>/brest/<,>/brest/<,>n.乳房/n.胸脯/n.胸膛<,>She held the baby to her breast.<,>她把婴儿抱在胸前。<,>He put his hand over his heart breast.<,>他把手放在心口上。<,>Chicken breast is a good source of protein.<,>鸡胸肉是很好的蛋白质来源。<,>breast(鼓起)→胸部的鼓起部分→乳房<,>beast(n.野兽)/breath(n.呼吸)/breathe(v.呼吸)

glance<,>/ɡlɑːns/<,>/ɡlæns/<,>v.看一下/n.一瞥<,>She glanced at her watch nervously.<,>她紧张地瞥了一眼手表。<,>I caught a glance of the thief running away.<,>我瞥见小偷逃跑。<,>At first glance, the problem seems simple.<,>乍一看，这个问题似乎很简单。<,>glance(闪光)→像闪光一样快速看→一瞥<,>glare(v.怒视)/grace(n.优雅)/glacier(n.冰川)

announce<,>/əˈnaʊns/<,>/əˈnaʊns/<,>v.宣布/v.宣告/v.发表<,>The principal announced the holiday schedule.<,>校长宣布了假期安排。<,>They announced their engagement at the party.<,>他们在聚会上宣布了订婚消息。<,>The company will announce its earnings next week.<,>公司将于下周公布收益。<,>an(向)+nounce(报告)→向...报告→宣布<,>pronounce(v.发音)/denounce(v.谴责)/renounce(v.放弃)

join<,>/dʒɔɪn/<,>/dʒɔɪn/<,>v.参加/v.连接<,>Would you like to join us for dinner?<,>你想和我们一起吃晚饭吗？<,>The two rivers join near the city.<,>这两条河在城市附近汇合。<,>He joined the company last month.<,>他上个月加入了这家公司。<,>join(结合)→把东西结合在一起→连接<,>joint(n.关节)/joy(n.欢乐)/coin(n.硬币)
poor<,>/pɔː(r)/<,>/pʊr/<,>adj.贫穷的/adj.贫乏的<,>Many people in the world live in poor conditions.<,>世界上很多人生活在贫困的条件下。<,>The soil in this area is poor in nutrients.<,>这个地区的土壤缺乏养分。<,>He gave a poor performance in the exam.<,>他在考试中表现不佳。<,>p(谐音“破”)+oor(形似“门”)→破门→贫穷的<,>pour(v. 倾泻)/pool(n.水池)

reference<,>/ˈrefrəns/<,>/ˈrɛfrəns/<,>n.参考/n.提及<,>Please include a list of references in your report.<,>请在报告中包含参考文献列表。<,>She made a reference to his earlier work.<,>她提到了他之前的工作。<,>This book is an excellent reference for beginners.<,>这本书是初学者的优秀参考。<,>refer(参考)+ence(名词后缀)→参考<,>preference(n.偏爱)/conference(n.会议)

delete<,>/dɪˈliːt/<,>/dɪˈlit/<,>v.删除/v.擦掉<,>Please delete the unnecessary files from your computer.<,>请从电脑中删除不必要的文件。<,>He accidentally deleted an important email.<,>他不小心删了一封重要邮件。<,>The editor decided to delete the controversial paragraph.<,>编辑决定删除有争议的段落。<,>de(去掉)+lete(谐音“离它”)→删除<,>complete(adj.完整的)/deplete(v.耗尽)

digest<,>/daɪˈdʒest/<,>/daɪˈdʒɛst/<,>v.消化/v.领会/n.文摘<,>It takes time to digest a heavy meal.<,>消化一顿大餐需要时间。<,>I need some time to digest the news.<,>我需要些时间来消化这个消息。<,>Reader's Digest is a popular magazine.<,>《读者文摘》是受欢迎的杂志。<,>di(分开)+gest(运送)→分开运送→消化<,>suggest(v.建议)/digress(v.离题)

great<,>/ɡreɪt/<,>/ɡret/<,>adj.大的/adj.伟大的<,>China has a great civilization.<,>中国有着伟大的文明。<,>We had a great time at the party.<,>我们在聚会上玩得很开心。<,>The Great Wall is a famous tourist attraction.<,>长城是著名的旅游景点。<,>gr(ground)+eat(吃)→大地吃→包容→伟大<,>grate(n.炉栅)/grape(n.葡萄)

nut<,>/nʌt/<,>/nʌt/<,>n.坚果/n.干果/n.螺母<,>Squirrels like to collect nuts for winter.<,>松鼠喜欢为冬天收集坚果。<,>He tightened the nut with a wrench.<,>他用扳手拧紧了螺母。<,>Almonds are my favorite type of nut.<,>杏仁是我最喜欢的坚果。<,>nu(拼音“女”)+t(形似“伞”)→女孩打伞捡坚果<,>net(n.网)/not(adv.不)

gun<,>/ɡʌn/<,>/ɡʌn/<,>n.枪/n.炮/n.手枪<,>The police officer drew his gun.<,>警察拔出了枪。<,>Hunting with guns is prohibited in this area.<,>这个区域禁止用枪打猎。<,>The tank's main gun can fire long distances.<,>坦克的主炮可以远距离射击。<,>gu(拼音“姑”)+n(形似“门”)→姑姑进门拿枪<,>fun(n.乐趣)/sun(n.太阳)

urge<,>/ɜːdʒ/<,>/ɜrdʒ/<,>v.催促/v.推进/n.冲动<,>I urge you to reconsider your decision.<,>我敦促你重新考虑决定。<,>She felt an urge to travel the world.<,>她有周游世界的冲动。<,>The coach urged the team to keep trying.<,>教练鼓励球队继续努力。<,>ur(你的)+ge(拼音“哥”)→你的哥在催促你<,>surge(v.汹涌)/merge(v.合并)

but<,>/bʌt/<,>/bʌt/<,>conj.但是/conj.可是<,>I wanted to go, but I was too tired.<,>我想去，但我太累了。<,>She's young but very talented.<,>她年轻但很有才华。<,>It's not cheap, but it's worth the price.<,>这不便宜，但物有所值。<,>bu(拼音“不”)+t(拼音“听”)→不听→但是<,>butt(n.屁股)/bit(n.少量)

ought<,>/ɔːt/<,>/ɔt/<,>modal.应当/modal.应该<,>You ought to apologize for your behavior.<,>你应该为你的行为道歉。<,>We ought to leave early to avoid traffic.<,>我们应该早点出发避开交通。<,>He ought to know better at his age.<,>以他的年龄应该更懂事。<,>ou(拼音“偶”)+ght(light去掉li)→偶尔需要光明→应该<,>aught(n.任何事物)/bought(v.买)
impossible<,>/ɪmˈpɒsəbl/<,>/ɪmˈpɑːsəbl/<,>adj.不可能的/adj.办不到的<,>It's impossible to finish this task in one day.<,>一天内完成这个任务是不可能的。<,>She felt it was impossible to convince him.<,>她觉得要说服他是不可能的。<,>Nothing is impossible if you try hard.<,>只要努力，没有什么是不可能的。<,>im(不)+possible(可能的)→不可能的<,>possible(adj.可能的)/improbable(adj.不大可能的)  

real<,>/rɪəl/<,>/ˈriːəl/<,>adj.真的/adj.现实的<,>This is a real diamond, not a fake one.<,>这是真钻石，不是假的。<,>He needs to face the real world.<,>他需要面对现实世界。<,>The story is based on real events.<,>这个故事是基于真实事件改编的。<,>re(再)+al(形容词后缀)→真实的<,>reel(n.卷轴/v.踉跄)/royal(adj.皇家的)  

score<,>/skɔː(r)/<,>/skɔːr/<,>n.得分/n.比数/n.成绩<,>The final score was 3-2 in our favor.<,>最终比分是我们3比2获胜。<,>He got a high score on the test.<,>他在考试中取得了高分。<,>Keep score of the game for me.<,>帮我记录比赛的得分。<,>s(蛇)+core(核心)→蛇的核心是得分<,>scare(v.惊吓)/store(n.商店)  

devise<,>/dɪˈvaɪz/<,>/dɪˈvaɪz/<,>v.设计/v.发明<,>They devised a new plan to solve the problem.<,>他们设计了一个新计划来解决问题。<,>He devised a clever method to save time.<,>他发明了一个聪明的方法来节省时间。<,>The engineer devised a new type of engine.<,>这位工程师设计了一种新型发动机。<,>de(向下)+vise(看)→向下看→设计<,>device(n.装置)/advise(v.建议)  

equipment<,>/ɪˈkwɪpmənt/<,>/ɪˈkwɪpmənt/<,>n.装备/n.设备/n.配备<,>The laboratory has the latest equipment.<,>实验室配备了最新的设备。<,>We need to check the camping equipment before leaving.<,>出发前我们需要检查露营装备。<,>The factory imported new production equipment.<,>工厂进口了新的生产设备。<,>equip(装备)+ment(名词后缀)→装备<,>equivalent(adj.相等的)/experiment(n.实验)  

luck<,>/lʌk/<,>/lʌk/<,>n.好运/n.幸运/n.运气<,>Good luck with your exam!<,>祝你考试好运！<,>It was pure luck that we met again.<,>我们再次相遇纯属运气。<,>He always has bad luck in gambling.<,>他赌博总是运气不好。<,>l(像数字1)+uck(看作"uck")→第一个uck是好运<,>lack(v.缺乏)/lock(n.锁)  

absolutely<,>/ˈæbsəluːtli/<,>/ˈæbsəluːtli/<,>adv.完全地/adv.绝对地<,>I absolutely agree with you.<,>我完全同意你的观点。<,>This is absolutely the best solution.<,>这绝对是最好的解决方案。<,>She was absolutely right about the matter.<,>她在这件事上绝对正确。<,>absolute(绝对的)+ly(副词后缀)→绝对地<,>obviously(adv.明显地)/absurdly(adv.荒谬地)  

queue<,>/kjuː/<,>/kjuː/<,>n.行列/v.排队等候<,>There was a long queue at the ticket office.<,>售票处排了很长的队。<,>We had to queue for hours to get in.<,>我们不得不排队几个小时才能进去。<,>Please queue in an orderly manner.<,>请有序排队。<,>qu(拼音"去")+eue(看作"eye")→去用眼睛看排队<,>cue(n.提示)/quick(adj.快的)  

rural<,>/ˈrʊərəl/<,>/ˈrʊrəl/<,>adj.农村的/adj.田园的<,>She grew up in a rural area.<,>她在农村地区长大。<,>Rural life is peaceful and quiet.<,>田园生活宁静祥和。<,>The government is investing in rural development.<,>政府正在投资农村发展。<,>rur(乡村)+al(形容词后缀)→农村的<,>urban(adj.城市的)/royal(adj.皇家的)  

office<,>/ˈɒfɪs/<,>/ˈɑːfɪs/<,>n.办公室/n.处/n.局/n.社<,>He works in a big office downtown.<,>他在市中心的大办公室工作。<,>The post office is just around the corner.<,>邮局就在拐角处。<,>She was promoted to the head of the office.<,>她被提升为办公室主任。<,>off(离开)+ice(冰)→离开冰的办公室<,>officer(n.军官)/official(adj.官方的)
sore<,>/sɔː(r)/<,>/sɔr/<,>adj.痛的/adj.恼火的/n.疮<,>My throat is sore after shouting at the concert.<,>音乐会喊叫后我的喉咙痛。<,>He was sore about not being invited to the party.<,>他对未被邀请参加聚会感到恼火。<,>The cut developed into a painful sore.<,>伤口发展成了疼痛的疮。<,>so(如此)+re(反复)→如此反复→恼火的<,>sour(adj.酸的)/soar(v.高飞)/core(n.核心)

confuse<,>/kənˈfjuːz/<,>/kənˈfjuz/<,>v.使混乱/v.混淆<,>The complicated instructions confused the new employees.<,>复杂的说明让新员工感到困惑。<,>Don't confuse the twins - they look very similar.<,>别把这对双胞胎弄混了——他们长得很像。<,>His sudden change of topic confused everyone.<,>他突然改变话题让所有人都糊涂了。<,>con(共同)+fuse(流)→流到一起→混淆<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/diffuse(v.扩散)/infuse(v.注入)

neighbourhood<,>/ˈneɪbəhʊd/<,>/ˈneɪbərˌhʊd/<,>n.附近地区/n.邻近居民<,>There's a great bakery in our neighbourhood.<,>我们附近有一家很棒的面包店。<,>The whole neighbourhood came to the street party.<,>整个街区的居民都来参加街头派对。<,>This neighbourhood is known for its historic buildings.<,>这个社区以其历史建筑而闻名。<,>neighbour(邻居)+hood(状态)→邻居的状态→社区<,>childhood(n.童年)/likelihood(n.可能性)/brotherhood(n.兄弟情谊)

Japanese<,>/ˌdʒæpəˈniːz/<,>/ˌdʒæpəˈniz/<,>adj.日本的/n.日本人<,>She studies Japanese art history at university.<,>她在大学学习日本艺术史。<,>Many Japanese enjoy eating sushi for breakfast.<,>许多日本人早餐喜欢吃寿司。<,>This restaurant serves authentic Japanese cuisine.<,>这家餐厅提供正宗的日本料理。<,>Japan(日本)+ese(人/语言)→日本人/日语<,>Chinese(adj.中国的/n.中国人)/Portuguese(adj.葡萄牙的/n.葡萄牙人)

fulfil<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>v.履行/v.满足/v.完成<,>She fulfilled her promise to visit every year.<,>她履行了每年都来拜访的承诺。<,>This job fulfils all my career aspirations.<,>这份工作满足了我所有的职业抱负。<,>It took him three years to fulfil the requirements for the degree.<,>他花了三年时间完成学位要求。<,>ful(满的)+fil(填充)→填满→完成<,>fill(v.填充)/fullfil(错误拼写)/unfulfilled(adj.未实现的)

chocolate<,>/ˈtʃɒklət/<,>/ˈtʃɔːklət/<,>n.巧克力/n.巧克力糖<,>Dark chocolate is my favorite treat.<,>黑巧克力是我最爱的零食。<,>She gave me a box of Belgian chocolates.<,>她给了我一盒比利时巧克力糖。<,>Hot chocolate is perfect for cold winter days.<,>热巧克力是寒冷冬日的完美饮品。<,>choco(可可)+late(晚)→晚上吃的可可制品<,>chip(n.碎片)/cocoa(n.可可粉)/caramel(n.焦糖)

chicken<,>/ˈtʃɪkɪn/<,>/ˈtʃɪkən/<,>n.鸡/n.鸡肉<,>We keep chickens in our backyard.<,>我们在后院养鸡。<,>Would you like fried chicken or grilled chicken?<,>你想要炸鸡还是烤鸡？<,>Chicken soup is good for colds.<,>鸡汤对感冒有好处。<,>chick(小鸡)+en(小)→小鸡<,>kitchen(n.厨房)/children(n.孩子们)/kitten(n.小猫)

limited<,>/ˈlɪmɪtɪd/<,>/ˈlɪmɪtəd/<,>adj.有限的<,>We have a limited amount of time to finish the project.<,>我们完成项目的时间有限。<,>The edition is limited to 500 copies.<,>这个版本限量500份。<,>His knowledge of the subject is rather limited.<,>他对这个主题的了解相当有限。<,>limit(限制)+ed(形容词后缀)→被限制的<,>unlimited(adj.无限的)/limitation(n.限制)/eliminate(v.消除)

kilometre<,>/ˈkɪləmiːtə(r)/<,>/kɪˈlɑːmɪtər/<,>n.千米/n.公里<,>The marathon is 42.195 kilometres long.<,>马拉松全长42.195公里。<,>Our school is about two kilometres from here.<,>我们学校离这里大约两公里。<,>He cycles 20 kilometres to work every day.<,>他每天骑自行车20公里去上班。<,>kilo(千)+metre(米)→千米<,>millimeter(n.毫米)/centimeter(n.厘米)/kilogram(n.千克)

separate<,>/ˈseprət/<,>/ˈsɛpərət/<,>adj.分离的/adj.个别的<,>Keep the raw meat separate from other foods.<,>把生肉和其他食物分开。<,>They have separate bank accounts.<,>他们有各自的银行账户。<,>The twins are in separate classes this year.<,>今年这对双胞胎被分在了不同的班级。<,>se(分开)+par(准备)+ate→分开准备→分离<,>desperate(adj.绝望的)/operate(v.操作)/celebrate(v.庆祝)
campus<,>/ˈkæmpəs/<,>/ˈkæmpəs/<,>n.校园/n.学校场地<,>The new library is located in the center of the campus.<,>新图书馆位于校园中心。<,>There are many trees and lawns on the campus.<,>校园里有许多树木和草坪。<,>The campus covers an area of 100 acres.<,>校园占地100英亩。<,>camp(营地)+us(我们)→我们的营地→校园<,>campaign(n.运动/v.参加活动)/compass(n.指南针/v.包围)  

blanket<,>/ˈblæŋkɪt/<,>/ˈblæŋkɪt/<,>n.毛毯/n.毯子/n.羊毛毯<,>She wrapped herself in a warm blanket.<,>她用一条温暖的毯子裹住自己。<,>The baby was sleeping under a soft blanket.<,>婴儿在柔软的毯子下睡觉。<,>We spread a blanket on the grass for the picnic.<,>我们在草地上铺了毯子野餐。<,>blank(空白)+et(小)→覆盖空白的小东西→毯子<,>blank(adj.空白的/n.空白)/bracket(n.支架/v.归类)  

frequently<,>/ˈfriːkwəntli/<,>/ˈfriːkwəntli/<,>adv.时常/adv.常常<,>He frequently visits his grandparents.<,>他经常去看望祖父母。<,>This error occurs frequently in the system.<,>这个错误在系统中频繁出现。<,>She frequently checks her phone for messages.<,>她经常查看手机信息。<,>frequent(频繁的)+ly(副词后缀)→频繁地<,>frequency(n.频率)/infrequently(adv.不经常地)  

thermometer<,>/θəˈmɒmɪtə(r)/<,>/θərˈmɑːmɪtər/<,>n.温度计/n.寒暑表<,>The doctor used a thermometer to check my temperature.<,>医生用温度计给我量体温。<,>This thermometer can measure both Celsius and Fahrenheit.<,>这个温度计可以测量摄氏和华氏温度。<,>The thermometer showed that the water was boiling.<,>温度计显示水正在沸腾。<,>thermo(热)+meter(测量)→测量热度的工具→温度计<,>thermos(n.保温瓶)/barometer(n.气压计)  

undoubtedly<,>/ʌnˈdaʊtɪdli/<,>/ʌnˈdaʊtɪdli/<,>adv.无容置疑/adv.肯定地<,>He is undoubtedly the best player in the team.<,>他无疑是队里最好的球员。<,>This is undoubtedly a great achievement.<,>这无疑是一个伟大的成就。<,>She will undoubtedly succeed in her career.<,>她无疑会在事业上取得成功。<,>un(不)+doubt(怀疑)+ed+ly→不容怀疑地<,>doubt(n.怀疑/v.怀疑)/undoubted(adj.无疑的)  

market<,>/ˈmɑːkɪt/<,>/ˈmɑːrkɪt/<,>n.市场/n.集市/n.销路<,>We bought fresh vegetables at the local market.<,>我们在当地市场买了新鲜蔬菜。<,>The company is trying to expand its market share.<,>公司正在努力扩大市场份额。<,>There's a growing market for organic products.<,>有机产品的市场正在增长。<,>mark(标记)+et(小)→做标记交易的地方→市场<,>marketing(n.市场营销)/supermarket(n.超市)  

big<,>/bɪɡ/<,>/bɪɡ/<,>adj.大的/adj.巨大的<,>They live in a big house by the lake.<,>他们住在湖边的一栋大房子里。<,>This is a big opportunity for our company.<,>这对我们公司来说是个大机会。<,>She has big plans for the future.<,>她对未来有宏伟的计划。<,>对比small(小的)→big(大的)<,>bag(n.包)/bug(n.虫子)  

half<,>/hɑːf/<,>/hæf/<,>n.半/n.一半/adj.一半的<,>I'll eat half of the pizza and save the rest.<,>我要吃一半披萨，剩下的留着。<,>The glass is half full of water.<,>杯子里有一半的水。<,>She works half days on Fridays.<,>她周五只上半天班。<,>hal(完整)+f→完整的一半→半<,>whole(adj.完整的/n.全部)/behalf(n.代表)  

blade<,>/bleɪd/<,>/bleɪd/<,>n.刀刃/n.刀片/n.叶片<,>Be careful with that knife - the blade is very sharp.<,>小心那把刀，刀刃非常锋利。<,>The blades of the fan were covered with dust.<,>风扇的叶片上布满了灰尘。<,>He replaced the razor blade with a new one.<,>他换上了新的剃须刀片。<,>bl(光亮)+ade→发光的锋利部分→刀刃<,>blame(v.责备/n.责任)/bleak(adj.阴冷的)  

afraid<,>/əˈfreɪd/<,>/əˈfreɪd/<,>adj.害怕的/adj.担心的<,>She is afraid of spiders.<,>她害怕蜘蛛。<,>Don't be afraid to ask questions.<,>不要害怕提问。<,>I'm afraid we might be late for the meeting.<,>我担心我们可能会开会迟到。<,>a(加强)+fraid(同fray，害怕)→非常害怕的<,>unafraid(adj.不害怕的)/fright(n.惊吓)

hostile<,>/ˈhɒstaɪl/<,>/ˈhɑːstl/<,>adj.不友善的/adj.敌方的<,>He gave me a hostile look.<,>他给了我一个不友善的眼神。<,>The two countries have hostile relations.<,>这两个国家关系敌对。<,>The terrain was hostile to farming.<,>这种地形不利于耕作。<,>host(主人)+ile→像对待敌人一样→敌对的<,>hospital(n.医院)/hostel(n.旅社)/hospitable(adj.好客的)

line<,>/laɪn/<,>/laɪn/<,>n.线/n.线条/n.排/n.路线<,>Draw a straight line here.<,>在这里画一条直线。<,>There was a long line at the ticket office.<,>售票处排了长队。<,>The train runs on this line.<,>火车在这条线路上运行。<,>lin(线)+e→线条<,>lane(n.小巷)/lion(n.狮子)/lean(v.倾斜)

extensive<,>/ɪkˈstensɪv/<,>/ɪkˈstensɪv/<,>adj.广阔的/adj.广泛的<,>He has extensive knowledge of history.<,>他有渊博的历史知识。<,>The fire caused extensive damage.<,>火灾造成了广泛的破坏。<,>They own extensive lands in the countryside.<,>他们在乡下拥有广阔的土地。<,>ex(出)+tens(伸展)+ive→向外伸展的→广阔的<,>expensive(adj.昂贵的)/intensive(adj.密集的)/extend(v.延伸)

bet<,>/bet/<,>/bet/<,>v.打赌/n.打赌<,>I bet it will rain tomorrow.<,>我打赌明天会下雨。<,>He placed a bet on the horse race.<,>他在赛马上下了注。<,>It's a safe bet that prices will rise.<,>物价上涨是十拿九稳的事。<,>be(是)+t(他)→是他→我敢打赌是他<,>bat(n.球棒)/bit(n.一点)/betray(v.背叛)

prove<,>/pruːv/<,>/pruːv/<,>v.证明/v.结果是<,>Can you prove your innocence?<,>你能证明自己的清白吗？<,>The theory proved to be correct.<,>这个理论被证明是正确的。<,>Time will prove who is right.<,>时间会证明谁是对的。<,>pro(向前)+ve(看)→向前看→证明<,>approve(v.批准)/improve(v.改进)/proof(n.证据)

sway<,>/sweɪ/<,>/sweɪ/<,>v.摇动<,>The trees sway in the wind.<,>树木在风中摇曳。<,>His speech swayed many voters.<,>他的演讲打动了许多选民。<,>Don't let others sway your decision.<,>别让别人动摇你的决定。<,>s(蛇)+way(路)→蛇在路上摇摆前进<,>swan(n.天鹅)/stay(v.停留)/swear(v.发誓)
locomotive<,>/ˌləʊkəˈməʊtɪv/<,>/ˌloʊkəˈmoʊtɪv/<,>n.火车头/n.机车<,>The locomotive pulled a long line of freight cars.<,>火车头拉着一长串货车车厢。<,>Steam locomotives are now mostly found in museums.<,>蒸汽机车现在大多在博物馆里才能见到。<,>The engineer checked the locomotive before departure.<,>司机在出发前检查了火车头。<,>loco(地方)+mot(移动)+ive→移动地方的机器→火车头<,>locomotion(n.运动)/motivate(v.激励)/automotive(adj.汽车的)

along<,>/əˈlɒŋ/<,>/əˈlɔːŋ/<,>prep.沿着/adv.向前<,>We walked along the riverbank.<,>我们沿着河岸散步。<,>Come along with us to the party.<,>和我们一起去参加派对吧。<,>She moved along the crowded street.<,>她在拥挤的街道上前行。<,>a(在...上)+long(长的)→沿着长的方向<,>alone(adj.独自的)/among(prep.在...之中)/belong(v.属于)

oven<,>/ˈʌv(ə)n/<,>/ˈʌvən/<,>n.炉/n.灶/n.烘箱<,>She baked cookies in the oven.<,>她在烤箱里烤饼干。<,>The turkey needs to go in the oven now.<,>火鸡现在需要放进烤箱了。<,>Don't touch the oven door - it's hot!<,>别碰烤箱门 - 很烫！<,>oven→over(结束)+n→食物在里面"结束"生食状态<,>even(adv.甚至)/open(v.打开)/often(adv.经常)

bury<,>/ˈberi/<,>/ˈberi/<,>v.埋葬/v.葬/v.埋藏<,>They will bury the time capsule tomorrow.<,>他们明天将埋藏时间胶囊。<,>The dog likes to bury bones in the backyard.<,>这只狗喜欢在后院埋骨头。<,>Ancient treasures were buried under the ruins.<,>古代珍宝被埋在废墟下。<,>bury→busy(忙碌的)+y→忙着埋东西<,>berry(n.浆果)/burn(v.燃烧)/buy(v.购买)

arrow<,>/ˈærəʊ/<,>/ˈæroʊ/<,>n.箭/n.箭状物/n.箭头符号<,>Follow the arrows to the exit.<,>跟着箭头走向出口。<,>Cupid's arrow struck his heart.<,>丘比特之箭射中了他的心。<,>The arrow on the map points north.<,>地图上的箭头指向北方。<,>arrow→arr(到达)+ow(噢)→"噢"的一声箭到达目标<,>narrow(adj.狭窄的)/borrow(v.借)/sorrow(n.悲伤)

green<,>/ɡriːn/<,>/ɡriːn/<,>adj.绿色的/n.绿色<,>The grass is very green after the rain.<,>雨后的草地非常绿。<,>She was wearing a beautiful green dress.<,>她穿着一件漂亮的绿色连衣裙。<,>Environmentalists are concerned about green issues.<,>环保人士关注绿色环保问题。<,>green→grass(草)+een→草的颜色<,>greet(v.问候)/greed(n.贪婪)/glean(v.收集)

logic<,>/ˈlɒdʒɪk/<,>/ˈlɑːdʒɪk/<,>n.逻辑/n.推理/n.逻辑性<,>Your argument lacks logic.<,>你的论点缺乏逻辑。<,>Computer programming requires strong logic skills.<,>计算机编程需要强大的逻辑能力。<,>He solved the puzzle using pure logic.<,>他用纯粹的推理解开了这个谜题。<,>log(说)+ic→有道理的说法→逻辑<,>magic(n.魔术)/topic(n.话题)/toxic(adj.有毒的)

fluid<,>/ˈfluːɪd/<,>/ˈfluːɪd/<,>n.流体/n.液体<,>Water is the most essential fluid for life.<,>水是生命最重要的液体。<,>The doctor checked my bodily fluids.<,>医生检查了我的体液。<,>Hydraulic systems use fluid to transmit power.<,>液压系统使用流体传递动力。<,>flu(流)+id→流动的东西→流体<,>solid(n.固体)/flood(n.洪水)/fruit(n.水果)

press<,>/pres/<,>/pres/<,>v.压/v.按/v.催促<,>Press the button to start the machine.<,>按下按钮启动机器。<,>The media pressed the politician for answers.<,>媒体催促政客回答问题。<,>She pressed her dress with an iron.<,>她用熨斗熨烫连衣裙。<,>press→pre(前)+ss(死死)→向前死死用力<,>dress(n.连衣裙)/stress(n.压力)/express(v.表达)

firm<,>/fɜːm/<,>/fɜːrm/<,>n.商行/n.商号/n.公司<,>He works for a law firm in New York.<,>他在纽约的一家律师事务所工作。<,>The consulting firm has offices worldwide.<,>这家咨询公司在全球设有办事处。<,>She started her own fashion firm last year.<,>她去年创办了自己的时装公司。<,>firm→fire(火)+m→像火一样稳定燃烧的公司<,>farm(n.农场)/form(n.表格)/film(n.电影)
funeral<,>/ˈfjuːnərəl/<,>/ˈfjuːnərəl/<,>n.葬礼/n.丧礼/n.丧葬<,>The funeral was attended by hundreds of mourners.<,>数百名哀悼者参加了葬礼。<,>She wore black to her father's funeral.<,>她穿着黑色衣服参加父亲的葬礼。<,>The funeral procession moved slowly through the town.<,>送葬队伍缓缓穿过小镇。<,>fun(结束)+eral→生命结束的仪式<,>fun(n.乐趣)/funfair(n.游乐场)/funerary(adj.葬礼的)

compile<,>/kəmˈpaɪl/<,>/kəmˈpaɪl/<,>v.编辑/v.编制/v.搜集<,>She is compiling a dictionary of technical terms.<,>她正在编写一本技术术语词典。<,>The report was compiled from various sources.<,>这份报告是根据各种资料汇编而成的。<,>It took years to compile all this data.<,>搜集所有这些数据花了数年时间。<,>com(共同)+pile(堆)→把资料堆在一起<,>compel(v.强迫)/compile(v.编辑)/comply(v.遵从)

grey<,>/ɡreɪ/<,>/ɡreɪ/<,>adj.灰色的/n.灰色<,>The sky turned grey before the storm.<,>暴风雨来临前天空变成了灰色。<,>He has grey hair now.<,>他现在有了灰白的头发。<,>She was dressed in grey from head to toe.<,>她从头到脚都穿着灰色衣服。<,>gr(生长)+ey→植物枯萎的颜色<,>gray(美式拼写)/greet(v.问候)/greed(n.贪婪)

claw<,>/klɔː/<,>/klɔː/<,>n.爪/n.脚爪/n.螯<,>The cat sharpened its claws on the tree.<,>猫在树上磨爪子。<,>The eagle grabbed the fish with its powerful claws.<,>老鹰用有力的爪子抓住了鱼。<,>Crabs use their claws for defense and feeding.<,>螃蟹用螯进行防御和进食。<,>cl(抓住)+aw→用来抓的东西<,>clay(n.黏土)/clap(v.鼓掌)/clan(n.氏族)

fluent<,>/ˈfluːənt/<,>/ˈfluːənt/<,>adj.流利的/adj.流畅的<,>She is fluent in three languages.<,>她能流利地说三种语言。<,>His speech was fluent and persuasive.<,>他的演讲流畅而有说服力。<,>The river flows in a fluent curve.<,>河流以流畅的曲线流淌。<,>flu(流动)+ent→像流水一样的<,>fluid(n.流体)/fluency(n.流利)/affluent(adj.富裕的)

prominent<,>/ˈprɒmɪnənt/<,>/ˈprɑːmɪnənt/<,>adj.突出的/adj.凸起的<,>He has a prominent nose.<,>他有一个突出的鼻子。<,>The church tower is a prominent landmark.<,>教堂塔楼是一个突出的地标。<,>She played a prominent role in the negotiations.<,>她在谈判中发挥了突出作用。<,>pro(向前)+min(突出)+ent→向前突出的<,>dominant(adj.主导的)/eminent(adj.著名的)/imminent(adj.即将发生的)

bitterly<,>/ˈbɪtəli/<,>/ˈbɪtərli/<,>adv.苦苦地/adv.悲痛地<,>She wept bitterly at the news.<,>听到这个消息她悲痛地哭了。<,>The wind was blowing bitterly cold.<,>寒风刺骨。<,>He complained bitterly about the unfair treatment.<,>他痛苦地抱怨不公平的待遇。<,>bitter(苦的)+ly→像苦味一样地<,>better(adj.更好的)/butter(n.黄油)/battery(n.电池)

dissatisfy<,>/dɪsˈsætɪsfaɪ/<,>/dɪsˈsætɪsfaɪ/<,>v.使不满/v.使不平<,>Poor service dissatisfied the customers.<,>糟糕的服务让顾客不满。<,>He was dissatisfied with the exam results.<,>他对考试成绩不满意。<,>The workers were dissatisfied with their wages.<,>工人们对工资不满意。<,>dis(不)+satisfy(满足)→不满足<,>satisfy(v.满足)/dissatisfaction(n.不满)/dissatisfied(adj.不满意的)

embrace<,>/ɪmˈbreɪs/<,>/ɪmˈbreɪs/<,>v.拥抱/v.包括<,>They embraced each other warmly.<,>他们热情地拥抱彼此。<,>The new policy embraces many reforms.<,>新政策包含许多改革。<,>She embraced the opportunity to study abroad.<,>她欣然接受了出国留学的机会。<,>em(进入)+brace(手臂)→进入手臂中<,>brace(n.支撑)/embarrass(v.使尴尬)/embrace(v.拥抱)

defence<,>/dɪˈfens/<,>/dɪˈfens/<,>n.防御/n.防务/n.辩护<,>The castle's defences were very strong.<,>城堡的防御非常坚固。<,>He works in the Ministry of Defence.<,>他在国防部工作。<,>The lawyer presented a strong defence for his client.<,>律师为当事人进行了有力的辩护。<,>de(离开)+fence(打击)→避开打击<,>offence(n.冒犯)/fence(n.栅栏)/defend(v.防御)
trade<,>/treɪd/<,>/treɪd/<,>n.贸易/n.职业/v.交易<,>International trade is vital for economic growth.<,>国际贸易对经济增长至关重要。<,>He learned the trade from his father.<,>他从父亲那里学到了这门手艺。<,>They trade stocks on the exchange.<,>他们在交易所交易股票。<,>tr(转)+ade(行为)→交换行为→贸易<,>trail(n.踪迹/v.拖拽)/tread(v.踩踏/n.步法)  

owe<,>/əʊ/<,>/oʊ/<,>v.欠/v.应把…归功于<,>I owe you twenty dollars.<,>我欠你二十美元。<,>She owes her success to hard work.<,>她把成功归功于努力工作。<,>We owe a debt of gratitude to our teachers.<,>我们应感恩老师。<,>ow(拥有)+e→拥有债务→欠<,>own(adj.自己的/v.拥有)/owl(n.猫头鹰)  

gray<,>/ɡreɪ/<,>/ɡreɪ/<,>adj.灰色的/n.灰色<,>Her hair turned gray with age.<,>她的头发随着年龄变灰白。<,>The sky was gray and gloomy.<,>天空灰暗阴沉。<,>He wore a gray suit to the interview.<,>他穿了灰色西装去面试。<,>gr(颗粒)+ay→像颗粒般的颜色→灰色<,>grey(英式拼写)/grain(n.纹理)  

digital<,>/ˈdɪdʒɪtl/<,>/ˈdɪdʒɪtl/<,>adj.数字的/adj.计数的<,>Digital technology has changed our lives.<,>数字技术改变了我们的生活。<,>She prefers digital watches over analog ones.<,>她喜欢数字表胜过指针表。<,>The library has a vast digital collection.<,>图书馆有庞大的数字馆藏。<,>digit(数字)+al(…的)→数字的<,>analog(adj.模拟的)/dial(n.刻度盘)  

gradually<,>/ˈɡrædʒuəli/<,>/ˈɡrædʒuəli/<,>adv.逐渐地/adv.逐步地<,>The days gradually became shorter.<,>白昼逐渐变短。<,>She gradually adapted to the new environment.<,>她逐步适应了新环境。<,>His health improved gradually.<,>他的健康状况逐渐好转。<,>grad(步)+ual(…的)+ly→一步步地→逐渐地<,>gradual(adj.逐渐的)/gradient(n.坡度)  

ax<,>/æks/<,>/æks/<,>n.斧子<,>He chopped wood with an ax.<,>他用斧头劈柴。<,>The lumberjack sharpened his ax.<,>伐木工人磨利了他的斧子。<,>There's an old ax in the shed.<,>棚屋里有把旧斧头。<,>a(一个)+x(交叉形状)→交叉形状的工具→斧子<,>axe(英式拼写)/max(n.最大值)  

estimate<,>/ˈestɪmeɪt/<,>/ˈɛstəˌmeɪt/<,>v.估计/v.评价/n.估计<,>They estimate the cost at $500.<,>他们估计费用为500美元。<,>It's difficult to estimate his true intentions.<,>很难评估他的真实意图。<,>The final estimate was higher than expected.<,>最终估价高于预期。<,>estim(价值)+ate(使)→使产生价值判断→估计<,>esteem(n.尊重)/ultimate(adj.最终的)  

avoid<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>v.避免/v.躲开<,>Try to avoid making the same mistake.<,>尽量避免犯同样的错误。<,>He avoided eye contact during the conversation.<,>谈话时他避开了眼神接触。<,>The driver swerved to avoid the pothole.<,>司机急转弯避开坑洞。<,>a(不)+void(空)→不让事情落空→避免<,>void(adj.空的)/avid(adj.渴望的)  

acceleration<,>/əkˌseləˈreɪʃn/<,>/ækˌsɛləˈreɪʃən/<,>n.加速/n.加速度<,>The car's acceleration was impressive.<,>这辆车的加速性能令人印象深刻。<,>Newton's second law relates force to acceleration.<,>牛顿第二定律将力与加速度联系起来。<,>Economic acceleration boosted employment.<,>经济加速促进了就业。<,>ac(向)+celer(快)+ation→加快速度→加速<,>celerity(n.迅速)/decelerate(v.减速)  

also<,>/ˈɔːlsəʊ/<,>/ˈɔlsoʊ/<,>adv.而且/adv.还/adv.亦/adv.也<,>She speaks French and also Spanish.<,>她会说法语，还会说西班牙语。<,>The book is informative and also entertaining.<,>这本书既有知识性又有趣味性。<,>He's a teacher and also a writer.<,>他是老师，也是作家。<,>al(全部)+so(如此)→全部如此→也<,>too(adv.也)/as well(同样地)
subway<,>/ˈsʌbweɪ/<,>/ˈsʌbˌweɪ/<,>n.地道/n.地下铁路<,>We took the subway to avoid traffic.<,>我们乘坐地铁以避开交通拥堵。<,>The subway station is just around the corner.<,>地铁站就在拐角处。<,>There's a pedestrian subway under the busy road.<,>繁忙的马路下有一条人行地道。<,>sub(地下)+way(路)→地下的路→地铁<,>subway(n.地铁)/sublet(v.转租)/submerge(v.淹没)

circumference<,>/səˈkʌmf(ə)rəns/<,>/sərˈkʌmf(ə)rəns/<,>n.圆周/n.周长/n.圆周线<,>The circumference of the circle is 31.4 centimeters.<,>这个圆的周长是31.4厘米。<,>We measured the circumference of the tree trunk.<,>我们测量了树干的周长。<,>The equator is Earth's largest circumference.<,>赤道是地球最大的圆周线。<,>circum(环绕)+fer(携带)+ence→携带环绕一周→周长<,>circumstance(n.环境)/circuit(n.电路)/circular(adj.圆形的)

seek<,>/siːk/<,>/sik/<,>v.寻找/v.探索/v.试图<,>They seek shelter from the rain.<,>他们寻找避雨的地方。<,>He seeks to improve his English skills.<,>他试图提高英语水平。<,>Scientists seek answers to complex questions.<,>科学家探索复杂问题的答案。<,>see(看)+k(谐音"可")→看可找到→寻找<,>peek(v.偷看)/leak(v.泄漏)/sneak(v.潜行)

require<,>/rɪˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkwaɪər/<,>v.需要/v.要求/v.命令<,>This job requires patience.<,>这份工作需要耐心。<,>The law requires drivers to wear seat belts.<,>法律规定司机必须系安全带。<,>The recipe requires three eggs.<,>这个食谱需要三个鸡蛋。<,>re(再)+quire(寻求)→一再寻求→需要<,>acquire(v.获得)/inquire(v.询问)/request(v.请求)

bounce<,>/baʊns/<,>/baʊns/<,>v.反跳/v.弹起/v.跳起<,>The ball bounced off the wall.<,>球从墙上弹了回来。<,>Children love bouncing on the trampoline.<,>孩子们喜欢在蹦床上跳。<,>Her check bounced due to insufficient funds.<,>她的支票因资金不足被退票。<,>bound(跳跃)+ce→弹跳的动作<,>ounce(n.盎司)/pounce(v.猛扑)/announce(v.宣布)

minister<,>/ˈmɪnɪstə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪnɪstər/<,>n.部长/n.大臣/n.公使<,>The foreign minister attended the summit.<,>外交部长出席了峰会。<,>He was appointed minister of education.<,>他被任命为教育大臣。<,>The British minister visited our country.<,>英国公使访问了我国。<,>mini(小)+ster(人)→小人物→最初指神职人员，后指大臣<,>administer(v.管理)/ministry(n.部门)/monastery(n.修道院)

miracle<,>/ˈmɪrəkl/<,>/ˈmɪrəkəl/<,>n.奇迹/n.令人惊奇的人<,>Her recovery was a medical miracle.<,>她的康复是个医学奇迹。<,>The child prodigy is a miracle of nature.<,>这个神童是大自然的奇迹。<,>They performed miracles with limited resources.<,>他们用有限的资源创造了奇迹。<,>mir(惊奇)+acle(东西)→令人惊奇的东西→奇迹<,>mirage(n.海市蜃楼)/mirror(n.镜子)/admire(v.钦佩)

clothe<,>/kləʊð/<,>/kloʊð/<,>v.给...穿衣服<,>She clothed the baby in warm pajamas.<,>她给宝宝穿上了温暖的睡衣。<,>The charity clothes the homeless in winter.<,>这个慈善机构在冬天为无家可归者提供衣服。<,>Trees clothe the hills in green.<,>树木给山丘披上绿装。<,>cloth(布)+e→用布包裹→穿衣<,>clothes(n.衣服)/cloth(n.布料)/closet(n.壁橱)

newly<,>/ˈnjuːli/<,>/ˈnuːli/<,>adv.新近/adv.最近<,>They are newly married.<,>他们新婚不久。<,>The newly built bridge opened last week.<,>新建的桥上周通车了。<,>She's newly arrived from Canada.<,>她刚从加拿大来。<,>new(新)+ly(副词后缀)→新近地<,>newlywed(n.新婚者)/newborn(adj.新生的)/renew(v.更新)

confidence<,>/ˈkɒnfɪdəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnfɪdəns/<,>n.信任/n.信赖/n.信心<,>She spoke with great confidence.<,>她说话时充满自信。<,>I have complete confidence in your ability.<,>我对你的能力完全有信心。<,>He betrayed my confidence by telling my secret.<,>他泄露我的秘密，辜负了我的信任。<,>con(完全)+fid(信任)+ence→完全信任→信心<,>confident(adj.自信的)/confidant(n.知己)/confidential(adj.机密的)
lack<,>/læk/<,>/læk/<,>n.缺乏/n.不足/v.缺乏/v.不足<,>There is a lack of evidence to support his claim.<,>缺乏证据支持他的主张。<,>She lacks confidence in public speaking.<,>她在公开演讲方面缺乏自信。<,>The project failed due to a lack of funding.<,>该项目因资金不足而失败。<,>lack(谐音：拉客)→拉不到客人→缺乏<,>slack(adj.松弛的)/black(adj.黑色的)/lick(v.舔)

bureau<,>/ˈbjʊərəʊ/<,>/ˈbjʊroʊ/<,>n.局/n.司/n.处/n.社/n.所<,>She works at the Federal Bureau of Investigation.<,>她在联邦调查局工作。<,>The travel bureau provides useful information for tourists.<,>旅游局为游客提供有用信息。<,>He placed the documents in the top drawer of the bureau.<,>他把文件放在办公桌的顶层抽屉里。<,>bur(办公)+eau(场所)→办公场所→局<,>bureaucracy(n.官僚主义)/burette(n.滴定管)/burrow(n.地洞)

detection<,>/dɪˈtekʃn/<,>/dɪˈtekʃən/<,>n.察觉/n.发觉/n.侦察<,>Early detection of cancer increases survival rates.<,>癌症的早期发现提高了生存率。<,>The detection of fraud requires careful investigation.<,>发现欺诈需要仔细调查。<,>His detection of the error saved the company thousands.<,>他发现了这个错误，为公司节省了数千美元。<,>de(去掉)+tect(覆盖)+ion→去掉覆盖→发现<,>detective(n.侦探)/defection(n.背叛)/deterioration(n.恶化)

jury<,>/ˈdʒʊəri/<,>/ˈdʒʊri/<,>n.陪审团/n.评奖团<,>The jury reached a unanimous verdict.<,>陪审团达成了一致裁决。<,>She served on the jury for the film festival.<,>她担任了电影节的评奖委员。<,>The jury is still out on whether the new policy will work.<,>新政策是否会奏效尚无定论。<,>jur(法律)+y→法律相关团体→陪审团<,>injury(n.伤害)/journey(n.旅行)/jewelry(n.珠宝)

difference<,>/ˈdɪfrəns/<,>/ˈdɪfərəns/<,>n.差别/n.差/n.分歧<,>There's a big difference between theory and practice.<,>理论和实践有很大差别。<,>Can you tell the difference between these two brands?<,>你能分辨这两个品牌的区别吗？<,>We settled our differences through negotiation.<,>我们通过谈判解决了分歧。<,>differ(不同)+ence→不同之处→差别<,>indifference(n.冷漠)/reference(n.参考)/preference(n.偏好)

hope<,>/həʊp/<,>/hoʊp/<,>v.希望/n.希望<,>I hope you have a wonderful trip.<,>希望你旅途愉快。<,>Don't lose hope; things will get better.<,>不要失去希望，情况会好转的。<,>She is our last hope for winning the competition.<,>她是我们赢得比赛的最后希望。<,>h(high)+ope(open)→高处开放→希望<,>rope(n.绳子)/cope(v.应对)/hole(n.洞)

grant<,>/ɡrɑːnt/<,>/ɡrænt/<,>n.授给物/v.授予<,>He received a research grant from the university.<,>他获得了大学的研究资助。<,>The king granted him permission to leave the country.<,>国王准许他离开这个国家。<,>This scholarship grants you $5,000 per year.<,>这项奖学金每年授予你5000美元。<,>gr(grow)+ant(蚂蚁)→蚂蚁成长需要资助→授予<,>grand(adj.宏伟的)/grain(n.谷物)/grunt(v.咕哝)

insufficient<,>/ˌɪnsəˈfɪʃnt/<,>/ˌɪnsəˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.不足的/adj.不适当的<,>The evidence was insufficient to convict him.<,>证据不足以给他定罪。<,>Her preparation was insufficient for the exam.<,>她对考试的准备不足。<,>Insufficient sleep can affect your health.<,>睡眠不足会影响你的健康。<,>in(不)+sufficient(足够的)→不足的<,>efficient(adj.高效的)/deficient(adj.缺乏的)/proficient(adj.熟练的)

cheerful<,>/ˈtʃɪəfl/<,>/ˈtʃɪrfl/<,>adj.快乐的/adj.愉快的<,>She has a cheerful personality that brightens the room.<,>她性格开朗，能让整个房间活跃起来。<,>Despite the rain, he remained cheerful.<,>尽管下雨，他仍然保持愉快。<,>The children's cheerful laughter filled the playground.<,>孩子们欢快的笑声充满了操场。<,>cheer(欢呼)+ful(充满)→充满欢呼的→快乐的<,>cheerless(adj.阴郁的)/cheerleader(n.啦啦队员)/cheesefull(adj.充满奶酪的)

committee<,>/kəˈmɪti/<,>/kəˈmɪti/<,>n.委员会/n.全体委员<,>The committee will meet next Tuesday to discuss the budget.<,>委员会将于下周二开会讨论预算。<,>She was elected to the executive committee.<,>她被选入执行委员会。<,>The whole committee agreed on the new policy.<,>全体委员都同意这项新政策。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)+ee(人)→共同做事的人→委员会<,>commit(v.承诺)/commission(n.佣金)/admit(v.承认)
east<,>/iːst/<,>/iːst/<,>n.东/n.东部/adv.在东方<,>The sun rises in the east.<,>太阳从东方升起。<,>They live in the east of the country.<,>他们住在该国的东部。<,>The wind is blowing from the east.<,>风从东方吹来。<,>ea(谐音"易")+st(stand)→容易站立的方向→东方<,>west(n.西方/adv.向西)/feast(n.宴会/v.款待)/yeast(n.酵母)

pronunciation<,>/prəˌnʌn.siˈeɪ.ʃən/<,>/prəˌnʌn.siˈeɪ.ʃən/<,>n.发音/n.发音法<,>Her pronunciation of English is excellent.<,>她的英语发音非常好。<,>This dictionary gives phonetic pronunciations.<,>这本词典提供了音标发音。<,>Correct pronunciation is important in language learning.<,>正确的发音在语言学习中很重要。<,>pro(向前)+nunci(宣布)+ation(名词后缀)→向前宣布→发音<,>annunciation(n.宣告)/denunciation(n.谴责)/enunciation(n.阐明)

photo<,>/ˈfəʊ.təʊ/<,>/ˈfoʊ.toʊ/<,>n.照片/n.相片<,>I took a photo of the sunset.<,>我拍了一张日落的照片。<,>This photo was taken ten years ago.<,>这张照片是十年前拍的。<,>She keeps her family photos in an album.<,>她把家庭照片保存在相册里。<,>ph(光)+oto→用光记录→照片<,>photon(n.光子)/photocopy(n.复印件)/photogenic(adj.上镜的)

occupation<,>/ˌɒk.jəˈpeɪ.ʃən/<,>/ˌɑː.kjəˈpeɪ.ʃən/<,>n.职业/n.占领/n.占据<,>Teaching is her occupation.<,>教书是她的职业。<,>The building is under enemy occupation.<,>这栋建筑被敌军占领。<,>Gardening occupies most of his time.<,>园艺占据了他大部分时间。<,>oc(加强)+cup(拿)+ation→拿住→占领<,>preoccupation(n.全神贯注)/occupancy(n.占用)/occupier(n.占领者)

document<,>/ˈdɒk.jə.mənt/<,>/ˈdɑː.kjə.mənt/<,>n.公文/n.文件/n.证件<,>Please sign this document.<,>请签署这份文件。<,>I need to see your identification documents.<,>我需要看你的身份证件。<,>The historical documents are well preserved.<,>这些历史文献保存完好。<,>doc(教)+u+ment→教学用的→文件<,>docent(n.讲解员)/doctrine(n.教条)/documentary(n.纪录片)

popular<,>/ˈpɒp.jə.lər/<,>/ˈpɑː.pjə.lɚ/<,>adj.流行的/adj.民众的<,>This song is very popular among teenagers.<,>这首歌在青少年中很流行。<,>The president enjoys great popular support.<,>总统享有广泛的民众支持。<,>Jogging is a popular form of exercise.<,>慢跑是一种流行的锻炼方式。<,>pop(人民)+ular(形容词后缀)→人民的→流行的<,>populous(adj.人口稠密的)/population(n.人口)/popularity(n.普及)

resume<,>/rɪˈzjuːm/<,>/rɪˈzuːm/<,>v.重新开始/v.恢复<,>Classes will resume after the holiday.<,>假期后课程将恢复。<,>He resumed his seat after speaking.<,>发言后他重新坐下。<,>The peace talks resumed last week.<,>和平谈判上周恢复了。<,>re(重新)+sume(拿)→重新拿起→恢复<,>presume(v.假定)/consume(v.消耗)/assume(v.承担)

eyesight<,>/ˈaɪ.saɪt/<,>/ˈaɪ.saɪt/<,>n.视力/n.目力<,>His eyesight is failing with age.<,>随着年龄增长，他的视力在下降。<,>You need good eyesight to be a pilot.<,>当飞行员需要好视力。<,>The small print is hard to read for people with poor eyesight.<,>视力不好的人很难看清这些小字。<,>eye(眼)+sight(看)→眼睛看的能力→视力<,>insight(n.洞察力)/oversight(n.疏忽)/foresight(n.远见)

canal<,>/kəˈnæl/<,>/kəˈnæl/<,>n.运河/n.沟渠/n.管<,>The Suez Canal connects the Mediterranean and Red Sea.<,>苏伊士运河连接地中海和红海。<,>The irrigation canals distribute water to the fields.<,>灌溉渠将水分流到田间。<,>The ear canal leads to the eardrum.<,>耳道通向鼓膜。<,>can(管子)+al→像管子一样的→运河<,>channel(n.频道)/canon(n.标准)/cannon(n.大炮)

obviously<,>/ˈɒb.vi.əs.li/<,>/ˈɑːb.vi.əs.li/<,>adv.明显地/adv.显然地<,>He was obviously nervous during the interview.<,>面试时他显然很紧张。<,>Obviously, we need to make some changes.<,>显然，我们需要做些改变。<,>The answer is obviously wrong.<,>这个答案明显是错的。<,>ob(在...上)+vi(路)+ous+ly→在路上→明显地<,>obvious(adj.明显的)/oblivious(adj.健忘的)/devious(adj.迂回的)
please<,>/pliːz/<,>/pliz/<,>v.使高兴/v.请满意<,>Can you please pass me the salt?<,>请你把盐递给我好吗？<,>Her kindness pleased everyone.<,>她的善良使大家都很高兴。<,>I aim to please with my work.<,>我力求让我的工作令人满意。<,>pl(愉悦)+ease(轻松)→使人愉悦<,>plea(n.请求/v.恳求)/pleat(n.褶/v.打褶)  

breeze<,>/briːz/<,>/briz/<,>n.微风/n.和风<,>A gentle breeze blew through the trees.<,>一阵微风吹过树林。<,>She completed the task with a breeze.<,>她轻松完成了任务。<,>The breeze carried the scent of flowers.<,>微风带来了花香。<,>br(轻柔)+eeze(拟声词)→轻柔的风声<,>freeze(v.冻结/n.冰冻)/breathe(v.呼吸)  

mechanic<,>/məˈkænɪk/<,>/məˈkænɪk/<,>n.技工/n.机械/n.机修工<,>The mechanic fixed my car engine.<,>机修工修好了我的汽车发动机。<,>He has a mechanic's understanding of machines.<,>他对机器有机械师般的理解。<,>She works as a mechanic in a garage.<,>她在修车厂当技工。<,>mechan(机器)+ic(人)→操作机器的人<,>machine(n.机器/v.用机器制造)/mechanism(n.机械装置)  

beside<,>/bɪˈsaɪd/<,>/bɪˈsaɪd/<,>prep.在…旁边<,>She sat beside me during the meeting.<,>开会时她坐在我旁边。<,>The book is beside the lamp on the table.<,>书在桌上台灯的旁边。<,>There's a beautiful garden beside the house.<,>房子旁边有个漂亮的花园。<,>be(在)+side(边)→在旁边<,>besides(prep.除...之外)/aside(adv.在旁边)  

lid<,>/lɪd/<,>/lɪd/<,>n.盖子/n.盖/n.囊盖<,>Put the lid back on the jar.<,>把罐子的盖子盖回去。<,>She lifted the lid of the box carefully.<,>她小心地掀开盒盖。<,>His eyes were hidden beneath heavy lids.<,>他的眼睛藏在厚重的眼皮下。<,>联想：kid(小孩)去掉k→盖子<,>lip(n.嘴唇)/bid(v.出价)  

percent<,>/pəˈsent/<,>/pɚˈsɛnt/<,>adj.百分之…<,>Fifty percent of the students passed the exam.<,>百分之五十的学生通过了考试。<,>There's a 20 percent discount today.<,>今天有20%的折扣。<,>He invested ten percent of his income.<,>他投资了收入的百分之十。<,>per(每)+cent(百)→每一百中的部分<,>century(n.世纪)/percentage(n.百分比)  

Englishman<,>/ˈɪŋɡlɪʃmən/<,>/ˈɪŋɡlɪʃmən/<,>n.英国男子<,>The Englishman spoke with a refined accent.<,>那个英国男子说话带着优雅的口音。<,>An Englishman invented the modern football rules.<,>一个英国人发明了现代足球规则。<,>He's a typical Englishman who loves tea.<,>他是个典型的爱喝茶的英国男人。<,>English(英国的)+man(人)→英国男人<,>Englishwoman(n.英国女人)/Dutchman(n.荷兰人)  

mature<,>/məˈtjʊə(r)/<,>/məˈtʃʊr/<,>adj.成熟的/v.使成熟<,>This cheese needs time to mature.<,>这种奶酪需要时间成熟。<,>She's very mature for her age.<,>就她的年龄而言，她非常成熟。<,>The wine has matured over ten years.<,>这葡萄酒已经陈酿了十年以上。<,>mat(母亲)+ure(状态)→像母亲般成熟的状态<,>nature(n.自然)/manual(adj.手工的)  

basketball<,>/ˈbɑːskɪtbɔːl/<,>/ˈbæskɪtˌbɔl/<,>n.篮球运动/n.篮球<,>He plays basketball every weekend.<,>他每个周末都打篮球。<,>The basketball hit the rim but didn't go in.<,>篮球碰到了篮筐但没进。<,>She's on the school basketball team.<,>她是学校篮球队的成员。<,>basket(篮子)+ball(球)→投进篮子的球<,>baseball(n.棒球)/football(n.足球)  

orbit<,>/ˈɔːbɪt/<,>/ˈɔrbɪt/<,>n.运行轨道/v.环绕<,>The satellite is in orbit around Earth.<,>卫星在环绕地球的轨道上运行。<,>The moon orbits our planet.<,>月球环绕我们的行星运行。<,>They calculated the orbit of the comet.<,>他们计算了彗星的轨道。<,>orb(圆)+it(走)→圆形路线<,>oral(adj.口头的)/obit(n.讣告)
govern<,>/ˈɡʌvən/<,>/ˈɡʌvərn/<,>v.统治/v.治理/v.支配<,>The president governs the country with wisdom.<,>总统以智慧治理国家。<,>Laws govern the behavior of citizens.<,>法律支配着公民的行为。<,>She governs her emotions well in public.<,>她在公共场合很好地控制了自己的情绪。<,>govern(统治)→government(政府)<,>govern(v. 统治)/governess(n.女家庭教师)/governor(n.州长)  

expose<,>/ɪkˈspəʊz/<,>/ɪkˈspoʊz/<,>v.使暴露/v.揭露<,>The journalist exposed the corruption scandal.<,>记者揭露了腐败丑闻。<,>Don't expose your skin to the sun for too long.<,>不要让皮肤暴露在阳光下太久。<,>The documentary exposed the truth behind the event.<,>这部纪录片揭露了事件背后的真相。<,>ex(出)+pose(放)→放出来→暴露<,>disclose(v. 揭露)/reveal(v. 揭示)/uncover(v. 揭开)  

nod<,>/nɒd/<,>/nɑːd/<,>v.点（头）/v.点头表示<,>She nodded in agreement.<,>她点头表示同意。<,>The teacher nodded to the student to begin.<,>老师向学生点头示意开始。<,>He nodded off during the meeting.<,>他在会议期间打瞌睡。<,>nod(点头)→noddle(脑袋)<,>nob(n. 贵族)/knot(n. 结)/nook(n. 角落)  

ash<,>/æʃ/<,>/æʃ/<,>n.灰/n.灰末/n.骨灰<,>The volcano covered the town with ash.<,>火山灰覆盖了整个小镇。<,>She kept her father's ashes in an urn.<,>她把父亲的骨灰保存在骨灰盒里。<,>The cigarette ash fell on the carpet.<,>香烟灰掉在了地毯上。<,>ash(灰)→ashtray(烟灰缸)<,>rash(adj. 轻率的)/lash(v. 鞭打)/bash(v. 猛击)  

privilege<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/<,>/ˈprɪvəlɪdʒ/<,>n.特权/n.优惠<,>Education should be a right, not a privilege.<,>教育应该是权利，而非特权。<,>Members enjoy special shopping privileges.<,>会员享有购物优惠。<,>It's a privilege to meet you.<,>见到您是我的荣幸。<,>priv(私人)+lege(法律)→私人法律→特权<,>privacy(n. 隐私)/privation(n. 匮乏)/pristine(adj. 原始的)  

grocer<,>/ˈɡrəʊsə(r)/<,>/ˈɡroʊsər/<,>n.食品商/n.杂货商<,>I bought flour at the local grocer.<,>我在本地杂货店买了面粉。<,>The grocer delivers fresh produce weekly.<,>这家食品商每周配送新鲜农产品。<,>My grandfather was a grocer in this town.<,>我祖父曾是这镇上的杂货商。<,>grocer(杂货商)→grocery(杂货店)<,>gross(adj. 总的)/glower(v. 怒视)/grouser(n. 抱怨者)  

numerous<,>/ˈnjuːmərəs/<,>/ˈnuːmərəs/<,>adj.为数众多的/adj.许多<,>Numerous studies support this theory.<,>许多研究支持这一理论。<,>She has received numerous awards.<,>她获得了众多奖项。<,>Numerous visitors came to the exhibition.<,>许多参观者来到展览会。<,>numer(数字)+ous(多)→数量多的<,>numerical(adj. 数字的)/enumerate(v. 列举)/innumerable(adj. 无数的)  

swift<,>/swɪft/<,>/swɪft/<,>adj.快的/adj.反应快的<,>The swift runner won the race.<,>那个飞快的跑步者赢得了比赛。<,>She gave a swift response to the question.<,>她对问题作出了快速反应。<,>The company took swift action to solve the problem.<,>公司迅速采取行动解决问题。<,>swift(快的)→swiftly(迅速地)<,>shift(v. 移动)/sift(v. 筛选)/rift(n. 裂缝)  

arise<,>/əˈraɪz/<,>/əˈraɪz/<,>v.出现/v.由…引起<,>New problems may arise during the process.<,>过程中可能会出现新问题。<,>The conflict arose from a misunderstanding.<,>冲突由误解引起。<,>A strange noise arose in the night.<,>夜间出现了奇怪的声音。<,>a(加强)+rise(升起)→出现<,>rise(v. 上升)/raise(v. 举起)/rouse(v. 唤醒)  

foremost<,>/ˈfɔːməʊst/<,>/ˈfɔːrmoʊst/<,>adj.最初的/adj.第一流的<,>He is the foremost expert in this field.<,>他是该领域最顶尖的专家。<,>Safety should be our foremost concern.<,>安全应该是我们最首要的关注点。<,>This was the foremost reason for their success.<,>这是他们成功的最初原因。<,>fore(前)+most(最)→最前面的<,>foremost(第一流的)/foreman(n. 工头)/foretell(v. 预言)
wage<,>/weɪdʒ/<,>/weɪdʒ/<,>v.开展（运动）<,>They waged a campaign against pollution.<,>他们开展了一场反对污染的运动。<,>The union decided to wage a strike.<,>工会决定发起罢工。<,>The government waged war on illegal drugs.<,>政府对非法毒品发动了战争。<,>wage(工资)→用工资支持→开展运动<,>rage(n.愤怒)/cage(n.笼子)/engage(v.从事)

implication<,>/ˌɪmplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪmplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.含义/n.暗示/n.暗指<,>His words had serious implications.<,>他的话有严重的含义。<,>She didn't realize the implication of her statement.<,>她没有意识到她声明的暗示。<,>The study examines the implications of climate change.<,>这项研究探讨了气候变化的含义。<,>im(进入)+plic(折叠)+ation→折叠进去的意思→暗示<,>application(n.申请)/complication(n.复杂)/duplication(n.复制)

childish<,>/ˈtʃaɪldɪʃ/<,>/ˈtʃaɪldɪʃ/<,>adj.孩子的/adj.幼稚的<,>Don't be so childish!<,>别这么幼稚！<,>She has a childish innocence about her.<,>她身上有种孩子般的天真。<,>His behavior was rather childish for a grown man.<,>作为一个成年人，他的行为相当幼稚。<,>child(孩子)+ish(形容词后缀)→孩子的<,>childlike(adj.孩子般天真的)/childhood(n.童年)/childless(adj.无子女的)

name<,>/neɪm/<,>/neɪm/<,>n.名字/n.名誉/v.说出<,>What's your name?<,>你叫什么名字？<,>He made a name for himself in the industry.<,>他在这个行业赢得了声誉。<,>Can you name all the states in America?<,>你能说出美国所有的州吗？<,>name(名字)→与名誉相关→说出名字<,>fame(n.名声)/nickname(n.绰号)/rename(v.重命名)

prefer<,>/prɪˈfɜː(r)/<,>/prɪˈfɜːr/<,>v.更喜欢<,>I prefer tea to coffee.<,>比起咖啡，我更喜欢茶。<,>She prefers walking to driving.<,>她更喜欢步行而不是开车。<,>Would you prefer to stay in or go out?<,>你更喜欢待在家里还是出去？<,>pre(前)+fer(拿)→提前选择→更喜欢<,>refer(v.参考)/defer(v.推迟)/infer(v.推断)

exact<,>/ɪɡˈzækt/<,>/ɪɡˈzækt/<,>adj.确切的/adj.精确的<,>What is the exact time?<,>确切的时间是几点？<,>We need exact measurements for this project.<,>这个项目我们需要精确的测量。<,>She has an exact memory of the event.<,>她对那次事件有精确的记忆。<,>ex(出)+act(做)→做出来→精确的<,>extract(v.提取)/exactitude(n.精确)/exacting(adj.严格的)

often<,>/ˈɒfn/<,>/ˈɔːfn/<,>adv.经常/adv.常常<,>I often go to the gym after work.<,>我经常下班后去健身房。<,>How often do you visit your parents?<,>你多久去看一次父母？<,>It often rains in April.<,>四月份经常下雨。<,>often(经常)→频率副词<,>frequent(adj.频繁的)/always(adv.总是)/seldom(adv.很少)

residence<,>/ˈrezɪdəns/<,>/ˈrezɪdəns/<,>n.居住/n.驻扎/n.住处<,>He took up residence in Paris.<,>他在巴黎定居。<,>The official residence of the president is well guarded.<,>总统的官邸守卫森严。<,>This building is for student residence only.<,>这栋楼仅供学生居住。<,>re(再)+sid(坐)+ence→再次坐下来→居住<,>resident(n.居民)/president(n.总统)/subsidence(n.下沉)

flood<,>/flʌd/<,>/flʌd/<,>n.洪水/v.淹没<,>The flood destroyed many homes.<,>洪水摧毁了许多家园。<,>Memories came flooding back.<,>回忆如潮水般涌来。<,>The river might flood after heavy rain.<,>大雨过后河流可能会泛滥。<,>flood(洪水)→流动的水→淹没<,>blood(n.血液)/floor(n.地板)/flow(v.流动)

generation<,>/ˌdʒenəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌdʒenəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.一代/n.一代人/n.产生<,>My generation grew up with computers.<,>我这一代人是伴随着电脑长大的。<,>The power plant uses water for electricity generation.<,>这个发电厂用水来发电。<,>There's often a generation gap between parents and children.<,>父母和孩子之间经常存在代沟。<,>gener(产生)+ation→一代人的产生<,>general(adj.一般的)/generate(v.产生)/degenerate(v.退化)
permanent<,>/ˈpɜːmənənt/<,>/ˈpɜːrmənənt/<,>adj.永久的/adj.持久的<,>They built a permanent home in the countryside.<,>他们在乡下建了一个永久的家。<,>The ink left a permanent stain on the shirt.<,>墨水在衬衫上留下了永久的污渍。<,>Her smile left a permanent impression on his mind.<,>她的微笑在他脑海中留下了永久的印象。<,>per(贯穿)+man(手)+ent→一直用手做→持久的<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/momentary(adj.瞬间的)
