genius<,>/ˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ˈdʒiːniəs/<,>n.天才/n.天赋/n.天资<,>Einstein was a genius in physics.<,>爱因斯坦是物理学天才。<,>She has a genius for languages.<,>她有语言天赋。<,>His musical genius was evident from a young age.<,>他的音乐天资从小就显而易见。<,>gen(出生)+ius→天生的才能→天才<,>genuine(adj.真正的)/ingenious(adj.机灵的)

desert<,>/ˈdezət/<,>/ˈdezərt/<,>n.沙漠/v.离弃/v.擅离<,>The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.<,>撒哈拉是世界上最大的热沙漠。<,>He deserted his family when they needed him most.<,>他在家人最需要他的时候抛弃了他们。<,>Many soldiers deserted during the war.<,>许多士兵在战争中擅离职守。<,>de(离开)+sert(加入)→离开加入的地方→离弃<,>dessert(n.甜点)/deserve(v.应得)

nerve<,>/nɜːv/<,>/nɜːrv/<,>n.神经/n.勇敢/n.胆量<,>The dentist hit a nerve while drilling.<,>牙医钻牙时碰到了神经。<,>It took a lot of nerve to speak in front of the crowd.<,>在人群面前讲话需要很大勇气。<,>She has the nerve to ask for a raise after being late every day.<,>她每天迟到还敢要求加薪。<,>nerve原指"肌腱"，后引申为"神经"和"勇气"<,>nervous(adj.紧张的)/neuron(n.神经元)

northern<,>/ˈnɔːðən/<,>/ˈnɔːrðərn/<,>adj.北方的/adj.北部的<,>They traveled to northern Europe last summer.<,>他们去年夏天去了北欧旅行。<,>The northern lights are a spectacular natural phenomenon.<,>北极光是一种壮观的自然现象。<,>Northern cuisine tends to be heartier than southern cooking.<,>北方菜通常比南方菜更丰盛。<,>north(北)+ern(形容词后缀)→北方的<,>southern(adj.南方的)/eastern(adj.东方的)

specialize<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>v.成为...专家/v.专攻<,>He specializes in criminal law.<,>他专攻刑法。<,>This restaurant specializes in seafood dishes.<,>这家餐厅专做海鲜料理。<,>She decided to specialize in pediatric medicine.<,>她决定专攻儿科医学。<,>special(特殊的)+ize(使)→使成为特殊的领域→专攻<,>specialist(n.专家)/generalize(v.概括)

emergency<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒənsi/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒənsi/<,>n.紧急情况/n.突然事件<,>Call 911 in case of emergency.<,>遇到紧急情况请拨打911。<,>The hospital has an emergency room open 24 hours.<,>医院有24小时开放的急诊室。<,>We need to prepare for emergencies like earthquakes.<,>我们需要为地震等突发事件做准备。<,>e(出)+merge(沉)+ency→突然浮现出来的情况→紧急情况<,>urgency(n.紧急)/emergence(n.出现)

hen<,>/hen/<,>/hen/<,>n.母鸡/n.雌禽<,>The hen laid an egg this morning.<,>母鸡今早下了一个蛋。<,>We keep three hens in the backyard.<,>我们在后院养了三只母鸡。<,>The mother hen protected her chicks from the cat.<,>母鸡保护小鸡不被猫伤害。<,>hen与pen(笔)押韵，可以联想"母鸡用笔写字"<,>rooster(n.公鸡)/chicken(n.鸡)

act<,>/ækt/<,>/ækt/<,>v.行动/v.见效/n.行为<,>We must act quickly to save the patient.<,>我们必须迅速行动挽救病人。<,>The medicine took an hour to act.<,>药物一小时才见效。<,>His kind act was appreciated by everyone.<,>他的善举得到了大家的赞赏。<,>act与fact(事实)对比记忆，行动产生事实<,>action(n.行动)/actor(n.演员)

one<,>/wʌn/<,>/wʌn/<,>num.一/pron.一个人<,>I have one brother and two sisters.<,>我有一个兄弟和两个姐妹。<,>One should always tell the truth.<,>一个人应该永远说实话。<,>This is the one I've been looking for.<,>这就是我一直在找的那个。<,>one与won(win的过去式)发音相同<,>once(adv.一次)/only(adj.唯一的)
argument<,>/ˈɑːɡjumənt/<,>/ˈɑːrɡjumənt/<,>n.争论/n.辩论/n.理由<,>They had a heated argument about politics.<,>他们就政治问题进行了激烈的争论。<,>His argument was based on solid evidence.<,>他的论点基于确凿的证据。<,>She presented a strong argument for the proposal.<,>她为这个提案提出了强有力的理由。<,>argu(争论)+ment(名词后缀)→争论<,>augment(v.增加)/allegation(n.指控)/assertion(n.断言)

painter<,>/ˈpeɪntə(r)/<,>/ˈpeɪntər/<,>n.画家/n.绘画者/n.漆工<,>The painter is working on a new masterpiece.<,>这位画家正在创作一幅新的杰作。<,>We hired a painter to repaint our house.<,>我们雇了一个油漆工来重新粉刷房子。<,>She is a talented painter of landscapes.<,>她是一位才华横溢的风景画家。<,>paint(绘画)+er(人)→画家<,>printer(n.打印机)/writer(n.作家)/sculptor(n.雕塑家)

division<,>/dɪˈvɪʒn/<,>/dɪˈvɪʒən/<,>n.分/n.分配/n.除法<,>The division of labor improved efficiency.<,>分工提高了效率。<,>He struggled with long division in math class.<,>他在数学课上为长除法而苦恼。<,>There was a clear division between the two groups.<,>这两个团体之间有明显的分歧。<,>divide(分开)+sion(名词后缀)→分配<,>diversion(n.转移)/vision(n.视力)/decision(n.决定)

burst<,>/bɜːst/<,>/bɜːrst/<,>v.使爆裂/n.爆炸<,>The balloon burst when it touched the thorn.<,>气球碰到刺就爆了。<,>There was a burst of applause after the performance.<,>表演结束后爆发出一阵掌声。<,>She burst into tears when she heard the news.<,>她听到这个消息突然哭了起来。<,>拟声词，模仿爆炸的声音<,>bust(n.半身像)/blast(n.爆炸)/burn(v.燃烧)

closely<,>/ˈkləʊsli/<,>/ˈkloʊsli/<,>adv.紧密地/adv.接近地<,>The two companies are closely related.<,>这两家公司关系密切。<,>She listened closely to the instructions.<,>她仔细聆听了指示。<,>The detective examined the evidence closely.<,>侦探仔细检查了证据。<,>close(接近的)+ly(副词后缀)→接近地<,>closet(n.壁橱)/coarsely(adv.粗糙地)/closely(adv.严密地)

church<,>/tʃɜːtʃ/<,>/tʃɜːrtʃ/<,>n.教堂/n.礼拜堂/n.教会<,>They got married in a beautiful church.<,>他们在一座美丽的教堂结婚了。<,>We go to church every Sunday.<,>我们每个星期天都去教堂。<,>The church plays an important role in the community.<,>教会在社区中扮演着重要角色。<,>ch发音与"基督"相关+urch→教堂<,>chapel(n.小教堂)/cathedral(n.大教堂)/temple(n.寺庙)

track<,>/træk/<,>/træk/<,>n.行踪/n.路径/n.轨道<,>The police followed the suspect's tracks.<,>警察追踪了嫌疑人的行踪。<,>The train runs on this track.<,>火车在这条轨道上行驶。<,>Keep track of your expenses.<,>记录你的开支。<,>tr(表示移动)+ack→移动的路径→轨道<,>tract(n.大片土地)/trace(v.追踪)/truck(n.卡车)

chase<,>/tʃeɪs/<,>/tʃeɪs/<,>n.追逐/n.追赶/n.追求<,>The dog chased the cat up a tree.<,>狗把猫追到了树上。<,>He gave up the chase when he realized it was hopeless.<,>当他意识到无望时就放弃了追逐。<,>She's been chasing her dream for years.<,>她多年来一直在追求自己的梦想。<,>谐音"cheese"→老鼠追奶酪→追逐<,>phase(n.阶段)/chess(n.国际象棋)/case(n.案例)

note<,>/nəʊt/<,>/noʊt/<,>n.笔记/n.便条/n.注释<,>She took notes during the lecture.<,>她在讲座期间做了笔记。<,>He left a note on the fridge.<,>他在冰箱上留了张便条。<,>Please see the note at the bottom of the page.<,>请参阅页面底部的注释。<,>not(标记)+e→做标记→笔记<,>node(n.节点)/notch(n.凹口)/vote(v.投票)

attract<,>/əˈtrækt/<,>/əˈtrækt/<,>v.吸引/v.引起...的兴趣/v.诱惑<,>The bright colors attract butterflies.<,>鲜艳的颜色吸引了蝴蝶。<,>The museum attracts thousands of visitors each year.<,>这个博物馆每年吸引成千上万的游客。<,>He was attracted to her intelligence.<,>他被她的智慧所吸引。<,>at(向)+tract(拉)→拉向→吸引<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/contract(n.合同)/distract(v.分散注意力)
both<,>/bəʊθ/<,>/boʊθ/<,>pron.两者（都）<,>Both of them are excellent students.<,>他们两个都是优秀的学生。<,>I like both tea and coffee.<,>我既喜欢茶也喜欢咖啡。<,>Both options seem good to me.<,>两个选项对我来说都很好。<,>bo(两者)+th(都)→两者都<,>bother(v.打扰)/booth(n.摊位)  

brilliant<,>/ˈbrɪliənt/<,>/ˈbrɪljənt/<,>adj.光辉的/adj.卓越的<,>She gave a brilliant performance on stage.<,>她在舞台上表现卓越。<,>The stars were brilliant in the night sky.<,>夜空中的星星闪闪发光。<,>He has a brilliant mind for solving problems.<,>他有解决问题的卓越头脑。<,>brilli(发光)+ant(形容词后缀)→发光的<,>radiant(adj.光芒四射的)/brave(adj.勇敢的)  

consume<,>/kənˈsjuːm/<,>/kənˈsuːm/<,>v.消耗/v.消费/v.消灭<,>The fire consumed the entire building.<,>大火吞噬了整个建筑。<,>He consumes a lot of energy during workouts.<,>他在锻炼时消耗大量能量。<,>We need to consume resources wisely.<,>我们需要明智地消费资源。<,>con(完全)+sume(拿取)→完全拿取→消耗<,>resume(v.恢复)/presume(v.假定)  

axis<,>/ˈæksɪs/<,>/ˈæksɪs/<,>n.轴/n.轴线/n.中心线<,>The Earth rotates on its axis.<,>地球绕地轴旋转。<,>The main axis of the building runs north-south.<,>建筑的主轴线是南北走向的。<,>The plot revolves around the axis of good versus evil.<,>情节围绕善恶对抗的中心线展开。<,>ax(轴)+is→轴<,>axes(n.轴复数)/access(n.入口)  

plastic<,>/ˈplæstɪk/<,>/ˈplæstɪk/<,>adj.可塑的/n.塑料<,>Clay is a plastic material when wet.<,>黏土在湿润时可塑。<,>Plastic pollution is a global problem.<,>塑料污染是全球性问题。<,>She stored the food in a plastic container.<,>她把食物存放在塑料容器里。<,>plast(塑造)+ic→可塑的<,>elastic(adj.有弹性的)/fantastic(adj.极好的)  

relation<,>/rɪˈleɪʃn/<,>/rɪˈleɪʃn/<,>n.关系/n.联系/n.家属<,>There is a close relation between diet and health.<,>饮食和健康有密切关系。<,>She invited all her relations to the wedding.<,>她邀请了所有家属参加婚礼。<,>The two countries have diplomatic relations.<,>两国建有外交关系。<,>re(重新)+lat(携带)+ion→重新携带→联系<,>relative(n.亲戚)/relationship(n.关系)  

succession<,>/səkˈseʃn/<,>/səkˈseʃn/<,>n.连续/n.继任/n.继承<,>He won three games in succession.<,>他连续赢了三场比赛。<,>The succession to the throne was carefully planned.<,>王位继承经过周密安排。<,>A succession of accidents delayed our trip.<,>一连串事故延误了我们的行程。<,>suc(随后)+cess(走)+ion→随后跟上→连续<,>success(n.成功)/session(n.会议)  

weaken<,>/ˈwiːkən/<,>/ˈwiːkən/<,>v.削弱<,>The storm weakened as it moved inland.<,>风暴向内陆移动时减弱了。<,>Lack of sleep can weaken your immune system.<,>睡眠不足会削弱免疫系统。<,>Their resolve weakened after hours of negotiation.<,>数小时谈判后他们的决心动摇了。<,>weak(弱)+en(使)→使变弱<,>waken(v.唤醒)/strengthen(v.加强)  

officer<,>/ˈɒfɪsə(r)/<,>/ˈɑːfɪsər/<,>n.官员/n.干事/n.军官<,>The police officer directed traffic at the intersection.<,>警官在十字路口指挥交通。<,>She is the chief financial officer of the company.<,>她是公司的首席财务官。<,>Military officers attended the ceremony.<,>军官们出席了仪式。<,>office(办公室)+er(人)→办公室人员→官员<,>official(adj.官方的)/offer(v.提供)  

keep<,>/kiːp/<,>/kiːp/<,>v.保持/v.坚持<,>Keep calm in emergencies.<,>紧急情况下保持冷静。<,>She keeps her room very tidy.<,>她保持房间十分整洁。<,>He kept working despite being tired.<,>尽管累了，他仍坚持工作。<,>k(开)+eep(持续)→持续开着→保持<,>keen(adj.热切的)/peep(v.偷看)
electronics<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɒnɪks/<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɑːnɪks/<,>n.电子学<,>He is studying electronics at university.<,>他在大学学习电子学。<,>Modern electronics have revolutionized communication.<,>现代电子学彻底改变了通讯方式。<,>This device uses advanced electronics.<,>这个设备采用了先进的电子技术。<,>electron(电子)+ics(学科)→电子学<,>electric(adj.电的)/electricity(n.电力)

optimistic<,>/ˌɒptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌɑːptɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.乐观的/adj.乐观主义的<,>She has an optimistic view of the future.<,>她对未来持乐观态度。<,>Despite the difficulties, he remained optimistic.<,>尽管有困难，他仍然保持乐观。<,>The team is optimistic about winning the championship.<,>团队对赢得冠军持乐观态度。<,>opt(选择)+imistic→选择看到好的一面→乐观的<,>pessimistic(adj.悲观的)/optimum(adj.最佳的)

permission<,>/pəˈmɪʃən/<,>/pərˈmɪʃən/<,>n.允许/n.许可/n.同意<,>You need permission to enter this area.<,>你需要许可才能进入这个区域。<,>He asked for permission to leave early.<,>他请求允许提前离开。<,>The teacher gave us permission to use calculators.<,>老师允许我们使用计算器。<,>per(通过)+miss(发送)+ion→允许通过<,>admission(n.入场许可)/commission(n.委员会)

brick<,>/brɪk/<,>/brɪk/<,>n.砖/n.砖块/n.砖状物<,>The house is built of red bricks.<,>这房子是用红砖建造的。<,>He threw a brick through the window.<,>他把一块砖扔进了窗户。<,>These chocolate bars come in brick shapes.<,>这些巧克力棒是砖块形状的。<,>发音类似"break"(打破)→砖块容易打破<,>brisk(adj.轻快的)/brink(n.边缘)

loose<,>/luːs/<,>/luːs/<,>adj.松的/adj.宽松的<,>This screw is loose and needs tightening.<,>这个螺丝松了，需要拧紧。<,>She prefers to wear loose clothing in summer.<,>夏天她喜欢穿宽松的衣服。<,>The dog got loose from its leash.<,>狗挣脱了皮带。<,>发音类似"lose"(丢失)→松的东西容易丢失<,>lose(v.丢失)/loss(n.损失)

welfare<,>/ˈwelfeə(r)/<,>/ˈwelfer/<,>n.幸福/n.福利<,>The government provides welfare for the unemployed.<,>政府为失业者提供福利。<,>Animal welfare is an important issue.<,>动物福利是一个重要问题。<,>Parents are concerned about their children's welfare.<,>父母关心孩子的幸福。<,>well(好)+fare(状况)→好的状况→福利<,>farewell(n.告别)/warfare(n.战争)

paper<,>/ˈpeɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈpeɪpər/<,>n.纸/n.官方文件/n.文章<,>Please write your name on this piece of paper.<,>请在这张纸上写下你的名字。<,>She published a paper in a scientific journal.<,>她在科学期刊上发表了一篇文章。<,>We need to sign these legal papers.<,>我们需要签署这些法律文件。<,>papyrus(古埃及纸莎草纸)→paper的起源<,>pepper(n.胡椒)/pamper(v.纵容)

former<,>/ˈfɔːmə(r)/<,>/ˈfɔːrmər/<,>adj.在前的/n.前者<,>The former president still gives speeches.<,>前总统仍在发表演讲。<,>Of these two options, I prefer the former.<,>在这两个选项中，我更喜欢前者。<,>She is a former student of this university.<,>她是这所大学的校友。<,>form(形式)+er→以前的形式→前者<,>formal(adj.正式的)/farmer(n.农民)

truth<,>/truːθ/<,>/truːθ/<,>n.事实/n.真理/n.真实性<,>You should always tell the truth.<,>你应该永远说实话。<,>The truth about the incident finally came out.<,>事件的真相终于大白。<,>Scientists search for truth about the universe.<,>科学家们探索关于宇宙的真理。<,>true(真实的)+th→真实的事物→真理<,>truce(n.休战)/trust(n.信任)

impose<,>/ɪmˈpəʊz/<,>/ɪmˈpoʊz/<,>v.把...强加/v.征税<,>The government imposed new taxes on luxury goods.<,>政府对奢侈品征收新税。<,>Parents shouldn't impose their opinions on children.<,>父母不应把自己的观点强加给孩子。<,>The school imposes strict rules on students.<,>学校对学生实施严格的规章制度。<,>im(进入)+pose(放置)→强行放入→强加<,>compose(v.组成)/expose(v.暴露)
neglect<,>/nɪˈɡlekt/<,>/nɪˈɡlɛkt/<,>v.疏忽/v.忽视/v.忽略<,>He neglected his duties as a father.<,>他疏忽了作为父亲的责任。<,>The garden was neglected and full of weeds.<,>花园被忽视了，长满了杂草。<,>She felt neglected by her friends.<,>她觉得被朋友们忽视了。<,>neg(否定)+lect(选择)→不选择→忽视<,>negligence(n.疏忽)/negligible(adj.微不足道的)

harm<,>/hɑːm/<,>/hɑrm/<,>n.伤害/n.损害/v.损害<,>Smoking can harm your health.<,>吸烟会损害你的健康。<,>The storm did a lot of harm to the crops.<,>暴风雨对庄稼造成了很大损害。<,>No harm was done in the accident.<,>事故中没有造成伤害。<,>harm(伤害)→与"arm(手臂)"区分<,>hurt(v.伤害)/damage(n.损害)/injure(v.伤害)

pie<,>/paɪ/<,>/paɪ/<,>n.(西点)馅饼<,>She baked an apple pie for dessert.<,>她烤了一个苹果派作为甜点。<,>Would you like a slice of pie?<,>你想要一块馅饼吗？<,>The pie chart shows the distribution clearly.<,>这个饼状图清晰地显示了分布情况。<,>pie(馅饼)→与"pi(π)"区分<,>tart(n.果馅饼)/pastry(n.油酥点心)

pioneer<,>/ˌpaɪəˈnɪə(r)/<,>/ˌpaɪəˈnɪr/<,>n.拓荒者/n.先驱者<,>He was a pioneer in the field of medicine.<,>他是医学领域的先驱者。<,>The pioneers settled in the new land.<,>拓荒者在新土地上定居下来。<,>She pioneered a new teaching method.<,>她开创了一种新的教学方法。<,>pione(先驱)+er(人)→先驱者<,>explorer(n.探险家)/trailblazer(n.开拓者)

mystery<,>/ˈmɪstri/<,>/ˈmɪstəri/<,>n.神秘/n.神秘的事物<,>The disappearance of the plane remains a mystery.<,>飞机的失踪仍然是个谜。<,>She loves reading mystery novels.<,>她喜欢读悬疑小说。<,>There's an air of mystery about him.<,>他身上有种神秘感。<,>myst(神秘)+ery(状态)→神秘<,>history(n.历史)/ministry(n.部门)

determination<,>/dɪˌtɜːmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/dɪˌtɜːrmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.决心/n.决定/n.确定<,>Her determination to succeed is admirable.<,>她成功的决心令人钦佩。<,>The determination of the cause took weeks.<,>确定原因花了数周时间。<,>He showed great determination in the race.<,>他在比赛中表现出极大的决心。<,>determine(决定)+ation(名词后缀)→决心<,>destination(n.目的地)/termination(n.终止)

reply<,>/rɪˈplaɪ/<,>/rɪˈplaɪ/<,>v.回答/n.回答<,>He didn't reply to my email.<,>他没有回复我的邮件。<,>Her reply was brief and to the point.<,>她的回答简短而切中要点。<,>I'm waiting for a reply from the company.<,>我在等待公司的回复。<,>re(回)+ply(折叠)→折回去→回答<,>apply(v.申请)/supply(v.供应)

department<,>/dɪˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/dɪˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.部/n.司/n.局/n.处/n.系<,>She works in the marketing department.<,>她在市场营销部门工作。<,>The English department is on the third floor.<,>英语系在三楼。<,>He heads the finance department.<,>他主管财务部门。<,>depart(分开)+ment(名词后缀)→部门<,>apartment(n.公寓)/compartment(n.隔间)

cake<,>/keɪk/<,>/keɪk/<,>n.饼/n.糕/n.蛋糕<,>She baked a chocolate cake for my birthday.<,>她为我的生日烤了一个巧克力蛋糕。<,>Would you like some cake?<,>你想要一些蛋糕吗？<,>The icing on the cake was too sweet.<,>蛋糕上的糖霜太甜了。<,>cake(蛋糕)→与"take(拿)"区分<,>cookie(n.饼干)/pastry(n.糕点)

parcel<,>/ˈpɑːsl/<,>/ˈpɑːrsl/<,>n.包裹/n.小包/n.邮包<,>I received a parcel from my sister.<,>我收到了姐姐寄来的包裹。<,>The parcel was delivered this morning.<,>包裹是今天早上送到的。<,>She wrapped the gift in a brown parcel.<,>她用棕色包装纸包好了礼物。<,>par(部分)+cel(小)→小部分→小包<,>package(n.包裹)/packet(n.小包)
status<,>/ˈsteɪtəs/<,>/ˈsteɪtəs/<,>n.地位/n.身份<,>His status in the company has risen significantly.<,>他在公司的地位显著提升。<,>She enjoys a high social status.<,>她享有很高的社会地位。<,>Marital status is required on the form.<,>表格上需要填写婚姻状况。<,>stat(站立)+us→站立的位置→地位<,>statue(n.雕像)/statute(n.法规)/stature(n.身高)  

edge<,>/edʒ/<,>/edʒ/<,>n.边缘/n.边/n.刀口<,>Be careful not to fall off the edge of the cliff.<,>小心别从悬崖边上掉下去。<,>The knife has a very sharp edge.<,>这把刀的刀刃非常锋利。<,>They live on the edge of the forest.<,>他们住在森林边缘。<,>e(出)+dge(刀)→刀锋→边缘<,>hedge(n.树篱)/ledge(n.壁架)/pledge(n.保证)  

refusal<,>/rɪˈfjuːzl/<,>/rɪˈfjuːzl/<,>n.拒绝<,>His refusal to cooperate surprised everyone.<,>他拒绝合作让所有人都很惊讶。<,>I got a refusal letter from the university.<,>我收到了大学的拒信。<,>Her refusal was polite but firm.<,>她的拒绝礼貌但坚定。<,>re(反)+fus(流)+al→反流→拒绝<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/refuge(n.避难所)/refund(n.退款)  

kettle<,>/ˈketl/<,>/ˈketl/<,>n.水壶/n.锅<,>The kettle is whistling on the stove.<,>水壶在炉子上鸣叫。<,>She poured hot water from the kettle.<,>她从水壶里倒出热水。<,>We need a bigger kettle for camping.<,>我们需要一个更大的野营锅。<,>ket(罐)+tle→罐状物→水壶<,>cattle(n.牛)/settle(v.解决)/nettle(n.荨麻)  

positive<,>/ˈpɒzətɪv/<,>/ˈpɑːzətɪv/<,>adj.积极的/adj.确定的<,>She has a positive attitude towards life.<,>她对生活持积极态度。<,>The test results came back positive.<,>检测结果呈阳性。<,>I'm positive that I locked the door.<,>我确定我锁门了。<,>posit(放置)+ive→明确放置的→确定的<,>negative(adj.消极的)/position(n.位置)/possessive(adj.占有的)  

gaze<,>/ɡeɪz/<,>/ɡeɪz/<,>v.凝视/v.盯/v.注视<,>He gazed at the stars for hours.<,>他凝视星空数小时。<,>Her gaze never left the painting.<,>她的目光从未离开那幅画。<,>The child gazed in wonder at the fireworks.<,>孩子惊奇地注视着烟花。<,>gaz(看)+e→长时间看→凝视<,>glaze(v.上釉)/graze(v.吃草)/haze(n.薄雾)  

close<,>/kləʊz/<,>/kloʊz/<,>v.关/v.闭/v.结束<,>Please close the window before leaving.<,>离开前请关上窗户。<,>The store closes at 9 pm.<,>商店晚上9点关门。<,>Let's close the meeting with a summary.<,>让我们以总结结束会议。<,>clos(关闭)+e→关的动作<,>disclose(v.揭露)/enclose(v.围住)/closet(n.壁橱)  

presence<,>/ˈprezns/<,>/ˈprezns/<,>n.出席/n.到场/n.存在<,>Your presence at the meeting is required.<,>你必须出席会议。<,>She has a strong stage presence.<,>她有很强的舞台存在感。<,>I was aware of his presence in the room.<,>我意识到他在房间里。<,>pre(前)+sence(存在)→在前存在→出席<,>present(adj.现在的)/present(n.礼物)/president(n.总统)  

production<,>/prəˈdʌkʃn/<,>/prəˈdʌkʃn/<,>n.生产/n.总产量<,>The factory increased its production by 20%.<,>工厂将产量提高了20%。<,>This play is a school production.<,>这部戏剧是学校的作品。<,>Oil production has declined this year.<,>今年石油产量下降了。<,>pro(向前)+duct(引导)+ion→向前引导→生产<,>product(n.产品)/productive(adj.多产的)/reproduction(n.复制)  

foolish<,>/ˈfuːlɪʃ/<,>/ˈfuːlɪʃ/<,>adj.愚蠢的/adj.鲁莽的<,>It was foolish to go out without a coat.<,>不穿外套出门很愚蠢。<,>He made a foolish mistake in the exam.<,>他在考试中犯了个愚蠢的错误。<,>Don't be foolish - wear your helmet!<,>别犯傻——戴上头盔！<,>fool(傻瓜)+ish→像傻瓜的→愚蠢的<,>fool(n.傻瓜)/foolproof(adj.简单易懂的)/foolhardy(adj.莽撞的)
found<,>/faʊnd/<,>/faʊnd/<,>v.创立/v.创办/v.建立<,>They founded the company in 1995.<,>他们在1995年创办了这家公司。<,>The school was founded by a group of volunteers.<,>这所学校是由一群志愿者建立的。<,>He founded his argument on solid evidence.<,>他的论点建立在确凿的证据上。<,>found(基础)+er(人)→打基础的人→创立者<,>fund(n.资金/v.资助)/founded(adj.有根据的)/founder(n.创始人)  

whisper<,>/ˈwɪspə(r)/<,>/ˈwɪspɚ/<,>v.低声地讲<,>She whispered the secret in my ear.<,>她在我耳边低声说出了这个秘密。<,>They were whispering in the corner.<,>他们在角落里窃窃私语。<,>The wind whispered through the trees.<,>风儿在树林间低语。<,>whis(拟声词)+per(持续)→持续发出"嘘"声→低语<,>whistle(v.吹口哨/n.哨子)/whisker(n.胡须)/whimper(v.呜咽)  

gather<,>/ˈɡæðə(r)/<,>/ˈɡæðɚ/<,>v.聚集/v.集合/v.收集<,>People gathered in the square to celebrate.<,>人们聚集在广场上庆祝。<,>She gathered her belongings and left.<,>她收拾好自己的物品离开了。<,>The clouds are gathering, it might rain soon.<,>乌云密布，可能要下雨了。<,>gath(同"get")+er(表动作)→把东西拿到一起→收集<,>together(adv.一起)/scatter(v.分散)/lather(n.泡沫)  

captive<,>/ˈkæptɪv/<,>/ˈkæptɪv/<,>n.俘虏/n.被监禁的人<,>The soldiers took many captives during the battle.<,>士兵们在战斗中俘虏了许多人。<,>He was held captive for three years.<,>他被囚禁了三年。<,>The zoo's animals are essentially captives.<,>动物园的动物本质上是被囚禁的。<,>capt(抓)+ive(表人)→被抓的人→俘虏<,>capture(v.捕获/n.战利品)/captivate(v.迷住)/active(adj.活跃的)  

colonel<,>/ˈkɜːnl/<,>/ˈkɜːrnl/<,>n.陆军上校/n.中校<,>The colonel gave orders to his troops.<,>上校向他的部队下达了命令。<,>He was promoted to colonel last year.<,>他去年被提升为上校。<,>Colonel Sanders founded KFC.<,>桑德斯上校创立了肯德基。<,>注意发音与拼写差异(kernel同音)<,>colonial(adj.殖民的)/coronal(adj.冠状的)/coroner(n.验尸官)  

hateful<,>/ˈheɪtfl/<,>/ˈheɪtfəl/<,>adj.可恨的/adj.可恶的<,>His hateful comments offended everyone.<,>他可恨的言论冒犯了所有人。<,>The crime was particularly hateful.<,>这起犯罪尤其可恶。<,>She gave him a hateful look.<,>她恶狠狠地看了他一眼。<,>hate(恨)+ful(充满)→充满恨意的<,>hate(n.憎恨/v.讨厌)/heatful(无此词)/grateful(adj.感激的)  

routine<,>/ruːˈtiːn/<,>/ruːˈtiːn/<,>n.例行公事/adj.日常的<,>Morning exercise is part of my daily routine.<,>晨练是我日常例行公事的一部分。<,>The doctor performed a routine check-up.<,>医生进行了例行检查。<,>Don't worry, it's just routine paperwork.<,>别担心，这只是日常文书工作。<,>route(路线)+ine→固定路线→例行公事<,>route(n.路线)/rut(n.车辙)/rotund(adj.圆胖的)  

mess<,>/mes/<,>/mes/<,>n.混乱/n.混杂/n.肮脏<,>Your room is in a complete mess!<,>你的房间一团糟！<,>I made a mess of the presentation.<,>我把演示搞得一团糟。<,>The divorce left his life in a mess.<,>离婚使他的生活陷入混乱。<,>谐音"没收拾"→混乱<,>mass(n.大量)/mesh(n.网眼)/messy(adj.凌乱的)  

pronounce<,>/prəˈnaʊns/<,>/prəˈnaʊns/<,>v.发...的音/v.宣布<,>How do you pronounce this word?<,>这个词你怎么发音？<,>The judge pronounced the verdict.<,>法官宣布了判决。<,>She pronounces French words perfectly.<,>她的法语单词发音很完美。<,>pro(向前)+nounce(说)→向前说出来→发音<,>denounce(v.谴责)/renounce(v.放弃)/enounce(v.清晰地发音)  

correspond<,>/ˌkɒrəˈspɒnd/<,>/ˌkɔːrəˈspɑːnd/<,>v.相符合/v.相当<,>His actions don't correspond with his words.<,>他的言行不一致。<,>This English word corresponds to that French one.<,>这个英语单词对应那个法语单词。<,>We've been corresponding for years.<,>我们通信已有多年。<,>cor(共同)+respond(回应)→相互回应→通信/对应<,>respond(v.回答)/correspondence(n.通信)/corrode(v.腐蚀)
blank<,>/blæŋk/<,>/blæŋk/<,>adj.空白的/n.空白<,>Please fill in the blank spaces on the form.<,>请在表格的空白处填写。<,>His mind went blank during the exam.<,>考试时他的大脑一片空白。<,>She stared at the blank page, unable to write.<,>她盯着空白页，无法下笔。<,>bl(白)+ank(空)→空白的<,>blanket(n.毯子)/blink(v.眨眼)/bank(n.银行)  

consequence<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwens/<,>n.结果/n.后果<,>His actions had serious consequences.<,>他的行为带来了严重后果。<,>You must consider the consequences before making a decision.<,>做决定前必须考虑后果。<,>As a consequence of the rain, the match was postponed.<,>由于下雨，比赛被推迟了。<,>con(共同)+sequ(跟随)+ence→跟随而来的东西→结果<,>sequence(n.顺序)/subsequent(adj.随后的)/eloquence(n.雄辩)  

hello<,>/həˈləʊ/<,>/hɛˈloʊ/<,>int.喂<,>Hello, how are you today?<,>喂，你今天好吗？<,>She answered the phone with a cheerful hello.<,>她接电话时欢快地说了声"喂"。<,>Hello! Is anyone there?<,>喂！有人在吗？<,>hell(地狱)+o→从地狱来的招呼(幽默记忆法)<,>hallo(int.喂)/hollow(adj.空的)/halo(n.光环)  

slit<,>/slɪt/<,>/slɪt/<,>n.裂缝/v.切开/v.撕开<,>There was a narrow slit in the wall.<,>墙上有一道狭窄的裂缝。<,>She slit open the envelope with a knife.<,>她用刀划开了信封。<,>The robber slit the bag and stole the money.<,>劫匪划开袋子偷走了钱。<,>s(像蛇)+lit(light过去式)→像蛇一样在光中切开<,>split(v.分裂)/slot(n.狭槽)/silt(n.淤泥)  

chalk<,>/tʃɔːk/<,>/tʃɔk/<,>n.白垩/n.粉笔<,>The teacher wrote on the blackboard with chalk.<,>老师用粉笔在黑板上写字。<,>The cliffs are made of white chalk.<,>这些悬崖是由白色白垩构成的。<,>He marked the spot with a piece of chalk.<,>他用粉笔标记了这个位置。<,>ch(吃)+alk(碱)→可以吃的碱性物质(白垩)<,>chock(n.楔子)/cheek(n.脸颊)/chicken(n.鸡肉)  

midday<,>/ˌmɪdˈdeɪ/<,>/ˈmɪdˌdeɪ/<,>n.正午/n.中午<,>We agreed to meet at midday.<,>我们约定中午见面。<,>The sun is strongest around midday.<,>正午时分阳光最强烈。<,>The midday meal is served at 12:30.<,>午餐在12:30供应。<,>mid(中间)+day(天)→一天的中间时刻<,>midnight(n.午夜)/midway(adv.中途)/midterm(n.期中)  

despise<,>/dɪˈspaɪz/<,>/dɪˈspaɪz/<,>v.鄙视/v.蔑视<,>She despises people who lie.<,>她鄙视说谎的人。<,>He was despised by his colleagues for his arrogance.<,>他因傲慢被同事蔑视。<,>I despise such cowardly behavior.<,>我鄙视这种懦弱的行为。<,>de(向下)+spise(看)→向下看→鄙视<,>despite(prep.尽管)/despair(n.绝望)/disperse(v.分散)  

humour<,>/ˈhjuːmə(r)/<,>/ˈhjumɚ/<,>n.幽默/n.诙谐/n.幽默感<,>British humour is often subtle.<,>英式幽默通常很含蓄。<,>He has a great sense of humour.<,>他很有幽默感。<,>The play is full of humour and wit.<,>这部剧充满了幽默和机智。<,>hum(人)+our(我们的)→我们人类的特质<,>humorous(adj.幽默的)/rumor(n.谣言)/tumor(n.肿瘤)  

volt<,>/vəʊlt/<,>/voʊlt/<,>n.伏特/n.伏<,>This battery provides 9 volts of power.<,>这块电池提供9伏电力。<,>Be careful - the wire carries 220 volts.<,>小心-这根电线有220伏电压。<,>The electric fence operates at 6000 volts.<,>电网的电压是6000伏。<,>volt(旋转)→电压使电子旋转<,>voltage(n.电压)/revolt(v.反抗)/vault(n.拱顶)  

roller<,>/ˈrəʊlə(r)/<,>/ˈroʊlɚ/<,>n.滚筒/n.滚轴/n.滚柱<,>They used a roller to flatten the road.<,>他们用压路机压平道路。<,>The printer's roller needs replacing.<,>打印机的滚轴需要更换了。<,>She put her hair in rollers for the party.<,>她用卷发筒为派对做发型。<,>roll(滚动)+er(物)→滚动物体<,>rollercoaster(n.过山车)/scroll(n.卷轴)/trolley(n.手推车)
navigation<,>/ˌnævɪˈɡeɪʃən/<,>/ˌnævɪˈɡeɪʃən/<,>n.航行/n.航海术<,>Modern ships rely on advanced navigation systems.<,>现代船只依赖先进的航行系统。<,>He studied navigation to become a sailor.<,>他学习航海术以成为一名水手。<,>Navigation through the storm was challenging.<,>在暴风雨中航行很有挑战性。<,>nav(船)+ig(驱动)+ation→驾驶船只→航行<,>navy(n.海军)/navigate(v.导航)/aviation(n.航空)  

establishment<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃmənt/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃmənt/<,>n.建立/n.设立/n.确立<,>The establishment of the school took three years.<,>学校的建立花了三年时间。<,>This law led to the establishment of new rules.<,>这项法律导致了新规则的制定。<,>She works at a scientific research establishment.<,>她在一家科研机构工作。<,>establish(建立)+ment(名词后缀)→建立的过程或结果<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/install(v.安装)/institution(n.机构)  

needle<,>/ˈniːdəl/<,>/ˈniːdəl/<,>n.针/n.编织针<,>She threaded the needle with great care.<,>她小心翼翼地穿针。<,>Knitting needles are used to create sweaters.<,>编织针用于织毛衣。<,>The doctor used a sterile needle for the injection.<,>医生使用无菌针头注射。<,>need(需要)+le(小)→缝纫时需要的小工具→针<,>noodle(n.面条)/kneel(v.跪下)/need(n.需要)  

torch<,>/tɔːtʃ/<,>/tɔːrtʃ/<,>n.手电筒/n.火炬<,>He shone the torch into the dark cave.<,>他用手电筒照向黑暗的洞穴。<,>The Olympic torch was carried across the country.<,>奥运火炬在全国传递。<,>She used a torch to light the campfire.<,>她用火炬点燃了篝火。<,>tor(扭曲)+ch→古代火炬用扭曲的布条制成→火炬<,>porch(n.门廊)/touch(v.触摸)/torque(n.扭矩)  

another<,>/əˈnʌðə(r)/<,>/əˈnʌðər/<,>det.再一个的/det.别的<,>Would you like another cup of tea?<,>你想再来一杯茶吗？<,>Let's try another approach to solve this problem.<,>我们试试用另一种方法解决这个问题。<,>She moved to another city for work.<,>她为了工作搬到了另一个城市。<,>an(一个)+other(其他的)→另一个<,>other(adj.其他的)/mother(n.母亲)/bother(v.打扰)  

bubble<,>/ˈbʌbəl/<,>/ˈbʌbəl/<,>n.泡/v.冒泡/v.沸腾<,>Children love blowing soap bubbles.<,>孩子们喜欢吹肥皂泡。<,>The water began to bubble as it boiled.<,>水沸腾时开始冒泡。<,>Her excitement bubbled over when she heard the news.<,>听到消息时她兴奋不已。<,>拟声词，模仿气泡破裂的声音<,>pebble(n.鹅卵石)/babble(v.含糊不清地说)/hubble(n.混乱)  

vary<,>/ˈveəri/<,>/ˈveri/<,>v.改变/v.使多样化<,>Prices vary depending on the season.<,>价格随季节变化。<,>She varies her workout routine every week.<,>她每周改变锻炼计划。<,>The landscape varies from region to region.<,>不同地区风景各异。<,>var(变化)+y→使变化<,>very(adv.非常)/variable(adj.可变的)/variety(n.多样性)  

finger<,>/ˈfɪŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪŋɡər/<,>n.手指/n.指状物<,>He pointed at the map with his finger.<,>他用手指指着地图。<,>She wore a ring on her middle finger.<,>她中指上戴着一枚戒指。<,>The machine has finger-like projections.<,>这台机器有指状突起。<,>fin(结束)+ger→身体最灵活的部位→手指<,>singer(n.歌手)/linger(v.徘徊)/ginger(n.姜)  

charming<,>/ˈtʃɑːmɪŋ/<,>/ˈtʃɑːrmɪŋ/<,>adj.迷人的/adj.可爱的<,>She has a charming personality.<,>她性格迷人。<,>The charming village attracted many tourists.<,>这个可爱的村庄吸引了许多游客。<,>He told a charming story to the children.<,>他给孩子们讲了个迷人的故事。<,>charm(魅力)+ing→有魅力的<,>alarming(adj.惊人的)/harming(v.伤害)/warming(adj.温暖的)  

abstract<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>/ˈæbstrækt/<,>adj.抽象的/n.摘要<,>Modern art is often abstract.<,>现代艺术通常是抽象的。<,>Please write an abstract of your research paper.<,>请为你的研究论文写个摘要。<,>His ideas were too abstract for most people to understand.<,>他的想法太抽象，大多数人无法理解。<,>abs(离开)+tract(拉)→从具体中拉出→抽象的<,>extract(v.提取)/contract(n.合同)/distract(v.分散注意力)
endless<,>/ˈendləs/<,>/ˈendləs/<,>adj.无止境的<,>The desert seemed endless under the scorching sun.<,>在烈日下，沙漠似乎无边无际。<,>Her patience was endless when dealing with children.<,>她在对待孩子时有着无尽的耐心。<,>The meeting felt endless due to the lengthy discussions.<,>由于冗长的讨论，会议感觉没完没了。<,>end(结束)+less(无…的)→无结束的→无止境的<,>limitless(adj.无限的)/boundless(adj.无边无际的)

fast<,>/fɑːst/<,>/fæst/<,>adj.快的/adj.偏快的/adv.快<,>He is a fast runner and always wins races.<,>他是个跑得很快的人，总是赢得比赛。<,>The clock is five minutes fast.<,>这个钟快了五分钟。<,>She reads fast and finishes books in one day.<,>她阅读速度很快，一天就能读完一本书。<,>对比记忆：fast(快)与feast(盛宴)发音相似<,>quick(adj.迅速的)/rapid(adj.快速的)/swift(adj.敏捷的)

painful<,>/ˈpeɪnfl/<,>/ˈpeɪnfl/<,>adj.使痛的/adj.费力的<,>The wound was still painful after a week.<,>一周后伤口仍然疼痛。<,>It was a painful decision to leave her hometown.<,>离开家乡对她来说是个痛苦的决定。<,>The recovery process was long and painful.<,>恢复过程漫长而痛苦。<,>pain(疼痛)+ful(形容词后缀)→疼痛的<,>painless(adj.无痛的)/gainful(adj.有收益的)

import<,>/ɪmˈpɔːt/<,>/ˈɪmpɔːrt/<,>n.输入/n.进口/v.输入/v.进口<,>The country imports most of its oil from the Middle East.<,>这个国家的大部分石油从中东进口。<,>There are strict regulations on the import of exotic animals.<,>对异国动物的进口有严格规定。<,>This software can import data from various file formats.<,>这个软件可以从多种文件格式导入数据。<,>im(进入)+port(港口)→进入港口→进口<,>export(v.出口/n.出口)/report(v.报告/n.报告)

additional<,>/əˈdɪʃənl/<,>/əˈdɪʃənl/<,>adj.附加的/adj.追加的<,>We need additional information to complete the report.<,>我们需要更多信息来完成报告。<,>There will be an additional charge for late checkout.<,>延迟退房将收取额外费用。<,>She took on additional responsibilities at work.<,>她在工作中承担了额外的责任。<,>add(增加)+ition(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→附加的<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/essential(adj.必要的)

die<,>/daɪ/<,>/daɪ/<,>v.死/v.死亡/v.灭亡<,>Many plants die without enough water.<,>许多植物没有足够的水会死亡。<,>The ancient civilization died out centuries ago.<,>这个古代文明在几个世纪前就消亡了。<,>His dream of becoming an astronaut died when he failed the physical test.<,>当他体检不合格时，他成为宇航员的梦想破灭了。<,>对比记忆：die(死)与dye(染色)发音相同<,>dead(adj.死亡的)/death(n.死亡)/dying(adj.垂死的)

abnormal<,>/æbˈnɔːml/<,>/æbˈnɔːrml/<,>adj.不正常的/adj.变态的<,>The test results showed abnormal levels of hormones.<,>检测结果显示激素水平异常。<,>His behavior was considered abnormal by his colleagues.<,>他的行为被同事们认为不正常。<,>Abnormal weather patterns have become more frequent.<,>异常天气模式变得更加频繁。<,>ab(偏离)+normal(正常的)→偏离正常的→不正常的<,>normal(adj.正常的)/subnormal(adj.低于正常的)/supernormal(adj.超常的)

peasant<,>/ˈpeznt/<,>/ˈpeznt/<,>n.农民<,>The peasant worked in the fields from dawn till dusk.<,>这位农民从早到晚在田里劳作。<,>In medieval Europe, peasants made up the majority of the population.<,>在中世纪的欧洲，农民构成了人口的大多数。<,>The government introduced policies to improve peasants' living conditions.<,>政府出台了改善农民生活条件的政策。<,>对比记忆：peasant(农民)与pleasant(愉快的)拼写相似<,>farmer(n.农场主)/laborer(n.劳动者)/serf(n.农奴)

hydrogen<,>/ˈhaɪdrədʒən/<,>/ˈhaɪdrədʒən/<,>n.氢<,>Hydrogen is the lightest element in the periodic table.<,>氢是元素周期表中最轻的元素。<,>The balloon was filled with hydrogen gas.<,>气球里充满了氢气。<,>Hydrogen fuel cells are considered a clean energy source.<,>氢燃料电池被认为是一种清洁能源。<,>hydro(水)+gen(产生)→产生水的元素→氢<,>oxygen(n.氧)/nitrogen(n.氮)/carbon(n.碳)

heel<,>/hiːl/<,>/hiːl/<,>n.脚后跟/n.踵<,>She hurt her heel while running on the hard pavement.<,>她在坚硬的人行道上跑步时伤到了脚后跟。<,>The shoes were rubbing against my heels.<,>这双鞋磨我的脚后跟。<,>He stood on his heels to reach the top shelf.<,>他踮起脚后跟去够顶层的架子。<,>对比记忆：heel(脚跟)与heal(治愈)发音相同<,>toe(n.脚趾)/sole(n.脚底)/ankle(n.踝关节)
base<,>/beɪs/<,>/beɪs/<,>n.基础/n.底层/n.基地<,>The vase sits on a wooden base.<,>花瓶放在一个木制底座上。<,>The company has its base in New York.<,>公司的总部设在纽约。<,>He touched first base safely.<,>他安全地触到了一垒。<,>bas(低)+e→低的东西→基础<,>basic(adj.基本的)/basis(n.基础)/basement(n.地下室)  

uncover<,>/ʌnˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/ʌnˈkʌvər/<,>v.揭开…的盖子<,>Journalists uncovered the scandal.<,>记者揭露了这一丑闻。<,>She uncovered the pot to stir the soup.<,>她揭开锅盖搅动汤。<,>Archaeologists uncovered ancient ruins.<,>考古学家发掘出古代遗址。<,>un(否定)+cover(覆盖)→不覆盖→揭开<,>discover(v.发现)/recover(v.恢复)/cover(v.覆盖)  

interior<,>/ɪnˈtɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈtɪriər/<,>adj.内的/adj.内地的/n.内部<,>The interior walls need painting.<,>内墙需要粉刷。<,>He explored the interior of Africa.<,>他探索了非洲内陆。<,>The car's interior is leather.<,>汽车内饰是皮革的。<,>inter(在…之间)+ior→内部的<,>exterior(n.外部)/inferior(adj.下等的)/superior(adj.上级的)  

chain<,>/tʃeɪn/<,>/tʃeɪn/<,>n.链/n.链条<,>She wore a gold chain around her neck.<,>她脖子上戴着一条金链。<,>The prisoners were kept in chains.<,>囚犯们被锁链锁着。<,>It's a chain of supermarkets.<,>这是一个连锁超市。<,>chair(椅子)+n→像椅子腿一样连接→链条<,>train(n.火车)/china(n.中国)/chair(n.椅子)  

slippery<,>/ˈslɪpəri/<,>/ˈslɪpəri/<,>adj.滑的/adj.使人滑跤的<,>The floor was slippery after the rain.<,>雨后地板很滑。<,>He avoided the slippery topic.<,>他避开了这个棘手的话题。<,>The fish was too slippery to hold.<,>鱼太滑了抓不住。<,>slip(滑)+ery→滑的<,>sleepy(adj.困倦的)/slender(adj.苗条的)/slim(adj.纤细的)  

historical<,>/hɪˈstɒrɪkl/<,>/hɪˈstɔːrɪkl/<,>adj.历史的/adj.有关历史的<,>This is a historical moment.<,>这是一个历史性时刻。<,>She studies historical documents.<,>她研究历史文献。<,>The book gives a historical account.<,>这本书提供了历史记述。<,>history(历史)+ical→历史的<,>hysterical(adj.歇斯底里的)/historic(adj.有历史意义的)/historian(n.历史学家)  

mechanically<,>/məˈkænɪkli/<,>/məˈkænɪkli/<,>adv.机械地<,>He answered mechanically.<,>他机械地回答。<,>The door closes mechanically.<,>门自动关闭。<,>She performed the task mechanically.<,>她机械地执行任务。<,>mechanic(机械)+ally→机械地<,>manually(adv.手动地)/automatically(adv.自动地)/technically(adv.技术上)  

myself<,>/maɪˈself/<,>/maɪˈself/<,>pron.我自己/pron.我亲自<,>I hurt myself.<,>我伤到了自己。<,>I'll do it myself.<,>我会亲自做这件事。<,>I'm not myself today.<,>我今天状态不好。<,>my(我的)+self(自己)→我自己<,>yourself(pron.你自己)/himself(pron.他自己)/herself(pron.她自己)  

signal<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>/ˈsɪɡnəl/<,>n.信号/v.发信号<,>Wait for the green signal.<,>等待绿灯信号。<,>He signaled to turn left.<,>他发出左转信号。<,>The smoke was a distress signal.<,>烟雾是求救信号。<,>sign(标记)+al→信号<,>single(adj.单一的)/signature(n.签名)/significant(adj.重要的)  

thoughtful<,>/ˈθɔːtfl/<,>/ˈθɔːtfl/<,>adj.体贴的/adj.沉思的<,>That was very thoughtful of you.<,>你真是考虑周到。<,>She had a thoughtful expression.<,>她露出沉思的表情。<,>He gave a thoughtful answer.<,>他给出了深思熟虑的回答。<,>thought(想法)+ful→充满想法的→体贴的/沉思的<,>thoughtless(adj.轻率的)/thankful(adj.感激的)/hopeful(adj.有希望的)
discipline<,>/ˈdɪsəplɪn/<,>/ˈdɪsəplɪn/<,>n.纪律/n.训练/v.训练<,>Good discipline is essential in the military.<,>良好的纪律在军队中至关重要。<,>She disciplined herself to study every day.<,>她训练自己每天学习。<,>Parents should discipline their children appropriately.<,>父母应该适当地管教孩子。<,>dis(分开)+cip(拿)+line(线)→分开拿线→纪律<,>disciple(n.门徒/n.弟子)/principle(n.原则/n.原理)

draft<,>/drɑːft/<,>/dræft/<,>n.草稿/n.汇票/v.起草<,>He wrote the first draft of his novel in a month.<,>他用一个月时间完成了小说的初稿。<,>Please draft a proposal for the meeting.<,>请为会议起草一份提案。<,>The bank issued a draft for the payment.<,>银行开出了一张付款汇票。<,>dr(拉)+aft(后)→向后拉→草稿<,>craft(n.工艺/n.手艺)/graft(v.嫁接/n.贪污)

performance<,>/pəˈfɔːməns/<,>/pərˈfɔːrməns/<,>n.演出/n.表现/n.履行<,>The band gave an outstanding performance last night.<,>昨晚乐队的演出非常出色。<,>Her job performance has improved significantly.<,>她的工作表现有了显著提高。<,>The contract requires the performance of certain duties.<,>合同要求履行某些职责。<,>perform(表演)+ance(名词后缀)→表演的结果→表现<,>performer(n.表演者/n.执行者)/preference(n.偏爱/n.优先)

workshop<,>/ˈwɜːkʃɒp/<,>/ˈwɜːrkʃɑːp/<,>n.车间/n.工场/n.创作室<,>He spends most of his time in the workshop.<,>他大部分时间都在车间里度过。<,>The artist has a small workshop in his backyard.<,>艺术家在后院有一个小创作室。<,>They attended a creative writing workshop.<,>他们参加了一个创意写作工坊。<,>work(工作)+shop(场所)→工作的场所→车间<,>workspace(n.工作空间)/workstation(n.工作站)

listener<,>/ˈlɪsənə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪsənər/<,>n.听众之一/n.听者<,>She is a good listener and always pays attention.<,>她是个很好的倾听者，总是很专注。<,>The radio show has millions of listeners.<,>这个广播节目有数百万听众。<,>As a therapist, he must be an active listener.<,>作为治疗师，他必须是一个积极的倾听者。<,>listen(听)+er(人)→听的人→听者<,>speaker(n.说话者/n.扬声器)/hearer(n.听者)

paint<,>/peɪnt/<,>/peɪnt/<,>v.上油漆/v.画/v.绘画<,>They decided to paint the house blue.<,>他们决定把房子漆成蓝色。<,>She loves to paint landscapes in her free time.<,>她喜欢在空闲时画风景画。<,>The artist used oil to paint the portrait.<,>艺术家用油彩画了这幅肖像。<,>p(泼)+aint(染)→泼染→绘画<,>painter(n.画家/n.油漆工)/print(v.印刷/n.印刷品)

generate<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪt/<,>v.发生/v.引起<,>The dam generates electricity for the entire region.<,>大坝为整个地区发电。<,>His speech generated a lot of controversy.<,>他的演讲引起了很多争议。<,>The machine generates heat when operating.<,>机器运转时会产生热量。<,>gener(产生)+ate(动词后缀)→产生<,>general(adj.一般的/n.将军)/generation(n.一代人/n.产生)

resist<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>v.抵制/v.抵抗<,>It's hard to resist the temptation of chocolate.<,>很难抵制巧克力的诱惑。<,>The soldiers resisted the enemy attack bravely.<,>士兵们勇敢地抵抗敌人的进攻。<,>This material resists heat and corrosion.<,>这种材料耐热耐腐蚀。<,>re(反)+sist(站)→反着站→抵抗<,>insist(v.坚持/v.坚决要求)/persist(v.坚持/v.持续)

sensitive<,>/ˈsensətɪv/<,>/ˈsensətɪv/<,>adj.敏感的/adj.灵敏的<,>She is very sensitive to criticism.<,>她对批评非常敏感。<,>This device is sensitive to temperature changes.<,>这个装置对温度变化很灵敏。<,>He has a sensitive skin that gets irritated easily.<,>他的皮肤很敏感，容易受刺激。<,>sens(感觉)+itive(形容词后缀)→感觉灵敏的→敏感的<,>sensible(adj.明智的)/sensory(adj.感觉的/n.感觉器官)

perform<,>/pəˈfɔːm/<,>/pərˈfɔːrm/<,>v.演出/v.履行/v.执行<,>She will perform in the concert tonight.<,>她将在今晚的音乐会上演出。<,>He always performs his duties diligently.<,>他总是勤勉地履行自己的职责。<,>The car performs well in extreme conditions.<,>这辆车在极端条件下表现良好。<,>per(完全)+form(形式)→完全按照形式→执行<,>performer(n.表演者)/performance(n.表演/n.表现)
fertilizer<,>/ˈfɜːtɪlaɪzə(r)/<,>/ˈfɜːrtəlaɪzər/<,>n.肥料<,>Farmers use fertilizer to improve crop yields.<,>农民使用肥料来提高作物产量。<,>Organic fertilizer is better for the environment.<,>有机肥料对环境更友好。<,>Too much fertilizer can harm plants.<,>过多的肥料会伤害植物。<,>fertile(肥沃的)+lize(使...化)+er(名词后缀)→使土地肥沃的东西→肥料<,>pesticide(n. 农药)/herbicide(n. 除草剂)/fertilize(v. 施肥)

reinforce<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ˌriːɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>v.加强/v.增援/v.支援<,>The army sent more troops to reinforce the border.<,>军队派遣更多部队增援边境。<,>We need to reinforce the bridge's structure.<,>我们需要加强桥梁的结构。<,>Her words reinforced my confidence.<,>她的话增强了我的信心。<,>re(再次)+in(进入)+force(力量)→再次加入力量→加强<,>enforce(v. 实施)/reinforcement(n. 增援)/force(n. 力量)

recognize<,>/ˈrekəɡnaɪz/<,>/ˈrekəɡnaɪz/<,>v.认出/v.认识/v.承认<,>I recognized her voice immediately.<,>我立刻认出了她的声音。<,>The government refused to recognize the new regime.<,>政府拒绝承认新政权。<,>Do you recognize this song?<,>你认识这首歌吗？<,>re(再次)+cogn(知道)+ize(使...化)→再次知道→认出<,>cognition(n. 认知)/ignorance(n. 无知)/recognition(n. 承认)

okay<,>/əʊˈkeɪ/<,>/oʊˈkeɪ/<,>convention.对/convention.好<,>Okay, I'll meet you at 5 pm.<,>好的，我下午5点见你。<,>Is it okay if I borrow your pen?<,>我可以借你的笔吗？<,>She said okay to the proposal.<,>她同意了这个提议。<,>来自"all correct"的缩写形式<,>yes(adv. 是)/no(adv. 不)/alright(adv. 好吧)

police<,>/pəˈliːs/<,>/pəˈliːs/<,>n.警察/n.警察当局<,>The police are investigating the crime.<,>警方正在调查这起犯罪。<,>Call the police if you see anything suspicious.<,>如果看到可疑情况就报警。<,>Police officers patrol the streets at night.<,>警察夜间在街道上巡逻。<,>poli(城市)+ce(名词后缀)→管理城市的人→警察<,>policy(n. 政策)/polite(adj. 礼貌的)/politician(n. 政治家)

forth<,>/fɔːθ/<,>/fɔːrθ/<,>adv.向前/adv.向外/adv.往外<,>He came forth to receive his award.<,>他走上前来领奖。<,>The flowers burst forth in spring.<,>春天花朵绽放。<,>From this day forth, I will exercise daily.<,>从今天起，我将每天锻炼。<,>与"fourth(第四)"发音相同但拼写不同<,>forward(adv. 向前)/backward(adv. 向后)/henceforth(adv. 今后)

reproduce<,>/ˌriːprəˈdjuːs/<,>/ˌriːprəˈduːs/<,>v.繁殖/v.生殖<,>Rabbits reproduce quickly.<,>兔子繁殖得很快。<,>This machine can reproduce documents.<,>这台机器可以复印文件。<,>Scientists reproduced the experiment successfully.<,>科学家成功复制了这个实验。<,>re(再次)+produce(生产)→再次生产→繁殖<,>produce(v. 生产)/product(n. 产品)/reproduction(n. 复制)

framework<,>/ˈfreɪmwɜːk/<,>/ˈfreɪmwɜːrk/<,>n.框架/n.构架/n.结构<,>The building's steel framework is complete.<,>建筑的钢结构框架已完成。<,>This course provides a framework for understanding economics.<,>这门课程提供了理解经济学的框架。<,>We need a legal framework for this project.<,>我们需要这个项目的法律框架。<,>frame(框架)+work(工作)→工作的基础→框架<,>structure(n. 结构)/skeleton(n. 骨架)/infrastructure(n. 基础设施)

gracious<,>/ˈɡreɪʃəs/<,>/ˈɡreɪʃəs/<,>adj.有礼貌的/adj.仁慈的<,>She gave a gracious smile to everyone.<,>她对每个人都报以礼貌的微笑。<,>It was gracious of you to help us.<,>你帮助我们真是仁慈。<,>The host was gracious to all the guests.<,>主人对所有客人都很有礼貌。<,>grace(优雅)+ious(形容词后缀)→优雅的→有礼貌的<,>graceful(adj. 优雅的)/graciousness(n. 亲切)/ungracious(adj. 粗鲁的)

screw<,>/skruː/<,>/skruː/<,>n.螺旋/n.螺丝/v.拧紧<,>Use a screwdriver to tighten the screw.<,>用螺丝刀拧紧螺丝。<,>He screwed the lid on tightly.<,>他把盖子拧紧了。<,>The machine has many small screws.<,>这台机器有很多小螺丝。<,>与"crew(船员)"发音相似<,>bolt(n. 螺栓)/nut(n. 螺母)/unscrew(v. 拧松)
pause<,>/pɔːz/<,>/pɔz/<,>n.中止/n.暂停/v.中止/v.暂停<,>She pressed the pause button on the remote control.<,>她按下了遥控器上的暂停键。<,>Let's take a pause and think about this carefully.<,>我们暂停一下，仔细想想这件事。<,>He paused for a moment before answering the question.<,>他停顿了一下才回答问题。<,>paus(停止)+e→暂停<,>cause(n.原因/v.引起)/clause(n.条款/n.从句)

cheese<,>/tʃiːz/<,>/tʃiz/<,>n.奶酪/n.干酪<,>I like to put cheese on my sandwiches.<,>我喜欢在三明治上放奶酪。<,>This cheese has a very strong smell.<,>这种奶酪气味很浓。<,>Would you like some cheese with your wine?<,>你想来点奶酪配酒吗？<,>chee(音似"吃")+se(色)→吃有颜色的东西→奶酪<,>choose(v.选择)/cheer(v.欢呼/n.欢呼声)

sleeve<,>/sliːv/<,>/sliv/<,>n.袖子/n.袖套<,>He rolled up his sleeves and started working.<,>他卷起袖子开始工作。<,>There's a hole in the sleeve of my jacket.<,>我夹克的袖子上有个洞。<,>She wiped her tears with her sleeve.<,>她用袖子擦眼泪。<,>slee(音似"丝缕")+ve→衣服的丝缕部分→袖子<,>leave(v.离开/n.休假)/sleek(adj.光滑的/v.使光滑)

donkey<,>/ˈdɒŋki/<,>/ˈdɑːŋki/<,>n.驴<,>The donkey carried heavy loads up the mountain.<,>驴驮着重物上山。<,>He's as stubborn as a donkey.<,>他像驴一样固执。<,>We rode donkeys to visit the village.<,>我们骑驴参观村庄。<,>don(音似"驮")+key(钥匙)→驮着钥匙的动物→驴<,>monkey(n.猴子)/turkey(n.火鸡)

vacant<,>/ˈveɪkənt/<,>/ˈveɪkənt/<,>adj.空的/adj.未被占用的<,>The seat next to me is vacant.<,>我旁边的座位是空的。<,>There are several vacant positions in our company.<,>我们公司有几个空缺职位。<,>He stared at the vacant lot, imagining a new building there.<,>他盯着那块空地，想象那里有栋新建筑。<,>vac(空)+ant(形容词后缀)→空的<,>vacation(n.假期)/vacuum(n.真空)

expense<,>/ɪkˈspens/<,>/ɪkˈspɛns/<,>n.花费/n.消费/n.费用<,>The expense of living in this city is very high.<,>在这个城市生活费用很高。<,>We need to cut down on unnecessary expenses.<,>我们需要减少不必要的开支。<,>Don't worry about the expense - the company will pay for it.<,>别担心费用-公司会支付的。<,>ex(出)+pens(支付)+e→支付出去→花费<,>expand(v.扩大)/expel(v.驱逐)

lead<,>/led/<,>/lɛd/<,>n.铅/n.铅制品<,>This pencil contains lead.<,>这支铅笔含有铅。<,>Lead poisoning can be very dangerous.<,>铅中毒可能非常危险。<,>The old pipes were made of lead.<,>旧管道是用铅制成的。<,>lead(领导)→铅能"领导"其他金属(因其密度大)<,>led(lead的过去式)/load(n.负担/v.装载)

friendship<,>/ˈfrendʃɪp/<,>/ˈfrɛndʃɪp/<,>n.友谊/n.友好<,>Their friendship has lasted for over 20 years.<,>他们的友谊已经持续了20多年。<,>True friendship is hard to find.<,>真正的友谊很难得。<,>We celebrated our friendship with a special dinner.<,>我们用一顿特别的晚餐庆祝我们的友谊。<,>friend(朋友)+ship(关系)→朋友关系→友谊<,>relationship(n.关系)/fellowship(n.伙伴关系)

bare<,>/beə(r)/<,>/bɛr/<,>adj.赤裸的/adj.仅仅的<,>He walked on the beach with bare feet.<,>他赤脚走在沙滩上。<,>The room was bare except for a single chair.<,>房间里除了一把椅子外空无一物。<,>She told the bare facts without any emotion.<,>她不带任何感情地陈述了基本事实。<,>bar(酒吧)+e→酒吧里喝多了会"赤裸"<,>bear(v.忍受/n.熊)/barely(adv.仅仅)

athlete<,>/ˈæθliːt/<,>/ˈæθlit/<,>n.运动员/n.田径运动员<,>The athlete broke the world record.<,>这位运动员打破了世界纪录。<,>She has been training like a professional athlete.<,>她一直像职业运动员一样训练。<,>Many young athletes dream of competing in the Olympics.<,>许多年轻运动员梦想参加奥运会。<,>athl(竞赛)+ete(人)→参加竞赛的人→运动员<,>athletic(adj.运动的)/marathon(n.马拉松)
regarding<,>/rɪˈɡɑːdɪŋ/<,>/rɪˈɡɑrdɪŋ/<,>prep.关于<,>Regarding your question, I will answer it later.<,>关于你的问题，我稍后会回答。<,>She wrote a letter regarding the issue.<,>她就这个问题写了一封信。<,>There are new rules regarding safety.<,>有关于安全的新规定。<,>re(再)+gard(看)+ing→再看→关于<,>regard(v.看待/n.注意)/disregard(v.忽视/n.漠视)

commonly<,>/ˈkɒmənli/<,>/ˈkɑːmənli/<,>adv.普通地/adv.一般地<,>This phrase is commonly used in daily conversation.<,>这个短语在日常对话中很常用。<,>He is commonly known as Jack.<,>他一般被叫做杰克。<,>These flowers are commonly found in this area.<,>这些花在这一带很常见。<,>common(普通)+ly(副词后缀)→普通地<,>commonly(adv.通常)/rarely(adv.很少)/usually(adv.通常)

magic<,>/ˈmædʒɪk/<,>/ˈmædʒɪk/<,>n.魔法/n.巫术/n.戏法<,>The magician performed amazing magic tricks.<,>魔术师表演了惊人的魔术戏法。<,>She believes in the power of magic.<,>她相信魔法的力量。<,>This potion has magic properties.<,>这种药剂有魔法属性。<,>mag(魔力)+ic(形容词后缀)→魔法的<,>magical(adj.魔法的)/tragic(adj.悲剧的)/logic(n.逻辑)

cook<,>/kʊk/<,>/kʊk/<,>v.烹调/v.煮/v.烧菜<,>She cooks dinner every evening.<,>她每天晚上做晚饭。<,>He is learning to cook Italian food.<,>他正在学习做意大利菜。<,>Can you cook this meat well?<,>你能把这肉煮好吗？<,>谐音"酷客"→酷爱烹饪的客人<,>cooker(n.炊具)/cookie(n.饼干)/book(n.书)

intend<,>/ɪnˈtend/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnd/<,>v.想要/v.打算/v.意指<,>I intend to visit Japan next year.<,>我打算明年去日本旅游。<,>What do you intend by saying that?<,>你说那话是什么意思？<,>They intend the building to be a museum.<,>他们打算把这栋楼用作博物馆。<,>in(内)+tend(伸展)→内心伸展→打算<,>intent(n.意图)/extend(v.延伸)/pretend(v.假装)

powder<,>/ˈpaʊdə(r)/<,>/ˈpaʊdər/<,>n.粉末/n.药粉/n.火药<,>She put some powder on her face.<,>她在脸上扑了些粉。<,>This medicine comes in powder form.<,>这种药是粉末状的。<,>Gunpowder is an ancient invention.<,>火药是一项古老的发明。<,>pow(音似"炮")+der→炮需要的东西→火药<,>power(n.力量)/shower(n.淋浴)/flower(n.花)

pitch<,>/pɪtʃ/<,>/pɪtʃ/<,>n.沥青<,>The road was covered with pitch.<,>路面上铺着沥青。<,>They used pitch to waterproof the boat.<,>他们用沥青给船防水。<,>The smell of pitch is very strong.<,>沥青的气味很浓烈。<,>pit(坑)+ch→坑里填的东西→沥青<,>patch(n.补丁)/pinch(v.捏)/witch(n.女巫)

ninth<,>/naɪnθ/<,>/naɪnθ/<,>num.第九/n.九分之一<,>September is the ninth month.<,>九月是第九个月份。<,>He got a ninth of the prize money.<,>他得到了奖金的九分之一。<,>This is my ninth visit to Paris.<,>这是我第九次来巴黎。<,>nine(九)+th(序数词后缀)→第九<,>ninety(num.九十)/nineteen(num.十九)/ninthly(adv.第九)

filter<,>/ˈfɪltə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪltər/<,>v.过滤/n.过滤器<,>We need to filter the water before drinking.<,>喝水前我们需要过滤一下。<,>The coffee filter needs to be changed.<,>咖啡过滤器需要更换了。<,>He filtered out the unnecessary information.<,>他过滤掉了不必要的信息。<,>fil(线)+ter→用线编织的东西→过滤器<,>falter(v.蹒跚)/filler(n.填充物)/filed(v.归档)

deal<,>/diːl/<,>/diːl/<,>n.买卖/n.待遇<,>They made a good deal on the car.<,>他们在这辆车上做了笔好买卖。<,>The new employees get a fair deal.<,>新员工得到了公平待遇。<,>It's a deal! Let's shake on it.<,>成交！我们握手为定。<,>dea(音似"迪")+l(了)→迪了→买卖成交了<,>meal(n.餐)/seal(n.海豹)/real(adj.真实的)
collect<,>/kəˈlekt/<,>/kəˈlɛkt/<,>v.收集/v.收款<,>She likes to collect stamps from different countries.<,>她喜欢收集来自不同国家的邮票。<,>The charity will collect donations for the homeless.<,>该慈善机构将为无家可归者募集捐款。<,>He went door to door to collect the rent.<,>他挨家挨户去收租金。<,>col(共同)+lect(选择)→共同选择→收集<,>correct(v.纠正/adj.正确的)/connect(v.连接)/reflect(v.反射/v.反映)  

conjunction<,>/kənˈdʒʌŋkʃn/<,>/kənˈdʒʌŋkʃən/<,>n.接合/n.连接/n.连接词<,>The bridge is built at the conjunction of two rivers.<,>这座桥建在两条河流的交汇处。<,>"And" is a common conjunction in English.<,>"And"是英语中常见的连接词。<,>The project was completed in conjunction with a local company.<,>这个项目是与一家当地公司合作完成的。<,>con(共同)+junct(连接)+ion→共同连接→接合<,>junction(n.连接点)/adjunction(n.附加)/injunction(n.命令/n.禁令)  

bond<,>/bɒnd/<,>/bɑːnd/<,>n.债券/n.公债/n.联结/n.联系<,>Government bonds are considered a safe investment.<,>政府债券被认为是一种安全的投资。<,>There is a strong bond between the twins.<,>这对双胞胎之间有很强的联系。<,>The glue forms a tight bond with the surface.<,>这种胶水能与表面形成紧密的粘合。<,>bon(好)+d→好的联系→联结<,>band(n.带子/n.乐队)/bound(v.跳跃/adj.必定的)/bondage(n.奴役)  

jail<,>/dʒeɪl/<,>/dʒel/<,>n.监狱/v.监禁<,>The thief was sent to jail for three years.<,>小偷被判入狱三年。<,>They threatened to jail anyone who protested.<,>他们威胁要监禁任何抗议的人。<,>The prison reform aims to improve jail conditions.<,>监狱改革旨在改善监狱条件。<,>jail与gaol同义，后者为英式拼写<,>jailbird(n.囚犯)/jailbreak(n.越狱)/bail(n.保释金)  

arrangement<,>/əˈreɪndʒmənt/<,>/əˈrendʒmənt/<,>n.安排/n.整理/n.排列<,>We made arrangements to meet at the café.<,>我们安排在咖啡馆见面。<,>The flower arrangement looked beautiful on the table.<,>桌上的插花看起来很漂亮。<,>The seating arrangement was carefully planned.<,>座位安排经过了精心策划。<,>ar(加强)+range(排列)+ment→排列<,>derangement(n.精神错乱)/rearrange(v.重新安排)/arrange(v.安排)  

competent<,>/ˈkɒmpɪtənt/<,>/ˈkɑːmpɪtənt/<,>adj.有能力的<,>She is competent in handling difficult situations.<,>她有能力处理困难情况。<,>The team needs a competent leader to guide them.<,>团队需要一位能干的领导者来指导他们。<,>He was found competent to stand trial.<,>他被认定有能力接受审判。<,>com(共同)+pet(追求)+ent→有能力追求目标<,>competence(n.能力)/competitive(adj.竞争的)/incompetent(adj.无能的)  

section<,>/ˈsekʃn/<,>/ˈsɛkʃən/<,>n.切片/n.一段/n.部分/n.部门<,>Please read the first section of the report.<,>请阅读报告的第一部分。<,>The orange was divided into equal sections.<,>橙子被分成均等的几瓣。<,>She works in the finance section of the company.<,>她在公司的财务部门工作。<,>sect(切割)+ion→切割的部分→切片<,>dissect(v.解剖)/intersection(n.交叉点)/subsection(n.小节)  

confusion<,>/kənˈfjuːʒn/<,>/kənˈfjuʒən/<,>n.混乱/n.骚乱/n.混淆<,>There was confusion about the meeting time.<,>关于会议时间存在混淆。<,>The accident caused traffic confusion in the area.<,>事故导致该地区交通混乱。<,>His explanation only added to our confusion.<,>他的解释只会增加我们的困惑。<,>con(共同)+fus(流)+ion→流到一起→混乱<,>diffusion(n.扩散)/infusion(n.灌输)/refuse(v.拒绝)  

mercy<,>/ˈmɜːsi/<,>/ˈmɜːrsi/<,>n.仁慈/n.慈悲/n.恩惠<,>The judge showed mercy to the first-time offender.<,>法官对初犯者表现出仁慈。<,>They were at the mercy of the storm.<,>他们在暴风雨中听天由命。<,>It's a mercy that no one was hurt in the accident.<,>幸运的是事故中没有人受伤。<,>merc(报酬)+y→给予报酬→仁慈<,>mercenary(adj.唯利是图的)/merciless(adj.无情的)/merchandise(n.商品)  

successive<,>/səkˈsesɪv/<,>/səkˈsɛsɪv/<,>adj.连续的/adj.接连的<,>The team won five successive games.<,>这个队连续赢了五场比赛。<,>Successive governments have tried to solve this problem.<,>历届政府都试图解决这个问题。<,>He suffered successive defeats in the competition.<,>他在比赛中接连遭遇失败。<,>suc(后面)+cess(走)+ive→一个跟着一个走→连续的<,>success(n.成功)/successor(n.继任者)/access(n.入口)
pour<,>/pɔː(r)/<,>/pɔr/<,>v.灌/v.倒/v.倾泻<,>She poured the milk into the glass.<,>她把牛奶倒进玻璃杯里。<,>The rain poured down all day.<,>大雨倾盆下了一整天。<,>He poured out his feelings to his friend.<,>他向朋友倾诉了自己的感受。<,>p(泼)+our(我们的)→把我们的东西泼出去→倒<,>pore(n.毛孔/v.钻研)/sour(adj.酸的/v.变酸)

couple<,>/ˈkʌpl/<,>/ˈkʌpəl/<,>n.夫妇/n.(一)对/n.几个<,>The couple went on a honeymoon to Paris.<,>这对夫妇去巴黎度蜜月了。<,>I need a couple of chairs for the party.<,>我需要几把椅子来办派对。<,>She bought a couple of apples at the market.<,>她在市场买了几个苹果。<,>coup(突然行动)+le(小)→突然结合的小团体→夫妇<,>couplet(n.对联)/coupling(n.连接器)

mention<,>/ˈmenʃn/<,>/ˈmɛnʃən/<,>v.提及/v.说起/n.提及/n.说起<,>He didn't mention the accident to anyone.<,>他没有向任何人提起那次事故。<,>Special mention should be made of her contribution.<,>应该特别提及她的贡献。<,>The book makes no mention of this event.<,>这本书没有提到这个事件。<,>ment(思考)+ion→思考后说出来→提及<,>mental(adj.精神的)/menu(n.菜单)

stake<,>/steɪk/<,>/steɪk/<,>n.赌金/n.桩/n.奖品<,>They played for high stakes in the poker game.<,>他们在扑克游戏中下了高赌注。<,>We need to put stakes around the young tree.<,>我们需要在小树周围打桩。<,>The stakes in this competition are very high.<,>这次比赛的奖品非常丰厚。<,>s(死)+take(拿)→死也要拿→赌金<,>steak(n.牛排)/stale(adj.不新鲜的)

decide<,>/dɪˈsaɪd/<,>/dɪˈsaɪd/<,>v.决定/v.决心/v.解决<,>I can't decide which dress to buy.<,>我无法决定买哪条裙子。<,>They decided to go on a trip together.<,>他们决定一起去旅行。<,>The judge will decide the case tomorrow.<,>法官明天将裁决这个案子。<,>de(向下)+cide(切)→切下去→决定<,>suicide(n.自杀)/homicide(n.杀人)

conscious<,>/ˈkɒnʃəs/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəs/<,>adj.意识到的/adj.有意的<,>She was conscious of someone watching her.<,>她意识到有人在看她。<,>He made a conscious effort to improve his grades.<,>他有意识地努力提高成绩。<,>The patient became conscious after the surgery.<,>手术后病人恢复了意识。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+ous→共同知道的→有意识的<,>conscience(n.良心)/unconscious(adj.无意识的)

companion<,>/kəmˈpæniən/<,>/kəmˈpænjən/<,>n.同伴/n.共事者/n.伴侣<,>My dog is my faithful companion.<,>我的狗是我忠实的伙伴。<,>She found a traveling companion for the trip.<,>她为这次旅行找了个旅伴。<,>This book is a companion to the main textbook.<,>这本书是主教材的配套用书。<,>com(共同)+pan(面包)+ion→一起吃面包的人→同伴<,>company(n.公司)/companionship(n.友谊)

football<,>/ˈfʊtbɔːl/<,>/ˈfʊtˌbɔl/<,>n.足球<,>He plays football every weekend.<,>他每个周末都踢足球。<,>The football match was canceled due to rain.<,>足球比赛因雨取消了。<,>American football is different from soccer.<,>美式足球与英式足球不同。<,>foot(脚)+ball(球)→用脚踢的球→足球<,>basketball(n.篮球)/volleyball(n.排球)

careful<,>/ˈkeəfl/<,>/ˈkɛrfəl/<,>adj.仔细的/adj.细致的<,>Be careful when crossing the road.<,>过马路时要小心。<,>She is very careful with her work.<,>她工作非常细致。<,>Careful planning is essential for success.<,>细致的规划对成功至关重要。<,>care(关心)+ful(充满)→充满关心的→仔细的<,>careless(adj.粗心的)/carefree(adj.无忧无虑的)

receive<,>/rɪˈsiːv/<,>/rɪˈsiv/<,>v.得到/v.收到/v.接待<,>I received a letter from my friend.<,>我收到了朋友的来信。<,>The hotel receives guests from all over the world.<,>这家酒店接待来自世界各地的客人。<,>She received excellent medical care.<,>她得到了极好的医疗护理。<,>re(回)+ceive(拿)→拿回来→收到<,>perceive(v.察觉)/conceive(v.构思)
nowhere<,>/ˈnəʊweə(r)/<,>/ˈnoʊwɛr/<,>adv.任何地方都不<,>He found himself in the middle of nowhere.<,>他发现自己身处荒无人烟的地方。<,>There's nowhere to hide in this small room.<,>在这个小房间里无处可藏。<,>Her dreams seemed to lead nowhere.<,>她的梦想似乎毫无出路。<,>no(无)+where(地方)→没有任何地方<,>nowhere vs somewhere(某处)/everywhere(到处)

settle<,>/ˈsetl/<,>/ˈsɛtl/<,>v.安排/v.安放/v.调停<,>They settled their differences peacefully.<,>他们和平解决了分歧。<,>She settled the vase carefully on the shelf.<,>她小心地把花瓶放在架子上。<,>We need to settle this matter by Friday.<,>我们需要在周五前解决这件事。<,>set(放置)+tle→安放<,>settle vs saddle(马鞍)/kettle(水壶)

sign<,>/saɪn/<,>/saɪn/<,>n.符号/n.招牌/v.签名<,>Please sign your name at the bottom.<,>请在底部签上你的名字。<,>The shop had a bright neon sign.<,>商店有一个明亮的霓虹灯招牌。<,>Dark clouds are a sign of coming rain.<,>乌云是下雨的征兆。<,>sign(标记)→符号/签名<,>sign vs sigh(叹息)/sing(唱歌)

hide<,>/haɪd/<,>/haɪd/<,>v.把...藏起来/v.隐瞒<,>She tried to hide her disappointment.<,>她试图掩饰自己的失望。<,>The children hid behind the trees.<,>孩子们躲在树后。<,>Don't hide the truth from me.<,>不要对我隐瞒真相。<,>hide(隐藏)→与"high"(高)发音相似但意思不同<,>hide vs ride(骑)/side(侧面)

architecture<,>/ˈɑːkɪtektʃə(r)/<,>/ˈɑrkɪtɛktʃər/<,>n.建筑式样/n.建筑学<,>Roman architecture influenced many later styles.<,>罗马建筑影响了许多后来的风格。<,>She's studying architecture at university.<,>她在大学学习建筑学。<,>The modern architecture of the building is striking.<,>这座建筑的现代风格很引人注目。<,>arch(主要的)+tect(建造)+ure→主要建造→建筑<,>architecture vs architect(建筑师)/structure(结构)

daylight<,>/ˈdeɪlaɪt/<,>/ˈdeɪlaɪt/<,>n.白昼/n.日光/n.黎明<,>We worked from daylight till dusk.<,>我们从黎明工作到黄昏。<,>The room was filled with natural daylight.<,>房间里充满了自然光。<,>The robbery happened in broad daylight.<,>抢劫发生在光天化日之下。<,>day(白天)+light(光)→日光<,>daylight vs sunlight(阳光)/moonlight(月光)

entitle<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>v.给...权利（或资格）<,>This ticket entitles you to a free drink.<,>这张票使你有权获得一杯免费饮料。<,>She's entitled to her opinion.<,>她有权发表自己的意见。<,>The book is entitled "Modern History".<,>这本书名为《现代史》。<,>en(使)+title(头衔)→给予头衔→授权<,>entitle vs enable(使能够)/enlist(征募)

legend<,>/ˈledʒənd/<,>/ˈlɛdʒənd/<,>n.传说/n.传奇<,>The legend of King Arthur is well-known.<,>亚瑟王的传说非常有名。<,>He became a legend in his own lifetime.<,>他在有生之年就成了传奇人物。<,>According to local legend, the lake is haunted.<,>根据当地传说，这个湖闹鬼。<,>leg(读)+end(结束)→值得传颂的故事<,>legend vs legion(军团)/legendary(传奇的)

appropriate<,>/əˈprəʊpriət/<,>/əˈproʊpriət/<,>adj.适当的/adj.恰当的<,>That dress isn't appropriate for a job interview.<,>那件连衣裙不适合工作面试穿。<,>Please use appropriate language in class.<,>请在课堂上使用恰当的语言。<,>Is this an appropriate time to call?<,>现在打电话合适吗？<,>ap(向)+propri(自己的)+ate→使成为自己的→适当的<,>appropriate vs approximate(大约的)/approve(批准)

crust<,>/krʌst/<,>/krʌst/<,>n.面包皮/n.硬外皮<,>I prefer bread with a crispy crust.<,>我更喜欢有脆皮的面包。<,>The earth's crust is relatively thin.<,>地壳相对较薄。<,>There was a crust of ice on the pond.<,>池塘上结了一层冰。<,>crust(外壳)→与"trust"(信任)发音相似<,>crust vs crustacean(甲壳类)/crusty(有硬壳的)
existence<,>/ɪɡˈzɪstəns/<,>/ɪɡˈzɪstəns/<,>n.存在/n.实在/n.生活<,>The existence of life on other planets is still a mystery.<,>其他星球上是否存在生命仍是个谜。<,>He leads a simple existence in the countryside.<,>他在乡下过着简单的生活。<,>The existence of the ancient city was confirmed by recent discoveries.<,>最近发现证实了这座古城的存在。<,>ex(出)+ist(站立)+ence→站出来→存在<,>essence(n.本质)/extant(adj.现存的)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)

territory<,>/ˈterətri/<,>/ˈterətɔːri/<,>n.领土/n.版图/n.领域<,>This island is part of our national territory.<,>这个岛屿是我国领土的一部分。<,>He is an expert in the territory of psychology.<,>他是心理学领域的专家。<,>The company is expanding its business territory.<,>公司正在扩大业务版图。<,>terr(土地)+itory→领土<,>terrain(n.地形)/terror(n.恐怖)/terrace(n.梯田)

outlet<,>/ˈaʊtlet/<,>/ˈaʊtlɛt/<,>n.出口/n.出路/n.排遣<,>The river provides an outlet to the sea.<,>这条河是通往大海的出口。<,>Exercise is a good outlet for stress.<,>运动是排解压力的好方法。<,>The shopping mall has many brand outlets.<,>这个商场有许多品牌专卖店。<,>out(出)+let(让)→让...出去→出口<,>inlet(n.入口)/outset(n.开始)/outcry(n.强烈抗议)

compare<,>/kəmˈpeə(r)/<,>/kəmˈpɛr/<,>v.比较/v.对照/v.比作<,>Let's compare these two products before buying.<,>购买前让我们比较下这两款产品。<,>Shakespeare compared the world to a stage.<,>莎士比亚把世界比作舞台。<,>Compared to last year, sales have increased by 20%.<,>与去年相比，销售额增长了20%。<,>com(共同)+pare(平等)→放在一起看平等→比较<,>compete(v.竞争)/compose(v.组成)/compel(v.强迫)

emotional<,>/ɪˈməʊʃənl/<,>/ɪˈmoʊʃənl/<,>adj.感情的/adj.情绪的<,>She gave an emotional speech at the ceremony.<,>她在仪式上发表了感人的演讲。<,>Don't make decisions when you're too emotional.<,>情绪激动时不要做决定。<,>The movie has many emotional moments.<,>这部电影有许多感人瞬间。<,>e(出)+mot(动)+ion+al→情感流露的<,>motion(n.运动)/motivate(v.激励)/emote(v.强烈表现感情)

subtract<,>/səbˈtrækt/<,>/səbˈtrækt/<,>v.减/v.减去/v.去掉<,>Subtract 5 from 10 and you get 5.<,>10减去5等于5。<,>The teacher asked us to subtract the wrong answers from the total.<,>老师让我们从总分中减去错误答案。<,>Please subtract the discount from the total amount.<,>请从总额中减去折扣。<,>sub(下)+tract(拉)→向下拉→减去<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/contract(n.合同)/distract(v.分散注意力)

Italian<,>/ɪˈtæliən/<,>/ɪˈtæliən/<,>adj.意大利的/n.意大利人<,>Italian cuisine is famous worldwide.<,>意大利菜世界闻名。<,>She married an Italian and moved to Rome.<,>她嫁给了一个意大利人并搬到了罗马。<,>We're learning Italian at the language school.<,>我们正在语言学校学习意大利语。<,>Italy(意大利)+an(...的/人)→意大利的/意大利人<,>Spain(n.西班牙)/Spaniard(n.西班牙人)/Italianate(adj.意大利风格的)

density<,>/ˈdensəti/<,>/ˈdɛnsəti/<,>n.密集/n.稠密/n.密度<,>The population density in this city is very high.<,>这个城市的人口密度很高。<,>The density of the fog made driving dangerous.<,>浓雾使驾驶变得危险。<,>Scientists measure the density of materials.<,>科学家测量物质的密度。<,>dens(密集)+ity→密度<,>dense(adj.密集的)/condense(v.浓缩)/intense(adj.强烈的)

drunk<,>/drʌŋk/<,>/drʌŋk/<,>adj.醉的/adj.陶醉的<,>He was arrested for driving while drunk.<,>他因酒驾被捕。<,>She was drunk with happiness after winning the award.<,>获奖后她陶醉在幸福中。<,>The drunk man couldn't stand steadily.<,>那个醉汉站不稳。<,>drink的过去分词→喝醉的<,>drank(v.喝过去式)/drunken(adj.常醉的)/sober(adj.清醒的)

magazine<,>/ˌmæɡəˈziːn/<,>/ˈmæɡəziːn/<,>n.杂志/n.期刊<,>I bought a fashion magazine at the airport.<,>我在机场买了本时尚杂志。<,>This scientific magazine is published monthly.<,>这本科学期刊每月出版。<,>She writes articles for a business magazine.<,>她为商业杂志撰稿。<,>magaz(仓库)+ine→知识的仓库→杂志<,>journal(n.期刊)/periodical(n.期刊)/gazette(n.公报)
patience<,>/ˈpeɪʃəns/<,>/ˈpeɪʃəns/<,>n.忍耐/n.容忍/n.耐心<,>She showed great patience while teaching the children.<,>她在教孩子们时表现出极大的耐心。<,>Patience is a virtue that not everyone possesses.<,>耐心是一种并非人人都具备的美德。<,>Learning to play the piano requires a lot of patience.<,>学习弹钢琴需要很多耐心。<,>pati(忍受)+ence(状态)→忍耐的状态<,>patient(adj.耐心的/n.病人)/impatience(n.不耐烦)

direction<,>/dɪˈrekʃən/<,>/dɪˈrɛkʃən/<,>n.方向/n.方位/n.指导<,>We walked in the direction of the beach.<,>我们朝着海滩的方向走去。<,>The teacher gave clear directions for the assignment.<,>老师对作业给出了明确的指导。<,>The wind changed direction suddenly.<,>风向突然改变了。<,>direct(指导)+ion(名词后缀)→方向/指导<,>director(n.导演/n.主管)/directory(n.目录/n.指南)

job<,>/dʒɒb/<,>/dʒɑːb/<,>n.职业/n.工作/n.零活<,>He got a new job at a software company.<,>他在一家软件公司找到了一份新工作。<,>She did a great job on her project.<,>她的项目完成得很出色。<,>I have a few odd jobs to do this weekend.<,>这个周末我有一些零活要做。<,>job与work同义，但job更具体指某个职位<,>jog(v.慢跑)/jot(v.草草记下)

practise<,>/ˈpræktɪs/<,>/ˈpræktɪs/<,>v.练习/v.实习/v.训练<,>You need to practise the piano every day.<,>你需要每天练习钢琴。<,>She practises law in New York.<,>她在纽约从事法律工作。<,>The team practised for the match all week.<,>球队为比赛训练了整个星期。<,>pract(实践)+ise(动词后缀)→练习<,>practice(n.练习)/practitioner(n.从业者)

slope<,>/sləʊp/<,>/sloʊp/<,>n.倾斜/n.斜面/v.倾斜<,>The house is built on a steep slope.<,>房子建在一个陡坡上。<,>The road slopes downward to the river.<,>这条路向下倾斜通向河边。<,>He skied down the snowy slope.<,>他从积雪的斜坡上滑下。<,>sl(滑)+ope(开放)→滑动的斜面<,>scope(n.范围)/slip(v.滑倒)

ankle<,>/ˈæŋkl/<,>/ˈæŋkəl/<,>n.踝/n.踝节部<,>She twisted her ankle while running.<,>她在跑步时扭伤了脚踝。<,>He wore a bracelet around his ankle.<,>他在脚踝上戴了一个脚链。<,>The doctor examined his swollen ankle.<,>医生检查了他肿胀的脚踝。<,>ank(弯曲)+le(小)→可以弯曲的小部位<,>uncle(n.叔叔)/angle(n.角度)

dead<,>/ded/<,>/dɛd/<,>adj.死的/adj.无生命的<,>The flowers in the vase are dead.<,>花瓶里的花已经死了。<,>He was pronounced dead at the scene.<,>他在现场被宣布死亡。<,>The battery is completely dead.<,>电池完全没电了。<,>dead与die(v.死亡)同源<,>deed(n.行为)/dread(v.害怕)

sphere<,>/sfɪə(r)/<,>/sfɪr/<,>n.球/n.圆体/n.范围<,>The earth is not a perfect sphere.<,>地球不是一个完美的球体。<,>Her work falls within the sphere of education.<,>她的工作属于教育领域。<,>They studied the celestial spheres in astronomy class.<,>他们在天文课上研究了天体。<,>spher(球)+e→球体<,>atmosphere(n.大气)/hemisphere(n.半球)

me<,>/miː/<,>/mi/<,>pron.(宾格)我<,>Can you help me with this problem?<,>你能帮我解决这个问题吗？<,>She gave the book to me.<,>她把书给了我。<,>Between you and me, I don't trust him.<,>就我们俩之间说说，我不信任他。<,>I(主格)→me(宾格)<,>my(adj.我的)/mine(pron.我的)

develop<,>/dɪˈveləp/<,>/dɪˈvɛləp/<,>v.发展/v.形成/v.开发<,>The city has developed rapidly in recent years.<,>这座城市近年来发展迅速。<,>He developed a new software program.<,>他开发了一个新的软件程序。<,>She developed an interest in photography.<,>她对摄影产生了兴趣。<,>de(去掉)+velop(包裹)→展开→发展<,>envelop(v.包裹)/development(n.发展)
immense<,>/ɪˈmens/<,>/ɪˈmɛns/<,>adj.巨大的/adj.极好的<,>The Grand Canyon is an immense natural wonder.<,>大峡谷是一个巨大的自然奇观。<,>She felt immense joy when she heard the good news.<,>听到这个好消息时，她感到无比喜悦。<,>The project required immense effort to complete.<,>这个项目需要巨大的努力才能完成。<,>im(不)+mense(测量)→无法测量的→巨大的<,>immerse(v.沉浸)/immensity(n.巨大)

rabbit<,>/ˈræbɪt/<,>/ˈræbɪt/<,>n.兔子<,>The rabbit hopped quickly across the field.<,>兔子快速跳过田野。<,>She keeps a pet rabbit in her backyard.<,>她在后院养了一只宠物兔。<,>Rabbit fur is often used to make warm gloves.<,>兔毛常被用来制作保暖手套。<,>rab(抓)+bit(小)→被抓的小动物→兔子<,>habit(n.习惯)/robust(adj.强健的)

outset<,>/ˈaʊtset/<,>/ˈaʊtˌsɛt/<,>n.开始/n.开端<,>From the outset, it was clear the project would be challenging.<,>从一开始就很清楚这个项目将具有挑战性。<,>At the outset of his career, he faced many difficulties.<,>在他职业生涯开始时，他面临许多困难。<,>Let's clarify the rules at the outset to avoid confusion later.<,>让我们一开始就明确规则，以避免以后的混乱。<,>out(出)+set(放)→放出去→开始<,>offset(v.抵消)/upset(v.打乱)

disguise<,>/dɪsˈɡaɪz/<,>/dɪsˈɡaɪz/<,>v.隐瞒/v.掩埋/n.假装<,>He disguised his voice on the phone.<,>他在电话里伪装了自己的声音。<,>The spy wore a clever disguise.<,>间谍穿着巧妙的伪装。<,>She couldn't disguise her disappointment.<,>她无法掩饰自己的失望。<,>dis(不)+guise(外表)→改变外表→伪装<,>disgust(n.厌恶)/disclose(v.揭露)

brisk<,>/brɪsk/<,>/brɪsk/<,>adj.活泼的/adj.清新的<,>She walked at a brisk pace to keep warm.<,>她以轻快的步伐行走以保持温暖。<,>The morning air was brisk and refreshing.<,>早晨的空气清新宜人。<,>Business was brisk during the holiday season.<,>假日期间生意兴隆。<,>b(像人)+risk(冒险)→爱冒险的人很活泼<,>brink(n.边缘)/bristle(n.鬃毛)

keyboard<,>/ˈkiːbɔːd/<,>/ˈkiˌbɔrd/<,>n.键盘<,>She practiced on the piano keyboard for hours.<,>她在钢琴键盘上练习了好几个小时。<,>The computer keyboard needs cleaning.<,>电脑键盘需要清洁了。<,>He types quickly on his mechanical keyboard.<,>他在机械键盘上打字很快。<,>key(键)+board(板)→有键的板→键盘<,>keynote(n.主旨)/cupboard(n.橱柜)

onion<,>/ˈʌnjən/<,>/ˈʌnjən/<,>n.洋葱/n.洋葱头<,>She chopped onions for the soup.<,>她为汤切洋葱。<,>The smell of frying onions filled the kitchen.<,>煎洋葱的味道充满了厨房。<,>Onion layers can make you cry when cutting them.<,>切洋葱时，洋葱层会让你流泪。<,>on(在...上)+ion(离子)→让人流泪的离子→洋葱<,>opinion(n.意见)/union(n.联盟)

energy<,>/ˈenədʒi/<,>/ˈɛnərdʒi/<,>n.活力/n.精力/n.能/n.能量<,>Solar energy is a renewable resource.<,>太阳能是一种可再生资源。<,>The children were full of energy after their nap.<,>孩子们午睡后精力充沛。<,>She put all her energy into the project.<,>她把全部精力都投入到这个项目中。<,>en(使)+erg(工作)+y→使工作→能量<,>synergy(n.协同作用)/emergency(n.紧急情况)

shriek<,>/ʃriːk/<,>/ʃrik/<,>v.尖声喊叫/n.尖叫声<,>The girl shrieked when she saw the spider.<,>女孩看到蜘蛛时尖叫起来。<,>A sudden shriek broke the silence of the night.<,>突然的尖叫声打破了夜晚的寂静。<,>They shrieked with laughter at the joke.<,>他们听了笑话后尖声大笑。<,>sh(嘘声)+riek(像尖叫的声音)→尖叫声<,>shrink(v.收缩)/shrill(adj.刺耳的)

elaborate<,>/ɪˈlæbərət/<,>/ɪˈlæbəˌret/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.精心制作的<,>She wore an elaborate costume to the party.<,>她穿了一件精心制作的服装去参加聚会。<,>The plan was too elaborate to explain quickly.<,>这个计划太复杂，无法快速解释。<,>He gave an elaborate description of his journey.<,>他对他的旅程进行了详尽的描述。<,>e(出)+labor(劳动)+ate→付出劳动的→精心制作的<,>elaboration(n.精心制作)/collaborate(v.合作)
horse<,>/hɔːs/<,>/hɔːrs/<,>n.马/n.马科动物<,>She loves riding her horse in the countryside.<,>她喜欢在乡村骑马。<,>The horse galloped across the field.<,>那匹马疾驰过田野。<,>Horses are herbivores and eat grass.<,>马是食草动物，吃草。<,>hoarse(adj.嘶哑的)与horse发音相似<,>mare(n.母马)/stallion(n.公马)/pony(n.小马)

requirement<,>/rɪˈkwaɪəmənt/<,>/rɪˈkwaɪərmənt/<,>n.需要/n.要求<,>The job has strict educational requirements.<,>这份工作有严格的教育要求。<,>Meeting the basic requirements is essential.<,>满足基本要求是必要的。<,>What are the requirements for this course?<,>这门课程的要求是什么？<,>require(v.需要)+ment(名词后缀)<,>prerequisite(n.先决条件)/request(n.请求)/requisite(n.必需品)

grain<,>/ɡreɪn/<,>/ɡreɪn/<,>n.谷物/n.谷粒/n.颗粒<,>He spilled grains of rice on the table.<,>他把米粒撒在了桌子上。<,>Whole grain bread is healthier.<,>全麦面包更健康。<,>The wood has a fine grain.<,>这块木头的纹理很细。<,>与train(n.火车)对比记忆<,>granule(n.小颗粒)/kernel(n.核)/seed(n.种子)

moment<,>/ˈməʊmənt/<,>/ˈmoʊmənt/<,>n.时刻/n.片刻/n.瞬间<,>Wait a moment, please.<,>请稍等片刻。<,>That was a magical moment.<,>那是一个神奇的时刻。<,>I'll be back in a moment.<,>我一会儿就回来。<,>momentum(n.动量)来自moment<,>instant(n.瞬间)/minute(n.分钟)/second(n.秒)

occurrence<,>/əˈkʌrəns/<,>/əˈkɜːrəns/<,>n.发生/n.出现/n.事件<,>Earthquakes are rare occurrences here.<,>这里很少发生地震。<,>This is a common occurrence in nature.<,>这是自然界常见的现象。<,>The occurrence of the accident shocked everyone.<,>事故的发生震惊了所有人。<,>occur(v.发生)+ence(名词后缀)<,>incidence(n.发生率)/event(n.事件)/phenomenon(n.现象)

deed<,>/diːd/<,>/diːd/<,>n.行为/n.功绩/n.劣迹/n.契约<,>His good deeds were recognized by the community.<,>他的善行得到了社区的认可。<,>She signed the deed to the house.<,>她签署了房屋契约。<,>The criminal's evil deeds were exposed.<,>罪犯的恶行被揭露了。<,>与dead(adj.死的)发音相似<,>action(n.行动)/achievement(n.成就)/misdeed(n.罪行)

owl<,>/aʊl/<,>/aʊl/<,>n.猫头鹰/n.枭<,>The owl hooted in the night.<,>猫头鹰在夜晚鸣叫。<,>Owls are nocturnal birds.<,>猫头鹰是夜行性鸟类。<,>She collects owl figurines.<,>她收集猫头鹰小雕像。<,>howl(v.嚎叫)去掉h就是owl<,>eagle(n.鹰)/hawk(n.鹰)/falcon(n.隼)

isolate<,>/ˈaɪsəleɪt/<,>/ˈaɪsəleɪt/<,>v.使隔离/v.使孤立<,>The sick child was isolated from others.<,>生病的孩子被隔离了。<,>They live in an isolated village.<,>他们住在一个与世隔绝的村庄。<,>Scientists isolated the new virus.<,>科学家分离出了新病毒。<,>is(岛)+olate→使像岛一样孤立<,>insulate(v.隔离)/separate(v.分开)/quarantine(v.检疫隔离)

knife<,>/naɪf/<,>/naɪf/<,>n.小刀/n.刀/n.餐刀<,>He used a knife to cut the bread.<,>他用刀切面包。<,>Be careful with that knife, it's sharp.<,>小心那把刀，它很锋利。<,>She set the table with a knife and fork.<,>她在桌上摆好了刀叉。<,>k(开)+nife(谐音“耐夫”)→开耐用的工具→小刀<,>knives(复数形式)/knifed(过去式)/knifing(现在分词)

ignore<,>/ɪɡˈnɔː(r)/<,>/ɪɡˈnɔːr/<,>v.不顾/v.不理/v.忽视<,>He chose to ignore her rude comments.<,>他选择无视她无礼的评论。<,>The teacher ignored the student's raised hand.<,>老师没注意到那个学生举起了手。<,>Don't ignore the warning signs of illness.<,>不要忽视疾病的警告信号。<,>ig(不)+nore(知道)→不知道→忽视<,>ignorant(adj.无知的)/ignorance(n.无知)/neglect(v.疏忽)

sufficient<,>/səˈfɪʃ(ə)nt/<,>/səˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.足够的/adj.充分的<,>We have sufficient evidence to prove his guilt.<,>我们有足够的证据证明他有罪。<,>Make sure you get sufficient rest before the exam.<,>考试前确保得到充分的休息。<,>The food was sufficient for all the guests.<,>食物足够所有客人享用。<,>suf(下)+fic(做)+ient→做到下面→充分的<,>efficient(adj.高效的)/deficient(adj.不足的)/proficient(adj.熟练的)

proposal<,>/prəˈpəʊzl/<,>/prəˈpoʊzl/<,>n.提议/n.建议/n.求婚<,>She made a proposal to improve working conditions.<,>她提出了改善工作条件的建议。<<,>He accepted her marriage proposal.<,>他接受了她的求婚。<,>The committee rejected the budget proposal.<,>委员会否决了预算提案。<,>pro(向前)+pos(放)+al→向前放出的东西→提议<,>disposal(n.处理)/oppose(v.反对)/compose(v.组成)

milk<,>/mɪlk/<,>/mɪlk/<,>n.乳/n.牛奶/v.挤(奶)<,>She drinks a glass of milk every morning.<,>她每天早上喝一杯牛奶。<,>The farmer milks the cows twice a day.<,>农夫每天给奶牛挤两次奶。<,>Breast milk is best for babies.<,>母乳对婴儿最好。<,>mi(蜜)+lk(音"乐可")→甜蜜可口的液体→牛奶<,>milky(adj.乳白色的)/milker(n.挤奶工)/milkshake(n.奶昔)

during<,>/ˈdjʊərɪŋ/<,>/ˈdʊrɪŋ/<,>prep.在...期间<,>During the meeting, he took careful notes.<,>会议期间，他认真做了笔记。<,>She read three books during the summer.<,>她在夏天期间读了三本书。<,>Please remain seated during takeoff.<,>起飞期间请保持就座。<,>dur(持续)+ing→持续的时间→在...期间<,>duration(n.持续时间)/durable(adj.耐用的)/endure(v.忍受)
