security<,>/sɪˈkjʊərəti/<,>/sɪˈkjʊrəti/<,>n.安全工作/n.安全/n.安全感<,>Security at the airport has been tightened.<,>机场的安保工作加强了。<,>She felt a sense of security with him.<,>和他在一起她感到有安全感。<,>Job security is important to me.<,>工作保障对我很重要。<,>se(分开)+cur(关心)+ity→分开关心→安全<,>sure(adj.确定的)/secure(adj.安全的)/curiosity(n.好奇心)

tremble<,>/ˈtrembl/<,>/ˈtrɛmbəl/<,>v.发抖/v.哆嗦/v.摇动<,>Her hands trembled with fear.<,>她的手因恐惧而发抖。<,>The leaves trembled in the wind.<,>树叶在风中摇动。<,>He was trembling with excitement.<,>他兴奋得发抖。<,>trem(颤抖)+ble→发抖<,>tremor(n.震动)/tremendous(adj.巨大的)/trample(v.践踏)

inferior<,>/ɪnˈfɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɪriər/<,>adj.下等的/adj.劣等的<,>This product is inferior to that one.<,>这个产品比那个差。<,>He always felt inferior to his brother.<,>他总是觉得自己不如哥哥。<,>They were treated as inferior beings.<,>他们被当作低等人对待。<,>in(不)+fer(带来)+ior→不能带来价值的→劣等的<,>superior(adj.优越的)/interior(n.内部)/exterior(n.外部)

marble<,>/ˈmɑːbl/<,>/ˈmɑrbəl/<,>n.大理石<,>The floor was made of marble.<,>地板是大理石做的。<,>She collects marble statues.<,>她收集大理石雕像。<,>The columns are carved from white marble.<,>这些柱子是用白色大理石雕刻的。<,>mar(海)+ble→像海一样有花纹的石头→大理石<,>marbles(n.弹珠)/maple(n.枫树)/mumble(v.咕哝)
inventor<,>/ɪnˈvɛntə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈvɛntər/<,>n.发明者/n.发明家<,>Thomas Edison was a famous inventor.<,>托马斯·爱迪生是一位著名的发明家。<,>The inventor received a patent for his new device.<,>这位发明家为他的新设备获得了专利。<,>She is the inventor of a revolutionary new technology.<,>她是一项革命性新技术的发明者。<,>invent(发明)+or(人)→发明的人→发明家<,>invention(n.发明)/investor(n.投资者)

metal<,>/ˈmɛtl/<,>/ˈmɛtəl/<,>n.金属/n.金属制品<,>Gold is a precious metal.<,>黄金是一种贵重金属。<,>The bridge is made of strong metal.<,>这座桥是用坚固的金属建造的。<,>She collects antique metal objects.<,>她收集古董金属制品。<,>met(测量)+al→古代用金属测量重量→金属<,>mental(adj.精神的)/medal(n.奖章)

efficiency<,>/ɪˈfɪʃnsi/<,>/ɪˈfɪʃənsi/<,>n.效率/n.效能/n.功效<,>The new system improved work efficiency.<,>新系统提高了工作效率。<,>Energy efficiency is important for the environment.<,>能源效率对环境很重要。<,>The machine operates at maximum efficiency.<,>这台机器以最高效率运行。<,>ef(出)+fic(做)+iency→做出效果→效率<,>effect(n.效果)/sufficiency(n.充足)

high<,>/haɪ/<,>/haɪ/<,>adj.高的/adj.高级的/adv.高<,>The plane flew at a high altitude.<,>飞机在高空飞行。<,>She holds a high position in the company.<,>她在公司担任高级职位。<,>Prices have risen too high.<,>价格涨得太高了。<,>hi(嗨)+gh→在高处打招呼→高的<,>height(n.高度)/low(adj.低的)

born<,>/bɔːn/<,>/bɔːrn/<,>adj.天生的/adj.出生的<,>He was born in 1990.<,>他出生于1990年。<,>She is a born leader.<,>她是个天生的领导者。<,>The baby was born healthy.<,>这个婴儿出生时很健康。<,>bor(带)+n→带来生命→出生<,>borne(v. bear的过去分词)/burn(v.燃烧)

destroy<,>/dɪˈstrɔɪ/<,>/dɪˈstrɔɪ/<,>v.破坏/v.消灭/v.打破<,>The fire destroyed the entire building.<,>大火摧毁了整个建筑。<,>The storm destroyed many homes.<,>暴风雨摧毁了许多房屋。<,>He wanted to destroy the evidence.<,>他想销毁证据。<,>de(向下)+stroy(建造)→把建造的推倒→破坏<,>destruction(n.破坏)/construct(v.建造)

heating<,>/ˈhiːtɪŋ/<,>/ˈhiːtɪŋ/<,>n.加热/n.供暖<,>We turned on the heating in winter.<,>冬天我们打开了暖气。<,>The heating system needs repair.<,>供暖系统需要修理。<,>Solar heating is environmentally friendly.<,>太阳能供暖很环保。<,>heat(热)+ing→加热的过程→加热<,>cooling(n.冷却)/eating(v.吃)

comprise<,>/kəmˈpraɪz/<,>/kəmˈpraɪz/<,>v.包含/v.包括/v.构成<,>The team comprises five members.<,>这个团队由五名成员组成。<,>The book comprises three parts.<,>这本书包含三个部分。<,>Water comprises most of the Earth's surface.<,>水构成了地球表面的大部分。<,>com(共同)+prise(抓住)→全部抓住→包含<,>compromise(n.妥协)/surprise(n.惊讶)

ease<,>/iːz/<,>/iːz/<,>n.容易/n.舒适/v.缓和<,>He completed the task with ease.<,>他轻松地完成了任务。<,>The medicine will ease your pain.<,>这种药会缓解你的疼痛。<,>She lives a life of ease.<,>她过着舒适的生活。<,>eas(轻松)+e→容易的状态→容易<,>easy(adj.容易的)/disease(n.疾病)

liberation<,>/ˌlɪbəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌlɪbəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.解放<,>The country celebrated its liberation day.<,>这个国家庆祝解放日。<,>Women's liberation was an important movement.<,>妇女解放是一项重要运动。<,>He fought for the liberation of his people.<,>他为人民的解放而战。<,>liber(自由)+ation→使获得自由→解放<,>liberty(n.自由)/liberal(adj.自由的)
wholly<,>/ˈhəʊlli/<,>/ˈhoʊlli/<,>adv.完全地/adv.全部<,>She was wholly devoted to her work.<,>她完全投入到工作中。<,>The project was wholly funded by donations.<,>这个项目全部由捐款资助。<,>He wholly agreed with the decision.<,>他完全同意这个决定。<,>whole(完整的)+ly(副词后缀)→完全地<,>holy(adj.神圣的)/hollow(adj.空的)

split<,>/splɪt/<,>/splɪt/<,>v.被劈开/v.劈开<,>He split the log with an axe.<,>他用斧头劈开了木头。<,>The group split into two factions.<,>这个团体分裂成两个派系。<,>She split her pants while dancing.<,>她跳舞时把裤子撑破了。<,>s(撕)+plit(劈)→劈开<,>spit(v.吐痰)/splat(n.啪嗒声)

basin<,>/ˈbeɪsn/<,>/ˈbeɪsən/<,>n.洗脸盆/n.盆/n.盆地<,>She washed her face in the basin.<,>她在洗脸盆里洗脸。<,>The river flows into a large basin.<,>这条河流入一个大盆地。<,>He planted flowers in the basin.<,>他在盆里种了花。<,>base(基础)+in(里面)→盛东西的容器→盆<,>basic(adj.基本的)/basis(n.基础)

weed<,>/wiːd/<,>/wid/<,>n.杂草/n.野草/v.除草<,>The garden is full of weeds.<,>花园里长满了杂草。<,>He spent the afternoon weeding the flower beds.<,>他花了一下午给花坛除草。<,>This herbicide kills weeds effectively.<,>这种除草剂能有效杀死野草。<,>wee(小的)+d(的)→小小的杂草<,>need(v.需要)/seed(n.种子)

calm<,>/kɑːm/<,>/kɑm/<,>adj.静的/adj.平静的<,>The sea was calm after the storm.<,>暴风雨过后海面恢复了平静。<,>She remained calm during the crisis.<,>她在危机中保持冷静。<,>Take deep breaths to stay calm.<,>深呼吸保持平静。<,>call(叫喊)+m(没)→没有叫喊→平静的<,>clam(n.蛤蜊)/palm(n.手掌)

sweater<,>/ˈswetə(r)/<,>/ˈswɛtər/<,>n.厚运动衫/n.毛线衫<,>She knitted a warm sweater for winter.<,>她织了一件暖和的毛衣过冬。<,>He took off his sweater when it got hot.<,>天气变热时他脱掉了毛衣。<,>This wool sweater is very comfortable.<,>这件羊毛衫非常舒适。<,>sweat(出汗)+er(物)→出汗时穿的衣服<,>sweet(adj.甜的)/swear(v.发誓)

shear<,>/ʃɪə(r)/<,>/ʃɪr/<,>v.剪/v.剥夺<,>The farmer sheared the sheep's wool.<,>农民剪下了羊的毛。<,>The storm sheared off the tree branches.<,>暴风雨折断了树枝。<,>His power was sheared by the new law.<,>新法律剥夺了他的权力。<,>she(她)+ear(耳朵)→她剪掉了耳朵<,>share(v.分享)/sheer(adj.纯粹的)

swallow<,>/ˈswɒləʊ/<,>/ˈswɑloʊ/<,>n.燕子<,>We saw a swallow building its nest.<,>我们看到一只燕子在筑巢。<,>Swallows migrate south in winter.<,>燕子在冬天迁徙到南方。<,>The swallow flew swiftly over the lake.<,>燕子快速掠过湖面。<,>sw(水)+allow(允许)→允许在水上飞的鸟<,>shallow(adj.浅的)/wallow(v.打滚)

greet<,>/ɡriːt/<,>/ɡrit/<,>v.问候/v.招呼/v.反应<,>He greeted me with a warm smile.<,>他热情地微笑着向我打招呼。<,>The news was greeted with cheers.<,>这个消息受到了欢呼。<,>She greeted every customer politely.<,>她礼貌地问候每一位顾客。<,>g(哥)+reet(reet看作meet)→哥哥见到我要问候<,>great(adj.伟大的)/grit(n.砂砾)

practical<,>/ˈpræktɪkl/<,>/ˈpræktɪkəl/<,>adj.实践的/adj.实用的<,>This is a practical solution to the problem.<,>这是解决这个问题的实用方法。<,>She has a practical approach to life.<,>她对生活有务实的态度。<,>The course provides practical skills.<,>这门课程提供实用技能。<,>practice(练习)+al(形容词后缀)→实践的<,>practicable(adj.可行的)/theoretical(adj.理论的)
basically<,>/ˈbeɪsɪkli/<,>/ˈbeɪsɪkli/<,>adv.基本上<,>Basically, the plan is to leave early in the morning.<,>基本上，计划是早上早点出发。<,>He is basically a good person, despite his flaws.<,>尽管有缺点，他基本上是个好人。<,>The solution is basically the same as before.<,>解决方案基本上和以前一样。<,>base(基础)+ical(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→基于基础地→基本上<,>basic(adj.基础的)/basis(n.基础)  

conductor<,>/kənˈdʌktə(r)/<,>/kənˈdʌktər/<,>n.售票员/n.(乐队)指挥<,>The conductor checked our tickets on the train.<,>列车员在火车上检查了我们的票。<,>The orchestra followed the conductor's lead perfectly.<,>管弦乐队完美地跟随指挥的引导。<,>She works as a bus conductor in the city.<,>她在城里当公交车售票员。<,>conduct(引导)+or(人)→引导的人→指挥者<,>semiconductor(n.半导体)/insulator(n.绝缘体)  

naturally<,>/ˈnætʃrəli/<,>/ˈnætʃrəli/<,>adv.自然地/adv.天然地<,>She speaks naturally in front of large audiences.<,>她在大量观众面前说话很自然。<,>This juice is made from naturally grown fruits.<,>这种果汁是用天然种植的水果制成的。<,>Naturally, we were disappointed when the show was canceled.<,>演出取消时，我们自然很失望。<,>nature(自然)+al(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→自然地<,>unnaturally(adv.不自然地)/supernaturally(adv.超自然地)  

undertake<,>/ˌʌndəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌʌndərˈteɪk/<,>v.从事/v.承担/v.保证<,>She undertook the responsibility of caring for her sick mother.<,>她承担了照顾生病母亲的责任。<,>The company undertook to finish the project by December.<,>公司保证在12月前完成项目。<,>He undertook a journey around the world last year.<,>去年他进行了一次环球旅行。<,>under(在...下)+take(拿)→在责任下拿取→承担<,>overtake(v.超过)/mistake(n.错误)  

despair<,>/dɪˈspeə(r)/<,>/dɪˈsper/<,>n.绝望/v.绝望<,>He was in deep despair after losing his job.<,>失业后他陷入了深深的绝望。<,>Don't despair; things will get better.<,>不要绝望，情况会好转的。<,>Her face showed complete despair when she heard the news.<,>听到消息时，她脸上显示出完全的绝望。<,>de(去掉)+spair(希望)→没有希望→绝望<,>desperate(adj.绝望的)/repair(v.修理)  

nose<,>/nəʊz/<,>/noʊz/<,>n.鼻子<,>She has a small, upturned nose.<,>她有一个小巧上翘的鼻子。<,>The dog sniffed the air with its wet nose.<,>狗用湿鼻子嗅着空气。<,>He broke his nose playing basketball.<,>他打篮球时摔断了鼻子。<,>联想：no(没有)+se(色)→鼻子没有颜色(通常肉色)<,>rose(n.玫瑰)/pose(v.摆姿势)  

morning<,>/ˈmɔːnɪŋ/<,>/ˈmɔːrnɪŋ/<,>n.早晨/n.上午<,>I usually drink coffee in the morning.<,>我通常在早上喝咖啡。<,>We have a meeting tomorrow morning at nine.<,>我们明天上午九点有个会议。<,>The morning sun shone through the window.<,>晨光透过窗户照射进来。<,>morn(早晨)+ing(名词后缀)→早晨<,>evening(n.晚上)/mourning(n.哀悼)  

mild<,>/maɪld/<,>/maɪld/<,>adj.温柔的/adj.和缓的<,>She has a very mild temperament.<,>她性情非常温和。<,>The weather was mild for December.<,>对于十二月来说天气很温和。<,>This soap is mild enough for sensitive skin.<,>这款肥皂足够温和，适合敏感肌肤。<,>联想：mild与child(孩子)押韵→温和的孩子<,>wild(adj.狂野的)/mile(n.英里)  

interrupt<,>/ˌɪntəˈrʌpt/<,>/ˌɪntəˈrʌpt/<,>v.打断/v.打扰/v.中止<,>Please don't interrupt me while I'm speaking.<,>我说话时请不要打断我。<,>The phone call interrupted our dinner.<,>电话打断了我们的晚餐。<,>The game was interrupted by rain.<,>比赛因雨中断。<,>inter(在...之间)+rupt(断裂)→在中间断裂→打断<,>erupt(v.爆发)/corrupt(adj.腐败的)  

period<,>/ˈpɪəriəd/<,>/ˈpɪriəd/<,>n.时期/n.学时/n.句号<,>This was the most difficult period of my life.<,>这是我生命中最困难的时期。<,>Each class period lasts 45 minutes.<,>每节课时长为45分钟。<,>Don't forget to put a period at the end of the sentence.<,>别忘了在句末加上句号。<,>peri(周围)+od(路)→绕行一周的时间→时期<,>periodic(adj.周期的)/periodical(n.期刊)
loaf<,>/ləʊf/<,>/loʊf/<,>n.一条面包/n.一个面包<,>He bought a loaf of bread from the bakery.<,>他从面包店买了一条面包。<,>She sliced the loaf into thick pieces.<,>她把面包切成厚片。<,>I prefer a wholemeal loaf to white bread.<,>比起白面包我更喜欢全麦面包。<,>联想: loaf(面包)与life(生活)发音相似，面包是生活必需品<,>loaf(n.面包)/loan(n.贷款)/load(n.负担)

resistance<,>/rɪˈzɪstəns/<,>/rɪˈzɪstəns/<,>n.抵抗/n.抵制/n.抵抗力<,>The protesters showed strong resistance to the new law.<,>抗议者对新法律表现出强烈抵制。<,>His body has built up a resistance to the virus.<,>他的身体已经对这种病毒产生了抵抗力。<,>The army met fierce resistance from the rebels.<,>军队遇到了叛军的激烈抵抗。<,>re(反)+sist(站)→站在对立面→抵抗<,>assistance(n.帮助)/persistence(n.坚持)/existence(n.存在)

enforce<,>/ɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>v.实施/v.执行/v.强制<,>The police are here to enforce the law.<,>警察在这里执法。<,>The school strictly enforces the dress code.<,>学校严格执行着装规定。<,>New traffic rules will be enforced next month.<,>新的交通规则将于下月实施。<,>en(使)+force(力量)→使有力量→强制执行<,>reinforce(v.加强)/enforceable(adj.可强制执行的)/enforcement(n.执行)

definitely<,>/ˈdefɪnətli/<,>/ˈdefɪnətli/<,>adv.一定地/adv.明确地<,>I will definitely attend the meeting tomorrow.<,>我明天一定会参加会议。<,>This is definitely the best solution to the problem.<,>这绝对是解决问题的最佳方案。<,>She definitely said she would come by 8 o'clock.<,>她明确说过会在8点前来。<,>definite(明确的)+ly(副词后缀)→明确地<,>definitive(adj.决定性的)/indefinitely(adv.无限期地)/infinitely(adv.无限地)

flow<,>/fləʊ/<,>/floʊ/<,>v.流动/v.飘垂/v.涨潮<,>The river flows into the sea.<,>这条河流入大海。<,>Her long hair flowed down her back.<,>她的长发垂在背后。<,>The tide begins to flow at dawn.<,>黎明时分开始涨潮。<,>联想: flow(流动)与flower(花)相似，花需要水流动<,>flaw(n.瑕疵)/flew(v.飞，fly过去式)/glow(v.发光)

grow<,>/ɡrəʊ/<,>/ɡroʊ/<,>v.增长/v.生长<,>The plants grow quickly in this fertile soil.<,>植物在这肥沃的土壤里生长得很快。<,>Our business has grown significantly this year.<,>今年我们的业务增长显著。<,>Children grow up so fast these days.<,>如今孩子们长得真快。<,>gr(地面)+ow(表示动作)→从地面生长<,>glow(v.发光)/crow(n.乌鸦)/brow(n.眉毛)

federal<,>/ˈfedərəl/<,>/ˈfedərəl/<,>adj.联邦的/adj.联盟的<,>The federal government announced new policies today.<,>联邦政府今天宣布了新政策。<,>This is a federal crime that crosses state lines.<,>这是跨越州界的联邦罪行。<,>The Federal Reserve plays a key role in the economy.<,>美联储在经济中扮演关键角色。<,>feder(联盟)+al(形容词后缀)→联盟的<,>federate(v.结成联邦)/confederate(adj.同盟的)/federation(n.联邦)

agent<,>/ˈeɪdʒənt/<,>/ˈeɪdʒənt/<,>n.代理人/n.代理商<,>She works as a real estate agent.<,>她是一名房地产经纪人。<,>The secret agent completed the mission successfully.<,>特工成功完成了任务。<,>Our company has appointed a new sales agent.<,>我们公司任命了一位新的销售代理。<,>ag(做)+ent(人)→做事的人→代理人<,>agency(n.代理机构)/agenda(n.议程)/urgent(adj.紧急的)

lively<,>/ˈlaɪvli/<,>/ˈlaɪvli/<,>adj.活泼的<,>The lively music made everyone want to dance.<,>活泼的音乐让每个人都想跳舞。<,>She has a lively personality that attracts people.<,>她活泼的性格很吸引人。<,>The debate was lively and interesting.<,>这场辩论生动有趣。<,>live(活的)+ly(形容词后缀)→活泼的<,>lovely(adj.可爱的)/lifely(错误拼写)/liveliness(n.活泼)

utility<,>/juːˈtɪləti/<,>/juːˈtɪləti/<,>n.效用/n.有用/n.实用<,>The new software has great utility for small businesses.<,>这款新软件对小企业非常有用。<,>Public utilities include water and electricity.<,>公共事业包括水和电。<,>This multi-purpose tool has high utility value.<,>这个多功能工具实用价值很高。<,>util(使用)+ity(名词后缀)→效用<,>utilitarian(adj.功利的)/utilize(v.利用)/futility(n.无用)
establish<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>v.建立/v.设立/v.确立<,>They established a new company last year.<,>他们去年成立了一家新公司。<,>The scientist established a new theory.<,>这位科学家确立了一个新理论。<,>She quickly established herself as a leader.<,>她迅速确立了自己的领导地位。<,>e(出)+stabl(稳定)+ish(使)→使稳定→建立<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/install(v.安装)/statue(n.雕像)

distinct<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>adj.与其它不同的<,>There is a distinct difference between the two methods.<,>这两种方法有明显的区别。<,>She has a distinct way of speaking.<,>她有独特的说话方式。<,>The flavor is quite distinct from others.<,>这种味道与其他完全不同。<,>dis(分开)+tinct(刺)→刺出不同→区别的<,>extinct(adj.灭绝的)/instinct(n.本能)/distinguish(v.区分)

interval<,>/ˈɪntəvəl/<,>/ˈɪntərvəl/<,>n.间隔/n.休息/n.间距<,>There was a short interval between the two meetings.<,>两次会议之间有短暂的间隔。<,>He takes regular intervals during work.<,>他工作时会定期休息。<,>The trees are planted at intervals of 5 meters.<,>这些树每隔5米种植一棵。<,>inter(在...之间)+val(墙)→在墙之间→间隔<,>internal(adj.内部的)/intervene(v.干预)/interlude(n.插曲)

motor<,>/ˈməʊtə(r)/<,>/ˈmoʊtər/<,>n.发动机/n.机动车<,>The motor of the car needs repairing.<,>汽车的发动机需要修理。<,>He bought a new motor for his boat.<,>他为船买了新发动机。<,>Motor vehicles are not allowed in this area.<,>这个区域不允许机动车进入。<,>mot(移动)+or(物)→使移动的物体→发动机<,>motion(n.运动)/motivate(v.激励)/motorcycle(n.摩托车)

brute<,>/bruːt/<,>/brut/<,>n.禽兽/n.畜生<,>He behaved like a brute to the animals.<,>他对动物像畜生一样残忍。<,>The brute force of the storm destroyed many houses.<,>暴风雨的蛮力摧毁了许多房屋。<,>Don't be such a brute to your little brother.<,>别对你弟弟这么粗暴。<,>发音类似"bruise"(淤青)→野兽造成的伤害<,>brutal(adj.残忍的)/brutality(n.暴行)/bruit(v.传播)

account<,>/əˈkaʊnt/<,>/əˈkaʊnt/<,>n.记述/n.解释/n.账目<,>She gave a detailed account of the accident.<,>她对事故做了详细描述。<,>You need to check your bank account regularly.<,>你需要定期检查银行账户。<,>How do you account for your absence?<,>你如何解释你的缺席？<,>ac(强调)+count(计算)→需要计算的东西→账目<,>discount(n.折扣)/accountant(n.会计)/counter(n.计数器)

gramme<,>/ɡræm/<,>/ɡræm/<,>n.克(重量单位)<,>This package weighs 500 grammes.<,>这个包裹重500克。<,>Add 100 grammes of sugar to the mixture.<,>在混合物中加入100克糖。<,>The gold coin weighs exactly one gramme.<,>这枚金币正好重1克。<,>gram(写)+me→最初用刻度量→克<,>kilogram(n.千克)/grammar(n.语法)/program(n.程序)

absence<,>/ˈæbsəns/<,>/ˈæbsəns/<,>n.缺席/n.不在场/n.缺乏<,>His absence from the meeting was noticed.<,>他缺席会议被注意到了。<,>In the absence of evidence, the case was closed.<,>由于缺乏证据，案件被撤销了。<,>She returned after a long absence.<,>她在长期缺席后回来了。<,>ab(离开)+sence(存在)→不存在→缺席<,>presence(n.出席)/essence(n.本质)/absent(adj.缺席的)

operation<,>/ˌɒpəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːpəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.手术/n.操作/n.运算<,>The patient is undergoing a heart operation.<,>病人正在接受心脏手术。<,>Do you know how to operate this machine?<,>你知道如何操作这台机器吗？<,>The computer performs millions of operations per second.<,>计算机每秒执行数百万次运算。<,>oper(工作)+ation→工作状态→操作<,>cooperate(v.合作)/opera(n.歌剧)/operative(adj.操作的)

crash<,>/kræʃ/<,>/kræʃ/<,>v.碰撞/v.坠落/n.碰撞<,>The car crashed into a tree.<,>汽车撞上了一棵树。<,>The stock market crashed yesterday.<,>股市昨天暴跌。<,>We heard a loud crash from the kitchen.<,>我们听到厨房传来巨大的碰撞声。<,>拟声词，模仿碰撞的声音<,>clash(v.冲突)/smash(v.粉碎)/crush(v.压碎)
beef<,>/biːf/<,>/bif/<,>n.牛肉/n.菜牛<,>I would like to order a beef steak.<,>我想点一份牛排。<,>They raise beef cattle on their farm.<,>他们在农场饲养菜牛。<,>Beef is rich in protein and iron.<,>牛肉富含蛋白质和铁。<,>bee(蜜蜂)+f→想象蜜蜂在牛肉上采蜜<,>leaf(n.树叶)/reef(n.礁石)/deaf(adj.聋的)

heap<,>/hiːp/<,>/hip/<,>n.(一)堆/n.大量<,>There was a heap of clothes on the floor.<,>地板上有一堆衣服。<,>He has heaps of work to do.<,>他有大量的工作要做。<,>She heaped praise on her students.<,>她对学生们大加赞扬。<,>hear(听)+p→听到大量消息<,>leap(v.跳跃)/heat(n.热量)/heap(v.堆积)

deposit<,>/dɪˈpɒzɪt/<,>/dɪˈpɑzɪt/<,>v.使沉淀/v.存放<,>The river deposits silt at its mouth.<,>河流在入海口沉积淤泥。<,>I need to deposit this check at the bank.<,>我需要去银行存这张支票。<,>A thick layer of dust had deposited on the furniture.<,>家具上积了厚厚一层灰。<,>de(向下)+posit(放置)→向下放→沉淀<,>dispose(v.处理)/opposite(adj.相反的)/composite(n.合成物)

displease<,>/dɪsˈpliːz/<,>/dɪsˈpliz/<,>v.使不愉快/v.使生气<,>His rude behavior displeased the guests.<,>他粗鲁的行为让客人们很不愉快。<,>The decision displeased many employees.<,>这个决定让很多员工很生气。<,>She was displeased with the poor service.<,>她对糟糕的服务很不满意。<,>dis(否定)+please(取悦)→不取悦→使不悦<,>disease(n.疾病)/display(v.展示)/displace(v.取代)

appoint<,>/əˈpɔɪnt/<,>/əˈpɔɪnt/<,>v.任命/v.委任/v.约定<,>The company appointed a new CEO.<,>公司任命了一位新CEO。<,>They appointed a time to meet again.<,>他们约定了再次见面的时间。<,>She was appointed to the committee.<,>她被委任进入委员会。<,>ap(强调)+point(点)→指定某个点→任命<,>anoint(v.涂油)/account(n.账户)/adjoin(v.毗邻)

bound<,>/baʊnd/<,>/baʊnd/<,>adj.一定的/adj.有义务的<,>You are bound to succeed with such talent.<,>有这样的天赋，你一定会成功。<,>We are bound by the contract.<,>我们受合同约束。<,>The train is bound for New York.<,>这列火车开往纽约。<,>bounce(弹跳)+d→有弹性的→有约束力的<,>bond(n.债券)/bend(v.弯曲)/blend(v.混合)

merely<,>/ˈmɪəli/<,>/ˈmɪrli/<,>adv.仅仅/adv.只不过<,>It's merely a suggestion, not an order.<,>这只不过是个建议，不是命令。<,>He was merely joking when he said that.<,>他说那话只是在开玩笑。<,>The difference is merely in the details.<,>区别仅仅在于细节。<,>mere(仅仅的)+ly(副词后缀)→仅仅<,>merry(adj.愉快的)/merge(v.合并)/merit(n.优点)

besides<,>/bɪˈsaɪdz/<,>/bɪˈsaɪdz/<,>adv.而且/prep.除...之外<,>Besides English, she speaks French fluently.<,>除了英语，她法语也说得很流利。<,>I don't want to go; besides, I'm too tired.<,>我不想去；而且，我太累了。<,>There were three others besides me at the meeting.<,>除了我，还有三个人参加了会议。<,>beside(在旁边)+s→在旁边还有→此外<,>beside(prep.在旁边)/besiege(v.围攻)/bespeak(v.预示)

park<,>/pɑːk/<,>/pɑrk/<,>n.公园/n.停车场<,>Let's take a walk in the park.<,>我们去公园散步吧。<,>I couldn't find a parking space in the park.<,>我在停车场找不到停车位。<,>The children are playing in the park.<,>孩子们正在公园里玩耍。<,>par(平等)+k→人人平等的休闲场所→公园<,>part(n.部分)/pork(n.猪肉)/perk(n.津贴)

nineteen<,>/ˌnaɪnˈtiːn/<,>/ˌnaɪnˈtin/<,>num.十九/num.十九个<,>She is nineteen years old.<,>她十九岁了。<,>There are nineteen students in our class.<,>我们班有十九个学生。<,>The bus leaves at nineteen minutes past the hour.<,>公交车在整点过十九分钟发车。<,>nine(九)+teen(十几)→十九<,>ninety(num.九十)/nineteen(num.十九)/nineteenth(adj.第十九的)
depress<,>/dɪˈpres/<,>/dɪˈprɛs/<,>v.使沮丧/v.按下<,>The rainy weather always depresses me.<,>阴雨天气总是让我感到沮丧。<,>Depress the button to start the machine.<,>按下按钮启动机器。<,>Bad news can depress people's mood.<,>坏消息会让人情绪低落。<,>de(向下)+press(压)→向下压→使沮丧<,>express(v.表达)/impress(v.留下印象)/compress(v.压缩)

cry<,>/kraɪ/<,>/kraɪ/<,>v.哭，哭泣/v.叫喊<,>The baby cried all night long.<,>婴儿整晚都在哭。<,>He cried out in pain when he fell.<,>他摔倒时痛得大叫。<,>Don't cry over spilled milk.<,>不要为打翻的牛奶哭泣。<,>拟声词，模仿哭泣或喊叫的声音<,>dry(adj.干燥的)/fry(v.油炸)/try(v.尝试)

into<,>/ˈɪntuː/<,>/ˈɪntu/<,>prep.进，入/prep.进入到<,>She walked into the room quietly.<,>她悄悄地走进了房间。<,>Translate this sentence into English.<,>把这个句子翻译成英语。<,>He got into trouble again.<,>他又惹上麻烦了。<,>in(在...里)+to(向)→进入<,>onto(prep.到...上)/within(prep.在...内)/intro(n.介绍)

maths<,>/mæθs/<,>/mæθs/<,>n.（英）数学<,>I have a maths test tomorrow.<,>我明天有数学考试。<,>She's very good at maths.<,>她数学很好。<,>Maths is my favorite subject.<,>数学是我最喜欢的科目。<,>mathematics的缩写形式<,>math(n.（美）数学)/match(n.比赛)/moth(n.蛾子)

significance<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkəns/<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkəns/<,>n.意义，意味/n.重要性<,>The discovery has great scientific significance.<,>这个发现具有重大的科学意义。<,>What's the significance of this symbol?<,>这个符号有什么含义？<,>He didn't realize the significance of his words.<,>他没有意识到自己话的重要性。<,>sign(标记)+i+fic(做)+ance(名词后缀)→做标记→意义<,>significant(adj.重要的)/signify(v.表示)/insignificant(adj.不重要的)

bag<,>/bæɡ/<,>/bæɡ/<,>n.袋，包/n.钱包/n.背包<,>She carried a shopping bag.<,>她提着一个购物袋。<,>Don't forget your gym bag.<,>别忘了你的健身包。<,>He put the money in his bag.<,>他把钱放进包里。<,>简单易记的短单词<,>bad(adj.坏的)/beg(v.乞求)/bug(n.虫子)

crack<,>/kræk/<,>/kræk/<,>n.裂缝，裂纹/v.爆裂<,>There's a crack in the wall.<,>墙上有一道裂缝。<,>The glass cracked when it fell.<,>玻璃掉下来时裂开了。<,>We heard a loud crack of thunder.<,>我们听到一声响雷。<,>拟声词，模仿破裂的声音<,>track(n.轨道)/crank(n.曲柄)/crock(n.瓦罐)

certainty<,>/ˈsɜːtnti/<,>/ˈsɜːrtnti/<,>n.必然/n.肯定<,>There's no certainty that he'll come.<,>不能确定他是否会来。<,>Death is the only certainty in life.<,>死亡是生命中唯一确定的事。<,>I can say with certainty that she's honest.<,>我可以肯定地说她是诚实的。<,>certain(确定的)+ty(名词后缀)→确定性<,>uncertainty(n.不确定性)/certify(v.证明)/certificate(n.证书)

lazy<,>/ˈleɪzi/<,>/ˈleɪzi/<,>adj.懒惰的/adj.懒散的<,>He's too lazy to clean his room.<,>他太懒了，不愿打扫房间。<,>It was a lazy Sunday afternoon.<,>那是一个慵懒的周日下午。<,>Don't be lazy, do your homework!<,>别偷懒，做你的作业！<,>谐音"累死"，懒惰的人怕累<,>hazy(adj.朦胧的)/crazy(adj.疯狂的)/lacy(adj.花边的)

effect<,>/ɪˈfekt/<,>/ɪˈfɛkt/<,>n.结果/n.效果，效力<,>The medicine had a good effect.<,>这种药效果很好。<,>The new law will take effect next month.<,>新法律将于下个月生效。<,>Special effects make movies more exciting.<,>特效使电影更加精彩。<,>ef(出)+fect(做)→做出来的结果<,>affect(v.影响)/defect(n.缺陷)/infect(v.感染)
hurt<,>/hɜːt/<,>/hɜːrt/<,>v.使受伤/v.使痛心<,>His words hurt her feelings deeply.<,>他的话深深地伤害了她的感情。<,>Be careful not to hurt yourself with that knife.<,>小心别被那把刀伤到自己。<,>The dog's leg was hurt in the accident.<,>狗的腿在事故中受伤了。<,>发音类似“呵疼”→受伤会疼<,>harm(v.伤害/n.损害)/hunt(v.打猎/n.狩猎)

block<,>/blɒk/<,>/blɑːk/<,>n.街区/v.堵塞/v.拦阻<,>There's a new coffee shop on the next block.<,>下个街区有家新咖啡店。<,>The protesters blocked the main road.<,>抗议者堵塞了主干道。<,>A fallen tree blocked our path.<,>一棵倒下的树挡住了我们的路。<,>b(形状像路障)+lock(锁)→封锁道路<,>black(adj.黑色的)/blank(n.空白/adj.空白的)

hillside<,>/ˈhɪlsaɪd/<,>/ˈhɪlsaɪd/<,>n.(小山)山腰/n.山坡<,>The sheep were grazing on the hillside.<,>羊群在山坡上吃草。<,>Their house is built into the hillside.<,>他们的房子建在山腰上。<,>We had a picnic on the sunny hillside.<,>我们在阳光明媚的山坡上野餐。<,>hill(山)+side(边)→山的旁边→山坡<,>hillside指山坡/mountainside指大山坡

specialist<,>/ˈspeʃəlɪst/<,>/ˈspeʃəlɪst/<,>n.专家<,>You should consult a heart specialist.<,>你应该咨询心脏专家。<,>She's a specialist in ancient Greek history.<,>她是古希腊历史专家。<,>The company hired a marketing specialist.<,>公司聘请了一位营销专家。<,>special(特殊的)+ist(人)→特殊领域的人→专家<,>expert(n.专家)/generalist(n.通才)

worm<,>/wɜːm/<,>/wɜːrm/<,>n.虫/n.蠕虫<,>The bird was looking for worms in the soil.<,>鸟儿在土里找虫子。<,>I found a worm in my apple.<,>我在苹果里发现了一条虫。<,>Some worms are beneficial to the garden.<,>有些蠕虫对花园有益。<,>w(扭动)+orm→扭动的生物→蠕虫<,>warm(adj.温暖的)/swarm(n.群/v.聚集)

dictionary<,>/ˈdɪkʃənri/<,>/ˈdɪkʃəneri/<,>n.词典/n.字典<,>Look up the word in your dictionary.<,>在字典里查查这个词。<,>He gave me an English-Chinese dictionary.<,>他给了我一本英汉字典。<,>This dictionary contains over 50,000 entries.<,>这本词典收录了5万多词条。<,>dict(说)+ion+ary(场所)→收录词语的地方→字典<,>directory(n.目录/n.姓名地址录)

cabbage<,>/ˈkæbɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkæbɪdʒ/<,>n.洋白菜/n.卷心菜<,>She made a salad with fresh cabbage.<,>她用新鲜卷心菜做了沙拉。<,>Cabbage soup is very nutritious.<,>白菜汤很有营养。<,>The rabbit likes to eat cabbage leaves.<,>兔子喜欢吃白菜叶。<,>cab(出租车)+bage(发音“白菜”)→出租车运白菜<,>baggage(n.行李)/garbage(n.垃圾)

date<,>/deɪt/<,>/deɪt/<,>n.日期/v.注...日期<,>What's the date today?<,>今天几号？<,>Please date your application form.<,>请在申请表上注明日期。<,>Their wedding date is set for June 10th.<,>他们的婚礼日期定在6月10日。<,>da(大)+te(特)→特别大的日子→日期<,>data(n.数据)/fate(n.命运)

warmth<,>/wɔːmθ/<,>/wɔːrmθ/<,>n.暖和/n.温暖/n.热烈<,>The fireplace gave the room a cozy warmth.<,>壁炉给房间带来了舒适的温暖。<,>She spoke with genuine warmth.<,>她说话带着真诚的热情。<,>The sun's warmth melted the snow.<,>太阳的温暖融化了雪。<,>warm(温暖的)+th(名词后缀)→温暖<,>width(n.宽度)/growth(n.生长)

latter<,>/ˈlætə(r)/<,>/ˈlætər/<,>adj.(两者中)后者的<,>Of these two options, I prefer the latter.<,>这两个选项中，我更喜欢后者。<,>The latter part of the movie was exciting.<,>电影的后半部分很精彩。<,>In the latter case, we'll need more time.<,>在后一种情况下，我们需要更多时间。<,>late(晚的)+er(比较级)→更晚的→后者的<,>former(adj.前者的)/later(adv.稍后)
indoors<,>/ˌɪnˈdɔːz/<,>/ˌɪnˈdɔːrz/<,>adv.在室内/adv.在屋里<,>It's raining outside, so we should stay indoors.<,>外面在下雨，我们应该待在室内。<,>She prefers to exercise indoors during winter.<,>冬天她更喜欢在室内锻炼。<,>The cat ran indoors when it heard thunder.<,>猫听到雷声就跑进了屋里。<,>in(在...内)+doors(门)→在门内→室内<,>outdoors(adv. 在户外)/inside(adv. 在里面)

helicopter<,>/ˈhelɪkɒptə(r)/<,>/ˈhelɪkɑːptər/<,>n.直升机<,>The helicopter landed on the hospital roof.<,>直升机降落在医院屋顶上。<,>We took a helicopter tour of the Grand Canyon.<,>我们乘坐直升机游览了大峡谷。<,>The rescue team arrived by helicopter.<,>救援队乘直升机到达。<,>helico(螺旋)+pter(翅膀)→有螺旋翅膀的机器<,>airplane(n. 飞机)/chopper(n. 直升机，俚语)

leg<,>/leɡ/<,>/leɡ/<,>n.腿/n.腿部<,>He broke his leg in a skiing accident.<,>他在滑雪事故中摔断了腿。<,>The table has four wooden legs.<,>这张桌子有四条木腿。<,>She crossed her legs and sat comfortably.<,>她跷着二郎腿舒服地坐着。<,>联想：leg(腿)和peg(木桩)都有"g"结尾<,>arm(n. 手臂)/foot(n. 脚)

quality<,>/ˈkwɒləti/<,>/ˈkwɑːləti/<,>n.质量/n.品质/n.特性<,>The quality of this product is excellent.<,>这个产品的质量非常好。<,>Honesty is an important quality in a friend.<,>诚实是朋友的重要品质。<,>This wine has a unique fruity quality.<,>这款酒有独特的水果特性。<,>qual(性质)+ity(名词后缀)→性质→质量<,>quantity(n. 数量)/qualify(v. 使合格)

command<,>/kəˈmɑːnd/<,>/kəˈmænd/<,>v.命令/v.指挥/v.控制<,>The general commanded his troops to advance.<,>将军命令他的部队前进。<,>She commands great respect from her colleagues.<,>她赢得了同事们的极大尊敬。<,>This program allows you to command the computer with your voice.<,>这个程序允许你用声音控制电脑。<,>com(完全)+mand(命令)→完全命令→指挥<,>demand(v. 要求)/commend(v. 称赞)

preference<,>/ˈprefrəns/<,>/ˈprefrəns/<,>n.偏爱/n.优先/n.优先权<,>I have a preference for tea over coffee.<,>比起咖啡，我更喜欢茶。<,>The hotel gives preference to returning guests.<,>酒店优先考虑回头客。<,>She was given preference in the job selection.<,>她在工作选拔中获得了优先权。<,>pre(前)+fer(拿)+ence→提前拿→偏爱<,>reference(n. 参考)/difference(n. 差异)

actually<,>/ˈæktʃuəli/<,>/ˈæktʃuəli/<,>adv.实际上/adv.竟然<,>Actually, I don't agree with your opinion.<,>实际上，我不同意你的观点。<,>He actually finished the project ahead of schedule.<,>他竟然提前完成了项目。<,>I thought she was French, but actually she's Belgian.<,>我以为她是法国人，实际上她是比利时人。<,>act(行动)+ual(的)+ly(副词后缀)→实际地<,>currently(adv. 当前)/virtually(adv. 几乎)

secondary<,>/ˈsekəndri/<,>/ˈsekənderi/<,>adj.第二的/adj.次要的<,>English is his secondary language.<,>英语是他的第二语言。<,>The color is of secondary importance in this design.<,>在这个设计中，颜色是次要的。<,>She teaches at a secondary school.<,>她在一所中学教书。<,>second(第二)+ary(形容词后缀)→第二的<,>primary(adj. 主要的)/elementary(adj. 初级的)

academy<,>/əˈkædəmi/<,>/əˈkædəmi/<,>n.专科院校/n.私立中学<,>He graduated from a military academy.<,>他毕业于一所军事学院。<,>The Royal Academy of Arts is famous worldwide.<,>皇家艺术学院世界闻名。<,>She sends her children to an expensive academy.<,>她把孩子送到一所昂贵的私立中学。<,>源自希腊神话中英雄Akademos的花园<,>university(n. 大学)/college(n. 学院)

report<,>/rɪˈpɔːt/<,>/rɪˈpɔːrt/<,>v.报告/v.汇报<,>The journalist reported the latest news.<,>记者报道了最新消息。<,>Students must report their progress every month.<,>学生必须每月汇报他们的进展。<,>She reported the theft to the police.<,>她向警方报告了盗窃案。<,>re(回)+port(带)→带回来→报告<,>support(v. 支持)/transport(v. 运输)
magnet<,>/ˈmæɡnɪt/<,>/ˈmæɡnət/<,>n.磁铁/n.磁石/n.磁体<,>The magnet attracts iron filings.<,>磁铁吸引铁屑。<,>She stuck the note to the fridge with a magnet.<,>她用磁铁把便条贴在冰箱上。<,>The Earth is like a giant magnet.<,>地球就像一个巨大的磁铁。<,>mag(魔法)+net(网)→像魔法网一样吸引→磁铁<,>magnate(n.巨头/n.大亨)/magnify(v.放大/v.夸大)  

none<,>/nʌn/<,>/nʌn/<,>pron.没有人/pron.没有一点/adv.毫不<,>None of the students passed the exam.<,>没有一个学生通过考试。<,>She had none of her mother's beauty.<,>她一点也没有她母亲的美貌。<,>None of this matters to me.<,>这些对我来说都无所谓。<,>no(无)+one(一个)→没有一个→毫无<,>nun(n.修女)/noon(n.中午)  

large<,>/lɑːdʒ/<,>/lɑːrdʒ/<,>adj.大的/adj.巨大的<,>He lives in a large house.<,>他住在一所大房子里。<,>She has a large collection of books.<,>她有大量的藏书。<,>A large crowd gathered in the square.<,>一大群人聚集在广场上。<,>谐音"拉锯"→拉锯战规模大→大的<,>enlarge(v.扩大/v.放大)/largely(adv.主要地/adv.大部分)  

corporation<,>/ˌkɔːpəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɔːrpəˈreɪʃn/<,>n.公司/n.企业/n.社团<,>He works for a multinational corporation.<,>他在一家跨国公司工作。<,>The corporation donated money to charity.<,>这家公司向慈善机构捐款。<,>The corporation holds its annual meeting next week.<,>该公司下周举行年度会议。<,>corpor(身体)+ation→组成一个整体→公司<,>cooperation(n.合作)/corporate(adj.公司的/adj.法人的)  

thorough<,>/ˈθʌrə/<,>/ˈθɜːroʊ/<,>adj.彻底的/adj.详尽的<,>She gave the room a thorough cleaning.<,>她把房间彻底打扫了一遍。<,>The police conducted a thorough investigation.<,>警方进行了彻底的调查。<,>He has a thorough knowledge of the subject.<,>他对这个学科有透彻的了解。<,>through(通过)+o→从头到尾通过→彻底的<,>through(prep.通过)/though(conj.虽然)  

chin<,>/tʃɪn/<,>/tʃɪn/<,>n.颏/n.下巴<,>He rubbed his chin thoughtfully.<,>他若有所思地摸着下巴。<,>She has a dimple in her chin.<,>她的下巴上有个酒窝。<,>The boxer took a punch to the chin.<,>拳击手的下巴挨了一拳。<,>chin→chin up(振作起来)→抬起下巴→下巴<,>chin(n.下巴)/shin(n.胫骨)/chin-chin(干杯)  

nearby<,>/ˌnɪəˈbaɪ/<,>/ˌnɪrˈbaɪ/<,>adj.附近的/adv.在附近<,>There is a grocery store nearby.<,>附近有一家杂货店。<,>We found a nearby restaurant for lunch.<,>我们在附近找了家餐厅吃午饭。<,>She lives in a nearby town.<,>她住在附近的一个小镇上。<,>near(近的)+by(在旁边)→在附近<,>nearly(adv.几乎)/nearby(adj.附近的)  

react<,>/riˈækt/<,>/riˈækt/<,>v.作出反应/v.有影响<,>How did she react to the news?<,>她对这个消息有什么反应？<,>The chemicals react violently when mixed.<,>这些化学物质混合时会剧烈反应。<,>The market reacted badly to the announcement.<,>市场对这个公告反应不佳。<,>re(回)+act(行动)→反应<,>interact(v.互动)/overreact(v.反应过度)  

map<,>/mæp/<,>/mæp/<,>n.地图/n.图/n.天体图<,>Can you show me on the map where we are?<,>你能在地图上指出我们现在的位置吗？<,>He drew a map of the treasure's location.<,>他画了一张藏宝图。<,>Scientists have mapped the human genome.<,>科学家已经绘制了人类基因组图谱。<,>map→map out(规划)→地图<,>nap(n.小睡)/cap(n.帽子)  

vinegar<,>/ˈvɪnɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈvɪnɪɡər/<,>n.醋<,>She added a splash of vinegar to the salad.<,>她在沙拉里加了一点醋。<,>The smell of vinegar filled the kitchen.<,>厨房里弥漫着醋的味道。<,>This vinegar is made from apples.<,>这种醋是用苹果酿造的。<,>vine(葡萄)+gar(看作"garlic"大蒜)→葡萄和大蒜都能做醋→醋<,>vine(n.葡萄藤)/vintage(n.葡萄酒/adj.经典的)
article<,>/ˈɑːtɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈɑːrtɪk(ə)l/<,>n.文章/n.物品/n.条款<,>She wrote an article about climate change.<,>她写了一篇关于气候变化的文章。<,>This article of clothing is very expensive.<,>这件衣物非常昂贵。<,>Please read the fifth article of the contract.<,>请阅读合同的第五条。<,>art(艺术)+icle(小东西)→小艺术品→文章/物品<,>particle(n. 微粒)/articulate(v. 清晰地表达)

angle<,>/ˈæŋɡ(ə)l/<,>/ˈæŋɡ(ə)l/<,>n.角/n.角度<,>The photo was taken from an unusual angle.<,>这张照片是从一个不寻常的角度拍摄的。<,>Let's approach the problem from a different angle.<,>让我们从不同的角度来处理这个问题。<,>The two roads meet at a sharp angle.<,>两条路以锐角相交。<,>ang(角)+le→角/角度<,>angel(n. 天使)/ankle(n. 脚踝)

zone<,>/zəʊn/<,>/zoʊn/<,>n.地区/n.区域/n.范围<,>This is a no-parking zone.<,>这是禁止停车区。<,>The city is divided into several zones.<,>这个城市被划分为几个区域。<,>The tropical zone has a hot climate.<,>热带地区气候炎热。<,>zon(带)+e→地带→区域<,>bone(n. 骨头)/tone(n. 音调)

rail<,>/reɪl/<,>/reɪl/<,>n.横条/n.横杆/n.铁轨<,>Hold onto the rail when going down the stairs.<,>下楼梯时要扶着栏杆。<,>The train runs on these rails.<,>火车在这些铁轨上行驶。<,>He leaned against the garden rail.<,>他靠在花园的栏杆上。<,>rai(杆)+l→横杆/铁轨<,>sail(v. 航行)/fail(v. 失败)

holy<,>/ˈhəʊli/<,>/ˈhoʊli/<,>adj.神圣的/adj.圣洁的<,>This is a holy place for pilgrims.<,>这是朝圣者的圣地。<,>She leads a holy life.<,>她过着圣洁的生活。<,>The Bible is considered a holy book.<,>圣经被认为是一本圣书。<,>hol(完整)+y→完整无缺的→神圣的<,>wholly(adv. 完全地)/hole(n. 洞)

copy<,>/ˈkɒpi/<,>/ˈkɑːpi/<,>n.抄件/v.抄写/v.复制<,>Make a copy of this document.<,>把这份文件复印一份。<,>Don't copy others' homework.<,>不要抄袭别人的作业。<,>The artist copied the famous painting.<,>这位艺术家临摹了那幅名画。<,>cop(抓)+y→抓取→复制<,>cozy(adj. 舒适的)/copper(n. 铜)

elephant<,>/ˈelɪf(ə)nt/<,>/ˈelɪf(ə)nt/<,>n.象<,>The elephant is the largest land animal.<,>大象是最大的陆地动物。<,>We saw elephants at the zoo.<,>我们在动物园看到了大象。<,>An elephant never forgets.<,>大象从不忘事。<,>eleph(象)+ant→大象<,>elegant(adj. 优雅的)/element(n. 元素)

hasten<,>/ˈheɪs(ə)n/<,>/ˈheɪs(ə)n/<,>v.催促/v.赶紧<,>We must hasten our departure.<,>我们必须赶紧出发。<,>She hastened to finish her work.<,>她赶紧完成工作。<,>The medicine will hasten your recovery.<,>这种药会加速你的康复。<,>haste(匆忙)+en(使)→使匆忙→赶紧<,>fasten(v. 系紧)/hazard(n. 危险)

helpless<,>/ˈhelpləs/<,>/ˈhelpləs/<,>adj.无助的/adj.无能的<,>The baby looked so helpless.<,>那个婴儿看起来非常无助。<,>I felt helpless in that situation.<,>我在那种情况下感到无能为力。<,>He was helpless against the strong wind.<,>他无力抵抗强风。<,>help(帮助)+less(无)→无助的<,>hopeless(adj. 绝望的)/harmless(adj. 无害的)

mutter<,>/ˈmʌtə/<,>/ˈmʌtər/<,>v.轻声低语/v.抱怨<,>He muttered something under his breath.<,>他低声嘟囔着什么。<,>She's always muttering about her job.<,>她总是抱怨她的工作。<,>The old man muttered to himself.<,>老人自言自语地嘟囔着。<,>mut(改变)+ter→声音改变→低声说<,>butter(n. 黄油)/mutterer(n. 喃喃低语者)
musical<,>/ˈmjuːzɪkəl/<,>/ˈmjuːzɪkəl/<,>adj.音乐的<,>She has a musical talent that amazes everyone.<,>她拥有令人惊叹的音乐天赋。<,>The musical performance was breathtaking.<,>那场音乐表演令人叹为观止。<,>He comes from a very musical family.<,>他来自一个非常有音乐氛围的家庭。<,>music(音乐)+al(形容词后缀)→音乐的<,>melody(n.旋律)/harmony(n.和声)  

silk<,>/sɪlk/<,>/sɪlk/<,>n.蚕丝/丝/丝织品<,>She wore a beautiful dress made of silk.<,>她穿了一件漂亮的丝绸连衣裙。<,>The silk scarf feels very soft.<,>这条丝巾摸起来非常柔软。<,>Silk production has a long history in China.<,>丝绸生产在中国有着悠久的历史。<,>联想：silk发音类似"丝可"→丝绸<,>satin(n.缎子)/velvet(n.天鹅绒)  

agency<,>/ˈeɪdʒənsi/<,>/ˈeɪdʒənsi/<,>n.经办/代理/代理处<,>He works at a travel agency.<,>他在一家旅行社工作。<,>The advertising agency created a successful campaign.<,>广告代理公司策划了一场成功的活动。<,>This government agency handles environmental issues.<,>这个政府机构处理环境问题。<,>agent(代理人)+cy(名词后缀)→代理处<,>agenda(n.议程)/agent(n.代理人)  

conflict<,>/ˈkɒnflɪkt/<,>/ˈkɑːnflɪkt/<,>n.争论/冲突/斗争<,>There was a conflict between the two countries.<,>两国之间发生了冲突。<,>His statement conflicts with the facts.<,>他的陈述与事实相矛盾。<,>She tried to avoid conflict at work.<,>她试图避免工作中的冲突。<,>con(共同)+flict(打击)→互相打击→冲突<,>inflict(v.使遭受)/afflict(v.使痛苦)  

anything<,>/ˈeniθɪŋ/<,>/ˈeniθɪŋ/<,>pron.任何事物/一切<,>You can ask me anything you want to know.<,>你可以问我任何你想知道的事情。<,>Is there anything I can do to help?<,>有什么我能帮忙的吗？<,>He would do anything for his family.<,>他愿意为家人做任何事情。<,>any(任何)+thing(事物)→任何事物<,>everything(pron.所有事物)/nothing(pron.没有东西)  

outskirt<,>/ˈaʊtskɜːt/<,>/ˈaʊtskɜːrt/<,>n.外边/郊区<,>They live on the outskirts of the city.<,>他们住在城市郊区。<,>The factory is located in the outskirts.<,>这家工厂位于郊区。<,>We took a walk on the outskirts of town.<,>我们在城镇外围散步。<,>out(外)+skirt(边缘)→外边缘→郊区<,>suburb(n.郊区)/periphery(n.外围)  

peculiar<,>/pɪˈkjuːliə(r)/<,>/pɪˈkjuːliər/<,>adj.特有的/特别的<,>He has a peculiar way of speaking.<,>他有种特别的说话方式。<,>This plant is peculiar to this region.<,>这种植物是这个地区特有的。<,>There was a peculiar smell in the room.<,>房间里有股奇怪的气味。<,>pecu(私人财产)+liar→私人所有的→特有的<,>particular(adj.特定的)/special(adj.特殊的)  

index<,>/ˈɪndeks/<,>/ˈɪndeks/<,>n.索引/指数/指标<,>Check the index to find the page number.<,>查看索引找到页码。<,>The stock market index rose today.<,>今天股市指数上涨了。<,>This test is an index of your ability.<,>这个测试是你能力的指标。<,>in(进入)+dex(指向)→指向内容→索引<,>indicator(n.指示器)/appendix(n.附录)  

anxious<,>/ˈæŋkʃəs/<,>/ˈæŋkʃəs/<,>adj.忧虑的/渴望的<,>She was anxious about her exam results.<,>她对考试成绩感到焦虑。<,>He is anxious to start his new job.<,>他渴望开始新工作。<,>The parents were anxious for their missing child.<,>父母为失踪的孩子感到忧虑。<,>anx(痛苦)+ious(形容词后缀)→痛苦的→忧虑的<,>eager(adj.渴望的)/nervous(adj.紧张的)  

likely<,>/ˈlaɪkli/<,>/ˈlaɪkli/<,>adj.可能的/adv.很可能<,>It's likely to rain this afternoon.<,>今天下午很可能会下雨。<,>She is the most likely candidate for the job.<,>她是最有可能获得这份工作的候选人。<,>They will likely arrive late.<,>他们很可能会迟到。<,>like(像)+ly→像要发生的→可能的<,>alike(adj.相似的)/unlikely(adj.不太可能的)
mat<,>/mæt/<,>/mæt/<,>n.席子/n.草席/n.垫子<,>She put a mat under the hot dish to protect the table.<,>她在热盘子下放了一个垫子以保护桌子。<,>The yoga mat provides a comfortable surface for exercise.<,>瑜伽垫为锻炼提供了舒适的表面。<,>He wiped his feet on the doormat before entering.<,>他在进门之前在地垫上擦了擦脚。<,>mat(垫子)与map(地图)发音相似<,>rug(n.小地毯)/carpet(n.地毯)/pad(n.衬垫)

cushion<,>/ˈkʊʃn/<,>/ˈkʊʃən/<,>n.垫子/n.坐垫/n.靠垫<,>She placed a cushion behind her back for support.<,>她在背后放了一个靠垫作为支撑。<,>The sofa cushions need to be fluffed up.<,>沙发垫需要拍松。<,>He used a cushion to kneel on the hard floor.<,>他用一个垫子跪在硬地板上。<,>cush(软垫)+ion(名词后缀)→垫子<,>pillow(n.枕头)/mat(n.垫子)/padding(n.填充物)

flock<,>/flɒk/<,>/flɑːk/<,>n.羊群/n.群/n.大量<,>A flock of birds flew over the lake.<,>一群鸟飞过湖面。<,>The shepherd tended his flock in the meadow.<,>牧羊人在草地上照看他的羊群。<,>Flock of tourists visited the famous monument.<,>大批游客参观了这座著名的纪念碑。<,>fl(飞)+ock(群体)→飞行的群体→鸟群<,>herd(n.兽群)/swarm(n.昆虫群)/pack(n.狼群)

mislead<,>/ˌmɪsˈliːd/<,>/ˌmɪsˈlid/<,>v.将...引入歧途/v.误导<,>The advertisement misled consumers about the product's benefits.<,>这则广告误导了消费者对该产品好处的认知。<,>Don't be misled by appearances.<,>不要被表象所迷惑。<,>His vague answers misled the investigators.<,>他含糊的回答误导了调查人员。<,>mis(错误)+lead(引导)→错误引导<,>deceive(v.欺骗)/misinform(v.误报)/guide(v.正确引导)

vague<,>/veɪɡ/<,>/veɪɡ/<,>adj.模糊的/adj.含糊的<,>She gave a vague answer to avoid the question.<,>她给出了一个含糊的回答来回避问题。<,>The instructions were too vague to follow.<,>这些说明太模糊，无法遵循。<,>I have a vague memory of that event.<,>我对那件事的记忆很模糊。<,>vag(漫游)+ue→漫游的→模糊的<,>ambiguous(adj.模棱两可的)/clear(adj.清晰的)/precise(adj.精确的)

generator<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪtər/<,>n.发电机/n.发生者<,>The hospital has backup generators in case of power failure.<,>医院有备用发电机以防停电。<,>He is a great generator of new ideas.<,>他是新点子的优秀创造者。<,>The wind turbine acts as an electricity generator.<,>风力涡轮机作为发电机使用。<,>generat(产生)+or(人或物)→产生者<,>motor(n.电动机)/alternator(n.交流发电机)/dynamo(n.直流发电机)

concrete<,>/ˈkɒŋkriːt/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkriːt/<,>n.混凝土/n.具体物<,>The workers poured concrete for the foundation.<,>工人们为地基浇筑混凝土。<,>We need concrete evidence to support this claim.<,>我们需要具体的证据来支持这一说法。<,>Her ideas were abstract rather than concrete.<,>她的想法是抽象的而非具体的。<,>con(共同)+crete(生长)→共同生长→凝固→混凝土<,>cement(n.水泥)/abstract(adj.抽象的)/specific(adj.具体的)

scatter<,>/ˈskætə(r)/<,>/ˈskætər/<,>v.撒/v.散播/v.使消散<,>She scattered seeds in the garden.<,>她在花园里撒种子。<,>The crowd scattered when the police arrived.<,>警察到来时人群散开了。<,>Leaves were scattered across the lawn.<,>树叶散落在草坪上。<,>s(分散)+catter(看作cat猫)→像猫一样四处分散<,>spread(v.传播)/gather(v.聚集)/disperse(v.驱散)

brake<,>/breɪk/<,>/breɪk/<,>n.闸/n.刹车/v.制动<,>He applied the brakes to avoid hitting the dog.<,>他踩刹车以避免撞到狗。<,>The car's brakes need to be checked.<,>这辆车的刹车需要检查。<,>She braked suddenly at the red light.<,>她在红灯前突然刹车。<,>brake(刹车)与break(打破)同音<,>accelerator(n.油门)/clutch(n.离合器)/handbrake(n.手刹)

brain<,>/breɪn/<,>/breɪn/<,>n.脑/n.脑髓/n.脑力<,>The human brain is a complex organ.<,>人脑是一个复杂的器官。<,>She has a brilliant business brain.<,>她有出色的商业头脑。<,>The boxer suffered brain damage in the match.<,>这位拳击手在比赛中脑部受伤。<,>b(头)+rain(雨)→头脑中的雨→思维活动<,>mind(n.心智)/skull(n.头骨)/intellect(n.智力)
commander<,>/kəˈmɑːndə(r)/<,>/kəˈmændər/<,>n.司令官/n.指挥员<,>The commander gave orders to his troops.<,>司令官向他的部队下达了命令。<,>She was appointed as the new commander of the naval base.<,>她被任命为海军基地的新指挥官。<,>The young officer aspired to become a great commander one day.<,>这位年轻军官渴望有朝一日成为一名伟大的指挥官。<,>com(共同)+mand(命令)+er(人)→共同发号施令的人→指挥官<,>command(v.命令/n.指挥)/demander(n.要求者)/commend(v.称赞/v.推荐)

arrest<,>/əˈrest/<,>/əˈrɛst/<,>v.逮捕/v.拘留/v.阻止<,>The police arrested the suspect at the scene.<,>警方在现场逮捕了嫌疑人。<,>The new policy aims to arrest the spread of the disease.<,>新政策旨在阻止疾病的传播。<,>He was placed under arrest for drunk driving.<,>他因酒驾被拘留。<,>ar(加强)+rest(休息)→强制休息→拘留<,>rest(n.休息/v.依靠)/assert(v.断言)/asset(n.资产)

limb<,>/lɪm/<,>/lɪm/<,>n.肢/n.臂/n.翼/n.树枝<,>He lost a limb in the accident.<,>他在事故中失去了一条肢体。<,>The bird spread its limbs to fly.<,>鸟儿展开翅膀准备飞翔。<,>They were sitting on a thick limb of the oak tree.<,>他们坐在橡树的粗树枝上。<,>lim(界限)+b→身体的边界部分→肢体<,>limp(v.跛行/adj.柔软的)/lamb(n.羔羊)/limbo(n.不稳定状态)

highway<,>/ˈhaɪweɪ/<,>/ˈhaɪˌweɪ/<,>n.公路/n.大路<,>The highway connects the two major cities.<,>这条公路连接着两座大城市。<,>Traffic was heavy on the highway during the holiday.<,>假日期间公路交通十分拥挤。<,>They built a new highway to ease congestion.<,>他们新建了一条公路以缓解拥堵。<,>high(高的)+way(路)→高标准的路→公路<,>freeway(n.高速公路)/highland(n.高地)/hallway(n.门厅)

quite<,>/kwaɪt/<,>/kwaɪt/<,>adv.完全/adv.相当/adv.的确<,>I'm quite sure about my decision.<,>我对自己的决定十分确定。<,>The movie was quite interesting.<,>这部电影相当有趣。<,>It's quite a different story now.<,>现在情况完全不同了。<,>quit(停止)+e→完全停止→完全<,>quiet(adj.安静的)/quit(v.退出)/quote(v.引用)

disposal<,>/dɪˈspəʊzl/<,>/dɪˈspoʊzl/<,>n.丢掉/n.处理/n.销毁<,>The city has a waste disposal problem.<,>这个城市存在垃圾处理问题。<,>He has a large sum of money at his disposal.<,>他有一大笔钱可供支配。<,>Proper disposal of hazardous materials is important.<,>正确处理危险材料很重要。<,>dis(分开)+pos(放置)+al→分开放置→处理<,>proposal(n.建议)/dispose(v.处理)/depose(v.免职)

analyse<,>/ˈænəlaɪz/<,>/ˈænəˌlaɪz/<,>v.分析/v.分解/v.解析<,>Scientists will analyse the data carefully.<,>科学家们将仔细分析这些数据。<,>The chemist analysed the substance into its elements.<,>化学家把这种物质分解成元素。<,>We need to analyse the causes of failure.<,>我们需要分析失败的原因。<,>ana(向上)+lyse(松开)→向上松开→分解分析<,>analysis(n.分析)/analogy(n.类比)/analyst(n.分析师)

flight<,>/flaɪt/<,>/flaɪt/<,>n.航班/n.飞行/n.逃跑<,>Our flight was delayed by two hours.<,>我们的航班延误了两小时。<,>The bird took flight when it saw us.<,>鸟儿看到我们就飞走了。<,>The criminals took flight after the robbery.<,>罪犯们在抢劫后逃跑了。<,>fl(飞)+ight→飞行状态<,>fright(n.惊吓)/fleet(n.舰队)/flighty(adj.轻浮的)

consistent<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.坚持的/adj.一贯的<,>She has been consistent in her opinions.<,>她的观点始终如一。<,>His work shows consistent improvement.<,>他的工作显示出持续的进步。<,>We need a consistent approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要一个一贯的方法来解决这个问题。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)+ent→共同站立的→一致的<,>insistent(adj.坚持的)/persistent(adj.持久的)/resistant(adj.抵抗的)

repetition<,>/ˌrepəˈtɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛpəˈtɪʃən/<,>n.重复/n.反复<,>Repetition is the mother of learning.<,>重复是学习之母。<,>The song has too much repetition in the lyrics.<,>这首歌的歌词重复太多。<,>He learned the skill through constant repetition.<,>他通过不断重复学会了这项技能。<,>re(再)+pet(寻求)+ition→再次寻求→重复<,>competition(n.比赛)/petition(n.请愿)/appetite(n.食欲)
inform<,>/ɪnˈfɔːm/<,>/ɪnˈfɔːrm/<,>v.通知/v.向…报告<,>Please inform me of any changes in the schedule.<,>如有任何日程变动请通知我。<,>He informed the police about the accident.<,>他向警方报告了这起事故。<,>The teacher informed the students about the test results.<,>老师向学生们通报了考试成绩。<,>in(进入)+form(形式)→把内容放进形式里→通知<,>information(n.信息)/formal(adj.正式的)/perform(v.执行)

flat<,>/flæt/<,>/flæt/<,>adj.平的/adj.扁平的<,>The land here is very flat and good for farming.<,>这里的土地非常平坦，适合耕种。<,>She placed the book flat on the table.<,>她把书平放在桌子上。<,>He used a flat stone to skip across the water.<,>他用一块扁平的石头打水漂。<,>fl(飞)+at(在)→飞在平面上→平的<,>fat(adj.肥胖的)/flask(n.烧瓶)/flap(v.拍打)

idea<,>/aɪˈdɪə/<,>/aɪˈdiːə/<,>n.想法/n.思想/n.意见<,>That's a great idea for the project!<,>这个项目想法很棒！<,>He has some strange ideas about education.<,>他对教育有些奇怪的想法。<,>What's your idea about this proposal?<,>你对这个提议有什么意见？<,>ide(思想)+a→想法<,>ideal(adj.理想的)/idle(adj.空闲的)/identical(adj.相同的)

blue<,>/bluː/<,>/bluː/<,>adj.蓝色的/n.蓝色<,>She was wearing a beautiful blue dress.<,>她穿着一条漂亮的蓝色连衣裙。<,>The sky was a deep blue that afternoon.<,>那天下午天空是深蓝色的。<,>Blue is my favorite color.<,>蓝色是我最喜欢的颜色。<,>bl(布)+ue→布的颜色→蓝色<,>blew(v.吹，blow的过去式)/glue(n.胶水)/blur(v.模糊)

bridge<,>/brɪdʒ/<,>/brɪdʒ/<,>n.桥/n.桥梁/n.桥牌<,>They built a new bridge across the river.<,>他们在河上建了一座新桥。<,>Bridge is a popular card game among older people.<,>桥牌是老年人中流行的纸牌游戏。<,>The bridge connects the two parts of the city.<,>这座桥连接了城市的两部分。<,>bri(明亮)+dge(边缘)→明亮的边缘→桥<,>fridge(n.冰箱)/bride(n.新娘)/bribe(v.贿赂)

spare<,>/speə(r)/<,>/sper/<,>v.抽出/v.拨出/v.留出/v.匀出/adj.多余的<,>Can you spare me a few minutes?<,>你能抽出几分钟给我吗？<,>We have a spare room for guests.<,>我们有一间多余的客房。<,>She always spares some money for charity.<,>她总是留出一些钱做慈善。<,>sp(特别)+are(是)→特别的是多余的<,>spear(n.矛)/share(v.分享)/square(n.正方形)

anyone<,>/ˈeniwʌn/<,>/ˈeniwʌn/<,>pron.任何人<,>Is anyone home?<,>有人在家吗？<,>Anyone can learn to play the piano with practice.<,>任何人都可以通过练习学会弹钢琴。<,>Did anyone call while I was out?<,>我不在的时候有人打电话来吗？<,>any(任何)+one(一个人)→任何人<,>everyone(pron.每个人)/someone(pron.某人)/anybody(pron.任何人)

fault<,>/fɔːlt/<,>/fɔlt/<,>n.缺点/n.过失/n.故障<,>It's my fault that we're late.<,>我们迟到是我的错。<,>The car has an electrical fault.<,>这辆车有电路故障。<,>She has many good qualities despite her faults.<,>尽管有缺点，她仍有很多优点。<,>fa(做)+ult→做错→过失<,>default(n.违约/v.缺席)/vault(n.拱顶/v.跳跃)
