museum<,>/mjuːˈziːəm/<,>/mjuˈziəm/<,>n.博物馆/n.展览馆<,>We visited the British Museum during our trip to London.<,>我们在伦敦旅行期间参观了大英博物馆。<,>The museum has a large collection of ancient artifacts.<,>这个博物馆收藏了大量古代文物。<,>Children enjoy the interactive exhibits at the science museum.<,>孩子们喜欢科学博物馆的互动展品。<,>muse(缪斯)+um(场所)→缪斯女神的神殿→博物馆<,>mausoleum(n.陵墓)/amusement(n.娱乐)

coast<,>/kəʊst/<,>/koʊst/<,>n.海岸/n.海滨(地区)<,>We drove along the coast and enjoyed the ocean view.<,>我们沿着海岸开车，欣赏海景。<,>The hotel is located on the east coast of the island.<,>酒店位于岛屿的东海岸。<,>Many seabirds nest along this rocky coast.<,>许多海鸟在这片岩石海岸筑巢。<,>coat(外套)+s→像外套一样包围陆地→海岸<,>cost(n.成本/v.花费)/coastal(adj.沿海的)

diamond<,>/ˈdaɪəmənd/<,>/ˈdaɪəmənd/<,>n.金刚石/n.钻石/n.菱形<,>She received a diamond engagement ring.<,>她收到了一枚钻石订婚戒指。<,>The baseball field is shaped like a diamond.<,>棒球场呈菱形。<,>Diamond is the hardest known natural material.<,>金刚石是已知最硬的天然材料。<,>dia(穿过)+mond(世界)→穿越世界的坚硬物质→钻石<,>diamante(n.闪光装饰片)/diametrical(adj.直径的/完全相反的)

increasingly<,>/ɪnˈkriːsɪŋli/<,>/ɪnˈkrisɪŋli/<,>adv.日益/adv.越来越多地<,>The weather is becoming increasingly warm.<,>天气变得越来越暖和了。<,>She found it increasingly difficult to concentrate.<,>她发现越来越难以集中注意力。<,>Social media is playing an increasingly important role in marketing.<,>社交媒体在营销中扮演着越来越重要的角色。<,>increase(增加)+ing+ly→表示程度不断增加<,>decreasingly(adv.逐渐减少地)/incredibly(adv.难以置信地)

spill<,>/spɪl/<,>/spɪl/<,>v.使溢出<,>Be careful not to spill your coffee.<,>小心别把咖啡洒出来。<,>Oil spilled from the damaged tanker.<,>石油从受损的油轮中泄漏出来。<,>The child spilled milk all over the table.<,>孩子把牛奶洒得满桌都是。<,>s(加强)+pill(药丸)→像药丸一样滚落→溢出<,>spiel(n.流利夸张的演说)/spell(v.拼写/n.咒语)

comprehension<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhenʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhenʃn/<,>n.理解/n.理解力/n.领悟<,>The reading passage was beyond my comprehension.<,>这篇阅读文章超出了我的理解能力。<,>She nodded to show her comprehension of the instructions.<,>她点头表示理解了指示。<,>Listening comprehension is an important language skill.<,>听力理解是一项重要的语言技能。<,>com(完全)+prehend(抓住)+sion→完全抓住→理解<,>apprehension(n.忧虑/n.理解)/comprehensive(adj.全面的)

consciousness<,>/ˈkɒnʃəsnəs/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəsnəs/<,>n.意识/n.觉悟/n.知觉<,>He lost consciousness after the accident.<,>事故后他失去了知觉。<,>Environmental consciousness is growing worldwide.<,>全球范围内的环保意识正在增强。<,>She regained consciousness in the hospital.<,>她在医院恢复了意识。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+ous+ness→共同知道的状态→意识<,>conscience(n.良心)/subconscious(adj.潜意识的)

chest<,>/tʃest/<,>/tʃest/<,>n.胸腔/n.胸膛/n.箱子<,>He felt a sharp pain in his chest.<,>他感到胸部一阵剧痛。<,>The treasure was kept in a wooden chest.<,>财宝被保存在一个木箱里。<,>She crossed her arms over her chest.<,>她双臂交叉放在胸前。<,>che(车)+st(站)→车站的储物箱→箱子<,>cheese(n.奶酪)/chef(n.主厨)

otherwise<,>/ˈʌðəwaɪz/<,>/ˈʌðərwaɪz/<,>adv.否则/adv.要不然<,>Hurry up, otherwise we'll be late.<,>快点，否则我们要迟到了。<,>The evidence suggests otherwise.<,>证据表明情况并非如此。<,>She was tired but otherwise in good health.<,>她很疲倦，但除此之外健康状况良好。<,>other(其他)+wise(方式)→用其他方式→否则<,>likewise(adv.同样地)/otherwise(adj.另外的)
movement<,>/ˈmuːvmənt/<,>/ˈmuvmənt/<,>n.动作/n.活动/n.移动<,>She made a sudden movement with her hand.<,>她的手突然动了一下。<,>The movement of the train made me sleepy.<,>火车的移动让我昏昏欲睡。<,>He studies the movement of planets.<,>他研究行星的运动。<,>move(移动)+ment(名词后缀)→动作/移动<,>moment(n.瞬间)/momentum(n.动量)  

bowl<,>/bəʊl/<,>/boʊl/<,>n.碗/n.钵/n.碗状物<,>She filled the bowl with soup.<,>她往碗里盛满了汤。<,>The stadium is shaped like a giant bowl.<,>这个体育场形状像个巨大的碗。<,>He won the gold bowl in the competition.<,>他在比赛中赢得了金碗奖。<,>bow(弓)+l→形状像弓的容器→碗<,>bow(v.鞠躬)/bole(n.树干)  

bat<,>/bæt/<,>/bæt/<,>n.球拍/n.蝙蝠<,>He swung the bat and hit the ball.<,>他挥动球拍击中了球。<,>Bats use echolocation to navigate.<,>蝙蝠用回声定位来导航。<,>She's afraid of bats flying at night.<,>她害怕夜间飞行的蝙蝠。<,>b(形状)+at(在)→在击打的工具→球拍<,>bet(v.打赌)/bad(adj.坏的)  

somewhat<,>/ˈsʌmwɒt/<,>/ˈsʌmwʌt/<,>adv.有点<,>I'm somewhat tired after the long trip.<,>长途旅行后我有点累。<,>The results were somewhat surprising.<,>结果有点出人意料。<,>He looked somewhat confused.<,>他看起来有点困惑。<,>some(一些)+what(什么)→某种程度上→有点<,>somewhere(adv.某处)/somehow(adv.以某种方式)  

ancestor<,>/ˈænsestə(r)/<,>/ˈænˌsɛstər/<,>n.祖宗/n.祖先<,>My ancestors came from Ireland.<,>我的祖先来自爱尔兰。<,>This tradition has been passed down by our ancestors.<,>这个传统是我们的祖先传下来的。<,>We should respect our ancestors' wisdom.<,>我们应该尊重祖先的智慧。<,>an(向前)+cest(走)+or(人)→走在前面的人→祖先<,>ancestry(n.祖先)/ancient(adj.古代的)  

liberal<,>/ˈlɪbərəl/<,>/ˈlɪbərəl/<,>adj.心胸宽大的/adj.慷慨的<,>He has liberal views on social issues.<,>他对社会问题持开明观点。<,>She was liberal with her donations.<,>她捐款很慷慨。<,>A liberal amount of sauce was added.<,>加入了大量的酱汁。<,>liber(自由)+al(形容词后缀)→自由的→开明的<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literary(adj.文学的)  

far<,>/fɑː(r)/<,>/fɑr/<,>adj.远的/adv.远/adv.遥远<,>The mountains are far away.<,>群山远在天边。<,>How far is it to the nearest gas station?<,>最近的加油站有多远？<,>She has traveled far and wide.<,>她游历过很多地方。<,>f(飞翔)+ar(方向)→向远方飞→远的<,>fear(n.恐惧)/fare(n.费用)  

battle<,>/ˈbætl/<,>/ˈbætl/<,>n.战役/n.斗争/v.作战<,>The battle lasted for three days.<,>这场战役持续了三天。<,>They battled against the storm.<,>他们与暴风雨搏斗。<,>She's battling cancer bravely.<,>她正在勇敢地与癌症作斗争。<,>bat(打)+tle(反复)→反复打斗→战役<,>bottle(n.瓶子)/cattle(n.牛)  

tropical<,>/ˈtrɒpɪkl/<,>/ˈtrɑːpɪkl/<,>adj.热带的<,>Tropical fruits are my favorite.<,>热带水果是我的最爱。<,>They went on a tropical vacation.<,>他们去热带地区度假了。<,>The island has a tropical climate.<,>这个岛属于热带气候。<,>trop(转)+ical(形容词后缀)→太阳直射的区域→热带的<,>typical(adj.典型的)/topical(adj.局部的)  

molecule<,>/ˈmɒlɪkjuːl/<,>/ˈmɑːləkjuːl/<,>n.分子/n.克分子<,>Water is made up of hydrogen and oxygen molecules.<,>水由氢分子和氧分子组成。<,>This molecule has a complex structure.<,>这个分子结构复杂。<,>Scientists are studying the behavior of molecules.<,>科学家正在研究分子行为。<,>mole(块)+cule(小)→小块物质→分子<,>molar(adj.摩尔的)/molecular(adj.分子的)
general<,>/ˈdʒenrəl/<,>/ˈdʒɛnərəl/<,>adj.总的/adj.一般的/n.将军<,>The general opinion is that the plan will work.<,>普遍认为这个计划会奏效。<,>He was promoted to the rank of general.<,>他被提升为将军。<,>She has a general idea of how to proceed.<,>她对如何进行有一个大致的想法。<,>gen(产生)+eral→产生一切的→总的<,>generic(adj.一般的)/generate(v.产生)/generous(adj.慷慨的)

gentle<,>/ˈdʒentl/<,>/ˈdʒɛntl/<,>adj.和蔼的/adj.轻柔的<,>She spoke in a gentle voice to the child.<,>她用温柔的声音对孩子说话。<,>The gentle breeze felt refreshing.<,>轻柔的微风让人感到清爽。<,>He has a gentle manner with animals.<,>他对动物态度温和。<,>gen(出生)+tle→天生温和的→和蔼的<,>gentleman(n.绅士)/genteel(adj.文雅的)/genial(adj.友好的)

motion<,>/ˈməʊʃn/<,>/ˈmoʊʃən/<,>n.运动/n.手势/n.提议<,>The motion of the boat made her feel sick.<,>船的晃动让她感到恶心。<,>He made a motion to call the meeting to order.<,>他提议会议开始。<,>She used hand motions to explain the concept.<,>她用手势来解释这个概念。<,>mot(移动)+ion→运动<,>emotion(n.情绪)/promotion(n.晋升)/motivate(v.激励)

however<,>/haʊˈevə(r)/<,>/haʊˈɛvər/<,>adv.然而/adv.不管怎样<,>However, we must consider the costs first.<,>然而，我们必须先考虑成本。<,>You can dress however you like for the party.<,>你可以随意穿什么去参加派对。<,>However hard he tried, he couldn't solve the problem.<,>无论他多么努力，都无法解决这个问题。<,>how(如何)+ever(曾经)→不管怎样<,>whatever(pron.无论什么)/whenever(conj.无论何时)/whoever(pron.无论谁)

float<,>/fləʊt/<,>/floʊt/<,>v.漂浮/v.使漂浮<,>The leaf floated on the surface of the water.<,>树叶漂浮在水面上。<,>They floated the idea of a company picnic.<,>他们提出了公司野餐的想法。<,>The balloon floated up into the sky.<,>气球飘向天空。<,>fl(流动)+oat(船)→漂浮<,>flood(n.洪水)/fleet(n.舰队)/flour(n.面粉)

adjust<,>/əˈdʒʌst/<,>/əˈdʒʌst/<,>v.调整/v.调节<,>It took time to adjust to the new time zone.<,>适应新时区需要时间。<,>Can you adjust the volume, please?<,>你能调节一下音量吗？<,>She adjusted her glasses before speaking.<,>她在说话前调整了一下眼镜。<,>ad(加强)+just(正确)→使正确→调整<,>adjoin(v.毗邻)/adjourn(v.休会)/adjudge(v.判决)

drama<,>/ˈdrɑːmə/<,>/ˈdrɑmə/<,>n.戏剧<,>She studied drama at university.<,>她在大学学习戏剧。<,>The play was a historical drama.<,>这部戏是一部历史剧。<,>There's too much drama in their relationship.<,>他们的关系中有太多戏剧性。<,>dra(做)+ma→表演→戏剧<,>dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)/dramatist(n.剧作家)/dramatize(v.戏剧化)

circular<,>/ˈsɜːkjələ(r)/<,>/ˈsɜrkjələr/<,>adj.圆的/adj.循环的<,>The table has a circular shape.<,>这张桌子是圆形的。<,>We received a circular email about the policy change.<,>我们收到了一封关于政策变更的群发邮件。<,>The argument became circular and unproductive.<,>争论变得循环往复且没有结果。<,>circ(圆)+ular→圆的<,>circle(n.圆)/circulate(v.循环)/circuit(n.电路)

financial<,>/faɪˈnænʃl/<,>/fəˈnænʃəl/<,>adj.财政的/adj.金融的<,>He works in the financial sector.<,>他在金融行业工作。<,>The company is in financial difficulty.<,>公司面临财务困难。<,>They need financial advice for retirement planning.<,>他们需要退休规划的财务建议。<,>fin(结束)+ancial→与钱有关的→金融的<,>finance(n.金融)/financier(n.金融家)/fine(adj.好的)

above<,>/əˈbʌv/<,>/əˈbʌv/<,>prep.在...上面/prep.高于<,>The picture hangs above the fireplace.<,>画挂在壁炉上方。<,>Temperatures were above average this summer.<,>今年夏天的气温高于平均水平。<,>Her performance was above expectations.<,>她的表现超出了预期。<,>a(在)+bove(上方)→在上面<,>below(prep.在...下面)/about(adv.大约)/abound(v.大量存在)
enthusiastic<,>/ɪnˌθjuːziˈæstɪk/<,>/ɪnˌθuːziˈæstɪk/<,>adj.热情的/adj.热心的<,>She is very enthusiastic about the new project.<,>她对那个新项目非常热心。<,>His enthusiastic speech inspired everyone.<,>他热情的演讲鼓舞了每个人。<,>The children gave an enthusiastic response to the idea.<,>孩子们对这个想法反应热烈。<,>en(使)+thus(神)+iastic→像神一样充满热情→热情的<,>enthusiasm(n.热情)/pessimistic(adj.悲观的)

landlord<,>/ˈlændlɔːd/<,>/ˈlændlɔːrd/<,>n.地主/n.房东/n.店主<,>The landlord raised the rent again.<,>房东又涨房租了。<,>He is the landlord of this pub.<,>他是这家酒吧的店主。<,>In feudal times, landlords had great power.<,>在封建时代，地主有很大的权力。<,>land(土地)+lord(主人)→土地的主人→地主<,>landlady(n.女房东)/tenant(n.房客)

volcano<,>/vɒlˈkeɪnəʊ/<,>/vɑːlˈkeɪnoʊ/<,>n.火山<,>The volcano erupted last night.<,>那座火山昨晚喷发了。<,>They live near an active volcano.<,>他们住在一座活火山附近。<,>Volcanic ash covered the town.<,>火山灰覆盖了整个小镇。<,>volcan(火神Vulcan)+o→火山<,>volcanic(adj.火山的)/earthquake(n.地震)

convey<,>/kənˈveɪ/<,>/kənˈveɪ/<,>v.传送/v.运送<,>The pipes convey water to the fields.<,>这些管道把水输送到田里。<,>Words cannot convey my gratitude.<,>言语无法表达我的感激之情。<,>This train conveys passengers to the airport.<,>这列火车运送乘客去机场。<,>con(共同)+vey(路)→共同上路→运送<,>convoy(n.护送队)/survey(v.调查)

hard<,>/hɑːd/<,>/hɑːrd/<,>adj.硬的/adj.困难的<,>The bread is too hard to eat.<,>面包太硬了，没法吃。<,>This is a hard question to answer.<,>这是个很难回答的问题。<,>He works hard every day.<,>他每天努力工作。<,>hard(坚硬的)→引申为困难的<,>hardly(adv.几乎不)/harden(v.变硬)

microphone<,>/ˈmaɪkrəfəʊn/<,>/ˈmaɪkrəfoʊn/<,>n.话筒/n.麦克风<,>Please speak into the microphone.<,>请对着麦克风说话。<,>The singer dropped the microphone.<,>歌手把麦克风掉地上了。<,>We need to buy a new microphone.<,>我们需要买个新话筒。<,>micro(微小)+phone(声音)→把微小声音放大的设备→麦克风<,>megaphone(n.扩音器)/telephone(n.电话)

proud<,>/praʊd/<,>/praʊd/<,>adj.骄傲的/adj.自负的〔含贬义〕/adj.自豪的<,>She is too proud to admit her mistake.<,>她太骄傲了，不肯承认错误。<,>They are proud of their son's achievement.<,>他们为儿子的成就感到自豪。<,>His proud manner annoys people.<,>他傲慢的态度让人讨厌。<,>pr(向前)+oud(大声)→昂首挺胸→骄傲的<,>pride(n.骄傲)/arrogant(adj.傲慢的)

gently<,>/ˈdʒentli/<,>/ˈdʒentli/<,>adv.有礼貌地/adv.柔和地<,>She spoke gently to the child.<,>她温柔地对孩子说话。<,>The wind blew gently through the trees.<,>风轻柔地吹过树林。<,>Handle the glass gently.<,>轻拿轻放这个玻璃杯。<,>gent(温和的)+ly(副词后缀)→柔和地<,>gentle(adj.温和的)/roughly(adv.粗暴地)

curl<,>/kɜːl/<,>/kɜːrl/<,>n.卷毛/n.螺旋/v.卷曲<,>Her hair has natural curls.<,>她的头发有自然的卷曲。<,>The smoke curled upwards.<,>烟雾盘旋上升。<,>He curled his lip in disdain.<,>他不屑地撇了撇嘴。<,>curl(卷曲)→形状像字母C<,>curly(adj.卷曲的)/coil(v.盘绕)

gloomy<,>/ˈɡluːmi/<,>/ˈɡluːmi/<,>adj.黑暗的/adj.令人沮丧的<,>It's a gloomy winter day.<,>这是个阴暗的冬日。<,>The news put him in a gloomy mood.<,>这个消息让他心情沮丧。<,>The room was dark and gloomy.<,>房间又暗又阴森。<,>gloom(阴暗)+y(形容词后缀)→黑暗的<,>bloom(v.开花)/doom(n.厄运)
flavour<,>/ˈfleɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈfleɪvər/<,>n.味/n.味道/n.风味<,>This dish has a unique flavour.<,>这道菜有一种独特的味道。<,>She added some herbs to enhance the flavour.<,>她加了一些香草来提升风味。<,>The flavour of the soup is too strong.<,>这汤的味道太浓了。<,>flav(味道)+our(名词后缀)→味道<,>favor(n.恩惠/v.偏爱)/savor(v.品尝/n.滋味)

loud<,>/laʊd/<,>/laʊd/<,>adj.响亮的/adj.吵闹的<,>The music is too loud.<,>音乐太吵了。<,>He spoke in a loud voice.<,>他大声说话。<,>She gave a loud laugh.<,>她大声笑了。<,>lou(响亮)+d(形容词后缀)→响亮的<,>cloud(n.云)/proud(adj.骄傲的)

manner<,>/ˈmænə(r)/<,>/ˈmænər/<,>n.方式/n.态度/n.礼貌<,>He has a polite manner.<,>他态度礼貌。<,>She spoke in a friendly manner.<,>她以友好的方式说话。<,>It's bad manners to interrupt others.<,>打断别人是不礼貌的。<,>man(手)+ner(名词后缀)→用手做事的方式→方式<,>manor(n.庄园)/mannerism(n.特殊习惯)

psychological<,>/ˌsaɪkəˈlɒdʒɪkl/<,>/ˌsaɪkəˈlɑːdʒɪkl/<,>adj.心理的/adj.心理学的<,>He has psychological problems.<,>他有心理问题。<,>This is a psychological test.<,>这是一个心理测试。<,>She studies psychological theories.<,>她研究心理学理论。<,>psycho(心理)+logical(学科的)→心理学的<,>physiological(adj.生理的)/psychiatric(adj.精神病的)

passive<,>/ˈpæsɪv/<,>/ˈpæsɪv/<,>adj.被动的/adj.消极的<,>He has a passive attitude.<,>他态度消极。<,>She remained passive during the discussion.<,>她在讨论中保持被动。<,>The verb is in the passive voice.<,>这个动词是被动语态。<,>pass(忍受)+ive(形容词后缀)→被动忍受的→被动的<,>active(adj.积极的)/passion(n.激情)

tender<,>/ˈtendə(r)/<,>/ˈtendər/<,>adj.嫩的/adj.脆弱的<,>The meat is very tender.<,>这肉很嫩。<,>She has a tender heart.<,>她心肠软。<,>He gave her a tender look.<,>他温柔地看了她一眼。<,>tend(照料)+er(形容词后缀)→需要照料的→脆弱的<,>tend(v.倾向于)/render(v.提供)

dry<,>/draɪ/<,>/draɪ/<,>adj.干的/adj.干燥的<,>The clothes are dry now.<,>衣服现在干了。<,>She has dry skin.<,>她皮肤干燥。<,>The lecture was very dry.<,>这个讲座很枯燥。<,>dr(干燥)+y(形容词后缀)→干燥的<,>try(v.尝试)/cry(v.哭泣)

mute<,>/mjuːt/<,>/mjuːt/<,>adj.缄默的/n.哑巴<,>He remained mute during the meeting.<,>他在会议中保持沉默。<,>She is a mute girl.<,>她是个哑巴女孩。<,>He pressed the mute button.<,>他按了静音键。<,>mut(改变)+e→改变声音→静音的<,>mutt(n.杂种狗)/muse(v.沉思)

dorm<,>/dɔːm/<,>/dɔːrm/<,>n.宿舍<,>He lives in a college dorm.<,>他住在大学宿舍。<,>The dorm is very noisy at night.<,>宿舍晚上很吵。<,>She decorated her dorm room.<,>她装饰了她的宿舍房间。<,>dorm(睡眠)+itory(场所)→睡觉的场所→宿舍<,>dormant(adj.休眠的)/dormer(n.天窗)

discard<,>/dɪsˈkɑːd/<,>/dɪsˈkɑːrd/<,>v.丢弃/v.抛弃/v.遗弃<,>He discarded the old clothes.<,>他丢弃了旧衣服。<,>She discarded her bad habits.<,>她改掉了坏习惯。<,>Don't discard useful things.<,>不要丢弃有用的东西。<,>dis(不)+card(纸牌)→不用的牌→丢弃<,>disregard(v.忽视)/discern(v.辨别)
change<,>/tʃeɪndʒ/<,>/tʃeɪndʒ/<,>n.改变/n.变化/n.零钱<,>The weather can change quickly in the mountains.<,>山里的天气变化很快。<,>Do you have change for a twenty-dollar bill?<,>你能把20美元换成零钱吗？<,>She decided to make a big change in her life.<,>她决定在生活中做出重大改变。<,>ch(改变)+ange(状态)→改变的状态<,>charge(v.收费/n.指控)/exchange(v.交换/n.交易所)  

outstanding<,>/aʊtˈstændɪŋ/<,>/aʊtˈstændɪŋ/<,>adj.突出的/adj.杰出的<,>She did an outstanding job on the project.<,>她在这个项目上表现非常出色。<,>The company has some outstanding debts.<,>公司还有一些未偿还的债务。<,>His performance was outstanding among all the candidates.<,>在所有候选人中他的表现最为突出。<,>out(超出)+stand(站立)+ing→站在众人之上→杰出的<,>understand(v.理解)/standout(n.杰出的人)  

distress<,>/dɪˈstres/<,>/dɪˈstres/<,>n.忧虑/n.悲伤<,>The news caused her great distress.<,>这个消息让她非常忧虑。<,>The ship sent out a distress signal.<,>那艘船发出了求救信号。<,>He was in obvious distress after the accident.<,>事故后他明显很悲伤。<,>dis(分开)+stress(压力)→被压力分开→忧虑<,>stress(n.压力)/depress(v.使沮丧)  

wear<,>/weə(r)/<,>/wer/<,>v.磨损<,>These shoes are starting to wear out.<,>这双鞋开始磨损了。<,>She wears her hair long.<,>她留着长发。<,>The constant friction will wear the surface smooth.<,>持续的摩擦会使表面变得光滑。<,>wear(穿)→穿久了会磨损<,>ware(n.商品)/weary(adj.疲倦的)  

relate<,>/rɪˈleɪt/<,>/rɪˈleɪt/<,>v.使联系/v.叙述<,>Can you relate what happened yesterday?<,>你能叙述一下昨天发生的事情吗？<,>The study relates smoking to lung cancer.<,>这项研究将吸烟与肺癌联系起来。<,>I can't relate to his way of thinking.<,>我无法理解他的思维方式。<,>re(再)+late(带来)→再次带来→联系<,>relative(adj.相对的)/relationship(n.关系)  

undergo<,>/ˌʌndəˈɡəʊ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈɡoʊ/<,>v.经历/v.经受/v.忍受<,>He had to undergo surgery last week.<,>他上周不得不接受手术。<,>The building is undergoing renovations.<,>这栋建筑正在进行翻修。<,>She underwent great hardship during the war.<,>战争期间她经历了巨大的苦难。<,>under(在...下)+go(走)→在下面走→经历<,>underground(adj.地下的)/undergraduate(n.本科生)  

radioactive<,>/ˌreɪdiəʊˈæktɪv/<,>/ˌreɪdioʊˈæktɪv/<,>adj.放射性的<,>Radioactive materials must be handled carefully.<,>放射性物质必须小心处理。<,>The area was contaminated by radioactive waste.<,>该地区被放射性废物污染了。<,>Uranium is a naturally radioactive element.<,>铀是一种天然放射性元素。<,>radio(射线)+active(活跃的)→放射性的<,>radiation(n.辐射)/radioactivity(n.放射性)  

geography<,>/dʒiˈɒɡrəfi/<,>/dʒiˈɑːɡrəfi/<,>n.地理/n.地理学<,>Geography was my favorite subject in school.<,>地理是我在学校最喜欢的科目。<,>The geography of this region is very complex.<,>这个地区的地理非常复杂。<,>He specializes in human geography.<,>他专攻人文地理学。<,>geo(地球)+graphy(写)→写地球→地理学<,>geology(n.地质学)/geometry(n.几何学)  

his<,>/hɪz/<,>/hɪz/<,>pron.他的/pron.他的东西<,>This is his book.<,>这是他的书。<,>His opinion differs from mine.<,>他的观点和我的不同。<,>The decision is his to make.<,>这个决定由他来做。<,>he(他)+'s→他的<,>her(pron.她的)/him(pron.他)  

probable<,>/ˈprɒbəbl/<,>/ˈprɑːbəbl/<,>adj.很可能的/adj.大概的<,>It's probable that it will rain tomorrow.<,>明天很可能会下雨。<,>The probable cause of the accident was human error.<,>事故的可能原因是人为失误。<,>He is the probable winner of the competition.<,>他很可能是比赛的获胜者。<,>prob(测试)+able(能...的)→能通过测试的→很可能的<,>possible(adj.可能的)/probability(n.可能性)
aware<,>/əˈweə(r)/<,>/əˈwer/<,>adj.知道的/adj.意识到的<,>She was aware of the risks involved.<,>她意识到了其中的风险。<,>He became aware of a strange noise.<,>他开始注意到一个奇怪的声音。<,>Are you aware of the time?<,>你知道现在几点了吗？<,>a(加强)+ware(注意)→注意到的<,>beware(v.当心)/unaware(adj.未意识到的)

central<,>/ˈsentrəl/<,>/ˈsentrəl/<,>adj.中心的/adj.主要的<,>The hotel is in a central location.<,>这家酒店位于中心位置。<,>This is a central issue in the debate.<,>这是辩论中的核心问题。<,>The central character in the novel is very complex.<,>小说中的主要角色非常复杂。<,>centr(中心)+al(形容词后缀)→中心的<,>centric(adj.中心的)/centralize(v.集中)

ownership<,>/ˈəʊnəʃɪp/<,>/ˈoʊnərʃɪp/<,>n.所有(权)/n.所有制<,>The ownership of the land is disputed.<,>这块土地的所有权存在争议。<,>He took ownership of the project.<,>他承担了这个项目的责任。<,>Private ownership is protected by law.<,>私有制受法律保护。<,>owner(所有者)+ship(状态)→所有权<,>partnership(n.合伙关系)/leadership(n.领导权)

household<,>/ˈhaʊshəʊld/<,>/ˈhaʊshoʊld/<,>n.家庭/n.户/n.家务<,>There are four people in our household.<,>我们家有四口人。<,>Household chores can be tiring.<,>家务活可能很累人。<,>This is a common household item.<,>这是常见的家庭用品。<,>house(房子)+hold(持有)→家庭<,>housewife(n.家庭主妇)/housework(n.家务)

site<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>n.地点/n.地基/n.场所<,>This is the site of the ancient city.<,>这里是古城的遗址。<,>They chose a site for the new school.<,>他们为新学校选好了地点。<,>The construction site is very busy.<,>建筑工地非常忙碌。<,>sit(坐)+e→坐落的地方→地点<,>cite(v.引用)/sight(n.视力)

nine<,>/naɪn/<,>/naɪn/<,>num.九/num.九个<,>She has nine cats.<,>她有九只猫。<,>The meeting is at nine o'clock.<,>会议在九点举行。<,>I'll be back in nine days.<,>我九天后回来。<,>与"night"(夜晚)发音相似，但意思不同<,>nineteen(num.十九)/ninety(num.九十)

voyage<,>/ˈvɔɪɪdʒ/<,>/ˈvɔɪɪdʒ/<,>n.航海/n.航空/v.航海/v.航行<,>They embarked on a long voyage.<,>他们开始了一次长途航行。<,>The voyage to Mars will take months.<,>前往火星的航行需要数月时间。<,>He voyaged around the world.<,>他进行了环球航行。<,>voy(路)+age(行为)→航行<,>voyager(n.航行者)/voyeur(n.偷窥者)

expensive<,>/ɪkˈspensɪv/<,>/ɪkˈspensɪv/<,>adj.昂贵的/adj.花钱多的<,>This watch is too expensive for me.<,>这块手表对我来说太贵了。<,>Living in the city is expensive.<,>在城市生活很花钱。<,>She bought an expensive dress.<,>她买了一件昂贵的连衣裙。<,>ex(出)+pens(花费)+ive→要花很多钱的<,>expend(v.花费)/extensive(adj.广泛的)

provide<,>/prəˈvaɪd/<,>/prəˈvaɪd/<,>v.提供/v.装备/v.供给<,>The school provides free lunch.<,>学校提供免费午餐。<,>Can you provide more details?<,>你能提供更多细节吗？<,>The hotel provides towels and soap.<,>酒店提供毛巾和肥皂。<,>pro(向前)+vide(看)→提前看到需求而提供<,>provision(n.供应)/provided(conj.假如)

before<,>/bɪˈfɔː(r)/<,>/bɪˈfɔːr/<,>prep.在...以前<,>Please arrive before 8 o'clock.<,>请在8点前到达。<,>Think before you speak.<,>三思而后言。<,>I've never seen this before.<,>我以前从未见过这个。<,>be(在)+fore(前面)→在前面→在...之前<,>afore(prep.在...前)/beforehand(adv.事先)
empty<,>/ˈempti/<,>/ˈɛmpti/<,>adj.空的/adj.空洞的<,>The room was completely empty.<,>这个房间完全是空的。<,>His promises were empty words.<,>他的承诺都是空话。<,>She felt empty after the breakup.<,>分手后她感到空虚。<,>em(出)+pty(倒)→倒出→空的<,>ample(adj.充足的)/emptor(n.买主)  

heat<,>/hiːt/<,>/hit/<,>n.热/n.炎热/v.变热<,>The heat of the sun was unbearable.<,>太阳的热度让人难以忍受。<,>She heated the soup on the stove.<,>她在炉子上热汤。<,>Metal expands when heated.<,>金属受热会膨胀。<,>h(火)+eat(吃)→火在"吃"东西→产生热<,>heal(v.治愈)/heel(n.脚后跟)  

professional<,>/prəˈfeʃənl/<,>/prəˈfɛʃənl/<,>adj.职业的/n.专业人员<,>He is a professional photographer.<,>他是专业摄影师。<,>She behaved in a very professional manner.<,>她表现得非常专业。<,>The team hired a professional to fix the problem.<,>团队雇了专业人员来解决问题。<,>profess(声称)+ion(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→声称有技能的→专业的<,>professor(n.教授)/proficient(adj.精通的)  

Canadian<,>/kəˈneɪdiən/<,>/kəˈneɪdiən/<,>adj.加拿大的<,>She is a Canadian citizen.<,>她是加拿大公民。<,>Canadian maple syrup is famous worldwide.<,>加拿大枫糖浆世界闻名。<,>We visited the Canadian Rockies last summer.<,>去年夏天我们游览了加拿大落基山脉。<,>Canada(加拿大)+ian(形容词后缀)→加拿大的<,>America(n.美国)/Australian(adj.澳大利亚的)  

beam<,>/biːm/<,>/bim/<,>n.梁/n.横梁/n.束，柱<,>The wooden beams support the roof.<,>木梁支撑着屋顶。<,>A beam of sunlight entered the room.<,>一束阳光照进房间。<,>The lighthouse sends out powerful beams at night.<,>灯塔在夜间发出强光束。<,>b(形似梁的形状)+eam→横梁<,>bean(n.豆子)/seam(n.接缝)  

last<,>/lɑːst/<,>/læst/<,>adj.最后的/adv.最后<,>This is my last warning.<,>这是我最后的警告。<,>He arrived last at the meeting.<,>他最后一个到会。<,>The movie lasted three hours.<,>这部电影持续了三小时。<,>las(持续)+t→持续到最后→最后的<,>late(adj.迟的)/lost(adj.丢失的)  

cause<,>/kɔːz/<,>/kɔz/<,>n.原因/n.理由/n.事业<,>What was the cause of the accident?<,>事故的原因是什么？<,>She fights for a good cause.<,>她为正义事业而战。<,>Smoking can cause lung cancer.<,>吸烟会导致肺癌。<,>cau(注意)+se→需要注意的东西→原因<,>course(n.课程)/coarse(adj.粗糙的)  

reluctant<,>/rɪˈlʌktənt/<,>/rɪˈlʌktənt/<,>adj.不愿的/adj.勉强的<,>He was reluctant to admit his mistake.<,>他不愿承认错误。<,>She gave a reluctant smile.<,>她勉强笑了笑。<,>They were reluctant participants in the project.<,>他们是勉强参与这个项目的。<,>re(反)+luct(斗争)+ant→反着斗争的→不愿意的<,>resultant(adj.作为结果的)/relent(v.变温和)  

exclaim<,>/ɪkˈskleɪm/<,>/ɪkˈsklem/<,>v.呼喊/v.惊叫<,>"Look out!" she exclaimed.<,>"小心！"她喊道。<,>He exclaimed in surprise when he saw the gift.<,>看到礼物时他惊讶地叫了起来。<,>The children exclaimed with delight at the fireworks.<,>孩子们看到烟花高兴地大叫。<,>ex(出)+claim(喊)→喊出来→呼喊<,>proclaim(v.宣布)/acclaim(v.欢呼)  

breed<,>/briːd/<,>/brid/<,>n.品种/v.使繁殖<,>This is a rare breed of dog.<,>这是一种稀有犬种。<,>Rabbits breed quickly.<,>兔子繁殖很快。<,>The farm breeds high-quality cattle.<,>这个农场培育优质牛种。<,>b(形似怀孕的肚子)+reed(芦苇)→在芦苇中繁殖<,>bleed(v.流血)/bread(n.面包)
keeper<,>/ˈkiːpə(r)/<,>/ˈkiːpər/<,>n.饲养员/n.看护人<,>The zoo keeper feeds the animals every morning.<,>动物园饲养员每天早上给动物喂食。<,>She is the keeper of the family traditions.<,>她是家族传统的守护者。<,>The lighthouse keeper warned ships of the dangerous rocks.<,>灯塔看守人警告船只注意危险的礁石。<,>keep(保持)+er(人)→保持事物的人→看护人<,>keeper(n.看护人)/keeper(n.监护人)/keeper(n.管理人)

mouth<,>/maʊθ/<,>/maʊθ/<,>n.嘴/n.口/n.口腔<,>She covered her mouth when she coughed.<,>她咳嗽时捂住了嘴。<,>The river mouth is where the water meets the sea.<,>河口是河水与海水交汇的地方。<,>Don't speak with your mouth full.<,>嘴里有食物时不要说话。<,>mou(发音似"猫")+th(发音似"嘶")→猫嘶叫要用嘴<,>mouth(n.嘴)/mouse(n.老鼠)/month(n.月份)

camel<,>/ˈkæml/<,>/ˈkæməl/<,>n.骆驼<,>The camel can go for days without water.<,>骆驼可以几天不喝水。<,>We rode camels across the desert.<,>我们骑着骆驼穿越沙漠。<,>A camel's hump stores fat, not water.<,>骆驼的驼峰储存的是脂肪，不是水。<,>ca(拼音"擦")+mel(联想"蜜")→骆驼擦蜜→沙漠之舟<,>camel(n.骆驼)/camera(n.照相机)/cancel(v.取消)

hell<,>/hel/<,>/hɛl/<,>n.地狱/n.极大的痛苦<,>He went through hell during the war.<,>他在战争中经历了极大的痛苦。<,>Some people believe bad souls go to hell.<,>有些人认为恶灵会下地狱。<,>This traffic is absolute hell!<,>这交通简直是地狱！<,>hell(发音似"黑哦")→黑暗的地方→地狱<,>hell(n.地狱)/hall(n.大厅)/hill(n.小山)

fourth<,>/fɔːθ/<,>/fɔrθ/<,>pron.第四/n.四分之一<,>He finished fourth in the race.<,>他在比赛中获得第四名。<,>A quarter is one fourth of a dollar.<,>25美分是一美元的四分之一。<,>Our office is on the fourth floor.<,>我们的办公室在四楼。<,>four(四)+th(序数词后缀)→第四<,>fourth(第四)/forth(向前)/fort(堡垒)

March<,>/mɑːtʃ/<,>/mɑrtʃ/<,>n.三月<,>My birthday is in March.<,>我的生日在三月份。<,>March is the third month of the year.<,>三月是一年中的第三个月份。<,>The flowers start blooming in March.<,>花朵在三月份开始绽放。<,>Mar(火星)+ch→古罗马战神月→三月<,>March(n.三月)/march(v.行军)/match(n.比赛)

entrance<,>/ˈentrəns/<,>/ˈɛntrəns/<,>n.入口/n.门口/n.进入<,>Please use the main entrance.<,>请使用主入口。<,>Her entrance made everyone turn their heads.<,>她的入场让所有人都转过头来。<,>There's a fee for entrance to the museum.<,>博物馆入场需要收费。<,>en(进入)+trance(恍惚)→进入恍惚状态→进入<,>entrance(n.入口)/exit(n.出口)/entry(n.进入)

essential<,>/ɪˈsenʃl/<,>/ɪˈsɛnʃəl/<,>adj.必要的/adj.本质的<,>Water is essential for life.<,>水是生命必不可少的。<,>The essential difference is their approach.<,>本质区别在于他们的方法。<,>It's essential to arrive on time.<,>准时到达非常重要。<,>es(出)+sent(感觉)+ial→感觉出来的→本质的<,>essential(必要的)/necessary(必需的)/fundamental(基本的)

consider<,>/kənˈsɪdə(r)/<,>/kənˈsɪdər/<,>v.考虑/v.认为/v.关心<,>Please consider my proposal carefully.<,>请仔细考虑我的提议。<,>I consider him my best friend.<,>我把他看作我最好的朋友。<,>We must consider the environmental impact.<,>我们必须考虑环境影响。<,>con(共同)+sider(星星)→古代观星象→考虑<,>consider(考虑)/ponder(沉思)/contemplate(深思)

compress<,>/kəmˈpres/<,>/kəmˈprɛs/<,>v.压紧/v.压缩<,>Compress the file before sending it.<,>发送前先压缩文件。<,>She compressed her clothes to fit more in the suitcase.<,>她把衣服压紧以便在行李箱里装更多。<,>The machine compresses air into liquid.<,>这台机器把空气压缩成液体。<,>com(共同)+press(压)→一起压→压缩<,>compress(压缩)/condense(浓缩)/compact(压紧)
brow<,>/braʊ/<,>/braʊ/<,>n.额/n.眉/n.眉毛<,>She wiped the sweat from her brow.<,>她擦去额头上的汗水。<,>His brows furrowed in concentration.<,>他皱着眉头全神贯注。<,>The actor raised his brows in surprise.<,>演员惊讶地扬起了眉毛。<,>br(联想: bridge)+ow(联想: low)→眉毛像低垂的桥<,>blow(v.吹/n.打击)/brown(adj.棕色的)/bow(v.鞠躬/n.弓)

sound<,>/saʊnd/<,>/saʊnd/<,>adj.健康的/adj.完好的<,>The old bridge is still sound after decades.<,>这座老桥几十年后依然完好无损。<,>She has a sound mind and body.<,>她身心都很健康。<,>The advice he gave was sound and practical.<,>他给出的建议既合理又实用。<,>s(联想: strong)+ound(联想: round)→强壮的、圆满的→健康的<,>wound(n.伤口/v.伤害)/found(v.建立)/bound(adj.必定的)

recall<,>/rɪˈkɔːl/<,>/rɪˈkɔl/<,>v.回想/v.叫回/v.收回<,>I can't recall where I put my keys.<,>我想不起来把钥匙放哪了。<,>The company recalled the defective products.<,>公司召回了有缺陷的产品。<,>He was recalled to active military duty.<,>他被召回服现役。<,>re(重新)+call(叫)→重新叫回来→召回<,>recollect(v.回忆)/recount(v.详细叙述)/recede(v.后退)

scarcely<,>/ˈskeəsli/<,>/ˈskɛrsli/<,>adv.几乎不/adv.仅仅<,>I had scarcely finished when the phone rang.<,>我刚做完电话就响了。<,>There was scarcely any food left in the fridge.<,>冰箱里几乎没剩什么食物了。<,>He was scarcely able to walk after the accident.<,>事故后他几乎不能走路。<,>scar(伤疤)+ce(联想: see)+ly→伤疤几乎看不见→几乎不<,>scare(v.惊吓)/scarce(adj.稀少的)/scarcity(n.缺乏)

secure<,>/sɪˈkjʊə(r)/<,>/sɪˈkjʊr/<,>adj.安心的/adj.安全的<,>Make sure the windows are secure before leaving.<,>离开前确保窗户都关好了。<,>She felt secure in her new job.<,>她对新工作感到很安心。<,>The vault is highly secure against theft.<,>这个金库防盗措施非常安全。<,>se(分开)+cure(治愈)→分开治愈→确保安全<,>sure(adj.确定的)/rescue(v.救援)/obscure(adj.模糊的)

mayor<,>/meə(r)/<,>/ˈmeɪər/<,>n.市长<,>The mayor cut the ribbon at the opening ceremony.<,>市长在开幕式上剪彩。<,>Our new mayor has many plans for the city.<,>我们的新市长对城市有很多规划。<,>The mayor addressed the crowd at the town square.<,>市长在镇广场向人群发表讲话。<,>may(可能)+or(人)→可能是城市最重要的人<,>major(adj.主要的)/minor(adj.次要的)/manor(n.庄园)

most<,>/məʊst/<,>/moʊst/<,>det,pron.最多的/adv.最/adv.很<,>This is the most beautiful sunset I've ever seen.<,>这是我见过最美的日落。<,>Most people agree with the new policy.<,>大多数人同意新政策。<,>She was most kind to help us.<,>她非常友善地帮助了我们。<,>mo(联想: more)+st(最高级)→更多的最高级→最多<,>must(aux.必须)/moist(adj.潮湿的)/host(n.主人)

connection<,>/kəˈnekʃn/<,>/kəˈnɛkʃən/<,>n.连接/n.联系<,>There's a strong connection between diet and health.<,>饮食和健康之间有密切联系。<,>My internet connection is very slow today.<,>今天我的网络连接很慢。<,>She has good connections in the industry.<,>她在业内人脉很广。<,>con(共同)+nect(连接)+ion→共同连接→联系<,>collection(n.收藏)/correction(n.改正)/convection(n.对流)

nature<,>/ˈneɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈneɪtʃər/<,>n.大自然/n.本性/n.性质<,>We should protect the beauty of nature.<,>我们应该保护大自然的美丽。<,>It's not in his nature to be cruel.<,>残忍不是他的本性。<,>The nature of the problem is complex.<,>这个问题的性质很复杂。<,>nat(出生)+ure→与生俱来的→本性<,>nurture(v.养育)/natural(adj.自然的)/mature(adj.成熟的)

alone<,>/əˈləʊn/<,>/əˈloʊn/<,>adj.单独的/adv.单独地<,>She prefers to work alone in the office.<,>她更喜欢独自在办公室工作。<,>The old man lives alone in that big house.<,>老人独自住在那栋大房子里。<,>Let me think about it alone for a while.<,>让我一个人思考一会儿。<,>a(一个)+lone(孤独的)→单独的一个<,>lonely(adj.孤独的)/along(prep.沿着)/aloud(adv.大声地)
marvellous<,>/ˈmɑːvələs/<,>/ˈmɑːrvələs/<,>adj.奇迹般的/了不起的<,>The view from the top of the mountain was marvellous.<,>从山顶看到的景色美得不可思议。<,>She did a marvellous job on the project.<,>她在这个项目上做得非常出色。<,>His performance was simply marvellous.<,>他的表演简直棒极了。<,>mar(火星)+vellous(联想velvet天鹅绒)→像火星般神奇的天鹅绒→奇迹般的<,>marvel(n.奇迹/v.惊叹)/malicious(adj.恶意的)  

hold<,>/həʊld/<,>/hoʊld/<,>v.拿住/v.掌握/v.拥有<,>Please hold the baby carefully.<,>请小心抱住婴儿。<,>She holds a PhD in physics.<,>她拥有物理学博士学位。<,>This room can hold up to 50 people.<,>这个房间最多可容纳50人。<,>h(手)+old(老)→老手掌握技巧<,>hole(n.洞)/fold(v.折叠)/mold(n.模具)  

like<,>/laɪk/<,>/laɪk/<,>v.喜欢/v.喜爱/v.希望<,>I like reading books in my free time.<,>我喜欢在空闲时间读书。<,>She looks like her mother.<,>她长得像她妈妈。<,>Would you like some coffee?<,>你想喝点咖啡吗？<,>li(拼音"丽")+ke(拼音"可")→美丽可爱→喜欢<,>alike(adj.相似的)/unlike(prep.不像)/likely(adj.可能的)  

treat<,>/triːt/<,>/trit/<,>v.对待/v.处理/n.款待<,>He treats his employees with respect.<,>他尊重地对待员工。<,>This is a special treat for your birthday.<,>这是给你的生日特别款待。<,>How would you treat this situation?<,>你会如何处理这种情况？<,>treat(谐音"吹他")→吹捧他→款待<,>retreat(v.撤退/n.静修)/threat(n.威胁)/trait(n.特征)  

beg<,>/beɡ/<,>/bɛɡ/<,>v.乞求/v.请求<,>The dog begs for food at the table.<,>狗在桌边乞求食物。<,>I beg you to reconsider your decision.<,>我请求你重新考虑你的决定。<,>He was begging in the street.<,>他在街上乞讨。<,>be(是)+g(拼音"给")→是给点吧→乞求<,>bag(n.包)/big(adj.大的)/bug(n.虫子)  

footstep<,>/ˈfʊtstep/<,>/ˈfʊtˌstɛp/<,>n.脚步/n.脚步声/n.足迹<,>I heard footsteps in the hallway.<,>我听到走廊里有脚步声。<,>Follow in your father's footsteps.<,>追随你父亲的足迹。<,>The footsteps faded into the distance.<,>脚步声渐渐消失在远处。<,>foot(脚)+step(步)→脚步<,>footprint(n.脚印)/footstool(n.脚凳)/footrest(n.脚踏板)  

himself<,>/hɪmˈself/<,>/hɪmˈsɛlf/<,>pron.他自己/pron.他亲自<,>He fixed the car himself.<,>他自己修好了车。<,>The manager will attend the meeting himself.<,>经理将亲自参加会议。<,>He talked to himself while working.<,>他工作时自言自语。<,>him(他)+self(自己)→他自己<,>herself(pron.她自己)/itself(pron.它自己)/myself(pron.我自己)  

cure<,>/kjʊə(r)/<,>/kjʊr/<,>v.医治/v.消除/n.治愈<,>This medicine can cure your headache.<,>这种药可以治好你的头痛。<,>There is no cure for the common cold.<,>普通感冒没有治愈方法。<,>Time cured him of his grief.<,>时间治愈了他的悲伤。<,>cu(拼音"除")+re(拼音"热")→除热→医治<,>pure(adj.纯净的)/sure(adj.确定的)/lure(v.引诱)  

bough<,>/baʊ/<,>/baʊ/<,>n.树枝<,>The bough broke under the weight of snow.<,>树枝在雪的重量下折断了。<,>A bird perched on the bough.<,>一只鸟栖息在树枝上。<,>They decorated the bough with lights.<,>他们用灯装饰树枝。<,>bough(谐音"抱")→抱住的树枝<,>bow(v.鞠躬/n.弓)/bought(buy的过去式)/brow(n.眉毛)  

bee<,>/biː/<,>/bi/<,>n.蜂/n.蜜蜂/n.忙碌的人<,>The bee is collecting nectar from the flower.<,>蜜蜂正在从花中采集花蜜。<,>She's as busy as a bee preparing for the party.<,>她像蜜蜂一样忙着准备派对。<,>Be careful not to get stung by a bee.<,>小心别被蜜蜂蜇到。<,>bee(拼音"必")→蜜蜂必会采蜜<,>be(v.是)/pea(n.豌豆)/tea(n.茶)
treaty<,>/ˈtriːti/<,>/ˈtriːti/<,>n.条约/n.协议/n.协定<,>The two countries signed a peace treaty.<,>两国签署了和平条约。<,>This treaty aims to reduce carbon emissions.<,>该协议旨在减少碳排放。<,>The treaty was ratified by all member states.<,>该协定得到了所有成员国的批准。<,>treat(处理)+y→处理问题的文件→条约<,>treat(v.对待/n.款待)/treatise(n.论文/n.专著)

bird<,>/bɜːd/<,>/bɜːrd/<,>n.鸟/n.禽<,>I saw a beautiful bird in the garden.<,>我在花园里看到一只漂亮的鸟。<,>The early bird catches the worm.<,>早起的鸟儿有虫吃。<,>Some birds migrate south for winter.<,>有些鸟类会迁徙到南方过冬。<,>b(像鸟嘴)+ird→鸟<,>bard(n.吟游诗人)/beard(n.胡须)

butterfly<,>/ˈbʌtəflaɪ/<,>/ˈbʌtərflaɪ/<,>n.蝴蝶<,>The butterfly landed on the flower.<,>蝴蝶落在花朵上。<,>She has a butterfly collection.<,>她收集蝴蝶标本。<,>Butterflies undergo metamorphosis.<,>蝴蝶会经历变态发育。<,>butter(黄油)+fly(飞)→黄油色的飞虫→蝴蝶<,>dragonfly(n.蜻蜓)/firefly(n.萤火虫)

insert<,>/ɪnˈsɜːt/<,>/ɪnˈsɜːrt/<,>v.插入/v.嵌入/v.登载<,>Please insert the key into the lock.<,>请把钥匙插入锁中。<,>The magazine will insert your advertisement.<,>杂志将刊登你的广告。<,>He inserted a coin into the vending machine.<,>他把硬币投入自动售货机。<,>in(进入)+sert(加入)→加入进去→插入<,>assert(v.断言)/desert(n.沙漠/v.遗弃)

phase<,>/feɪz/<,>/feɪz/<,>n.阶段/n.相位<,>The project is in its final phase.<,>项目处于最后阶段。<,>The moon has different phases.<,>月亮有不同的月相。<,>We'll phase in the new system gradually.<,>我们将逐步引入新系统。<,>ph(发音"f")+ase(名词后缀)→阶段<,>phrase(n.短语)/faze(v.打扰)

irregular<,>/ɪˈreɡjələ(r)/<,>/ɪˈreɡjələr/<,>adj.不规则的/adj.不整齐的<,>His attendance was irregular.<,>他的出勤不规律。<,>The coastline has an irregular shape.<,>海岸线形状不规则。<,>These verbs have irregular conjugations.<,>这些动词有不规则变位。<,>ir(不)+regular(规则的)→不规则的<,>regular(adj.规则的)/irrigate(v.灌溉)

necessarily<,>/ˌnesəˈserəli/<,>/ˌnesəˈserəli/<,>adv.必然/adv.必定<,>Expensive doesn't necessarily mean better.<,>贵不一定意味着更好。<,>You don't necessarily have to go.<,>你不一定非得去。<,>This will necessarily lead to changes.<,>这必将导致变化。<,>necessary(必要的)+ly(副词后缀)→必然地<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/necessity(n.必需品)

cloth<,>/klɒθ/<,>/klɔːθ/<,>n.布/n.衣料/n.桌布<,>She bought some cloth to make a dress.<,>她买了些布料做裙子。<,>Wipe the table with a damp cloth.<,>用湿布擦桌子。<,>This cloth feels very soft.<,>这块布料摸起来很柔软。<,>cl(像织布机)+oth→布<,>clothe(v.给...穿衣)/clothes(n.衣服)

door<,>/dɔː(r)/<,>/dɔːr/<,>n.门/n.通道/n.一家<,>Please close the door behind you.<,>请随手关门。<,>Opportunity knocks at every door.<,>机会会敲每个人的门。<,>They live next door to us.<,>他们住在我们隔壁。<,>d(像门框)+oor→门<,>floor(n.地板)/indoor(adj.室内的)

description<,>/dɪˈskrɪpʃn/<,>/dɪˈskrɪpʃn/<,>n.描写/n.形容/n.种类<,>He gave a vivid description of the event.<,>他对事件进行了生动的描述。<,>The product matches its description.<,>产品与描述相符。<,>This plant is of rare description.<,>这种植物很罕见。<,>de(加强)+script(写)+ion→写出来→描述<,>prescription(n.处方)/subscription(n.订阅)
marry<,>/ˈmæri/<,>/ˈmɛri/<,>v.结婚/v.娶/v.嫁<,>They decided to marry next summer.<,>他们决定明年夏天结婚。<,>He wants to marry his childhood sweetheart.<,>他想娶他的青梅竹马。<,>She married into a wealthy family.<,>她嫁入了一个富裕的家庭。<,>mar(男人)+ry→男人娶妻→结婚<,>merry(adj.愉快的)/marrow(n.骨髓/n.精华)  

beat<,>/biːt/<,>/bit/<,>v.打/v.敲/v.打败<,>He beat the drum loudly.<,>他大声地敲鼓。<,>Our team beat the champions last night.<,>昨晚我们队打败了冠军队伍。<,>Her heart was beating fast with excitement.<,>她的心脏因兴奋而快速跳动。<,>beat(打)→反复打→击败<,>beet(n.甜菜)/bead(n.珠子)  

community<,>/kəˈmjuːnəti/<,>/kəˈmjunəti/<,>n.社区/n.社会/n.公社<,>Our community organizes a clean-up day every month.<,>我们社区每月组织一次清洁日。<,>She works for the welfare of the community.<,>她为社区福利工作。<,>They formed an artists' community in the countryside.<,>他们在乡下建立了一个艺术家公社。<,>com(共同)+mun(服务)+ity→共同服务的地方→社区<,>commune(n.公社)/communicate(v.交流)  

swing<,>/swɪŋ/<,>/swɪŋ/<,>v.摇摆/n.摇摆/v.回转<,>The children love to swing on the playground.<,>孩子们喜欢在操场上荡秋千。<,>His mood can swing from joy to anger quickly.<,>他的情绪可以从高兴迅速转为愤怒。<,>The pendulum swings back and forth.<,>钟摆来回摆动。<,>s(蛇)+wing(翅膀)→蛇摆动翅膀→摇摆<,>swan(n.天鹅)/sing(v.唱歌)  

branch<,>/brɑːntʃ/<,>/bræntʃ/<,>n.树枝/n.分部/n.分科<,>A bird is sitting on the branch of that tree.<,>一只鸟停在那棵树的树枝上。<,>The company opened a new branch in Shanghai.<,>公司在上海开设了新分部。<,>He specializes in the branch of quantum physics.<,>他专攻量子物理学这一分科。<,>branch(树枝)→像树枝一样分叉→分部<,>brunch(n.早午餐)/brand(n.品牌)  

stimulate<,>/ˈstɪmjuleɪt/<,>/ˈstɪmjəˌlet/<,>v.刺激/v.激励/v.激发<,>Coffee can stimulate your brain in the morning.<,>咖啡可以在早晨刺激你的大脑。<,>The teacher's praise stimulated him to work harder.<,>老师的表扬激励他更加努力。<,>This drug stimulates the production of white blood cells.<,>这种药物刺激白细胞的产生。<,>stim(刺)+ulate→用刺促使→刺激<,>simulate(v.模拟)/stipulate(v.规定)  

uneasy<,>/ʌnˈiːzi/<,>/ʌnˈizi/<,>adj.心神不安的/adj.忧虑的<,>She felt uneasy about leaving her child alone.<,>她对把孩子单独留下感到不安。<,>There was an uneasy silence in the room.<,>房间里有一种令人不安的沉默。<,>His uneasy manner made me suspicious.<,>他不安的举止让我起疑。<,>un(不)+easy(轻松)→不轻松→不安的<,>easy(adj.容易的)/uneven(adj.不平的)  

solemn<,>/ˈsɒləm/<,>/ˈsɑːləm/<,>adj.严肃的/adj.庄重的/adj.隆重的<,>The judge wore a solemn expression.<,>法官表情严肃。<,>They made a solemn promise to each other.<,>他们互相许下庄重的承诺。<,>A solemn ceremony was held for the memorial.<,>为纪念活动举行了隆重的仪式。<,>sol(太阳)+emn→像太阳一样庄严→庄重的<,>sole(adj.唯一的)/column(n.圆柱)  

sew<,>/səʊ/<,>/soʊ/<,>v.缝制/v.缝纫<,>My grandmother taught me how to sew buttons.<,>我祖母教我如何缝纽扣。<,>She sews beautiful dresses for her daughter.<,>她为女儿缝制漂亮的连衣裙。<,>This machine can sew through thick leather.<,>这台机器可以缝制厚皮革。<,>sew(缝)→像蛇(s)穿线(ew)→缝纫<,>sow(v.播种)/saw(n.锯子)  

astronaut<,>/ˈæstrənɔːt/<,>/ˈæstrəˌnɔt/<,>n.宇宙航行员/n.宇航员<,>The astronaut conducted experiments in space.<,>宇航员在太空进行了实验。<,>She dreamed of becoming an astronaut since childhood.<,>她从小梦想成为宇航员。<,>Astronauts need special training to go to space.<,>宇航员需要特殊训练才能进入太空。<,>astro(星星)+naut(航行)→星际航行者→宇航员<,>astronomy(n.天文学)/astrology(n.占星术)
memorial<,>/məˈmɔːriəl/<,>/məˈmɔːriəl/<,>adj.纪念的/adj.记忆的<,>The memorial service was held in honor of the fallen soldiers.<,>纪念仪式是为了纪念阵亡的士兵而举行的。<,>She kept the photo as a memorial of her trip.<,>她保留这张照片作为她旅行的纪念。<,>His memorial speech moved everyone to tears.<,>他的纪念演讲让每个人都感动得流泪。<,>memory(记忆)+ial(形容词后缀)→记忆的<,>memorize(v.记住)/memorandum(n.备忘录)/immemorial(adj.古老的)

dispose<,>/dɪˈspəʊz/<,>/dɪˈspoʊz/<,>v.去掉/v.丢掉/v.销毁<,>Please dispose of the garbage properly.<,>请妥善处理垃圾。<,>He disposed of his old car and bought a new one.<,>他处理掉了旧车，买了一辆新的。<,>The documents were disposed of after the meeting.<,>会议结束后文件被销毁了。<,>dis(分开)+pose(放置)→分开放置→处理掉<,>expose(v.暴露)/impose(v.强加)/compose(v.组成)

brighten<,>/ˈbraɪtn/<,>/ˈbraɪtn/<,>v.使发光/v.使快活<,>The sun brightened the room.<,>阳光照亮了房间。<,>Her smile brightened my day.<,>她的笑容让我的一天变得愉快。<,>They painted the walls to brighten up the house.<,>他们粉刷了墙壁，使房子变得明亮。<,>bright(明亮的)+en(动词后缀)→使明亮<,>lighten(v.减轻)/enlighten(v.启发)/brightness(n.亮度)

addition<,>/əˈdɪʃn/<,>/əˈdɪʃn/<,>n.附加物/n.加/n.加法<,>The new addition to the family is a baby girl.<,>家庭的新成员是一个女婴。<,>He is good at addition and subtraction.<,>他擅长加减法。<,>The addition of spices improved the flavor of the dish.<,>加入香料提升了菜肴的味道。<,>add(加)+ition(名词后缀)→加法<,>edition(n.版本)/audition(n.试听)/ambition(n.雄心)

sulfur<,>/ˈsʌlfə(r)/<,>/ˈsʌlfər/<,>n.硫（磺）/n.硫黄<,>Sulfur is used in the production of matches.<,>硫磺用于火柴的生产。<,>The smell of sulfur is quite strong near the volcano.<,>火山附近的硫磺味很浓。<,>Sulfur dioxide is a common air pollutant.<,>二氧化硫是一种常见的空气污染物。<,>sul(硫)+fur(皮毛)→硫磺<,>sulphur(英式拼写)/sulfate(n.硫酸盐)/sulfide(n.硫化物)

beginner<,>/bɪˈɡɪnə(r)/<,>/bɪˈɡɪnər/<,>n.初学者/n.生手<,>This class is suitable for beginners.<,>这个课程适合初学者。<,>As a beginner, he made many mistakes.<,>作为新手，他犯了很多错误。<,>The book provides useful tips for beginners.<,>这本书为初学者提供了有用的建议。<,>begin(开始)+er(人)→初学者<,>winner(n.赢家)/dinner(n.晚餐)/sinner(n.罪人)

impress<,>/ɪmˈpres/<,>/ɪmˈpres/<,>v.给…深刻印象<,>His speech impressed the audience.<,>他的演讲给观众留下了深刻印象。<,>She was impressed by his kindness.<,>他的善良给她留下了深刻印象。<,>The beauty of the landscape impressed me deeply.<,>风景的美丽给我留下了深刻的印象。<,>im(进入)+press(压)→压入心中→留下印象<,>express(v.表达)/compress(v.压缩)/depress(v.使沮丧)

print<,>/prɪnt/<,>/prɪnt/<,>v.印刷/n.印刷的文字<,>Please print your name clearly.<,>请清楚地打印你的名字。<,>The book is out of print now.<,>这本书现在已经绝版了。<,>She works in a print shop.<,>她在一家印刷厂工作。<,>pr(压)+int→压印→印刷<,>paint(v.绘画)/point(n.点)/pint(n.品脱)

fit<,>/fɪt/<,>/fɪt/<,>v.适合/v.安装<,>This dress fits you perfectly.<,>这条裙子非常适合你。<,>He is fit for the job.<,>他适合这份工作。<,>They will fit a new lock on the door.<,>他们将在门上安装一个新锁。<,>f(形状像钩子)+it→钩住→适合<,>fat(adj.肥胖的)/fix(v.固定)/fist(n.拳头)

lay<,>/leɪ/<,>/leɪ/<,>v.置放/v.铺设/v.设置<,>She laid the book on the table.<,>她把书放在桌子上。<,>They are laying a new carpet.<,>他们正在铺设新地毯。<,>He laid the foundation for his success.<,>他为成功奠定了基础。<,>l(形状像放置的动作)+ay→放置<,>lie(v.躺)/law(n.法律)/lay(n.短诗)
pollute<,>/pəˈluːt/<,>/pəˈlut/<,>v.弄脏/v.污染/v.沾污<,>Factories pollute the air with harmful gases.<,>工厂排放有害气体污染空气。<,>Don't pollute the river with plastic waste.<,>不要用塑料垃圾污染河流。<,>The oil spill polluted the ocean.<,>石油泄漏污染了海洋。<,>pol(城市)+lute(洗)→城市需要清洗→污染<,>dilute(v.稀释)/pollutant(n.污染物)/pollution(n.污染)

experimental<,>/ɪkˌsperɪˈmentl/<,>/ɪkˌspɛrəˈmɛntl/<,>adj.实验的/adj.试验的<,>This is an experimental drug.<,>这是一种实验性药物。<,>The results are still at the experimental stage.<,>结果仍处于试验阶段。<,>She works in an experimental laboratory.<,>她在实验实验室工作。<,>experiment(实验)+al(形容词后缀)→实验的<,>experience(n.经验)/expert(n.专家)/empirical(adj.经验主义的)

attach<,>/əˈtætʃ/<,>/əˈtætʃ/<,>v.缚/v.系/v.贴/v.附加<,>Please attach the file to your email.<,>请将文件附加到你的邮件中。<,>He attached a note to the gift.<,>他在礼物上贴了张便条。<,>The dog is attached to its owner.<,>这只狗很依恋主人。<,>at(加强)+tach(钉)→钉上→附加<,>detach(v.分离)/attack(v.攻击)/attaché(n.随员)

focus<,>/ˈfəʊkəs/<,>/ˈfoʊkəs/<,>v.聚焦/v.注视/n.焦点<,>Focus your attention on the speaker.<,>把你的注意力集中在演讲者身上。<,>The camera can't focus in this light.<,>相机在这种光线下无法对焦。<,>Education is the focus of our discussion.<,>教育是我们讨论的焦点。<,>foc(火)+us→像火一样集中→焦点<,>locus(n.地点)/focal(adj.焦点的)/foci(n.焦点复数)

hunt<,>/hʌnt/<,>/hʌnt/<,>n.打猎/n.搜寻/v.追猎<,>They went on a deer hunt.<,>他们去猎鹿了。<,>I'm hunting for my lost keys.<,>我正在寻找丢失的钥匙。<,>The police are hunting the escaped prisoner.<,>警方正在追捕逃犯。<,>h+unt(反)→反着找→搜寻<,>haunt(v.常去)/hint(n.暗示)/hunker(v.蹲下)

cruel<,>/kruːəl/<,>/ˈkruəl/<,>adj.残忍的/adj.残酷的<,>It's cruel to keep animals in small cages.<,>把动物关在小笼子里很残忍。<,>The cruel king executed many people.<,>残忍的国王处死了很多人。<,>Don't be cruel to your little brother.<,>不要对你弟弟太残忍。<,>cr(哭)+uel→让人哭的→残忍的<,>crew(n.船员)/crude(adj.粗糙的)/cruelty(n.残忍)

desk<,>/desk/<,>/dɛsk/<,>n.书桌/n.办公桌<,>There's a lamp on my desk.<,>我的书桌上有一盏灯。<,>She works at the front desk.<,>她在前台工作。<,>Put your homework on the teacher's desk.<,>把你的作业放在老师桌上。<,>de(的)+sk(时刻)→时刻工作的桌子→办公桌<,>disk(n.磁盘)/dusk(n.黄昏)/deck(n.甲板)

cost<,>/kɒst/<,>/kɔst/<,>n.价格/n.代价/n.成本<,>What's the cost of this computer?<,>这台电脑的价格是多少？<,>The war came at a high human cost.<,>战争付出了高昂的人员代价。<,>We need to reduce production costs.<,>我们需要降低生产成本。<,>co(共同)+st(站)→共同站在一起的价格→成本<,>cosy(adj.舒适的)/coast(n.海岸)/costly(adj.昂贵的)

slam<,>/slæm/<,>/slæm/<,>v.使劲关/v.砰地放下<,>Don't slam the door!<,>不要使劲关门！<,>He slammed the book on the table.<,>他把书砰地放在桌子上。<,>The car slammed into the wall.<,>汽车猛地撞上了墙。<,>sl(死力)+am→用死力→使劲关<,>slum(n.贫民窟)/slip(v.滑倒)/slap(v.拍打)

decay<,>/dɪˈkeɪ/<,>/dɪˈkeɪ/<,>v.腐烂/v.衰败/n.腐烂<,>The fruit began to decay.<,>水果开始腐烂了。<,>Tooth decay can cause pain.<,>蛀牙会引起疼痛。<,>The old building is in decay.<,>这座老建筑正在衰败。<,>de(向下)+cay(落)→向下掉落→腐烂<,>delay(v.延迟)/decade(n.十年)/decant(v.倾注)

decade<,>/ˈdekeɪd/<,>/ˈdekeɪd/<,>n.十年/n.十年期<,>Technology has changed a lot in the past decade.<,>在过去十年里，科技发生了很大变化。<,>She has been working here for over a decade.<,>她在这里工作已经超过十年了。<,>The book covers events from the last decade.<,>这本书涵盖了上个十年的事件。<,>dec(十)+ade→十年<,>decay(v.腐烂/n.衰退)/decant(v.倾注)/decibel(n.分贝)

trick<,>/trɪk/<,>/trɪk/<,>n.诡计/n.窍门/v.哄骗<,>He played a trick on his friend.<,>他捉弄了他的朋友。<,>She knows a trick to solve the puzzle quickly.<,>她知道快速解决这个谜题的窍门。<,>Don't let anyone trick you into giving them money.<,>别让任何人骗你给他们钱。<,>tri(三)+ck(刺客)→三个刺客用诡计<,>trick(n.诡计)/track(n.轨道)/truck(n.卡车)  

February<,>/ˈfebruəri/<,>/ˈfebrueri/<,>n.二月<,>February is the shortest month of the year.<,>二月是一年中最短的月份。<,>My birthday is in February.<,>我的生日在二月。<,>The February weather is usually cold.<,>二月的天气通常很冷。<,>Feb(菲伯)+ruary→二月<,>February(n.二月)/January(n.一月)/March(n.三月)  

cell<,>/sel/<,>/sel/<,>n.细胞/n.小房间<,>The human body is made up of millions of cells.<,>人体由数百万个细胞组成。<,>The prisoner was kept in a small cell.<,>囚犯被关在一个小房间里。<,>She studies plant cells under a microscope.<,>她在显微镜下研究植物细胞。<,>ce(测)+ll(了)→测量了细胞<,>cell(n.细胞)/sell(v.卖)/bell(n.铃)
completely<,>/kəmˈpliːtli/<,>/kəmˈpliːtli/<,>adv.十分/adv.完全地<,>She was completely exhausted after the marathon.<,>马拉松后她完全筋疲力尽了。<,>The room was completely silent.<,>房间里完全安静。<,>I completely forgot about our meeting.<,>我完全忘记了我们的会议。<,>complete(完整的)+ly(副词后缀)→完全地<,>entirely(adv.完全地)/totally(adv.全部地)  

overtake<,>/ˌəʊvəˈteɪk/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈteɪk/<,>v.追上/v.赶上<,>The blue car overtook us on the highway.<,>那辆蓝色汽车在高速公路上超过了我们。<,>China's economy may overtake the US in the near future.<,>中国经济可能在不久的将来超过美国。<,>Don't try to overtake on this narrow road.<,>不要在这条狭窄的道路上超车。<,>over(超过)+take(拿)→超过→追上<,>overcome(v.克服)/overlook(v.忽视)  

extend<,>/ɪkˈstend/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnd/<,>v.延长/v.扩大<,>We've decided to extend our vacation by a week.<,>我们决定把假期延长一周。<,>The company plans to extend its business overseas.<,>公司计划将业务扩展到海外。<,>Please extend your arms straight out.<,>请把你的手臂伸直。<,>ex(出)+tend(伸展)→向外伸展→延长<,>expand(v.扩张)/extent(n.范围)  

pair<,>/peə(r)/<,>/pɛr/<,>n.一对/v.成对/v.配对<,>I bought a new pair of shoes yesterday.<,>我昨天买了一双新鞋。<,>The teacher paired the students for the project.<,>老师把学生分组做项目。<,>These socks don't pair up.<,>这些袜子不成对。<,>pair(一对)→来自拉丁语paria(相等的东西)<,>pear(n.梨)/pare(v.削皮)  

policy<,>/ˈpɒləsi/<,>/ˈpɑːləsi/<,>n.政策/n.方针<,>The company has a strict no-smoking policy.<,>公司有严格的禁烟政策。<,>What's your policy on late assignments?<,>你对迟交作业有什么政策？<,>The government announced new economic policies.<,>政府宣布了新的经济政策。<,>polic(城市)+y→管理城市的方针→政策<,>police(n.警察)/polish(v.磨光)  

sympathetic<,>/ˌsɪmpəˈθetɪk/<,>/ˌsɪmpəˈθɛtɪk/<,>adj.同情的<,>She gave me a sympathetic smile.<,>她给了我一个同情的微笑。<,>The teacher was sympathetic to my situation.<,>老师对我的处境表示同情。<,>I found him very sympathetic and understanding.<,>我发现他非常富有同情心和理解力。<,>sym(共同)+path(感觉)+etic→有共同感觉的→同情的<,>apathetic(adj.冷漠的)/empathic(adj.移情的)  

mass<,>/mæs/<,>/mæs/<,>n.团/n.众多/n.群众<,>A mass of dark clouds covered the sky.<,>一大片乌云遮住了天空。<,>The mass media influences public opinion.<,>大众媒体影响公众舆论。<,>The church holds mass every Sunday.<,>教堂每周日举行弥撒。<,>mass(大量)→来自拉丁语massa(面团)<,>mess(n.混乱)/mask(n.面具)  

desperate<,>/ˈdespərət/<,>/ˈdɛspərət/<,>adj.拼死的/adj.绝望的<,>The refugees were in desperate need of food.<,>难民们急需食物。<,>He made a desperate attempt to save his business.<,>他拼命试图挽救他的生意。<,>She felt desperate after losing her job.<,>失业后她感到绝望。<,>de(去掉)+sper(希望)+ate→没有希望的→绝望的<,>separate(v.分开)/disparate(adj.不同的)  

initial<,>/ɪˈnɪʃl/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəl/<,>adj.最初的<,>My initial reaction was surprise.<,>我最初的反应是惊讶。<,>Please write your initials here.<,>请在这里写下你名字的首字母。<,>The initial stage of the project was the hardest.<,>项目的最初阶段是最困难的。<,>in(进入)+it(走)+ial→开始走进去的→最初的<,>initiate(v.开始)/inertial(adj.惯性的)  

red<,>/red/<,>/rɛd/<,>adj.红色的/n.红色<,>She was wearing a beautiful red dress.<,>她穿着一件漂亮的红色连衣裙。<,>The traffic light turned red.<,>交通灯变红了。<,>His face turned red with embarrassment.<,>他的脸因尴尬而变红。<,>red(红色)→与血液颜色相关的基本颜色词<,>read(v.读)/rid(v.摆脱)
award<,>/əˈwɔːd/<,>/əˈwɔːrd/<,>n.奖/n.奖品<,>She won an award for her outstanding performance.<,>她因出色的表现而获奖。<,>The award ceremony will be held next week.<,>颁奖典礼将于下周举行。<,>He received an award for his contribution to science.<,>他因对科学的贡献而获奖。<,>a(强调)+ward(方向)→给予奖励<,>reward(n.报酬/v.奖励)/awkward(adj.笨拙的)

dig<,>/dɪɡ/<,>/dɪɡ/<,>v.掘/v.挖/v.采掘<,>They are digging a hole in the garden.<,>他们正在花园里挖洞。<,>He dug deep to find the treasure.<,>他挖得很深以寻找宝藏。<,>She dug into her bag to find her keys.<,>她在包里翻找钥匙。<,>d(动作)+ig(小)→小动作→挖掘<,>dog(n.狗)/dug(v.挖的过去式)

electron<,>/ɪˈlektrɒn/<,>/ɪˈlektrɑːn/<,>n.电子<,>Electrons move around the nucleus of an atom.<,>电子围绕原子核运动。<,>The flow of electrons creates electricity.<,>电子的流动产生电。<,>This device controls the movement of electrons.<,>这个装置控制电子的运动。<,>electr(电)+on(基本粒子)→电子<,>proton(n.质子)/neutron(n.中子)

comfortable<,>/ˈkʌmftəbl/<,>/ˈkʌmfərtəbl/<,>adj.舒适的<,>This chair is very comfortable.<,>这把椅子非常舒适。<,>She felt comfortable in her new home.<,>她在新家里感到舒适。<,>Make yourself comfortable while you wait.<,>等待时请随意放松。<,>comfort(舒适)+able(可…的)→舒适的<,>uncomfortable(adj.不舒服的)/comfortably(adv.舒适地)

association<,>/əˌsəʊsiˈeɪʃn/<,>/əˌsoʊsiˈeɪʃn/<,>n.协会/n.团体/n.联合<,>He is a member of the local business association.<,>他是当地商业协会的成员。<,>The association between the two companies was beneficial.<,>两家公司的联合是有益的。<,>She has no association with that group.<,>她与那个团体没有关联。<,>as(加强)+soci(同伴)+ation(状态)→联合<,>society(n.社会)/associate(v.联系)

labour<,>/ˈleɪbə(r)/<,>/ˈleɪbər/<,>n.劳动/n.工作/n.劳工<,>Manual labour can be very tiring.<,>体力劳动可能非常累人。<,>The labour union is negotiating for better wages.<,>工会正在为更高的工资谈判。<,>She went into labour at midnight.<,>她在午夜开始分娩。<,>lab(工作)+our(我们的)→我们的劳动<,>labor(美式拼写)/labored(adj.费力的)

diagram<,>/ˈdaɪəɡræm/<,>/ˈdaɪəɡræm/<,>n.图解/n.图表/n.简图<,>The teacher drew a diagram on the board.<,>老师在黑板上画了一个图表。<,>This diagram explains how the machine works.<,>这个图解解释了机器的工作原理。<,>Please refer to the diagram on page 10.<,>请参考第10页的图表。<,>dia(穿过)+gram(写)→画线→图表<,>program(n.程序)/telegram(n.电报)

scheme<,>/skiːm/<,>/skiːm/<,>n.计划/n.规划/n.诡计<,>The government announced a new housing scheme.<,>政府宣布了一项新的住房计划。<,>He came up with a clever scheme to solve the problem.<,>他想出了一个聪明的计划来解决问题。<,>Be careful, it might be a scheme to cheat you.<,>小心，这可能是个骗你的诡计。<,>sch(学校)+eme(法语后缀)→学校计划<,>theme(n.主题)/schema(n.模式)

accustomed<,>/əˈkʌstəmd/<,>/əˈkʌstəmd/<,>adj.惯常的/adj.习惯的<,>I'm accustomed to getting up early.<,>我习惯早起。<,>She gave her accustomed smile.<,>她露出了惯常的微笑。<,>He quickly became accustomed to the new environment.<,>他很快适应了新环境。<,>ac(加强)+custom(习惯)+ed(…的)→习惯的<,>custom(n.习惯)/customer(n.顾客)

substantial<,>/səbˈstænʃl/<,>/səbˈstænʃl/<,>adj.坚固的<,>The bridge is built with substantial materials.<,>这座桥是用坚固的材料建造的。<,>She made a substantial improvement in her grades.<,>她的成绩有了显著提高。<,>They provided substantial evidence to support their claim.<,>他们提供了充分的证据来支持他们的主张。<,>sub(下面)+stant(站立)+ial(…的)→下面站得住的→坚固的<,>substantive(adj.实质的)/substance(n.物质)
awake<,>/əˈweɪk/<,>/əˈweɪk/<,>adj.醒着的/v.唤醒<,>She was awake all night worrying about the exam.<,>她整晚都醒着，担心考试。<,>The loud noise awoke the baby.<,>巨大的噪音把婴儿吵醒了。<,>I need to stay awake during the meeting.<,>我需要在会议期间保持清醒。<,>a(强调)+wake(醒)→醒着的<,>awaken(v. 唤醒)/awakened(adj. 被唤醒的)

entry<,>/ˈentri/<,>/ˈɛntri/<,>n.入口处/n.登记/n.进入<,>Please use the side entry to the building.<,>请使用大楼的侧门入口。<,>He made an entry in his diary every night.<,>他每晚都在日记中写一篇记录。<,>The country tightened its entry requirements.<,>该国收紧了入境要求。<,>entr(进入)+y(名词后缀)→入口<,>exit(n. 出口)/entree(n. 主菜)

assistant<,>/əˈsɪstənt/<,>/əˈsɪstənt/<,>n.助手/n.助理/n.助教<,>She works as an assistant to the CEO.<,>她是首席执行官的助理。<,>The professor has two teaching assistants.<,>这位教授有两名助教。<,>I need an assistant to help with the paperwork.<,>我需要一名助手帮忙处理文书工作。<,>assist(帮助)+ant(人)→帮助的人→助手<,>assistance(n. 帮助)/assisted(adj. 辅助的)

pocket<,>/ˈpɒkɪt/<,>/ˈpɑːkɪt/<,>n.衣袋/adj.袖珍的<,>He put his keys in his pants pocket.<,>他把钥匙放进了裤袋里。<,>This is a pocket dictionary for travelers.<,>这是一本旅行者用的袖珍词典。<,>She pocketed the money without saying anything.<,>她一言不发地把钱装进了口袋。<,>pock(袋)+et(小)→小袋子→衣袋<,>socket(n. 插座)/rocket(n. 火箭)

code<,>/kəʊd/<,>/koʊd/<,>n.准则/n.法典/n.代码<,>All employees must follow the company's code of conduct.<,>所有员工都必须遵守公司的行为准则。<,>The programmer wrote a new code for the app.<,>程序员为应用程序编写了新代码。<,>The legal code was updated last year.<,>法典去年进行了更新。<,>cod(写)+e→写下的规则→准则<,>mode(n. 模式)/node(n. 节点)

lime<,>/laɪm/<,>/laɪm/<,>n.石灰<,>Farmers use lime to improve soil quality.<,>农民用石灰来改善土壤质量。<,>The walls were painted with lime wash.<,>墙壁用石灰水粉刷过。<,>Lime is an important material in construction.<,>石灰是建筑中的重要材料。<,>lim(界限)+e→用来划界限的材料→石灰<,>sublime(adj. 崇高的)/climb(v. 攀登)

drum<,>/drʌm/<,>/drʌm/<,>n.鼓/n.鼓状物/n.圆桶<,>He plays the drum in a jazz band.<,>他在一个爵士乐队中打鼓。<,>The oil is stored in large drums.<,>石油储存在大圆桶里。<,>She tapped her fingers on the desk like a drum.<,>她像打鼓一样用手指敲打桌子。<,>drum(拟声词)→鼓的声音→鼓<,>dumb(adj. 哑的)/crumb(n. 碎屑)

singular<,>/ˈsɪŋɡjələ(r)/<,>/ˈsɪŋɡjələr/<,>adj.单数的/adj.非凡的<,>"Child" is the singular form of "children".<,>"child"是"children"的单数形式。<,>She showed singular courage in the crisis.<,>她在危机中表现出了非凡的勇气。<,>The singular beauty of the landscape amazed us all.<,>风景的独特之美让我们所有人都惊叹不已。<,>singul(单一)+ar→单数的<,>plural(adj. 复数的)/angular(adj. 有角的)

aim<,>/eɪm/<,>/eɪm/<,>v.瞄准/v.针对/v.致力<,>He aimed the gun carefully at the target.<,>他小心地把枪瞄准目标。<,>This program aims to help unemployed people.<,>这个项目旨在帮助失业人员。<,>She aims to become a doctor in the future.<,>她的目标是将来成为一名医生。<,>ai(方向)+m→向某个方向→瞄准<,>claim(v. 声称)/maim(v. 使残废)

counter<,>/ˈkaʊntə(r)/<,>/ˈkaʊntər/<,>n.柜台/n.计数器<,>The cashier stood behind the counter.<,>收银员站在柜台后面。<,>This device has a digital counter.<,>这个设备有一个数字计数器。<,>He placed the package on the kitchen counter.<,>他把包裹放在厨房柜台上。<,>count(计数)+er(人或物)→计数器<,>encounter(v. 遭遇)/country(n. 国家)
because<,>/bɪˈkɒz/<,>/bɪˈkɔz/<,>conj.由于/conj.因为<,>I stayed home because it was raining.<,>我待在家里因为下雨了。<,>She was late because of the traffic.<,>她因为交通堵塞迟到了。<,>He couldn't attend the meeting because he was sick.<,>他因为生病没能参加会议。<,>be(是)+cause(原因)→因为是...的原因→因为<,>since(conj.因为)/as(conj.因为)/due to(由于)

religious<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒəs/<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒəs/<,>adj.宗教的/adj.虔诚的<,>They visited a religious site during their trip.<,>他们在旅行中参观了一个宗教场所。<,>She is very religious and prays every day.<,>她非常虔诚，每天都祈祷。<,>Religious tolerance is important in a diverse society.<,>宗教宽容在多元社会中很重要。<,>reli(依靠)+gious→依靠信仰的→宗教的<,>sacred(adj.神圣的)/spiritual(adj.精神的)/devout(adj.虔诚的)

persuade<,>/pəˈsweɪd/<,>/pərˈsweɪd/<,>v.说服<,>He tried to persuade her to change her mind.<,>他试图说服她改变主意。<,>I was persuaded to join the club.<,>我被说服加入了俱乐部。<,>It's hard to persuade stubborn people.<,>说服固执的人很难。<,>per(彻底)+suade(劝)→彻底劝服→说服<,>convince(v.使确信)/dissuade(v.劝阻)/coax(v.哄骗)

consumption<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/kənˈsʌmpʃən/<,>n.消耗量/n.消耗<,>The car has low fuel consumption.<,>这辆车油耗低。<,>Excessive consumption of sugar is unhealthy.<,>过量摄入糖分不健康。<,>They studied the energy consumption patterns.<,>他们研究了能源消耗模式。<,>con(全部)+sumpt(拿)+ion→全部拿走→消耗<,>assumption(n.假设)/presumption(n.假定)/resumption(n.恢复)

harmony<,>/ˈhɑːməni/<,>/ˈhɑːrməni/<,>n.调合/n.协调/n.和谐<,>The choir sang in perfect harmony.<,>合唱团唱得非常和谐。<,>They live in harmony with nature.<,>他们与自然和谐相处。<,>The colors are in harmony with each other.<,>这些颜色相互协调。<,>harm(适合)+ony→适合的状态→和谐<,>melody(n.旋律)/symphony(n.交响乐)/discord(n.不和谐)

improvement<,>/ɪmˈpruːvmənt/<,>/ɪmˈpruːvmənt/<,>n.改进/n.改善/n.改进之处<,>There's been a noticeable improvement in his work.<,>他的工作有了明显改善。<,>The city has seen many infrastructure improvements.<,>这座城市的基础设施有了很多改进。<,>She's making steady improvement in her English.<,>她的英语在稳步提高。<,>im(进入)+prove(证明)+ment→进入更好的证明→改进<,>enhancement(n.增强)/progress(n.进步)/deterioration(n.恶化)

dial<,>/ˈdaɪəl/<,>/ˈdaɪəl/<,>n.钟面/n.拨号盘/v.拨<,>He dialed the wrong number.<,>他拨错了号码。<,>The clock has a beautiful Roman numeral dial.<,>这个钟有一个漂亮的罗马数字钟面。<,>Rotate the dial to adjust the temperature.<,>旋转拨号盘调节温度。<,>di(日)+al→日晷→钟面<,>dialect(n.方言)/diameter(n.直径)/diary(n.日记)

efficient<,>/ɪˈfɪʃnt/<,>/ɪˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.效率高的/adj.有能力的<,>The new system is more efficient.<,>新系统效率更高。<,>She's an efficient secretary.<,>她是个能干的秘书。<,>Energy-efficient appliances save money.<,>节能电器能省钱。<,>ef(出)+fic(做)+ient→能做出来的→有效率的<,>effective(adj.有效的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)/proficient(adj.熟练的)

loudspeaker<,>/ˌlaʊdˈspiːkə(r)/<,>/ˈlaʊdˌspikər/<,>n.扬声器/n.喇叭<,>The announcement came over the loudspeaker.<,>通知通过扬声器传来。<,>They installed new loudspeakers in the auditorium.<,>他们在礼堂安装了新扬声器。<,>The loudspeaker volume was too high.<,>扬声器音量太大了。<,>loud(大声的)+speaker(说话者)→大声说话者→扬声器<,>microphone(n.麦克风)/headphone(n.耳机)/megaphone(n.扩音器)

typist<,>/ˈtaɪpɪst/<,>/ˈtaɪpɪst/<,>n.打字员<,>She works as a typist in an office.<,>她在办公室当打字员。<,>The typist finished the document quickly.<,>打字员很快完成了文件。<,>Good typists can type very fast.<,>好的打字员能打得很快。<,>type(打字)+ist(人)→打字的人→打字员<,>artist(n.艺术家)/pianist(n.钢琴家)/journalist(n.记者)
accumulate<,>/əˈkjuːmjəleɪt/<,>/əˈkjumjəˌleɪt/<,>v.积累/v.堆积<,>He has accumulated a large collection of books over the years.<,>多年来他积累了大量书籍。<,>Dust tends to accumulate in corners.<,>灰尘容易堆积在角落。<,>Her savings accumulated quickly with careful budgeting.<,>通过精打细算，她的存款迅速积累。<,>ac(加强)+cumul(堆积)+ate(动词后缀)→不断堆积→积累<,>cumulative(adj.累积的)/accumulation(n.积累)/cumulus(n.积云)  

grasp<,>/ɡrɑːsp/<,>/ɡræsp/<,>v.抓紧/v.掌握/n.抓<,>She grasped the rope tightly to avoid falling.<,>她紧紧抓住绳子以防摔倒。<,>He quickly grasped the main concepts of the lecture.<,>他迅速掌握了讲座的主要概念。<,>The baby's grasp on my finger was surprisingly strong.<,>婴儿抓我手指的力道出奇地大。<,>gr(抓)+asp(渴望)→渴望抓住→抓紧<,>grip(v.紧握)/clasp(v.扣住)/grab(v.抢夺)  

picnic<,>/ˈpɪknɪk/<,>/ˈpɪkˌnɪk/<,>n.郊游/n.野餐/v.野餐<,>We had a lovely picnic by the lake last Sunday.<,>上周日我们在湖边进行了愉快的野餐。<,>They decided to picnic in the park despite the cloudy weather.<,>尽管天气阴沉，他们还是决定在公园野餐。<,>The school organized a picnic for all the students.<,>学校为所有学生组织了一次郊游。<,>pic(啄食)+nic(美好时光)→户外啄食的美好时光→野餐<,>panic(n.恐慌)/picket(n.哨兵)/picture(n.图片)  

crisis<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>n.危机/n.存亡之际<,>The country is facing an economic crisis.<,>该国正面临经济危机。<,>In times of crisis, true leaders emerge.<,>危难时刻方见真领袖。<,>The patient's condition reached a crisis point last night.<,>昨晚病人的病情到了危急关头。<,>cri(判断)+sis(状态)→需要判断的状态→危机<,>critic(n.评论家)/criticize(v.批评)/criteria(n.标准)  

underneath<,>/ˌʌndəˈniːθ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈniθ/<,>prep.在下面/adv.在底下<,>The cat was hiding underneath the table.<,>猫躲在桌子下面。<,>She wore a red dress with a white blouse underneath.<,>她穿着红色连衣裙，里面套着白色衬衫。<,>The truth lies underneath all these lies.<,>真相藏在这些谎言之下。<,>under(在...下)+neath(下方)→在下方之下→在下面<,>beneath(prep.在...之下)/under(prep.在...下)/below(prep.在...下面)  

contain<,>/kənˈteɪn/<,>/kənˈteɪn/<,>v.包含/v.容纳<,>This box contains all my childhood memories.<,>这个盒子里装着我所有的童年回忆。<,>The stadium can contain up to 50,000 spectators.<,>这个体育场可容纳多达5万名观众。<,>Try to contain your excitement until the official announcement.<,>在官方宣布前尽量控制你的兴奋。<,>con(共同)+tain(保持)→共同保持在内→包含<,>retain(v.保留)/maintain(v.维持)/obtain(v.获得)  

go<,>/ɡəʊ/<,>/ɡoʊ/<,>v.去/v.走/v.变为<,>I usually go to work by subway.<,>我通常乘地铁去上班。<,>Her hair is going gray.<,>她的头发正在变白。<,>Let's go for a walk after dinner.<,>晚饭后我们去散步吧。<,>简单动词，表示基本动作<,>gone(adj.离去的)/going(n.进行)/goal(n.目标)  

loyalty<,>/ˈlɔɪəlti/<,>/ˈlɔɪəlti/<,>n.忠诚/n.忠心<,>His loyalty to the company never wavered.<,>他对公司的忠诚从未动摇。<,>The dog showed incredible loyalty to its owner.<,>这条狗对主人表现出惊人的忠诚。<,>Customer loyalty is important for any business.<,>客户忠诚度对任何企业都很重要。<,>loy(法律)+alty(性质)→遵守法律的性质→忠诚<,>royalty(n.皇室)/legal(adj.合法的)/loyal(adj.忠诚的)  

amaze<,>/əˈmeɪz/<,>/əˈmeɪz/<,>v.使惊奇/v.使惊愕<,>Her performance amazed everyone in the audience.<,>她的表演让所有观众都感到惊讶。<,>I was amazed by how much the city had changed.<,>城市的变化之大让我感到惊讶。<,>The magician's tricks never fail to amaze children.<,>魔术师的戏法总能让孩子惊叹。<,>a(加强)+maze(迷宫)→像迷宫一样令人困惑→使惊奇<,>amazing(adj.惊人的)/amazement(n.惊奇)/maze(n.迷宫)  

copper<,>/ˈkɒpə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːpər/<,>n.铜/n.铜币<,>The statue was made of copper.<,>这座雕像是用铜制成的。<,>In ancient times, copper was used to make coins.<,>在古代，铜被用来制造钱币。<,>The roof was covered with copper sheets.<,>屋顶覆盖着铜板。<,>cop(警察)+per(每)→警察每天接触的铜质警徽→铜<,>cobber(n.朋友)/cooper(n.制桶工人)/copier(n.复印机)
delivery<,>/dɪˈlɪvəri/<,>/dɪˈlɪvəri/<,>n.投递/n.交付/n.分娩<,>The delivery of the package was delayed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，包裹的投递被延迟了。<,>She had a smooth delivery and a healthy baby.<,>她分娩顺利，生了一个健康的宝宝。<,>The company guarantees next-day delivery for local orders.<,>公司保证本地订单次日送达。<,>de(离开)+liver(自由)+y→把东西从手中自由放走→交付<,>deliver(v.递送)/livery(n.制服)/recovery(n.恢复)

institute<,>/ˈɪnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈɪnstɪtuːt/<,>n.研究所/n.学院<,>She works at a medical research institute.<,>她在一家医学研究所工作。<,>The institute offers courses in business management.<,>这个学院提供商业管理课程。<,>He was invited to speak at the prestigious institute.<,>他受邀在这所著名学院演讲。<,>in(进入)+stitute(建立)→建立起来的机构<,>constitution(n.宪法)/substitute(n.替代品)/prostitute(n.妓女)

assign<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>v.指派〔任务〕/v.分配/v.分派<,>The teacher will assign homework every Friday.<,>老师每周五都会布置作业。<,>They assigned me to the marketing department.<,>他们把我分配到了市场部。<,>Can you assign someone to help with this project?<,>你能指派个人来帮忙这个项目吗？<,>as(向)+sign(标记)→做标记分配<,>design(v.设计)/resign(v.辞职)/consign(v.托运)

intelligence<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒəns/<,>/ɪnˈtelɪdʒəns/<,>n.智力/n.理解力/n.情报<,>His intelligence is well above average.<,>他的智力远超平均水平。<,>The spy gathered military intelligence.<,>间谍收集了军事情报。<,>Artificial intelligence is changing our world.<,>人工智能正在改变我们的世界。<,>intel(在...之间)+lig(选择)+ence→能在事物间做出选择的能力<,>intellectual(adj.智力的)/diligent(adj.勤奋的)/negligent(adj.疏忽的)

fill<,>/fɪl/<,>/fɪl/<,>v.装满/v.盛满/v.占满<,>Please fill the glass with water.<,>请把玻璃杯装满水。<,>The auditorium was filled with excited fans.<,>礼堂里挤满了兴奋的粉丝。<,>This position has already been filled.<,>这个职位已经有人了。<,>与full(满的)同源<,>spill(v.溢出)/thrill(n.兴奋)/drill(v.钻孔)

overhead<,>/ˌəʊvəˈhed/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈhed/<,>adj.在头顶上的/adj.架空的<,>The overhead lights were too bright.<,>头顶上的灯太亮了。<,>Watch out for the overhead power lines.<,>小心头顶的电线。<,>The plane flew overhead at a low altitude.<,>飞机低空从头顶飞过。<,>over(在...上)+head(头)→在头顶上的<,>overhear(v.偷听)/overhaul(v.彻底检修)/overhang(v.悬垂)

conscience<,>/ˈkɒnʃəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəns/<,>n.良心/n.道德心<,>His conscience wouldn't allow him to lie.<,>他的良心不允许他说谎。<,>She acted according to her conscience.<,>她凭良心行事。<,>I have a clear conscience about my decision.<,>我对自己的决定问心无愧。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+ence→共同知晓的道德心<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/science(n.科学)/omniscient(adj.全知的)

ours<,>/aʊəz/<,>/aʊrz/<,>pron.我们的<,>This house is ours.<,>这房子是我们的。<,>The victory is ours!<,>胜利属于我们！<,>Their opinion differs from ours.<,>他们的意见和我们不同。<,>our(我们的)+s→我们的(东西)<,>yours(pron.你们的)/theirs(pron.他们的)/hers(pron.她的)

borrow<,>/ˈbɒrəʊ/<,>/ˈbɑːroʊ/<,>v.借/v.借用/v.借入<,>Can I borrow your pen?<,>我能借你的笔吗？<,>He borrowed money from the bank.<,>他向银行借了钱。<,>English has borrowed many words from French.<,>英语从法语借用了很多词汇。<,>borrow与lend(借出)相对<,>burrow(n.地洞)/sorrow(n.悲伤)/tomorrow(n.明天)

landing<,>/ˈlændɪŋ/<,>/ˈlændɪŋ/<,>n.上岸/n.登陆/n.着陆<,>The plane made a smooth landing.<,>飞机平稳着陆了。<,>The troops prepared for a beach landing.<,>部队准备海滩登陆。<,>She fell on the stair landing.<,>她在楼梯平台上摔倒了。<,>land(陆地)+ing→到达陆地的过程<,>launching(n.发射)/stranding(n.搁浅)/wanding(n.用魔杖施法)
urgent<,>/ˈɜːdʒənt/<,>/ˈɜːrdʒənt/<,>adj.紧急的<,>This is an urgent matter that needs immediate attention.<,>这是一件需要立即关注的紧急事项。<,>He received an urgent call from the hospital.<,>他接到了医院打来的紧急电话。<,>The situation is urgent and requires quick action.<,>情况紧急，需要迅速采取行动。<,>urg(催促)+ent(形容词后缀)→催促的→紧急的<,>emergent(adj. 紧急的)/agent(n.代理人)/urgently(adv.紧急地)  

Roman<,>/ˈrəʊmən/<,>/ˈroʊmən/<,>n.古罗马人/adj.罗马的<,>The Romans built many roads across Europe.<,>古罗马人在欧洲修建了许多道路。<,>She is studying Roman history at university.<,>她在大学学习罗马历史。<,>The architecture has a distinct Roman style.<,>这座建筑有明显的罗马风格。<,>Rome(罗马)+an(形容词后缀)→罗马的<,>romance(n.浪漫)/roman(n.小说)/Romulus(罗马神话中的建城者)  

remind<,>/rɪˈmaɪnd/<,>/rɪˈmaɪnd/<,>v.提醒/v.使想起<,>Can you remind me to call my mom later?<,>你能提醒我稍后给我妈妈打电话吗？<,>The smell of cookies reminds me of my childhood.<,>饼干的香味让我想起了我的童年。<,>She reminded him of their meeting at 3 PM.<,>她提醒他下午3点有会议。<,>re(再)+mind(头脑)→再次进入脑海→提醒<,>remember(v.记得)/reminisce(v.回忆)/remain(v.保持)  

power<,>/ˈpaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈpaʊər/<,>n.能力/n.力/n.权/n.幂<,>She has the power to influence people's opinions.<,>她有影响人们观点的能力。<,>The power went out during the storm.<,>暴风雨期间停电了。<,>2 to the power of 3 is 8.<,>2的3次方是8。<,>pow(源自拉丁语posse,意为能够)+er→能力<,>empower(v.授权)/powerful(adj.强大的)/powerless(adj.无力的)  

pick<,>/pɪk/<,>/pɪk/<,>n.镐/n.鹤嘴锄<,>The miner used a pick to break the rocks.<,>矿工用镐敲碎岩石。<,>He sharpened the pick before starting work.<,>他在开始工作前磨尖了鹤嘴锄。<,>Archaeologists found an ancient pick at the site.<,>考古学家在现场发现了一把古代的镐。<,>p+ick(尖)→尖的工具→镐<,>peck(v.啄)/prick(v.刺)/pickle(n.泡菜)  

possess<,>/pəˈzes/<,>/pəˈzes/<,>v.占用/v.拥有(财产)<,>He possesses great wealth but little happiness.<,>他拥有巨额财富但几乎没有幸福。<,>The museum possesses a rare collection of paintings.<,>博物馆拥有一批珍贵的画作收藏。<,>She was possessed by a strange idea.<,>她被一个奇怪的想法占据了头脑。<,>pos(能够)+sess(坐)→能够坐拥→拥有<,>possession(n.拥有)/dispossess(v.剥夺)/obsess(v.迷住)  

between<,>/bɪˈtwiːn/<,>/bɪˈtwiːn/<,>prep.在...中间<,>The cat is sleeping between the two pillows.<,>猫睡在两个枕头中间。<,>There's a strong bond between the twins.<,>这对双胞胎之间有很强的纽带。<,>Choose between tea and coffee.<,>在茶和咖啡之间选择。<,>be(在)+tween(二)→在两者之间<,>among(prep.在...之中)/amid(prep.在...中间)/betwixt(prep.在...之间)  

cafe<,>/ˈkæfeɪ/<,>/kæˈfeɪ/<,>n.咖啡馆/n.小餐厅<,>Let's meet at the cafe on the corner.<,>我们在街角的咖啡馆见面吧。<,>This cafe serves the best croissants in town.<,>这家咖啡馆提供镇上最好的牛角面包。<,>She works part-time at a local cafe.<,>她在当地的一家小餐厅做兼职。<,>源自法语café(咖啡)→咖啡馆<,>coffee(n.咖啡)/cafeteria(n.自助餐厅)/caffeine(n.咖啡因)  

solid<,>/ˈsɒlɪd/<,>/ˈsɑːlɪd/<,>adj.固体的/n.固体<,>Ice is water in its solid state.<,>冰是水的固态形式。<,>The table is made of solid oak.<,>这张桌子是用实心橡木制成的。<,>He gave me solid advice based on experience.<,>他根据经验给了我可靠的建议。<,>sol(太阳)+id→像太阳一样稳固→固体<,>liquid(n.液体)/gas(n.气体)/solder(v.焊接)  

badly<,>/ˈbædli/<,>/ˈbædli/<,>adv.坏/adv.差/adv.严重地<,>He played badly in yesterday's match.<,>他在昨天的比赛中表现很差。<,>She was badly injured in the accident.<,>她在事故中受了重伤。<,>The project is going badly and needs help.<,>这个项目进展得很糟糕，需要帮助。<,>bad(坏的)+ly(副词后缀)→坏地<,>goodly(adv.很好地)/sadly(adv.悲伤地)/madly(adv.疯狂地)
or<,>/ɔː(r)/<,>/ɔːr/<,>conj.或/conj.或者/conj.即<,>You can have tea or coffee.<,>你可以喝茶或者咖啡。<,>It's a novel, or rather, a short story.<,>这是一部小说，或者说是一个短篇故事。<,>She can sing or dance.<,>她会唱歌或者跳舞。<,>or(或者)→选择关系<,>nor(conj.也不)/ore(n.矿石)/oar(n.桨)  

individual<,>/ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>/ˌɪndəˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>adj.个别的/adj.独特的<,>Each individual leaf is different.<,>每一片叶子都是独特的。<,>She has her own individual style.<,>她有自己独特的风格。<,>We treat each case on an individual basis.<,>我们根据个案情况处理。<,>in(不)+divid(分割)+ual→不可分割的→独特的<,>divide(v.分割)/indivisible(adj.不可分割的)/collective(adj.集体的)  

headquarters<,>/ˌhedˈkwɔːtəz/<,>/ˈhedˌkwɔːrtərz/<,>n.总部/n.司令部<,>The company's headquarters is in New York.<,>公司的总部在纽约。<,>Military headquarters issued a statement.<,>军事司令部发表了一份声明。<,>The police headquarters was heavily guarded.<,>警察总部戒备森严。<,>head(头)+quarters(四分之一)→总部<,>quarter(n.四分之一)/headboard(n.床头板)/headhunter(n.猎头)  

medal<,>/ˈmedl/<,>/ˈmedl/<,>n.奖章/n.勋章/n.纪念章<,>He won a gold medal in the Olympics.<,>他在奥运会上获得了金牌。<,>The soldier was awarded a medal for bravery.<,>这名士兵因勇敢而被授予勋章。<,>She keeps her grandfather's war medals in a box.<,>她把祖父的战争纪念章保存在一个盒子里。<,>med(中间)+al→中间的奖励→奖章<,>metal(n.金属)/meddle(v.干涉)/model(n.模型)  

associate<,>/əˈsəʊʃieɪt/<,>/əˈsoʊʃieɪt/<,>v.交往/n.伙伴/n.同事<,>I don't associate with people like that.<,>我不和那样的人交往。<,>He is my business associate.<,>他是我的商业伙伴。<,>She is an associate professor at the university.<,>她是大学的副教授。<,>as(加强)+soci(同伴)+ate→成为同伴→交往<,>society(n.社会)/social(adj.社会的)/dissociate(v.分离)  

post<,>/pəʊst/<,>/poʊst/<,>n.柱/n.桩/n.杆/v.贴出<,>The fence was held up by wooden posts.<,>篱笆由木桩支撑着。<,>Please post this notice on the board.<,>请把这个通知贴在公告板上。<,>He was leaning against a lamp post.<,>他靠在一根路灯杆上。<,>post(放置)→把东西放置在某处→贴出<,>past(adj.过去的)/pose(v.摆姿势)/host(n.主人)  

awkward<,>/ˈɔːkwəd/<,>/ˈɔːkwərd/<,>adj.尴尬的/adj.笨拙的<,>There was an awkward silence.<,>出现了尴尬的沉默。<,>He felt awkward in the formal suit.<,>他穿着正式西装感到不自在。<,>The handle is in an awkward position.<,>把手的位置很不方便。<,>awk(错误的)+ward(方向)→方向错误→笨拙的<,>backward(adj.向后的)/forward(adj.向前的)/coward(n.懦夫)  

generally<,>/ˈdʒenrəli/<,>/ˈdʒenrəli/<,>adv.一般地/adv.通常地<,>Generally speaking, I agree with you.<,>总的来说，我同意你的观点。<,>It's generally hot in summer.<,>夏天通常很热。<,>He is generally considered to be honest.<,>人们普遍认为他是诚实的。<,>general(一般的)+ly(副词后缀)→一般地<,>generous(adj.慷慨的)/generate(v.产生)/genuine(adj.真正的)  

drop<,>/drɒp/<,>/drɑːp/<,>v.使落下/v.降低<,>She dropped her keys on the floor.<,>她把钥匙掉在了地上。<,>Prices have dropped recently.<,>最近价格下降了。<,>Don't drop the glass!<,>别把玻璃杯摔了！<,>dr(向下)+op(落下)→使落下<,>drip(v.滴下)/drab(adj.单调的)/drape(v.悬挂)  

fine<,>/faɪn/<,>/faɪn/<,>adj.美好的/adj.纤细的<,>It's a fine day today.<,>今天天气很好。<,>She has fine hair.<,>她的头发很细。<,>The artist has a fine eye for detail.<,>这位艺术家对细节有敏锐的洞察力。<,>fin(结束)+e→完美的结束→美好的<,>find(v.找到)/fire(n.火)/fame(n.名声)
its<,>/ɪts/<,>/ɪts/<,>det.它的<,>The cat licked its paws.<,>猫舔了舔它的爪子。<,>The tree lost its leaves in autumn.<,>秋天树掉了叶子。<,>Its color is very bright.<,>它的颜色很鲜艳。<,>it's (it is 的缩写)<,>his (他的)/her (她的)/their (他们的)

carry<,>/ˈkæri/<,>/ˈkæri/<,>v.携带/v.运载/v.传送<,>She can carry all the groceries in one trip.<,>她可以一次把所有的杂货都搬完。<,>This truck can carry heavy loads.<,>这辆卡车可以运载重物。<,>The internet carries information quickly.<,>互联网能快速传送信息。<,>car(车)+ry→用车运载<,>cart(n.手推车)/cargo(n.货物)/carrier(n.运输工具)

bill<,>/bɪl/<,>/bɪl/<,>n.账单/n.票据/n.招贴<,>Please pay the electricity bill by Friday.<,>请在周五前付电费。<,>He paid with a 100-dollar bill.<,>他用一张100美元的钞票支付。<,>They put up bills advertising the concert.<,>他们张贴了音乐会的宣传海报。<,>bill(鸟嘴)→像鸟嘴一样突出的票据<,>fill(v.填满)/pill(n.药丸)/bull(n.公牛)

barber<,>/ˈbɑːbə(r)/<,>/ˈbɑːrbər/<,>n.理发师<,>My barber gives me a great haircut every time.<,>我的理发师每次都给我理得很好。<,>The barber shop is on Main Street.<,>理发店在主街上。<,>He's been a barber for 20 years.<,>他当理发师已经20年了。<,>barb(胡须)+er(人)→修剪胡须的人<,>barber(v.修剪)/bar(n.酒吧)/barb(n.倒钩)

payment<,>/ˈpeɪmənt/<,>/ˈpeɪmənt/<,>n.支付<,>We accept cash or credit card payments.<,>我们接受现金或信用卡支付。<,>The payment is due next week.<,>付款下周到期。<,>He made a payment on his car loan.<,>他支付了一笔汽车贷款。<,>pay(支付)+ment(名词后缀)<,>repayment(n.偿还)/prepayment(n.预付)/nonpayment(n.不支付)

tower<,>/ˈtaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈtaʊər/<,>n.塔/v.屹立/v.高耸<,>The Eiffel Tower is in Paris.<,>埃菲尔铁塔在巴黎。<,>The mountains tower over the valley.<,>群山高耸于山谷之上。<,>He towered above his classmates.<,>他在同学中鹤立鸡群。<,>tow(拖)+er→像被拖向天空的建筑<,>power(n.力量)/flower(n.花)/towel(n.毛巾)

luggage<,>/ˈlʌɡɪdʒ/<,>/ˈlʌɡɪdʒ/<,>n.行李/n.皮箱/n.皮包<,>Please check your luggage at the counter.<,>请在柜台托运您的行李。<,>She packed her luggage for the trip.<,>她为旅行收拾好了行李。<,>The hotel has a luggage storage service.<,>酒店有行李寄存服务。<,>lug(拖)+gage(物品)→拖运的物品<,>baggage(n.行李)/language(n.语言)/garage(n.车库)

important<,>/ɪmˈpɔːtnt/<,>/ɪmˈpɔːrtnt/<,>adj.重要的/adj.有势力的<,>It's important to drink enough water.<,>喝足够的水很重要。<,>He's an important figure in the company.<,>他是公司里的重要人物。<,>This is an important decision.<,>这是一个重要的决定。<,>im(进入)+port(港口)+ant→进入港口的东西都很重要<,>import(v.进口/n.重要性)/export(v.出口)

flare<,>/fleə(r)/<,>/fler/<,>v.闪耀<,>The fireworks flared in the night sky.<,>烟花在夜空中闪耀。<,>Her temper flared during the argument.<,>她在争论中突然发怒。<,>The match flared in the darkness.<,>火柴在黑暗中突然亮起。<,>fl(火焰)+are(是)→是火焰→闪耀<,>glare(v.怒视)/blare(v.鸣响)/flame(n.火焰)

off<,>/ɒf/<,>/ɔːf/<,>adv.(离)开/adv.(停)止<,>Turn off the lights when you leave.<,>离开时请关灯。<,>The meeting is off for today.<,>今天的会议取消了。<,>He took his jacket off.<,>他脱下了夹克。<,>of(的)+f(分离)→分离的状态<,>on(在...上)/of(的)/if(如果)
dear<,>/dɪə(r)/<,>/dɪr/<,>adj.亲爱的/int.啊<,>Dear friends, thank you for your support.<,>亲爱的朋友们，感谢你们的支持。<,>Oh dear! I forgot my keys.<,>啊呀！我忘记带钥匙了。<,>She wrote a dear letter to her grandmother.<,>她给祖母写了一封亲切的信。<,>dear(亲爱的)与deer(鹿)同音<,>deer(n.鹿)/fear(n.害怕)/tear(n.眼泪)

constant<,>/ˈkɒnstənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstənt/<,>adj.经常的/adj.永恒的<,>He is in constant pain.<,>他经常感到疼痛。<,>The speed of light is constant.<,>光速是恒定的。<,>She gave me constant support.<,>她给了我持续的支持。<,>con(共同)+stant(站立)→一直站在一起→永恒的<,>instant(adj.立即的)/distant(adj.遥远的)/consistent(adj.一致的)

mode<,>/məʊd/<,>/moʊd/<,>n.方式/n.样式<,>Switch the camera to manual mode.<,>将相机切换到手动模式。<,>This dress is in the latest mode.<,>这件裙子是最新款式的。<,>He has a strange mode of speaking.<,>他有种奇怪的说话方式。<,>mode与model(模型)同源<,>mood(n.情绪)/mod(n.现代派)/code(n.代码)

coal<,>/kəʊl/<,>/koʊl/<,>n.煤/n.煤块<,>We need to buy some coal for winter.<,>我们需要买些煤过冬。<,>A coal fell out of the stove.<,>一块煤从炉子里掉了出来。<,>Coal mining is dangerous work.<,>煤矿开采是危险的工作。<,>coal与cold(冷的)形似<,>goal(n.目标)/coil(v.盘绕)/cola(n.可乐)

approximate<,>/əˈprɒksɪmət/<,>/əˈprɑːksɪmət/<,>adj.近似的/v.近似<,>The approximate time of arrival is 3 pm.<,>大约到达时间是下午3点。<,>Can you approximate the cost?<,>你能估算一下成本吗？<,>These figures are approximate.<,>这些数字是近似值。<,>ap(向)+proxim(接近)+ate→接近的<,>proximate(adj.最近的)/appropriate(adj.合适的)/approval(n.批准)

defect<,>/ˈdiːfekt/<,>/ˈdiːfekt/<,>n.缺点/n.缺陷/n.欠缺<,>The product was recalled due to a manufacturing defect.<,>该产品因制造缺陷被召回。<,>His main defect is impatience.<,>他的主要缺点是缺乏耐心。<,>The plan has some serious defects.<,>这个计划有一些严重缺陷。<,>de(离开)+fect(做)→做得不好→缺陷<,>effect(n.效果)/infect(v.感染)/perfect(adj.完美的)

afternoon<,>/ˌɑːftəˈnuːn/<,>/ˌæftərˈnuːn/<,>n.下午/n.午后<,>Let's meet tomorrow afternoon.<,>我们明天下午见面吧。<,>I usually take a nap in the afternoon.<,>我通常在下午小睡一会儿。<,>The afternoon sun was very hot.<,>午后的太阳很热。<,>after(之后)+noon(中午)→中午之后<,>morning(n.早晨)/evening(n.晚上)/midday(n.正午)

worthless<,>/ˈwɜːθləs/<,>/ˈwɜːrθləs/<,>adj.无价值的/adj.无用的<,>This old coin is worthless.<,>这枚旧硬币毫无价值。<,>His advice was completely worthless.<,>他的建议完全没用。<,>I feel worthless when I can't help.<,>当我帮不上忙时感觉很没用。<,>worth(价值)+less(无)→无价值的<,>worthwhile(adj.值得的)/worthy(adj.值得的)/priceless(adj.无价的)

infect<,>/ɪnˈfekt/<,>/ɪnˈfekt/<,>v.传染/v.感染<,>The virus can infect humans.<,>这种病毒可以感染人类。<,>Her enthusiasm infected everyone.<,>她的热情感染了每个人。<,>Make sure the wound doesn't get infected.<,>确保伤口不被感染。<,>in(进入)+fect(做)→进入体内作用→感染<,>affect(v.影响)/effect(n.效果)/perfect(adj.完美的)

ultimate<,>/ˈʌltɪmət/<,>/ˈʌltɪmət/<,>adj.最后的/adj.最终的<,>This is our ultimate goal.<,>这是我们的最终目标。<,>The ultimate decision rests with you.<,>最后的决定权在你。<,>He gave his ultimate performance.<,>他进行了最后一次表演。<,>ultim(最后)+ate→最后的<,>intimate(adj.亲密的)/estimate(v.估计)/animate(v.使有生气)
linen<,>/ˈlɪnɪn/<,>/ˈlɪnən/<,>n.亚麻布/n.亚麻织物<,>She wore a dress made of fine linen.<,>她穿了一件用优质亚麻布做的裙子。<,>The table was covered with a white linen cloth.<,>桌子上铺着白色的亚麻桌布。<,>Linen is known for its durability and breathability.<,>亚麻布以其耐用性和透气性著称。<,>lin(亚麻)+en(材料后缀)→亚麻布<,>cotton(n.棉花)/wool(n.羊毛)/silk(n.丝绸)

moist<,>/mɔɪst/<,>/mɔɪst/<,>adj.湿润的/adj.多雨的<,>Keep the soil moist for the plants to grow.<,>保持土壤湿润以利于植物生长。<,>The air was moist after the rain.<,>雨后空气很湿润。<,>Her eyes were moist with tears.<,>她的眼睛因泪水而湿润。<,>moi(类似"霉")+st→潮湿容易发霉→湿润的<,>damp(adj.潮湿的)/humid(adj.湿热的)/arid(adj.干旱的)

anger<,>/ˈæŋɡə(r)/<,>/ˈæŋɡər/<,>n.愤怒/v.使发怒<,>He couldn't control his anger when he heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时他无法控制自己的愤怒。<,>Her words angered the crowd.<,>她的话激怒了人群。<,>Anger management is important for mental health.<,>愤怒管理对心理健康很重要。<,>ang(痛苦)+er(名词后缀)→愤怒<,>hunger(n.饥饿)/danger(n.危险)/anxiety(n.焦虑)

April<,>/ˈeɪprəl/<,>/ˈeɪprəl/<,>n.四月<,>April is the fourth month of the year.<,>四月是一年中的第四个月。<,>We usually have spring break in April.<,>我们通常在四月放春假。<,>April showers bring May flowers.<,>四月的雨带来五月的花。<,>A(开)+pril(类似"喷")→四月万物开始喷发式生长<,>March(n.三月)/May(n.五月)/August(n.八月)

fate<,>/feɪt/<,>/feɪt/<,>n.命运/n.天数<,>They believed it was fate that brought them together.<,>他们相信是命运让他们相遇。<,>He accepted his fate with dignity.<,>他尊严地接受了自己的命运。<,>The fate of the project is still uncertain.<,>这个项目的命运仍不确定。<,>fat(胖)+e→胖是命中注定的→命运<,>faith(n.信念)/face(n.脸面)/fake(adj.假的)

match<,>/mætʃ/<,>/mætʃ/<,>n.比赛/n.竞赛/n.对手<,>The football match ended in a draw.<,>足球比赛以平局告终。<,>He found his perfect match in the competition.<,>他在比赛中找到了旗鼓相当的对手。<,>This tie doesn't match my shirt.<,>这条领带和我的衬衫不配。<,>mat(垫子)+ch→比赛时垫子很重要→比赛<,>watch(v.观看)/patch(n.补丁)/march(v.行军)

gasoline<,>/ˈɡæsəliːn/<,>/ˈɡæsəliːn/<,>n.汽油<,>The price of gasoline has risen again.<,>汽油价格又上涨了。<,>This car runs on unleaded gasoline.<,>这辆车使用无铅汽油。<,>He stopped to fill up the tank with gasoline.<,>他停下来给油箱加满汽油。<,>gas(气体)+ol(油)+ine→汽油<,>petrol(n.汽油[英式])/diesel(n.柴油)/kerosene(n.煤油)

how<,>/haʊ/<,>/haʊ/<,>adv.怎么/adv.怎样/adv.多少<,>How did you solve this problem?<,>你是怎么解决这个问题的？<,>How much does it cost?<,>这个多少钱？<,>How about going for a walk?<,>去散步怎么样？<,>h(how)+ow(感叹)→怎么<,>now(adv.现在)/cow(n.奶牛)/bow(v.鞠躬)

patient<,>/ˈpeɪʃnt/<,>/ˈpeɪʃənt/<,>adj.忍耐的/n.病人<,>Be patient, the results will come soon.<,>耐心点，结果很快就会出来。<,>The doctor is seeing his next patient.<,>医生正在看下一个病人。<,>She was very patient with the children.<,>她对孩子们非常耐心。<,>pati(忍受)+ent(形容词后缀)→忍耐的<,>impatient(adj.不耐烦的)/parent(n.父母)/patent(n.专利)

cunning<,>/ˈkʌnɪŋ/<,>/ˈkʌnɪŋ/<,>adj.狡猾的/adj.狡诈的<,>The fox is known for its cunning nature.<,>狐狸以其狡猾的本性著称。<,>He devised a cunning plan to escape.<,>他想出了一个狡猾的逃跑计划。<,>Her cunning smile made me suspicious.<,>她狡诈的笑容让我起了疑心。<,>cun(谐音"坑")+ning→总想坑人→狡猾的<,>running(n.跑步)/dunning(n.催债)/sunny(adj.晴朗的)
paragraph<,>/ˈpærəɡrɑːf/<,>/ˈpærəɡræf/<,>n.（文章的）段/节<,>Please read the first paragraph aloud.<,>请大声朗读第一段。<,>Each paragraph should focus on one main idea.<,>每个段落应围绕一个主要观点展开。<,>The conclusion is in the final paragraph.<,>结论在最后一段。<,>para(旁边)+graph(写)→在旁边写的内容→段落<,>parallel(adj.平行的/n.平行线)/graphite(n.石墨)  

alternative<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːnətɪv/<,>/ɔlˈtɜrnətɪv/<,>n.替换物/取舍/抉择<,>We need to find an alternative solution.<,>我们需要找到替代方案。<,>There is no alternative but to wait.<,>除了等待别无选择。<,>She chose the healthier alternative.<,>她选择了更健康的替代品。<,>alter(改变)+native(…的)→可改变的→替代的<,>alternate(v.交替/adj.轮流的)/alteration(n.修改)  

dust<,>/dʌst/<,>/dʌst/<,>n.尘土/灰尘<,>The furniture was covered with dust.<,>家具上布满了灰尘。<,>She dusted the shelves every morning.<,>她每天早上掸去架子上的灰尘。<,>A cloud of dust rose from the road.<,>路上扬起一片尘土。<,>d(地)+ust(看作must必须)→地上必须打扫的是灰尘<,>rust(n.铁锈/v.生锈)/must(aux.必须)  

wound<,>/wuːnd/<,>/wund/<,>n.创伤/伤/v.使受伤<,>The wound took a long time to heal.<,>伤口花了很长时间才愈合。<,>His words wounded her deeply.<,>他的话深深伤害了她。<,>She was wounded in the accident.<,>她在事故中受了伤。<,>w(像伤口形状)+ound(看作round环绕)→环绕身体的伤口<,>found(v.建立)/bound(adj.必定的)  

grade<,>/ɡreɪd/<,>/ɡreɪd/<,>v.给…分等级/n.等级<,>The teacher graded our papers.<,>老师给我们的试卷打了分。<,>She got an A grade in math.<,>她数学得了A。<,>This is top-grade coffee.<,>这是顶级咖啡。<,>g(看作good好)+rade(看作rate评级)→好的评级→等级<,>grape(n.葡萄)/grate(v.磨碎)  

pop<,>/pɒp/<,>/pɑp/<,>n.流行音乐/流行歌曲<,>She loves listening to pop music.<,>她喜欢听流行音乐。<,>The song became a pop hit.<,>这首歌成为了流行金曲。<,>He is a famous pop singer.<,>他是著名的流行歌手。<,>拟声词，模仿爆裂声→引申为流行的爆发<,>pip(n.种子)/pope(n.教皇)  

aviation<,>/ˌeɪviˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌeɪviˈeɪʃn/<,>n.航空/航空学<,>He works in the aviation industry.<,>他在航空业工作。<,>Aviation technology has advanced rapidly.<,>航空技术发展迅速。<,>She studies aviation at university.<,>她在大学学习航空学。<,>avi(鸟)+ation(名词后缀)→像鸟一样飞行→航空<,>navy(n.海军)/avoid(v.避免)  

vast<,>/vɑːst/<,>/væst/<,>adj.巨大的/大量的<,>They crossed the vast desert.<,>他们穿越了广阔的沙漠。<,>A vast amount of data was collected.<,>收集了大量数据。<,>The difference is vast.<,>差异巨大。<,>vas(容器)+t(特别)→特别大的容器→巨大的<,>vest(n.背心)/fast(adj.快的)  

diverse<,>/daɪˈvɜːs/<,>/dɪˈvɜrs/<,>adj.不一样的/相异的<,>The city has a diverse population.<,>这座城市人口多样化。<,>We need diverse opinions.<,>我们需要不同的意见。<,>Her interests are very diverse.<,>她的兴趣非常广泛。<,>di(分开)+verse(转)→转向不同方向→不同的<,>divert(v.转移)/reverse(adj.相反的)  

enjoy<,>/ɪnˈdʒɔɪ/<,>/ɪnˈdʒɔɪ/<,>v.享受/欣赏/喜爱<,>I enjoy reading books.<,>我喜欢读书。<,>They enjoyed the party very much.<,>他们非常喜欢这个派对。<,>Enjoy your meal!<,>请慢用！<,>en(使)+joy(快乐)→使快乐→享受<,>enlarge(v.扩大)/enroll(v.注册)
potential<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>adj.潜在的/n.潜力<,>She has the potential to become a great leader.<,>她有成为伟大领袖的潜力。<,>There is potential danger in this plan.<,>这个计划存在潜在危险。<,>He hasn't reached his full potential yet.<,>他还没有发挥出全部潜力。<,>pot(力量)+ent(形容词后缀)+ial→有力量的→潜力<,>essential(adj.必要的)/substantial(adj.大量的)/influential(adj.有影响力的)

deceive<,>/dɪˈsiːv/<,>/dɪˈsiːv/<,>v.欺骗/v.蒙蔽/v.行骗<,>Don't deceive yourself about the situation.<,>不要在这个情况上欺骗自己。<,>His friendly manner didn't deceive us.<,>他友好的态度没有蒙蔽我们。<,>They deceived the old man into signing the document.<,>他们骗老人签了文件。<,>de(向下)+ceive(拿)→在下面拿→偷偷拿→欺骗<,>receive(v.接收)/perceive(v.察觉)/conceive(v.构想)

voltage<,>/ˈvəʊltɪdʒ/<,>/ˈvoʊltɪdʒ/<,>n.电压<,>The voltage in this circuit is too high.<,>这个电路的电压太高。<,>Check the voltage before connecting the device.<,>连接设备前检查电压。<,>A voltage regulator maintains constant output.<,>稳压器保持恒定输出。<,>volt(伏特)+age(名词后缀)→电压<,>current(n.电流)/resistance(n.电阻)/wattage(n.瓦数)

reporter<,>/rɪˈpɔːtə(r)/<,>/rɪˈpɔːrtər/<,>n.记者/n.通讯员<,>The reporter interviewed the president.<,>记者采访了总统。<,>She works as a court reporter.<,>她是法庭通讯员。<,>The reporter filed his story before deadline.<,>记者在截止日期前提交了报道。<,>report(报告)+er(人)→做报告的人→记者<,>correspondent(n.通讯记者)/journalist(n.新闻记者)/announcer(n.播音员)

dialog<,>/ˈdaɪəlɒɡ/<,>/ˈdaɪəlɔːɡ/<,>n.对话/n.对白<,>The dialog between the two leaders was productive.<,>两位领导人的对话富有成效。<,>I enjoyed the witty dialog in the play.<,>我喜欢剧中机智的对白。<,>Let's open a dialog about this issue.<,>让我们就这个问题展开对话。<,>dia(两者之间)+log(说)→两人之间的谈话→对话<,>monolog(n.独白)/catalog(n.目录)/prolog(n.序言)

air<,>/eə(r)/<,>/er/<,>n.空气/n.空中<,>The fresh air made me feel better.<,>新鲜空气让我感觉好多了。<,>The plane is still in the air.<,>飞机还在空中。<,>There's an air of excitement in the room.<,>房间里有兴奋的气氛。<,>air(词根本身表示"空气")<,>heir(n.继承人)/ere(prep.在...之前)/err(v.犯错)

circulate<,>/ˈsɜːkjəleɪt/<,>/ˈsɜːrkjəleɪt/<,>v.使循环<,>Blood circulates through the body.<,>血液在体内循环。<,>Please circulate these documents to all staff.<,>请把这些文件分发给所有员工。<,>The fan helps to circulate the air.<,>风扇帮助空气循环。<,>circ(圆)+ul(小)+ate(动词后缀)→使成小圆→循环<,>circular(adj.圆形的)/circuit(n.电路)/circus(n.马戏团)

garden<,>/ˈɡɑːdn/<,>/ˈɡɑːrdn/<,>n.花园/n.菜园/n.公园<,>She spends hours working in her garden.<,>她花很多时间在花园里工作。<,>We grow vegetables in our kitchen garden.<,>我们在菜园里种蔬菜。<,>Let's meet at the botanical garden.<,>我们在植物园见面吧。<,>gar(保护)+den(地方)→受保护的地方→花园<,>guard(v.守卫)/garment(n.衣服)/garlic(n.大蒜)

discovery<,>/dɪˈskʌvəri/<,>/dɪˈskʌvəri/<,>n.发现/n.被发现的事物<,>The discovery of penicillin changed medicine.<,>青霉素的发现改变了医学。<,>This is an important archaeological discovery.<,>这是一个重要的考古发现。<,>The book describes his discoveries in Africa.<,>这本书描述了他在非洲的发现。<,>dis(不)+cover(覆盖)+y→不再覆盖→发现<,>recovery(n.恢复)/delivery(n.交付)/misery(n.痛苦)

underline<,>/ˌʌndəˈlaɪn/<,>/ˌʌndərˈlaɪn/<,>v.划线于...之下<,>Please underline the key points.<,>请在重点内容下划线。<,>This incident underlines the need for better security.<,>这一事件凸显了加强安保的必要性。<,>She underlined her name on the form.<,>她在表格上自己的名字下划了线。<,>under(在...下)+line(线)→在下面划线<,>underline(n.下划线)/underlie(v.构成...的基础)/undermine(v.逐渐削弱)
