concept<,>/ˈkɒnsept/<,>/ˈkɑːnsept/<,>n.概念/n.观念/n.设想<,>The concept of time is difficult to explain.<,>时间的概念很难解释。<,>She has a clear concept of what she wants to achieve.<,>她对自己想要实现的目标有清晰的概念。<,>This new product is based on an innovative concept.<,>这个新产品基于一个创新的设想。<,>con(共同)+cept(拿)→共同拿住的想法→概念<,>precept(n.规则/n.训导)/percept(n.知觉对象)/incept(v.开始/v.摄取)

look<,>/lʊk/<,>/lʊk/<,>v.看/v.显得/n.看<,>Look at that beautiful sunset!<,>看那美丽的日落！<,>You look tired today.<,>你今天看起来很累。<,>Let me have a look at your new phone.<,>让我看看你的新手机。<,>与"book"押韵记忆<,>see(v.看见)/watch(v.观看)/gaze(v.凝视)

forever<,>/fərˈevə(r)/<,>/fɔːrˈevər/<,>adv.永远/adv.总是/adv.老是<,>I will love you forever.<,>我会永远爱你。<,>He is forever complaining about his job.<,>他总是抱怨他的工作。<,>This moment will stay in my memory forever.<,>这一刻将永远留在我的记忆中。<,>for(为了)+ever(永远)→永远<,>never(adv.从不)/whenever(adv.无论何时)/wherever(adv.无论哪里)

worship<,>/ˈwɜːʃɪp/<,>/ˈwɜːrʃɪp/<,>n.礼拜/n.崇拜/v.崇拜<,>They attend worship every Sunday.<,>他们每周日参加礼拜。<,>She worships her favorite pop star.<,>她崇拜她最喜欢的流行歌星。<,>The ancient Greeks worshipped many gods.<,>古希腊人崇拜许多神。<,>wor(看作worth价值)+ship(状态)→认为有价值→崇拜<,>warship(n.军舰)/friendship(n.友谊)/ownership(n.所有权)

altogether<,>/ˌɔːltəˈɡeðə(r)/<,>/ˌɔːltəˈɡeðər/<,>adv.完全/adv.总而言之<,>Altogether, it was a successful event.<,>总而言之，这是一次成功的活动。<,>I don't altogether agree with you.<,>我并不完全同意你的观点。<,>There were altogether 50 people at the party.<,>聚会上总共有50人。<,>all(全部)+together(一起)→完全<,>together(adv.一起)/gather(v.聚集)/further(adv.进一步)

tough<,>/tʌf/<,>/tʌf/<,>adj.坚韧的/adj.健壮的<,>This meat is too tough to eat.<,>这块肉太硬了，咬不动。<,>He's a tough guy who never gives up.<,>他是个从不放弃的坚强家伙。<,>It was a tough decision to make.<,>这是一个艰难的决定。<,>发音类似"塔夫"→塔一样坚固→坚韧的<,>rough(adj.粗糙的)/cough(v.咳嗽)/though(conj.虽然)

glimpse<,>/ɡlɪmps/<,>/ɡlɪmps/<,>v.瞥见/n.一瞥/n.一看<,>I caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.<,>我在人群中瞥见了她。<,>He glimpsed at his watch and realized he was late.<,>他瞥了一眼手表，意识到自己迟到了。<,>The book offers a glimpse into ancient cultures.<,>这本书让我们一窥古代文化。<,>gl(光)+impse(看作impulse冲动)→光一闪的冲动→一瞥<,>glance(v.扫视)/glimmer(n.微光)/glisten(v.闪光)

dialect<,>/ˈdaɪəlekt/<,>/ˈdaɪəlekt/<,>n.方言/n.土语/n.地方话<,>She speaks the local dialect fluently.<,>她能流利地说当地方言。<,>This word is only used in certain dialects.<,>这个词只在某些方言中使用。<,>The dialect differs from village to village.<,>每个村庄的方言都有所不同。<,>dia(两者之间)+lect(说)→两者之间说的话→方言<,>dialogue(n.对话)/dial(n.刻度盘)/dictate(v.口述)

vertical<,>/ˈvɜːtɪkl/<,>/ˈvɜːrtɪkl/<,>adj.垂直的/adj.竖式的<,>The cliff has a vertical drop of 100 meters.<,>悬崖有100米的垂直落差。<,>Please draw a vertical line on the paper.<,>请在纸上画一条垂直线。<,>The vertical takeoff of the helicopter was impressive.<,>直升机的垂直起飞令人印象深刻。<,>vert(转)+ical(形容词后缀)→向上转的→垂直的<,>horizontal(adj.水平的)/vertex(n.顶点)/vortex(n.漩涡)

vice<,>/vaɪs/<,>/vaɪs/<,>n.罪恶/n.恶习<,>Gambling is a vice that can ruin lives.<,>赌博是一种能毁掉生活的恶习。<,>The novel explores the theme of virtue versus vice.<,>这部小说探讨了美德与罪恶的主题。<,>He was arrested for vice-related activities.<,>他因涉及罪恶活动而被捕。<,>与"nice"相反记忆<,>virtue(n.美德)/vise(n.虎钳)/voice(n.声音)
romantic<,>/rəʊˈmæntɪk/<,>/roʊˈmæntɪk/<,>adj.浪漫的<,>They had a romantic dinner by the beach.<,>他们在海滩边享用了一顿浪漫的晚餐。<,>She loves reading romantic novels.<,>她喜欢读浪漫小说。<,>The sunset created a romantic atmosphere.<,>日落营造出浪漫的氛围。<,>rom(罗马)+antic→罗马式的→浪漫的<,>romance(n.浪漫/恋爱)/dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)/fantastic(adj.极好的)

dictate<,>/dɪkˈteɪt/<,>/ˈdɪkteɪt/<,>v.口授/v.命令<,>The manager dictated a letter to his secretary.<,>经理向秘书口授了一封信。<,>The general dictated the terms of surrender.<,>将军下达了投降的条件。<,>She refused to be dictated to by anyone.<,>她拒绝接受任何人的命令。<,>dict(说)+ate(动词后缀)→口授<,>dictator(n.独裁者)/predict(v.预言)/addict(v.使沉迷)

health<,>/helθ/<,>/hɛlθ/<,>n.健康状况/n.健康<,>Regular exercise is good for your health.<,>定期锻炼对你的健康有益。<,>He is in poor health after the accident.<,>事故后他的健康状况不佳。<,>Mental health is as important as physical health.<,>心理健康和身体健康同样重要。<,>heal(治愈)+th(名词后缀)→健康<,>wealth(n.财富)/stealth(n.秘密行动)/healthy(adj.健康的)

awful<,>/ˈɔːfʊl/<,>/ˈɔfəl/<,>adj.令人不愉快的<,>The weather was awful during our vacation.<,>我们度假期间的天气糟透了。<,>I had an awful headache yesterday.<,>昨天我头痛得厉害。<,>That's an awful thing to say to someone.<,>对某人说那样的话真是太恶劣了。<,>awe(敬畏)+ful(充满)→令人敬畏的→糟糕的<,>awesome(adj.极好的)/lawful(adj.合法的)/awfully(adv.非常)

plural<,>/ˈplʊərəl/<,>/ˈplʊrəl/<,>adj.复数的/n.复数<,>"Children" is the plural form of "child".<,>"children"是"child"的复数形式。<,>Some nouns have irregular plurals.<,>有些名词有不规则的复数形式。<,>The verb should agree with the plural subject.<,>动词应与复数主语一致。<,>plur(多)+al(形容词后缀)→复数的<,>singular(adj.单数的/n.单数)/pluralism(n.多元主义)/plurality(n.多数)

influential<,>/ˌɪnfluˈenʃəl/<,>/ˌɪnfluˈɛnʃəl/<,>adj.有影响的/adj.有权势的<,>He is an influential figure in the industry.<,>他是业内具有影响力的人物。<,>The book was highly influential in my thinking.<,>这本书对我的思想产生了很大影响。<,>She comes from an influential family.<,>她出身于一个有权势的家庭。<,>in(进入)+flu(流动)+ential→流入的→有影响的<,>influence(n.影响/v.影响)/fluent(adj.流利的)/affluent(adj.富裕的)

piece<,>/piːs/<,>/pis/<,>n.块/n.碎片/v.拼合<,>Would you like a piece of cake?<,>你想要一块蛋糕吗？<,>The vase fell and broke into pieces.<,>花瓶掉下来摔成了碎片。<,>It took hours to piece the puzzle together.<,>花了几个小时才把拼图拼好。<,>peace(和平)去掉a→piece(碎片)<,>peace(n.和平)/pierce(v.刺穿)/peach(n.桃子)

free<,>/friː/<,>/fri/<,>adj.自由的/adj.空闲的<,>Everyone has the right to be free.<,>每个人都有自由的权利。<,>Are you free this weekend?<,>你这个周末有空吗？<,>The prisoners were finally set free.<,>囚犯们终于获得了自由。<,>freedom(自由)去掉dom→free(自由的)<,>freedom(n.自由)/flee(v.逃跑)/freeze(v.冻结)

robot<,>/ˈrəʊbɒt/<,>/ˈroʊbɑt/<,>n.机器人/n.自动机<,>The factory uses robots to assemble cars.<,>这家工厂使用机器人组装汽车。<,>He built a small robot as a science project.<,>他制作了一个小型机器人作为科学项目。<,>Some people fear robots will take over human jobs.<,>有些人担心机器人会取代人类的工作。<,>rob(抢劫)+ot→像抢劫者一样工作的→机器人<,>robotics(n.机器人技术)/robust(adj.强健的)/robin(n.知更鸟)

applicable<,>/əˈplɪkəbəl/<,>/ˈæplɪkəbəl/<,>adj.能应用的/adj.适当的<,>This rule is not applicable in all situations.<,>这条规则并非适用于所有情况。<,>The discount is only applicable to members.<,>折扣仅适用于会员。<,>Is this theory applicable to real-world problems?<,>这个理论能应用于现实问题吗？<,>apply(应用)+able(能够)→能应用的<,>application(n.申请/应用)/applicant(n.申请人)/appliance(n.器具)
demonstrate<,>/ˈdɛmənstreɪt/<,>/ˈdɛmənˌstreɪt/<,>v.说明/v.论证/v.表露<,>The scientist will demonstrate the experiment to the students.<,>这位科学家将向学生们演示这个实验。<,>She demonstrated her love by giving him a hug.<,>她用一个拥抱表达了自己的爱。<,>The data clearly demonstrates the effectiveness of the new drug.<,>数据清楚地证明了新药的有效性。<,>demo(展示)+strate(站立)→展示说明<,>demonstrative(adj. 说明的)/demonstration(n. 示范)/remonstrate(v. 抗议)

nobody<,>/ˈnəʊbədi/<,>/ˈnoʊˌbɑdi/<,>pron.谁也不/pron.无人<,>Nobody knows the answer to this question.<,>没有人知道这个问题的答案。<,>There was nobody in the room when I arrived.<,>我到的时候房间里一个人也没有。<,>Nobody is perfect, we all make mistakes.<,>人无完人，我们都会犯错。<,>no(无)+body(人)→没有人<,>somebody(pron.某人)/anybody(pron.任何人)/everybody(pron.每个人)

unload<,>/ʌnˈləʊd/<,>/ʌnˈloʊd/<,>v.卸(货)<,>The workers are unloading the truck.<,>工人们正在卸卡车上的货物。<,>It took them two hours to unload all the boxes.<,>他们花了两个小时卸下所有的箱子。<,>Please unload your worries and relax.<,>请卸下你的忧虑，放松一下。<,>un(反义)+load(装载)→卸载<,>upload(v.上传)/download(v.下载)/overload(v.超载)

apologize<,>/əˈpɒlədʒaɪz/<,>/əˈpɑləˌdʒaɪz/<,>v.道歉/v.谢罪/v.认错<,>I must apologize for being late.<,>我必须为迟到道歉。<,>He apologized to his friend for his rude behavior.<,>他为自己的粗鲁行为向朋友道歉。<,>She refused to apologize for telling the truth.<,>她拒绝为说出真相而道歉。<,>apo(远离)+log(说)+ize→说远离(错误)的话→道歉<,>apology(n.道歉)/apologetic(adj.道歉的)/apologist(n.辩护者)

complex<,>/ˈkɒmpleks/<,>/kəmˈplɛks/<,>adj.复杂的<,>The problem is too complex for me to solve.<,>这个问题太复杂了，我解决不了。<,>She has a very complex personality.<,>她有着非常复杂的性格。<,>The human brain is a complex organ.<,>人脑是一个复杂的器官。<,>com(共同)+plex(折叠)→多重折叠→复杂的<,>simplex(adj.简单的)/duplex(adj.双重的)/multiplex(adj.多样的)

anxiety<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>n.焦虑/n.忧虑/n.渴望<,>He felt great anxiety before the exam.<,>考试前他感到非常焦虑。<,>Her anxiety about the future kept her awake at night.<,>她对未来的忧虑使她夜不能寐。<,>There is growing anxiety about climate change.<,>人们对气候变化的忧虑与日俱增。<,>anx(痛苦)+iety(状态)→痛苦的状态→焦虑<,>angst(n.焦虑)/worry(n.担心)/eagerness(n.渴望)

drag<,>/dræɡ/<,>/dræɡ/<,>v.拖/v.拉/v.拖曳<,>Don't drag your feet when you walk.<,>走路时不要拖着脚。<,>They had to drag the heavy box upstairs.<,>他们不得不把沉重的箱子拖上楼。<,>The meeting dragged on for hours.<,>会议拖拖拉拉持续了好几个小时。<,>d(向下)+rag(拉)→向下拉→拖曳<,>draw(v.拉)/pull(v.拉)/haul(v.拖运)

clay<,>/kleɪ/<,>/kleɪ/<,>n.粘土/n.泥土<,>The potter shaped the clay into a vase.<,>陶艺师把粘土塑造成了一个花瓶。<,>This area has rich deposits of clay.<,>这个地区有丰富的粘土沉积。<,>Children love to play with clay.<,>孩子们喜欢玩粘土。<,>cl(黏)+ay→黏土<,>play(v.玩耍)/slay(v.杀害)/delay(v.延迟)

government<,>/ˈɡʌvənmənt/<,>/ˈɡʌvərnmənt/<,>n.政府/n.治理/n.政治<,>The government announced new economic policies.<,>政府宣布了新的经济政策。<,>Good government requires transparency and accountability.<,>良好的治理需要透明度和问责制。<,>He is studying government at university.<,>他在大学学习政治学。<,>govern(统治)+ment(名词后缀)→政府<,>governor(n.州长)/governance(n.治理)/governmental(adj.政府的)

flower<,>/ˈflaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈflaʊər/<,>n.花/n.花卉/n.开花<,>She received a bouquet of beautiful flowers.<,>她收到了一束美丽的花。<,>The cherry trees are in full flower now.<,>樱花树现在正盛开。<,>Flowers need sunlight and water to grow.<,>花朵需要阳光和水才能生长。<,>flow(流动)+er→像流动般绽放→花<,>flour(n.面粉)/flourish(v.繁荣)/floral(adj.花的)
casual<,>/ˈkæʒuəl/<,>/ˈkæʒuəl/<,>adj.偶然的/adj.随便的<,>He wore casual clothes to the party.<,>他穿着休闲服去参加派对。<,>Their meeting was purely casual.<,>他们的相遇纯属偶然。<,>She has a casual attitude towards her work.<,>她对工作态度随便。<,>cas(落下)+ual(形容词后缀)→偶然落下的→偶然的<,>causal(adj.因果关系的)/casualty(n.伤亡人员)  

outwards<,>/ˈaʊtwədz/<,>/ˈaʊtwərdz/<,>adv.向外/adv.往海外<,>The door opens outwards.<,>门是向外开的。<,>The company is expanding outwards.<,>公司正在向海外扩展。<,>He turned his palms outwards.<,>他将手掌向外翻转。<,>out(外)+wards(方向)→向外<,>inwards(adv.向内)/towards(prep.朝向)  

withstand<,>/wɪðˈstænd/<,>/wɪðˈstænd/<,>v.抵挡/v.反抗<,>The bridge can withstand strong winds.<,>这座桥能抵挡强风。<,>He withstood the pressure bravely.<,>他勇敢地抵抗住了压力。<,>This material can withstand high temperatures.<,>这种材料能承受高温。<,>with(反)+stand(站立)→反抗站立→抵挡<,>withhold(v.扣留)/withdraw(v.撤回)  

forgive<,>/fəˈɡɪv/<,>/fərˈɡɪv/<,>v.原谅/v.饶恕/v.宽恕<,>Please forgive me for being late.<,>请原谅我迟到了。<,>She forgave his mistakes.<,>她宽恕了他的错误。<,>It's hard to forgive such betrayal.<,>很难原谅这样的背叛。<,>for(完全)+give(给予)→完全给予宽恕→原谅<,>forget(v.忘记)/forgo(v.放弃)  

eve<,>/iːv/<,>/iːv/<,>n.前夜/n.前夕<,>We had a party on New Year's Eve.<,>我们在新年前夜举办了派对。<,>The eve of the exam was stressful.<,>考试前夕很紧张。<,>On the eve of her wedding, she felt nervous.<,>婚礼前夕，她感到紧张。<,>eve(夜晚)→前夜<,>even(n.傍晚)/evening(n.晚上)  

bind<,>/baɪnd/<,>/baɪnd/<,>v.捆绑/v.包扎/v.装订<,>She bound the books together.<,>她把书装订在一起。<,>The doctor bound his wound.<,>医生包扎了他的伤口。<,>They were bound by a contract.<,>他们被合同约束。<,>bind(绑)→捆绑<,>bond(n.纽带)/bend(v.弯曲)  

pillar<,>/ˈpɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈpɪlər/<,>n.柱/n.柱子/n.栋梁<,>The roof is supported by stone pillars.<,>屋顶由石柱支撑。<,>He is a pillar of the community.<,>他是社区的栋梁。<,>The old temple has beautiful pillars.<,>那座古庙有漂亮的柱子。<,>pill(柱)+ar(名词后缀)→柱子<,>pillow(n.枕头)/piller(v.掠夺)  

metric<,>/ˈmetrɪk/<,>/ˈmetrɪk/<,>adj.公制的/adj.米制的<,>Most countries use the metric system.<,>大多数国家使用公制。<,>The metric measurements are more precise.<,>公制测量更精确。<,>Convert these units to metric.<,>把这些单位转换为公制。<,>metr(测量)+ic(形容词后缀)→测量的→公制的<,>meter(n.米)/metre(n.公尺)  

pine<,>/paɪn/<,>/paɪn/<,>n.松树/n.松木<,>The pine trees smell wonderful.<,>松树闻起来很香。<,>This table is made of pine.<,>这张桌子是松木做的。<,>Pine forests cover the mountains.<,>松树林覆盖了山脉。<,>pine(松)→松树<,>pain(n.疼痛)/pane(n.窗格)  

explore<,>/ɪkˈsplɔː(r)/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔːr/<,>v.探险/v.探索<,>They explored the ancient ruins.<,>他们探索了古代遗迹。<,>Scientists are exploring new treatments.<,>科学家正在探索新的治疗方法。<,>She wants to explore different cultures.<,>她想探索不同的文化。<,>ex(出)+plore(流出)→探索<,>explode(v.爆炸)/exploit(v.开发)
profession<,>/prəˈfeʃn/<,>/prəˈfɛʃən/<,>n.职业<,>Teaching is a noble profession.<,>教书是一项崇高的职业。<,>She chose medicine as her profession.<,>她选择医学作为她的职业。<,>He entered the legal profession after graduation.<,>他毕业后进入了法律行业。<,>pro(向前)+fess(说)+ion→在公众面前说→职业<,>professional(adj.专业的/n.专业人员)/professor(n.教授)/confession(n.忏悔/n.坦白)  

eighteen<,>/ˌeɪˈtiːn/<,>/ˌeɪˈtin/<,>num.十八/num.十八个<,>She just turned eighteen last week.<,>她上周刚满十八岁。<,>There are eighteen students in the classroom.<,>教室里有十八个学生。<,>The train departs at eighteen hundred hours.<,>火车在十八点整发车。<,>eight(八)+teen(十几)→十八<,>eighth(num.第八)/eighteenth(num.第十八)/eighty(num.八十)  

breath<,>/breθ/<,>/brɛθ/<,>n.气息/n.呼吸<,>Take a deep breath before you dive.<,>潜水前深呼吸。<,>His breath smelled of garlic.<,>他的气息有大蒜味。<,>The cold air took my breath away.<,>冷空气让我喘不过气。<,>breath与bread(面包)发音相似<,>breathe(v.呼吸)/breathless(adj.喘不过气的)/death(n.死亡)  

gang<,>/ɡæŋ/<,>/ɡæŋ/<,>n.一帮/n.一伙<,>The police arrested a gang of thieves.<,>警方逮捕了一伙小偷。<,>He got involved with the wrong gang.<,>他误入歧途加入了不良团伙。<,>They work in gangs to complete the project.<,>他们分组完成这个项目。<,>gang与bang(巨响)押韵<,>gangster(n.匪徒)/gangway(n.通道)/gangplank(n.跳板)  

effort<,>/ˈefət/<,>/ˈɛfɚt/<,>n.努力/n.努力的成果<,>She made an effort to arrive on time.<,>她努力准时到达。<,>Their efforts finally paid off.<,>他们的努力终于有了回报。<,>It takes great effort to learn a new language.<,>学习新语言需要很大努力。<,>ef(出)+fort(力量)→使出力量→努力<,>afford(v.负担得起)/comfort(n.舒适)/fort(n.堡垒)  

hardship<,>/ˈhɑːdʃɪp/<,>/ˈhɑrdˌʃɪp/<,>n.艰难/n.困苦<,>They endured many hardships during the war.<,>他们在战争期间经历了许多艰难困苦。<,>Financial hardship forced him to drop out.<,>经济困难迫使他辍学。<,>Overcoming hardship builds character.<,>克服困苦能塑造品格。<,>hard(艰苦的)+ship(状态)→艰难状态<,>hardship与friendship(友谊)结构相似/hard(adj.困难的)+ship(后缀)  

near<,>/nɪə(r)/<,>/nɪr/<,>adv.近/adv.接近/adj.近的<,>The supermarket is near the station.<,>超市在车站附近。<,>Spring is drawing near.<,>春天临近了。<,>She came near to tears.<,>她差点哭出来。<,>near与ear(耳朵)发音相似<,>nearly(adv.几乎)/nearby(adj.附近的)/neat(adj.整洁的)  

shower<,>/ˈʃaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈʃaʊɚ/<,>n.阵雨/n.(一)阵/n.淋浴<,>Take a shower before going to bed.<,>睡前洗个淋浴。<,>A sudden shower caught us unprepared.<,>突如其来的阵雨让我们措手不及。<,>She received a shower of compliments.<,>她收到一连串的赞美。<,>show(展示)+er→像展示一样落下的雨→阵雨<,>shower与flower(花)押韵/show(v.展示)+er  

alive<,>/əˈlaɪv/<,>/əˈlaɪv/<,>adj.活着的/adj.活跃的<,>The injured man is still alive.<,>受伤的男子还活着。<,>Keep the tradition alive.<,>让传统保持活力。<,>The city comes alive at night.<,>这座城市夜晚很活跃。<,>a(强调)+live(生活)→活着的<,>live(v.居住/adj.现场的)/life(n.生命)/lively(adj.活泼的)  

Indian<,>/ˈɪndiən/<,>/ˈɪndiən/<,>adj.印度的/n.印度人<,>Indian cuisine is very spicy.<,>印度菜很辣。<,>He is an Indian studying abroad.<,>他是在国外留学的印度人。<,>The Indian Ocean is the third largest ocean.<,>印度洋是第三大洋。<,>India(印度)+an(…的)→印度的<,>indian与lndiana(印第安纳)拼写相似/India(n.印度)+an(后缀)
serve<,>/sɜːv/<,>/sɜrv/<,>v.为…服务/v.招待<,>He serves as the manager of the company.<,>他担任公司的经理。<,>She served us tea and biscuits.<,>她为我们端上了茶和饼干。<,>The restaurant serves delicious food.<,>这家餐厅提供美味的食物。<,>ser(服务)+ve(动词后缀)→服务<,>service(n.服务)/deserve(v.应得)/reserve(v.保留)

backward<,>/ˈbækwəd/<,>/ˈbækwərd/<,>adj.向后的/adj.倒退的<,>He took a backward step.<,>他向后退了一步。<,>The country's economy is moving backward.<,>这个国家的经济正在倒退。<,>She glanced backward over her shoulder.<,>她回头向后看了一眼。<,>back(后)+ward(方向)→向后的<,>forward(adj.向前的)/awkward(adj.笨拙的)/afterward(adv.后来)

fear<,>/fɪə(r)/<,>/fɪr/<,>n.害怕/n.担心/v.害怕<,>She has a fear of heights.<,>她恐高。<,>I fear that I might fail the exam.<,>我担心我可能会考试不及格。<,>He feared for his safety.<,>他为自己的安全感到害怕。<,>f(音似"飞")+ear(耳朵)→飞进耳朵的可怕声音→害怕<,>dear(adj.亲爱的)/tear(n.眼泪)/fare(n.车费)

operational<,>/ˌɒpəˈreɪʃənl/<,>/ˌɑːpəˈreɪʃənl/<,>adj.操作上的/adj.可使用的<,>The new system is now fully operational.<,>新系统现在完全可用了。<,>He is in charge of operational matters.<,>他负责操作上的事务。<,>The machine is not yet operational.<,>这台机器还不能使用。<,>operate(操作)+tion(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→操作上的<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/rational(adj.理性的)/national(adj.国家的)

delay<,>/dɪˈleɪ/<,>/dɪˈleɪ/<,>v.耽搁/v.延误/v.推迟<,>The flight was delayed due to bad weather.<,>航班因恶劣天气延误了。<,>Don't delay making the decision.<,>不要拖延做决定。<,>The project has been delayed for a month.<,>这个项目被推迟了一个月。<,>de(向下)+lay(放置)→向下放→推迟<,>relay(v.传递)/decay(v.腐烂)/display(v.展示)

arithmetic<,>/əˈrɪθmətɪk/<,>/əˈrɪθmətɪk/<,>n.算术/n.四则运算<,>She is good at mental arithmetic.<,>她擅长心算。<,>The children are learning basic arithmetic.<,>孩子们正在学习基础算术。<,>He made a mistake in his arithmetic.<,>他在算术上犯了一个错误。<,>arithm(数字)+etic(学科)→数字的学科→算术<,>mathematics(n.数学)/geometry(n.几何)/algebra(n.代数)

value<,>/ˈvæljuː/<,>/ˈvæljuː/<,>n.价值/n.价格/v.评价<,>This painting has great artistic value.<,>这幅画有很大的艺术价值。<,>He valued her opinion highly.<,>他高度评价她的意见。<,>The value of the house has increased.<,>这栋房子的价值上涨了。<,>val(价值)+ue(名词后缀)→价值<,>valuable(adj.有价值的)/evaluate(v.评估)/devalue(v.贬值)

madam<,>/ˈmædəm/<,>/ˈmædəm/<,>n.夫人/n.女士/n.太太<,>Good morning, madam.<,>早上好，夫人。<,>Madam President will speak now.<,>总统女士现在要讲话了。<,>The madam of the house welcomed us warmly.<,>房子的女主人热情地欢迎了我们。<,>ma(妈)+dam(女士)→对女士的尊称<,>sir(n.先生)/ma'am(n.夫人)/madame(n.夫人)

dangerous<,>/ˈdeɪndʒərəs/<,>/ˈdeɪndʒərəs/<,>adj.危险的/adj.不安全的<,>It's dangerous to swim here.<,>在这里游泳很危险。<,>The chemicals are highly dangerous.<,>这些化学品非常危险。<,>He's in a dangerous situation.<,>他处于危险境地。<,>danger(危险)+ous(形容词后缀)→危险的<,>adventurous(adj.冒险的)/courageous(adj.勇敢的)/mysterious(adj.神秘的)

if<,>/ɪf/<,>/ɪf/<,>conj.假如/conj.如果<,>If it rains, we'll stay at home.<,>如果下雨，我们就待在家里。<,>I wonder if he will come.<,>我想知道他是否会来。<,>If I were you, I would apologize.<,>如果我是你，我会道歉。<,>i(我)+f(仿佛)→我仿佛→如果<,>unless(conj.除非)/whether(conj.是否)/though(conj.虽然)
per<,>/pɜː(r)/<,>/pɜːr/<,>prep.每<,>The car can go up to 120 miles per hour.<,>这辆车每小时能跑120英里。<,>The cost is $10 per person.<,>费用是每人10美元。<,>He earns $50,000 per year.<,>他每年赚5万美元。<,>per(通过)+cent(百)→每一百→每<,>peer(n.同龄人/v.凝视)/perm(n.烫发/v.烫发)

loss<,>/lɒs/<,>/lɔːs/<,>n.遗失/n.损失/n.失败<,>The loss of his job was a big blow to him.<,>失去工作对他是一个巨大的打击。<,>They suffered heavy losses in the stock market.<,>他们在股市中遭受了重大损失。<,>She was at a loss for words when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，她不知道该说什么。<,>lose(v.丢失)的名词形式<,>lost(adj.丢失的)/loose(adj.松散的)/boss(n.老板)

damp<,>/dæmp/<,>/dæmp/<,>adj.潮湿的/adj.有湿气的<,>The walls were damp from the rain.<,>墙壁因为下雨而潮湿。<,>She used a damp cloth to clean the table.<,>她用一块湿布擦桌子。<,>The damp weather made his clothes feel uncomfortable.<,>潮湿的天气让他的衣服感觉不舒服。<,>dam(水坝)+p→像水坝一样潮湿<,>dump(v.倾倒/n.垃圾场)/lamp(n.灯)/camp(n.营地)

age<,>/eɪdʒ/<,>/eɪdʒ/<,>n.年龄/n.时代/v.变老<,>What is your age?<,>你多大了？<,>We live in the age of information.<,>我们生活在信息时代。<,>Fine wine ages well.<,>好酒越陈越香。<,>age(年龄)→随着年龄增长而变老<,>ago(adv.以前)/ape(n.猿)/axe(n.斧头)

launch<,>/lɔːntʃ/<,>/lɔːntʃ/<,>v.发射/v.投射/v.发动<,>They will launch a new satellite next month.<,>他们下个月将发射一颗新卫星。<,>The company launched a new product line.<,>公司推出了新的产品线。<,>He launched a campaign against pollution.<,>他发起了一项反对污染的运动。<,>laun(看作"lunar"月球的)+ch→向月球发射<,>lunch(n.午餐)/ranch(n.牧场)/branch(n.树枝)

stain<,>/steɪn/<,>/steɪn/<,>v.沾污/v.给...着色<,>The coffee stained his white shirt.<,>咖啡弄脏了他的白衬衫。<,>She stained the wood with a dark color.<,>她用深色给木头上色。<,>His reputation was stained by the scandal.<,>他的名誉因丑闻而受损。<,>st(站立)+ain(看作"pain"痛苦)→站着痛苦地弄脏<,>sustain(v.维持)/stair(n.楼梯)/strain(v.拉紧)

vain<,>/veɪn/<,>/veɪn/<,>adj.徒劳的/adj.自负的<,>All their efforts were in vain.<,>他们所有的努力都是徒劳的。<,>He is vain about his appearance.<,>他对自己的外表很自负。<,>She made a vain attempt to fix the broken vase.<,>她徒劳地尝试修复破碎的花瓶。<,>vain(虚荣)→徒劳的虚荣<,>vein(n.静脉)/pain(n.疼痛)/gain(v.获得)

gratitude<,>/ˈɡrætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈɡrætɪtuːd/<,>n.感激/n.感谢/n.感恩<,>She expressed her gratitude for their help.<,>她对他们的帮助表示感谢。<,>I feel deep gratitude towards my teachers.<,>我对我的老师们深怀感激。<,>He showed his gratitude by sending a thank-you note.<,>他通过发送感谢信表达感激之情。<,>grat(高兴)+itude(状态)→感激的状态<,>attitude(n.态度)/altitude(n.海拔)/latitude(n.纬度)

assignment<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>n.任务/n.指定的作业<,>The teacher gave us a new assignment.<,>老师给我们布置了新作业。<,>He completed his work assignment on time.<,>他按时完成了工作任务。<,>This assignment is due next Monday.<,>这项作业下周一截止。<,>assign(分配)+ment(名词后缀)→分配的任务<,>alignment(n.对齐)/consignment(n.托运)/design(n.设计)

egg<,>/eɡ/<,>/eɡ/<,>n.蛋/n.卵/n.鸡蛋<,>She had boiled eggs for breakfast.<,>她早餐吃了煮鸡蛋。<,>The bird laid three eggs in the nest.<,>这只鸟在巢里下了三个蛋。<,>Don't put all your eggs in one basket.<,>不要把所有的鸡蛋放在一个篮子里(不要孤注一掷)。<,>egg(蛋)→形状像字母"O"的蛋<,>edge(n.边缘)/beg(v.乞求)/leg(n.腿)
tailor<,>/ˈteɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈteɪlər/<,>n.裁缝/v.专门制作/v.订做<,>The tailor made a suit for the groom.<,>裁缝为新郎做了一套西装。<,>We can tailor the program to meet your needs.<,>我们可以根据您的需求定制这个项目。<,>This course is tailored for beginners.<,>这门课程是为初学者量身定制的。<,>tail(尾巴)+or(人)→做衣服的人要处理衣服的"尾巴"→裁缝<,>sailor(n.水手)/teller(n.出纳员)/trailer(n.拖车)

reliable<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbl/<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbəl/<,>adj.可靠的/adj.可信赖的<,>She is a reliable employee who always meets deadlines.<,>她是个可靠的员工，总能按时完成任务。<,>This car is reliable in all weather conditions.<,>这辆车在各种天气条件下都很可靠。<,>We need reliable data for our research.<,>我们的研究需要可靠的数据。<,>re(再)+li(绑)+able(能)→能再次绑定的→可靠的<,>liable(adj.有责任的)/reliant(adj.依赖的)/reliability(n.可靠性)

pole<,>/pəʊl/<,>/poʊl/<,>n.杆/n.柱<,>The flag was flying at the top of the pole.<,>旗帜在旗杆顶端飘扬。<,>He used a pole to push the boat away from shore.<,>他用一根杆子把船推离岸边。<,>The North Pole is covered with ice.<,>北极被冰雪覆盖。<,>发音类似"pole"(杆)与"role"(角色)→杆子扮演支撑的角色<,>poll(n.投票)/pore(n.毛孔)/pole(波兰人)

broad<,>/brɔːd/<,>/brɔd/<,>adj.宽的/adj.阔的/adj.广泛的<,>He has broad shoulders from years of swimming.<,>多年的游泳使他肩膀宽阔。<,>She has a broad knowledge of world history.<,>她对世界历史有广泛的了解。<,>The river is too broad to swim across.<,>这条河太宽了，游不过去。<,>b(大)+road(路)→大路→宽阔的<,>abroad(adv.在国外)/board(n.木板)/brood(v.孵蛋)

June<,>/dʒuːn/<,>/dʒun/<,>n.六月<,>My birthday is in June.<,>我的生日在六月。<,>June is usually the hottest month here.<,>六月通常是这里最热的月份。<,>We're getting married next June.<,>我们明年六月结婚。<,>联想"Jewel"(珠宝)→六月像珠宝一样闪亮的季节<,>July(n.七月)/Juneau(朱诺，阿拉斯加首府)/junior(adj.年少的)

accordingly<,>/əˈkɔːdɪŋli/<,>/əˈkɔrdɪŋli/<,>adv.照着/adv.因此/adv.所以<,>The rules have changed; we must act accordingly.<,>规则已经改变，我们必须相应地行动。<,>He was tired and accordingly went to bed early.<,>他很累，所以早早就睡了。<,>Prices rose, and wages were adjusted accordingly.<,>物价上涨，工资也相应调整了。<,>accord(一致)+ing+ly→按照一致的方式→因此<,>accounting(n.会计)/according(adj.一致的)/accordion(n.手风琴)

careless<,>/ˈkeələs/<,>/ˈkɛrləs/<,>adj.粗心的/adj.漫不经心的<,>His careless mistake cost the company thousands.<,>他粗心的错误让公司损失了数千元。<,>She was careless with her phone and dropped it.<,>她不小心把手机掉地上了。<,>Careless driving causes many accidents.<,>粗心驾驶导致许多事故。<,>care(关心)+less(少)→关心太少→粗心的<,>carefree(adj.无忧无虑的)/careful(adj.小心的)/carelessness(n.粗心)

comfort<,>/ˈkʌmfət/<,>/ˈkʌmfərt/<,>n.舒适/n.安慰/v.安慰<,>The hotel room provided great comfort after a long journey.<,>长途旅行后，酒店房间提供了极大的舒适。<,>She comforted the crying child.<,>她安慰了哭泣的孩子。<,>Words of comfort can help in difficult times.<,>安慰的话语在困难时期很有帮助。<,>com(完全)+fort(力量)→完全给力量→安慰<,>effort(n.努力)/fort(n.堡垒)/comfortable(adj.舒适的)

facility<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>n.设备<,>The sports facility includes a swimming pool and gym.<,>这个体育设施包括游泳池和健身房。<,>The new laboratory has state-of-the-art facilities.<,>新实验室拥有最先进的设备。<,>The facility is open to the public on weekends.<,>这个设施周末对公众开放。<,>fac(做)+ility(能力)→能够做事的东西→设备<,>felicity(n.幸福)/faculty(n.全体教员)/facilitate(v.促进)

employee<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪiː/<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪi/<,>n.受雇者/n.雇员/n.雇工<,>The company has over 500 employees.<,>这家公司有500多名员工。<,>Every employee must wear a security badge.<,>每位员工都必须佩戴安全徽章。<,>She's been an employee here for ten years.<,>她在这里工作了十年。<,>employ(雇佣)+ee(被...的人)→被雇佣的人→雇员<,>employer(n.雇主)/employment(n.就业)/employable(adj.可雇用的)
typical<,>/ˈtɪpɪkəl/<,>/ˈtɪpɪkəl/<,>adj.典型的/adj.代表性的<,>This is a typical example of his work.<,>这是他作品的典型例子。<,>She has a typical British accent.<,>她有典型的英国口音。<,>The weather was typical for the season.<,>这种天气是这个季节的典型特征。<,>typ(类型)+ical(形容词后缀)→典型的<,>atypical(adj.非典型的)/typicality(n.典型性)  

nucleus<,>/ˈnjuːkliəs/<,>/ˈnuːkliəs/<,>n.核/n.(原子)核/n.核心<,>The nucleus of an atom contains protons and neutrons.<,>原子核包含质子和中子。<,>This small group formed the nucleus of the new political party.<,>这个小团体组成了新政党的核心。<,>The museum's collection became the nucleus of the national gallery.<,>该博物馆的收藏品成为了国家美术馆的核心。<,>nucle(核)+us(名词后缀)→核心<,>nuclear(adj.核的)/nucleic(adj.核的)  

all<,>/ɔːl/<,>/ɔːl/<,>det.全部的/pron.全部<,>All the students passed the exam.<,>所有的学生都通过了考试。<,>She ate all of the cake.<,>她吃掉了整个蛋糕。<,>All I want is some peace and quiet.<,>我想要的只是一些安宁和安静。<,>与"ball"(球)对比记忆<,>all in all(总而言之)/all along(始终)  

negative<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>adj.否定的/adj.消极的<,>He gave a negative answer to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了否定的回答。<,>Don't be so negative about everything.<,>不要对所有事情都这么消极。<,>The test results came back negative.<,>检测结果呈阴性。<,>neg(否定)+ative(形容词后缀)→否定的<,>positive(adj.肯定的/积极的)  

India<,>/ˈɪndiə/<,>/ˈɪndiə/<,>n.印度<,>India is known for its rich culture and history.<,>印度以其丰富的文化和历史而闻名。<,>I'm planning a trip to India next year.<,>我计划明年去印度旅行。<,>Indian cuisine is becoming increasingly popular worldwide.<,>印度菜在全球越来越受欢迎。<,>与"Indiana"(印第安纳州)对比<,>Indian(adj.印度的/n.印度人)  

advanced<,>/ədˈvɑːnst/<,>/ədˈvænst/<,>adj.先进的/adj.高级的<,>This is an advanced technology.<,>这是一项先进的技术。<,>She's taking an advanced English course.<,>她正在学习高级英语课程。<,>The disease was in an advanced stage.<,>疾病已进入晚期。<,>advance(前进)+ed(形容词后缀)→先进的<,>beginner(adj.初级的)/intermediate(adj.中级的)  

cottage<,>/ˈkɒtɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkɑːtɪdʒ/<,>n.村舍/n.小屋<,>They rented a charming cottage by the lake.<,>他们在湖边租了一间迷人的小屋。<,>My grandparents live in a small country cottage.<,>我的祖父母住在一间乡村小屋里。<,>The cottage was surrounded by beautiful gardens.<,>小屋周围环绕着美丽的花园。<,>cot(小屋)+age(名词后缀)→村舍<,>cabin(n.小木屋)/hut(n.简陋小屋)  

oblige<,>/əˈblaɪdʒ/<,>/əˈblaɪdʒ/<,>v.迫使<,>The law obliges companies to pay minimum wage.<,>法律强制公司支付最低工资。<,>I felt obliged to help him.<,>我觉得有义务帮助他。<,>Circumstances obliged him to sell his house.<,>情况迫使他卖掉房子。<,>ob(加强)+lige(绑)→绑住→迫使<,>obligation(n.义务)/obligatory(adj.义务的)  

evaluate<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>v.评价/v.估...的价<,>Teachers evaluate students' progress regularly.<,>教师定期评估学生的进步。<,>We need to evaluate the success of the project.<,>我们需要评估项目的成功与否。<,>The property was evaluated at $500,000.<,>该房产估价为50万美元。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ate(动词后缀)→评估价值<,>valuation(n.估价)/reevaluate(v.重新评估)  

skilled<,>/skɪld/<,>/skɪld/<,>adj.有技能的/adj.熟练的<,>We need skilled workers for this job.<,>我们需要熟练的工人来做这项工作。<,>She is highly skilled in negotiation.<,>她的谈判技巧非常娴熟。<,>Skilled labor is in high demand.<,>熟练劳动力需求很大。<,>skill(技能)+ed(形容词后缀)→有技能的<,>unskilled(adj.不熟练的)/skillful(adj.灵巧的)
inn<,>/ɪn/<,>/ɪn/<,>n.小旅店/n.小酒店<,>We stayed at a cozy inn during our trip.<,>我们旅行时住在一家舒适的小旅店里。<,>The old inn has been serving guests for over a century.<,>这家老旅店已经接待客人一个多世纪了。<,>He owns a small inn by the lake.<,>他在湖边拥有一家小旅店。<,>in(里面)+n→提供住宿的场所<,>ink(n.墨水)/pin(n.别针)/sin(n.罪)

static<,>/ˈstætɪk/<,>/ˈstætɪk/<,>adj.静的/adj.静态的<,>The TV screen showed only static after the storm.<,>暴风雨过后电视屏幕只显示静电干扰。<,>Her life had become static and predictable.<,>她的生活变得一成不变且可预测。<,>The website has too many static elements.<,>这个网站有太多静态元素。<,>stat(站立)+ic→站立不动的<,>statue(n.雕像)/status(n.状态)/stationary(adj.静止的)

forty<,>/ˈfɔːti/<,>/ˈfɔːrti/<,>num.四十/num.第四十<,>She celebrated her fortieth birthday last week.<,>她上周庆祝了四十岁生日。<,>The temperature dropped to forty degrees below zero.<,>温度降到了零下四十度。<,>There are forty students in our class.<,>我们班有四十名学生。<,>for(为了)+ty(十)→四十<,>fourteen(num.十四)/fourth(num.第四)/fortify(v.加强)

severe<,>/sɪˈvɪə(r)/<,>/səˈvɪr/<,>adj.严厉的<,>The teacher gave us a severe warning about cheating.<,>老师就作弊给了我们严厉的警告。<,>He suffered severe injuries in the accident.<,>他在事故中受了重伤。<,>The country is facing severe economic problems.<,>这个国家正面临严重的经济问题。<,>sever(切断)+e→严厉的<,>sever(v.切断)/several(adj.几个)/persevere(v.坚持)

portrait<,>/ˈpɔːtreɪt/<,>/ˈpɔːrtrət/<,>n.肖像/n.画像<,>She painted a beautiful portrait of her mother.<,>她为母亲画了一幅漂亮的肖像。<,>The museum has a collection of royal portraits.<,>博物馆收藏有皇室肖像画。<,>He sat for his portrait yesterday.<,>他昨天坐着让人给他画像。<,>port(携带)+rait(画)→携带的画→肖像<,>porter(n.搬运工)/portion(n.部分)/portray(v.描绘)

derive<,>/dɪˈraɪv/<,>/dɪˈraɪv/<,>v.取得/v.起源<,>Many English words derive from Latin.<,>许多英语单词源自拉丁语。<,>She derives great pleasure from reading.<,>她从阅读中获得极大乐趣。<,>The company derives most of its income from exports.<,>公司大部分收入来自出口。<,>de(向下)+rive(河流)→从源头流下→起源<,>deprive(v.剥夺)/arrive(v.到达)/thrive(v.繁荣)

partial<,>/ˈpɑːʃl/<,>/ˈpɑːrʃl/<,>adj.部分的/adj.不公平的<,>The project is only partially complete.<,>这个项目只完成了一部分。<,>The judge was accused of being partial.<,>法官被指控有偏袒。<,>I have only partial information about the incident.<,>我只有关于这个事件的部分信息。<,>part(部分)+ial→部分的<,>particle(n.微粒)/participate(v.参与)/partition(n.分隔)

yearly<,>/ˈjɪəli/<,>/ˈjɪrli/<,>adj.每年的/adv.每年<,>We have a yearly family reunion.<,>我们每年都有家庭聚会。<,>The magazine publishes six issues yearly.<,>这本杂志每年出版六期。<,>Employees receive a yearly bonus.<,>员工每年都会得到奖金。<,>year(年)+ly→每年的<,>monthly(adj.每月的)/daily(adj.每日的)/weekly(adj.每周的)

straw<,>/strɔː/<,>/strɔ/<,>n.稻草/n.麦杆/n.吸管<,>The farmer gathered straw for the animals.<,>农民为牲畜收集稻草。<,>She drank her juice through a straw.<,>她用吸管喝果汁。<,>The last straw was when he forgot our anniversary.<,>他忘记我们的纪念日成了压垮骆驼的最后一根稻草。<,>str(伸展)+aw→伸展的杆子→麦杆<,>strawberry(n.草莓)/strew(v.散播)/stray(v.迷路)

dip<,>/dɪp/<,>/dɪp/<,>v.浸/v.蘸<,>She dipped her finger in the water to test the temperature.<,>她把手指浸入水中测试温度。<,>He dipped the brush into the paint.<,>他把刷子蘸进颜料里。<,>The road dips down into the valley.<,>这条路向下延伸到山谷。<,>di(向下)+p→向下进入→浸<,>dig(v.挖)/drip(v.滴下)/lip(n.嘴唇)
invite<,>/ɪnˈvaɪt/<,>/ɪnˈvaɪt/<,>v.邀请/v.正式邀请/v.请求<,>She invited me to her birthday party.<,>她邀请我参加她的生日派对。<,>The professor invited questions from the audience.<,>教授请求听众提问。<,>We were invited to the official ceremony.<,>我们被邀请参加正式仪式。<,>in(进入)+vite(生命)→邀请进入生活<,>invest(v.投资)/invent(v.发明)/invert(v.倒置)

cord<,>/kɔːd/<,>/kɔːrd/<,>n.细绳/n.粗线/n.索<,>He tied the package with a strong cord.<,>他用一根结实的绳子捆扎包裹。<,>The climbers used special cords for safety.<,>登山者使用特殊绳索保证安全。<,>She pulled the cord to turn on the light.<,>她拉动细绳打开灯。<,>cord(心)→像心脏连接血管一样连接物体<,>chord(n.和弦)/corded(adj.有绳索的)/cordless(adj.无线的)

invasion<,>/ɪnˈveɪʒn/<,>/ɪnˈveɪʒən/<,>n.入侵/n.侵略/n.侵犯<,>The country suffered from foreign invasion.<,>这个国家遭受了外国入侵。<,>Privacy invasion is a serious issue.<,>隐私侵犯是个严重问题。<,>The invasion of weeds ruined the garden.<,>杂草的入侵毁坏了花园。<,>in(进入)+vas(走)+ion→走进去→入侵<,>evasion(n.逃避)/pervasion(n.扩散)/invader(n.侵略者)

audience<,>/ˈɔːdiəns/<,>/ˈɔːdiəns/<,>n.听众/n.观众/n.读者<,>The audience applauded after the performance.<,>演出结束后观众鼓掌。<,>This book targets a young audience.<,>这本书面向年轻读者。<,>The speaker addressed the audience clearly.<,>演讲者清晰地对着听众讲话。<,>audi(听)+ence→听的人→听众<,>audio(adj.声音的)/audible(adj.听得见的)/auditorium(n.礼堂)

compound<,>/ˈkɒmpaʊnd/<,>/ˈkɑːmpaʊnd/<,>n.化合物/n.复合词<,>Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.<,>水是氢和氧的化合物。<,>"Blackboard" is a compound word.<,>"黑板"是一个复合词。<,>The chemist analyzed the new compound.<,>化学家分析了这种新化合物。<,>com(一起)+pound(放置)→放在一起→化合物<,>component(n.组件)/compose(v.组成)/compound(v.混合)

risk<,>/rɪsk/<,>/rɪsk/<,>n.风险/n.危险/n.冒险<,>Smoking increases the risk of cancer.<,>吸烟增加患癌风险。<,>He took a big risk investing all his money.<,>他冒险把所有钱都投资了。<,>There's no risk of rain today.<,>今天没有下雨的危险。<,>risk(危险)→像悬崖边缘一样危险<,>brisk(adj.轻快的)/risky(adj.危险的)/risque(adj.有伤风化的)

almost<,>/ˈɔːlməʊst/<,>/ˈɔːlmoʊst/<,>adv.几乎/adv.差不多<,>I almost forgot your birthday.<,>我差点忘了你的生日。<,>The project is almost finished.<,>这个项目差不多完成了。<,>She almost never eats meat.<,>她几乎从不吃肉。<,>al(all全部)+most(最多)→几乎全部<,>almond(n.杏仁)/already(adv.已经)/altogether(adv.完全)

loosen<,>/ˈluːsn/<,>/ˈluːsn/<,>v.解开/v.使松弛<,>Loosen your tie and relax.<,>解开领带放松一下。<,>The screw has loosened over time.<,>螺丝随着时间变松了。<,>Exercise helps to loosen stiff muscles.<,>锻炼有助于放松僵硬的肌肉。<,>loose(松的)+en(使)→使变松<,>lessen(v.减少)/lost(adj.丢失的)/loose(adj.松的)

industrialize<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəlaɪz/<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəlaɪz/<,>v.使工业化<,>The country industrialized rapidly in the 20th century.<,>这个国家在20世纪迅速工业化。<,>Many regions are trying to industrialize.<,>许多地区正努力实现工业化。<,>Industrialized nations consume more energy.<,>工业化国家消耗更多能源。<,>industry(工业)+alize(使)→使工业化<,>industrial(adj.工业的)/industrious(adj.勤奋的)/industry(n.工业)

glorious<,>/ˈɡlɔːriəs/<,>/ˈɡlɔːriəs/<,>adj.光荣的/adj.壮丽的<,>They achieved a glorious victory.<,>他们取得了光荣的胜利。<,>The sunset was absolutely glorious.<,>日落景象壮丽无比。<,>It was a glorious day for our school.<,>这是我们学校的光荣日子。<,>glory(光荣)+ous(形容词后缀)→光荣的<,>gloriously(adv.光荣地)/glorify(v.赞美)/glory(n.光荣)
normally<,>/ˈnɔːməli/<,>/ˈnɔːrməli/<,>adv.通常/adv.正常地<,>Normally, I wake up at 7 a.m.<,>通常，我早上7点起床。<,>She behaved normally despite the stress.<,>尽管有压力，她表现得很正常。<,>The system is functioning normally now.<,>系统现在运行正常。<,>normal(正常的)+ly(副词后缀)→正常地<,>formally(adv.正式地)/abnormally(adv.反常地)

excess<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>/ˈɛkˌsɛs/<,>n.超越/n.过量/n.过度<,>He drinks to excess on weekends.<,>他周末饮酒过量。<,>The excess of rain caused flooding.<,>雨水过多导致了洪水。<,>There's an excess of sugar in this recipe.<,>这个食谱中糖分过多。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)→走出界限→过量<,>access(n.入口/v.接近)/success(n.成功)/process(n.过程)

ridiculous<,>/rɪˈdɪkjələs/<,>/rɪˈdɪkjələs/<,>adj.荒谬的/adj.可笑的<,>That's a ridiculous idea!<,>那是个荒谬的想法！<,>He looked ridiculous in that costume.<,>他穿那套服装看起来很可笑。<,>The prices at that restaurant are ridiculous.<,>那家餐厅的价格太离谱了。<,>rid(笑)+iculous(形容词后缀)→可笑的<,>ridicule(n.嘲笑/v.嘲弄)/miraculous(adj.奇迹般的)

balloon<,>/bəˈluːn/<,>/bəˈluːn/<,>n.气球/n.玩具气球<,>The children played with colorful balloons.<,>孩子们玩着五颜六色的气球。<,>Her dress ballooned in the wind.<,>她的裙子在风中鼓了起来。<,>We released balloons at the celebration.<,>我们在庆祝活动上放飞了气球。<,>ball(球)+oon(大)→大气球<,>ballot(n.选票)/saloon(n.大厅)/buffoon(n.小丑)

in<,>/ɪn/<,>/ɪn/<,>prep.在...里/prep.进/prep.入<,>The book is in the drawer.<,>书在抽屉里。<,>Come in, please.<,>请进来。<,>She's in trouble now.<,>她现在有麻烦了。<,>简单介词，表示位置或状态<,>inn(n.小旅馆)/ink(n.墨水)/pin(n.别针)

everyday<,>/ˈevrideɪ/<,>/ˈɛvriˌdeɪ/<,>adj.每天的/adj.日常的<,>These are my everyday shoes.<,>这些是我日常穿的鞋子。<,>She deals with everyday problems at work.<,>她在工作中处理日常问题。<,>The book uses everyday language.<,>这本书使用日常语言。<,>every(每)+day(天)→每天的<,>every day(每天，分开写是副词短语)/everyday(连写是形容词)

exaggerate<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəreɪt/<,>/ɪɡˈzædʒəˌreɪt/<,>v.夸大/v.夸张<,>Don't exaggerate your achievements.<,>不要夸大你的成就。<,>He tends to exaggerate his stories.<,>他总爱夸大自己的故事。<,>The media exaggerated the incident.<,>媒体夸大了这个事件。<,>ex(出)+agger(堆积)+ate(动词后缀)→堆积出来→夸大<,>aggregate(v.聚集/n.总数)/irritate(v.激怒)

furthermore<,>/ˌfɜːðəˈmɔː(r)/<,>/ˌfɜrðərˈmɔːr/<,>adv.而且/adv.此外<,>Furthermore, we need to consider the costs.<,>此外，我们还需要考虑成本。<,>He's qualified, and furthermore, he's experienced.<,>他有资质，而且经验丰富。<,>The plan is risky; furthermore, it's expensive.<,>这个计划有风险；而且很昂贵。<,>further(进一步)+more(更多)→更进一步说<,>moreover(adv.此外)/therefore(adv.因此)

transfer<,>/trænsˈfɜː(r)/<,>/trænsˈfɜːr/<,>v.转移/v.调动<,>She transferred to another department.<,>她调到了另一个部门。<,>Please transfer the files to my computer.<,>请把这些文件传到我电脑上。<,>He transferred his money to a new bank.<,>他把钱转到了新银行。<,>trans(跨越)+fer(携带)→带过去→转移<,>transform(v.转变)/transmit(v.传输)/transport(v.运输)

criminal<,>/ˈkrɪmɪnl/<,>/ˈkrɪmənl/<,>n.犯人/n.罪犯/n.刑事犯<,>The criminal was sentenced to prison.<,>罪犯被判入狱。<,>He works as a criminal lawyer.<,>他是一名刑事律师。<,>Criminal activities have increased in this area.<,>这个地区的犯罪活动增加了。<,>crime(犯罪)+al(人)→犯罪的人<,>civil(adj.民事的)/crimson(n.深红色)/discriminate(v.歧视)
Christian<,>/ˈkrɪstʃən/<,>/ˈkrɪstʃən/<,>n.基督教徒/n.信徒<,>He is a devout Christian.<,>他是一个虔诚的基督教徒。<,>Many Christians attend church on Sundays.<,>许多基督徒周日去教堂。<,>She converted to Christianity and became a Christian.<,>她皈依基督教成为信徒。<,>Christ(基督)+ian(人)→基督教徒<,>Christ(n.基督)/Christmas(n.圣诞节)

cargo<,>/ˈkɑːɡəʊ/<,>/ˈkɑːrɡoʊ/<,>n.船货/n.货物<,>The ship was carrying a cargo of bananas.<,>这艘船载着一批香蕉。<,>Customs officers inspected the cargo carefully.<,>海关官员仔细检查了货物。<,>They unloaded the cargo from the truck.<,>他们从卡车上卸下货物。<,>car(车)+go(走)→车载货物<,>freight(n.货运)/shipment(n.装运)

plantation<,>/plɑːnˈteɪʃən/<,>/plænˈteɪʃən/<,>n.种植园<,>They worked on a cotton plantation.<,>他们在棉花种植园工作。<,>The plantation covers hundreds of acres.<,>这个种植园占地数百英亩。<,>Sugar cane is grown on this plantation.<,>这个种植园种植甘蔗。<,>plant(种植)+ation(场所)→种植园<,>plantation与plant(n.植物/v.种植)同源

gross<,>/ɡrəʊs/<,>/ɡroʊs/<,>adj.总的/adj.严重的<,>The gross weight is 500 kilograms.<,>总重量是500公斤。<,>That was a gross mistake.<,>那是个严重的错误。<,>Gross income includes all earnings.<,>总收入包括所有收入。<,>与grass(草)形似但不同<,>net(adj.净的)/total(adj.全部的)

gradual<,>/ˈɡrædʒuəl/<,>/ˈɡrædʒuəl/<,>adj.逐渐的/adj.渐进的<,>There has been a gradual improvement in his health.<,>他的健康状况逐渐好转。<,>The change was too gradual to notice.<,>变化太渐进以至于没注意到。<,>We saw the gradual rise of the sun.<,>我们看着太阳渐渐升起。<,>grad(步)+ual→一步步的→渐进的<,>sudden(adj.突然的)/abrupt(adj.急剧的)

culture<,>/ˈkʌltʃə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌltʃər/<,>n.文化/n.文明<,>Chinese culture has a long history.<,>中国文化历史悠久。<,>He studies pop culture in college.<,>他在大学研究流行文化。<,>The museum displays ancient cultures.<,>博物馆展示古代文明。<,>cult(培养)+ure→培养的结果→文化<,>agriculture(n.农业)/horticulture(n.园艺)

position<,>/pəˈzɪʃən/<,>/pəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.姿势/n.位置/n.职位<,>He sat in a comfortable position.<,>他坐姿很舒服。<,>What's your position on this issue?<,>你对此事的立场是什么？<,>She got a management position.<,>她获得了管理职位。<,>pos(放置)+ition→放置的地方→位置<,>posture(n.姿势)/disposition(n.性情)

four<,>/fɔː(r)/<,>/fɔːr/<,>num.四/num.四个/num.第四<,>There are four seasons in a year.<,>一年有四个季节。<,>She came in fourth place.<,>她获得了第四名。<,>I'll meet you at four o'clock.<,>我四点和你见面。<,>与for(为了)发音相似<,>forty(num.四十)/fourteen(num.十四)

immigrant<,>/ˈɪmɪɡrənt/<,>/ˈɪmɪɡrənt/<,>n.移民<,>Many immigrants came to America for a better life.<,>许多移民来美国寻求更好的生活。<,>She is an immigrant from Mexico.<,>她是来自墨西哥的移民。<,>The city has a large immigrant population.<,>这座城市有大量移民人口。<,>im(进入)+migr(迁移)+ant→移民<,>emigrant(n.移居外国者)/migrant(n.移居者)

trend<,>/trend/<,>/trend/<,>n.倾向<,>There's a trend towards healthier eating.<,>现在有更健康饮食的倾向。<,>Fashion trends change quickly.<,>时尚潮流变化很快。<,>The trend shows increasing sales.<,>趋势显示销售额在增长。<,>与tend(倾向于)形似<,>tendency(n.趋势)/fad(n.一时的风尚)
humid<,>/ˈhjuːmɪd/<,>/ˈhjuːmɪd/<,>adj.湿的/adj.湿气重的<,>The air was hot and humid in the rainforest.<,>雨林里的空气又热又潮湿。<,>Humid weather makes my hair frizzy.<,>潮湿的天气让我的头发卷曲。<,>They use a dehumidifier to reduce the humid air.<,>他们用除湿机来减少潮湿的空气。<,>hum(人)+id(形容词后缀)→人出汗→潮湿的<,>human(n.人类)/humble(adj.谦逊的)

preparation<,>/ˌprepəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɛpəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.准备/n.预备/n.制备<,>She spent hours in preparation for the exam.<,>她花了几个小时准备考试。<,>The preparation of this dish takes a lot of time.<,>这道菜的制备需要很多时间。<,>All the preparations for the party are complete.<,>派对的所有准备工作都完成了。<,>pre(前)+par(安排)+ation(名词后缀)→提前安排→准备<,>preparatory(adj.预备的)/reparation(n.赔偿)

magnetic<,>/mæɡˈnetɪk/<,>/mæɡˈnɛtɪk/<,>adj.磁的/adj.有吸引力的<,>The magnetic field protects Earth from solar winds.<,>磁场保护地球免受太阳风的影响。<,>She has a magnetic personality that draws people in.<,>她有一种吸引人的个性。<,>The magnetic strip on the card stores information.<,>卡上的磁条存储信息。<,>magnet(磁铁)+ic(形容词后缀)→磁的<,>magnificent(adj.壮丽的)/magic(n.魔法)

November<,>/nəʊˈvembə(r)/<,>/noʊˈvɛmbər/<,>n.十一月<,>My birthday is in November.<,>我的生日在十一月。<,>November is the eleventh month of the year.<,>十一月是一年中的第十一个月。<,>The weather gets colder in November.<,>十一月天气变冷了。<,>Novem(拉丁语"九")+ber→古罗马历法的第九个月<,>December(n.十二月)/September(n.九月)

clothes<,>/kləʊðz/<,>/kloʊðz/<,>n.衣服/n.服装<,>She folded her clothes neatly.<,>她把衣服叠得整整齐齐。<,>These clothes need to be washed.<,>这些衣服需要洗了。<,>He donated his old clothes to charity.<,>他把旧衣服捐给了慈善机构。<,>cloth(布)+es(复数)→用布做的物品→衣服<,>cloths(n.布片)/clothing(n.服装总称)

glow<,>/ɡləʊ/<,>/ɡloʊ/<,>n.白热光/v.发白热光<,>The glow of the fireflies was magical.<,>萤火虫的光芒很神奇。<,>Her face began to glow with happiness.<,>她的脸上洋溢着幸福的光芒。<,>The embers continued to glow in the dark.<,>余烬在黑暗中继续发光。<,>g(光)+low(低)→低强度的光→微光<,>grow(v.生长)/glue(n.胶水)

pad<,>/pæd/<,>/pæd/<,>n.垫/n.本子/v.填塞<,>She wrote her ideas on a notepad.<,>她把想法写在记事本上。<,>The chair has a soft pad for comfort.<,>椅子上有软垫，坐着舒服。<,>He padded the box with newspaper.<,>他用报纸填塞箱子。<,>pa(拍)+d(地)→拍地的垫子<,>pat(v.轻拍)/pet(n.宠物)

dusk<,>/dʌsk/<,>/dʌsk/<,>n.薄暮/n.黄昏/n.幽暗<,>The streetlights turn on at dusk.<,>街灯在黄昏时亮起。<,>We took a walk in the dusk.<,>我们在暮色中散步。<,>The room was in dusk as the sun set.<,>日落时房间变得昏暗。<,>du(度)+sk(时刻)→过渡时刻→黄昏<,>dust(n.灰尘)/disk(n.磁盘)

force<,>/fɔːs/<,>/fɔrs/<,>n.力/n.力量/v.强迫<,>The force of the wind knocked down trees.<,>风力把树吹倒了。<,>They forced the door open.<,>他们强行把门打开。<,>She spoke with great force.<,>她说话很有力度。<,>for(为了)+ce(测)→为了测量而用力<,>forge(v.锻造)/farce(n.闹剧)

rainy<,>/ˈreɪni/<,>/ˈreɪni/<,>adj.下雨的/adj.多雨的<,>I always feel sleepy on rainy days.<,>下雨天我总是想睡觉。<,>The rainy season lasts from June to August.<,>雨季从六月持续到八月。<,>Don't forget your umbrella; it's rainy outside.<,>别忘了带伞，外面在下雨。<,>rain(雨)+y(形容词后缀)→多雨的<,>sunny(adj.晴朗的)/windy(adj.多风的)
tame<,>/teɪm/<,>/teɪm/<,>adj.驯服的/adj.顺从的<,>The lion was surprisingly tame around humans.<,>这只狮子在人类周围出奇地温顺。<,>She has a tame personality and rarely argues.<,>她性格温顺，很少与人争执。<,>The wild horse was eventually tamed by the trainer.<,>那匹野马最终被驯马师驯服了。<,>tame与time发音相似，但意思完全不同<,>game(n.游戏)/fame(n.名声)/lame(adj.跛的)

formal<,>/ˈfɔːməl/<,>/ˈfɔːrməl/<,>adj.正式的/adj.礼仪上的<,>Please wear formal attire to the wedding.<,>请穿正式服装参加婚礼。<,>They exchanged formal greetings at the meeting.<,>他们在会议上交换了正式的问候。<,>The invitation was written in very formal language.<,>邀请函是用非常正式的语言写的。<,>form(形式)+al(形容词后缀)→正式的<,>normal(adj.正常的)/informal(adj.非正式的)/former(adj.前者的)

switch<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>n.开关/n.转换/v.转换<,>Please turn off the light switch before leaving.<,>离开前请关掉电灯开关。<,>He decided to switch his major from biology to chemistry.<,>他决定把专业从生物转为化学。<,>The train will switch tracks at the next station.<,>火车将在下一站换轨。<,>switch与twitch(抽搐)发音相似<,>pitch(n.球场)/stitch(n.针脚)/snitch(v.告密)

fruit<,>/fruːt/<,>/frut/<,>n.水果/n.果实/n.成果<,>She eats fresh fruit every morning.<,>她每天早上都吃新鲜水果。<,>The apple tree bore fruit for the first time this year.<,>这棵苹果树今年第一次结果。<,>Years of hard work finally bore fruit when he got promoted.<,>多年的辛勤工作终于有了成果，他获得了晋升。<,>fruit与fruity(果味的)相关<,>root(n.根)/brute(n.野兽)/flute(n.长笛)

equation<,>/ɪˈkweɪʒn/<,>/ɪˈkweɪʒən/<,>n.方程（式）/n.等式<,>The math teacher wrote a complex equation on the board.<,>数学老师在黑板上写了一个复杂的方程式。<,>Solving this equation requires advanced algebra skills.<,>解这个方程需要高等代数技巧。<,>The chemical equation shows the reaction process clearly.<,>这个化学方程式清晰地展示了反应过程。<,>equ(平等)+ation(名词后缀)→等式<,>equator(n.赤道)/equivalent(adj.等价的)/equilibrium(n.平衡)

circumstance<,>/ˈsɜːkəmstəns/<,>/ˈsɜːrkəmstæns/<,>n.情况/n.条件/n.境遇<,>Under no circumstances should you open this door.<,>在任何情况下你都不应该打开这扇门。<,>The police are investigating the circumstances of the accident.<,>警方正在调查事故的情况。<,>Given our current financial circumstances, we can't afford a vacation.<,>考虑到我们目前的经济状况，我们负担不起度假。<,>circum(周围)+stance(站立)→站在周围的情况<,>instance(n.实例)/substance(n.物质)/distance(n.距离)

eighty<,>/ˈeɪti/<,>/ˈeɪti/<,>num.八十/num.八十个<,>My grandmother is eighty years old but still very active.<,>我祖母八十岁了，但仍然很活跃。<,>The temperature reached eighty degrees Fahrenheit today.<,>今天气温达到了华氏八十度。<,>There are eighty students in our graduating class.<,>我们毕业班有八十名学生。<,>eight(八)+ty(表示"十"的后缀)→八十<,>eighteen(num.十八)/eighth(adj.第八)/eighty-eight(n.88式钢琴)

reach<,>/riːtʃ/<,>/ritʃ/<,>v.抵达/v.伸出/v.达到<,>We should reach the destination by noon.<,>我们应该在中午前到达目的地。<,>She reached out to grab the book on the top shelf.<,>她伸手去拿顶层书架上的书。<,>After years of effort, he finally reached his goal.<,>经过多年努力，他终于实现了目标。<,>reach与beach(海滩)押韵<,>teach(v.教学)/peach(n.桃子)/breach(n.违反)

luxury<,>/ˈlʌkʃəri/<,>/ˈlʌɡʒəri/<,>n.奢侈/n.奢华/n.奢侈品<,>Staying in a five-star hotel is a real luxury.<,>住五星级酒店是真正的奢侈享受。<,>She can't afford such luxury items on her salary.<,>以她的工资买不起这样的奢侈品。<,>For him, having time to read is the greatest luxury.<,>对他来说，有时间读书是最大的奢侈。<,>lux(光)+ury→闪闪发光的东西→奢侈品<,>luxurious(adj.豪华的)/luxuriant(adj.茂盛的)/luxuriate(v.尽情享受)

pound<,>/paʊnd/<,>/paʊnd/<,>n.磅/n.英磅<,>This package weighs about five pounds.<,>这个包裹重约五磅。<,>The exchange rate is 1.3 dollars to the pound.<,>汇率是1.3美元兑1英镑。<,>She bought a pound of apples at the market.<,>她在市场买了一磅苹果。<,>pound与sound(声音)押韵<,>found(v.建立)/round(adj.圆的)/bound(v.跳跃)
beer<,>/bɪə(r)/<,>/bɪr/<,>n.啤酒<,>He ordered a pint of beer at the pub.<,>他在酒吧点了一品脱啤酒。<,>This brewery produces the best beer in the region.<,>这家啤酒厂生产本地区最好的啤酒。<,>She doesn't like the bitter taste of dark beer.<,>她不喜欢黑啤酒的苦味。<,>发音类似"比尔"→比尔喝啤酒<,>bear(n.熊/v.忍受)/deer(n.鹿)/peer(n.同龄人/v.凝视)

accuracy<,>/ˈækjərəsi/<,>/ˈækjərəsi/<,>n.准确（性）/n.准确度<,>The accuracy of his predictions was astonishing.<,>他预测的准确性令人惊讶。<,>This instrument measures temperature with high accuracy.<,>这个仪器能高精度测量温度。<,>We need to check the accuracy of these figures.<,>我们需要核实这些数字的准确性。<,>accurate(准确的)+cy(名词后缀)→准确性<,>precision(n.精确)/correctness(n.正确性)/error(n.错误)

punish<,>/ˈpʌnɪʃ/<,>/ˈpʌnɪʃ/<,>v.罚/v.惩罚/v.处罚<,>The teacher punished the student for cheating.<,>老师惩罚了作弊的学生。<,>Parents shouldn't punish children too severely.<,>父母不应该过分严厉地惩罚孩子。<,>The law punishes drunk driving with heavy fines.<,>法律对酒驾处以重罚。<,>pun(惩罚)+ish(动词后缀)→惩罚<,>penalize(v.处罚)/discipline(v.惩戒)/reward(v.奖励)

poetry<,>/ˈpəʊɪtri/<,>/ˈpoʊətri/<,>n.诗/n.诗歌/n.诗作<,>She has a great talent for writing poetry.<,>她在诗歌创作方面很有天赋。<,>Ancient Chinese poetry is highly regarded worldwide.<,>中国古代诗歌在世界范围内备受推崇。<,>He recited a beautiful piece of poetry at the wedding.<,>他在婚礼上朗诵了一首优美的诗歌。<,>poet(诗人)+ry(名词后缀)→诗歌<,>prose(n.散文)/verse(n.诗句)/rhyme(n.押韵)

idle<,>/ˈaɪdl/<,>/ˈaɪdl/<,>adj.空闲的/adj.懒散的<,>The machines stood idle during the holiday.<,>假期期间机器闲置着。<,>Don't be idle all day; find something meaningful to do.<,>不要整天无所事事，找些有意义的事情做。<,>He made idle promises that he never intended to keep.<,>他许下了一些根本没打算兑现的空头承诺。<,>发音类似"爱抖"→爱抖腿的人显得懒散<,>busy(adj.忙碌的)/lazy(adj.懒惰的)/active(adj.活跃的)

rare<,>/reə(r)/<,>/rer/<,>adj.稀薄的/adj.稀有的<,>This is a rare species of butterfly.<,>这是一种稀有的蝴蝶品种。<,>The air becomes rare at high altitudes.<,>高海拔地区空气变得稀薄。<,>It's rare to see him so excited.<,>很少见他这么兴奋。<,>对比"bare"(赤裸的)→稀有物品需要"赤裸"展示<,>scarce(adj.缺乏的)/common(adj.常见的)/frequent(adj.频繁的)

environment<,>/ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/<,>/ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/<,>n.环境/n.外界<,>We must protect our natural environment.<,>我们必须保护自然环境。<,>Children need a safe learning environment.<,>孩子们需要一个安全的学习环境。<,>The software runs in various operating environments.<,>该软件可在多种操作环境下运行。<,>environ(环绕)+ment(名词后缀)→周围环境<,>surroundings(n.周围环境)/ecosystem(n.生态系统)/habitat(n.栖息地)

island<,>/ˈaɪlənd/<,>/ˈaɪlənd/<,>n.岛/n.岛屿<,>They spent their vacation on a tropical island.<,>他们在一个热带岛屿上度假。<,>Britain is an island nation.<,>英国是一个岛国。<,>The small island is uninhabited.<,>这个小岛无人居住。<,>is(是)+land(陆地)→是陆地→岛屿<,>isle(n.小岛)/peninsula(n.半岛)/continent(n.大陆)

color<,>/ˈkʌlə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌlər/<,>n.颜色/n.彩色/n.颜料<,>What color is your new car?<,>你的新车是什么颜色？<,>She loves wearing bright colors.<,>她喜欢穿鲜艳颜色的衣服。<,>The artist mixed the colors carefully.<,>艺术家仔细地调配颜料。<,>谐音"卡了"→卡在颜色选择上<,>hue(n.色调)/pigment(n.色素)/dye(n.染料)

extremely<,>/ɪkˈstriːmli/<,>/ɪkˈstriːmli/<,>adv.极端/adv.极其/adv.非常<,>The weather was extremely cold last winter.<,>去年冬天天气极其寒冷。<,>She was extremely happy with the results.<,>她对结果感到非常高兴。<,>This task is extremely difficult to complete.<,>这项任务极其难以完成。<,>extreme(极端的)+ly(副词后缀)→极其<,>very(adv.非常)/exceedingly(adv.极度)/moderately(adv.适度地)
certainly<,>/ˈsɜːtnli/<,>/ˈsɜrtnli/<,>adv.一定/adv.必定/adv.当然<,>He will certainly come to the party.<,>他一定会来参加派对。<,>Certainly, you can ask me any questions.<,>当然，你可以问我任何问题。<,>She certainly knows how to make people laugh.<,>她当然知道如何逗人笑。<,>certain(确定的)+ly(副词后缀)→确定地→当然<,>sure(adj.确信的)/definitely(adv.肯定地)/absolutely(adv.绝对地)

tractor<,>/ˈtræktə(r)/<,>/ˈtræktər/<,>n.拖拉机/n.牵引车<,>The farmer uses a tractor to plow the field.<,>农民用拖拉机耕地。<,>The tractor pulled the heavy trailer with ease.<,>拖拉机轻松地拉动了沉重的拖车。<,>Modern tractors are equipped with GPS technology.<,>现代拖拉机配备了GPS技术。<,>tract(拉)+or(物)→拉的东西→拖拉机<,>attract(v.吸引)/contract(n.合同)/extract(v.提取)

handwriting<,>/ˈhændraɪtɪŋ/<,>/ˈhændˌraɪtɪŋ/<,>n.笔迹/n.手迹/n.书法<,>Her handwriting is very neat and beautiful.<,>她的笔迹非常整洁漂亮。<,>The teacher recognized the student's handwriting immediately.<,>老师立即认出了学生的笔迹。<,>Ancient Chinese handwriting is considered an art form.<,>中国古代书法被认为是一种艺术形式。<,>hand(手)+writing(写)→手写的东西→笔迹<,>handmade(adj.手工的)/handbook(n.手册)/handshake(n.握手)

aid<,>/eɪd/<,>/eɪd/<,>n.帮助/n.助手/n.救护<,>First aid knowledge can save lives.<,>急救知识可以挽救生命。<,>She works as a teacher's aid in the classroom.<,>她在教室里担任教师助手。<,>Many countries provide aid to developing nations.<,>许多国家向发展中国家提供援助。<,>a(加强)+id(帮助)→帮助<,>aide(n.助手)/add(v.增加)/raid(n.袭击)

craft<,>/krɑːft/<,>/kræft/<,>n.工艺/n.手艺<,>She learned the craft of pottery making from her grandmother.<,>她从祖母那里学会了陶艺。<,>The ancient craft of weaving is still practiced today.<,>古老的编织工艺至今仍在传承。<,>He takes pride in his woodworking craft.<,>他为自己的木工手艺感到自豪。<,>cr(创造)+aft(能力)→创造的能力→手艺<,>draft(n.草稿)/graft(v.嫁接)/crafty(adj.狡猾的)

laugh<,>/lɑːf/<,>/læf/<,>v.笑/v.发笑/n.笑<,>The joke made everyone laugh out loud.<,>这个笑话让大家都大笑起来。<,>Her infectious laugh brightened the room.<,>她富有感染力的笑声让房间明亮起来。<,>Don't laugh at other people's mistakes.<,>不要嘲笑别人的错误。<,>lau(拟声词)+gh→笑声<,>laughter(n.笑声)/cough(v.咳嗽)/slaughter(v.屠杀)

century<,>/ˈsentʃəri/<,>/ˈsentʃəri/<,>n.世纪/n.百年<,>We are living in the 21st century.<,>我们生活在21世纪。<,>The castle was built in the 15th century.<,>这座城堡建于15世纪。<,>It took nearly a century to complete the project.<,>这个项目花了近一个世纪才完成。<,>cent(百)+ury(名词后缀)→百年<,>century(adj.百年的)/centurion(n.百夫长)/centimeter(n.厘米)

hers<,>/hɜːz/<,>/hɜrz/<,>pron.她的(所有物)<,>The red bag is hers, not mine.<,>这个红色的包是她的，不是我的。<,>Hers is the last name on the list.<,>名单上最后一个是她的名字。<,>These books are hers, you can borrow them.<,>这些书是她的，你可以借阅。<,>her(她的)+s(所有格)→她的东西<,>his(pron.他的)/ours(pron.我们的)/theirs(pron.他们的)

gravity<,>/ˈɡrævəti/<,>/ˈɡrævəti/<,>n.重力/n.引力/n.严重性<,>Gravity keeps us on the ground.<,>重力让我们保持在地面上。<,>The gravity of the situation became clear to everyone.<,>所有人都清楚情况的严重性。<,>Newton discovered the law of gravity.<,>牛顿发现了万有引力定律。<,>grav(重)+ity(名词后缀)→重力<,>grave(adj.严重的)/gravitate(v.受吸引)/gravid(adj.怀孕的)

northeast<,>/ˌnɔːθˈiːst/<,>/ˌnɔrθˈist/<,>n.东北/adj.位于东北的<,>The wind is coming from the northeast.<,>风从东北方向吹来。<,>They live in the northeast part of the city.<,>他们住在城市的东北部。<,>Northeast China has cold winters.<,>中国东北地区冬季寒冷。<,>north(北)+east(东)→东北<,>northwest(n.西北)/southeast(n.东南)/southwest(n.西南)
purpose<,>/ˈpɜːpəs/<,>/ˈpɜːrpəs/<,>n.目的/n.意图<,>What is the purpose of your visit?<,>你此行的目的是什么？<,>He did it with a clear purpose.<,>他做这件事有明确的目的。<,>The purpose of the meeting was to discuss the budget.<,>会议的目的是讨论预算。<,>pur(完全)+pose(放置)→完全放在心里→目的<,>propose(v.提议)/suppose(v.假设)/dispose(v.处理)

issue<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>n.问题/n.发行/v.发行<,>This magazine is issued monthly.<,>这本杂志每月发行一次。<,>The government issued a statement yesterday.<,>政府昨天发表了一份声明。<,>We need to address this issue immediately.<,>我们需要立即解决这个问题。<,>is(出)+sue(跟随)→跟随出来→发行<,>tissue(n.组织/n.纸巾)/pursue(v.追求)/ensue(v.接着发生)

literary<,>/ˈlɪtərəri/<,>/ˈlɪtəreri/<,>adj.文学(上)的<,>He has a great interest in literary works.<,>他对文学作品有浓厚的兴趣。<,>She won a literary prize last year.<,>她去年获得了文学奖。<,>The book is full of literary allusions.<,>这本书充满了文学典故。<,>liter(文字)+ary(形容词后缀)→文学的<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literate(adj.有文化的)/illiterate(adj.文盲的)

hire<,>/ˈhaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈhaɪər/<,>v.租借/n.租用/n.雇用<,>We hired a car for our holiday.<,>我们为假期租了一辆车。<,>The company is hiring new employees.<,>公司正在招聘新员工。<,>He was hired as a consultant.<,>他被聘为顾问。<,>hir(拿)+e→拿过来用→租借<,>fire(v.解雇/n.火)/tire(v.疲劳/n.轮胎)/wire(n.电线/v.发电报)

nursery<,>/ˈnɜːsəri/<,>/ˈnɜːrsəri/<,>n.托儿所/n.苗圃<,>She works in a nursery taking care of children.<,>她在托儿所工作，照顾孩子。<,>We bought these plants from a nursery.<,>我们从苗圃买了这些植物。<,>The nursery is full of colorful toys.<,>托儿所里满是五颜六色的玩具。<,>nurse(护理)+ry(场所)→护理的场所→托儿所<,>nursing(n.护理)/nurture(v.养育)/nurse(n.护士/v.护理)

excite<,>/ɪkˈsaɪt/<,>/ɪkˈsaɪt/<,>v.使激动/v.引起<,>The news excited everyone in the room.<,>这个消息让房间里的每个人都兴奋不已。<,>His speech excited great interest.<,>他的演讲引起了极大的兴趣。<,>The children were excited about the trip.<,>孩子们对这次旅行感到兴奋。<,>ex(出)+cite(唤起)→唤起出来→使激动<,>incite(v.煽动)/recite(v.背诵)/cite(v.引用)

resolution<,>/ˌrezəˈluːʃn/<,>/ˌrezəˈluːʃn/<,>n.坚决/n.坚定/n.决定<,>She made a resolution to exercise every day.<,>她下定决心每天锻炼。<,>The resolution was passed unanimously.<,>决议获得一致通过。<,>He showed great resolution in facing the challenge.<,>他在面对挑战时表现出极大的决心。<,>re(再)+solution(解决)→再次解决→决心<,>revolution(n.革命)/evolution(n.进化)/solution(n.解决方案)

disappoint<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɔɪnt/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɔɪnt/<,>v.使失望/v.使受挫折<,>I don't want to disappoint my parents.<,>我不想让父母失望。<,>The movie disappointed many fans.<,>这部电影让很多粉丝失望。<,>His performance disappointed the coach.<,>他的表现让教练失望。<,>dis(不)+appoint(任命)→不被任命→失望<,>appoint(v.任命)/point(n.点/v.指向)/joint(n.关节/adj.联合的)

silver<,>/ˈsɪlvə(r)/<,>/ˈsɪlvər/<,>n.银/n.银币/n.银器<,>She wore a beautiful silver necklace.<,>她戴着一条漂亮的银项链。<,>The coins are made of silver.<,>这些硬币是银制的。<,>He polished the family silver.<,>他擦拭了家里的银器。<,>silv(银)+er→银<,>sliver(n.薄片)/silicon(n.硅)/silk(n.丝绸)

hesitate<,>/ˈhezɪteɪt/<,>/ˈhezɪteɪt/<,>v.犹豫/v.踌躇/v.含糊<,>Don't hesitate to ask if you need help.<,>如果需要帮助，请不要犹豫。<,>She hesitated before answering the question.<,>她在回答问题前犹豫了一下。<,>He hesitated at the door, unsure whether to enter.<,>他在门口犹豫，不确定是否要进去。<,>hes(粘)+it+ate→粘住不动→犹豫<,>hesitation(n.犹豫)/hasten(v.加速)/hesitant(adj.犹豫的)
transmit<,>/trænzˈmɪt/<,>/trænzˈmɪt/<,>v.传送/v.传达/v.发射<,>The radio station transmits news every hour.<,>这个广播电台每小时传送新闻。<,>He transmitted his ideas clearly to the team.<,>他向团队清晰地传达了他的想法。<,>The satellite transmits signals to Earth.<,>这颗卫星向地球发射信号。<,>trans(跨越)+mit(发送)→传送<,>transfer(v.转移/n.转让)/submit(v.提交/v.屈服)/omit(v.省略/v.遗漏)

threaten<,>/ˈθretn/<,>/ˈθretn/<,>v.威胁/v.恐吓<,>He threatened to call the police.<,>他威胁要报警。<,>The dark clouds threatened rain.<,>乌云预示着要下雨。<,>She felt threatened by his aggressive behavior.<,>她因他的挑衅行为感到受威胁。<,>threat(威胁)+en(动词后缀)→威胁<,>thread(n.线/v.穿线)/treat(v.对待/n.款待)/throat(n.喉咙)

lap<,>/læp/<,>/læp/<,>n.〔坐着时的〕大腿部/n.一圈<,>The cat sat comfortably on her lap.<,>猫舒服地坐在她的大腿上。<,>He finished the race in ten laps.<,>他以十圈完成了比赛。<,>She folded her hands in her lap.<,>她双手交叉放在大腿上。<,>联想：lap(大腿)像一张"lap"(膝上电脑)<,>lip(n.嘴唇)/lab(n.实验室)/lamp(n.灯)

tremendous<,>/trəˈmendəs/<,>/trəˈmendəs/<,>adj.极大的/adj.非常的<,>They made a tremendous effort to finish the project.<,>他们付出了极大的努力来完成项目。<,>The concert was a tremendous success.<,>这场音乐会非常成功。<,>She has a tremendous amount of work to do.<,>她有非常多的工作要做。<,>trem(颤抖)+endous→大得令人颤抖的<,>tremble(v.颤抖)/tremor(n.震动)/tremendously(adv.非常地)

independence<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendəns/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendəns/<,>n.独立/n.自主/n.自立<,>The country gained independence in 1947.<,>这个国家于1947年获得独立。<,>Teenagers often seek more independence from their parents.<,>青少年常常寻求更多来自父母的自主权。<,>Financial independence is important for young adults.<,>经济自立对年轻人很重要。<,>in(不)+depend(依赖)+ence→不依赖→独立<,>dependence(n.依赖)/independent(adj.独立的)/pendulum(n.钟摆)

manager<,>/ˈmænɪdʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmænɪdʒər/<,>n.经理/n.管理人<,>The store manager handled the complaint professionally.<,>商店经理专业地处理了投诉。<,>She was promoted to project manager last month.<,>她上个月被提升为项目经理。<,>A good manager knows how to motivate the team.<,>一个好的管理人知道如何激励团队。<,>manage(管理)+er(人)→管理人<,>manger(n.马槽)/management(n.管理)/manor(n.庄园)

brass<,>/brɑːs/<,>/bræs/<,>n.黄铜/n.黄铜器<,>The doorknob was made of brass.<,>门把手是黄铜制的。<,>He polished the brass until it shone.<,>他把黄铜器擦得发亮。<,>The band's brass section sounded amazing.<,>乐队的铜管部分听起来很棒。<,>bra(铜)+ss→黄铜<,>grass(n.草)/bass(n.低音)/brace(n.支架)

band<,>/bænd/<,>/bænd/<,>n.乐队/n.带/n.波段<,>The rock band performed at the festival.<,>这支摇滚乐队在音乐节上表演。<,>She wore a rubber band around her wrist.<,>她手腕上戴着一个橡皮筋。<,>This radio picks up FM band signals.<,>这台收音机能接收调频波段信号。<,>ban(禁止)+d→乐队(最初被禁止的音乐形式)<,>bend(v.弯曲)/bond(n.债券)/brand(n.品牌)

proceed<,>/prəˈsiːd/<,>/proʊˈsiːd/<,>v.进行/v.继续进行<,>After the interruption, we proceeded with the meeting.<,>中断后，我们继续开会。<,>Please proceed to the next checkpoint.<,>请继续前往下一个检查站。<,>The project is proceeding as planned.<,>项目正按计划进行。<,>pro(向前)+ceed(走)→向前走→进行<,>precede(v.先于)/proceeds(n.收入)/process(n.过程)

expansion<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>n.扩大/n.扩充/n.扩张<,>The company announced plans for international expansion.<,>公司宣布了国际扩张计划。<,>The expansion of the universe is accelerating.<,>宇宙的膨胀正在加速。<,>This software allows for memory expansion.<,>这个软件允许内存扩充。<,>ex(出)+pan(展开)+sion→向外展开→扩张<,>expense(n.花费)/expansive(adj.广阔的)/expend(v.花费)
from<,>/frɒm/<,>/frʌm/<,>prep.从…来<,>She is from Canada.<,>她来自加拿大。<,>The letter is from my friend.<,>这封信是我朋友寄来的。<,>He moved from London to Paris.<,>他从伦敦搬到了巴黎。<,>fro(向前)+m(移动)→从某处移动而来<,>form(n.形式/v.形成)/frame(n.框架/v.设计)  

elimination<,>/ɪˌlɪmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ɪˌlɪmɪˈneɪʃən/<,>n.排除/n.消除/n.消灭<,>The elimination of waste is important for the environment.<,>废物的清除对环境很重要。<,>The team was disappointed by their early elimination from the tournament.<,>球队对在比赛中早早被淘汰感到失望。<,>Vaccination led to the elimination of smallpox.<,>疫苗接种导致了天花的消灭。<,>e(出)+limin(门槛)+ation→扔出门槛→排除<,>illuminate(v.照亮)/limitation(n.限制)  

defend<,>/dɪˈfend/<,>/dɪˈfɛnd/<,>v.保卫/v.防守<,>Soldiers defend our country.<,>士兵保卫我们的国家。<,>The lawyer will defend the accused in court.<,>律师将在法庭上为被告辩护。<,>He raised his arms to defend himself.<,>他举起手臂自卫。<,>de(向下)+fend(打击)→向下打击→防守<,>offend(v.冒犯)/defense(n.防御)  

significant<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>/sɪɡˈnɪfɪkənt/<,>adj.有意义的/adj.重要的<,>This discovery is significant for science.<,>这一发现对科学很重要。<,>There was a significant increase in sales.<,>销售额有显著增长。<,>She gave me a significant look.<,>她给了我一个意味深长的眼神。<,>sign(标记)+i+fic(做)+ant→做了标记的→重要的<,>magnificent(adj.宏伟的)/insignificant(adj.微不足道的)  

always<,>/ˈɔːlweɪz/<,>/ˈɔlweɪz/<,>adv.总是/adv.一直/adv.永远<,>She always arrives on time.<,>她总是准时到达。<,>I will always remember this day.<,>我会永远记住这一天。<,>The sun always rises in the east.<,>太阳总是从东方升起。<,>all(全部)+ways(方式)→以所有方式→总是<,>allay(v.减轻)/alway(古英语"总是")  

rod<,>/rɒd/<,>/rɑd/<,>n.杆/n.竿/n.棒<,>He caught a fish with a fishing rod.<,>他用钓鱼竿钓到了一条鱼。<,>The curtain hangs from a metal rod.<,>窗帘挂在金属杆上。<,>The teacher used a pointer rod in class.<,>老师在课堂上使用了教鞭。<,>与"road(道路)"发音相似，但意思不同<,>cod(n.鳕鱼)/pod(n.豆荚)/rodent(n.啮齿动物)  

mainland<,>/ˈmeɪnlænd/<,>/ˈmeɪnˌlænd/<,>n.大陆<,>They traveled from the island to the mainland.<,>他们从岛上前往大陆。<,>Mainland China has a large population.<,>中国大陆人口众多。<,>The ferry connects the island with the mainland.<,>渡轮连接着岛屿和大陆。<,>main(主要的)+land(陆地)→主要的陆地→大陆<,>island(n.岛屿)/inland(adj.内陆的)  

maximum<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>/ˈmæksəməm/<,>n.最大量/adj.最大的<,>The maximum speed limit is 120 km/h.<,>最高限速是每小时120公里。<,>We need to achieve maximum efficiency.<,>我们需要达到最高效率。<,>This room has a maximum capacity of 50 people.<,>这个房间最多可容纳50人。<,>max(大)+imum(最)→最大的<,>minimum(n.最小量/adj.最小的)/maxim(n.格言)  

honeymoon<,>/ˈhʌnimuːn/<,>/ˈhʌniˌmun/<,>n.蜜月<,>They went to Hawaii for their honeymoon.<,>他们去夏威夷度蜜月。<,>The honeymoon period of the new job is over.<,>新工作的蜜月期结束了。<,>They enjoyed a romantic honeymoon in Paris.<,>他们在巴黎享受了浪漫的蜜月。<,>honey(蜜)+moon(月)→甜蜜的月份→蜜月<,>honeybee(n.蜜蜂)/moonshine(n.月光)  

content<,>/kənˈtent/<,>/kənˈtɛnt/<,>adj.满意的/adj.满足的<,>She seems content with her life.<,>她似乎对自己的生活很满意。<,>The cat lay content by the fire.<,>猫满足地躺在火炉旁。<,>I am content to stay at home tonight.<,>今晚我很乐意待在家里。<,>con(完全)+tent(伸展)→完全伸展→满足的<,>contend(v.竞争)/consent(v.同意)
scholar<,>/ˈskɒlə(r)/<,>/ˈskɑːlər/<,>n.学者（尤指文学方面）<,>He is a renowned scholar in classical literature.<,>他是古典文学领域的著名学者。<,>The scholar spent years researching ancient manuscripts.<,>这位学者花了多年时间研究古代手稿。<,>Young scholars should be encouraged to pursue their interests.<,>应该鼓励年轻学者追求他们的兴趣。<,>school(学校)+ar(人)→与学校相关的人→学者<,>solar(adj.太阳的)/scolar(n.学者)/scoliosis(n.脊柱侧弯)

tedious<,>/ˈtiːdiəs/<,>/ˈtiːdiəs/<,>adj.冗长乏味的，沉闷的<,>The lecture was so tedious that half the audience fell asleep.<,>讲座太枯燥了，一半的听众都睡着了。<,>Filling out these forms is a tedious process.<,>填写这些表格是个乏味的过程。<,>He found the repetitive work extremely tedious.<,>他发现重复性工作极其无聊。<,>ted(厌倦)+ious(形容词后缀)→令人厌倦的<,>tedium(n.沉闷)/tepid(adj.微温的)/teddy(n.泰迪熊)

late<,>/leɪt/<,>/leɪt/<,>adj.迟的/adv.迟，晚<,>She was late for the meeting because of traffic.<,>因为堵车，她开会迟到了。<,>The train arrived late at night.<,>火车深夜才到。<,>It's never too late to learn new skills.<,>学习新技能永远不嫌晚。<,>lat(迟)+e→迟的<,>later(adv.后来)/latest(adj.最新的)/latent(adj.潜在的)

Germany<,>/ˈdʒɜːməni/<,>/ˈdʒɜːrməni/<,>n.德意志，德国<,>Germany is known for its engineering excellence.<,>德国以其卓越的工程闻名。<,>We're planning a trip to Germany next summer.<,>我们计划明年夏天去德国旅行。<,>Many famous composers came from Germany.<,>许多著名作曲家来自德国。<,>German(德国的)+y(名词后缀)→德国<,>germany(n.德国)/germ(n.微生物)/German(adj.德国的)

figure<,>/ˈfɪɡə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪɡjər/<,>n.数字；外形；人物<,>The sales figures show a significant increase.<,>销售数字显示出显著增长。<,>She has an elegant figure.<,>她身材优雅。<,>He is a key figure in the company.<,>他是公司的关键人物。<,>fig(形状)+ure→外形<,>finger(n.手指)/figment(n.虚构)/figurine(n.小雕像)

clearly<,>/ˈklɪəli/<,>/ˈklɪrli/<,>adv.明白地，清晰地<,>Please speak clearly so everyone can understand.<,>请说清楚些，让每个人都能听懂。<,>The instructions were clearly written.<,>说明书写得很清楚。<,>It's clearly a mistake that needs to be corrected.<,>这显然是个需要纠正的错误。<,>clear(清楚的)+ly(副词后缀)→清楚地<,>clearly(adv.清楚地)/closely(adv.紧密地)/cleanly(adv.干净地)

follow<,>/ˈfɒləʊ/<,>/ˈfɑːloʊ/<,>v.跟随；结果是<,>Please follow me to the conference room.<,>请跟我到会议室。<,>If you study hard, good grades will follow.<,>如果你努力学习，好成绩自然会来。<,>The detective followed the suspect for days.<,>侦探跟踪嫌疑人好几天了。<,>fol(叶子)+low(低)→叶子低垂→跟随<,>follow(v.跟随)/fellow(n.同伴)/hollow(adj.空的)

fortunately<,>/ˈfɔːtʃənətli/<,>/ˈfɔːrtʃənətli/<,>adv.幸运地，幸亏<,>Fortunately, no one was hurt in the accident.<,>幸运的是，事故中没人受伤。<,>We arrived late but fortunately the show hadn't started.<,>我们迟到了，但幸运的是演出还没开始。<,>Fortunately, I had brought an umbrella.<,>幸亏我带了伞。<,>fortunate(幸运的)+ly(副词后缀)→幸运地<,>fortunately(adv.幸运地)/unfortunately(adv.不幸地)/fortune(n.运气)

particle<,>/ˈpɑːtɪkl/<,>/ˈpɑːrtɪkl/<,>n.微粒；粒子<,>Dust particles floated in the sunlight.<,>尘埃颗粒在阳光中漂浮。<,>Scientists study subatomic particles.<,>科学家研究亚原子粒子。<,>There wasn't a particle of truth in his story.<,>他的故事没有一点真实性。<,>part(部分)+icle(小)→小部分→微粒<,>particle(n.微粒)/particular(adj.特定的)/particulate(adj.微粒的)

version<,>/ˈvɜːʃn/<,>/ˈvɜːrʒn/<,>n.说法；译文；改写本<,>This is the latest version of the software.<,>这是软件的最新版本。<,>There are several versions of what happened that night.<,>关于那晚发生的事情有几种说法。<,>I prefer the film version to the original novel.<,>比起原著小说，我更喜欢电影改编版。<,>vers(转)+ion→转换的结果→版本<,>version(n.版本)/vision(n.视力)/versus(prep.对)
pink<,>/pɪŋk/<,>/pɪŋk/<,>n.粉红色/adj.粉红色的<,>She wore a beautiful pink dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件漂亮的粉红色连衣裙去参加派对。<,>The sky turned pink at sunset.<,>日落时天空变成了粉红色。<,>He painted his room pink.<,>他把房间刷成了粉红色。<,>联想：pink（粉红色）与ink（墨水）相似，但颜色不同。<,>pink(粉红色)/link(连接)/sink(下沉)

bring<,>/brɪŋ/<,>/brɪŋ/<,>v.带来/v.引出/v.促使<,>Please bring your homework tomorrow.<,>请明天带上你的作业。<,>His speech brought tears to my eyes.<,>他的演讲让我热泪盈眶。<,>This new policy will bring many changes.<,>这项新政策将带来许多变化。<,>br(联想：bring)+ing(进行时)→带来<,>bring(带来)/ring(戒指)/sing(唱歌)

ground<,>/ɡraʊnd/<,>/ɡraʊnd/<,>n.地/n.场地/n.根据<,>The children are playing on the ground.<,>孩子们正在地上玩耍。<,>This is a good ground for a picnic.<,>这是一个野餐的好场地。<,>There is no ground for his complaint.<,>他的抱怨毫无根据。<,>gr(联想：ground)+ound(声音)→地面<,>ground(地面)/round(圆的)/sound(声音)

pursue<,>/pəˈsjuː/<,>/pərˈsuː/<,>v.进行/v.追赶/v.追踪<,>He decided to pursue a career in music.<,>他决定从事音乐事业。<,>The police pursued the thief through the streets.<,>警察在街上追赶小偷。<,>She pursued her dreams despite the difficulties.<,>尽管困难重重，她仍追求自己的梦想。<,>pur(完全)+sue(跟随)→完全跟随→追赶<,>pursue(追赶)/purchase(购买)/purpose(目的)

film<,>/fɪlm/<,>/fɪlm/<,>n.影片/n.胶卷/n.薄层<,>We watched a great film last night.<,>昨晚我们看了一部很棒的电影。<,>He loaded the film into the camera.<,>他把胶卷装进了相机。<,>There was a thin film of dust on the table.<,>桌子上有一层薄薄的灰尘。<,>f(联想：film)+ilm(声音)→电影<,>film(电影)/fill(填满)/firm(坚定的)

Canada<,>/ˈkænədə/<,>/ˈkænədə/<,>n.加拿大<,>I visited Canada last summer.<,>我去年夏天去了加拿大。<,>Canada is known for its beautiful landscapes.<,>加拿大以其美丽的风景而闻名。<,>She moved to Canada for work.<,>她为了工作搬到了加拿大。<,>Can(能)+ada(联想：Ada)→加拿大<,>Canada(加拿大)/banana(香蕉)/camera(相机)

propose<,>/prəˈpəʊz/<,>/prəˈpoʊz/<,>v.提议/v.求婚<,>He proposed a new plan at the meeting.<,>他在会议上提出了一个新计划。<,>He proposed to her on Valentine's Day.<,>他在情人节向她求婚。<,>She proposed that we leave early.<,>她提议我们早点离开。<,>pro(向前)+pose(放置)→向前放置→提议<,>propose(提议)/oppose(反对)/suppose(假设)

recorder<,>/rɪˈkɔːdə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkɔːrdər/<,>n.录音机/n.记录者<,>She used a recorder to capture the interview.<,>她用录音机录下了采访。<,>He is the official recorder of the meeting.<,>他是会议的官方记录者。<,>The recorder is a simple musical instrument.<,>录音机是一种简单的乐器。<,>re(重新)+cord(心)+er(人)→记录者<,>recorder(录音机)/record(记录)/reorder(重新排序)

economy<,>/ɪˈkɒnəmi/<,>/ɪˈkɑːnəmi/<,>n.经济/n.节约/n.节省<,>The country's economy is growing rapidly.<,>该国的经济正在快速增长。<,>We need to practice economy in our daily life.<,>我们需要在日常生活中节约。<,>Flying economy class is cheaper.<,>坐经济舱更便宜。<,>eco(家)+nomy(管理)→家庭管理→经济<,>economy(经济)/ecology(生态)/economist(经济学家)

sensible<,>/ˈsensəbl/<,>/ˈsensəbl/<,>adj.明智的/adj.感觉得到的<,>It's sensible to save money for the future.<,>为未来存钱是明智的。<,>She made a sensible decision.<,>她做了一个明智的决定。<,>There was a sensible drop in temperature.<,>温度明显下降了。<,>sense(感觉)+ible(可…的)→可感觉到的<,>sensible(明智的)/sensitive(敏感的)/sensory(感觉的)
among<,>/əˈmʌŋ/<,>/əˈmʌŋ/<,>prep.在…之中<,>She was standing among a crowd of people.<,>她站在人群中。<,>The book is popular among teenagers.<,>这本书在青少年中很受欢迎。<,>He found his keys among the papers on his desk.<,>他在桌上的文件中找到了钥匙。<,>a(在)+mong(群众)→在群众中→在…之中<,>between(prep. 在两者之间)/amid(prep. 在…中间)  

discussion<,>/dɪˈskʌʃn/<,>/dɪˈskʌʃən/<,>n.讨论/n.谈论/n.论述<,>We had a long discussion about the project.<,>我们就这个项目进行了长时间的讨论。<,>The discussion focused on environmental issues.<,>讨论集中在环境问题上。<,>His article sparked a heated discussion.<,>他的文章引发了一场激烈的讨论。<,>dis(分开)+cuss(敲打)+ion→分开敲打→讨论<,>argument(n. 争论)/debate(n. 辩论)/conversation(n. 交谈)  

republic<,>/rɪˈpʌblɪk/<,>/rɪˈpʌblɪk/<,>n.共和国/n.共和政体<,>France is a republic with a president as head of state.<,>法国是一个以总统为国家元首的共和国。<,>The Roman Republic lasted for nearly 500 years.<,>罗马共和国持续了近500年。<,>Many countries became republics after gaining independence.<,>许多国家在独立后成为共和国。<,>re(公共)+public(人民)→人民公共的国家→共和国<,>democracy(n. 民主国家)/monarchy(n. 君主国)/federation(n. 联邦)  

yawn<,>/jɔːn/<,>/jɔn/<,>v.打呵欠/n.呵欠<,>He tried to hide his yawn during the meeting.<,>他试图在会议中隐藏他的呵欠。<,>The baby yawned and fell asleep.<,>婴儿打了个呵欠然后睡着了。<,>A yawn is often contagious.<,>打呵欠常常会传染。<,>谐音"哟嗯"→打呵欠时的声音<,>yawn(v.打呵欠)/yarn(n. 纱线)/yearn(v. 渴望)  

lawn<,>/lɔːn/<,>/lɔn/<,>n.草地/n.草坪/n.草场<,>Children were playing on the lawn.<,>孩子们在草坪上玩耍。<,>He mows the lawn every Saturday.<,>他每周六修剪草坪。<,>The house has a beautiful front lawn.<,>这房子前面有一片漂亮的草坪。<,>law(法律)+n→法律般整齐的草地→草坪<,>lawn(n.草坪)/meadow(n. 草地)/grassland(n. 草原)  

gas<,>/ɡæs/<,>/ɡæs/<,>n.气体/n.煤气/n.汽油<,>Oxygen is a colorless gas.<,>氧气是一种无色气体。<,>Our stove runs on natural gas.<,>我们的炉子使用天然气。<,>I need to stop for gas.<,>我需要停下来加油。<,>谐音"盖斯"→气体盖住四周<,>gas(n.气体)/gasp(v. 喘息)/gash(n. 深伤口)  

distant<,>/ˈdɪstənt/<,>/ˈdɪstənt/<,>adj.在远处的/adj.疏远的<,>We could see distant mountains.<,>我们可以看到远处的山脉。<,>She has been distant lately.<,>她最近很疏远。<,>The sound of distant thunder could be heard.<,>可以听到远处的雷声。<,>dis(分开)+stant(站)→分开站着→远处的<,>distant(adj.远处的)/distance(n. 距离)/instant(adj. 立即的)  

ability<,>/əˈbɪləti/<,>/əˈbɪləti/<,>n.能力/n.能耐/n.本领<,>She has the ability to solve complex problems.<,>她有解决复杂问题的能力。<,>His musical ability is impressive.<,>他的音乐才能令人印象深刻。<,>The test measures reading ability.<,>这个测试衡量阅读能力。<,>able(能够的)+ity(名词后缀)→能力<,>ability(n.能力)/capability(n. 才能)/capacity(n. 容量)  

instinct<,>/ˈɪnstɪŋkt/<,>/ˈɪnstɪŋkt/<,>n.本能/n.直觉/n.生性<,>Birds migrate by instinct.<,>鸟类靠本能迁徙。<,>Her instinct told her something was wrong.<,>她的直觉告诉她出问题了。<,>He has an instinct for business.<,>他有做生意的天分。<,>in(内)+stinct(刺)→内心被刺中的感觉→本能<,>instinct(n.本能)/intuition(n. 直觉)/impulse(n. 冲动)  

approval<,>/əˈpruːvl/<,>/əˈpruvəl/<,>n.批准/n.赞成/n.同意<,>The plan needs official approval.<,>这个计划需要官方批准。<,>She nodded in approval.<,>她点头表示同意。<,>The new policy met with public approval.<,>新政策获得了公众的赞同。<,>ap(向)+prov(证明)+al→向...证明→批准<,>approval(n.批准)/disapproval(n. 不赞成)/prove(v. 证明)
await<,>/əˈweɪt/<,>/əˈweɪt/<,>v.等候/v.期待<,>We await your reply with great interest.<,>我们非常期待您的回复。<,>The team is eagerly awaiting the results of the competition.<,>团队正热切等待比赛结果。<,>She sat quietly, awaiting her turn.<,>她静静地坐着，等待轮到她。<,>a(加强)+wait(等待)→强调等待→等候<,>wait(v.等待)/award(n.奖品/v.授予)/awake(adj.醒着的/v.唤醒)  

lemon<,>/ˈlemən/<,>/ˈlɛmən/<,>n.柠檬/n.柠檬树<,>She added a slice of lemon to her tea.<,>她在茶里加了一片柠檬。<,>The lemon tree in our garden bears fruit every year.<,>我们花园里的柠檬树每年都结果。<,>This dish needs a bit of lemon juice to enhance the flavor.<,>这道菜需要加点柠檬汁提味。<,>lem(光)+on(名词后缀)→柠檬黄的颜色像光一样明亮<,>melon(n.甜瓜)/demon(n.恶魔)/cement(n.水泥/v.巩固)  

triangle<,>/ˈtraɪæŋɡl/<,>/ˈtraɪˌæŋɡəl/<,>n.三角（形）<,>The teacher drew a triangle on the blackboard.<,>老师在黑板上画了一个三角形。<,>A love triangle often complicates relationships.<,>三角恋通常使关系复杂化。<,>The Bermuda Triangle is famous for mysterious disappearances.<,>百慕大三角以神秘失踪事件闻名。<,>tri(三)+angle(角)→三角形<,>rectangle(n.长方形)/tangle(v.缠结/n.混乱)/strangle(v.扼杀)  

advise<,>/ədˈvaɪz/<,>/ædˈvaɪz/<,>v.劝告/v.建议/v.通知<,>I would advise you to arrive early for the interview.<,>我建议你面试早点到。<,>The doctor advised him to quit smoking.<,>医生劝他戒烟。<,>Please advise us of any changes in your schedule.<,>如有日程变动请通知我们。<,>ad(向)+vis(看)+e→向别人提出看法→建议<,>advice(n.建议)/revise(v.修订)/devise(v.设计)  

bank<,>/bæŋk/<,>/bæŋk/<,>n.银行/n.库/n.沿,堤<,>I need to deposit this check at the bank.<,>我需要去银行存这张支票。<,>The blood bank is running low on supplies.<,>血库的储备不足了。<,>We had a picnic on the river bank.<,>我们在河堤上野餐。<,>ban(禁止)+k(形似金库)→银行金库禁止随意进入<,>blank(adj.空白的/n.空白)/bunk(n.铺位)/tank(n.坦克/n.水箱)  

measurement<,>/ˈmeʒəmənt/<,>/ˈmɛʒərmənt/<,>n.尺寸/n.衡量/n.测量<,>The tailor took my measurements for a new suit.<,>裁缝给我量尺寸做新西装。<,>Accurate measurement is crucial in scientific experiments.<,>精确测量在科学实验中至关重要。<,>The measurement of the room is 20 square meters.<,>这个房间的面积是20平方米。<,>measure(测量)+ment(名词后缀)→测量结果<,>treasure(n.财富/v.珍视)/pleasure(n.愉快)/mensuration(n.测量法)  

help<,>/help/<,>/hɛlp/<,>v.帮助/v.援助/n.帮手<,>Can you help me carry these boxes?<,>你能帮我搬这些箱子吗？<,>Financial help was provided to the flood victims.<,>向洪水灾民提供了经济援助。<,>She's been a great help in organizing the event.<,>她在活动组织中帮了大忙。<,>h(形似举手)+elp(看作"协助")→举手协助→帮助<,>yelp(v.吠叫/n.尖叫)/kelp(n.海藻)/whelp(n.幼兽)  

justice<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>n.司法/n.正义/n.公正<,>The judge is a symbol of justice.<,>法官是正义的象征。<,>We must fight for social justice.<,>我们必须为社会公正而战。<,>The justice system needs reform.<,>司法体系需要改革。<,>just(公正的)+ice(名词后缀)→公正的状态<,>justify(v.证明合理)/adjust(v.调整)/injustice(n.不公正)  

remember<,>/rɪˈmembə(r)/<,>/rɪˈmɛmbər/<,>v.记得/v.想起/v.记住<,>I can't remember where I put my keys.<,>我想不起把钥匙放哪了。<,>She remembers meeting him at a conference.<,>她记得在会议上见过他。<,>Remember to turn off the lights before leaving.<,>记得离开前关灯。<,>re(重新)+member(成员)→重新成为记忆中的一员→记得<,>dismember(v.肢解)/member(n.成员)/November(n.十一月)  

widow<,>/ˈwɪdəʊ/<,>/ˈwɪdoʊ/<,>n.寡妇<,>The young widow wore black for a year.<,>这位年轻的寡妇穿了一年的黑衣。<,>She became a widow at the age of 35.<,>她35岁就成了寡妇。<,>The foundation provides support for war widows.<,>该基金会为战争遗孀提供支持。<,>wid(分开)+ow(表示人)→与丈夫分开的人→寡妇<,>window(n.窗户)/widower(n.鳏夫)/meadow(n.草地)
telescope<,>/ˈtelɪskəʊp/<,>/ˈtelɪskoʊp/<,>n.望远镜<,>He looked at the stars through his telescope.<,>他用望远镜观察星星。<,>The telescope allows us to see distant galaxies.<,>望远镜让我们能看到遥远的星系。<,>She bought a new telescope for stargazing.<,>她买了一个新的望远镜来观星。<,>tele(远)+scope(看)→看远处的东西→望远镜<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/periscope(n.潜望镜)/stethoscope(n.听诊器)

even<,>/ˈiːvn/<,>/ˈiːvən/<,>adv.甚至/adv.甚至更/adv.还<,>Even a child can understand this.<,>甚至连小孩都能理解这个。<,>It's even colder today than yesterday.<,>今天比昨天还要冷。<,>Do you even know what you're saying?<,>你知不知道自己在说什么？<,>eve(前夕)+n→甚至在前夕都→甚至<,>ever(adv.曾经)/event(n.事件)/evening(n.傍晚)

booth<,>/buːθ/<,>/buːθ/<,>n.公用电话亭/n.货摊<,>He made a call from the phone booth.<,>他从电话亭打了个电话。<,>She set up a booth at the fair.<,>她在集市上摆了个货摊。<,>The voting booth was private.<,>投票亭是私密的。<,>boo(拟声词)+th→电话亭的拟声记忆<,>tooth(n.牙齿)/boot(n.靴子)/boost(v.促进)

final<,>/ˈfaɪnl/<,>/ˈfaɪnəl/<,>adj.最后的/adj.决定性的<,>This is your final chance.<,>这是你最后的机会。<,>The judge's decision is final.<,>法官的判决是决定性的。<,>We're in the final stages of the project.<,>我们正处于项目的最后阶段。<,>fin(结束)+al→最后的<,>fine(adj.好的)/finance(n.财政)/finale(n.终曲)

receiver<,>/rɪˈsiːvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈsiːvər/<,>n.收受者/n.收件人<,>The receiver of the award was very grateful.<,>奖项的获得者非常感激。<,>Please write the receiver's name clearly.<,>请清楚地写上收件人的名字。<,>The phone's receiver was broken.<,>电话的听筒坏了。<,>re(再)+ceive(拿)+er→再次拿东西的人→接收者<,>deceiver(n.骗子)/perceiver(n.感知者)/conceiver(n.构想者)

drought<,>/draʊt/<,>/draʊt/<,>n.旱灾/n.干旱<,>The crops died during the long drought.<,>庄稼在长期的干旱中枯死了。<,>California often suffers from drought.<,>加利福尼亚经常遭受干旱。<,>Water conservation is important in times of drought.<,>干旱时期节约用水很重要。<,>dr(干)+ought(应该)→应该干的→干旱<,>draught(n.通风)/doubt(n.怀疑)/brought(v.带来)

tin<,>/tɪn/<,>/tɪn/<,>n.锡/n.罐头<,>The box is made of tin.<,>这个盒子是锡制的。<,>She opened a tin of beans.<,>她开了一罐豆子。<,>Tin is a soft metal.<,>锡是一种软金属。<,>t(形似罐头)+in(里面)→罐头里面有东西<,>tan(n.棕褐色)/ten(num.十)/tint(n.色调)

left<,>/left/<,>/left/<,>adj.左边的<,>Turn left at the traffic light.<,>在红绿灯处左转。<,>Her left hand was injured.<,>她的左手受伤了。<,>The book is on the left shelf.<,>书在左边的架子上。<,>le(了)+ft(福特)→了福特在左边<,>lift(v.举起)/loft(n.阁楼)/leaf(n.叶子)

resign<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>/rɪˈzaɪn/<,>v.放弃<,>He resigned from his position as manager.<,>他辞去了经理的职位。<,>She resigned herself to her fate.<,>她听天由命了。<,>The CEO resigned unexpectedly.<,>CEO意外辞职了。<,>re(再)+sign(签字)→再次签字表示放弃<,>design(v.设计)/assign(v.分配)/re-sign(v.重新签约)

farm<,>/fɑːm/<,>/fɑːrm/<,>n.农场/n.农庄/n.饲养场<,>They grow corn on their farm.<,>他们在农场种植玉米。<,>We visited a dairy farm yesterday.<,>昨天我们参观了一个奶牛场。<,>The farm has been in the family for generations.<,>这个农场在这个家族中传了好几代。<,>far(远)+m(亩)→远处的亩地→农场<,>firm(adj.坚固的)/form(n.形式)/fame(n.名声)
miner<,>/ˈmaɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪnər/<,>n.矿工<,>The miner works deep underground every day.<,>矿工每天在地下深处工作。<,>His father was a coal miner for thirty years.<,>他父亲当了三十年的煤矿工人。<,>Miners often face dangerous working conditions.<,>矿工经常面临危险的工作环境。<,>mine(矿)+er(人)→采矿的人→矿工<,>minor(adj.较小的/n.未成年人)/mineral(n.矿物)

prosperity<,>/prɒˈsperəti/<,>/prɑːˈsperəti/<,>n.繁荣/昌盛/兴旺<,>The country enjoyed a period of great prosperity.<,>这个国家经历了一段繁荣昌盛的时期。<,>Economic prosperity benefits all citizens.<,>经济繁荣惠及所有公民。<,>Their business has grown into prosperity.<,>他们的生意已经发展得兴旺发达。<,>pro(向前)+sper(希望)+ity(名词后缀)→向前有希望→繁荣<,>posterity(n.后代)/property(n.财产)

Britain<,>/ˈbrɪtən/<,>/ˈbrɪtn/<,>n.不列颠/英国<,>Britain is an island country in Europe.<,>不列颠是欧洲的一个岛国。<,>The weather in Britain is often rainy.<,>英国的天气经常下雨。<,>She moved to Britain five years ago.<,>她五年前搬到了英国。<,>Great Britain(大不列颠)的简称<,>British(adj.英国的)/Briton(n.英国人)

mix<,>/mɪks/<,>/mɪks/<,>v.使混合/混淆<,>Mix the flour and eggs together.<,>把面粉和鸡蛋混合在一起。<,>Don't mix business with pleasure.<,>不要把工作和娱乐混为一谈。<,>Oil and water don't mix.<,>油和水不相溶。<,>谐音"米克斯"→把米和克斯(其他东西)混合<,>fix(v.固定)/max(n.最大值)

average<,>/ˈævərɪdʒ/<,>/ˈævərɪdʒ/<,>n.平均数/adj.平均的<,>The average temperature in July is 30°C.<,>七月的平均气温是30摄氏度。<,>His grades are above average.<,>他的成绩高于平均水平。<,>On average, I read two books a month.<,>我平均每月读两本书。<,>a+ver(真实)+age→一个真实的数字→平均数<,>everage(n.饮料)/aver(v.断言)

pinch<,>/pɪntʃ/<,>/pɪntʃ/<,>v.捏/拧/掐掉<,>She pinched her brother's arm playfully.<,>她开玩笑地捏了捏弟弟的手臂。<,>He pinched off the dead flowers.<,>他掐掉了凋谢的花朵。<,>These shoes pinch my toes.<,>这双鞋夹我的脚趾。<,>谐音"拼吃"→拼命吃(捏)东西<,>punch(v.打孔)/pitch(n.球场/v.投掷)

whip<,>/wɪp/<,>/wɪp/<,>v.鞭笞/搅打/n.鞭子<,>He whipped the cream until it was stiff.<,>他把奶油搅打至浓稠。<,>The rider cracked his whip.<,>骑手甩响了鞭子。<,>The wind whipped around the corners of the building.<,>风在建筑物的角落呼啸。<,>wh(风的声音)+ip→像风一样抽打→鞭子<,>whim(n.奇想)/whisper(v.耳语)

fond<,>/fɒnd/<,>/fɑːnd/<,>adj.喜爱的/溺爱的<,>She is fond of classical music.<,>她喜欢古典音乐。<,>His fond parents spoiled him.<,>他溺爱的父母宠坏了他。<,>I have fond memories of my childhood.<,>我对童年有着美好的回忆。<,>谐音"芳的"→芬芳的东西让人喜爱<,>found(v.建立)/bond(n.纽带)

expression<,>/ɪkˈspreʃn/<,>/ɪkˈspreʃn/<,>n.词句/表达/表情<,>Her facial expression showed surprise.<,>她的面部表情显示出惊讶。<,>This is a common English expression.<,>这是一个常见的英语表达。<,>Freedom of expression is important.<,>言论自由很重要。<,>ex(出)+press(压)+ion→把想法压出来→表达<,>impression(n.印象)/oppression(n.压迫)

agriculture<,>/ˈæɡrɪkʌltʃə(r)/<,>/ˈæɡrɪkʌltʃər/<,>n.农业/n.农艺/n.农学<,>Agriculture is the backbone of many developing countries.<,>农业是许多发展中国家的支柱。<,>He studied agriculture at university.<,>他在大学学习农学。<,>Modern agriculture relies heavily on technology.<,>现代农业高度依赖技术。<,>agri(田地)+culture(耕作)→农业<,>horticulture(n.园艺)/aquaculture(n.水产养殖)

anyhow<,>/ˈenihaʊ/<,>/ˈenihaʊ/<,>adv.无论如何<,>Anyhow, let's finish this project today.<,>无论如何，我们今天要完成这个项目。<,>I don't know the answer, but I'll try anyhow.<,>我不知道答案，但无论如何我会试试。<,>Anyhow, it's too late to change now.<,>无论如何，现在改变已经太迟了。<,>any(任何)+how(方式)→无论如何<,>anyway(adv.无论如何)/somehow(adv.以某种方式)

transistor<,>/trænˈzɪstə(r)/<,>/trænˈzɪstər/<,>n.晶体管<,>The invention of the transistor revolutionized electronics.<,>晶体管的发明彻底改变了电子行业。<,>This radio uses old-style transistors.<,>这台收音机使用老式晶体管。<,>Transistors are essential components in modern computers.<,>晶体管是现代计算机的基本组件。<,>trans(跨越)+istor(电阻器)→晶体管<,>resistor(n.电阻器)/capacitor(n.电容器)

house<,>/haʊs/<,>/haʊs/<,>n.房屋/n.住宅/n.商号<,>They bought a new house in the suburbs.<,>他们在郊区买了新房子。<,>The publishing house released several new books.<,>这家出版社发行了几本新书。<,>Our house is near the train station.<,>我们家靠近火车站。<,>house(房屋)→与"horse(马)"区分<,>home(n.家)/building(n.建筑物)

knob<,>/nɒb/<,>/nɑːb/<,>n.门把/n.拉手/n.旋钮<,>Turn the knob to adjust the volume.<,>转动旋钮调节音量。<,>The door knob was cold to the touch.<,>门把手摸起来很凉。<,>He polished the brass knobs on the cabinet.<,>他擦亮了柜子上的铜把手。<,>knob(旋钮)→与"knob(小块)"同形异义<,>handle(n.把手)/button(n.按钮)

religion<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒən/<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒən/<,>n.宗教信仰/n.宗教<,>Freedom of religion is a basic human right.<,>宗教信仰自由是基本人权。<,>She studies comparative religion at college.<,>她在大学学习比较宗教学。<,>Buddhism is one of the world's major religions.<,>佛教是世界主要宗教之一。<,>re(再)+lig(捆绑)+ion→宗教<,>belief(n.信仰)/faith(n.信念)

factor<,>/ˈfæktə(r)/<,>/ˈfæktər/<,>n.因素/n.系数/n.因子<,>Time was a crucial factor in the experiment.<,>时间是实验中的关键因素。<,>The growth factor was calculated carefully.<,>增长系数被仔细计算过。<,>Several factors contributed to the accident.<,>多个因素导致了这次事故。<,>fact(做)+or→起作用的因素<,>element(n.元素)/component(n.组件)

inexpensive<,>/ˌɪnɪkˈspensɪv/<,>/ˌɪnɪkˈspensɪv/<,>adj.花费不多的/adj.廉价的<,>This restaurant serves good, inexpensive meals.<,>这家餐厅提供物美价廉的餐食。<,>We found an inexpensive hotel near the beach.<,>我们在海滩附近找到了一家便宜的酒店。<,>Inexpensive doesn't always mean low quality.<,>便宜不一定意味着质量差。<,>in(不)+expensive(昂贵的)→不贵的<,>cheap(adj.便宜的)/affordable(adj.负担得起的)

finish<,>/ˈfɪnɪʃ/<,>/ˈfɪnɪʃ/<,>v.完成/v.结束/n.结尾<,>Please finish your homework before dinner.<,>请在晚饭前完成作业。<,>The race had a dramatic finish.<,>比赛有个戏剧性的结尾。<,>Let's finish this project by Friday.<,>我们周五前完成这个项目吧。<,>fin(结束)+ish→完成<,>complete(v.完成)/end(v.结束)

phenomenon<,>/fəˈnɒmɪnən/<,>/fəˈnɑːmɪnən/<,>n.现象<,>The Northern Lights are a natural phenomenon.<,>北极光是一种自然现象。<,>This social phenomenon deserves study.<,>这种社会现象值得研究。<,>Global warming is a worrying phenomenon.<,>全球变暖是个令人担忧的现象。<,>pheno(显现)+menon→显现出来的现象<,>event(n.事件)/occurrence(n.发生)
allow<,>/əˈlaʊ/<,>/əˈlaʊ/<,>v.允许/v.准许/v.任<,>My parents don't allow me to stay out late.<,>我父母不允许我在外面待到很晚。<,>The teacher allowed extra time for the test.<,>老师允许延长考试时间。<,>This ticket allows two people to enter.<,>这张票允许两个人进入。<,>al(向)+low(低)→降低标准→允许<,>alloy(n.合金)/arrow(n.箭)/aloft(adv.在空中)

keen<,>/kiːn/<,>/kin/<,>adj.热心的/adj.激烈的<,>She's very keen on learning French.<,>她对学习法语非常热心。<,>There was keen competition for the job.<,>这份工作的竞争很激烈。<,>He has a keen interest in photography.<,>他对摄影有浓厚的兴趣。<,>keep(保持)+n→保持热情→热心的<,>kin(n.亲属)/keel(n.龙骨)/ken(n.视野范围)
