cave<,>/keɪv/<,>/keɪv/<,>n.山洞/n.洞穴/n.窑洞<,>The explorers discovered a hidden cave in the mountains.<,>探险家们在山里发现了一个隐蔽的山洞。<,>Bats often live in dark caves.<,>蝙蝠通常生活在黑暗的洞穴中。<,>The ancient people used caves as shelters.<,>古人用窑洞作为住所。<,>cave(空)→中空的→洞穴<,>carve(v.雕刻)/cavern(n.大洞穴)/pave(v.铺设)

banana<,>/bəˈnɑːnə/<,>/bəˈnænə/<,>n.香蕉/n.芭蕉属植物<,>She peeled the banana and ate it quickly.<,>她剥开香蕉很快吃掉了。<,>Banana trees grow well in tropical climates.<,>芭蕉属植物在热带气候中生长良好。<,>Would you like a banana for dessert?<,>你想要一根香蕉当甜点吗？<,>ba(爸)+nana(奶奶)→爸爸和奶奶都爱吃香蕉<,>bandana(n.头巾)/panama(n.巴拿马草帽)/banal(adj.平庸的)

unknown<,>/ʌnˈnəʊn/<,>/ʌnˈnoʊn/<,>adj.不知道的/adj.未知的<,>The cause of the accident is still unknown.<,>事故原因仍然未知。<,>He received a letter from an unknown sender.<,>他收到一封来自未知发件人的信。<,>Many unknown species live in the deep ocean.<,>许多未知物种生活在深海。<,>un(不)+known(知道)→不知道的<,>unknowing(adj.不知情的)/unbeknown(adj.不为所知的)/knowable(adj.可知的)

despite<,>/dɪˈspaɪt/<,>/dɪˈspaɪt/<,>prep.尽管/prep.虽然/prep.任凭<,>Despite the rain, we went for a walk.<,>尽管下雨，我们还是去散步了。<,>She smiled despite her sadness.<,>尽管悲伤，她还是笑了。<,>Despite all warnings, he continued the dangerous journey.<,>任凭所有警告，他继续这危险的旅程。<,>de(向下)+spite(看)→向下看(不顾)→尽管<,>despise(v.鄙视)/spite(n.恶意)/respite(n.暂缓)

transportation<,>/ˌtrænspɔːˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌtrænspərˈteɪʃən/<,>n.运输/n.运送/n.客运<,>Public transportation is convenient in this city.<,>这个城市的公共交通很方便。<,>The transportation of goods by sea takes longer.<,>海运货物需要更长时间。<,>He works in the transportation department.<,>他在运输部门工作。<,>trans(跨越)+port(运)+ation→运输<,>transport(v.运输)/import(n.进口)/export(n.出口)

collar<,>/ˈkɒlə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːlər/<,>n.衣领/n.项圈<,>He straightened his collar before the interview.<,>面试前他整理了一下衣领。<,>The dog's collar has its name on it.<,>狗的项圈上有它的名字。<,>She grabbed him by the collar angrily.<,>她生气地抓住他的衣领。<,>coll(脖子)+ar→脖子上的东西→衣领/项圈<,>dollar(n.美元)/cellar(n.地窖)/color(n.颜色)

lean<,>/liːn/<,>/liːn/<,>v.倾斜/v.屈身/v.靠<,>The tower leans slightly to one side.<,>塔微微向一侧倾斜。<,>She leaned forward to hear better.<,>她屈身向前以便听得更清楚。<,>He leaned against the wall, exhausted.<,>他筋疲力尽地靠在墙上。<,>lean(瘦)→瘦的人容易倾斜<,>learn(v.学习)/loan(n.贷款)/clean(adj.干净的)

undergraduate<,>/ˌʌndəˈɡrædʒuət/<,>/ˌʌndərˈɡrædʒuət/<,>n.大学在校生<,>As an undergraduate, she studied biology.<,>作为大学在校生时，她学习生物学。<,>The undergraduate program lasts four years.<,>本科课程持续四年。<,>Many undergraduates live on campus.<,>许多大学在校生住在校园里。<,>under(在...下)+graduate(毕业生)→尚未毕业的学生<,>graduate(n.毕业生)/postgraduate(n.研究生)/underground(adj.地下的)

material<,>/məˈtɪəriəl/<,>/məˈtɪriəl/<,>n.材料/n.素材/adj.物质的<,>We need more building materials.<,>我们需要更多的建筑材料。<,>She collected material for her new book.<,>她为新书收集素材。<,>Material wealth doesn't always bring happiness.<,>物质财富并不总能带来幸福。<,>mater(母亲)+ial→母亲是生命的原材料<,>immaterial(adj.非物质的)/materialize(v.实现)/maternal(adj.母亲的)
neutral<,>/ˈnjuːtrəl/<,>/ˈnuːtrəl/<,>adj.中立的/adj.中性的<,>She remained neutral during the argument.<,>她在争论中保持中立。<,>The solution is chemically neutral.<,>这种溶液是化学中性的。<,>He adopted a neutral stance on the issue.<,>他对这个问题采取了中立立场。<,>neutr(中)+al(形容词后缀)→中立的<,>natural(adj.自然的)/neutralize(v.使中立化)

male<,>/meɪl/<,>/meɪl/<,>adj.男的/adj.雄的/n.男子<,>The male lion has a large mane.<,>雄狮有浓密的鬃毛。<,>This is a male-only club.<,>这是一个男性专属俱乐部。<,>He is a tall, dark-haired male.<,>他是个高个子、黑头发的男子。<,>mal(坏)+e→与女性相对→男性<,>female(adj.女性的/n.女性)/mail(n.邮件)

circle<,>/ˈsɜːkl/<,>/ˈsɜːrkl/<,>n.圆/n.圆周/n.圈子<,>Draw a perfect circle on the paper.<,>在纸上画一个完美的圆。<,>She moves in artistic circles.<,>她在艺术圈活动。<,>The children sat in a circle.<,>孩子们围坐成一圈。<,>circ(环)+le(小)→小环→圆圈<,>circus(n.马戏团)/cycle(n.循环)

thickness<,>/ˈθɪknəs/<,>/ˈθɪknəs/<,>n.厚度/n.密度<,>The thickness of the glass is 5mm.<,>玻璃的厚度是5毫米。<,>The thickness of the forest made it hard to walk through.<,>森林的密度使得难以穿行。<,>Check the thickness of the sauce before serving.<,>上菜前检查酱汁的浓稠度。<,>thick(厚的)+ness(名词后缀)→厚度<,>sickness(n.疾病)/weakness(n.弱点)

news<,>/njuːz/<,>/nuːz/<,>n.新闻/n.消息<,>I heard the good news this morning.<,>我今天早上听到了这个好消息。<,>The news spread quickly through the town.<,>消息在镇上迅速传开。<,>She works as a news reporter.<,>她是一名新闻记者。<,>new(新的)+s→新的事物→新闻<,>newspaper(n.报纸)/renew(v.更新)

wicked<,>/ˈwɪkɪd/<,>/ˈwɪkɪd/<,>adj.坏的/adj.令人厌恶的<,>That was a wicked thing to do.<,>那样做太恶劣了。<,>She gave me a wicked smile.<,>她给了我一个邪恶的微笑。<,>The witch in the story is very wicked.<,>故事里的女巫非常邪恶。<,>wick(灯芯)+ed→像燃烧的灯芯→邪恶的<,>wicker(n.柳条)/quick(adj.快的)

suspicious<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>/səˈspɪʃəs/<,>adj.怀疑的/adj.可疑的<,>The police found his behavior suspicious.<,>警方觉得他的行为可疑。<,>I'm suspicious of his motives.<,>我怀疑他的动机。<,>There was a suspicious package at the station.<,>车站有个可疑包裹。<,>sus(在...下)+pic(看)+ious→在下面看→怀疑的<,>suspicion(n.怀疑)/superstitious(adj.迷信的)

shoot<,>/ʃuːt/<,>/ʃuːt/<,>v.发射/v.射中/n.芽<,>He shot an arrow at the target.<,>他向靶子射了一箭。<,>New shoots appeared in spring.<,>春天出现了新芽。<,>Don't shoot! I surrender!<,>别开枪！我投降！<,>sh(嘘声)+oot(像子弹声)→射击声→发射<,>shot(n.射击)/shoe(n.鞋子)

publication<,>/ˌpʌblɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌpʌblɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.出版/n.出版物/n.公布<,>The publication date is next month.<,>出版日期是下个月。<,>This is an academic publication.<,>这是一份学术出版物。<,>The publication of the results was delayed.<,>结果的公布被推迟了。<,>public(公共的)+ation(名词后缀)→向公众发布→出版<,>publicity(n.宣传)/population(n.人口)

possibility<,>/ˌpɒsəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌpɑːsəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可能/n.可能的事<,>There's a possibility of rain tomorrow.<,>明天有可能下雨。<,>We need to consider all possibilities.<,>我们需要考虑所有可能性。<,>Is there any possibility of getting a refund?<,>有可能退款吗？<,>possible(可能的)+ity(名词后缀)→可能性<,>probability(n.概率)/capability(n.能力)
lie<,>/laɪ/<,>/laɪ/<,>v.躺/v.平放/v.位于<,>She lies on the sofa reading a book.<,>她躺在沙发上看书。<,>The book lies open on the table.<,>书摊开放在桌子上。<,>The town lies to the north of the river.<,>这个小镇位于河的北边。<,>lie(躺)与die(死)押韵<,>lay(v.放置)/lied(v.撒谎)/lain(v.躺的过去分词)

quarrel<,>/ˈkwɒrəl/<,>/ˈkwɔːrəl/<,>n.争吵/n.吵架/n.口角<,>They had a quarrel about money.<,>他们因为钱吵了一架。<,>It's not worth quarrelling over such small things.<,>为这种小事争吵不值得。<,>The quarrel between the neighbors lasted for hours.<,>邻居之间的争吵持续了好几个小时。<,>quar(抱怨)+rel→争吵<,>squabble(n.小争吵)/wrangle(n.争论)/bicker(v.斗嘴)

here<,>/hɪə(r)/<,>/hɪr/<,>adv.这里/adv.向这里<,>Come here and look at this.<,>过来看看这个。<,>Here is your coffee.<,>这是你的咖啡。<,>I've lived here for five years.<,>我在这里住了五年了。<,>here(这里)与there(那里)对应<,>hear(v.听)/hare(n.野兔)/hero(n.英雄)

scrape<,>/skreɪp/<,>/skreɪp/<,>v.刮/v.擦/n.刮伤/n.擦痕<,>He scraped the mud off his shoes.<,>他刮掉了鞋上的泥。<,>I got a scrape on my knee when I fell.<,>我摔倒时膝盖擦伤了。<,>The car scraped against the wall.<,>汽车擦到了墙上。<,>scrap(碎片)+e→刮擦产生碎片<,>scratch(v.抓/n.抓痕)/scrap(n.碎片/v.废弃)/scalp(n.头皮)

example<,>/ɪɡˈzɑːmpl/<,>/ɪɡˈzæmpl/<,>n.例子/n.实例/n.模范<,>Can you give me an example?<,>你能给我举个例子吗？<,>She sets a good example for her children.<,>她为孩子们树立了好榜样。<,>This is a classic example of Gothic architecture.<,>这是哥特式建筑的典型例子。<,>ex(出)+ample(拿)→拿出来做例子<,>sample(n.样品)/exemplar(n.典范)/exemplify(v.例证)

Bible<,>/ˈbaɪbl/<,>/ˈbaɪbəl/<,>n.基督教《圣经》<,>He reads the Bible every morning.<,>他每天早上都读《圣经》。<,>The Bible is divided into the Old and New Testaments.<,>《圣经》分为《旧约》和《新约》。<,>Many English idioms come from the Bible.<,>许多英语习语来自《圣经》。<,>Bible(圣经)与biblio(书的词根)相关<,>biblical(adj.圣经的)/bibliography(n.参考文献)/bibliophile(n.爱书者)

stability<,>/stəˈbɪləti/<,>/stəˈbɪləti/<,>n.稳定/n.稳定性<,>Political stability is important for economic growth.<,>政治稳定对经济增长很重要。<,>This chair lacks stability.<,>这把椅子不够稳固。<,>Emotional stability is key to mental health.<,>情绪稳定是心理健康的关键。<,>st(站)+ability(能力)→站立的能力→稳定<,>instability(n.不稳定)/stabilize(v.使稳定)/staple(n.主食)

equip<,>/ɪˈkwɪp/<,>/ɪˈkwɪp/<,>v.装备/v.配备<,>The lab is equipped with modern instruments.<,>实验室配备了现代化仪器。<,>They equipped the soldiers with new weapons.<,>他们给士兵配备了新武器。<,>Education equips us for life.<,>教育为我们的人生做好准备。<,>e(出)+quip(船)→装备船只<,>equipment(n.设备)/adequate(adj.充足的)/quip(n.妙语)

forest<,>/ˈfɒrɪst/<,>/ˈfɔːrɪst/<,>n.森林/n.森林地带<,>We went for a walk in the forest.<,>我们去森林里散步了。<,>The forest covers thousands of acres.<,>这片森林占地数千英亩。<,>Many animals live in this forest.<,>许多动物生活在这片森林里。<,>for(外)+est→外面的树木→森林<,>forester(n.林务员)/forestry(n.林业)/forage(v.搜寻食物)

reasonable<,>/ˈriːznəbl/<,>/ˈriːznəbl/<,>adj.合情合理的/adj.公道的<,>That's a reasonable price.<,>这个价格很公道。<,>She gave a reasonable explanation.<,>她给出了合理的解释。<,>Be reasonable - you can't expect perfection.<,>讲点道理，你不能指望十全十美。<,>reason(理由)+able(能)→有理由的→合理的<,>unreasonable(adj.不合理的)/reasoning(n.推理)/seasonable(adj.合时宜的)
quit<,>/kwɪt/<,>/kwɪt/<,>v.离开/v.退出/v.停止<,>He decided to quit his job and travel the world.<,>他决定辞职去环游世界。<,>She quit smoking last year.<,>她去年戒烟了。<,>Press this button to quit the game.<,>按这个按钮退出游戏。<,>qui(安静)+t(后缀)→安静离开→退出<,>quite(adv. 相当)/quiet(adj.安静的)  

lower<,>/ˈləʊə(r)/<,>/ˈloʊər/<,>adj.较低的/v.放下<,>Please lower your voice in the library.<,>在图书馆请降低音量。<,>The company decided to lower the prices.<,>公司决定降价。<,>He lowered himself into the chair.<,>他缓缓坐进椅子。<,>low(低)+er(比较级)→更低的<,>flower(n.花)/glower(v.怒视)  

beneath<,>/bɪˈniːθ/<,>/bɪˈniθ/<,>prep.在...下方<,>The cat is sleeping beneath the table.<,>猫在桌子下面睡觉。<,>Her actions were beneath contempt.<,>她的行为令人不齿。<,>They found treasure buried beneath the old oak tree.<,>他们在老橡树下发现了埋藏的宝藏。<,>be(在)+neath(下方)→在下面<,>under(prep.在...下)/below(prep.在...下方)  

transform<,>/trænsˈfɔːm/<,>/trænsˈfɔːrm/<,>v.改变/v.改造/v.变换<,>The caterpillar transformed into a butterfly.<,>毛毛虫变成了蝴蝶。<,>They transformed the old factory into luxury apartments.<,>他们把旧工厂改造成了豪华公寓。<,>This experience transformed his life.<,>这次经历改变了他的人生。<,>trans(跨越)+form(形状)→改变形状<,>transfer(v.转移)/transport(v.运输)  

musician<,>/mjuˈzɪʃn/<,>/mjuˈzɪʃən/<,>n.音乐家/n.作曲家<,>Mozart was a brilliant musician.<,>莫扎特是位杰出的音乐家。<,>The musician played a beautiful melody on the violin.<,>音乐家用小提琴演奏了优美的旋律。<,>She aspires to be a professional musician.<,>她立志成为职业音乐家。<,>music(音乐)+ian(人)→音乐人<,>magician(n.魔术师)/physician(n.医生)  

attribute<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/əˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>v.把...归因于/n.属性<,>She attributes her success to hard work.<,>她把成功归因于努力工作。<,>Patience is an important attribute for a teacher.<,>耐心是教师的重要品质。<,>The painting is attributed to Van Gogh.<,>这幅画被认为是梵高的作品。<,>at(向)+tribute(给予)→把...归于<,>contribute(v.贡献)/distribute(v.分配)  

saddle<,>/ˈsædl/<,>/ˈsædl/<,>n.鞍子/n.马鞍<,>He adjusted the saddle before mounting the horse.<,>他上马前调整了马鞍。<,>The cowboy's saddle was decorated with silver.<,>牛仔的马鞍装饰着银饰。<,>She fell off when the saddle slipped.<,>马鞍滑脱时她摔了下来。<,>sad(坐)+dle(小物品)→坐具→马鞍<,>paddle(n.桨)/waddle(v.蹒跚而行)  

trunk<,>/trʌŋk/<,>/trʌŋk/<,>n.树干/n.大衣箱/n.皮箱<,>The elephant used its trunk to pick up food.<,>大象用鼻子捡食物。<,>We stored our winter clothes in the trunk.<,>我们把冬装存放在大衣箱里。<,>The tree's trunk was over two meters thick.<,>这棵树的树干有两米多粗。<,>truck(卡车)去掉c→像卡车一样能装东西的→大衣箱<,>drunk(adj.喝醉的)/truck(n.卡车)  

submit<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>/səbˈmɪt/<,>v.服从<,>You must submit your application by Friday.<,>你必须在周五前提交申请。<,>He refused to submit to their demands.<,>他拒绝服从他们的要求。<,>Please submit your report to the manager.<,>请把报告提交给经理。<,>sub(下)+mit(送)→从下送上→提交<,>permit(v.允许)/admit(v.承认)  

customer<,>/ˈkʌstəmə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌstəmər/<,>n.顾客/n.主顾<,>The customer is always right.<,>顾客永远是对的。<,>We have many regular customers at this café.<,>我们咖啡馆有很多常客。<,>She's our best customer, shopping here every week.<,>她是我们最好的顾客，每周都来这里购物。<,>custom(习惯)+er(人)→习惯来的人→顾客<,>consumer(n.消费者)/costume(n.戏服)
observation<,>/ˌɒbzəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːbzərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.注意/n.观察/n.观察力<,>Her powers of observation are remarkable.<,>她的观察力非常出色。<,>The scientist made a detailed observation of the experiment.<,>科学家对实验进行了详细的观察。<,>Observation is key to understanding nature.<,>观察是理解自然的关键。<,>ob(加强)+serv(保持)+ation→一直保持→观察<,>observance(n.遵守)/observatory(n.天文台)/reservation(n.保留)  

moderate<,>/ˈmɒdərət/<,>/ˈmɑːdərət/<,>adj.温和的/adj.有节制的<,>He has a moderate approach to politics.<,>他对政治持温和态度。<,>She drinks alcohol in moderate amounts.<,>她饮酒有节制。<,>The weather is moderate this season.<,>这个季节的天气很温和。<,>mod(方式)+erate→有方式的→适度的<,>modest(adj.谦虚的)/modern(adj.现代的)/modify(v.修改)  

cope<,>/kəʊp/<,>/koʊp/<,>v.对付/v.应付<,>She coped well with the pressure.<,>她很好地应对了压力。<,>How do you cope with stress?<,>你如何应对压力？<,>He couldn't cope with the workload.<,>他无法应付工作量。<,>cop(抓)+e→抓住问题→应对<,>cape(n.披肩)/copy(v.复制)/scope(n.范围)  

king<,>/kɪŋ/<,>/kɪŋ/<,>n.国王/n.君主<,>The king ruled for over 50 years.<,>这位国王统治了50多年。<,>He was crowned king at age 25.<,>他在25岁时加冕为国王。<,>The lion is called the king of the jungle.<,>狮子被称为丛林之王。<,>kin(亲属)+g→家族的首领→国王<,>kind(n.种类)/kink(n.扭结)/sing(v.唱歌)  

reaction<,>/riˈækʃn/<,>/riˈækʃn/<,>n.反应/n.反作用力<,>Her reaction to the news was surprising.<,>她对这消息的反应令人惊讶。<,>Every action has an equal and opposite reaction.<,>每个作用力都有相等的反作用力。<,>He had an allergic reaction to the medicine.<,>他对这种药物有过敏反应。<,>re(回)+act(行动)+ion→反作用<,>action(n.行动)/reactive(adj.反应的)/reactor(n.反应堆)  

outlook<,>/ˈaʊtlʊk/<,>/ˈaʊtlʊk/<,>n.观点/n.看法/n.展望<,>His outlook on life is very positive.<,>他的人生观非常积极。<,>The economic outlook is uncertain.<,>经济前景不确定。<,>She has a global outlook on business.<,>她对商业有全球视野。<,>out(外)+look(看)→向外看→展望<,>overlook(v.忽视)/lookout(n.瞭望)/outlet(n.出口)  

member<,>/ˈmembə(r)/<,>/ˈmembər/<,>n.成员/n.会员<,>She is a member of the local gym.<,>她是当地健身房的会员。<,>All members must follow the rules.<,>所有成员都必须遵守规则。<,>He became a member of parliament.<,>他成为了议会成员。<,>memb(部分)+er→整体的一部分→成员<,>remember(v.记住)/membrane(n.薄膜)/dismember(v.肢解)  

passport<,>/ˈpɑːspɔːt/<,>/ˈpæspɔːrt/<,>n.护照<,>You need a valid passport to travel abroad.<,>你需要有效护照才能出国旅行。<,>He lost his passport at the airport.<,>他在机场丢失了护照。<,>Her passport expires next month.<,>她的护照下个月到期。<,>pass(通过)+port(港口)→通过港口的证件→护照<,>password(n.密码)/portfolio(n.文件夹)/portal(n.入口)  

reduction<,>/rɪˈdʌkʃn/<,>/rɪˈdʌkʃn/<,>n.减少/n.减小/n.缩减<,>There was a significant reduction in costs.<,>成本大幅降低。<,>The company announced staff reductions.<,>公司宣布裁员。<,>This coupon gives you a 20% reduction.<,>这张优惠券可以打8折。<,>re(回)+duct(引导)+ion→往回引→减少<,>deduction(n.扣除)/induction(n.就职)/production(n.生产)  

childhood<,>/ˈtʃaɪldhʊd/<,>/ˈtʃaɪldhʊd/<,>n.童年/n.幼年/n.早期<,>She had a happy childhood in the countryside.<,>她在乡下度过了快乐的童年。<,>Childhood memories are often the strongest.<,>童年记忆往往最深刻。<,>Many diseases originate in childhood.<,>许多疾病源于童年时期。<,>child(孩子)+hood(状态)→孩童时期<,>adulthood(n.成年)/neighborhood(n.社区)/likelihood(n.可能性)
corner<,>/ˈkɔːnə(r)/<,>/ˈkɔːrnər/<,>n.角/n.边远地区<,>He sat in the corner of the room.<,>他坐在房间的角落里。<,>They live in a quiet corner of the country.<,>他们住在国家的一个安静边远地区。<,>The shop is just around the corner.<,>商店就在拐角处。<,>corn(玉米)+er→玉米地边角→角落<,>cornea(n.角膜)/corner(n.角球)

grandmother<,>/ˈɡrænmʌðə(r)/<,>/ˈɡrænmʌðər/<,>n.祖母/n.外祖母<,>My grandmother bakes delicious cookies.<,>我的祖母会烤美味的饼干。<,>She told stories about her grandmother.<,>她讲述了她外祖母的故事。<,>Grandmother's wisdom is always valuable.<,>祖母的智慧总是宝贵的。<,>grand(大的)+mother(母亲)→比母亲大→祖母<,>grandfather(n.祖父)/grandparent(n.祖父母)

lightning<,>/ˈlaɪtnɪŋ/<,>/ˈlaɪtnɪŋ/<,>n.闪电/n.闪电放电<,>Lightning struck the tree during the storm.<,>暴风雨中闪电击中了那棵树。<,>The lightning flashed across the sky.<,>闪电划过天空。<,>He moved with lightning speed.<,>他以闪电般的速度移动。<,>light(光)+ning→闪光→闪电<,>lighten(v.减轻/v.照亮)/lighting(n.照明)

of<,>/ɒv/<,>/ʌv/<,>prep.…的/prep.由于<,>This is a picture of my family.<,>这是一张我家的照片。<,>She died of a heart attack.<,>她死于心脏病发作。<,>The color of the sky is blue.<,>天空的颜色是蓝色的。<,>o+f→简单介词<,>off(adv.离开/prep.从...离开)/if(conj.如果)

classification<,>/ˌklæsɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌklæsəfəˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.分类/n.分级/n.分类法<,>The classification of plants is complex.<,>植物的分类很复杂。<,>This book falls under the fiction classification.<,>这本书属于小说分类。<,>They developed a new classification system.<,>他们开发了一个新的分类系统。<,>class(类别)+ify(使)+cation→分类<,>classify(v.分类)/clarification(n.澄清)

tension<,>/ˈtenʃn/<,>/ˈtenʃən/<,>n.紧张/n.不安/n.拉紧/n.张力<,>There was tension in the air before the exam.<,>考试前空气中弥漫着紧张。<,>The tension in the rope was too high.<,>绳子的张力太大了。<,>She felt the tension between them.<,>她感觉到他们之间的紧张关系。<,>ten(伸展)+sion→拉紧的状态→张力<,>intention(n.意图)/extension(n.延伸)

strip<,>/strɪp/<,>/strɪp/<,>v.剥去/v.除去/n.条/n.带<,>He stripped the old paint off the wall.<,>他把墙上的旧油漆剥去。<,>She wore a strip of cloth as a headband.<,>她用一条布当头带。<,>The comedian did a strip show.<,>那个喜剧演员表演了脱衣秀。<,>s(蛇)+trip(旅行)→蛇蜕皮旅行→剥去<,>strap(n.带子/v.捆扎)/stripe(n.条纹)

interpretation<,>/ɪnˌtɜːprɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˌtɜːrprɪˈteɪʃən/<,>n.解释<,>His interpretation of the poem was unique.<,>他对这首诗的解释很独特。<,>The data allows for multiple interpretations.<,>这些数据允许多种解释。<,>She gave her interpretation of the dream.<,>她给出了对梦的解释。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(价格)+ation→在中间定价→解释<,>interruption(n.打断)/interpolation(n.插入)

condemn<,>/kənˈdem/<,>/kənˈdɛm/<,>v.谴责/v.指责/v.判刑<,>The government condemned the violent acts.<,>政府谴责了暴力行为。<,>The judge condemned him to life imprisonment.<,>法官判他无期徒刑。<,>Everyone condemned his rude behavior.<,>每个人都谴责他粗鲁的行为。<,>con(共同)+demn(伤害)→共同伤害→谴责<,>contemn(v.蔑视)/condense(v.浓缩)

previous<,>/ˈpriːviəs/<,>/ˈpriviəs/<,>adj.先的/adj.前的<,>He had no previous experience in teaching.<,>他之前没有教学经验。<,>On the previous day, it had rained heavily.<,>前一天下了大雨。<,>She returned to her previous job.<,>她回到了之前的工作。<,>pre(前)+vi(路)+ous→前面的路→先的<,>precious(adj.珍贵的)/premise(n.前提)
hopeful<,>/ˈhəʊpfʊl/<,>/ˈhoʊpfəl/<,>adj.有希望的<,>She gave me a hopeful smile.<,>她给了我一个充满希望的微笑。<,>The future looks hopeful for the young entrepreneur.<,>这位年轻企业家的未来看起来充满希望。<,>Despite the setbacks, he remained hopeful.<,>尽管遭遇挫折，他仍然充满希望。<,>hope(希望)+ful(形容词后缀)→有希望的<,>hopeless(adj.绝望的)/wishful(adj.渴望的)/helpful(adj.有帮助的)  

invisible<,>/ɪnˈvɪzəbl/<,>/ɪnˈvɪzəbəl/<,>adj.看不见的/adj.无形的<,>The tiny germs are invisible to the naked eye.<,>这些微小的细菌肉眼看不见。<,>He felt invisible in the crowded room.<,>在拥挤的房间里他觉得自己被忽视了。<,>Some stars are invisible without a telescope.<,>有些星星不用望远镜是看不见的。<,>in(不)+vis(看)+ible(能…的)→看不见的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/invincible(adj.无敌的)/indivisible(adj.不可分割的)  

occasion<,>/əˈkeɪʒn/<,>/əˈkeɪʒən/<,>n.场合/n.时刻/n.时机<,>This is a special occasion for celebration.<,>这是一个值得庆祝的特殊场合。<,>I met him on several occasions.<,>我在几个不同的场合见过他。<,>She took the occasion to express her gratitude.<,>她借此机会表达了感激之情。<,>oc(加强)+cas(落下)+ion→事情落下的时刻→时机<,>accident(n.事故)/casual(adj.随意的)/decade(n.十年)  

noun<,>/naʊn/<,>/naʊn/<,>n.名词<,>"Book" is a common noun.<,>"书"是一个普通名词。<,>Proper nouns are always capitalized.<,>专有名词总是大写。<,>In this sentence, "happiness" functions as a noun.<,>在这个句子中，"happiness"作为名词使用。<,>noun(名词)与pronoun(代词)相对应<,>verb(n.动词)/adjective(n.形容词)/adverb(n.副词)  

blend<,>/blend/<,>/blɛnd/<,>v.混和/n.混和物<,>Blend the ingredients until smooth.<,>把原料混合到顺滑为止。<,>This tea is a blend of different herbs.<,>这种茶是多种草药的混合物。<,>The colors blend well together.<,>这些颜色融合得很好。<,>blend(混合)与bland(平淡的)发音相似<,>mix(v.混合)/combine(v.结合)/merge(v.合并)  

colleague<,>/ˈkɒliːɡ/<,>/ˈkɑːliːɡ/<,>n.同事/n.同僚<,>My colleague helped me with the project.<,>我的同事帮我完成了这个项目。<,>She introduced me to her colleagues.<,>她把我介绍给她的同事们。<,>We have been colleagues for five years.<,>我们做同事已经有五年了。<,>col(共同)+league(联盟)→共同联盟的人→同事<,>college(n.学院)/league(n.联盟)/collaborate(v.合作)  

electronic<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɒnɪk/<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɑːnɪk/<,>adj.电子的<,>I prefer electronic books these days.<,>现在我更喜欢电子书。<,>The store sells various electronic devices.<,>这家商店出售各种电子设备。<,>Electronic music is becoming more popular.<,>电子音乐越来越受欢迎。<,>electron(电子)+ic(形容词后缀)→电子的<,>electric(adj.电的)/electrical(adj.电气的)/electricity(n.电)  

fire<,>/ˈfaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈfaɪər/<,>n.火/n.火灾/v.开火<,>The fire spread quickly through the building.<,>火势在楼内迅速蔓延。<,>The soldiers were ordered to fire.<,>士兵们接到开火的命令。<,>We sat around the campfire telling stories.<,>我们围坐在篝火旁讲故事。<,>fire(火)与hire(雇佣)拼写相似<,>flame(n.火焰)/spark(n.火花)/ignite(v.点燃)  

layer<,>/ˈleɪə(r)/<,>/ˈleɪər/<,>n.层/n.层次<,>Apply a thin layer of paint.<,>涂上薄薄的一层颜料。<,>The cake has multiple layers of cream.<,>这个蛋糕有多层奶油。<,>There are several layers of meaning in this poem.<,>这首诗有多层含义。<,>lay(放置)+er(名词后缀)→放置的东西→层<,>player(n.玩家)/slayer(n.杀手)/lawyer(n.律师)  

fade<,>/feɪd/<,>/feɪd/<,>v.逐渐消失/v.褪色<,>The music faded into the distance.<,>音乐声渐渐消失在远方。<,>The color of the curtains has faded over time.<,>窗帘的颜色随着时间褪去了。<,>His smile faded when he heard the news.<,>听到这个消息时，他的笑容消失了。<,>fade(褪色)与face(脸)发音相似<,>vanish(v.消失)/disappear(v.消失)/dim(v.变暗淡)
ahead<,>/əˈhed/<,>/əˈhɛd/<,>adv.向前/adv.在前/adv.提前<,>Go straight ahead and you'll see the library.<,>一直往前走，你会看到图书馆。<,>The deadline is just ahead.<,>截止日期就在眼前。<,>She finished her work ahead of time.<,>她提前完成了工作。<,>a(在)+head(头)→在前头→向前<,>aboard(adv.在船上)/abroad(adv.在国外)  

chop<,>/tʃɒp/<,>/tʃɑp/<,>v.砍/v.劈/v.切细<,>He chopped the wood into small pieces.<,>他把木头劈成小块。<,>Chop the onions finely for the salad.<,>把洋葱切细做沙拉。<,>The chef chopped the vegetables quickly.<,>厨师快速切好了蔬菜。<,>chop(拟声词，砍伐声)<,>chip(n.碎片/v.削)/chap(n.家伙)/chopstick(n.筷子)  

gulf<,>/ɡʌlf/<,>/ɡʌlf/<,>n.海湾<,>The Persian Gulf is rich in oil.<,>波斯湾石油资源丰富。<,>A hurricane formed in the Gulf of Mexico.<,>飓风在墨西哥湾形成。<,>There's a wide gulf between their opinions.<,>他们的观点存在巨大分歧。<,>gulf(联想gulp大口吞咽)→海湾像大地张开的嘴<,>golf(n.高尔夫)/gull(n.海鸥)  

convenient<,>/kənˈviːniənt/<,>/kənˈvinjənt/<,>adj.便利的/adj.近便的<,>The hotel is in a convenient location.<,>酒店位置便利。<,>Is this time convenient for you?<,>这个时间对你方便吗？<,>Online shopping is very convenient.<,>网购非常方便。<,>con(共同)+ven(来)+ient→大家都容易来的→便利的<,>convention(n.惯例)/inconvenient(adj.不便的)  

eleven<,>/ɪˈlevn/<,>/ɪˈlɛvən/<,>num.十一/num.十一个<,>There are eleven players in a football team.<,>足球队有十一名队员。<,>My flight leaves at eleven o'clock.<,>我的航班十一点起飞。<,>She got eleven presents for her birthday.<,>她收到了十一件生日礼物。<,>eleven(形似两根筷子加一个碗)<,>seven(num.七)/even(adj.平坦的)  

by<,>/baɪ/<,>/baɪ/<,>prep.在...旁/prep.被/prep.由<,>She sat by the window reading.<,>她坐在窗边看书。<,>The book was written by Mark Twain.<,>这本书是马克·吐温写的。<,>We traveled by train to Paris.<,>我们乘火车去巴黎。<,>by(谐音"拜")→拜倒在...旁<,>buy(v.购买)/bye(int.再见)  

Australian<,>/ɒˈstreɪliən/<,>/ɔˈstreɪljən/<,>adj.澳大利亚的<,>Kangaroos are Australian animals.<,>袋鼠是澳大利亚的动物。<,>She has an Australian accent.<,>她有澳大利亚口音。<,>Australian wines are famous worldwide.<,>澳大利亚葡萄酒世界闻名。<,>Australia(澳大利亚)+n→澳大利亚的<,>Austrian(adj.奥地利的)/Asian(adj.亚洲的)  

main<,>/meɪn/<,>/meɪn/<,>adj.主要的/adj.最重要的<,>The main reason was lack of time.<,>主要原因是时间不足。<,>Turn left onto Main Street.<,>左转进入主街。<,>What's the main idea of the article?<,>这篇文章的主旨是什么？<,>main(谐音"命")→命脉→最重要的<,>man(n.男人)/maid(n.女仆)  

candy<,>/ˈkændi/<,>/ˈkændi/<,>n.糖果<,>Don't eat too much candy.<,>不要吃太多糖果。<,>She gave me a box of chocolates and candies.<,>她给了我一盒巧克力和糖果。<,>Halloween is a time for kids to collect candy.<,>万圣节是孩子们收集糖果的时候。<,>can(能)+dy(谐音"甜")→能甜的东西→糖果<,>cane(n.手杖)/candle(n.蜡烛)  

bacteria<,>/bækˈtɪəriə/<,>/bækˈtɪriə/<,>n.细菌<,>Wash your hands to remove bacteria.<,>洗手去除细菌。<,>Some bacteria are beneficial to health.<,>有些细菌对健康有益。<,>Antibiotics can kill harmful bacteria.<,>抗生素能杀死有害细菌。<,>bacter(杆)+ia(病)→杆状致病物→细菌<,>virus(n.病毒)/fungus(n.真菌)
repeatedly<,>/rɪˈpiːtɪdli/<,>/rɪˈpiːtɪdli/<,>adv.重复地/adv.一再<,>He repeatedly asked the same question.<,>他一再问同一个问题。<,>The alarm rang repeatedly throughout the night.<,>警报整夜反复响起。<,>She repeatedly checked her phone for messages.<,>她反复查看手机是否有消息。<,>repeat(重复)+ed(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→重复地<,>frequently(adv.频繁地)/constantly(adv.不断地)  

explanation<,>/ˌekspləˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌekspləˈneɪʃn/<,>n.解释/n.说明/n.辩解<,>Can you give me an explanation for your absence?<,>你能解释一下你为什么缺席吗？<,>The teacher provided a clear explanation of the theory.<,>老师对这个理论做了清晰的解释。<,>His explanation didn't satisfy the police.<,>他的解释没能让警方满意。<,>ex(出)+plan(平坦)+ation(名词后缀)→把问题摊平→解释<,>examination(n.考试)/exploration(n.探索)  

impact<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>n.影响/n.作用/n.冲击<,>The new policy had a significant impact on the economy.<,>新政策对经济产生了重大影响。<,>The car hit the wall with great impact.<,>汽车猛烈地撞上了墙。<,>Social media has a huge impact on teenagers.<,>社交媒体对青少年影响很大。<,>im(进入)+pact(压)→压进去→冲击<,>impair(v.损害)/impart(v.传授)  

mainly<,>/ˈmeɪnli/<,>/ˈmeɪnli/<,>adv.主要地/adv.大体上<,>The audience consisted mainly of students.<,>观众主要是学生。<,>He is mainly responsible for the project.<,>他主要负责这个项目。<,>The damage was mainly to the roof.<,>损坏主要在屋顶。<,>main(主要的)+ly(副词后缀)→主要地<,>mostly(adv.大部分)/primarily(adv.首要地)  

administration<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ədˌmɪnɪˈstreɪʃn/<,>n.管理/n.管理部门<,>She works in hospital administration.<,>她在医院行政部门工作。<,>The administration of the new policy will be challenging.<,>新政策的实施将具有挑战性。<,>University administration has announced new rules.<,>大学管理部门宣布了新规定。<,>administer(管理)+ation(名词后缀)→管理<,>admission(n.入场)/admiration(n.钦佩)  

skillful<,>/ˈskɪlfəl/<,>/ˈskɪlfəl/<,>adj.灵巧的/adj.娴熟的<,>She is a skillful surgeon.<,>她是位技术娴熟的外科医生。<,>His skillful handling of the situation impressed everyone.<,>他对局势的巧妙处理给大家留下了深刻印象。<,>The artist's skillful brushwork is remarkable.<,>这位艺术家娴熟的笔触令人惊叹。<,>skill(技能)+ful(形容词后缀)→有技能的<,>skilled(adj.熟练的)/skilful(英式拼写)  

data<,>/ˈdeɪtə/<,>/ˈdætə/<,>n.数据/n.资料<,>We need to analyze the data carefully.<,>我们需要仔细分析这些数据。<,>The research is based on reliable data.<,>这项研究基于可靠的数据。<,>Please back up your data regularly.<,>请定期备份你的数据。<,>datum的复数形式<,>date(n.日期)/database(n.数据库)  

pollution<,>/pəˈluːʃn/<,>/pəˈluːʃn/<,>n.污染<,>Air pollution is a serious problem in big cities.<,>空气污染是大城市的一个严重问题。<,>The factory was fined for water pollution.<,>这家工厂因水污染被罚款。<,>Noise pollution affects people's health.<,>噪音污染影响人们的健康。<,>pollute(污染)+ion(名词后缀)→污染<,>population(n.人口)/solution(n.解决方案)  

possession<,>/pəˈzeʃn/<,>/pəˈzeʃn/<,>n.有/n.所有/n.占有物<,>He was found in possession of illegal drugs.<,>他被发现持有非法毒品。<,>The house has been in our family's possession for generations.<,>这房子是我们家几代人的财产。<,>She packed all her personal possessions.<,>她收拾好了所有个人物品。<,>possess(拥有)+ion(名词后缀)→占有<,>procession(n.队伍)/profession(n.职业)  

manly<,>/ˈmænli/<,>/ˈmænli/<,>adj.男子气概的/adj.果断的<,>He has a strong, manly appearance.<,>他有种强壮的、男子气概的外表。<,>She admired his manly courage.<,>她钦佩他男子汉的勇气。<,>It was a manly decision to admit the mistake.<,>承认错误是个男子汉的决定。<,>man(男人)+ly(形容词后缀)→像男人的<,>mainly(adv.主要地)/mannerly(adj.有礼貌的)
reverse<,>/rɪˈvɜːs/<,>/rɪˈvɜːrs/<,>v.颠倒/v.翻转/n.背面<,>He reversed the car into the parking space.<,>他把车倒进了停车位。<,>Please write your name on the reverse side of the paper.<,>请在纸张背面写上你的名字。<,>The court reversed its earlier decision.<,>法院推翻了早先的判决。<,>re(回)+verse(转)→转回去→颠倒<,>verse(n.诗句)/diverse(adj.多样的)/adverse(adj.不利的)

gallon<,>/ˈɡælən/<,>/ˈɡælən/<,>n.加仑<,>This car gets 30 miles per gallon.<,>这辆车每加仑油能跑30英里。<,>I need to buy a gallon of milk.<,>我需要买一加仑牛奶。<,>The tank holds 50 gallons of water.<,>这个水箱能装50加仑水。<,>gal(女孩)+lon(长)→女孩用长计量单位→加仑<,>galleon(n.大帆船)/gallop(v.飞奔)/gallonage(n.加仑量)

have<,>/hæv/<,>/hæv/<,>aux v.(与过去分词连用构成完成时)/v.有/v.吃<,>I have finished my homework.<,>我已经完成了作业。<,>She has two cats.<,>她有两只猫。<,>Let's have lunch together.<,>我们一起吃午饭吧。<,>ha(哈)+ve(维生素E)→哈哈有维E→有<,>halve(v.减半)/hive(n.蜂房)/heave(v.举起)

boy<,>/bɔɪ/<,>/bɔɪ/<,>n.男孩/n.少年/n.家伙<,>The boy is playing football.<,>那个男孩在踢足球。<,>He's just a boy of 15.<,>他只是个15岁的少年。<,>That boy is really funny.<,>那家伙真有趣。<,>bo(波)+y(歪)→波浪歪歪的男孩→男孩<,>toy(n.玩具)/joy(n.欢乐)/buoy(n.浮标)

Mister<,>/ˈmɪstə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪstər/<,>n.先生<,>Good morning, Mister Smith.<,>早上好，史密斯先生。<,>Mister President will give a speech.<,>总统先生将发表演讲。<,>Excuse me, Mister, you dropped your wallet.<,>打扰了先生，您钱包掉了。<,>Miss(小姐)+ter(人)→比小姐更正式→先生<,>master(n.主人)/mister(n.先生)/moisture(n.湿气)

crawl<,>/krɔːl/<,>/krɔːl/<,>v.爬/v.爬行<,>The baby is learning to crawl.<,>宝宝正在学爬。<,>Traffic was crawling along the highway.<,>车辆在高速公路上缓慢行驶。<,>I saw a spider crawling up the wall.<,>我看到一只蜘蛛在墙上爬。<,>c(see)+raw(生的)+l(了)→看到生的了要爬走→爬行<,>brawl(n.争吵)/scrawl(v.潦草地写)/drawl(v.拉长声调说)

employment<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/<,>/ɪmˈplɔɪmənt/<,>n.工作/n.职业/n.雇用/n.使用<,>He found employment at a local factory.<,>他在当地工厂找到了工作。<,>Full employment is the government's goal.<,>充分就业是政府的目标。<,>The employment of new technology improved efficiency.<,>新技术的使用提高了效率。<,>employ(雇佣)+ment(名词后缀)→雇佣状态→工作<,>employer(n.雇主)/employee(n.雇员)/deployment(n.部署)

dread<,>/dred/<,>/dred/<,>n.畏惧/n.恐怖/v.惧怕<,>She has a dread of spiders.<,>她害怕蜘蛛。<,>The villagers lived in dread of the monster.<,>村民们生活在怪物的恐怖中。<,>I dread going to the dentist.<,>我害怕去看牙医。<,>d(地)+read(读)→地上读恐怖小说→畏惧<,>dream(n.梦)/bread(n.面包)/dredge(v.疏浚)

difficult<,>/ˈdɪfɪkəlt/<,>/ˈdɪfɪkəlt/<,>adj.困难的/adj.难对付的<,>This math problem is very difficult.<,>这道数学题很难。<,>He's a difficult person to work with.<,>他是个难相处的人。<,>It's difficult to learn a new language.<,>学习一门新语言很难。<,>dif(否定)+fic(做)+ult→不好做的→困难的<,>different(adj.不同的)/diffident(adj.羞怯的)/deflect(v.偏转)

aggressive<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>/əˈɡresɪv/<,>adj.侵略的/adj.好斗的<,>He has an aggressive personality.<,>他性格好斗。<,>The country adopted an aggressive foreign policy.<,>该国采取了侵略性的外交政策。<,>Some dogs can become aggressive if provoked.<,>有些狗如果被激怒会变得具有攻击性。<,>ag(加强)+gress(走)+ive→不断向前走→侵略的<,>progressive(adj.进步的)/digressive(adj.离题的)/congress(n.国会)
elder<,>/ˈeldə(r)/<,>/ˈɛldər/<,>adj.年龄较大的/n.长者<,>My elder brother is a doctor.<,>我的哥哥是一名医生。<,>We should respect our elders.<,>我们应该尊敬长辈。<,>The elder members of the family made the decision.<,>家族中较年长的成员做出了决定。<,>eld(old的比较级)+er(人)→年长者<,>older(adj.更老的)/elderly(adj.年老的)

twin<,>/twɪn/<,>/twɪn/<,>adj.孪生的/n.孪生儿<,>She gave birth to twin girls.<,>她生下了一对双胞胎女孩。<,>The twin towers were destroyed in the attack.<,>双子塔在袭击中被毁。<,>They are identical twins.<,>他们是同卵双胞胎。<,>tw(二)+in→双的<,>twice(adv.两次)/twist(v.扭曲)

furnace<,>/ˈfɜːnɪs/<,>/ˈfɜːrnɪs/<,>n.炉子/熔炉/鼓风炉<,>The metal was melted in a furnace.<,>金属在熔炉中熔化。<,>It's like a furnace in here!<,>这里热得像火炉！<,>The blast furnace produces pig iron.<,>高炉生产生铁。<,>furn(火)+ace→火炉<,>furnish(v.布置)/furniture(n.家具)

political<,>/pəˈlɪtɪkl/<,>/pəˈlɪtɪkəl/<,>adj.政治的/政治上的<,>He has strong political opinions.<,>他有强烈的政治观点。<,>The country is in political turmoil.<,>该国正处于政治动荡中。<,>She's studying political science.<,>她在学习政治学。<,>polit(国家)+ical→政治的<,>politician(n.政治家)/policy(n.政策)

statue<,>/ˈstætʃuː/<,>/ˈstætʃuː/<,>n.塑像/雕像/铸像<,>The Statue of Liberty is in New York.<,>自由女神像在纽约。<,>They erected a statue in his honor.<,>他们为他竖立了一座雕像。<,>The marble statue is very valuable.<,>这座大理石雕像非常珍贵。<,>stat(站立)+ue→站立的东西→雕像<,>status(n.地位)/stature(n.身高)

geometry<,>/dʒiˈɒmətri/<,>/dʒiˈɑːmətri/<,>n.几何/几何学<,>I'm struggling with geometry homework.<,>我在几何作业上遇到困难。<,>The building has interesting geometric shapes.<,>这座建筑有有趣的几何形状。<,>Geometry is a branch of mathematics.<,>几何是数学的一个分支。<,>geo(地)+metry(测量)→测量土地的学问→几何<,>geography(n.地理学)/geology(n.地质学)

union<,>/ˈjuːniən/<,>/ˈjuːnjən/<,>n.协会/联合<,>The workers formed a trade union.<,>工人们成立了工会。<,>The union of two companies created a giant corporation.<,>两家公司的联合形成了一个大企业。<,>Marriage is a union of two people.<,>婚姻是两个人的结合。<,>uni(一)+on→联合<,>unite(v.联合)/unity(n.团结)

accord<,>/əˈkɔːd/<,>/əˈkɔːrd/<,>v.给予/使一致<,>He was accorded a hero's welcome.<,>他受到了英雄般的欢迎。<,>Her actions don't accord with her words.<,>她的言行不一致。<,>The two sides finally accorded on the terms.<,>双方最终就条款达成一致。<,>ac(向)+cord(心)→心往一处想→一致<,>accordion(n.手风琴)/record(v.记录)

terminal<,>/ˈtɜːmɪnl/<,>/ˈtɜːrmɪnl/<,>adj.末端的/n.终点站<,>He has a terminal illness.<,>他患有不治之症。<,>The bus terminal is crowded.<,>公交终点站很拥挤。<,>The wire has a plastic terminal.<,>电线有一个塑料端子。<,>termin(界限)+al→末端的<,>terminate(v.终止)/terminology(n.术语)

petroleum<,>/pəˈtrəʊliəm/<,>/pəˈtroʊliəm/<,>n.石油<,>Petroleum is a non-renewable resource.<,>石油是不可再生资源。<,>The country exports petroleum products.<,>该国出口石油产品。<,>Petroleum prices fluctuate frequently.<,>石油价格经常波动。<,>petr(石)+oleum(油)→石油<,>petrol(n.汽油)/petrochemical(adj.石油化学的)
northwest<,>/ˌnɔːθˈwest/<,>/ˌnɔːrθˈwest/<,>n.西北/adj.位于西北的<,>The wind is coming from the northwest.<,>风从西北方向吹来。<,>They live in the northwest part of the city.<,>他们住在城市的西北部。<,>The northwest corner of the garden gets the most sunlight.<,>花园的西北角阳光最充足。<,>north(北)+west(西)→西北方向<,>northeast(n.东北/adj.位于东北的)/southwest(n.西南/adj.位于西南的)

wool<,>/wʊl/<,>/wʊl/<,>n.羊毛/n.毛线/n.绒线<,>This sweater is made of pure wool.<,>这件毛衣是纯羊毛的。<,>She bought some colorful wool for knitting.<,>她买了一些彩色毛线用来编织。<,>The blanket is woven from soft wool.<,>这条毯子是用柔软的绒线织成的。<,>发音类似"乌尔"→想象羊毛乌黑发亮<,>wood(n.木材)/woolen(adj.羊毛制的)/wooliness(n.羊毛质)

hollow<,>/ˈhɒləʊ/<,>/ˈhɑːloʊ/<,>adj.空的/adj.空洞的<,>The tree trunk was hollow inside.<,>树干里面是空的。<,>His promises sounded hollow and insincere.<,>他的承诺听起来空洞而不真诚。<,>They found a hollow space behind the wall.<,>他们在墙后发现了一个空洞。<,>hol(whole全部)+low(低)→全部掏空变低→空的<,>hallow(v.使神圣)/hollow(n.洞)/shallow(adj.浅的)

mission<,>/ˈmɪʃn/<,>/ˈmɪʃən/<,>n.使命/n.任务/n.使团<,>The soldiers completed their mission successfully.<,>士兵们成功完成了任务。<,>She felt it was her mission to help the poor.<,>她觉得帮助穷人是她的使命。<,>A Chinese trade mission visited Europe last week.<,>上周一个中国贸易使团访问了欧洲。<,>miss(发送)+ion→被派遣出去的任务<,>commission(n.委员会)/admission(n.承认)/emission(n.排放)

lantern<,>/ˈlæntən/<,>/ˈlæntərn/<,>n.提灯/n.灯笼<,>They hung red lanterns for the festival.<,>他们为节日挂起了红灯笼。<,>The old man carried a lantern to light his way.<,>老人提着灯笼照亮道路。<,>Paper lanterns floated on the river during the ceremony.<,>仪式期间纸灯笼在河上漂浮。<,>lan(谐音"蓝")+tern(tern鸟)→想象蓝色灯笼上画着燕鸥<,>lenten(adj.四旬斋的)/lanternfish(n.灯笼鱼)/lantana(n.马缨丹属植物)

earnest<,>/ˈɜːnɪst/<,>/ˈɜːrnɪst/<,>adj.认真的/adj.诚恳的<,>He gave an earnest promise to change his ways.<,>他诚恳地承诺改变自己的行为方式。<,>She is an earnest student who always does her best.<,>她是个认真的学生，总是尽力而为。<,>His earnest manner convinced me of his sincerity.<,>他诚恳的态度让我相信了他的真诚。<,>ear(耳朵)+nest(巢)→像鸟儿筑巢一样认真专注<,>earnings(n.收入)/earwig(n.蠼螋)/eastern(adj.东方的)

lavatory<,>/ˈlævətri/<,>/ˈlævətɔːri/<,>n.盥洗室/n.厕所<,>Excuse me, where is the lavatory?<,>请问洗手间在哪里？<,>The airplane lavatory is occupied.<,>飞机上的洗手间有人在使用。<,>Please keep the lavatory clean.<,>请保持洗手间清洁。<,>lava(熔岩)+tory(场所)→想象熔岩般急迫时需要去的地方<,>laboratory(n.实验室)/lavish(adj.奢侈的)/lavation(n.洗涤)

oneself<,>/wʌnˈself/<,>/wʌnˈself/<,>pron.自己/pron.亲自<,>One should learn to rely on oneself.<,>人应该学会依靠自己。<,>The queen herself attended the ceremony.<,>女王亲自出席了仪式。<,>It's important to be true to oneself.<,>对自己诚实很重要。<,>one(一个)+self(自己)→自己一个人<,>myself(pron.我自己)/yourself(pron.你自己)/itself(pron.它自己)

familiar<,>/fəˈmɪliə(r)/<,>/fəˈmɪliər/<,>adj.熟悉的<,>This place looks familiar to me.<,>这个地方对我来说很熟悉。<,>Are you familiar with this software?<,>你熟悉这个软件吗？<,>His face was familiar but I couldn't remember his name.<,>他的脸很熟悉，但我想不起他的名字。<,>family(家庭)+iar→像家人一样熟悉<,>similar(adj.相似的)/familial(adj.家庭的)/familiarity(n.熟悉)

rocket<,>/ˈrɒkɪt/<,>/ˈrɑːkɪt/<,>n.火箭/n.火箭发动机<,>The space rocket was launched successfully.<,>太空火箭成功发射了。<,>Scientists are developing a new rocket engine.<,>科学家正在研发新型火箭发动机。<,>Prices have rocketed in recent months.<,>最近几个月价格飞涨。<,>rock(岩石)+et(小东西)→像小石头一样快速飞行的东西<,>pocket(n.口袋)/racket(n.球拍)/locket(n.小盒)
veteran<,>/ˈvetərən/<,>/ˈvɛtərən/<,>n.老兵/n.老手<,>He is a veteran of the Second World War.<,>他是二战老兵。<,>She is a veteran in the field of journalism.<,>她是新闻界的老手。<,>The veteran shared his war experiences with us.<,>这位老兵与我们分享了他的战争经历。<,>vet(老)+eran(人)→老兵<,>veterinary(adj.兽医的)/vegetarian(n.素食者)  

declare<,>/dɪˈkleə(r)/<,>/dɪˈklɛr/<,>v.断言/v.声明/v.表明<,>The company declared bankruptcy last week.<,>该公司上周宣布破产。<,>He declared his love for her in front of everyone.<,>他当众向她表白。<,>The government declared a state of emergency.<,>政府宣布进入紧急状态。<,>de(加强)+clare(清楚)→说清楚→声明<,>decline(v.下降/n.衰退)/declaim(v.慷慨陈词)  

span<,>/spæn/<,>/spæn/<,>n.持续时间/n.跨距<,>The bridge has a span of 200 meters.<,>这座桥跨距200米。<,>Her career spanned over three decades.<,>她的职业生涯持续了三十多年。<,>The attention span of children is usually short.<,>儿童的注意力持续时间通常很短。<,>s(看作space)+pan(平底锅)→平底锅的空间→跨距<,>spin(v.旋转/n.旋转)/spank(v.打屁股)  

bunch<,>/bʌntʃ/<,>/bʌntʃ/<,>n.束/n.串/n.一群<,>She gave me a bunch of flowers.<,>她给了我一束花。<,>A bunch of kids were playing in the park.<,>一群孩子在公园里玩耍。<,>He ate a whole bunch of grapes.<,>他吃了一整串葡萄。<,>b(看作bee)+unch→蜜蜂群→一群<,>lunch(n.午餐)/hunch(n.预感)  

approve<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>/əˈpruv/<,>v.批准/v.赞成/v.称许<,>The committee approved the new policy.<,>委员会批准了新政策。<,>Her parents don't approve of her boyfriend.<,>她父母不赞成她的男朋友。<,>The teacher approved his answer with a smile.<,>老师微笑着认可了他的回答。<,>ap(加强)+prove(证明)→证明可行→批准<,>improve(v.改进)/disapprove(v.不赞成)  

hobby<,>/ˈhɒbi/<,>/ˈhɑːbi/<,>n.业余爱好/n.癖好<,>Gardening is her favorite hobby.<,>园艺是她最喜欢的业余爱好。<,>He has a strange hobby of collecting bottle caps.<,>他有收集瓶盖的奇怪癖好。<,>Finding a good hobby can enrich your life.<,>找到一个好的业余爱好可以丰富你的生活。<,>hob(炉边)+by→炉边活动→业余爱好<,>lobby(n.大厅)/hubby(n.丈夫)  

pea<,>/piː/<,>/pi/<,>n.豌豆/n.豌豆属植物<,>She planted some peas in her garden.<,>她在花园里种了些豌豆。<,>Pea soup is his favorite dish.<,>豌豆汤是他最喜欢的菜。<,>The princess couldn't sleep because of a pea under the mattress.<,>因为床垫下的一粒豌豆，公主睡不着觉。<,>p(看作pod豆荚)+ea→豌豆<,>pee(v.小便)/peace(n.和平)  

collapse<,>/kəˈlæps/<,>/kəˈlæps/<,>v.倒坍/v.崩溃/v.瓦解<,>The old building collapsed during the earthquake.<,>旧建筑在地震中倒塌了。<,>He collapsed from exhaustion after working for 20 hours.<,>工作20小时后，他因精疲力竭而倒下。<,>Their marriage collapsed after the scandal.<,>他们的婚姻在丑闻后瓦解了。<,>col(共同)+lapse(滑)→一起滑落→倒塌<,>elapse(v.时间流逝)/lapse(n.失误)  

insect<,>/ˈɪnsekt/<,>/ˈɪnˌsɛkt/<,>n.昆虫/n.虫<,>There's an insect in your hair!<,>你头发里有只虫子！<,>Butterflies are beautiful insects.<,>蝴蝶是美丽的昆虫。<,>He has a collection of rare insects.<,>他收藏稀有昆虫。<,>in(进入)+sect(切割)→昆虫身体分节→昆虫<,>insert(v.插入)/infect(v.感染)  

he<,>/hiː/<,>/hi/<,>pron.(主格)他<,>He is my best friend.<,>他是我最好的朋友。<,>He doesn't know the answer.<,>他不知道答案。<,>Where is he going?<,>他要去哪里？<,>h(看作him)+e→他<,>she(pron.她)/her(pron.她的)
eat<,>/iːt/<,>/it/<,>v.吃<,>I eat breakfast every morning.<,>我每天早上吃早餐。<,>She doesn't eat meat.<,>她不吃肉。<,>He ate too much at dinner.<,>他晚餐吃太多了。<,>ea(吃)+t(动作)→吃<,>ate(过去式)/beat(v.打)/heat(n.热)

add<,>/æd/<,>/æd/<,>v.添加/v.附加/v.掺加<,>Add some sugar to your coffee.<,>给你的咖啡加点糖。<,>Please add your name to the list.<,>请把你的名字加到名单上。<,>The noise added to my headache.<,>噪音加剧了我的头痛。<,>ad(增加)+d(动作)→添加<,>odd(adj.奇怪的)/aid(v.帮助)/ad(n.广告)

growth<,>/ɡrəʊθ/<,>/ɡroʊθ/<,>n.增长/n.增长量/n.生长<,>The city has seen rapid growth in population.<,>这个城市人口增长迅速。<,>Economic growth is slowing down.<,>经济增长正在放缓。<,>Nails are made of the same material as hair growth.<,>指甲和头发生长的物质相同。<,>grow(生长)+th(名词后缀)→生长<,>groan(v.呻吟)/grow(v.生长)/grit(n.砂砾)

strange<,>/streɪndʒ/<,>/streɪndʒ/<,>adj.陌生的/adj.奇怪的<,>I heard a strange noise last night.<,>昨晚我听到一个奇怪的声音。<,>He felt strange in the new environment.<,>他在新环境中感到陌生。<,>It's strange that she didn't call.<,>奇怪的是她没有打电话来。<,>str(街道)+ange(天使)→街上遇到天使→奇怪的<,>strong(adj.强壮的)/strain(v.拉紧)/stranger(n.陌生人)

invention<,>/ɪnˈvenʃn/<,>/ɪnˈvɛnʃən/<,>n.发明/n.创造/n.捏造/n.假话<,>The telephone was an important invention.<,>电话是一项重要发明。<,>His excuse was pure invention.<,>他的借口纯属捏造。<,>She has a talent for invention.<,>她有发明的天赋。<,>in(进入)+vent(来)+ion→想出来的东西→发明<,>convention(n.惯例)/intervention(n.干预)/inventory(n.库存)

female<,>/ˈfiːmeɪl/<,>/ˈfiˌmeɪl/<,>n.雌性的动物/n.女性<,>The female lion does most of the hunting.<,>雌狮负责大部分捕猎工作。<,>She was the only female in the team.<,>她是团队中唯一的女性。<,>Female employees face unique challenges.<,>女性员工面临独特的挑战。<,>fe(拼音"非")+male(男性)→非男性→女性<,>male(n.男性)/feminine(adj.女性的)/fame(n.名声)

disaster<,>/dɪˈzɑːstə(r)/<,>/dɪˈzæstər/<,>n.灾难/n.灾祸/n.天灾<,>The earthquake was a major disaster.<,>这次地震是一场大灾难。<,>The party turned into a complete disaster.<,>派对变成了一场彻底的灾难。<,>Poor planning led to financial disaster.<,>糟糕的规划导致了财务灾难。<,>dis(不)+aster(星星)→星位不正→灾难<,>aster(n.紫菀)/disease(n.疾病)/dismay(n.沮丧)

headache<,>/ˈhedeɪk/<,>/ˈhɛdˌeɪk/<,>n.头痛/n.头痛的事<,>I have a terrible headache.<,>我头痛得厉害。<,>This project is giving me a headache.<,>这个项目让我很头疼。<,>Loud noises can cause headaches.<,>噪音会导致头痛。<,>head(头)+ache(疼痛)→头痛<,>heartache(n.心痛)/backache(n.背痛)/stomachache(n.胃痛)

comment<,>/ˈkɒment/<,>/ˈkɑːment/<,>n.评论/n.意见/n.批评/n.指责<,>He made a rude comment about her appearance.<,>他对她的外表做了粗鲁的评论。<,>I'd appreciate your comments on my work.<,>我很想听听你对我工作的意见。<,>The article attracted many online comments.<,>这篇文章吸引了许多网络评论。<,>com(共同)+ment(思考)→共同思考→评论<,>commend(v.称赞)/command(v.命令)/commence(v.开始)

damage<,>/ˈdæmɪdʒ/<,>/ˈdæmɪdʒ/<,>v.损害/v.毁坏/n.损害<,>The storm damaged many houses.<,>暴风雨损坏了许多房屋。<,>Smoking can damage your health.<,>吸烟会损害你的健康。<,>The company paid for the damage.<,>公司赔偿了损失。<,>dam(水坝)+age(年龄)→水坝年久失修→损坏<,>damn(v.谴责)/dame(n.夫人)/damp(adj.潮湿的)
assure<,>/əˈʃʊə(r)/<,>/əˈʃʊr/<,>v.使确信/v.向…保证<,>I assure you that the product is of high quality.<,>我向你保证这个产品质量很好。<,>He assured me of his support.<,>他向我保证会支持我。<,>She assured her parents that she would be careful.<,>她向父母保证会小心。<,>as(强调)+sure(确定)→使确信<,>ensure(v.确保)/insure(v.投保)/reassure(v.使安心)

store<,>/stɔː(r)/<,>/stɔːr/<,>n.商店/n.贮藏/n.贮存品<,>She went to the store to buy some groceries.<,>她去商店买了一些杂货。<,>We need to store the food properly to keep it fresh.<,>我们需要妥善储存食物以保持新鲜。<,>He has a store of old coins in his collection.<,>他收藏了一批旧硬币。<,>st(站立)+ore(地方)→站立的地方→商店<,>storage(n.储存)/restore(v.恢复)/story(n.故事)

withdraw<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>v.撤退/v.收回/v.撤回<,>The army decided to withdraw from the area.<,>军队决定从该地区撤退。<,>He withdrew his hand quickly from the hot stove.<,>他迅速把手从热炉子上缩回。<,>She withdrew her application for the job.<,>她撤回了工作申请。<,>with(向后)+draw(拉)→向后拉→撤退<,>withdrawal(n.撤退)/withhold(v.扣留)/withstand(v.抵抗)

conduct<,>/ˈkɒndʌkt/<,>/ˈkɑːndʌkt/<,>n.举止/n.行为<,>His conduct at the meeting was inappropriate.<,>他在会议上的举止不得体。<,>The teacher praised the student for good conduct.<,>老师表扬了这名学生的良好行为。<,>Professional conduct is important in business.<,>职业行为在商业中很重要。<,>con(共同)+duct(引导)→共同引导→行为<,>conductor(n.指挥)/deduct(v.扣除)/induct(v.使就职)

bulb<,>/bʌlb/<,>/bʌlb/<,>n.电灯泡<,>The light bulb in the kitchen needs to be replaced.<,>厨房的电灯泡需要更换了。<,>She planted tulip bulbs in the garden.<,>她在花园里种了郁金香球茎。<,>The bulb flickered before going out completely.<,>灯泡闪烁了几下后完全熄灭了。<,>bul(球)+b→球形物→灯泡<,>bulky(adj.庞大的)/bulge(n.膨胀)/bulbous(adj.球茎状的)

alcohol<,>/ˈælkəhɒl/<,>/ˈælkəhɔːl/<,>n.酒精/n.乙醇<,>Alcohol consumption should be moderate.<,>饮酒应该适度。<,>The doctor warned him about the dangers of alcohol.<,>医生警告他酒精的危害。<,>This hand sanitizer contains 70% alcohol.<,>这款洗手液含有70%的酒精。<,>al(阿拉伯语前缀)+cohol→酒精<,>alcoholic(adj.含酒精的)/alcoholism(n.酗酒)/methanol(n.甲醇)

bitter<,>/ˈbɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈbɪtər/<,>adj.痛苦的/adj.严寒的<,>The divorce left her with bitter memories.<,>离婚给她留下了痛苦的回忆。<,>The bitter cold made it difficult to go outside.<,>严寒使得外出变得困难。<,>The medicine has a bitter taste.<,>这种药有苦味。<,>bit(咬)+ter→咬到苦的东西→苦的<,>better(adj.更好的)/batter(v.击打)/butter(n.黄油)

respond<,>/rɪˈspɒnd/<,>/rɪˈspɑːnd/<,>v.作答/v.响应<,>She didn't respond to my email.<,>她没有回复我的邮件。<,>The patient is responding well to the treatment.<,>病人对治疗反应良好。<,>The government must respond to citizens' concerns.<,>政府必须回应市民的关切。<,>re(回)+spond(承诺)→回应承诺→响应<,>response(n.回应)/correspond(v.通信)/responsible(adj.负责的)

naked<,>/ˈneɪkɪd/<,>/ˈneɪkɪd/<,>adj.裸体的/adj.无遮蔽的<,>The baby was lying naked on the changing table.<,>婴儿光着身子躺在换尿布台上。<,>The naked truth is sometimes hard to accept.<,>赤裸的真相有时难以接受。<,>The trees stood naked after losing their leaves.<,>树叶掉光后，树木光秃秃地矗立着。<,>nake(古英语"裸")+ed→裸体的<,>nude(adj.裸体的)/baked(adj.烘烤的)/faked(adj.伪造的)

radar<,>/ˈreɪdɑː(r)/<,>/ˈreɪdɑːr/<,>n.雷达/n.无线电探测器<,>The plane disappeared from radar screens.<,>飞机从雷达屏幕上消失了。<,>Police used radar to detect speeding cars.<,>警察用雷达探测超速车辆。<,>The ship's radar detected an approaching storm.<,>船上的雷达探测到一场即将到来的风暴。<,>ra(dio)+d(etection)+a(nd)+r(anging)→无线电探测与测距<,>sonar(n.声纳)/laser(n.激光)/lidar(n.激光雷达)
birthday<,>/ˈbɜːθdeɪ/<,>/ˈbɜːrθdeɪ/<,>n.生日/n.诞生的日期<,>Today is my birthday and I'm so excited!<,>今天是我的生日，我非常兴奋！<,>We celebrated her birthday with a big party.<,>我们举办了一个盛大的派对庆祝她的生日。<,>He received many gifts on his birthday.<,>他在生日那天收到了很多礼物。<,>birth(出生)+day(日子)→出生的日子→生日<,>birthmark(n.胎记)/birthright(n.与生俱来的权利)  

precise<,>/prɪˈsaɪs/<,>/prɪˈsaɪs/<,>adj.精确的/adj.准确的<,>The measurements must be precise to the nearest millimeter.<,>测量必须精确到毫米。<,>She gave a precise description of the suspect.<,>她对嫌疑人做了精确的描述。<,>The scientist conducted the experiment with precise calculations.<,>科学家用精确的计算进行了实验。<,>pre(预先)+cise(切)→预先切好→精确的<,>concise(adj.简明的)/precis(n.摘要)  

emerge<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒ/<,>v.出现/v.涌现/v.冒出<,>The sun emerged from behind the clouds.<,>太阳从云层后面露出来了。<,>New evidence emerged during the investigation.<,>调查过程中出现了新的证据。<,>A new leader emerged after the election.<,>选举后出现了一位新领导人。<,>e(出)+merge(沉)→从沉没中出来→出现<,>immerse(v.沉浸)/submerge(v.淹没)  

reality<,>/riˈæləti/<,>/riˈæləti/<,>n.现实/n.真实<,>We must face reality and accept the truth.<,>我们必须面对现实，接受真相。<,>Virtual reality technology is becoming more advanced.<,>虚拟现实技术越来越先进。<,>His dream finally became a reality.<,>他的梦想终于成为了现实。<,>real(真实的)+ity(名词后缀)→现实<,>realism(n.现实主义)/realize(v.实现)  

wing<,>/wɪŋ/<,>/wɪŋ/<,>n.翼/n.翅膀/n.翅<,>The bird spread its wings and flew away.<,>鸟儿展开翅膀飞走了。<,>The new wing of the hospital will open next month.<,>医院的新翼楼将于下个月开放。<,>He plays on the left wing for the soccer team.<,>他在足球队踢左边锋。<,>win(赢)+g→有翅膀才能赢→翅膀<,>swing(v.摇摆)/king(n.国王)  

gauge<,>/ɡeɪdʒ/<,>/ɡeɪdʒ/<,>v.量/v.测量/n.量器<,>We need to gauge the depth of the river before crossing.<,>我们需要在过河前测量河的深度。<,>The fuel gauge shows that the tank is almost empty.<,>油表显示油箱快空了。<,>It's difficult to gauge his true intentions.<,>很难揣测他的真实意图。<,>发音类似"给值"→测量就是给数值<,>gouge(v.凿/n.半圆凿)/gage(n.抵押品)  

give<,>/ɡɪv/<,>/ɡɪv/<,>v.做/v.作/v.送给<,>Can you give me a hand with this heavy box?<,>你能帮我搬这个重箱子吗？<,>She gave a wonderful performance last night.<,>她昨晚的表演非常精彩。<,>He gave his seat to the elderly woman.<,>他把座位让给了那位老妇人。<,>g(给)+ive→给予<,>forgive(v.原谅)/gift(n.礼物)  

end<,>/end/<,>/end/<,>n.末端/n.目标/v.结束<,>We walked to the end of the street.<,>我们走到了街的尽头。<,>The movie had a surprising end.<,>这部电影有一个出人意料的结局。<,>Let's end this discussion now.<,>我们现在结束这个讨论吧。<,>e(出)+nd(结)→结束<,>bend(v.弯曲)/send(v.发送)  

rust<,>/rʌst/<,>/rʌst/<,>n.锈/v.生锈/v.氧化<,>The old bicycle was covered in rust.<,>那辆旧自行车上满是锈迹。<,>Iron will rust if exposed to moisture.<,>铁暴露在湿气中会生锈。<,>The gate's hinges had rusted shut.<,>大门的铰链已经锈死了。<,>ru(如)+st(石头)→像石头一样硬→锈<,>crust(n.外壳)/trust(v.信任)  

disagree<,>/ˌdɪsəˈɡriː/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈɡriː/<,>v.有分歧/v.不一致<,>I disagree with your opinion on this matter.<,>我不同意你在这件事上的观点。<,>The two reports disagree on the main findings.<,>两份报告在主要发现上不一致。<,>We often disagree but still respect each other.<,>我们经常有分歧，但仍然互相尊重。<,>dis(不)+agree(同意)→不同意<,>agree(v.同意)/disapprove(v.不赞成)
engineer<,>/ˌendʒɪˈnɪə(r)/<,>/ˌendʒɪˈnɪr/<,>n.工程师/n.技师<,>He works as a civil engineer.<,>他是一名土木工程师。<,>She is an engineer in the automotive industry.<,>她是汽车行业的一名技师。<,>The engineer fixed the machine quickly.<,>工程师很快就修好了机器。<,>engin(引擎)+eer(人)→操作引擎的人→工程师<,>engine(n.引擎)/engineering(n.工程学)

expert<,>/ˈekspɜːt/<,>/ˈekspɜːrt/<,>n.专家/adj.熟练的<,>She is an expert in ancient history.<,>她是古代历史方面的专家。<,>He gave an expert opinion on the matter.<,>他对这件事给出了专业的意见。<,>Her expert hands repaired the watch.<,>她熟练的手修好了手表。<,>ex(出)+pert(尝试)→尝试过很多的人→专家<,>export(v.出口/n.出口商品)/except(conj.除了)

plain<,>/pleɪn/<,>/pleɪn/<,>n.平原/adj.清楚的<,>The vast plain stretched for miles.<,>广阔的平原绵延数英里。<,>Her instructions were plain and easy to follow.<,>她的指示清楚且易于遵循。<,>He wore a plain white shirt.<,>他穿着一件素白的衬衫。<,>pl(平坦)+ain→平坦的地方→平原<,>plane(n.飞机/平面)/explain(v.解释)

philosopher<,>/fəˈlɒsəfə(r)/<,>/fəˈlɑːsəfər/<,>n.哲学家<,>Socrates was a famous Greek philosopher.<,>苏格拉底是著名的希腊哲学家。<,>The philosopher wrote many books on ethics.<,>这位哲学家写了许多关于伦理学的书。<,>She studies the works of modern philosophers.<,>她研究现代哲学家的著作。<,>philo(爱)+soph(智慧)+er(人)→爱智慧的人→哲学家<,>philosophy(n.哲学)/sophisticated(adj.复杂的)

eastern<,>/ˈiːstən/<,>/ˈiːstərn/<,>adj.朝东的/adj.东方的<,>The eastern part of the country is more developed.<,>这个国家的东部更发达。<,>They prefer eastern medicine.<,>他们更喜欢东方医学。<,>The room has an eastern exposure.<,>这个房间朝东。<,>east(东)+ern(形容词后缀)→东方的<,>western(adj.西方的)/northern(adj.北方的)

automobile<,>/ˈɔːtəməbiːl/<,>/ˈɔːtəməbiːl/<,>n.汽车/n.机动车<,>The automobile industry is growing rapidly.<,>汽车工业正在快速增长。<,>He collects vintage automobiles.<,>他收藏老式汽车。<,>Automobile accidents are common in this area.<,>这个地区机动车事故很常见。<,>auto(自动)+mobile(移动)→自动移动的车辆→汽车<,>automatic(adj.自动的)/mobile(adj.移动的)

noon<,>/nuːn/<,>/nuːn/<,>n.正午/n.中午<,>We'll meet at noon tomorrow.<,>我们明天中午见。<,>The sun is directly overhead at noon.<,>正午时分太阳在正上方。<,>She takes a nap every noon.<,>她每天中午都会小睡一会儿。<,>no(没有)+on(在...上)→太阳不在东也不在西→正午<,>moon(n.月亮)/soon(adv.不久)

region<,>/ˈriːdʒən/<,>/ˈriːdʒən/<,>n.地区/n.地带/n.领域<,>This region is known for its wine.<,>这个地区以葡萄酒闻名。<,>He specializes in the region of applied physics.<,>他专攻应用物理领域。<,>The coastal region has a mild climate.<,>沿海地带气候温和。<,>reg(统治)+ion→统治的区域→地区<,>religion(n.宗教)/register(v.登记)

transformation<,>/ˌtrænsfəˈmeɪʃn/<,>/ˌtrænsfərˈmeɪʃn/<,>n.变化/n.改造/n.转变<,>The transformation of the old factory was amazing.<,>旧工厂的改造令人惊叹。<,>Digital transformation is changing businesses.<,>数字化转型正在改变企业。<,>Her physical transformation was remarkable.<,>她身体的变化非常显著。<,>trans(跨越)+form(形状)+ation→形状跨越→转变<,>transportation(n.运输)/information(n.信息)

benefit<,>/ˈbenɪfɪt/<,>/ˈbenɪfɪt/<,>n.利益/n.恩惠/n.津贴<,>Exercise has many health benefits.<,>锻炼有许多健康益处。<,>Employees receive medical benefits.<,>员工享有医疗津贴。<,>The new policy will benefit everyone.<,>新政策将使每个人受益。<,>bene(好)+fit(做)→做好事→利益<,>profit(n.利润)/beneficial(adj.有益的)
least<,>/liːst/<,>/list/<,>det.最少的/pron.最少的/adv.最少<,>She ate the least amount of food at the party.<,>她在聚会上吃得最少。<,>This is the least expensive option available.<,>这是最便宜的选择。<,>He worked the least but complained the most.<,>他干得最少却抱怨最多。<,>little的最高级形式<,>last(adj.最后的)/lease(n.租约)/lest(conj.唯恐)

grind<,>/ɡraɪnd/<,>/ɡraɪnd/<,>v.磨（碎）/v.磨利<,>She grinds coffee beans every morning.<,>她每天早上都磨咖啡豆。<,>The knife needs to be ground to sharpen it.<,>这把刀需要磨一磨才能锋利。<,>He ground his teeth in frustration.<,>他沮丧地磨牙。<,>gr(摩擦)+ind(动作)→研磨动作<,>grand(adj.宏伟的)/grip(v.紧握)/grin(v.咧嘴笑)

do<,>/duː/<,>/du/<,>aux.（用于实义动词前构成否定句和疑问句）/v.做/v.干/v.办<,>Do you like chocolate?<,>你喜欢巧克力吗？<,>I'll do the dishes after dinner.<,>晚饭后我来洗碗。<,>She did a great job on the project.<,>她这个项目做得很好。<,>助动词原型<,>due(adj.到期的)/dew(n.露水)/die(v.死亡)

national<,>/ˈnæʃnəl/<,>/ˈnæʃənəl/<,>adj.民族的/adj.国家的<,>The national anthem is played before sports events.<,>体育赛事前会演奏国歌。<,>This is a matter of national security.<,>这是国家安全问题。<,>She won the national chess championship.<,>她赢得了全国象棋冠军。<,>nation(国家)+al(形容词后缀)<,>rational(adj.理性的)/notional(adj.概念的)/natal(adj.出生的)

excursion<,>/ɪkˈskɜːʃn/<,>/ɪkˈskɜːrʒn/<,>n.远足/n.短途旅行<,>We went on an excursion to the mountains.<,>我们去山里远足。<,>The school organized an excursion to the museum.<,>学校组织了去博物馆的短途旅行。<,>The excursion included a boat ride on the lake.<,>这次短途旅行包括湖上乘船。<,>ex(出)+curs(跑)+ion→跑出去→远足<,>excuse(n.借口)/excavation(n.挖掘)/excretion(n.排泄)

haste<,>/heɪst/<,>/heɪst/<,>n.急速/n.急忙/n.草率<,>In his haste, he forgot his keys.<,>匆忙中他忘了带钥匙。<,>More haste, less speed.<,>欲速则不达。<,>She left in great haste to catch the train.<,>她匆忙离开去赶火车。<,>has(有)+te(拼音"特")→特别有速度→急速<,>taste(n.味道)/waste(n.浪费)/paste(n.糨糊)

suit<,>/suːt/<,>/sut/<,>n.起诉/n.诉讼/v.适合<,>The black dress suits you perfectly.<,>这件黑色连衣裙很适合你。<,>He filed a suit against the company.<,>他对公司提起了诉讼。<,>This job suits my qualifications.<,>这份工作适合我的资历。<,>s(像蛇)+uit(uit拼音"一套")→蛇穿一套衣服→适合<,>suite(n.套房)/sue(v.起诉)/sour(adj.酸的)

stock<,>/stɒk/<,>/stɑːk/<,>n.库存品/n.股本<,>We need to check our stock levels.<,>我们需要检查库存水平。<,>He invested in tech stocks.<,>他投资了科技股。<,>The store has a wide stock of books.<,>这家书店有大量库存书。<,>st(站立)+ock(lock锁)→锁住站立的东西→库存<,>stuck(v.卡住)/stalk(n.茎)/stork(n.鹳)

needless<,>/ˈniːdləs/<,>/ˈnidələs/<,>adj.不需要的<,>Needless to say, I was very disappointed.<,>不用说，我非常失望。<,>This is a needless expense.<,>这是不必要的开支。<,>His comments were needless and hurtful.<,>他的评论既多余又伤人。<,>need(需要)+less(否定后缀)→不需要的<,>needle(n.针)/heedless(adj.不注意的)/seedless(adj.无籽的)

laser<,>/ˈleɪzə(r)/<,>/ˈleɪzər/<,>n.激光<,>The doctor used a laser to remove the tumor.<,>医生用激光切除了肿瘤。<,>Laser pointers are not toys for children.<,>激光笔不是儿童玩具。<,>They cut the metal with a laser beam.<,>他们用激光束切割金属。<,>las(谐音"镭射")+er(名词后缀)<,>lager(n.贮藏啤酒)/laser(n.激光)/lasso(n.套索)
boot<,>/buːt/<,>/but/<,>n.靴子/n.长统靴<,>She wore a pair of leather boots in the snow.<,>她在雪地里穿了一双皮靴。<,>He cleaned his muddy boots after the hike.<,>徒步后他清理了沾满泥巴的靴子。<,>The cowboy's boots had intricate stitching patterns.<,>牛仔的靴子上有复杂的缝线图案。<,>boot与foot(脚)相关，靴子穿在脚上<,>boot(v.启动电脑)/booth(n.电话亭)/boost(v.促进)

pain<,>/peɪn/<,>/peɪn/<,>n.痛/n.疼痛/n.辛苦<,>The pain in her knee made walking difficult.<,>她膝盖的疼痛让行走变得困难。<,>He endured years of pain to achieve his dream.<,>他忍受多年的艰辛来实现梦想。<,>No pain, no gain is a common saying.<,>"没有付出就没有收获"是句俗语。<,>pain与pane(窗格玻璃)发音相同<,>painful(adj.痛苦的)/pained(adj.痛苦的)/painkiller(n.止痛药)

stale<,>/steɪl/<,>/stel/<,>adj.陈腐的/adj.走了气的<,>The bread became stale after two days.<,>面包两天后就不新鲜了。<,>His jokes were stale and predictable.<,>他的笑话老套又容易猜到。<,>The air in the room was stale and stuffy.<,>房间里的空气浑浊闷热。<,>stale与stable(稳定的)对比记忆<,>stalemate(n.僵局)/staleness(n.不新鲜)/stalwart(adj.坚定的)

habitual<,>/həˈbɪtʃuəl/<,>/həˈbɪtʃuəl/<,>adj.习惯性的/adj.惯常的<,>She was a habitual latecomer to meetings.<,>她开会总是习惯性迟到。<,>His habitual kindness made him popular.<,>他一贯的善良让他很受欢迎。<,>Smoking had become a habitual action for him.<,>吸烟已成为他的习惯性动作。<,>habit(习惯)+ual(形容词后缀)<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/habituate(v.使习惯)/habitude(n.习俗)

erect<,>/ɪˈrekt/<,>/ɪˈrɛkt/<,>v.建造/v.使竖立<,>They plan to erect a new statue in the park.<,>他们计划在公园里竖立一座新雕像。<,>The cat erected its fur when threatened.<,>猫受到威胁时竖起了毛发。<,>It took months to erect the skyscraper.<,>建造这座摩天大楼花了数月时间。<,>e(出)+rect(直)→使直立<,>direct(adj.直接的)/correct(v.纠正)/erection(n.建立)

noticeable<,>/ˈnəʊtɪsəbl/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪsəbl/<,>adj.显而易见的<,>There was a noticeable improvement in her grades.<,>她的成绩有明显进步。<,>The stain on his shirt was quite noticeable.<,>他衬衫上的污渍相当明显。<,>The temperature drop was noticeable after sunset.<,>日落后的温度下降很明显。<,>notice(注意)+able(能够)→能注意到的<,>notable(adj.显著的)/notorious(adj.臭名昭著的)/notification(n.通知)

hate<,>/heɪt/<,>/het/<,>v.恨/v.憎恨/v.不喜欢<,>I hate getting up early on weekends.<,>我讨厌周末早起。<,>They hate each other since the argument.<,>自从那次争吵后他们就互相憎恨。<,>She hates the taste of bitter melon.<,>她讨厌苦瓜的味道。<,>hate与heat(热)发音相似<,>hatred(n.憎恨)/hateful(adj.可恨的)/hate crime(n.仇恨犯罪)

orderly<,>/ˈɔːdəli/<,>/ˈɔrdərli/<,>adj.整洁的/adj.有秩序的<,>The students lined up in an orderly fashion.<,>学生们整齐地排好队。<,>Her desk was always neat and orderly.<,>她的书桌总是整洁有序。<,>The protest remained orderly throughout the day.<,>抗议活动一整天都保持有序。<,>order(秩序)+ly(形容词后缀)<,>disorderly(adj.混乱的)/orderliness(n.整齐)/ordered(adj.有序的)

menu<,>/ˈmenjuː/<,>/ˈmɛnju/<,>n.菜单<,>Could you bring us the dessert menu?<,>能给我们拿甜点菜单吗？<,>The restaurant updates its seasonal menu monthly.<,>这家餐厅每月更新季节性菜单。<,>He scanned the menu but couldn't decide what to order.<,>他浏览菜单但决定不了点什么。<,>menu与me(我)+new(新的)联想记忆<,>manual(n.手册)/menus(n.菜单复数)/menubar(n.菜单栏)

fair<,>/feə(r)/<,>/fɛr/<,>adj.公平的/adj.相当的<,>The judge made a fair decision.<,>法官做出了公正的判决。<,>She has a fair chance of winning the competition.<,>她有相当大的机会赢得比赛。<,>The weather forecast predicts fair skies tomorrow.<,>天气预报说明天天气晴朗。<,>fair与fare(车费)发音相同<,>unfair(adj.不公平的)/fairly(adv.相当地)/fairness(n.公平)
point<,>/pɔɪnt/<,>/pɔɪnt/<,>n.点/n.要点/n.细目/n.分<,>She made a good point during the meeting.<,>她在会议上提出了一个很好的观点。<,>The needle has a sharp point.<,>这根针有一个尖点。<,>He scored 10 points in the game.<,>他在比赛中得了10分。<,>poi(尖)+nt→尖的东西→点<,>appoint(v. 任命)/disappoint(v. 使失望)/viewpoint(n. 观点)  

live<,>/lɪv/<,>/lɪv/<,>v.居住/v.活/adj.活的<,>I live in a small apartment.<,>我住在一个小公寓里。<,>This is a live broadcast.<,>这是现场直播。<,>Fish cannot live without water.<,>鱼离开水无法生存。<,>liv(生命)+e→有生命的→活的<,>alive(adj. 活着的)/lively(adj. 活泼的)/liver(n. 肝脏)  

altitude<,>/ˈæltɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈæltɪtuːd/<,>n.高/n.高度/n.高处<,>The plane reached an altitude of 30,000 feet.<,>飞机达到了3万英尺的高度。<,>Mountain climbers need to adjust to high altitudes.<,>登山者需要适应高海拔。<,>The town is at a low altitude.<,>这个城镇海拔很低。<,>alt(高)+itude(状态)→高度<,>attitude(n. 态度)/latitude(n. 纬度)/gratitude(n. 感激)  

horizon<,>/həˈraɪzən/<,>/həˈraɪzən/<,>n.地平线/n.眼界/n.见识<,>The sun disappeared below the horizon.<,>太阳消失在地平线下。<,>Travel broadens one's horizons.<,>旅行能开阔人的眼界。<,>She has narrow horizons.<,>她见识狭窄。<,>hori(界限)+zon→地平线<,>horizontal(adj. 水平的)/vertical(adj. 垂直的)/parallel(n. 平行线)  

similarly<,>/ˈsɪmələli/<,>/ˈsɪmələrli/<,>adv.类似地/adv.相似地<,>Similarly, his brother is also a doctor.<,>类似地，他的兄弟也是一名医生。<,>They dress similarly.<,>他们穿得相似。<,>Similarly, we can solve this problem.<,>同样地，我们可以解决这个问题。<,>simil(相同)+ar+ly→相似地<,>similar(adj. 相似的)/dissimilar(adj. 不相似的)/simile(n. 明喻)  

protein<,>/ˈprəʊtiːn/<,>/ˈproʊtiːn/<,>n.蛋白质/n.朊<,>Eggs are rich in protein.<,>鸡蛋富含蛋白质。<,>Protein is essential for muscle growth.<,>蛋白质对肌肉生长至关重要。<,>This supplement contains plant protein.<,>这种补充剂含有植物蛋白。<,>pro(首要)+tein→首要的营养→蛋白质<,>proton(n. 质子)/prototype(n. 原型)/protease(n. 蛋白酶)  

miserable<,>/ˈmɪzrəbl/<,>/ˈmɪzərəbl/<,>adj.痛苦的/adj.悲惨的<,>He looked miserable after the loss.<,>输掉比赛后他看起来很痛苦。<,>They live in miserable conditions.<,>他们生活在悲惨的环境中。<,>It was a miserable rainy day.<,>那是个糟糕的雨天。<,>miser(可怜)+able→可怜的→悲惨的<,>misery(n. 痛苦)/miser(n. 守财奴)/commiserate(v. 同情)  

influence<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>n.影响/n.势力/v.影响<,>Her teacher had a great influence on her.<,>她的老师对她影响很大。<,>He has influence in political circles.<,>他在政界有影响力。<,>Don't let others influence your decision.<,>不要让别人影响你的决定。<,>in(进入)+flu(流)+ence→流入→影响<,>affluence(n. 富裕)/confluence(n. 汇合)/fluent(adj. 流利的)  

July<,>/dʒuˈlaɪ/<,>/dʒʊˈlaɪ/<,>n.七月<,>My birthday is in July.<,>我的生日在七月。<,>July is usually the hottest month.<,>七月通常是最热的月份。<,>We'll go on vacation in July.<,>我们将在七月去度假。<,>源自罗马统治者Julius Caesar的名字<,>June(n. 六月)/August(n. 八月)/Julian(adj. 儒略历的)  

sake<,>/seɪk/<,>/seɪk/<,>n.缘故/n.理由<,>He did it for the sake of his family.<,>他为了家人做了这件事。<,>For safety's sake, wear a helmet.<,>为了安全起见，请戴头盔。<,>Don't argue just for the sake of arguing.<,>不要为了争论而争论。<,>sak(原因)+e→缘故<,>make(v. 制作)/take(v. 拿)/fake(adj. 假的)
tendency<,>/ˈtendənsi/<,>/ˈtɛndənsi/<,>n.倾向/n.趋向/n.趋势<,>She has a tendency to procrastinate.<,>她有拖延的倾向。<,>There is a growing tendency towards healthier lifestyles.<,>现在有一种越来越倾向于更健康生活方式的趋势。<,>The market shows a tendency to fluctuate.<,>市场显示出波动的趋势。<,>tend(趋向)+ency(名词后缀)→倾向<,>trend(n.趋势)/tender(adj.温柔的)/intend(v.打算)

giant<,>/ˈdʒaɪənt/<,>/ˈdʒaɪənt/<,>n.巨人/n.巨物<,>The giant in the story was very kind.<,>故事中的巨人非常善良。<,>He is a giant in the field of science.<,>他是科学界的巨人。<,>The company is a giant in the tech industry.<,>这家公司是科技行业的巨头。<,>gi(大)+ant(名词后缀)→巨人<,>gigantic(adj.巨大的)/genius(n.天才)/giantess(n.女巨人)

father<,>/ˈfɑːðə(r)/<,>/ˈfɑðər/<,>n.父亲/n.神父/n.创始人<,>My father is a doctor.<,>我的父亲是一名医生。<,>The priest is called Father John.<,>那位神父被称为约翰神父。<,>He is considered the father of modern physics.<,>他被认为是现代物理学之父。<,>fat(胖)+her(她)→父亲<,>mother(n.母亲)/feather(n.羽毛)/farther(adj.更远的)

specimen<,>/ˈspesɪmən/<,>/ˈspɛsəmən/<,>n.样本/n.标本/n.样品<,>The doctor took a blood specimen for testing.<,>医生取了血样进行检测。<,>This museum has a large collection of insect specimens.<,>这个博物馆有大量的昆虫标本。<,>Please send us a specimen of your work.<,>请给我们寄一份你的作品样本。<,>speci(种类)+men(名词后缀)→样本<,>species(n.物种)/special(adj.特别的)/specific(adj.具体的)

upward<,>/ˈʌpwəd/<,>/ˈʌpwərd/<,>adj.上升的/adj.向上的<,>The balloon floated upward into the sky.<,>气球向上飘向天空。<,>There is an upward trend in house prices.<,>房价呈上升趋势。<,>He gave an upward glance at the clock.<,>他向上瞥了一眼时钟。<,>up(上)+ward(方向)→向上的<,>downward(adj.向下的)/forward(adj.向前的)/backward(adj.向后的)

ready<,>/ˈredi/<,>/ˈrɛdi/<,>adj.准备好的/adj.愿意的<,>Dinner is ready.<,>晚餐准备好了。<,>Are you ready to help?<,>你愿意帮忙吗？<,>She was always ready with a quick reply.<,>她总是能迅速回答。<,>read(读)+y(形容词后缀)→准备好的<,>steady(adj.稳定的)/already(adv.已经)/readily(adv.乐意地)

path<,>/pɑːθ/<,>/pæθ/<,>n.路/n.小道/n.道路<,>We walked along a narrow path through the woods.<,>我们沿着一条穿过树林的狭窄小路行走。<,>This is the path to success.<,>这是通往成功的道路。<,>The dog ran down the garden path.<,>狗沿着花园的小路跑下去了。<,>pat(拍)+h(形似小路)→小路<,>pass(n.通行证)/patch(n.补丁)/pant(v.喘息)

helmet<,>/ˈhelmɪt/<,>/ˈhɛlmɪt/<,>n.头盔/n.钢盔<,>Always wear a helmet when riding a bike.<,>骑自行车时一定要戴头盔。<,>The soldier put on his helmet before the battle.<,>士兵在战斗前戴上了钢盔。<,>The construction worker's helmet protected him from falling debris.<,>建筑工人的头盔保护他免受坠落碎片的伤害。<,>helm(舵)+et(小)→头盔<,>helmeted(adj.戴头盔的)/helmsman(n.舵手)/help(v.帮助)

adverb<,>/ˈædvɜːb/<,>/ˈædvɜrb/<,>n.副词<,>In the sentence 'She runs quickly,' 'quickly' is an adverb.<,>在句子“她跑得快”中，“快”是副词。<,>Adverbs often end in -ly.<,>副词通常以-ly结尾。<,>He used an adverb to modify the verb.<,>他用一个副词来修饰动词。<,>ad(加)+verb(动词)→副词<,>adjective(n.形容词)/verb(n.动词)/adverbial(adj.副词的)

information<,>/ˌɪnfəˈmeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən/<,>n.消息/n.信息/n.通知<,>Please give me more information about the event.<,>请给我更多关于这个活动的信息。<,>The information in the report was inaccurate.<,>报告中的信息不准确。<,>We received information about the schedule change.<,>我们收到了关于日程变更的通知。<,>in(内)+form(形式)+ation(名词后缀)→信息<,>inform(v.通知)/formation(n.形成)/informative(adj.信息丰富的)
exterior<,>/ɪkˈstɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈstɪriər/<,>adj.外部的<,>The exterior walls of the house are painted white.<,>房子的外墙被漆成了白色。<,>The car's exterior is shiny and new.<,>汽车的外部闪闪发光，看起来很新。<,>He focused on the exterior appearance rather than the interior design.<,>他更关注外观而不是内部设计。<,>ex(外)+ter(土地)+ior(形容词后缀)→外部的<,>interior(adj.内部的)/exteriorize(v.使外表化)

setting<,>/ˈsetɪŋ/<,>/ˈsɛtɪŋ/<,>n.环境/n.安装/n.调整<,>The novel has a beautiful rural setting.<,>小说的背景是一个美丽的乡村环境。<,>She adjusted the setting on the washing machine.<,>她调整了洗衣机的设置。<,>The stage setting for the play was very elaborate.<,>这出戏的舞台布景非常精致。<,>set(放置)+ing(名词后缀)→放置的环境→背景<,>settle(v.解决/n.长椅)/scenery(n.风景/n.景色)

tidy<,>/ˈtaɪdi/<,>/ˈtaɪdi/<,>adj.整洁的/adj.整齐的<,>Her room is always neat and tidy.<,>她的房间总是干净整洁。<,>He made a tidy sum from the business.<,>他从生意中赚了一大笔钱。<,>Please tidy up your desk before leaving.<,>离开前请整理好你的桌子。<,>tide(潮汐)+y(形容词后缀)→像潮汐一样有规律的→整齐的<,>tiny(adj.极小的)/tie(n.领带/v.系)

eagle<,>/ˈiːɡl/<,>/ˈiɡəl/<,>n.鹰<,>The eagle soared high above the mountains.<,>鹰在高山上空翱翔。<,>He has the eyesight of an eagle.<,>他有鹰一般的视力。<,>The national emblem features a golden eagle.<,>国徽上有一只金色的鹰。<,>ea(鹰的叫声)+gle→鹰<,>beagle(n.小猎犬)/eager(adj.渴望的)

variable<,>/ˈveəriəbl/<,>/ˈvɛriəbəl/<,>adj.易变的/n.变量<,>The weather is very variable in this region.<,>这个地区的天气变化无常。<,>Scientists study the variables in the experiment.<,>科学家研究实验中的变量。<,>Her mood is as variable as the weather.<,>她的情绪像天气一样多变。<,>vary(变化)+able(能够)→能够变化的→易变的<,>variety(n.种类)/various(adj.各种各样的)

belt<,>/belt/<,>/bɛlt/<,>n.带/n.腰带/n.皮带/n.区<,>He tightened his belt before the race.<,>比赛前他系紧了腰带。<,>The conveyor belt moves the products along.<,>传送带将产品运送过去。<,>This area is known as the corn belt.<,>这个地区被称为玉米带。<,>bel(铃铛)+t→像铃铛一样系在腰上→腰带<,>bolt(n.螺栓/v.逃跑)/bent(adj.弯曲的)

open<,>/ˈəʊpən/<,>/ˈoʊpən/<,>adj.开的/adj.开放的/v.开<,>The door is open, please come in.<,>门是开着的，请进来。<,>She opened the window to let in fresh air.<,>她打开窗户让新鲜空气进来。<,>The museum is open to the public.<,>博物馆对公众开放。<,>o(圆形)+pen(笔)→像笔一样可以打开→开<,>opener(n.开启者)/opera(n.歌剧)

relative<,>/ˈrelətɪv/<,>/ˈrɛlətɪv/<,>adj.有关系的/adj.相对的<,>She is a relative of mine.<,>她是我的一个亲戚。<,>The humidity is high relative to the temperature.<,>相对于温度而言，湿度很高。<,>He spoke about the relative importance of the issues.<,>他谈到了这些问题的相对重要性。<,>relate(关联)+ive(形容词后缀)→有关系的<,>relativity(n.相对性)/relax(v.放松)

cage<,>/keɪdʒ/<,>/keɪdʒ/<,>n.笼/n.鸟笼/n.囚笼<,>The bird was kept in a golden cage.<,>这只鸟被关在一个金色的笼子里。<,>The tiger paced back and forth in its cage.<,>老虎在笼子里来回踱步。<,>He felt like he was in a cage at the office.<,>他觉得自己在办公室里就像在笼子里一样。<,>c(形状像笼子)+age(年龄)→随着年龄增长被关在笼子里→笼子<,>cave(n.洞穴)/page(n.页)

revolt<,>/rɪˈvəʊlt/<,>/rɪˈvoʊlt/<,>n.反抗/n.造反/v.反抗/v.造反<,>The peasants rose in revolt against the king.<,>农民们起义反抗国王。<,>Such cruelty revolts me.<,>这种残忍让我反感。<,>The revolt was quickly suppressed by the army.<,>起义很快被军队镇压了。<,>re(反)+volt(转)→反转→反抗<,>revolve(v.旋转)/revolution(n.革命)
exist<,>/ɪɡˈzɪst/<,>/ɪɡˈzɪst/<,>v.存在/v.生存/v.生活<,>Do aliens exist in the universe?<,>宇宙中存在外星人吗？<,>They exist on a very limited budget.<,>他们靠非常有限的预算生活。<,>The problem has existed for years.<,>这个问题已经存在多年了。<,>ex(出)+ist(站立)→站出来→存在<,>exit(n.出口)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)/insist(v.坚持)  

width<,>/wɪdθ/<,>/wɪdθ/<,>n.宽度<,>The width of the river is about 20 meters.<,>这条河的宽度大约是20米。<,>Measure the width of the door before buying the furniture.<,>买家具前先量一下门的宽度。<,>The road has a width of six lanes.<,>这条道路有六车道宽。<,>wide(宽的)+th(名词后缀)→宽度<,>length(n.长度)/breadth(n.宽度)/depth(n.深度)  

argue<,>/ˈɑːɡjuː/<,>/ˈɑːrɡjuː/<,>v.争论/v.争辩/v.辩论<,>They often argue about politics.<,>他们经常争论政治问题。<,>I won't argue with you about this.<,>我不会和你争论这个。<,>She argued her case persuasively.<,>她很有说服力地为自己辩护。<,>ar(加强)+gue(引导)→引导争论→辩论<,>augment(v.增加)/allegue(v.声称)/ague(n.疟疾)  

herself<,>/hɜːˈself/<,>/hɜːrˈself/<,>pron.她自己/pron.她亲自<,>She hurt herself while cooking.<,>她在做饭时伤到了自己。<,>The manager herself will handle the complaint.<,>经理将亲自处理投诉。<,>She told me the story herself.<,>她亲口告诉了我这个故事。<,>her(她)+self(自己)→她自己<,>himself(pron.他自己)/itself(pron.它自己)/yourself(pron.你自己)  

potato<,>/pəˈteɪtəʊ/<,>/pəˈteɪtoʊ/<,>n.马铃薯/n.土豆<,>Mashed potato is my favorite side dish.<,>土豆泥是我最喜欢的配菜。<,>She planted potatoes in her garden.<,>她在花园里种了土豆。<,>This soup is made with sweet potatoes.<,>这个汤是用红薯做的。<,>pot(罐子)+ato→形状像罐子的食物→土豆<,>tomato(n.西红柿)/avocado(n.鳄梨)/pottery(n.陶器)  

aspect<,>/ˈæspekt/<,>/ˈæspekt/<,>n.方面/n.样子/n.外表<,>We need to consider every aspect of the problem.<,>我们需要考虑问题的每个方面。<,>The house has a southern aspect.<,>这栋房子朝南。<,>Her cheerful aspect brightened the room.<,>她快乐的样子让房间都明亮起来。<,>a(向)+spect(看)→看的方向→方面<,>respect(n.尊敬)/inspect(v.检查)/suspect(v.怀疑)  

fertile<,>/ˈfɜːtaɪl/<,>/ˈfɜːrtl/<,>adj.肥沃的<,>The Nile delta is very fertile.<,>尼罗河三角洲非常肥沃。<,>She has a fertile imagination.<,>她有丰富的想象力。<,>This land is fertile for growing crops.<,>这片土地适合种植庄稼。<,>fer(带来)+tile→能带来丰收的→肥沃的<,>futile(adj.徒劳的)/fertilize(v.施肥)/fertility(n.肥沃)  

chamber<,>/ˈtʃeɪmbə(r)/<,>/ˈtʃeɪmbər/<,>n.室/n.腔/n.会议室/n.房间<,>The heart has four chambers.<,>心脏有四个腔室。<,>The jury retired to the deliberation chamber.<,>陪审团退庭到评议室商议。<,>He booked a chamber in the old castle.<,>他在古堡里订了一个房间。<,>chamb(房间)+er→房间<,>chamberlain(n.管家)/chameleon(n.变色龙)/champagne(n.香槟)  

rotary<,>/ˈrəʊtəri/<,>/ˈroʊtəri/<,>adj.旋转的/adj.转动的<,>The rotary blades of the helicopter create lift.<,>直升机的旋转叶片产生升力。<,>This is a rotary printing press.<,>这是一台轮转印刷机。<,>The engine has a rotary motion.<,>这台发动机有旋转运动。<,>rot(旋转)+ary(形容词后缀)→旋转的<,>rotate(v.旋转)/rotor(n.转子)/rotund(adj.圆胖的)  

elbow<,>/ˈelbəʊ/<,>/ˈelboʊ/<,>n.肘/n.肘部/n.弯管<,>He rested his elbows on the table.<,>他把肘部放在桌子上。<,>The pipe has a 90-degree elbow.<,>这根管子有一个90度的弯头。<,>She nudged me with her elbow.<,>她用肘轻轻推了我一下。<,>el(旧时长度单位)+bow(弯曲)→弯曲的部位→肘部<,>rainbow(n.彩虹)/elbowroom(n.活动空间)/elbow-grease(n.费力的工作)
dye<,>/daɪ/<,>/daɪ/<,>v.染/n.染料/n.染色<,>She dyed her hair blonde.<,>她把头发染成了金色。<,>The dye is made from natural ingredients.<,>这种染料是用天然成分制成的。<,>The fabric holds the dye well.<,>这种布料很上色。<,>die(死亡)+y→染色的过程像"死亡"一样改变颜色<,>die(v.死亡)/dyer(n.染色工)/dyeing(n.染色工艺)

condition<,>/kənˈdɪʃn/<,>/kənˈdɪʃən/<,>n.状况/n.状态/n.环境<,>The car is in excellent condition.<,>这辆车的状况非常好。<,>Working conditions have improved.<,>工作环境已经改善了。<,>His medical condition is stable.<,>他的身体状况稳定。<,>con(共同)+dit(说)+ion→共同说出的情况→状况<,>position(n.位置)/edition(n.版本)/addition(n.增加)

deaf<,>/def/<,>/dɛf/<,>adj.聋的/adj.不愿听的<,>He's been deaf since birth.<,>他天生耳聋。<,>She turned a deaf ear to my advice.<,>她对我的建议充耳不闻。<,>The loud music made him temporarily deaf.<,>巨大的音乐声让他暂时失聪。<,>dead(死的)+f→像死了一样听不见→聋的<,>death(n.死亡)/deed(n.行为)/deep(adj.深的)

prize<,>/praɪz/<,>/praɪz/<,>n.奖赏/n.奖金/v.珍视<,>She won first prize in the competition.<,>她在比赛中获得了一等奖。<,>He prizes his family above all else.<,>他把家庭看得比什么都重要。<,>The Nobel Prize is awarded annually.<,>诺贝尔奖每年颁发一次。<,>price(价格)+z→比价格更珍贵的东西→奖赏<,>price(n.价格)/prise(v.撬开)/praise(v.赞美)

knit<,>/nɪt/<,>/nɪt/<,>v.把...编结<,>My grandmother taught me to knit.<,>我祖母教我编织。<,>The broken bones will knit together in time.<,>骨折会及时愈合。<,>She's knitting a sweater for her grandson.<,>她正在为孙子织毛衣。<,>k(像两根针)+nit(结)→用针打结→编织<,>knot(n.结)/nit(n.虱卵)/kit(n.成套工具)

neither<,>/ˈnaɪðə(r)/<,>/ˈniðɚ/<,>adj.(两者)都不的<,>Neither answer is correct.<,>两个答案都不对。<,>I like neither coffee nor tea.<,>我既不喜欢咖啡也不喜欢茶。<,>Neither of them came to the party.<,>他们两个都没来参加聚会。<,>n(否定)+either(任一)→两者都不<,>either(任一)/nether(下面的)/weather(n.天气)

register<,>/ˈredʒɪstə(r)/<,>/ˈrɛdʒɪstɚ/<,>n.登记/n.注册/v.登记/v.注册<,>Please register at the front desk.<,>请在前台登记。<,>The thermometer registered 30 degrees.<,>温度计显示30度。<,>She's registered for the conference.<,>她已经报名参加会议了。<,>re(再)+gister(带来)→再次带来信息→登记<,>registry(n.登记处)/gesture(n.手势)/sister(n.姐妹)

flu<,>/fluː/<,>/flu/<,>n.流行性感冒<,>I caught the flu last winter.<,>我去年冬天得了流感。<,>Flu season usually peaks in January.<,>流感季节通常在1月达到高峰。<,>She stayed home with a bad case of the flu.<,>她因患严重流感呆在家里。<,>flew(飞)的谐音→流感像飞一样传播<,>flue(n.烟道)/flew(v.飞过去式)/flute(n.长笛)

petrol<,>/ˈpetrəl/<,>/ˈpɛtrəl/<,>n.(英)汽油<,>We need to stop for petrol.<,>我们需要停下来加油。<,>Petrol prices have risen again.<,>汽油价格又上涨了。<,>The car runs on unleaded petrol.<,>这辆车使用无铅汽油。<,>petr(石头)+ol(油)→从石头中提取的油→汽油<,>patrol(v.巡逻)/petrel(n.海燕)/petal(n.花瓣)

continent<,>/ˈkɒntɪnənt/<,>/ˈkɑːntɪnənt/<,>n.大陆/n.陆地/n.洲<,>Africa is the second largest continent.<,>非洲是第二大洲。<,>The continent was covered with ice during the Ice Age.<,>冰河时期大陆被冰覆盖。<,>They traveled across the continent by train.<,>他们乘火车横穿大陆。<,>con(一起)+tin(保持)+ent→保持在一起的陆地→大陆<,>content(n.内容)/contain(v.包含)/continent(adj.节制的)
echo<,>/ˈekəʊ/<,>/ˈekoʊ/<,>n.回声/n.反响/v.重复<,>Her voice echoed through the empty hall.<,>她的声音在空荡的大厅里回荡。<,>The decision was an echo of public opinion.<,>这个决定是民意的反响。<,>He echoed his teacher's words.<,>他重复了老师的话。<,>eco(生态)+ho(呼喊)→生态呼喊→回声<,>ego(n.自我)/epoch(n.纪元)/eerie(adj.怪异的)

boil<,>/bɔɪl/<,>/bɔɪl/<,>v.沸腾/v.汽化/v.煮沸<,>Water boils at 100°C.<,>水在100摄氏度时沸腾。<,>She boiled the eggs for breakfast.<,>她煮了鸡蛋当早餐。<,>His anger boiled over during the meeting.<,>会议期间他的怒火爆发了。<,>b(水)+oil(油)→水油沸腾<,>broil(v.烤)/foil(n.箔/v.挫败)/coil(v.盘绕)

accident<,>/ˈæksɪdənt/<,>/ˈæksɪdənt/<,>n.意外事件/n.事故<,>He was injured in a car accident.<,>他在一场车祸中受伤了。<,>The discovery was a happy accident.<,>这个发现是个幸运的意外。<,>Accidents will happen in the best regulated families.<,>家规再严，事端难免。<,>ac(向)+cid(落下)+ent→突然落下的→意外<,>incident(n.事件)/coincident(adj.巧合的)/accidental(adj.偶然的)

log<,>/lɒɡ/<,>/lɔːɡ/<,>n.原木/n.木料<,>They floated logs down the river.<,>他们把原木顺流漂下。<,>He chopped the log into firewood.<,>他把原木劈成柴火。<,>The cabin was built of pine logs.<,>这个小屋是用松木建造的。<,>lo(看)+g(木头)→看木头→原木<,>lag(v.落后)/lug(v.拖拽)/blog(n.博客)

cheat<,>/tʃiːt/<,>/tʃiːt/<,>v.骗取/v.哄<,>He cheated in the exam by using a hidden note.<,>他在考试中作弊用了小抄。<,>Don't let them cheat you out of your money.<,>别让他们骗走你的钱。<,>She felt cheated by the false advertisement.<,>她觉得自己被虚假广告欺骗了。<,>che(车)+at(在)→在车上行骗<,>cheap(adj.便宜的)/chest(n.胸部)/wheat(n.小麦)

grass<,>/ɡrɑːs/<,>/ɡræs/<,>n.草/n.牧草/n.草地<,>The grass needs cutting.<,>草坪需要修剪了。<,>Cows were grazing on the lush grass.<,>奶牛在茂盛的草地上吃草。<,>Don't let the grass grow under your feet.<,>不要拖延时间。<,>gr(生长)+ass(驴)→驴吃的生长物→草<,>glass(n.玻璃)/grasp(v.抓住)/grace(n.优雅)

desire<,>/dɪˈzaɪə(r)/<,>/dɪˈzaɪər/<,>v.想要/v.要求/n.愿望<,>He desires to travel around the world.<,>他渴望环游世界。<,>She has a strong desire for success.<,>她对成功有强烈的渴望。<,>We desire your immediate reply.<,>我们希望你立即回复。<,>de(向下)+sire(星星)→向星星许愿<,>despair(n.绝望)/dessert(n.甜点)/desert(n.沙漠)

dense<,>/dens/<,>/dens/<,>adj.密集的/adj.浓厚的<,>The forest was too dense to walk through.<,>森林太茂密了无法穿过。<,>Fog was dense in the valley this morning.<,>今天早晨山谷里雾很浓。<,>He has a dense population of ideas.<,>他脑子里想法很多。<,>den(洞穴)+se(色)→洞穴颜色深→密集<,>dental(adj.牙齿的)/tense(adj.紧张的)/sense(n.感觉)

tank<,>/tæŋk/<,>/tæŋk/<,>n.大容器/n.槽/n.坦克<,>They filled the tank with gasoline.<,>他们把油箱加满了汽油。<,>The fish tank needs cleaning.<,>鱼缸需要清洗了。<,>Military tanks rolled into the city.<,>军用坦克开进了城市。<,>tan(晒)+k(壳)→晒壳容器→坦克<,>bank(n.银行)/sank(v.下沉)/thank(v.感谢)

restrict<,>/rɪˈstrɪkt/<,>/rɪˈstrɪkt/<,>v.限制/v.限定/v.约束<,>The law restricts smoking in public places.<,>法律限制在公共场所吸烟。<,>Our view was restricted by tall buildings.<,>我们的视线被高楼挡住了。<,>The doctor restricted him to a light diet.<,>医生限制他只能吃清淡食物。<,>re(回)+strict(拉紧)→拉紧限制<,>district(n.地区)/constrict(v.压缩)/restrain(v.抑制)
first<,>/fɜːst/<,>/fɜrst/<,>num.第一/adv.最初<,>She was the first to arrive at the party.<,>她是第一个到达派对的人。<,>First, let's introduce ourselves.<,>首先，让我们自我介绍一下。<,>He first visited Paris in 2010.<,>他最初是在2010年访问巴黎的。<,>fir(火)+st(站立)→火最先站立→第一<,>fast(adj.快的)/fist(n.拳头)/feast(n.盛宴)  

deliver<,>/dɪˈlɪvə(r)/<,>/dɪˈlɪvər/<,>v.投递/v.送交/v.发表<,>The postman delivers letters every morning.<,>邮递员每天早上投递信件。<,>She delivered a powerful speech at the conference.<,>她在会议上发表了有力的演讲。<,>We deliver fresh groceries to your doorstep.<,>我们将新鲜杂货送到您家门口。<,>de(向下)+liver(自由)→把东西自由放下→投递<,>liver(n.肝脏)/diver(n.潜水员)/delirium(n.精神错乱)  

reduce<,>/rɪˈdjuːs/<,>/rɪˈduːs/<,>v.减少/v.减小<,>We need to reduce our expenses this month.<,>我们需要减少这个月的开支。<,>The doctor advised him to reduce sugar intake.<,>医生建议他减少糖的摄入量。<,>The price was reduced by 20%.<,>价格降低了20%。<,>re(回)+duce(引导)→往回引导→减少<,>produce(v.生产)/deduce(v.推断)/seduce(v.引诱)  

aircraft<,>/ˈeəkrɑːft/<,>/ˈerkræft/<,>n.飞机/n.飞行器<,>The aircraft took off smoothly.<,>飞机平稳起飞了。<,>Military aircraft flew over the city.<,>军用飞机飞过城市上空。<,>This aircraft can carry 300 passengers.<,>这架飞行器能搭载300名乘客。<,>air(空气)+craft(工艺)→空中工艺→飞行器<,>spacecraft(n.宇宙飞船)/hovercraft(n.气垫船)/handicraft(n.手工艺品)  

specific<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>/spəˈsɪfɪk/<,>adj.特有的/adj.具体的<,>She gave specific instructions for the project.<,>她为这个项目给出了具体的指示。<,>This plant is specific to tropical regions.<,>这种植物是热带地区特有的。<,>Can you be more specific about your requirements?<,>你能更具体地说明你的要求吗？<,>speci(种类)+fic(做)→按种类做的→具体的<,>special(adj.特别的)/specimen(n.标本)/specify(v.指定)  

scout<,>/skaʊt/<,>/skaʊt/<,>n.侦察员/n.侦察机<,>The scout reported enemy movements.<,>侦察员报告了敌军的动向。<,>They sent out a scout plane to survey the area.<,>他们派出侦察机勘察该地区。<,>He joined the Boy Scouts at age 10.<,>他10岁加入了童子军。<,>s(蛇)+cout(计算)→蛇计算路线→侦察<,>shout(v.喊叫)/sprout(v.发芽)/scorn(v.轻蔑)  

instant<,>/ˈɪnstənt/<,>/ˈɪnstənt/<,>n.瞬间/adj.立即的<,>It all happened in an instant.<,>这一切都发生在一瞬间。<,>We need an instant solution to this problem.<,>我们需要立即解决这个问题。<,>Instant coffee is convenient but not as tasty.<,>速溶咖啡很方便但没那么好喝。<,>in(不)+stant(站立)→不站立→瞬间<,>constant(adj.持续的)/distant(adj.遥远的)/instance(n.例子)  

involve<,>/ɪnˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪnˈvɑːlv/<,>v.使卷入/v.牵涉<,>Don't involve me in your personal problems.<,>别把我卷入你的个人问题中。<,>The project involves a lot of teamwork.<,>这个项目需要很多团队合作。<,>Several departments were involved in the decision.<,>多个部门被牵涉到这个决定中。<,>in(入)+volve(卷)→卷入其中<,>evolve(v.进化)/revolve(v.旋转)/dissolve(v.溶解)  

layout<,>/ˈleɪaʊt/<,>/ˈleɪaʊt/<,>n.布局/n.安排/n.设计<,>I like the layout of this apartment.<,>我喜欢这套公寓的布局。<,>The magazine has a new page layout.<,>这本杂志有了新的版面设计。<,>We need to discuss the office layout.<,>我们需要讨论办公室的安排。<,>lay(放置)+out(出来)→把东西放置出来→布局<,>layoff(n.裁员)/outlay(n.支出)/playout(n.播放)  

business<,>/ˈbɪznəs/<,>/ˈbɪznəs/<,>n.商业/n.生意/n.事务<,>He runs a successful business in London.<,>他在伦敦经营着一家成功的企业。<,>It's none of your business.<,>这不关你的事。<,>Business is booming this quarter.<,>这个季度生意兴隆。<,>busy(忙碌)+ness(状态)→忙碌的状态→生意<,>busyness(n.忙碌状态)/bossiness(n.专横)/baseness(n.卑鄙)

shiver<,>/ˈʃɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈʃɪvər/<,>v.颤抖/v.哆嗦/n.冷颤<,>She shivered in the cold wind.<,>她在寒风中瑟瑟发抖。<,>A shiver ran down his spine when he heard the ghost story.<,>听到鬼故事时他脊背发凉。<,>The dog gave a little shiver and curled up by the fire.<,>狗微微颤抖着蜷缩在火炉旁。<,>shi(拼音"湿")+ver(非常)→湿冷得发抖<,>quiver(v.颤抖)/shudder(v.战栗)/shiver(n.碎片)

contradiction<,>/ˌkɒntrəˈdɪkʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːntrəˈdɪkʃn/<,>n.矛盾/n.不一致/n.否认<,>There is a contradiction between his words and actions.<,>他的言行相互矛盾。<,>The witness's testimony was in direct contradiction to the evidence.<,>证人的证词与证据直接矛盾。<,>He flatly contradicted his earlier statement.<,>他断然否认了自己先前的声明。<,>contra(反对)+dict(说)+ion→反对的说法→矛盾<,>contrary(adj.相反的)/contradict(v.反驳)/contradistinction(n.对比区别)

photograph<,>/ˈfəʊtəɡrɑːf/<,>/ˈfoʊtəɡræf/<,>n.照片/n.相片<,>She took a photograph of the sunset.<,>她拍了一张日落的照片。<,>This photograph brings back many memories.<,>这张照片唤起了许多回忆。<,>He had his photograph taken for the passport.<,>他为护照拍了照片。<,>photo(光)+graph(写)→用光写下的影像→照片<,>photocopy(n.复印件)/photogenic(adj.上相的)/photography(n.摄影术)

sophisticated<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/səˈfɪstɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.老于世故的/adj.高级的<,>She has a sophisticated taste in art.<,>她对艺术有着高雅的品味。<,>The lab is equipped with sophisticated instruments.<,>实验室配备了精密的仪器。<,>His sophisticated manners impressed everyone at the party.<,>他老练的举止给派对上的每个人留下了印象。<,>soph(智慧)+ist(人)+icated→有智慧的人→老练的<,>sophomore(n.大学二年级学生)/philosophy(n.哲学)/sophisticate(v.使变得世故)

exploit<,>/ɪkˈsplɔɪt/<,>/ˈɛkˌsplɔɪt/<,>v.剥削/v.利用/v.开拓<,>The company was accused of exploiting child labor.<,>该公司被指控剥削童工。<,>We should exploit solar energy more efficiently.<,>我们应该更高效地利用太阳能。<,>Early settlers exploited the natural resources of the new land.<,>早期移民开发了新大陆的自然资源。<,>ex(出)+ploit(折叠)→把资源折叠出来→开发<,>explore(v.探索)/explosion(n.爆炸)/exploit(n.英勇事迹)

likewise<,>/ˈlaɪkwaɪz/<,>/ˈlaɪkwaɪz/<,>adv.同样地/adv.也/adv.又<,>He smiled at her, and she did likewise.<,>他向她微笑，她也同样报以微笑。<,>I'll have tea, and you might want to do likewise.<,>我要喝茶，你可能也想同样来一杯。<,>The teacher praised Tom, and likewise praised Mary.<,>老师表扬了汤姆，同样也表扬了玛丽。<,>like(像)+wise(方式)→以同样的方式→同样地<,>otherwise(adv.否则)/clockwise(adv.顺时针地)/likeness(n.相似)

ratio<,>/ˈreɪʃiəʊ/<,>/ˈreɪʃioʊ/<,>n.比/n.比率<,>The ratio of boys to girls in the class is 3:2.<,>班上男女比例是3比2。<,>The school maintains a low student-teacher ratio.<,>学校保持着较低的师生比例。<,>Mix the ingredients in the ratio of two to one.<,>按二比一的比例混合配料。<,>rat(计算)+io→计算出来的比例→比率<,>ration(n.定量)/rate(n.比率)/rational(adj.理性的)

textile<,>/ˈtekstaɪl/<,>/ˈtɛkstaɪl/<,>n.纺织品<,>The city was once famous for its textile industry.<,>这座城市曾以纺织业闻名。<,>She collects antique textiles from around the world.<,>她收藏来自世界各地的古董纺织品。<,>This textile is made from organic cotton.<,>这种纺织品是用有机棉制成的。<,>text(编织)+ile(能)→能编织的东西→纺织品<,>text(n.课文)/texture(n.质地)/textual(adj.文本的)
