arrive<,>/əˈraɪv/<,>/əˈraɪv/<,>v.到达/v.来临/v.达到<,>We will arrive at the airport at 3 pm.<,>我们将在下午3点到达机场。<,>Spring arrives earlier this year.<,>今年春天来得更早。<,>After years of hard work, he finally arrived at success.<,>经过多年努力，他终于获得了成功。<,>ar(加强)+rive(河岸)→到达河岸<,>depart(v.离开)/reach(v.到达)/derive(v.源于)

preferable<,>/ˈprefrəbl/<,>/ˈprɛfərəbəl/<,>adj.更可取的/adj.更好的<,>Staying home is preferable to going out in this weather.<,>这种天气呆在家里比出门更好。<,>The second option seems preferable to the first one.<,>第二个选择似乎比第一个更可取。<,>Early booking is preferable to ensure availability.<,>为了确保有空位，最好提前预订。<,>pre(前)+fer(拿)+able(能)→能优先拿取的<,>preferred(adj.首选的)/favorable(adj.有利的)/prior(adj.优先的)

indifferent<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɪfərənt/<,>adj.冷漠的/adj.不积极的<,>He was indifferent to her feelings.<,>他对她的感受漠不关心。<,>The students were indifferent to the lecture.<,>学生们对讲座不感兴趣。<,>She remained indifferent to all the gossip about her.<,>她对所有关于她的闲言碎语都无动于衷。<,>in(不)+different(不同)→没有不同反应→冷漠<,>different(adj.不同的)/unconcerned(adj.不关心的)/apathetic(adj.冷漠的)

impatient<,>/ɪmˈpeɪʃnt/<,>/ɪmˈpeɪʃənt/<,>adj.不耐烦的/adj.急躁的<,>The children grew impatient waiting for the show to start.<,>孩子们等演出开始等得不耐烦了。<,>He is impatient with slow learners.<,>他对学习慢的人没有耐心。<,>Don't be so impatient - good things take time.<,>别这么急躁-好事需要时间。<,>im(不)+patient(耐心的)→不耐烦的<,>patient(adj.耐心的)/impetuous(adj.冲动的)/hasty(adj.匆忙的)

vapour<,>/ˈveɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈveɪpər/<,>n.汽/n.蒸气<,>Hot water produces vapour in cold air.<,>热水在冷空气中会产生蒸汽。<,>The bathroom mirror was covered with vapour after the shower.<,>淋浴后浴室镜子上布满了水汽。<,>Scientists study water vapour in the atmosphere.<,>科学家研究大气中的水蒸气。<,>vap(蒸汽)+our(我们的)→我们看到的蒸汽<,>steam(n.蒸汽)/mist(n.薄雾)/fume(n.烟雾)

chemist<,>/ˈkemɪst/<,>/ˈkɛmɪst/<,>n.化学家/n.药剂师<,>The chemist discovered a new element.<,>这位化学家发现了一种新元素。<,>You can buy this medicine at the chemist's.<,>你可以在药店买到这种药。<,>She works as a chemist in a pharmaceutical company.<,>她在一家制药公司担任化学师。<,>chem(化学)+ist(人)→研究化学的人<,>pharmacist(n.药剂师)/scientist(n.科学家)/biologist(n.生物学家)

novel<,>/ˈnɒvl/<,>/ˈnɑːvl/<,>n.小说/adj.新的<,>She is writing her first novel.<,>她正在写她的第一部小说。<,>This is a novel approach to solving the problem.<,>这是解决问题的新方法。<,>The scientist proposed a novel theory about the origin of life.<,>这位科学家提出了一个关于生命起源的新理论。<,>nov(新)+el(小)→新的小故事<,>new(adj.新的)/innovation(n.创新)/story(n.故事)

forward<,>/ˈfɔːwəd/<,>/ˈfɔrwərd/<,>adv.向前/adv.今后/adv.往后<,>Please step forward when your name is called.<,>叫到你名字时请向前一步。<,>Looking forward, we need to make some changes.<,>展望未来，我们需要做出一些改变。<,>He leaned forward to hear better.<,>他向前倾身以便听得更清楚。<,>fore(前)+ward(方向)→向前<,>backward(adv.向后)/onward(adv.向前)/forth(adv.向前)
civilize<,>/ˈsɪvɪlaɪz/<,>/ˈsɪvəˌlaɪz/<,>v.使文明/v.教育<,>Education helps to civilize people.<,>教育有助于教化人们。<,>They tried to civilize the native tribes.<,>他们试图教化土著部落。<,>Reading can civilize the mind.<,>阅读可以陶冶心智。<,>civil(文明)+ize(使…化)→使文明<,>civil(adj.公民的/n.平民)/civilian(n.平民/adj.民用的)

nail<,>/neɪl/<,>/neɪl/<,>n.钉/n.指甲/v.钉<,>He hammered a nail into the wall.<,>他把钉子钉进墙里。<,>She painted her nails red.<,>她把指甲涂成红色。<,>Please nail the poster to the board.<,>请把海报钉在板上。<,>nail(指甲)→像钉子一样坚硬<,>snail(n.蜗牛)/fail(v.失败)/mail(n.邮件)

harsh<,>/hɑːʃ/<,>/hɑːrʃ/<,>adj.严厉的/adj.刺耳的<,>The teacher gave him a harsh punishment.<,>老师给了他严厉的惩罚。<,>The harsh light hurt my eyes.<,>刺眼的光线伤害了我的眼睛。<,>His voice was harsh and unpleasant.<,>他的声音刺耳难听。<,>har(看作hard)+sh→非常硬→严厉的<,>hash(n.剁碎的食物)/hush(v.安静)

fail<,>/feɪl/<,>/feɪl/<,>v.失败/v.不能/v.失灵<,>He failed the driving test twice.<,>他两次驾照考试都没通过。<,>The engine failed during the flight.<,>发动机在飞行途中失灵了。<,>Words fail to express my gratitude.<,>言语无法表达我的感激。<,>f(看作fall)+ail(病)→病倒→失败<,>fall(v.落下)/fail(v.失败)/file(n.文件)

disturb<,>/dɪˈstɜːb/<,>/dɪˈstɜːrb/<,>v.打扰/v.扰乱/v.弄乱<,>Don't disturb him while he's working.<,>他工作时不要打扰他。<,>The noise disturbed my sleep.<,>噪音干扰了我的睡眠。<,>Someone has disturbed my papers.<,>有人翻乱了我的文件。<,>dis(分开)+turb(搅动)→搅乱→打扰<,>distort(v.扭曲)/distress(n.苦恼)

favourable<,>/ˈfeɪvərəbl/<,>/ˈfeɪvərəbəl/<,>adj.赞成的/adj.有利的<,>The weather is favourable for a picnic.<,>天气很适合野餐。<,>He gave a favourable reply.<,>他给出了赞同的答复。<,>The terms of the contract are favourable.<,>合同条款很有利。<,>favour(喜爱)+able(可…的)→有利的<,>favourite(adj.最喜欢的)/flavourable(错误拼写)

exciting<,>/ɪkˈsaɪtɪŋ/<,>/ɪkˈsaɪtɪŋ/<,>adj.令人兴奋的<,>It was an exciting football match.<,>这是一场激动人心的足球比赛。<,>The news is really exciting.<,>这个消息真令人兴奋。<,>She leads an exciting life.<,>她过着刺激的生活。<,>ex(出)+cite(唤起)+ing→唤起情绪的→令人兴奋的<,>excite(v.使兴奋)/exacting(adj.苛求的)

seize<,>/siːz/<,>/siːz/<,>v.抓住/v.夺取/v.逮捕<,>The police seized the stolen goods.<,>警方缴获了赃物。<,>He seized the opportunity to speak.<,>他抓住了发言的机会。<,>The army seized control of the city.<,>军队夺取了城市的控制权。<,>se(看作see)+ize→看到就抓住→抓住<,>size(n.尺寸)/cease(v.停止)

day<,>/deɪ/<,>/deɪ/<,>n.(一)天/n.白昼/n.白天<,>I'll see you the day after tomorrow.<,>我后天见你。<,>It's a beautiful day today.<,>今天天气真好。<,>She works day and night.<,>她日夜工作。<,>day(日)→太阳升起的时间<,>day(n.天)/dairy(n.乳制品)/daily(adj.每日的)

onto<,>/ˈɒntə/<,>/ˈɑːntə/<,>prep.到...上<,>He jumped onto the horse.<,>他跳上了马背。<,>The cat climbed onto the roof.<,>猫爬上了屋顶。<,>She stepped onto the stage.<,>她走上了舞台。<,>on(在...上)+to(到)→到...上<,>into(prep.到...里)/upon(prep.在...上)
ninety<,>/ˈnaɪnti/<,>/ˈnaɪnti/<,>num.九十/num.九十个<,>She is ninety years old.<,>她九十岁了。<,>There are ninety students in the classroom.<,>教室里有九十个学生。<,>The temperature reached ninety degrees.<,>温度达到了九十度。<,>nine(九)+ty(表示十的倍数)→九十<,>nineteen(num.十九)/ninth(adj.第九的)/nineties(n.九十年代)  

application<,>/ˌæplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌæplɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.请求/n.申请/n.施用<,>He submitted an application for the job.<,>他提交了这份工作的申请。<,>The application of this theory is complex.<,>这个理论的应用很复杂。<,>She made an application to join the club.<,>她申请加入俱乐部。<,>apply(申请)+cation(名词后缀)→申请<,>appliance(n.器具)/applicant(n.申请人)/applied(adj.应用的)  

plot<,>/plɒt/<,>/plɑːt/<,>n.小块土地/v.密谋<,>They bought a small plot of land to build a house.<,>他们买了一块小地来建房子。<,>The criminals plotted to rob the bank.<,>罪犯密谋抢劫银行。<,>The novel has an interesting plot.<,>这本小说有个有趣的剧情。<,>p(片)+lot(许多)→一小片地<,>pot(n.罐)/plat(n.平面图)/plod(v.沉重行走)  

hotel<,>/həʊˈtel/<,>/hoʊˈtel/<,>n.旅馆<,>We stayed at a five-star hotel in Paris.<,>我们住在巴黎的一家五星级酒店。<,>The hotel offers excellent service.<,>这家旅馆提供优质服务。<,>He works as a manager in a hotel.<,>他在一家旅馆当经理。<,>hot(热)+el(场所)→提供温暖休息的场所<,>hostel(n.青年旅舍)/motel(n.汽车旅馆)/hospital(n.医院)  

encourage<,>/ɪnˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>v.鼓励/v.支持/v.助长<,>The teacher encouraged the students to ask questions.<,>老师鼓励学生提问。<,>His success encouraged me to try harder.<,>他的成功激励我更努力。<,>Warm weather encourages plant growth.<,>温暖的天气助长植物生长。<,>en(使)+courage(勇气)→使有勇气→鼓励<,>discourage(v.使气馁)/courage(n.勇气)/encouragement(n.鼓励)  

concentrate<,>/ˈkɒnsntreɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːnsntreɪt/<,>v.集中/v.聚集/v.浓缩<,>You need to concentrate on your work.<,>你需要集中精力工作。<,>The population is concentrated in cities.<,>人口集中在城市。<,>This juice is concentrated.<,>这是浓缩果汁。<,>con(共同)+centr(中心)+ate(动词后缀)→集中到中心<,>central(adj.中心的)/concentration(n.集中)/centrifuge(n.离心机)  

achievement<,>/əˈtʃiːvmənt/<,>/əˈtʃiːvmənt/<,>n.成就/n.成绩/n.完成<,>Winning the award was a great achievement.<,>赢得这个奖项是个巨大成就。<,>Her academic achievements are impressive.<,>她的学术成绩令人印象深刻。<,>The achievement of this goal took years.<,>完成这个目标花了数年时间。<,>achieve(实现)+ment(名词后缀)→成就<,>achieve(v.实现)/achiever(n.成功者)/mischievous(adj.淘气的)  

comparison<,>/kəmˈpærɪsn/<,>/kəmˈpærɪsn/<,>n.比较/n.对照/n.比拟<,>There's no comparison between these two products.<,>这两种产品无法相提并论。<,>She made a comparison of different brands.<,>她对不同品牌进行了比较。<,>The comparison with his brother is unfair.<,>和他兄弟比较是不公平的。<,>compare(比较)+ison(名词后缀)→比较<,>comparable(adj.可比较的)/comparative(adj.比较的)/compartment(n.隔间)  

build<,>/bɪld/<,>/bɪld/<,>v.建筑/v.建立/v.创立<,>They plan to build a new school here.<,>他们计划在这里建一所新学校。<,>It takes time to build trust.<,>建立信任需要时间。<,>He built his business from scratch.<,>他白手起家创立了企业。<,>b(表示"基础")+uild(建造)→建筑<,>builder(n.建造者)/building(n.建筑物)/rebuild(v.重建)  

bosom<,>/ˈbʊzəm/<,>/ˈbʊzəm/<,>n.胸/n.胸部/n.内心<,>The baby slept on her mother's bosom.<,>婴儿在母亲胸前睡着了。<,>He kept the secret in his bosom.<,>他把秘密藏在心里。<,>She felt a pain in her bosom.<,>她感到胸部疼痛。<,>bo(身体)+som(部位)→身体部位→胸部<,>blossom(n.花朵)/boom(n.繁荣)/bottom(n.底部)
bother<,>/ˈbɒðə(r)/<,>/ˈbɑːðər/<,>v.烦扰/v.迷惑/n.麻烦<,>Don't bother me while I'm working.<,>我工作时别来烦我。<,>It's no bother at all to help you.<,>帮助你一点也不麻烦。<,>He was bothered by the strange noise.<,>他被奇怪的声音所困扰。<,>brother(兄弟)去掉r→烦扰<,>brother(n.兄弟)/both(adj.两者)/bottle(n.瓶子)

festival<,>/ˈfestɪvl/<,>/ˈfɛstəvəl/<,>n.节/n.节庆/n.会演/n.节日<,>The film festival attracts many celebrities.<,>电影节吸引了许多名人。<,>We celebrate the Spring Festival every year.<,>我们每年都庆祝春节。<,>The music festival was a huge success.<,>音乐节取得了巨大成功。<,>fest(节日)+ival→节日<,>festive(adj.节日的)/feast(n.盛宴)/festoon(n.花彩)

ensure<,>/ɪnˈʃʊə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈʃʊr/<,>v.保证/v.保护/v.赋予<,>This medicine will ensure you a good night's sleep.<,>这种药能保证你睡个好觉。<,>We must ensure the safety of our children.<,>我们必须保证孩子们的安全。<,>The contract ensures your rights.<,>这份合同保障你的权利。<,>en(使)+sure(确定)→使确定→保证<,>insure(v.保险)/assure(v.使确信)/endure(v.忍受)

face<,>/feɪs/<,>/feɪs/<,>n.脸/n.表面<,>She has a beautiful face.<,>她有一张漂亮的脸。<,>The clock face is easy to read.<,>这个钟面很容易看清。<,>He showed a brave face in difficult times.<,>他在困难时期表现得很勇敢。<,>fac(做)+e→做出来的→脸<,>phase(n.阶段)/fame(n.名声)/fate(n.命运)

handy<,>/ˈhændi/<,>/ˈhændi/<,>adj.便于使用的/adj.手边的<,>Keep a dictionary handy when you read.<,>阅读时手边放本字典很方便。<,>This tool is very handy for small repairs.<,>这个工具很适合小修理。<,>She's handy with a needle and thread.<,>她擅长针线活。<,>hand(手)+y→手边的<,>handle(v.处理/n.把手)/handsome(adj.英俊的)/handful(n.一把)

honesty<,>/ˈɒnəsti/<,>/ˈɑːnəsti/<,>n.诚实/n.正直<,>Honesty is the best policy.<,>诚实是最好的策略。<,>I appreciate your honesty about the matter.<,>我欣赏你在这件事上的诚实。<,>His honesty earned him great respect.<,>他的正直为他赢得了极大的尊重。<,>honest(诚实的)+y→诚实<,>honey(n.蜂蜜)/honor(n.荣誉)/honorary(adj.名誉的)

genuine<,>/ˈdʒenjuɪn/<,>/ˈdʒɛnjuɪn/<,>adj.真的/adj.真正的<,>This is a genuine diamond.<,>这是一颗真钻石。<,>She showed genuine concern for others.<,>她对他人表现出真诚的关心。<,>His apology seemed genuine.<,>他的道歉似乎是真诚的。<,>gen(产生)+uine→天生的→真正的<,>generous(adj.慷慨的)/genius(n.天才)/genus(n.种类)

cycle<,>/ˈsaɪkl/<,>/ˈsaɪkəl/<,>n.循环/n.自行车<,>The water cycle is essential to life.<,>水循环对生命至关重要。<,>I ride my cycle to work every day.<,>我每天骑自行车上班。<,>The seasons follow a natural cycle.<,>季节遵循自然循环。<,>cycl(圆)+e→循环<,>circle(n.圆圈)/recycle(v.回收)/bicycle(n.自行车)

parent<,>/ˈpeərənt/<,>/ˈpɛrənt/<,>n.父亲/n.母亲/n.双亲<,>My parents are very supportive.<,>我的父母非常支持我。<,>She became a parent at the age of 25.<,>她在25岁时成为了父母。<,>Both parents attended the school meeting.<,>父母双方都参加了学校会议。<,>par(生)+ent→生你的人→父母<,>apparent(adj.明显的)/transparent(adj.透明的)/prepare(v.准备)

graph<,>/ɡrɑːf/<,>/ɡræf/<,>n.图/n.图表<,>The graph shows sales figures for the year.<,>这张图显示了年度销售数据。<,>Draw a graph to illustrate your point.<,>画个图表来说明你的观点。<,>This bar graph is easy to understand.<,>这个柱状图很容易理解。<,>graph(写)→写出来的→图表<,>paragraph(n.段落)/photograph(n.照片)/geography(n.地理)
seal<,>/siːl/<,>/sil/<,>n.印记/n.封蜡/v.封<,>The letter was secured with a wax seal.<,>这封信用蜡封密封。<,>They sealed the deal with a handshake.<,>他们握手达成了协议。<,>The jar has a tight seal to keep the contents fresh.<,>罐子密封得很紧以保持内容物新鲜。<,>sea(海)+l(形似锁链)→海上的锁链→封住<,>deal(v.交易/n.协议)/heal(v.治愈)/meal(n.餐食)

strengthen<,>/ˈstreŋθn/<,>/ˈstrɛŋθən/<,>v.加强/v.巩固<,>Exercise can strengthen your muscles.<,>锻炼可以增强你的肌肉。<,>The team needs to strengthen their defense.<,>球队需要加强防守。<,>This agreement will strengthen our partnership.<,>这项协议将巩固我们的伙伴关系。<,>strength(力量)+en(使)→使有力量→加强<,>lengthen(v.延长)/widen(v.加宽)/heighten(v.提高)

deny<,>/dɪˈnaɪ/<,>/dɪˈnaɪ/<,>v.否定/v.拒绝相信<,>He denied all the accusations against him.<,>他否认了对他的所有指控。<,>She was denied entry to the club.<,>她被拒绝进入俱乐部。<,>You can't deny the fact that climate change is real.<,>你不能否认气候变化是真实存在的。<,>de(向下)+ny(音似"no")→向下说不→否认<,>defy(v.违抗)/decry(v.谴责)/delay(v.延迟)

empire<,>/ˈempaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈɛmpaɪɚ/<,>n.帝国<,>The Roman Empire lasted for centuries.<,>罗马帝国持续了几个世纪。<,>He built a business empire from scratch.<,>他白手起家建立了一个商业帝国。<,>The British Empire once spanned the globe.<,>大英帝国曾经横跨全球。<,>em(使)+pire(看作"power")→使有权力→帝国<,>umpire(n.裁判)/expire(v.到期)/aspire(v.渴望)

surgery<,>/ˈsɜːdʒəri/<,>/ˈsɜrdʒəri/<,>n.外科/n.外科手术<,>He underwent heart surgery last month.<,>他上个月接受了心脏手术。<,>The doctor specializes in plastic surgery.<,>这位医生专攻整形外科。<,>Surgery will be performed under general anesthesia.<,>手术将在全身麻醉下进行。<,>sur(上)+gery(工作)→在上面工作→外科手术<,>survey(n.调查/v.测量)/surge(n.巨浪/v.汹涌)

fortune<,>/ˈfɔːtʃuːn/<,>/ˈfɔrtʃən/<,>n.运气/n.巨款/n.命运<,>She had the good fortune to meet her idol.<,>她有幸见到了她的偶像。<,>He made a fortune in the stock market.<,>他在股市赚了一大笔钱。<,>Fortune favors the brave.<,>命运眷顾勇者。<,>fort(堡垒)+une→堡垒里的财富→巨款<,>misfortune(n.不幸)/fortunate(adj.幸运的)/fortify(v.加强)

interesting<,>/ˈɪntrəstɪŋ/<,>/ˈɪntrəstɪŋ/<,>adj.有趣的/adj.引人入胜的<,>This book is really interesting.<,>这本书真的很有趣。<,>She told me an interesting story about her travels.<,>她给我讲了一个关于她旅行的有趣故事。<,>The lecture was so interesting that no one left early.<,>讲座太有趣了，没有人提前离开。<,>interest(兴趣)+ing→引起兴趣的<,>interested(adj.感兴趣的)/uninteresting(adj.无趣的)

project<,>/ˈprɒdʒekt/<,>/ˈprɑdʒɛkt/<,>n.方案/n.工程/v.伸出<,>The company is working on a new project.<,>公司正在进行一个新项目。<,>The bridge project will take two years to complete.<,>这座桥梁工程需要两年时间完成。<,>The tree projects its shadow on the wall.<,>树的影子投射在墙上。<,>pro(向前)+ject(投掷)→向前投→方案<,>object(n.物体/v.反对)/reject(v.拒绝)/inject(v.注射)

again<,>/əˈɡen/<,>/əˈɡɛn/<,>adv.又一次/adv.而且<,>Please say that again.<,>请再说一遍。<,>He failed the test but decided to try again.<,>他考试不及格但决定再试一次。<,>Again, I must remind you to be careful.<,>而且，我必须提醒你要小心。<,>a(一)+gain(获得)→又一次获得<,>against(prep.反对)/gainsay(v.否认)/regain(v.重新获得)

favour<,>/ˈfeɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈfeɪvɚ/<,>n.恩惠/n.赞同<,>Could you do me a favour?<,>你能帮我个忙吗？<,>The plan found favour with the committee.<,>这个计划得到了委员会的赞同。<,>He returned the favour by helping her move.<,>他通过帮她搬家来回报这个恩惠。<,>fav(看作"fave"最爱)+our→我们最爱的→恩惠<,>flavor(n.味道)/fever(n.发烧)/favor(v.偏爱)
fleet<,>/fliːt/<,>/flit/<,>n.舰队/n.机群<,>The navy has a powerful fleet.<,>海军拥有一支强大的舰队。<,>The airline operates a fleet of modern aircraft.<,>这家航空公司运营着一支现代化机群。<,>The fishing fleet returned to the harbor at dawn.<,>渔船队在黎明时分返回港口。<,>flee(逃跑)+t→逃跑的船队→舰队<,>flee(v.逃跑)/feet(n.脚)/fleet(adj.快速的)

mankind<,>/mænˈkaɪnd/<,>/ˈmænˌkaɪnd/<,>n.人类<,>Mankind has made great progress in science.<,>人类在科学上取得了巨大进步。<,>The history of mankind is full of conflicts.<,>人类的历史充满了冲突。<,>We must protect the environment for future generations of mankind.<,>我们必须为人类的未来世代保护环境。<,>man(人)+kind(种类)→人类<,>humankind(n.人类)/mankind(n.男性)

liter<,>/ˈliːtə(r)/<,>/ˈlidər/<,>n.升(容量单位)<,>This bottle contains two liters of water.<,>这个瓶子装有两升水。<,>The car's fuel consumption is 8 liters per 100 kilometers.<,>这辆车的油耗是每百公里8升。<,>I need to buy a liter of milk from the store.<,>我需要从商店买一升牛奶。<,>lit(点燃)+er→测量液体体积的单位<,>liter(n.升)/litter(n.垃圾/v.乱扔)

mechanics<,>/məˈkænɪks/<,>/məˈkænɪks/<,>n.力学<,>He is studying the mechanics of fluid motion.<,>他正在研究流体运动的力学。<,>The mechanics of this machine are quite complex.<,>这台机器的力学原理相当复杂。<,>Understanding quantum mechanics is challenging.<,>理解量子力学很有挑战性。<,>mechan(机械)+ics(学科)→力学<,>mechanic(n.机械师)/machine(n.机器)

schedule<,>/ˈʃedjuːl/<,>/ˈskedʒuːl/<,>n.计划表/n.时间表<,>Please check the schedule for the meeting time.<,>请查看会议时间表。<,>I have a busy schedule this week.<,>我这周的时间表很满。<,>The train is running behind schedule.<,>火车晚点了。<,>sched(纸)+ule→写在纸上的计划<,>schema(n.图解)/scheme(n.计划)

crystal<,>/ˈkrɪstl/<,>/ˈkrɪstəl/<,>n.结晶体/n.晶粒/n.水晶<,>The snowflakes formed perfect crystals.<,>雪花形成了完美的结晶体。<,>She wore a necklace made of crystal.<,>她戴着一条水晶项链。<,>The crystal structure of diamonds is very strong.<,>钻石的晶体结构非常坚固。<,>cry(哭)+stal→像眼泪一样透明的水晶<,>crisp(adj.脆的)/crystal(n.水晶)

letter<,>/ˈletə(r)/<,>/ˈlɛtər/<,>n.信/n.字母<,>I received a letter from my friend abroad.<,>我收到了国外朋友的来信。<,>The English alphabet has 26 letters.<,>英语字母表有26个字母。<,>Please write your name in capital letters.<,>请用大写字母写下你的名字。<,>let(让)+ter→让人阅读的东西→信<,>litter(n.垃圾)/latter(adj.后者的)

effective<,>/ɪˈfektɪv/<,>/əˈfɛktɪv/<,>adj.有效的/adj.有影响的<,>This medicine is very effective for headaches.<,>这种药对头痛很有效。<,>She gave an effective presentation.<,>她做了一个很有影响力的演讲。<,>The new policy will become effective next month.<,>新政策将于下月生效。<,>effect(效果)+ive→有效果的<,>affective(adj.情感的)/effective(adj.有效的)

eye<,>/aɪ/<,>/aɪ/<,>n.眼睛/n.眼力<,>She has beautiful blue eyes.<,>她有一双漂亮的蓝眼睛。<,>He has a good eye for detail.<,>他对细节很有眼力。<,>Keep an eye on your luggage at the airport.<,>在机场要看好你的行李。<,>ey(看)+e→用来看的器官<,>aye(adv.永远)/eye(n.眼睛)

card<,>/kɑːd/<,>/kɑrd/<,>n.卡/n.卡片/n.名片<,>Please show your ID card at the entrance.<,>请在入口处出示你的身份证。<,>I sent her a birthday card.<,>我给她寄了一张生日贺卡。<,>Here's my business card with my contact information.<,>这是我的名片，上面有我的联系方式。<,>car(汽车)+d→像汽车一样随身携带的卡片<,>cart(n.手推车)/cord(n.绳索)
bush<,>/bʊʃ/<,>/bʊʃ/<,>n.灌木/n.灌木丛/n.矮树<,>The rabbit hid in the bush.<,>兔子躲在灌木丛中。<,>We cleared the bushes to make a path.<,>我们清理了灌木丛开辟一条小路。<,>The garden was full of flowering bushes.<,>花园里开满了灌木花。<,>发音类似“不湿”→灌木丛不湿<,>brush(n.刷子/v.刷)/push(v.推/n.推动)

rouse<,>/raʊz/<,>/raʊz/<,>v.唤醒/v.唤起/v.惊起<,>The loud noise roused the baby from sleep.<,>巨大的噪音把婴儿从睡梦中惊醒。<,>His speech roused the crowd to action.<,>他的演讲唤起了人群的行动。<,>The hunter roused a deer from the bushes.<,>猎人从灌木丛中惊起一只鹿。<,>rou(谐音“扰”)+se(谐音“醒”)→扰醒→唤醒<,>arouse(v.唤醒/v.激起)/rise(v.上升/n.上涨)

reflexion<,>/rɪˈflekʃən/<,>/rɪˈflekʃən/<,>n.映象/n.反映/n.反射<,>The lake gave a perfect reflexion of the mountains.<,>湖面完美地映出了山的倒影。<,>Her actions are a reflexion of her upbringing.<,>她的行为反映了她所受的教育。<,>The mirror's reflexion was distorted.<,>镜子的映象是扭曲的。<,>re(回)+flex(弯曲)+ion(名词后缀)→弯曲返回→反射<,>reflection(美式拼写)/deflection(n.偏斜/n.偏差)

Arabian<,>/əˈreɪbiən/<,>/əˈreɪbiən/<,>adj.阿拉伯的<,>She bought an Arabian carpet.<,>她买了一块阿拉伯地毯。<,>The Arabian Nights is a famous collection of stories.<,>《一千零一夜》是著名的故事集。<,>Arabian horses are known for their beauty.<,>阿拉伯马以美丽著称。<,>Arab(阿拉伯)+ian(形容词后缀)→阿拉伯的<,>Asian(adj.亚洲的)/Arctic(adj.北极的)

widen<,>/ˈwaɪdən/<,>/ˈwaɪdən/<,>v.变宽/v.加宽<,>The road will be widened next year.<,>这条路明年将会加宽。<,>Her eyes widened in surprise.<,>她惊讶地睁大了眼睛。<,>The gap between rich and poor is widening.<,>贫富差距正在扩大。<,>wide(宽的)+en(使...)→使变宽<,>widen(v.加宽)/whiten(v.变白)

violent<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>adj.暴力的/adj.强暴的/adj.猛烈的/adj.狂暴的<,>The movie contains violent scenes.<,>这部电影包含暴力场景。<,>A violent storm damaged the crops.<,>猛烈的暴风雨毁坏了庄稼。<,>He has a violent temper.<,>他脾气暴躁。<,>vio(谐音“威”)+lent(谐音“冷”)→威冷→暴力冷酷的<,>violet(n.紫罗兰/adj.紫色的)/silent(adj.安静的)

basic<,>/ˈbeɪsɪk/<,>/ˈbeɪsɪk/<,>adj.基本的/adj.基础的<,>She has a basic knowledge of French.<,>她有基本的法语知识。<,>This is a basic human right.<,>这是基本人权。<,>The course covers basic computer skills.<,>这门课程涵盖基本的计算机技能。<,>base(基础)+ic(形容词后缀)→基础的<,>basis(n.基础)/acid(n.酸/adj.酸的)

director<,>/dɪˈrektə(r)/<,>/dɪˈrektər/<,>n.理事/n.导演/n.指导者/n.负责人<,>The film director won an award.<,>这位电影导演获奖了。<,>She is the director of the company.<,>她是公司的负责人。<,>The school board has five directors.<,>学校董事会有五位理事。<,>direct(指导)+or(人)→指导者<,>detector(n.探测器)/doctor(n.医生)

own<,>/əʊn/<,>/oʊn/<,>adj.自己的/v.有/v.拥有<,>This is my own car.<,>这是我自己的车。<,>He owns three restaurants.<,>他拥有三家餐厅。<,>She likes to do things her own way.<,>她喜欢按自己的方式做事。<,>own发音类似“哦我”→哦这是我的→自己的<,>owe(v.欠/v.感激)/owl(n.猫头鹰)

commit<,>/kəˈmɪt/<,>/kəˈmɪt/<,>v.犯(错误)/v.干(坏事)<,>He committed a serious crime.<,>他犯下了严重罪行。<,>She committed herself to the project.<,>她全身心投入这个项目。<,>Don't commit the same mistake again.<,>不要再犯同样的错误。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)→一起送出去→犯(错)<,>omit(v.省略/v.遗漏)/submit(v.提交/v.屈服)
ampere<,>/ˈæmpeə(r)/<,>/ˈæmpɪr/<,>n.安培<,>The current is measured in amperes.<,>电流以安培为单位测量。<,>This device can handle up to 10 amperes.<,>这个设备最多可承受10安培电流。<,>One ampere is equal to one coulomb per second.<,>一安培等于每秒一库仑。<,>amp(放大)+ere→电流单位<,>voltage(n.电压)/watt(n.瓦特)/ohm(n.欧姆)

blast<,>/blɑːst/<,>/blæst/<,>n.爆炸/n.冲击波/v.炸<,>The blast shattered windows miles away.<,>爆炸震碎了几英里外的窗户。<,>They blasted a tunnel through the mountain.<,>他们炸穿山体开凿隧道。<,>A blast of cold air hit us as we opened the door.<,>我们开门时一股冷空气扑面而来。<,>b(爆破音)+last(持续)→持续爆破→爆炸<,>blaze(n.火焰/v.燃烧)/burst(v.爆裂/n.突发)/blunt(adj.钝的)

doubtless<,>/ˈdaʊtləs/<,>/ˈdaʊtləs/<,>adv.无疑地/adv.很可能<,>She will doubtless arrive late as usual.<,>她无疑会像往常一样迟到。<,>This is doubtless the best solution.<,>这无疑是最好的解决方案。<,>He doubtless knew about the problem beforehand.<,>他很可能事先就知道这个问题。<,>doubt(怀疑)+less(无)→无疑<,>doubtful(adj.可疑的)/undoubtedly(adv.毋庸置疑地)/dubious(adj.不确定的)

cloak<,>/kləʊk/<,>/kloʊk/<,>n.斗篷/n.覆盖（物）<,>He wore a black cloak that reached the floor.<,>他穿着一件及地的黑色斗篷。<,>The hills were cloaked in mist.<,>群山笼罩在薄雾中。<,>Her kindness was a cloak for her real intentions.<,>她的善良掩盖了她真实的意图。<,>cl(覆盖)+oak(橡树)→像橡树皮一样覆盖→斗篷<,>clock(n.时钟)/clog(v.阻塞)/cloister(n.修道院)

comprehensive<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>adj.广泛的<,>We need a comprehensive plan for the project.<,>我们需要一个全面的项目计划。<,>The encyclopedia provides comprehensive coverage of the subject.<,>这本百科全书全面涵盖了该主题。<,>She has a comprehensive understanding of the issue.<,>她对这个问题有全面的理解。<,>com(完全)+prehend(抓住)+ive→完全抓住的→广泛的<,>comprehensible(adj.可理解的)/apprehensive(adj.忧虑的)/reprehensive(adj.谴责的)

housewife<,>/ˈhaʊswaɪf/<,>/ˈhaʊswaɪf/<,>n.家庭主妇<,>My mother was a traditional housewife.<,>我母亲是个传统的家庭主妇。<,>Modern housewives often have part-time jobs.<,>现代家庭主妇通常有兼职工作。<,>She gave up her career to become a housewife.<,>她放弃事业成为了家庭主妇。<,>house(家)+wife(妻子)→家庭主妇<,>housework(n.家务)/housekeeper(n.管家)/homemaker(n.主妇)

oak<,>/əʊk/<,>/oʊk/<,>n.栎属植物/n.栎木/n.橡木<,>The old oak tree in the yard is over 200 years old.<,>院子里那棵老橡树有200多年历史了。<,>The table is made of solid oak.<,>这张桌子是实心橡木做的。<,>Oak leaves turn brown in autumn.<,>橡树叶在秋天会变成棕色。<,>o(圆形)+ak→橡果形状→橡树<,>maple(n.枫树)/pine(n.松树)/birch(n.桦树)
available<,>/əˈveɪləb(ə)l/<,>/əˈveɪləb(ə)l/<,>adj.可利用的/adj.可获得的/adj.有空的<,>This book is available in the library.<,>这本书在图书馆可以借到。<,>Are you available for a meeting tomorrow?<,>你明天有空开会吗？<,>The information is readily available online.<,>这些信息在网上很容易找到。<,>a(强调)+vail(价值)+able(能够)→有价值的东西可以利用<,>unavailable(adj.不可获得的)/availability(n.可用性)

somebody<,>/ˈsʌmbədi/<,>/ˈsʌmbədi/<,>pron.某人/pron.有人<,>Somebody left their umbrella here.<,>有人把伞落在这里了。<,>I need somebody to help me with this project.<,>我需要有人帮我完成这个项目。<,>She wants to be somebody in the future.<,>她想将来成为重要人物。<,>some(某)+body(人)→某人<,>anybody(pron.任何人)/nobody(pron.没有人)

rotation<,>/rəʊˈteɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/roʊˈteɪʃ(ə)n/<,>n.旋转/n.转动/n.轮换<,>The Earth's rotation causes day and night.<,>地球自转导致昼夜交替。<,>Crop rotation is important for soil health.<,>轮作对土壤健康很重要。<,>The players take turns in rotation.<,>球员们轮流上场。<,>rot(旋转)+ation(名词后缀)→旋转<,>revolution(n.革命/n.公转)/vibration(n.振动)

virtue<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuː/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuː/<,>n.善/n.美德/n.优点<,>Honesty is a great virtue.<,>诚实是一种美德。<,>The virtue of this method is its simplicity.<,>这个方法的优点是简单。<,>She is a woman of virtue.<,>她是个有德行的女人。<,>virt(男子气概)+ue→美德<,>virtual(adj.虚拟的)/virtuoso(n.艺术大师)

urban<,>/ˈɜːbən/<,>/ˈɜːrbən/<,>adj.都市的/adj.住在都市的<,>Urban life can be very hectic.<,>都市生活可能非常忙碌。<,>The urban population is growing rapidly.<,>城市人口正在快速增长。<,>She prefers urban to rural areas.<,>比起农村地区，她更喜欢城市。<,>urb(城市)+an(形容词后缀)→都市的<,>suburban(adj.郊区的)/urbane(adj.彬彬有礼的)

hardware<,>/ˈhɑːdweə(r)/<,>/ˈhɑːrdwer/<,>n.硬件/n.五金器具<,>My computer hardware needs upgrading.<,>我的电脑硬件需要升级。<,>He works in a hardware store.<,>他在五金店工作。<,>The project requires both software and hardware support.<,>这个项目需要软件和硬件的支持。<,>hard(硬的)+ware(物品)→硬件<,>software(n.软件)/hardcover(n.精装书)

annoy<,>/əˈnɔɪ/<,>/əˈnɔɪ/<,>v.使恼怒/v.打搅/v.打扰<,>Loud noises annoy me.<,>噪音让我很烦。<,>Stop annoying your sister!<,>别烦你妹妹了！<,>His constant complaining is beginning to annoy everyone.<,>他不停的抱怨开始惹恼所有人。<,>an(强调)+noy(伤害)→使恼怒<,>annoyance(n.烦恼)/enjoy(v.享受)

centigrade<,>/ˈsentɪɡreɪd/<,>/ˈsentɪɡreɪd/<,>adj.百分度的/adj.摄氏温度的<,>Water boils at 100 degrees centigrade.<,>水在100摄氏度时沸腾。<,>The temperature today is 25 degrees centigrade.<,>今天气温是25摄氏度。<,>The centigrade scale is used in most countries.<,>大多数国家使用摄氏温标。<,>centi(百)+grade(度)→百分度的<,>Fahrenheit(adj.华氏温度的)/centimeter(n.厘米)

ink<,>/ɪŋk/<,>/ɪŋk/<,>n.墨水/n.油墨<,>Please sign your name in ink.<,>请用墨水签名。<,>The printer is running out of ink.<,>打印机快没墨了。<,>Octopuses release ink to escape predators.<,>章鱼释放墨汁来躲避捕食者。<,>与drink(喝)对比记忆，墨水不能喝<,>link(n.链接/v.连接)/pink(adj.粉红色的)
parallel<,>/ˈpærəlel/<,>/ˈpærəˌlɛl/<,>adj.平行的/adj.相同的<,>The two roads are parallel to each other.<,>这两条路互相平行。<,>Their experiences are parallel in many ways.<,>他们的经历在许多方面是相似的。<,>Parallel lines never meet.<,>平行线永不相交。<,>para(旁边)+llel(线)→并排的线→平行的<,>paralyze(v.使瘫痪)/parasite(n.寄生虫)/paragon(n.模范)

naughty<,>/ˈnɔːti/<,>/ˈnɔːti/<,>adj.顽皮的/adj.淘气的<,>The naughty boy drew on the wall.<,>那个淘气的男孩在墙上画画。<,>She gave me a naughty smile.<,>她朝我顽皮地笑了笑。<,>Stop being so naughty!<,>别这么淘气了！<,>naught(零)+y→像零一样无价值→顽皮的<,>naught(n.零)/haughty(adj.傲慢的)/knotty(adj.棘手的)

cassette<,>/kəˈset/<,>/kəˈsɛt/<,>n.盒式录音带<,>I found some old cassettes in the attic.<,>我在阁楼里找到了一些旧磁带。<,>This cassette player still works.<,>这台卡带录音机还能用。<,>She recorded her voice on a cassette.<,>她把声音录在了磁带上。<,>case(盒子)+ette(小)→小盒子→盒式磁带<,>casket(n.首饰盒)/casserole(n.砂锅)/cassock(n.法衣)

fifth<,>/fɪfθ/<,>/fɪfθ/<,>num.第五/n.五分之一<,>He finished fifth in the race.<,>他在比赛中获得了第五名。<,>I'll take a fifth of the profits.<,>我将拿利润的五分之一。<,>This is my fifth visit to Paris.<,>这是我第五次来巴黎。<,>fif(五)+th(序数词后缀)→第五<,>fifty(num.五十)/fifteen(num.十五)/fifthly(adv.第五)

organization<,>/ˌɔːɡənaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɔrɡənəˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.组织/n.团体/n.机构<,>She works for a charitable organization.<,>她为一个慈善机构工作。<,>The organization of the event took months.<,>这次活动的组织花了几个月时间。<,>This organization helps homeless people.<,>这个组织帮助无家可归的人。<,>organ(器官)+ize(使...化)+ation→使成为有机体→组织<,>organize(v.组织)/organism(n.有机体)/organ(n.器官)

hall<,>/hɔːl/<,>/hɔːl/<,>n.门厅/n.过道/n.会堂<,>Wait for me in the hall.<,>在大厅等我。<,>The concert will be held in the town hall.<,>音乐会将在市政厅举行。<,>There's a mirror in the hall.<,>门厅里有面镜子。<,>hal(呼吸)+l→让人呼吸的地方→大厅<,>hail(v.欢呼/n.冰雹)/hale(adj.强壮的)/hell(n.地狱)

prevail<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>v.流行/v.获胜<,>Justice will prevail in the end.<,>正义终将获胜。<,>This custom still prevails in some areas.<,>这个习俗在一些地区仍然流行。<,>Our team prevailed despite the difficulties.<,>尽管困难重重，我们队还是赢了。<,>pre(前)+vail(价值)→价值在前→占优势<,>prevalent(adj.流行的)/avail(v.利用)/veil(n.面纱)

continue<,>/kənˈtɪnjuː/<,>/kənˈtɪnju/<,>v.继续/v.延伸<,>Please continue with your story.<,>请继续讲你的故事。<,>The road continues for another mile.<,>这条路又延伸了一英里。<,>He continued working despite his illness.<,>尽管生病了，他仍继续工作。<,>con(共同)+tin(保持)+ue→共同保持→继续<,>contain(v.包含)/content(n.内容)/continent(n.大陆)

microcomputer<,>/ˈmaɪkrəʊkəmpjuːtə(r)/<,>/ˈmaɪkroʊkəmpjuːtər/<,>n.微型计算机/n.微机<,>This microcomputer is very powerful.<,>这台微型计算机功能很强大。<,>We use microcomputers in our lab.<,>我们在实验室使用微机。<,>The first microcomputer was invented in the 1970s.<,>第一台微型计算机发明于20世纪70年代。<,>micro(微小)+computer(计算机)→微型计算机<,>microscope(n.显微镜)/microphone(n.麦克风)/microchip(n.微芯片)

persist<,>/pəˈsɪst/<,>/pərˈsɪst/<,>v.坚持/v.持续<,>He persists in his belief.<,>他坚持自己的信念。<,>The rain persisted all day.<,>雨持续下了一整天。<,>If symptoms persist, consult a doctor.<,>如果症状持续，请咨询医生。<,>per(完全)+sist(站立)→完全站立→坚持<,>insist(v.坚持)/resist(v.抵抗)/assist(v.协助)
unless<,>/ʌnˈles/<,>/ʌnˈlɛs/<,>conj.除非/conj.如果不<,>You won't pass the exam unless you study hard.<,>除非你努力学习，否则你不会通过考试。<,>Unless it rains, we'll have a picnic tomorrow.<,>如果不下雨，我们明天就去野餐。<,>I won't go unless you come with me.<,>除非你和我一起去，否则我不会去。<,>un(不)+less(更少)→除非<,>until(conj.直到)/lest(conj.以免)/if(conj.如果)

manage<,>/ˈmænɪdʒ/<,>/ˈmænɪdʒ/<,>v.管理/v.设法/v.成功应付<,>She manages a team of 20 people.<,>她管理着一个20人的团队。<,>He managed to finish the project on time.<,>他设法按时完成了项目。<,>Can you manage the heavy box by yourself?<,>你能自己应付这个重箱子吗？<,>man(手)+age(行为)→用手处理→管理<,>manager(n.经理)/management(n.管理)/mangle(v.乱砍)

owner<,>/ˈəʊnə(r)/<,>/ˈoʊnər/<,>n.物主/n.所有人<,>The owner of the shop is very friendly.<,>这家店的老板非常友好。<,>Who is the owner of this car?<,>这辆车的主人是谁？<,>She became the proud owner of a new house.<,>她成为了新房子的骄傲主人。<,>own(拥有)+er(人)→拥有者<,>owe(v.欠)/own(v.拥有)/onerous(adj.繁重的)

weep<,>/wiːp/<,>/wip/<,>v.哭泣/v.流泪<,>The child began to weep when he lost his toy.<,>孩子丢了玩具后开始哭泣。<,>She wept tears of joy at her daughter's wedding.<,>她在女儿的婚礼上流下了喜悦的泪水。<,>The willow trees seem to weep in the wind.<,>柳树在风中似乎在哭泣。<,>wee(小的)+p(象声词)→小声哭泣<,>sweep(v.打扫)/peep(v.偷看)/sleep(v.睡觉)

vacuum<,>/ˈvækjuːm/<,>/ˈvækjuːm/<,>n.真空/n.真空吸尘器<,>Sound cannot travel through a vacuum.<,>声音不能在真空中传播。<,>I need to clean the carpet with the vacuum.<,>我需要用吸尘器清理地毯。<,>Space is a near-perfect vacuum.<,>太空几乎是完美的真空。<,>vac(空)+uum(状态)→真空状态<,>vacant(adj.空缺的)/vacation(n.假期)/vaccine(n.疫苗)
realize<,>/ˈrɪəlaɪz/<,>/ˈriəˌlaɪz/<,>v.认识到/v.实现<,>I didn't realize how late it was.<,>我没有意识到已经这么晚了。<,>She finally realized her dream of becoming a doctor.<,>她终于实现了成为医生的梦想。<,>He realized his mistake too late.<,>他意识到自己的错误时已经太晚了。<,>real(真实的)+ize(使)→使成为真实→实现<,>recognize(v.认出)/actualize(v.实现)/idealize(v.理想化)

predict<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>/prɪˈdɪkt/<,>v.预言/v.预告/v.预测<,>It's hard to predict the weather accurately.<,>很难准确预测天气。<,>The economist predicted a recession next year.<,>经济学家预测明年会出现经济衰退。<,>No one could have predicted this outcome.<,>没有人能预测到这个结果。<,>pre(前)+dict(说)→提前说→预测<,>foretell(v.预言)/prophesy(v.预言)/forecast(v.预报)

portable<,>/ˈpɔːtəbl/<,>/ˈpɔːrtəbl/<,>adj.轻便的/adj.手提的<,>This portable computer is very convenient.<,>这台便携式电脑非常方便。<,>He bought a portable speaker for his trip.<,>他为旅行买了一个便携式扬声器。<,>The device is small and portable.<,>这个设备小巧便携。<,>port(携带)+able(能)→能携带的→便携的<,>mobile(adj.移动的)/transportable(adj.可运输的)/handheld(adj.手持的)

ditch<,>/dɪtʃ/<,>/dɪtʃ/<,>n.沟/n.沟渠/n.渠道<,>The car got stuck in a ditch by the road.<,>汽车陷在路边的沟里了。<,>Farmers use ditches to irrigate their fields.<,>农民用沟渠灌溉田地。<,>They dug a ditch to drain the water.<,>他们挖了一条沟排水。<,>dit(挖)+ch→挖出来的→沟渠<,>trench(n.壕沟)/canal(n.运河)/moat(n.护城河)

relief<,>/rɪˈliːf/<,>/rɪˈliːf/<,>n.减轻/n.救济/n.援救<,>The medicine brought immediate relief.<,>药物立即带来了缓解。<,>Relief supplies were sent to the disaster area.<,>救援物资被送往灾区。<,>It's a relief to hear you're safe.<,>听到你安全了真是松了一口气。<,>re(再)+lief(轻)→再次变轻→减轻<,>alleviate(v.减轻)/succor(n.救济)/rescue(n.援救)

accommodate<,>/əˈkɒmədeɪt/<,>/əˈkɑːmədeɪt/<,>v.容纳/v.供应/v.提供住宿<,>The hotel can accommodate 500 guests.<,>这家酒店可以容纳500位客人。<,>We need to accommodate the special needs of students.<,>我们需要满足学生的特殊需求。<,>The apartment accommodates a family of four.<,>这套公寓可供四口之家居住。<,>ac(向)+com(共同)+mod(方式)+ate→使适应方式→容纳<,>lodge(v.提供住宿)/house(v.容纳)/adjust(v.调整)

laboratory<,>/ləˈbɒrətri/<,>/ˈlæbrətɔːri/<,>n.实验室/n.研究室<,>He spends most of his time in the laboratory.<,>他大部分时间都在实验室里度过。<,>The new laboratory is well equipped.<,>新实验室设备齐全。<,>They conducted experiments in the chemistry laboratory.<,>他们在化学实验室进行了实验。<,>labor(劳动)+atory(场所)→劳动的场所→实验室<,>lab(n.实验室简称)/workshop(n.车间)/clinic(n.诊所)

brush<,>/brʌʃ/<,>/brʌʃ/<,>n.刷子/n.毛刷/n.画笔<,>She uses a brush to paint.<,>她用画笔作画。<,>Clean your shoes with this brush.<,>用这把刷子清洁你的鞋子。<,>He gave his teeth a quick brush.<,>他快速刷了牙。<,>brus(擦)+h→用来擦的工具→刷子<,>broom(n.扫帚)/comb(n.梳子)/sponge(n.海绵)

microscope<,>/ˈmaɪkrəskəʊp/<,>/ˈmaɪkrəskoʊp/<,>n.显微镜<,>We observed cells under the microscope.<,>我们在显微镜下观察细胞。<,>The microscope revealed tiny organisms.<,>显微镜显示了微小生物体。<,>This microscope has high magnification.<,>这台显微镜放大倍数很高。<,>micro(微小)+scope(看)→看微小物体的工具→显微镜<,>telescope(n.望远镜)/magnifier(n.放大镜)/periscope(n.潜望镜)

emperor<,>/ˈempərə(r)/<,>/ˈempərər/<,>n.皇帝<,>The emperor ruled for over 50 years.<,>这位皇帝统治了50多年。<,>The emperor wore a golden crown.<,>皇帝戴着金冠。<,>This palace was built for the emperor.<,>这座宫殿是为皇帝建造的。<,>emper(命令)+or(人)→发号施令的人→皇帝<,>empress(n.女皇)/king(n.国王)/monarch(n.君主)
render<,>/ˈrɛndə/<,>/ˈrɛndər/<,>v.使得/v.表示/v.给予<,>The news rendered her speechless.<,>这个消息让她说不出话来。<,>He rendered a beautiful song at the concert.<,>他在音乐会上演唱了一首美妙的歌曲。<,>The jury rendered a verdict of not guilty.<,>陪审团作出了无罪的裁决。<,>ren(再次)+der(给予)→再次给予→表示/使得<,>surrender(v.投降/n.交出)/tender(adj.温柔的/v.提供)  

plug<,>/plʌɡ/<,>/plʌɡ/<,>n.塞子/n.插头/v.塞<,>She pulled the plug out of the sink.<,>她把水槽的塞子拔了出来。<,>Don't forget to plug in your phone.<,>别忘了给手机插上充电器。<,>He plugged the hole with a piece of cloth.<,>他用一块布塞住了洞口。<,>pl(固定)+ug(装置)→固定装置→塞子/插头<,>pluck(v.拔/n.勇气)/plunge(v.投入/n.跳水)  

consult<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>v.请教/v.查阅<,>You should consult a doctor about your symptoms.<,>你应该向医生咨询你的症状。<,>I need to consult the dictionary for this word.<,>我需要查字典找这个单词的意思。<,>They consulted together before making the decision.<,>他们在做决定前一起商议。<,>con(共同)+sult(召集)→召集共同商议→请教<,>insult(v.侮辱/n.侮辱)/result(n.结果/v.导致)  

candle<,>/ˈkændl/<,>/ˈkændl/<,>n.蜡烛<,>She blew out the birthday candles.<,>她吹灭了生日蜡烛。<,>The candle flickered in the breeze.<,>蜡烛在微风中闪烁。<,>We had to use candles during the power outage.<,>停电时我们不得不使用蜡烛。<,>cand(发光)+le(小)→发光的小东西→蜡烛<,>handle(n.把手/v.处理)/kindle(v.点燃/n.电子阅读器)  

range<,>/reɪndʒ/<,>/reɪndʒ/<,>n.一系列/n.范围/n.山脉<,>The store offers a wide range of products.<,>这家商店提供各种各样的产品。<,>The Himalayas are the highest mountain range in the world.<,>喜马拉雅山脉是世界上最高的山脉。<,>Her voice has an impressive range.<,>她的音域令人印象深刻。<,>ran(跑)+ge(地方)→跑过的地方→范围<,>arrange(v.安排/n.布置)/orange(n.橙子/adj.橙色的)  

adult<,>/ˈædʌlt/<,>/əˈdʌlt/<,>n.成年人/adj.成年的<,>Children must be accompanied by an adult.<,>儿童必须有成人陪同。<,>Adult education is becoming more popular.<,>成人教育越来越受欢迎。<,>The movie is only suitable for adult audiences.<,>这部电影只适合成年观众。<,>ad(趋向)+ult(成长)→趋向成长→成年人<,>adopt(v.采用/v.收养)/adapt(v.适应/v.改编)  

approach<,>/əˈprəʊtʃ/<,>/əˈproʊtʃ/<,>v.向...靠近/n.靠近<,>The train is approaching the station.<,>火车正在进站。<,>We need a new approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要新的方法来解决这个问题。<,>Winter is approaching quickly.<,>冬天很快就要来了。<,>ap(向)+proach(接近)→向...接近→靠近<,>reproach(v.责备/n.责备)/approve(v.批准/v.赞成)  

eventually<,>/ɪˈvɛntʃuəli/<,>/ɪˈvɛntʃuəli/<,>adv.终于/adv.最后<,>After many attempts, he eventually succeeded.<,>经过多次尝试，他终于成功了。<,>The wound will eventually heal.<,>伤口最终会愈合的。<,>They eventually reached an agreement.<,>他们最终达成了协议。<,>event(事件)+ual(的)+ly(地)→事件发展地→最终<,>actually(adv.实际上)/virtually(adv.几乎)  

glad<,>/ɡlæd/<,>/ɡlæd/<,>adj.高兴的/adj.乐意的<,>I'm glad to hear the good news.<,>听到这个好消息我很高兴。<,>She was glad to help her friend.<,>她很乐意帮助她的朋友。<,>We're glad you could join us.<,>我们很高兴你能加入我们。<,>g(给予)+lad(小伙子)→给予小伙子快乐→高兴的<,>glide(v.滑行/n.滑翔)/glare(v.怒视/n.强光)  

conclude<,>/kənˈkluːd/<,>/kənˈklud/<,>v.推断出/v.结束<,>The detective concluded that it was a murder.<,>侦探推断这是一起谋杀案。<,>The meeting concluded at 5 pm.<,>会议在下午5点结束。<,>From the evidence, we can conclude he's innocent.<,>从证据来看，我们可以断定他是无辜的。<,>con(完全)+clude(关闭)→完全关闭→结束/得出结论<,>include(v.包含)/exclude(v.排除)
radiation<,>/ˌreɪdiˈeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌreɪdiˈeɪʃən/<,>n.辐射/n.辐射能<,>Exposure to high levels of radiation can be harmful.<,>暴露在高强度辐射下可能有害。<,>Solar radiation provides energy for plants.<,>太阳辐射为植物提供能量。<,>The radiation from the nuclear accident spread widely.<,>核事故的辐射广泛扩散。<,>radi(光线)+ation(名词后缀)→辐射<,>radio(n.收音机)/radius(n.半径)/radiate(v.辐射)  

accidental<,>/ˌæksɪˈdent(ə)l/<,>/ˌæksəˈdɛntl/<,>adj.偶然的/adj.非本质的<,>Their meeting was purely accidental.<,>他们的相遇纯属偶然。<,>The damage was accidental, not intentional.<,>损坏是偶然的，不是故意的。<,>An accidental discovery led to a scientific breakthrough.<,>一个偶然的发现带来了科学突破。<,>accident(事故)+al(形容词后缀)→偶然的<,>incidental(adj.附带的)/coincidental(adj.巧合的)/essential(adj.本质的)  

dog<,>/dɒɡ/<,>/dɔːɡ/<,>n.狗/n.犬科动物<,>The dog barked loudly at the stranger.<,>狗对着陌生人大声吠叫。<,>He adopted a stray dog from the shelter.<,>他从收容所领养了一只流浪狗。<,>Dogs are known for their loyalty.<,>狗以忠诚著称。<,>联想：dog→倒着拼写是god(神)→狗是人类忠实伙伴<,>puppy(n.小狗)/wolf(n.狼)/fox(n.狐狸)  

automation<,>/ˌɔːtəˈmeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌɔtəˈmeɪʃən/<,>n.自动/n.自动化<,>Factory automation has increased production efficiency.<,>工厂自动化提高了生产效率。<,>The automation of this process saves time.<,>这个过程的自动化节省了时间。<,>Many jobs are being replaced by automation.<,>许多工作正被自动化取代。<,>auto(自动)+mation(名词后缀)→自动化<,>automatic(adj.自动的)/autonomy(n.自治)/automobile(n.汽车)  

huge<,>/hjuːdʒ/<,>/hjudʒ/<,>adj.巨大的/adj.庞大的<,>They live in a huge mansion.<,>他们住在一座巨大的豪宅里。<,>The project requires a huge amount of funding.<,>这个项目需要巨额资金。<,>There was a huge crowd at the concert.<,>音乐会上人山人海。<,>联想：huge→发音似"糊纸"→糊满纸→巨大的<,>enormous(adj.巨大的)/gigantic(adj.庞大的)/tiny(adj.微小的)  

few<,>/fjuː/<,>/fju/<,>adj.很少的/adj.少数的<,>Few people attended the meeting.<,>很少人参加了会议。<,>She has few friends in this city.<,>她在这个城市朋友很少。<,>There are few opportunities like this.<,>像这样的机会很少。<,>对比记忆：few(几乎没有)/a few(有一些)<,>scanty(adj.不足的)/numerous(adj.众多的)/several(adj.几个的)  

angel<,>/ˈeɪndʒ(ə)l/<,>/ˈeɪndʒəl/<,>n.天使/n.仁慈善良的人<,>The child looked like an angel when sleeping.<,>孩子睡觉时像个天使。<,>She's been an angel to the homeless.<,>她对无家可归者非常仁慈。<,>Angels are often depicted with wings.<,>天使常被描绘有翅膀。<,>谐音记忆：angel→"安琪儿"→天使<,>angle(n.角度)/ankle(n.脚踝)/devil(n.魔鬼)  

handsome<,>/ˈhæns(ə)m/<,>/ˈhænsəm/<,>adj.英俊的/adj.相当大的<,>He grew into a handsome young man.<,>他长成了一个英俊的年轻人。<,>The company made a handsome profit last year.<,>公司去年获得了可观的利润。<,>She received a handsome reward for her work.<,>她因工作获得了丰厚的报酬。<,>hand(手)+some(一些)→手头宽裕→可观的<,>pretty(adj.漂亮的)/good-looking(adj.好看的)/ugly(adj.丑陋的)  

class<,>/klɑːs/<,>/klæs/<,>n.班级/n.阶级/n.等级<,>Our class has 30 students.<,>我们班有30名学生。<,>She comes from the upper class.<,>她来自上层阶级。<,>This wine is of the highest class.<,>这种葡萄酒是最高等级的。<,>cl(聚集)+ass(名词后缀)→聚集在一起→班级<,>classification(n.分类)/classic(adj.经典的)/classroom(n.教室)  

nation<,>/ˈneɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈneɪʃən/<,>n.国家/n.民族<,>The whole nation celebrated the victory.<,>举国欢庆胜利。<,>The United Nations was founded in 1945.<,>联合国成立于1945年。<,>This festival is important to our nation.<,>这个节日对我们的民族很重要。<,>nat(出生)+ion(名词后缀)→出生地→国家<,>national(adj.国家的)/native(adj.本地的)/international(adj.国际的)
complaint<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>/kəmˈpleɪnt/<,>n.抱怨/n.怨言/n.控告<,>She made a complaint about the noisy neighbors.<,>她对吵闹的邻居提出了抱怨。<,>His complaint was dismissed by the court.<,>他的控告被法院驳回了。<,>We received a complaint from a customer about the service.<,>我们收到了一位顾客对服务的投诉。<,>com(共同)+plain(抱怨)+t→共同抱怨→抱怨<,>complain(v.抱怨)/plaintive(adj.哀伤的)/plain(adj.简单的)  

era<,>/ˈɪərə/<,>/ˈɪrə/<,>n.时代/n.年代/n.纪元<,>The invention marked the beginning of a new era.<,>这项发明标志着一个新时代的开始。<,>This painting is from the Victorian era.<,>这幅画来自维多利亚时代。<,>The era of digital technology has transformed our lives.<,>数字技术时代改变了我们的生活。<,>era(时代)→与"error(错误)"区分<,>epoch(n.纪元)/age(n.年龄；时代)/period(n.时期)  

port<,>/pɔːt/<,>/pɔːrt/<,>n.港/n.港口<,>The ship arrived at the port safely.<,>船安全抵达港口。<,>This city has a busy commercial port.<,>这座城市有一个繁忙的商业港口。<,>They watched the sunset over the port.<,>他们看着港口上方的日落。<,>port(港口)→与"part(部分)"区分<,>harbor(n.海港)/dock(n.码头)/airport(n.机场)  

column<,>/ˈkɒləm/<,>/ˈkɑːləm/<,>n.柱/n.支柱/n.圆柱<,>The ancient temple has marble columns.<,>这座古庙有大理石柱子。<,>She writes a weekly column for the newspaper.<,>她为报纸撰写每周专栏。<,>There was a long column of cars on the highway.<,>高速公路上有一长列汽车。<,>column(圆柱)→与"colon(冒号)"区分<,>pillar(n.柱子)/post(n.柱子；邮件)/beam(n.横梁)  

message<,>/ˈmesɪdʒ/<,>/ˈmesɪdʒ/<,>n.信息/n.消息/n.启示/n.要旨/n.寓意<,>I left a message on your voicemail.<,>我在你的语音信箱留了言。<,>The movie carries an important message about friendship.<,>这部电影传递了关于友谊的重要启示。<,>Did you get my text message?<,>你收到我的短信了吗？<,>mess(发送)+age(名词后缀)→发送的东西→信息<,>massage(n.按摩)/mess(n.混乱)/passage(n.段落；通道)  

pack<,>/pæk/<,>/pæk/<,>v.打包/v.装箱/v.挤满/n.包<,>She packed her suitcase for the trip.<,>她为旅行收拾好了手提箱。<,>The bus was packed with commuters.<,>公交车上挤满了通勤者。<,>He bought a pack of gum at the store.<,>他在商店买了一包口香糖。<,>pack(包)→与"peck(啄)"区分<,>package(n.包裹)/packet(n.小包)/backpack(n.背包)  

black<,>/blæk/<,>/blæk/<,>adj.黑色的/adj.黑暗的<,>She was wearing a black dress.<,>她穿着一条黑色连衣裙。<,>The room was completely black when the lights went out.<,>灯灭时房间里一片漆黑。<,>He prefers black coffee with no sugar.<,>他喜欢不加糖的黑咖啡。<,>black(黑色)→与"blank(空白)"区分<,>dark(adj.黑暗的)/white(adj.白色的)/gray(adj.灰色的)  

scan<,>/skæn/<,>/skæn/<,>v.细看/v.浏览/v.扫描<,>He scanned the document quickly.<,>他快速浏览了文件。<,>The doctor scanned her brain for abnormalities.<,>医生扫描了她的大脑以检查异常。<,>She scanned the crowd for her friend.<,>她在人群中寻找她的朋友。<,>scan(扫描)→与"span(跨度)"区分<,>skim(v.略读)/scrutinize(v.仔细检查)/examine(v.检查)  

variation<,>/ˌveəriˈeɪʃn/<,>/ˌveriˈeɪʃn/<,>n.变化/n.变动/n.变异<,>There is a lot of variation in temperature this week.<,>本周气温变化很大。<,>The study examines genetic variation in plants.<,>这项研究考察了植物的遗传变异。<,>Cultural variations exist between different countries.<,>不同国家之间存在文化差异。<,>vari(变化)+ation(名词后缀)→变化<,>variable(adj.可变的)/various(adj.各种各样的)/variety(n.多样性)  

planet<,>/ˈplænɪt/<,>/ˈplænɪt/<,>n.行星<,>Earth is the third planet from the sun.<,>地球是距离太阳第三近的行星。<,>Scientists have discovered a new planet in our solar system.<,>科学家在我们的太阳系中发现了一颗新行星。<,>The movie is about life on another planet.<,>这部电影讲述的是另一个星球上的生活。<,>planet(行星)→与"plant(植物)"区分<,>star(n.恒星)/moon(n.卫星)/galaxy(n.星系)
lend<,>/lend/<,>/lɛnd/<,>v.把…借给/v.贷（款）<,>Can you lend me your pen for a moment?<,>你能把笔借我用一下吗？<,>Banks lend money to businesses to help them grow.<,>银行向企业贷款以帮助它们发展。<,>He lent his car to his brother for the weekend.<,>他把车借给弟弟用了一个周末。<,>len(长度)+d(给予)→给予长度→借出<,>loan(n.贷款)/borrow(v.借入)/lease(v.出租)

reflection<,>/rɪˈflekʃn/<,>/rɪˈflɛkʃən/<,>n.映象/n.反射/n.反映<,>The lake gave a perfect reflection of the mountains.<,>湖面完美地映出了群山的倒影。<,>Her actions are a reflection of her upbringing.<,>她的行为反映了她所受的教育。<,>Light reflection makes the room appear brighter.<,>光线反射使房间显得更亮。<,>re(回)+flect(弯曲)+ion→光线弯曲返回→反射<,>deflection(n.偏斜)/inflection(n.屈折变化)/flexion(n.弯曲)

acre<,>/ˈeɪkə(r)/<,>/ˈeɪkər/<,>n.英亩<,>This farm covers about 50 acres of land.<,>这个农场占地约50英亩。<,>They bought an acre of land to build their house.<,>他们买了一英亩地来建房子。<,>An acre is roughly the size of a football field.<,>一英亩大约相当于一个足球场的大小。<,>a(一)+cre(生长)→一块生长的土地<,>hectare(n.公顷)/are(n.公亩)/arc(n.弧)

removal<,>/rɪˈmuːvl/<,>/rɪˈmuvəl/<,>n.移动/n.移走/n.除掉/n.搬迁<,>The removal of the old tree took all day.<,>移走那棵老树花了一整天。<,>Stain removal is easier if you act quickly.<,>如果迅速处理，污渍更容易去除。<,>We hired a company to help with our office removal.<,>我们雇了家公司帮忙搬迁办公室。<,>re(再)+mov(移动)+al→再次移动→搬迁<,>movement(n.运动)/removable(adj.可移动的)/immovable(adj.固定的)

sail<,>/seɪl/<,>/seɪl/<,>n.帆/n.船/v.航行<,>The ship's sail caught the wind perfectly.<,>船帆完美地捕捉到了风。<,>We plan to sail around the Mediterranean next summer.<,>我们计划明年夏天在地中海航行。<,>There wasn't a sail in sight on the horizon.<,>地平线上看不到一艘船。<,>s(水)+ail(航行)→水上航行<,>sale(n.销售)/tail(n.尾巴)/nail(n.钉子)

France<,>/frɑːns/<,>/fræns/<,>n.法国/n.法兰西<,>France is famous for its wine and cuisine.<,>法国以其葡萄酒和美食闻名。<,>We spent two weeks touring France last summer.<,>去年夏天我们在法国旅游了两周。<,>The capital of France is Paris.<,>法国的首都是巴黎。<,>Fran(自由)+ce→自由之地<,>franchise(n.特许权)/franc(n.法郎)/frank(adj.坦率的)

superior<,>/suːˈpɪəriə(r)/<,>/sʊˈpɪriər/<,>adj.有优越感的/adj.较高的<,>Her superior attitude made her unpopular.<,>她傲慢的态度让她不受欢迎。<,>This product is superior in quality to others.<,>这个产品质量优于其他产品。<,>The superior court overturned the lower court's decision.<,>上级法院推翻了地方法院的判决。<,>super(超过)+ior(比较级)→超过其他的<,>inferior(adj.下级的)/exterior(adj.外部的)/interior(adj.内部的)

cafeteria<,>/ˌkæfəˈtɪəriə/<,>/ˌkæfəˈtɪriə/<,>n.自助食堂<,>The school cafeteria serves lunch at noon.<,>学校自助食堂中午供应午餐。<,>We usually eat in the office cafeteria.<,>我们通常在办公室自助餐厅吃饭。<,>The hospital cafeteria is open 24 hours.<,>医院自助餐厅24小时开放。<,>cafe(咖啡)+teria(场所)→咖啡场所→食堂<,>cafe(n.咖啡馆)/cater(v.提供饮食)/café(n.小餐馆)

costly<,>/ˈkɒstli/<,>/ˈkɔstli/<,>adj.昂贵的/adj.代价高的<,>The repairs proved to be very costly.<,>维修费用被证明非常昂贵。<,>War is always costly in human lives.<,>战争总是以人的生命为高昂代价。<,>That was a costly mistake for the company.<,>这对公司来说是个代价高昂的错误。<,>cost(花费)+ly(形容词后缀)→花费多的<,>cheap(adj.便宜的)/priceless(adj.无价的)/worthless(adj.无价值的)

ideal<,>/aɪˈdiːəl/<,>/aɪˈdiəl/<,>adj.理想的<,>This would be the ideal place for a picnic.<,>这将是野餐的理想地点。<,>She's the ideal candidate for the job.<,>她是这份工作的理想人选。<,>The weather was ideal for outdoor activities.<,>天气非常适合户外活动。<,>idea(想法)+l→符合想法的→理想的<,>real(adj.真实的)/idle(adj.闲置的)/idol(n.偶像)
sample<,>/ˈsɑːmpl/<,>/ˈsæmpəl/<,>n.样品/n.标本<,>The company sent us a free sample of their new product.<,>公司给我们寄来了他们新产品的免费样品。<,>She collected water samples from the river for testing.<,>她从河里采集了水样进行检测。<,>This blood sample will be sent to the lab for analysis.<,>这个血液样本将被送到实验室进行分析。<,>sam(类似)+ple(小东西)→类似的小东西→样品<,>simple(adj.简单的)/example(n.例子)

continuous<,>/kənˈtɪnjuəs/<,>/kənˈtɪnjuəs/<,>adj.连续不断的/adj.持续的<,>The rain has been continuous for three days.<,>雨已经连续下了三天了。<,>We need a continuous supply of fresh water.<,>我们需要持续的淡水供应。<,>The machine makes a continuous humming noise.<,>机器发出持续的嗡嗡声。<,>con(共同)+tin(保持)+uous(形容词后缀)→共同保持的→连续的<,>contiguous(adj.邻近的)/continual(adj.频繁的)

joy<,>/dʒɔɪ/<,>/dʒɔɪ/<,>n.欢乐/n.喜悦/n.乐事<,>The children's laughter brought her great joy.<,>孩子们的笑声给她带来了极大的快乐。<,>It's a joy to see you so happy.<,>看到你这么高兴真让人开心。<,>Winning the competition was a great joy for him.<,>赢得比赛对他来说是一大乐事。<,>joy(欢乐)与toy(玩具)押韵<,>enjoy(v.享受)/job(n.工作)

navy<,>/ˈneɪvi/<,>/ˈneɪvi/<,>n.海军<,>My brother serves in the navy.<,>我哥哥在海军服役。<,>The navy conducted exercises in the Pacific Ocean.<,>海军在太平洋进行了演习。<,>She dreams of joining the navy after graduation.<,>她梦想毕业后加入海军。<,>nav(船)+y(名词后缀)→与船有关的→海军<,>naval(adj.海军的)/naive(adj.天真的)

fabric<,>/ˈfæbrɪk/<,>/ˈfæbrɪk/<,>n.织物/n.纺织品/n.结构<,>This fabric is very soft and comfortable.<,>这种布料非常柔软舒适。<,>The social fabric of the community is strong.<,>这个社区的社会结构很稳固。<,>She bought some fabric to make a new dress.<,>她买了一些布料做新裙子。<,>fabr(制作)+ic(名词后缀)→制作的东西→织物<,>fabricate(v.制造)/fiber(n.纤维)

evolve<,>/ɪˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪˈvɑːlv/<,>v.使进化/v.使发展<,>The species evolved over millions of years.<,>这个物种经过数百万年进化而来。<,>Our business has evolved into a multinational company.<,>我们的业务已发展成为跨国公司。<,>The plan evolved as we discussed it further.<,>随着我们进一步讨论，计划逐渐完善。<,>e(出)+volve(转)→转出来→进化<,>involve(v.包含)/revolve(v.旋转)

eliminate<,>/ɪˈlɪmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈlɪməˌneɪt/<,>v.消灭/v.消除/v.排除<,>We need to eliminate all possible errors.<,>我们需要消除所有可能的错误。<,>The team was eliminated in the first round.<,>该队在首轮就被淘汰了。<,>This medicine helps eliminate toxins from the body.<,>这种药物有助于排除体内毒素。<,>e(出)+limin(门槛)+ate(动词后缀)→赶出门槛→消除<,>illuminate(v.阐明)/dominate(v.支配)

staff<,>/stɑːf/<,>/stæf/<,>n.全体职员/n.员工/n.工作人员/n.参谋<,>The hospital staff are very professional.<,>医院的工作人员非常专业。<,>We need to hire more staff for the busy season.<,>我们需要为旺季雇佣更多员工。<,>The general consulted with his staff before making the decision.<,>将军在做出决定前咨询了他的参谋。<,>staff(员工)与stuff(东西)发音相似<,>stiff(adj.僵硬的)/stuff(n.材料)

repeat<,>/rɪˈpiːt/<,>/rɪˈpit/<,>v.重说/v.重做/n.重演/n.重现<,>Could you repeat what you just said?<,>你能重复一下刚才说的话吗？<,>History seems to repeat itself.<,>历史似乎在重演。<,>The teacher asked him to repeat the experiment.<,>老师让他重做这个实验。<,>re(再)+peat(寻求)→再次寻求→重复<,>retreat(v.撤退)/compete(v.竞争)

narrow<,>/ˈnærəʊ/<,>/ˈnæroʊ/<,>adj.狭的/adj.狭窄的<,>The road is too narrow for two cars to pass.<,>这条路太窄，两辆车无法同时通过。<,>She has a narrow view of the situation.<,>她对形势的看法很狭隘。<,>The bridge is only wide enough for pedestrians.<,>这座桥只够行人通过。<,>narrow(狭窄)与arrow(箭)押韵<,>borrow(v.借)/marrow(n.骨髓)
freight<,>/freɪt/<,>/freɪt/<,>n.货运/n.货物/n.运费<,>The freight train carries goods across the country.<,>货运列车在全国各地运送货物。<,>The cost of freight has increased recently.<,>最近运费上涨了。<,>They loaded the freight onto the ship.<,>他们把货物装上了船。<,>fr(联想free自由的)+eight(八)→自由运输的八节车厢→货运<,>fright(n. 惊吓)/fraught(adj. 充满的)/freighter(n. 货船)

educate<,>/ˈedʒukeɪt/<,>/ˈɛdʒəˌkeɪt/<,>v.教育/v.培养/v.训练/v.教导<,>Parents should educate their children about safety.<,>父母应该教育孩子注意安全。<,>She was educated at a prestigious university.<,>她在一所名牌大学接受教育。<,>The program aims to educate people about healthy eating.<,>该项目旨在教育人们健康饮食。<,>e(出)+duc(引导)+ate(动词后缀)→引导出来→教育<,>educe(v. 引出)/deduce(v. 推断)/induce(v. 诱导)

fence<,>/fens/<,>/fɛns/<,>n.栅栏<,>The dog jumped over the fence.<,>狗跳过了栅栏。<,>They built a wooden fence around the garden.<,>他们在花园周围建了木栅栏。<,>The neighbors argued about the property fence.<,>邻居们因为地产栅栏发生了争执。<,>fen(沼泽)+ce→沼泽边的围栏→栅栏<,>defense(n. 防御)/offense(n. 进攻)/fencing(n. 击剑运动)

lick<,>/lɪk/<,>/lɪk/<,>v.舔/v.舔吃<,>The cat licked its paws clean.<,>猫把爪子舔干净了。<,>He licked the ice cream cone quickly.<,>他快速地舔着冰淇淋蛋筒。<,>Don't lick the envelope, use a sponge.<,>不要舔信封，用海绵沾湿。<,>lick(形似link连接)→用舌头连接食物→舔<,>sick(adj. 生病的)/kick(v. 踢)/pick(v. 挑选)

necessary<,>/ˈnesəsəri/<,>/ˈnɛsəˌsɛri/<,>adj.必要的/adj.必然的<,>Sleep is necessary for good health.<,>睡眠对健康是必要的。<,>It's necessary to wear a seatbelt while driving.<,>开车时必须系安全带。<,>Changes to the plan were necessary.<,>计划变更是必要的。<,>ne(不)+cess(走)+ary→不能走开的→必要的<,>necessity(n. 必需品)/necessarily(adv. 必然地)/unnecessary(adj. 不必要的)

primitive<,>/ˈprɪmətɪv/<,>/ˈprɪmɪtɪv/<,>adj.原始的/adj.老式的/adj.简陋的<,>Primitive humans used stone tools.<,>原始人类使用石器。<,>The hut had only primitive furnishings.<,>小屋只有简陋的家具。<,>His painting style is quite primitive.<,>他的绘画风格很原始。<,>prim(第一)+itive→第一时间的→原始的<,>prime(adj. 主要的)/primary(adj. 初级的)/primate(n. 灵长类动物)

read<,>/riːd/<,>/rid/<,>v.读/v.看懂<,>She reads a book every week.<,>她每周读一本书。<,>Can you read this ancient text?<,>你能看懂这篇古文吗？<,>I like to read the newspaper with breakfast.<,>我喜欢早餐时看报纸。<,>read(形似ready准备)→读书要准备好<,>reed(n. 芦苇)/red(adj. 红色的)/bread(n. 面包)

and<,>/ænd/<,>/ænd/<,>conj.和/conj.又/conj.并/conj.则/conj.那么<,>She bought apples and oranges.<,>她买了苹果和橙子。<,>He is tall and handsome.<,>他又高又帅。<,>Study hard, and you will succeed.<,>努力学习，那么你就会成功。<,>and(联想hand手)→手拉手→和<,>end(n. 结束)/band(n. 乐队)/sand(n. 沙子)

complain<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>v.抱怨/v.诉苦/v.控告<,>Customers often complain about poor service.<,>顾客经常抱怨服务差。<,>She complained to the manager about the noise.<,>她向经理投诉噪音问题。<,>He's always complaining about his job.<,>他总是抱怨自己的工作。<,>com(共同)+plain(平坦)→把不平的事摊平→抱怨<,>explain(v. 解释)/plain(adj. 平坦的)/complaint(n. 抱怨)

thrust<,>/θrʌst/<,>/θrʌst/<,>v.插/v.刺/n.猛冲/n.猛刺/n.推进<,>He thrust the key into the lock.<,>他把钥匙插进锁里。<,>The fencer made a quick thrust.<,>击剑手快速刺出一剑。<,>The rocket's thrust propelled it into space.<,>火箭的推进力将它送入太空。<,>thru(通过)+st(站立)→通过站立点刺入→刺<,>trust(v. 信任)/thirst(n. 口渴)/thrash(v. 鞭打)
junior<,>/ˈdʒuːniə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒuːniər/<,>adj.青少年的/n.晚辈<,>He is a junior member of the team.<,>他是团队的年轻成员。<,>She is three years my junior.<,>她比我小三岁。<,>The junior high school is nearby.<,>这所初中就在附近。<,>jun(年轻)+ior(比较级后缀)→更年轻的<,>senior(adj.年长的/n.长辈)/major(adj.主要的/n.专业)/minor(adj.较小的/n.未成年人)

leading<,>/ˈliːdɪŋ/<,>/ˈliːdɪŋ/<,>adj.最主要的<,>She is the leading expert in this field.<,>她是这个领域的顶尖专家。<,>The leading cause of death is heart disease.<,>最主要的死因是心脏病。<,>He played the leading role in the movie.<,>他在电影中扮演主角。<,>lead(领导)+ing(形容词后缀)→领导的→最主要的<,>misleading(adj.误导的)/pleading(n.恳求)/reading(n.阅读)

spur<,>/spɜː(r)/<,>/spɜːr/<,>n.刺激物/v.刺激<,>The prize was a spur to greater effort.<,>这个奖项激励人们更加努力。<,>He spurred his horse to go faster.<,>他策马加速前进。<,>Her words spurred me into action.<,>她的话激励我采取行动。<,>spur(马刺)→像马刺一样刺激<,>spurn(v.轻蔑地拒绝)/spurt(v.喷出/n.迸发)/spurge(n.大戟属植物)

commercial<,>/kəˈmɜːʃl/<,>/kəˈmɜːrʃl/<,>adj.商业的/商品化的<,>This is a commercial district.<,>这是一个商业区。<,>The film was a commercial success.<,>这部电影在商业上很成功。<,>Commercial vehicles must pay tolls.<,>商用车辆必须支付通行费。<,>commerce(商业)+ial(形容词后缀)→商业的<,>noncommercial(adj.非商业的)/mercantile(adj.贸易的)/commercialize(v.商业化)

extraordinary<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːdnri/<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːrdəneri/<,>adj.非同寻常的/特别的<,>She showed extraordinary courage.<,>她表现出非凡的勇气。<,>This is an extraordinary meeting.<,>这是一次特别会议。<,>His memory is extraordinary.<,>他的记忆力非同寻常。<,>extra(超出)+ordinary(普通的)→超出普通的→非同寻常的<,>ordinary(adj.普通的)/extraordinarily(adv.非常地)/extraordinariness(n.非凡)

inspire<,>/ɪnˈspaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈspaɪər/<,>v.鼓舞/给...以灵感<,>His speech inspired the crowd.<,>他的演讲鼓舞了群众。<,>The scenery inspired her to write a poem.<,>这景色激发她写了一首诗。<,>She is an inspiring teacher.<,>她是位鼓舞人心的老师。<,>in(进入)+spire(呼吸)→吸入灵感→鼓舞<,>expire(v.到期)/aspire(v.渴望)/respire(v.呼吸)

climate<,>/ˈklaɪmət/<,>/ˈklaɪmət/<,>n.气候/地带/风气<,>The climate here is mild.<,>这里的气候温和。<,>We need to improve the political climate.<,>我们需要改善政治风气。<,>This region has a tropical climate.<,>这个地区属于热带气候。<,>cli(倾斜)+mate(伙伴)→地球倾斜造就气候<,>weather(n.天气)/acclimate(v.使适应)/climatic(adj.气候的)

outward<,>/ˈaʊtwəd/<,>/ˈaʊtwərd/<,>adj.外面的/向外的<,>There was no outward sign of injury.<,>没有明显的外伤迹象。<,>The door opens outward.<,>门是向外开的。<,>She maintained an outward calm.<,>她表面上保持冷静。<,>out(外)+ward(方向)→向外的<,>inward(adj.向内的)/outwards(adv.向外)/outwear(v.穿坏)

pessimistic<,>/ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.悲观的/厌世的<,>He has a pessimistic view of life.<,>他对生活持悲观看法。<,>The report was pessimistic about the economy.<,>这份报告对经济持悲观态度。<,>Don't be so pessimistic!<,>别这么悲观！<,>pessim(最坏)+istic(形容词后缀)→总是想到最坏的→悲观的<,>optimistic(adj.乐观的)/pessimism(n.悲观主义)/pessimist(n.悲观主义者)

frost<,>/frɒst/<,>/frɔːst/<,>n.冰冻/严寒/霜<,>The grass was covered with frost.<,>草地上覆盖着霜。<,>There was a heavy frost last night.<,>昨晚有严重霜冻。<,>Frost can damage crops.<,>霜冻会损害庄稼。<,>frost(冻结)→寒冷结霜<,>frosty(adj.结霜的)/frostbite(n.冻伤)/defrost(v.解冻)
curse<,>/kɜːs/<,>/kɜːrs/<,>n.诅咒/n.咒骂<,>The witch put a curse on the village.<,>女巫对这个村庄下了诅咒。<,>He muttered a curse under his breath.<,>他低声咒骂了一句。<,>The curse was finally lifted after many years.<,>多年后诅咒终于被解除了。<,>cur(跑)+se→跑出来的恶毒话→诅咒<,>course(n.课程)/nurse(n.护士)/pursue(v.追求)

heroic<,>/hɪˈrəʊɪk/<,>/hɪˈroʊɪk/<,>adj.英雄的/adj.英勇的<,>His heroic actions saved many lives.<,>他英勇的行为挽救了许多生命。<,>The movie tells a heroic story of a firefighter.<,>这部电影讲述了一个消防员的英雄故事。<,>She showed heroic courage in the face of danger.<,>面对危险时她表现出了英勇的勇气。<,>hero(英雄)+ic(形容词后缀)→英雄的<,>historic(adj.历史的)/hysteric(adj.歇斯底里的)

dive<,>/daɪv/<,>/daɪv/<,>v.跳水/v.潜水/v.俯冲<,>The athlete will dive from the 10-meter platform.<,>这位运动员将从10米跳台跳水。<,>Seals can dive very deep in search of food.<,>海豹可以潜得很深寻找食物。<,>The eagle made a sudden dive to catch its prey.<,>老鹰突然俯冲捕捉猎物。<,>di(向下)+ve→向下运动→潜水<,>drive(v.驾驶)/dove(n.鸽子)/dice(n.骰子)

survey<,>/ˈsɜːveɪ/<,>/ˈsɜːrveɪ/<,>v.调查/v.测量<,>They conducted a survey about consumer habits.<,>他们进行了一项关于消费者习惯的调查。<,>The land was carefully surveyed before construction.<,>施工前对土地进行了仔细测量。<,>Please complete this survey about our services.<,>请完成这份关于我们服务的调查问卷。<,>sur(上)+vey(看)→从上往下看→调查<,>surgery(n.手术)/survive(v.幸存)/surveillance(n.监视)

leak<,>/liːk/<,>/liːk/<,>v.漏/v.泄露/n.漏洞<,>The roof leaks when it rains heavily.<,>下大雨时屋顶会漏水。<,>Someone leaked confidential documents to the press.<,>有人将机密文件泄露给了媒体。<,>There's a small leak in the water pipe.<,>水管有个小漏洞。<,>lea(漏)+k→漏<,>peak(n.山峰)/leek(n.韭葱)/lead(v.领导)

democratic<,>/ˌdeməˈkrætɪk/<,>/ˌdeməˈkrætɪk/<,>adj.民主的/adj.民主政体的<,>The country has a democratic system of government.<,>这个国家有民主的政府体制。<,>Democratic elections were held last month.<,>上个月举行了民主选举。<,>They believe in democratic principles.<,>他们信仰民主原则。<,>demo(人民)+crat(统治)+ic→人民统治的→民主的<,>autocratic(adj.专制的)/bureaucratic(adj.官僚的)/diplomatic(adj.外交的)

apart<,>/əˈpɑːt/<,>/əˈpɑːrt/<,>adv.相隔/adv.分开/adv.除去<,>The two houses stand 50 meters apart.<,>两栋房子相隔50米。<,>They decided to live apart for a while.<,>他们决定分开住一段时间。<,>Apart from English, she speaks French fluently.<,>除了英语，她法语也说得很流利。<,>a(不)+part(部分)→不成为部分→分开<,>apparent(adj.明显的)/apartment(n.公寓)/depart(v.离开)

resort<,>/rɪˈzɔːt/<,>/rɪˈzɔːrt/<,>vi.求助/vi.凭借/n.诉诸<,>They had to resort to legal action.<,>他们不得不诉诸法律手段。<,>The island is a popular tourist resort.<,>这个岛是个受欢迎的旅游胜地。<,>As a last resort, we can borrow money from the bank.<,>作为最后手段，我们可以向银行借钱。<,>re(再)+sort(种类)→再找一种方法→求助<,>retort(v.反驳)/report(v.报告)/restore(v.恢复)

utter<,>/ˈʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈʌtər/<,>adj.完全的/adj.彻底的<,>It was an utter disaster.<,>这完全是一场灾难。<,>She was in utter confusion after the accident.<,>事故后她完全糊涂了。<,>He showed utter disregard for the rules.<,>他表现出对规则的彻底无视。<,>ut(出)+ter→完全出来的→完全的<,>butter(n.黄油)/mutter(v.嘀咕)/gutter(n.排水沟)

penetrate<,>/ˈpenɪtreɪt/<,>/ˈpenɪtreɪt/<,>v.穿过<,>The bullet penetrated the wall.<,>子弹穿过了墙壁。<,>Sunlight barely penetrates the thick forest canopy.<,>阳光几乎穿不过茂密的森林树冠。<,>His words penetrated her heart deeply.<,>他的话深深触动了她的心。<,>pen(全部)+etr(进入)+ate→全部进入→穿过<,>permeate(v.渗透)/perforate(v.穿孔)/penitent(adj.悔过的)
passenger<,>/ˈpæsɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ˈpæsəndʒər/<,>n.乘客/n.旅客<,>The bus can carry up to 50 passengers.<,>这辆公交车最多可载50名乘客。<,>Passengers must fasten their seat belts during takeoff.<,>起飞时乘客必须系好安全带。<,>She was the only passenger in the first-class cabin.<,>她是头等舱唯一的乘客。<,>pass(通过)+enger(人)→通过的人→乘客<,>messenger(n.信使/n.邮递员)/passage(n.通道/n.段落)

compete<,>/kəmˈpiːt/<,>/kəmˈpit/<,>v.竞争/v.对抗/v.比赛<,>Several companies are competing for the contract.<,>几家公司正在竞争这份合同。<,>She will compete in the 100-meter race.<,>她将参加100米赛跑。<,>Our products compete with international brands.<,>我们的产品与国际品牌竞争。<,>com(共同)+pete(追求)→共同追求→竞争<,>complete(adj.完整的/v.完成)/competent(adj.有能力的)

boast<,>/bəʊst/<,>/boʊst/<,>v.自夸/v.吹嘘<,>He likes to boast about his achievements.<,>他喜欢吹嘘自己的成就。<,>The town boasts a beautiful beach.<,>这个镇拥有一片美丽的海滩。<,>She boasted that she could speak five languages.<,>她夸口说她会说五种语言。<,>boat(船)+st→在船上吹嘘→自夸<,>toast(n.吐司/v.干杯)/roast(v.烤/n.烤肉)

breadth<,>/bredθ/<,>/brɛdθ/<,>n.宽度/n.幅度/n.幅面<,>The river is 50 meters in breadth.<,>这条河宽50米。<,>He has a great breadth of knowledge.<,>他知识渊博。<,>The breadth of her experience impressed the interviewers.<,>她经验的广度给面试官留下了深刻印象。<,>bread(面包)+th→面包的宽度→宽度<,>breath(n.呼吸)/break(n.休息/v.打破)

unique<,>/juːˈniːk/<,>/juˈnik/<,>adj.唯一的/adj.独一无二的<,>Each person's fingerprint is unique.<,>每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。<,>This is a unique opportunity you shouldn't miss.<,>这是一个你不应错过的独特机会。<,>Her style of painting is quite unique.<,>她的绘画风格非常独特。<,>uni(单一)+que→唯一的<,>unite(v.联合)/uniform(n.制服/adj.统一的)

opportunity<,>/ˌɒpəˈtjuːnəti/<,>/ˌɑpərˈtunəti/<,>n.机会/n.良机<,>This job provides excellent career opportunities.<,>这份工作提供了极好的职业机会。<,>I'll take the opportunity to visit my grandparents.<,>我要趁这个机会去看望祖父母。<,>Don't miss this golden opportunity.<,>不要错过这个黄金机会。<,>op(朝向)+port(港口)+unity→朝向港口的统一→机会<,>opposite(adj.相反的)/opponent(n.对手)

precious<,>/ˈpreʃəs/<,>/ˈprɛʃəs/<,>adj.珍贵的/adj.宝贵的<,>Time is more precious than money.<,>时间比金钱更宝贵。<,>She keeps her precious jewelry in a safe.<,>她把珍贵的珠宝放在保险箱里。<,>The photo is precious to me because it's the last one with my grandfather.<,>这张照片对我很珍贵，因为这是我和祖父的最后一张合影。<,>preci(价值)+ous→有价值的→珍贵的<,>previous(adj.先前的)/precise(adj.精确的)

accurate<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>/ˈækjərət/<,>adj.准确的/adj.正确无误的<,>The witness gave an accurate description of the suspect.<,>目击者准确描述了嫌疑人的特征。<,>This watch keeps accurate time.<,>这块表走时准确。<,>We need accurate data for the research.<,>我们需要准确的研究数据。<,>ac(强调)+cur(关心)+ate→非常关心的→准确的<,>accuse(v.指责)/accumulate(v.积累)

feeble<,>/ˈfiːbl/<,>/ˈfibəl/<,>adj.虚弱的/adj.微弱的<,>The old man's voice was feeble but clear.<,>老人的声音微弱但清晰。<,>She made a feeble attempt to stand up.<,>她虚弱地尝试站起来。<,>The light from the candle was feeble in the dark.<,>蜡烛的光在黑暗中很微弱。<,>fee(费)+ble→花费力气→虚弱的<,>fable(n.寓言)/flee(v.逃跑)

kind<,>/kaɪnd/<,>/kaɪnd/<,>n.种类<,>What kind of music do you like?<,>你喜欢哪种音乐？<,>This is a new kind of smartphone.<,>这是一种新型智能手机。<,>We need all kinds of materials for the project.<,>我们需要各种材料来完成这个项目。<,>kin(亲属)+d→同类的→种类<,>king(n.国王)/bind(v.捆绑)
helpful<,>/ˈhɛlpfʊl/<,>/ˈhɛlpfəl/<,>adj.给予帮助的/adj.有用的<,>She gave me some helpful advice.<,>她给了我一些有用的建议。<,>The book is very helpful for beginners.<,>这本书对初学者非常有用。<,>He is always helpful to his colleagues.<,>他总是乐于帮助同事。<,>help(帮助)+ful(形容词后缀)→给予帮助的<,>helpless(adj.无助的)/hopeful(adj.有希望的)  

apology<,>/əˈpɒlədʒi/<,>/əˈpɑːlədʒi/<,>n.道歉/n.认错/n.谢罪<,>He made an apology for being late.<,>他为迟到道歉。<,>She accepted his apology gracefully.<,>她大方地接受了他的道歉。<,>I owe you an apology for my mistake.<,>我为我的错误向你道歉。<,>apo(远离)+log(说)+y→说远离的话→道歉<,>apologize(v.道歉)/apologetic(adj.道歉的)  

lighten<,>/ˈlaɪtn/<,>/ˈlaɪtn/<,>v.照亮/v.使明亮<,>She opened the curtains to lighten the room.<,>她拉开窗帘让房间明亮起来。<,>His joke helped to lighten the mood.<,>他的笑话让气氛轻松起来。<,>The sky began to lighten at dawn.<,>黎明时分天空开始变亮。<,>light(光)+en(动词后缀)→使有光→照亮<,>enlighten(v.启发)/brighten(v.使明亮)  

hot<,>/hɒt/<,>/hɑːt/<,>adj.热的/adj.刺激的/adj.辣的<,>The soup is too hot to drink.<,>汤太烫了，没法喝。<,>She loves eating hot peppers.<,>她喜欢吃辣椒。<,>The debate became very hot.<,>辩论变得非常激烈。<,>hot(热)→与温度或辣味相关<,>heat(n.热量)/hut(n.小屋)  

hasty<,>/ˈheɪsti/<,>/ˈheɪsti/<,>adj.急速的/adj.仓促的<,>He made a hasty decision.<,>他做了一个仓促的决定。<,>They ate a hasty meal before leaving.<,>他们匆匆吃了饭就离开了。<,>Don't be hasty in judging others.<,>不要急于评判他人。<,>haste(匆忙)+y(形容词后缀)→仓促的<,>hasten(v.加速)/hazard(n.危险)  

civil<,>/ˈsɪvl/<,>/ˈsɪvl/<,>adj.公民的/adj.普通公民的/adj.平民的<,>Everyone has civil rights.<,>每个人都有公民权利。<,>He works in the civil service.<,>他在政府部门工作。<,>They had a civil conversation.<,>他们进行了一次礼貌的交谈。<,>civ(公民)+il(形容词后缀)→公民的<,>civic(adj.城市的)/civilian(n.平民)  

able<,>/ˈeɪbl/<,>/ˈeɪbl/<,>adj.有能力的/adj.出色的<,>She is able to solve the problem.<,>她有能力解决这个问题。<,>He is an able leader.<,>他是一个出色的领导者。<,>I wasn't able to attend the meeting.<,>我没能参加会议。<,>able(能)→与能力相关<,>enable(v.使能够)/disable(v.使失去能力)  

drive<,>/draɪv/<,>/draɪv/<,>v.驾驶/v.打入/v.驱<,>He drives to work every day.<,>他每天开车上班。<,>She drove the nail into the wall.<,>她把钉子钉进墙里。<,>The farmer drove the sheep into the pen.<,>农夫把羊赶进围栏。<,>drive(驱动)→与移动或推动相关<,>driver(n.司机)/dive(v.潜水)  

eleventh<,>/ɪˈlɛvnθ/<,>/ɪˈlɛvnθ/<,>adj.第十一（个）<,>This is the eleventh time I've called you.<,>这是我第十一次给你打电话。<,>He finished in eleventh place.<,>他获得了第十一名。<,>Her birthday is on the eleventh of May.<,>她的生日是五月十一日。<,>eleven(十一)+th(序数词后缀)→第十一<,>twelfth(adj.第十二)/tenth(adj.第十)  

friction<,>/ˈfrɪkʃn/<,>/ˈfrɪkʃn/<,>n.摩擦/n.摩擦力<,>Friction causes the machine to heat up.<,>摩擦使机器发热。<,>There was friction between the two teams.<,>两队之间有摩擦。<,>Oil reduces friction in the engine.<,>机油减少发动机的摩擦力。<,>frict(摩擦)+ion(名词后缀)→摩擦力<,>fraction(n.分数)/fiction(n.小说)
expectation<,>/ˌɛkspɛkˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌɛkspɛkˈteɪʃən/<,>n.期待/n.预期/n.期望<,>Her performance exceeded all expectations.<,>她的表现超出了所有人的预期。<,>We have high expectations for this project.<,>我们对这个项目抱有很高的期望。<,>The movie didn't live up to my expectations.<,>这部电影没有达到我的期望。<,>ex(出)+pect(看)+ation→向外看→期待<,>exception(n.例外)/expedition(n.远征)/expenditure(n.支出)  

commission<,>/kəˈmɪʃən/<,>/kəˈmɪʃən/<,>n.委员会/n.委任状<,>The government appointed a commission to investigate the matter.<,>政府任命了一个委员会来调查此事。<,>He received his commission as an officer.<,>他收到了军官委任状。<,>The artist works on commission.<,>这位艺术家接受委托创作。<,>com(共同)+mission(任务)→共同完成任务→委员会<,>mission(n.任务)/admission(n.承认)/omission(n.省略)  

old<,>/əʊld/<,>/oʊld/<,>adj.老的/adj...岁的<,>This is an old tradition in our family.<,>这是我们家的一个古老传统。<,>She is five years old.<,>她五岁了。<,>The old man told us interesting stories.<,>老人给我们讲了有趣的故事。<,>与"gold"(黄金)对比记忆<,>older(比较级)/eldest(最高级)/ancient(adj.古代的)  

night<,>/naɪt/<,>/naɪt/<,>n.夜/n.夜间<,>I usually read a book at night.<,>我通常在晚上看书。<,>The stars are beautiful at night.<,>夜晚的星星很美。<,>He works night shifts at the hospital.<,>他在医院上夜班。<,>与"knight"(骑士)对比记忆<,>nightmare(n.噩梦)/midnight(n.午夜)/overnight(adv.通宵)  

joyful<,>/ˈdʒɔɪfəl/<,>/ˈdʒɔɪfəl/<,>adj.十分喜悦的/adj.快乐的<,>The children were joyful on Christmas morning.<,>圣诞节早晨孩子们非常快乐。<,>She gave a joyful laugh.<,>她发出了快乐的笑声。<,>It was a joyful occasion for everyone.<,>对每个人来说这都是个快乐的场合。<,>joy(快乐)+ful(充满的)→充满快乐的<,>joyless(adj.不快乐的)/enjoyable(adj.令人愉快的)/joyous(adj.快乐的)  

highly<,>/ˈhaɪli/<,>/ˈhaɪli/<,>adv.很/adv.非常/adv.高度地<,>She is highly intelligent.<,>她非常聪明。<,>I highly recommend this book.<,>我强烈推荐这本书。<,>The product is highly effective.<,>这个产品非常有效。<,>high(高)+ly(副词后缀)→高度地<,>high(adj.高的)/height(n.高度)/highland(n.高地)  

full<,>/fʊl/<,>/fʊl/<,>adj.满的/adj.完全的<,>The glass is full of water.<,>玻璃杯装满了水。<,>He gave a full explanation.<,>他给出了完整的解释。<,>I'm full after the big meal.<,>大餐后我吃饱了。<,>与"fill"(装满)对比记忆<,>fully(adv.完全地)/fulfill(v.履行)/fullness(n.充满)  

detail<,>/ˈdiːteɪl/<,>/ˈdiːteɪl/<,>n.细节/n.枝节<,>Pay attention to every detail.<,>注意每一个细节。<,>The report contains many details.<,>报告包含许多细节。<,>Let me explain in detail.<,>让我详细解释一下。<,>de(分开)+tail(切割)→切分成小部分→细节<,>retail(n.零售)/entail(v.需要)/detailed(adj.详细的)  

foot<,>/fʊt/<,>/fʊt/<,>n.脚/n.最下部/n.英尺<,>My foot hurts after the long walk.<,>长时间行走后我的脚疼。<,>The note was at the foot of the page.<,>注释在页面底部。<,>The room is 12 feet long.<,>这个房间12英尺长。<,>与"food"(食物)对比记忆<,>footstep(n.脚步)/football(n.足球)/footnote(n.脚注)  

tag<,>/tæɡ/<,>/tæɡ/<,>n.标签/n.附加语<,>Please check the price tag.<,>请查看价格标签。<,>He added a tag to his email.<,>他在邮件中添加了附加语。<,>The dog has an ID tag.<,>狗有身份标签。<,>与"bag"(包)对比记忆<,>tagline(n.标语)/tagalong(n.跟随者)/hashtag(n.话题标签)
cash<,>/kæʃ/<,>/kæʃ/<,>n.现金/n.现款<,>I need some cash to pay for the groceries.<,>我需要一些现金来支付杂货。<,>He withdrew cash from the ATM.<,>他从自动取款机取了现金。<,>She always carries cash in her wallet.<,>她钱包里总是带着现金。<,>ca(谐音“卡”)+sh(谐音“刷”)→刷卡取现金<,>cache(n.隐藏处)/crash(v.碰撞/n.坠毁)

vanish<,>/ˈvænɪʃ/<,>/ˈvænɪʃ/<,>v.突然不见/v.消失<,>The magician made the rabbit vanish.<,>魔术师让兔子消失了。<,>Her smile vanished when she heard the news.<,>听到这个消息，她的笑容消失了。<,>The fog will vanish by noon.<,>中午前雾会散去。<,>van(空)+ish(动词后缀)→变空→消失<,>varnish(n.清漆/v.粉饰)/banish(v.流放)

movie<,>/ˈmuːvi/<,>/ˈmuvi/<,>n.电影/n.电影院<,>Let's go to the movies tonight.<,>我们今晚去看电影吧。<,>This movie won several awards.<,>这部电影获得了多个奖项。<,>He works in the movie industry.<,>他在电影行业工作。<,>mov(移动)+ie→移动的画面→电影<,>moving(adj.感人的)/movement(n.运动)

convert<,>/kənˈvɜːt/<,>/kənˈvɜrt/<,>v.使转变/v.使改变<,>They converted the garage into a bedroom.<,>他们把车库改造成了卧室。<,>She converted to Buddhism last year.<,>她去年改信了佛教。<,>This device converts sunlight into electricity.<,>这个装置将阳光转化为电能。<,>con(共同)+vert(转)→一起转变<,>converse(v.交谈)/invert(v.倒置)

although<,>/ɔːlˈðəʊ/<,>/ɔlˈðoʊ/<,>conj.尽管/conj.虽然<,>Although it was raining, we went for a walk.<,>虽然下着雨，我们还是去散步了。<,>She's happy although she doesn't show it.<,>她很快乐，虽然不表现出来。<,>Although small, the room is comfortable.<,>房间虽小，但很舒适。<,>al(全部)+though(虽然)→尽管全部<,>though(conj.虽然)/through(prep.通过)

submerge<,>/səbˈmɜːdʒ/<,>/səbˈmɜrdʒ/<,>v.浸没/v.潜入水中<,>The submarine submerged quickly.<,>潜艇迅速下潜了。<,>Floods submerged the entire village.<,>洪水淹没了整个村庄。<,>She submerged her hands in warm water.<,>她把双手浸在温水中。<,>sub(下)+merge(沉)→沉下去→浸没<,>emerge(v.出现)/merge(v.合并)

event<,>/ɪˈvent/<,>/ɪˈvɛnt/<,>n.事件/n.大事/n.事变<,>The Olympic Games is a major sporting event.<,>奥运会是一项重大体育赛事。<,>We're planning a special event for the anniversary.<,>我们正在为周年纪念策划一个特别活动。<,>In the event of rain, the party will be indoors.<,>如果下雨，聚会将在室内举行。<,>e(出)+vent(来)→出来的事→事件<,>invent(v.发明)/prevent(v.阻止)

jam<,>/dʒæm/<,>/dʒæm/<,>n.果酱<,>I like strawberry jam on my toast.<,>我喜欢在吐司上涂草莓酱。<,>She made homemade jam from the berries.<,>她用浆果自制果酱。<,>There's a jar of jam in the fridge.<,>冰箱里有一罐果酱。<,>ja(谐音“加”)+m(谐音“蜜”)→加蜜→果酱<,>jamb(n.门侧柱)/jump(v.跳跃)

display<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>v.陈列/v.展览/v.显示<,>The museum displays ancient artifacts.<,>博物馆展出古代文物。<,>He displayed great courage in the crisis.<,>他在危机中表现出极大的勇气。<,>The computer displays the results instantly.<,>电脑立即显示出结果。<,>dis(分开)+play(播放)→分开播放→展示<,>displease(v.使不快)/dispose(v.处理)

mutton<,>/ˈmʌtn/<,>/ˈmʌtn/<,>n.羊肉<,>Roast mutton is a traditional dish here.<,>烤羊肉是这里的传统菜肴。<,>I prefer mutton to beef in this stew.<,>这道炖菜里我更喜欢羊肉而不是牛肉。<,>The smell of cooked mutton filled the kitchen.<,>煮熟的羊肉香味充满了厨房。<,>mut(变化)+ton(吨)→变化成吨的肉→羊肉<,>button(n.纽扣)/muttonhead(n.笨蛋)
exhaust<,>/ɪɡˈzɔːst/<,>/ɪɡˈzɔst/<,>v.使筋疲力尽/v.用尽<,>The long hike exhausted us.<,>长途远足让我们筋疲力尽。<,>We must not exhaust our natural resources.<,>我们绝不能耗尽自然资源。<,>Her patience was exhausted by his constant complaints.<,>她被他不断的抱怨耗尽了耐心。<,>ex(出)+haust(抽)→抽出→耗尽<,>exhibit(v.展览/n.展品)/haul(v.拖拽/n.拖运)  

pot<,>/pɒt/<,>/pɑːt/<,>n.锅/n.壶/n.罐/n.盆<,>She boiled water in a pot.<,>她用锅烧水。<,>He planted flowers in a clay pot.<,>他把花种在陶盆里。<,>Keep the sugar in an airtight pot.<,>把糖存放在密封罐里。<,>联想：hot pot(火锅)<,>pit(n.深坑)/pat(v.轻拍/n.小块)  

murder<,>/ˈmɜːdə(r)/<,>/ˈmɜːrdər/<,>n.谋杀/n.凶杀/v.谋杀/v.凶杀<,>The detective solved the murder case.<,>侦探侦破了这起谋杀案。<,>It's immoral to murder innocent people.<,>谋杀无辜的人是不道德的。<,>She was accused of attempted murder.<,>她被指控谋杀未遂。<,>mur(死)+der(名词后缀)→致死行为<,>murmur(v.低语/n.潺潺声)/muster(v.召集/n.集合)  

language<,>/ˈlæŋɡwɪdʒ/<,>/ˈlæŋɡwɪdʒ/<,>n.语言/n.语言课程<,>English is an international language.<,>英语是一门国际语言。<,>She takes a language course every summer.<,>她每年夏天都上语言课程。<,>Body language can reveal true feelings.<,>肢体语言能透露真实情感。<,>lang(舌)+uage→舌头发出的声音<,>linguist(n.语言学家)/lingo(n.行话)  

wire<,>/ˈwaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈwaɪər/<,>n.金属线/n.电缆<,>The fence was made of wire.<,>围栏是用金属线做的。<,>They installed new electrical wires.<,>他们安装了新的电缆。<,>The message was sent via wire.<,>消息是通过电缆发送的。<,>wire→wireless(无线的)<,>fire(n.火/v.解雇)/hire(v.雇佣/n.租金)  

honourable<,>/ˈɒnərəbl/<,>/ˈɑːnərəbl/<,>adj.光荣的<,>It was an honourable discharge from the army.<,>这是光荣退伍。<,>He received an honourable mention in the competition.<,>他在比赛中获得荣誉奖。<,>She comes from an honourable family.<,>她出身名门。<,>honour(荣誉)+able(可…的)<,>honorary(adj.名誉的)/honest(adj.诚实的)  

nationality<,>/ˌnæʃəˈnæləti/<,>/ˌnæʃəˈnæləti/<,>n.国籍/n.民族/n.族<,>What's your nationality?<,>你的国籍是什么？<,>China has 56 nationalities.<,>中国有56个民族。<,>He has dual nationality.<,>他有双重国籍。<,>nation(国家)+ality(性质)→国家属性<,>native(adj.本地的/n.当地人)/nation(n.国家)  

remove<,>/rɪˈmuːv/<,>/rɪˈmuːv/<,>v.移动/v.搬开/v.脱掉<,>Please remove your shoes before entering.<,>进屋前请脱鞋。<,>They removed the old furniture.<,>他们搬走了旧家具。<,>The stain is hard to remove.<,>这个污渍很难去除。<,>re(再)+move(移动)→再次移动<,>movement(n.运动)/remote(adj.遥远的)  

spacecraft<,>/ˈspeɪskrɑːft/<,>/ˈspeɪskræft/<,>n.航天器/n.宇宙飞船<,>The spacecraft landed on Mars.<,>航天器在火星着陆。<,>NASA launched a new spacecraft.<,>美国宇航局发射了新航天器。<,>The spacecraft is orbiting Earth.<,>宇宙飞船正在绕地球轨道运行。<,>space(太空)+craft(飞行器)<,>aircraft(n.飞机)/hovercraft(n.气垫船)  

channel<,>/ˈtʃænl/<,>/ˈtʃænl/<,>n.海峡/n.渠道/n.频道<,>The English Channel separates England and France.<,>英吉利海峡隔开英法两国。<,>We watched the news on Channel 5.<,>我们在5频道看新闻。<,>They communicated through official channels.<,>他们通过官方渠道沟通。<,>chan(管道)+nel→通道<,>tunnel(n.隧道)/canal(n.运河)
lunch<,>/lʌntʃ/<,>/lʌntʃ/<,>n.午餐/n.便餐<,>Let's have lunch together at noon.<,>我们中午一起吃午饭吧。<,>She packed a simple lunch for her son.<,>她给儿子准备了一份简单的便餐。<,>We usually take a lunch break at 12:30.<,>我们通常在12:30午休。<,>lun(谐音"轮")+ch(谐音"吃")→轮流吃饭时间→午餐<,>launch(v.发射)/munch(v.大声咀嚼)/brunch(n.早午餐)

form<,>/fɔːm/<,>/fɔːrm/<,>n.形式/n.形状/v.形成<,>The artist created a beautiful form with clay.<,>艺术家用黏土塑造了一个美丽的形状。<,>Please fill out this application form.<,>请填写这张申请表。<,>Ice forms when water freezes.<,>水结冰时就形成了冰。<,>for(为了)+m(形状)→为了某种形状→形成<,>from(介词.来自)/foam(n.泡沫)/farm(n.农场)

soak<,>/səʊk/<,>/soʊk/<,>v.浸/v.泡<,>Soak the beans overnight before cooking.<,>煮之前把豆子浸泡一夜。<,>She likes to soak in a hot bath after work.<,>她喜欢下班后泡个热水澡。<,>The rain soaked through his jacket.<,>雨水浸透了他的夹克。<,>so(如此)+ak(谐音"啊渴")→如此渴望水→浸泡<,>sock(n.袜子)/soap(n.肥皂)/oak(n.橡树)

mobile<,>/ˈməʊbaɪl/<,>/ˈmoʊbəl/<,>adj.运动的/adj.流动的<,>Mobile phones have become essential in modern life.<,>手机已成为现代生活的必需品。<,>The library has a mobile service for rural areas.<,>图书馆为农村地区提供流动服务。<,>He has a very mobile face that shows every emotion.<,>他有一张表情丰富的脸。<,>mob(移动)+ile(形容词后缀)→可移动的<,>mob(n.暴民)/model(n.模型)/modem(n.调制解调器)

dim<,>/dɪm/<,>/dɪm/<,>adj.昏暗的/adj.朦胧的<,>The dim light made it hard to read.<,>昏暗的灯光让人难以阅读。<,>I have only a dim memory of that event.<,>我对那件事只有模糊的记忆。<,>Her eyes were dim with tears.<,>她的眼睛因泪水而模糊。<,>di(谐音"低")+m(谐音"目")→低目→光线昏暗<,>dam(n.水坝)/dime(n.一角硬币)/dumb(adj.哑的)

death<,>/deθ/<,>/dɛθ/<,>n.死/n.死亡/n.灭亡<,>The death of his pet dog made him very sad.<,>宠物狗的死亡让他非常伤心。<,>Smoking can lead to an early death.<,>吸烟可能导致早逝。<,>The death of the empire came suddenly.<,>这个帝国的灭亡来得很突然。<,>dea(谐音"跌")+th(谐音"死")→跌倒死亡<,>breath(n.呼吸)/depth(n.深度)/debt(n.债务)

inevitable<,>/ɪnˈevɪtəbl/<,>/ɪnˈɛvɪtəbəl/<,>adj.不可避免的/adj.必然的<,>Death is the inevitable end of life.<,>死亡是生命不可避免的结局。<,>It was inevitable that they would meet again.<,>他们再次相遇是必然的。<,>The accident was the inevitable result of carelessness.<,>这次事故是粗心大意的必然结果。<,>in(不)+evitable(可避免的)→不可避免的<,>evitable(adj.可避免的)/edible(adj.可食用的)/incredible(adj.难以置信的)

host<,>/həʊst/<,>/hoʊst/<,>n.主人/n.东道主<,>Our host welcomed us warmly at the door.<,>主人在门口热情地欢迎我们。<,>China was the host country for the 2008 Olympics.<,>中国是2008年奥运会的东道主。<,>The TV show has a new host this season.<,>这个电视节目本季有新主持人。<,>ho(谐音"候")+st(谐音"侍")→等候侍奉的人→主人<,>ghost(n.鬼)/most(adj.最多的)/post(n.邮件)

Marxist<,>/ˈmɑːksɪst/<,>/ˈmɑːrksɪst/<,>adj.马克思主义的<,>He holds Marxist views on economics.<,>他在经济学上持有马克思主义观点。<,>The Marxist theory influenced many revolutionaries.<,>马克思主义理论影响了许多革命者。<,>She is writing a paper on Marxist philosophy.<,>她正在写一篇关于马克思主义哲学的论文。<,>Marx(马克思)+ist(主义者)→马克思主义的<,>artist(n.艺术家)/cyclist(n.骑自行车的人)/specialist(n.专家)

pork<,>/pɔːk/<,>/pɔːrk/<,>n.猪肉<,>We're having roast pork for dinner tonight.<,>我们今晚晚餐吃烤猪肉。<,>Pork is forbidden in some religions.<,>某些宗教禁止食用猪肉。<,>This restaurant serves the best pork chops in town.<,>这家餐厅有城里最好的猪排。<,>por(谐音"破")+k(谐音"壳")→破壳而出的猪→猪肉<,>fork(n.叉子)/park(n.公园)/pore(n.毛孔)
expect<,>/ɪkˈspekt/<,>/ɪkˈspekt/<,>v.预料/v.预期/v.等待<,>I expect the meeting to finish by 5 PM.<,>我预计会议将在下午5点前结束。<,>We are expecting guests this weekend.<,>我们这周末有客人要来。<,>Don't expect too much from him.<,>不要对他期望太高。<,>ex(向外)+pect(看)→向外看→预期<,>except(conj.除了)/inspect(v.检查)/respect(v.尊重)

disorder<,>/dɪsˈɔːdə(r)/<,>/dɪsˈɔːrdər/<,>n.骚乱/n.混乱/n.杂乱<,>The room was in complete disorder after the party.<,>派对过后房间一片狼藉。<,>He suffers from a sleep disorder.<,>他患有睡眠障碍。<,>The police were called to control the public disorder.<,>警察被叫来控制骚乱。<,>dis(否定)+order(秩序)→没有秩序→混乱<,>order(n.顺序/v.命令)/border(n.边界)/disorient(v.使迷失方向)

triumph<,>/ˈtraɪʌmf/<,>/ˈtraɪəmf/<,>n.凯旋/n.胜利/v.成功<,>The team's triumph was celebrated by all.<,>全队都在庆祝这次胜利。<,>She triumphed over many difficulties.<,>她克服了许多困难。<,>The Roman triumph was a grand procession.<,>罗马凯旋式是盛大的游行。<,>tri(三)+umph(声音)→三次欢呼→胜利<,>trumpet(n.小号)/trump(v.胜过)/triumphal(adj.胜利的)

jaw<,>/dʒɔː/<,>/dʒɔː/<,>n.颌/n.颚<,>He broke his jaw in the accident.<,>他在事故中摔断了颌骨。<,>The crocodile has powerful jaws.<,>鳄鱼有强有力的颚。<,>She rested her chin on her jaw.<,>她把下巴搁在手上。<,>谐音"嚼"→用颚咀嚼<,>law(n.法律)/paw(n.爪子)/saw(n.锯子)

peak<,>/piːk/<,>/piːk/<,>n.山顶/n.巅/adj.最高的<,>We reached the mountain peak at dawn.<,>我们在黎明时分到达了山顶。<,>Tourist numbers peak in summer.<,>游客数量在夏季达到高峰。<,>She is at the peak of her career.<,>她正处于事业巅峰。<,>pea(豌豆)+k→像豌豆一样突出的山顶<,>peek(v.偷看)/leak(v.泄漏)/beak(n.鸟嘴)

practically<,>/ˈpræktɪkli/<,>/ˈpræktɪkli/<,>adv.实际上/adv.几乎<,>It's practically impossible to finish today.<,>今天几乎不可能完成。<,>He's practically a member of the family.<,>他几乎算是家庭成员了。<,>Practically speaking, this plan won't work.<,>实际上，这个计划行不通。<,>practical(实际的)+ly(副词后缀)→实际上<,>theoretically(adv.理论上)/technically(adv.技术上)/literally(adv.字面上)

exclusively<,>/ɪkˈskluːsɪvli/<,>/ɪkˈskluːsɪvli/<,>adv.专门地<,>This room is exclusively for VIP guests.<,>这个房间专供VIP客人使用。<,>The magazine is published exclusively online.<,>这本杂志只在网上出版。<,>She works exclusively with children.<,>她专门与儿童一起工作。<,>ex(出)+clus(关闭)+ive+ly→排他性地<,>inclusively(adv.包含地)/conclusively(adv.决定性地)/exclusion(n.排除)

noble<,>/ˈnəʊbl/<,>/ˈnoʊbl/<,>adj.贵族的/adj.高尚的<,>He comes from a noble family.<,>他出身贵族家庭。<,>It was a noble gesture of forgiveness.<,>这是高尚的宽恕之举。<,>The noble gases are chemically inert.<,>惰性气体化学性质不活泼。<,>no(不)+ble(ble音同"卑")→不卑微→高贵的<,>mobile(adj.移动的)/humble(adj.谦逊的)/notable(adj.显著的)

liberty<,>/ˈlɪbəti/<,>/ˈlɪbərti/<,>n.自由/n.释放/n.许可<,>The Statue of Liberty is a famous landmark.<,>自由女神像是著名的地标。<,>You have the liberty to choose.<,>你有选择的自由。<,>They fought for their liberty.<,>他们为自由而战。<,>liber(自由)+ty(名词后缀)→自由<,>library(n.图书馆)/liberal(adj.自由的)/literal(adj.字面的)

graceful<,>/ˈɡreɪsfl/<,>/ˈɡreɪsfəl/<,>adj.优美的/adj.优雅的<,>The dancer's movements were graceful.<,>舞者的动作很优美。<,>She made a graceful exit.<,>她优雅地退场了。<,>The swan is a graceful bird.<,>天鹅是优雅的鸟类。<,>grace(优雅)+ful(形容词后缀)→优雅的<,>grateful(adj.感激的)/grace(n.恩典)/gracious(adj.亲切的)
joint<,>/dʒɔɪnt/<,>/dʒɔɪnt/<,>n.关节/n.接头/n.接缝<,>He injured his knee joint while playing football.<,>他在踢足球时伤到了膝关节。<,>The plumber fixed the leak at the pipe joint.<,>水管工修好了管道的接头处。<,>The joint between the two pieces of wood was barely visible.<,>两块木头之间的接缝几乎看不见。<,>join(连接)+t→连接处→关节/接头<,>joined(adj.连接的)/joiner(n.接合器)

sweep<,>/swiːp/<,>/swip/<,>v.扫/v.刮起/v.扫过<,>She sweeps the floor every morning.<,>她每天早上都会扫地。<,>The wind swept the leaves across the yard.<,>风把树叶刮得满院子都是。<,>A wave of nostalgia swept over her.<,>一阵怀旧之情掠过她的心头。<,>s+weep(哭泣)→边哭边扫→清扫<,>weep(v.哭泣)/sweet(adj.甜的)/sweat(n.汗水)

session<,>/ˈseʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈsɛʃən/<,>n.一段时间/n.会议<,>The therapy session lasted for an hour.<,>治疗持续了一个小时。<,>The conference will have multiple sessions throughout the day.<,>会议将在全天进行多个场次。<,>The legislative session ended with no agreement.<,>立法会议结束时没有达成任何协议。<,>sess(坐)+ion→坐着开会→会议<,>season(n.季节)/cession(n.割让)

countryside<,>/ˈkʌntrɪsaɪd/<,>/ˈkʌntriˌsaɪd/<,>n.乡下/n.农村<,>They went for a picnic in the countryside.<,>他们去乡下野餐了。<,>The countryside is beautiful in spring.<,>春天的乡村很美。<,>Many people prefer the quiet life of the countryside.<,>许多人更喜欢乡村的宁静生活。<,>country(国家)+side(边)→国家的边缘→乡村<,>countryman(n.乡下人)/countrywide(adj.全国性的)

miss<,>/mɪs/<,>/mɪs/<,>n.小姐<,>Miss Smith is our new teacher.<,>史密斯小姐是我们的新老师。<,>The letter was addressed to Miss Johnson.<,>这封信是寄给约翰逊小姐的。<,>Miss, could you help me with this?<,>小姐，你能帮我这个忙吗？<,>mi(拼音"迷")+ss(两个美女)→迷人的小姐<,>mist(n.薄雾)/kiss(v.亲吻)

hundred<,>/ˈhʌndrəd/<,>/ˈhʌndrəd/<,>num.百/num.百个/n.许多<,>There are a hundred students in the hall.<,>大厅里有一百名学生。<,>He made hundreds of mistakes in his essay.<,>他的文章里有很多错误。<,>Hundreds of people attended the concert.<,>数百人参加了音乐会。<,>hund(古英语"百")+red(红色)→红色的百元大钞<,>hunger(n.饥饿)/thunder(n.雷声)

tube<,>/tjuːb/<,>/tub/<,>n.管/n.电子管/n.显像管<,>He looked through the telescope tube.<,>他通过望远镜筒观察。<,>The old TV had a cathode ray tube.<,>那台旧电视有个阴极射线管。<,>She squeezed toothpaste from the tube.<,>她从管子里挤出牙膏。<,>tu(拼音"土")+be(是)→土管子<,>cube(n.立方体)/tune(n.曲调)

jungle<,>/ˈdʒʌŋɡ(ə)l/<,>/ˈdʒʌŋɡəl/<,>n.丛林/n.密林/n.莽丛<,>The explorers got lost in the jungle.<,>探险者在丛林中迷路了。<,>Jungle animals can be very dangerous.<,>丛林动物可能非常危险。<,>The city is a concrete jungle.<,>这座城市是个混凝土丛林。<,>jun(拼音"军")+gle→军队在丛林中训练<,>juggle(v.玩杂耍)/jingle(n.叮当声)

fool<,>/fuːl/<,>/ful/<,>n.蠢人/n.傻子/v.欺骗<,>Don't be such a fool!<,>别这么傻了！<,>He fooled everyone with his disguise.<,>他用伪装骗过了所有人。<,>April Fools' Day is on April 1st.<,>愚人节是在4月1日。<,>foo(拼音"佛")+l(像棍子)→佛祖用棍子打醒愚人<,>foul(adj.肮脏的)/fuel(n.燃料)

optical<,>/ˈɒptɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈɑptɪkəl/<,>adj.眼的/adj.光学的<,>He needs optical correction for his vision.<,>他的视力需要光学矫正。<,>The store sells optical instruments.<,>这家商店出售光学仪器。<,>Optical illusions can trick the eye.<,>视错觉可以欺骗眼睛。<,>opt(选择)+ical→选择用眼睛看的→视觉的<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/optimal(adj.最佳的)
attentive<,>/əˈtentɪv/<,>/əˈtɛntɪv/<,>adj.注意的/adj.有礼貌的<,>She was very attentive to the needs of her students.<,>她非常关注学生的需求。<,>He gave an attentive nod during the meeting.<,>他在会议期间礼貌地点了点头。<,>The attentive waiter refilled our glasses promptly.<,>那位有礼貌的服务员迅速为我们续杯。<,>at(强调)+tent(伸展)+ive(形容词后缀)→伸展出去关注→注意的<,>intensive(adj.密集的)/retentive(adj.保持的)/pretend(v.假装)  

anybody<,>/ˈenibɒdi/<,>/ˈɛniˌbɑdi/<,>pron.任何人<,>Does anybody know the answer to this question?<,>有人知道这个问题的答案吗？<,>Anybody can join the club if they are interested.<,>任何感兴趣的人都可以加入这个俱乐部。<,>I didn't see anybody at the party that I knew.<,>我在派对上没看到任何认识的人。<,>any(任何)+body(人)→任何人<,>nobody(pron.没有人)/somebody(pron.某人)/everybody(pron.每个人)  

complete<,>/kəmˈpliːt/<,>/kəmˈplit/<,>adj.完整的/adj.完成的<,>The puzzle is now complete with all its pieces.<,>拼图现在完整了，所有碎片都在。<,>She felt complete after achieving her lifelong dream.<,>实现毕生梦想后，她感到圆满了。<,>Please complete the form before submitting it.<,>提交前请填完整表格。<,>com(完全)+plete(填满)→完全填满→完整的<,>compete(v.竞争)/comply(v.遵从)/complement(n.补充物)  

depth<,>/depθ/<,>/dɛpθ/<,>n.深度/n.深厚/n.深处<,>The depth of the ocean at this point is over 3,000 meters.<,>此处海洋深度超过3000米。<,>I was moved by the depth of her emotions.<,>她感情的深厚让我感动。<,>The submarine explored the depths of the Mariana Trench.<,>潜水艇探索了马里亚纳海沟的深处。<,>deep(深的)+th(名词后缀)→深度<,>width(n.宽度)/breadth(n.广度)/length(n.长度)  

participate<,>/pɑːˈtɪsɪpeɪt/<,>/pɑrˈtɪsəˌpeɪt/<,>v.参与/v.参加/v.分享<,>All students are encouraged to participate in the discussion.<,>鼓励所有学生参与讨论。<,>She participated actively in the charity event.<,>她积极参与了慈善活动。<,>We'd like you to participate in the profits.<,>我们希望你分享利润。<,>part(部分)+cip(拿)+ate(动词后缀)→拿一部分→参与<,>anticipate(v.预期)/emancipate(v.解放)/principal(adj.主要的)  

tire<,>/ˈtaɪə(r)/<,>/taɪr/<,>v.疲劳/v.累/v.厌倦<,>The long journey tired the travelers.<,>长途旅行使游客们疲惫不堪。<,>She never tires of helping others.<,>她从不厌倦帮助他人。<,>The children tired quickly after playing all day.<,>孩子们玩了一整天后很快就累了。<,>联想tired(adj.疲倦的)→tire是其动词形式<,>retire(v.退休)/entire(adj.全部的)/attire(n.服装)  

God<,>/ɡɒd/<,>/ɡɑd/<,>n.神/n.神像/n.上帝<,>They prayed to God for help.<,>他们向上帝祈祷帮助。<,>The ancient Greeks believed in many gods.<,>古希腊人信仰许多神。<,>The temple housed a golden god.<,>寺庙里供奉着一尊金神像。<,>注意首字母大写时特指"上帝"<,>goddess(n.女神)/godly(adj.神圣的)/godfather(n.教父)  

habit<,>/ˈhæbɪt/<,>/ˈhæbɪt/<,>n.习惯/n.习性<,>Smoking is a bad habit that's hard to break.<,>吸烟是个难以戒掉的坏习惯。<,>She has a habit of biting her nails when nervous.<,>她有紧张时咬指甲的习惯。<,>The nocturnal habits of owls fascinate biologists.<,>猫头鹰的夜行习性让生物学家着迷。<,>hab(居住)+it→长期居住形成的→习惯<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/inhabit(v.居住)/exhibit(v.展览)
