enlarge<,>/ɪnˈlɑːdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈlɑrdʒ/<,>v.扩大/v.扩展/v.放大<,>They decided to enlarge their house by adding a new wing.<,>他们决定扩建房屋，增加一个新侧厅。<,>The photo was enlarged to show more details.<,>照片被放大以显示更多细节。<,>The company plans to enlarge its market share.<,>公司计划扩大市场份额。<,>en(使)+large(大)→使变大→扩大<,>engage(v.从事)/encourage(v.鼓励)/endanger(v.危及)  

bargain<,>/ˈbɑːɡən/<,>/ˈbɑrɡɪn/<,>n.交易/v.议价<,>I got this dress at a bargain price.<,>我以很便宜的价格买了这条裙子。<,>They bargained for hours over the price of the car.<,>他们就汽车价格讨价还价了几个小时。<,>It's a real bargain at only $10!<,>只要10美元，真是划算！<,>bar(酒吧)+gain(获得)→在酒吧达成交易<,>barge(n.驳船)/barrage(n.弹幕)/barn(n.谷仓)
revolutionary<,>/ˌrevəˈluːʃənəri/<,>/ˌrevəˈluːʃəneri/<,>adj.革命的/n.革命者<,>His ideas were considered revolutionary at the time.<,>他的想法在当时被认为是革命性的。<,>She was a true revolutionary who fought for freedom.<,>她是一位为自由而战的真正革命者。<,>The revolutionary movement spread quickly across the country.<,>革命运动迅速在全国蔓延。<,>revolut(旋转)+ionary→彻底改变现状的<,>evolutionary(adj.进化的)/revolt(v.反抗/n.叛乱)

instance<,>/ˈɪnstəns/<,>/ˈɪnstəns/<,>n.例子/n.实例/n.事例<,>This is just one instance of his kindness.<,>这只是他善良的一个例子。<,>For instance, you could try a different approach.<,>例如，你可以尝试不同的方法。<,>In this instance, we'll make an exception.<,>在这种情况下，我们将破例一次。<,>in(在)+stance(站立)→具体站立的例子<,>instant(adj.立即的)/distance(n.距离)

considerate<,>/kənˈsɪdərət/<,>/kənˈsɪdərət/<,>adj.考虑周到的/adj.体谅的<,>It was very considerate of you to bring flowers.<,>你带花来真是考虑周到。<,>He's always considerate of other people's feelings.<,>他总是体谅别人的感受。<,>A considerate driver slows down near schools.<,>体贴的司机在学校附近会减速。<,>consider(考虑)+ate→考虑很多的<,>considerable(adj.相当大的)/deliberate(adj.故意的)

dismiss<,>/dɪsˈmɪs/<,>/dɪsˈmɪs/<,>v.不再考虑/v.解雇<,>The judge dismissed the case due to lack of evidence.<,>法官因证据不足驳回了此案。<,>She was dismissed from her job for being late too often.<,>她因经常迟到而被解雇。<,>He quickly dismissed the idea as impractical.<,>他很快认为这个想法不切实际而不再考虑。<,>dis(离开)+miss(送)→送走<,>dismal(adj.阴沉的)/missile(n.导弹)

dare<,>/deə(r)/<,>/der/<,>v.敢/v.竟敢<,>How dare you speak to me like that!<,>你竟敢这样跟我说话！<,>I wouldn't dare tell him the truth.<,>我不敢告诉他真相。<,>Do you dare to try this spicy food?<,>你敢尝试这个辣的食物吗？<,>与"dear(亲爱的)"对比记忆<,>daring(adj.大胆的)/bare(adj.赤裸的)

odour<,>/ˈəʊdə(r)/<,>/ˈoʊdər/<,>n.气味/n.味道<,>The kitchen was filled with the delicious odour of baking bread.<,>厨房里充满了烤面包的香味。<,>There was a strange odour coming from the basement.<,>地下室传来一股奇怪的气味。<,>Some flowers have strong odours to attract insects.<,>有些花有强烈的气味来吸引昆虫。<,>odo(气味)+ur→气味<,>odor(美式拼写)/order(n.顺序)

cultivate<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>v.耕种/v.种植/v.培养<,>Farmers cultivate the land to grow crops.<,>农民耕种土地种植庄稼。<,>She cultivated her musical talent from a young age.<,>她从很小就开始培养音乐才能。<,>We need to cultivate good study habits.<,>我们需要培养良好的学习习惯。<,>cult(耕种)+ivate→使耕种<,>culture(n.文化)/agriculture(n.农业)

thunder<,>/ˈθʌndə(r)/<,>/ˈθʌndər/<,>n.雷/v.打雷/v.吼出<,>We could hear thunder in the distance.<,>我们能听到远处的雷声。<,>"Get out!" he thundered angrily.<,>"出去！"他愤怒地吼道。<,>It's thundering outside; a storm is coming.<,>外面在打雷，暴风雨要来了。<,>thun(雷声)+der→雷声<,>thunderstorm(n.雷暴)/wonder(v.想知道)

enclose<,>/ɪnˈkləʊz/<,>/ɪnˈkloʊz/<,>v.附上/v.围住/v.圈起<,>Please find enclosed a copy of my resume.<,>随信附上我的简历一份。<,>The garden was enclosed by a high fence.<,>花园被高篱笆围了起来。<,>I'll enclose some photos with this letter.<,>我会在这封信里附上一些照片。<,>en(使)+close(关闭)→使关闭<,>disclose(v.揭露)/closure(n.关闭)

enter<,>/ˈentə(r)/<,>/ˈentər/<,>v.走进/v.进入/v.参加<,>Please knock before you enter the room.<,>进入房间前请先敲门。<,>He entered the competition last year.<,>他去年参加了这个比赛。<,>The train is about to enter the tunnel.<,>火车即将进入隧道。<,>与"exit(出口)"对比记忆<,>entry(n.进入)/center(n.中心)
introduce<,>/ˌɪntrəˈdjuːs/<,>/ˌɪntrəˈduːs/<,>v.介绍/v.引进/v.传入<,>Let me introduce my friend to you.<,>让我向你介绍我的朋友。<,>The company plans to introduce a new product next month.<,>公司计划下个月引进一款新产品。<,>Tea was introduced to Europe from China.<,>茶是从中国传入欧洲的。<,>intro(向内)+duce(引导)→引入→介绍<,>reduce(v.减少)/produce(v.生产)/deduce(v.推断)

judgement<,>/ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/<,>/ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/<,>n.判断/n.意见/n.审判<,>I trust your judgement in this matter.<,>在这件事上我相信你的判断。<,>The court will pass judgement tomorrow.<,>法庭明天将作出审判。<,>In my judgement, we should wait for more information.<,>依我看，我们应该等待更多信息。<,>judge(判断)+ment(名词后缀)→判断<,>judgment(美式拼写)/adjustment(n.调整)/acknowledgement(n.承认)

pool<,>/puːl/<,>/puːl/<,>n.游泳池/n.水塘/n.水池<,>The kids are swimming in the pool.<,>孩子们正在游泳池里游泳。<,>There's a small pool in the garden.<,>花园里有个小水池。<,>We found some frogs in the pool behind the house.<,>我们在屋后的水塘里发现了一些青蛙。<,>发音类似"扑通"落水声→游泳池<,>pole(n.杆子)/poor(adj.贫穷的)/poll(n.投票)

daring<,>/ˈdeərɪŋ/<,>/ˈderɪŋ/<,>adj.大胆的/adj.勇敢的<,>That was a daring decision to make.<,>那是个大胆的决定。<,>The daring firefighter saved the child from the burning building.<,>勇敢的消防员从燃烧的建筑物中救出了孩子。<,>Her daring fashion choices always attract attention.<,>她大胆的时尚选择总是引人注目。<,>dare(敢)+ing→敢做的→大胆的<,>darling(n.亲爱的)/darning(n.织补)/darting(adj.飞奔的)

postpone<,>/pəˈspəʊn/<,>/poʊˈspoʊn/<,>v.延迟/v.推迟/v.延缓<,>We have to postpone the meeting until next week.<,>我们不得不把会议推迟到下周。<,>The game was postponed due to bad weather.<,>比赛因天气不好而推迟了。<,>She decided to postpone her trip to Europe.<,>她决定推迟去欧洲的旅行。<,>post(后)+pone(放)→往后放→推迟<,>propose(v.建议)/oppose(v.反对)/dispose(v.处理)

telegram<,>/ˈtelɪɡræm/<,>/ˈtelɪɡræm/<,>n.电报<,>They received a telegram announcing the birth of their grandson.<,>他们收到了一封宣布孙子出生的电报。<,>In the past, people used telegrams for urgent messages.<,>过去人们用电报发送紧急信息。<,>The telegram was delivered by a messenger on a bicycle.<,>电报是由骑自行车的信使送来的。<,>tele(远)+gram(写)→远距离书写→电报<,>telephone(n.电话)/telegraph(n.电报机)/telemetry(n.遥测技术)

fund<,>/fʌnd/<,>/fʌnd/<,>n.基金/n.资金<,>The university established a scholarship fund.<,>大学设立了一个奖学金基金。<,>We need to raise funds for the new project.<,>我们需要为新项目筹集资金。<,>The government allocated funds for road repairs.<,>政府拨出资金用于道路维修。<,>发音类似"放得"→把钱放进去→基金<,>found(v.建立)/fun(n.乐趣)/fond(adj.喜欢的)

lifetime<,>/ˈlaɪftaɪm/<,>/ˈlaɪftaɪm/<,>n.一生/n.终身<,>This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.<,>这是个千载难逢的机会。<,>He devoted his lifetime to scientific research.<,>他把一生都奉献给了科学研究。<,>The warranty is valid for the lifetime of the product.<,>保修在产品使用寿命内有效。<,>life(生命)+time(时间)→生命时间→一生<,>daytime(n.白天)/nighttime(n.夜间)/pastime(n.消遣)

control<,>/kənˈtrəʊl/<,>/kənˈtroʊl/<,>v.控制/v.克制/n.控制<,>You need to control your temper.<,>你需要控制你的脾气。<,>The pilot lost control of the airplane.<,>飞行员失去了对飞机的控制。<,>This remote control doesn't work properly.<,>这个遥控器不太好用。<,>contr(反对)+ol(控制)→反对失控→控制<,>contrast(n.对比)/contract(n.合同)/contrail(n.航迹云)

bronze<,>/brɒnz/<,>/brɑːnz/<,>n.青铜/n.青铜制品<,>The statue is made of bronze.<,>这座雕像是青铜制成的。<,>He won a bronze medal in the Olympics.<,>他在奥运会上获得了一枚铜牌。<,>The museum has a collection of ancient bronze artifacts.<,>博物馆收藏了一批古代青铜器。<,>发音类似"布朗兹"→青铜<,>brass(n.黄铜)/bronco(n.野马)/bronchi(n.支气管)
pit<,>/pɪt/<,>/pɪt/<,>n.坑/n.地坑/n.煤矿<,>They dug a pit to bury the waste.<,>他们挖了一个坑来掩埋垃圾。<,>The miners work deep in the pit.<,>矿工们在深坑里工作。<,>Be careful not to fall into the pit.<,>小心别掉进坑里。<,>pi(拼音"皮")+t(形状像坑)→皮掉进坑里<,>bit(n.一点)/fit(v.适合)/sit(v.坐)

lab<,>/læb/<,>/læb/<,>n.实验室/n.研究室<,>She spends most of her time in the lab.<,>她大部分时间都在实验室里。<,>The new lab is equipped with advanced instruments.<,>新实验室配备了先进的仪器。<,>Our chemistry lab is on the third floor.<,>我们的化学实验室在三楼。<,>lab(谐音"来吧")→来做实验<,>lap(n.膝盖)/lamb(n.羔羊)/lobe(n.耳垂)

dynamic<,>/daɪˈnæmɪk/<,>/daɪˈnæmɪk/<,>adj.有活力的/adj.动力的<,>She has a dynamic personality.<,>她性格活泼。<,>The city has a dynamic economy.<,>这个城市经济活跃。<,>Dynamic stretching is better before exercise.<,>运动前做动态拉伸更好。<,>dyna(力量)+mic(形容词后缀)→有力量的<,>dynamite(n.炸药)/dynasty(n.王朝)/diameter(n.直径)

disable<,>/dɪsˈeɪbl/<,>/dɪsˈeɪbəl/<,>v.使无能/v.使伤残<,>The accident disabled him for life.<,>这次事故使他终身残疾。<,>This button disables the alarm system.<,>这个按钮可以关闭警报系统。<,>Viruses can disable your computer.<,>病毒会使你的电脑瘫痪。<,>dis(否定)+able(能够)→使不能<,>enable(v.使能够)/unable(adj.不能的)/disability(n.残疾)

comparative<,>/kəmˈpærətɪv/<,>/kəmˈpærətɪv/<,>adj.比较的/adj.相对的<,>We made a comparative study of the two methods.<,>我们对两种方法进行了比较研究。<,>Living here is of comparative comfort.<,>住在这里相对舒适。<,>This is a comparative advantage.<,>这是一个相对优势。<,>compare(比较)+ative(形容词后缀)→比较的<,>comparable(adj.可比较的)/comparison(n.比较)/competitive(adj.竞争的)

gate<,>/ɡeɪt/<,>/ɡeɪt/<,>n.大门/n.篱笆门<,>Please close the gate behind you.<,>请随手关门。<,>We'll meet at the school gate.<,>我们在校门口见面。<,>The garden gate is painted green.<,>花园门漆成了绿色。<,>g(形状像门)+ate(eat过去式)→在门口吃东西<,>gait(n.步态)/grate(v.磨碎)/gateau(n.奶油蛋糕)

seed<,>/siːd/<,>/siːd/<,>n.种子/n.籽/n.起因/n.萌芽<,>Plant the seeds in spring.<,>春天播种。<,>This apple contains many seeds.<,>这个苹果有很多籽。<,>Her idea was the seed of our project.<,>她的想法是我们项目的萌芽。<,>see(看)+d(地)→看地里长出的种子<,>seek(v.寻找)/seem(v.似乎)/seep(v.渗出)

worthwhile<,>/ˌwɜːθˈwaɪl/<,>/ˌwɜːrθˈwaɪl/<,>adj.值得花时间的<,>It's worthwhile to visit the museum.<,>参观博物馆是值得的。<,>This is a worthwhile investment.<,>这是一项值得的投资。<,>Learning English is worthwhile.<,>学习英语是值得的。<,>worth(价值)+while(时间)→值得花时间的<,>worthless(adj.无价值的)/worthy(adj.值得的)/worthily(adv.值得地)

fame<,>/feɪm/<,>/feɪm/<,>n.名声/n.名望<,>He achieved fame as a writer.<,>他作为作家成名了。<,>Her fame spread worldwide.<,>她的名声传遍全球。<,>Fame comes with responsibility.<,>名声伴随着责任。<,>fa(拼音"发")+me(我)→我出名了<,>frame(n.框架)/flame(n.火焰)/famine(n.饥荒)

doubtful<,>/ˈdaʊtfəl/<,>/ˈdaʊtfəl/<,>adj.难以预测的/adj.怀疑的<,>I'm doubtful about his story.<,>我对他的说法表示怀疑。<,>The weather looks doubtful for tomorrow.<,>明天的天气难以预测。<,>She gave me a doubtful look.<,>她给了我一个怀疑的眼神。<,>doubt(怀疑)+ful(形容词后缀)→怀疑的<,>doubtless(adj.无疑的)/undoubted(adj.无疑的)/redoubtable(adj.可敬畏的)
distinguish<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>v.区别/v.辨别/v.认别<,>Can you distinguish between these two colors?<,>你能区分这两种颜色吗？<,>He has the ability to distinguish right from wrong.<,>他有辨别是非的能力。<,>It's hard to distinguish her voice in the crowd.<,>在人群中很难辨认出她的声音。<,>dis(分开)+stingu(刺)+ish→用刺分开→区别<,>extinguish(v.熄灭)/distinct(adj.明显的)/distinctive(adj.独特的)

concert<,>/ˈkɒnsət/<,>/ˈkɑːnsərt/<,>n.音乐会/n.演奏会<,>We went to a classical concert last night.<,>昨晚我们去听了一场古典音乐会。<,>The concert was canceled due to bad weather.<,>由于天气不好，音乐会被取消了。<,>She performed beautifully at the school concert.<,>她在学校音乐会上表演得很出色。<,>con(共同)+cert(确定)→共同确认→音乐会<,>concerto(n.协奏曲)/concerted(adj.协同的)/concertina(n.六角手风琴)

famine<,>/ˈfæmɪn/<,>/ˈfæmɪn/<,>n.饥荒<,>The country suffered from a severe famine last year.<,>去年这个国家遭受了严重的饥荒。<,>Many people died during the great famine.<,>许多人在大饥荒期间死去。<,>Charities are sending food to famine-stricken areas.<,>慈善机构正在向饥荒灾区运送食物。<,>fam(饥饿)+ine(状态)→饥饿状态→饥荒<,>famine(n.饥荒)/feminine(adj.女性的)/familiar(adj.熟悉的)

slice<,>/slaɪs/<,>/slaɪs/<,>n.薄片/n.切片/n.部分<,>Would you like a slice of cake?<,>你想要一块蛋糕吗？<,>He cut the bread into thin slices.<,>他把面包切成薄片。<,>A large slice of the budget goes to education.<,>预算的很大一部分用于教育。<,>s+lice(光滑)→光滑地切→薄片<,>splice(v.拼接)/slit(n.裂缝)/slick(adj.光滑的)

invade<,>/ɪnˈveɪd/<,>/ɪnˈveɪd/<,>v.入侵/v.侵略/v.侵袭<,>The army decided to invade at dawn.<,>军队决定在黎明时分入侵。<,>Weeds have invaded the garden.<,>杂草已经侵占了花园。<,>Privacy should not be invaded without permission.<,>未经许可不应侵犯隐私。<,>in(进入)+vade(走)→走进去→入侵<,>evade(v.逃避)/pervade(v.弥漫)/invader(n.入侵者)

celebrate<,>/ˈselɪbreɪt/<,>/ˈsɛləˌbreɪt/<,>v.庆祝/v.歌颂/v.赞美<,>We'll celebrate your birthday tomorrow.<,>我们明天会庆祝你的生日。<,>The whole city celebrated the victory.<,>全城都在庆祝胜利。<,>The poem celebrates the beauty of nature.<,>这首诗歌颂了大自然的美。<,>celebr(荣誉)+ate(使)→使有荣誉→庆祝<,>celebrity(n.名人)/celebrated(adj.著名的)/celebration(n.庆祝)

prisoner<,>/ˈprɪzənə(r)/<,>/ˈprɪzənər/<,>n.囚犯<,>The prisoner escaped from jail last night.<,>那个囚犯昨晚越狱了。<,>He was taken as a prisoner of war.<,>他被当作战俘抓了起来。<,>The prisoners are allowed one hour of exercise daily.<,>囚犯们每天有一小时的锻炼时间。<,>prison(监狱)+er(人)→监狱里的人→囚犯<,>prison(n.监狱)/imprison(v.监禁)/prisoner(n.囚犯)

temporary<,>/ˈtemprəri/<,>/ˈtempəreri/<,>adj.暂时的/adj.临时的<,>This is just a temporary solution.<,>这只是个临时的解决方案。<,>He found a temporary job during the holidays.<,>他在假期找到了一份临时工作。<,>The pain is only temporary.<,>疼痛只是暂时的。<,>tempor(时间)+ary(的)→时间的→暂时的<,>contemporary(adj.当代的)/temporal(adj.时间的)/temporize(v.拖延)

princess<,>/prɪnˈses/<,>/ˈprɪnsɪs/<,>n.公主/n.王妃<,>The little girl dressed up as a princess.<,>小女孩打扮成公主的样子。<,>Princess Diana was very popular.<,>戴安娜王妃非常受欢迎。<,>The princess waved to the crowd.<,>公主向人群挥手致意。<,>prince(王子)+ess(女性)→王子的女性→公主<,>prince(n.王子)/princely(adj.王子的)/princess(n.公主)

treasure<,>/ˈtreʒə(r)/<,>/ˈtrɛʒər/<,>n.财富/n.珍宝/v.珍视<,>They found buried treasure on the island.<,>他们在岛上发现了埋藏的财宝。<,>This old watch is my greatest treasure.<,>这块旧手表是我最珍视的东西。<,>We should treasure our friendship.<,>我们应该珍惜我们的友谊。<,>treas(财富)+ure→财富<,>treasury(n.金库)/treasurer(n.财务主管)/treasure(n.财富)
ill<,>/ɪl/<,>/ɪl/<,>adj.有病的/adj.坏的/adv.恶劣地/adv.讨厌地<,>She felt ill after eating the spoiled food.<,>她吃了变质的食物后感到不适。<,>He spoke ill of his former friend.<,>他说了他以前朋友的坏话。<,>The weather turned ill during the hike.<,>远足时天气变得恶劣。<,>illness(n.疾病)<,>sick(adj.生病的)/evil(adj.邪恶的)  

comrade<,>/ˈkɒmreɪd/<,>/ˈkɑːmreɪd/<,>n.亲密的同伴/n.同志<,>He fought alongside his comrades in the war.<,>他在战争中与战友并肩作战。<,>We are comrades in the same cause.<,>我们是志同道合的同志。<,>She trusted her comrade with the secret.<,>她把秘密告诉了她的亲密伙伴。<,>com(共同)+rade(源自拉丁语"radix"根)→同根生的人<,>colleague(n.同事)/companion(n.同伴)  

fragment<,>/ˈfræɡmənt/<,>/ˈfræɡmənt/<,>n.碎片/n.破片/n.碎块<,>The vase fell and broke into fragments.<,>花瓶掉下来摔成了碎片。<,>Only a fragment of the ancient manuscript remains.<,>古代手稿只残存片段。<,>She collected glass fragments on the beach.<,>她在海滩上收集玻璃碎片。<,>frag(破碎)+ment(名词后缀)<,>segment(n.部分)/fraction(n.小部分)  

problem<,>/ˈprɒbləm/<,>/ˈprɑːbləm/<,>n.问题/n.习题<,>Solving this math problem took me an hour.<,>解这道数学题花了我一个小时。<,>The main problem is lack of funding.<,>主要问题是资金不足。<,>She always sees problems as challenges.<,>她总是把问题看作挑战。<,>pro(向前)+blem(投掷)→向前投掷的难题<,>question(n.问题)/puzzle(n.谜题)  

enough<,>/ɪˈnʌf/<,>/ɪˈnʌf/<,>det.足够的/adv.足够地<,>We have enough food for everyone.<,>我们有足够的食物给大家。<,>She is old enough to make her own decisions.<,>她足够大了可以自己做决定。<,>That's enough for today.<,>今天就到这里吧。<,>en(使)+ough(源自古英语"genog")<,>sufficient(adj.充足的)/adequate(adj.适当的)  

address<,>/əˈdres/<,>/əˈdres/<,>n.地址/n.演说<,>Please write your address clearly.<,>请清楚地写下你的地址。<,>The president gave an address to the nation.<,>总统向全国发表了演说。<,>What's your email address?<,>你的电子邮箱地址是什么？<,>ad(朝向)+dress(引导)→引导到某处<,>speech(n.演讲)/location(n.位置)  

bath<,>/bɑːθ/<,>/bæθ/<,>n.浴/n.洗澡/n.浴缸<,>I take a hot bath every evening.<,>我每天晚上都洗热水澡。<,>The baby enjoys splashing in the bath.<,>宝宝喜欢在浴缸里玩水。<,>We need to clean the bath regularly.<,>我们需要定期清洗浴缸。<,>bathe(v.洗澡)<,>shower(n.淋浴)/tub(n.浴盆)  

invent<,>/ɪnˈvent/<,>/ɪnˈvɛnt/<,>v.发明/v.创造/v.捏造<,>Edison invented the light bulb.<,>爱迪生发明了电灯泡。<,>He invented an excuse for being late.<,>他为迟到编造了一个借口。<,>They invented a new game for children.<,>他们为孩子们发明了一个新游戏。<,>in(进入)+vent(来)→想出<,>discover(v.发现)/create(v.创造)  

provision<,>/prəˈvɪʒn/<,>/prəˈvɪʒən/<,>n.供应/n.预备/n.存粮<,>The ship carried provisions for a six-month voyage.<,>这艘船携带了六个月的航行补给。<,>They made provision for their retirement.<,>他们为退休做好了准备。<,>The provision of clean water is essential.<,>提供清洁水是必要的。<,>pro(向前)+vis(看)+ion→预先看到需要<,>supply(n.供应)/preparation(n.准备)  

coordinate<,>/kəʊˈɔːdɪneɪt/<,>/koʊˈɔːrdɪneɪt/<,>v.使协调/v.调节<,>We need to coordinate our schedules.<,>我们需要协调我们的时间表。<,>She coordinates the volunteers' work.<,>她协调志愿者的工作。<,>The dance movements must be well coordinated.<,>舞蹈动作必须协调一致。<,>co(共同)+ordin(顺序)+ate→使有序<,>organize(v.组织)/harmonize(v.使和谐)
devote<,>/dɪˈvəʊt/<,>/dɪˈvoʊt/<,>v.将…奉献/v.致力于<,>She decided to devote her life to helping the poor.<,>她决定毕生致力于帮助穷人。<,>He devoted all his time to his research.<,>他把所有时间都投入到研究中。<,>The book is devoted to the study of ancient cultures.<,>这本书专门研究古代文化。<,>de(加强)+vote(投票)→全心投入→奉献<,>devotee(n.爱好者)/devotion(n.奉献)/vote(v.投票)

inside<,>/ɪnˈsaɪd/<,>/ɪnˈsaɪd/<,>prep.在…里面/n.内部<,>She left her keys inside the car.<,>她把钥匙落在车里了。<,>The inside of the house was beautifully decorated.<,>房子内部装修得很漂亮。<,>He knows the inside story of the company.<,>他知道公司的内幕。<,>in(在…内)+side(边)→在里面<,>outside(prep.在…外面)/insider(n.内部人士)/insight(n.洞察力)

valid<,>/ˈvælɪd/<,>/ˈvælɪd/<,>adj.有效的/adj.正当的<,>The ticket is valid for three months.<,>这张票三个月内有效。<,>He made a valid point during the discussion.<,>他在讨论中提出了一个合理的观点。<,>Your passport must be valid for at least six months.<,>你的护照有效期必须至少还有六个月。<,>val(价值)+id→有价值的→有效的<,>invalid(adj.无效的)/validate(v.使生效)/validity(n.有效性)

oh<,>/əʊ/<,>/oʊ/<,>int.嗬/int.哦/int.唉呀<,>Oh, I didn't see you there!<,>哦，我没看到你在那儿！<,>Oh dear, what happened to your hand?<,>哎呀，你的手怎么了？<,>Oh no, I forgot my wallet at home.<,>糟了，我把钱包忘在家里了。<,>语气词，表示惊讶、失望等情绪<,>ah(int.啊)/ooh(int.哦，表示惊喜)/uh(int.呃)

liberate<,>/ˈlɪbəreɪt/<,>/ˈlɪbəˌreɪt/<,>v.解放/v.释放<,>The army helped liberate the occupied city.<,>军队帮助解放了被占领的城市。<,>This new policy will liberate the economy.<,>这项新政策将解放经济。<,>Music has the power to liberate the mind.<,>音乐有解放心灵的力量。<,>liber(自由)+ate(使)→使自由→解放<,>liberal(adj.自由的)/liberty(n.自由)/liberation(n.解放)

talk<,>/tɔːk/<,>/tɔk/<,>v.讲话/v.谈论<,>We need to talk about your performance.<,>我们需要谈谈你的表现。<,>She talks to her plants every morning.<,>她每天早上都和她的植物说话。<,>They were talking politics at dinner.<,>他们在晚餐时谈论政治。<,>发音类似"套客"→套近乎需要谈话<,>walk(v.行走)/stalk(v.潜行)/chalk(n.粉笔)

ever<,>/ˈevə(r)/<,>/ˈɛvər/<,>adv.在任何时候/adv.曾经<,>Have you ever been to Paris?<,>你去过巴黎吗？<,>This is the best movie I've ever seen.<,>这是我看过的最好的电影。<,>If you ever need help, just call me.<,>如果你任何时候需要帮助，就打电话给我。<,>e(出)+ver(真实)→真实发生过→曾经<,>never(adv.从不)/forever(adv.永远)/every(adj.每一个)

bark<,>/bɑːk/<,>/bɑrk/<,>n.吠叫声/v.吠/v.叫<,>The dog barked at the stranger.<,>狗对着陌生人吠叫。<,>I was woken by the bark of a fox.<,>我被狐狸的叫声吵醒了。<,>His bark is worse than his bite.<,>他嘴硬心软。<,>发音类似"巴克"→巴克是常见狗名→狗叫<,>dark(adj.黑暗的)/park(n.公园)/mark(n.标记)

horror<,>/ˈhɒrə(r)/<,>/ˈhɔːrər/<,>n.恐怖/n.战栗/n.憎恶<,>I have a horror of spiders.<,>我特别害怕蜘蛛。<,>She watched the horror movie through her fingers.<,>她透过指缝看完了这部恐怖片。<,>The news filled me with horror.<,>这消息让我充满恐惧。<,>horr(发抖)+or→令人发抖的事物→恐怖<,>terror(n.恐怖)/horrible(adj.可怕的)/horrify(v.使恐惧)

deduce<,>/dɪˈdjuːs/<,>/dɪˈdus/<,>v.演绎/v.推论/v.推断<,>From the evidence, we can deduce that he was lying.<,>从证据我们可以推断他在说谎。<,>Sherlock Holmes could deduce much from small details.<,>福尔摩斯能从细节中推断出很多信息。<,>What do you deduce from these facts?<,>你从这些事实中得出什么结论？<,>de(向下)+duce(引导)→向下引导→推论<,>induce(v.引诱)/reduce(v.减少)/seduce(v.引诱)
deserve<,>/dɪˈzɜːv/<,>/dɪˈzɜːrv/<,>v.应受/v.值得<,>She deserves a promotion for her hard work.<,>她工作努力，应该得到晋升。<,>This delicious meal deserves a compliment.<,>这顿美味的饭菜值得称赞。<,>He didn't deserve the punishment he received.<,>他不应该受到那样的惩罚。<,>de(加强)+serve(服务)→值得服务→应得<,>reserve(v.保留/n.储备)/preserve(v.保存/n.蜜饯)/conserve(v.保存/n.果酱)

overcome<,>/ˌəʊvəˈkʌm/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈkʌm/<,>v.克服/v.战胜<,>She overcame her fear of public speaking.<,>她克服了对公开演讲的恐惧。<,>They overcame many obstacles to succeed.<,>他们克服了许多障碍才取得成功。<,>Love can overcome all difficulties.<,>爱能战胜一切困难。<,>over(在...上)+come(来)→来到上面→战胜<,>overdo(v.做得过分)/overlook(v.忽视)/overload(v.超载)

angry<,>/ˈæŋɡri/<,>/ˈæŋɡri/<,>adj.愤怒的/adj.生气的<,>He was angry about the unfair treatment.<,>他对不公平的待遇感到愤怒。<,>Don't be angry with me for being late.<,>别因为我迟到而生我的气。<,>Her angry words hurt his feelings.<,>她愤怒的话语伤害了他的感情。<,>ang(痛苦)+ry(形容词后缀)→痛苦的→愤怒的<,>hungry(adj.饥饿的)/anxiety(n.焦虑)/anger(n.愤怒)

Asian<,>/ˈeɪʒn/<,>/ˈeɪʒən/<,>adj.亚洲的/n.亚洲人<,>Asian cultures are diverse and rich.<,>亚洲文化多样而丰富。<,>She is an Asian studying in Europe.<,>她是一个在欧洲学习的亚洲人。<,>Asian cuisine is becoming popular worldwide.<,>亚洲菜在世界范围内越来越受欢迎。<,>Asia(亚洲)+n(形容词/名词后缀)→亚洲的/亚洲人<,>African(adj.非洲的/n.非洲人)/American(adj.美洲的/n.美洲人)/European(adj.欧洲的/n.欧洲人)

dress<,>/dres/<,>/dres/<,>n.服装<,>She wore a beautiful dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件漂亮的连衣裙去参加派对。<,>The dress code for the event is formal.<,>这次活动的着装要求是正式的。<,>He bought a new dress for his daughter.<,>他给女儿买了一件新衣服。<,>dress(源自拉丁语"directus"→整理)→整理衣着→服装<,>address(n.地址/v.演讲)/stress(n.压力/v.强调)/press(n.新闻界/v.按压)

inefficient<,>/ˌɪnɪˈfɪʃnt/<,>/ˌɪnɪˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.效率低的/adj.无能的<,>The old machine is very inefficient.<,>这台旧机器效率很低。<,>Inefficient management led to the company's failure.<,>低效的管理导致了公司的失败。<,>His inefficient work habits waste time.<,>他低效的工作习惯浪费时间。<,>in(不)+efficient(有效率的)→无效率的<,>effective(adj.有效的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)/deficient(adj.不足的)

mouthful<,>/ˈmaʊθfʊl/<,>/ˈmaʊθfʊl/<,>n.满口/n.一口<,>He took a mouthful of water.<,>他喝了一大口水。<,>That's quite a mouthful to say!<,>这个词真拗口！<,>She gave the baby a small mouthful of food.<,>她给了婴儿一小口食物。<,>mouth(口)+ful(充满)→满口<,>handful(n.一把)/spoonful(n.一勺)/armful(n.一抱)

appetite<,>/ˈæpɪtaɪt/<,>/ˈæpɪtaɪt/<,>n.食欲/n.胃口/n.欲望<,>Exercise gives me a good appetite.<,>运动让我胃口大开。<,>He has an appetite for adventure.<,>他渴望冒险。<,>I've lost my appetite due to illness.<,>因为生病，我失去了食欲。<,>ap(向)+pet(追求)+ite→追求食物的欲望→食欲<,>petition(n.请愿)/compete(v.竞争)/repeat(v.重复)

hospital<,>/ˈhɒspɪtl/<,>/ˈhɑːspɪtl/<,>n.医院<,>She works as a nurse in the hospital.<,>她在医院当护士。<,>He was taken to hospital after the accident.<,>事故后他被送往医院。<,>The new hospital will open next month.<,>新医院将于下个月开业。<,>hosp(客人)+ital(地方)→接待客人的地方→医院<,>hostel(n.旅舍)/hotel(n.酒店)/hospitable(adj.好客的)

fortnight<,>/ˈfɔːtnaɪt/<,>/ˈfɔːrtnaɪt/<,>n.两星期/n.十四天<,>I'll be on vacation for a fortnight.<,>我将休假两周。<,>They met a fortnight ago.<,>他们两周前见过面。<,>The project will be completed in a fortnight.<,>这个项目将在两周内完成。<,>fort(fourteen的缩写)+night(夜)→十四个夜晚→两星期<,>fortnightly(adj.两周一次的)/overnight(adj.通宵的)/tonight(n.今晚)
chew<,>/tʃuː/<,>/tʃuː/<,>v.咀嚼/v.嚼碎<,>Chew your food thoroughly before swallowing.<,>吞咽前要彻底咀嚼食物。<,>He was chewing gum loudly during the meeting.<,>他在会议期间大声嚼口香糖。<,>The baby is learning to chew solid food.<,>宝宝正在学习咀嚼固体食物。<,>chew(音似"嚼")→咀嚼<,>chop(v.砍)/chow(n.食物)/cheer(v.欢呼)

optional<,>/ˈɒpʃənl/<,>/ˈɑːpʃənl/<,>adj.可以任意选择的<,>The course has several optional modules.<,>这门课程有几个选修模块。<,>Wearing a tie is optional at this event.<,>这个活动打领带是可选的。<,>She took all the optional tests for extra credit.<,>她参加了所有可选测试以获得额外学分。<,>option(选择)+al(形容词后缀)→可选的<,>optical(adj.光学的)/optional(adj.可选的)/optimistic(adj.乐观的)

assist<,>/əˈsɪst/<,>/əˈsɪst/<,>v.援助/v.帮助<,>The nurse will assist the doctor during the operation.<,>护士将在手术期间协助医生。<,>Can you assist me with this heavy box?<,>你能帮我搬这个重箱子吗？<,>New software assists in data analysis.<,>新软件有助于数据分析。<,>as(加强)+sist(站立)→站在旁边→帮助<,>insist(v.坚持)/consist(v.组成)/resist(v.抵抗)

carpet<,>/ˈkɑːpɪt/<,>/ˈkɑːrpɪt/<,>n.地毯/n.毡毯/n.毛毯<,>The red carpet was rolled out for the VIP guests.<,>为贵宾铺上了红地毯。<,>Our living room has a new Persian carpet.<,>我们的客厅有一块新的波斯地毯。<,>He spilled coffee on the white carpet.<,>他把咖啡洒在白地毯上了。<,>car(车)+pet(宠物)→车里的宠物地毯<,>carpet(n.地毯)/cabinet(n.橱柜)/capital(n.首都)

probability<,>/ˌprɒbəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌprɑːbəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可能性/n.概率<,>There's a high probability of rain tomorrow.<,>明天下雨的可能性很大。<,>The probability of winning the lottery is very low.<,>中彩票的概率非常低。<,>Scientists calculated the probability of this event occurring.<,>科学家计算了这一事件发生的概率。<,>prob(测试)+ability(能力)→可测试性→概率<,>possibility(n.可能性)/probability(n.概率)/capability(n.能力)

railway<,>/ˈreɪlweɪ/<,>/ˈreɪlweɪ/<,>n.铁路/n.铁道<,>The new railway will connect the two cities.<,>新铁路将连接这两座城市。<,>He works as a railway engineer.<,>他是一名铁路工程师。<,>The railway station is just five minutes' walk from here.<,>火车站离这里只有五分钟步行路程。<,>rail(轨道)+way(路)→铁路<,>railway(n.铁路)/freeway(n.高速公路)/subway(n.地铁)

each<,>/iːtʃ/<,>/iːtʃ/<,>det.各/pron.各自<,>Each student received a certificate.<,>每个学生都收到了一张证书。<,>They each have their own opinions.<,>他们各自有自己的观点。<,>The apples cost $1 each.<,>这些苹果每个1美元。<,>each(音似"一吃")→每一个<,>each(det.各)/every(det.每个)/all(det.所有)

explosion<,>/ɪkˈspləʊʒn/<,>/ɪkˈsploʊʒn/<,>n.爆炸/n.炸裂/n.爆发<,>The explosion could be heard miles away.<,>爆炸声几英里外都能听到。<,>There was an explosion of laughter in the room.<,>房间里爆发出一阵笑声。<,>The population explosion is a serious issue.<,>人口爆炸是个严重问题。<,>ex(出)+plos(爆)+ion(名词后缀)→爆炸<,>explosion(n.爆炸)/erosion(n.侵蚀)/exploration(n.探索)

racial<,>/ˈreɪʃl/<,>/ˈreɪʃl/<,>adj.种族的/adj.人种的<,>Racial discrimination is illegal in this country.<,>在这个国家，种族歧视是非法的。<,>The school promotes racial harmony.<,>学校促进种族和谐。<,>They studied racial differences in disease patterns.<,>他们研究了疾病模式的种族差异。<,>race(种族)+ial(形容词后缀)→种族的<,>racial(adj.种族的)/radical(adj.激进的)/rational(adj.理性的)

clerk<,>/klɑːk/<,>/klɜːrk/<,>n.办事员/n.职员/n.店员<,>The hotel clerk checked us in efficiently.<,>酒店职员高效地为我们办理了入住。<,>She works as a clerk in a law firm.<,>她在一家律师事务所当办事员。<,>The store clerk helped me find what I needed.<,>商店店员帮我找到了我需要的东西。<,>clerk(音似"课了课")→上课的职员<,>clerk(n.职员)/clan(n.氏族)/clamp(n.夹子)
asleep<,>/əˈsliːp/<,>/əˈslip/<,>adj.睡着的/adj.睡熟的<,>The baby is asleep in the crib.<,>婴儿在婴儿床里睡着了。<,>He fell asleep during the movie.<,>他在看电影时睡着了。<,>She was sound asleep by 10 p.m.<,>她晚上10点就睡熟了。<,>a(在...状态)+sleep(睡觉)→在睡觉的状态→睡着的<,>sleep(n.睡眠/v.睡觉)/awake(adj.醒着的)

possible<,>/ˈpɒsəbl/<,>/ˈpɑːsəbl/<,>adj.可能的/adj.可能存在的<,>It's possible that it will rain tomorrow.<,>明天可能会下雨。<,>She is the only possible candidate for the job.<,>她是这份工作唯一可能的人选。<,>Is it possible to finish the project by Friday?<,>有可能在周五前完成这个项目吗？<,>poss(能力)+ible(能够...的)→有能力做到的→可能的<,>impossible(adj.不可能的)/probable(adj.很可能的)

hostess<,>/ˈhəʊstəs/<,>/ˈhoʊstəs/<,>n.女主人<,>The hostess greeted all the guests warmly.<,>女主人热情地迎接了所有客人。<,>She worked as a flight hostess for five years.<,>她当了五年的空姐。<,>The hostess served tea to the visitors.<,>女主人给来访者端上了茶。<,>host(主人)+ess(女性)→女主人<,>host(n.主人/v.主持)/guest(n.客人)

exception<,>/ɪkˈsepʃn/<,>/ɪkˈsɛpʃən/<,>n.例外/n.除外<,>Everyone must attend the meeting without exception.<,>所有人都必须参加会议，无一例外。<,>This rule applies to all students, with no exceptions.<,>这条规则适用于所有学生，没有例外。<,>She is an exception to the usual pattern.<,>她是个例外，不符合通常的模式。<,>ex(出)+cept(拿)+ion→拿出去→除外<,>except(prep.除...之外)/accept(v.接受)

cathedral<,>/kəˈθiːdrəl/<,>/kəˈθidrəl/<,>n.总教堂/n.大教堂<,>We visited the famous cathedral in the city center.<,>我们参观了市中心那座著名的大教堂。<,>The cathedral took over 200 years to build.<,>这座大教堂花了200多年才建成。<,>The cathedral's stained glass windows are magnificent.<,>大教堂的彩色玻璃窗非常壮观。<,>cathedra(主教座)+al→主教座所在的教堂→大教堂<,>church(n.教堂)/chapel(n.小教堂)

acceptance<,>/əkˈseptəns/<,>/əkˈsɛptəns/<,>n.接受/n.验收/n.承认<,>His acceptance of the award was very emotional.<,>他领奖时的感言非常感人。<,>The product passed the quality acceptance test.<,>产品通过了质量验收测试。<,>Her acceptance of the job offer surprised everyone.<,>她接受了这份工作让所有人都很惊讶。<,>accept(接受)+ance(名词后缀)→接受<,>accept(v.接受)/except(prep.除了)

might<,>/maɪt/<,>/maɪt/<,>v.可能/v.会/v.也许<,>It might rain later, so take an umbrella.<,>稍后可能会下雨，所以带把伞吧。<,>He might come to the party if he finishes work early.<,>如果他早点完成工作，可能会来参加派对。<,>This medicine might help with your headache.<,>这种药也许能缓解你的头痛。<,>might(力量)→可能的力量→可能<,>may(v.可能)/must(v.必须)

unite<,>/juːˈnaɪt/<,>/juˈnaɪt/<,>v.联合<,>The two companies decided to unite to form a larger corporation.<,>两家公司决定联合组成一家更大的企业。<,>We must unite to solve this problem.<,>我们必须联合起来解决这个问题。<,>The treaty united the two countries politically.<,>这项条约使两国在政治上联合起来。<,>uni(单一)+te(使)→使成为一体→联合<,>unity(n.团结)/divide(v.分开)

ox<,>/ɒks/<,>/ɑːks/<,>n.阉牛/n.牛/n.公牛<,>The farmer uses an ox to plow the field.<,>农民用牛来犁地。<,>An ox can pull heavy loads.<,>牛能拉很重的东西。<,>We saw a team of oxen at the county fair.<,>我们在县集市上看到了一队牛。<,>ox(牛)→公牛/阉牛<,>cow(n.母牛)/bull(n.未阉割的公牛)

recovery<,>/rɪˈkʌvəri/<,>/rɪˈkʌvəri/<,>n.重获/n.痊愈/n.恢复<,>The patient made a full recovery after the surgery.<,>手术后病人完全康复了。<,>The economy is showing signs of recovery.<,>经济显示出复苏的迹象。<,>The recovery of the stolen artwork took years.<,>找回被盗的艺术品花了好几年时间。<,>re(重新)+cover(覆盖)+y→重新覆盖→恢复<,>discovery(n.发现)/recover(v.恢复)
fellow<,>/ˈfeləʊ/<,>/ˈfɛloʊ/<,>n.家伙/n.伙伴<,>He's a good fellow, always ready to help.<,>他是个好家伙，总是乐于助人。<,>We were fellows at college.<,>我们是大学时的伙伴。<,>The old fellow smiled kindly at the children.<,>那位老人和蔼地对孩子们微笑。<,>fell(同伴)+ow→伙伴<,>follow(v.跟随)/fallow(adj.休耕的)

brown<,>/braʊn/<,>/braʊn/<,>n.褐色/n.棕色<,>She has beautiful brown eyes.<,>她有一双漂亮的棕色眼睛。<,>The leaves turn brown in autumn.<,>秋天树叶变成褐色。<,>He wore a brown leather jacket.<,>他穿着一件棕色皮夹克。<,>br(棕色)+own(自己的)→属于自己的棕色<,>crown(n.王冠)/drown(v.淹没)

blind<,>/blaɪnd/<,>/blaɪnd/<,>adj.瞎的/adj.盲目的<,>He's been blind since birth.<,>他天生失明。<,>Love is sometimes blind.<,>爱情有时是盲目的。<,>She turned a blind eye to his faults.<,>她对他的缺点视而不见。<,>b(不)+lind(看)→看不见的<,>blend(v.混合)/bind(v.捆绑)

dash<,>/dæʃ/<,>/dæʃ/<,>v.使猛撞/v.溅/n.猛冲<,>He dashed the glass against the wall.<,>他把玻璃杯猛摔在墙上。<,>She made a dash for the door.<,>她向门口冲去。<,>Rain dashed against the windows.<,>雨水拍打着窗户。<,>d(快速)+ash(灰烬)→像灰烬一样快速散开<,>rash(adj.轻率的)/cash(n.现金)

must<,>/mʌst/<,>/mʌst/<,>v.必须/v.必然要<,>You must finish your homework first.<,>你必须先完成作业。<,>This must be the place we're looking for.<,>这一定是我们找的地方。<,>All passengers must wear seat belts.<,>所有乘客都必须系安全带。<,>mus(必须)+t(强调)→必须<,>most(adj.最多的)/musk(n.麝香)

importance<,>/ɪmˈpɔːt(ə)ns/<,>/ɪmˈpɔːrtns/<,>n.重要/n.重要性<,>This matter is of great importance.<,>这件事非常重要。<,>He stressed the importance of education.<,>他强调了教育的重要性。<,>The importance of this discovery cannot be overstated.<,>这一发现的重要性怎么强调都不为过。<,>im(进入)+port(携带)+ance→携带进来的东西→重要性<,>import(v.进口)/export(v.出口)

reception<,>/rɪˈsepʃ(ə)n/<,>/rɪˈsɛpʃən/<,>n.接待/n.招待会<,>The hotel has a 24-hour reception.<,>这家酒店提供24小时接待服务。<,>We're holding a wedding reception next week.<,>我们下周将举办婚宴。<,>The new product got a warm reception from customers.<,>新产品受到了顾客的热烈欢迎。<,>re(再)+cept(拿)+ion→再次拿取→接待<,>conception(n.概念)/deception(n.欺骗)

cap<,>/kæp/<,>/kæp/<,>n.帽子/n.便帽/n.帽状物<,>He tipped his cap politely.<,>他礼貌地轻触帽檐致意。<,>Put the cap back on the bottle.<,>把瓶盖盖回去。<,>She wore a red knitted cap.<,>她戴着一顶红色针织帽。<,>c(覆盖)+ap(顶端)→覆盖顶端的东西→帽子<,>cup(n.杯子)/cab(n.出租车)

captain<,>/ˈkæptɪn/<,>/ˈkæptən/<,>n.陆军上尉/n.队长<,>He was promoted to captain last year.<,>他去年被提升为上尉。<,>The captain led his team to victory.<,>队长带领他的队伍取得了胜利。<,>Who's the captain of this ship?<,>这艘船的船长是谁？<,>cap(头)+tain(持有)→领头的人<,>capital(n.首都)/caption(n.字幕)

rigid<,>/ˈrɪdʒɪd/<,>/ˈrɪdʒɪd/<,>adj.刚硬的/adj.僵硬的<,>The metal bar was completely rigid.<,>那根金属棒非常坚硬。<,>He maintained a rigid posture throughout the meeting.<,>整个会议期间他都保持着僵硬的姿势。<,>Her face was rigid with fear.<,>她的脸因恐惧而僵硬。<,>rig(坚硬)+id(形容词后缀)→坚硬的<,>rigor(n.严格)/ridge(n.山脊)
mistake<,>/mɪˈsteɪk/<,>/mɪˈsteɪk/<,>n.错误/v.误解/v.弄错<,>It's easy to make a mistake when you're in a hurry.<,>匆忙时容易犯错。<,>Don't mistake my kindness for weakness.<,>别把我的善意误认为软弱。<,>I mistook the time of the meeting.<,>我弄错了会议时间。<,>mis(错误)+take(拿)→拿错了→错误<,>misunderstand(v.误解)/mislead(v.误导)/misplace(v.放错)

depart<,>/dɪˈpɑːt/<,>/dɪˈpɑːrt/<,>v.离开/v.起程/v.出发<,>The train will depart from platform 3 at 9:15.<,>火车将于9:15从3号站台出发。<,>We departed from our original plan.<,>我们偏离了原计划。<,>He departed this life at the age of 80.<,>他80岁时去世了。<,>de(离开)+part(部分)→离开一部分→出发<,>apart(adv.分开)/departure(n.离开)/partition(n.分割)

engage<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈɡeɪdʒ/<,>v.使从事于/v.聘用<,>She engaged herself in volunteer work.<,>她从事志愿工作。<,>The company engaged a new marketing director.<,>公司聘用了一位新的市场总监。<,>He was engaged in conversation with his boss.<,>他正与老板交谈。<,>en(使)+gage(保证)→保证做→从事<,>engagement(n.订婚)/mortgage(n.抵押)/disengage(v.脱离)

crazy<,>/ˈkreɪzi/<,>/ˈkreɪzi/<,>adj.疯狂的/adj.荒唐的<,>That's a crazy idea!<,>那是个疯狂的想法！<,>She's crazy about pop music.<,>她对流行音乐很着迷。<,>The prices these days are just crazy.<,>现在的价格简直离谱。<,>craz(裂纹)+y→思维有裂纹→疯狂的<,>lazy(adj.懒惰的)/hazy(adj.朦胧的)/dizzy(adj.头晕的)

butcher<,>/ˈbʊtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈbʊtʃər/<,>n.屠夫/n.屠杀者<,>The butcher cut the meat into small pieces.<,>屠夫把肉切成小块。<,>He was accused of being a butcher during the war.<,>他被指控在战争期间是个屠杀者。<,>The surgeon butchered the operation.<,>外科医生把手术搞砸了。<,>butch(屠宰)+er(人)→屠宰的人→屠夫<,>baker(n.面包师)/barber(n.理发师)/butler(n.管家)

pay<,>/peɪ/<,>/peɪ/<,>v.支付/v.付给/v.给予<,>I need to pay the electricity bill today.<,>我今天需要付电费。<,>His hard work paid off in the end.<,>他的努力最终得到了回报。<,>Pay attention to what I'm saying.<,>注意听我说的话。<,>p(钱)+ay(给)→给钱→支付<,>play(v.玩耍)/pray(v.祈祷)/prey(n.猎物)

lonely<,>/ˈləʊnli/<,>/ˈloʊnli/<,>adj.孤独的/adj.荒凉的<,>She felt lonely in the big city.<,>她在大城市里感到孤独。<,>It's a lonely road at night.<,>晚上这是一条荒凉的路。<,>The old man lived a lonely life.<,>老人过着孤独的生活。<,>lone(单独)+ly→孤独的<,>alone(adj.单独的)/lonesome(adj.寂寞的)/lovely(adj.可爱的)

corn<,>/kɔːn/<,>/kɔːrn/<,>n.谷物/n.(英)小麦<,>We grow corn in this field.<,>我们在这块地里种玉米。<,>In Britain, corn refers to wheat.<,>在英国，corn指的是小麦。<,>He had corns on his feet from tight shoes.<,>他因鞋子太紧而长了鸡眼。<,>cor(核心)+n→谷物核心→谷物<,>horn(n.角)/born(v.出生)/core(n.核心)

pierce<,>/pɪəs/<,>/pɪrs/<,>v.剌穿<,>The needle pierced her finger.<,>针扎进了她的手指。<,>Her scream pierced the silence.<,>她的尖叫声划破了寂静。<,>The cold wind pierced through his coat.<,>寒风穿透了他的外套。<,>pier(码头)+ce→像码头一样突出→刺穿<,>piece(n.块)/pier(n.码头)/fierce(adj.凶猛的)

revise<,>/rɪˈvaɪz/<,>/rɪˈvaɪz/<,>v.修订/v.校订/v.修改<,>I need to revise my essay before submitting it.<,>我需要在提交前修改我的文章。<,>She's revising for her final exams.<,>她正在为期末考试复习。<,>The company revised its sales forecast.<,>公司修改了销售预测。<,>re(再)+vise(看)→再看→修订<,>devise(v.设计)/advise(v.建议)/supervise(v.监督)
primarily<,>/praɪˈmerəli/<,>/praɪˈmɛrəli/<,>adv.首先/adv.主要地<,>The book is primarily intended for beginners.<,>这本书主要是为初学者准备的。<,>He is primarily responsible for the project's success.<,>他主要负责项目的成功。<,>The issue is primarily about funding.<,>这个问题主要是关于资金。<,>prime(首要的)+ary(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→首要地→主要地<,>principal(adj.主要的/n.校长)/primary(adj.初级的/n.初选)

field<,>/fiːld/<,>/fild/<,>n.田野/n.田/n.运动场<,>The children were playing in the field.<,>孩子们在田野里玩耍。<,>He works in the field of medicine.<,>他在医学领域工作。<,>The team practiced on the football field.<,>球队在足球场上训练。<,>fie(古英语"田地")+ld(后缀)→田地→田野<,>yield(v.生产/n.产量)/shield(n.盾牌/v.保护)

compromise<,>/ˈkɒmprəmaɪz/<,>/ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/<,>n.妥协/n.和解<,>They reached a compromise after long negotiations.<,>经过长时间谈判，他们达成了妥协。<,>A good compromise leaves everyone satisfied.<,>一个好的妥协让每个人都满意。<,>He refused to compromise his principles.<,>他拒绝妥协自己的原则。<,>com(共同)+promise(承诺)→共同承诺→妥协<,>comprise(v.包含)/promise(n.承诺/v.答应)

crane<,>/kreɪn/<,>/kren/<,>n.起重机/n.摄影升降机<,>The crane lifted the heavy container.<,>起重机吊起了沉重的集装箱。<,>They used a camera crane for the movie shot.<,>他们用摄影升降机拍摄电影镜头。<,>A crane flew over the lake.<,>一只鹤飞过湖面。<,>cran(古英语"鹤")+e→鹤颈般的机器→起重机<,>cane(n.手杖)/cranky(adj.古怪的)

future<,>/ˈfjuːtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈfjutʃɚ/<,>n.将来/n.未来/n.前途<,>We need to plan for the future.<,>我们需要为未来做计划。<,>She has a bright future ahead.<,>她前途光明。<,>In the near future, technology will advance further.<,>在不久的将来，技术会进一步发展。<,>fut(拉丁语"将来")+ure(名词后缀)→将来<,>feature(n.特征)/furniture(n.家具)

external<,>/ɪkˈstɜːnl/<,>/ɪkˈstɜːrnl/<,>adj.外部的/adj.外面的<,>The external walls need repainting.<,>外墙需要重新粉刷。<,>External factors affected the decision.<,>外部因素影响了这个决定。<,>Apply the ointment to external wounds only.<,>只在外伤处涂抹药膏。<,>ex(外)+tern(边界)+al(形容词后缀)→外部的<,>internal(adj.内部的)/eternal(adj.永恒的)

fraction<,>/ˈfrækʃn/<,>/ˈfrækʃən/<,>n.小部分/n.片断/n.分数<,>Only a fraction of the students passed.<,>只有一小部分学生通过了。<,>She added a fraction of salt to the soup.<,>她在汤里加了一点点盐。<,>3/4 is a proper fraction.<,>3/4是一个真分数。<,>fract(打破)+ion(名词后缀)→打破的部分→小部分<,>fracture(n.骨折)/friction(n.摩擦)

delicate<,>/ˈdelɪkət/<,>/ˈdɛləkət/<,>adj.纤细的/adj.易碎的<,>Handle the delicate vase with care.<,>小心拿这个易碎的花瓶。<,>She has delicate features.<,>她五官精致。<,>The situation requires delicate handling.<,>这个情况需要谨慎处理。<,>de(加强)+lic(诱惑)+ate(形容词后缀)→需要小心对待的→易碎的<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/delicious(adj.美味的)

abundant<,>/əˈbʌndənt/<,>/əˈbʌndənt/<,>adj.丰富的/adj.大量的<,>The region has abundant natural resources.<,>这个地区有丰富的自然资源。<,>We have abundant evidence to support our claim.<,>我们有大量证据支持我们的主张。<,>The harvest was abundant this year.<,>今年收成很好。<,>ab(离开)+und(波浪)+ant(形容词后缀)→像波浪一样多的→大量的<,>abandon(v.放弃)/redundant(adj.多余的)

brittle<,>/ˈbrɪtl/<,>/ˈbrɪtl/<,>adj.脆的/adj.易损坏的<,>The brittle branches snapped in the wind.<,>脆弱的树枝在风中折断了。<,>Handle the brittle glassware carefully.<,>小心拿这些易碎的玻璃器皿。<,>Her voice sounded brittle with tension.<,>她的声音因紧张而显得尖锐。<,>brit(古英语"断裂")+tle(形容词后缀)→容易断裂的→脆的<,>bridge(n.桥梁)/battle(n.战斗)
claim<,>/kleɪm/<,>/kleɪm/<,>v.声称/v.主张/v.索取<,>He claims to have seen a UFO.<,>他声称看到了不明飞行物。<,>You can claim compensation for the damaged goods.<,>你可以索取损坏货物的赔偿。<,>She claims that the idea was hers.<,>她主张这个想法是她的。<,>cl(close)+aim(目标)→接近目标→声称<,>acclaim(v.欢呼/n.称赞)/exclaim(v.呼喊/v.惊叫)/proclaim(v.宣布/v.声明)

appreciate<,>/əˈpriːʃieɪt/<,>/əˈpriːʃieɪt/<,>v.领会/v.感谢/v.欣赏<,>I really appreciate your help.<,>我非常感谢你的帮助。<,>She appreciates modern art.<,>她欣赏现代艺术。<,>It's hard to appreciate the full significance of this discovery.<,>很难领会这一发现的全部意义。<,>ap(加强)+preci(价值)+ate→给予价值→欣赏<,>depreciate(v.贬值/v.轻视)/appraisal(n.评价/n.估价)/precious(adj.珍贵的/adj.宝贵的)

about<,>/əˈbaʊt/<,>/əˈbaʊt/<,>prep.关于/prep.在...周围<,>What are you talking about?<,>你们在谈论什么？<,>There were about 50 people at the party.<,>派对周围大约有50人。<,>He walked about the room nervously.<,>他在房间里紧张地走来走去。<,>a(在)+bout(边界)→在边界周围→关于<,>above(prep.在...上面)/around(prep.在...周围)/abound(v.大量存在/v.充满)

parade<,>/pəˈreɪd/<,>/pəˈreɪd/<,>n.游行/n.检阅/v.游行<,>The victory parade will be held tomorrow.<,>胜利游行将于明天举行。<,>The general inspected the troops at the parade.<,>将军在阅兵式上检阅了部队。<,>Protesters paraded through the city center.<,>抗议者在市中心游行。<,>para(旁边)+de(展示)→在旁边展示→游行<,>paradise(n.天堂/n.乐园)/parasol(n.遮阳伞)/paragon(n.模范/n.典范)

furnish<,>/ˈfɜːnɪʃ/<,>/ˈfɜːrnɪʃ/<,>v.装备/v.布置/v.供应<,>We need to furnish the new apartment.<,>我们需要布置新公寓。<,>The company furnishes all necessary equipment.<,>公司提供所有必要的设备。<,>She furnished the room with antique furniture.<,>她用古董家具装备这个房间。<,>fur(皮毛)+nish(完成)→用皮毛完成→布置<,>furniture(n.家具)/burnish(v.擦亮/v.磨光)/furbish(v.翻新/v.刷新)

mourn<,>/mɔːn/<,>/mɔːrn/<,>v.哀痛/v.哀悼<,>The whole nation mourned the death of the president.<,>全国人民哀悼总统的逝世。<,>She is still mourning her lost love.<,>她仍在为失去的爱情哀痛。<,>They wore black to mourn their leader.<,>他们穿黑色衣服哀悼他们的领袖。<,>mour(悲伤)+n→哀痛<,>moan(v.呻吟/n.抱怨)/morning(n.早晨)/mournful(adj.悲哀的/adj.令人伤心的)

hazard<,>/ˈhæzəd/<,>/ˈhæzərd/<,>n.危险/n.公害<,>Smoking is a health hazard.<,>吸烟对健康有害。<,>The icy roads presented a serious hazard.<,>结冰的道路构成了严重危险。<,>Chemical waste is an environmental hazard.<,>化学废料是一种环境公害。<,>haz(机会)+ard(名词后缀)→危险的机会→危险<,>haphazard(adj.偶然的/adj.随意的)/hazardous(adj.危险的/adj.冒险的)/haze(n.薄雾/v.变朦胧)

choice<,>/tʃɔɪs/<,>/tʃɔɪs/<,>n.选择/n.抉择<,>You have to make a choice.<,>你必须做出选择。<,>It was a difficult choice between the two jobs.<,>在这两份工作之间做出抉择很困难。<,>The menu offers a wide choice of dishes.<,>菜单提供了多种菜品选择。<,>cho(音似"求")+ice(冰)→求冰解渴→选择<,>choose(v.选择)/voice(n.声音/v.表达)/rejoice(v.高兴/v.欣喜)

liable<,>/ˈlaɪəbl/<,>/ˈlaɪəbl/<,>adj.易于...的/adj.可能的<,>He's liable to get angry if you disturb him.<,>如果你打扰他，他可能会生气。<,>This area is liable to flooding.<,>这个地区容易发生洪水。<,>The company is liable for any damages.<,>公司可能要对任何损坏负责。<,>li(绑)+able(能够)→能被绑住的→可能的<,>reliable(adj.可靠的)/pliable(adj.易弯的/adj.柔韧的)/viable(adj.可行的/adj.能养活的)

sum<,>/sʌm/<,>/sʌm/<,>n.金额/n.总数<,>The sum of 5 and 7 is 12.<,>5和7的总数是12。<,>He donated a large sum to charity.<,>他向慈善机构捐赠了一大笔金额。<,>Can you give me the sum total?<,>你能给我总数吗？<,>su(音似"数")+m(拼音"目")→数目→总数<,>summary(n.摘要/adj.概括的)/summit(n.顶峰/n.峰会)/summon(v.召唤/v.召集)
foreigner<,>/ˈfɒr.ɪ.nər/<,>/ˈfɔːr.ɪ.nər/<,>n.外国人<,>He is a foreigner who just moved to our city.<,>他是一个刚搬到我们城市的外国人。<,>The foreigner was struggling to understand the local customs.<,>这个外国人正努力理解当地的风俗。<,>She helped the foreigner find his way to the hotel.<,>她帮助那个外国人找到了去酒店的路。<,>foreign(外国的)+er(人)→外国人<,>stranger(n.陌生人)/alien(n.外星人/外国人)  

mud<,>/mʌd/<,>/mʌd/<,>n.软泥/n.泥浆<,>After the rain, the path was covered in mud.<,>雨后，小路上满是泥浆。<,>The children enjoyed playing in the mud.<,>孩子们喜欢在泥巴里玩耍。<,>His shoes were caked with mud.<,>他的鞋子上沾满了泥巴。<,>mud(泥)→与“mother”(母亲)发音相似<,>muddy(adj.泥泞的)/muck(n.污物/v.弄脏)  

reveal<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>v.揭示/v.揭露/v.展现<,>The investigation revealed some shocking facts.<,>调查揭露了一些令人震惊的事实。<,>She revealed her true feelings at last.<,>她终于表露了自己的真实感受。<,>The curtain rose to reveal a beautiful scene.<,>幕布升起，展现出一幅美丽的场景。<,>re(重新)+veal(看)→重新看到→揭示<,>conceal(v.隐藏)/unveil(v.揭幕/v.揭露)  

fold<,>/fəʊld/<,>/foʊld/<,>v.折叠/v.合拢/n.褶<,>She folded the letter and put it in an envelope.<,>她把信折好放进信封。<,>He folded his arms and waited patiently.<,>他双臂交叉，耐心等待。<,>There was a neat fold in the paper.<,>纸上有一道整齐的折痕。<,>fold(折叠)→与“old”(老)押韵<,>unfold(v.展开)/folder(n.文件夹)  

beard<,>/bɪəd/<,>/bɪrd/<,>n.胡须/n.络腮胡子<,>He has a thick black beard.<,>他有一把浓密的黑胡子。<,>She tugged at his beard playfully.<,>她顽皮地拽了拽他的胡子。<,>The old man stroked his long beard thoughtfully.<,>老人若有所思地捋着长胡子。<,>bear(熊)+d→熊一样的胡子<,>bearded(adj.有胡须的)/bare(adj.赤裸的)  

illustrate<,>/ˈɪl.ə.streɪt/<,>/ˈɪl.ə.streɪt/<,>v.(用图等)说明<,>The diagram illustrates how the machine works.<,>这张图说明了机器的工作原理。<,>She illustrated her point with a funny story.<,>她用一个有趣的故事阐明了自己的观点。<,>The book is beautifully illustrated with color photographs.<,>这本书配有精美的彩色照片。<,>il(进入)+lustr(光)+ate→用光照亮→说明<,>demonstrate(v.演示)/explain(v.解释)  

protect<,>/prəˈtekt/<,>/prəˈtekt/<,>v.保护/v.保卫/v.警戒<,>It's important to protect your skin from the sun.<,>保护皮肤免受阳光伤害很重要。<,>The soldiers were sent to protect the border.<,>士兵们被派去保卫边境。<,>He raised his arm to protect his face.<,>他抬起手臂护住脸。<,>pro(前面)+tect(覆盖)→在前面覆盖→保护<,>defend(v.防御)/shield(v.防护)  

airline<,>/ˈeə.laɪn/<,>/ˈer.laɪn/<,>n.航空公司<,>She works for a major international airline.<,>她在一家大型国际航空公司工作。<,>The airline announced a new flight schedule.<,>航空公司宣布了新的航班时刻表。<,>We booked our tickets through a budget airline.<,>我们通过一家廉价航空公司订了票。<,>air(空中)+line(线路)→空中线路→航空公司<,>airliner(n.大型客机)/airway(n.航线)  

military<,>/ˈmɪl.ɪ.tri/<,>/ˈmɪl.ɪ.ter.i/<,>adj.军事的/adj.军人的<,>He comes from a military family.<,>他出身于军人家庭。<,>The country has a strong military force.<,>这个国家拥有强大的军事力量。<,>They received military training last summer.<,>他们去年夏天接受了军事训练。<,>milit(军事)+ary(形容词后缀)→军事的<,>militant(adj.好战的)/civilian(adj.民用的)  

Negro<,>/ˈniː.ɡrəʊ/<,>/ˈniː.ɡroʊ/<,>n.黑人<,>The term "Negro" is considered outdated and offensive now.<,>“Negro”一词现在被认为是过时且冒犯的。<,>Negro spirituals are an important part of American music history.<,>黑人灵歌是美国音乐史的重要组成部分。<,>He was a prominent leader in the Negro community.<,>他是黑人社区的一位杰出领袖。<,>Negro(黑人)→源自西班牙语“negro”(黑色)<,>African-American(n.非裔美国人)/black(n.黑人)
deep<,>/diːp/<,>/dip/<,>adj.深的/adj.纵深的<,>The ocean is very deep here.<,>这里的海洋非常深。<,>She took a deep breath before speaking.<,>她在说话前深吸了一口气。<,>The well is 30 meters deep.<,>这口井有30米深。<,>d(地)+eep(深)→深深的<,>steep(adj.陡峭的)/peep(v.偷看)  

storey<,>/ˈstɔːri/<,>/ˈstɔri/<,>n.（层）楼<,>The building has five storeys.<,>这座大楼有五层。<,>She lives on the top storey.<,>她住在顶层。<,>Each storey has two apartments.<,>每层楼有两套公寓。<,>story(故事)+e→楼层<,>story(n.故事)/floor(n.地板)  

willing<,>/ˈwɪlɪŋ/<,>/ˈwɪlɪŋ/<,>adj.愿意的/adj.心甘情愿的<,>He is willing to help us.<,>他愿意帮助我们。<,>She gave a willing smile.<,>她露出了心甘情愿的微笑。<,>They were willing participants.<,>他们是自愿的参与者。<,>will(意愿)+ing→愿意的<,>unwilling(adj.不愿意的)/will(n.意志)  

quarter<,>/ˈkwɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈkwɔrtər/<,>n.四分之一/n.一刻钟<,>Cut the apple into quarters.<,>把苹果切成四份。<,>It's a quarter past three.<,>现在是三点一刻。<,>A quarter of the students passed.<,>四分之一的学生通过了。<,>quart(四)+er→四分之一<,>quart(n.夸脱)/quarterly(adj.季度的)  

obey<,>/əˈbeɪ/<,>/oʊˈbeɪ/<,>v.顺从<,>Soldiers must obey orders.<,>士兵必须服从命令。<,>Dogs usually obey their owners.<,>狗通常顺从主人。<,>She refused to obey the rules.<,>她拒绝遵守规则。<,>ob(加强)+ey(听)→顺从<,>disobey(v.不服从)/obedient(adj.顺从的)  

pattern<,>/ˈpætən/<,>/ˈpætərn/<,>n.型/n.式样/n.模/n.模型<,>The fabric has a floral pattern.<,>这块布料有花卉图案。<,>She noticed a pattern in his behavior.<,>她注意到他行为的模式。<,>Use this pattern to make a dress.<,>用这个式样做一件连衣裙。<,>pat(拍)+tern→拍出模型<,>patent(n.专利)/patter(v.喋喋不休)  

lightly<,>/ˈlaɪtli/<,>/ˈlaɪtli/<,>adv.轻轻地/adv.轻松地<,>She touched his arm lightly.<,>她轻轻地碰了碰他的手臂。<,>He took the criticism lightly.<,>他轻松地接受了批评。<,>The snow fell lightly.<,>雪轻轻地下着。<,>light(轻的)+ly→轻轻地<,>lightly(adv.轻微地)/tightly(adv.紧紧地)  

suppose<,>/səˈpəʊz/<,>/səˈpoʊz/<,>v.猜想/v.假定<,>I suppose he will come late.<,>我猜他会迟到。<,>Let's suppose that you are right.<,>假设你是对的。<,>She is supposed to be here by now.<,>她现在应该到了。<,>sup(下)+pose(放)→放在下面→假定<,>propose(v.建议)/oppose(v.反对)  

case<,>/keɪs/<,>/keɪs/<,>n.情况/n.病例/n.事实<,>In any case, we must be prepared.<,>无论如何，我们必须准备好。<,>This is a serious case of flu.<,>这是一例严重的流感病例。<,>The police studied the case carefully.<,>警方仔细研究了案情。<,>ca(抓)+se→抓住事实<,>cause(n.原因)/chase(v.追逐)  

overcoat<,>/ˈəʊvəkəʊt/<,>/ˈoʊvərkoʊt/<,>n.外衣/n.大衣<,>He wore a thick overcoat in winter.<,>冬天他穿了一件厚大衣。<,>Her overcoat was hanging on the door.<,>她的外衣挂在门上。<,>This overcoat keeps me warm.<,>这件大衣让我很暖和。<,>over(覆盖)+coat(外套)→大衣<,>coat(n.外套)/raincoat(n.雨衣)

incline<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>n.斜坡/v.使倾斜<,>The road has a steep incline.<,>这条路有一个陡峭的斜坡。<,>I incline to believe his story.<,>我倾向于相信他的说法。<,>She inclined her head to listen carefully.<,>她侧着头仔细听。<,>in(向内)+cline(倾斜)→使倾斜<,>decline(v.下降/v.拒绝)/recline(v.斜靠)/include(v.包含)

superficial<,>/ˌsuːpəˈfɪʃəl/<,>/ˌsuːpərˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.肤浅的/adj.表面的<,>He has only a superficial knowledge of the subject.<,>他对这个学科只有肤浅的了解。<,>The wound is only superficial and will heal quickly.<,>伤口只是表面的，会很快愈合。<,>Her kindness was superficial and insincere.<,>她的友善是表面的，不真诚的。<,>super(上面)+fic(面)+ial(形容词后缀)→表面的<,>artificial(adj.人工的)/official(adj.官方的)/beneficial(adj.有益的)

appointment<,>/əˈpɔɪntmənt/<,>/əˈpɔɪntmənt/<,>n.约定/n.约会/n.任命<,>I have a dentist appointment at 3 pm.<,>我下午3点有个牙医预约。<,>His appointment as CEO was announced yesterday.<,>他担任CEO的任命昨天宣布了。<,>She made an appointment to see the lawyer.<,>她约好了去见律师。<,>ap(加强)+point(点)+ment(名词后缀)→约定<,>disappointment(n.失望)/pointment(不存在的词)/appoint(v.任命)

tyre<,>/ˈtaɪə(r)/<,>/ˈtaɪər/<,>n.轮胎/n.车胎<,>I need to replace the tyres on my car.<,>我需要更换汽车轮胎。<,>The front tyre is flat.<,>前轮胎没气了。<,>Check the tyre pressure before a long trip.<,>长途旅行前检查轮胎气压。<,>tyre(轮胎)与tire(使疲倦)同音不同义<,>tire(v.使疲倦)/tyre(n.轮胎)/fire(n.火)

failure<,>/ˈfeɪljə(r)/<,>/ˈfeɪljər/<,>n.失败/n.失败的人<,>The project ended in failure.<,>这个项目以失败告终。<,>He felt like a complete failure.<,>他觉得自己是个彻底的失败者。<,>Failure is the mother of success.<,>失败是成功之母。<,>fail(失败)+ure(名词后缀)→失败<,>sailor(n.水手)/tailor(n.裁缝)/jailer(n.狱卒)

beauty<,>/ˈbjuːti/<,>/ˈbjuːti/<,>n.美/n.美丽/n.美人<,>She was known for her great beauty.<,>她以美貌闻名。<,>The beauty of the sunset took our breath away.<,>日落的美丽让我们惊叹不已。<,>She won the beauty contest.<,>她赢得了选美比赛。<,>beaut(美丽)+y(名词后缀)→美丽<,>duty(n.责任)/booty(n.战利品)/beautify(v.美化)

frown<,>/fraʊn/<,>/fraʊn/<,>v.皱眉/v.蹙额<,>She frowned when she heard the bad news.<,>听到坏消息时她皱起了眉头。<,>He frowned at the messy room.<,>他看着凌乱的房间皱起了眉头。<,>The teacher frowned upon cheating.<,>老师不赞成作弊。<,>frown(皱眉)与brown(棕色)押韵<,>brown(adj.棕色的)/crown(n.王冠)/drown(v.淹死)
drown<,>/draʊn/<,>/draʊn/<,>v.淹死/v.溺死<,>He almost drowned in the lake.<,>他差点在湖里淹死。<,>The loud music drowned out their conversation.<,>嘈杂的音乐淹没了他们的谈话声。<,>She drowned her sorrows in alcohol.<,>她借酒消愁。<,>d(水)+rown(沉)→沉入水中→淹死<,>frown(v.皱眉)/brown(adj.棕色的)/down(adv.向下)

resemble<,>/rɪˈzembl/<,>/rɪˈzɛmbəl/<,>v.像/v.类似<,>She closely resembles her mother.<,>她长得很像她母亲。<,>This artificial flower resembles the real one.<,>这朵人造花很像真花。<,>The two situations resemble each other.<,>这两种情况很相似。<,>re(再)+semble(相似)→再次相似→像<,>assemble(v.集合)/dissemble(v.掩饰)/ensemble(n.整体)

pressure<,>/ˈpreʃə(r)/<,>/ˈprɛʃər/<,>n.压力/n.〔工作或生活中的〕压力/n.压/n.按<,>High blood pressure can cause health problems.<,>高血压会导致健康问题。<,>She's under a lot of pressure at work.<,>她在工作中承受很大压力。<,>Apply pressure to stop the bleeding.<,>按压止血。<,>press(压)+ure(状态)→压力状态<,>pleasure(n.愉快)/treasure(n.财富)/measure(v.测量)

remarkable<,>/rɪˈmɑːkəbl/<,>/rɪˈmɑrkəbəl/<,>adj.异常的/adj.非凡的<,>She made remarkable progress in her studies.<,>她在学习上取得了显著进步。<,>This is a remarkable achievement.<,>这是一项非凡的成就。<,>His memory is remarkable for his age.<,>就他的年龄而言，他的记忆力很惊人。<,>re(再)+mark(标记)+able(能)→能再次被标记的→非凡的<,>remark(v.评论)/marketable(adj.有销路的)/memorable(adj.难忘的)

muscle<,>/ˈmʌsl/<,>/ˈmʌsəl/<,>n.肌肉/n.肌/n.体力<,>He has well-developed muscles.<,>他的肌肉很发达。<,>It takes muscle to lift that heavy box.<,>抬起那个重箱子需要力气。<,>She pulled a muscle in her back.<,>她拉伤了背部肌肉。<,>mus(老鼠)+cle(小)→像小老鼠般跳动的→肌肉<,>mussel(n.贻贝)/muse(v.沉思)/muzzle(n.口套)

company<,>/ˈkʌmpəni/<,>/ˈkʌmpəni/<,>n.公司/n.商号/n.同伴<,>He works for a software company.<,>他在一家软件公司工作。<,>I enjoy your company.<,>我喜欢有你作伴。<,>She kept him company while he was sick.<,>他生病时她陪伴着他。<,>com(共同)+pan(面包)+y→一起吃面包的人→同伴<,>accompany(v.陪伴)/companion(n.同伴)/compartment(n.隔间)
