maintain<,>/meɪnˈteɪn/<,>/meɪnˈteɪn/<,>v.维持/v.赡养/v.维修<,>He works hard to maintain his family.<,>他努力工作以维持家庭。<,>The machine needs regular maintenance to keep it running smoothly.<,>这台机器需要定期维修以保持运转顺畅。<,>She maintains a positive attitude despite the difficulties.<,>尽管有困难，她仍保持积极的态度。<,>main(主要)+tain(保持)→维持主要状态→维持<,>retain(v.保留)/contain(v.包含)/obtain(v.获得)

computer<,>/kəmˈpjuːtə(r)/<,>/kəmˈpjuːtər/<,>n.计算机/n.电脑<,>I use my computer for work and entertainment.<,>我用电脑工作和娱乐。<,>The computer crashed and I lost all my files.<,>电脑崩溃了，我丢失了所有文件。<,>Modern computers are much faster than older models.<,>现代计算机比旧型号快得多。<,>compute(计算)+er(工具)→用于计算的工具→计算机<,>commuter(n.通勤者)/computation(n.计算)/computing(n.计算)

feasible<,>/ˈfiːzəbl/<,>/ˈfiːzəbəl/<,>adj.可行的/adj.可能的<,>The plan sounds feasible in theory.<,>这个计划在理论上是可行的。<,>It's not feasible to finish the project in one week.<,>一周内完成这个项目是不可行的。<,>We need to find a feasible solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到一个可行的解决方案。<,>feas(做)+ible(能…的)→能做的→可行的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/flexible(adj.灵活的)/infeasible(adj.不可行的)

transformer<,>/trænsˈfɔːmə(r)/<,>/trænsˈfɔːrmər/<,>n.变压器<,>The transformer converts high voltage to low voltage.<,>变压器将高压转换为低压。<,>We need to replace the old transformer in the power station.<,>我们需要更换发电站里的旧变压器。<,>The transformer is an essential component in electrical systems.<,>变压器是电力系统中的重要组件。<,>trans(转变)+form(形状)+er(物)→改变形状的装置→变压器<,>transform(v.转变)/reformer(n.改革者)/conformer(n.顺从者)

vehicle<,>/ˈviːəkl/<,>/ˈviːhɪkəl/<,>n.车辆/n.机动车<,>The city has many electric vehicles on the roads.<,>这座城市有许多电动车辆在路上行驶。<,>Bicycles are a popular vehicle for short trips.<,>自行车是短途旅行的流行交通工具。<,>The police stopped the suspicious vehicle.<,>警察拦下了可疑车辆。<,>veh(运送)+icle(小东西)→运送的小东西→车辆<,>vessel(n.船只)/vocal(adj.声音的)/vehicular(adj.车辆的)

politician<,>/ˌpɒləˈtɪʃn/<,>/ˌpɑːləˈtɪʃn/<,>n.政治家/n.政客<,>The politician gave a speech about education reform.<,>这位政治家发表了关于教育改革的演讲。<,>Many people distrust politicians these days.<,>现在许多人不信任政客。<,>She decided to become a politician to make a difference.<,>她决定成为一名政治家以做出改变。<,>polit(政治)+ician(人)→从事政治的人→政治家<,>politics(n.政治)/political(adj.政治的)/politicize(v.使政治化)

regard<,>/rɪˈɡɑːd/<,>/rɪˈɡɑːrd/<,>v.把…看作<,>I regard him as my best friend.<,>我把他看作我最好的朋友。<,>She is highly regarded in her field.<,>她在她的领域备受尊敬。<,>We regard this issue as very important.<,>我们认为这个问题非常重要。<,>re(再)+gard(看)→再看→看作<,>disregard(v.忽视)/reward(n.奖励)/guard(n.守卫)

oral<,>/ˈɔːrəl/<,>/ˈɔːrəl/<,>adj.口头的/adj.口的<,>We had an oral exam in French class.<,>我们在法语课上进行了口试。<,>The doctor gave me oral instructions for taking the medicine.<,>医生给了我服药的口头指示。<,>Oral hygiene is important for dental health.<,>口腔卫生对牙齿健康很重要。<,>or(嘴)+al(…的)→口的<,>aural(adj.听觉的)/moral(adj.道德的)/oval(adj.椭圆形的)

height<,>/haɪt/<,>/haɪt/<,>n.高/n.高度/n.高处<,>The height of the mountain is 3,000 meters.<,>这座山的高度是3000米。<,>She is afraid of heights and can't look down from tall buildings.<,>她有恐高症，不能从高楼往下看。<,>He reached the height of his career at age 40.<,>他在40岁时达到了职业生涯的顶峰。<,>high(高)+t→高度<,>weight(n.重量)/width(n.宽度)/length(n.长度)

approximately<,>/əˈprɒksɪmətli/<,>/əˈprɑːksɪmətli/<,>adv.近似地/adv.大约<,>The journey takes approximately two hours.<,>旅程大约需要两小时。<,>There were approximately 50 people at the party.<,>聚会上大约有50人。<,>The price is approximately $100.<,>价格大约是100美元。<,>approximate(近似的)+ly(副词后缀)→大约地<,>exactly(adv.精确地)/proximately(adv.接近地)/proximate(adj.近似的)
long<,>/lɒŋ/<,>/lɔːŋ/<,>v.渴望/v.极想念<,>She longed for her hometown after years abroad.<,>在国外多年后，她非常想念家乡。<,>He longed to see his family again.<,>他渴望再次见到家人。<,>The child longed for a new toy.<,>这个孩子非常想要一个新玩具。<,>联想：long(长)→长时间的思念→渴望<,>belong(v.属于)/along(prep.沿着)  

bit<,>/bɪt/<,>/bɪt/<,>n.一点/n.一些/n.小片<,>Can I have a bit of your cake?<,>我能吃一点你的蛋糕吗？<,>He felt a bit tired after work.<,>工作后他感觉有点累。<,>There's a bit of paper on the floor.<,>地板上有一小片纸。<,>联想：bit(二进制位)→很小的单位→一点<,>bite(v.咬)/fit(v.适合)  

sole<,>/səʊl/<,>/soʊl/<,>n.脚底/n.鞋底/n.袜底<,>The sole of my shoe is worn out.<,>我的鞋底磨破了。<,>He massaged the sole of his foot.<,>他按摩了自己的脚底。<,>These socks have reinforced soles.<,>这些袜子有加厚的袜底。<,>联想：sole(单独的)→脚底是单独接触地面的部分<,>soul(n.灵魂)/solo(n.独奏)  

imprison<,>/ɪmˈprɪzn/<,>/ɪmˈprɪzən/<,>v.关押/v.监禁/v.限制<,>The criminal was imprisoned for 10 years.<,>这个罪犯被监禁了10年。<,>She felt imprisoned by her strict parents.<,>她觉得被严格的父母限制了自由。<,>The bird was imprisoned in a small cage.<,>这只鸟被关在小笼子里。<,>im(进入)+prison(监狱)→关进监狱<,>prison(n.监狱)/impress(v.给...留下印象)  

folk<,>/fəʊk/<,>/foʊk/<,>n.人们/n.家属/n.亲属<,>Folks around here are very friendly.<,>这里的人们非常友好。<,>My folks are coming to visit this weekend.<,>我的家人这周末要来看我。<,>It's a tradition among country folk.<,>这是乡下人的传统。<,>联想：folk(民谣)→民间的人们<,>fork(n.叉子)/fog(n.雾)  

carve<,>/kɑːv/<,>/kɑːrv/<,>v.刻/v.雕刻/v.切开<,>He carved his name into the tree.<,>他把自己的名字刻在树上。<,>The artist carved a beautiful statue.<,>艺术家雕刻了一座美丽的雕像。<,>She carved the turkey for Thanksgiving dinner.<,>她为感恩节晚餐切火鸡。<,>car(车)+ve→像车一样"刻"出痕迹<,>curve(n.曲线)/cave(n.洞穴)  

practice<,>/ˈpræktɪs/<,>/ˈpræktɪs/<,>n.练习/n.实践/n.业务<,>Practice makes perfect.<,>熟能生巧。<,>He has a dental practice in town.<,>他在镇上有个牙医诊所。<,>Putting theory into practice is important.<,>把理论付诸实践很重要。<,>pract(做)+ice→不断做→练习<,>practise(v.练习)/precise(adj.精确的)  

element<,>/ˈelɪmənt/<,>/ˈelɪmənt/<,>n.成分/n.要素/n.元素<,>Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen elements.<,>水由氢和氧元素组成。<,>Honesty is an important element in friendship.<,>诚实是友谊的重要要素。<,>This dish has all the elements of a perfect meal.<,>这道菜包含了完美一餐的所有成分。<,>ele(出来)+ment→基本的组成部分<,>elevate(v.提升)/elegant(adj.优雅的)  

rapid<,>/ˈræpɪd/<,>/ˈræpɪd/<,>adj.快的<,>The rapid growth of the city surprised everyone.<,>城市的快速发展让所有人惊讶。<,>She made rapid progress in her studies.<,>她在学习上进步很快。<,>The river has a rapid current here.<,>这里的河流很湍急。<,>rap(抢夺)+id→快速抢夺的<,>rabid(adj.狂热的)/rigid(adj.僵硬的)  

rational<,>/ˈræʃənəl/<,>/ˈræʃənəl/<,>adj.理性的/adj.出于理性的<,>We need to make a rational decision.<,>我们需要做出理性的决定。<,>His argument was clear and rational.<,>他的论点清晰而理性。<,>There's no rational explanation for his behavior.<,>对他的行为没有合理的解释。<,>ratio(比率)+nal→按比率思考的→理性的<,>national(adj.国家的)/radical(adj.激进的)
indispensable<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbl/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈspensəbəl/<,>adj.必不可少的/adj.必需的<,>Water is indispensable to life.<,>水对生命是必不可少的。<,>She became an indispensable member of the team.<,>她成为了团队中不可或缺的一员。<,>His advice was indispensable for our success.<,>他的建议对我们的成功至关重要。<,>in(不)+dispensable(可有可无的)→不可没有的→必不可少的<,>dispensable(adj.可有可无的)/necessary(adj.必要的)/essential(adj.基本的)

contact<,>/ˈkɒntækt/<,>/ˈkɑːntækt/<,>v.与…联系<,>Please contact me if you have any questions.<,>如有任何问题，请与我联系。<,>He contacted the police immediately after the accident.<,>事故发生后，他立即联系了警察。<,>We lost contact with them years ago.<,>我们多年前就与他们失去了联系。<,>con(共同)+tact(接触)→互相接触→联系<,>contract(n.合同)/content(n.内容)/connect(v.连接)

treatment<,>/ˈtriːtmənt/<,>/ˈtriːtmənt/<,>n.待遇/n.治疗/n.疗法<,>He received special treatment because of his status.<,>由于他的身份，他受到了特殊待遇。<,>The new treatment has shown promising results.<,>新疗法已显示出良好的效果。<,>She is undergoing treatment for her illness.<,>她正在接受疾病治疗。<,>treat(对待/治疗)+ment(名词后缀)→待遇/治疗<,>therapy(n.治疗)/cure(n.治愈)/management(n.管理)

insure<,>/ɪnˈʃʊə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈʃʊr/<,>v.给…保险/v.确保<,>You should insure your house against fire.<,>你应该为你的房子投保火险。<,>I insured that all doors were locked before leaving.<,>我确保在离开前所有的门都锁上了。<,>The company insures its employees against accidents.<,>公司为员工投保意外险。<,>in(使)+sure(确定)→使确定→确保<,>ensure(v.确保)/assure(v.保证)/secure(adj.安全的)

excellent<,>/ˈeksələnt/<,>/ˈeksələnt/<,>adj.优秀的/adj.杰出的<,>She did an excellent job on the project.<,>她在这个项目上做得非常出色。<,>The food at the restaurant was excellent.<,>这家餐厅的食物非常棒。<,>He has excellent communication skills.<,>他有出色的沟通技巧。<,>ex(出)+cell(升起)+ent(形容词后缀)→突出的→优秀的<,>exceptional(adj.非凡的)/superb(adj.极好的)/outstanding(adj.杰出的)

loyal<,>/ˈlɔɪəl/<,>/ˈlɔɪəl/<,>adj.忠诚的/adj.忠心的<,>He has been a loyal friend for many years.<,>多年来他一直是个忠诚的朋友。<,>The dog is loyal to its owner.<,>这只狗对主人很忠诚。<,>She remained loyal to her principles.<,>她忠于自己的原则。<,>loy(法律)+al(形容词后缀)→遵守法律的→忠诚的<,>royal(adj.皇家的)/legal(adj.合法的)/faithful(adj.忠实的)

dull<,>/dʌl/<,>/dʌl/<,>adj.枯燥的/adj.不鲜明的<,>The lecture was so dull that many students fell asleep.<,>这个讲座太枯燥了，许多学生都睡着了。<,>The colors of the painting have become dull over time.<,>这幅画的颜色随着时间的推移变得暗淡了。<,>He has a dull job with no challenges.<,>他有一份没有挑战性的枯燥工作。<,>d(低)+ull(声音)→低沉的声音→沉闷的<,>doll(n.洋娃娃)/dullard(n.笨蛋)/dumb(adj.哑的)

ghost<,>/ɡəʊst/<,>/ɡoʊst/<,>n.鬼/n.灵魂/n.鬼魂<,>She claimed to have seen a ghost in the old house.<,>她声称在那栋老房子里看到了鬼。<,>The ghost of his past still haunts him.<,>他过去的阴影仍然困扰着他。<,>The story is about a friendly ghost.<,>这个故事是关于一个友好的鬼魂的。<,>g(鬼)+host(主人)→鬼主人→鬼魂<,>guest(n.客人)/host(n.主人)/ghastly(adj.可怕的)

mortal<,>/ˈmɔːtl/<,>/ˈmɔːrtl/<,>adj.终有一死的/adj.致死的<,>All human beings are mortal.<,>所有人终有一死。<,>The wound was mortal and he died soon after.<,>这个伤口是致命的，他很快就死了。<,>They were locked in mortal combat.<,>他们陷入了生死搏斗。<,>mort(死亡)+al(形容词后缀)→终有一死的<,>immortal(adj.不朽的)/moral(adj.道德的)/mortality(n.死亡率)

identify<,>/aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/<,>/aɪˈdentɪfaɪ/<,>v.认出/v.识别/v.鉴定<,>Can you identify the man in this photo?<,>你能认出照片中的这个人吗？<,>She quickly identified the problem with the machine.<,>她很快识别出了机器的问题。<,>The police asked him to identify the suspect.<,>警察让他辨认嫌疑人。<,>ident(相同)+ify(使)→使相同→识别<,>identity(n.身份)/identical(adj.相同的)/verification(n.验证)
iron<,>/ˈaɪən/<,>/ˈaɪərn/<,>n.铁/v.烫（衣）<,>Strike while the iron is hot.<,>趁热打铁。<,>She ironed her shirt before the meeting.<,>她在开会前熨烫了衬衫。<,>The bridge is made of iron.<,>这座桥是用铁造的。<,>ir(进入)+on(名词后缀)→进入金属状态→铁<,>icon(n. 图标)/ion(n. 离子)/irony(n. 讽刺)  

China<,>/ˈtʃaɪnə/<,>/ˈtʃaɪnə/<,>n.中国<,>China has a long history.<,>中国有悠久的历史。<,>I want to visit China someday.<,>我希望有一天能去中国。<,>The Great Wall is a famous landmark in China.<,>长城是中国著名的地标。<,>chin(下巴)+a(名词后缀)→像下巴一样突出的国家→中国<,>chili(n. 辣椒)/china(n. 瓷器)/Chinatown(n. 唐人街)  

collision<,>/kəˈlɪʒn/<,>/kəˈlɪʒən/<,>n.碰撞/n.冲突<,>The collision between the two cars was terrible.<,>两车相撞非常严重。<,>There was a collision of opinions at the meeting.<,>会议上出现了意见冲突。<,>The collision caused a traffic jam.<,>碰撞导致了交通堵塞。<,>col(共同)+lision(打击)→共同打击→碰撞<,>collusion(n. 共谋)/collation(n. 核对)/colligate(v. 捆绑)  

harmful<,>/ˈhɑːmfl/<,>/ˈhɑːrmfl/<,>adj.有害的<,>Smoking is harmful to your health.<,>吸烟有害健康。<,>These chemicals can be harmful to the environment.<,>这些化学物质对环境有害。<,>Too much sugar is harmful to teeth.<,>过多的糖对牙齿有害。<,>harm(伤害)+ful(形容词后缀)→有害的<,>harmless(adj. 无害的)/harmony(n. 和谐)/harm(n. 伤害)  

volume<,>/ˈvɒljuːm/<,>/ˈvɑːljuːm/<,>n.音量/n.容积/n.卷，册<,>Please turn down the volume.<,>请把音量调低。<,>The volume of the box is 2 cubic meters.<,>这个箱子的容积是2立方米。<,>I bought the first volume of the encyclopedia.<,>我买了百科全书的第一卷。<,>vol(卷)+ume(名词后缀)→卷，册<,>volunteer(n. 志愿者)/volatile(adj. 不稳定的)/voluble(adj. 健谈的)  

bull<,>/bʊl/<,>/bʊl/<,>n.公牛/n.雄的象<,>The bull was charging at the matador.<,>公牛正向斗牛士冲去。<,>We saw a bull elephant in the safari park.<,>我们在野生动物园看到一头公象。<,>He's as strong as a bull.<,>他壮得像头牛。<,>bul(膨胀)+l→体型膨胀的动物→公牛<,>bully(n. 恶霸)/bulb(n. 灯泡)/bulk(n. 体积)  

mask<,>/mɑːsk/<,>/mæsk/<,>n.面具/n.伪装/v.掩饰<,>He wore a mask to the party.<,>他戴着面具参加派对。<,>Her smile masked her sadness.<,>她的微笑掩饰了她的悲伤。<,>The thief used a mask to hide his identity.<,>小偷用面具隐藏身份。<,>mas(混乱)+k→制造混乱的东西→面具<,>mash(v. 捣碎)/musk(n. 麝香)/task(n. 任务)  

crime<,>/kraɪm/<,>/kraɪm/<,>n.犯罪/n.罪，罪行<,>Stealing is a crime.<,>偷窃是犯罪行为。<,>He was arrested for his crimes.<,>他因罪行被捕。<,>The crime rate has decreased this year.<,>今年犯罪率下降了。<,>cri(哭)+me(我)→让我哭泣的行为→犯罪<,>prime(adj. 主要的)/grime(n. 污垢)/chime(n. 钟声)  

debate<,>/dɪˈbeɪt/<,>/dɪˈbeɪt/<,>n.争论，辩论/v.争论，辩论<,>They had a heated debate about politics.<,>他们就政治问题进行了激烈辩论。<,>We will debate the issue tomorrow.<,>我们明天将辩论这个问题。<,>The debate lasted for hours.<,>辩论持续了数小时。<,>de(下)+bate(打)→言语上的打击→辩论<,>rebate(n. 回扣)/debit(n. 借方)/debacle(n. 崩溃)  

newspaper<,>/ˈnjuːzpeɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈnuːzpeɪpər/<,>n.报纸，报<,>I read the newspaper every morning.<,>我每天早上看报纸。<,>She works for a local newspaper.<,>她在当地报社工作。<,>The newspaper reported the event in detail.<,>报纸详细报道了该事件。<,>news(新闻)+paper(纸)→新闻纸→报纸<,>newsletter(n. 简报)/newsstand(n. 报摊)/newsroom(n. 新闻编辑室)
criticize<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsaɪz/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsaɪz/<,>v.批评/v.非难/v.评论<,>She criticized his decision to quit the job.<,>她批评了他辞职的决定。<,>The film was criticized for its unrealistic plot.<,>这部电影因情节不真实而受到批评。<,>He often criticizes others but never looks at his own faults.<,>他经常批评别人，却从不看自己的缺点。<,>crit(判断)+icize(动词后缀)→做出判断→批评<,>critique(n.评论)/criticism(n.批评)/critic(n.批评家)

pencil<,>/ˈpensl/<,>/ˈpɛnsəl/<,>n.铅笔<,>She drew a picture with a colored pencil.<,>她用彩色铅笔画了一幅画。<,>Can I borrow your pencil for a moment?<,>我能借一下你的铅笔吗？<,>He always keeps a pencil behind his ear.<,>他总是在耳朵后面夹一支铅笔。<,>pen(笔)+cil(小)→小笔→铅笔<,>pen(n.钢笔)/pence(n.便士)/pencil case(n.铅笔盒)

courage<,>/ˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>n.勇气/n.胆量/n.胆识<,>It took great courage to stand up to the bully.<,>站出来对抗霸凌者需要很大的勇气。<,>She showed courage in the face of danger.<,>她在危险面前表现出了勇气。<,>He lacked the courage to admit his mistake.<,>他没有勇气承认自己的错误。<,>cour(心)+age(名词后缀)→内心的力量→勇气<,>encourage(v.鼓励)/discourage(v.使气馁)/courageous(adj.勇敢的)

forehead<,>/ˈfɒrɪd/<,>/ˈfɔːrhed/<,>n.额头/n.前部<,>She wiped the sweat from her forehead.<,>她擦去了额头上的汗水。<,>He has a scar on his forehead.<,>他的额头上有一道疤痕。<,>The baby's forehead felt warm, so she took his temperature.<,>宝宝的额头摸起来很热，所以她给他量了体温。<,>fore(前)+head(头)→头部的前面→额头<,>forearm(n.前臂)/foreleg(n.前腿)/foreword(n.前言)

perceive<,>/pəˈsiːv/<,>/pərˈsiːv/<,>v.理解/v.察觉/v.发觉<,>I perceived a change in his attitude.<,>我察觉到了他态度的变化。<,>She perceived the hidden meaning in his words.<,>她理解了他话中的隐含意思。<,>The child perceived the danger and ran away.<,>孩子察觉到了危险就跑开了。<,>per(完全)+ceive(拿)→完全拿到→察觉<,>receive(v.接收)/conceive(v.构想)/deceive(v.欺骗)

place<,>/pleɪs/<,>/pleɪs/<,>n.地方/n.地点/n.住所<,>This is a nice place for a picnic.<,>这是个野餐的好地方。<,>They moved to a new place last month.<,>他们上个月搬到了一个新住所。<,>I can't remember the exact place where we met.<,>我记不清我们见面的确切地点了。<,>pla(平坦)+ce→平坦的地方→地点<,>palace(n.宫殿)/space(n.空间)/replace(v.替换)

joke<,>/dʒəʊk/<,>/dʒoʊk/<,>n.笑话/v.说笑话<,>He told a funny joke at the party.<,>他在聚会上讲了一个有趣的笑话。<,>Don't joke about serious matters.<,>不要拿严肃的事情开玩笑。<,>They were joking with each other all evening.<,>他们整个晚上都在互相开玩笑。<,>jok(玩笑)+e→笑话<,>poke(v.戳)/yoke(n.轭)/smoke(n.烟)

sheet<,>/ʃiːt/<,>/ʃit/<,>n.被单/n.纸张/n.薄板<,>She changed the sheets on the bed.<,>她换了床上的被单。<,>Please hand me a sheet of paper.<,>请递给我一张纸。<,>The metal sheet was used to cover the roof.<,>这块金属薄板被用来覆盖屋顶。<,>she(她)+et(小东西)→她的小东西→被单<,>sleet(n.雨夹雪)/sweet(adj.甜的)/feet(n.脚)

dot<,>/dɒt/<,>/dɑːt/<,>n.点/n.圆点/v.打点于<,>There's a red dot on the white wall.<,>白墙上有一个红点。<,>She wore a dress with polka dots.<,>她穿了一件圆点花纹的连衣裙。<,>Don't forget to dot the 'i' in your signature.<,>别忘了在你签名中的"i"上打点。<,>do(做)+t(小)→做小标记→点<,>pot(n.锅)/hot(adj.热的)/lot(n.很多)

balance<,>/ˈbæləns/<,>/ˈbæləns/<,>v.使平衡/n.天平<,>She balanced the book on her head.<,>她把书平衡地放在头上。<,>The gymnast has excellent balance.<,>这位体操运动员有极好的平衡能力。<,>We need to balance work and life.<,>我们需要平衡工作和生活。<,>bal(球)+ance(名词后缀)→像球一样保持平衡→平衡<,>ball(n.球)/dance(v.跳舞)/glance(v.瞥见)
melon<,>/ˈmelən/<,>/ˈmɛlən/<,>n.瓜/n.甜瓜<,>She cut the melon into slices.<,>她把甜瓜切成片。<,>This melon is very sweet.<,>这个瓜非常甜。<,>He bought a melon from the market.<,>他从市场买了一个甜瓜。<,>melon(瓜)→联想"蜜瓜"的甜味<,>lemon(n.柠檬)/watermelon(n.西瓜)  

injure<,>/ˈɪndʒə(r)/<,>/ˈɪndʒɚ/<,>v.伤害/v.损害/v.损伤<,>He injured his leg while playing football.<,>他在踢足球时伤了腿。<<,>The accident injured three people.<,>事故造成三人受伤。<,>Her words injured his pride.<,>她的话伤害了他的自尊。<,>in(不)+jure(法律)→不合法→伤害<,>injury(n.伤害)/insure(v.保险)  

cucumber<,>/ˈkjuːkʌmbə(r)/<,>/ˈkjuˌkʌmbɚ/<,>n.黄瓜<,>She added cucumber to the salad.<,>她在沙拉里加了黄瓜。<,>Cucumber is good for hydration.<,>黄瓜有助于补水。<,>He grows cucumbers in his garden.<,>他在花园里种黄瓜。<,>cucumber(黄瓜)→联想"酷黄瓜"的清凉感<,>cumber(v.拖累)/cucurbit(n.葫芦)  

flame<,>/fleɪm/<,>/fleɪm/<,>n.火焰/n.热情<,>The flames grew higher.<,>火焰越烧越高。<,>She has a flame for music.<,>她对音乐充满热情。<,>He extinguished the flame quickly.<,>他迅速扑灭了火焰。<,>flame(火焰)→联想"飞来的火焰"<,>blame(v.责备)/frame(n.框架)  

less<,>/les/<,>/lɛs/<,>adj.更少的/adv.更少地<,>She eats less sugar now.<,>她现在吃更少的糖。<,>He works less than before.<,>他比以前工作得更少。<,>This bottle contains less water.<,>这个瓶子的水更少。<,>less(更少)→反义词"more(更多)"<,>loss(n.损失)/lest(conj.以免)  

peace<,>/piːs/<,>/pis/<,>n.和平/n.平静/n.和睦<,>They signed a peace treaty.<,>他们签署了和平条约。<,>She found peace in nature.<,>她在自然中找到了平静。<,>They live in peace with their neighbors.<,>他们与邻居和睦相处。<,>peace(和平)→联想"piece(碎片)"的谐音<,>piece(n.碎片)/peach(n.桃子)  

solve<,>/sɒlv/<,>/sɑlv/<,>v.解决/v.解答/v.解释<,>He solved the math problem quickly.<,>他很快解出了这道数学题。<,>We need to solve this issue.<,>我们需要解决这个问题。<,>Can you solve the riddle?<,>你能解开这个谜语吗？<,>solve(解决)→联想"sol(太阳)+ve(胜利)"→太阳带来胜利→解决<,>resolve(v.决心)/dissolve(v.溶解)  

basis<,>/ˈbeɪsɪs/<,>/ˈbeɪsɪs/<,>n.基础/n.根据<,>This theory has no scientific basis.<,>这个理论没有科学依据。<,>They meet on a weekly basis.<,>他们每周见面一次。<,>Trust is the basis of friendship.<,>信任是友谊的基础。<,>basis(基础)→联想"base(基础)"的变体<,>basic(adj.基本的)/bases(n.基础复数)  

once<,>/wʌns/<,>/wʌns/<,>adv.一次/adv.曾经<,>I visited Paris once.<,>我曾去过巴黎一次。<,>Once upon a time, there was a king.<,>从前有一位国王。<,>He calls his parents once a week.<,>他每周给父母打一次电话。<,>once(一次)→联想"one(一)+ce"<,>ounce(n.盎司)/nonce(n.当下)  

bus<,>/bʌs/<,>/bʌs/<,>n.公共汽车<,>She takes the bus to work.<,>她乘公交车上班。<,>The bus arrives every 10 minutes.<,>公交车每10分钟一班。<,>He missed the last bus.<,>他错过了末班车。<,>bus(公交车)→联想"busy(忙碌)"的谐音<,>boss(n.老板)/bust(n.半身像)
husband<,>/ˈhʌzbənd/<,>/ˈhʌzbənd/<,>n.丈夫<,>Her husband is a doctor.<,>她的丈夫是一名医生。<,>She has been married to her husband for ten years.<,>她和丈夫结婚十年了。<,>My husband loves cooking for the family.<,>我丈夫喜欢为家人做饭。<,>hus(家庭)+band(绑)→绑在一起的家庭成员→丈夫<,>husbandry(n. 农业/n.畜牧业)  

haircut<,>/ˈheəkʌt/<,>/ˈherkʌt/<,>n.理发<,>I need a haircut before the interview.<,>面试前我需要理个发。<,>He got a trendy haircut at the new salon.<,>他在新沙龙剪了个时髦的发型。<,>Her haircut makes her look younger.<,>她的发型让她看起来更年轻。<,>hair(头发)+cut(剪)→剪头发→理发<,>hairdo(n. 发型)/hairline(n. 发际线)  

kiss<,>/kɪs/<,>/kɪs/<,>v.吻/n.吻<,>She kissed her baby goodnight.<,>她亲吻孩子道晚安。<,>He gave her a gentle kiss on the forehead.<,>他轻轻吻了她的额头。<,>Their first kiss was under the moonlight.<,>他们的初吻是在月光下。<,>拟声词，模拟亲吻的声音<,>hiss(v. 发出嘶嘶声)/miss(v. 想念/n.小姐)  

pet<,>/pet/<,>/pet/<,>n.爱畜；宠儿<,>My pet cat sleeps on my bed.<,>我的宠物猫睡在我的床上。<,>The teacher's pet always gets special treatment.<,>老师的宠儿总是得到特殊待遇。<,>He treats his car like a pet.<,>他像对待宠物一样对待他的车。<,>pe(拍)+t(它)→拍它→宠物<,>vet(n. 兽医)/pat(v. 轻拍)  

harvest<,>/ˈhɑːvɪst/<,>/ˈhɑːrvɪst/<,>n.收获；收成/v.收割<,>Farmers celebrate the harvest every autumn.<,>农民每年秋天庆祝丰收。<,>We harvested apples from our orchard.<,>我们从果园收获了苹果。<,>The harvest this year is better than last year.<,>今年的收成比去年好。<,>har(硬)+vest(衣服)→穿着硬衣服劳作→收割<,>harvester(n. 收割机)/haste(n. 匆忙)  

considerable<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbl/<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbl/<,>adj.相当大的；重要的<,>She has considerable experience in teaching.<,>她有相当丰富的教学经验。<,>The project requires a considerable amount of time.<,>这个项目需要相当多的时间。<,>He made a considerable contribution to the team.<,>他为团队做出了重要贡献。<,>consider(考虑)+able(能…的)→值得考虑的→重要的<,>considerate(adj. 体贴的)/inconsiderable(adj. 微不足道的)  

cordial<,>/ˈkɔːdiəl/<,>/ˈkɔːrdʒəl/<,>adj.真诚的，诚恳的<,>They gave us a cordial welcome.<,>他们热情地欢迎了我们。<,>The meeting was conducted in a cordial atmosphere.<,>会议在友好的气氛中进行。<,>She has a cordial relationship with her neighbors.<,>她和邻居关系融洽。<,>cord(心)+ial(…的)→发自内心的→真诚的<,>cardiac(adj. 心脏的)/corridor(n. 走廊)  

sketch<,>/sketʃ/<,>/sketʃ/<,>n.略图；速写；概略<,>He drew a quick sketch of the landscape.<,>他快速画了张风景速写。<,>The architect showed us the sketch of the building.<,>建筑师给我们看了建筑的草图。<,>She gave a brief sketch of her plans.<,>她简要概述了她的计划。<,>s(速)+ketch(抓)→快速抓取→速写<,>stretch(v. 伸展)/scratch(v. 抓)  

avenue<,>/ˈævənjuː/<,>/ˈævənuː/<,>n.大街；林荫道，道路<,>They walked down the tree-lined avenue.<,>他们沿着林荫大道散步。<,>Fifth Avenue is famous for its luxury shops.<,>第五大道以豪华商店闻名。<,>We explored every avenue to solve the problem.<,>我们探索了解决问题的各种途径。<,>a(向)+ven(来)+ue→通向某处的路→大街<,>venue(n. 场所)/revenue(n. 税收)  

bright<,>/braɪt/<,>/braɪt/<,>adj.明亮的；聪明的<,>The sun is bright today.<,>今天阳光明媚。<,>She is one of the brightest students in class.<,>她是班上最聪明的学生之一。<,>His eyes were bright with excitement.<,>他的眼睛因兴奋而发亮。<,>b(白)+right(正确)→白而正确→明亮的<,>light(n. 光/adj.轻的)/blight(n. 枯萎病)
intimate<,>/ˈɪntɪmət/<,>/ˈɪntɪmət/<,>adj.亲密的/adj.个人的<,>They have an intimate relationship.<,>他们有着亲密的关系。<,>She shared her intimate thoughts with me.<,>她向我吐露了她的个人想法。<,>The room had an intimate atmosphere.<,>这个房间有一种私密的氛围。<,>in(内)+tim(害怕)+ate→内心不害怕→亲密的<,>imitate(v.模仿)/intimidate(v.恐吓)

locate<,>/ləʊˈkeɪt/<,>/ˈloʊkeɪt/<,>v.探明/v.找出/v.查出<,>Can you locate the nearest gas station?<,>你能找到最近的加油站吗？<,>The police are trying to locate the missing person.<,>警方正在努力查找失踪人员。<,>Scientists located the source of the earthquake.<,>科学家们确定了地震的震源。<,>loc(地方)+ate(使)→使有地方→定位<,>allocate(v.分配)/relocate(v.搬迁)

pride<,>/praɪd/<,>/praɪd/<,>n.骄傲/n.自豪/v.自夸<,>She takes pride in her work.<,>她为自己的工作感到自豪。<,>His pride prevented him from apologizing.<,>他的骄傲使他无法道歉。<,>He prides himself on his cooking skills.<,>他为自己的烹饪技巧感到自豪。<,>p(谐音"傲")+ride(骑)→骄傲地骑马<,>bride(n.新娘)/price(n.价格)

ore<,>/ɔː(r)/<,>/ɔːr/<,>n.矿/n.矿石/n.矿砂<,>The region is rich in iron ore.<,>这个地区富含铁矿。<,>They discovered a new vein of gold ore.<,>他们发现了一条新的金矿脉。<,>The ore is processed to extract the metal.<,>矿石被加工以提取金属。<,>or(或者)+e→或者挖到矿<,>core(n.核心)/bore(v.钻孔)

cupboard<,>/ˈkʌbəd/<,>/ˈkʌbərd/<,>n.碗柜/n.碗碟橱/n.食橱<,>The plates are in the cupboard.<,>盘子在碗柜里。<,>She opened the cupboard to get a glass.<,>她打开食橱拿了一个杯子。<,>We need to clean out the kitchen cupboard.<,>我们需要清理厨房的碗柜。<,>cup(杯子)+board(板)→放杯子的板→碗柜<,>cup(n.杯子)/board(n.木板)

battery<,>/ˈbætəri/<,>/ˈbætəri/<,>n.电池/n.一套/n.一组<,>The remote control needs new batteries.<,>遥控器需要新电池。<,>He was charged with assault and battery.<,>他被指控殴打他人。<,>A battery of tests was conducted.<,>进行了一系列测试。<,>bat(打)+tery→能"打"出电的东西→电池<,>buttery(adj.油腻的)/batter(v.击打)

impression<,>/ɪmˈpreʃn/<,>/ɪmˈpreʃən/<,>n.印象/n.印记<,>First impressions are important.<,>第一印象很重要。<,>The letter left an impression in the paper.<,>信在纸上留下了印记。<,>What was your impression of the movie?<,>你对这部电影的印象如何？<,>im(进入)+press(压)+ion→压进去→印象<,>expression(n.表达)/depression(n.沮丧)

waterproof<,>/ˈwɔːtəpruːf/<,>/ˈwɔːtərpruːf/<,>adj.不透水的/adj.防水的<,>This jacket is waterproof.<,>这件夹克是防水的。<,>They sell waterproof watches.<,>他们出售防水手表。<,>Make sure the tent is completely waterproof.<,>确保帐篷完全防水。<,>water(水)+proof(防)→防水的<,>fireproof(adj.防火的)/soundproof(adj.隔音的)

find<,>/faɪnd/<,>/faɪnd/<,>v.找到/v.找出/v.发觉<,>I can't find my keys.<,>我找不到我的钥匙。<,>Did you find the answer to the question?<,>你找到问题的答案了吗？<,>She found that she enjoyed painting.<,>她发现自己喜欢绘画。<,>fin(结束)+d→找到就是结束寻找<,>found(v.建立)/wind(n.风)

chapter<,>/ˈtʃæptə(r)/<,>/ˈtʃæptər/<,>n.章/n.回/n.篇<,>Please read chapter five for homework.<,>请阅读第五章作为作业。<,>The book has twenty chapters.<,>这本书有二十章。<,>This marks a new chapter in my life.<,>这标志着我人生的新篇章。<,>chap(家伙)+ter→每个家伙(角色)都有自己的篇章<,>chatter(v.闲聊)/charter(n.宪章)
powerful<,>/ˈpaʊəf(ə)l/<,>/ˈpaʊərfəl/<,>adj.有权威的/adj.强有力的<,>He is a powerful leader in the company.<,>他是公司里一位有权威的领导者。<,>The powerful engine can pull heavy loads.<,>这台强有力的发动机可以拉动重物。<,>She gave a powerful speech that moved everyone.<,>她发表了一场强有力的演讲，感动了所有人。<,>power(力量)+ful(形容词后缀)→有力量的<,>powerless(adj.无力的)/forceful(adj.强有力的)  

overtime<,>/ˈəʊvətaɪm/<,>/ˈoʊvərtaɪm/<,>n.加班/n.加班的时间<,>She worked overtime to finish the project.<,>她加班完成这个项目。<,>He gets paid extra for overtime.<,>他加班有额外的报酬。<,>Overtime is common in this industry.<,>在这个行业加班很常见。<,>over(超过)+time(时间)→超过正常工作时间→加班<,>part-time(adj.兼职的)/full-time(adj.全职的)  

carrier<,>/ˈkæriə(r)/<,>/ˈkæriər/<,>n.运输工具/n.运载工具<,>The aircraft carrier is huge.<,>这艘航空母舰非常庞大。<,>Mosquitoes are carriers of diseases.<,>蚊子是疾病的传播者。<,>The postal carrier delivers mail every day.<,>邮递员每天送信。<,>carry(运送)+er(名词后缀)→运送的人或工具<,>career(n.职业)/courier(n.快递员)  

troop<,>/truːp/<,>/trup/<,>n.军队/n.一群，大量<,>The troops were deployed to the border.<,>军队被部署到边境。<,>A troop of monkeys was playing in the trees.<,>一群猴子在树上玩耍。<,>She joined the Girl Scouts troop.<,>她加入了女童子军。<,>与"group(群组)"发音相似→都表示群体<,>troupe(n.剧团)/trooper(n.骑兵)  

garbage<,>/ˈɡɑːbɪdʒ/<,>/ˈɡɑrbɪdʒ/<,>n.垃圾/n.污物/n.废料<,>Take out the garbage before it smells.<,>在垃圾发臭前把它拿出去。<,>His argument was full of garbage.<,>他的论点全是废话。<,>The garbage truck comes every Monday.<,>垃圾车每周一来一次。<,>gar(看作"gross"恶心的)+bage(联想"bag"袋子)→恶心的袋子→垃圾<,>rubbish(n.垃圾)/trash(n.废物)  

literature<,>/ˈlɪtrətʃə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪtərətʃər/<,>n.文学/n.文献<,>She has a degree in English literature.<,>她有英国文学学位。<,>The doctor reviewed the medical literature.<,>医生查阅了医学文献。<,>This book is a classic of American literature.<,>这本书是美国文学的经典。<,>liter(文字)+ature(名词后缀)→与文字相关的→文学<,>literal(adj.字面的)/literacy(n.读写能力)  

excessive<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsɛsɪv/<,>adj.过多的/adj.极度的<,>Excessive drinking is harmful to health.<,>过度饮酒对健康有害。<,>She was criticized for excessive spending.<,>她因过度消费受到批评。<,>The heat was excessive in the desert.<,>沙漠里酷热难当。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)+ive(形容词后缀)→走出去太多→过度的<,>access(n.入口)/success(n.成功)  

nasty<,>/ˈnɑːsti/<,>/ˈnæsti/<,>adj.龌龊的/adj.淫猥的<,>He has a nasty habit of interrupting people.<,>他有打断别人说话的恶习。<,>The room had a nasty smell.<,>房间里有股难闻的气味。<,>That was a nasty comment.<,>那是个恶毒的评论。<,>na(拼音"那")+sty(看作"stink"发臭)→那很臭→龌龊的<,>tasty(adj.美味的)/hasty(adj.匆忙的)  

aboard<,>/əˈbɔːd/<,>/əˈbɔrd/<,>adv.在船(车)上/adv.上船<,>All passengers must be aboard before departure.<,>所有乘客必须在出发前登船。<,>Welcome aboard the flight to New York.<,>欢迎乘坐本次飞往纽约的航班。<,>He climbed aboard the train just in time.<,>他刚好及时登上了火车。<,>a(在...上)+board(木板)→在甲板上→在船上<,>abroad(adv.在国外)/board(n.木板)  

outdoor<,>/ˌaʊtˈdɔː(r)/<,>/ˌaʊtˈdɔr/<,>adj.户外的/adj.室外的<,>We love outdoor activities like hiking.<,>我们喜欢徒步旅行等户外活动。<,>The restaurant has an outdoor seating area.<,>这家餐厅有室外座位区。<,>Outdoor sports are good for health.<,>户外运动对健康有益。<,>out(外)+door(门)→在门外的一户外的<,>indoor(adj.室内的)/outdoors(adv.在户外)
accuse<,>/əˈkjuːz/<,>/əˈkjuz/<,>v.指责/v.归咎于<,>She accused him of stealing her wallet.<,>她指责他偷了她的钱包。<,>He was accused of lying to the court.<,>他被指控向法庭撒谎。<,>The report accuses the government of corruption.<,>这份报告指责政府腐败。<,>ac(强调)+cuse(原因)→强调原因→归咎于<,>excuse(n.借口/v.原谅)/abuse(v.滥用/n.虐待)

heaven<,>/ˈhɛv(ə)n/<,>/ˈhɛvən/<,>n.天堂/n.天,天空<,>They believe good people go to heaven after death.<,>他们相信好人死后会上天堂。<,>The stars shone brightly in the night heaven.<,>夜空中繁星闪烁。<,>This place is like a heaven on earth.<,>这个地方就像人间天堂。<,>heav(重)+en(名词后缀)→重的地方→天堂<,>haven(n.避难所)/heavy(adj.重的)

include<,>/ɪnˈkluːd/<,>/ɪnˈklud/<,>v.包括/v.包含<,>The price includes breakfast and dinner.<,>这个价格包含早餐和晚餐。<,>Our team includes members from five countries.<,>我们团队包括来自五个国家的成员。<,>Please include your contact information in the email.<,>请在邮件中包含你的联系方式。<,>in(进入)+clud(关闭)+e→关在里面→包含<,>exclude(v.排除)/conclude(v.结束)

poisonous<,>/ˈpɔɪz(ə)nəs/<,>/ˈpɔɪzənəs/<,>adj.有毒的/adj.有害的<,>That snake is highly poisonous.<,>那条蛇有剧毒。<,>The factory released poisonous gases into the air.<,>工厂向空气中排放有毒气体。<,>Some mushrooms are poisonous to humans.<,>有些蘑菇对人类有毒。<,>poison(毒)+ous(形容词后缀)→有毒的<,>venomous(adj.有毒的)/poison(n.毒药)

medicine<,>/ˈmɛd(ə)s(ə)n/<,>/ˈmɛdəsən/<,>n.内服药/n.医学<,>Take this medicine three times a day.<,>这种药每天服用三次。<,>She is studying medicine at university.<,>她在大学学习医学。<,>Traditional Chinese medicine has a long history.<,>中医有着悠久的历史。<,>medic(治疗)+ine(名词后缀)→治疗的东西→药物<,>medication(n.药物治疗)/medical(adj.医学的)

Europe<,>/ˈjʊərəp/<,>/ˈjʊrəp/<,>n.欧洲<,>I traveled around Europe last summer.<,>去年夏天我环游了欧洲。<,>France is one of the largest countries in Europe.<,>法国是欧洲最大的国家之一。<,>The European Union has 27 member states.<,>欧盟有27个成员国。<,>Euro(欧洲)+pe(地方)→欧洲<,>European(adj.欧洲的)/Asia(n.亚洲)

examine<,>/ɪɡˈzæmɪn/<,>/ɪɡˈzæmən/<,>v.检查/v.仔细观察<,>The doctor will examine you carefully.<,>医生会仔细给你做检查。<,>We need to examine all the evidence.<,>我们需要检查所有证据。<,>Students are examining the specimen under microscopes.<,>学生们正在显微镜下观察标本。<,>ex(出)+amin(称量)+e→称量出来→检查<,>inspect(v.检查)/investigate(v.调查)

halt<,>/hɔːlt/<,>/hɔlt/<,>v.停止/n.停住<,>The train halted suddenly at the station.<,>火车突然在车站停了下来。<,>Work came to a halt because of the strike.<,>由于罢工，工作停止了。<,>The officer ordered the troops to halt.<,>军官命令部队停止前进。<,>hal(停止)+t→停止<,>hold(v.握住)/halt(n.跛行)

endure<,>/ɪnˈdjʊə/<,>/ɪnˈdʊr/<,>v.忍受/v.容忍<,>She endured great pain during the operation.<,>她在手术中忍受了巨大的痛苦。<,>I can't endure his rude behavior any longer.<,>我再也无法忍受他粗鲁的行为了。<,>The old bridge has endured for centuries.<,>这座古桥已经屹立了几个世纪。<,>en(使)+dur(持续)+e→使持续→忍受<,>ensure(v.确保)/endurance(n.忍耐力)

opening<,>/ˈəʊp(ə)nɪŋ/<,>/ˈoʊpənɪŋ/<,>adj.开始的/n.开始<,>The opening ceremony was spectacular.<,>开幕式非常壮观。<,>There's an opening for a manager in our company.<,>我们公司有一个经理职位的空缺。<,>The opening chapter introduces the main characters.<,>开篇章节介绍了主要人物。<,>open(开)+ing(名词后缀)→开始<,>beginning(n.开始)/closing(n.结束)
silence<,>/ˈsaɪləns/<,>/ˈsaɪləns/<,>n.沉默/v.使沉默<,>There was a long silence before anyone spoke.<,>在有人说话之前，有一段长时间的沉默。<,>He silenced the crowd with a wave of his hand.<,>他挥了挥手使人群安静下来。<,>The teacher silenced the noisy students.<,>老师让吵闹的学生们安静下来。<,>sil(安静)+ence(名词后缀)→安静的状态→沉默<,>silent(adj.安静的)/violence(n.暴力)  

missile<,>/ˈmɪsaɪl/<,>/ˈmɪsəl/<,>n.导弹/n.发射物<,>The missile was launched towards the target.<,>导弹被发射向目标。<,>They developed a new missile defense system.<,>他们开发了一套新的导弹防御系统。<,>The angry crowd threw missiles at the police.<,>愤怒的人群向警察投掷物品。<,>miss(发送)+ile(能…的)→能发送的东西→导弹<,>mission(n.任务)/missive(n.信件)  

executive<,>/ɪɡˈzekjətɪv/<,>/ɪɡˈzekjətɪv/<,>adj.执行的/n.执行者<,>She is an executive in a large company.<,>她是一家大公司的高管。<,>The executive committee will meet tomorrow.<,>执行委员会明天将开会。<,>He has strong executive abilities.<,>他有很强的执行能力。<,>ex(出)+ecut(跟随)+ive→跟随着执行的人→执行者<,>execution(n.执行)/executor(n.执行者)  

reliability<,>/rɪˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>/rɪˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可靠性<,>The reliability of these results is questionable.<,>这些结果的可靠性值得怀疑。<,>We need to test the reliability of the new system.<,>我们需要测试新系统的可靠性。<,>His reliability makes him a valuable employee.<,>他的可靠性使他成为有价值的员工。<,>rely(依赖)+ability(能力)→可依赖的能力→可靠性<,>reliable(adj.可靠的)/liability(n.责任)  

granddaughter<,>/ˈɡrændɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈɡrænˌdɔtər/<,>n.孙女/n.外孙女<,>My granddaughter is starting school this year.<,>我的孙女今年要开始上学了。<,>She loves spending time with her granddaughter.<,>她喜欢和她的外孙女一起度过时光。<,>The old man told stories to his granddaughter.<,>老人给他的孙女讲故事。<,>grand(大的)+daughter(女儿)→女儿的女儿→孙女<,>grandson(n.孙子)/grandparent(n.祖父母)  

occasional<,>/əˈkeɪʒənl/<,>/əˈkeɪʒənl/<,>adj.偶然的/adj.临时的<,>He makes occasional visits to his hometown.<,>他偶尔会回老家看看。<,>She works as an occasional teacher.<,>她做临时教师的工作。<,>We have occasional disagreements, but nothing serious.<,>我们偶尔会有分歧，但没什么严重的。<,>occasion(场合)+al(…的)→特定场合的→临时的<,>occasionally(adv.偶尔)/casual(adj.随意的)  

fortunate<,>/ˈfɔːtʃənət/<,>/ˈfɔːrtʃənət/<,>adj.幸运的/adj.侥幸的<,>We were fortunate to escape the accident unharmed.<,>我们很幸运在事故中毫发无损。<,>It was fortunate that someone found her lost wallet.<,>幸运的是有人找到了她丢失的钱包。<,>You're fortunate to have such good friends.<,>你有这么好的朋友真是幸运。<,>fortune(运气)+ate(…的)→有好运的→幸运的<,>unfortunate(adj.不幸的)/fortunately(adv.幸运地)  

ear<,>/ɪə(r)/<,>/ɪr/<,>n.耳朵/n.听力/n.听觉<,>She whispered something in his ear.<,>她在他耳边低声说了些什么。<,>He has a good ear for music.<,>他对音乐有很好的鉴赏力。<,>The dog pricked up its ears at the sound.<,>狗听到声音竖起了耳朵。<,>ear(耳朵)→与听觉相关的器官<,>hear(v.听)/earring(n.耳环)  

sequence<,>/ˈsiːkwəns/<,>/ˈsiːkwəns/<,>n.次序<,>Please arrange these cards in the correct sequence.<,>请把这些卡片按正确的顺序排列。<,>The DNA sequence was finally decoded.<,>DNA序列终于被解码了。<,>There was a sequence of events leading to the accident.<,>有一系列事件导致了这次事故。<,>sequ(跟随)+ence(状态)→跟随的状态→次序<,>consequence(n.结果)/sequential(adj.连续的)  

guarantee<,>/ˌɡærənˈtiː/<,>/ˌɡærənˈti/<,>n.保证/n.担保物<,>The product comes with a one-year guarantee.<,>这个产品有一年的保修期。<,>I can't guarantee that I'll be there on time.<,>我不能保证我会准时到那里。<,>He used his house as a guarantee for the loan.<,>他用房子作为贷款的担保。<,>guar(保护)+antee→提供保护→保证<,>warranty(n.保修)/guardian(n.监护人)
link<,>/lɪŋk/<,>/lɪŋk/<,>v.有环连接/n.环<,>They found a link between the two crimes.<,>他们发现这两起犯罪之间有联系。<,>The bridge links the two sides of the river.<,>这座桥连接了河的两岸。<,>She wore a gold link bracelet.<,>她戴了一条金环手链。<,>link(链条)→环环相扣→连接<,>blink(v.眨眼)/sink(v.下沉)/rink(n.溜冰场)

actual<,>/ˈæktʃuəl/<,>/ˈæktʃuəl/<,>adj.实际的<,>The actual cost was higher than we expected.<,>实际成本比我们预期的要高。<,>In actual fact, he was lying.<,>事实上，他在撒谎。<,>The actual size of the room is quite small.<,>房间的实际面积很小。<,>act(行动)+ual(形容词后缀)→实际的<,>virtual(adj.虚拟的)/factual(adj.事实的)/eventual(adj.最终的)

after<,>/ˈɑːftə(r)/<,>/ˈæftər/<,>prep.在…以后/次于<,>We'll go for a walk after dinner.<,>我们晚饭后会去散步。<,>After you with the salt, please.<,>请把盐递给我。<,>He arrived after me.<,>他在我之后到达。<,>aft(后部)+er(比较级)→在…之后<,>before(prep.在…之前)/alter(v.改变)/offer(v.提供)

access<,>/ˈækses/<,>/ˈækˌsɛs/<,>n.通道/n.入口<,>The fire escape provides access to the roof.<,>消防通道通向屋顶。<,>Students have access to the library 24 hours a day.<,>学生可以24小时使用图书馆。<,>The only access to the village is by boat.<,>进入这个村庄的唯一途径是乘船。<,>ac(强调)+cess(走)→走过去→通道<,>assess(v.评估)/excess(n.过量)/accede(v.同意)

recently<,>/ˈriːsntli/<,>/ˈrisəntli/<,>adv.最近/新近<,>I've been very busy recently.<,>我最近非常忙。<,>She recently moved to a new apartment.<,>她最近搬到了新公寓。<,>The book was published quite recently.<,>这本书是最近出版的。<,>recent(最近的)+ly(副词后缀)→最近<,>frequently(adv.频繁地)/currently(adv.当前)/presently(adv.目前)

intellectual<,>/ˌɪntəˈlektʃuəl/<,>/ˌɪntəˈlɛktʃuəl/<,>n.知识分子/adj.智力的<,>He was an intellectual who loved philosophy.<,>他是个热爱哲学的知识分子。<,>Chess is an intellectual game.<,>国际象棋是一项智力游戏。<,>The conference attracted many intellectuals.<,>这次会议吸引了许多知识分子。<,>intel(智慧)+lect(选择)+ual→有智慧选择的人→知识分子<,>intelligent(adj.聪明的)/intellect(n.智力)/intuition(n.直觉)

rotate<,>/rəʊˈteɪt/<,>/ˈroʊteɪt/<,>v.旋转<,>The Earth rotates on its axis.<,>地球绕地轴旋转。<,>We rotate the crops to keep the soil healthy.<,>我们轮种作物以保持土壤健康。<,>The tires rotate as the car moves.<,>汽车行驶时轮胎会转动。<,>rot(轮子)+ate(动词后缀)→像轮子一样转动→旋转<,>rotation(n.旋转)/rotary(adj.旋转的)/rotunda(n.圆形大厅)

deck<,>/dek/<,>/dɛk/<,>n.甲板/n.舱面/n.层面<,>We sat on the deck and enjoyed the sunshine.<,>我们坐在甲板上享受阳光。<,>The ship has three decks.<,>这艘船有三层甲板。<,>He shuffled the deck of cards.<,>他洗了洗牌。<,>deck(覆盖)→覆盖船体的部分→甲板<,>dock(n.码头)/peck(v.啄)/neck(n.脖子)

plough<,>/plaʊ/<,>/plaʊ/<,>n.犁/v.犁/v.耕<,>The farmer used a plough to prepare the field.<,>农民用犁来准备田地。<,>They plough the fields every spring.<,>他们每年春天犁地。<,>The ship ploughed through the waves.<,>船破浪前进。<,>plough(犁)→与ground(地面)相关→耕地<,>plow(美式拼写)/slough(n.沼泽)/bough(n.大树枝)

poison<,>/ˈpɔɪzn/<,>/ˈpɔɪzən/<,>n.毒/n.毒药/v.毒害<,>The poison killed the rat instantly.<,>毒药立刻杀死了老鼠。<,>Someone tried to poison the king.<,>有人试图毒害国王。<,>Pollution is poisoning our rivers.<,>污染正在毒害我们的河流。<,>pois(喝)+on→喝下去有害的东西→毒药<,>prison(n.监狱)/person(n.人)/portion(n.部分)
perhaps<,>/pəˈhæps/<,>/pərˈhæps/<,>adv.也许/adv.可能/adv.多半<,>Perhaps we should leave now.<,>也许我们现在该走了。<,>She is perhaps the best singer in the school.<,>她可能是学校里最好的歌手。<,>Perhaps it will rain tomorrow.<,>明天可能会下雨。<,>per(完全)+haps(机会)→完全靠机会→也许<,>probably(adv.很可能)/possibly(adv.可能地)  

acid<,>/ˈæsɪd/<,>/ˈæsɪd/<,>n.酸/adj.酸的/adj.酸性的<,>Vinegar contains acetic acid.<,>醋含有乙酸。<,>The orange has an acid taste.<,>这个橙子有酸味。<,>Acid rain can damage buildings.<,>酸雨会损坏建筑物。<,>ac(尖)+id→尖酸→酸的<,>base(n.碱)/alkali(n.碱)  

elect<,>/ɪˈlekt/<,>/ɪˈlɛkt/<,>v.选举/v.推选/v.选择<,>We will elect a new president next month.<,>我们下个月将选举新总统。<,>She was elected as team leader.<,>她被推选为队长。<,>He elected to stay home instead of going out.<,>他选择待在家里而不是出去。<,>e(出)+lect(选)→选出→选举<,>select(v.选择)/erect(adj.直立的)  

cent<,>/sent/<,>/sɛnt/<,>n.分/n.分币<,>This candy costs fifty cents.<,>这颗糖果要五十美分。<,>He doesn't have a cent to his name.<,>他身无分文。<,>She saved every cent she earned.<,>她存下了挣的每一分钱。<,>cent(百)→百分之一元→分<,>scent(n.气味)/sent(v.发送)  

arbitrary<,>/ˈɑːbɪtrəri/<,>/ˈɑrbəˌtrɛri/<,>adj.随心所欲的/adj.专断的<,>The decision seemed completely arbitrary.<,>这个决定看起来完全是武断的。<,>He made an arbitrary choice without consulting anyone.<,>他没有咨询任何人就做了专断的选择。<,>The arbitrary rules frustrated everyone.<,>这些武断的规定让每个人都很沮丧。<,>arbitr(判断)+ary→凭个人判断的→武断的<,>arbitrator(n.仲裁人)/arbitration(n.仲裁)  

either<,>/ˈaɪðə(r)/<,>/ˈiðər/<,>det,pron.(两者)任何一个<,>You can take either book.<,>你可以拿任意一本书。<,>Either of the options is acceptable.<,>这两个选择中任何一个都可以接受。<,>I don't like either of them.<,>我两个都不喜欢。<,>ei(两者)+ther→两者中任一个<,>neither(两者都不)/other(其他的)  

Atlantic<,>/ətˈlæntɪk/<,>/ætˈlæntɪk/<,>adj.大西洋的/n.大西洋<,>They crossed the Atlantic Ocean by ship.<,>他们乘船横渡大西洋。<,>Atlantic storms can be very powerful.<,>大西洋的风暴可能非常强烈。<,>The Atlantic coast is beautiful.<,>大西洋海岸很美。<,>Atlas(希腊神话中的擎天神)+tic→阿特拉斯擎天的地方→大西洋<,>Pacific(adj.太平洋的/n.太平洋)  

actor<,>/ˈæktə(r)/<,>/ˈæktər/<,>n.演剧的人<,>He is a famous Hollywood actor.<,>他是好莱坞著名演员。<,>The actor performed brilliantly in the play.<,>这位演员在剧中表现出色。<,>She wants to become an actor when she grows up.<,>她长大后想成为一名演员。<,>act(表演)+or(人)→表演的人→演员<,>actress(n.女演员)/action(n.行动)  

fever<,>/ˈfiːvə(r)/<,>/ˈfivər/<,>n.发热/n.发烧/n.狂热<,>She has a high fever and needs to rest.<,>她发高烧需要休息。<,>Football fever gripped the nation during the World Cup.<,>世界杯期间全国都陷入了足球狂热。<,>The child's fever broke after taking medicine.<,>孩子吃药后退烧了。<,>fever(热)→发烧<,>febrile(adj.发热的)/fervor(n.热情)  

mostly<,>/ˈməʊstli/<,>/ˈmoʊstli/<,>adv.主要的/adv.大部分<,>The audience was mostly teenagers.<,>观众大部分是青少年。<,>She mostly eats vegetarian food.<,>她主要吃素食。<,>The book is mostly about his childhood.<,>这本书主要是关于他的童年。<,>most(最多)+ly→大部分地<,>mainly(adv.主要地)/almost(adv.几乎)
player<,>/ˈpleɪə(r)/<,>/ˈpleɪər/<,>n.游戏的人/n.比赛者<,>He is a talented football player.<,>他是一个有天赋的足球运动员。<,>She's a key player in our team.<,>她是我们团队的关键选手。<,>The video game player won the championship.<,>这个电子游戏玩家赢得了冠军。<,>play(玩)+er(人)→玩游戏的人<,>payer(n.付款人)/prayer(n.祈祷者)

swell<,>/swel/<,>/swɛl/<,>v.膨胀/v.增长/v.隆起<,>The river swelled after the heavy rain.<,>大雨过后河水上涨了。<,>His ankle began to swell after the injury.<,>受伤后他的脚踝开始肿胀。<,>The population has swollen to over 10 million.<,>人口已增长到超过1000万。<,>s(蛇)+well(井)→蛇在井里膨胀<,>smell(v.闻/n.气味)/spell(v.拼写)

experience<,>/ɪkˈspɪəriəns/<,>/ɪkˈspɪriəns/<,>n.经验/n.感受/n.经历<,>She has years of teaching experience.<,>她有多年教学经验。<,>It was a frightening experience.<,>那是一次可怕的经历。<,>Gaining work experience is important for students.<,>获得工作经验对学生很重要。<,>ex(出)+peri(尝试)+ence→尝试出来的东西→经验<,>experiment(n.实验)/expert(n.专家)

creative<,>/kriˈeɪtɪv/<,>/kriˈeɪtɪv/<,>adj.创造性的/adj.创作的<,>She has a very creative mind.<,>她很有创造力。<,>The ad campaign was highly creative.<,>这个广告活动非常有创意。<,>Creative writing helps express emotions.<,>创意写作有助于表达情感。<,>create(创造)+ive(形容词后缀)→创造性的<,>reactive(adj.反应的)/cooperative(adj.合作的)

perfect<,>/ˈpɜːfɪkt/<,>/ˈpɜːrfɪkt/<,>adj.完美的/adj.完全的<,>Her English pronunciation is perfect.<,>她的英语发音很完美。<,>This is the perfect time to invest.<,>这是投资的绝佳时机。<,>He's a perfect stranger to me.<,>他对我来说完全是个陌生人。<,>per(完全)+fect(做)→完全做好→完美<,>prefect(n.长官)/infect(v.传染)

affection<,>/əˈfekʃn/<,>/əˈfekʃən/<,>n.慈爱/n.爱/n.爱慕<,>She has great affection for her students.<,>她非常关爱她的学生。<,>He showed no affection towards his children.<,>他对孩子毫无慈爱之情。<,>They married out of mutual affection.<,>他们因相爱而结婚。<,>affect(影响)+ion→影响感情的东西→爱<,>infection(n.感染)/affliction(n.痛苦)

largely<,>/ˈlɑːdʒli/<,>/ˈlɑːrdʒli/<,>adv.大部分/adv.大量地<,>The success was largely due to teamwork.<,>成功主要归功于团队合作。<,>The city has largely recovered from the earthquake.<,>这座城市已基本从地震中恢复。<,>His theory is largely accepted by scientists.<,>他的理论被科学家广泛接受。<,>large(大的)+ly(副词后缀)→大量地<,>likely(adv.可能地)/lately(adv.最近)

extent<,>/ɪkˈstent/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnt/<,>n.程度/n.广度/n.范围<,>I was surprised at the extent of the damage.<,>我对破坏的程度感到惊讶。<,>The extent of his knowledge is impressive.<,>他的知识面令人印象深刻。<,>To some extent, I agree with you.<,>在某种程度上，我同意你的观点。<,>ex(出)+tent(伸展)→伸展出的范围<,>extend(v.延伸)/extant(adj.现存的)

better<,>/ˈbetə(r)/<,>/ˈbɛtər/<,>adj.较好的/adv.更好地<,>This solution is better than the previous one.<,>这个解决方案比之前的好。<,>She sings better than her sister.<,>她唱得比她姐姐好。<,>I feel much better today.<,>我今天感觉好多了。<,>good的比较级形式<,>batter(v.连续猛击)/butter(n.黄油)

disappear<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪə(r)/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪr/<,>v.消失/v.不见/v.失踪<,>The sun disappeared behind the clouds.<,>太阳消失在云层后面。<,>My keys have disappeared again!<,>我的钥匙又不见了！<,>Many species are disappearing due to habitat loss.<,>许多物种因栖息地丧失而消失。<,>dis(不)+appear(出现)→不出现→消失<,>appear(v.出现)/disapprove(v.不赞成)
motivate<,>/ˈməʊtɪveɪt/<,>/ˈmoʊtəveɪt/<,>v.促动/v.激励/v.激发<,>The teacher's praise motivated the students to work harder.<,>老师的表扬激励学生们更加努力。<,>A good leader knows how to motivate their team.<,>一个好的领导者知道如何激励团队。<,>His speech motivated me to pursue my dreams.<,>他的演讲激发了我追求梦想。<,>motiv(动机)+ate(使)→使有动机→激励<,>stimulate(v.刺激)/activate(v.激活)/provoke(v.挑衅)  

moreover<,>/mɔːrˈəʊvə(r)/<,>/mɔːrˈoʊvər/<,>adv.再者/adv.加之/adv.此外<,>The plan is risky; moreover, it's expensive.<,>这个计划有风险；此外，还很昂贵。<,>She is talented, and moreover, she is hardworking.<,>她很有才华，而且她还很勤奋。<,>The weather is bad; moreover, the roads are icy.<,>天气很糟糕；再加上道路结冰。<,>more(更多)+over(超过)→进一步补充→此外<,>furthermore(adv.此外)/besides(adv.而且)/additionally(adv.另外)  

regulate<,>/ˈreɡjuleɪt/<,>/ˈreɡjəleɪt/<,>v.管理/v.控制/v.调整<,>The government regulates the use of pesticides.<,>政府管控农药的使用。<,>This valve regulates the flow of water.<,>这个阀门调节水流。<,>She needs to regulate her sleep schedule.<,>她需要调整她的睡眠时间表。<,>reg(规则)+ulate(使)→使有规则→管理<,>control(v.控制)/adjust(v.调整)/moderate(v.缓和)  

respectively<,>/rɪˈspektɪvli/<,>/rɪˈspektɪvli/<,>adv.各自地/adv.分别地<,>Tom and Jerry are 10 and 8 years old, respectively.<,>汤姆和杰瑞分别是10岁和8岁。<,>The winners received gold and silver medals, respectively.<,>获胜者分别获得了金牌和银牌。<,>The rooms are assigned to John and Mary, respectively.<,>这些房间分别分配给了约翰和玛丽。<,>respect(方面)+ive+ly→按各自的方面→分别地<,>individually(adv.个别地)/separately(adv.分开地)/correspondingly(adv.相应地)  

exit<,>/ˈeksɪt/<,>/ˈɛɡzɪt/<,>n.出口/n.退场/v.退出<,>Please use the emergency exit in case of fire.<,>如遇火灾，请使用紧急出口。<,>The actor made a dramatic exit from the stage.<,>演员戏剧性地退场了。<,>Press Ctrl+Alt+Del to exit the program.<,>按Ctrl+Alt+Del退出程序。<,>ex(出)+it(走)→走出去→出口<,>entrance(n.入口)/access(n.进入)/depart(v.离开)  

chairman<,>/ˈtʃeəmən/<,>/ˈtʃermən/<,>n.主席/n.议长/n.会长<,>The chairman opened the meeting with a speech.<,>主席以演讲开始了会议。<,>He was elected chairman of the committee.<,>他被选为委员会主席。<,>The chairman announced the new policy.<,>会长宣布了新政策。<,>chair(椅子)+man(人)→坐在主位的人→主席<,>president(n.总统)/director(n.董事)/moderator(n.主持人)  

journal<,>/ˈdʒɜːnl/<,>/ˈdʒɜːrnl/<,>n.日报/n.杂志/n.日志<,>She writes in her journal every night.<,>她每晚都写日记。<,>This scientific journal publishes groundbreaking research.<,>这本科学杂志发表开创性的研究。<,>He works as a reporter for a daily journal.<,>他在一家日报社当记者。<,>journ(日)+al→每日的记录→日志<,>diary(n.日记)/magazine(n.杂志)/chronicle(n.编年史)  

below<,>/bɪˈləʊ/<,>/bɪˈloʊ/<,>prep.在…下面/prep.以下<,>The temperature dropped below freezing.<,>温度降到了零度以下。<,>Sign your name below the line.<,>在横线下方签名。<,>See the instructions below for details.<,>详情请见下面的说明。<,>be(在)+low(低)→在低处→下面<,>above(prep.在…上方)/under(prep.在…正下方)/beneath(prep.在…之下)  

belief<,>/bɪˈliːf/<,>/bɪˈliːf/<,>n.信念/n.信任/n.相信<,>Her belief in justice never wavered.<,>她对正义的信念从未动摇。<,>It's my belief that honesty is the best policy.<,>我相信诚实是最好的策略。<,>The story challenges traditional beliefs.<,>这个故事挑战了传统观念。<,>be(使)+lief(爱)→因爱而信任→信念<,>faith(n.信仰)/trust(n.信任)/conviction(n.确信)  

minority<,>/maɪˈnɒrəti/<,>/maɪˈnɔːrəti/<,>n.少数/n.少数民族<,>Only a minority of people voted against the proposal.<,>只有少数人投票反对这个提议。<,>The rights of minorities must be protected.<,>少数民族的权利必须得到保护。<,>She comes from an ethnic minority group.<,>她来自一个少数民族群体。<,>minor(较小的)+ity(状态)→少数状态<,>majority(n.多数)/plurality(n.多元化)/ethnicity(n.种族)
over<,>/ˈəʊvə(r)/<,>/ˈoʊvər/<,>prep.在…上方/prep.超过<,>The plane flew over the mountains.<,>飞机飞越了群山。<,>She is over 30 years old.<,>她已经30多岁了。<,>He jumped over the fence.<,>他跳过了篱笆。<,>o(圆形)+ver(转)→在…上方转→超过<,>cover(v.覆盖/n.盖子)/hover(v.盘旋/n.徘徊)/moreover(adv.此外)  

conversation<,>/ˌkɒnvəˈseɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnvərˈseɪʃn/<,>n.会话/n.非正式会谈<,>They had a long conversation about politics.<,>他们就政治问题进行了长时间的交谈。<,>I overheard their private conversation.<,>我无意中听到了他们的私人谈话。<,>Let's continue this conversation later.<,>我们晚点再继续这个谈话。<,>con(共同)+vers(转)+ation→相互交流→会话<,>conservation(n.保护/n.保存)/conversion(n.转变/n.皈依)/convention(n.惯例/n.大会)  

factory<,>/ˈfæktri/<,>/ˈfæktəri/<,>n.工厂/n.制造厂<,>He works in a car factory.<,>他在一家汽车厂工作。<,>The factory produces electronic devices.<,>这家工厂生产电子设备。<,>They closed down the old factory.<,>他们关闭了那家老工厂。<,>fact(做)+ory(场所)→制造的场所→工厂<,>factor(n.因素/v.分解)/manufactory(n.制造厂)/fraction(n.部分/n.分数)  

cherry<,>/ˈtʃeri/<,>/ˈtʃeri/<,>n.樱桃/n.樱桃树<,>She loves eating fresh cherries.<,>她喜欢吃新鲜的樱桃。<,>The cherry blossoms are beautiful in spring.<,>春天的樱花很美。<,>He planted a cherry tree in his garden.<,>他在花园里种了一棵樱桃树。<,>cher(珍爱)+ry→可爱的红色果实→樱桃<,>berry(n.浆果)/cherish(v.珍爱)/cheery(adj.愉快的)  

consent<,>/kənˈsent/<,>/kənˈsent/<,>n.同意/n.赞成/v.同意<,>She gave her consent to the proposal.<,>她同意了这个提议。<,>Silence implies consent.<,>沉默意味着同意。<,>They consented to our terms.<,>他们同意了我们的条款。<,>con(共同)+sent(感觉)→共同的感觉→同意<,>content(n.内容/adj.满足的)/dissent(v.不同意/n.异议)/resent(v.怨恨)  

else<,>/els/<,>/els/<,>adv.其它/adv.另外/adj.别的<,>What else do you want to know?<,>你还想知道什么？<,>Someone else will do the job.<,>会有其他人来做这份工作。<,>Is there anything else I can help you with?<,>还有什么我能帮你的吗？<,>el(出)+se→除此之外→别的<,>ease(n.容易/v.减轻)/erase(v.擦除)/elude(v.逃避)  

mouse<,>/maʊs/<,>/maʊs/<,>n.鼠/n.耗子<,>The cat chased the mouse.<,>猫追着老鼠跑。<,>He uses a wireless mouse for his computer.<,>他用无线鼠标操作电脑。<,>There's a mouse in the kitchen.<,>厨房里有只老鼠。<,>mou(嘴)+se→爱啃咬的小动物→老鼠<,>mouth(n.嘴)/mousse(n.慕斯)/muse(v.沉思/n.缪斯)  

disk<,>/dɪsk/<,>/dɪsk/<,>n.圆盘/n.唱片/n.磁盘<,>He bought a new hard disk for his computer.<,>他给电脑买了个新硬盘。<,>The moon looks like a silver disk.<,>月亮看起来像个银盘。<,>I found an old vinyl disk in the attic.<,>我在阁楼发现了一张老唱片。<,>dis(分开)+k→可以旋转分开的→圆盘<,>desk(n.书桌)/dusk(n.黄昏)/risk(n.风险/v.冒险)  

legal<,>/ˈliːɡl/<,>/ˈliːɡl/<,>adj.法律的/adj.合法的<,>You should seek legal advice.<,>你应该寻求法律建议。<,>Is it legal to park here?<,>在这里停车合法吗？<,>They are fighting for their legal rights.<,>他们正在为自己的合法权利而斗争。<,>leg(法律)+al→与法律有关的→合法的<,>illegal(adj.非法的)/legacy(n.遗产)/legend(n.传说)  

fundamental<,>/ˌfʌndəˈmentl/<,>/ˌfʌndəˈmentl/<,>adj.基础的/adj.基本的<,>This is a fundamental principle of physics.<,>这是物理学的基本原理。<,>Reading is fundamental to learning.<,>阅读是学习的基础。<,>We need to address the fundamental issues.<,>我们需要解决根本问题。<,>fund(基础)+a+ment(名词后缀)+al→基础的<,>foundation(n.基础)/fund(n.资金/v.资助)/mental(adj.精神的)
liquor<,>/ˈlɪkə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪkɚ/<,>n.酒<,>He enjoys a glass of liquor after dinner.<,>他喜欢在晚餐后喝一杯酒。<,>The store sells various types of liquor.<,>这家商店出售各种类型的酒。<,>Excessive liquor consumption is harmful to health.<,>过量饮酒对健康有害。<,>liq(液体)+or→液体→酒<,>liquid(n.液体)/liqueur(n.利口酒)

ancient<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>/ˈeɪnʃənt/<,>adj.古代的/adj.古老的<,>The ancient city is a popular tourist destination.<,>这座古城是一个受欢迎的旅游目的地。<,>She studies ancient history at university.<,>她在大学学习古代历史。<,>This ancient tree is over 500 years old.<,>这棵古老的树有500多年的历史。<,>anci(古老)+ent(形容词后缀)→古老的<,>antique(adj.古老的/n.古董)/ancestor(n.祖先)

pillow<,>/ˈpɪləʊ/<,>/ˈpɪloʊ/<,>n.枕头<,>She fluffed her pillow before going to sleep.<,>她在睡觉前拍松了枕头。<,>The hotel provides extra pillows upon request.<,>酒店应要求提供额外的枕头。<,>He hugged his pillow tightly in his sleep.<,>他在睡梦中紧紧抱着枕头。<,>pill(药丸)+ow→像药丸一样柔软→枕头<,>willow(n.柳树)/pillar(n.柱子)

grip<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>v.握紧/v.抓牢/n.紧握<,>She gripped the railing tightly as she climbed the stairs.<,>她上楼梯时紧紧抓住栏杆。<,>The tennis player has a strong grip on his racket.<,>这位网球选手握拍很紧。<,>Fear gripped his heart as he entered the dark room.<,>当他进入黑暗的房间时，恐惧攫住了他的心。<,>gr(抓)+ip→抓住→握紧<,>grasp(v.抓住)/gripe(v.抱怨)

limitation<,>/ˌlɪmɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌlɪmɪˈteɪʃn/<,>n.限制/n.限度/n.局限<,>There is a limitation on how much luggage you can bring.<,>你能携带的行李数量是有限制的。<,>The study has several limitations that affect its results.<,>这项研究有几个影响结果的局限性。<,>He is aware of his own limitations.<,>他知道自己的局限性。<,>limit(限制)+ation(名词后缀)→限制<,>limitation(n.限制)/limitation(n.极限)

chief<,>/tʃiːf/<,>/tʃiːf/<,>adj.首席的/adj.主要的<,>She is the chief editor of the magazine.<,>她是这本杂志的主编。<,>The chief reason for his success is hard work.<,>他成功的主要原因是努力工作。<,>The chief guest arrived late to the ceremony.<,>主宾迟到了仪式。<,>chie(首领)+f→首领的→主要的<,>chef(n.厨师)/thief(n.小偷)

dark<,>/dɑːk/<,>/dɑːrk/<,>adj.暗的/adj.黑色的<,>It's too dark to see anything in the room.<,>房间里太暗了，什么都看不见。<,>She prefers dark chocolate to milk chocolate.<,>比起牛奶巧克力，她更喜欢黑巧克力。<,>The sky turned dark as the storm approached.<,>随着暴风雨的临近，天空变暗了。<,>dar(隐藏)+k→隐藏的→黑暗的<,>dank(adj.阴湿的)/dare(v.敢)

stoop<,>/stuːp/<,>/stuːp/<,>v.俯身/v.弯身/n.曲背/n.驼背<,>She stooped to pick up the coin from the ground.<,>她俯身从地上捡起硬币。<,>Years of hard work gave him a permanent stoop.<,>多年的辛苦工作使他永远驼背了。<,>He stoops when he walks due to back pain.<,>由于背痛，他走路时弯着腰。<,>stoo(站立)+p→站立时弯曲→俯身<,>scoop(v.舀取)/stop(v.停止)

parliament<,>/ˈpɑːləmənt/<,>/ˈpɑːrləmənt/<,>n.议会/n.国会<,>The new law was passed by parliament last week.<,>新法律上周由议会通过。<,>Members of parliament debated the issue for hours.<,>议员们就这个问题辩论了几个小时。<,>The prime minister addressed parliament yesterday.<,>首相昨天在议会发表了讲话。<,>parlia(说话)+ment(名词后缀)→说话的地方→议会<,>pavement(n.人行道)/apartment(n.公寓)

weld<,>/weld/<,>/weld/<,>v.焊接/v.熔接/n.焊接点<,>The worker is welding two pieces of metal together.<,>工人正在把两块金属焊接在一起。<,>A strong weld is essential for the structure's safety.<,>牢固的焊接对结构的安全至关重要。<,>He learned how to weld in vocational school.<,>他在职业学校学会了焊接。<,>wel(连接)+d→连接金属→焊接<,>wild(adj.野生的)/wield(v.挥舞)
hang<,>/hæŋ/<,>/hæŋ/<,>v.挂/v.悬/v.吊死<,>She likes to hang pictures on the wall.<,>她喜欢把画挂在墙上。<,>The criminal was hanged for his crimes.<,>罪犯因罪行被处以绞刑。<,>The fog hangs over the city in the morning.<,>早晨雾气笼罩着城市。<,>谐音“航”→悬挂航行<,>hung(过去式)/hanger(n.衣架)/hunger(n.饥饿)

pacific<,>/pəˈsɪfɪk/<,>/pəˈsɪfɪk/<,>adj.和平的/n.太平洋<,>She has a pacific temperament.<,>她性情温和。<,>They sailed across the Pacific Ocean.<,>他们横渡了太平洋。<,>The pacific solution was accepted by all parties.<,>各方都接受了和平解决方案。<,>paci(和平)+fic(做)→带来和平的<,>specific(adj.特定的)/terrific(adj.极好的)/Pacific(n.太平洋)

regulation<,>/ˌreɡjuˈleɪʃn/<,>/ˌreɡjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.规则/n.规章/n.管理<,>The new traffic regulations will take effect next month.<,>新交通规则将于下月生效。<,>This device is for the regulation of temperature.<,>这个装置用于温度调节。<,>Schools must comply with government regulations.<,>学校必须遵守政府规定。<,>regul(控制)+ation(名词后缀)→控制规则<,>regular(adj.规则的)/legislation(n.立法)/registration(n.登记)

against<,>/əˈɡenst/<,>/əˈɡenst/<,>prep.倚在/prep.逆/prep.对着<,>He leaned against the wall.<,>他靠在墙上。<,>We swam against the current.<,>我们逆流游泳。<,>It's against the law to park here.<,>在这里停车是违法的。<,>a(强调)+gain(获得)+st→为获得而对抗<,>again(adv.再次)/gainsay(v.否认)/agape(adj.目瞪口呆的)

blood<,>/blʌd/<,>/blʌd/<,>n.血/n.血液/n.血统<,>Blood was dripping from the wound.<,>血从伤口滴下来。<,>They share the same blood type.<,>他们有相同的血型。<,>He is of noble blood.<,>他出身贵族。<,>bl(蓝色)+ood(状态)→蓝色的静脉血<,>bleed(v.流血)/flood(n.洪水)/brood(n.一窝)

life<,>/laɪf/<,>/laɪf/<,>n.生命/n.一生/n.寿命<,>Life is full of surprises.<,>生活充满惊喜。<,>He devoted his life to science.<,>他毕生致力于科学。<,>The battery has a long life.<,>这个电池寿命很长。<,>谐音“来福”→带来福气的生活<,>live(v.生活)/lift(v.举起)/leaf(n.树叶)

cannon<,>/ˈkænən/<,>/ˈkænən/<,>n.大炮/n.火炮/n.榴弹炮<,>The cannon fired at dawn.<,>大炮在黎明时分开火。<,>They loaded the cannon with ammunition.<,>他们给大炮装弹药。<,>Ancient castles often had defensive cannons.<,>古城堡通常有防御性火炮。<,>can(能)+non(不)→能造成巨大破坏的武器<,>canyon(n.峡谷)/canon(n.教规)/cannonball(n.炮弹)

evening<,>/ˈiːvnɪŋ/<,>/ˈivnɪŋ/<,>n.傍晚/n.黄昏/n.晚上<,>We usually take a walk in the evening.<,>我们通常在傍晚散步。<,>The evening sky was beautiful.<,>黄昏的天空很美。<,>Are you free this evening?<,>你今晚有空吗？<,>eve(前夕)+ning→日暮时分<,>morning(n.早晨)/even(adj.平坦的)/event(n.事件)

confine<,>/kənˈfaɪn/<,>/kənˈfaɪn/<,>v.禁闭/v.限制<,>The prisoners were confined to their cells.<,>囚犯被关在牢房里。<,>Please confine your remarks to the topic.<,>请把你的评论限制在主题内。<,>The virus is confined to this area.<,>病毒被限制在这个区域。<,>con(共同)+fine(界限)→共同设限<,>define(v.定义)/refine(v.精炼)/confess(v.承认)

ceiling<,>/ˈsiːlɪŋ/<,>/ˈsilɪŋ/<,>n.天花板/n.顶蓬<,>A fly was buzzing near the ceiling.<,>一只苍蝇在天花板附近嗡嗡飞。<,>The room has a high ceiling.<,>这个房间天花板很高。<,>They painted the ceiling white.<,>他们把天花板刷成了白色。<,>ceil(天空)+ing→像天空一样的顶部<,>floor(n.地板)/sealing(n.密封)/feeling(n.感觉)
ashamed<,>/əˈʃeɪmd/<,>/əˈʃeɪmd/<,>adj.惭愧的/adj.羞耻的<,>He felt ashamed of his behavior.<,>他对自己的行为感到惭愧。<,>She was too ashamed to admit her mistake.<,>她羞于承认自己的错误。<,>Don't be ashamed to ask for help.<,>不要羞于寻求帮助。<,>a(强调)+shame(羞耻)+ed→感到羞耻的<,>shameful(adj.可耻的)/shameless(adj.无耻的)

just<,>/dʒʌst/<,>/dʒʌst/<,>adv.正好/adv.只是/adv.刚才<,>That's just what I need!<,>这正是我需要的！<,>He was just joking.<,>他只是开玩笑。<,>I just finished my homework.<,>我刚做完作业。<,>ju(拼音"就")+st(stand站立)→就站在那里→正好<,>adjust(v.调整)/justice(n.正义)

necessity<,>/nəˈsesəti/<,>/nəˈsɛsɪti/<,>n.必要性/n.必然性<,>Food is a necessity for survival.<,>食物是生存的必需品。<,>There's no necessity to hurry.<,>没有必要着急。<,>The necessity of the situation forced him to act.<,>形势所迫他不得不采取行动。<,>ne(不)+cess(走)+ity→不走不行→必要性<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/access(n.入口)

mercury<,>/ˈmɜːkjəri/<,>/ˈmɜːrkjəri/<,>n.水银/n.汞<,>The thermometer contains mercury.<,>温度计含有水银。<,>Mercury is a liquid metal.<,>汞是一种液态金属。<,>Mercury pollution is dangerous.<,>汞污染很危险。<,>mer(海)+cur(跑)+y→海里跑动的金属→水银<,>mercurial(adj.水银的)/merchant(n.商人)

materialism<,>/məˈtɪəriəlɪzəm/<,>/məˈtɪriəlɪzəm/<,>n.唯物主义<,>Modern society is full of materialism.<,>现代社会充满了物质主义。<,>He criticized the materialism of our culture.<,>他批评了我们文化中的物质主义。<,>Materialism emphasizes physical needs.<,>唯物主义强调物质需求。<,>material(物质)+ism(主义)→唯物主义<,>idealistic(adj.理想主义的)/materialistic(adj.唯物论的)

let<,>/let/<,>/lɛt/<,>v.允许/v.让/v.使<,>Let me help you.<,>让我来帮你。<,>She let the children play outside.<,>她让孩子们在外面玩。<,>Don't let the opportunity pass.<,>不要让机会溜走。<,>le(拼音"乐")+t(拼音"他")→让他快乐→允许<,>late(adj.迟的)/lead(v.带领)

billion<,>/ˈbɪljən/<,>/ˈbɪljən/<,>num.万亿(英)<,>The company is worth billions.<,>这家公司价值数十亿。<,>Billions of stars are in the sky.<,>天空中有无数星星。<,>He made his first billion at 30.<,>他在30岁时赚到了第一个十亿。<,>bi(二)+llion(百万)→百万的平方→十亿<,>million(num.百万)/trillion(num.万亿)

frame<,>/freɪm/<,>/freɪm/<,>n.框架/n.框子/n.构架<,>The picture is in a wooden frame.<,>这幅画装在木框里。<,>The building's steel frame is strong.<,>建筑的钢架结构很坚固。<,>He framed the question carefully.<,>他仔细地构思了这个问题。<,>fr(拼音"放入")+ame(名词后缀)→放入东西的结构→框架<,>flame(n.火焰)/fame(n.名声)

head<,>/hɛd/<,>/hɛd/<,>n.头/n.上端/v.率领<,>He hit his head on the low ceiling.<,>他的头撞到了低矮的天花板。<,>She heads the marketing department.<,>她主管市场部。<,>The arrow points to the head of the page.<,>箭头指向页面的顶端。<,>head(头)→身体的顶端→上端<,>lead(v.带领)/heed(v.注意)/behead(v.斩首)

injection<,>/ɪnˈdʒɛkʃən/<,>/ɪnˈdʒɛkʃən/<,>n.注射/n.注入<,>The nurse gave him an injection.<,>护士给他打了一针。<,>The company needs a cash injection.<,>公司需要资金注入。<,>This is a painless injection method.<,>这是一种无痛注射方法。<,>in(进入)+ject(投掷)+ion→注射<,>ejection(n.喷射)/projection(n.投射)/rejection(n.拒绝)

transparent<,>/trænsˈpærənt/<,>/trænsˈpærənt/<,>adj.透明的/adj.易识破的<,>The glass is completely transparent.<,>这块玻璃是完全透明的。<,>His lies were transparent to everyone.<,>他的谎言对每个人来说都很容易识破。<,>She wore a transparent blouse.<,>她穿了一件透明的衬衫。<,>trans(穿过)+parent(出现)→能看穿的一透明的<,>translucent(adj.半透明的)/opaque(adj.不透明的)

exposure<,>/ɪkˈspəʊʒə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspoʊʒər/<,>n.暴露/n.揭露/n.曝光<,>Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin damage.<,>长时间暴露在阳光下会损害皮肤。<,>The newspaper published an exposure of government corruption.<,>报纸刊登了一篇揭露政府腐败的文章。<,>The photo needs more exposure to light.<,>这张照片需要更多的曝光。<,>ex(出)+pos(放)+ure(状态)→放出来→暴露<,>expose(v.暴露)/disclosure(n.披露)/revelation(n.揭露)

sightseeing<,>/ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ/<,>/ˈsaɪtsiːɪŋ/<,>n.观光/n.游览<,>We went sightseeing in Paris last summer.<,>去年夏天我们去巴黎观光了。<,>The city offers many sightseeing opportunities.<,>这座城市提供了许多观光机会。<,>They took a sightseeing bus around the city.<,>他们乘坐观光巴士游览了城市。<,>sight(景色)+seeing(看)→看景色→观光<,>tour(n.旅行)/excursion(n.短途旅行)/voyage(n.航海旅行)
