everybody<,>/ˈevribɒdi/<,>/ˈevribɑːdi/<,>pron.每人/pron.人人<,>Everybody was happy with the decision.<,>每个人都对这个决定感到高兴。<,>Everybody knows the truth now.<,>现在人人都知道真相了。<,>Is everybody ready for the trip?<,>大家都准备好去旅行了吗？<,>every(每)+body(身体)→每个人<,>everyone(pron.每个人)/somebody(pron.某人)/nobody(pron.没有人)

cart<,>/kɑːt/<,>/kɑːrt/<,>n.二轮运货马车<,>The farmer loaded the cart with vegetables.<,>农民把蔬菜装上马车。<,>They used a horse-drawn cart to transport goods.<,>他们用马拉的货车运输货物。<,>The cart overturned on the bumpy road.<,>马车在崎岖的路上翻了。<,>car(车)+t(小)→小车→马车<,>car(n.汽车)/carriage(n.四轮马车)/wagon(n.四轮运货马车)

theoretical<,>/ˌθɪəˈretɪkl/<,>/ˌθiːəˈretɪkl/<,>adj.理论(上)的<,>This is just a theoretical possibility.<,>这只是一个理论上的可能性。<,>He has a strong theoretical background in physics.<,>他在物理学方面有很强的理论背景。<,>The course covers both practical and theoretical aspects.<,>这门课程涵盖了实践和理论两个方面。<,>theory(理论)+etical(形容词后缀)→理论的<,>practical(adj.实际的)/empirical(adj.经验主义的)/hypothetical(adj.假设的)

herd<,>/hɜːd/<,>/hɜːrd/<,>n.兽群/n.牧群/v.放牧<,>A herd of elephants crossed the plain.<,>一群大象穿过了平原。<,>The shepherd herded the sheep into the pen.<,>牧羊人把羊群赶进了围栏。<,>Cows in the herd were grazing peacefully.<,>牛群中的牛在安静地吃草。<,>her(她)+d(的)→她的牧群<,>flock(n.鸟群)/swarm(n.昆虫群)/pack(n.狼群)

fatal<,>/ˈfeɪtl/<,>/ˈfeɪtl/<,>adj.致命的<,>The accident proved to be fatal.<,>这次事故被证明是致命的。<,>He made a fatal mistake in his calculations.<,>他在计算中犯了一个致命的错误。<,>The disease can be fatal if not treated in time.<,>如果不及时治疗，这种疾病可能是致命的。<,>fat(肥胖)+al(形容词后缀)→肥胖可能是致命的<,>mortal(adj.终有一死的)/deadly(adj.致命的)/lethal(adj.致命的)

England<,>/ˈɪŋɡlənd/<,>/ˈɪŋɡlənd/<,>n.英格兰/n.英国<,>London is the capital of England.<,>伦敦是英格兰的首都。<,>He was born in England but grew up in America.<,>他出生在英格兰，但在美国长大。<,>England is famous for its rainy weather.<,>英格兰以多雨的天气而闻名。<,>Eng(英)+land(土地)→英格兰<,>Britain(n.不列颠)/United Kingdom(n.联合王国)/Scotland(n.苏格兰)
sportsman<,>/ˈspɔːtsmən/<,>/ˈspɔːrtsmən/<,>n.运动员<,>He is a professional sportsman who competes in international tournaments.<,>他是一名参加国际比赛的专业运动员。<,>The sportsman trained hard every day to improve his performance.<,>这位运动员每天刻苦训练以提高表现。<,>Being a sportsman requires discipline and dedication.<,>成为一名运动员需要纪律和奉献精神。<,>sport(运动)+man(人)→从事运动的人→运动员<,>athlete(n.运动员)/player(n.选手)/competitor(n.竞争者)

intensity<,>/ɪnˈtensəti/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnsəti/<,>n.强烈/n.剧烈/n.强度<,>The intensity of the storm caused widespread damage.<,>风暴的强度造成了广泛的破坏。<,>She spoke with great intensity about the issue.<,>她非常激烈地谈论这个问题。<,>The light's intensity can be adjusted with this dial.<,>光的强度可以用这个旋钮调节。<,>in(加强)+tens(伸展)+ity(名词后缀)→伸展的程度→强度<,>density(n.密度)/tension(n.紧张)/intention(n.意图)

violet<,>/ˈvaɪələt/<,>/ˈvaɪəlɪt/<,>n.紫罗兰<,>She planted violets in her garden for their beautiful color.<,>她在花园里种了紫罗兰，因为它们颜色美丽。<,>The sunset painted the sky in shades of violet and pink.<,>日落将天空染成了紫罗兰色和粉红色。<,>He gave her a bouquet of violets for her birthday.<,>他送给她一束紫罗兰作为生日礼物。<,>vio(紫色)+let(小)→紫色的小花→紫罗兰<,>violent(adj.暴力的)/violet(n.紫罗兰)/vibrant(adj.充满生气的)

agree<,>/əˈɡriː/<,>/əˈɡri/<,>v.同意/v.持相同意见<,>We all agree that the plan needs more work.<,>我们都同意这个计划需要更多的工作。<,>She agreed to help me with the project.<,>她同意帮我完成这个项目。<,>They finally agreed on a price for the house.<,>他们最终就房子的价格达成了一致。<,>a(加强)+gree(高兴)→使高兴→同意<,>disagree(v.不同意)/agreement(n.协议)/greed(n.贪婪)

lens<,>/lenz/<,>/lɛnz/<,>n.镜头/n.透镜/n.镜片<,>The photographer cleaned the lens before taking the picture.<,>摄影师在拍照前清洁了镜头。<,>He needs new lenses for his glasses.<,>他需要新的眼镜片。<,>The microscope's lens magnifies the specimen 100 times.<,>显微镜的透镜将标本放大100倍。<,>lens(拉丁语"小扁豆")→形状像扁豆的镜片→透镜<,>lend(v.借出)/lease(n.租约)/lens(n.镜片)

attitude<,>/ˈætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈætɪtuːd/<,>n.态度/n.看法/n.姿势<,>Her positive attitude makes her a joy to work with.<,>她积极的态度使与她共事很愉快。<,>He has a very relaxed attitude towards life.<,>他对生活持非常放松的态度。<,>The dancer's attitude was graceful and poised.<,>舞者的姿势优雅而平衡。<,>att(倾向)+itude(状态)→倾向的状态→态度<,>altitude(n.海拔)/aptitude(n.才能)/latitude(n.纬度)

dirt<,>/dɜːt/<,>/dɜːrt/<,>n.尘土/n.污物/n.土<,>He wiped the dirt off his shoes before entering the house.<,>他进屋前擦掉了鞋上的尘土。<,>The children came home covered in dirt after playing outside.<,>孩子们在外面玩耍后满身泥土地回家了。<,>There's some dirt on your shirt that needs to be washed off.<,>你衬衫上有些污渍需要洗掉。<,>dirt(与dark同源)→暗色的东西→尘土<,>dirty(adj.脏的)/dust(n.灰尘)/mud(n.泥浆)

assemble<,>/əˈsembl/<,>/əˈsɛmbəl/<,>v.集合/v.召集/v.装配<,>The students assembled in the auditorium for the lecture.<,>学生们在礼堂集合听讲座。<,>It took him two hours to assemble the furniture.<,>他花了两个小时组装家具。<,>The manager assembled the team to discuss the new project.<,>经理召集团队讨论新项目。<,>as(加强)+semble(相似)→使相似的东西在一起→集合<,>resemble(v.相似)/ensemble(n.整体)/assembly(n.集会)

slender<,>/ˈslendə(r)/<,>/ˈslɛndər/<,>adj.细长的/adj.微薄的<,>She has a slender figure that looks good in any dress.<,>她身材苗条，穿任何裙子都好看。<,>The tree had a slender trunk but was surprisingly strong.<,>这棵树树干细长但出奇地结实。<,>They survived on a slender income during the difficult times.<,>他们在困难时期靠微薄的收入维持生活。<,>slend(滑)+er→像滑过一样细→细长的<,>slander(n.诽谤)/tender(adj.温柔的)/splendor(n.辉煌)

sticky<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>adj.粘性的/adj.胶粘的<,>The tape became sticky in the hot weather.<,>胶带在炎热的天气里变得粘粘的。<,>His fingers were sticky from eating the candy.<,>他吃完糖果后手指粘粘的。<,>We used sticky notes to mark important pages in the book.<,>我们用便利贴标记书中重要的页面。<,>stick(粘)+y(形容词后缀)→粘性的<,>tacky(adj.俗气的)/slick(adj.光滑的)/sticky(adj.粘的)
drawer<,>/ˈdrɔːə(r)/<,>/ˈdrɔːər/<,>n.抽屉<,>She put the socks in the top drawer.<,>她把袜子放在最上面的抽屉里。<,>The drawer is stuck and won't open.<,>抽屉卡住了，打不开。<,>He keeps his important documents in a locked drawer.<,>他把重要文件放在一个上锁的抽屉里。<,>draw(拉)+er(名词后缀)→拉出来的东西→抽屉<,>draw(v.画/v.拉)/drawn(adj.疲惫的/v.绘画的过去分词)  

dormitory<,>/ˈdɔːmətri/<,>/ˈdɔːrmətɔːri/<,>n.集体寝室/n.宿舍<,>Most students live in the college dormitory.<,>大多数学生住在学院宿舍里。<,>The dormitory has strict rules about quiet hours.<,>宿舍有严格的安静时间规定。<,>Each dormitory room accommodates four students.<,>每间宿舍可容纳四名学生。<,>dorm(睡眠)+itory(场所)→睡觉的地方→宿舍<,>dormant(adj.休眠的)/dormouse(n.睡鼠)  

ray<,>/reɪ/<,>/reɪ/<,>n.光线/n.射线/n.辐射线<,>A ray of sunlight shone through the window.<,>一束阳光透过窗户照射进来。<,>X-rays are used in medical diagnosis.<,>X射线用于医疗诊断。<,>The plant needs at least six hours of direct rays daily.<,>这种植物每天需要至少六小时的直射光线。<,>联想：ray→光线像字母"r"的放射状<,>array(n.阵列/v.排列)/pray(v.祈祷)/bray(n.驴叫声)  

delicious<,>/dɪˈlɪʃəs/<,>/dɪˈlɪʃəs/<,>adj.美味的/adj.怡人的<,>The cake smells absolutely delicious.<,>这个蛋糕闻起来非常美味。<,>We had a delicious meal at the new restaurant.<,>我们在新餐厅吃了一顿美味的饭。<,>The delicious breeze made the evening perfect.<,>怡人的微风让夜晚变得完美。<,>de(加强)+lic(诱惑)+ious(形容词后缀)→非常诱惑人的→美味的<,>delicate(adj.精致的)/delight(n.快乐)  

admit<,>/ədˈmɪt/<,>/ədˈmɪt/<,>v.承认/v.准许...进入<,>He admitted his mistake to the teacher.<,>他向老师承认了自己的错误。<,>This ticket admits two people to the museum.<,>这张票允许两人进入博物馆。<,>The school admits only 100 new students each year.<,>这所学校每年只招收100名新生。<,>ad(朝向)+mit(发送)→发送进入→准许进入<,>omit(v.省略)/commit(v.承诺)/emit(v.发出)  

thread<,>/θred/<,>/θred/<,>n.线/n.丝/n.螺纹/n.头绪<,>She sewed the button with a strong thread.<,>她用结实的线缝纽扣。<,>I can't follow the thread of your argument.<,>我理不清你论证的头绪。<,>The screw has fine threads for better grip.<,>这个螺丝有细螺纹以获得更好的抓力。<,>th(细)+read(读)→像读细线一样→线<,>threat(n.威胁)/tread(v.踩踏)/bread(n.面包)  

poet<,>/ˈpəʊɪt/<,>/ˈpoʊət/<,>n.诗人<,>Shakespeare is considered the greatest English poet.<,>莎士比亚被认为是最伟大的英语诗人。<,>The young poet won a national poetry competition.<,>这位年轻诗人赢得了全国诗歌比赛。<,>She lives the life of a romantic poet.<,>她过着浪漫诗人的生活方式。<,>poe(诗歌)+t(人)→写诗的人→诗人<,>poem(n.诗歌)/poetry(n.诗歌艺术)/pot(n.锅)  

somehow<,>/ˈsʌmhaʊ/<,>/ˈsʌmhaʊ/<,>adv.由于某种原因<,>Somehow, I knew he would come back.<,>不知怎么的，我就知道他会回来。<,>The keys have disappeared somehow.<,>钥匙不知怎么就不见了。<,>Somehow we managed to finish the project on time.<,>我们设法按时完成了项目。<,>some(某)+how(方式)→以某种方式→由于某种原因<,>somewhat(adv.有点)/anyhow(adv.无论如何)  

mate<,>/meɪt/<,>/meɪt/<,>n.伙伴/n.同事/n.配偶<,>He's been my best mate since childhood.<,>他是我从小最好的伙伴。<,>The captain and his first mate prepared the ship.<,>船长和大副准备船只。<,>The penguins stay with their mates for life.<,>企鹅终生与配偶在一起。<,>ma(妈)+te(特)→特别像妈妈的人→配偶<,>meat(n.肉)/matt(n.人名)/date(n.日期)  

character<,>/ˈkærəktə(r)/<,>/ˈkærɪktər/<,>n.性格/n.角色/n.特性<,>Her cheerful character makes her popular.<,>她开朗的性格使她受欢迎。<,>He played the main character in the movie.<,>他在电影中扮演主角。<,>This wine has a unique character.<,>这种酒有独特的特性。<,>char(炭)+act(行动)+er(人)→像炭一样留下印记的特性→性格<,>charter(n.宪章)/caricature(n.漫画)
across<,>/əˈkrɒs/<,>/əˈkrɔːs/<,>prep.横过/prep.在…对面<,>She walked across the street carefully.<,>她小心地走过街道。<,>They live across the river.<,>他们住在河对面。<,>The store is just across the road.<,>商店就在马路对面。<,>a(朝向)+cross(交叉)→横过<,>cross(v.穿过/n.十字架)/across(横过)/crossing(n.十字路口)

organ<,>/ˈɔːɡən/<,>/ˈɔːrɡən/<,>n.器官/n.管风琴/n.机构<,>The heart is a vital organ.<,>心脏是一个重要器官。<,>He plays the organ in church.<,>他在教堂演奏管风琴。<,>This is a charitable organ.<,>这是一个慈善机构。<,>org(工作)+an→工作的部分→器官<,>organism(n.生物体)/organic(adj.有机的)/organization(n.组织)

gesture<,>/ˈdʒestʃə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒestʃər/<,>n.姿势/n.手势/n.姿态<,>He made a rude gesture.<,>他做了一个粗鲁的手势。<,>Her gesture of kindness touched me.<,>她善意的姿态感动了我。<,>Use hand gestures to emphasize your point.<,>用手势来强调你的观点。<,>gest(动作)+ure→动作的表现→手势<,>posture(n.姿势)/gestation(n.怀孕)/register(v.登记/n.注册)

equality<,>/iˈkwɒləti/<,>/iˈkwɑːləti/<,>n.等同/n.平等/n.相等<,>We should strive for gender equality.<,>我们应该争取性别平等。<,>All people are born with equality.<,>人人生而平等。<,>There's no equality in their treatment.<,>他们的待遇不平等。<,>equal(平等)+ity(状态)→平等<,>equity(n.公平)/equation(n.等式)/equivalent(adj.等价的)

landlady<,>/ˈlændleɪdi/<,>/ˈlændleɪdi/<,>n.女房东/n.女地主<,>My landlady is very strict about noise.<,>我的女房东对噪音很严格。<,>The landlady owns several apartments.<,>这位女房东拥有几套公寓。<,>She became a landlady after inheriting the estate.<,>继承遗产后她成了女地主。<,>land(土地)+lady(女士)→女地主<,>landlord(n.男房东)/housekeeper(n.管家)/tenant(n.租客)

attend<,>/əˈtend/<,>/əˈtend/<,>v.出席/v.照顾/v.护理<,>I will attend the meeting tomorrow.<,>我明天会出席会议。<,>Nurses attend to patients' needs.<,>护士照顾病人的需求。<,>She attended the wounded soldier.<,>她护理了受伤的士兵。<,>at(朝向)+tend(伸展)→把注意力伸向→出席<,>attention(n.注意)/attendant(n.服务员)/pretend(v.假装)

proof<,>/pruːf/<,>/pruːf/<,>n.证据/n.证明/n.校样<,>Do you have any proof of identity?<,>你有身份证明吗？<,>The fingerprints were proof of his presence.<,>指纹是他在场的证据。<,>I need to check the final proof before printing.<,>印刷前我需要检查最终校样。<,>pro(向前)+of(看作off)→验证通过→证明<,>prove(v.证明)/proofread(v.校对)/roof(n.屋顶)

cover<,>/ˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/ˈkʌvər/<,>v.盖/v.包括/n.盖子<,>Please cover the food with plastic wrap.<,>请用保鲜膜盖住食物。<,>The report covers all important aspects.<,>报告涵盖了所有重要方面。<,>I can't find the cover for this pot.<,>我找不到这个锅的盖子。<,>co(完全)+ver(盖)→完全盖住→覆盖<,>discover(v.发现)/recover(v.恢复)/covert(adj.隐蔽的)

fasten<,>/ˈfɑːsn/<,>/ˈfæsn/<,>v.扎牢/v.扣住<,>Fasten your seatbelt before driving.<,>开车前系好安全带。<,>She fastened the necklace around her neck.<,>她把项链扣在脖子上。<,>The door was fastened with a heavy lock.<,>门用重锁牢牢锁住。<,>fast(牢固的)+en(使)→使牢固→扎牢<,>hasten(v.加速)/fastener(n.紧固件)/faster(adj.更快的)

push<,>/pʊʃ/<,>/pʊʃ/<,>v.推/v.鼓励/v.敦促/v.逼迫<,>Don't push the door, pull it.<,>别推门，要拉。<,>My teacher pushed me to do better.<,>老师鼓励我做得更好。<,>They pushed him to make a decision.<,>他们敦促他做决定。<,>pu(拟声)+sh→推的声音→推<,>pull(v.拉)/rush(v.冲)/bush(n.灌木)
rib<,>/rɪb/<,>/rɪb/<,>n.肋/n.肋骨<,>He broke a rib in the accident.<,>他在事故中折断了一根肋骨。<,>She poked him in the ribs playfully.<,>她顽皮地戳了戳他的肋骨。<,>The ribs protect the internal organs.<,>肋骨保护着内脏器官。<,>rib(肋骨)→rib cage(胸腔)<,>ribbon(n. 丝带)/rob(v. 抢劫)

light<,>/laɪt/<,>/laɪt/<,>adj.轻的/adj.少量的<,>The suitcase is very light.<,>这个手提箱很轻。<,>She added a light sprinkle of salt.<,>她加了少量的盐。<,>The room was filled with light laughter.<,>房间里充满了轻轻的笑声。<,>light(光)→轻的像光一样<,>flight(n. 飞行)/delight(n. 高兴)

stir<,>/stɜː(r)/<,>/stɜːr/<,>v.搅动/v.搅和/v.搅拌<,>Stir the soup gently.<,>轻轻搅拌汤。<,>She stirred her coffee with a spoon.<,>她用勺子搅动咖啡。<,>The news stirred up controversy.<,>这个消息引发了争议。<,>st(站)+ir(红外线)→站着用红外线搅拌<,>star(n. 星星)/stare(v. 凝视)

earthquake<,>/ˈɜːθkweɪk/<,>/ˈɜːrθkweɪk/<,>n.地震/n.大震荡<,>The earthquake caused widespread damage.<,>地震造成了广泛的破坏。<,>They felt a small earthquake last night.<,>昨晚他们感觉到了一次小地震。<,>The political scandal was an earthquake for the government.<,>这起政治丑闻对政府来说是一次大震荡。<,>earth(地球)+quake(震动)→地震<,>heartquake(n. 心震)/thunderquake(n. 雷震)

concentration<,>/ˌkɒnsnˈtreɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsnˈtreɪʃn/<,>n.专注/n.集中/n.浓度<,>He lost his concentration during the exam.<,>他在考试中走神了。<,>The concentration of salt in the water is high.<,>水中的盐浓度很高。<,>Yoga helps improve concentration.<,>瑜伽有助于提高专注力。<,>con(共同)+centr(中心)+ation→集中到中心<,>concentrate(v. 集中)/consideration(n. 考虑)

make<,>/meɪk/<,>/meɪk/<,>v.做/v.制造/v.使<,>She makes beautiful pottery.<,>她制作漂亮的陶器。<,>The news made him happy.<,>这个消息使他高兴。<,>They make cars in this factory.<,>他们在这家工厂制造汽车。<,>make(制造)→maker(制造者)<,>fake(adj. 假的)/bake(v. 烘焙)

wind<,>/wɪnd/<,>/wɪnd/<,>v.绕/v.缠绕<,>She wound the yarn into a ball.<,>她把毛线绕成一个球。<,>The river winds through the valley.<,>河流蜿蜒穿过山谷。<,>He wound the clock carefully.<,>他小心地给钟上发条。<,>wind(风)→像风一样蜿蜒<,>wound(n. 伤口)/find(v. 找到)

guilty<,>/ˈɡɪlti/<,>/ˈɡɪlti/<,>adj.内疚的/adj.有罪的<,>He felt guilty for lying.<,>他因为撒谎而感到内疚。<,>The jury found him guilty.<,>陪审团判定他有罪。<,>She had a guilty conscience.<,>她良心不安。<,>guilt(罪责)+y→有罪的<,>gilt(n. 镀金)/guild(n. 行会)

blaze<,>/bleɪz/<,>/bleɪz/<,>n.火/n.闪光/v.燃烧<,>The blaze destroyed the forest.<,>大火烧毁了森林。<,>Her eyes blazed with anger.<,>她的眼中燃烧着怒火。<,>A sudden blaze of light illuminated the room.<,>一道突然的闪光照亮了房间。<,>bl(蓝色)+aze(aze→fire)→蓝色的火<,>blame(v. 责备)/blazon(v. 宣扬)

invest<,>/ɪnˈvest/<,>/ɪnˈvest/<,>v.投资/v.投入<,>He invested heavily in the stock market.<,>他在股市上投入了大量资金。<,>She invested her time in learning French.<,>她把时间投入到学习法语上。<,>The company plans to invest in new technology.<,>公司计划投资新技术。<,>in(进入)+vest(衣服)→把钱放进衣服里→投资<,>infest(v. 侵扰)/invent(v. 发明)
cloudy<,>/ˈklaʊdi/<,>/ˈklaʊdi/<,>adj.多云的/adj.云一般的<,>It's a cloudy day today.<,>今天是个多云的日子。<,>Her mind was cloudy with confusion.<,>她的头脑因困惑而模糊不清。<,>The sky was cloudy and gray.<,>天空多云且灰暗。<,>cloud(云)+y(形容词后缀)→多云的<,>clear(adj.晴朗的)/foggy(adj.有雾的)

grandson<,>/ˈɡrænsʌn/<,>/ˈɡrænˌsʌn/<,>n.孙子/n.外孙子<,>His grandson visits him every weekend.<,>他的孙子每个周末都来看他。<,>She loves her grandson very much.<,>她非常爱她的外孙子。<,>The old man is playing chess with his grandson.<,>老人正在和他的孙子下棋。<,>grand(祖辈的)+son(儿子)→孙子<,>granddaughter(n.孙女)/grandfather(n.祖父)

feeling<,>/ˈfiːlɪŋ/<,>/ˈfilɪŋ/<,>n.感觉/n.知觉/n.感情<,>I have a strange feeling about this.<,>我对这件事有种奇怪的感觉。<,>She expressed her feelings openly.<,>她公开表达了自己的感情。<,>He lost all feeling in his legs after the accident.<,>事故后他的双腿完全失去了知觉。<,>feel(感觉)+ing(名词后缀)→感觉<,>emotion(n.情绪)/sensation(n.感觉)

trap<,>/træp/<,>/træp/<,>n.陷阱/n.诡计/v.诱骗<,>The hunter set a trap for the fox.<,>猎人为狐狸设下了陷阱。<,>Don't fall into his trap.<,>不要落入他的圈套。<,>They trapped the criminal in an alley.<,>他们把罪犯诱骗到了一条小巷里。<,>tr(陷阱)+ap(捕捉)→陷阱<,>trip(n.旅行)/strap(n.带子)

race<,>/reɪs/<,>/reɪs/<,>n.比赛/n.竞赛/n.竞争<,>He won the 100-meter race.<,>他赢得了100米赛跑。<,>The race for the presidency is heating up.<,>总统竞选正在升温。<,>Different races live together in this city.<,>不同种族的人生活在这个城市里。<,>rac(奔跑)+e→比赛<,>pace(n.步伐)/face(n.脸)

overlook<,>/ˌəʊvəˈlʊk/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈlʊk/<,>v.忽略/v.未注意到/v.眺望<,>Don't overlook the small details.<,>不要忽略这些小细节。<,>Our room overlooks the sea.<,>我们的房间可以眺望大海。<,>She overlooked his rude behavior.<,>她没有注意到他的粗鲁行为。<,>over(在...之上)+look(看)→俯瞰<,>overload(v.超载)/overcome(v.克服)

spade<,>/speɪd/<,>/speɪd/<,>n.铲/n.铁锹<,>He dug a hole with a spade.<,>他用铁锹挖了一个洞。<,>The gardener uses a spade to plant flowers.<,>园丁用铲子种花。<,>Call a spade a spade.<,>直言不讳。<,>spa(空间)+de(工具)→铲子<,>spade(n.黑桃)/spade(v.铲)

whistle<,>/ˈwɪsl/<,>/ˈwɪsəl/<,>n.口哨/v.吹口哨<,>He gave a loud whistle.<,>他吹了一声响亮的口哨。<,>She whistles while she works.<,>她工作时吹口哨。<,>The referee blew his whistle to stop the game.<,>裁判吹哨停止了比赛。<,>whis(风)+tle(小)→口哨声<,>whisper(v.低语)/whisker(n.胡须)

action<,>/ˈækʃn/<,>/ˈækʃən/<,>n.行动/n.作用/n.功能<,>We need to take action now.<,>我们现在需要采取行动。<,>The medicine has a quick action.<,>这种药见效很快。<,>This button controls the camera's action.<,>这个按钮控制相机的功能。<,>act(行动)+ion(名词后缀)→行动<,>active(adj.活跃的)/actor(n.演员)

bolt<,>/bəʊlt/<,>/boʊlt/<,>n.插销/n.螺栓/v.闩门<,>He fastened the door with a bolt.<,>他用插销把门闩上了。<,>The bolt came loose.<,>螺栓松动了。<,>She bolted the window before the storm.<,>暴风雨来临前她闩上了窗户。<,>bol(固定)+t→螺栓<,>bold(adj.大胆的)/belt(n.腰带)
drug<,>/drʌɡ/<,>/drʌɡ/<,>n.药/n.药物/n.药材<,>The doctor prescribed a new drug for my headache.<,>医生给我开了一种新药治疗头痛。<,>Illegal drugs can ruin your life.<,>非法药物会毁掉你的人生。<,>This herb is a traditional Chinese drug.<,>这种草药是一种传统的中药材。<,>dr(发音类似“抓”)+ug(联想“药”)→抓药<,>drag(v.拖拽)/drum(n.鼓)/druid(n.德鲁伊)

nitrogen<,>/ˈnaɪtrədʒən/<,>/ˈnaɪtrədʒən/<,>n.氮<,>Nitrogen makes up about 78% of the Earth's atmosphere.<,>氮气约占地球大气的78%。<,>Plants need nitrogen to grow properly.<,>植物需要氮才能正常生长。<,>Liquid nitrogen is extremely cold.<,>液氮温度极低。<,>nitro(硝基)+gen(产生)→产生硝基的物质<,>hydrogen(n.氢)/oxygen(n.氧)/carbon(n.碳)

listen<,>/ˈlɪs(ə)n/<,>/ˈlɪs(ə)n/<,>v.听/v.留神听/v.听从<,>Listen carefully to the teacher's instructions.<,>认真听老师的指示。<,>I like to listen to music while working.<,>我喜欢边工作边听音乐。<,>You should listen to your parents' advice.<,>你应该听从父母的建议。<,>list(列表)+en(使)→使进入列表→注意听<,>lesson(n.课程)/glister(v.闪烁)/glisten(v.闪光)

murderer<,>/ˈmɜːd(ə)rə/<,>/ˈmɜrdərər/<,>n.杀人犯/n.凶手<,>The murderer was sentenced to life imprisonment.<,>凶手被判处无期徒刑。<,>Police are still searching for the murderer.<,>警方仍在搜寻杀人犯。<,>The novel is about a clever murderer.<,>这本小说讲述了一个聪明的凶手。<,>murder(谋杀)+er(人)→谋杀者<,>murder(n.谋杀)/murmur(n.低语)/muster(v.召集)

evidence<,>/ˈevɪd(ə)ns/<,>/ˈevɪdəns/<,>n.根据/n.证据/n.证人<,>There is no evidence to support his claim.<,>没有证据支持他的说法。<,>The fingerprints were key evidence in the case.<,>指纹是这个案件的关键证据。<,>Several witnesses gave evidence in court.<,>几位证人在法庭上作证。<,>e(出)+vid(看)+ence→看得见的东西→证据<,>evident(adj.明显的)/provide(v.提供)/prevent(v.防止)

inhabitant<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪt(ə)nt/<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪtənt/<,>n.居民/n.住户<,>The island has about 1,000 inhabitants.<,>这个岛大约有1000名居民。<,>Most inhabitants of this town work in factories.<,>这个镇的大多数居民在工厂工作。<,>The new policy affects all local inhabitants.<,>新政策影响所有当地居民。<,>in(里)+habit(居住)+ant(人)→住在里面的人<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/inhibit(v.抑制)/exhibit(v.展览)

instead<,>/ɪnˈsted/<,>/ɪnˈsted/<,>adv.代替/adv.顶替/adv.反而<,>I'll have tea instead of coffee today.<,>今天我要喝茶而不是咖啡。<,>She couldn't come, so I went instead.<,>她不能来，所以我代替她去了。<,>Instead of getting angry, he laughed.<,>他没有生气，反而笑了。<,>in(进入)+stead(位置)→进入某个位置→代替<,>insist(v.坚持)/install(v.安装)/instant(adj.立即的)

alike<,>/əˈlaɪk/<,>/əˈlaɪk/<,>adj.相像/adj.十分相似<,>The twins look very much alike.<,>这对双胞胎长得非常像。<,>Great minds think alike.<,>英雄所见略同。<,>All the houses in this area are alike.<,>这个区域的所有房子都很相似。<,>a(加强)+like(像)→非常像<,>unlike(adj.不同的)/alive(adj.活着的)/align(v.对齐)

lesson<,>/ˈles(ə)n/<,>/ˈles(ə)n/<,>n.功课/n.课/n.课程<,>We have an English lesson every morning.<,>我们每天早上有一节英语课。<,>This failure taught me a valuable lesson.<,>这次失败给了我一个宝贵的教训。<,>The piano lesson lasts for one hour.<,>钢琴课持续一小时。<,>less(更少)+on(在...上)→在减少错误中学习<,>listen(v.听)/lessen(v.减少)/lesser(adj.较小的)

medium<,>/ˈmiːdɪəm/<,>/ˈmiːdɪəm/<,>n.媒质/adj.中等的<,>Water is a medium for sound waves.<,>水是声波的传播媒质。<,>She prefers medium-rare steak.<,>她喜欢五分熟的牛排。<,>TV is a powerful advertising medium.<,>电视是一种强大的广告媒介。<,>medi(中间)+um→中间的<,>median(n.中位数)/media(n.媒体)/medieval(adj.中世纪的)
lest<,>/lɛst/<,>/lɛst/<,>conj.以免/conj.惟恐<,>He spoke quietly lest he wake the baby.<,>他轻声说话以免吵醒婴儿。<,>She double-checked her work lest there be any mistakes.<,>她反复检查工作，惟恐有任何错误。<,>They left early lest they miss the train.<,>他们提早离开以免错过火车。<,>联想：let（让）+ s（蛇）→ 让蛇走以免被咬<,>least(adj.最少的/adv.最少)/last(adj.最后的/adv.最后)

cancel<,>/ˈkænsəl/<,>/ˈkænsəl/<,>v.取消/v.撤销<,>They had to cancel the meeting due to bad weather.<,>由于天气不好，他们不得不取消会议。<,>She canceled her subscription to the magazine.<,>她取消了对该杂志的订阅。<,>The flight was canceled at the last minute.<,>航班在最后一刻被取消了。<,>can(能) + cel(细胞)→ 能像细胞一样消失→ 取消<,>cancer(n.癌症)/candle(n.蜡烛)/channel(n.频道)

butter<,>/ˈbʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈbʌtər/<,>n.黄油/n.奶油<,>She spread butter on her toast.<,>她在吐司上涂了黄油。<,>This recipe calls for two tablespoons of butter.<,>这个食谱需要两汤匙黄油。<,>He prefers margarine to butter.<,>他更喜欢人造黄油而不是黄油。<,>but(但是) + ter(特)→ 但是特制的黄油<,>better(adj.更好的/adv.更好地)/batter(n.面糊/v.连续猛击)

pill<,>/pɪl/<,>/pɪl/<,>n.药丸/n.丸剂<,>Take one pill three times a day.<,>每天三次，每次一片。<,>She swallowed the pill with water.<,>她用水吞下了药丸。<,>The doctor prescribed some sleeping pills.<,>医生开了一些安眠药。<,>p(皮) + ill(病)→ 治病的皮→ 药丸<,>pile(n.堆/v.堆积)/pull(v.拉/n.拉力)

fairly<,>/ˈfeəli/<,>/ˈferli/<,>adv.相当/adv.公平地<,>The test was fairly difficult.<,>这次考试相当难。<,>He treated all his employees fairly.<,>他公平地对待所有员工。<,>She's fairly certain about her decision.<,>她对她的决定相当确定。<,>fair(公平的) + ly(副词后缀)→ 公平地<,>fairy(n.仙女/adj.仙女的)/fearfully(adv.害怕地/adv.非常)

horn<,>/hɔːn/<,>/hɔːrn/<,>n.号角/n.喇叭/n.角<,>The driver honked his horn at the slow car.<,>司机向慢车按喇叭。<,>The bull has sharp horns.<,>这头公牛有锋利的角。<,>He played a tune on his hunting horn.<,>他用猎号吹奏了一首曲子。<,>h(高) + orn(装饰)→ 高装饰→ 号角<,>corn(n.玉米)/born(v.出生/adj.天生的)

melt<,>/melt/<,>/melt/<,>v.融化<,>The ice cream began to melt in the sun.<,>冰淇淋在阳光下开始融化。<,>Her heart melted when she saw the puppy.<,>看到小狗时她的心都融化了。<,>The snow will melt when spring comes.<,>春天来临时雪会融化。<,>me(我) + lt(楼梯)→ 我在楼梯上融化<,>smelt(v.熔炼/n.香鱼)/belt(n.腰带/v.用带系住)

preposition<,>/ˌprepəˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌprepəˈzɪʃn/<,>n.前置词/n.介词<,>"On" is a preposition indicating location.<,>"On"是表示位置的介词。<,>She's learning about prepositions in English class.<,>她正在英语课上学习介词。<,>Can you identify the preposition in this sentence?<,>你能找出这个句子中的介词吗？<,>pre(前) + position(位置)→ 放在前面的词→ 介词<,>proposition(n.提议/n.命题)/composition(n.作文/n.构成)

fruitful<,>/ˈfruːtfl/<,>/ˈfruːtfl/<,>adj.多产的/adj.肥沃的<,>Their collaboration was very fruitful.<,>他们的合作非常富有成果。<,>The valley is known for its fruitful soil.<,>这个山谷以其肥沃的土壤而闻名。<,>It was a fruitful discussion with many good ideas.<,>这是一次富有成果的讨论，提出了许多好主意。<,>fruit(水果) + ful(充满)→ 充满水果的→ 多产的<,>frightful(adj.可怕的/adv.非常)/beautiful(adj.美丽的)

middle<,>/ˈmɪdl/<,>/ˈmɪdl/<,>n.中部/adj.中部的<,>He sat in the middle of the room.<,>他坐在房间中央。<,>The middle section of the book is the most exciting.<,>这本书的中间部分最精彩。<,>She's the middle child in her family.<,>她是家里的中间孩子。<,>mid(中) + dle(小)→ 中间的小部分<,>muddle(n.混乱/v.弄乱)/medal(n.奖牌)
leap<,>/liːp/<,>/lip/<,>v.跳/v.跃/n.跳跃<,>The cat made a leap onto the table.<,>猫跳到了桌子上。<,>He took a leap of faith and started his own business.<,>他冒险一试，开始自己创业。<,>Her heart gave a little leap when she saw him.<,>看到他时，她的心轻轻跳了一下。<,>lea(草地)+p(扑)→在草地上扑→跳跃<,>heap(n.堆/v.堆积)/leak(v.漏/n.漏洞)

million<,>/ˈmɪljən/<,>/ˈmɪljən/<,>num.百万/n.许多<,>She won a million dollars in the lottery.<,>她彩票中了一百万美元。<,>Millions of people watched the royal wedding.<,>数百万人观看了皇家婚礼。<,>There's not one in a million chance he'll agree.<,>他同意的可能性微乎其微。<,>mill(千)+ion→百万<,>billion(num.十亿)/millionaire(n.百万富翁)

know<,>/nəʊ/<,>/noʊ/<,>v.知道/v.认识/v.通晓<,>I know how to solve this problem.<,>我知道如何解决这个问题。<,>Do you know the way to the station?<,>你知道去车站的路吗？<,>He knows three languages fluently.<,>他精通三种语言。<,>k(开)+now(现在)→现在开窍→知道<,>now(adv.现在)/knew(v.知道过去式)

biology<,>/baɪˈɒlədʒi/<,>/baɪˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.生物学<,>She's studying biology at university.<,>她在大学学习生物学。<,>The biology of this species is fascinating.<,>这个物种的生物学特性很迷人。<,>He has a degree in marine biology.<,>他有海洋生物学学位。<,>bio(生命)+logy(学科)→生物学<,>geology(n.地质学)/zoology(n.动物学)

voluntary<,>/ˈvɒləntri/<,>/ˈvɑːlənteri/<,>adj.自愿的/adj.志愿的<,>She does voluntary work at the hospital.<,>她在医院做志愿工作。<,>Attendance is purely voluntary.<,>参加完全是自愿的。<,>He made a voluntary confession to the police.<,>他向警方自愿供认。<,>vol(意志)+untary→自愿的<,>involuntary(adj.非自愿的)/volunteer(n.志愿者)

acquire<,>/əˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/əˈkwaɪər/<,>v.取得/v.获得/v.学到<,>She acquired a taste for olives in Greece.<,>她在希腊喜欢上了橄榄。<,>The company was acquired by a multinational.<,>这家公司被跨国公司收购了。<,>It takes time to acquire new skills.<,>学习新技能需要时间。<,>ac(强调)+quire(寻求)→获得<,>require(v.需要)/inquire(v.询问)

independent<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendənt/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendənt/<,>adj.独立的/adj.自主的<,>She's financially independent from her parents.<,>她在经济上独立于父母。<,>This is an independent study.<,>这是一项独立研究。<,>The country became independent in 1947.<,>这个国家于1947年独立。<,>in(不)+depend(依赖)+ent→独立的<,>dependent(adj.依赖的)/interdependent(adj.互相依赖的)

wheel<,>/wiːl/<,>/wil/<,>n.轮/n.车轮<,>The car's front wheel was damaged.<,>汽车的前轮损坏了。<,>He was at the wheel when the accident happened.<,>事故发生时他在开车。<,>The potter shaped the clay on the wheel.<,>陶工在转轮上塑造黏土。<,>wh(旋转)+eel→轮子<,>heel(n.脚后跟)/weal(n.福利)

hole<,>/həʊl/<,>/hoʊl/<,>n.洞/n.孔眼/n.裂开处<,>There's a hole in my sock.<,>我的袜子上有个洞。<,>The rabbit disappeared down its hole.<,>兔子钻进了洞里。<,>His argument was full of holes.<,>他的论点漏洞百出。<,>hol(空)+e→洞<,>whole(adj.完整的)/holy(adj.神圣的)

symbol<,>/ˈsɪmbl/<,>/ˈsɪmbəl/<,>n.象征/n.符号/n.记号<,>The dove is a symbol of peace.<,>鸽子是和平的象征。<,>H2O is the chemical symbol for water.<,>H2O是水的化学符号。<,>She wore the ring as a symbol of their love.<,>她戴着戒指作为他们爱情的象征。<,>sym(共同)+bol(投掷)→共同投掷的标志→符号<,>cymbal(n.钹)/simple(adj.简单的)
curious<,>/ˈkjʊəriəs/<,>/ˈkjʊriəs/<,>adj.好奇的/adj.稀奇古怪的<,>She was curious about the new neighbor.<,>她对新邻居感到好奇。<,>The old book had a curious smell.<,>这本旧书有一股奇怪的味道。<,>He gave her a curious glance.<,>他好奇地看了她一眼。<,>cur(关心)+ious(多…的)→过分关心的→好奇的<,>furious(adj. 狂怒的)/serious(adj. 严肃的)

bay<,>/beɪ/<,>/beɪ/<,>n.湾<,>The ship sailed into the bay.<,>船驶入了海湾。<,>We had a picnic by the bay.<,>我们在海湾边野餐。<,>The bay is famous for its clear water.<,>这个海湾以清澈的海水闻名。<,>bay(海湾)→与"beach(海滩)"对比记忆<,>gay(adj. 快乐的)/day(n. 白天)

forbid<,>/fəˈbɪd/<,>/fərˈbɪd/<,>v.禁止/v.不许/v.阻止<,>Smoking is forbidden here.<,>这里禁止吸烟。<,>Her parents forbade her to go out late.<,>她父母不许她晚归。<,>The law forbids discrimination.<,>法律禁止歧视。<,>for(反对)+bid(命令)→禁止<,>permit(v. 允许)/prohibit(v. 禁止)

refer<,>/rɪˈfɜː(r)/<,>/rɪˈfɜːr/<,>v.谈到<,>He referred to his notes during the speech.<,>他在演讲时参考了笔记。<,>The doctor referred her to a specialist.<,>医生把她转诊给专家。<,>Don't refer to that matter again.<,>别再提那件事了。<,>re(回)+fer(带来)→带回来→参考<,>infer(v. 推断)/prefer(v. 更喜欢)

finally<,>/ˈfaɪnəli/<,>/ˈfaɪnəli/<,>adv.最后<,>Finally, we reached the top of the mountain.<,>最后，我们到达了山顶。<,>She finally agreed to our plan.<,>她最终同意了我们的计划。<,>The project was finally completed.<,>这个项目终于完成了。<,>final(最后的)+ly(副词后缀)→最后<,>finely(adv. 精细地)/finale(n. 终曲)

nylon<,>/ˈnaɪlɒn/<,>/ˈnaɪlɑːn/<,>n.尼龙/n.耐纶<,>This jacket is made of nylon.<,>这件夹克是尼龙做的。<,>Nylon stockings were very popular in the 1950s.<,>尼龙袜在20世纪50年代非常流行。<,>The rope is strong because it's nylon.<,>这根绳子很结实，因为是尼龙的。<,>ny(发音似"耐")+lon(发音似"纶")→耐纶<,>cotton(n. 棉花)/polyester(n. 聚酯纤维)

ambition<,>/æmˈbɪʃn/<,>/æmˈbɪʃn/<,>n.雄心/n.抱负/n.野心<,>His ambition is to become a doctor.<,>他的抱负是成为一名医生。<,>She has great ambitions for her career.<,>她对事业有很大的抱负。<,>Political ambition drove him to run for office.<,>政治野心驱使他竞选公职。<,>ambi(周围)+tion(名词后缀)→想掌控周围→野心<,>addition(n. 增加)/exhibition(n. 展览)

electric<,>/ɪˈlektrɪk/<,>/ɪˈlektrɪk/<,>adj.电的/adj.电动的<,>We need an electrician to fix the wiring.<,>我们需要电工来修理电线。<,>He bought an electric car.<,>他买了一辆电动车。<,>The atmosphere was electric with excitement.<,>气氛因兴奋而充满激情。<,>electr(电的)+ic(形容词后缀)→电的<,>electronic(adj. 电子的)/electrical(adj. 电气的)

velocity<,>/vəˈlɒsəti/<,>/vəˈlɑːsəti/<,>n.速度<,>The car reached a velocity of 100 mph.<,>汽车达到了每小时100英里的速度。<,>They measured the velocity of the wind.<,>他们测量了风速。<,>High velocity bullets are more dangerous.<,>高速子弹更危险。<,>veloc(快速)+ity(名词后缀)→速度<,>veracity(n. 真实)/viscosity(n. 粘度)

relax<,>/rɪˈlæks/<,>/rɪˈlæks/<,>v.使松弛<,>She relaxed on the beach all day.<,>她在海滩上放松了一整天。<,>Music helps me relax after work.<,>音乐帮助我下班后放松。<,>The rules were relaxed for special occasions.<,>特殊场合下规则有所放宽。<,>re(重新)+lax(松的)→使松弛<,>release(v. 释放)/relate(v. 叙述)
golf<,>/ɡɒlf/<,>/ɡɑːlf/<,>n.高尔夫球<,>He plays golf every weekend.<,>他每个周末都打高尔夫球。<,>Golf is a popular sport among businessmen.<,>高尔夫是商人中流行的运动。<,>The golf course was beautifully maintained.<,>高尔夫球场维护得很好。<,>golf(高尔夫)与gulf(海湾)发音相似<,>gulf(n.海湾)/wolf(n.狼)/gold(n.黄金)

bone<,>/bəʊn/<,>/boʊn/<,>n.骨/n.骨骼<,>He broke a bone in his leg.<,>他腿部骨折了。<,>The dog buried a bone in the garden.<,>狗在花园里埋了一根骨头。<,>Calcium is important for strong bones.<,>钙对强健骨骼很重要。<,>bone(骨头)与phone(电话)押韵<,>tone(n.音调)/cone(n.圆锥体)/zone(n.区域)

glory<,>/ˈɡlɔːri/<,>/ˈɡlɔːri/<,>n.光荣/n.荣誉的事<,>They fought for the glory of their country.<,>他们为国家的荣誉而战。<,>The sunset was a glory of colors.<,>日落呈现出绚丽的色彩。<,>He basked in the glory of his success.<,>他沉浸在成功的荣耀中。<,>glory(荣耀)与story(故事)押韵<,>gory(adj.血腥的)/flory(adj.有花纹的)/lory(n.鹦鹉)

interpret<,>/ɪnˈtɜːprɪt/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrprɪt/<,>v.口译/v.解释/v.说明<,>Can you interpret what he said?<,>你能解释他说的话吗？<,>She interpreted for the foreign delegates.<,>她为外国代表做口译。<,>The law is open to interpretation.<,>这条法律可以有多种解释。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)→在中间表达→解释<,>interrupt(v.打断)/intercept(v.拦截)/interpose(v.插入)

want<,>/wɒnt/<,>/wɑːnt/<,>n.需要/n.缺乏<,>There's a want of fresh vegetables in winter.<,>冬天缺乏新鲜蔬菜。<,>His want of experience showed in his work.<,>他工作中表现出经验不足。<,>The refugees are in want of basic necessities.<,>难民们缺乏基本生活必需品。<,>want(需要)与wont(习惯)发音相同<,>wont(n.习惯)/wane(v.减弱)/wont(adj.惯常的)

mood<,>/muːd/<,>/muːd/<,>n.心情/n.情绪/n.语气<,>She's in a good mood today.<,>她今天心情很好。<,>The poem has a melancholy mood.<,>这首诗带着忧郁的情绪。<,>Don't talk to him when he's in that mood.<,>他心情不好的时候别跟他说话。<,>mood(情绪)与food(食物)押韵<,>mode(n.模式)/moon(n.月亮)/moot(adj.有争议的)

coach<,>/kəʊtʃ/<,>/koʊtʃ/<,>n.长途公共汽车<,>We took the coach to London.<,>我们乘长途汽车去伦敦。<,>The coach leaves at 8 am every morning.<,>长途汽车每天早上8点发车。<,>There's a coach station near the city center.<,>市中心附近有个长途汽车站。<,>coach(长途汽车)与couch(沙发)发音相似<,>couch(n.沙发)/coax(v.哄骗)/coot(n.老傻瓜)

examination<,>/ɪɡˌzæmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ɪɡˌzæmɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.考试/n.检查/n.细查<,>The medical examination took two hours.<,>体检花了两个小时。<,>He passed the final examination with flying colors.<,>他以优异成绩通过了期末考试。<,>The documents are under examination.<,>这些文件正在审查中。<,>examine(检查)+ation(名词后缀)→检查<,>examine(v.检查)/examiner(n.考官)/examination(n.考试)

kindness<,>/ˈkaɪndnəs/<,>/ˈkaɪndnəs/<,>n.仁慈/n.好意<,>She showed great kindness to the stray dog.<,>她对那只流浪狗表现出极大的善意。<,>His kindness won him many friends.<,>他的善良为他赢得了许多朋友。<,>Thank you for your kindness.<,>谢谢你的好意。<,>kind(善良的)+ness(名词后缀)→善良<,>kindle(v.点燃)/kingdom(n.王国)/kindred(n.亲属)

terror<,>/ˈterə(r)/<,>/ˈterər/<,>n.恐怖/n.惊骇<,>The villagers lived in terror of the monster.<,>村民们生活在怪物的恐惧中。<,>The explosion struck terror into their hearts.<,>爆炸使他们心惊胆战。<,>He has a terror of spiders.<,>他非常害怕蜘蛛。<,>terror(恐怖)与error(错误)押韵<,>terrorist(n.恐怖分子)/terrace(n.平台)/terrier(n.小猎犬)

cricket<,>/ˈkrɪkɪt/<,>/ˈkrɪkɪt/<,>n.板球/n.蟋蟀<,>He enjoys playing cricket on weekends.<,>他喜欢在周末打板球。<,>The sound of crickets filled the summer night.<,>蟋蟀的叫声充满了夏夜。<,>England is famous for its cricket tradition.<,>英格兰以其板球传统而闻名。<,>crick(拟声词，模仿蟋蟀叫声)+et(小)→蟋蟀<,>wicket(n.三柱门)/bracket(n.支架)

retreat<,>/rɪˈtriːt/<,>/rɪˈtriːt/<,>v.(被迫)退却/v.后退<,>The army had to retreat under heavy fire.<,>军队在猛烈炮火下不得不撤退。<,>She retreated to her room when guests arrived.<,>客人到来时她退回了自己的房间。<,>The tide is retreating from the shore.<,>潮水正从岸边退去。<,>re(回)+treat(处理)→处理回去→退却<,>retreat(n.撤退)/retrace(v.折返)

curve<,>/kɜːv/<,>/kɜrv/<,>n.曲线/n.弯/v.弄弯<,>The road has a dangerous curve ahead.<,>前方道路有一个危险的弯道。<,>She drew a perfect curve on the paper.<,>她在纸上画了一条完美的曲线。<,>Heat can curve this material easily.<,>加热可以轻松弯曲这种材料。<,>curv(弯曲)+e→曲线<,>carve(v.雕刻)/cove(n.小海湾)

structural<,>/ˈstrʌktʃərəl/<,>/ˈstrʌktʃərəl/<,>adj.结构的/adj.构造的<,>The engineers found structural problems in the building.<,>工程师发现了建筑的结构问题。<,>This is a structural analysis of the poem.<,>这是对这首诗的结构分析。<,>The structural design is very innovative.<,>这个结构设计非常创新。<,>struct(建造)+ure(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→结构的<,>structure(n.结构)/construct(v.建造)

via<,>/ˈvaɪə/<,>/ˈvaɪə/<,>prep.经过/prep.通过<,>We flew to New York via London.<,>我们经伦敦飞往纽约。<,>I sent the message via email.<,>我通过电子邮件发送了这条消息。<,>The news spread quickly via social media.<,>这个消息通过社交媒体迅速传播。<,>vi(路)+a→经过某条路→经过<,>vie(v.竞争)/visa(n.签证)

misunderstand<,>/ˌmɪsʌndəˈstænd/<,>/ˌmɪsʌndərˈstænd/<,>v.误解/v.误会/v.曲解<,>Don't misunderstand me, I'm not blaming you.<,>别误会，我不是在责怪你。<,>They often misunderstand each other's intentions.<,>他们经常误解对方的意图。<,>His words were misunderstood by the audience.<,>他的话被观众曲解了。<,>mis(错误)+understand(理解)→误解<,>misinterpret(v.曲解)/misconstrue(v.误解)

pond<,>/pɒnd/<,>/pɑːnd/<,>n.池塘<,>There are fish in the garden pond.<,>花园的池塘里有鱼。<,>The children like to feed ducks at the pond.<,>孩子们喜欢在池塘边喂鸭子。<,>A frog jumped into the pond.<,>一只青蛙跳进了池塘。<,>pond(重量单位，引申为"重"的水体)→池塘<,>pound(n.磅)/pontoon(n.浮桥)

precaution<,>/prɪˈkɔːʃn/<,>/prɪˈkɔʃən/<,>n.预防/n.警惕<,>Take precautions against the flu in winter.<,>冬季要预防流感。<,>Safety precautions must be followed in the lab.<,>实验室必须遵守安全预防措施。<,>As a precaution, she locked all the doors.<,>作为预防措施，她锁上了所有的门。<,>pre(前)+caution(小心)→提前小心→预防<,>caution(n.小心)/prevention(n.防止)

shore<,>/ʃɔː(r)/<,>/ʃɔːr/<,>n.滨/n.岸<,>We walked along the shore at sunset.<,>我们在日落时分沿着岸边散步。<,>The ship was anchored near the shore.<,>船停泊在靠近岸边的地方。<,>Seashells were scattered on the shore.<,>贝壳散落在海岸上。<,>shore(分享，引申为陆地和水的分界)→岸<,>sure(adj.确定的)/shear(v.剪)
autumn<,>/ˈɔːtəm/<,>/ˈɔːtəm/<,>n.秋/n.秋季<,>The leaves turn yellow in autumn.<,>秋天树叶变黄。<,>Autumn is my favorite season because of the cool weather.<,>因为凉爽的天气，秋天是我最喜欢的季节。<,>We often go hiking in the mountains during autumn.<,>我们经常在秋天去山里徒步旅行。<,>au(金)+tumn→金色的季节→秋天<,>summer(n.夏天)/winter(n.冬天)/spring(n.春天)

prospect<,>/ˈprɒspekt/<,>/ˈprɑːspekt/<,>n.展望/n.前景/n.前程<,>The prospect of a promotion motivated him to work harder.<,>升职的前景激励他更加努力工作。<,>There is a bright prospect for the new business.<,>新业务前景光明。<,>She was excited about the prospect of studying abroad.<,>她对出国留学的前景感到兴奋。<,>pro(向前)+spect(看)→向前看→前景<,>perspective(n.观点/n.远景)/inspect(v.检查/v.视察)/aspect(n.方面/n.外观)

question<,>/ˈkwestʃən/<,>/ˈkwɛstʃən/<,>n.问题/n.疑问<,>May I ask you a question?<,>我可以问你一个问题吗？<,>The teacher answered all the students' questions patiently.<,>老师耐心地回答了学生们所有的问题。<,>There is no question about his honesty.<,>他的诚实毋庸置疑。<,>quest(寻求)+ion→寻求答案→问题<,>query(n.疑问/v.询问)/inquiry(n.调查/n.询问)/request(n.请求/v.要求)

front<,>/frʌnt/<,>/frʌnt/<,>adj.前面的/n.前部<,>Please sit in the front row.<,>请坐在前排。<,>The front of the building was decorated with flowers.<,>建筑物的前部装饰着鲜花。<,>He stood at the front of the line.<,>他站在队伍的前面。<,>fr(自由)+ont→自由的前方→前部<,>confront(v.面对/v.遭遇)/frontier(n.边境/n.前沿)/affront(n.侮辱/v.冒犯)

broadcast<,>/ˈbrɔːdkɑːst/<,>/ˈbrɔːdkæst/<,>n.广播/n.播音<,>The news was broadcast live on television.<,>新闻在电视上直播。<,>He works for a local radio broadcast station.<,>他在当地广播电台工作。<,>The president's speech will be broadcast nationwide.<,>总统的演讲将在全国范围内广播。<,>broad(宽广的)+cast(投掷)→广泛投掷信息→广播<,>forecast(n.预报/v.预测)/podcast(n.播客)/telecast(n.电视广播)

background<,>/ˈbækɡraʊnd/<,>/ˈbækˌɡraʊnd/<,>n.背景/n.经历/n.后景<,>She has a strong academic background.<,>她有很强的学术背景。<,>The background music was too loud.<,>背景音乐太吵了。<,>He comes from a humble background.<,>他出身卑微。<,>back(后面)+ground(地面)→后面的地面→背景<,>foreground(n.前景)/underground(adj.地下的/n.地铁)/playground(n.操场)

appearance<,>/əˈpɪərəns/<,>/əˈpɪrəns/<,>n.外观/n.出现/n.来到<,>Her appearance at the party surprised everyone.<,>她在派对上的出现让每个人都感到惊讶。<,>Don't judge by appearances.<,>不要以貌取人。<,>The actor made a special appearance at the event.<,>这位演员在活动中特别亮相。<,>appear(出现)+ance→出现的外观<,>disappearance(n.消失)/reappearance(n.再现)/clearance(n.清除/n.许可)

fur<,>/fɜː(r)/<,>/fɜːr/<,>n.软毛/n.毛皮/n.裘皮<,>The cat has soft fur.<,>这只猫有柔软的毛。<,>She wore a coat made of fur.<,>她穿了一件毛皮大衣。<,>Fur trade was once very profitable.<,>毛皮贸易曾经非常有利可图。<,>fur(毛)+ry→毛茸茸的→毛皮<,>furry(adj.毛茸茸的)/fury(n.愤怒)/furnish(v.布置/v.提供)

pronoun<,>/ˈprəʊnaʊn/<,>/ˈproʊnaʊn/<,>n.代词<,>"He" is a personal pronoun.<,>"他"是人称代词。<,>In this sentence, "it" is used as a pronoun.<,>在这个句子中，"it"用作代词。<,>Relative pronouns connect clauses in a sentence.<,>关系代词连接句子中的从句。<,>pro(代替)+noun(名词)→代替名词的词→代词<,>noun(n.名词)/verb(n.动词)/adjective(n.形容词)

coarse<,>/kɔːs/<,>/kɔːrs/<,>adj.粗的/adj.粗糙的<,>The fabric feels coarse to the touch.<,>这种布料摸起来很粗糙。<,>He spoke in a coarse voice.<,>他用粗哑的声音说话。<,>Coarse sand is not suitable for building.<,>粗砂不适合建筑。<,>co(共同)+arse(屁股)→像屁股一样粗糙的→粗糙的<,>hoarse(adj.嘶哑的)/course(n.课程/n.路线)/coast(n.海岸)
clarify<,>/ˈklærɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈklærəˌfaɪ/<,>v.澄清/v.阐明<,>Could you clarify your statement?<,>你能澄清一下你的陈述吗？<,>The teacher clarified the difficult concept for the students.<,>老师为学生阐明了这个难懂的概念。<,>He clarified his position on the issue.<,>他阐明了自己在这个问题上的立场。<,>clar(清楚)+ify(使)→使清楚→澄清<,>classify(v.分类)/verify(v.核实)/certify(v.证明)

remote<,>/rɪˈməʊt/<,>/rɪˈmoʊt/<,>adj.相隔很远的/adj.冷淡的<,>They live in a remote village.<,>他们住在一个偏远的村庄。<,>His manner was remote and unfriendly.<,>他的态度冷淡而不友好。<,>The possibility of success seems remote.<,>成功的可能性似乎很渺茫。<,>re(回)+mot(移动)+e→移回去的→遥远的<,>remove(v.移除)/promote(v.促进)/demote(v.降级)

investigation<,>/ɪnˌvestɪˈɡeɪʃən/<,>/ɪnˌvɛstəˈɡeɪʃən/<,>n.调查/n.调查研究<,>The police are conducting an investigation.<,>警方正在进行调查。<,>A thorough investigation revealed the truth.<,>彻底的调查揭示了真相。<,>The investigation into the accident will take weeks.<,>对事故的调查将需要数周时间。<,>in(进入)+vestig(追踪)+ation→追踪进入→调查<,>investment(n.投资)/invention(n.发明)/intervention(n.干预)

boat<,>/bəʊt/<,>/boʊt/<,>n.小船/n.艇<,>We went fishing in a small boat.<,>我们乘小船去钓鱼。<,>The boat sank during the storm.<,>船在暴风雨中沉没了。<,>He rows his boat every morning.<,>他每天早上划船。<,>发音类似"波特"(人名)→波特的小船<,>float(v.漂浮)/coat(n.外套)/goat(n.山羊)

attractive<,>/əˈtræktɪv/<,>/əˈtræktɪv/<,>adj.有吸引力的<,>She is an attractive woman.<,>她是个有魅力的女人。<,>The offer was very attractive.<,>这个提议很有吸引力。<,>The city has many attractive features.<,>这个城市有许多吸引人的特点。<,>at(向)+tract(拉)+ive→把...拉过来的→有吸引力的<,>active(adj.活跃的)/abstract(adj.抽象的)/attentive(adj.专注的)

occupy<,>/ˈɒkjupaɪ/<,>/ˈɑkjəˌpaɪ/<,>v.占领/v.占/v.占有<,>Troops occupied the city.<,>军队占领了这座城市。<,>This table occupies too much space.<,>这张桌子占了太多空间。<,>She occupies an important position in the company.<,>她在公司担任要职。<,>oc(强调)+cupy(抓)→抓住→占领<,>occur(v.发生)/occult(adj.神秘的)/occasional(adj.偶尔的)

agony<,>/ˈæɡəni/<,>/ˈæɡəni/<,>n.极度痛苦<,>He was in agony after the accident.<,>事故后他处于极度痛苦中。<,>The agony of losing a child is unbearable.<,>失去孩子的痛苦是难以承受的。<,>She cried out in agony.<,>她痛苦地哭喊。<,>ago(以前)+ny→以前的痛苦记忆→痛苦<,>analogy(n.类比)/antagonism(n.对抗)/anthology(n.选集)

platform<,>/ˈplætfɔːm/<,>/ˈplætˌfɔrm/<,>n.站台/n.讲台/n.平台<,>The train will depart from platform 3.<,>火车将从3号站台出发。<,>He spoke from the platform.<,>他在讲台上发言。<,>The company provides a digital platform for learning.<,>该公司提供了一个数字学习平台。<,>plat(平的)+form(形状)→平的形状→平台<,>perform(v.表演)/reform(v.改革)/inform(v.通知)

communism<,>/ˈkɒmjənɪzəm/<,>/ˈkɑmjəˌnɪzəm/<,>n.共产主义<,>Communism advocates class equality.<,>共产主义主张阶级平等。<,>He believes in the principles of communism.<,>他信仰共产主义原则。<,>The book discusses the history of communism.<,>这本书讨论了共产主义的历史。<,>commune(公社)+ism(主义)→共产主义<,>communion(n.共享)/community(n.社区)/communication(n.交流)

not<,>/nɒt/<,>/nɑt/<,>adv.不/adv.没有<,>I am not hungry.<,>我不饿。<,>She did not attend the meeting.<,>她没有参加会议。<,>Not all students passed the exam.<,>不是所有学生都通过了考试。<,>简单词，与"hot"(热)对比记忆<,>note(n.笔记)/knot(n.结)/nut(n.坚果)
intensive<,>/ɪnˈtensɪv/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnsɪv/<,>adj.加强的/adj.精耕细作的<,>She took an intensive course in Spanish before her trip.<,>她在旅行前参加了一个西班牙语强化课程。<,>The farmers use intensive farming methods to maximize yields.<,>农民们采用精耕细作的方法来最大化产量。<,>The patient received intensive care after the surgery.<,>手术后病人接受了重症监护。<,>in(向内)+tens(伸展)+ive(形容词后缀)→向内伸展→加强的<,>extensive(adj.广泛的)/intense(adj.强烈的)/intention(n.意图)  

maybe<,>/ˈmeɪbi/<,>/ˈmeɪbi/<,>adv.大概/adv.或许/adv.也许<,>Maybe we should leave early to avoid traffic.<,>或许我们应该早点出发以避免堵车。<,>She said maybe she would come to the party.<,>她说她也许会来参加派对。<,>Maybe it will rain tomorrow, so bring an umbrella.<,>明天可能会下雨，所以带上伞吧。<,>may(可能)+be(是)→可能是→大概<,>may be(可能是)/perhaps(adv.或许)/possibly(adv.可能地)  

disgust<,>/dɪsˈɡʌst/<,>/dɪsˈɡʌst/<,>n.厌恶/n.憎恶<,>The smell of rotten food filled him with disgust.<,>腐烂食物的气味让他感到恶心。<,>She looked at him with disgust after his rude comment.<,>他粗鲁的评论后，她厌恶地看着他。<,>His behavior was so bad that it caused widespread disgust.<,>他的行为太恶劣，引起了普遍的厌恶。<,>dis(否定)+gust(味道)→不好的味道→厌恶<,>disgusting(adj.令人厌恶的)/gusto(n.爱好)/discuss(v.讨论)  

utilize<,>/ˈjuːtəlaɪz/<,>/ˈjutəˌlaɪz/<,>v.利用<,>We should utilize solar energy to reduce pollution.<,>我们应该利用太阳能来减少污染。<,>The company utilizes advanced technology to improve efficiency.<,>公司利用先进技术提高效率。<,>She utilized her free time to learn a new skill.<,>她利用空闲时间学习了一项新技能。<,>util(使用)+ize(动词后缀)→使用→利用<,>utility(n.效用)/utensil(n.器具)/use(v.使用)  

protection<,>/prəˈtekʃn/<,>/prəˈtɛkʃən/<,>n.保护<,>Wearing a helmet provides protection for your head.<,>戴头盔可以保护你的头部。<,>The law offers protection to endangered species.<,>法律为濒危物种提供保护。<,>She bought a phone case for extra protection.<,>她买了个手机壳以增加保护。<,>pro(向前)+tect(覆盖)+ion(名词后缀)→向前覆盖→保护<,>protect(v.保护)/detection(n.探测)/projection(n.投射)  

connect<,>/kəˈnekt/<,>/kəˈnɛkt/<,>v.连接/v.连结/v.联系<,>Please connect the printer to the computer.<,>请将打印机连接到电脑。<,>The bridge connects the two parts of the city.<,>这座桥连接了城市的两部分。<,>I can't connect to the internet right now.<,>我现在无法连接到互联网。<,>con(共同)+nect(绑)→绑在一起→连接<,>connection(n.连接)/collect(v.收集)/correct(adj.正确的)  

cancel<,>/ˈkænsl/<,>/ˈkænsəl/<,>vt.取消/vt.撤销/vt.删去<,>They had to cancel the meeting due to bad weather.<,>由于天气不好，他们不得不取消会议。<,>She canceled her subscription to the magazine.<,>她取消了对该杂志的订阅。<,>The bank canceled the fraudulent transaction.<,>银行撤销了这笔欺诈交易。<,>can(能)+cel(停止)→能停止→取消<,>cancer(n.癌症)/candle(n.蜡烛)/conceal(v.隐藏)  

explosive<,>/ɪkˈspləʊsɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsploʊsɪv/<,>adj.爆炸的/adj.极易引起争论的/n.炸药<,>The explosive device was safely defused by the bomb squad.<,>爆破小组安全拆除了这个爆炸装置。<,>Racial issues are often explosive topics in discussions.<,>种族问题常常是讨论中极易引起争论的话题。<,>The miners used explosives to break the rocks.<,>矿工们用炸药炸开岩石。<,>ex(出)+plos(爆)+ive(形容词后缀)→爆炸的<,>explode(v.爆炸)/explosion(n.爆炸)/expensive(adj.昂贵的)  

numerous<,>/ˈnjuːmərəs/<,>/ˈnumərəs/<,>adj.众多的<,>Numerous studies have confirmed the benefits of exercise.<,>众多研究证实了锻炼的好处。<,>She has received numerous awards for her work.<,>她的工作获得了众多奖项。<,>Numerous fans attended the concert.<,>众多粉丝参加了这场音乐会。<,>numer(数字)+ous(形容词后缀)→数字多的→众多的<,>number(n.数字)/enumerate(v.列举)/numerical(adj.数字的)  

govern<,>/ˈɡʌvn/<,>/ˈɡʌvərn/<,>vi.居支配地位/vi.占优势/vt.统治/vt.治理/vt.支配<,>The king governed the country for over 30 years.<,>这位国王统治了这个国家30多年。<,>Economic factors often govern people's decisions.<,>经济因素常常支配着人们的决定。<,>Democracy is a system where the people govern themselves.<,>民主是一种人民自治的制度。<,>govern(管理)+ment(名词后缀)→政府<,>government(n.政府)/governor(n.州长)/control(v.控制)
analyse<,>/ˈænəlaɪz/<,>/ˈænəˌlaɪz/<,>vt.分析/vt.分解/vt.解析<,>Scientists analyse the data to find patterns.<,>科学家分析数据以寻找模式。<,>We need to analyse the problem before solving it.<,>我们需要在解决问题前先分析它。<,>The teacher asked us to analyse the poem.<,>老师让我们解析这首诗。<,>ana(分开)+lyse(松开)→分开松开→分析<,>analysis(n.分析)/analogy(n.类比)/anatomy(n.解剖)  

discourage<,>/dɪsˈkʌrɪdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈkɜːrɪdʒ/<,>vt.使泄气/vt.使灰心/vt.阻止/vt.劝阻<,>Don't let failure discourage you.<,>别让失败使你灰心。<,>High prices discourage people from buying.<,>高价格阻止人们购买。<,>She discouraged him from taking risks.<,>她劝阻他不要冒险。<,>dis(否定)+courage(勇气)→使失去勇气→使泄气<,>encourage(vt.鼓励)/discourse(n.演讲)/discover(vt.发现)  

resemble<,>/rɪˈzembl/<,>/rɪˈzɛmbəl/<,>vt.像/vt.类似于<,>She resembles her mother in appearance.<,>她外表像她母亲。<,>This situation resembles what happened last year.<,>这种情况类似于去年发生的事。<,>The twins resemble each other closely.<,>这对双胞胎非常相似。<,>re(再)+semble(类似)→再相似→类似于<,>assemble(vt.集合)/dissemble(vt.掩饰)/semblance(n.外表)  

remote<,>/rɪˈməʊt/<,>/rɪˈmoʊt/<,>adj.遥远的/adj.偏僻的/adj.关系疏远的/adj.脱离的/adj.微乎其微的/adj.孤高的/adj.冷淡的/adj.遥控的<,>They live in a remote village.<,>他们住在一个偏僻的村庄。<,>There's only a remote chance of success.<,>成功的可能性微乎其微。<,>He gave me a remote smile.<,>他对我冷淡地笑了笑。<,>re(回)+mote(移动)→移回去→遥远的<,>promote(vt.促进)/demote(vt.降级)/motion(n.运动)  

salary<,>/ˈsæləri/<,>/ˈsæləri/<,>n.薪金/n.薪水<,>He earns a good salary.<,>他薪水不错。<,>The company offers competitive salaries.<,>公司提供有竞争力的薪水。<,>Her salary was paid monthly.<,>她的薪水按月支付。<,>sal(盐)+ary(与...相关)→古罗马士兵用盐当工资→薪水<,>wage(n.工资)/income(n.收入)/bonus(n.奖金)  

pollution<,>/pəˈluːʃn/<,>/pəˈluːʃn/<,>n.污染/n.污染物<,>Air pollution is a serious problem.<,>空气污染是个严重问题。<,>The river is full of pollution.<,>这条河里满是污染物。<,>Noise pollution affects our health.<,>噪音污染影响我们的健康。<,>pollut(污染)+ion(状态)→污染<,>solution(n.解决方案)/dilution(n.稀释)/evolution(n.进化)  

pretend<,>/prɪˈtend/<,>/prɪˈtɛnd/<,>vt.装作/vt.假装<,>She pretended not to see me.<,>她假装没看见我。<,>Children often pretend to be superheroes.<,>孩子们常假装是超级英雄。<,>He pretended to be asleep.<,>他装作睡着了。<,>pre(前)+tend(伸展)→提前伸展→假装<,>intend(vt.打算)/extend(vt.延伸)/contend(vt.竞争)  

kettle<,>/ˈketl/<,>/ˈkɛtl/<,>n.水壶<,>The kettle is boiling.<,>水壶开了。<,>She poured hot water from the kettle.<,>她从水壶倒出热水。<,>I'll put the kettle on for tea.<,>我要烧壶水泡茶。<,>ket(罐)+tle(小)→小罐→水壶<,>bottle(n.瓶子)/cattle(n.牛)/settle(vt.解决)  

wreck<,>/rek/<,>/rɛk/<,>n.失事/n.残骸/n.精神或身体已垮的人/vt.破坏<,>The ship was a total wreck.<,>那艘船完全失事了。<,>He's a wreck after the illness.<,>他病后身体垮了。<,>The storm wrecked many houses.<,>暴风雨毁坏了许多房屋。<,>wr(扭曲)+eck(结果)→扭曲的结果→残骸<,>wreath(n.花环)/wrench(vt.扭伤)/wreckage(n.残骸)  

drunk<,>/drʌŋk/<,>/drʌŋk/<,>adj.醉的/adj.陶醉的<,>He got drunk at the party.<,>他在聚会上喝醉了。<,>She was drunk with happiness.<,>她陶醉在幸福中。<,>Drunk driving is dangerous.<,>酒后驾驶很危险。<,>drink的过去分词→喝醉的<,>drank(v. drink的过去式)/dunk(vt.浸泡)/trunk(n.树干)
calculate<,>/ˈkælkjʊleɪt/<,>/ˈkælkjəˌleɪt/<,>vt.计算/vt.估计/vt.计划<,>Scientists calculate the speed of light with great precision.<,>科学家们非常精确地计算光速。<,>We need to calculate the total cost before starting the project.<,>我们需要在项目开始前估算总成本。<,>She calculated the best route to avoid traffic.<,>她计划了最佳路线以避免交通拥堵。<,>calc(石头)+ulate→古时用石头计算→计算<,>calculator(n.计算器)/speculate(v.推测)/formulate(v.规划)

persistent<,>/pəˈsɪstənt/<,>/pərˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.坚持的/adj.不屈不挠的/adj.持续不断的/adj.反复出现的<,>Her persistent efforts finally led to success.<,>她坚持不懈的努力最终带来了成功。<,>The persistent rain caused flooding in some areas.<,>持续不断的降雨导致部分地区洪水泛滥。<,>He has a persistent cough that won't go away.<,>他咳嗽反复出现，一直不好。<,>per(完全)+sist(站立)+ent→始终站立→坚持的<,>insistent(adj.坚持的)/consistent(adj.一致的)/resistant(adj.抵抗的)

sake<,>/seɪk/<,>/seɪk/<,>n.缘故/n.理由<,>He quit smoking for the sake of his health.<,>为了健康着想，他戒烟了。<,>They compromised for the sake of peace.<,>为了和平，他们做出了妥协。<,>Don't argue just for the sake of arguing.<,>不要为了争论而争论。<,>sake(酒)→日本清酒→引申为"目的、缘故"<,>sake vs stake(n.赌注)/sake vs bake(v.烘焙)/sake vs fake(adj.假的)

conceal<,>/kənˈsiːl/<,>/kənˈsil/<,>vt.隐藏/vt.掩盖/vt.隐瞒<,>She tried to conceal her disappointment with a smile.<,>她试图用微笑掩饰失望。<,>The spy concealed important documents in a secret compartment.<,>间谍把重要文件藏在暗格中。<,>He couldn't conceal the truth any longer.<,>他再也无法隐瞒真相了。<,>con(完全)+ceal(隐藏)→完全隐藏<,>reveal(v.揭示)/concede(v.让步)/conceit(n.自负)

audience<,>/ˈɔːdiəns/<,>/ˈɔdiəns/<,>n.听众/n.观众/n.读者<,>The audience applauded loudly after the performance.<,>演出结束后观众热烈鼓掌。<,>This book targets a young adult audience.<,>这本书的目标读者是年轻成年人。<,>The speaker adjusted his speech to suit his audience.<,>演讲者调整了演讲内容以适应听众。<,>audi(听)+ence→听的人→听众<,>audible(adj.听得见的)/auditorium(n.礼堂)/audio(adj.音频的)

meanwhile<,>/ˈmiːnwaɪl/<,>/ˈminˌhwaɪl/<,>adv.与此同时<,>She was preparing dinner; meanwhile, the children were doing homework.<,>她在准备晚餐，与此同时孩子们在做作业。<,>The main team continued working, meanwhile a smaller group investigated alternatives.<,>主力团队继续工作，同时一个小分队研究替代方案。<,>He'll arrive in an hour; meanwhile, let's get everything ready.<,>他一小时后到，在此期间我们把一切准备好。<,>mean(中间)+while(时间)→中间时间→与此同时<,>meantime(n.其间)/whereas(conj.然而)/while(conj.当...时)

possess<,>/pəˈzes/<,>/pəˈzɛs/<,>vt.占用/vt.拥有<,>He possesses great knowledge of ancient history.<,>他拥有丰富的古代史知识。<,>The museum possesses several rare paintings.<,>博物馆收藏有几幅珍稀画作。<,>She was possessed by a strange idea.<,>她被一个奇怪的想法占据了头脑。<,>pos(能够)+sess(坐)→能够坐下→占有<,>possession(n.财产)/process(n.过程)/obsess(v.迷住)

competent<,>/ˈkɒmpɪtənt/<,>/ˈkɑmpɪtənt/<,>adj.有能力的/adj.能胜任的<,>She is competent to handle this complex project.<,>她有能力处理这个复杂项目。<,>The court ruled he was mentally competent to stand trial.<,>法庭裁定他精神健全，可以接受审判。<,>We need competent staff who can work independently.<,>我们需要能独立工作的称职员工。<,>compete(竞争)+ent→能在竞争中胜出→有能力的<,>competitive(adj.竞争的)/component(n.部件)/complacent(adj.自满的)

investment<,>/ɪnˈvestmənt/<,>/ɪnˈvɛstmənt/<,>n.投资/n.投资额/n.投入<,>Real estate is generally considered a safe investment.<,>房地产通常被认为是安全的投资。<,>The company made a huge investment in new technology.<,>公司在新技术上投入巨资。<,>Education is an investment in your future.<,>教育是对未来的投资。<,>invest(投资)+ment→投资行为<,>investor(n.投资者)/divest(v.剥离)/vest(n.背心)

neutral<,>/ˈnjuːtrəl/<,>/ˈnutrəl/<,>adj.中立的/adj.中性的<,>Switzerland remained neutral during World War II.<,>瑞士在二战期间保持中立。<,>The judge must maintain a neutral position in the case.<,>法官必须在案件中保持中立立场。<,>This detergent is pH neutral and safe for all fabrics.<,>这种洗涤剂pH值中性，适用于所有织物。<,>neutr(两者都不)+al→不偏袒任何一方→中立的<,>neutron(n.中子)/natural(adj.自然的)/neutralize(v.中和)
scratch<,>/skrætʃ/<,>/skrætʃ/<,>v.抓/v.搔/v.扒/v.刮/v.擦/v.刻出/n.抓痕/n.划痕/n.抓/n.搔/n.刮<,>The cat likes to scratch the sofa.<,>这只猫喜欢抓沙发。<,>He scratched his name on the wall with a key.<,>他用钥匙在墙上刻下了自己的名字。<,>There's a scratch on my new phone.<,>我的新手机上有一道划痕。<,>sc(切割)+ratch(抓)→抓痕<,>snatch(v.抢夺/n.片段)/match(n.比赛/v.匹配)  

optional<,>/ˈɒpʃənl/<,>/ˈɑːpʃənl/<,>adj.可以任选的<,>The course has several optional modules.<,>这门课程有几个选修模块。<,>Wearing a tie is optional at this event.<,>这个活动打领带是可选的。<,>She chose the optional insurance coverage.<,>她选择了可选的保险范围。<,>option(选择)+al(形容词后缀)→可选的<,>optical(adj.光学的)/optional(adj.可选的)  

require<,>/rɪˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkwaɪər/<,>vt.需要/vt.要求/vt.命令<,>This job requires patience.<,>这份工作需要耐心。<,>The law requires all citizens to pay taxes.<,>法律要求所有公民纳税。<,>He was required to attend the meeting.<,>他被要求参加会议。<,>re(再)+quire(寻求)→反复寻求→需要<,>acquire(v.获得)/inquire(v.询问)  

circular<,>/ˈsɜːkjələ(r)/<,>/ˈsɜːrkjələr/<,>adj.圆的/adj.循环的/adj.兜圈子的/n.通知/n.通告<,>The children sat in a circular formation.<,>孩子们围坐成一个圆圈。<,>We received a circular about the new policy.<,>我们收到了一份关于新政策的通告。<,>The argument was circular and didn't lead anywhere.<,>这个论点循环往复，没有结论。<,>circ(圆)+ular(形容词后缀)→圆形的<,>cylinder(n.圆柱体)/circuit(n.电路)  

analysis<,>/əˈnæləsɪs/<,>/əˈnæləsɪs/<,>n.分析/n.分析报告/n.分解/n.解析<,>The data requires careful analysis.<,>这些数据需要仔细分析。<,>She presented her analysis of the market trends.<,>她展示了她对市场趋势的分析。<,>Chemical analysis revealed the substance's composition.<,>化学分析揭示了该物质的成分。<,>ana(向上)+lysis(松开)→分解开来→分析<,>synthesis(n.合成)/paralysis(n.麻痹)  

click<,>/klɪk/<,>/klɪk/<,>v.发出咔嗒声/v.点击/n.咔嗒声<,>Click the icon to open the file.<,>点击图标打开文件。<,>The door closed with a loud click.<,>门咔嗒一声关上了。<,>They clicked immediately and became friends.<,>他们一见如故，成为了朋友。<,>拟声词，模仿咔嗒声<,>clique(n.小集团)/clack(n.咔哒声)  

fashionable<,>/ˈfæʃnəbl/<,>/ˈfæʃənəbl/<,>adj.流行的/adj.时髦的<,>This hairstyle is very fashionable now.<,>这种发型现在很流行。<,>She always wears fashionable clothes.<,>她总是穿时髦的衣服。<,>The café is in a fashionable part of town.<,>这家咖啡馆位于城里的时尚区。<,>fashion(时尚)+able(能...的)→时尚的<,>unfashionable(adj.过时的)/passable(adj.可通行的)  

devise<,>/dɪˈvaɪz/<,>/dɪˈvaɪz/<,>vt.设计/vt.发明<,>They devised a new marketing strategy.<,>他们设计了一个新的营销策略。<,>The engineer devised a solution to the problem.<,>工程师设计出了问题的解决方案。<,>He devised a clever plan to escape.<,>他想出了一个聪明的逃跑计划。<,>de(向下)+vise(看)→深入思考→设计<,>device(n.装置)/advise(v.建议)  

apparent<,>/əˈpærənt/<,>/əˈpærənt/<,>adj.表面上的/adj.明显的<,>Her happiness was only apparent.<,>她的快乐只是表面上的。<,>It's apparent that he's lying.<,>很明显他在撒谎。<,>There was an apparent change in his attitude.<,>他的态度有明显的改变。<,>ap(加强)+par(出现)+ent→明显出现的→明显的<,>transparent(adj.透明的)/parent(n.父母)  

journalist<,>/ˈdʒɜːnəlɪst/<,>/ˈdʒɜːrnəlɪst/<,>n.新闻工作者/n.新闻记者<,>She works as a journalist for a newspaper.<,>她是一家报纸的记者。<,>The journalist interviewed the president.<,>这位记者采访了总统。<,>Investigative journalists uncovered the scandal.<,>调查记者揭露了这一丑闻。<,>journal(日报)+ist(人)→写日报的人→记者<,>journey(n.旅行)/colonist(n.殖民者)
exposure<,>/ɪkˈspəʊʒə(r)/<,>/ɪkˈspoʊʒər/<,>n.暴露/n.揭露/n.曝光<,>Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin damage.<,>长时间暴露在阳光下会导致皮肤损伤。<,>The documentary led to the exposure of corruption in the government.<,>这部纪录片揭露了政府中的腐败行为。<,>The photographer adjusted the camera settings for proper exposure.<,>摄影师调整相机设置以获得适当的曝光。<,>ex(向外)+pos(放置)+ure(状态)→向外放置→暴露<,>disclosure(n. 披露)/expose(v. 暴露)/expound(v. 详细说明)

temper<,>/ˈtempə(r)/<,>/ˈtempər/<,>n.韧度/n.心情/n.情绪/vt.调和/vt.使缓和/vt.使回火<,>She has a quick temper and gets angry easily.<,>她脾气急躁，容易生气。<,>The blacksmith tempered the steel to make it stronger.<,>铁匠将钢回火以使其更坚固。<,>He tried to temper his criticism with some praise.<,>他试图用一些赞扬来缓和批评。<,>temper(时间)→情绪随时间变化→心情<,>tamper(v. 篡改)/tempo(n. 节奏)/temperate(adj. 温和的)

protective<,>/prəˈtektɪv/<,>/prəˈtektɪv/<,>adj.保护的/adj.防护的<,>Wearing protective gear is essential when handling chemicals.<,>处理化学品时穿戴防护装备是必要的。<,>She has a protective attitude towards her younger brother.<,>她对弟弟有一种保护的态度。<,>The vaccine provides protective immunity against the disease.<,>疫苗提供了对这种疾病的保护性免疫。<,>pro(向前)+tect(覆盖)+ive(形容词后缀)→向前覆盖→保护的<,>preventive(adj. 预防的)/productive(adj. 多产的)/protective(n. 保护剂)

sideways<,>/ˈsaɪdweɪz/<,>/ˈsaɪdweɪz/<,>adv&adj.从一边/adv&adj.向一边/adv&adj.在一边/adv&adj.斜着/adv&adj.侧身<,>He glanced sideways at her to see her reaction.<,>他斜眼瞥了她一眼，看她的反应。<,>The car skidded sideways on the icy road.<,>汽车在结冰的路面上侧滑。<,>She moved sideways through the narrow alley.<,>她侧身穿过狭窄的小巷。<,>side(边)+ways(方向)→向一边的方向→斜着<,>sidewalk(n. 人行道)/sidekick(n. 助手)/sideboard(n. 餐具柜)

multicultural<,>/ˌmʌltiˈkʌltʃərəl/<,>/ˌmʌltiˈkʌltʃərəl/<,>adj.融合多种文化的<,>Toronto is a multicultural city with diverse communities.<,>多伦多是一个拥有多元社区的多元文化城市。<,>The school promotes multicultural education to celebrate diversity.<,>学校推广多元文化教育以庆祝多样性。<,>The festival showcases multicultural performances from around the world.<,>这个节日展示了来自世界各地的多元文化表演。<,>multi(多)+cultural(文化的)→多种文化的→多元文化的<,>monocultural(adj. 单一文化的)/intercultural(adj. 跨文化的)/bicultural(adj. 双文化的)

object<,>/ˈɒbdʒɪkt/<,>/ˈɑːbdʒekt/<,>vi.反对/vi.不赞成/n.实物/n.物体/n.目的/n.目标/n.对象/n.宾语<,>She objected to the proposal during the meeting.<,>她在会议上反对这个提议。<,>The strange object in the sky turned out to be a drone.<,>天空中奇怪的物体原来是一架无人机。<,>The object of the game is to score the most points.<,>这个游戏的目标是得分最多。<,>ob(反)+ject(投掷)→反向投掷→反对<,>subject(n. 主题/v. 使服从)/project(n. 项目/v. 投射)/reject(v. 拒绝)

humble<,>/ˈhʌmbl/<,>/ˈhʌmbəl/<,>adj.谦逊的/adj.地位低下的/adj.简陋的<,>Despite his success, he remained humble and kind.<,>尽管他成功了，但他仍然谦逊和善良。<,>They live in a humble cottage in the countryside.<,>他们住在乡下一间简陋的小屋里。<,>She comes from a humble background but has achieved great things.<,>她出身卑微，但取得了伟大的成就。<,>hum(地)+ble→接近地面的→谦逊的<,>humbug(n. 欺骗)/humerus(n. 肱骨)/humility(n. 谦逊)

chapter<,>/ˈtʃæptə(r)/<,>/ˈtʃæptər/<,>n.章/n.回/n.篇<,>The first chapter of the book introduces the main characters.<,>这本书的第一章介绍了主要人物。<,>She read a chapter of her novel before going to bed.<,>她睡前读了一章小说。<,>This event marks a new chapter in the company's history.<,>这一事件标志着公司历史的新篇章。<,>chap(头)+ter→书的开头部分→章<,>chatter(v. 喋喋不休)/charter(n. 宪章)/chapter(v. 分章)

harbour<,>/ˈhɑːbə(r)/<,>/ˈhɑːrbər/<,>n.海港/n.港口/vt.庇护/vt.心怀<,>The ship sailed into the harbour at dawn.<,>船在黎明时分驶入港口。<,>It's illegal to harbour a fugitive from justice.<,>窝藏逃犯是违法的。<,>She harboured a grudge against him for years.<,>她多年来对他心怀怨恨。<,>har(军队)+bour(庇护所)→军队的庇护所→港口<,>arbor(n. 凉亭)/harbinger(n. 预兆)/harbor(n. 港口，美式拼写)

independent<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendənt/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendənt/<,>adj.独立的/adj.自主的/adj.无偏见的/adj.不相关联的<,>She became financially independent after graduating.<,>毕业后她实现了经济独立。<,>The newspaper prides itself on being politically independent.<,>这家报纸以政治上的独立为荣。<,>The two events are independent of each other.<,>这两个事件互不相关。<,>in(不)+depend(依赖)+ent(形容词后缀)→不依赖的→独立的<,>dependable(adj. 可靠的)/interdependent(adj. 相互依赖的)/independence(n. 独立)
carriage<,>/ˈkærɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkærɪdʒ/<,>n.客车厢/n.四轮马车<,>The carriage was pulled by two white horses.<,>这辆四轮马车由两匹白马拉着。<,>She sat in the first-class carriage of the train.<,>她坐在火车的一等车厢里。<,>The baby carriage was left unattended.<,>婴儿车被遗留在那里无人看管。<,>carri(携带)+age(名词后缀)→携带人或物的工具<,>cart(n.手推车)/wagon(n.货车)/coach(n.长途汽车)

cliff<,>/klɪf/<,>/klɪf/<,>n.悬崖/n.峭壁<,>He stood at the edge of the cliff, looking down.<,>他站在悬崖边缘往下看。<,>The castle was built on top of a steep cliff.<,>城堡建在陡峭的悬崖顶上。<,>Many seabirds nest on these cliffs.<,>许多海鸟在这些悬崖上筑巢。<,>cli(倾斜)+ff(重复)→陡峭的倾斜面<,>bluff(n.虚张声势)/crag(n.峭壁)/precipice(n.绝壁)

infinite<,>/ˈɪnfɪnət/<,>/ˈɪnfənɪt/<,>adj.无限的/adj.无穷的<,>The universe is infinite in size.<,>宇宙的大小是无限的。<,>She has infinite patience with children.<,>她对孩子们有无限的耐心。<,>The possibilities are infinite.<,>可能性是无穷无尽的。<,>in(不)+fin(界限)+ite(形容词后缀)→没有界限的<,>finite(adj.有限的)/definite(adj.明确的)/indefinite(adj.不确定的)

concede<,>/kənˈsiːd/<,>/kənˈsid/<,>vt.承认/vt.承认...为真/vt.承认失败/vt.允许/vt.让予/vt.让步/vt.认输<,>He finally conceded defeat.<,>他最终承认了失败。<,>The company conceded that there had been problems.<,>公司承认存在问题。<,>I concede that you have a point.<,>我承认你说的有道理。<,>con(完全)+cede(走)→完全让步<,>recede(v.后退)/precede(v.领先)/proceed(v.继续进行)

elect<,>/ɪˈlekt/<,>/ɪˈlɛkt/<,>vt.选举/vt.推选/vt.选择<,>They elected him as their leader.<,>他们选举他为领导人。<,>She was elected to the committee.<,>她被选入委员会。<,>I elect to stay home tonight.<,>我选择今晚待在家里。<,>e(出)+lect(选择)→选出<,>select(v.挑选)/collect(v.收集)/neglect(v.忽视)

weekly<,>/ˈwiːkli/<,>/ˈwikli/<,>adv.每周/adj.每周的<,>The magazine is published weekly.<,>这本杂志每周出版一次。<,>We have weekly meetings on Mondays.<,>我们每周一开会。<,>She receives a weekly allowance.<,>她每周得到一笔零花钱。<,>week(周)+ly(副词/形容词后缀)→每周的<,>daily(adj.每日的)/monthly(adj.每月的)/yearly(adj.每年的)

result<,>/rɪˈzʌlt/<,>/rɪˈzʌlt/<,>vi.发生/n.结果/n.成果/n.比分<,>His success resulted from hard work.<,>他的成功源于努力工作。<,>The test results will be available tomorrow.<,>测试结果明天出来。<,>What was the final result of the game?<,>比赛的最终比分是多少？<,>re(回)+sult(跳)→跳回来的东西→结果<,>insult(v.侮辱)/consult(v.咨询)/exult(v.狂喜)

golf<,>/ɡɒlf/<,>/ɡɑlf/<,>n.高尔夫球运动<,>He plays golf every weekend.<,>他每个周末都打高尔夫球。<,>The golf course was beautifully maintained.<,>高尔夫球场维护得很好。<,>She won the golf tournament.<,>她赢得了高尔夫球比赛。<,>联想：green(绿色)+olf→在绿色草地上进行的运动<,>gulf(n.海湾)/wolf(n.狼)/gulp(v.吞咽)

selfish<,>/ˈselfɪʃ/<,>/ˈsɛlfɪʃ/<,>adj.自私的/adj.利己的<,>Don't be so selfish - share your toys.<,>别这么自私，分享你的玩具。<,>It was selfish of him to take the last piece.<,>他拿走了最后一块，太自私了。<,>Her selfish behavior upset everyone.<,>她自私的行为让大家都很不高兴。<,>self(自己)+ish(形容词后缀)→只顾自己的<,>selfless(adj.无私的)/fish(n.鱼)/foolish(adj.愚蠢的)

sexism<,>/ˈseksɪzəm/<,>/ˈsɛksɪzəm/<,>n.性别偏见/n.性别歧视<,>Sexism in the workplace is still a problem.<,>职场中的性别歧视仍然是个问题。<,>The advertisement was criticized for its sexism.<,>这则广告因性别歧视而受到批评。<,>We need to combat sexism in our society.<,>我们需要与社会中的性别偏见作斗争。<,>sex(性别)+ism(主义)→性别主义<,>racism(n.种族主义)/feminism(n.女权主义)/ageism(n.年龄歧视)
commission<,>/kəˈmɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/kəˈmɪʃən/<,>n.委任状/n.委员会/n.佣金,回扣/n.授权,委托/vt.委任,委托<,>She received a commission to paint the mayor's portrait.<,>她接受了为市长画肖像的委托。<,>The salesperson earns a 10% commission on each sale.<,>销售人员每笔销售可获得10%的佣金。<,>The government set up a commission to investigate the matter.<,>政府成立了一个委员会来调查此事。<,>com(共同)+mission(任务)→共同完成任务→委托<,>mission(n.任务)/admission(n.入场许可)/omission(n.遗漏)

headline<,>/ˈhedlaɪn/<,>/ˈhɛdˌlaɪn/<,>n.大字标题/n.新闻提要<,>The scandal made headlines around the world.<,>这桩丑闻登上了全球各大媒体的头条。<,>I only had time to read the headlines this morning.<,>今早我只来得及浏览新闻标题。<,>The newspaper's headline caught everyone's attention.<,>报纸的大标题吸引了所有人的注意。<,>head(头)+line(行)→文章最上方的行→标题<,>deadline(n.截止日期)/guideline(n.指导方针)/underline(v.在...下面划线)

connect<,>/kəˈnekt/<,>/kəˈnɛkt/<,>vt.连接/vt.结合/vt.联系/vt.给...接通电话<,>Please connect the printer to the computer.<,>请将打印机连接到电脑。<,>The police are trying to connect him to the crime.<,>警方正试图将他与这起犯罪联系起来。<,>Hold on, I'll connect you to Mr. Smith.<,>请稍等，我为您转接史密斯先生。<,>con(共同)+nect(绑)→绑在一起→连接<,>collect(v.收集)/correct(adj.正确的)/contact(n.接触)

rational<,>/ˈræʃ(ə)n(ə)l/<,>/ˈræʃənəl/<,>adj.理性的/adj.理智的/adj.合理的<,>There must be a rational explanation for this phenomenon.<,>这种现象必定有合理的解释。<,>He made a rational decision based on the facts.<,>他根据事实做出了理性的决定。<,>It's not rational to be afraid of harmless spiders.<,>害怕无害的蜘蛛是不理智的。<,>ratio(比率)+nal→符合比率的→合理的<,>national(adj.国家的)/emotional(adj.情绪的)/irrational(adj.不合理的)

policy<,>/ˈpɒləsi/<,>/ˈpɑləsi/<,>n.政策/n.方针/n.保险单<,>The company has a strict no-smoking policy.<,>公司有严格的禁烟政策。<,>You should check your insurance policy carefully.<,>你应该仔细检查你的保险单。<,>The government's economic policy has been successful.<,>政府的经济政策取得了成功。<,>poli(城市)+cy→管理城市的方法→政策<,>police(n.警察)/polish(v.磨光)/politics(n.政治)

editorial<,>/ˌedɪˈtɔːriəl/<,>/ˌɛdɪˈtɔriəl/<,>adj.编辑的/adj.主笔的/adj.编者的/adj.社论的/n.社论/n.重要评论<,>The editorial team worked late to meet the deadline.<,>编辑团队工作到很晚以赶上截止日期。<,>Today's editorial discusses the education reform.<,>今天的社论讨论了教育改革。<,>She has an editorial position at the newspaper.<,>她在报社担任编辑职位。<,>edit(编辑)+orial→与编辑有关的<,>editor(n.编辑)/edition(n.版本)/education(n.教育)

resume<,>/rɪˈzjuːm/<,>/rɪˈzum/<,>vt.重新开始/vt.继续/vt.恢复/n.摘要/n.概要/n.简历<,>Let's resume our discussion after lunch.<,>我们午饭后继续讨论。<,>Please send your resume to the HR department.<,>请将你的简历发送至人力资源部。<,>Traffic resumed after the accident was cleared.<,>事故清理完毕后交通恢复了。<,>re(重新)+sume(拿)→重新拿起→继续<,>assume(v.假定)/consume(v.消耗)/presume(v.推测)

rebuild<,>/ˌriːˈbɪld/<,>/ˌriˈbɪld/<,>v.重建/v.改造/v.复原<,>They plan to rebuild the old theater.<,>他们计划重建这座老剧院。<,>After the earthquake, the city took years to rebuild.<,>地震后，这座城市花了数年时间重建。<,>He's trying to rebuild his reputation.<,>他正在努力重建自己的声誉。<,>re(重新)+build(建造)→重新建造<,>build(v.建造)/rebuke(v.斥责)/rebound(v.弹回)

committee<,>/kəˈmɪti/<,>/kəˈmɪti/<,>n.委员会/n.全体委员<,>The committee will meet next Tuesday.<,>委员会将于下周二开会。<,>She was elected to the finance committee.<,>她被选入财务委员会。<,>The committee members have different opinions.<,>委员会成员有不同的意见。<,>commit(委托)+ee(人)→被委托的人→委员会<,>commission(n.委员会)/commute(v.通勤)/commitment(n.承诺)

namely<,>/ˈneɪmli/<,>/ˈnemli/<,>adv.即/adv.也就是<,>Three students were absent, namely Tom, Jack and Mary.<,>三名学生缺席，即汤姆、杰克和玛丽。<,>We visited two cities, namely London and Paris.<,>我们游览了两座城市，即伦敦和巴黎。<,>The company produces three products, namely A, B and C.<,>公司生产三种产品，即A、B和C。<,>name(名字)+ly→具体说出名字→即<,>name(n.名字)/mainly(adv.主要地)/namely(adv.即)
artistic<,>/ɑːˈtɪstɪk/<,>/ɑrˈtɪstɪk/<,>adj.艺术的/adj.艺术家的/adj.富有艺术性的/adj.精美的/adj.精彩的<,>She has an artistic talent for painting.<,>她有绘画的艺术天赋。<,>The gallery displayed his artistic creations.<,>画廊展出了他的艺术创作。<,>Her performance was truly artistic.<,>她的表演非常精彩。<,>art(艺术)+istic(形容词后缀)→艺术的<,>artistic(adj.艺术的)/artificial(adj.人造的)/artistic(adj.艺术的)

union<,>/ˈjuːniən/<,>/ˈjunjən/<,>n.工会/n.联盟/n.联合/n.团结/n.一致<,>The workers formed a union to protect their rights.<,>工人们组建了工会来保护他们的权利。<,>The union of the two companies created a powerful entity.<,>两家公司的联合形成了一个强大的实体。<,>There was a union of opinion among the members.<,>成员们意见一致。<,>uni(单一)+on(名词后缀)→联合<,>union(n.工会)/unison(n.一致)/unique(adj.独特的)

plentiful<,>/ˈplentɪfl/<,>/ˈplɛntɪfəl/<,>adj.丰富的/adj.充足的/adj.大量的<,>The harvest was plentiful this year.<,>今年的收成很丰富。<,>There is a plentiful supply of fresh water.<,>有充足的淡水供应。<,>She had a plentiful amount of energy.<,>她精力充沛。<,>plenty(丰富)+ful(形容词后缀)→丰富的<,>plentiful(adj.丰富的)/plenty(n.大量)/plenteous(adj.丰富的)

halt<,>/hɔːlt/<,>/hɔlt/<,>vt.停止/n.停住<,>The train came to a halt at the station.<,>火车在车站停了下来。<,>The project was halted due to lack of funds.<,>由于资金不足，项目被叫停了。<,>He halted his speech to take a sip of water.<,>他停下来喝了口水。<,>hal(停止)+t→停止<,>halt(vt.停止)/halt(n.停住)/halt(vi.踌躇)

component<,>/kəmˈpəʊnənt/<,>/kəmˈpoʊnənt/<,>adj.组成的/adj.构成的/n.组成部分/n.部件/n.组件<,>Each component of the machine is essential.<,>机器的每个部件都很重要。<,>She studied the component parts of the system.<,>她研究了系统的组成部分。<,>The software has several key components.<,>这个软件有几个关键组件。<,>com(共同)+pon(放置)+ent(形容词后缀)→组成的<,>component(n.组件)/compose(vt.组成)/compound(n.化合物)

consultant<,>/kənˈsʌltənt/<,>/kənˈsʌltənt/<,>n.顾问/n.会诊医师/n.专科医生<,>He works as a business consultant.<,>他是一名商业顾问。<,>The consultant gave valuable advice.<,>顾问给出了宝贵的建议。<,>She is a consultant in pediatric medicine.<,>她是一名儿科医生顾问。<,>consult(咨询)+ant(名词后缀)→顾问<,>consultant(n.顾问)/consult(vt.咨询)/consultation(n.咨询)

sunset<,>/ˈsʌnset/<,>/ˈsʌnˌsɛt/<,>n.日落/n.晚霞<,>We watched the sunset at the beach.<,>我们在海滩上看了日落。<,>The sky was painted with beautiful sunset colors.<,>天空被美丽的晚霞染上了颜色。<,>The sunset marked the end of a perfect day.<,>日落标志着完美一天的结束。<,>sun(太阳)+set(落下)→日落<,>sunset(n.日落)/sunrise(n.日出)/sunshine(n.阳光)

obvious<,>/ˈɒbviəs/<,>/ˈɑbviəs/<,>adj.明显的<,>It was obvious that he was lying.<,>很明显他在撒谎。<,>The solution to the problem was obvious.<,>问题的解决方案很明显。<,>She made an obvious mistake.<,>她犯了一个明显的错误。<,>ob(在...上)+vi(路)+ous(形容词后缀)→明显的<,>obvious(adj.明显的)/oblivious(adj.健忘的)/obvious(adj.明显的)

illustration<,>/ˌɪləˈstreɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪləˈstreɪʃən/<,>n.说明/n.图解/n.例证<,>The book contains many illustrations.<,>这本书有许多图解。<,>He used an illustration to explain his point.<,>他用一个例证来解释他的观点。<,>The illustration helped clarify the concept.<,>这个说明帮助澄清了概念。<,>il(在...上)+lustr(光)+ation(名词后缀)→说明<,>illustration(n.说明)/illustrate(vt.说明)/illustrious(adj.杰出的)

disguise<,>/dɪsˈɡaɪz/<,>/dɪsˈɡaɪz/<,>vt.假扮/vt.化装/vt.伪装/vt.掩盖/vt.掩饰/n.用来伪装的东西/n.伪装/n.掩饰<,>He disguised himself as a waiter.<,>他假扮成一名服务员。<,>She tried to disguise her disappointment.<,>她试图掩饰自己的失望。<,>The spy wore a clever disguise.<,>间谍穿着巧妙的伪装。<,>dis(不)+guise(外表)→伪装<,>disguise(vt.伪装)/disgust(n.厌恶)/disguise(vt.伪装)
wrap<,>/ræp/<,>/ræp/<,>vt.裹/vt.包/vt.捆/n.披肩<,>She wrapped the gift in colorful paper.<,>她用彩纸把礼物包了起来。<,>He wore a warm wrap against the cold wind.<,>他披了件披肩抵御寒风。<,>Please wrap these books together with a string.<,>请用绳子把这些书捆在一起。<,>wr(缠绕)+ap→包裹<,>rap(n.说唱/v.敲击)/trap(n.陷阱/v.诱捕)

surgery<,>/ˈsɜːdʒəri/<,>/ˈsɜːrdʒəri/<,>n.外科/n.外科手术/n.手术室<,>The patient was taken to surgery immediately.<,>病人立即被送进了手术室。<,>He specializes in heart surgery.<,>他专攻心脏外科手术。<,>She underwent a three-hour surgery.<,>她经历了一场三小时的手术。<,>sur(上)+gery(工作)→在身体上工作→外科手术<,>surge(n.汹涌/v.激增)/sergeant(n.警官/n.军士)

violent<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>/ˈvaɪələnt/<,>adj.暴力引起的/adj.暴力的/adj.猛烈的/adj.剧烈的<,>The movie contains violent scenes.<,>这部电影包含暴力场景。<,>A violent storm damaged many houses.<,>猛烈的暴风雨毁坏了许多房屋。<,>He died a violent death.<,>他死于暴力。<,>viol(力量)+ent→暴力的<,>violet(n.紫罗兰/adj.紫色的)/silent(adj.安静的)

harmony<,>/ˈhɑːməni/<,>/ˈhɑːrməni/<,>n.调和/n.协调/n.和谐<,>The choir sang in perfect harmony.<,>合唱团唱得非常和谐。<,>We need to live in harmony with nature.<,>我们需要与自然和谐相处。<,>The colors are in harmony with each other.<,>这些颜色相互协调。<,>harmon(和谐)+y→和谐<,>armory(n.军械库)/harmonica(n.口琴)

resolve<,>/rɪˈzɒlv/<,>/rɪˈzɑːlv/<,>n&v.解决/n&v.解答/n&v.决定/n&v.决意<,>We must resolve this issue quickly.<,>我们必须迅速解决这个问题。<,>She resolved to study harder.<,>她决心更加努力学习。<,>The committee passed a resolution to resolve the dispute.<,>委员会通过了一项决议来解决争端。<,>re(再)+solve(解决)→解决<,>dissolve(v.溶解)/absolve(v.免除)

chill<,>/tʃɪl/<,>/tʃɪl/<,>v.变冷/v.感到冷/n.寒冷/n.寒气/n.风寒/n.寒战<,>There's a chill in the air this morning.<,>今天早上空气中有一丝寒意。<,>I caught a chill from being out in the rain.<,>我在雨中淋雨感冒了。<,>Let the soup chill in the refrigerator.<,>让汤在冰箱里冷却。<,>ch(冷)+ill(病)→寒冷<,>hill(n.小山)/child(n.孩子)

confront<,>/kənˈfrʌnt/<,>/kənˈfrʌnt/<,>vt.迎面遇到/vt.遭遇/vt.勇敢地面对/vt.正视/vt.使对质/vt.使当面对证<,>We must confront these challenges bravely.<,>我们必须勇敢面对这些挑战。<,>He was confronted with evidence of his crime.<,>他面对着自己犯罪的证据。<,>The two rivals confronted each other in the debate.<,>两个对手在辩论中对质。<,>con(共同)+front(前面)→共同面对→对抗<,>comfort(n.舒适/v.安慰)/confuse(v.混淆)

dominate<,>/ˈdɒmɪneɪt/<,>/ˈdɑːmɪneɪt/<,>vi.拥有优势/vt.在...中占首要地位/vt.支配/vt.统治/vt.控制/vt.耸立于/vt.俯视<,>The castle dominates the city skyline.<,>城堡耸立在城市天际线上。<,>One company dominates the smartphone market.<,>一家公司主导着智能手机市场。<,>He tends to dominate every conversation.<,>他倾向于主导每一次谈话。<,>domin(主人)+ate→成为主人→支配<,>donate(v.捐赠)/dominion(n.主权)

imitate<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>/ˈɪmɪteɪt/<,>vt.模仿/vt.仿效/vt.仿制<,>Children often imitate their parents' behavior.<,>孩子们经常模仿父母的行为。<,>This painting imitates the style of Van Gogh.<,>这幅画模仿了梵高的风格。<,>Some birds can imitate human speech.<,>有些鸟能模仿人类说话。<,>imit(相似)+ate→使相似→模仿<,>intimate(adj.亲密的)/immediate(adj.立即的)
faithful<,>/ˈfeɪθfəl/<,>/ˈfeɪθfəl/<,>adj.忠诚的/adj.如实的/adj.尽职的<,>He has been a faithful friend for many years.<,>多年来他一直是个忠诚的朋友。<,>She gave a faithful account of the incident.<,>她对事件做了如实的描述。<,>The dog remained faithful to its owner until the end.<,>这只狗对主人忠心耿耿直到最后。<,>faith(信仰)+ful(充满)→充满信仰的→忠诚的<,>faithless(adj.不忠的)/truthful(adj.诚实的)  

reproduce<,>/ˌriːprəˈdjuːs/<,>/ˌriːprəˈduːs/<,>v.复制/v.再现/v.繁殖/v.生殖<,>Scientists are trying to reproduce the experiment.<,>科学家们正试图复制这个实验。<,>The painting reproduces the original scene perfectly.<,>这幅画完美再现了原始场景。<,>These animals reproduce rapidly in warm climates.<,>这些动物在温暖气候下繁殖很快。<,>re(再)+produce(生产)→再生产→复制<,>produce(v.生产/n.农产品)/reduce(v.减少)  

institution<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtjuːʃən/<,>/ˌɪnstɪˈtuːʃən/<,>n.协会/n.制度/n.习俗<,>Harvard is a prestigious educational institution.<,>哈佛是一所享有盛誉的教育机构。<,>Marriage is an important social institution.<,>婚姻是一项重要的社会制度。<,>The bank is a well-established financial institution.<,>这家银行是一家历史悠久的金融机构。<,>in(在...里)+stitut(建立)+ion→建立起来的组织→机构<,>constitution(n.宪法)/substitution(n.替代)  

pad<,>/pæd/<,>/pæd/<,>n.垫/n.衬垫/n.便笺本/n.发射台/vt.填塞<,>She put a knee pad on before skating.<,>滑冰前她戴上了护膝。<,>I need a writing pad to take notes.<,>我需要一个便笺本做笔记。<,>The rocket was launched from the pad.<,>火箭从发射台发射升空。<,>与"bad"(坏的)对比记忆<,>paddle(n.桨)/pedal(n.踏板)  

provocation<,>/ˌprɒvəˈkeɪʃən/<,>/ˌprɑːvəˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.激怒/n.刺激/n.挑衅/n.挑拨<,>His rude remarks were a provocation.<,>他粗鲁的言论是一种挑衅。<,>The protest was in response to police provocation.<,>这次抗议是对警方挑衅的回应。<,>She remained calm despite the provocation.<,>尽管受到挑衅，她仍保持冷静。<,>pro(向前)+voc(喊叫)+ation→向前喊叫→挑衅<,>provoke(v.激怒)/evocation(n.唤起)  

ambition<,>/æmˈbɪʃən/<,>/æmˈbɪʃən/<,>n.雄心/n.抱负/n.野心/n.期望得到的东西<,>Her ambition is to become a doctor.<,>她的抱负是成为一名医生。<,>He has great ambitions for his company.<,>他对公司怀有远大抱负。<,>Political ambition drove him to run for office.<,>政治野心驱使他竞选公职。<,>ambi(周围)+tion→想要环绕一切→野心<,>ambiguous(adj.模糊的)/ambient(adj.周围的)  

scholarship<,>/ˈskɒləʃɪp/<,>/ˈskɑːlərʃɪp/<,>n.奖学金/n.学问/n.学识<,>She won a scholarship to study abroad.<,>她获得了出国留学的奖学金。<,>His work shows deep scholarship.<,>他的作品显示出深厚的学识。<,>The university offers various scholarships.<,>该大学提供多种奖学金。<,>scholar(学者)+ship(状态)→学者的状态→学识<,>fellowship(n.友谊)/leadership(n.领导)  

exceed<,>/ɪkˈsiːd/<,>/ɪkˈsiːd/<,>vt.超过/vt.胜过/vt.超出<,>His performance exceeded our expectations.<,>他的表现超出了我们的预期。<,>The speed limit must not be exceeded.<,>不得超过限速。<,>Demand exceeds supply in this market.<,>这个市场供不应求。<,>ex(出)+ceed(走)→走出去→超过<,>proceed(v.进行)/recede(v.后退)  

besides<,>/bɪˈsaɪdz/<,>/bɪˈsaɪdz/<,>adv.而且/prep.除...之外<,>Besides English, she speaks French fluently.<,>除了英语，她还能流利说法语。<,>I don't want to go; besides, I'm too tired.<,>我不想去；而且，我太累了。<,>Besides the main course, we ordered dessert.<,>除了主菜，我们还点了甜点。<,>beside(在旁边)+s→在旁边还有→而且<,>beside(prep.在...旁边)/aside(adv.在旁边)  

preposition<,>/ˌprepəˈzɪʃən/<,>/ˌprepəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.介词<,>"In" and "on" are common prepositions.<,>"In"和"on"是常用介词。<,>The word is used as a preposition in this sentence.<,>这个词在这个句子中用作介词。<,>Prepositions show relationships between words.<,>介词表示词语之间的关系。<,>pre(前)+position(位置)→放在前面的词→介词<,>proposition(n.提议)/composition(n.作文)
enlarge<,>/ɪnˈlɑːdʒ/<,>/ɪnˈlɑːrdʒ/<,>vt.扩大/vt.扩展/vt.放大<,>They decided to enlarge the kitchen to create more space.<,>他们决定扩大厨房以创造更多空间。<,>Reading can enlarge your knowledge.<,>阅读可以扩展你的知识。<,>Please enlarge the text so I can read it better.<,>请放大文本以便我能更好地阅读。<,>en(使)+large(大)→使变大→扩大<,>expand(v.扩展)/extend(v.延伸)/magnify(v.放大)

murder<,>/ˈmɜːdə(r)/<,>/ˈmɜːrdər/<,>n.谋杀/n.凶杀/n.谋杀罪/v.谋杀/v.杀害<,>The detective is investigating the murder case.<,>侦探正在调查这起谋杀案。<,>He was charged with murder.<,>他被指控犯有谋杀罪。<,>It's cruel to murder innocent animals.<,>杀害无辜的动物是残忍的。<,>mur(死)+der→谋杀<,>suicide(n.自杀)/homicide(n.杀人)/assassinate(v.暗杀)

pat<,>/pæt/<,>/pæt/<,>adj.非常恰当的/adj.适时的/n.轻拍<,>Her answer was pat and to the point.<,>她的回答非常恰当且切中要点。<,>Give the dog a pat on the head.<,>轻轻拍拍狗的头。<,>The timing of your arrival was pat.<,>你到达的时机非常恰当。<,>拟声词，拍打的声音<,>tap(v.轻拍)/pet(n.宠物)/pad(n.垫子)

fantasy<,>/ˈfæntəsi/<,>/ˈfæntəsi/<,>n.想象/n.幻想/n.想象的产物<,>Children often live in a world of fantasy.<,>孩子们常常生活在幻想的世界里。<,>The novel is full of fantasy elements.<,>这部小说充满了幻想元素。<,>Don't confuse fantasy with reality.<,>不要把幻想和现实混淆。<,>fan(迷)+tasy→让人着迷的东西→幻想<,>fancy(n.幻想)/fantastic(adj.极好的)/phantasy(n.幻想)

horsepower<,>/ˈhɔːspaʊə(r)/<,>/ˈhɔːrspaʊər/<,>n.马力<,>This car has 200 horsepower.<,>这辆车有200马力。<,>Horsepower is a unit of power measurement.<,>马力是功率的计量单位。<,>The engine's horsepower determines its performance.<,>发动机的马力决定了它的性能。<,>horse(马)+power(力量)→马力<,>watt(n.瓦特)/energy(n.能量)/torque(n.扭矩)

visibility<,>/ˌvɪzəˈbɪləti/<,>/ˌvɪzəˈbɪləti/<,>n.可见度/n.能见度/n.可见性/n.明显性<,>The fog reduced visibility on the road.<,>大雾降低了道路上的能见度。<,>High visibility clothing is important for safety.<,>高可见性服装对安全很重要。<,>The stars have good visibility tonight.<,>今晚星星的可见度很好。<,>vis(看)+ibility(能力)→能见度<,>vision(n.视力)/visual(adj.视觉的)/invisible(adj.不可见的)

invitation<,>/ˌɪnvɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌɪnvɪˈteɪʃn/<,>n.邀请/n.招待/n.请柬/n.吸引/n.诱惑<,>I received an invitation to the wedding.<,>我收到了婚礼的邀请。<,>The job offer was an invitation to a better life.<,>这份工作邀请通向更好的生活。<,>The open door was an invitation to thieves.<,>敞开的门对小偷是一种诱惑。<,>in(内)+vit(生命)+ation→邀请进入生活<,>invite(v.邀请)/visitation(n.访问)/provocation(n.挑衅)
paw<,>/pɔː/<,>/pɔ/<,>v.用爪子抓/v.用蹄扒/v.翻找/n.爪子<,>The cat pawed at the toy mouse.<,>猫用爪子抓玩具老鼠。<,>He pawed through his bag looking for his keys.<,>他在包里翻找钥匙。<,>The dog left muddy paw prints on the floor.<,>狗在地板上留下了泥爪印。<,>paw与saw(锯子)形似<,>claw(n.爪/v.抓)/hoof(n.蹄)/talon(n.猛禽的爪)

enormous<,>/ɪˈnɔːməs/<,>/ɪˈnɔːrməs/<,>adj.巨大的/adj.庞大的<,>They live in an enormous house.<,>他们住在一栋巨大的房子里。<,>The project required an enormous amount of time.<,>这个项目需要大量的时间。<,>She has an enormous collection of stamps.<,>她有大量的邮票收藏。<,>e(出)+norm(标准)+ous→超出标准→巨大的<,>immense(adj.极大的)/tremendous(adj.巨大的)/gigantic(adj.庞大的)

moisture<,>/ˈmɔɪstʃə(r)/<,>/ˈmɔɪstʃər/<,>n.潮湿/n.湿气<,>The plants need moisture to grow.<,>植物需要水分才能生长。<,>There was moisture on the bathroom mirror.<,>浴室镜子上有水汽。<,>The desert air contains very little moisture.<,>沙漠空气中的水分很少。<,>moist(潮湿的)+ure(名词后缀)→潮湿<,>humidity(n.湿度)/dampness(n.潮湿)/aridity(n.干燥)

toast<,>/təʊst/<,>/toʊst/<,>n.烤面包/n.祝酒词/vt.烘/vt.烤/vt.向...祝酒<,>I had toast and jam for breakfast.<,>我早餐吃了烤面包和果酱。<,>Let's toast to your success!<,>让我们为你的成功干杯！<,>She toasted the bread until it was golden brown.<,>她把面包烤至金黄色。<,>to(向)+ast(看作fast快)→快速加热→烤面包<,>roast(v.烤)/boast(v.自夸)/coast(n.海岸)
