cheerful<,>/ˈtʃɪəfl/<,>/ˈtʃɪrfl/<,>adj.快乐的/adj.愉快的/adj.使人感到愉快的<,>She has a cheerful personality.<,>她性格开朗。<,>The cheerful music lifted everyone's spirits.<,>欢快的音乐让每个人都精神振奋。<,>He gave a cheerful smile.<,>他露出了愉快的微笑。<,>cheer(欢呼)+ful(充满)→充满欢呼的→快乐的<,>cheerless(adj.阴郁的)/cheer(n.欢呼/v.鼓舞)

merit<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>/ˈmerɪt/<,>n.长处/n.优点/n.价值/n.功劳/n.成绩/v.值得/v.应受<,>His work has great merit.<,>他的工作很有价值。<,>She received a prize for her merits.<,>她因成绩优异而获奖。<,>The idea merits further discussion.<,>这个想法值得进一步讨论。<,>mer(值得)+it→值得的东西→优点<,>demerit(n.缺点)/merry(adj.愉快的)

misunderstand<,>/ˌmɪsʌndəˈstænd/<,>/ˌmɪsʌndərˈstænd/<,>v.误解/v.误会<,>Don't misunderstand me; I'm not blaming you.<,>别误会，我不是在责怪你。<,>There was a misunderstanding between them.<,>他们之间产生了误会。<,>I think you misunderstood what I said.<,>我想你误解了我的话。<,>mis(错误)+understand(理解)→错误理解→误解<,>misinterpret(v.曲解)/mislead(v.误导)

guilty<,>/ˈɡɪlti/<,>/ˈɡɪlti/<,>adj.内疚的/adj.有罪的<,>He felt guilty about lying to his friend.<,>他对向朋友撒谎感到内疚。<,>The jury found him guilty.<,>陪审团裁定他有罪。<,>She had a guilty conscience.<,>她良心不安。<,>guilt(罪责)+y(形容词后缀)→有罪的<,>gilt(n.镀金)/guild(n.协会)

measure<,>/ˈmeʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmeʒər/<,>v.测量/v.度量/v.衡量/n.分量/n.尺寸/n.量具/n.计量单位/n.量度/n.测量/n.措施/n.办法<,>We need to measure the room before buying furniture.<,>买家具前我们需要测量房间。<,>The government has taken measures to reduce pollution.<,>政府已采取措施减少污染。<,>Success cannot be measured by money alone.<,>成功不能仅用金钱来衡量。<,>meas(测量)+ure→测量<,>treasure(n.财富/v.珍视)/pleasure(n.愉快)

overall<,>/ˌəʊvərˈɔːl/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈɔːl/<,>adj.全面的/adj.总体的/adj.全部的<,>The overall situation is improving.<,>总体情况正在改善。<,>She has overall responsibility for the project.<,>她对项目负全部责任。<,>The overall cost was higher than expected.<,>总成本比预期高。<,>over(超过)+all(全部)→超过全部的→全面的<,>overlook(v.忽视)/overhaul(v.彻底检修)

receipt<,>/rɪˈsiːt/<,>/rɪˈsiːt/<,>n.发票/n.收据/n.收入/n.进款/n.收到/n.接到<,>Please keep your receipt in case you need to return the item.<,>请保留收据以防需要退货。<,>The receipt of the payment was confirmed.<,>付款已确认收到。<,>He signed the receipt for the package.<,>他签收了包裹。<,>re(回)+ceipt(拿)→拿回的东西→收据<,>reception(n.接待)/conceit(n.自负)
assume<,>/əˈsjuːm/<,>/əˈsuːm/<,>vt.假定/vt.假设/vt.臆断/vt.承担/vt.担任/vt.呈现<,>Let's assume that the meeting will be postponed.<,>我们假设会议会被推迟。<,>She assumed the role of team leader last month.<,>她上个月承担了团队领导的角色。<,>The situation assumed a new dimension after the press conference.<,>新闻发布会后情况出现了新的变化。<,>as(加强)+sume(拿)→拿住→承担<,>presume(vt.假定/vt.推测)/consume(vt.消耗/vt.消费)/resume(vt.恢复/vt.重新开始)

pepper<,>/ˈpepə(r)/<,>/ˈpɛpɚ/<,>n.胡椒/n.胡椒粉/vt.在…上撒/vt.使布满<,>Add some pepper to the soup for extra flavor.<,>往汤里加些胡椒粉提味。<,>The chef peppered the steak with herbs.<,>厨师在牛排上撒满了香草。<,>His speech was peppered with jokes.<,>他的演讲中穿插了许多笑话。<,>pep(活力)+per→给食物增添活力的调料<,>paper(n.纸张)/peeper(n.偷窥者)/peppery(adj.胡椒味的/adj.辛辣的)

plural<,>/ˈplʊərəl/<,>/ˈplʊrəl/<,>adj.复数的/n.复数<,>"Children" is the plural form of "child".<,>"children"是"child"的复数形式。<,>Some nouns have irregular plural forms.<,>有些名词有不规则的复数形式。<,>The verb should agree with the plural subject.<,>动词应该与复数主语保持一致。<,>plu(多)+ral→表示多个的<,>singular(adj.单数的/n.单数)/pluralism(n.多元主义)/plurality(n.复数/n.多数)

doctoral<,>/ˈdɒktərəl/<,>/ˈdɑːktərəl/<,>adj.博士的<,>She is working on her doctoral thesis.<,>她正在撰写她的博士论文。<,>He received his doctoral degree last year.<,>他去年获得了博士学位。<,>The university offers doctoral programs in various fields.<,>该大学提供多个领域的博士课程。<,>doctor(博士)+al(形容词后缀)→博士的<,>doctorate(n.博士学位)/doctoral(adj.博士的)/doctrinaire(adj.教条主义的)

concept<,>/ˈkɒnsept/<,>/ˈkɑːnsept/<,>n.概念/n.观念/n.设想<,>The concept of time varies in different cultures.<,>时间的概念在不同文化中有所不同。<,>He has a clear concept of what he wants to achieve.<,>他对自己想要实现的目标有清晰的概念。<,>The new product is based on an innovative concept.<,>这个新产品基于一个创新的理念。<,>con(共同)+cept(拿)→共同抓住的想法→概念<,>conception(n.概念/n.构想)/precept(n.规则/n.训导)/except(prep.除...之外)

resistant<,>/rɪˈzɪstənt/<,>/rɪˈzɪstənt/<,>adj.抵抗的/adj.抗…的/adj.耐…的<,>This material is heat resistant.<,>这种材料是耐热的。<,>Some bacteria have become resistant to antibiotics.<,>一些细菌对抗生素产生了抗药性。<,>He was resistant to the new changes at first.<,>他最初对新变化持抵制态度。<,>re(反)+sist(站)+ant→站在对立面的→抵抗的<,>resistance(n.抵抗/n.阻力)/persistent(adj.坚持的/adj.持续的)/insistent(adj.坚持的/adj.紧急的)

effort<,>/ˈefət/<,>/ˈefərt/<,>n.努力/n.努力的成果<,>She made a great effort to finish the project on time.<,>她付出了巨大努力按时完成项目。<,>Teamwork requires joint efforts.<,>团队合作需要共同努力。<,>His efforts finally paid off with a promotion.<,>他的努力最终以晋升得到了回报。<,>ef(出)+fort(力量)→使出力量→努力<,>afford(vt.负担得起)/comfort(n.舒适/vt.安慰)/fort(n.堡垒)

video<,>/ˈvɪdiəʊ/<,>/ˈvɪdioʊ/<,>adj.录像的/adj.电视的/n.录像<,>We watched a video of the wedding.<,>我们观看了婚礼的录像。<,>The video quality is excellent.<,>视频质量非常好。<,>She works in the video production industry.<,>她在视频制作行业工作。<,>vid(看)+eo→可以看的→录像<,>audio(n.音频)/visual(adj.视觉的)/vivid(adj.生动的)

disaster<,>/dɪˈzɑːstə(r)/<,>/dɪˈzæstɚ/<,>n.灾难/n.灾祸/n.天灾/n.彻底的失败<,>The earthquake was a major disaster for the region.<,>地震对该地区是一场重大灾难。<,>The party turned out to be a complete disaster.<,>派对结果彻底搞砸了。<,>Poor planning led to a financial disaster.<,>糟糕的规划导致了财务灾难。<,>dis(坏)+aster(星星)→星位不正→灾难<,>catastrophe(n.大灾难)/calamity(n.灾难)/misfortune(n.不幸)

agriculture<,>/ˈæɡrɪkʌltʃə(r)/<,>/ˈæɡrɪkʌltʃɚ/<,>n.农业/n.农学<,>Modern agriculture relies heavily on technology.<,>现代农业高度依赖技术。<,>He studied agriculture at university.<,>他在大学学习农学。<,>Agriculture is the main industry in this area.<,>农业是该地区的主要产业。<,>agri(田地)+cult(耕种)+ure→耕种田地→农业<,>horticulture(n.园艺)/aquaculture(n.水产养殖)/arboriculture(n.树木栽培)
weapon<,>/ˈwepən/<,>/ˈwɛpən/<,>n.武器/n.兵器<,>He was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon.<,>他因携带隐蔽武器被捕。<,>Nuclear weapons pose a threat to global security.<,>核武器对全球安全构成威胁。<,>The soldier cleaned his weapon carefully.<,>士兵仔细地擦拭他的武器。<,>weap(战争)+on(名词后缀)→战争工具→武器<,>wagon(n.货车)/warp(v.弯曲/n.扭曲)

grocer<,>/ˈɡrəʊsə(r)/<,>/ˈɡroʊsər/<,>n.食品商/n.杂货商<,>I need to stop by the grocer's to buy some milk.<,>我得顺路去杂货店买些牛奶。<,>The local grocer knows all his customers by name.<,>当地的杂货商能叫出所有顾客的名字。<,>She opened a small grocer shop in the neighborhood.<,>她在附近开了一家小杂货店。<,>groc(大量)+er(人)→卖大量商品的人→杂货商<,>groove(n.凹槽)/gross(adj.总的/n.总额)

stare<,>/steə(r)/<,>/stɛr/<,>n.盯/vi.凝视<,>It's rude to stare at people.<,>盯着别人看是不礼貌的。<,>She stared at the painting for a long time.<,>她盯着那幅画看了很久。<,>The cat stared at the moving shadow.<,>猫凝视着移动的影子。<,>star(星星)+e→像星星一样注视→凝视<,>glare(v.怒视/n.强光)/spare(v.节省/adj.多余的)

painful<,>/ˈpeɪnfl/<,>/ˈpeɪnfəl/<,>adj.疼痛的/adj.引起疼痛的/adj.困难的/adj.令人不快的<,>The wound is still painful after a week.<,>一周后伤口仍然疼痛。<,>It was a painful decision to leave her hometown.<,>离开家乡是个痛苦的决定。<,>The memories are too painful to talk about.<,>这些回忆太痛苦了无法谈论。<,>pain(疼痛)+ful(形容词后缀)→疼痛的<,>painless(adj.无痛的)/gainful(adj.有收益的)

vote<,>/vəʊt/<,>/voʊt/<,>v.投票/v.表决/n.票/n.选票/n.选举/n.投票/n.表决/n.表决结果/n.投票总数<,>Citizens over 18 have the right to vote.<,>18岁以上的公民有投票权。<,>The vote was unanimous in favor of the proposal.<,>投票一致赞成该提案。<,>She cast her vote for the independent candidate.<,>她把票投给了独立候选人。<,>vot(发誓)+e→通过发誓表达选择→投票<,>veto(v.否决/n.否决权)/volt(n.伏特)

steady<,>/ˈstedi/<,>/ˈstɛdi/<,>vi.稳定/adj.稳的/adj.平稳的/adj.稳定的/adj.持续的/adj.稳固的<,>Hold the ladder steady while I climb up.<,>我爬上去时扶稳梯子。<,>She has a steady job at the bank.<,>她在银行有份稳定的工作。<,>His breathing became steady after the panic attack.<,>恐慌发作后他的呼吸变得平稳。<,>stead(位置)+y(形容词后缀)→保持位置的→稳定的<,>ready(adj.准备好的)/study(v.学习/n.研究)

enhance<,>/ɪnˈhɑːns/<,>/ɪnˈhæns/<,>vt.提高/vt.增加/vt.加强<,>Good lighting can enhance the appearance of a room.<,>良好的照明能提升房间的外观。<,>This training will enhance your career prospects.<,>这次培训将提升你的职业前景。<,>The software update enhances system performance.<,>软件更新提高了系统性能。<,>en(使)+hance(高)→使变高→提高<,>entrance(n.入口)/enhancer(n.增强剂)

enclose<,>/ɪnˈkləʊz/<,>/ɪnˈkloʊz/<,>vt.围住/vt.圈起/vt.附上/vt.把...装入信封<,>Please find enclosed a copy of my resume.<,>随信附上我的简历一份。<,>The garden is enclosed by a high fence.<,>花园被高篱笆围住。<,>Don't forget to enclose the payment with your application.<,>别忘了随申请附上付款。<,>en(使)+close(关闭)→使关闭→围住<,>disclose(v.揭露)/enclosure(n.围场)

convention<,>/kənˈvenʃn/<,>/kənˈvɛnʃən/<,>n.习俗/n.惯例/n.公约/n.会议<,>It's a social convention to shake hands when meeting.<,>见面握手是社会习俗。<,>The Geneva Convention protects prisoners of war.<,>日内瓦公约保护战俘。<,>The annual convention will be held in Chicago.<,>年度会议将在芝加哥举行。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ion→大家共同来遵守的→惯例<,>invention(n.发明)/intervention(n.干预)

disease<,>/dɪˈziːz/<,>/dɪˈziz/<,>n.病/n.疾病/n.不健全/n.弊端<,>Heart disease is a leading cause of death.<,>心脏病是主要死亡原因之一。<,>The doctor specializes in infectious diseases.<,>这位医生专攻传染病。<,>Corruption is a disease in our society.<,>腐败是我们社会的弊端。<,>dis(不)+ease(舒适)→不舒适→疾病<,>decease(n.死亡)/decrease(v.减少)
center<,>/ˈsentə(r)/<,>/ˈsɛntər/<,>n.圆心/n.正中/n.中心<,>The statue is in the center of the square.<,>雕像位于广场的中心。<,>She placed the vase at the center of the table.<,>她把花瓶放在桌子的正中央。<,>The city is a major cultural center.<,>这座城市是一个重要的文化中心。<,>cent(百)+er→古罗马百人队会议的地方→中心<,>scent(n.气味/v.嗅到)/canter(n.慢跑/v.使慢跑)

suspicion<,>/səˈspɪʃn/<,>/səˈspɪʃən/<,>n.怀疑/n.疑心/n.猜疑/n.一点儿/n.少量<,>He was arrested on suspicion of theft.<,>他因涉嫌盗窃被捕。<,>There was a suspicion of a smile on her face.<,>她脸上露出一丝微笑。<,>I have a suspicion that he's lying.<,>我怀疑他在撒谎。<,>sus(在...下面)+pic(看)+ion→在下面看→怀疑<,>suspension(n.暂停/n.悬浮)/supposition(n.假定/n.推测)

purchase<,>/ˈpɜːtʃəs/<,>/ˈpɜːrtʃəs/<,>vt.买/vt.购买/n.购买/n.购买的物品<,>She purchased a new car last week.<,>她上周买了一辆新车。<,>Keep your receipt as proof of purchase.<,>保留收据作为购买凭证。<,>The purchases were delivered this morning.<,>购买的物品今早送到了。<,>pur(完全)+chase(追逐)→完全追逐→购买<,>pursue(v.追求/v.追赶)/purpose(n.目的/n.意图)

refusal<,>/rɪˈfjuːzl/<,>/rɪˈfjuːzəl/<,>n.拒绝<,>His refusal to help surprised me.<,>他拒绝帮忙让我很惊讶。<,>She gave a flat refusal to their proposal.<,>她断然拒绝了他们的提议。<,>The company's refusal led to a lawsuit.<,>公司的拒绝导致了诉讼。<,>re(反)+fus(流)+al→倒流→拒绝<,>refuse(v.拒绝/n.垃圾)/refuel(v.加燃料)

technician<,>/tekˈnɪʃn/<,>/tɛkˈnɪʃən/<,>n.技术员/n.技师<,>The technician repaired my computer quickly.<,>技术员很快修好了我的电脑。<,>She works as a laboratory technician.<,>她是一名实验室技术员。<,>We need to hire more skilled technicians.<,>我们需要雇佣更多熟练的技术人员。<,>techn(技术)+ician(人)→技术人员<,>technical(adj.技术的)/technology(n.技术)

generic<,>/dʒəˈnerɪk/<,>/dʒəˈnɛrɪk/<,>adj.属的/adj.类的/adj.一般的/adj.普通的<,>This is just a generic brand of medicine.<,>这只是普通品牌的药。<,>The report was full of generic statements.<,>报告中充满了泛泛而谈的陈述。<,>He gave a generic answer to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了一个笼统的回答。<,>gen(种类)+eric→属于某类的<,>genetic(adj.遗传的)/generous(adj.慷慨的)

genius<,>/ˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ˈdʒinjəs/<,>n.天才/n.天赋/n.天资/n.天才人物<,>Einstein was a scientific genius.<,>爱因斯坦是科学天才。<,>She has a genius for languages.<,>她有语言天赋。<,>It takes genius to solve this problem.<,>解决这个问题需要天才。<,>gen(出生)+ius→天生的才能→天才<,>genuine(adj.真正的)/genial(adj.和蔼的)

alike<,>/əˈlaɪk/<,>/əˈlaɪk/<,>adv.一样地/adv.相似地/adv.同样程度地/adj.同样的/adj.相同的<,>The twins look very much alike.<,>这对双胞胎看起来非常像。<,>Great minds think alike.<,>英雄所见略同。<,>They were dressed alike for the party.<,>他们为派对穿得一样。<,>a(加强)+like(像)→非常像<,>unlike(adj.不同的)/alive(adj.活着的)

fund<,>/fʌnd/<,>/fʌnd/<,>n.资金/n.基金/n.存款/vt.为...提供资金<,>The project is short of funds.<,>这个项目资金短缺。<,>She donated to the scholarship fund.<,>她向奖学金基金捐款。<,>The government will fund the research.<,>政府将为这项研究提供资金。<,>found(基础)→fund(资金)→事业基础<,>found(v.建立)/refund(v.退款)

gravity<,>/ˈɡrævəti/<,>/ˈɡrævɪti/<,>n.重力/n.引力/n.严重性/n.严肃/n.庄重<,>The gravity on the moon is less than on Earth.<,>月球上的重力比地球小。<,>He spoke with great gravity about the situation.<,>他非常严肃地谈论了局势。<,>We must understand the gravity of this problem.<,>我们必须理解这个问题的严重性。<,>grav(重)+ity→重力<,>grave(adj.严重的)/gravel(n.碎石)
typical<,>/ˈtɪpɪkəl/<,>/ˈtɪpɪkəl/<,>adj.典型的/adj.代表性的<,>This is a typical example of his work.<,>这是他作品的典型例子。<,>She has a typical British accent.<,>她有典型的英国口音。<,>The weather is typical for this time of year.<,>这种天气是这个季节的典型特征。<,>typ(类型)+ical(形容词后缀)→典型的<,>type(n.类型/v.打字)/atypical(adj.非典型的)  

quotation<,>/kwəʊˈteɪʃən/<,>/kwoʊˈteɪʃən/<,>n.引文/n.引语/n.语录/n.报价/n.牌价/n.行情<,>He began his speech with a quotation from Shakespeare.<,>他引用莎士比亚的话开始了演讲。<,>Can you give me a quotation for the repairs?<,>你能给我一个维修的报价吗？<,>The newspaper published daily stock market quotations.<,>该报每日刊登股市行情。<,>quot(引用)+ation(名词后缀)→引文<,>quote(v.引用/n.引文)/quota(n.配额)/notation(n.符号)

studio<,>/ˈstjuːdiəʊ/<,>/ˈstuːdioʊ/<,>n.画室/n.摄影室/n.播音室/n.录音室/n.摄影棚<,>The artist works in a small studio.<,>这位艺术家在一间小画室里工作。<,>They recorded the album in a famous studio.<,>他们在一家著名的录音室录制了这张专辑。<,>The TV show is filmed in a Hollywood studio.<,>这个电视节目是在好莱坞摄影棚拍摄的。<,>stud(学习)+io(场所)→学习创作的场所→画室<,>study(v.学习/n.书房)/student(n.学生)/stadium(n.体育场)  

tray<,>/treɪ/<,>/treɪ/<,>n.盘/n.托盘/n.碟<,>She carried the tea cups on a tray.<,>她用托盘端着茶杯。<,>Please put your used dishes in the tray.<,>请把用过的餐具放在托盘里。<,>The waiter brought a tray of drinks.<,>服务员端来一盘饮料。<,>tr(运输)+ay(名词后缀)→运输物品的工具→托盘<,>tray vs. plate(盘子)/tray vs. saucer(茶碟)/tray vs. platter(大浅盘)  

downward<,>/ˈdaʊnwəd/<,>/ˈdaʊnwərd/<,>adv.向下地/adj.向下的<,>The balloon floated downward slowly.<,>气球慢慢向下飘落。<,>There's a downward trend in prices.<,>价格呈下降趋势。<,>He gave me a downward glance.<,>他向下瞥了我一眼。<,>down(向下)+ward(方向)→向下的<,>downwards(adv.向下)/upward(adv.向上)/forward(adv.向前)  

cabbage<,>/ˈkæbɪdʒ/<,>/ˈkæbɪdʒ/<,>n.洋白菜/n.卷心菜<,>We had boiled cabbage for dinner.<,>我们晚餐吃了煮卷心菜。<,>Cabbage is rich in vitamin C.<,>卷心菜富含维生素C。<,>She made a salad with shredded cabbage.<,>她用切碎的卷心菜做了沙拉。<,>cab(头)+bage→形状像头的蔬菜→卷心菜<,>cabbage vs. lettuce(生菜)/cabbage vs. broccoli(西兰花)/cabbage vs. cauliflower(花椰菜)  

regulate<,>/ˈreɡjuleɪt/<,>/ˈreɡjəleɪt/<,>vt.管理/vt.控制/vt.调整/vt.调节<,>The thermostat regulates the temperature.<,>恒温器调节温度。<,>Laws regulate traffic on this road.<,>法律管理这条道路的交通。<,>You should regulate your eating habits.<,>你应该调整你的饮食习惯。<,>reg(规则)+ulate(动词后缀)→使有规则→调节<,>regular(adj.规则的)/regulation(n.规章)/deregulate(v.解除管制)  

palm<,>/pɑːm/<,>/pɑːm/<,>n.手掌/n.掌状物/n.棕榈树<,>She held the coin in her palm.<,>她把硬币握在手掌里。<,>Palm trees line the beach.<,>海滩边排列着棕榈树。<,>He read his fortune in his palm.<,>他看手相算命。<,>palm(手掌)→形状像手掌的树→棕榈树<,>palm vs. hand(手)/palm vs. fist(拳头)/palm vs. finger(手指)  

hydrogen<,>/ˈhaɪdrədʒən/<,>/ˈhaɪdrədʒən/<,>n.氢<,>Hydrogen is the lightest element.<,>氢是最轻的元素。<,>Water is made of hydrogen and oxygen.<,>水由氢和氧组成。<,>They filled the balloon with hydrogen gas.<,>他们用氢气充填气球。<,>hydro(水)+gen(产生)→产生水的元素→氢<,>oxygen(n.氧)/nitrogen(n.氮)/carbon(n.碳)
infant<,>/ˈɪnfənt/<,>/ˈɪnfənt/<,>adj.婴儿的/adj.幼稚的/n.婴儿<,>The infant was sleeping peacefully in the crib.<,>婴儿在婴儿床里安静地睡觉。<,>He has an infant sense of humor.<,>他有种幼稚的幽默感。<,>Infant mortality rates have decreased significantly.<,>婴儿死亡率显著下降。<,>in(不)+fant(说话)→不会说话的人→婴儿<,>infantry(n.步兵)/infancy(n.婴儿期)/infantile(adj.幼稚的)

hen<,>/hen/<,>/hɛn/<,>n.母鸡/n.雌禽<,>The hen laid an egg this morning.<,>母鸡今天早上下了个蛋。<,>We keep a few hens in the backyard.<,>我们在后院养了几只母鸡。<,>The hen clucked loudly to protect her chicks.<,>母鸡大声咯咯叫以保护她的小鸡。<,>联想：hen(恨)→母鸡恨狐狸<,>pen(n.钢笔)/den(n.兽穴)/henpecked(adj.怕老婆的)

whoever<,>/huːˈevə(r)/<,>/huˈɛvɚ/<,>pron.谁/pron.无论谁/pron.究竟是谁<,>Whoever breaks the rules will be punished.<,>无论谁违反规则都将受到惩罚。<,>Whoever said that was mistaken.<,>说那话的人肯定是错了。<,>I'll give this to whoever needs it most.<,>我会把这个给最需要它的人。<,>who(谁)+ever(永远)→无论谁<,>whatever(pron.无论什么)/whenever(conj.无论何时)/wherever(adv.无论哪里)

carbon<,>/ˈkɑːbən/<,>/ˈkɑrbən/<,>n.碳<,>Diamonds are made of pure carbon.<,>钻石是由纯碳构成的。<,>Carbon dioxide is a greenhouse gas.<,>二氧化碳是一种温室气体。<,>This paper has a low carbon footprint.<,>这种纸张的碳足迹很低。<,>car(汽车)+bon(好)→汽车排放碳不好<,>carbohydrate(n.碳水化合物)/carbonate(n.碳酸盐)/carbonic(adj.碳的)

unload<,>/ˌʌnˈləʊd/<,>/ˌʌnˈloʊd/<,>v.卸/v.卸货/v.下客/v.退出子弹/v.卸下胶卷<,>The workers unloaded the truck quickly.<,>工人们迅速卸下了卡车上的货物。<,>We need to unload the passengers first.<,>我们需要先让乘客下车。<,>He unloaded the camera after taking photos.<,>他拍完照片后卸下了胶卷。<,>un(不)+load(装载)→卸货<,>upload(v.上传)/download(v.下载)/overload(v.超载)

payment<,>/ˈpeɪmənt/<,>/ˈpeɪmənt/<,>n.支付/n.支付的款项<,>The payment is due at the end of the month.<,>付款截止到月底。<,>We accept various forms of payment.<,>我们接受多种支付方式。<,>He received a large payment for his work.<,>他因工作获得了一大笔报酬。<,>pay(支付)+ment(名词后缀)→支付<,>repayment(n.偿还)/prepayment(n.预付款)/nonpayment(n.不支付)

specifically<,>/spəˈsɪfɪkli/<,>/spəˈsɪfɪkli/<,>adv.特别地/adv.特定地/adv.明确地/adv.具体地<,>This medicine is specifically for children.<,>这种药是专门给儿童用的。<,>He asked specifically for you.<,>他特别要求见你。<,>Can you explain more specifically?<,>你能解释得更具体些吗？<,>specific(具体的)+ally(副词后缀)→具体地<,>special(adj.特别的)/especially(adv.尤其)/particularly(adv.特别)

controversial<,>/ˌkɒntrəˈvɜːʃl/<,>/ˌkɑːntrəˈvɜːrʃl/<,>adj.引起争论的/adj.有争议的<,>This is a controversial decision.<,>这是一个有争议的决定。<,>The book became controversial for its content.<,>这本书因其内容而引发争议。<,>He's a controversial figure in politics.<,>他是政界一个有争议的人物。<,>contro(反对)+vers(转)+ial→意见相左的→有争议的<,>conversation(n.谈话)/reverse(v.逆转)/diverse(adj.多样的)

attain<,>/əˈteɪn/<,>/əˈteɪn/<,>vt.达到/vt.获得/vt.完成<,>She attained her goal through hard work.<,>她通过努力工作实现了目标。<,>It took years to attain this level of skill.<,>达到这个技能水平花了很多年。<,>The company attained record profits last year.<,>公司去年获得了创纪录的利润。<,>at(加强)+tain(拿住)→获得<,>obtain(v.获得)/retain(v.保留)/contain(v.包含)

trap<,>/træp/<,>/træp/<,>n.陷阱/n.捕捉器/n.圈套/n.诡计/n.困境/vt.设陷阱捕捉/vt.诱骗<,>The mouse was caught in a trap.<,>老鼠被陷阱捉住了。<,>Don't fall into his trap.<,>别中了他的圈套。<,>They trapped the fox humanely.<,>他们人道地捕捉了狐狸。<,>tr(树)+ap(阿婆)→树下的阿婆设陷阱<,>trip(n.旅行)/strap(n.带子)/trapeze(n.高空秋千)
gallery<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>/ˈɡæləri/<,>n.画廊/n.美术馆/n.楼座/n.旁听席/n.回廊/n.走廊<,>We visited an art gallery last weekend.<,>我们上周末参观了一家艺术画廊。<,>The public gallery was full during the trial.<,>审判期间旁听席座无虚席。<,>There's a beautiful gallery connecting the two buildings.<,>有一条漂亮的走廊连接着两栋建筑。<,>gal(欢乐)+lery(场所)→欣赏艺术的欢乐场所<,>alley(n.小巷)/valley(n.山谷)/gala(n.庆典)

hardware<,>/ˈhɑːdweə(r)/<,>/ˈhɑːrdwer/<,>n.五金器具/n.硬件<,>He went to the hardware store to buy some tools.<,>他去五金店买了一些工具。<,>Computer hardware needs regular maintenance.<,>电脑硬件需要定期维护。<,>The hardware of this phone is very advanced.<,>这款手机的硬件非常先进。<,>hard(硬的)+ware(物品)→硬件<,>software(n.软件)/firmware(n.固件)/freeware(n.免费软件)

warmth<,>/wɔːmθ/<,>/wɔːrmθ/<,>n.暖和/n.温暖/n.热烈/n.热情/n.热心<,>The warmth of the sun felt good on my skin.<,>阳光的温暖让我感觉很舒服。<,>She greeted us with great warmth.<,>她非常热情地欢迎了我们。<,>There was a warmth in his voice that comforted me.<,>他声音中的温暖让我感到安慰。<,>warm(温暖的)+th(名词后缀)→温暖<,>swarm(n.群)/harm(n.伤害)/charm(n.魅力)

supreme<,>/suːˈpriːm/<,>/sʊˈprim/<,>adj.最高的/adj.最大的/adj.极度的/adj.最重要的<,>The Supreme Court made a historic decision.<,>最高法院做出了历史性的判决。<,>She showed supreme confidence in the competition.<,>她在比赛中表现出极大的自信。<,>This is of supreme importance to our project.<,>这对我们的项目至关重要。<,>supre(在...之上)+me→最高的<,>super(adj.超级的)/superb(adj.极好的)/summit(n.顶峰)

ambulance<,>/ˈæmbjələns/<,>/ˈæmbjələns/<,>n.救护车/n.野战医院<,>Call an ambulance immediately!<,>立即叫救护车！<,>The wounded soldier was taken to a field ambulance.<,>受伤的士兵被送到了野战医院。<,>Ambulance sirens could be heard in the distance.<,>可以听到远处救护车的警笛声。<,>ambul(行走)+ance→行走的医院→救护车<,>ambulant(adj.走动的)/ambulate(v.行走)/ambulatory(adj.流动的)

preventive<,>/prɪˈventɪv/<,>/prɪˈvɛntɪv/<,>adj.预防性的<,>Vaccination is a preventive measure against diseases.<,>疫苗接种是预防疾病的措施。<,>We need to take preventive action before the storm hits.<,>我们需要在风暴来临前采取预防措施。<,>The doctor recommended preventive healthcare.<,>医生推荐了预防性医疗保健。<,>pre(前)+vent(来)+ive→提前来防止→预防性的<,>prevent(v.预防)/invent(v.发明)/advent(n.到来)

junior<,>/ˈdʒuːniə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒuːniər/<,>adj.年少的/adj.资历较浅的/n.晚辈/n.三年级学生<,>He is a junior member of the team.<,>他是团队中资历较浅的成员。<,>She is three years my junior.<,>她比我小三岁。<,>He is a junior at Harvard University.<,>他是哈佛大学的三年级学生。<,>jun(年轻)+ior(比较级后缀)→年少的<,>senior(adj.年长的/n.长辈)/inferior(adj.下级的)/superior(adj.上级的)  

allocate<,>/ˈæləkeɪt/<,>/ˈæləˌkeɪt/<,>vt.分配/vt.分派/vt.把…拨给<,>We need to allocate more resources to this project.<,>我们需要为这个项目分配更多资源。<,>The government allocated funds for education.<,>政府为教育拨了款。<,>Each team member was allocated specific tasks.<,>每个团队成员都被分配了具体任务。<,>al(加强)+loc(地方)+ate(动词后缀)→分派到地方→分配<,>locate(v.定位)/relocate(v.重新安置)/allocation(n.分配)  

provide<,>/prəˈvaɪd/<,>/prəˈvaɪd/<,>vt.提供/vt.供给<,>The company provides health insurance for all employees.<,>公司为所有员工提供健康保险。<,>Parents provide food and shelter for their children.<,>父母为孩子提供食物和住所。<,>This book provides useful information.<,>这本书提供了有用的信息。<,>pro(向前)+vide(看)→提前看到需求→提供<,>provision(n.供应)/provider(n.供应者)/provided(conj.假如)

layer<,>/ˈleɪə(r)/<,>/ˈleɪər/<,>n.层/n.层次<,>She wore several layers of clothing.<,>她穿了好几层衣服。<,>This cake has five layers.<,>这个蛋糕有五层。<,>The ozone layer protects us from UV rays.<,>臭氧层保护我们免受紫外线伤害。<,>lay(放置)+er(物)→放置的东西→层<,>lawyer(n.律师)/player(n.玩家)/slayer(n.杀手)

triangle<,>/ˈtraɪæŋɡl/<,>/ˈtraɪˌæŋɡəl/<,>n.三角<,>The Bermuda Triangle is famous for mysterious disappearances.<,>百慕大三角以神秘失踪事件闻名。<,>A triangle has three sides and three angles.<,>三角形有三条边和三个角。<,>She drew a perfect equilateral triangle.<,>她画了一个完美的等边三角形。<,>tri(三)+angle(角)→三角形<,>rectangle(n.长方形)/pentangle(n.五角形)/quadrangle(n.四边形)

accidental<,>/ˌæksɪˈdentl/<,>/ˌæksəˈdɛntl/<,>adj.偶然的/adj.意外的<,>Their meeting was purely accidental.<,>他们的相遇纯属偶然。<,>He made an accidental discovery.<,>他有了一个意外发现。<,>The damage was accidental, not intentional.<,>损坏是意外，不是故意的。<,>accident(事故)+al(的)→偶然的<,>incidental(adj.附带的)/coincidental(adj.巧合的)/essential(adj.必要的)

assure<,>/əˈʃʊə(r)/<,>/əˈʃʊr/<,>vt.使确信/vt.确保/vt.向...保证<,>I assure you that everything will be fine.<,>我向你保证一切都会好起来的。<,>The doctor assured me of the safety of the procedure.<,>医生向我保证手术的安全性。<,>He assured his parents that he would study hard.<,>他向父母保证会努力学习。<,>as(加强)+sure(确定)→使确信<,>ensure(vt.确保)/insure(vt.保险)/reassure(vt.使安心)

consult<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>/kənˈsʌlt/<,>vt.请教/vt.查阅/vt.商议<,>You should consult a doctor about your symptoms.<,>你应该就症状咨询医生。<,>I need to consult the dictionary for this word.<,>我需要查字典找这个单词。<,>The president consulted with his advisors.<,>总统与顾问们商议。<,>con(共同)+sult(坐)→坐在一起商议<,>result(n.结果)/insult(vt.侮辱)/desultory(adj.散漫的)

theme<,>/θiːm/<,>/θim/<,>n.主题/n.题目<,>Love is a common theme in literature.<,>爱情是文学中常见的主题。<,>The theme of the party is "Under the Sea".<,>派对的主题是"海底世界"。<,>This song has a beautiful theme melody.<,>这首歌有优美的主题旋律。<,>the(那)+me(我)→那个关于我的→主题<,>theory(n.理论)/thesis(n.论文)/theater(n.剧院)

smash<,>/smæʃ/<,>/smæʃ/<,>v.粉碎/v.打烂/v.狠打/v.猛击/v.破灭/v.失败/v.猛撞/v.猛冲/n.破碎/n.猛击/n.猛撞/n.轰动的演出/n.巨大的成功<,>He smashed the window in anger.<,>他愤怒地打碎了窗户。<,>The movie was a smash hit.<,>这部电影大获成功。<,>The car smashed into the wall.<,>汽车猛撞到墙上。<,>s(死)+mash(糊状)→打成糊状→粉碎<,>crash(v.碰撞)/bash(v.猛击)/trash(n.垃圾)

merely<,>/ˈmɪəli/<,>/ˈmɪrli/<,>adv.仅仅/adv.只不过<,>It's merely a suggestion, not an order.<,>这仅仅是个建议，不是命令。<,>He was merely joking.<,>他只不过是在开玩笑。<,>This is merely the beginning.<,>这仅仅是开始。<,>mere(仅仅的)+ly(副词后缀)→仅仅<,>nearly(adv.几乎)/barely(adv.勉强)/clearly(adv.清楚地)
contradiction<,>/ˌkɒntrəˈdɪkʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːntrəˈdɪkʃn/<,>n.矛盾/n.不一致/n.否认/n.反驳<,>There is a contradiction between his words and actions.<,>他的言行之间存在矛盾。<,>She pointed out the contradiction in his argument.<,>她指出了他论点中的矛盾之处。<,>He flatly denied the contradiction in his statement.<,>他断然否认了声明中的矛盾。<,>contra(反对)+dict(说)+ion→说反对的话→矛盾<,>contrast(n.对比/v.对比)/contradict(v.反驳/v.否认)

fuss<,>/fʌs/<,>/fʌs/<,>n.忙乱/n.大惊小怪/n.小题大做/n.烦恼/n.过于忧虑<,>Don't make a fuss over such a small mistake.<,>不要为这样的小错误小题大做。<,>She always fusses about her appearance.<,>她总是对自己的外表过于忧虑。<,>He made a big fuss when he lost his keys.<,>他丢了钥匙后大吵大闹。<,>发音类似“发丝”→为头发丝般的小事烦恼→小题大做<,>fuzzy(adj.模糊的)/fuse(n.保险丝/v.融合)

wealth<,>/welθ/<,>/welθ/<,>n.财富/n.财产/n.丰富<,>He accumulated great wealth through hard work.<,>他通过努力工作积累了巨额财富。<,>The book is a wealth of information on ancient history.<,>这本书是关于古代历史的丰富资料。<,>She inherited a vast wealth from her family.<,>她从家族继承了一大笔财产。<,>weal(福利)+th→带来福利的东西→财富<,>health(n.健康)/stealth(n.秘密行动)

editor<,>/ˈedɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈedɪtər/<,>n.编辑/n.编者/n.校订者<,>The editor made some changes to the manuscript.<,>编辑对手稿做了一些修改。<,>She works as an editor for a publishing company.<,>她在一家出版公司担任编辑。<,>The chief editor approved the final version of the article.<,>主编批准了文章的最终版本。<,>edit(编辑)+or(人)→编辑的人→编辑<,>edition(n.版本)/editorial(adj.编辑的/n.社论)

barrel<,>/ˈbærəl/<,>/ˈbærəl/<,>n.桶/n.圆筒/n.枪管<,>They stored the wine in oak barrels.<,>他们把葡萄酒储存在橡木桶里。<,>The barrel of the gun needs cleaning.<,>枪管需要清理了。<,>He rolled the barrel down the hill.<,>他把桶滚下山去。<,>bar(棒)+rel→用木棒围成的容器→桶<,>barrier(n.障碍)/barren(adj.贫瘠的)

means<,>/miːnz/<,>/miːnz/<,>n.方法/n.手段/n.工具/n.金钱/n.财产<,>We need to find a means to solve this problem.<,>我们需要找到解决这个问题的方法。<,>He has the means to buy a new car.<,>他有足够的钱买一辆新车。<,>By means of hard work, she achieved success.<,>通过努力工作，她取得了成功。<,>mean(中间)+s→中间途径→方法<,>meaning(n.意义)/meant(v.意味)

desire<,>/dɪˈzaɪə(r)/<,>/dɪˈzaɪər/<,>v.渴望/v.要求/n.愿望/n.欲望<,>He has a strong desire to travel the world.<,>他有强烈的愿望去环游世界。<,>She desired nothing more than peace and quiet.<,>她只渴望和平与宁静。<,>The company desires qualified applicants for the position.<,>公司希望有合格的申请人来应聘这个职位。<,>de(加强)+sire(星星)→像星星一样吸引人→渴望<,>desirable(adj.值得拥有的)/desperate(adj.绝望的)

survive<,>/səˈvaɪv/<,>/sərˈvaɪv/<,>v.活下来/v.幸存/v.从...逃出/v.幸免于/v.从中挺过来/v.比...活得长<,>Few buildings survived the earthquake.<,>很少有建筑物在地震中幸存下来。<,>She survived the accident with minor injuries.<,>她在事故中幸存下来，只受了轻伤。<,>The old man survived his wife by ten years.<,>这位老人比他的妻子多活了十年。<,>sur(超过)+viv(活)+e→活得超过别人→幸存<,>revive(v.复活)/vivid(adj.生动的)

efficient<,>/ɪˈfɪʃnt/<,>/ɪˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.效率高的/adj.有能力的<,>The new system is more efficient than the old one.<,>新系统比旧系统效率更高。<,>She is an efficient secretary who gets things done quickly.<,>她是个能干的秘书，办事效率很高。<,>Energy-efficient appliances save money in the long run.<,>节能电器从长远来看能省钱。<,>ef(出)+fic(做)+ient→能做出来的→有效率的<,>sufficient(adj.足够的)/deficient(adj.不足的)

initial<,>/ɪˈnɪʃl/<,>/ɪˈnɪʃəl/<,>adj.最初的/adj.开始的/n.首字母<,>My initial impression of him was positive.<,>我对他的第一印象是积极的。<,>Please write your initials at the bottom of the page.<,>请在页面底部写上你的姓名首字母。<,>The initial stage of the project is the most challenging.<,>项目的最初阶段是最具挑战性的。<,>in(进入)+it(走)+ial→刚开始走进去的→最初的<,>initiate(v.开始)/initiative(n.主动性)
unfortunately<,>/ʌnˈfɔːtʃənətli/<,>/ʌnˈfɔːrtʃənətli/<,>adv.不幸地<,>Unfortunately, the concert was canceled due to bad weather.<,>不幸的是，音乐会因恶劣天气取消了。<,>He arrived late, unfortunately missing the beginning of the movie.<,>他来晚了，不幸错过了电影的开头。<,>Unfortunately, the project failed despite all our efforts.<,>不幸的是，尽管我们尽了全力，项目还是失败了。<,>un(否定)+fortunate(幸运的)+ly(副词后缀)→不幸地<,>fortunately(adv.幸运地)/unhappy(adj.不快乐的)/unlucky(adj.不幸的)  

consistent<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>/kənˈsɪstənt/<,>adj.坚持的/一贯的/一致的/符合的<,>She is consistent in her efforts to improve her skills.<,>她坚持努力提高自己的技能。<,>The results are consistent with our expectations.<,>结果与我们的预期一致。<,>He has been a consistent supporter of the team.<,>他一直坚定地支持这支队伍。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)+ent(形容词后缀)→站在一起的→一致的<,>persistent(adj.坚持的)/constant(adj.不变的)/inconsistent(adj.不一致的)  

reverse<,>/rɪˈvɜːs/<,>/rɪˈvɜːrs/<,>v.撤销/推翻/反向/倒转/彻底改变/adj.反向的/相反的/倒转的/n.相反/对立面/反面/背面/后面/挫折/逆境<,>The court reversed its decision after new evidence was presented.<,>法院在提交新证据后撤销了原判。<,>He reversed the car into the parking space.<,>他把车倒进了停车位。<,>The team suffered a major reverse in the competition.<,>队伍在比赛中遭遇重大挫折。<,>re(回)+verse(转)→转回去→倒转<,>diverse(adj.多样的)/adverse(adj.不利的)/converse(v.交谈)  

heterogeneity<,>/ˌhɛtərəʊdʒɪˈniːɪti/<,>/ˌhɛtəroʊdʒəˈniːəti/<,>n.异种/异质/不同成分<,>The heterogeneity of the group made collaboration challenging.<,>团队的异质性使得合作具有挑战性。<,>Genetic heterogeneity can lead to varied responses to treatment.<,>遗传异质性可能导致对治疗的不同反应。<,>The cultural heterogeneity of the city is one of its strengths.<,>这座城市的文化多样性是其优势之一。<,>hetero(不同)+gene(基因)+ity(名词后缀)→异质性<,>homogeneity(n.同质性)/heterodox(adj.非正统的)/heterosexual(adj.异性恋的)  

sword<,>/sɔːd/<,>/sɔːrd/<,>n.剑/刀<,>The knight drew his sword to defend himself.<,>骑士拔出剑来自卫。<,>He was skilled in the art of sword fighting.<,>他精通剑术。<,>The sword is a symbol of power and honor.<,>剑是权力和荣誉的象征。<,>sw(拟声词，剑挥舞的声音)+ord→剑<,>board(n.木板)/word(n.单词)/cord(n.绳索)  

permanent<,>/ˈpɜːmənənt/<,>/ˈpɜːrmənənt/<,>adj.永久的/固定的<,>They are looking for a permanent solution to the problem.<,>他们正在寻找问题的永久解决方案。<,>She got a permanent job at the company.<,>她在公司得到了一份固定工作。<,>The tattoo is permanent and cannot be removed easily.<,>这个纹身是永久性的，不容易去除。<,>per(贯穿)+man(保持)+ent(形容词后缀)→一直保持的→永久的<,>temporary(adj.临时的)/impermanent(adj.非永久的)/permanence(n.永久性)  

barely<,>/ˈbeəli/<,>/ˈberli/<,>adv.仅仅/只不过/几乎不<,>He barely passed the exam with a score of 60.<,>他勉强以60分通过了考试。<,>She could barely hear the speaker from the back of the room.<,>她在房间后面几乎听不清演讲者的话。<,>There was barely enough food for everyone.<,>食物几乎不够所有人吃。<,>bare(仅仅的)+ly(副词后缀)→仅仅<,>scarcely(adv.几乎不)/hardly(adv.几乎不)/merely(adv.仅仅)  

summarize<,>/ˈsʌməraɪz/<,>/ˈsʌməraɪz/<,>vt.概括/概述/总结<,>Can you summarize the main points of the article?<,>你能总结一下文章的主要观点吗？<,>He summarized the meeting in a few sentences.<,>他用几句话概括了会议内容。<,>The report summarizes the findings of the research.<,>报告总结了研究结果。<,>sum(总和)+marize(动词后缀)→概括<,>summary(n.摘要)/summation(n.总结)/resume(v.重新开始)  

chap<,>/tʃæp/<,>/tʃæp/<,>n.小伙子/男人/家伙<,>He's a friendly chap who always helps his neighbors.<,>他是个友善的小伙子，总是帮助邻居。<,>The old chap at the store told me an interesting story.<,>店里那位老伙计给我讲了个有趣的故事。<,>Who's that chap you were talking to?<,>你刚才在跟那个家伙聊什么？<,>ch(拟声词，打招呼)+ap→小伙子<,>chop(v.砍)/chip(n.碎片)/chapel(n.小教堂)  

facility<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>/fəˈsɪləti/<,>n.设备/容易/场所<,>The gym has excellent facilities for training.<,>健身房有极好的训练设备。<,>She speaks French with great facility.<,>她法语说得很流利。<,>The new sports facility will open next month.<,>新的体育场所将于下个月开放。<,>fac(做)+ility(名词后缀)→做事的便利→设备<,>facilitate(v.促进)/faculty(n.能力)/felicity(n.幸福)
beam<,>/biːm/<,>/bim/<,>n.梁,横梁/n.束,柱/n.笑容,喜色/vt.面露喜色/vt.定向发出,播送<,>The wooden beam supports the roof of the old house.<,>这根木梁支撑着老房子的屋顶。<,>She gave me a bright beam of welcome.<,>她向我露出灿烂的欢迎笑容。<,>The satellite beams signals back to Earth.<,>卫星向地球定向发射信号。<,>b(形似梁的形状)+eam(team团队)→团队合作的梁柱<,>bean(n.豆子)/seam(n.接缝)/ream(n.令纸的量)

alliance<,>/əˈlaɪəns/<,>/əˈlaɪəns/<,>n.结盟,联盟<,>The two companies formed a strategic alliance.<,>两家公司形成了战略联盟。<,>The alliance between the countries strengthened their position.<,>国家间的联盟加强了他们的地位。<,>They broke their alliance due to conflicting interests.<,>由于利益冲突，他们解除了联盟。<,>alli(ally盟友)+ance(名词后缀)→联盟<,>appliance(n.器具)/allowance(n.津贴)/reliance(n.信赖)

civilization<,>/ˌsɪvɪlaɪˈzeɪʃən/<,>/ˌsɪvəlɪˈzeɪʃən/<,>n.文明,文化/n.开化<,>Ancient Egyptian civilization fascinates historians.<,>古埃及文明令历史学家着迷。<,>The spread of civilization brought new technologies.<,>文明的传播带来了新技术。<,>He believed education was key to civilization.<,>他认为教育是开化的关键。<,>civil(公民的)+ization(化)→公民化过程→文明<,>civilian(n.平民)/civilize(v.使文明)/uncivilized(adj.未开化的)

fiction<,>/ˈfɪkʃən/<,>/ˈfɪkʃən/<,>n.小说/n.虚构,杜撰<,>She enjoys reading science fiction novels.<,>她喜欢读科幻小说。<,>His account of the event was pure fiction.<,>他对事件的描述纯属虚构。<,>The line between fact and fiction is sometimes blurred.<,>事实与虚构之间的界限有时很模糊。<,>fict(做)+ion→做出来的故事→虚构<,>fraction(n.分数)/friction(n.摩擦)/nonfiction(n.非虚构作品)

possession<,>/pəˈzeʃən/<,>/pəˈzɛʃən/<,>n.有,所有/n.所有物<,>The house has been in their possession for decades.<,>这房子归他们所有已有几十年。<,>He carried all his possessions in a single suitcase.<,>他所有的财物都装在一个手提箱里。<,>The team took possession of the ball for most of the game.<,>比赛中大部分时间都是这个队控球。<,>pos(放置)+sess(坐)+ion→把东西放在自己位置上→占有<,>procession(n.行列)/profession(n.职业)/obsession(n.痴迷)

replace<,>/rɪˈpleɪs/<,>/rɪˈples/<,>vt.代替,取代/vt.更换,调换/vt.把...放回原处<,>They replaced the old windows with energy-efficient ones.<,>他们用节能窗户替换了旧窗户。<,>Can you replace the book on the shelf when you're done?<,>你看完后能把书放回书架吗？<,>No one can replace her in our team.<,>在我们团队中没人能取代她。<,>re(重新)+place(放置)→重新放置→替换<,>displace(vt.移置)/misplace(vt.放错)/placement(n.放置)

appointment<,>/əˈpɔɪntmənt/<,>/əˈpɔɪntmənt/<,>n.任命/n.约定,约会/n.委任的职位<,>She has a doctor's appointment at 3 pm.<,>她下午3点有医生预约。<,>His appointment as CEO surprised everyone.<,>他被任命为CEO让所有人惊讶。<,>The appointment lasted only fifteen minutes.<,>这次约会只持续了15分钟。<,>ap(强调)+point(点)+ment→指定时间点→预约<,>disappointment(n.失望)/anointment(n.涂油礼)/reappointment(n.重新任命)

hip<,>/hɪp/<,>/hɪp/<,>n.臀部,髋部<,>She put her hands on her hips and sighed.<,>她双手叉腰叹了口气。<,>He broke his hip in the accident.<,>他在事故中髋部骨折。<,>The baby was carried on her hip.<,>婴儿被她抱在髋部。<,>h(形似臀部曲线)+ip→臀部<,>lip(n.嘴唇)/tip(n.尖端)/ship(n.船)

merry<,>/ˈmeri/<,>/ˈmɛri/<,>adj.欢乐的,愉快的<,>They were all in a merry mood at the party.<,>派对上他们都心情愉快。<,>Merry Christmas! she said with a smile.<,>"圣诞快乐！"她微笑着说。<,>The merry sound of laughter filled the room.<,>房间里充满了欢快的笑声。<,>me(我)+rry(拼音"日日乐")→我天天快乐→欢乐的<,>marry(v.结婚)/berry(n.浆果)/ferry(n.渡船)

dam<,>/dæm/<,>/dæm/<,>n.水坝,水堤/n.障碍物/vt.筑堤挡住<,>The dam provides electricity for the whole region.<,>这座水坝为整个地区供电。<,>They built a dam across the river.<,>他们在河上筑了一道坝。<,>Emotional dams prevented him from expressing his feelings.<,>情感障碍使他无法表达感受。<,>d(堤)+am(是)→是堤坝→水坝<,>dim(adj.昏暗的)/jam(n.果酱)/ram(n.公羊)
pessimistic<,>/ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>/ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk/<,>adj.悲观的<,>He has a pessimistic view of the future.<,>他对未来持悲观态度。<,>Her pessimistic attitude affects everyone around her.<,>她悲观的态度影响了周围的每个人。<,>Despite the challenges, he avoids being pessimistic.<,>尽管面临挑战，他避免悲观。<,>pess(坏)+imistic(形容词后缀)→悲观的<,>optimistic(adj.乐观的)/realistic(adj.现实的)

commander<,>/kəˈmɑːndə(r)/<,>/kəˈmændər/<,>n.司令官/n.指挥员<,>The commander led his troops to victory.<,>司令官带领他的部队取得了胜利。<,>She was appointed as the new commander of the unit.<,>她被任命为该部队的新指挥员。<,>The commander gave strict orders to his soldiers.<,>指挥官向士兵们下达了严格的命令。<,>com(共同)+mand(命令)+er(人)→发号施令的人→司令官<,>command(v.命令/n.指挥)/demand(v.要求/n.需求)

bloom<,>/bluːm/<,>/bluːm/<,>v.开花/n.花/n.开花期/n.青春焕发<,>The roses are in full bloom in the garden.<,>花园里的玫瑰正盛开着。<,>Her talent began to bloom at a young age.<,>她的才华在年轻时就开始展现。<,>Spring is the season when flowers bloom.<,>春天是花朵盛开的季节。<,>bl(明亮)+oom(状态)→花朵盛开的状态<,>blossom(v.开花/n.花)/gloom(n.忧郁/v.变阴暗)

major<,>/ˈmeɪdʒə(r)/<,>/ˈmeɪdʒər/<,>adj.较大的/adj.主要的/adj.重大的/n.少校/n.专业<,>This is a major problem that needs immediate attention.<,>这是一个需要立即关注的主要问题。<,>He decided to major in computer science at university.<,>他决定在大学主修计算机科学。<,>The major ordered his troops to advance.<,>少校命令他的部队前进。<,>maj(大)+or(比较级)→较大的<,>minor(adj.较小的/n.未成年人)/mayor(n.市长)

zone<,>/zəʊn/<,>/zoʊn/<,>n.地区/n.区域/n.范围<,>This area is designated as a no-parking zone.<,>这个区域被指定为禁止停车区。<,>The city is divided into several residential zones.<,>这个城市被划分为几个住宅区。<,>The tropical zone has a warm climate all year round.<,>热带地区全年气候温暖。<,>zon(带)+e→地带→区域<,>bone(n.骨头/v.剔骨)/tone(n.音调/v.调和)

emphasis<,>/ˈemfəsɪs/<,>/ˈemfəsɪs/<,>n.强调/n.重点/n.重要性<,>The teacher placed great emphasis on punctuality.<,>老师非常强调守时的重要性。<,>There is a strong emphasis on teamwork in this company.<,>这家公司非常强调团队合作。<,>His speech laid emphasis on environmental protection.<,>他的演讲强调了环境保护。<,>em(进入)+phas(显示)+is→重点显示→强调<,>phase(n.阶段/v.分阶段进行)/empathy(n.同理心)

interrupt<,>/ˌɪntəˈrʌpt/<,>/ˌɪntəˈrʌpt/<,>v.打断/v.打扰/v.中断<,>Please don't interrupt me while I'm speaking.<,>我说话时请不要打断我。<,>The meeting was interrupted by a fire alarm.<,>会议被火警警报打断了。<,>He apologized for interrupting our conversation.<,>他为打断我们的谈话而道歉。<,>inter(在...之间)+rupt(断裂)→在中间断裂→打断<,>erupt(v.爆发)/corrupt(adj.腐败的/v.使堕落)

feasible<,>/ˈfiːzəbl/<,>/ˈfiːzəbl/<,>adj.可行的/adj.可能的<,>The plan seems feasible with our current resources.<,>这个计划在我们现有的资源下似乎是可行的。<,>They are looking for a feasible solution to the problem.<,>他们正在寻找一个可行的解决方案。<,>Is it feasible to complete the project in one month?<,>在一个月内完成这个项目可行吗？<,>feas(做)+ible(能...的)→能做的→可行的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/flexible(adj.灵活的)

prescribe<,>/prɪˈskraɪb/<,>/prɪˈskraɪb/<,>vt.开(药方)/vt.吩咐采用/vt.规定/vt.指定<,>The doctor prescribed some medicine for my cold.<,>医生为我的感冒开了一些药。<,>The law prescribes strict penalties for this offense.<,>法律对这种违法行为规定了严厉的惩罚。<,>The manual prescribes the correct procedure for assembly.<,>手册规定了正确的组装程序。<,>pre(前)+scribe(写)→事先写好的→规定<,>describe(v.描述)/subscribe(v.订阅)

potential<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>/pəˈtenʃl/<,>adj.潜在的/adj.可能的/n.潜力/n.潜能<,>She has the potential to become a great leader.<,>她有成为伟大领袖的潜力。<,>There is a potential risk in this investment.<,>这项投资存在潜在风险。<,>We need to tap into the students' full potential.<,>我们需要挖掘学生的全部潜能。<,>potent(力量)+ial(形容词后缀)→有力量的→潜在的<,>essential(adj.必要的)/influential(adj.有影响力的)
bean<,>/biːn/<,>/bin/<,>n.豆/n.蚕豆<,>She planted beans in her garden.<,>她在花园里种了豆子。<,>I love eating baked beans on toast.<,>我喜欢吃烤豆子配吐司。<,>This soup is made with black beans.<,>这个汤是用黑豆做的。<,>bean(豆)→发音类似“饼”→豆子可以做成豆饼<,>been(v. be的过去分词)/lean(v.倾斜/adj.瘦的)/mean(v.意思是/adj.吝啬的)  

accustomed<,>/əˈkʌstəmd/<,>/əˈkʌstəmd/<,>adj.惯常的/adj.习惯的<,>He was accustomed to waking up early.<,>他习惯了早起。<,>She quickly became accustomed to the new environment.<,>她很快就适应了新环境。<,>It takes time to get accustomed to a different culture.<,>适应不同的文化需要时间。<,>ac(强调)+custom(习惯)+ed→习惯的<,>custom(n.习惯/n.海关)/customer(n.顾客)/accustom(v.使习惯)  

combination<,>/ˌkɒmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːmbɪˈneɪʃn/<,>n.结合/n.联合/n.化合<,>The combination of these ingredients makes a delicious cake.<,>这些原料的组合可以做出美味的蛋糕。<,>They won the game through a perfect combination of skills.<,>他们通过完美的技能组合赢得了比赛。<,>This lock opens with a number combination.<,>这把锁用数字组合打开。<,>com(共同)+bin(两个)+ation→两个东西放在一起→结合<,>combine(v.结合)/comb(n.梳子)/combat(n.战斗)  

obtain<,>/əbˈteɪn/<,>/əbˈteɪn/<,>v.获得/v.通用/v.流行/v.存在<,>You need to obtain permission before entering.<,>进入前你需要获得许可。<,>This model is no longer obtained in stores.<,>这个型号在商店里已经买不到了。<,>The information was obtained from reliable sources.<,>这个信息是从可靠来源获得的。<,>ob(强调)+tain(拿住)→拿到→获得<,>attain(v.达到)/retain(v.保留)/contain(v.包含)  

turbine<,>/ˈtɜːbaɪn/<,>/ˈtɜːrbaɪn/<,>n.叶轮机/n.汽轮机<,>The wind turbine generates electricity for the village.<,>风力涡轮机为村庄发电。<,>They installed a new steam turbine in the power plant.<,>他们在发电厂安装了一台新的蒸汽轮机。<,>The aircraft's turbine engine is very powerful.<,>这架飞机的涡轮发动机非常强大。<,>turb(搅动)+ine→搅动的机器→涡轮机<,>turbid(adj.浑浊的)/disturb(v.打扰)/turbulence(n.骚乱)  

repeatedly<,>/rɪˈpiːtɪdli/<,>/rɪˈpiːtɪdli/<,>adv.一再/adv.再三/adv.多次地<,>He repeatedly asked the same question.<,>他一再问同一个问题。<,>The teacher repeatedly emphasized this point.<,>老师再三强调这一点。<,>I've told you repeatedly not to do that.<,>我已经多次告诉过你不要那样做。<,>repeat(重复)+ed+ly→重复地<,>repetition(n.重复)/repeater(n.中继器)/compete(v.竞争)  

curiosity<,>/ˌkjʊəriˈɒsəti/<,>/ˌkjʊriˈɑːsəti/<,>n.好奇/n.好奇心/n.奇物/n.奇事/n.珍品<,>Children have a natural curiosity about the world.<,>孩子们对世界有着天然的好奇心。<,>This old map is a real curiosity.<,>这张旧地图真是个稀奇的东西。<,>Her curiosity led her to discover the truth.<,>她的好奇心驱使她发现了真相。<,>cur(关心)+iosity→关心的事物→好奇心<,>curious(adj.好奇的)/cure(v.治愈)/secure(adj.安全的)  

gross<,>/ɡrəʊs/<,>/ɡroʊs/<,>adj.总的/adj.严重的/adj.粗俗的/adj.臃肿的<,>The gross weight of the package is 5kg.<,>这个包裹的总重量是5公斤。<,>That was a gross mistake.<,>那是个严重的错误。<,>His gross behavior offended everyone.<,>他粗俗的行为冒犯了所有人。<,>gross(总的)→和“rose(玫瑰)”发音相似→玫瑰总数<,>grass(n.草)/gloss(n.光泽)/grope(v.摸索)  

workshop<,>/ˈwɜːkʃɒp/<,>/ˈwɜːrkʃɑːp/<,>n.车间/n.作坊/n.创作室/n.研讨会/n.讲习班<,>He's fixing the car in the workshop.<,>他正在车间修车。<,>We attended a creative writing workshop.<,>我们参加了一个创意写作研讨会。<,>The artist's workshop is full of paintings.<,>这位艺术家的工作室里满是画作。<,>work(工作)+shop(场所)→工作的场所→车间<,>works(n.作品)/shop(n.商店)/ship(n.船)  

resist<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>/rɪˈzɪst/<,>v.抵抗/v.反抗/v.抵制/v.抗/v.耐/v.忍住/v.拒受...的影响<,>The soldiers resisted the enemy attack.<,>士兵们抵抗了敌人的进攻。<,>This material resists heat very well.<,>这种材料非常耐热。<,>I couldn't resist eating another piece of cake.<,>我忍不住又吃了一块蛋糕。<,>re(反)+sist(站)→反着站→抵抗<,>persist(v.坚持)/insist(v.坚持)/desist(v.停止)
liter<,>/ˈliːtə(r)/<,>/ˈliːtər/<,>n.升<,>He bought a liter of milk from the store.<,>他从商店买了一升牛奶。<,>The car's fuel efficiency is 15 kilometers per liter.<,>这辆车的燃油效率是每升15公里。<,>This bottle can hold up to two liters of water.<,>这个瓶子能装两升水。<,>联想记忆：liter与“litre”（升的英式拼写）同义<,>literature(n.文学)/literal(adj.字面的)/literacy(n.读写能力)

format<,>/ˈfɔːmæt/<,>/ˈfɔːrˌmæt/<,>n.设计/安排/格式/样式/版式/vt.使格式化<,>The document needs to be saved in PDF format.<,>这个文档需要保存为PDF格式。<,>She formatted the hard drive before installing the new OS.<,>她在安装新操作系统前格式化了硬盘。<,>The conference will follow a formal format.<,>会议将遵循正式的流程安排。<,>form(形式)+at→使形成固定形式→格式化<,>formation(n.形成)/formula(n.公式)/informal(adj.非正式的)

sacrifice<,>/ˈsækrɪfaɪs/<,>/ˈsækrəˌfaɪs/<,>v.牺牲/舍身/献祭/供奉/n.牺牲/供奉/祭品<,>He sacrificed his career to take care of his family.<,>他牺牲事业来照顾家庭。<,>In ancient times, people would sacrifice animals to the gods.<,>古时候人们会向神献祭动物。<,>Her success came at the sacrifice of her personal life.<,>她的成功是以牺牲个人生活为代价的。<,>sacr(神圣)+fic(做)+e→为神圣而做→献祭<,>sacred(adj.神圣的)/sanctify(v.使神圣化)/satisfy(v.满足)

illegal<,>/ɪˈliːɡl/<,>/ɪˈliːɡəl/<,>adj.不合法的/非法的<,>Parking in this area is illegal.<,>在这个区域停车是违法的。<,>He was arrested for illegal possession of firearms.<,>他因非法持有枪支被捕。<,>The company was fined for illegal business practices.<,>该公司因非法经营被罚款。<,>il(不)+legal(合法的)→不合法的<,>legal(adj.合法的)/legitimate(adj.合法的)/illicit(adj.违法的)

stimulate<,>/ˈstɪmjuleɪt/<,>/ˈstɪmjəˌleɪt/<,>vt.刺激/激励/激发<,>The teacher used questions to stimulate students' thinking.<,>老师用问题激发学生思考。<,>Coffee can stimulate the central nervous system.<,>咖啡能刺激中枢神经系统。<,>The new policy aims to stimulate economic growth.<,>新政策旨在刺激经济增长。<,>stimul(刺激)+ate(使)→刺激<,>simulate(v.模拟)/stipulate(v.规定)/accumulate(v.积累)

formal<,>/ˈfɔːml/<,>/ˈfɔːrməl/<,>adj.正式的/礼仪上的<,>You need to wear formal attire to the wedding.<,>参加婚礼需要穿正式服装。<,>The company sent a formal letter of apology.<,>公司发了一封正式的道歉信。<,>They made a formal agreement to cooperate.<,>他们正式签订了合作协议。<,>form(形式)+al→形式上的→正式的<,>informal(adj.非正式的)/format(n.格式)/formation(n.形成)

congratulate<,>/kənˈɡrætʃuleɪt/<,>/kənˈɡrætʃəˌleɪt/<,>vt.祝贺/向...道喜<,>I congratulate you on your promotion.<,>祝贺你升职。<,>They congratulated the newlyweds at the wedding.<,>他们在婚礼上向新人道贺。<,>We should congratulate him for winning the competition.<,>我们应该祝贺他赢得比赛。<,>con(共同)+grat(高兴)+ulate→一起高兴→祝贺<,>gratitude(n.感激)/gratify(v.使满足)/gratuitous(adj.免费的)

rainbow<,>/ˈreɪnbəʊ/<,>/ˈreɪnˌboʊ/<,>n.虹/彩虹<,>We saw a beautiful rainbow after the rain.<,>雨后我们看到了一道美丽的彩虹。<,>The rainbow arched across the sky.<,>彩虹横跨天空。<,>She wore a dress with all the colors of the rainbow.<,>她穿了一条七彩的裙子。<,>rain(雨)+bow(弓)→雨后出现的弓形→彩虹<,>raincoat(n.雨衣)/rainfall(n.降雨量)/rainproof(adj.防雨的)

soak<,>/səʊk/<,>/soʊk/<,>v.浸/泡<,>Soak the beans overnight before cooking.<,>烹饪前先把豆子浸泡一夜。<,>The rain soaked through my jacket.<,>雨水浸透了我的夹克。<,>She likes to soak in the bathtub after work.<,>她喜欢下班后泡在浴缸里。<,>联想记忆：soak与"sock"(袜子)发音相似，袜子需要浸泡清洗<,>sock(n.袜子)/soap(n.肥皂)/soup(n.汤)

soar<,>/sɔː(r)/<,>/sɔːr/<,>vi.猛增/剧增/高飞/升腾/高涨/高耸/屹立<,>The eagle soared high above the mountains.<,>老鹰在高山上空翱翔。<,>Prices have soared in recent months.<,>最近几个月价格飞涨。<,>Her spirits soared when she heard the good news.<,>听到好消息后她情绪高涨。<,>联想记忆：soar与"sore"(疼痛的)发音相同，但意思完全不同<,>sore(adj.疼痛的)/roar(v.咆哮)/sour(adj.酸的)
salesman<,>/ˈseɪlzmən/<,>/ˈseɪlzmən/<,>n.售货员/n.推销员<,>The salesman showed us the latest model of the car.<,>推销员向我们展示了最新款的汽车。<,>He works as a salesman in a department store.<,>他在一家百货商店当售货员。<,>The salesman was very persuasive and convinced me to buy the product.<,>推销员很有说服力，让我买了这个产品。<,>sale(销售)+man(人)→销售的人→推销员<,>saleswoman(n.女售货员)/salesperson(n.销售人员)/salesclerk(n.店员)

interference<,>/ˌɪntəˈfɪərəns/<,>/ˌɪntərˈfɪrəns/<,>n.干涉/n.干预/n.阻碍<,>His interference in the project caused delays.<,>他对项目的干预导致了延误。<,>The government's interference in the market was criticized.<,>政府对市场的干涉受到了批评。<,>There was too much interference on the radio signal.<,>无线电信号受到了太多干扰。<,>inter(在...之间)+fer(带来)+ence→带来阻碍→干涉<,>intervene(v.干涉)/interrupt(v.打断)/intercept(v.拦截)

fibre<,>/ˈfaɪbə/<,>/ˈfaɪbər/<,>n.纤维/n.纤维质<,>This fabric is made from natural fibres.<,>这种布料是由天然纤维制成的。<,>Eating foods high in fibre is good for digestion.<,>吃高纤维食物对消化有好处。<,>The rope is strong because it's made of synthetic fibres.<,>这根绳子很结实，因为它是用合成纤维制成的。<,>fib(纤维)+re→纤维<,>fiber(美式拼写)/fibril(n.小纤维)/fibrin(n.纤维蛋白)

sustain<,>/səˈsteɪn/<,>/səˈsteɪn/<,>vt.保持/vt.使持续下去/vt.供养/vt.维持/vt.支持/vt.支撑/vt.经受/vt.遭受<,>The company needs to sustain its growth in the coming years.<,>公司需要在未来几年保持增长。<,>The pillars sustain the weight of the roof.<,>这些柱子支撑着屋顶的重量。<,>She sustained serious injuries in the accident.<,>她在事故中受了重伤。<,>sus(在下面)+tain(保持)→在下面保持→支撑<,>maintain(vt.维持)/retain(vt.保留)/obtain(vt.获得)

entertain<,>/ˌentəˈteɪn/<,>/ˌentərˈteɪn/<,>vt.使欢乐/vt.招待/vt.请客<,>He entertained the children with magic tricks.<,>他用魔术逗孩子们开心。<,>We entertained our guests with a home-cooked meal.<,>我们用家常菜招待客人。<,>The show entertained the audience for two hours.<,>这场表演让观众开心了两个小时。<,>enter(进入)+tain(保持)→保持快乐→使欢乐<,>amuse(vt.逗乐)/divert(vt.使消遣)/host(vt.招待)

altitude<,>/ˈæltɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈæltɪtuːd/<,>n.海拔/n.高度/n.高处<,>The plane reached an altitude of 30,000 feet.<,>飞机达到了3万英尺的高度。<,>Mountain climbers need to adjust to high altitudes.<,>登山者需要适应高海拔。<,>The city is located at a high altitude.<,>这座城市位于高海拔地区。<,>alt(高)+itude(状态)→高度<,>latitude(n.纬度)/attitude(n.态度)/aptitude(n.才能)

classify<,>/ˈklæsɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈklæsɪfaɪ/<,>vt.把...分类/vt.把...分级<,>Scientists classify animals into different species.<,>科学家将动物分为不同的种类。<,>The documents are classified as confidential.<,>这些文件被列为机密。<,>We need to classify these books by subject.<,>我们需要按主题对这些书进行分类。<,>class(类别)+ify(使)→使成类别→分类<,>clarify(vt.澄清)/identify(vt.识别)/specify(vt.指定)

ease<,>/iːz/<,>/iːz/<,>n.容易/n.舒适/vt.缓和<,>She completed the task with ease.<,>她轻松地完成了任务。<,>The medicine will ease your pain.<,>这种药会缓解你的疼痛。<,>He spoke with ease in front of the large audience.<,>他在大批观众面前轻松地讲话。<,>eas(容易)+e→容易<,>easy(adj.容易的)/disease(n.疾病)/unease(n.不安)

mathematics<,>/ˌmæθəˈmætɪks/<,>/ˌmæθəˈmætɪks/<,>n.数学<,>She has a natural talent for mathematics.<,>她在数学方面有天赋。<,>Mathematics is the language of the universe.<,>数学是宇宙的语言。<,>He struggled with mathematics in school.<,>他在学校里数学学得很吃力。<,>math(数学)+ematics(学科)→数学<,>arithmetic(n.算术)/geometry(n.几何)/algebra(n.代数)  

wagon<,>/ˈwæɡən/<,>/ˈwæɡən/<,>n.四轮马车/n.大篷车/n.铁路货车/n.客货两用车<,>The pioneers traveled west in covered wagons.<,>拓荒者们乘坐有篷马车向西行进。<,>The train was pulling a long line of freight wagons.<,>火车拖着一长列货运车厢。<,>We loaded the wagon with supplies for the trip.<,>我们把旅行用品装上了大篷车。<,>wag(摇摆)+on(在...上)→摇摆的车→马车<,>wagon与waggon(英式拼写)/wain(古英语)/carriage(n.马车)  

elsewhere<,>/ˌelsˈweə(r)/<,>/ˌelsˈwer/<,>adv.在别处/adv.向别处<,>If the book isn't here, try looking elsewhere.<,>如果书不在这里，去别处找找看。<,>He decided to seek employment elsewhere.<,>他决定去别处找工作。<,>The solution must be found elsewhere.<,>必须在其他地方找到解决办法。<,>else(其他)+where(地方)→其他地方<,>elsewhere与somewhere(某处)/nowhere(无处)/everywhere(处处)  

penetrate<,>/ˈpenɪtreɪt/<,>/ˈpɛnɪˌtreɪt/<,>v.透入/v.渗入/v.进入/v.刺穿/v.洞察/v.了解<,>The bullet penetrated the wall.<,>子弹穿透了墙壁。<,>It's hard to penetrate their secret organization.<,>很难打入他们的秘密组织。<,>She has a penetrating mind.<,>她具有敏锐的头脑。<,>pen(几乎)+etr(进入)+ate(动词后缀)→几乎进入→穿透<,>permeate(v.渗透)/pierce(v.刺穿)/infiltrate(v.渗透)  

principal<,>/ˈprɪnsəpl/<,>/ˈprɪnsəpəl/<,>adj.最重要的/adj.主要的/n.负责人/n.校长/n.资本/n.本金/n.主要演员/n.主角<,>The principal reason for his success was hard work.<,>他成功的主要原因是努力工作。<,>She is the principal of the high school.<,>她是这所高中的校长。<,>He invested the principal but kept the interest.<,>他投资了本金但保留了利息。<,>prin(第一)+cip(拿)+al→拿第一的→主要的<,>principle(n.原则)/principality(n.公国)/prince(n.王子)  

tend<,>/tend/<,>/tɛnd/<,>v.照管/v.照料/v.护理/v.易于/v.往往会/v.趋向/v.倾向<,>She tends to her garden every morning.<,>她每天早晨照料她的花园。<,>Plants tend to grow toward the light.<,>植物往往会向光生长。<,>He has a tendency to exaggerate.<,>他有夸张的倾向。<,>tend(伸展)→伸展向某方向→趋向<,>attend(v.参加)/extend(v.延伸)/pretend(v.假装)  

exceedingly<,>/ɪkˈsiːdɪŋli/<,>/ɪkˈsidɪŋli/<,>adv.极端地/adv.非常<,>The task was exceedingly difficult.<,>这项任务极其困难。<,>She was exceedingly kind to us.<,>她对我们非常友善。<,>The view from the top was exceedingly beautiful.<,>从顶部看到的景色美极了。<,>exceed(超过)+ing+ly→超过一般地→非常<,>excessively(adv.过度地)/extremely(adv.极端地)/exceptionally(adv.异常地)  

specimen<,>/ˈspesɪmən/<,>/ˈspɛsəmən/<,>n.样本/n.标本/n.样品<,>The museum has a fine specimen of a dinosaur skeleton.<,>博物馆有一个很好的恐龙骨架标本。<,>The doctor took a blood specimen for testing.<,>医生取了血样进行检测。<,>This is a rare specimen of ancient pottery.<,>这是一件罕见的古代陶器标本。<,>speci(种类)+men(物品)→某类物品的代表→标本<,>sample(n.样品)/example(n.例子)/model(n.模型)  

relief<,>/rɪˈliːf/<,>/rɪˈlif/<,>n.轻松/n.宽慰/n.缓解/n.调剂/n.消遣/n.接替<,>It was a great relief to hear the good news.<,>听到这个好消息真是莫大的宽慰。<,>The medicine provided some relief from the pain.<,>这种药缓解了一些疼痛。<,>The relief pitcher saved the game.<,>替补投手挽救了比赛。<,>re(再)+lief(轻)→再次变轻→缓解<,>belief(n.信念)/grief(n.悲伤)/brief(adj.简短的)  

dimension<,>/daɪˈmenʃn/<,>/dɪˈmɛnʃən/<,>n.尺寸/n.尺度/n.方面/n.特点/n.面积/n.规模<,>We measured all the dimensions of the room.<,>我们测量了房间的所有尺寸。<,>This problem has an international dimension.<,>这个问题具有国际性。<,>The new discovery adds another dimension to our understanding.<,>这一新发现为我们的理解增添了另一个层面。<,>di(分开)+mens(测量)+ion→分开测量→尺寸<,>extension(n.延伸)/expansion(n.扩张)/comprehension(n.理解)
introduction<,>/ˌɪntrəˈdʌkʃən/<,>/ˌɪntrəˈdʌkʃən/<,>n.介绍/n.引进/n.引言<,>She gave a brief introduction about herself at the meeting.<,>她在会议上做了一个简短的自我介绍。<,>The introduction of new technology has improved productivity.<,>新技术的引进提高了生产力。<,>The book has an interesting introduction written by the author.<,>这本书有一个由作者写的有趣的引言。<,>intro(向内)+duct(引导)+ion→向内引导→介绍<,>introductory(adj.介绍的)/reduce(v.减少)/deduce(v.推断)  

deserve<,>/dɪˈzɜːv/<,>/dɪˈzɜːv/<,>vt.应受/vt.值得<,>You deserve a break after working so hard.<,>你工作这么努力，值得休息一下。<,>He deserves praise for his honesty.<,>他的诚实值得表扬。<,>Bad behavior deserves punishment.<,>不良行为应受惩罚。<,>de(加强)+serve(服务)→值得服务→值得<,>reserve(v.保留/n.储备)/preserve(v.保存)/observe(v.观察)  

process<,>/ˈprəʊses/<,>/ˈprɑːses/<,>n.过程/n.制作法/n.程序/vt.加工/vt.办理<,>The manufacturing process is highly automated.<,>制造过程高度自动化。<,>It takes time to process the visa application.<,>办理签证申请需要时间。<,>This cheese is processed from natural ingredients.<,>这种奶酪是用天然原料加工的。<,>pro(向前)+cess(走)→向前走→过程<,>procedure(n.程序)/access(n.入口)/success(n.成功)  

philosopher<,>/fɪˈlɒsəfə(r)/<,>/fɪˈlɑːsəfər/<,>n.哲学家/n.哲人<,>Socrates was a famous Greek philosopher.<,>苏格拉底是著名的希腊哲学家。<,>The philosopher shared his wisdom with his students.<,>这位哲人与他的学生分享智慧。<,>She reads books by modern philosophers.<,>她阅读现代哲学家的著作。<,>philo(爱)+soph(智慧)+er→爱智慧的人→哲学家<,>philosophy(n.哲学)/sophisticated(adj.复杂的)/sophomore(n.大学二年级学生)  

restore<,>/rɪˈstɔː(r)/<,>/rɪˈstɔːr/<,>vt.恢复/vt.使回复/vt.修复/vt.整修/vt.归还/vt.交还<,>The government is working to restore peace in the region.<,>政府正在努力恢复该地区的和平。<,>They restored the old painting to its original condition.<,>他们将这幅古画修复到原来的状态。<,>Please restore the book to the shelf after reading.<,>阅读后请将书放回书架。<,>re(重新)+store(储存)→重新储存→恢复<,>store(n.商店/v.储存)/restrain(v.抑制)/restock(v.重新进货)  

therapy<,>/ˈθerəpi/<,>/ˈθerəpi/<,>n.治疗/n.理疗<,>Physical therapy helped him recover from the injury.<,>物理治疗帮助他从伤病中恢复。<,>Music therapy can reduce stress and anxiety.<,>音乐疗法可以减轻压力和焦虑。<,>She is undergoing therapy for her depression.<,>她正在接受抑郁症的治疗。<,>therap(治疗)+y→治疗<,>therapist(n.治疗师)/thermal(adj.热的)/theorem(n.定理)  

alternative<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːnətɪv/<,>/ɔːlˈtɜːrnətɪv/<,>adj.两者选一的/adj.供选择的/adj.另类的/n.替换物/n.选择/n.选择的自由<,>We need to find an alternative solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的替代解决方案。<,>She prefers alternative medicine to traditional treatments.<,>比起传统治疗，她更喜欢另类医学。<,>You have the alternative of going by train or by bus.<,>你可以选择乘火车或乘公共汽车。<,>alter(改变)+native(…的)→可改变的→供选择的<,>alternate(v.交替)/alteration(n.改变)/native(adj.本地的)  

banner<,>/ˈbænə(r)/<,>/ˈbænər/<,>n.横幅/n.旗/n.旗帜<,>The protesters carried banners demanding justice.<,>抗议者举着要求正义的横幅。<,>The banner on the wall welcomed the new students.<,>墙上的横幅欢迎新同学。<,>The team's banner flew high during the championship.<,>在锦标赛期间，球队的旗帜高高飘扬。<,>ban(禁止)+n+er→禁止的标志→横幅<,>ban(n.禁令)/band(n.乐队)/bank(n.银行)  

concentration<,>/ˌkɒnsnˈtreɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsnˈtreɪʃn/<,>n.集中/n.专注/n.专心/n.浓缩/n.浓度<,>He lost his concentration when the phone rang.<,>电话响起时，他失去了专注力。<,>The concentration of salt in the water is very high.<,>水中的盐浓度非常高。<,>Yoga helps improve mental concentration.<,>瑜伽有助于提高精神集中力。<,>con(共同)+centr(中心)+ation→共同向中心→集中<,>central(adj.中心的)/concentric(adj.同心的)/centrifuge(n.离心机)  

encounter<,>/ɪnˈkaʊntə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkaʊntər/<,>vt.遭遇/vt.遇到/n.遭遇<,>They encountered many difficulties during the expedition.<,>他们在探险期间遇到了许多困难。<,>I had a chance encounter with an old friend yesterday.<,>昨天我偶然遇到了一位老朋友。<,>The novel describes an encounter with aliens.<,>这部小说描述了与外星人的遭遇。<,>en(使)+counter(相反)→使相对→遭遇<,>count(v.计数)/counter(n.柜台)/country(n.国家)
soda<,>/ˈsəʊdə/<,>/ˈsoʊdə/<,>n.碳酸钠/n.纯碱/n.汽水/n.苏打水<,>She ordered a glass of soda with her meal.<,>她点了一杯汽水配餐。<,>Baking soda is a common household item.<,>小苏打是常见的家用物品。<,>He prefers soda over juice.<,>比起果汁，他更喜欢汽水。<,>so(苏)+da(打)→苏打<,>sofa(n.沙发)/soap(n.肥皂)/solar(adj.太阳的)

gratitude<,>/ˈɡrætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈɡrætɪtuːd/<,>n.感激/n.感谢/n.感恩<,>I expressed my gratitude for their help.<,>我对他们的帮助表达了感激。<,>She showed deep gratitude to her teacher.<,>她对老师表示了深深的感谢。<,>Gratitude is the best attitude.<,>感恩是最好的态度。<,>grat(高兴)+itude(状态)→感激的状态<,>attitude(n.态度)/altitude(n.海拔)/latitude(n.纬度)  

approve<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>/əˈpruːv/<,>vt.赞成/vt.称许/vt.批准<,>The committee approved the new policy.<,>委员会批准了新政策。<,>Her parents approved of her decision.<,>她的父母赞成她的决定。<,>The manager approved my leave request.<,>经理批准了我的请假申请。<,>ap(强调)+prove(证明)→证明可行→批准<,>improve(v.改进)/prove(v.证明)/disapprove(v.不赞成)  

interaction<,>/ˌɪntərˈækʃn/<,>/ˌɪntərˈækʃn/<,>n.相互作用/n.干扰<,>The interaction between the two chemicals caused a reaction.<,>两种化学物质的相互作用引起了反应。<,>Social interaction is important for mental health.<,>社交互动对心理健康很重要。<,>There was little interaction between the two groups.<,>两组之间几乎没有互动。<,>inter(相互)+action(行动)→相互作用<,>interfere(v.干涉)/intervene(v.干预)/internet(n.互联网)  

chew<,>/tʃuː/<,>/tʃuː/<,>vt.咀嚼/vt.嚼碎<,>Chew your food properly before swallowing.<,>吞咽前要好好咀嚼食物。<,>The dog was chewing on a bone.<,>狗在啃骨头。<,>She chewed her gum loudly.<,>她大声地嚼着口香糖。<,>发音类似"嚼"<,>chop(v.砍)/cheer(v.欢呼)/cheek(n.脸颊)  

interfere<,>/ˌɪntəˈfɪə(r)/<,>/ˌɪntərˈfɪr/<,>vi.干涉/vi.干预/vi.妨碍<,>Don't interfere in other people's business.<,>不要干涉别人的事情。<,>The noise interfered with my concentration.<,>噪音干扰了我的注意力。<,>The government shouldn't interfere with the market.<,>政府不应该干预市场。<,>inter(在...之间)+fere(打击)→在中间打击→干涉<,>intervene(v.干预)/interrupt(v.打断)/infer(v.推断)  

apartment<,>/əˈpɑːtmənt/<,>/əˈpɑːrtmənt/<,>n.一套公寓房间<,>They rented an apartment in the city center.<,>他们在市中心租了一套公寓。<,>My apartment has two bedrooms and a kitchen.<,>我的公寓有两间卧室和一个厨房。<,>The apartment building has 20 floors.<,>这栋公寓楼有20层。<,>apart(分开)+ment(名词后缀)→分开的房间→公寓<,>department(n.部门)/compartment(n.隔间)/apart(adv.分开地)  

account<,>/əˈkaʊnt/<,>/əˈkaʊnt/<,>vi.说明原因/vi.占/n.记述/n.解释/n.账目<,>He couldn't account for his absence.<,>他无法解释自己缺席的原因。<,>Please give me your account of what happened.<,>请告诉我你对发生的事情的描述。<,>She keeps a detailed account of her expenses.<,>她详细记录自己的开支。<,>ac(强调)+count(计算)→账目<,>amount(n.数量)/discount(n.折扣)/counter(n.柜台)  

uneasy<,>/ʌnˈiːzi/<,>/ʌnˈiːzi/<,>adj.心神不安的/adj.忧虑的<,>I felt uneasy about the decision.<,>我对这个决定感到不安。<,>There was an uneasy silence in the room.<,>房间里有一种令人不安的沉默。<,>He gave me an uneasy look.<,>他给了我一个不安的眼神。<,>un(不)+easy(轻松的)→不轻松的→不安的<,>easy(adj.容易的)/disease(n.疾病)/uneven(adj.不平坦的)
tolerate<,>/ˈtɒləreɪt/<,>/ˈtɑːləreɪt/<,>vt.忍受/vt.容忍/vt.容许/vt.承认<,>She cannot tolerate loud noises.<,>她无法忍受噪音。<,>We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.<,>我们不容忍任何形式的歧视。<,>The teacher tolerated late submissions due to special circumstances.<,>老师因特殊情况允许迟交作业。<,>tol(忍受)+erate(动词后缀)→忍受<,>tolerance(n.容忍)/intolerable(adj.无法忍受的)  

developmental<,>/dɪˌveləpˈmentl/<,>/dɪˌveləpˈmentl/<,>adj.发展的<,>The program focuses on developmental psychology.<,>这个项目专注于发展心理学。<,>Early childhood is a critical developmental stage.<,>幼儿期是发展的关键阶段。<,>They studied the developmental milestones in infants.<,>他们研究了婴儿的发展里程碑。<,>develop(发展)+mental(形容词后缀)→发展的<,>development(n.发展)/developmentalist(n.发展专家)  

stack<,>/stæk/<,>/stæk/<,>n.堆/n.垛/vt.堆积/vt.堆放于<,>He stacked the books neatly on the shelf.<,>他把书整齐地堆放在书架上。<,>There was a stack of papers on the desk.<,>桌上有一堆文件。<,>She stacked the firewood for winter.<,>她为冬天堆好了柴火。<,>s(看作“山”)+tack(钉)→像山一样堆起来→堆<,>stock(n.库存)/stake(n.木桩)/stark(adj.完全的)  

underline<,>/ˌʌndəˈlaɪn/<,>/ˈʌndərlaɪn/<,>vt.在…下面画线/vt.强调/vt.使…突出<,>Please underline the key points in the text.<,>请在文中关键点下画线。<,>His speech underlined the importance of education.<,>他的演讲强调了教育的重要性。<,>The report underlines the need for immediate action.<,>报告突出了立即行动的必要性。<,>under(在…下)+line(线)→在下面画线→强调<,>underline(n.下划线)/underlying(adj.潜在的)  

innocent<,>/ˈɪnəsnt/<,>/ˈɪnəsnt/<,>adj.清白的/adj.幼稚的/adj.没有恶意的<,>The jury found him innocent of all charges.<,>陪审团判定他所有指控均不成立。<,>She gave an innocent smile.<,>她露出了天真的微笑。<,>It was just an innocent mistake.<,>那只是个无心的错误。<,>in(无)+noc(伤害)+ent(形容词后缀)→无伤害的→清白的<,>innocence(n.清白)/ignorant(adj.无知的)  

compassion<,>/kəmˈpæʃn/<,>/kəmˈpæʃn/<,>n.同情/n.怜悯<,>She showed great compassion for the homeless.<,>她对无家可归者表现出极大的同情。<,>Compassion is essential in healthcare.<,>怜悯在医疗保健中至关重要。<,>He acted out of compassion for the victims.<,>他出于对受害者的怜悯而行动。<,>com(共同)+pass(感情)+ion(名词后缀)→共同感情→同情<,>passion(n.激情)/compatible(adj.兼容的)  

alphabet<,>/ˈælfəbet/<,>/ˈælfəbet/<,>n.字母表/n.字母系统<,>Children learn the alphabet in kindergarten.<,>孩子们在幼儿园学习字母表。<,>The English alphabet has 26 letters.<,>英语字母表有26个字母。<,>She is practicing writing the Greek alphabet.<,>她正在练习写希腊字母表。<,>alpha(希腊字母α)+bet(希腊字母β)→字母表<,>alphabetical(adj.按字母顺序的)/alphabetic(adj.字母的)  

parliament<,>/ˈpɑːləmənt/<,>/ˈpɑːrləmənt/<,>n.议会/n.国会<,>The new law was debated in parliament.<,>新法律在议会进行了辩论。<,>She was elected to the UK Parliament.<,>她当选为英国国会议员。<,>Parliament will vote on the bill next week.<,>议会将于下周对该法案进行投票。<,>parlia(说话)+ment(名词后缀)→说话的地方→议会<,>parley(n.谈判)/parlour(n.会客厅)  

evaluation<,>/ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃn/<,>/ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃn/<,>n.评价/n.估计<,>The teacher gave a positive evaluation of his work.<,>老师对他的作业给予了积极评价。<,>We need a proper evaluation of the situation.<,>我们需要对情况进行恰当评估。<,>The evaluation process takes two weeks.<,>评估过程需要两周时间。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ation(名词后缀)→评估出价值→评价<,>value(n.价值)/valuable(adj.有价值的)  

crack<,>/kræk/<,>/kræk/<,>vi.爆裂/vi.噼啪地响/vi.打/vi.击/n.裂缝/n.裂纹/n.破裂声<,>The ice began to crack under the weight.<,>冰在重压下开始破裂。<,>We heard a loud crack of thunder.<,>我们听到一声响雷。<,>He cracked the code after hours of work.<,>他工作数小时后破解了密码。<,>c(象形裂缝)+rack(架子)→架子裂开→裂缝<,>cracker(n.饼干)/crackle(vi.发出噼啪声)
bind<,>/baɪnd/<,>/baɪnd/<,>vt.捆绑/vt.包扎/vt.装订/vt.约束/vt.使结合/vt.使黏合<,>She used a rope to bind the books together.<,>她用绳子把书捆在一起。<,>The wound was bound with a clean bandage.<,>伤口用干净的绷带包扎好了。<,>The contract binds both parties to the agreement.<,>这份合同约束双方履行协议。<,>bin(捆绑)+d→捆绑<,>band(n.带子/v.用带绑扎)/bend(v.弯曲/n.弯曲处)  

trim<,>/trɪm/<,>/trɪm/<,>adj.整齐的/vt.使整齐<,>She keeps her garden neat and trim.<,>她把花园打理得整洁美观。<,>He trimmed his beard before the interview.<,>面试前他修剪了胡子。<,>The editor trimmed the article to fit the space.<,>编辑删减文章以适应版面。<,>tri(三)+m→三方面整理→使整齐<,>slim(adj.苗条的/v.减肥)/brim(n.边缘/v.满溢)  

appreciate<,>/əˈpriːʃieɪt/<,>/əˈpriːʃiˌeɪt/<,>vt.重视/vt.赏识/vt.领会/vt.体会/vt.感谢/vt.增值<,>I really appreciate your help.<,>我非常感谢你的帮助。<,>She appreciates fine art.<,>她鉴赏美术作品。<,>The property has appreciated in value.<,>这处房产增值了。<,>ap(加强)+preci(价值)+ate→给予价值→赏识<,>depreciate(v.贬值)/appropriate(adj.适当的)  

dental<,>/ˈdentl/<,>/ˈdɛntl/<,>adj.牙齿的/adj.牙科的<,>She has a dental appointment tomorrow.<,>她明天约了牙医。<,>Regular dental care is important.<,>定期牙齿护理很重要。<,>The dentist used dental tools to examine my teeth.<,>牙医用牙科工具检查我的牙齿。<,>dent(牙齿)+al(…的)→牙齿的<,>mental(adj.精神的)/rental(n.租赁)  

predictable<,>/prɪˈdɪktəbl/<,>/prɪˈdɪktəbəl/<,>adj.可预料的<,>His reaction was predictable.<,>他的反应在意料之中。<,>The movie had a predictable ending.<,>这部电影结局老套。<,>Weather patterns are becoming less predictable.<,>天气模式越来越难以预测。<,>pre(前)+dict(说)+able(可…的)→可预言的<,>unpredictable(adj.不可预测的)/predictive(adj.预测性的)  

diverse<,>/daɪˈvɜːs/<,>/daɪˈvɜːrs/<,>adj.不一样的/adj.相异的/adj.多种多样的<,>The city has a diverse population.<,>这座城市人口多元。<,>We need diverse opinions to solve this problem.<,>我们需要不同意见来解决这个问题。<,>The ecosystem supports diverse species.<,>这个生态系统支持多种物种。<,>di(分开)+vers(转)+e→转向不同方向→多样的<,>divert(v.转移)/reverse(adj.相反的)  

railway<,>/ˈreɪlweɪ/<,>/ˈreɪlˌweɪ/<,>n.铁路<,>The railway connects two major cities.<,>这条铁路连接两座大城市。<,>He works for the railway company.<,>他在铁路公司工作。<,>The old railway has been turned into a bike path.<,>旧铁路被改造成了自行车道。<,>rail(铁轨)+way(路)→铁路<,>freeway(n.高速公路)/subway(n.地铁)  

cube<,>/kjuːb/<,>/kjub/<,>adj.清澈透明的/n.立方形/n.立方<,>Ice cubes clinked in the glass.<,>冰块在玻璃杯里叮当作响。<,>Cut the cheese into small cubes.<,>把奶酪切成小方块。<,>The water was cube clear.<,>水清澈透明。<,>cub(立方)+e→立方体<,>tube(n.管子)/cure(v.治愈)  

rally<,>/ˈræli/<,>/ˈræli/<,>v.集合/v.团结/v.恢复/v.重新振作/n.集会/n.公路汽车赛<,>Supporters rallied behind the team.<,>支持者们团结在队伍周围。<,>After the setback, he rallied quickly.<,>遭遇挫折后，他很快振作起来。<,>The car rally attracted many participants.<,>汽车拉力赛吸引了许多参赛者。<,>r(重新)+ally(联盟)→重新结盟→团结<,>ally(n.盟友/v.结盟)/sally(n.突围/v.出发)  

prime<,>/praɪm/<,>/praɪm/<,>adj.首要的/adj.最好的/n.青春/n.全盛时期/vt.使准备好<,>This is a prime example of good design.<,>这是优秀设计的典范。<,>She's in the prime of her career.<,>她正处于事业巅峰期。<,>The coach primed the team for the match.<,>教练让队伍做好比赛准备。<,>prim(第一)+e→首要的<,>premier(adj.首要的)/primary(adj.主要的)
happen<,>/ˈhæpən/<,>/ˈhæpən/<,>vi.发生/vi.碰巧/vi.恰好<,>What will happen if you press this button?<,>如果你按下这个按钮会发生什么？<,>I happened to meet an old friend at the mall.<,>我在商场碰巧遇到了一位老朋友。<,>It happens that we have the same birthday.<,>恰好我们同一天生日。<,>hap(运气)+pen(可能)→可能发生的事<,>happy(adj.快乐的)/happenstance(n.偶然事件)

festival<,>/ˈfestɪvl/<,>/ˈfɛstəvəl/<,>n.节日/n.音乐节<,>The Spring Festival is the most important holiday in China.<,>春节是中国最重要的节日。<,>We're going to a jazz festival this weekend.<,>这周末我们要去参加一个爵士音乐节。<,>The city hosts an international film festival every year.<,>这个城市每年举办国际电影节。<,>fest(节日)+ival→节日庆典<,>feast(n.盛宴)/festive(adj.节日的)

mild<,>/maɪld/<,>/maɪld/<,>adj.温柔的/adj.温暖的/adj.轻微的<,>She has a very mild temperament.<,>她性情非常温柔。<,>The weather is mild in spring.<,>春天的天气很温暖。<,>I have a mild headache.<,>我有点轻微头痛。<,>mild(温和的)与wild(狂野的)对比记忆<,>wild(adj.野生的)/mile(n.英里)

profile<,>/ˈprəʊfaɪl/<,>/ˈproʊfaɪl/<,>n.侧面/n.人物简介/n.轮廓/n.形象/n.姿态/vt.描绘/vt.写传略<,>She has a beautiful profile.<,>她的侧脸很美。<,>Please update your social media profile.<,>请更新你的社交媒体个人资料。<,>The journalist profiled the famous scientist.<,>这位记者为著名科学家写了人物简介。<,>pro(前面)+file(线条)→前面的线条→轮廓<,>file(n.文件)/pile(n.堆)

loyal<,>/ˈlɔɪəl/<,>/ˈlɔɪəl/<,>adj.忠诚的/adj.忠心的<,>He has been loyal to his company for 20 years.<,>他对公司忠心耿耿20年。<,>Dogs are known to be loyal animals.<,>狗以忠诚著称。<,>She remained loyal to her principles.<,>她始终忠于自己的原则。<,>loy(法律)+al→遵守法律→忠诚的<,>royal(adj.皇家的)/legal(adj.合法的)

preference<,>/ˈprefrəns/<,>/ˈprɛfərəns/<,>n.喜爱/n.偏爱/n.偏爱的事物/n.优先<,>I have a preference for tea over coffee.<,>比起咖啡我更喜欢茶。<,>The teacher showed no preference to any student.<,>老师对任何学生都没有偏爱。<,>Seats are given on a first-come, first-served preference.<,>座位按照先到先得的原则分配。<,>pre(前)+fer(拿)+ence→优先拿取→偏爱<,>reference(n.参考)/difference(n.不同)

impact<,>/ˈɪmpækt/<,>/ˈɪmˌpækt/<,>n.影响/n.作用/n.冲击<,>The new law will have a big impact on businesses.<,>新法律将对企业产生重大影响。<,>The car hit the wall with great impact.<,>汽车猛烈地撞上了墙。<,>Her speech made a profound impact on the audience.<,>她的演讲对观众产生了深远影响。<,>im(进入)+pact(压)→压进去→冲击<,>compact(adj.紧凑的)/impair(v.损害)

opportunity<,>/ˌɒpəˈtjuːnəti/<,>/ˌɑːpərˈtuːnəti/<,>n.机会/n.良机<,>This job is a great opportunity for you.<,>这份工作对你来说是个大好机会。<,>Don't miss this golden opportunity.<,>不要错过这个黄金机会。<,>He took the opportunity to travel abroad.<,>他抓住机会出国旅行了。<,>op(附近)+port(港口)+unity→靠近港口的机会→良机<,>opposite(adj.相反的)/opponent(n.对手)

active<,>/ˈæktɪv/<,>/ˈæktɪv/<,>adj.活跃的/adj.积极的/adj.主动的/adj.起作用的<,>She is very active in community service.<,>她在社区服务中非常活跃。<,>Volcanoes can remain active for many years.<,>火山可以保持活跃很多年。<,>Take an active part in class discussions.<,>积极参与课堂讨论。<,>act(行动)+ive→活跃的<,>actor(n.演员)/action(n.行动)

dorm<,>/dɔːm/<,>/dɔːrm/<,>n.宿舍<,>I live in a dorm on campus.<,>我住在校园宿舍里。<,>The dorm rules are quite strict.<,>宿舍规定相当严格。<,>We had a party in our dorm last night.<,>昨晚我们在宿舍开了个派对。<,>dormitory的缩写形式<,>door(n.门)/form(n.表格)
whichever<,>/wɪtʃˈevə(r)/<,>/wɪtʃˈevər/<,>pron&adj.无论哪个/无论哪些<,>You can choose whichever book you like.<,>你可以选择你喜欢的任何一本书。<,>Whichever decision you make, I will support you.<,>无论你做什么决定，我都会支持你。<,>Whichever way you look at it, the situation is not good.<,>无论你从哪个角度看，情况都不乐观。<,>which(哪一个)+ever(无论)→无论哪个<,>whatever(pron&adj.无论什么)/whenever(adv.无论何时)

court<,>/kɔːt/<,>/kɔːrt/<,>n.法院/n.法庭/n.庭院/n.宫廷/n.球场<,>The case was settled out of court.<,>这个案件在庭外和解了。<,>They played tennis on the court.<,>他们在球场上打网球。<,>The king held a grand feast at his court.<,>国王在宫廷里举行了盛大的宴会。<,>cour(跑)+t→跑动的地方→球场<,>quart(n.夸脱)/curt(adj.简短的)/cohort(n.一群人)

venture<,>/ˈventʃə(r)/<,>/ˈventʃər/<,>v.冒险/v.敢于/n.风险投资/n.风险项目<,>They ventured into the unknown forest.<,>他们冒险进入了未知的森林。<,>He started a new business venture.<,>他开始了一项新的商业冒险。<,>Don't venture too far from the path.<,>不要离小路太远。<,>vent(来)+ure→来到危险的地方→冒险<,>adventure(n.冒险)/vulture(n.秃鹫)/venue(n.地点)

bucket<,>/ˈbʌkɪt/<,>/ˈbʌkɪt/<,>n.水桶/n.吊桶/n.铲斗<,>He filled the bucket with water.<,>他把水桶装满了水。<,>The kids played with sand and buckets at the beach.<,>孩子们在海滩上玩沙子和水桶。<,>She kicked the bucket accidentally.<,>她不小心踢翻了水桶。<,>buck(美元)+et→装钱的桶→水桶<,>pocket(n.口袋)/racket(n.球拍)/ticket(n.票)

senior<,>/ˈsiːniə(r)/<,>/ˈsiːnjər/<,>adj.资格较老的/adj.地位较高的/adj.年长的/n.较年长者/n.毕业班学生<,>She is a senior manager in the company.<,>她是公司的高级经理。<,>He is my senior by three years.<,>他比我大三岁。<,>The seniors are preparing for graduation.<,>毕业班的学生正在准备毕业。<,>sen(老)+ior(比较级)→更老的→年长的<,>junior(adj.年少的)/senate(n.参议院)/senile(adj.衰老的)

dose<,>/dəʊs/<,>/doʊs/<,>n.剂量/n.用量/n.一剂<,>Take one dose of medicine every four hours.<,>每四小时服用一剂药。<,>The doctor prescribed the correct dose.<,>医生开了正确的剂量。<,>An overdose can be dangerous.<,>过量服用可能是危险的。<,>do(做)+se(色)→做颜色→剂量<,>doze(v.打盹)/rose(n.玫瑰)/hose(n.软管)

route<,>/ruːt/<,>/ruːt/<,>n.路线/n.路程<,>We took the scenic route to the mountains.<,>我们走了一条风景优美的路线去山区。<,>What's the quickest route to the airport?<,>去机场最快的路线是什么？<,>The bus follows the same route every day.<,>公交车每天走同样的路线。<,>rou(路)+te(特)→特别的路→路线<,>root(n.根)/rote(n.死记硬背)/rout(n.溃败)
