flexible<,>/ˈfleksəbl/<,>/ˈfleksəbəl/<,>adj.易弯曲的/adj.灵活的<,>This material is very flexible.<,>这种材料非常柔韧。<,>We need a flexible approach to solve this problem.<,>我们需要灵活的方法来解决这个问题。<,>She has a flexible schedule.<,>她的时间表很灵活。<,>flex(弯曲)+ible(能…的)→能弯曲的→灵活的<,>inflexible(adj.不灵活的)/reflex(n.反射)/flexion(n.弯曲)
adult<,>/ˈædʌlt/<,>/əˈdʌlt/<,>adj.成年的/adj.成年人的/n.成年人<,>She is now an adult and can make her own decisions.<,>她现在是个成年人了，可以自己做决定。<,>Adult education is becoming more popular these days.<,>成人教育如今越来越受欢迎。<,>This movie is for adult audiences only.<,>这部电影仅限成年观众观看。<,>ad(强调)+ult(成长)→成长完成的→成年的<,>adolescent(n.青少年/adj.青春期的)/adultery(n.通奸)

attitude<,>/ˈætɪtjuːd/<,>/ˈætɪtuːd/<,>n.态度/n.看法/n.姿势<,>His attitude towards work is very positive.<,>他对工作的态度非常积极。<,>She stood in a relaxed attitude.<,>她以放松的姿势站着。<,>Changing your attitude can change your life.<,>改变态度可以改变人生。<,>altitude(高度)去掉'l'→态度<,>altitude(n.海拔高度)/aptitude(n.天资)/latitude(n.纬度)

relative<,>/ˈrelətɪv/<,>/ˈrɛlətɪv/<,>adj.有关系的/adj.相对的/n.亲属<,>All human values are relative.<,>人类的所有价值都是相对的。<,>She's visiting her relatives in Canada.<,>她正在加拿大探亲。<,>The humidity is high relative to the temperature.<,>相对于温度而言湿度很高。<,>relate(关联)+ive→有关系的<,>relation(n.关系)/relativity(n.相对论)/relax(v.放松)

organ<,>/ˈɔːɡən/<,>/ˈɔrɡən/<,>n.器官/n.机构/n.管风琴/n.新闻媒介<,>The heart is a vital organ.<,>心脏是重要器官。<,>He plays the organ at church every Sunday.<,>他每周日在教堂弹管风琴。<,>This newspaper is the official organ of the party.<,>这份报纸是该党的官方喉舌。<,>org(工作)+an→工作的结构→器官<,>organic(adj.有机的)/organism(n.生物体)/organization(n.组织)

average<,>/ˈævərɪdʒ/<,>/ˈævərɪdʒ/<,>adj.平均的/adj.平常的/v.平均/n.平均数<,>The average temperature in July is 30°C.<,>七月的平均气温是30度。<,>Her performance was just average.<,>她的表现只是中等水平。<,>We average eight hours' work a day.<,>我们平均每天工作八小时。<,>a+ver(真实)+age→接近真实的→平均的<,>coverage(n.覆盖范围)/beverage(n.饮料)/leverage(n.杠杆作用)

treatment<,>/ˈtriːtmənt/<,>/ˈtritmənt/<,>n.待遇/n.治疗/n.对待<,>He received special treatment because of his position.<,>他因为职位得到了特殊待遇。<,>The new treatment has shown promising results.<,>新疗法显示出良好效果。<,>Fair treatment of all employees is important.<,>公平对待所有员工很重要。<,>treat(处理)+ment→处理方式→待遇<,>retreat(v.撤退/n.静修)/entreat(v.恳求)/maltreat(v.虐待)

compare<,>/kəmˈpeə(r)/<,>/kəmˈpɛr/<,>v.比较/v.对照/v.把...比作<,>Compare the two products before buying.<,>购买前比较下这两款产品。<,>Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?<,>我能否将你比作夏日？<,>Compared to last year, sales have doubled.<,>与去年相比，销售额翻了一番。<,>com(共同)+pare(平等)→使平等→比较<,>comparison(n.比较)/comparable(adj.可比较的)/compartment(n.隔间)

pluralism<,>/ˈplʊərəlɪzəm/<,>/ˈplʊrəlɪzəm/<,>n.多重性/n.兼职<,>Cultural pluralism enriches society.<,>文化多元性丰富了社会。<,>He maintains pluralism by holding two jobs.<,>他通过做两份工作来维持兼职状态。<,>Pluralism of opinions is healthy in a democracy.<,>意见多元化在民主制度中是健康的。<,>plural(复数)+ism→多重性<,>plural(adj.复数的)/plurality(n.多数)/plus(prep.加)

influential<,>/ˌɪnfluˈenʃl/<,>/ˌɪnfluˈɛnʃəl/<,>adj.有影响的/adj.有权势的<,>She is an influential figure in the art world.<,>她是艺术界有影响力的人物。<,>This was a highly influential decision.<,>这是个极具影响力的决定。<,>He comes from an influential family.<,>他出身于有权势的家族。<,>in(进入)+flu(流)+ential→能流入人心的→有影响的<,>influence(n.影响/v.影响)/fluent(adj.流利的)/affluent(adj.富裕的)

shiver<,>/ˈʃɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈʃɪvər/<,>n.战栗/v.颤抖<,>A shiver ran down her spine.<,>一阵战栗顺着她的脊背而下。<,>He was shivering with cold.<,>他冷得发抖。<,>The ghost story gave me the shivers.<,>这个鬼故事让我浑身发抖。<,>shi(拼音"湿")+ver→湿冷得发抖<,>quiver(v.颤抖/n.箭袋)/shudder(v.战栗)/shake(v.摇晃)
Bible<,>/ˈbaɪbl/<,>/ˈbaɪbəl/<,>n.圣经<,>He reads the Bible every night before bed.<,>他每晚睡前都会读圣经。<,>The Bible has been translated into many languages.<,>圣经已被翻译成多种语言。<,>She finds comfort in the teachings of the Bible.<,>她从圣经的教诲中找到慰藉。<,>Bible源自希腊语"biblia"，意为"书籍"<,>bibliography(n.参考文献)/biblical(adj.圣经的)

liquor<,>/ˈlɪkə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪkɚ/<,>n.酒/n.烈性酒<,>He was arrested for driving under the influence of liquor.<,>他因酒后驾驶被捕。<,>This store sells various types of liquor.<,>这家商店出售各种烈酒。<,>She doesn't drink hard liquor, only wine.<,>她不喝烈酒，只喝葡萄酒。<,>liqu(液体)+or(名词后缀)→液体→酒<,>liquid(n.液体)/liqueur(n.利口酒)/liquefy(v.液化)

honourable<,>/ˈɒnərəbl/<,>/ˈɑːnərəbəl/<,>adj.光荣的/adj.可敬的/adj.正直的<,>He received an honourable discharge from the army.<,>他从军队光荣退伍。<,>It was an honourable thing to admit your mistake.<,>承认错误是件光荣的事。<,>She comes from an honourable family.<,>她出身于一个受人尊敬的家族。<,>honour(荣誉)+able(能...的)→能带来荣誉的<,>honorary(adj.名誉的)/honor(n.荣誉)/dishonourable(adj.不光彩的)

characteristic<,>/ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/<,>/ˌkærəktəˈrɪstɪk/<,>adj.特有的/adj.典型的/n.特性<,>The striped pattern is characteristic of tigers.<,>条纹图案是老虎的特征。<,>Her kindness is one of her most endearing characteristics.<,>她的善良是她最可爱的特点之一。<,>This behavior is characteristic of his rebellious phase.<,>这种行为是他叛逆期的典型表现。<,>character(特征)+istic(形容词后缀)→特征的<,>character(n.性格)/characterize(v.以...为特征)/characterization(n.特性描述)

transparent<,>/trænsˈpærənt/<,>/trænsˈpærənt/<,>adj.透明的/adj.易识破的/adj.明显的<,>The glass is completely transparent.<,>这块玻璃完全透明。<,>His lies were transparent to everyone.<,>他的谎言对每个人来说都很明显。<,>We need more transparent policies in government.<,>我们需要政府更透明的政策。<,>trans(穿过)+par(看见)+ent→能看穿的→透明的<,>translucent(adj.半透明的)/opaque(adj.不透明的)/apparent(adj.明显的)

interior<,>/ɪnˈtɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈtɪriɚ/<,>adj.内部的/adj.内地的/n.内部<,>The interior of the house was beautifully decorated.<,>房子的内部装修得很漂亮。<,>He specializes in interior design.<,>他专攻室内设计。<,>They traveled to the interior of the country.<,>他们前往该国内陆地区旅行。<,>inter(在...内)+ior(比较级后缀)→更内部的<,>exterior(n.外部)/inferior(adj.下级的)/superior(adj.上级的)

rouse<,>/raʊz/<,>/raʊz/<,>vt.惊起/vt.唤起/vt.唤醒<,>The loud noise roused the sleeping baby.<,>巨大的声响惊醒了熟睡的婴儿。<,>His speech roused the crowd to action.<,>他的演讲唤起了人群的行动。<,>I couldn't rouse him from his deep sleep.<,>我无法把他从熟睡中唤醒。<,>与"rise"(上升)相似，都有"起来"的意思<,>arouse(vt.引起)/rouse(vt.唤醒)/drowse(vi.打瞌睡)

journal<,>/ˈdʒɜːnl/<,>/ˈdʒɜːrnl/<,>n.日报/n.杂志/n.日志<,>She keeps a personal journal to record her thoughts.<,>她记个人日志来记录自己的想法。<,>This scientific journal publishes groundbreaking research.<,>这本科学杂志发表突破性研究。<,>He works as a reporter for a daily journal.<,>他在一家日报社当记者。<,>journ(日)+al→每日的→日报<,>journalism(n.新闻业)/journalist(n.记者)/journey(n.旅行)

grasp<,>/ɡrɑːsp/<,>/ɡræsp/<,>vt.抓紧/vt.握紧/vt.理解/n.抓/n.理解<,>The baby grasped my finger tightly.<,>婴儿紧紧抓住我的手指。<,>I finally grasped the concept after hours of study.<,>经过数小时的学习，我终于理解了这个概念。<,>He has a good grasp of the situation.<,>他对情况有很好的把握。<,>与"grip"(紧握)意思相近<,>grasp(vt.理解)/grip(vt.紧握)/grape(n.葡萄)

involvement<,>/ɪnˈvɒlvmənt/<,>/ɪnˈvɑːlvmənt/<,>n.连累/n.包含<,>Her involvement in the project was crucial to its success.<,>她参与该项目对其成功至关重要。<,>He denied any involvement in the crime.<,>他否认与这起犯罪有任何牵连。<,>Parental involvement improves children's education.<,>家长的参与能改善孩子的教育。<,>in(进入)+volve(卷)+ment→卷入其中→参与<,>involve(vt.包含)/evolution(n.进化)/revolve(vi.旋转)
spark<,>/spɑːk/<,>/spɑrk/<,>vi.发出火花/n.火花/n.火星<,>The wires sparked when they touched.<,>电线接触时迸出了火花。<,>A tiny spark can start a fire.<,>一点火星就能引发火灾。<,>Her performance sparked a lot of interest.<,>她的表演引起了很多兴趣。<,>sp(喷)+ark(方舟)→喷出火花的方舟→火花<,>sparkle(v.闪耀/n.闪光)/spare(v.节省/adj.多余的)/stark(adj.完全的/adv.完全地)  

unlike<,>/ʌnˈlaɪk/<,>/ʌnˈlaɪk/<,>adj.不同的/prep.不像…<,>Unlike his brother, he is very quiet.<,>与他哥哥不同，他很安静。<,>The two paintings are quite unlike.<,>这两幅画很不一样。<,>She looks unlike her usual self today.<,>她今天看起来和往常不一样。<,>un(不)+like(像)→不像<,>dislike(v.不喜欢/n.厌恶)/alike(adj.相似的/adv.相似地)/unlikely(adj.不太可能的)  

assembly<,>/əˈsembli/<,>/əˈsɛmbli/<,>n.立法机构/n.议会/n.集合/n.集会的人们/n.装配/n.组装<,>The assembly passed the new law.<,>议会通过了新法律。<,>Morning assembly is at 8 a.m.<,>晨会早上8点开始。<,>The car assembly line is very efficient.<,>汽车装配线效率很高。<,>as(加强)+semble(类似)+y→把类似的东西放一起→集合<,>assemble(v.集合/v.装配)/resemble(v.像/v.类似)/dissemble(v.掩饰/v.假装)  

hearing<,>/ˈhɪərɪŋ/<,>/ˈhɪrɪŋ/<,>n.听力/n.听觉/n.听力所及之距离/n.意见听取会/n.申辩的机会<,>His hearing is getting worse.<,>他的听力越来越差。<,>The hearing will be held next week.<,>听证会将在下周举行。<,>Stay within hearing distance.<,>保持在能听到的距离内。<,>hear(听)+ing(状态)→听力<,>hearty(adj.衷心的/n.朋友们)/hearken(v.倾听)/overhear(v.无意中听到)  

acquisition<,>/ˌækwɪˈzɪʃn/<,>/ˌækwəˈzɪʃən/<,>n.取得/n.获得/n.习得/n.获得物/n.增添的人<,>Language acquisition takes time.<,>语言习得需要时间。<,>The museum's latest acquisition is a Picasso.<,>博物馆最新获得的藏品是一幅毕加索的画。<,>He is a valuable acquisition to the team.<,>他是团队的重要新成员。<,>ac(加强)+quis(寻求)+ition→不断寻求→获得<,>requisition(n.征用/v.征用)/inquisition(n.调查)/exquisite(adj.精致的)  

volcano<,>/vɒlˈkeɪnəʊ/<,>/vɑlˈkeɪnoʊ/<,>n.火山<,>The volcano erupted last night.<,>火山昨晚喷发了。<,>They live near an active volcano.<,>他们住在一座活火山附近。<,>Volcanic ash covered the town.<,>火山灰覆盖了整个小镇。<,>vol(意志)+can(能)+o→能喷发意志的→火山<,>volcanic(adj.火山的)/volition(n.意志)/voluble(adj.健谈的)  

rigid<,>/ˈrɪdʒɪd/<,>/ˈrɪdʒɪd/<,>adj.严格的/adj.死板的/adj.刚硬的/adj.僵硬的<,>The rules are too rigid.<,>这些规定太死板了。<,>He lay rigid with fear.<,>他吓得僵直地躺着。<,>Rigid materials don't bend easily.<,>刚性材料不易弯曲。<,>rig(硬)+id→硬的→刚硬的<,>rigorous(adj.严格的)/rigidity(n.刚性)/frigid(adj.寒冷的)  

deadline<,>/ˈdedlaɪn/<,>/ˈdɛdˌlaɪn/<,>n.最后期限<,>The deadline is tomorrow.<,>截止日期是明天。<,>Don't miss the deadline.<,>不要错过截止日期。<,>We're working to meet the deadline.<,>我们正在努力按时完成。<,>dead(死)+line(线)→死亡线→最后期限<,>headline(n.标题)/guideline(n.指导方针)/lifeline(n.生命线)  

so-called<,>/ˌsəʊˈkɔːld/<,>/ˌsoʊˈkɔld/<,>adj.所谓的/adj.号称的<,>His so-called friend betrayed him.<,>他所谓的朋友背叛了他。<,>The so-called expert was wrong.<,>那个所谓的专家错了。<,>It's just a so-called miracle cure.<,>这只是一个号称的奇迹疗法。<,>so(如此)+called(叫)→如此称呼的→所谓的<,>well-known(adj.众所周知的)/aforementioned(adj.前述的)/aforenamed(adj.前述的)  

grateful<,>/ˈɡreɪtfl/<,>/ˈɡreɪtfəl/<,>adj.感激的/adj.令人愉快的<,>I'm grateful for your help.<,>我很感激你的帮助。<,>It was a grateful rain after the drought.<,>这是干旱后一场喜人的雨。<,>She gave him a grateful smile.<,>她给了他一个感激的微笑。<,>grate(高兴)+ful(充满)→充满高兴的→感激的<,>gratitude(n.感激)/graceful(adj.优雅的)/grace(n.优雅)
chip<,>/tʃɪp/<,>/tʃɪp/<,>n.屑片/n.碎片/n.炸土豆条/n.集成电路片/n.集成块/n.缺口/n.瑕疵<,>He ate a bag of potato chips while watching TV.<,>他看电视时吃了一袋薯片。<,>There's a chip in the edge of this plate.<,>这个盘子的边缘有个缺口。<,>The computer chip is the heart of modern electronics.<,>计算机芯片是现代电子产品的核心。<,>联想：cheap(便宜的)去掉e→便宜的东西容易有瑕疵<,>chop(v.砍/n.排骨)/chirp(n.鸟叫声/v.吱喳叫)  

chin<,>/tʃɪn/<,>/tʃɪn/<,>n.颏/n.下巴<,>He rubbed his chin thoughtfully.<,>他若有所思地摸着下巴。<,>She has a dimple in her chin.<,>她的下巴有个酒窝。<,>The boxer took a punch to the chin.<,>拳击手的下巴挨了一拳。<,>chin和thin(瘦的)对比记忆→瘦的人下巴明显<,>sin(n.罪恶)/bin(n.垃圾桶)  

emotional<,>/ɪˈməʊʃənl/<,>/ɪˈmoʊʃənl/<,>adj.感情的/adj.情绪的<,>The movie's ending was very emotional.<,>这部电影的结局非常感人。<,>He made an emotional speech at the wedding.<,>他在婚礼上发表了感人的演讲。<,>She's going through an emotional time right now.<,>她正在经历情绪波动期。<,>e(出)+motion(运动)+al→情感流露的<,>motional(adj.运动的)/emotive(adj.引起情感的)  

operational<,>/ˌɒpəˈreɪʃənl/<,>/ˌɑːpəˈreɪʃənl/<,>adj.运转的/adj.可使用的/adj.操作上的<,>The new airport will become operational next month.<,>新机场将于下个月投入使用。<,>We need to check the operational status of the equipment.<,>我们需要检查设备的运行状态。<,>There are some operational difficulties we need to overcome.<,>我们需要克服一些操作上的困难。<,>operate(操作)+ion+al→操作上的<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/cooperational(adj.合作的)  

staff<,>/stɑːf/<,>/stæf/<,>n.工作人员/n.参谋/vt.为...配备人员<,>The hospital staff worked tirelessly during the pandemic.<,>疫情期间医院工作人员不知疲倦地工作。<,>We need to staff the new department with qualified people.<,>我们需要为这个新部门配备合格人员。<,>He joined the general's staff as a military advisor.<,>他作为军事顾问加入了将军的参谋部。<,>staff和stuff(材料)区分记忆<,>stiff(adj.僵硬的)/stuff(n.材料/vt.填塞)  

involve<,>/ɪnˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪnˈvɑːlv/<,>vt.使卷入/vt.牵涉/vt.包含/vt.含有<,>This project involves a lot of complex calculations.<,>这个项目涉及大量复杂计算。<,>Don't involve me in your personal problems.<,>别把我卷进你的个人问题中。<,>The job involves frequent business trips.<,>这份工作需要经常出差。<,>in(进入)+volve(卷)→卷入<,>evolve(v.进化)/revolve(v.旋转)  

noticeable<,>/ˈnəʊtɪsəbl/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪsəbl/<,>adj.显而易见的<,>There's been a noticeable improvement in her English.<,>她的英语有了明显进步。<,>The stain on the shirt is quite noticeable.<,>衬衫上的污渍相当明显。<,>The temperature drop was noticeable after sunset.<,>日落后的温度下降很明显。<,>notice(注意)+able(可...的)→值得注意的<,>notable(adj.显著的)/noteworthy(adj.值得注意的)  

assemble<,>/əˈsembl/<,>/əˈsembl/<,>v.集合/v.召集/v.装配<,>The students assembled in the school hall.<,>学生们在学校礼堂集合。<,>It took him two hours to assemble the furniture.<,>他花了两个小时组装家具。<,>The manager assembled all department heads for a meeting.<,>经理召集所有部门主管开会。<,>as(加强)+semble(类似)→把类似的东西放一起→集合<,>resemble(v.相似)/dissemble(v.掩饰)  

blast<,>/blɑːst/<,>/blæst/<,>n.爆炸/n.冲击波/n.一阵/vt.炸<,>A blast shook the entire building.<,>爆炸震动了整栋大楼。<,>They blasted through the mountain to build the tunnel.<,>他们炸穿山体修建隧道。<,>A blast of cold air came through the window.<,>一阵冷空气从窗户吹进来。<,>b(爆破音)+last(最后)→最后的爆破→爆炸<,>blaze(n.火焰)/bless(v.祝福)  

series<,>/ˈsɪəriːz/<,>/ˈsɪriːz/<,>n.一系列/n.连续/n.丛书/n.连续剧<,>She published a series of articles on climate change.<,>她发表了一系列关于气候变化的文章。<,>We're watching a new drama series on Netflix.<,>我们正在Netflix上看一部新的连续剧。<,>The library has the complete series of classic novels.<,>图书馆有这套经典小说的完整丛书。<,>seri(连接)+es→一系列连接的事物<,>serious(adj.严肃的)/serial(adj.连续的)
complicated<,>/ˈkɒmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>/ˈkɑːmplɪkeɪtɪd/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.难懂的<,>The instructions were so complicated that I couldn't understand them.<,>说明书太复杂了，我看不懂。<,>Their relationship is quite complicated.<,>他们的关系相当复杂。<,>This math problem is too complicated for me.<,>这道数学题对我来说太难了。<,>com(共同)+plic(折叠)+ated→全部折叠在一起→复杂的<,>complex(adj.复杂的/n.复合体)/complicate(vt.使复杂化)/complication(n.并发症/n.复杂化)  

cultivate<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>/ˈkʌltɪveɪt/<,>vt.耕作/vt.种植/vt.培养/vt.陶冶<,>Farmers cultivate the land to grow crops.<,>农民耕作土地种植庄稼。<,>She cultivated her musical talent from a young age.<,>她从小就培养音乐才能。<,>Reading good books helps cultivate one's mind.<,>阅读好书有助于陶冶心灵。<,>cult(耕种)+ivate(动词后缀)→耕作<,>culture(n.文化)/agriculture(n.农业)/cultivation(n.培养/n.耕作)  

maximum<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>/ˈmæksɪməm/<,>adj.最大的/adj.最高的/adj.顶点的/n.最大量/n.顶点<,>The maximum speed limit here is 60 km/h.<,>这里的最高限速是60公里/小时。<,>We need to make the maximum effort to succeed.<,>我们需要付出最大努力才能成功。<,>The temperature reached its maximum at noon.<,>中午时温度达到了最高点。<,>max(大)+imum(最高级)→最大的<,>minimum(adj.最小的/n.最小值)/maximize(vt.使最大化)/maximal(adj.最大的)  

thrive<,>/θraɪv/<,>/θraɪv/<,>vi.兴旺/vi.繁荣/vi.旺盛<,>Businesses thrive in this prosperous city.<,>企业在这个繁荣的城市蓬勃发展。<,>Plants thrive with proper sunlight and water.<,>植物在适当的阳光和水份下茁壮成长。<,>Children thrive in a loving environment.<,>孩子们在充满爱的环境中茁壮成长。<,>th(看作"the")+rive(看作"river")→河流带来繁荣→兴旺<,>strive(vi.努力)/survive(v.幸存)/thriving(adj.兴旺的)  

purse<,>/pɜːs/<,>/pɜːrs/<,>n.钱包/n.女用小提包<,>She opened her purse to pay for the groceries.<,>她打开钱包支付杂货。<,>Her new purse matches her shoes perfectly.<,>她的新手提包和鞋子完美搭配。<,>I found some coins at the bottom of my purse.<,>我在钱包底部发现了一些硬币。<,>pur(纯)+se(色)→纯色的钱包<,>pursue(vt.追求)/purchase(vt.购买)/nurse(n.护士)  

represent<,>/ˌreprɪˈzent/<,>/ˌreprɪˈzent/<,>vt.作为...的代表/vt.表示/vt.象征/vt.描绘/vt.表现<,>The lawyer will represent you in court.<,>律师将在法庭上代表你。<,>The dove represents peace in many cultures.<,>鸽子在许多文化中象征和平。<,>This painting represents a beautiful sunset.<,>这幅画描绘了美丽的日落。<,>re(再)+present(呈现)→再次呈现→代表<,>presentation(n.展示)/representative(n.代表)/misrepresent(vt.歪曲)  

compete<,>/kəmˈpiːt/<,>/kəmˈpiːt/<,>vi.比赛/vi.竞争/vi.对抗<,>Athletes from all over the world compete in the Olympics.<,>来自世界各地的运动员在奥运会上竞技。<,>Our company competes with several larger firms.<,>我们公司与几家大公司竞争。<,>Children shouldn't compete over trivial matters.<,>孩子们不应该为小事竞争。<,>com(共同)+pete(追求)→共同追求一个目标→竞争<,>competent(adj.有能力的)/competition(n.比赛)/competitive(adj.竞争的)  

dialect<,>/ˈdaɪəlekt/<,>/ˈdaɪəlekt/<,>n.方言/n.土语/n.地方话<,>People in this region speak a unique dialect.<,>这个地区的人说一种独特的方言。<,>It's hard to understand the local dialect.<,>很难听懂当地的土话。<,>The dialect varies from village to village.<,>每个村庄的方言都不同。<,>dia(两者之间)+lect(说)→两者之间说的话→方言<,>dialectic(n.辩证法)/dialogue(n.对话)/lecture(n.讲座)  

accountant<,>/əˈkaʊntənt/<,>/əˈkaʊntənt/<,>n.会计人员/n.会计师<,>We hired a new accountant for our company.<,>我们为公司雇佣了一位新会计师。<,>The accountant is checking the financial records.<,>会计正在核对财务记录。<,>She's training to become a certified accountant.<,>她正在培训成为注册会计师。<,>account(账目)+ant(人)→管账的人→会计师<,>accounting(n.会计学)/accountable(adj.有责任的)/count(v.计算)  

stocking<,>/ˈstɒkɪŋ/<,>/ˈstɑːkɪŋ/<,>n.长袜<,>She hung her Christmas stocking by the fireplace.<,>她把圣诞长袜挂在壁炉旁。<,>These stockings are made of fine silk.<,>这些长袜是用优质丝绸制成的。<,>She wore black stockings with her dress.<,>她穿黑色长袜配裙子。<,>stock(储存)+ing→储存腿部的衣物→长袜<,>sock(n.短袜)/stock(n.库存)/sticking(adj.粘的)
dim<,>/dɪm/<,>/dɪm/<,>adj.昏暗的/adj.朦胧的/adj.模糊不清的/v.变暗淡<,>The light was too dim to read by.<,>灯光太暗，无法阅读。<,>Her eyes dimmed with tears.<,>她的眼睛因泪水而模糊。<,>Memories of that day have dimmed over time.<,>那天的记忆随着时间变得模糊。<,>di(低)+m(模糊)→光线低的→昏暗的<,>dimly(adv.昏暗地)/dimness(n.昏暗)/dime(n.一角硬币)

emergency<,>/ɪˈmɜːdʒənsi/<,>/ɪˈmɜːrdʒənsi/<,>n.紧急情况/n.突然事件<,>Call 911 in case of emergency.<,>遇到紧急情况请拨打911。<,>The hospital has an emergency exit.<,>医院有一个紧急出口。<,>She kept a first aid kit for emergencies.<,>她备有急救箱以应对突发事件。<,>emerg(出现)+ency(状态)→突然出现的情况→紧急情况<,>urgency(n.紧急)/emergence(n.出现)/emergent(adj.紧急的)

dip<,>/dɪp/<,>/dɪp/<,>v.蘸/v.浸/n.游一会儿泳<,>She dipped her finger in the water.<,>她把手指浸入水中。<,>Let's take a quick dip in the pool.<,>我们去游泳池游一会儿吧。<,>The road dips down into the valley.<,>这条路向下延伸到山谷。<,>di(向下)+p(放入)→向下放入→蘸<,>drip(v.滴下)/tip(n.尖端)/lip(n.嘴唇)

recreational<,>/ˌrekriˈeɪʃənl/<,>/ˌrekriˈeɪʃənl/<,>adj.休养的/adj.娱乐的<,>This park has many recreational facilities.<,>这个公园有许多娱乐设施。<,>He enjoys recreational reading.<,>他喜欢消遣性阅读。<,>The resort offers various recreational activities.<,>这个度假村提供各种娱乐活动。<,>re(再)+creation(创造)+al(的)→再次创造快乐的→娱乐的<,>recreation(n.娱乐)/create(v.创造)/creative(adj.有创造力的)

faculty<,>/ˈfæklti/<,>/ˈfækəlti/<,>n.才能/n.能力/n.系/n.科/n.全体教员<,>She has a great faculty for languages.<,>她有很强的语言天赋。<,>The faculty meeting is on Friday.<,>全体教员会议在周五举行。<,>He is a member of the medical faculty.<,>他是医学院的教员。<,>fac(做)+ulty(能力)→做事的能力→才能<,>facility(n.设施)/factual(adj.事实的)/faction(n.派系)

passport<,>/ˈpɑːspɔːt/<,>/ˈpæspɔːrt/<,>n.护照<,>Don't forget to bring your passport.<,>别忘了带护照。<,>She renewed her passport last month.<,>她上个月更新了护照。<,>A passport is required for international travel.<,>国际旅行需要护照。<,>pass(通过)+port(港口)→通过港口的证件→护照<,>password(n.密码)/portal(n.入口)/import(v.进口)

prior<,>/ˈpraɪə(r)/<,>/ˈpraɪər/<,>adj.在前的/adj.优先的<,>Prior knowledge is required for this course.<,>这门课程需要先修知识。<,>This task has prior importance.<,>这项任务有优先重要性。<,>She had no prior experience in teaching.<,>她没有教学经验。<,>pri(前)+or(比较级)→更前面的→优先的<,>priority(n.优先权)/posterior(adj.后面的)/superior(adj.上级的)

bracket<,>/ˈbrækɪt/<,>/ˈbrækɪt/<,>n.括号/vt.把…归为同一类<,>Please put the numbers in square brackets.<,>请将数字放在方括号内。<,>These two issues should be bracketed together.<,>这两个问题应归为同一类。<,>The income levels are divided into different tax brackets.<,>收入水平被划分为不同的税级。<,>brack(支架)+et(小)→像支架一样括住→括号<,>rack(n.架子)/brake(n.刹车)/blanket(n.毯子)

relativity<,>/ˌreləˈtɪvəti/<,>/ˌreləˈtɪvəti/<,>n.相对论/n.相关性<,>Einstein's theory of relativity changed physics.<,>爱因斯坦的相对论改变了物理学。<,>There is a relativity between diet and health.<,>饮食和健康之间存在相关性。<,>He studied the relativity of cultural values.<,>他研究了文化价值观的相对性。<,>relative(相关的)+ity(名词后缀)→相关性<,>relativity(n.相对论)/relationship(n.关系)/relaxation(n.放松)

beneficial<,>/ˌbenɪˈfɪʃ(ə)l/<,>/ˌbenɪˈfɪʃ(ə)l/<,>adj.有利的/adj.有益的<,>Exercise is beneficial to your health.<,>锻炼对你的健康有益。<,>The new policy is beneficial for small businesses.<,>新政策对小企业有利。<,>Sunlight is beneficial for plant growth.<,>阳光对植物生长有益。<,>bene(好)+fic(做)+ial(形容词后缀)→有益的<,>benefit(n.利益)/beneficiary(n.受益人)/beneficent(adj.慈善的)

tackle<,>/ˈtæk(ə)l/<,>/ˈtæk(ə)l/<,>vt.对付/vt.处理/vt.与…交涉/vt.阻截/vt.擒抱/n.阻截/n.擒抱/n.用具/n.钓具/n.辘轳/n.滑车<,>He tackled the problem head-on.<,>他正面解决了这个问题。<,>The player was tackled before he could score.<,>球员在得分前被拦截了。<,>We need to tackle this issue immediately.<,>我们需要立即处理这个问题。<,>tack(钉)+le(动词后缀)→钉住→阻截<,>tickle(vt.使发痒)/tacky(adj.俗气的)/tact(n.机智)

reckon<,>/ˈrekən/<,>/ˈrekən/<,>vt.认为/vt.估计/vt.指望/vt.盼望/vt.测算/vt.测量<,>I reckon it will rain tomorrow.<,>我认为明天会下雨。<,>He reckoned the cost of the project.<,>他估算了项目的成本。<,>She reckoned on her friend's support.<,>她指望朋友的支持。<,>reck(注意)+on(动词后缀)→注意→估计<,>reckless(adj.鲁莽的)/recognize(vt.认出)/reckoning(n.计算)

confusion<,>/kənˈfjuːʒ(ə)n/<,>/kənˈfjuːʒ(ə)n/<,>n.困惑/n.糊涂/n.混淆/n.骚乱<,>There was confusion about the meeting time.<,>关于会议时间存在困惑。<,>His explanation only added to the confusion.<,>他的解释只会增加混乱。<,>The accident caused traffic confusion.<,>事故导致了交通混乱。<,>con(一起)+fus(流)+ion(名词后缀)→流到一起→混淆<,>refuse(vt.拒绝)/diffuse(vt.扩散)/fusion(n.融合)

occasion<,>/əˈkeɪʒ(ə)n/<,>/əˈkeɪʒ(ə)n/<,>n.场合/n.时刻/n.重大活动/n.时机/n.起因/vt.引起<,>This is a special occasion.<,>这是一个特殊的场合。<,>He took the occasion to thank everyone.<,>他借此机会感谢大家。<,>Her behavior occasioned much discussion.<,>她的行为引起了很多讨论。<,>oc(强调)+cas(落下)+ion(名词后缀)→落下的时机→场合<,>occasional(adj.偶尔的)/occupation(n.职业)/occasion(vt.引起)
loan<,>/ləʊn/<,>/loʊn/<,>n.贷款/v.借<,>He took out a loan to buy a car.<,>他贷款买了一辆车。<,>Can you loan me some money?<,>你能借我一些钱吗？<,>The bank approved her loan application.<,>银行批准了她的贷款申请。<,>loan与lend同源，但loan多指长期借贷<,>lend(v.借出)/borrow(v.借入)/debt(n.债务)

virtual<,>/ˈvɜːtʃuəl/<,>/ˈvɜːrtʃuəl/<,>adj.实质上的/adj.事实上的/adj.实际上的<,>She is the virtual leader of the group.<,>她实际上是这个团队的领导者。<,>The meeting was held in virtual reality.<,>会议是在虚拟现实中举行的。<,>He has virtual control over the company.<,>他实际上掌控着公司。<,>virt(美德)+ual→具有美德才是真实的<,>virtue(n.美德)/visual(adj.视觉的)/actual(adj.实际的)

squeeze<,>/skwiːz/<,>/skwiz/<,>v.挤/v.压榨/v.捏/n.挤/n.握手/n.拮据<,>She squeezed the juice from an orange.<,>她榨橙汁。<,>He gave my hand a friendly squeeze.<,>他友好地握了握我的手。<,>We're in a tight financial squeeze.<,>我们正处于财务困境。<,>s+quee(拟声挤压声)+ze→挤压的声音<,>press(v.压)/pinch(v.捏)/crush(v.压碎)

blank<,>/blæŋk/<,>/blæŋk/<,>adj.空白的/adj.茫然的/n.空白/n.空白表格<,>Please fill in the blank spaces.<,>请填写空白处。<,>He gave me a blank look.<,>他茫然地看着我。<,>My mind went blank during the exam.<,>考试时我大脑一片空白。<,>bl(白)+ank→空白<,>black(adj.黑色的)/blanket(n.毯子)/bank(n.银行)

landlord<,>/ˈlændlɔːd/<,>/ˈlændlɔːrd/<,>n.地主/n.房东/n.店主<,>The landlord raised the rent again.<,>房东又涨房租了。<,>He's the landlord of this pub.<,>他是这家酒馆的店主。<,>The feudal landlord oppressed the peasants.<,>封建地主压迫农民。<,>land(土地)+lord(主人)→土地的主人<,>landlady(n.女房东)/tenant(n.租客)/property(n.财产)

session<,>/ˈseʃn/<,>/ˈseʃən/<,>n.会议/n.一届会期/n.集会<,>The court is in session now.<,>法庭正在开庭。<,>We have a training session tomorrow.<,>明天我们有培训会。<,>The summer session begins in July.<,>夏季学期七月开始。<,>sess(坐)+ion→坐在一起→会议<,>meeting(n.会议)/conference(n.大会)/semester(n.学期)

additional<,>/əˈdɪʃənl/<,>/əˈdɪʃənl/<,>adj.附加的/adj.追加的<,>We need additional information.<,>我们需要更多信息。<,>There will be an additional charge for luggage.<,>行李需要额外收费。<,>She took on additional responsibilities.<,>她承担了额外责任。<,>add(增加)+ition(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→附加的<,>extra(adj.额外的)/supplementary(adj.补充的)/further(adj.更多的)

worthy<,>/ˈwɜːði/<,>/ˈwɜːrði/<,>adj.有价值的/adj.值得的<,>This is a worthy cause to support.<,>这是值得支持的事业。<,>He proved himself worthy of trust.<,>他证明自己值得信任。<,>She is a worthy opponent.<,>她是个值得尊敬的对手。<,>worth(价值)+y(形容词后缀)→有价值的<,>worthwhile(adj.值得的)/worthless(adj.无价值的)/deserve(v.应得)

endless<,>/ˈendləs/<,>/ˈendləs/<,>adj.无止境的<,>The desert seemed endless.<,>沙漠似乎无边无际。<,>We had endless problems with the project.<,>这个项目问题不断。<,>Their love story is endless.<,>他们的爱情故事永无止境。<,>end(结束)+less(无)→没有结束的<,>limitless(adj.无限的)/boundless(adj.无限的)/finite(adj.有限的)

expectation<,>/ˌekspekˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌekspekˈteɪʃən/<,>n.期待/n.期望/n.预期/n.前程<,>The movie didn't live up to my expectations.<,>这部电影没有达到我的预期。<,>She has high expectations for her children.<,>她对孩子期望很高。<,>This job offers good career expectations.<,>这份工作有很好的职业前景。<,>expect(期待)+ation(名词后缀)→期待<,>anticipation(n.预期)/hope(n.希望)/prospect(n.前景)
title<,>/ˈtaɪtl/<,>/ˈtaɪtl/<,>n.标题/n.题目/n.称号/n.头衔/n.权利/n.权益<,>The title of the book is "The Great Adventure".<,>这本书的标题是《伟大的冒险》。<,>She was given the title of "Employee of the Year".<,>她被授予“年度最佳员工”的称号。<,>He has no legal title to the property.<,>他对这处房产没有合法权利。<,>tit(小)+le→小标签→标题<,>tilt(v.倾斜/n.倾斜)/tittle(n.一点点)  

mist<,>/mɪst/<,>/mɪst/<,>v.蒙上薄雾/v.模糊/n.薄雾<,>The mountains were covered in mist this morning.<,>今早群山笼罩在薄雾中。<,>Her eyes misted over with tears.<,>她的双眼因泪水而模糊。<,>The mirror misted up after my hot shower.<,>我洗完热水澡后镜子蒙上了水雾。<,>mis(错误)+t→看不清→薄雾<,>moist(adj.潮湿的)/miss(v.错过/n.小姐)  

primarily<,>/praɪˈmerəli/<,>/praɪˈmɛrəli/<,>adv.首先/adv.主要地<,>This book is primarily intended for beginners.<,>这本书主要面向初学者。<,>We're primarily concerned with quality control.<,>我们主要关注质量控制。<,>The accident was primarily caused by human error.<,>这起事故主要是人为失误造成的。<,>prim(第一)+ary(…的)+ly→首要地<,>preliminary(adj.初步的/n.准备工作)  

duration<,>/djʊˈreɪʃn/<,>/dʊˈreɪʃən/<,>n.持续/n.持久<,>The duration of the movie is two hours.<,>这部电影的时长是两小时。<,>He was hospitalized for the duration of his illness.<,>他在生病期间一直住院。<,>The contract specifies the duration of employment.<,>合同规定了雇佣期限。<,>dur(持续)+ation→持续时间<,>during(prep.在…期间)/durable(adj.耐用的)  

plantation<,>/plɑːnˈteɪʃn/<,>/plænˈteɪʃən/<,>n.种植园/n.人工林<,>They visited a coffee plantation in Brazil.<,>他们参观了巴西的一个咖啡种植园。<,>The plantation covers over 100 acres.<,>这个种植园占地100多英亩。<,>Rubber plantations are common in Southeast Asia.<,>橡胶园在东南亚很常见。<,>plant(植物)+ation→种植植物的场所<,>planet(n.行星)/plankton(n.浮游生物)  

ignore<,>/ɪɡˈnɔː(r)/<,>/ɪɡˈnɔr/<,>vt.不顾/vt.不理/vt.忽视<,>She ignored his rude remarks.<,>她没有理会他粗鲁的言论。<,>The driver ignored the stop sign.<,>司机无视停车标志。<,>You can't ignore the facts.<,>你不能忽视这些事实。<,>i(不)+gnore(知道)→装作不知道→忽视<,>ignorant(adj.无知的)/ignition(n.点火)  

loaf<,>/ləʊf/<,>/loʊf/<,>vi.游荡/vi.闲逛/n.面包<,>He spent the afternoon loafing around the mall.<,>他整个下午都在商场里闲逛。<,>She bought a loaf of whole wheat bread.<,>她买了一条全麦面包。<,>Stop loafing and get to work!<,>别闲逛了，开始工作吧！<,>发音似“露腹”→闲逛时露着肚子<,>loan(n.贷款/v.借出)/load(n.负荷/v.装载)  

nuclear<,>/ˈnjuːkliə(r)/<,>/ˈnuːkliər/<,>adj.核子的/adj.核能的/adj.核武器的/adj.核心的<,>Nuclear energy is a controversial topic.<,>核能是一个有争议的话题。<,>The country has nuclear capabilities.<,>这个国家拥有核能力。<,>They are part of the nuclear family.<,>他们是核心家庭的成员。<,>nucle(核)+ar→核的<,>nucleus(n.原子核)/neutral(adj.中立的)

outward<,>/ˈaʊtwəd/<,>/ˈaʊtwərd/<,>adj.外面的/adj.外表的/adj.向外的<,>Her outward appearance was calm.<,>她外表看起来很平静。<,>The door opens outward.<,>这门是向外开的。<,>They made an outward show of support.<,>他们表面上表示支持。<,>out(外)+ward(方向)→向外的<,>inward(adj.向内的)/onward(adv.向前)
bloody<,>/ˈblʌdi/<,>/ˈblʌdi/<,>adv.非常/adj.非常的/adj.该死的/adj.流血的/adj.嗜杀的/vt.血染<,>It's bloody cold outside today.<,>今天外面非常冷。<,>He had a bloody nose after the fight.<,>打架后他的鼻子流血了。<,>She gave him a bloody look.<,>她恶狠狠地看了他一眼。<,>blood(血)+y(形容词后缀)→流血的<,>bloom(v.开花/n.花)/blond(adj.金发的/n.金发人)/bleed(v.流血)

vapour<,>/ˈveɪpə(r)/<,>/ˈveɪpər/<,>n.蒸汽<,>Steam is a visible form of water vapour.<,>蒸汽是水蒸气的可见形态。<,>The kettle was releasing hot vapour.<,>水壶正在冒出热蒸汽。<,>Vapour rose from the surface of the lake.<,>湖面上升起了水汽。<,>vapor(蒸汽)+u→蒸汽<,>vapor(n.蒸汽)/valour(n.英勇)/velour(n.丝绒)

relax<,>/rɪˈlæks/<,>/rɪˈlæks/<,>v.放松/v.松弛/v.放宽/v.缓和<,>I like to relax with a good book.<,>我喜欢读本好书放松一下。<,>The rules were relaxed for special occasions.<,>特殊场合下规则有所放宽。<,>Her muscles relaxed after the massage.<,>按摩后她的肌肉放松了。<,>re(重新)+lax(放松)→放松<,>release(v.释放)/relay(v.转播)/relate(v.叙述)

schedule<,>/ˈʃedjuːl/<,>/ˈskedʒuːl/<,>n.时刻表/n.日程安排表/n.清单/n.明细表/vt.安排/vt.排定<,>Please check the train schedule before you leave.<,>出发前请查看火车时刻表。<,>We need to schedule a meeting for next week.<,>我们需要为下周安排一次会议。<,>The project is behind schedule due to bad weather.<,>由于天气不好，项目进度落后了。<,>sched(纸)+ule(小)→小纸片→时刻表<,>scheme(n.计划/v.策划)/school(n.学校)/shuttle(n.穿梭班车)  

postage<,>/ˈpəʊstɪdʒ/<,>/ˈpoʊstɪdʒ/<,>n.邮费/n.邮资<,>The postage for this parcel is quite expensive.<,>这个包裹的邮费相当贵。<,>Don't forget to include the postage when sending the letter.<,>寄信时别忘了包括邮资。<,>Postage rates have increased again this year.<,>今年邮资又上涨了。<,>post(邮件)+age(费用)→邮费<,>posture(n.姿势)/portage(n.搬运)/postdate(v.填迟日期)  

tame<,>/teɪm/<,>/teɪm/<,>adj.驯服的/adj.顺从的/adj.沉闷的/adj.乏味的/vt.制服/vt.控制并利用/vt.驯化/vt.驯服<,>The tiger in the zoo looks very tame.<,>动物园里的老虎看起来很温顺。<,>He managed to tame his wild temper.<,>他设法控制住了自己的暴躁脾气。<,>The lecture was so tame that half the audience fell asleep.<,>讲座太乏味了，一半听众都睡着了。<,>tame(驯服)→与time(时间)谐音→驯服需要时间<,>lame(adj.跛的)/fame(n.名声)/game(n.游戏)  

material<,>/məˈtɪəriəl/<,>/məˈtɪriəl/<,>adj.物质的/adj.实体的/adj.肉体的/adj.重要的/adj.实质性的/n.材料/n.素材<,>This dress is made of high-quality material.<,>这件连衣裙是用优质材料制成的。<,>Material possessions are not the most important things in life.<,>物质财富不是生活中最重要的东西。<,>We need more material evidence to support our claim.<,>我们需要更多实质性证据来支持我们的主张。<,>mater(母亲)+ial→母亲是物质基础→材料<,>immaterial(adj.不重要的)/maternal(adj.母亲的)/materialize(v.实现)  

universe<,>/ˈjuːnɪvɜːs/<,>/ˈjuːnɪvɜːrs/<,>n.宇宙/n.世界/n.领域/n.范围<,>The universe is full of mysteries waiting to be discovered.<,>宇宙充满了等待被发现的奥秘。<,>In her universe, art is the most important thing.<,>在她的世界里，艺术是最重要的。<,>This theory applies to the whole universe of physics.<,>这个理论适用于整个物理学领域。<,>uni(单一)+vers(转)+e→统一旋转的→宇宙<,>university(n.大学)/universal(adj.普遍的)/diverse(adj.多样的)  

interpret<,>/ɪnˈtɜːprɪt/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrprɪt/<,>v.解释/v.说明/v.口译<,>Can you interpret this ancient text for us?<,>你能为我们解释这段古文吗？<,>She works as an interpreter at the United Nations.<,>她在联合国担任口译员。<,>Different people may interpret the same event differently.<,>不同的人可能对同一事件有不同的解释。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)→在两种语言间表达→口译<,>interrupt(v.打断)/intercept(v.拦截)/interplay(n.相互作用)  

spectacular<,>/spekˈtækjələ(r)/<,>/spekˈtækjələr/<,>adj.壮观的/adj.引人注目的/n.壮观的演出/n.惊人之举<,>The fireworks display was truly spectacular.<,>烟花表演确实壮观。<,>She made a spectacular comeback after her injury.<,>受伤后她做出了惊人的复出。<,>The circus performance was a spectacular that amazed everyone.<,>马戏团的表演是一场让所有人惊叹的壮观演出。<,>spect(看)+acular(形容词后缀)→值得看的→壮观的<,>spectator(n.观众)/spectrum(n.光谱)/specter(n.幽灵)
inherit<,>/ɪnˈhɛrɪt/<,>/ɪnˈhɛrɪt/<,>vi.成为继承人/vt.继承<,>She will inherit the family estate.<,>她将继承家族财产。<,>He inherited his father's business.<,>他继承了父亲的生意。<,>They inherited a large fortune from their uncle.<,>他们从叔叔那里继承了一大笔财富。<,>in(进入)+herit(继承)→继承<,>inherent(adj.固有的/内在的)/heritage(n.遗产/传统)  

peculiar<,>/pɪˈkjuːliə(r)/<,>/pɪˈkjuːliər/<,>adj.奇怪的/古怪的/特有的<,>He has a peculiar way of speaking.<,>他说话方式很古怪。<,>This plant is peculiar to the region.<,>这种植物是该地区特有的。<,>There was a peculiar smell in the room.<,>房间里有股怪味。<,>pecu(牛)+liar(说谎者)→像说谎的牛一样古怪<,>particular(adj.特别的/n.细节)/pecuniary(adj.金钱的)  

blanket<,>/ˈblæŋkɪt/<,>/ˈblæŋkɪt/<,>n.毛毯/毯子/羊毛毯<,>She wrapped herself in a warm blanket.<,>她裹着一条温暖的毯子。<,>The valley was covered with a blanket of snow.<,>山谷被白雪覆盖。<,>They spread a blanket on the grass for the picnic.<,>他们在草地上铺了毯子野餐。<,>blank(空白)+et(小)→覆盖空白的小东西→毯子<,>blank(adj.空白的/n.空白)/bracket(n.支架/v.括起)  

grant<,>/ɡrɑːnt/<,>/ɡrænt/<,>n.授予物/补助金/vt.授予/给予/同意<,>The university awarded him a research grant.<,>大学授予他一项研究补助金。<,>She granted permission for the project.<,>她批准了这个项目。<,>I grant that your argument has some merit.<,>我承认你的论点有一定道理。<,>gran(谷物)+t→给予谷物般的资助<,>grand(adj.宏伟的)/grunt(v.咕哝/n.咕哝声)  

injection<,>/ɪnˈdʒekʃn/<,>/ɪnˈdʒɛkʃən/<,>n.注射/注入/充满<,>The nurse gave him an injection.<,>护士给他打了一针。<,>The company needs an injection of new capital.<,>公司需要注入新资金。<,>His speech was full of energy and injection.<,>他的演讲充满活力和激情。<,>in(进入)+ject(投掷)+ion→投入→注射<,>rejection(n.拒绝)/projection(n.投射/预测)  

envy<,>/ˈenvi/<,>/ˈɛnvi/<,>n.妒忌/羡慕/妒忌的对象/vt.妒忌/羡慕<,>They looked at her with envy.<,>他们羡慕地看着她。<,>Her success is the envy of her colleagues.<,>她的成功让同事羡慕。<,>I envy your ability to stay calm.<,>我羡慕你能保持冷静。<,>en(使)+vy(看)→使别人看→羡慕<,>envious(adj.嫉妒的)/enviable(adj.令人羡慕的)  

hut<,>/hʌt/<,>/hʌt/<,>n.小屋/棚屋<,>They built a hut in the woods.<,>他们在树林里搭了间小屋。<,>The fisherman's hut stood by the lake.<,>渔夫的小屋矗立在湖边。<,>We took shelter in a mountain hut.<,>我们在山间小屋避雨。<,>hut→发音似"哈特"→小屋<,>hut/hot(adj.热的)/hit(v.打击/n.热门)  

invincible<,>/ɪnˈvɪnsəbl/<,>/ɪnˈvɪnsəbəl/<,>adj.不能征服的/无敌的<,>The team seemed invincible this season.<,>这个赛季这支球队似乎所向无敌。<,>He has an invincible will.<,>他有不可战胜的意志。<,>Their defense was considered invincible.<,>他们的防守被认为坚不可摧。<,>in(不)+vinc(征服)+ible(能)→不能征服的<,>visible(adj.可见的)/invincibility(n.无敌)  

discount<,>/ˈdɪskaʊnt/<,>/ˈdɪskaʊnt/<,>n.折扣/vt.将...打折扣/不信/漠视/低估<,>We offer a 20% discount on all items.<,>所有商品打八折。<,>You shouldn't discount his advice.<,>你不该轻视他的建议。<,>They discounted the rumors.<,>他们不相信那些谣言。<,>dis(不)+count(计算)→不算在内→折扣<,>account(n.账户/v.解释)/recount(v.叙述)  

convert<,>/kənˈvɜːt/<,>/kənˈvɜːrt/<,>v.转变/转化/改变<,>They converted the attic into a bedroom.<,>他们把阁楼改造成了卧室。<,>He converted to Buddhism last year.<,>他去年改信佛教。<,>Solar energy can be converted into electricity.<,>太阳能可以转化为电能。<,>con(共同)+vert(转)→共同转变→转化<,>convert/concert(n.音乐会)/converse(v.交谈)
construct<,>/kənˈstrʌkt/<,>/kənˈstrʌkt/<,>vt.建造/vt.构思/n.建筑物/n.构想/n.观念<,>They plan to construct a new bridge over the river.<,>他们计划在河上建造一座新桥。<,>The novel is skillfully constructed.<,>这部小说构思巧妙。<,>This building is a modern construct.<,>这座建筑是现代建筑物。<,>con(共同)+struct(建造)→共同建造→建造<,>structure(n.结构)/destruct(v.破坏)/instruct(v.指导)  

attempt<,>/əˈtempt/<,>/əˈtɛmpt/<,>vt.尝试/vt.试图/vt.努力<,>He attempted to climb the mountain but failed.<,>他试图攀登那座山，但失败了。<,>This is her first attempt at baking a cake.<,>这是她第一次尝试烤蛋糕。<,>They made no attempt to escape.<,>他们没有试图逃跑。<,>at(加强)+tempt(尝试)→尝试<,>tempt(v.诱惑)/contempt(n.轻视)/exempt(v.免除)  

thick<,>/θɪk/<,>/θɪk/<,>adv.厚厚地/adj.厚的/adj.密的/adj.浓的/adj.不清楚的/adj.口音重的<,>She spread the butter thick on the bread.<,>她在面包上涂了厚厚的黄油。<,>The forest is thick with trees.<,>这片森林树木茂密。<,>His accent is so thick that I can hardly understand him.<,>他的口音太重了，我几乎听不懂。<,>对比thin(adj.薄的)<,>tick(n.滴答声)/trick(n.诡计)/brick(n.砖)  

superficial<,>/ˌsuːpəˈfɪʃl/<,>/ˌsupərˈfɪʃəl/<,>adj.表面的/adj.肤浅的<,>He only has a superficial knowledge of the subject.<,>他对这个学科只有肤浅的了解。<,>The wound is superficial and not serious.<,>这个伤口很浅，不严重。<,>Their friendship was rather superficial.<,>他们的友谊相当肤浅。<,>super(上面)+fic(面)+ial→在表面上的→表面的<,>artificial(adj.人工的)/official(adj.官方的)/beneficial(adj.有益的)  

division<,>/dɪˈvɪʒn/<,>/dɪˈvɪʒən/<,>n.分/n.分配/n.除法/n.分歧/n.分裂<,>The division of the money was fair.<,>这笔钱的分配是公平的。<,>There is a division of opinion among the members.<,>成员之间存在意见分歧。<,>He's learning division in math class.<,>他正在数学课上学习除法。<,>divide(v.分割)+sion→分割→分裂<,>vision(n.视力)/provision(n.供应)/decision(n.决定)  

executive<,>/ɪɡˈzekjətɪv/<,>/ɪɡˈzɛkjətɪv/<,>adj.执行的/n.执行者<,>She has an executive position in the company.<,>她在公司担任高管职位。<,>The executive committee will meet next week.<,>执行委员会将于下周开会。<,>He is the chief executive of the corporation.<,>他是公司的首席执行官。<,>execute(v.执行)+ive→执行的<,>execution(n.执行)/executor(n.执行者)/executrix(n.女执行者)  

navigation<,>/ˌnævɪˈɡeɪʃn/<,>/ˌnævəˈɡeɪʃən/<,>n.航行/n.航海/n.航空/n.导航/n.领航<,>Navigation in this area is difficult due to the reefs.<,>由于暗礁的存在，这个区域的航行很困难。<,>The ship's navigation system is very advanced.<,>这艘船的导航系统非常先进。<,>He is studying air navigation.<,>他正在学习航空导航。<,>nav(船)+ig(驱动)+ation→驾驶船只→航行<,>navy(n.海军)/navigate(v.导航)/navigator(n.领航员)  

melt<,>/melt/<,>/mɛlt/<,>v.融化/v.熔化/v.消散<,>The ice will melt when the sun comes out.<,>太阳出来时冰就会融化。<,>Her anger melted when she saw the gift.<,>看到礼物时她的怒气消散了。<,>The metal melts at a very high temperature.<,>这种金属在高温下熔化。<,>对比freeze(v.冻结)<,>belt(n.皮带)/felt(n.毛毡)/pelt(n.毛皮)  

hook<,>/hʊk/<,>/hʊk/<,>v.钩住/n.钩/n.挂钩<,>He hooked the fish and pulled it out of the water.<,>他钩住鱼并把它拉出水面。<,>Hang your coat on the hook by the door.<,>把你的外套挂在门边的挂钩上。<,>The dress fastens with a hook at the back.<,>这件连衣裙在后面用钩子固定。<,>对比look(v.看)<,>book(n.书)/cook(v.烹饪)/took(v.拿)  

stale<,>/steɪl/<,>/stel/<,>adj.不新鲜的/adj.陈腐的/adj.过时的<,>This bread tastes stale.<,>这面包尝起来不新鲜了。<,>His jokes are stale and boring.<,>他的笑话老套又无聊。<,>The air in the room was stale.<,>房间里的空气不新鲜。<,>对比fresh(adj.新鲜的)<,>scale(n.规模)/stake(n.赌注)/stare(v.凝视)
balance<,>/ˈbæləns/<,>/ˈbæləns/<,>vt.使平衡/vt.称/vt.权衡/vt.比较/n.天平/n.平衡/n.结存/n.结欠<,>She balanced the books carefully on her head.<,>她小心地把书平衡在头上。<,>You need to balance your diet with exercise.<,>你需要通过运动来平衡饮食。<,>The balance in my bank account is running low.<,>我银行账户的余额快用完了。<,>bal(球)+ance(状态)→像球一样稳定→平衡<,>ball(n.球)/bland(adj.平淡的)/blend(v.混合)  

cigar<,>/sɪˈɡɑː(r)/<,>/sɪˈɡɑːr/<,>n.雪茄烟<,>He lit a cigar after dinner.<,>晚餐后他点燃了一支雪茄。<,>The smell of cigar smoke filled the room.<,>雪茄烟的味道充满了房间。<,>She gave him a box of Cuban cigars as a gift.<,>她送给他一盒古巴雪茄作为礼物。<,>cig(烟)+ar(名词后缀)→雪茄烟<,>cigarette(n.香烟)/cigarillo(n.小雪茄)/cigar-shaped(adj.雪茄形的)  

action<,>/ˈækʃn/<,>/ˈækʃən/<,>n.行动/n.已做的事/n.作用/n.功能/n.情节<,>We need to take action immediately.<,>我们需要立即采取行动。<,>The action of the drug lasts for six hours.<,>这种药的作用持续六小时。<,>The movie has a lot of exciting action scenes.<,>这部电影有很多激动人心的动作场面。<,>act(行动)+ion(名词后缀)→行动<,>active(adj.活跃的)/activity(n.活动)/actor(n.演员)  

stadium<,>/ˈsteɪdiəm/<,>/ˈsteɪdiəm/<,>n.运动场/n.体育场<,>The new stadium can hold 50,000 people.<,>新体育场能容纳五万人。<,>They are building a stadium for the Olympics.<,>他们正在为奥运会建造一个体育场。<,>The football match will be held at the national stadium.<,>足球比赛将在国家体育场举行。<,>stad(站立)+ium(场所)→站立观看的场所→体育场<,>studio(n.工作室)/stamen(n.雄蕊)/stadium-seating(n.阶梯式座位)  

whereas<,>/ˌweərˈæz/<,>/ˌwerˈæz/<,>conj.然而/conj.但是/conj.尽管<,>He is tall, whereas his brother is short.<,>他很高，而他弟弟很矮。<,>She loves coffee, whereas I prefer tea.<,>她喜欢咖啡，而我更喜欢茶。<,>Whereas the first plan failed, the second one succeeded.<,>尽管第一个计划失败了，但第二个成功了。<,>where(哪里)+as(如同)→如同在另一处→然而<,>whereby(adv.凭借)/wherein(adv.在其中)/whereupon(conj.于是)  

pitch<,>/pɪtʃ/<,>/pɪtʃ/<,>vi.投/vi.掷/vi.架设/vi.搭/vi.营/vi.颠簸/n.球场/n.程度/n.强度/n.高度/n.音高/n.沥青/vt.投掷/vt.使猛然倒下/vt.表达/vt.把…定于特定程度/vt.定调<,>He pitched the ball with great speed.<,>他以极快的速度投球。<,>The ship pitched violently in the storm.<,>船在暴风雨中剧烈颠簸。<,>They pitched their tent near the lake.<,>他们在湖边搭起了帐篷。<,>pit(坑)+ch→像投球入坑→投掷<,>patch(n.补丁)/pinch(v.捏)/pitch-black(adj.漆黑的)  

kindness<,>/ˈkaɪndnəs/<,>/ˈkaɪndnəs/<,>n.仁慈/n.好意<,>She showed great kindness to the stray dog.<,>她对流浪狗表现出极大的仁慈。<,>His kindness made everyone feel welcome.<,>他的好意让每个人都感到受欢迎。<,>Kindness is a virtue that should be practiced daily.<,>仁慈是一种应该每天实践的美德。<,>kind(仁慈的)+ness(名词后缀)→仁慈<,>kindle(v.点燃)/kindred(n.亲属)/kindly(adv.亲切地)  

adoptive<,>/əˈdɒptɪv/<,>/əˈdɑːptɪv/<,>adj.收养关系的/adj.采用的<,>She is very close to her adoptive parents.<,>她和养父母非常亲近。<,>The company has an adoptive approach to new technologies.<,>公司对新科技采取采用的态度。<,>Adoptive families can be just as loving as biological ones.<,>收养家庭可以和亲生家庭一样充满爱。<,>adopt(收养)+ive(形容词后缀)→收养关系的<,>adaptive(adj.适应的)/adoption(n.收养)/adopted(adj.被收养的)  

chop<,>/tʃɒp/<,>/tʃɑːp/<,>vt.砍/vt.劈/vt.切细/n.排骨<,>He chopped the wood into small pieces.<,>他把木头劈成小块。<,>She chopped the onions finely for the soup.<,>她把洋葱切得很细来做汤。<,>We ordered pork chops for dinner.<,>我们晚餐点了猪排。<,>ch(砍)+op(操作)→砍的操作→砍<,>chip(n.碎片)/chap(n.家伙)/chopsticks(n.筷子)  

electrical<,>/ɪˈlektrɪkl/<,>/ɪˈlektrɪkl/<,>adj.电的/adj.电气科学的<,>He is studying electrical engineering.<,>他正在学习电气工程。<,>The storm caused an electrical failure in the city.<,>暴风雨导致城市电力故障。<,>Be careful with electrical appliances near water.<,>在水附近使用电器要小心。<,>electric(电的)+al(形容词后缀)→电的<,>electronic(adj.电子的)/electricity(n.电)/electrify(v.使通电)
statue<,>/ˈstætʃuː/<,>/ˈstætʃuː/<,>n.塑像/n.雕像/n.铸像<,>The statue of liberty is a famous landmark in New York.<,>自由女神像是纽约的著名地标。<,>They erected a statue in honor of the national hero.<,>他们竖立了一座雕像以纪念这位民族英雄。<,>The bronze statue has stood in the square for over a century.<,>这座铜像已经在广场上矗立了一个多世纪。<,>stat(站立)+ue→站立的东西→雕像<,>status(n.地位/n.状态)/stature(n.身高/n.声望)  

being<,>/ˈbiːɪŋ/<,>/ˈbiːɪŋ/<,>n.存在/n.生物/n.生命<,>Human beings are the dominant species on Earth.<,>人类是地球上占主导地位的物种。<,>The origin of being has puzzled philosophers for centuries.<,>存在的起源困扰了哲学家们几个世纪。<,>She felt a strange presence, as if some supernatural being was nearby.<,>她感觉到一种奇怪的存在，仿佛附近有某种超自然生物。<,>be(存在)+ing→存在/生命<,>begin(v.开始)/belong(v.属于)  

sensitive<,>/ˈsensətɪv/<,>/ˈsensətɪv/<,>adj.敏感的/adj.灵敏的/adj.神经过敏的/adj.容易生气的/adj.易受伤害的<,>She is very sensitive to criticism.<,>她对批评非常敏感。<,>This equipment is sensitive to temperature changes.<,>这台设备对温度变化很灵敏。<,>Avoid using harsh words - he's in a sensitive mood today.<,>避免使用严厉的词语-他今天情绪很敏感。<,>sens(感觉)+itive→容易感觉的→敏感的<,>sensible(adj.明智的)/sensory(adj.感觉的)  

protest<,>/prəˈtest/<,>/ˈproʊtest/<,>v.抗议/v.反对/n.抗议/n.反对<,>Thousands of people protested against the new law.<,>数千人抗议这项新法律。<,>She lodged a formal protest with the management.<,>她向管理层提出了正式抗议。<,>The workers went on strike in protest of poor working conditions.<,>工人们罢工抗议恶劣的工作条件。<,>pro(向前)+test(作证)→站出来作证→抗议<,>protect(v.保护)/contest(n.竞赛)  

classification<,>/ˌklæsɪfɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌklæsəfəˈkeɪʃən/<,>n.分类/n.分级/n.分类法/n.类别/n.级别<,>The classification of plants and animals is called taxonomy.<,>动植物的分类被称为分类学。<,>This document has a security classification of 'top secret'.<,>这份文件的安全级别是"绝密"。<,>Librarians use the Dewey Decimal System for book classification.<,>图书馆员使用杜威十进制系统进行图书分类。<,>class(类别)+ify(使...化)+cation→分类<,>clarification(n.澄清)/certification(n.认证)  

vacant<,>/ˈveɪkənt/<,>/ˈveɪkənt/<,>adj.空的/adj.未被占用的/adj.空缺的/adj.茫然的/adj.空虚的<,>The apartment has been vacant for months.<,>这套公寓已经空置好几个月了。<,>There's a vacant position in the marketing department.<,>市场部有一个空缺职位。<,>He stared at me with a vacant expression.<,>他用茫然的表情盯着我。<,>vac(空)+ant→空的<,>vacation(n.假期)/vacuum(n.真空)  

physicist<,>/ˈfɪzɪsɪst/<,>/ˈfɪzɪsɪst/<,>n.物理学家<,>Albert Einstein was a famous theoretical physicist.<,>阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦是著名的理论物理学家。<,>The physicist won the Nobel Prize for his discovery.<,>这位物理学家因其发现获得了诺贝尔奖。<,>She aspires to become a quantum physicist.<,>她立志要成为一名量子物理学家。<,>physic(物理)+ist(人)→物理学家<,>physician(n.医生)/physical(adj.身体的)  

afford<,>/əˈfɔːd/<,>/əˈfɔːrd/<,>vt.担负得起/vt.提供<,>I can't afford to buy a new car right now.<,>我现在买不起新车。<,>The tree affords shade in the summer.<,>这棵树在夏天提供阴凉。<,>Education should afford equal opportunities to all children.<,>教育应该为所有孩子提供平等的机会。<,>af(加强)+ford(拿出)→能拿出来→负担得起<,>effort(n.努力)/forward(adv.向前)  

underground<,>/ˌʌndəˈɡraʊnd/<,>/ˈʌndərɡraʊnd/<,>adv.在地下/adv.往地下/adv.秘密地/adj.地下的/adj.秘密的/n.地铁/n.地下组织<,>The miners work underground for long hours.<,>矿工们在地下长时间工作。<,>There's an underground parking garage beneath the building.<,>大楼下面有一个地下停车场。<,>The resistance movement operated underground during the war.<,>抵抗运动在战争期间秘密进行。<,>under(在...下)+ground(地面)→地下<,>underline(v.强调)/underwear(n.内衣)  

curse<,>/kɜːs/<,>/kɜːrs/<,>v.诅咒/v.咒骂/n.天谴/n.祸害/n.祸根<,>He cursed loudly when he dropped the hammer on his foot.<,>当锤子砸到他的脚时，他大声咒骂。<,>The witch put a curse on the village.<,>女巫给村庄下了诅咒。<,>Gambling proved to be the family's curse.<,>赌博被证明是这个家庭的祸根。<,>cur(跑)+se→跑来的灾祸→诅咒<,>course(n.课程)/nurse(n.护士)
impression<,>/ɪmˈpreʃən/<,>/ɪmˈpreʃən/<,>n.印象/n.印记<,>His first impression of the city was overwhelming.<,>他对这座城市的第一印象非常深刻。<,>She left an impression of her hand in the wet clay.<,>她在湿黏土上留下了手印。<,>The speech made a strong impression on the audience.<,>这场演讲给观众留下了深刻的印象。<,>im(进入)+press(压)+ion→压进去→印记<,>expression(n.表达)/depression(n.沮丧/n.萧条)

baseball<,>/ˈbeɪsbɔːl/<,>/ˈbeɪsˌbɔl/<,>n.棒球<,>He plays baseball every weekend.<,>他每个周末都打棒球。<,>The baseball game was postponed due to rain.<,>棒球比赛因雨延期。<,>She collects baseball cards as a hobby.<,>她以收集棒球卡为爱好。<,>base(基础)+ball(球)→棒球<,>basketball(n.篮球)/football(n.足球)

interval<,>/ˈɪntəvəl/<,>/ˈɪntɚvəl/<,>n.间隔/n.间距/n.幕间休息<,>There was a short interval between the two acts.<,>两幕之间有短暂的休息时间。<,>The trees were planted at regular intervals.<,>树木按固定间距种植。<,>He takes medication at six-hour intervals.<,>他每隔六小时服药一次。<,>inter(在...之间)+val→间隔<,>internal(adj.内部的)/external(adj.外部的)

evaluate<,>/ɪˈvæljueɪt/<,>/ɪˈvæljuˌeɪt/<,>vt.评价/vt.估价<,>Teachers evaluate students' performance regularly.<,>老师定期评估学生的表现。<,>We need to evaluate the cost before making a decision.<,>我们需要在决定前评估成本。<,>The app allows users to evaluate products.<,>这个应用允许用户评价产品。<,>e(出)+valu(价值)+ate→评估价值<,>value(n.价值)/valuation(n.估价)

machinery<,>/məˈʃiːnəri/<,>/məˈʃinəri/<,>n.机器/n.机械<,>The factory uses modern machinery for production.<,>这家工厂使用现代化机械进行生产。<,>Farm machinery has greatly improved efficiency.<,>农业机械大大提高了效率。<,>He specializes in repairing industrial machinery.<,>他专门修理工业机械。<,>machine(机器)+ry→机械<,>mechanic(n.技工)/mechanical(adj.机械的)

upset<,>/ʌpˈset/<,>/ʌpˈsɛt/<,>adj.心烦的/adj.苦恼的/adj.不适的/vt.使心烦意乱/vt.使苦恼/vt.使不适/vt.搅乱/vt.弄翻/n.翻倒/n.搅乱/n.不安/n.不适<,>She was upset by the bad news.<,>她被这个坏消息搞得心烦意乱。<,>Don't upset the delicate balance.<,>不要打破这种微妙的平衡。<,>The boat upset in the storm.<,>小船在暴风雨中翻了。<,>up(上)+set(放置)→放倒→弄翻<,>reset(v.重置)/onset(n.开始)

inference<,>/ˈɪnfərəns/<,>/ˈɪnfɚəns/<,>n.推断结果/n.结论/n.推论/n.推理/n.推断<,>We can draw some inferences from the data.<,>我们可以从数据中得出一些推论。<,>His inference turned out to be correct.<,>他的推断结果证明是正确的。<,>Logical inference is an important skill.<,>逻辑推理是一项重要技能。<,>infer(推断)+ence→推论<,>reference(n.参考)/conference(n.会议)

curve<,>/kɜːv/<,>/kɝv/<,>v.弯曲/n.曲线/n.弯/n.弯曲处<,>The road curves to the left ahead.<,>前方的道路向左弯曲。<,>She drew a smooth curve on the paper.<,>她在纸上画了一条平滑的曲线。<,>The river makes a sharp curve here.<,>河流在这里有一个急转弯。<,>curve(弯曲)→曲线<,>cure(v.治愈)/carve(v.雕刻)
dot<,>/dɒt/<,>/dɑːt/<,>n.点/n.圆点/vt.打点于<,>She wore a dress with white dots.<,>她穿了一件带白点的连衣裙。<,>Dot the i's and cross the t's.<,>给i加点，给t画横线（意指做事要一丝不苟）。<,>The map was dotted with small towns.<,>地图上点缀着许多小镇。<,>do(做)+t(形状像点)→做点→打点<,>dotage(n.老年糊涂)/dote(v.溺爱)  

skim<,>/skɪm/<,>/skɪm/<,>v.撇去/v.掠过/v.擦过/v.浏览/v.略读<,>She skimmed the cream off the milk.<,>她把牛奶上的奶油撇去。<,>The swallows skimmed over the lake.<,>燕子掠过湖面。<,>I just skimmed through the report.<,>我只是略读了这份报告。<,>ski(滑雪)+m(动作轻快)→像滑雪一样轻快掠过<,>slim(adj.苗条的)/scam(n.骗局)  

phenomenon<,>/fəˈnɒmɪnən/<,>/fəˈnɑːmɪnən/<,>n.现象<,>The northern lights are a natural phenomenon.<,>北极光是一种自然现象。<,>This is a common phenomenon in big cities.<,>这是大城市里的常见现象。<,>The phenomenon attracted scientists' attention.<,>这一现象引起了科学家的注意。<,>pheno(显现)+menon(名词后缀)→显现出来的事物→现象<,>phenomena(复数形式)/phenomenal(adj.非凡的)  

notify<,>/ˈnəʊtɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈnoʊtɪfaɪ/<,>vt.通知/vt.告知/vt.报告<,>Please notify me when you arrive.<,>你到达时请通知我。<,>The school notified parents about the event.<,>学校就此事通知了家长。<,>He was notified of the decision.<,>他被告知了这个决定。<,>not(知道)+ify(使)→使知道→通知<,>notice(n.通知)/certify(v.证明)  

mention<,>/ˈmenʃn/<,>/ˈmenʃn/<,>n.提及/n.说起/vt.提及/vt.说起<,>He made no mention of the incident.<,>他没有提及这件事。<,>Did she mention where she was going?<,>她有没有说起要去哪里？<,>The book mentions this theory.<,>这本书提到了这个理论。<,>ment(心智)+ion→说到心里→提及<,>mental(adj.精神的)/comment(n.评论)  

stream<,>/striːm/<,>/striːm/<,>v.流出/v.涌出/n.河/n.溪流/n.一股/n.一串<,>Tears streamed down her face.<,>泪水从她脸上流下。<,>We crossed a small stream.<,>我们穿过了一条小溪。<,>A stream of cars passed by.<,>一串汽车驶过。<,>s(水)+tream(流动)→水流→溪流<,>steam(n.蒸汽)/scream(v.尖叫)

crime<,>/kraɪm/<,>/kraɪm/<,>n.罪/n.罪行/n.犯罪<,>Stealing is a crime.<,>偷窃是犯罪行为。<,>The crime rate has fallen.<,>犯罪率下降了。<,>He was arrested for committing a crime.<,>他因犯罪被捕。<,>cri(哭)+me(我)→我因犯罪而哭泣→罪行<,>criminal(n.罪犯)/prime(adj.主要的)

leisure<,>/ˈleʒə(r)/<,>/ˈliːʒər/<,>n.空闲时间/n.悠闲<,>He spends his leisure time reading books.<,>他在空闲时间读书。<,>She enjoys the leisure of a quiet afternoon.<,>她喜欢安静下午的悠闲时光。<,>They went for a walk in their leisure hours.<,>他们在闲暇时散步。<,>lei(累)+sure(确定)→累了需要确定休息时间→空闲时间<,>pleasure(n.快乐)/measure(n.措施)/treasure(n.财富)

positive<,>/ˈpɒzətɪv/<,>/ˈpɑːzətɪv/<,>adj.确实的/adj.明确的/adj.积极的/adj.肯定的<,>She has a positive attitude towards life.<,>她对生活有积极的态度。<,>The test results came back positive.<,>检测结果呈阳性。<,>He gave positive feedback on my work.<,>他对我的工作给予了肯定评价。<,>pos(放)+itive→明确放下的→明确的<,>negative(adj.消极的)/position(n.位置)/possessive(adj.占有的)

favourite<,>/ˈfeɪvərɪt/<,>/ˈfeɪvərɪt/<,>adj.特别受喜爱的/n.特别受喜爱的人<,>Chocolate is my favourite dessert.<,>巧克力是我最喜欢的甜点。<,>She is the teacher's favourite.<,>她是老师最喜欢的学生。<,>What's your favourite color?<,>你最喜欢的颜色是什么？<,>favour(喜爱)+ite(表人)→受喜爱的人<,>flavour(n.味道)/favor(n.喜爱)/favourable(adj.有利的)

menu<,>/ˈmenjuː/<,>/ˈmenjuː/<,>n.菜单<,>Could I see the menu, please?<,>请给我看看菜单。<,>The restaurant changes its menu every season.<,>这家餐厅每季更换菜单。<,>She studied the menu carefully before ordering.<,>她点菜前仔细研究了菜单。<,>men(人)+u(你)→给你看的东西→菜单<,>manual(n.手册)/mental(adj.精神的)/minute(n.分钟)

prospect<,>/ˈprɒspekt/<,>/ˈprɑːspekt/<,>v.勘探/v.勘察/n.前景/n.前途/n.可能性/n.景象/n.景色/n.可能成为主顾的人/n.有希望的候选人<,>The job offers good prospects for promotion.<,>这份工作有很好的晋升前景。<,>They are prospecting for gold in the mountains.<,>他们在山里勘探金矿。<,>The prospect of rain ruined our picnic plans.<,>可能下雨的前景破坏了我们的野餐计划。<,>pro(向前)+spect(看)→向前看→前景<,>perspective(n.观点)/prosper(v.繁荣)/spectacle(n.景象)
radar<,>/ˈreɪdɑː(r)/<,>/ˈreɪdɑːr/<,>n.雷达<,>The ship was detected by radar.<,>这艘船被雷达探测到了。<,>Air traffic control uses radar to monitor planes.<,>空中交通管制使用雷达监控飞机。<,>The weather radar shows heavy rain approaching.<,>天气雷达显示大雨即将来临。<,>ra(无线电)+dar(探测)→雷达<,>sonar(n.声纳)/laser(n.激光)/radio(n.无线电)  

refugee<,>/ˌrefjʊˈdʒiː/<,>/ˈrɛfjʊˌdʒi/<,>n.难民<,>The refugee camp provides shelter for thousands.<,>难民营为数千人提供庇护所。<,>Many refugees fled the war-torn country.<,>许多难民逃离了饱受战争蹂躏的国家。<,>She works for an organization that helps refugees.<,>她在一个帮助难民的组织工作。<,>re(重新)+fug(逃离)+ee(人)→逃离的人→难民<,>migrant(n.移民)/asylum(n.庇护)/displaced person(流离失所者)  

aluminium<,>/ˌæljəˈmɪniəm/<,>/əˈluːmɪnəm/<,>n.铝<,>Aluminium is a lightweight metal.<,>铝是一种轻质金属。<,>The cans are made of aluminium.<,>这些罐子是用铝制成的。<,>Aluminium foil is used for wrapping food.<,>铝箔用于包装食物。<,>alumin(明矾)+ium(元素后缀)→铝<,>iron(n.铁)/copper(n.铜)/steel(n.钢)  

comparable<,>/ˈkɒmpərəbl/<,>/ˈkɑːmpərəbl/<,>adj.可比较的/类似的/比得上的<,>The two products are of comparable quality.<,>这两种产品质量相当。<,>Her achievements are comparable to his.<,>她的成就可以与他相媲美。<,>There is no comparable example in history.<,>历史上没有类似的例子。<,>com(共同)+par(平等)+able(能…的)→可比较的<,>comparative(adj.比较的)/compatible(adj.兼容的)/incomparable(adj.无与伦比的)  

specialize<,>/ˈspeʃəlaɪz/<,>/ˈspɛʃəˌlaɪz/<,>vi.成为…专家/专攻<,>He specializes in computer science.<,>他专攻计算机科学。<,>The doctor specializes in heart surgery.<,>这位医生专攻心脏手术。<,>This restaurant specializes in Italian cuisine.<,>这家餐厅专做意大利菜。<,>special(专门的)+ize(使…)→专攻<,>generalize(v.概括)/specialty(n.专业)/expertise(n.专业知识)  

rotate<,>/rəʊˈteɪt/<,>/ˈroʊteɪt/<,>v.旋转/转动/轮流<,>The Earth rotates on its axis.<,>地球绕地轴旋转。<,>We rotate the tires every 10,000 miles.<,>我们每1万英里轮换一次轮胎。<,>The team members rotate the leadership role.<,>团队成员轮流担任领导角色。<,>rot(轮子)+ate(使…)→旋转<,>revolve(v.旋转)/alternate(v.交替)/spin(v.快速旋转)  

instance<,>/ˈɪnstəns/<,>/ˈɪnstəns/<,>n.例子/实例/事例<,>This is a classic instance of poor management.<,>这是管理不善的典型例子。<,>For instance, you could try a different approach.<,>例如，你可以尝试不同的方法。<,>In this instance, we will make an exception.<,>在这种情况下，我们将破例一次。<,>in(在…上)+stance(站立)→立即可见的例子<,>example(n.例子)/case(n.案例)/sample(n.样本)  

opera<,>/ˈɒpərə/<,>/ˈɑːpərə/<,>n.歌剧<,>We went to see an opera last night.<,>昨晚我们去看了歌剧。<,>She has a beautiful voice for opera.<,>她有唱歌剧的美妙嗓音。<,>"The Magic Flute" is a famous opera by Mozart.<,>《魔笛》是莫扎特的著名歌剧。<,>oper(工作)+a→音乐工作的艺术→歌剧<,>operetta(n.轻歌剧)/symphony(n.交响乐)/ballet(n.芭蕾)  

presumably<,>/prɪˈzjuːməbli/<,>/prɪˈzuːməbli/<,>adv.大概/可能/据推测<,>Presumably, he forgot about the meeting.<,>他大概是忘了开会。<,>She's presumably at home by now.<,>她现在可能在家。<,>Presumably, the project will be completed on time.<,>据推测，项目将按时完成。<,>presume(假定)+ably(可…地)→大概<,>probably(adv.很可能)/supposedly(adv.据称)/allegedly(adv.据传)  

conscience<,>/ˈkɒnʃəns/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəns/<,>n.良心/道德心<,>He couldn't in good conscience keep the money.<,>他良心不安，不能留下这笔钱。<,>Her conscience told her to confess.<,>她的良心告诉她应该坦白。<,>It's a matter of conscience for him.<,>这对他来说是良心问题。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+ence→共同知晓的道德心<,>conscious(adj.有意识的)/conscientious(adj.尽责的)/ethics(n.伦理)
subject<,>/ˈsʌbdʒɪkt/<,>/ˈsʌbdʒɛkt/<,>n.题目/n.学科/n.主语/vt.使隶属<,>Math is my favorite subject in school.<,>数学是我在学校最喜欢的科目。<,>The book covers a wide range of subjects.<,>这本书涵盖了广泛的主题。<,>The country was subjected to foreign rule for many years.<,>这个国家多年来一直受外国统治。<,>sub(在下面)+ject(投掷)→被投掷在下面→隶属<,>object(n.物体/v.反对)/project(n.项目/v.投射)/inject(v.注射)  

practically<,>/ˈpræktɪkli/<,>/ˈpræktɪkli/<,>adv.几乎/adv.简直/adv.实际上<,>I've practically finished my homework.<,>我几乎完成了我的作业。<,>It's practically impossible to solve this problem.<,>解决这个问题简直不可能。<,>Practically speaking, this method is more efficient.<,>实际上，这个方法更高效。<,>practic(实践)+al(形容词后缀)+ly(副词后缀)→实际上<,>theoretically(adv.理论上)/virtually(adv.几乎/实质上)  

recognition<,>/ˌrekəɡˈnɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛkəɡˈnɪʃən/<,>n.认出/n.识别/n.承认/n.赏识/n.表彰/n.报偿<,>She received recognition for her outstanding work.<,>她因出色的工作而受到表彰。<,>Facial recognition technology is widely used today.<,>面部识别技术如今被广泛应用。<,>He nodded in recognition when he saw his old friend.<,>他看到老朋友时点头示意认出了对方。<,>re(再)+cogn(知道)+ition(名词后缀)→再次知道→认出<,>cognition(n.认知)/ignorance(n.无知)/acknowledgment(n.承认)  

cassette<,>/kəˈset/<,>/kəˈsɛt/<,>n.盒式录音带<,>I found some old cassettes in the attic.<,>我在阁楼里发现了一些旧磁带。<,>Cassette players were popular in the 1980s.<,>盒式录音机在20世纪80年代很流行。<,>She recorded her voice on a cassette tape.<,>她把她的声音录在磁带上。<,>case(盒子)+ette(小)→小盒子→盒式磁带<,>CD(n.光盘)/vinyl(n.黑胶唱片)/tape(n.磁带)  

blade<,>/bleɪd/<,>/bleɪd/<,>n.刀刃/n.刀片/n.叶片<,>Be careful with that knife - the blade is very sharp.<,>小心那把刀 - 刀刃非常锋利。<,>The blades of the fan need cleaning.<,>风扇的叶片需要清洁。<,>He replaced the razor blade this morning.<,>他今天早上更换了剃须刀片。<,>blade(古英语"叶子")→刀片形状像叶子<,>blaze(n.火焰/v.燃烧)/bleak(adj.荒凉的)/blame(v.责备)  

arrangement<,>/əˈreɪndʒmənt/<,>/əˈreɪndʒmənt/<,>n.整理/n.排列/n.安排/n.准备工作<,>We made arrangements for the meeting next week.<,>我们为下周的会议做了安排。<,>The flower arrangement looks beautiful.<,>这个插花看起来很漂亮。<,>She has a special arrangement with her boss about working hours.<,>她和老板在工作时间上有特殊安排。<,>arrange(安排)+ment(名词后缀)→安排<,>engagement(n.订婚/约定)/management(n.管理)/alignment(n.排列)  

revenue<,>/ˈrevənjuː/<,>/ˈrɛvəˌnu/<,>n.收入/n.收益/n.税收/n.岁入<,>The company's revenue increased by 20% this year.<,>公司今年的收入增长了20%。<,>Tax revenue is used to fund public services.<,>税收用于资助公共服务。<,>Advertising is a major source of revenue for this website.<,>广告是这个网站的主要收入来源。<,>re(回)+ven(来)+ue→回来的东西→收入<,>avenue(n.大街)/revenge(n.报复)/inventory(n.存货清单)  

strip<,>/strɪp/<,>/strɪp/<,>v.脱光衣服/v.剥夺/n.条带<,>He stripped off his wet clothes.<,>他脱掉了湿衣服。<,>The soldiers were stripped of their ranks.<,>这些士兵被剥夺了军衔。<,>She cut the paper into thin strips.<,>她把纸剪成细条。<,>strip(剥去)→像剥皮一样脱衣服<,>stripe(n.条纹)/strap(n.带子)/trip(n.旅行)  

solution<,>/səˈluːʃn/<,>/səˈluʃən/<,>n.解决/n.解决办法/n.溶液<,>We need to find a solution to this problem.<,>我们需要找到这个问题的解决办法。<,>The sugar dissolved completely in the solution.<,>糖在溶液中完全溶解了。<,>Her solution was both creative and effective.<,>她的解决方案既有创意又有效。<,>solut(松开)+ion(名词后缀)→松开问题→解决<,>resolution(n.决心/分辨率)/dissolution(n.溶解)/salutation(n.问候)  

continuous<,>/kənˈtɪnjuəs/<,>/kənˈtɪnjuəs/<,>adj.连续不断的/adj.延伸的<,>The rain has been continuous for three days.<,>雨已经连续下了三天了。<,>The road is continuous for another 50 miles.<,>这条路又连续延伸了50英里。<,>Continuous learning is important in today's world.<,>在当今世界，持续学习很重要。<,>continu(继续)+ous(形容词后缀)→连续的<,>continual(adj.频繁的)/contiguous(adj.邻近的)/contentious(adj.有争议的)
opponent<,>/əˈpəʊnənt/<,>/əˈpoʊnənt/<,>n.对手/n.敌手/n.对抗者<,>He defeated his opponent in the final round.<,>他在最后一轮击败了对手。<,>She is a strong opponent of the new policy.<,>她是新政策的强烈反对者。<,>The boxer studied his opponent's moves carefully.<,>拳击手仔细研究对手的动作。<,>op(反)+pon(放置)+ent→反着站的人→对手<,>component(n.部件)/proponent(n.支持者)

accelerate<,>/əkˈseləreɪt/<,>/ækˈsɛləreɪt/<,>vt.使加快/vt.使增速<,>The car accelerated as it went downhill.<,>汽车下坡时加速了。<,>The company plans to accelerate production next month.<,>公司计划下个月加速生产。<,>Regular exercise can accelerate metabolism.<,>定期锻炼可以加速新陈代谢。<,>ac(加强)+celer(速度)+ate(使)→使加快<,>decelerate(v.减速)/celebrate(v.庆祝)/celerity(n.迅速)

backward<,>/ˈbækwəd/<,>/ˈbækwərd/<,>adv.倒/adv.向后/adv.往回/adj.向后的/adj.倒的/adj.落后的/adj.进步慢的<,>He took a step backward in surprise.<,>他惊讶地后退了一步。<,>This is a backward region with poor infrastructure.<,>这是一个基础设施落后的地区。<,>She glanced backward over her shoulder.<,>她回头向后瞥了一眼。<,>back(后面)+ward(方向)→向后<,>forward(adv.向前)/awkward(adj.笨拙的)/afterward(adv.后来)

grain<,>/ɡreɪn/<,>/ɡreɪn/<,>n.谷物/n.谷粒/n.颗粒/n.少量/n.微量<,>Wheat is an important grain crop.<,>小麦是重要的谷物作物。<,>There isn't a grain of truth in his story.<,>他的故事没有一点真实性。<,>The wood has a beautiful grain pattern.<,>这块木头有漂亮的纹理。<,>与"rain(雨)"一起记：雨滋润谷物<,>brain(n.大脑)/drain(v.排水)/train(n.火车)

maid<,>/meɪd/<,>/meɪd/<,>n.女仆/n.侍女<,>The maid cleaned the room every morning.<,>女仆每天早上打扫房间。<,>She worked as a maid in a hotel.<,>她在酒店当女服务员。<,>The young maid was very efficient at her work.<,>这个年轻女仆工作效率很高。<,>与"made(制造)"同音：女仆把房间收拾得整整齐齐<,>maiden(n.少女)/mail(n.邮件)/maize(n.玉米)

residence<,>/ˈrezɪdəns/<,>/ˈrɛzɪdəns/<,>n.住处/n.住宅/n.居住/n.居住资格<,>He took up residence in London last year.<,>他去年在伦敦定居。<,>The university provides residence for international students.<,>大学为国际学生提供住宿。<,>This is my official residence as ambassador.<,>这是我作为大使的官邸。<,>re(再)+sid(坐)+ence→长期坐的地方→住宅<,>resident(n.居民)/president(n.总统)/subsidence(n.下沉)

credit<,>/ˈkredɪt/<,>/ˈkrɛdɪt/<,>n.信贷/n.赊欠/n.赞扬/n.荣誉/n.学分/n.信任/vt.相信/vt.把...记入贷方/vt.把...归于<,>She got full credit for her hard work.<,>她的辛勤工作得到了充分认可。<,>I bought the TV on credit.<,>我赊账买了这台电视。<,>He credited his success to good luck.<,>他把成功归功于好运。<,>cred(相信)+it→信任<,>debit(n.借方)/edit(v.编辑)/secret(n.秘密)

regardless<,>/rɪˈɡɑːdləs/<,>/rɪˈɡɑːrdləs/<,>adv.不顾后果地/adv.不管怎样/adv.无论如何<,>He continued working regardless of his illness.<,>他不顾生病继续工作。<,>Regardless of the weather, we'll go hiking tomorrow.<,>不管天气如何，我们明天都要去远足。<,>She decided to marry him regardless.<,>她决定无论如何都要嫁给他。<,>regard(考虑)+less(不)→不考虑→不管怎样<,>regarding(prep.关于)/disregard(v.忽视)/regards(n.问候)

oxygen<,>/ˈɒksɪdʒən/<,>/ˈɑːksɪdʒən/<,>n.氧/n.氧气<,>Plants produce oxygen during photosynthesis.<,>植物在光合作用中产生氧气。<,>The patient was given oxygen to help him breathe.<,>给病人输氧帮助他呼吸。<,>Oxygen is essential for human life.<,>氧气对人类生命至关重要。<,>oxy(氧)+gen(产生)→产生氧气的<,>hydrogen(n.氢)/nitrogen(n.氮)/carbon(n.碳)

intensive<,>/ɪnˈtensɪv/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnsɪv/<,>adj.加强的/adj.精深的/adj.透彻的/adj.精耕细作的<,>She took an intensive English course.<,>她参加了英语强化课程。<,>The patient needs intensive care.<,>病人需要重症监护。<,>This farm uses intensive farming methods.<,>这个农场采用精耕细作的方法。<,>in(进入)+tens(伸展)+ive→深入伸展的→加强的<,>extensive(adj.广泛的)/tensive(adj.紧张的)/intense(adj.强烈的)
alter<,>/ˈɔːltə(r)/<,>/ˈɔːltər/<,>vt.改变/vt.变更/vt.变动<,>She altered her dress to fit better.<,>她修改了裙子使其更合身。<,>The schedule has been altered due to bad weather.<,>由于天气不好，日程已经变更。<,>His opinion altered after hearing the facts.<,>听完事实后他的观点改变了。<,>alt(高)+er→使变高→改变<,>alert(adj.警觉的)/altar(n.祭坛)

combine<,>/kəmˈbaɪn/<,>/kəmˈbaɪn/<,>v.结合/v.联合/v.化合/n.联合企业/n.联合收割机<,>We need to combine our efforts to solve this problem.<,>我们需要联合努力来解决这个问题。<,>Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.<,>氢和氧化合形成水。<,>He works for a large agricultural combine.<,>他在一家大型农业联合企业工作。<,>com(共同)+bine(捆)→捆在一起→结合<,>combination(n.结合)/combust(v.燃烧)

ideal<,>/aɪˈdiːəl/<,>/aɪˈdiːəl/<,>adj.理想的/adj.观念的/adj.空想的/n.理想/n.理想的东西<,>This is the ideal place for a picnic.<,>这是野餐的理想地点。<,>She has high ideals about marriage.<,>她对婚姻有很高的理想。<,>His ideal of happiness is simple.<,>他对幸福的观念很简单。<,>idea(想法)+l→理想的想法→理想的<,>idea(n.想法)/idle(adj.空闲的)

bearing<,>/ˈbeərɪŋ/<,>/ˈberɪŋ/<,>n.举止/n.风度/n.方位/n.方向感/n.影响<,>His military bearing impressed everyone.<,>他的军人风度给大家留下了深刻印象。<,>We lost our bearings in the dense fog.<,>我们在浓雾中迷失了方向。<,>This decision has a direct bearing on our future.<,>这个决定直接影响我们的未来。<,>bear(承受)+ing→承受的方式→举止<,>bearing(n.轴承)/bearing(n.生育)

illustrate<,>/ˈɪləstreɪt/<,>/ˈɪləstreɪt/<,>vt.说明<,>The professor illustrated his point with a diagram.<,>教授用图表说明了他的观点。<,>This book is beautifully illustrated.<,>这本书的插图很精美。<,>Let me illustrate what I mean with an example.<,>让我举个例子说明我的意思。<,>il(在...上)+lustr(光)+ate→把光照在上面→说明<,>demonstrate(v.演示)/illuminate(v.阐明)

occur<,>/əˈkɜː(r)/<,>/əˈkɜːr/<,>vi.发生/vi.出现/vi.存在/vi.被想起/vi.被想到<,>Accidents often occur at this intersection.<,>事故经常发生在这个十字路口。<,>A good idea occurred to me while showering.<,>洗澡时我想到了一个好主意。<,>This phenomenon occurs naturally in nature.<,>这种现象在自然界中自然存在。<,>oc(朝向)+cur(跑)→跑向→发生<,>recur(v.复发)/incur(v.招致)

comedy<,>/ˈkɒmədi/<,>/ˈkɑːmədi/<,>n.喜剧/n.喜剧性<,>We went to see a comedy last night.<,>昨晚我们去看了一场喜剧。<,>There's a lot of comedy in everyday life.<,>日常生活中有很多喜剧性。<,>He has a great sense of comedy timing.<,>他对喜剧节奏把握得很好。<,>com(共同)+edy(唱)→大家一起唱→喜剧<,>tragedy(n.悲剧)/comic(adj.滑稽的)

broom<,>/bruːm/<,>/bruːm/<,>n.扫帚<,>She swept the floor with a broom.<,>她用扫帚扫地。<,>The witch flew on her broomstick.<,>女巫骑着扫帚飞行。<,>He bought a new broom for cleaning.<,>他买了一把新扫帚用来打扫。<,>br(刷)+oom(拟声)→刷地的声音→扫帚<,>bloom(v.开花)/groom(n.新郎)

establishment<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃmənt/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃmənt/<,>n.建立/n.设立/n.确立/n.企业/n.当权人物<,>The establishment of the new school took two years.<,>新学校的建立花了两年时间。<,>He works for a large financial establishment.<,>他在一家大型金融机构工作。<,>The political establishment opposed the reforms.<,>当权派反对这些改革。<,>establish(建立)+ment(名词后缀)→建立<,>establish(v.建立)/stabilize(v.稳定)

pressure<,>/ˈpreʃə(r)/<,>/ˈpreʃər/<,>n.压/n.压强/n.压迫/vt.对...施加压力/vt.迫使<,>High blood pressure can be dangerous.<,>高血压可能有危险。<,>They pressured him to resign.<,>他们迫使他辞职。<,>The water pressure is too low in this building.<,>这栋楼的水压太低。<,>press(压)+ure(状态)→压力<,>compress(v.压缩)/depress(v.使沮丧)
breeze<,>/briːz/<,>/briz/<,>vi.飘然而行/n.微风/n.和风<,>The curtains fluttered in the gentle breeze.<,>窗帘在微风中轻轻飘动。<,>She breezed through the exam without any difficulty.<,>她轻松通过了考试。<,>A cool breeze blew in from the sea.<,>凉爽的海风从海上吹来。<,>bre(呼吸)+eze→像呼吸一样轻柔→微风<,>freeze(v.冻结/n.冰冻期)/breathe(v.呼吸)

trash<,>/træʃ/<,>/træʃ/<,>n.垃圾/n.废物/n.拙劣的文学作品/n.没用的人/n.社会渣滓/n.败类/vt.捣毁/vt.破坏<,>Take out the trash before it starts to smell.<,>在垃圾开始发臭前把它拿出去。<,>He trashed his hotel room after the concert.<,>音乐会后他捣毁了酒店房间。<,>That movie was complete trash.<,>那部电影完全是垃圾。<,>tr(看作true真实)+ash(灰烬)→真正的灰烬→垃圾<,>thrash(v.鞭打/v.猛烈摆动)/crash(v.碰撞/n.撞车)

painter<,>/ˈpeɪntə(r)/<,>/ˈpeɪntər/<,>n.漆工/n.画家<,>Van Gogh was a famous Dutch painter.<,>梵高是著名的荷兰画家。<,>We need to hire a painter for the house renovation.<,>我们需要雇个油漆工来装修房子。<,>The painter is working on a new masterpiece.<,>这位画家正在创作新的杰作。<,>paint(绘画)+er(人)→绘画的人→画家<,>printer(n.打印机/n.印刷工)/pointer(n.指针/n.指示物)

millimetre<,>/ˈmɪlimiːtə(r)/<,>/ˈmɪləˌmitər/<,>n.毫米<,>The tumor was only 5 millimetres in size.<,>肿瘤只有5毫米大小。<,>This ruler has millimetre markings.<,>这把尺子有毫米刻度。<,>A millimetre is one thousandth of a metre.<,>一毫米是一米的千分之一。<,>milli(千分之一)+metre(米)→千分之一米→毫米<,>centimetre(n.厘米)/kilometre(n.千米)

horn<,>/hɔːn/<,>/hɔrn/<,>n.角/n.号角/n.警报器<,>The driver honked his horn impatiently.<,>司机不耐烦地按着喇叭。<,>Rhinoceroses have distinctive horns.<,>犀牛有独特的角。<,>The ship's horn sounded as it left the harbor.<,>船只离港时鸣响了汽笛。<,>hor(看作hour小时)+n→古代用号角报时→号角<,>thorn(n.刺/n.荆棘)/hoard(v.贮藏/n.囤积)

specialist<,>/ˈspeʃəlɪst/<,>/ˈspɛʃəlɪst/<,>n.专家<,>She's a specialist in ancient Greek history.<,>她是古希腊历史专家。<,>You should see a heart specialist about your condition.<,>你应该找心脏病专家看看你的情况。<,>The company hired a marketing specialist.<,>公司聘请了一位营销专家。<,>special(专门的)+ist(人)→专门从事某领域的人→专家<,>generalist(n.多面手/n.通才)/specialize(v.专攻)

infer<,>/ɪnˈfɜː(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɜr/<,>vt.推论/vt.推断/vt.猜想<,>From his tone, I inferred that he was unhappy.<,>从他的语气，我推断他不高兴。<,>What can we infer from these data?<,>从这些数据我们能推断出什么？<,>It's reasonable to infer that prices will rise.<,>推断价格会上涨是合理的。<,>in(进入)+fer(带来)→带进思考中→推断<,>refer(v.参考/v.提及)/differ(v.不同/v.有异议)

compass<,>/ˈkʌmpəs/<,>/ˈkʌmpəs/<,>n.罗盘/n.指南针/n.圆规/n.界限/n.范围<,>The hikers used a compass to find their way.<,>徒步者用指南针找路。<,>Draw a circle with your compass.<,>用圆规画个圆。<,>This topic is beyond the compass of our discussion.<,>这个主题超出了我们讨论的范围。<,>com(共同)+pass(通过)→共同通过的工具→指南针<,>encompass(v.包含/v.包围)/pass(n.通行证/v.通过)

background<,>/ˈbækɡraʊnd/<,>/ˈbækˌɡraʊnd/<,>n.出身背景/n.经历/n.背景资料/n.背景/n.底子<,>She comes from a wealthy background.<,>她出身富裕家庭。<,>Check the background of this applicant.<,>核查这位申请者的背景。<,>The mountains make a beautiful background for photos.<,>群山构成了照片的美丽背景。<,>back(后面)+ground(地面)→后面的地面→背景<,>foreground(n.前景/v.突出)/underground(adj.地下的/n.地铁)

sore<,>/sɔː(r)/<,>/sɔr/<,>adj.痛的/adj.恼火的/adj.急剧的/adj.剧烈的/n.疮/n.痛处<,>My throat is sore from coughing.<,>我咳嗽得喉咙痛。<,>She was sore about not being invited.<,>她对没被邀请感到恼火。<,>He had a sore on his leg that wouldn't heal.<,>他腿上有处伤口总不愈合。<,>s(看作see看)+ore(矿石)→看到矿石眼睛痛→痛的<,>score(n.分数/v.得分)/store(n.商店/v.储存)
dispose<,>/dɪˈspəʊz/<,>/dɪˈspoʊz/<,>vt.处理/vt.解决/vt.使倾向于<,>Please dispose of the waste properly.<,>请妥善处理废弃物。<,>The sunny weather disposed me to go for a walk.<,>晴朗的天气让我想出去散步。<,>They disposed the problem quickly.<,>他们迅速解决了这个问题。<,>dis(分开)+pose(放置)→分开摆放→处理<,>expose(v.暴露)/impose(v.强加)/compose(v.组成)

constitution<,>/ˌkɒnstɪˈtjuːʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnstɪˈtuːʃn/<,>n.宪法/n.章程/n.组成/n.设立<,>The U.S. Constitution was written in 1787.<,>美国宪法起草于1787年。<,>He has a strong constitution.<,>他体格强健。<,>The constitution of this committee will be finalized next week.<,>这个委员会的组成将在下周最终确定。<,>con(共同)+stitute(建立)+ion→共同建立的东西→宪法<,>institution(n.机构)/substitution(n.替代)/destitution(n.贫困)

blend<,>/blend/<,>/blend/<,>n&v.混合<,>Blend the ingredients until smooth.<,>将原料混合至顺滑。<,>This coffee is a blend of three types of beans.<,>这种咖啡是三种豆子的混合。<,>The colors blend together beautifully.<,>这些颜色完美地融合在一起。<,>b(不)+lend(借)→不借出而是混合<,>bland(adj.平淡的)/blind(adj.盲的)/bend(v.弯曲)

nonsense<,>/ˈnɒnsəns/<,>/ˈnɑːnsens/<,>n.胡说/n.废话/n.冒失的行动<,>Don't talk nonsense!<,>别胡说八道！<,>This report is complete nonsense.<,>这份报告完全是胡说八道。<,>He had the nonsense to challenge the boss.<,>他冒失地挑战了老板。<,>non(无)+sense(意义)→无意义的话→胡说<,>nonsensical(adj.无意义的)/senseless(adj.无感觉的)  

stain<,>/steɪn/<,>/steɪn/<,>vt.玷污/vt.给…着色/n.污点/n.污迹<,>The ink stained his shirt.<,>墨水弄脏了他的衬衫。<,>She stained the wood with a dark color.<,>她用深色给木头上色。<,>There's a coffee stain on the carpet.<,>地毯上有咖啡渍。<,>st(站)+ain(痛苦)→站着痛苦→玷污<,>sustain(vt.维持)/strain(n.拉紧)
