X-ray<,>/ˈeks reɪ/<,>/ˈeks reɪ/<,>n.X射线/n.X光<,>The doctor ordered an X-ray of my chest.<,>医生让我拍胸片。<,>X-rays can detect broken bones.<,>X光能检测骨折。<,>The airport security uses X-ray machines.<,>机场安检使用X光机。<,>X(未知)+ray(光线)→未知光线→X射线<,>gamma ray(n.伽马射线)/ultraviolet(adj.紫外线的)  

physical<,>/ˈfɪzɪkəl/<,>/ˈfɪzɪkəl/<,>adj.身体的/adj.物理的/adj.物质的/adj.有形的<,>Physical exercise is important for health.<,>体育锻炼对健康很重要。<,>It's a physical impossibility.<,>这在物理上是不可能的。<,>We live in the physical world.<,>我们生活在物质世界。<,>phys(自然)+ical→自然的→物理的<,>physician(n.医生)/metaphysical(adj.形而上学的)  

fulfil<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>vt.履行/vt.实现/vt.完成/vt.满足/vt.使满意<,>He fulfilled his promise.<,>他履行了诺言。<,>This job fulfills her creative needs.<,>这份工作满足了她的创作需求。<,>The prophecy was fulfilled.<,>预言应验了。<,>ful(满的)+fil(填)→填满→完成<,>fill(vt.填充)/full(adj.满的)  

wicked<,>/ˈwɪkɪd/<,>/ˈwɪkɪd/<,>adj.坏的/adj.令人厌恶的/adj.淘气的/adj.顽皮的<,>That was a wicked thing to do.<,>那样做太恶劣了。<,>She gave me a wicked smile.<,>她对我顽皮地笑了笑。<,>The witch had wicked powers.<,>女巫有邪恶的力量。<,>wick(灯芯)+ed→像烧焦的灯芯→坏的<,>wicker(n.柳条)/wicket(n.小门)  

spokesman<,>/ˈspəʊksmən/<,>/ˈspoʊksmən/<,>n.发言人<,>The company spokesman made a statement.<,>公司发言人发表了声明。<,>He acts as spokesman for the group.<,>他担任该组织的发言人。<,>The government spokesman denied the rumors.<,>政府发言人否认了谣言。<,>spoke(说话)+s+man(人)→说话的人→发言人<,>spokesperson(n.发言人)/spokeswoman(n.女发言人)
equation<,>/ɪˈkweɪʒ(ə)n/<,>/ɪˈkweɪʒən/<,>n.方程/n.等式<,>Solving this equation requires advanced mathematical skills.<,>解这个方程需要高级的数学技巧。<,>The equation of time is a concept in astronomy.<,>时间等式是天文学中的一个概念。<,>He wrote the chemical equation on the blackboard.<,>他在黑板上写下了化学方程式。<,>equ(平等)+ation(名词后缀)→等式<,>equator(n.赤道)/equilibrium(n.平衡)/equity(n.公平)

impressive<,>/ɪmˈpresɪv/<,>/ɪmˈprɛsɪv/<,>adj.给人深刻印象的<,>Her performance was truly impressive.<,>她的表演确实令人印象深刻。<,>The view from the top of the mountain was impressive.<,>从山顶看到的景色令人难忘。<,>He made an impressive speech at the conference.<,>他在会议上发表了令人印象深刻的演讲。<,>im(进入)+press(压)+ive(形容词后缀)→压入内心的→印象深刻的<,>impress(v.给...留下印象)/expression(n.表达)/oppressive(adj.压迫的)

compound<,>/ˈkɒmpaʊnd/<,>/ˈkɑːmpaʊnd/<,>adj.复合的/adj.化合的/n.化合物/n.复合物/n.复合词/vt.使恶化/vt.加重/vt.使化合/vt.使合成<,>Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.<,>水是氢和氧的化合物。<,>The problem was compounded by lack of funding.<,>资金短缺使问题更加严重。<,>This medicine is a compound of several herbs.<,>这种药是几种草药的合成物。<,>com(一起)+pound(放置)→放在一起→化合物<,>component(n.组成部分)/compose(v.组成)/composite(adj.复合的)

structure<,>/ˈstrʌktʃə(r)/<,>/ˈstrʌktʃər/<,>n.结构/n.构造/vt.建造<,>The Eiffel Tower has a unique steel structure.<,>埃菲尔铁塔有独特的钢结构。<,>They are studying the molecular structure of the virus.<,>他们正在研究病毒的分子结构。<,>The company is restructuring its management team.<,>公司正在重组其管理团队。<,>struct(建造)+ure(名词后缀)→结构<,>construction(n.建筑)/destruction(n.破坏)/instruct(v.指导)

intensity<,>/ɪnˈtensəti/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnsəti/<,>n.强烈/n.剧烈/n.强度<,>The intensity of the storm caused widespread damage.<,>风暴的强度造成了广泛的破坏。<,>He spoke with great intensity about the issue.<,>他非常激烈地谈论这个问题。<,>The light's intensity can be adjusted with this knob.<,>光的强度可以用这个旋钮调节。<,>in(加强)+tens(伸展)+ity(名词后缀)→强度<,>intense(adj.强烈的)/tension(n.紧张)/extension(n.延伸)

waken<,>/ˈweɪkən/<,>/ˈweɪkən/<,>v.醒来/v.弄醒<,>The noise wakened me from my sleep.<,>噪音把我从睡梦中吵醒。<,>She usually wakens at dawn.<,>她通常在黎明时分醒来。<,>The baby wakened and started crying.<,>婴儿醒了并开始哭泣。<,>wake(醒来)+en(动词后缀)→醒来<,>awaken(v.唤醒)/wake(v.醒来)/weaken(v.削弱)

stake<,>/steɪk/<,>/steɪk/<,>n.桩/n.利害关系/n.股份/n.赌金/n.赌注/vt.以...打赌/vt.拿...冒险<,>He has a stake in the company's success.<,>他在公司的成功中有利害关系。<,>They staked their claim to the land.<,>他们声明对这块土地的所有权。<,>The stakes are high in this poker game.<,>这场扑克游戏的赌注很高。<,>s(看作"死")+take(拿)→拿命去赌→赌注<,>steak(n.牛排)/stack(n.堆)/stark(adj.完全的)

extraordinary<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːdnri/<,>/ɪkˈstrɔːrdəneri/<,>adj.非同寻常的/adj.特别的<,>She showed extraordinary courage in the face of danger.<,>她在危险面前表现出非凡的勇气。<,>This is an extraordinary opportunity for us.<,>这对我们来说是个特别的机会。<,>His memory is extraordinary - he never forgets anything.<,>他的记忆力非凡 - 他从不忘记任何事情。<,>extra(超出)+ordinary(普通的)→超出普通的→非凡的<,>ordinary(adj.普通的)/extra(adj.额外的)/extravagant(adj.奢侈的)

witness<,>/ˈwɪtnəs/<,>/ˈwɪtnəs/<,>n.证据/n.目击者/n.证人/vt.目击/vt.为...作证/vt.证明<,>She witnessed the accident and called the police.<,>她目击了事故并报了警。<,>His testimony was a key witness in the trial.<,>他的证词是审判中的关键证据。<,>This document witnesses the agreement between the two parties.<,>这份文件证明了两方之间的协议。<,>wit(知道)+ness(名词后缀)→知道情况的人→证人<,>wit(n.机智)/witty(adj.机智的)/wither(v.枯萎)

concerning<,>/kənˈsɜːnɪŋ/<,>/kənˈsɜːrnɪŋ/<,>prep.关于<,>I received a letter concerning your application.<,>我收到了一封关于你申请的信。<,>There are new regulations concerning food safety.<,>有关于食品安全的新规定。<,>He asked several questions concerning the project.<,>他问了几个关于这个项目的问题。<,>concern(关心)+ing→关于<,>concern(n.关心/v.涉及)/concert(n.音乐会)/concrete(adj.具体的)
attraction<,>/əˈtrækʃ(ə)n/<,>/əˈtrækʃən/<,>n.吸引/n.吸引力/n.引力/n.具有吸引力的事物<,>Her beauty was a major attraction at the party.<,>她的美貌是派对上的主要吸引力。<,>The attraction between the two magnets is strong.<,>两块磁铁之间的引力很强。<,>Disneyland is a popular tourist attraction.<,>迪士尼乐园是受欢迎的旅游景点。<,>at(向)+tract(拉)+ion(名词后缀)→向某处拉→吸引<,>distraction(n.分心)/extraction(n.提取)/contract(n.合同)

conventional<,>/kənˈvenʃ(ə)n(ə)l/<,>/kənˈvɛnʃənl/<,>adj.普通的/adj.习惯的/adj.常规的/adj.因循守旧的<,>He prefers conventional medicine to alternative therapies.<,>他更喜欢传统医学而非替代疗法。<,>It's just a conventional greeting, nothing special.<,>这只是个常规问候，没什么特别的。<,>Her parents have very conventional views on marriage.<,>她父母对婚姻有着非常传统的观念。<,>con(共同)+vent(来)+ion(名词后缀)+al(形容词后缀)→大家共同遵守的→常规的<,>convention(n.大会/n.惯例)/convenient(adj.方便的)/converge(v.会合)

regulation<,>/ˌreɡjʊˈleɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌrɛɡjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.规章/n.规则/n.管理/n.控制/n.调节<,>The new safety regulations will take effect next month.<,>新的安全规章将于下个月生效。<,>The thermostat controls the regulation of temperature.<,>恒温器控制温度调节。<,>Strict regulations govern the use of chemicals in food.<,>食品中化学品的使用受到严格规定。<,>reg(统治)+ul+ation(名词后缀)→统治的手段→规章<,>regular(adj.规则的)/irregular(adj.不规则的)/legislation(n.立法)

puzzle<,>/ˈpʌz(ə)l/<,>/ˈpʌzəl/<,>v.迷惑/v.为难/v.苦思/n.智力测验/n.谜/n.难题/n.令人费解的事/n.困惑<,>This math problem really puzzles me.<,>这道数学题真让我困惑。<,>She enjoys doing crossword puzzles in her free time.<,>她喜欢在空闲时间做填字游戏。<,>The detective was puzzled by the mysterious note.<,>侦探被那张神秘的纸条难住了。<,>puzz(困惑)+le(动词后缀)→使困惑<,>muzzle(n.口套)/dazzle(v.使目眩)/fizzle(v.失败)

circulation<,>/ˌsɜːkjʊˈleɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˌsɜrkjəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.循环/n.流传/n.发行/n.流通<,>Regular exercise improves blood circulation.<,>定期锻炼能改善血液循环。<,>The newspaper has a circulation of over one million.<,>这份报纸的发行量超过一百万份。<,>Rumors about their breakup are in circulation.<,>关于他们分手的谣言正在流传。<,>circ(圆)+ul+ation(名词后缀)→绕圈运动→循环<,>circular(adj.圆形的)/circulate(v.循环)/circuit(n.电路)

bake<,>/beɪk/<,>/beɪk/<,>vt.烤/vt.烘/vt.焙<,>She bakes fresh bread every morning.<,>她每天早上都烤新鲜面包。<,>The cake needs to bake for 30 minutes.<,>蛋糕需要烤30分钟。<,>The sun baked the dry ground.<,>太阳炙烤着干燥的地面。<,>bak(烤)+e→烤制<,>fake(adj.假的)/brake(n.刹车)/lake(n.湖)

mere<,>/mɪə(r)/<,>/mɪr/<,>adj.仅仅的/adj.纯粹的<,>The mere thought of spiders makes her shiver.<,>仅仅想到蜘蛛就让她发抖。<,>He's a mere child, don't be too hard on him.<,>他只是个孩子，别对他太严厉。<,>It's a mere coincidence that we have the same birthday.<,>我们同一天生日纯属巧合。<,>mer(纯粹)+e→纯粹的<,>merge(v.合并)/merit(n.优点)/mirror(n.镜子)

accommodation<,>/əˌkɒməˈdeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/əˌkɑməˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.住处/n.膳宿<,>The university provides accommodation for first-year students.<,>大学为一年级学生提供住宿。<,>We need to find suitable accommodation for our holiday.<,>我们需要为假期找到合适的住处。<,>The hotel offers luxury accommodation with sea views.<,>这家酒店提供带海景的豪华住宿。<,>ac(向)+com(共同)+mod(方式)+ation(名词后缀)→共同居住的方式→住处<,>commodity(n.商品)/commode(n.五斗柜)/accompany(v.陪伴)

evident<,>/ˈevɪd(ə)nt/<,>/ˈɛvɪdənt/<,>adj.明显的/adj.明白的<,>It's evident that she's unhappy with the decision.<,>很明显她对决定不满意。<,>There was evident improvement in his performance.<,>他的表现有明显进步。<,>The damage to the car was evident at first glance.<,>汽车的损坏一眼就能看出来。<,>e(出)+vid(看)+ent(形容词后缀)→能看出来的→明显的<,>evidence(n.证据)/provide(v.提供)/video(n.视频)

suburb<,>/ˈsʌbɜːb/<,>/ˈsʌbɜrb/<,>n.郊区/n.郊外/n.近郊<,>They moved to a quiet suburb to raise their children.<,>他们搬到一个安静的郊区抚养孩子。<,>The crime rate is lower in the suburbs than in the city center.<,>郊区的犯罪率比市中心低。<,>Many people commute from the suburbs to work in the city.<,>很多人从郊区通勤到城市工作。<,>sub(下)+urb(城市)→城市下面的区域→郊区<,>urban(adj.城市的)/subway(n.地铁)/surplus(n.剩余)
lodge<,>/lɒdʒ/<,>/lɑːdʒ/<,>v.暂住/v.借宿/n.乡间小屋/n.旅舍<,>We decided to lodge in a small inn for the night.<,>我们决定在一家小旅馆暂住一晚。<,>The hunting lodge was nestled in the woods.<,>那座狩猎小屋坐落在树林中。<,>He lodged a complaint with the manager.<,>他向经理提出了投诉。<,>log(木头)+dge→木头搭建的小屋→乡间小屋<,>lode(n.矿脉)/ledge(n.壁架)/dodge(v.躲避)

threat<,>/θret/<,>/θrɛt/<,>n.威胁/n.恐吓/n.凶兆/n.征兆<,>The storm posed a serious threat to the coastal town.<,>暴风雨对沿海小镇构成了严重威胁。<,>His words carried an implicit threat.<,>他的话暗含威胁。<,>Global warming is a threat to all mankind.<,>全球变暖是全人类的威胁。<,>th(死)+eat(吃)→死吃→威胁<,>treat(v.对待/n.款待)/thread(n.线/v.穿线)/throat(n.喉咙)

writer<,>/ˈraɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈraɪtər/<,>n.作者/n.作家<,>She is a famous writer of children's books.<,>她是一位著名的儿童文学作家。<,>The writer is working on his new novel.<,>这位作家正在创作他的新小说。<,>Many young writers attended the literary festival.<,>许多年轻作家参加了文学节。<,>write(写)+er(人)→写作的人→作家<,>rider(n.骑手)/waiter(n.服务员)/writhe(v.扭动)

simplify<,>/ˈsɪmplɪfaɪ/<,>/ˈsɪmpləˌfaɪ/<,>vt.简化/vt.使简明<,>The teacher simplified the complex problem for the students.<,>老师为学生简化了这个复杂的问题。<,>We need to simplify the application process.<,>我们需要简化申请流程。<,>The manual has been simplified for beginners.<,>这本手册已为初学者简化。<,>simpl(简单)+ify(使)→使简单→简化<,>sample(n.样品)/simple(adj.简单的)/simply(adv.简单地)

breast<,>/brest/<,>/brɛst/<,>n.乳房/n.胸脯/n.胸膛<,>The baby was feeding at its mother's breast.<,>婴儿正在吃母乳。<,>He clutched the book to his breast.<,>他把书紧紧抱在胸前。<,>Breast cancer is a major health concern for women.<,>乳腺癌是女性主要的健康问题。<,>b(身体)+reast(休息)→身体休息的部位→胸膛<,>beast(n.野兽)/breath(n.呼吸)/breathe(v.呼吸)

invention<,>/ɪnˈvenʃn/<,>/ɪnˈvɛnʃən/<,>n.发明/n.创造/n.捏造<,>The telephone was a revolutionary invention.<,>电话是一项革命性的发明。<,>His story was pure invention.<,>他的故事纯属捏造。<,>Necessity is the mother of invention.<,>需要是发明之母。<,>in(进入)+vent(来)+ion→新东西进来→发明<,>intention(n.意图)/intervention(n.干预)/inventory(n.存货)

mercy<,>/ˈmɜːsi/<,>/ˈmɜrsi/<,>n.仁慈/n.宽容/n.恩惠/n.幸运<,>They showed no mercy to their enemies.<,>他们对敌人毫不留情。<,>It was a mercy that no one was hurt in the accident.<,>幸运的是事故中无人受伤。<,>The judge granted him mercy due to his age.<,>法官因他的年龄而宽恕了他。<,>merc(商业)+y→商业需要仁慈→仁慈<,>merry(adj.愉快的)/merge(v.合并)/merit(n.优点)

annoy<,>/əˈnɔɪ/<,>/əˈnɔɪ/<,>vt.使恼怒/vt.打搅<,>The constant noise began to annoy me.<,>持续的噪音开始让我恼怒。<,>Don't annoy your brother when he's studying.<,>你弟弟学习时别打扰他。<,>Mosquitoes really annoy me in summer.<,>夏天蚊子真让我烦恼。<,>an(一个)+no(不)+y→一个不愉快→使恼怒<,>alloy(n.合金)/enjoy(v.享受)/annul(v.废除)

curl<,>/kɜːl/<,>/kɜrl/<,>n.鬈发/n.卷曲/n.卷曲物<,>Her hair fell in natural curls.<,>她的头发自然卷曲。<,>The cat curled up on the sofa.<,>猫蜷缩在沙发上。<,>Smoke curled upwards from the chimney.<,>烟从烟囱袅袅上升。<,>c(弯曲)+url(旋转)→弯曲旋转→卷曲<,>cure(v.治愈)/curb(n.路缘)/curd(n.凝乳)

inform<,>/ɪnˈfɔːm/<,>/ɪnˈfɔrm/<,>vi.告发/vi.告密/vt.通知/vt.报告<,>Please inform me of any changes.<,>有任何变化请通知我。<,>He informed on his accomplices to the police.<,>他向警方告发了他的同伙。<,>The leaflet informs customers about the new policy.<,>传单向顾客告知新政策。<,>in(进入)+form(形式)→把信息放入形式中→通知<,>perform(v.表演)/reform(v.改革)/conform(v.符合)
psychological<,>/ˌsaɪkəˈlɒdʒɪkəl/<,>/ˌsaɪkəˈlɑːdʒɪkəl/<,>adj.心理的<,>The psychological effects of the accident lasted for years.<,>事故的心理影响持续了多年。<,>She specializes in psychological counseling.<,>她专攻心理咨询。<,>His behavior has a psychological explanation.<,>他的行为有心理学上的解释。<,>psycho(心理)+logical(逻辑的)→心理的<,>physiological(adj.生理的)/psychiatric(adj.精神病的)  

glue<,>/ɡluː/<,>/ɡluː/<,>n.胶，胶水/vt.胶合<,>She used glue to stick the pieces together.<,>她用胶水把这些碎片粘在一起。<,>The model airplane was glued carefully.<,>这个模型飞机被小心地粘合。<,>He glued his eyes to the screen.<,>他目不转睛地盯着屏幕。<,>glue(胶)→发音类似“咕噜”→胶水黏稠的声音<,>clue(n.线索)/blue(adj.蓝色的)  

commit<,>/kəˈmɪt/<,>/kəˈmɪt/<,>vt.犯，干/vt.使承诺/vt.把…托付给/vt.调拨…供使用，拨出<,>He committed a serious mistake.<,>他犯了一个严重的错误。<,>She committed herself to the project.<,>她承诺参与这个项目。<,>Funds were committed to the new research.<,>资金被拨给了这项新研究。<,>com(共同)+mit(送)→共同送出一承诺<,>omit(vt.省略)/submit(vt.提交)  

scream<,>/skriːm/<,>/skriːm/<,>vi.尖叫，呼啸/n.尖叫声<,>The child screamed in fear.<,>孩子害怕得尖叫起来。<,>A loud scream echoed in the hallway.<,>一声尖叫在走廊里回荡。<,>The wind screamed through the trees.<,>风呼啸着穿过树林。<,>scr(刮擦声)+eam→模拟尖叫声<,>stream(n.溪流)/cream(n.奶油)  

sorrow<,>/ˈsɒrəʊ/<,>/ˈsɑːroʊ/<,>n.悲痛，悲哀，悲伤/n.伤心事，不幸的事<,>She felt deep sorrow at the loss.<,>她对这次损失感到深深的悲痛。<,>His face was full of sorrow.<,>他满脸悲伤。<,>The war brought great sorrow to the nation.<,>战争给这个国家带来了巨大的不幸。<,>sor(痛苦)+row(排)→排解不掉的痛苦→悲伤<,>borrow(vt.借)/sorrowful(adj.悲伤的)  

crash<,>/kræʃ/<,>/kræʃ/<,>vi.发出撞击声/vi.垮台，破产/vi.冲，闯/vt.碰撞/vt.坠落/n.碰撞/n.破裂声<,>The dishes crashed to the floor.<,>盘子哗啦一声摔在地上。<,>The stock market crashed yesterday.<,>股市昨天崩盘了。<,>We heard a loud crash outside.<,>我们听到外面一声巨响。<,>cr(破裂声)+ash(灰烬)→撞击后化为灰烬<,>crush(vt.压碎)/clash(vi.冲突)  

patch<,>/pætʃ/<,>/pætʃ/<,>n.补丁/n.斑，与周围不同的部分/n.一小块地/vt.补，修补<,>She sewed a patch on the torn jeans.<,>她在破牛仔裤上缝了块补丁。<,>There was a patch of blue in the cloudy sky.<,>多云的天空中有一小块蓝天。<,>He patched up the old roof.<,>他修补了旧屋顶。<,>pat(轻拍)+ch→轻拍补丁固定<,>batch(n.一批)/hatch(vt.孵化)  

observer<,>/əbˈzɜːvə(r)/<,>/əbˈzɜːrvər/<,>n.观察员，观察者<,>The UN sent observers to monitor the election.<,>联合国派遣观察员监督选举。<,>As an observer, he took detailed notes.<,>作为观察者，他做了详细记录。<,>The birdwatcher was a keen observer.<,>这位观鸟者是个敏锐的观察员。<,>ob(加强)+serve(服务)+er(人)→提供服务的人→观察员<,>preserver(n.保护者)/reserver(n.保留者)  

character<,>/ˈkærəktə(r)/<,>/ˈkærɪktər/<,>n.性格，特性/n.性质/n.人物，角色/n.符号/n.字<,>Her cheerful character makes her popular.<,>她开朗的性格使她受欢迎。<,>He played the main character in the movie.<,>他在电影中扮演主角。<,>Chinese characters are difficult to learn.<,>汉字很难学。<,>char(炭)+acter(行动者)→用炭写下的人物特性<,>charter(n.宪章)/caricature(n.漫画)  

reflect<,>/rɪˈflekt/<,>/rɪˈflekt/<,>v.反映，显示/v.反射，映现/v.深思，考虑，反省<,>The lake reflected the mountains.<,>湖面映现出群山。<,>His actions reflect his values.<,>他的行为反映了他的价值观。<,>She reflected on her past mistakes.<,>她反省过去的错误。<,>re(回)+flect(弯曲)→光线弯曲返回→反射<,>deflect(vt.使偏斜)/inflect(vt.使弯曲)
procession<,>/prəˈseʃn/<,>/prəˈsɛʃən/<,>n.队伍/n.行列<,>The wedding procession moved slowly down the aisle.<,>婚礼队伍沿着过道缓缓行进。<,>A long procession of cars followed the hearse.<,>一长列汽车跟在灵车后面。<,>The religious procession wound through the streets of the old town.<,>宗教游行队伍蜿蜒穿过老城的街道。<,>pro(向前)+cess(走)+ion→向前走的队伍<,>profession(n.职业)/concession(n.让步)/precession(n.先行)

contribution<,>/ˌkɒntrɪˈbjuːʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːntrɪˈbjuːʃən/<,>n.贡献/n.促成作用/n.捐款/n.捐献物/n.稿件<,>His contribution to the project was invaluable.<,>他对该项目的贡献是无价的。<,>She made a generous contribution to the charity.<,>她向慈善机构慷慨捐款。<,>The editor rejected his contribution to the magazine.<,>编辑拒绝了他投给杂志的稿件。<,>con(共同)+tribut(给予)+ion→共同给予→贡献<,>distribution(n.分配)/attribution(n.归属)/retribution(n.报应)

Marxist<,>/ˈmɑːksɪst/<,>/ˈmɑːrksɪst/<,>adj.马克思主义的/n.马克思主义者<,>He adopted a Marxist approach to analyzing history.<,>他采用马克思主义的方法分析历史。<,>The university has a strong Marxist tradition.<,>这所大学有深厚的马克思主义传统。<,>Many young intellectuals became Marxists during that period.<,>许多年轻知识分子在那个时期成为了马克思主义者。<,>Marx(马克思)+ist(主义者)→马克思主义者<,>artist(n.艺术家)/specialist(n.专家)/capitalist(n.资本家)

bang<,>/bæŋ/<,>/bæŋ/<,>vi.猛击/vi.猛撞/vi.发出砰的一声/n.巨响/n.枪声/n.猛击/vt.猛击/vt.猛撞/vt.砰地敲<,>The door banged shut in the wind.<,>门在风中砰地关上了。<,>He banged his fist on the table angrily.<,>他生气地用拳头猛击桌子。<,>We heard a loud bang from the construction site.<,>我们听到建筑工地传来一声巨响。<,>拟声词，模拟撞击声<,>hang(v.悬挂)/fang(n.尖牙)/gang(n.帮派)

brow<,>/braʊ/<,>/braʊ/<,>n.额/n.眉/n.眉毛<,>She wiped the sweat from her brow.<,>她擦去额头上的汗水。<,>His brows furrowed in concentration.<,>他皱着眉头全神贯注。<,>The artist carefully painted the model's arched brows.<,>艺术家仔细地描绘着模特弯弯的眉毛。<,>brow与eyebrow(眉毛)相关<,>blow(v.吹)/brown(adj.棕色的)/bow(n.弓)

meaning<,>/ˈmiːnɪŋ/<,>/ˈminɪŋ/<,>n.意义/n.意思/n.目的/n.重要性<,>What's the meaning of this word?<,>这个词是什么意思？<,>He questioned the meaning of life.<,>他质疑生命的意义。<,>This discovery has great meaning for science.<,>这一发现对科学有重大意义。<,>mean(意味)+ing→意义<,>meeting(n.会议)/mending(n.修补)/morning(n.早晨)

ignorant<,>/ˈɪɡnərənt/<,>/ˈɪɡnərənt/<,>adj.不知道的/adj.无知的<,>He was ignorant of the basic facts.<,>他对基本事实一无所知。<,>It's better to ask than to remain ignorant.<,>与其无知，不如发问。<,>Her ignorant comments embarrassed everyone.<,>她无知的评论让所有人都很尴尬。<,>i(不)+gnor(知道)+ant→不知道的<,>arrogant(adj.傲慢的)/tolerant(adj.宽容的)/vigorant(adj.精力充沛的)

magnetic<,>/mæɡˈnetɪk/<,>/mæɡˈnɛtɪk/<,>adj.磁的/adj.有吸引力的<,>The compass needle is magnetic.<,>指南针的针是有磁性的。<,>She has a magnetic personality.<,>她具有吸引人的个性。<,>The magnetic field protects Earth from solar radiation.<,>磁场保护地球免受太阳辐射。<,>magnet(磁铁)+ic→磁的<,>magic(n.魔术)/magnific(adj.宏伟的)/manic(adj.狂躁的)

band<,>/bænd/<,>/bænd/<,>n.乐队/n.群/n.伙/n.带/n.条纹/n.波段/vt.用带绑扎<,>The rock band performed last night.<,>昨晚摇滚乐队进行了表演。<,>She wore a gold band on her wrist.<,>她手腕上戴着一条金带。<,>They banded together to protest.<,>他们联合起来抗议。<,>与bind(绑)同源<,>bend(v.弯曲)/bond(n.纽带)/brand(n.品牌)

orbit<,>/ˈɔːbɪt/<,>/ˈɔːrbɪt/<,>n.轨道/vt.做轨道运行<,>The satellite was launched into orbit.<,>卫星被发射进入轨道。<,>Earth orbits the Sun once a year.<,>地球每年绕太阳运行一周。<,>The space station maintains a stable orbit.<,>空间站保持稳定的轨道。<,>orb(圆)+it→圆形路线→轨道<,>exhibit(v.展览)/inhabit(v.居住)/prohibit(v.禁止)
comprise<,>/kəmˈpraɪz/<,>/kəmˈpraɪz/<,>vt.包含/vt.包括/vt.构成<,>The committee comprises representatives from all departments.<,>委员会由各部门的代表组成。<,>The book comprises ten chapters.<,>这本书包含十个章节。<,>The team is comprised of experts in various fields.<,>团队由各领域的专家组成。<,>com(共同)+prise(抓住)→共同抓住→包含<,>compromise(n.妥协/v.妥协)/comprehend(v.理解)/composite(adj.复合的/n.合成物)  

moderate<,>/ˈmɒdərət/<,>/ˈmɑːdərət/<,>adj.中等的/adj.温和的/adj.稳健的/adj.有节制的/v.和缓/v.减轻/v.节制<,>He holds moderate political views.<,>他持温和的政治观点。<,>She moderated her tone when speaking to the children.<,>她对孩子们说话时缓和了语气。<,>Exercise in moderation is beneficial to health.<,>适度运动有益健康。<,>mod(方式)+erate→有节制的方式→适度的<,>modest(adj.谦虚的)/modern(adj.现代的)/modify(v.修改)  

resident<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>/ˈrezɪdənt/<,>adj.居住的/adj.定居的/adj.住校的/adj.住院的/n.居民/n.定居者/n.住院医生<,>She is a resident of New York.<,>她是纽约的居民。<,>The resident doctor is on duty tonight.<,>今晚住院医生值班。<,>This hotel has resident staff available 24/7.<,>这家酒店有全天候驻店员工。<,>re(反复)+sid(坐)+ent→反复坐在某地的人→居民<,>president(n.总统)/residence(n.住所)/residual(adj.残余的)  

spray<,>/spreɪ/<,>/spreɪ/<,>v.喷/v.溅散/n.浪花/n.水花/n.喷雾<,>He sprayed water on the plants.<,>他给植物喷水。<,>The ocean spray felt refreshing.<,>海水的浪花让人神清气爽。<,>She used a spray to clean the window.<,>她用喷雾清洁窗户。<,>spr(散开)+ay→散开的水→喷雾<,>spree(n.狂欢)/sprawl(v.蔓延)/sprayer(n.喷雾器)  

distinguish<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ/<,>vt.区别/vt.辨别/vt.识别/vt.使显出特色/vt.使杰出<,>It's hard to distinguish the twins apart.<,>很难区分这对双胞胎。<,>He distinguished himself in the field of science.<,>他在科学领域表现杰出。<,>Can you distinguish between these two colors?<,>你能区分这两种颜色吗？<,>dis(分开)+sting(刺)+uish→用刺分开→区分<,>extinguish(v.熄灭)/distinct(adj.不同的)/distress(n.痛苦)  

receiver<,>/rɪˈsiːvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈsiːvər/<,>n.听筒/n.接收器<,>She put the receiver down angrily.<,>她生气地放下听筒。<,>The satellite receiver needs adjustment.<,>卫星接收器需要调整。<,>He answered the phone but the receiver was faulty.<,>他接了电话但听筒有问题。<,>re(回)+ceive(拿)+er→拿回东西的人或物→接收器<,>receipt(n.收据)/reception(n.接待)/conceiver(n.构想者)  

outer<,>/ˈaʊtə(r)/<,>/ˈaʊtər/<,>adj.外面的/adj.外层的<,>The outer layer of the skin protects us.<,>皮肤的外层保护着我们。<,>They explored the outer regions of the country.<,>他们探索了国家的外围地区。<,>The package was wrapped in outer plastic.<,>包裹用外层塑料包装着。<,>out(外)+er→外面的<,>utter(v.说出/adj.完全的)/inner(adj.内部的)/other(adj.其他的)  

invent<,>/ɪnˈvent/<,>/ɪnˈvent/<,>vt.发明/vt.创造/vt.捏造<,>Edison invented the light bulb.<,>爱迪生发明了电灯泡。<,>He invented an excuse for being late.<,>他为迟到编造了一个借口。<,>They invented a new game for children.<,>他们为孩子们发明了一个新游戏。<,>in(进入)+vent(来)→来到新事物→发明<,>inventory(n.库存)/advent(n.出现)/prevent(v.防止)  

fluent<,>/ˈfluːənt/<,>/ˈfluːənt/<,>adj.流利的/adj.流畅的<,>She is fluent in three languages.<,>她能流利地说三种语言。<,>His speech was fluent and persuasive.<,>他的演讲流畅且有说服力。<,>The dancer's movements were fluent.<,>舞者的动作很流畅。<,>flu(流)+ent→流动的→流利的<,>influent(adj.流入的)/affluent(adj.富裕的)/fluency(n.流利)  

shortcoming<,>/ˈʃɔːtkʌmɪŋ/<,>/ˈʃɔːrtkʌmɪŋ/<,>n.短处/n.缺点<,>Punctuality is not his only shortcoming.<,>不守时不是他唯一的缺点。<,>The report points out the system's shortcomings.<,>报告指出了系统的缺点。<,>We all have our shortcomings.<,>我们都有自己的缺点。<,>short(短)+coming(来)→来得不够→缺点<,>shortcut(n.捷径)/shortage(n.短缺)/shortlist(n.入围名单)
substantial<,>/səbˈstænʃl/<,>/səbˈstænʃl/<,>adj.可观的/adj.大量的/adj.结实的/adj.坚固的/adj.实质的/adj.真实的<,>She received a substantial amount of money from her inheritance.<,>她从遗产中获得了可观的一笔钱。<,>The table is made of substantial wood and can last for years.<,>这张桌子由结实的木材制成，可以使用多年。<,>There is substantial evidence to support his claim.<,>有实质性的证据支持他的主张。<,>sub(在...下)+stant(站立)+ial→站在下面支撑→结实的<,>essential(adj.必要的)/superficial(adj.表面的)  

execute<,>/ˈeksɪkjuːt/<,>/ˈɛksɪˌkjuːt/<,>vt.将...处死/vt.实施/vt.执行<,>The criminal was executed for his crimes.<,>这名罪犯因其罪行被处决。<,>The company plans to execute a new marketing strategy next month.<,>公司计划下个月实施新的营销策略。<,>He executed the plan perfectly without any mistakes.<,>他完美地执行了计划，没有任何错误。<,>ex(出)+ecute(跟随)→跟随命令出去执行→执行<,>prosecute(vt.起诉)/persecute(vt.迫害)  

benefit<,>/ˈbenɪfɪt/<,>/ˈbɛnəfɪt/<,>v.有益于/v.得益/n.利益/n.恩惠/n.救济金/n.保险金/n.津贴<,>Regular exercise benefits your health.<,>定期锻炼有益于你的健康。<,>She receives unemployment benefits after losing her job.<,>她失业后领取失业救济金。<,>Both parties will benefit from this agreement.<,>双方都将从这项协议中受益。<,>bene(好)+fit(做)→做好事→有益于<,>profit(n.利润)/bonus(n.奖金)  

flood<,>/flʌd/<,>/flʌd/<,>v.淹没/v.涌入/n.洪水/n.大量<,>The river flooded after heavy rains.<,>大雨过后河水泛滥了。<,>The market was flooded with cheap imports.<,>市场上充斥着廉价的进口商品。<,>Memories of the past came flooding back.<,>过去的记忆如潮水般涌来。<,>f(谐音"覆")+lood(谐音"陆地")→覆盖陆地→洪水<,>blood(n.血液)/float(v.漂浮)  

vitamin<,>/ˈvɪtəmɪn/<,>/ˈvaɪtəmɪn/<,>n.维生素<,>Oranges are rich in vitamin C.<,>橙子富含维生素C。<,>She takes vitamin supplements every morning.<,>她每天早上服用维生素补充剂。<,>A lack of vitamin D can cause health problems.<,>缺乏维生素D会导致健康问题。<,>vita(生命)+min(小)→维持生命的小物质→维生素<,>mineral(n.矿物质)/protein(n.蛋白质)  

intention<,>/ɪnˈtenʃn/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnʃən/<,>n.意图/n.意向/n.目的<,>She had no intention of hurting his feelings.<,>她无意伤害他的感情。<,>His intention was to help, not to interfere.<,>他的目的是帮助，而不是干涉。<,>What are your intentions regarding this project?<,>你对这个项目有什么打算？<,>in(进入)+tent(伸展)+ion→心里伸展的想法→意图<,>attention(n.注意力)/extension(n.延伸)  

rude<,>/ruːd/<,>/rud/<,>adj.粗鲁的/adj.不礼貌的/adj.粗糙的/adj.粗陋的<,>It's rude to interrupt people when they're speaking.<,>打断别人说话是不礼貌的。<,>He made a rude remark about her appearance.<,>他对她的外表说了粗鲁的话。<,>The cabin was furnished with rude wooden furniture.<,>小屋里摆放着粗糙的木制家具。<,>rude(谐音"鲁的")→鲁莽的→粗鲁的<,>crude(adj.粗糙的)/brute(n.野蛮人)  

symptom<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>/ˈsɪmptəm/<,>n.症状/n.征候/n.征兆<,>Fever is a common symptom of the flu.<,>发烧是流感的常见症状。<,>These problems are symptoms of a deeper issue.<,>这些问题是一个更深层次问题的征兆。<,>She showed no symptoms of illness before collapsing.<,>她在晕倒前没有任何生病症状。<,>sym(一起)+ptom(落下)→一起落下的现象→症状<,>symbol(n.符号)/syndrome(n.综合征)  

pillar<,>/ˈpɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈpɪlər/<,>n.柱/n.柱子/n.栋梁<,>The roof is supported by massive stone pillars.<,>屋顶由巨大的石柱支撑。<,>He is considered a pillar of the community.<,>他被认为是社区的栋梁。<,>The old temple had beautifully carved pillars.<,>这座古庙有雕刻精美的柱子。<,>pill(柱子)+ar→柱子<,>collar(n.衣领)/dollar(n.美元)  

thereby<,>/ˌðeəˈbaɪ/<,>/ˌðɛrˈbaɪ/<,>adv.因此/adv.从而/adv.由此<,>He saved money, thereby enabling himself to buy a car.<,>他存了钱，因此能够买一辆车。<,>She improved her English, thereby increasing her job opportunities.<,>她提高了英语水平，从而增加了就业机会。<,>The company reduced costs, thereby increasing profits.<,>公司降低了成本，由此增加了利润。<,>there(那里)+by(通过)→通过那个方式→因此<,>therefore(adv.因此)/thereafter(adv.其后)
unique<,>/juːˈniːk/<,>/juˈnik/<,>adj.唯一的/adj.独一无二的/adj.极不寻常的/adj.极好的<,>Her style is unique and easily recognizable.<,>她的风格独特，很容易辨认。<,>This is a unique opportunity to travel abroad.<,>这是一个难得的出国旅行的机会。<,>He has a unique talent for playing the piano.<,>他在钢琴演奏方面有独特的天赋。<,>uni(单一)+que(形容词后缀)→唯一的<,>unite(v.联合)/uniform(adj.统一的)/universe(n.宇宙)  

funeral<,>/ˈfjuːnərəl/<,>/ˈfjunərəl/<,>n.葬礼/n.丧礼/n.丧葬<,>They attended the funeral of their beloved teacher.<,>他们参加了敬爱的老师的葬礼。<,>The funeral was held in the local church.<,>葬礼在当地教堂举行。<,>She wore black to the funeral as a sign of respect.<,>她穿着黑色衣服参加葬礼以示尊重。<,>fun(死亡)+eral(名词后缀)→葬礼<,>fun(n.乐趣)/funny(adj.有趣的)/funereal(adj.阴森的)  

boost<,>/buːst/<,>/bust/<,>vt.提高/vt.使增长/vt.推动/vt.激励/vt.替…做广告/vt.宣扬/n.提高/n.增长/n.推动/n.激励<,>The new policy will boost the economy.<,>新政策将促进经济增长。<,>She gave me a boost when I was feeling down.<,>在我情绪低落时，她给了我鼓励。<,>They launched a campaign to boost sales.<,>他们发起了一场促销活动。<,>boo(拟声词，表示力量)+st(站立)→使站起来→推动<,>boast(v.自夸)/boot(n.靴子)/boosted(adj.增强的)  

fireman<,>/ˈfaɪəmən/<,>/ˈfaɪrmən/<,>n.消防队员/n.司炉工<,>The fireman rescued the child from the burning building.<,>消防员从燃烧的建筑物中救出了孩子。<,>He has been a fireman for ten years.<,>他当消防员已经十年了。<,>The fireman checked the furnace in the basement.<,>司炉工检查了地下室的锅炉。<,>fire(火)+man(人)→与火打交道的人→消防员<,>firework(n.烟花)/fireplace(n.壁炉)/firefighter(n.消防员)  

sincere<,>/sɪnˈsɪə(r)/<,>/sɪnˈsɪr/<,>adj.真诚的/adj.诚挚的<,>I appreciate your sincere apology.<,>我感谢你真诚的道歉。<,>She has a sincere desire to help others.<,>她真心想帮助他人。<,>His smile was warm and sincere.<,>他的笑容温暖而真诚。<,>sin(单一)+cere(生长)→纯粹生长的→真诚的<,>since(conj.自从)/sincerely(adv.真诚地)/sinecure(n.闲职)  

male<,>/meɪl/<,>/meɪl/<,>adj.男的/adj.雄的/n.男子/n.雄性动物<,>The male lion has a large mane.<,>雄狮有浓密的鬃毛。<,>There are more female students than male students in this class.<,>这个班级女生比男生多。<,>He is the only male employee in the department.<,>他是部门里唯一的男性员工。<,>mal(坏)+e(后缀)→原指"坏的"，后转义为"男性"<,>mail(n.邮件)/mall(n.商场)/mallet(n.木槌)  

ministry<,>/ˈmɪnɪstri/<,>/ˈmɪnɪstri/<,>n.部<,>He works at the Ministry of Education.<,>他在教育部工作。<,>The ministry issued a new policy yesterday.<,>该部昨天发布了一项新政策。<,>She hopes to join the foreign ministry after graduation.<,>她希望毕业后能进入外交部工作。<,>mini(小)+stry(名词后缀)→原指"小部门"，现泛指"部"<,>minister(n.部长)/administer(v.管理)/minimal(adj.最小的)  

religious<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒəs/<,>/rɪˈlɪdʒəs/<,>adj.宗教的/adj.笃信宗教的/adj.虔诚的<,>They have strong religious beliefs.<,>他们有强烈的宗教信仰。<,>The festival has both cultural and religious significance.<,>这个节日具有文化和宗教双重意义。<,>She is very religious and goes to church every Sunday.<,>她很虔诚，每周日都去教堂。<,>re(再)+lig(捆绑)+ious(形容词后缀)→与神再次捆绑的→宗教的<,>religion(n.宗教)/irreligious(adj.无宗教信仰的)/relic(n.遗物)  

nevertheless<,>/ˌnevəðəˈles/<,>/ˌnɛvərðəˈlɛs/<,>adv.仍然/adv.然而<,>It was raining hard; nevertheless, we went out.<,>雨下得很大，但我们还是出去了。<,>He is very busy; nevertheless, he always finds time for his family.<,>他很忙，但总能抽出时间陪家人。<,>The plan has some risks; nevertheless, it's worth trying.<,>这个计划有些风险，但仍然值得一试。<,>never(从不)+the+less(更少)→从不更少→仍然<,>nonetheless(adv.尽管如此)/notwithstanding(prep.尽管)/however(adv.然而)  

prominent<,>/ˈprɒmɪnənt/<,>/ˈprɑmɪnənt/<,>adj.突出的/adj.杰出的/adj.突起的/adj.凸出的<,>He is a prominent scientist in his field.<,>他是该领域杰出的科学家。<,>The house is in a prominent position on the hill.<,>房子位于山上显眼的位置。<,>She has prominent cheekbones.<,>她有突出的颧骨。<,>pro(向前)+min(突出)+ent(形容词后缀)→向前突出的→杰出的<,>prominence(n.突出)/imminent(adj.迫近的)/eminent(adj.著名的)
shelter<,>/ˈʃeltə(r)/<,>/ˈʃɛltɚ/<,>n.掩蔽处/n.躲避处/n.住所/n.掩蔽/n.保护/vt.掩蔽/vt.庇护/vt.躲避<,>They sought shelter from the rain under a tree.<,>他们在树下避雨。<,>The homeless shelter provides food and beds.<,>这家收容所为无家可归者提供食物和床位。<,>We must shelter the refugees from the war.<,>我们必须庇护这些战争难民。<,>shell(壳)+ter→像壳一样保护→庇护所<,>shield(n.盾牌/vt.保护)/shelve(v.搁置)/shepherd(n.牧羊人)

outset<,>/ˈaʊtset/<,>/ˈaʊtˌsɛt/<,>n.开始/n.开端<,>From the outset, it was clear he would win.<,>从一开始就很明显他会赢。<,>At the outset of his career, he faced many challenges.<,>在他职业生涯初期，他面临许多挑战。<,>Let me state my position at the outset.<,>让我一开始就表明我的立场。<,>out(出)+set(设置)→设置出来→开端<,>onset(n.开始)/upset(vt.打翻 adj.心烦的)/offset(vt.抵消)

jewel<,>/ˈdʒuːəl/<,>/ˈdʒuəl/<,>n.宝石/n.宝石饰物<,>Her ring was set with a precious jewel.<,>她的戒指镶着一颗珍贵的宝石。<,>The crown was studded with jewels.<,>王冠上镶满了宝石。<,>He gave her a jewel box for her birthday.<,>他送给她一个珠宝盒作为生日礼物。<,>jew(犹太人)+el→犹太人擅长珠宝交易→宝石<,>jewelry(n.珠宝总称)/jeweled(adj.镶宝石的)/jew(n.犹太人)

scan<,>/skæn/<,>/skæn/<,>vt.细看/vt.审视/vt.扫描/vt.浏览/n.扫描<,>She scanned the newspaper for job ads.<,>她浏览报纸寻找招聘广告。<,>The doctor performed a brain scan.<,>医生做了脑部扫描。<,>He scanned the horizon for any sign of ships.<,>他仔细查看地平线寻找船只的踪迹。<,>s(看作see)+can(能)→能看到→扫描<,>scam(n.骗局)/span(n.跨度)/scant(adj.不足的)

association<,>/əˌsəʊsiˈeɪʃn/<,>/əˌsoʊsiˈeɪʃən/<,>n.协会/n.团体/n.联合/n.交往<,>He is a member of the local business association.<,>他是当地商业协会的成员。<,>The smell has strong associations with my childhood.<,>这种气味让我强烈联想到童年。<,>They formed an association to protect the environment.<,>他们成立了一个保护环境的协会。<,>as(加强)+soci(同伴)+ation→结伴→协会<,>associate(vt.联想)/dissociate(vt.分离)/society(n.社会)

fundamental<,>/ˌfʌndəˈmentl/<,>/ˌfʌndəˈmɛntl/<,>adj.基础的/adj.基本的/n.基本原则<,>Respect is fundamental to any relationship.<,>尊重是任何关系的基础。<,>She lacks a fundamental understanding of math.<,>她对数学缺乏基本的理解。<,>The book explains the fundamentals of economics.<,>这本书解释了经济学的基本原理。<,>fund(基础)+a+ment(名词后缀)+al→基础的<,>foundation(n.基础)/fund(n.资金)/elemental(adj.基本的)

eliminate<,>/ɪˈlɪmɪneɪt/<,>/ɪˈlɪməˌneɪt/<,>vt.消灭/vt.消除/vt.排除/vt.淘汰<,>The team was eliminated in the first round.<,>该队在第一轮就被淘汰了。<,>We must eliminate all possible errors.<,>我们必须消除所有可能的错误。<,>The vaccine helps eliminate the disease.<,>疫苗有助于消灭这种疾病。<,>e(出)+limin(门槛)+ate→赶出门槛→消除<,>illuminate(vt.阐明)/alleviate(vt.减轻)/dominate(vt.支配)

global<,>/ˈɡləʊbl/<,>/ˈɡloʊbəl/<,>adj.全球的/adj.全世界的/adj.总的/adj.完整的<,>Climate change is a global problem.<,>气候变化是一个全球性问题。<,>The company has a global presence.<,>这家公司在全球都有业务。<,>We need to take a global view of the situation.<,>我们需要全面看待这一局势。<,>globe(地球)+al→全球的<,>globe(n.地球)/local(adj.地方的)/glow(v.发光)

entitle<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>/ɪnˈtaɪtl/<,>vt.给...权利/vt.给题名<,>This ticket entitles you to a free drink.<,>这张票使你有权获得一杯免费饮料。<,>The book is entitled "War and Peace".<,>这本书名为《战争与和平》。<,>Employees are entitled to paid vacation.<,>员工享有带薪休假的权利。<,>en(使)+title(标题)→给标题→命名<,>enable(vt.使能够)/enlist(vt.征募)/title(n.标题)

outline<,>/ˈaʊtlaɪn/<,>/ˈaʊtˌlaɪn/<,>n.提纲/n.要点/n.外形/n.略图/vt.概述/vt.描...外形<,>First, let me outline my main points.<,>首先，让我概述一下我的要点。<,>The mountains were outlined against the sky.<,>群山在天空的映衬下显出轮廓。<,>She drew the outline of a house.<,>她画了一栋房子的轮廓。<,>out(外)+line(线)→外部的线条→轮廓<,>underline(vt.强调)/headline(n.标题)/timeline(n.时间轴)
fade<,>/feɪd/<,>/feɪd/<,>vi.褪色/vi.逐渐消失/vi.凋谢/vt.使褪色<,>The colors of the painting will fade over time.<,>这幅画的颜色会随着时间的推移而褪色。<,>Her smile faded as she heard the bad news.<,>听到坏消息时，她的笑容逐渐消失了。<,>The flowers in the garden are starting to fade.<,>花园里的花开始凋谢了。<,>联想：fade与face(脸)相似，脸褪色→褪色<,>fade(v.褪色)/face(n.脸)/fame(n.名声)

unless<,>/ʌnˈles/<,>/ʌnˈles/<,>conj.除非/conj.如果不<,>You won't succeed unless you work hard.<,>除非你努力工作，否则你不会成功。<,>Unless it rains, we'll go for a picnic tomorrow.<,>如果不下雨，我们明天就去野餐。<,>I won't go unless you come with me.<,>除非你和我一起去，否则我不会去。<,>un(不)+less(更少)→除非<,>until(conj.直到)/unless(conj.除非)/unlike(prep.不像)

butterfly<,>/ˈbʌtəflaɪ/<,>/ˈbʌtərflaɪ/<,>n.蝴蝶<,>The butterfly landed gently on the flower.<,>蝴蝶轻轻地落在花上。<,>She has a collection of butterfly specimens.<,>她有一组蝴蝶标本。<,>Children love chasing butterflies in the garden.<,>孩子们喜欢在花园里追逐蝴蝶。<,>butter(黄油)+fly(飞)→蝴蝶<,>butterfly(n.蝴蝶)/dragonfly(n.蜻蜓)/firefly(n.萤火虫)

excess<,>/ɪkˈses/<,>/ˈɛkˌsɛs/<,>adj.过量的/adj.额外的/n.超越/n.过量/n.过度<,>He was charged for excess baggage at the airport.<,>他在机场因行李超重被收费。<,>Drinking alcohol in excess can harm your health.<,>过量饮酒会损害你的健康。<,>The company made profits in excess of one million dollars.<,>公司的利润超过了一百万美元。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)→走出界限→过量<,>access(n.入口)/excess(n.过量)/success(n.成功)

glance<,>/ɡlɑːns/<,>/ɡlæns/<,>vi.看一下/n.一瞥/vt.用扫视/vt.反射<,>She glanced at her watch and realized she was late.<,>她瞥了一眼手表，意识到自己迟到了。<,>He gave me a quick glance before turning away.<,>他快速瞥了我一眼，然后转身走开。<,>The sunlight glanced off the surface of the lake.<,>阳光从湖面上反射出来。<,>gl(光)+ance→光的一瞥→一瞥<,>glance(v.瞥见)/glare(v.怒视)/glimpse(n.一瞥)

perspective<,>/pəˈspektɪv/<,>/pərˈspektɪv/<,>n.视角/n.观点/n.远景/n.景观/n.透视画法/n.透视图<,>From my perspective, the decision was unfair.<,>从我的角度来看，这个决定是不公平的。<,>The painting shows a perfect perspective of the city.<,>这幅画展示了城市的完美透视图。<,>We need to consider this issue from a global perspective.<,>我们需要从全球的角度来考虑这个问题。<,>per(通过)+spect(看)+ive→通过看→视角<,>prospective(adj.预期的)/perspective(n.视角)/respective(adj.各自的)

relationship<,>/rɪˈleɪʃnʃɪp/<,>/rɪˈleɪʃənˌʃɪp/<,>n.关系/n.关联<,>They have a close relationship with their neighbors.<,>他们与邻居关系密切。<,>The relationship between diet and health is well-known.<,>饮食与健康之间的关系是众所周知的。<,>She ended her relationship with him last month.<,>她上个月结束了与他的关系。<,>relate(关联)+tion(名词后缀)+ship(状态)→关系<,>relation(n.关系)/relationship(n.关系)/relative(n.亲戚)

equality<,>/iˈkwɒləti/<,>/iˈkwɑːləti/<,>n.等同/n.平等/n.相等<,>We should strive for gender equality in the workplace.<,>我们应该努力实现工作场所的性别平等。<,>The law guarantees equality for all citizens.<,>法律保障所有公民的平等。<,>There is no equality in their treatment of employees.<,>他们对员工的待遇不平等。<,>equal(平等的)+ity(名词后缀)→平等<,>equality(n.平等)/equity(n.公平)/equation(n.等式)

destruction<,>/dɪˈstrʌkʃn/<,>/dɪˈstrʌkʃən/<,>n.破坏/n.毁灭/n.消灭<,>The hurricane caused widespread destruction in the city.<,>飓风在城市中造成了广泛的破坏。<,>War brings nothing but death and destruction.<,>战争带来的只有死亡和毁灭。<,>The destruction of the rainforest is a global concern.<,>热带雨林的破坏是一个全球性的问题。<,>de(向下)+struct(建造)+ion→向下建造→破坏<,>construction(n.建设)/destruction(n.破坏)/instruction(n.指导)

dictation<,>/dɪkˈteɪʃn/<,>/dɪkˈteɪʃən/<,>n.口授/n.听写<,>The teacher gave us a French dictation exercise.<,>老师给我们做了一个法语听写练习。<,>He took dictation from his boss for the letter.<,>他根据老板的口授写了这封信。<,>Dictation is a good way to improve listening skills.<,>听写是提高听力技能的好方法。<,>dict(说)+ation(名词后缀)→口授<,>diction(n.措辞)/dictation(n.听写)/dictator(n.独裁者)
stiff<,>/stɪf/<,>/stɪf/<,>adv.极其/adv.非常/adv.僵硬地/adj.硬的/adj.僵直的/adj.不灵活的/adj.拘谨的/adj.生硬的/adj.费劲的/adj.强烈的<,>He stood stiff as a board after the long meeting.<,>长时间会议后他站得笔直僵硬。<,>She gave a stiff smile to the stranger.<,>她对陌生人露出生硬的微笑。<,>The competition was stiff this year.<,>今年的竞争非常激烈。<,>联想：still（静止的）+ f（仿佛冻住）→僵硬的<,>staff(n.员工)/stuff(n.材料)/stifle(v.窒息)  

expression<,>/ɪkˈspreʃn/<,>/ɪkˈspreʃən/<,>n.词语/n.表达/n.表情<,>Her facial expression showed great surprise.<,>她的面部表情显得非常惊讶。<,>This idiom is an old English expression.<,>这个习语是古老的英语表达。<,>Freedom of expression is a basic human right.<,>言论自由是基本人权。<,>ex(出)+press(压)+ion→把思想压出来→表达<,>impression(n.印象)/depression(n.沮丧)/repression(n.压制)  

invade<,>/ɪnˈveɪd/<,>/ɪnˈveɪd/<,>vt.入侵/vt.侵略/vt.侵袭<,>The army decided to invade at dawn.<,>军队决定在黎明时分入侵。<,>Tourists invaded the small coastal town.<,>游客涌入了这个海滨小镇。<,>Weeds invaded the garden quickly.<,>杂草迅速侵占了花园。<,>in(进入)+vade(走)→走进来→入侵<,>evade(v.逃避)/pervade(v.弥漫)/invader(n.侵略者)  

reaction<,>/riˈækʃn/<,>/riˈækʃən/<,>n.反应/n.反作用<,>Her reaction to the news was unexpected.<,>她对这消息的反应出人意料。<,>Chemical reactions produce new substances.<,>化学反应会产生新物质。<,>What was his reaction when he saw the result?<,>他看到结果时有什么反应？<,>re(回)+act(行动)+ion→反向行动→反应<,>action(n.行动)/interaction(n.互动)/overreaction(n.过度反应)  

childhood<,>/ˈtʃaɪldhʊd/<,>/ˈtʃaɪldhʊd/<,>n.童年/n.幼年/n.早期<,>She had a happy childhood in the countryside.<,>她在乡下度过了快乐的童年。<,>Childhood memories often stay with us forever.<,>童年记忆常常伴随我们一生。<,>Early childhood education is very important.<,>幼儿早期教育非常重要。<,>child(孩子)+hood(时期)→孩童时期<,>adulthood(n.成年)/neighborhood(n.社区)/likelihood(n.可能性)  

wolf<,>/wʊlf/<,>/wʊlf/<,>n.狼<,>The wolf howled at the full moon.<,>狼对着满月嚎叫。<,>He wolfed down his lunch in three minutes.<,>他三分钟就狼吞虎咽地吃完了午饭。<,>Don't trust him - he's a wolf in sheep's clothing.<,>别相信他，他是披着羊皮的狼。<,>对比：wool(羊毛)+f→狼爱吃羊<,>werewolf(n.狼人)/wolfish(adj.狼似的)/lone wolf(独来独往者)  

accordance<,>/əˈkɔːdns/<,>/əˈkɔːrdns/<,>n.一致/n.和谐<,>The project was done in accordance with the rules.<,>这个项目是按照规则完成的。<,>His actions were not in accordance with his words.<,>他的言行不一致。<,>The two reports are in perfect accordance.<,>两份报告完全一致。<,>ac(向)+cord(心)+ance→心心相印→一致<,>accord(v.符合)/discord(n.不一致)/concord(n.和谐)  

thorough<,>/ˈθʌrə/<,>/ˈθɜːroʊ/<,>adj.彻底的/adj.详尽的<,>She gave the room a thorough cleaning.<,>她把房间彻底打扫了一遍。<,>The police conducted a thorough investigation.<,>警方进行了彻底调查。<,>This textbook provides thorough coverage of the topic.<,>这本教材对该主题有详尽论述。<,>through(通过)+o→完全通过的→彻底的<,>though(conj.虽然)/through(prep.通过)/trough(n.低谷)  

appeal<,>/əˈpiːl/<,>/əˈpiːl/<,>vi.呼吁/vi.恳求/vi.申诉/vt.上诉/n.感染力/n.吸引力/n.呼吁/n.上诉<,>The charity appealed for donations.<,>慈善机构呼吁捐款。<,>His idea appealed to the committee.<,>他的想法吸引了委员会。<,>She decided to appeal the court's decision.<,>她决定对法院判决提出上诉。<,>ap(向)+peal(呼唤)→向...呼唤→呼吁<,>peel(v.剥皮)/repeal(v.废除)/appear(v.出现)  

democracy<,>/dɪˈmɒkrəsi/<,>/dɪˈmɑːkrəsi/<,>n.民主/n.民主制/n.民主国家<,>Greece is the birthplace of democracy.<,>希腊是民主的发源地。<,>True democracy requires active citizen participation.<,>真正的民主需要公民积极参与。<,>The country transitioned to democracy in 1990.<,>这个国家在1990年过渡到民主制。<,>demo(人民)+cracy(统治)→人民统治<,>autocracy(n.独裁)/bureaucracy(n.官僚)/aristocracy(n.贵族统治)
transportation<,>/ˌtrænspɔːˈteɪʃən/<,>/ˌtrænspərˈteɪʃən/<,>n.运输/n.运送/n.客运<,>Public transportation is essential in big cities.<,>公共交通在大城市中至关重要。<,>The transportation of goods by sea is cost-effective.<,>海运货物具有成本效益。<,>She works in the transportation department.<,>她在运输部门工作。<,>trans(跨越)+port(搬运)+ation(名词后缀)→搬运跨越→运输<,>transit(n.运输/v.通过)/import(n.进口/v.输入)/export(n.出口/v.输出)

dye<,>/daɪ/<,>/daɪ/<,>v.染/n.染料/n.染色<,>She decided to dye her hair red.<,>她决定把头发染成红色。<,>This fabric holds dye very well.<,>这种布料非常容易上色。<,>Natural dyes are safer for the environment.<,>天然染料对环境更安全。<,>die(死亡)→dye(染色)→联想：死亡的颜色是染上去的<,>die(v.死亡)/dyer(n.染色工)/dyeing(n.染色工艺)

evolve<,>/ɪˈvɒlv/<,>/ɪˈvɑːlv/<,>v.使进化/v.使发展<,>The species evolved over millions of years.<,>这个物种经过数百万年进化而来。<,>Our business strategy needs to evolve with the times.<,>我们的商业策略需要与时俱进。<,>He evolved his ideas through extensive research.<,>他通过广泛研究发展了自己的想法。<,>e(出)+volve(滚)→滚出来→发展出来→进化<,>involve(v.包含/v.卷入)/revolve(v.旋转/v.循环)/devolve(v.移交/v.退化)

extensive<,>/ɪkˈstensɪv/<,>/ɪkˈstensɪv/<,>adj.广阔的/adj.广泛的<,>He has extensive knowledge of history.<,>他拥有广博的历史知识。<,>The fire caused extensive damage to the building.<,>火灾对建筑物造成了广泛的破坏。<,>They conducted extensive research on the topic.<,>他们对此课题进行了广泛研究。<,>ex(出)+tens(伸展)+ive(形容词后缀)→伸展出去的→广阔的<,>intensive(adj.密集的/adj.加强的)/expensive(adj.昂贵的)/expansive(adj.广阔的/adj.健谈的)

congratulation<,>/kənˌɡrætʃuˈleɪʃən/<,>/kənˌɡrætʃəˈleɪʃən/<,>n.贺词/n.祝贺/n.恭喜<,>Congratulations on your graduation!<,>恭喜你毕业了！<,>She received many congratulations for her promotion.<,>她因升职收到了许多祝贺。<,>Let me offer my congratulations on your success.<,>请允许我对你的成功表示祝贺。<,>con(共同)+grat(高兴)+ulation(名词后缀)→共同高兴→祝贺<,>gratitude(n.感激)/gratify(v.使满足)/gratuitous(adj.免费的/adj.无理由的)

abandon<,>/əˈbændən/<,>/əˈbændən/<,>v.离弃/v.丢弃/v.遗弃/v.抛弃/v.放弃/n.放任/n.纵情<,>They had to abandon the sinking ship.<,>他们不得不弃下沉船。<,>She abandoned her career to raise her children.<,>她放弃事业来抚养孩子。<,>He danced with wild abandon.<,>他纵情地跳舞。<,>a(无)+band(绑)+on→不再绑住→放弃<,>bandon(无意义)/abundant(adj.丰富的)/band(n.乐队/n.带子)

definitely<,>/ˈdefɪnətli/<,>/ˈdefɪnətli/<,>adv.一定地/adv.明确地<,>I will definitely attend the meeting.<,>我一定会参加会议。<,>This is definitely the best solution.<,>这无疑是最好的解决方案。<,>She definitely said she would come.<,>她明确说了她会来。<,>definite(明确的)+ly(副词后缀)→明确地<,>definitive(adj.决定性的/adj.权威的)/finite(adj.有限的)/infinite(adj.无限的)

inspire<,>/ɪnˈspaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈspaɪr/<,>v.吸气/v.赋予灵感/v.鼓舞<,>The beautiful scenery inspired the poet.<,>美丽的风景给了诗人灵感。<,>She inspires her students to be creative.<,>她激励学生们发挥创造力。<,>Take a deep breath to inspire fresh air.<,>深呼吸吸入新鲜空气。<,>in(入)+spire(呼吸)→吸入→鼓舞<,>expire(v.到期/v.呼气)/respire(v.呼吸)/perspire(v.出汗)

marvelous<,>/ˈmɑːvələs/<,>/ˈmɑːrvələs/<,>adj.奇迹般的/adj.了不起的<,>What a marvelous performance!<,>多么精彩的表演！<,>You've done a marvelous job on this project.<,>你在这个项目上做得非常出色。<,>The view from the top is simply marvelous.<,>从顶部看去的景色简直太棒了。<,>marvel(奇迹)+ous(形容词后缀)→奇迹般的<,>marvel(n.奇迹/v.惊奇)/marvelously(adv.不可思议地)/miraculous(adj.神奇的)

household<,>/ˈhaʊshəʊld/<,>/ˈhaʊshoʊld/<,>adj.家庭的/adj.家喻户晓的/n.家庭/n.户/n.家务<,>This brand has become a household name.<,>这个品牌已成为家喻户晓的名字。<,>Household chores can be time-consuming.<,>家务活可能很耗时。<,>There are four people in our household.<,>我们家有四口人。<,>house(房子)+hold(持有)→持有一个房子→家庭<,>housewife(n.家庭主妇)/housekeeper(n.管家)/housework(n.家务)
geometry<,>/dʒiˈɒmətri/<,>/dʒiˈɑːmətri/<,>n.几何/n.几何学<,>She is studying geometry in school.<,>她在学校学习几何。<,>The geometry of the building is very complex.<,>这座建筑的几何结构非常复杂。<,>He enjoys solving geometry problems.<,>他喜欢解几何题。<,>geo(地)+metry(测量)→测量土地→几何<,>geography(n.地理学)/geology(n.地质学)  

ratio<,>/ˈreɪʃiəʊ/<,>/ˈreɪʃoʊ/<,>n.比/n.比率<,>The ratio of boys to girls in the class is 2:1.<,>这个班级的男女比例是2:1。<,>The screen has a 16:9 aspect ratio.<,>屏幕的长宽比是16:9。<,>They calculated the profit ratio carefully.<,>他们仔细计算了利润率。<,>rat(计算)+io→计算的比例→比率<,>rate(n.比率/v.评估)/ration(n.定量/v.配给)  

devote<,>/dɪˈvəʊt/<,>/dɪˈvoʊt/<,>vt.将…奉献给/vt.把…专用<,>She devoted her life to helping the poor.<,>她一生致力于帮助穷人。<,>He devotes two hours a day to exercise.<,>他每天花两小时锻炼。<,>This room is devoted to storage.<,>这个房间专门用来储物。<,>de(加强)+vote(发誓)→发誓做→奉献<,>vote(v.投票/n.选票)/devout(adj.虔诚的)  

agent<,>/ˈeɪdʒənt/<,>/ˈeɪdʒənt/<,>n.代理人/n.代理商/n.政府代表/n.动因/n.原因/n.剂<,>The real estate agent showed us several houses.<,>房地产经纪人带我们看了几套房子。<,>She works as a secret agent for the government.<,>她是政府的秘密特工。<,>This cleaning agent is very effective.<,>这种清洁剂非常有效。<,>ag(做)+ent(人)→做事的人→代理人<,>agency(n.代理机构)/agenda(n.议程)  

wool<,>/wʊl/<,>/wʊl/<,>n.羊毛/n.毛线/n.绒线<,>This sweater is made of pure wool.<,>这件毛衣是纯羊毛的。<,>She bought some wool to knit a scarf.<,>她买了些毛线来织围巾。<,>The sheep's wool was sheared in spring.<,>羊的羊毛在春天被剪下。<,>发音类似"乌尔"→羊毛的触感<,>wood(n.木材)/wolf(n.狼)  

wholly<,>/ˈhəʊlli/<,>/ˈhoʊlli/<,>adv.完全地/adv.全部地<,>I wholly agree with your opinion.<,>我完全同意你的观点。<,>The project was wholly funded by donations.<,>这个项目完全由捐款资助。<,>She was wholly absorbed in her book.<,>她完全沉浸在书中。<,>whole(完整的)+ly→完全地<,>holy(adj.神圣的)/wholesale(n.批发)  

instinct<,>/ˈɪnstɪŋkt/<,>/ˈɪnstɪŋkt/<,>n.本能/n.天性/n.直觉<,>Birds have an instinct to build nests.<,>鸟类有筑巢的本能。<,>She trusted her instinct and left the party early.<,>她相信直觉，早早离开了派对。<,>His instinct for business is remarkable.<,>他的商业直觉很出色。<,>in(内)+stinct(刺)→内在的刺激→本能<,>distinct(adj.不同的)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)  

approximate<,>/əˈprɒksɪmət/<,>/əˈprɑːksɪmət/<,>adj.近似的/vt.近似/vt.估计<,>The approximate cost is around $100.<,>大概花费是100美元左右。<,>Can you approximate the number of attendees?<,>你能估计一下参加人数吗？<,>The colors are approximate but not exact matches.<,>这些颜色近似但不完全匹配。<,>ap(向)+proxim(接近)+ate→接近的→近似的<,>proximate(adj.最近的)/appropriate(adj.合适的)  

invest<,>/ɪnˈvest/<,>/ɪnˈvest/<,>v.投资/v.投入/v.授予<,>They decided to invest in the stock market.<,>他们决定投资股市。<,>She invested a lot of time in learning Spanish.<,>她投入大量时间学习西班牙语。<,>The king invested him with the title of duke.<,>国王授予他公爵头衔。<,>in(进入)+vest(衣服)→穿上官服→授予<,>invent(v.发明)/infest(v.骚扰)  

afterward<,>/ˈɑːftəwəd/<,>/ˈæftərwərd/<,>adv.后来/adv.以后<,>We had dinner and afterward watched a movie.<,>我们吃了晚饭，后来看了场电影。<,>She felt tired afterward the long journey.<,>长途旅行后她感到疲惫。<,>I'll call you afterward the meeting.<,>会后我会给你打电话。<,>after(后)+ward(方向)→向后的时间→后来<,>afterwards(adv.后来)/forward(adv.向前)
reputation<,>/ˌrepjuˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛpjəˈteɪʃən/<,>n.名誉/n.名气/n.名声<,>He has a reputation for being honest.<,>他以诚实著称。<,>Her reputation was damaged by the scandal.<,>她的名声因丑闻受损。<,>The company built a solid reputation over the years.<,>这家公司多年来建立了稳固的声誉。<,>re(重新)+put(思考)+ation→反复思考的东西→名声<,>prestige(n.声望)/fame(n.名声)/status(n.地位)

project<,>/ˈprɒdʒekt/<,>/ˈprɑːdʒekt/<,>v.伸出/v.投射/v.预计/n.方案/n.计划/n.课题/n.项目/n.工程<,>The tree projects its shadow on the wall.<,>树影投射在墙上。<,>They are working on a new research project.<,>他们正在进行一个新的研究项目。<,>The company projects a 10% growth next year.<,>公司预计明年增长10%。<,>pro(向前)+ject(投掷)→向前投→投射<,>reject(v.拒绝)/inject(v.注射)/subject(n.主题)

shrug<,>/ʃrʌɡ/<,>/ʃrʌɡ/<,>n&v.耸肩<,>She shrugged her shoulders when asked about it.<,>被问到这件事时，她耸了耸肩。<,>His shrug indicated he didn't know the answer.<,>他的耸肩表示他不知道答案。<,>Don't just shrug off your responsibilities.<,>不要对你的责任置之不理。<,>拟声词，模仿耸肩动作的声音<,>hug(v.拥抱)/tug(v.拖拽)/drug(n.药物)

independence<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpendəns/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈpɛndəns/<,>n.独立/n.自主/n.自立<,>The country gained independence in 1947.<,>这个国家于1947年获得独立。<,>Teenagers often seek more independence from their parents.<,>青少年常常寻求更多来自父母的独立。<,>Financial independence is important for young adults.<,>经济独立对年轻人很重要。<,>in(不)+depend(依赖)+ence→不依赖→独立<,>dependence(n.依赖)/interdependence(n.相互依赖)

coordination<,>/kəʊˌɔːdɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/koʊˌɔːrdɪˈneɪʃən/<,>n.同等/n.调和<,>The dance requires perfect coordination.<,>这个舞蹈需要完美的协调。<,>Good hand-eye coordination is essential for tennis.<,>良好的手眼协调对网球很重要。<,>The project needs better coordination between departments.<,>这个项目需要部门间更好的协调。<,>co(共同)+ordin(顺序)+ation→共同顺序→协调<,>cooperation(n.合作)/collaboration(n.协作)

presentation<,>/ˌpreznˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌpriːzenˈteɪʃən/<,>n.提供/n.显示/n.外观/n.图像/n.授予/n.赠送/n.报告/n.介绍/n.表演<,>She gave an excellent presentation at the conference.<,>她在会议上做了精彩的报告。<,>The presentation of the award will be at 3pm.<,>颁奖仪式将在下午3点举行。<,>This software improves the presentation of data.<,>这个软件改进了数据的呈现方式。<,>present(呈现)+ation→呈现的行为<,>representation(n.代表)/demonstration(n.示范)

diameter<,>/daɪˈæmɪtə(r)/<,>/daɪˈæmɪtər/<,>n.直径<,>The diameter of the circle is 10cm.<,>这个圆的直径是10厘米。<,>Measure the diameter of the pipe before buying fittings.<,>购买配件前先测量管子的直径。<,>The tree has a diameter of over two meters.<,>这棵树的直径超过两米。<,>dia(穿过)+meter(测量)→穿过圆心的测量→直径<,>radius(n.半径)/circumference(n.周长)

barn<,>/bɑːn/<,>/bɑːrn/<,>n.谷仓/n.牲口棚<,>We stored the hay in the barn.<,>我们把干草储存在谷仓里。<,>The farmer keeps his cows in the barn at night.<,>农夫晚上把牛关在牲口棚里。<,>The old barn was converted into a house.<,>这个旧谷仓被改造成了房子。<,>与"bar"(酒吧)对比记忆<,>shed(n.棚屋)/stable(n.马厩)

bark<,>/bɑːk/<,>/bɑːrk/<,>vi.吠/n.吠声/n.叫声/n.树皮<,>The dog barked at the stranger.<,>狗对着陌生人吠叫。<,>We could hear the bark of a dog in the distance.<,>我们能听到远处狗的叫声。<,>Some medicines are made from tree bark.<,>有些药物是用树皮制成的。<,>拟声词，模仿狗叫声<,>park(n.公园)/dark(adj.黑暗的)

loop<,>/luːp/<,>/luːp/<,>v.成环/n.圈/n.环/n.回路/n.循环<,>She looped the rope around the post.<,>她把绳子绕在柱子上打了个环。<,>The road makes a loop around the lake.<,>这条路绕湖一圈。<,>The program runs in an endless loop.<,>这个程序在无限循环中运行。<,>形状像数字"8"的两个环<,>hoop(n.箍)/noose(n.套索)
restrain<,>/rɪˈstreɪn/<,>/rɪˈstreɪn/<,>vt.阻止/vt.控制/vt.抑制/vt.遏制<,>She had to restrain her anger during the meeting.<,>她不得不在会议期间抑制自己的愤怒。<,>The police used barriers to restrain the crowd.<,>警察用障碍物阻止人群。<,>He tried to restrain his laughter at the inappropriate joke.<,>他努力控制自己不笑那个不合时宜的笑话。<,>re(回)+strain(拉紧)→拉回来→抑制<,>constrain(v.强迫/v.限制)/refrain(v.克制/n.重复句)

greedy<,>/ˈɡriːdi/<,>/ˈɡridi/<,>adj.贪吃的/adj.贪婪的/adj.渴望的<,>The greedy child took all the candies for himself.<,>那个贪心的孩子把所有的糖果都拿走了。<,>He was greedy for power and wealth.<,>他对权力和财富贪得无厌。<,>She looked at the cake with greedy eyes.<,>她用渴望的眼神看着蛋糕。<,>green(绿色)+d→贪心的人眼红得发绿<,>need(n.需要/v.必须)/speed(n.速度/v.加速)

awkward<,>/ˈɔːkwəd/<,>/ˈɔkwərd/<,>adj.笨拙的/adj.尴尬的/adj.难操纵的/adj.使用不便的/adj.不灵巧的<,>He felt awkward at the formal dinner party.<,>他在正式晚宴上感到尴尬。<,>The heavy package was awkward to carry.<,>这个沉重的包裹很难搬运。<,>She gave an awkward apology for being late.<,>她为迟到笨拙地道了歉。<,>awk(错误的)+ward(方向)→方向错误→笨拙的<,>backward(adj.向后的/adv.向后)/forward(adj.向前的/adv.向前)

bare<,>/beə(r)/<,>/bɛr/<,>adj.赤裸的/adj.光秃的/adj.无遮盖的/adj.刚刚够的/adj.勉强的/vt.露出/vt.显露<,>The trees were bare in winter.<,>冬天树木光秃秃的。<,>He earned a bare living wage.<,>他挣的钱勉强够维持生活。<,>She bared her teeth in anger.<,>她愤怒地露出牙齿。<,>bar(酒吧)+e→酒吧里有人裸露<,>bear(v.忍受/n.熊)/barely(adv.仅仅/adv.几乎不)

ruin<,>/ˈruːɪn/<,>/ˈruɪn/<,>v.毁坏/n.毁灭/n.废墟<,>The storm ruined the crops.<,>暴风雨毁坏了庄稼。<,>The ancient castle is now in ruins.<,>这座古堡现在已成废墟。<,>Gambling ruined his financial situation.<,>赌博毁了他的经济状况。<,>rain(雨)+u→雨水冲刷成废墟<,>run(v.跑/n.跑步)/rub(v.擦/n.摩擦)

crane<,>/kreɪn/<,>/kreɪn/<,>n.起重机/n.摄影升降机/n.鹤<,>They used a crane to lift the heavy container.<,>他们用起重机吊起沉重的集装箱。<,>A beautiful crane stood by the lake.<,>一只美丽的鹤站在湖边。<,>The film crew set up a camera crane for the shot.<,>电影摄制组为拍摄架设了摄影升降机。<,>c(形状像鹤颈)+rane(看作rain雨)→雨中鹤<,>cane(n.手杖/n.藤条)/crave(v.渴望/v.恳求)

beard<,>/bɪəd/<,>/bɪrd/<,>n.胡须/n.络腮胡子<,>He grew a thick beard during the winter.<,>他在冬天留起了浓密的胡子。<,>The old man stroked his long beard thoughtfully.<,>老人若有所思地捋着长胡子。<,>She doesn't like men with beards.<,>她不喜欢留胡子的男人。<,>bear(熊)+d→熊一样的胡子<,>beer(n.啤酒)/board(n.木板/v.登机)

impatient<,>/ɪmˈpeɪʃnt/<,>/ɪmˈpeɪʃənt/<,>adj.不耐烦的/adj.急躁的<,>The impatient customer kept looking at his watch.<,>不耐烦的顾客不停地看表。<,>She was impatient for the results of the test.<,>她急切地等待考试结果。<,>Don't be so impatient with children.<,>对孩子不要这么没耐心。<,>im(不)+patient(耐心的)→不耐烦的<,>patient(adj.耐心的/n.病人)/impartial(adj.公正的/adj.不偏不倚的)

spill<,>/spɪl/<,>/spɪl/<,>v.溢出/v.洒落/n.溢出<,>Be careful not to spill the milk.<,>小心别把牛奶洒了。<,>There was an oil spill in the ocean.<,>海上发生了石油泄漏。<,>Her tears spilled onto the letter.<,>她的眼泪滴落在信纸上。<,>s(水)+pill(药丸)→药丸掉水里溅起水花<,>still(adj.静止的/adv.仍然)/spell(v.拼写/n.咒语)

owing<,>/ˈəʊɪŋ/<,>/ˈoʊɪŋ/<,>adj.应付的/adj.未付的<,>There is still £50 owing on the bill.<,>账单上还有50英镑未付。<,>Owing to bad weather, the flight was delayed.<,>由于天气恶劣，航班延误了。<,>He couldn't buy the car owing to lack of money.<,>由于缺钱，他买不起那辆车。<,>owe(欠)+ing→欠着的<,>own(adj.自己的/v.拥有)/owing to(由于/因为)
collection<,>/kəˈlekʃ(ə)n/<,>/kəˈlɛkʃən/<,>n.搜集/n.聚集/n.积聚/n.收集/n.收取/n.收藏品/n.收集的东西<,>She has a large collection of stamps.<,>她收藏了大量的邮票。<,>The collection of data took several months.<,>数据的收集花了几个月的时间。<,>His art collection is worth millions.<,>他的艺术收藏价值数百万。<,>col(共同)+lect(收集)+ion(名词后缀)→收集的东西<,>connection(n.连接)/correction(n.改正)/collection(n.收藏品)  

gardener<,>/ˈɡɑːdnə(r)/<,>/ˈɡɑrdnər/<,>n.园丁/n.花匠<,>The gardener is planting flowers in the garden.<,>园丁正在花园里种花。<,>She hired a gardener to maintain her backyard.<,>她雇了一个园丁来打理她的后院。<,>My grandfather was a skilled gardener.<,>我祖父是个技艺高超的园丁。<,>garden(花园)+er(人)→花园里的人→园丁<,>guardian(n.监护人)/gardener(n.园丁)/gardening(n.园艺)  

conquest<,>/ˈkɒŋkwest/<,>/ˈkɑŋkwɛst/<,>n.攻取/n.征服/n.克服<,>The conquest of new markets is essential for growth.<,>征服新市场对增长至关重要。<,>The Norman Conquest changed English history.<,>诺曼征服改变了英国历史。<,>His conquest of fear was inspiring.<,>他克服恐惧的过程令人鼓舞。<,>con(完全)+quest(寻求)→完全寻求到→征服<,>request(n.请求)/question(n.问题)/conquest(n.征服)  

finding<,>/ˈfaɪndɪŋ/<,>/ˈfaɪndɪŋ/<,>n.发现/n.调查的结果/n.裁决<,>The findings of the research were published yesterday.<,>这项研究的发现昨天发表了。<,>The court announced its finding this morning.<,>法庭今早宣布了裁决。<,>Her findings contradicted previous theories.<,>她的发现与之前的理论相矛盾。<,>find(发现)+ing(名词后缀)→发现的结果<,>funding(n.资金)/finding(n.发现)/founding(n.建立)  

dense<,>/dens/<,>/dɛns/<,>adj.密集的/adj.浓厚的/adj.密度大的<,>The forest was too dense to walk through.<,>森林太密集了，无法穿过。<,>Fog was dense on the highway this morning.<,>今早高速公路上的雾很浓。<,>This metal is denser than aluminum.<,>这种金属比铝密度大。<,>den(兽穴)+se→像兽穴一样密集的→密集的<,>dense(密集的)/tense(紧张的)/sense(感觉)  

fortnight<,>/ˈfɔːtnaɪt/<,>/ˈfɔrtnaɪt/<,>n.两星期/n.十四天<,>I'll be on vacation for a fortnight.<,>我将休假两周。<,>The project must be completed in a fortnight.<,>这个项目必须在两周内完成。<,>We meet every fortnight for book club.<,>我们每两周聚会一次读书俱乐部。<,>fort(fourteen)+night(夜晚)→十四个夜晚→两周<,>fortnight(n.两周)/tonight(adv.今晚)/midnight(n.午夜)  

laboratory<,>/ləˈbɒrətri/<,>/ˈlæbrətɔri/<,>n.实验室/n.研究室<,>He spends most of his time in the laboratory.<,>他大部分时间都在实验室里。<,>The new laboratory equipment arrived yesterday.<,>新的实验室设备昨天到了。<,>She works in a chemistry laboratory.<,>她在化学实验室工作。<,>labor(劳动)+atory(场所)→劳动的场所→实验室<,>lavatory(n.盥洗室)/laboratory(n.实验室)/observatory(n.天文台)  

inspect<,>/ɪnˈspekt/<,>/ɪnˈspɛkt/<,>vi.进行检查/vi.进行视察/vt.检查/vt.审查/vt.检阅<,>The general will inspect the troops tomorrow.<,>将军明天将检阅部队。<,>They came to inspect the building for safety.<,>他们来检查建筑物的安全性。<,>Customs officers inspect luggage at the airport.<,>海关官员在机场检查行李。<,>in(内)+spect(看)→向内看→检查<,>inspect(v.检查)/expect(v.期望)/respect(v.尊重)  

campaign<,>/kæmˈpeɪn/<,>/kæmˈpen/<,>vi.参加运动/vi.参加竞选/n.战役/n.运动<,>He is campaigning for the presidency.<,>他正在竞选总统。<,>The advertising campaign was very successful.<,>这次广告活动非常成功。<,>Napoleon's Russian campaign ended in disaster.<,>拿破仑的俄罗斯战役以灾难告终。<,>camp(田野)+aign→在田野上作战→战役<,>champagne(n.香槟)/campaign(n.运动)/companion(n.同伴)  

systematical<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˌsɪstəˈmætɪkəl/<,>adj.有系统的/adj.有计划的<,>She has a systematical approach to problem-solving.<,>她有一个系统性的解决问题的方法。<,>The research was conducted in a systematical manner.<,>这项研究是以系统的方式进行的。<,>His notes are very systematical and easy to follow.<,>他的笔记非常有条理，易于理解。<,>system(系统)+atic(形容词后缀)+al→系统的<,>systematical(adj.系统的)/systematic(adj.系统的)/symptomatic(adj.症状的)
vital<,>/ˈvaɪtl/<,>/ˈvaɪtəl/<,>adj.致命的/adj.生死攸关的/adj.极其重要的/adj.生命的/adj.有生命力的<,>Water is vital for all living things.<,>水对所有生物都是至关重要的。<,>She played a vital role in the project.<,>她在这个项目中发挥了极其重要的作用。<,>The patient's condition is vital.<,>病人的情况很危险。<,>vit(生命)+al(形容词后缀)→与生命有关的→至关重要的<,>mortal(adj.致命的)/vitality(n.活力)/vitalize(v.赋予生命)  

conflict<,>/ˈkɒnflɪkt/<,>/ˈkɑːnflɪkt/<,>vi.冲突/vi.抵触/n.冲突/n.抵触/n.争论/n.战斗/n.战争<,>There is a conflict between the two parties.<,>双方之间存在冲突。<,>His statement conflicts with the facts.<,>他的陈述与事实相抵触。<,>The conflict lasted for years.<,>这场战争持续了多年。<,>con(共同)+flict(打击)→互相打击→冲突<,>inflict(v.使遭受)/afflict(v.使痛苦)/confluence(n.汇合)  

farewell<,>/ˌfeəˈwel/<,>/ˌferˈwel/<,>n.告别/n.欢送会<,>They held a farewell party for him.<,>他们为他举行了欢送会。<,>She bid farewell to her friends.<,>她向朋友们告别。<,>It was a touching farewell.<,>那是一个感人的告别。<,>fare(旅行)+well(好)→祝一路顺风→告别<,>welfare(n.福利)/fare(n.车费)/welcome(v.欢迎)  

allow<,>/əˈlaʊ/<,>/əˈlaʊ/<,>vt.允许/vt.准许/vt.同意给/vt.承认/vt.允许…进入<,>Smoking is not allowed here.<,>这里不允许吸烟。<,>She allowed him to enter the room.<,>她允许他进入房间。<,>The teacher allowed extra time for the test.<,>老师同意延长考试时间。<,>al(向)+low(低的)→放低要求→允许<,>disallow(v.不允许)/allowance(n.津贴)/alloy(n.合金)

mass<,>/mæs/<,>/mæs/<,>adj.大量的/adj.大规模的/v.聚集/v.集中/n.众多/n.大量/n.团/n.块/n.堆/n.群众/n.质量<,>A mass of people gathered in the square.<,>一大群人聚集在广场上。<,>The company produces goods in mass quantities.<,>这家公司大规模生产商品。<,>The mass of the object was measured.<,>这个物体的质量被测量了。<,>mas(大量)+s→大量<,>mess(n.混乱)/massive(adj.巨大的)/amass(v.积累)

poem<,>/ˈpəʊɪm/<,>/ˈpoʊəm/<,>n.诗<,>She wrote a beautiful poem about nature.<,>她写了一首关于自然的美丽诗歌。<,>I can recite that poem from memory.<,>我能背诵那首诗。<,>The poem expresses deep emotions.<,>这首诗表达了深刻的情感。<,>poe(诗人)+m→诗人创作的东西→诗<,>poet(n.诗人)/poetry(n.诗歌)/prose(n.散文)

interest<,>/ˈɪntrəst/<,>/ˈɪntrɪst/<,>n.兴趣/n.利益/n.利害关系/n.利息/vt.使感兴趣<,>She has a great interest in art.<,>她对艺术很感兴趣。<,>The bank charges high interest on loans.<,>银行贷款利息很高。<,>This book might interest you.<,>这本书可能会让你感兴趣。<,>inter(在...之间)+est(存在)→存在于其中→兴趣<,>interact(v.互动)/internet(n.互联网)/interrupt(v.打断)

inferior<,>/ɪnˈfɪəriə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈfɪriər/<,>adj.下等的/adj.劣等的/adj.次于…的/n.下级/n.下属<,>This product is of inferior quality.<,>这个产品质量低劣。<,>He always felt inferior to his older brother.<,>他总是觉得自己不如哥哥。<,>The manager treats his inferiors with respect.<,>经理尊重地对待他的下属。<,>infer(下面)+ior→在下面的→下等的<,>superior(adj.上级的)/interior(adj.内部的)  

steamer<,>/ˈstiːmə(r)/<,>/ˈstimər/<,>n.轮船/n.汽船<,>We took a steamer across the lake.<,>我们乘汽船渡过了湖泊。<,>The old steamer still operates as a tourist attraction.<,>这艘老式汽船仍作为旅游景点运营。<,>Steamers were revolutionary in 19th-century transportation.<,>汽船在19世纪的交通运输中具有革命性。<,>steam(蒸汽)+er(物)→用蒸汽驱动的船→汽船<,>steel(n.钢铁)/stream(n.溪流)  

recently<,>/ˈriːsntli/<,>/ˈrisəntli/<,>adv.最近/adv.新近<,>I recently moved to a new apartment.<,>我最近搬到了新公寓。<,>The book was published quite recently.<,>这本书是最近才出版的。<,>Have you seen any good movies recently?<,>你最近看过什么好电影吗？<,>recent(最近的)+ly(副词后缀)→最近<,>resent(v.怨恨)/frequently(adv.频繁地)  

overlook<,>/ˌəʊvəˈlʊk/<,>/ˌoʊvərˈlʊk/<,>vt.忽视/vt.宽恕/vt.俯瞰<,>My office overlooks the city square.<,>我的办公室俯瞰城市广场。<,>Don't overlook the small details in the contract.<,>不要忽视合同中的小细节。<,>I'll overlook your mistake this time.<,>这次我会宽恕你的错误。<,>over(上面)+look(看)→从上面看→俯瞰<,>overload(v.超载)/overlord(n.霸主)
politician<,>/ˌpɒl.ɪˈtɪʃ.ən/<,>/ˌpɑː.ləˈtɪʃ.ən/<,>n.政治家/n.政客<,>The politician promised to lower taxes if elected.<,>这位政治家承诺如果当选将降低税收。<,>Many people distrust politicians because of their broken promises.<,>由于政客们违背承诺，许多人不信任他们。<,>She is the first female politician to hold this position.<,>她是第一位担任这一职位的女性政治家。<,>poli(城市)+tic(技巧)+ian(人)→管理城市的人→政治家<,>politics(n.政治)/political(adj.政治的)/policy(n.政策)

incredible<,>/ɪnˈkred.ə.bəl/<,>/ɪnˈkred.ə.bəl/<,>adj.不能相信的/adj.难以置信的/adj.惊人的<,>The view from the mountaintop was incredible.<,>从山顶看到的景色令人难以置信。<,>She has an incredible memory for details.<,>她对细节有着惊人的记忆力。<,>It's incredible that he survived the accident without any injuries.<,>他在事故中毫发无损地活下来真是不可思议。<,>in(不)+cred(相信)+ible(能)→不能相信的<,>credible(adj.可信的)/incredulous(adj.怀疑的)/credibility(n.可信度)

dramatic<,>/drəˈmæt.ɪk/<,>/drəˈmæt̬.ɪk/<,>adj.引人注目的/adj.激动人心的/adj.突然的<,>There was a dramatic increase in sales last month.<,>上个月销售额有了显著增长。<,>The play had a dramatic ending that left everyone speechless.<,>这部戏剧有一个令人震惊的结局，让所有人都说不出话来。<,>She made a dramatic entrance wearing a bright red dress.<,>她穿着鲜红色的连衣裙引人注目地入场。<,>drama(戏剧)+tic→像戏剧一样的→引人注目的<,>dynamic(adj.动态的)/dramatics(n.戏剧表演)/dramatize(v.戏剧化)

mosquito<,>/məˈskiː.təʊ/<,>/məˈskiː.t̬oʊ/<,>n.蚊子<,>Mosquitoes are most active at dawn and dusk.<,>蚊子在黎明和黄昏时最为活跃。<,>I got bitten by a mosquito last night and now my arm itches.<,>昨晚我被蚊子咬了，现在手臂很痒。<,>The city is spraying to control the mosquito population.<,>该市正在喷洒药物以控制蚊子数量。<,>mos(咬)+quito(小东西)→会咬人的小东西→蚊子<,>mosque(n.清真寺)/mosquitofish(n.食蚊鱼)/mosquitocide(n.杀蚊剂)

guitar<,>/ɡɪˈtɑːr/<,>/ɡɪˈtɑːr/<,>n.吉他/n.六弦琴<,>He plays the guitar in a local band.<,>他在当地乐队弹吉他。<,>She's been taking guitar lessons for three months.<,>她已经上了三个月的吉他课了。<,>The sound of an acoustic guitar filled the room.<,>房间里充满了木吉他的声音。<,>gui(音似"吉")+tar(乐器)→吉他<,>guitarist(n.吉他手)/guitar case(n.吉他盒)/guitar pick(n.拨片)

layout<,>/ˈleɪ.aʊt/<,>/ˈleɪ.aʊt/<,>n.布局/n.安排/n.设计<,>The magazine has a clean and modern layout.<,>这本杂志的版面设计简洁现代。<,>We need to change the layout of the office to improve workflow.<,>我们需要改变办公室的布局以提高工作效率。<,>The architect showed us the layout of the new building.<,>建筑师向我们展示了新建筑的布局图。<,>lay(放置)+out(出来)→把东西放置出来→布局<,>layover(n.中途停留)/layman(n.外行)/layoff(n.裁员)

artificial<,>/ˌɑː.tɪˈfɪʃ.əl/<,>/ˌɑːr.t̬əˈfɪʃ.əl/<,>adj.人工的/adj.人为的/adj.矫揉造作的/adj.模拟的<,>The flowers are made of artificial silk.<,>这些花是用人造丝做的。<,>Her smile seemed artificial and forced.<,>她的笑容看起来做作而勉强。<,>Artificial intelligence is changing many industries.<,>人工智能正在改变许多行业。<,>art(艺术)+fic(做)+ial→人为做出来的→人工的<,>artifice(n.诡计)/artisan(n.工匠)/artistic(adj.艺术的)

imaginary<,>/ɪˈmædʒ.ɪ.nər.i/<,>/ɪˈmædʒ.ə.ner.i/<,>adj.想象中的/adj.假想的<,>Children often have imaginary friends.<,>孩子们经常有假想的朋友。<,>The story takes place in an imaginary world.<,>这个故事发生在一个想象的世界里。<,>Her fears were mostly imaginary and not based on reality.<,>她的恐惧大多是想象出来的，并非基于现实。<,>imagin(想象)+ary→想象中的<,>imagination(n.想象力)/imaginative(adj.富有想象力的)/image(n.形象)

removal<,>/rɪˈmuː.vəl/<,>/rɪˈmuː.vəl/<,>n.除去/n.消除/n.移动/n.搬迁<,>The removal of the old tree took all day.<,>移除那棵老树花了一整天时间。<,>We hired a company to help with our office removal.<,>我们雇了一家公司来帮忙办公室搬迁。<,>The stain removal product worked very well.<,>这个去污产品效果很好。<,>re(再次)+mov(移动)+al→再次移动→搬迁<,>remove(v.移除)/movement(n.运动)/mobile(adj.可移动的)

formula<,>/ˈfɔː.mjə.lə/<,>/ˈfɔːr.mjə.lə/<,>n.公式/n.方程式/n.原则/n.方案/n.配方<,>The scientist developed a new formula for the medicine.<,>科学家为这种药物开发了新配方。<,>There's no magic formula for success.<,>成功没有神奇的公式。<,>Babies need special formula if they can't drink breast milk.<,>如果婴儿不能喝母乳，他们需要特殊的配方奶粉。<,>form(形式)+ula(小)→小的形式→公式<,>formulate(v.制定)/formation(n.形成)/formal(adj.正式的)
comment<,>/ˈkɒment/<,>/ˈkɑːment/<,>vi.评论/n.评论/n.意见/n.注释/n.闲话/n.议论<,>She refused to comment on the issue.<,>她拒绝对这个问题发表评论。<,>His comments were always insightful.<,>他的评论总是很有见地。<,>There was a lot of comment about her new hairstyle.<,>关于她的新发型有很多议论。<,>com(共同)+ment(思考)→共同思考→评论<,>commend(v.称赞/v.推荐)/commence(v.开始)/moment(n.瞬间/n.时刻)  

revolt<,>/rɪˈvəʊlt/<,>/rɪˈvoʊlt/<,>v.反叛/v.起义/v.反抗/v.违抗/v.厌恶/v.生反感/n.反叛/n.起义<,>The people revolted against the dictator.<,>人民起义反抗独裁者。<,>She revolted at the sight of blood.<,>她一看到血就感到恶心。<,>The revolt was quickly suppressed by the government.<,>起义很快被政府镇压了。<,>re(反)+volt(转)→反转→反叛<,>revolution(n.革命/n.旋转)/resolve(v.解决/v.决定)/revolve(v.旋转/v.循环)  

disgust<,>/dɪsˈɡʌst/<,>/dɪsˈɡʌst/<,>n.厌恶/n.憎恶/vt.厌恶/vt.憎恶<,>He looked at the rotten food with disgust.<,>他厌恶地看着腐烂的食物。<,>Her behavior disgusted everyone in the room.<,>她的行为让房间里的每个人都感到厌恶。<,>I feel nothing but disgust for such cruelty.<,>对这种残忍行为我只感到厌恶。<,>dis(不)+gust(味道)→不好的味道→厌恶<,>disguise(v.伪装/n.伪装)/discuss(v.讨论)/digest(v.消化/n.摘要)  

stem<,>/stem/<,>/stɛm/<,>vi.起源/n.茎/n.干/n.词干/vt.堵住/vt.止住/vt.停住<,>The problem stems from a lack of communication.<,>这个问题源于缺乏沟通。<,>She was picking the stems off the cherries.<,>她正在摘掉樱桃的梗。<,>They tried to stem the flow of blood from the wound.<,>他们试图止住伤口流血。<,>st(站立)+em→植物站立的部分→茎<,>steam(n.蒸汽/v.蒸)/stern(adj.严厉的/n.船尾)/stamp(n.邮票/v.跺脚)  

sunshine<,>/ˈsʌnʃaɪn/<,>/ˈsʌnˌʃaɪn/<,>n.日光/n.阳光<,>The children were playing in the sunshine.<,>孩子们在阳光下玩耍。<,>We haven't seen much sunshine this week.<,>这周我们没怎么见到阳光。<,>Her smile was like sunshine on a cloudy day.<,>她的微笑就像阴天里的阳光。<,>sun(太阳)+shine(发光)→阳光<,>sunset(n.日落)/sunburn(n.晒伤)/sunflower(n.向日葵)  

trend<,>/trend/<,>/trɛnd/<,>vi.伸向/vi.倾向/n.倾向<,>The river trends eastward at this point.<,>河流在这里向东延伸。<,>There's a growing trend towards healthier eating.<,>现在有一种越来越倾向于健康饮食的趋势。<,>The latest fashion trends are shown in this magazine.<,>这本杂志展示了最新的时尚趋势。<,>tend(倾向)的变体<,>tend(v.倾向于)/trench(n.沟渠)/tendency(n.趋势)  

achievement<,>/əˈtʃiːvmənt/<,>/əˈtʃivmənt/<,>n.完成/n.成就/n.成绩<,>Winning the award was her greatest achievement.<,>赢得这个奖项是她最大的成就。<,>The achievement of peace took many years of negotiation.<,>实现和平经历了许多年的谈判。<,>His academic achievements are impressive.<,>他的学术成绩令人印象深刻。<,>achieve(获得)+ment(名词后缀)→成就<,>achiever(n.成功者)/mischievous(adj.淘气的)/relieve(v.缓解)  

mechanic<,>/məˈkænɪk/<,>/məˈkænɪk/<,>n.技工/n.机修工/n.力学/n.机械学/n.过程/n.方法/n.技术性细节<,>The mechanic fixed my car in an hour.<,>机修工一小时内修好了我的车。<,>He has a good understanding of quantum mechanics.<,>他对量子力学有很好的理解。<,>Let me explain the mechanics of how this works.<,>让我来解释一下这个的工作原理。<,>mechan(机器)+ic(人)→与机器打交道的人→技工<,>machine(n.机器)/mechanism(n.机制)/mechanical(adj.机械的)  

desirable<,>/dɪˈzaɪərəbl/<,>/dɪˈzaɪrəbəl/<,>adj.值得向往的/adj.令人满意的<,>It's a highly desirable neighborhood.<,>这是个非常理想的社区。<,>Good communication skills are desirable in this job.<,>这份工作需要良好的沟通技巧。<,>The house has many desirable features.<,>这栋房子有许多令人满意的特点。<,>desire(渴望)+able(能够)→值得渴望的<,>desire(v.渴望/n.愿望)/desirous(adj.渴望的)/undesirable(adj.不受欢迎的)  

balcony<,>/ˈbælkəni/<,>/ˈbælkəni/<,>n.阳台/n.楼厅/n.楼座<,>We had breakfast on the balcony.<,>我们在阳台上吃了早餐。<,>Our seats were in the balcony of the theater.<,>我们的座位在剧院的楼厅。<,>She stood on the balcony, enjoying the view.<,>她站在阳台上欣赏风景。<,>balc(突出)+ony(地方)→突出的地方→阳台<,>ballet(n.芭蕾舞)/balloon(n.气球)/balance(n.平衡)
consist<,>/kənˈsɪst/<,>/kənˈsɪst/<,>vi.由…组成/vi.在于/vi.一致<,>The team consists of five members.<,>这个团队由五名成员组成。<,>Happiness consists in contentment.<,>知足常乐。<,>His actions do not consist with his words.<,>他的言行不一致。<,>con(共同)+sist(站立)→站在一起→组成<,>insist(v.坚持)/persist(v.持续)/resist(v.抵抗)  

preparation<,>/ˌprepəˈreɪʃn/<,>/ˌprɛpəˈreɪʃən/<,>n.准备/n.预备/n.制剂<,>She is making preparations for her trip.<,>她正在为旅行做准备。<,>The medicine is a preparation of herbs.<,>这种药是草药制剂。<,>Preliminary preparation is essential for success.<,>初步准备对成功至关重要。<,>pre(前)+par(准备)+ation→提前准备<,>preparatory(adj.预备的)/prepare(v.准备)/reparation(n.赔偿)  

reliable<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbl/<,>/rɪˈlaɪəbəl/<,>adj.可靠的/adj.可信赖的<,>He is a reliable friend.<,>他是个可靠的朋友。<,>This car is reliable in all weather conditions.<,>这辆车在各种天气条件下都可靠。<,>We need reliable data for the research.<,>我们需要可靠的研究数据。<,>rely(依赖)+able(能…的)→可依赖的<,>liable(adj.有责任的)/reliant(adj.依赖的)/reliability(n.可靠性)  

relate<,>/rɪˈleɪt/<,>/rɪˈleɪt/<,>vi.有关/vi.涉及/vi.符合/vi.相处/vt.使有关联/vt.讲述/vt.叙述<,>The story relates to his childhood.<,>这个故事与他的童年有关。<,>She related her adventure to us.<,>她向我们讲述了她的冒险经历。<,>He finds it hard to relate to his colleagues.<,>他发现很难与同事相处。<,>re(再)+late(带来)→再次带来→关联<,>relative(adj.相对的)/relation(n.关系)/correlate(v.关联)  

critic<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪk/<,>n.批评家/n.爱挑剔的人<,>He is a famous film critic.<,>他是著名的电影评论家。<,>She is her own worst critic.<,>她对自己要求最苛刻。<,>The critic gave the book a bad review.<,>评论家给这本书差评。<,>crit(判断)+ic(人)→判断的人→批评家<,>critical(adj.批判的)/criticism(n.批评)/critique(n.评论)  

elevator<,>/ˈelɪveɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈɛləˌveɪtər/<,>n.电梯/n.升降机<,>Take the elevator to the 10th floor.<,>乘电梯到10楼。<,>The elevator is out of order.<,>电梯坏了。<,>He works in an elevator company.<,>他在一家电梯公司工作。<,>elevate(提升)+or(物)→提升的机器→电梯<,>escalator(n.自动扶梯)/lift(n.电梯)/elevation(n.提升)  

grammar<,>/ˈɡræmə(r)/<,>/ˈɡræmər/<,>n.语法/n.语法书<,>She is good at English grammar.<,>她擅长英语语法。<,>This grammar book is very useful.<,>这本语法书很有用。<,>Grammar mistakes can affect your writing.<,>语法错误会影响你的写作。<,>gram(写)+mar→写文章的规则→语法<,>glamour(n.魅力)/gram(单位克)/program(n.程序)  

enable<,>/ɪˈneɪbl/<,>/ɪˈneɪbəl/<,>vt.使能够/vt.使可能<,>This app enables you to learn faster.<,>这个应用能让你学得更快。<,>The scholarship enabled him to go to college.<,>奖学金使他能够上大学。<,>Technology enables us to communicate easily.<,>科技使我们能够轻松交流。<,>en(使)+able(能…的)→使能够<,>unable(adj.不能的)/disable(v.使无能)/able(adj.能够的)  

preliminary<,>/prɪˈlɪmɪnəri/<,>/prɪˈlɪməˌnɛri/<,>adj.预备的/adj.初步的/n.初步做法/n.起始行为<,>We need to do some preliminary research.<,>我们需要做一些初步研究。<,>The preliminary results are promising.<,>初步结果很有希望。<,>The meeting is just a preliminary to the main event.<,>这次会议只是主要活动的序幕。<,>pre(前)+limin(门槛)+ary→在门槛前的→预备的<,>primary(adj.主要的)/premier(adj.首要的)/liminary(adj.边界的)  

dependent<,>/dɪˈpendənt/<,>/dɪˈpɛndənt/<,>adj.依靠的/adj.依赖的/adj.取决于…的<,>Children are dependent on their parents.<,>孩子依赖父母。<,>Success is dependent on hard work.<,>成功取决于努力。<,>She is financially dependent on her husband.<,>她在经济上依赖丈夫。<,>depend(依赖)+ent(…的)→依赖的<,>independent(adj.独立的)/dependable(adj.可靠的)/dependence(n.依赖)
obstacle<,>/ˈɒbstək(ə)l/<,>/ˈɑːbstək(ə)l/<,>n.障碍/n.障碍物/n.妨碍<,>Lack of education can be a major obstacle to success.<,>缺乏教育可能是成功的主要障碍。<,>They removed the obstacle from the road.<,>他们清除了路上的障碍物。<,>Fear is often the biggest obstacle to change.<,>恐惧往往是改变的最大障碍。<,>ob(反对)+sta(站立)+cle(小)→站在对立面的小东西→障碍<,>object(n.物体/v.反对)/obstruct(v.阻挡/v.妨碍)

profession<,>/prəˈfeʃ(ə)n/<,>/prəˈfɛʃ(ə)n/<,>n.职业/n.声明/n.表白<,>Teaching is a noble profession.<,>教书是一项崇高的职业。<,>He made a profession of his love for her.<,>他向她表白了自己的爱意。<,>Her profession of innocence didn't convince anyone.<,>她声称自己无辜，但没人相信。<,>pro(向前)+fess(说)+ion→向前说出来→声明/职业<,>professional(adj.专业的/n.专业人士)/confession(n.坦白/n.忏悔)

calculator<,>/ˈkælkjʊleɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈkælkjəˌleɪtər/<,>n.计算器/n.计算者<,>I used a calculator to solve the math problem.<,>我用计算器解决了这个数学问题。<,>He's a human calculator when it comes to numbers.<,>在数字方面，他就像个人体计算器。<,>The calculator's battery needs to be replaced.<,>计算器的电池需要更换了。<,>calcul(计算)+ate(动词后缀)+or(人或物)→计算的人或物<,>calculate(v.计算)/calculation(n.计算)/speculator(n.投机者)

van<,>/væn/<,>/væn/<,>n.大篷车/n.运货车<,>We rented a van for our road trip.<,>我们租了一辆大篷车去公路旅行。<,>The delivery van arrived early this morning.<,>送货车今天一大早就到了。<,>He converted his van into a mobile home.<,>他把运货车改装成了移动房屋。<,>联想：van(谐音"万")→能装"万"物的车<,>fan(n.风扇/n.粉丝)/pan(n.平底锅)/can(modal v.能/n.罐头)

biology<,>/baɪˈɒlədʒi/<,>/baɪˈɑːlədʒi/<,>n.生物学/n.生态学<,>She's studying biology at university.<,>她在大学学习生物学。<,>The biology of this region is very diverse.<,>这个地区的生态非常多样化。<,>Marine biology is his field of expertise.<,>海洋生物学是他的专业领域。<,>bio(生命)+logy(学科)→研究生命的学科<,>biography(n.传记)/biodegradable(adj.可生物降解的)/geology(n.地质学)

worm<,>/wɜːm/<,>/wɜːrm/<,>n.虫/n.蠕虫<,>The early bird catches the worm.<,>早起的鸟儿有虫吃。<,>There's a worm in this apple.<,>这个苹果里有条虫。<,>Computer worms can spread quickly through networks.<,>计算机蠕虫病毒能在网络中快速传播。<,>联想：worm→worm(谐音"我摸")→我不敢摸虫<,>warm(adj.温暖的)/swarm(n.一大群)/wormhole(n.虫洞)

compress<,>/kəmˈpres/<,>/kəmˈprɛs/<,>vt.压紧/vt.压缩<,>Compress the file before sending it.<,>发送前先压缩文件。<,>She compressed her clothes to fit more in the suitcase.<,>她把衣服压紧以便在行李箱里装更多。<,>The machine compresses the garbage into small blocks.<,>这台机器把垃圾压缩成小块。<,>com(一起)+press(压)→一起压→压缩<,>impress(v.留下印象)/express(v.表达)/depress(v.使沮丧)

arise<,>/əˈraɪz/<,>/əˈraɪz/<,>vi.出现/vi.由...引起/vi.起身<,>A problem arose during the meeting.<,>会议期间出现了一个问题。<,>Many questions arise from this discovery.<,>这个发现引出了许多问题。<,>He arose early to watch the sunrise.<,>他早早起床看日出。<,>a(加强)+rise(升起)→出现/起身<,>rise(v.上升)/raise(v.举起)/arouse(v.唤醒)

collaborative<,>/kəˈlæbərətɪv/<,>/kəˈlæbəˌreɪtɪv/<,>adj.合作的/adj.协作的/adj.协力完成的<,>This is a collaborative project between two universities.<,>这是两所大学之间的合作项目。<,>They have a very collaborative working style.<,>他们的工作方式非常协作。<,>The book was a collaborative effort by several authors.<,>这本书是几位作者协力完成的。<,>col(共同)+labor(劳动)+ative(形容词后缀)→共同劳动的→合作的<,>cooperate(v.合作)/coordinate(v.协调)/elaborate(adj.精心制作的)

cherish<,>/ˈtʃerɪʃ/<,>/ˈtʃɛrɪʃ/<,>vt.珍爱/vt.怀有<,>I cherish the memories of our time together.<,>我珍视我们一起度过的时光。<,>She cherishes a hope of becoming a doctor.<,>她怀有成为一名医生的希望。<,>We should cherish our friendships.<,>我们应该珍惜友谊。<,>cher(亲爱的)+ish(动词后缀)→像对亲爱的(人)一样对待→珍爱<,>perish(v.消亡)/nourish(v.滋养)/flourish(v.繁荣)
constitute<,>/ˈkɒnstɪtjuːt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstɪtuːt/<,>vt.组成/vt.形成/vt.设立/vt.任命<,>Twelve months constitute a year.<,>十二个月构成一年。<,>The committee was constituted in 2020.<,>该委员会设立于2020年。<,>She was constituted chairperson of the board.<,>她被任命为董事会主席。<,>con(共同)+stitute(站立)→共同站立→组成<,>constitution(n.宪法/n.构成)/substitute(v.代替/n.替代品)/institute(v.建立/n.学院)

cattle<,>/ˈkætl/<,>/ˈkætl/<,>n.牛/n.牲口/n.家畜<,>The cattle are grazing in the field.<,>牛群正在田里吃草。<,>He deals in cattle trading.<,>他从事牲口买卖。<,>These cattle belong to my uncle.<,>这些家畜是我叔叔的。<,>cat(猫)+tle→比猫大的动物→牛<,>battle(n.战斗/v.作战)/kettle(n.水壶)/cuddle(v.拥抱)

imagination<,>/ɪˌmædʒɪˈneɪʃn/<,>/ɪˌmædʒəˈneɪʃən/<,>n.想象/n.想象力/n.空想/n.想象出<,>Children have vivid imaginations.<,>孩子们有生动的想象力。<,>It's just your imagination.<,>这只是你的空想。<,>He couldn't imagine life without her.<,>他无法想象没有她的生活。<,>image(图像)+ination→在脑中形成图像→想象<,>imitation(n.模仿)/illustration(n.说明)/illusion(n.幻觉)

resistance<,>/rɪˈzɪstəns/<,>/rɪˈzɪstəns/<,>n.反抗/n.抵制/n.抵抗力/n.抵抗性/n.阻力/n.电阻<,>The protesters met with police resistance.<,>抗议者遇到了警察的反抗。<,>She has good resistance to colds.<,>她对感冒有很好的抵抗力。<,>Copper has low electrical resistance.<,>铜的电阻很低。<,>re(反对)+sist(站立)+ance→站起来反对→抵抗<,>assistance(n.帮助)/persistence(n.坚持)/existence(n.存在)

underneath<,>/ˌʌndəˈniːθ/<,>/ˌʌndərˈniːθ/<,>adv.在下面/prep.在...下面/n.下部<,>The cat was hiding underneath the table.<,>猫躲在桌子下面。<,>Write your name underneath the date.<,>把你的名字写在日期下面。<,>The underneath of the car was damaged.<,>汽车的底部受损了。<,>under(在...下)+neath(下面)→在下面<,>underwear(n.内衣)/underestimate(v.低估)/undergo(v.经历)

nursery<,>/ˈnɜːsəri/<,>/ˈnɜːrsəri/<,>n.托儿所/n.保育室/n.苗圃<,>She works in a children's nursery.<,>她在儿童托儿所工作。<,>The plants in the nursery are growing well.<,>苗圃里的植物长势良好。<,>We decorated the nursery for the new baby.<,>我们为新宝宝装饰了保育室。<,>nurse(护理)+ry(场所)→护理的场所→托儿所<,>nursing(n.护理)/nurture(v.养育)/nursemaid(n.保姆)

mate<,>/meɪt/<,>/meɪt/<,>v.成为配偶/v.交配/n.伙伴/n.同事/n.配偶/n.大副<,>Birds mate in the spring.<,>鸟类在春天交配。<,>He's my best mate at work.<,>他是我工作中最好的伙伴。<,>The captain and his mate were on the bridge.<,>船长和大副在舰桥上。<,>mat(垫子)+e→同睡一张垫子的人→配偶<,>date(n.日期/v.约会)/fate(n.命运)/gate(n.大门)

convince<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>/kənˈvɪns/<,>vt.使确信/vt.使信服/vt.说服<,>I couldn't convince him of my innocence.<,>我无法让他相信我是无辜的。<,>She convinced me to change my mind.<,>她说服我改变了主意。<,>The evidence convinced the jury.<,>证据使陪审团信服了。<,>con(完全)+vince(征服)→完全征服对方→说服<,>convict(v.定罪/n.罪犯)/convivial(adj.欢乐的)/convulsion(n.抽搐)

emperor<,>/ˈempərə(r)/<,>/ˈempərər/<,>n.皇帝<,>The emperor wore a golden crown.<,>皇帝戴着金色的王冠。<,>The emperor ruled for over 50 years.<,>这位皇帝统治了50多年。<,>They built a temple to honor the emperor.<,>他们建了一座寺庙来纪念皇帝。<,>empire(帝国)+or→帝国统治者→皇帝<,>empress(n.女皇)/emporium(n.商场)/empirical(adj.经验主义的)

prolong<,>/prəˈlɒŋ/<,>/prəˈlɔːŋ/<,>vt.拉长/vt.延长<,>They prolonged their stay by a week.<,>他们把停留时间延长了一周。<,>The treatment may prolong his life.<,>这种治疗可能会延长他的生命。<,>Don't prolong the meeting unnecessarily.<,>不要不必要地延长会议时间。<,>pro(向前)+long(长)→向前拉长→延长<,>prologue(n.序幕)/prolific(adj.多产的)/proliferate(v.激增)
theory<,>/ˈθɪəri/<,>/ˈθɪri/<,>n.理论/n.原理/n.学说/n.意见/n.看法<,>Einstein's theory of relativity changed physics forever.<,>爱因斯坦的相对论永远改变了物理学。<,>She has a theory about why the project failed.<,>她对项目失败的原因有自己的看法。<,>In theory, this plan should work perfectly.<,>理论上，这个计划应该完美运行。<,>theo(神)+ry→神的启示→理论<,>theorem(n.定理)/theology(n.神学)/hypothesis(n.假设)

distress<,>/dɪˈstres/<,>/dɪˈstrɛs/<,>n.忧虑/n.痛苦/n.悲伤/n.不幸<,>The news of the accident caused her great distress.<,>事故的消息让她非常痛苦。<,>The ship sent out a distress signal when it started sinking.<,>船开始下沉时发出了求救信号。<,>Financial distress forced him to sell his house.<,>经济困境迫使他卖掉了房子。<,>dis(分开)+stress(压力)→被压力分开→痛苦<,>stress(n.压力)/depress(v.使沮丧)/mistress(n.女主人)

flock<,>/flɒk/<,>/flɑːk/<,>n.羊群/n.群/n.大量<,>A flock of birds flew over the lake.<,>一群鸟飞过湖面。<,>Tourists flock to this museum every summer.<,>每年夏天游客大量涌入这个博物馆。<,>The shepherd watched over his flock carefully.<,>牧羊人仔细看管着他的羊群。<,>fl(飞)+ock(名词后缀)→飞的一群→鸟群<,>block(n.街区)/lock(n.锁)/flock(v.聚集)

internal<,>/ɪnˈtɜːnl/<,>/ɪnˈtɜːrnl/<,>adj.内的/adj.国内的/adj.内心的<,>The company is conducting an internal investigation.<,>公司正在进行内部调查。<,>He suffered internal injuries in the accident.<,>他在事故中受了内伤。<,>She struggled with internal conflicts.<,>她内心充满矛盾。<,>inter(在...之间)+nal→在内部的<,>external(adj.外部的)/international(adj.国际的)/infernal(adj.地狱的)

extension<,>/ɪkˈstenʃn/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnʃən/<,>n.延长部分/n.伸展/n.电话分机/n.分机号码<,>We built an extension to our house last year.<,>去年我们给房子加建了延伸部分。<,>Please dial extension 123 for customer service.<,>请拨打分机123联系客服。<,>The professor asked for an extension on his research deadline.<,>教授要求延长研究截止日期。<,>ex(出)+tens(伸展)+ion→伸展出去<,>extent(n.范围)/extensive(adj.广泛的)/intension(n.强度)

steep<,>/stiːp/<,>/stip/<,>adj.险峻的/adj.陡峭的/adj.过高的/adj.急剧的<,>The path became too steep to climb.<,>小路变得太陡峭无法攀登。<,>The price increase was too steep for most customers.<,>对大多数顾客来说价格上涨太高了。<,>There was a steep decline in sales last quarter.<,>上个季度销售额急剧下降。<,>st(站立)+eep→站得很直→陡峭的<,>sleep(v.睡觉)/sweep(v.打扫)/steer(v.驾驶)

classical<,>/ˈklæsɪk(ə)l/<,>/ˈklæsɪkəl/<,>adj.古典的/adj.经典的<,>She enjoys listening to classical music.<,>她喜欢听古典音乐。<,>This is a classical example of Roman architecture.<,>这是罗马建筑的经典范例。<,>He studies classical literature at university.<,>他在大学学习古典文学。<,>class(等级)+ical(形容词后缀)→最高等级的→经典的<,>classic(adj.经典的)/classify(v.分类)/classicism(n.古典主义)

foundation<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃ(ə)n/<,>/faʊnˈdeɪʃən/<,>n.基础<,>The report has no foundation in fact.<,>这份报告没有事实依据。<,>She works for a charitable foundation.<,>她为一个慈善基金会工作。<,>This course will give you a solid foundation in mathematics.<,>这门课程将为你打下扎实的数学基础。<,>found(建立)+ation(名词后缀)→建立的基础<,>fundamental(adj.基础的)/founder(n.创始人)/fund(n.资金)

naturally<,>/ˈnætʃ(ə)rəli/<,>/ˈnætʃərəli/<,>adv.当然/adv.天然地/adv.天生地<,>Naturally, I was upset when I heard the news.<,>当然，听到这个消息我很沮丧。<,>Her hair is naturally curly.<,>她的头发是天生的卷发。<,>This product is made from naturally occurring ingredients.<,>这个产品是用天然成分制成的。<,>nature(自然)+ally(副词后缀)→自然地<,>natural(adj.自然的)/unnatural(adj.不自然的)/supernatural(adj.超自然的)
