disappear<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪə(r)/<,>/ˌdɪsəˈpɪr/<,>vi.不见/vi.失踪/vi.消失<,>The sun disappeared behind the clouds.<,>太阳消失在云层后面。<,>My keys have disappeared from the table.<,>我的钥匙从桌子上不见了。<,>Many species are disappearing due to habitat loss.<,>许多物种因栖息地丧失而消失。<,>dis(不)+appear(出现)→不出现→消失<,>appear(v.出现)/disappearance(n.消失)/reappear(v.再次出现)  

summit<,>/ˈsʌmɪt/<,>/ˈsʌmɪt/<,>n.最高点/n.峰顶/n.最高级会议<,>They reached the summit of the mountain at dawn.<,>他们在黎明时分到达了山顶。<,>The leaders held a summit to discuss global issues.<,>领导人举行了峰会讨论全球问题。<,>The view from the summit was breathtaking.<,>从山顶看到的景色令人叹为观止。<,>sum(最高)+mit(名词后缀)→最高点<,>submit(v.提交)/summon(v.召唤)/consummate(adj.完美的/v.完成)  

recession<,>/rɪˈseʃn/<,>/rɪˈseʃn/<,>n.衰退/n.衰退期<,>The country is experiencing an economic recession.<,>这个国家正在经历经济衰退。<,>Many businesses closed during the recession.<,>许多企业在衰退期间倒闭了。<,>The recession led to high unemployment rates.<,>经济衰退导致了高失业率。<,>re(回)+cess(走)+ion(名词后缀)→往回走→衰退<,>concession(n.让步)/procession(n.队伍)/succession(n.连续)  

conclusion<,>/kənˈkluːʒn/<,>/kənˈkluːʒn/<,>n.结论/n.推论/n.结尾/n.缔结/n.议定<,>What is your conclusion after the experiment?<,>实验后你的结论是什么？<,>The story had a surprising conclusion.<,>这个故事有一个出人意料的结尾。<,>They came to the conclusion that more research was needed.<,>他们得出结论需要更多的研究。<,>con(共同)+clus(关闭)+ion(名词后缀)→共同关闭→结论<,>include(v.包括)/exclude(v.排除)/conclusive(adj.决定性的)  

typist<,>/ˈtaɪpɪst/<,>/ˈtaɪpɪst/<,>n.打字员<,>She works as a typist in a law firm.<,>她在一家律师事务所当打字员。<,>The typist finished the document quickly.<,>打字员很快完成了文件。<,>Modern typists need to be proficient in word processing.<,>现代打字员需要精通文字处理。<,>type(打字)+ist(人)→打字的人→打字员<,>typewriter(n.打字机)/typography(n.印刷术)/stereotype(n.刻板印象)
durable<,>/ˈdjʊərəbl/<,>/ˈdʊrəbəl/<,>adj.耐久的/adj.耐用的<,>This jacket is made of durable material.<,>这件夹克是用耐用的材料制成的。<,>Their friendship proved to be durable over the years.<,>他们的友谊经年累月依然坚固。<,>The durable peace agreement was signed by both countries.<,>两国签署了持久的和平协议。<,>dur(持续)+able(能…的)→能持续的→耐用的<,>endurable(adj.可忍受的)/duration(n.持续时间)/durability(n.耐久性)

negative<,>/ˈneɡətɪv/<,>/ˈnɛɡətɪv/<,>adj.否定的/adj.消极的/adj.负的/adj.阴性的/n.负片/n.底片/n.负数<,>He gave a negative answer to the question.<,>他对这个问题给出了否定的回答。<,>Her negative attitude affected the whole team.<,>她的消极态度影响了整个团队。<,>The test result came back negative.<,>检测结果呈阴性。<,>neg(否定)+ative(…的)→否定的<,>positive(adj.肯定的/adj.积极的/adj.正的)/negate(v.否定)/negation(n.否定)

impose<,>/ɪmˈpəʊz/<,>/ɪmˈpoʊz/<,>vi.利用/vi.占便宜/vi.欺骗/vt.把…强加于/vt.征<,>Don't impose on his kindness.<,>不要利用他的善良。<,>The government imposed new taxes on luxury goods.<,>政府对奢侈品征收新税。<,>She didn't want to impose her views on others.<,>她不想把自己的观点强加于人。<,>im(进入)+pose(放置)→强行放置→强加<,>compose(v.组成)/dispose(v.处理)/expose(v.暴露)

ally<,>/ˈælaɪ/<,>/ˈælaɪ/<,>v.结盟/v.联合/n.同盟国/n.同盟者/n.支持者<,>France allied with England during the war.<,>战争期间法国与英国结盟。<,>He found an ally in his fight against corruption.<,>他在反腐败斗争中找到了盟友。<,>The two companies allied to develop new technology.<,>两家公司联合开发新技术。<,>al(加强)+ly(绑)→绑在一起→结盟<,>alloy(n.合金)/alley(n.小巷)/rally(v.召集)

statement<,>/ˈsteɪtmənt/<,>/ˈsteɪtmənt/<,>n.陈述/n.声明/n.结算单/n.报表<,>The witness made a statement to the police.<,>目击者向警方作了陈述。<,>Check your bank statement regularly.<,>定期检查你的银行对账单。<,>The company issued a formal statement about the incident.<,>公司就该事件发表了正式声明。<,>state(陈述)+ment(名词后缀)→陈述<,>statesman(n.政治家)/station(n.车站)/stature(n.身高)

hence<,>/hens/<,>/hɛns/<,>adv.因此/adv.所以/adv.今后<,>He was late, hence he missed the train.<,>他迟到了，因此错过了火车。<,>The project will be completed two months hence.<,>这个项目将在两个月后完成。<,>She is very talented, hence her rapid promotion.<,>她很有才华，所以晋升很快。<,>hen(母鸡)+ce(拼音"策")→母鸡的策略→因此<,>thence(adv.从那里)/whence(adv.从何处)/hitherto(adv.迄今)

memorial<,>/məˈmɔːriəl/<,>/məˈmɔriəl/<,>adj.纪念的/adj.悼念的/n.纪念碑/n.纪念堂/n.纪念仪式<,>They built a war memorial in the town square.<,>他们在镇广场上建了一座战争纪念碑。<,>The memorial service was held yesterday.<,>追悼会昨天举行了。<,>This park is a memorial to the founder of the city.<,>这个公园是为纪念城市创始人而建的。<,>memor(记忆)+ial(…的)→纪念的<,>memory(n.记忆)/memorize(v.记住)/memorandum(n.备忘录)

factor<,>/ˈfæktə(r)/<,>/ˈfæktər/<,>n.因素/n.因子/n.系数<,>Time is an important factor in this project.<,>时间是这个项目的重要因素。<,>The weather was a deciding factor in our plans.<,>天气是我们计划中的决定性因素。<,>Genetic factors play a role in some diseases.<,>遗传因素在某些疾病中起作用。<,>fact(做)+or(人或物)→做事的人或物→因素<,>factory(n.工厂)/faction(n.派系)/factual(adj.事实的)

boot<,>/buːt/<,>/but/<,>n.靴子/n.长筒靴/n.行李箱/n.解雇<,>She bought a pair of leather boots.<,>她买了一双皮靴。<,>Put your luggage in the boot of the car.<,>把你的行李放在汽车后备箱里。<,>He got the boot for being late too often.<,>他因为经常迟到被解雇了。<,>b(像靴子形状)+oot(脚)→穿在脚上的靴子<,>booth(n.小间)/boost(v.促进)/boat(n.船)

pinch<,>/pɪntʃ/<,>/pɪntʃ/<,>vt.捏/vt.拧/n.撮/n.微量<,>She pinched his arm playfully.<,>她开玩笑地捏了他的胳膊。<,>Add just a pinch of salt to the soup.<,>往汤里加一小撮盐。<,>He pinched his finger in the door.<,>他的手指被门夹了。<,>p(拼音"拍")+inch(英寸)→拍一英寸→捏<,>punch(v.打孔)/pitch(n.沥青)/pin(n.别针)
delivery<,>/dɪˈlɪvəri/<,>/dɪˈlɪvəri/<,>n.投递/n.交付/n.分娩/n.讲话方式/n.投递的邮件<,>The delivery of the package was delayed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，包裹的投递被延迟了。<,>She had a smooth delivery and a healthy baby.<,>她分娩顺利，生下了一个健康的宝宝。<,>His speech delivery was clear and engaging.<,>他的演讲方式清晰且引人入胜。<,>de(离开)+liver(自由)+y→把东西从手中自由放走→交付<,>deliver(v.投递/v.发表)/livery(n.制服/n.侍从)

rack<,>/ræk/<,>/ræk/<,>n.挂架/n.搁架/vt.使痛苦/vt.折磨/vt.尽力使用<,>She placed the dishes on the rack to dry.<,>她把盘子放在架子上晾干。<,>The pain racked his entire body.<,>疼痛折磨着他的全身。<,>He racked his brains to solve the problem.<,>他绞尽脑汁解决这个问题。<,>rack(架子)→像架子一样承受压力→折磨<,>wrack(n.破坏/v.毁坏)/crack(n.裂缝/v.破裂)

election<,>/ɪˈlekʃn/<,>/ɪˈlekʃn/<,>n.选举/n.选择权/n.当选<,>The presidential election will be held next month.<,>总统选举将于下个月举行。<,>Every citizen has the right to vote in the election.<,>每个公民都有选举权。<,>His election as chairman was unexpected.<,>他当选为主席出乎意料。<,>e(出)+lect(选择)+ion→选举<,>selection(n.选择/n.精选)/erection(n.建立/n.勃起)

conquer<,>/ˈkɒŋkə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkər/<,>vt.征服/vt.战胜/vt.破除/vt.克服<,>The army conquered the enemy's territory.<,>军队征服了敌人的领土。<,>She conquered her fear of public speaking.<,>她克服了公开演讲的恐惧。<,>They worked hard to conquer the mountain.<,>他们努力征服了这座山。<,>con(完全)+quer(寻求)→完全寻求到→征服<,>conquest(n.征服)/conqueror(n.征服者)

learned<,>/ˈlɜːnɪd/<,>/ˈlɜːrnɪd/<,>adj.有学问的/adj.学术上的<,>The learned professor gave an insightful lecture.<,>这位博学的教授做了一个有见地的讲座。<,>This is a learned journal in the field of physics.<,>这是一本物理学领域的学术期刊。<,>His learned opinions are highly respected.<,>他学术上的观点备受尊重。<,>learn(学习)+ed(形容词后缀)→通过学习获得的→有学问的<,>learner(n.学习者)/learning(n.学问)

substance<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>/ˈsʌbstəns/<,>n.物质/n.实质/n.大意/n.要旨/n.根据/n.理由<,>Water is a vital substance for life.<,>水是生命的重要物质。<,>The substance of his argument was convincing.<,>他论点的实质很有说服力。<,>There is no substance to these rumors.<,>这些谣言毫无根据。<,>sub(在...下)+stance(站立)→站在下面的东西→实质<,>substantial(adj.大量的/adj.实质的)/substantiate(v.证实)

frown<,>/fraʊn/<,>/fraʊn/<,>n.皱眉/n.蹙额/vi.皱眉/vi.蹙额<,>She gave him a disapproving frown.<,>她向他投去不赞成的皱眉。<,>He frowned at the difficult math problem.<,>他对这道数学难题皱起了眉头。<,>A deep frown appeared on her forehead.<,>她的额头出现了深深的皱纹。<,>frown(皱眉)→像倒下的皇冠(crown)→表情不悦<,>brown(adj.棕色的)/crown(n.王冠)

bond<,>/bɒnd/<,>/bɑːnd/<,>v.黏合/v.结合/n.联结/n.联系/n.公债/n.契约/n.合同<,>Glue was used to bond the pieces together.<,>胶水被用来把这些碎片黏合在一起。<,>They shared a strong emotional bond.<,>他们之间有强烈的情感纽带。<,>He invested in government bonds.<,>他投资了政府公债。<,>bond(结合)→绑(bind)在一起→联结<,>bound(adj.必定的/v.跳跃)/band(n.带子/n.乐队)

target<,>/ˈtɑːɡɪt/<,>/ˈtɑːrɡɪt/<,>n.目标/vt.把...作为目标/vt.瞄准<,>The arrow hit the center of the target.<,>箭射中了靶心。<,>The campaign targets young consumers.<,>这次活动以年轻消费者为目标。<,>He carefully targeted the enemy soldier.<,>他仔细瞄准了敌方士兵。<,>tar(焦油)+get(得到)→像焦油一样粘住目标→瞄准<,>budget(n.预算)/forget(v.忘记)

wax<,>/wæks/<,>/wæks/<,>n.蜡/n.蜂蜡/vt.给...上蜡<,>She bought some wax to make candles.<,>她买了一些蜡来做蜡烛。<,>The floor was waxed to a high shine.<,>地板打了蜡，非常光亮。<,>Bees produce wax to build their honeycombs.<,>蜜蜂产生蜂蜡来建造蜂巢。<,>wax(蜡)→像max(最大)一样能覆盖表面→上蜡<,>wane(v.减少/v.衰落)/tax(n.税)
grind<,>/ɡraɪnd/<,>/ɡraɪnd/<,>v.磨/v.磨快<,>He grinds coffee beans every morning.<,>他每天早上都磨咖啡豆。<,>She ground the knife to a sharp edge.<,>她把刀磨得非常锋利。<,>The mill grinds wheat into flour.<,>磨坊将小麦磨成面粉。<,>gr(摩擦)+ind(动作)→磨的动作<,>grip(v.紧握/n.把手)/grand(adj.宏伟的/n.大钢琴)

urban<,>/ˈɜːbən/<,>/ˈɜːrbən/<,>adj.城市的/adj.都市的/adj.住在都市的<,>Urban life is fast-paced and exciting.<,>都市生活节奏快且令人兴奋。<,>She prefers urban living to rural areas.<,>比起乡村地区，她更喜欢都市生活。<,>Urban development needs careful planning.<,>城市发展需要精心规划。<,>urb(城市)+an(形容词后缀)→城市的<,>suburban(adj.郊区的)/rural(adj.乡村的)

furthermore<,>/ˌfɜːðəˈmɔː(r)/<,>/ˌfɜːrðərˈmɔːr/<,>adv.而且/adv.此外<,>Furthermore, we need to consider the budget.<,>此外，我们还需要考虑预算。<,>He's qualified, and furthermore, he's experienced.<,>他有资质，而且经验丰富。<,>The plan is risky; furthermore, it's expensive.<,>这个计划有风险，而且成本高。<,>further(进一步)+more(更多)→更进一步<,>moreover(adv.此外)/however(adv.然而)

guidance<,>/ˈɡaɪdns/<,>/ˈɡaɪdns/<,>n.引导/n.指导/n.领导<,>She sought guidance from her mentor.<,>她向导师寻求指导。<,>Under his guidance, the team succeeded.<,>在他的领导下，团队取得了成功。<,>The booklet provides guidance for new employees.<,>这本小册子为新员工提供指导。<,>guide(指导)+ance(名词后缀)→指导<,>governance(n.治理)/guardian(n.监护人)

risk<,>/rɪsk/<,>/rɪsk/<,>n.危险/n.风险/n.引起危险的事物/vt.冒...的危险/vt.使遭受危险<,>Smoking increases the risk of lung cancer.<,>吸烟会增加患肺癌的风险。<,>He risked his life to save the child.<,>他冒着生命危险救了那个孩子。<,>Investing in stocks involves some risk.<,>投资股票有一定的风险。<,>ris(危险)+k→危险<,>brisk(adj.轻快的)/frisk(v.欢跃/n.搜身)

flame<,>/fleɪm/<,>/fleɪm/<,>n.火焰/n.光辉/n.热情<,>The flames rose high into the night sky.<,>火焰高高升入夜空。<,>Her performance was full of flame and passion.<,>她的表演充满激情。<,>He blew out the candle's flame.<,>他吹灭了蜡烛的火焰。<,>fl(飞)+ame→飞动的火→火焰<,>frame(n.框架/v.陷害)/blame(v.责备/n.责任)

container<,>/kənˈteɪnə(r)/<,>/kənˈteɪnər/<,>n.容器/n.集装箱<,>She stored the cookies in an airtight container.<,>她把饼干存放在密封容器里。<,>The ship carried hundreds of containers.<,>这艘船运载了数百个集装箱。<,>This container is made of recycled plastic.<,>这个容器是用再生塑料制成的。<,>contain(包含)+er(物品)→容器<,>retainer(n.保持器/n.定金)/detainer(n.扣留)

leader<,>/ˈliːdə(r)/<,>/ˈliːdər/<,>n.领袖/n.领导人/n.首领<,>The leader addressed the crowd.<,>领导向人群发表了讲话。<,>She is a natural leader in her field.<,>她是该领域天生的领导者。<,>The team looked to their leader for direction.<,>团队向他们的领导寻求方向。<,>lead(领导)+er(人)→领导人<,>reader(n.读者)/loader(n.装载机)

delicate<,>/ˈdelɪkət/<,>/ˈdelɪkət/<,>adj.纤细的/adj.易碎的/adj.微妙的/adj.精美的<,>Handle the antique with care; it's very delicate.<,>小心处理这件古董，它非常易碎。<,>She wore a delicate lace dress.<,>她穿了一件精美的蕾丝连衣裙。<,>The situation requires delicate handling.<,>这种情况需要微妙的处理。<,>de(强调)+lic(诱惑)+ate→精致诱惑的→精美的<,>dedicate(v.奉献)/delicious(adj.美味的)

discard<,>/dɪsˈkɑːd/<,>/dɪsˈkɑːrd/<,>vt.丢弃/vt.抛弃/vt.遗弃<,>Please discard the empty bottles.<,>请把空瓶子扔掉。<,>He discarded his old habits.<,>他抛弃了旧习惯。<,>Don't discard this idea too quickly.<,>不要这么快就放弃这个想法。<,>dis(离开)+card(纸牌)→出牌→丢弃<,>disregard(v.忽视/n.漠视)/discharge(v.释放/n.排放)
fancy<,>/ˈfænsi/<,>/ˈfænsi/<,>adj.昂贵的/adj.别致的/n.想象力/n.设想/n.爱好/vt.喜欢/vt.想象/vt.猜想<,>She wore a fancy dress to the party.<,>她穿了一件别致的裙子去参加派对。<,>He has a fancy for vintage cars.<,>他对古董车情有独钟。<,>Don't fancy that you can succeed without hard work.<,>别以为不努力就能成功。<,>fan(迷)+cy→迷恋的→喜欢<,>fantasy(n.幻想)/faint(adj.模糊的/v.昏倒)

rebel<,>/ˈrebəl/<,>/ˈrɛbəl/<,>vi.反叛/vi.造反/vi.反对/vi.不服从/n.反叛分子/n.反对者<,>The people rebelled against the dictator.<,>人民反抗独裁者。<,>He was a rebel in his youth.<,>他年轻时是个叛逆者。<,>Teenagers often rebel against their parents.<,>青少年常常违抗父母。<,>re(反)+bel(战争)→反战→反叛<,>revel(v.狂欢)/repel(v.击退/v.使厌恶)

bounce<,>/baʊns/<,>/baʊns/<,>v.弹起/v.反弹/v.颠簸/n.弹/n.反弹<,>The ball bounced off the wall.<,>球从墙上弹了回来。<,>The car bounced along the rough road.<,>汽车在崎岖的路上颠簸前行。<,>She has a lot of bounce in her step.<,>她走路很有弹性。<,>boun(跳)+ce→弹跳<,>bound(v.跳跃/n.界限)/ounce(n.盎司)

usage<,>/ˈjuːsɪdʒ/<,>/ˈjusɪdʒ/<,>n.使用/n.对待/n.惯用法<,>This word has a special usage in legal documents.<,>这个词在法律文件中有特殊用法。<,>The usage of plastic should be reduced.<,>应该减少塑料的使用。<,>Her usage of the equipment was incorrect.<,>她对设备的使用方法不正确。<,>us(使用)+age(状态)→使用状态<,>use(v.使用/n.用途)/usher(n.引座员/v.引导)

tissue<,>/ˈtɪʃuː/<,>/ˈtɪʃu/<,>n.组织/n.薄绢/n.薄纸/n.手巾纸<,>She wiped her tears with a tissue.<,>她用纸巾擦眼泪。<,>Muscle tissue is important for movement.<,>肌肉组织对运动很重要。<,>The gift was wrapped in tissue paper.<,>礼物用薄纸包装着。<,>tis(编织)+sue→编织物→组织<,>issue(n.问题/v.发行)/tithe(n.什一税)

experimental<,>/ɪkˌsperɪˈmentl/<,>/ɪkˌspɛrəˈmɛntl/<,>adj.实验的/adj.试验的<,>This is an experimental treatment for cancer.<,>这是一种实验性的癌症治疗方法。<,>The band's new sound is still experimental.<,>乐队的新声音仍在试验阶段。<,>The experimental results were promising.<,>实验结果很有希望。<,>experiment(实验)+al(的)→实验的<,>experience(n.经验/v.体验)/expert(n.专家)

loosen<,>/ˈluːsn/<,>/ˈlusən/<,>vt.解开/vt.放松/vt.松弛<,>He loosened his tie after work.<,>下班后他松开了领带。<,>This medicine will help loosen your cough.<,>这种药会缓解你的咳嗽。<,>She loosened the soil before planting.<,>她在种植前松了土。<,>loose(松的)+en(使)→使变松<,>lose(v.丢失)/loss(n.损失)

rent<,>/rent/<,>/rɛnt/<,>v.租借/v.租用/v.出租/v.出借/n.租金/n.出租<,>We rent an apartment in the city center.<,>我们在市中心租了一套公寓。<,>The rent is due on the first of each month.<,>租金每月一号到期。<,>He rents out his garage as storage space.<,>他把车库出租作为储藏空间。<,>run(跑)+t→跑腿找房子→租借<,>tent(n.帐篷)/rend(v.撕裂)

nearby<,>/ˌnɪəˈbaɪ/<,>/ˈnɪrˌbaɪ/<,>adv.在附近/adj.附近的<,>There's a grocery store nearby.<,>附近有家杂货店。<,>We visited the nearby museum.<,>我们参观了附近的博物馆。<,>She lives in a nearby town.<,>她住在附近的小镇上。<,>near(近的)+by(在旁边)→在旁边近的→附近的<,>nearly(adv.几乎)/nearness(n.接近)

carpenter<,>/ˈkɑːpəntə(r)/<,>/ˈkɑrpəntər/<,>n.木工/n.木匠<,>The carpenter built a beautiful bookshelf.<,>木匠做了一个漂亮的书架。<,>He apprenticed with a master carpenter.<,>他跟一位木匠大师傅学徒。<,>Carpenters work with wood and tools.<,>木匠用木材和工具工作。<,>car(车)+pent(篷)+er→造车篷的人→木匠<,>carpet(n.地毯)/canter(n.慢跑/v.慢跑)
cart<,>/kɑːt/<,>/kɑːrt/<,>n.运货马车<,>He loaded the cart with fresh vegetables.<,>他把新鲜的蔬菜装上了马车。<,>The horse pulled the cart along the dirt road.<,>马拉着马车沿着土路前进。<,>We used a cart to transport the goods to the market.<,>我们用马车把货物运到市场。<,>car(车)+t(小)→小车→运货马车<,>card(n.卡片)/carton(n.纸板箱)/caret(n.插入符号)  

modest<,>/ˈmɒdɪst/<,>/ˈmɑːdɪst/<,>adj.谦虚的/adj.适中的/adj.羞怯的<,>She is very modest about her achievements.<,>她对自己的成就非常谦虚。<,>They live in a modest house in the suburbs.<,>他们住在郊区一栋适中的房子里。<,>He gave a modest smile when complimented.<,>受到称赞时他羞怯地笑了笑。<,>mod(方式)+est(最高级)→最合适的方式→适中的<,>modify(v.修改)/modern(adj.现代的)/mode(n.模式)  

cast<,>/kɑːst/<,>/kæst/<,>vt.投/vt.扔/vt.抛/vt.浇铸/n.演员表/n.全体演员/n.石膏绷带/n.铸型/n.铸件/n.投/n.抛<,>He cast the fishing line into the water.<,>他把钓鱼线抛入水中。<,>The doctor put a cast on his broken arm.<,>医生给他骨折的手臂打上了石膏。<,>The movie has an all-star cast.<,>这部电影有全明星阵容。<,>cat(猫)+s(蛇)→猫蛇一起表演→演员表<,>caste(n.种姓)/cost(n.成本)/cart(n.马车)  

anxious<,>/ˈæŋkʃəs/<,>/ˈæŋkʃəs/<,>adj.忧虑的/adj.令人焦急的/adj.渴望的<,>She was anxious about her exam results.<,>她对考试成绩感到忧虑。<,>The anxious parents waited for news of their missing child.<,>焦急的父母等待着失踪孩子的消息。<,>He is anxious to start his new job.<,>他渴望开始他的新工作。<,>anx(痛苦)+ious(形容词后缀)→痛苦的→忧虑的<,>anger(n.愤怒)/anguish(n.极度痛苦)/analogous(adj.类似的)  

hatred<,>/ˈheɪtrɪd/<,>/ˈheɪtrɪd/<,>n.憎恶/n.憎恨/n.仇恨<,>His eyes burned with hatred for his enemy.<,>他的眼中燃烧着对敌人的仇恨。<,>She felt a deep hatred towards injustice.<,>她对不公正现象怀有深深的憎恶。<,>Years of conflict fueled mutual hatred between the two groups.<,>多年的冲突加剧了两派之间的相互憎恨。<,>hat(帽子)+red(红色)→红帽子→象征仇恨<,>hate(v.憎恨)/heat(n.热量)/hasten(v.加速)  

crush<,>/krʌʃ/<,>/krʌʃ/<,>vt.压碎/vt.碾碎/vt.摧毁/vt.压垮<,>She accidentally crushed the glass with her foot.<,>她不小心用脚踩碎了玻璃杯。<,>The machine crushes rocks into gravel.<,>这台机器把石头碾碎成砂砾。<,>The loss of his business crushed him emotionally.<,>生意失败使他精神崩溃。<,>c(压)+rush(冲)→冲压→压碎<,>crash(v.碰撞)/brush(n.刷子)/hush(v.安静)  

largely<,>/ˈlɑːdʒli/<,>/ˈlɑːrdʒli/<,>adv.大部分/adv.大量地<,>The success was largely due to teamwork.<,>成功很大程度上归功于团队合作。<,>The forest is largely composed of pine trees.<,>这片森林大部分由松树组成。<,>He largely ignored the criticism.<,>他基本上无视了那些批评。<,>large(大的)+ly(副词后缀)→大部分地<,>largess(n.慷慨赠与)/larger(adj.更大的)/larder(n.食品储藏室)  

slice<,>/slaɪs/<,>/slaɪs/<,>n.薄片/n.切片/n.部分/vt.切/vt.削<,>She cut a thin slice of bread.<,>她切了一片薄面包。<,>He sliced the apple into quarters.<,>他把苹果切成四瓣。<,>A large slice of the budget goes to education.<,>预算的一大部分用于教育。<,>s(蛇)+lice(虱子)→蛇和虱子都要切片<,>splice(v.拼接)/slick(adj.光滑的)/slime(n.黏液)  

frost<,>/frɒst/<,>/frɔːst/<,>v.结霜/n.冰冻/n.严寒/n.霜<,>The grass was covered with frost this morning.<,>今早草地上覆盖着霜。<,>The windows frosted over during the cold night.<,>寒冷的夜晚窗户上结满了霜。<,>We need to protect the plants from frost.<,>我们需要保护植物免受霜冻。<,>f(飞)+rost(rost是德语"休息")→飞来的休息→霜冻使植物休息<,>forest(n.森林)/froth(n.泡沫)/front(n.前面)  

electron<,>/ɪˈlektrɒn/<,>/ɪˈlektrɑːn/<,>n.电子<,>Electrons orbit the nucleus of an atom.<,>电子围绕原子核运行。<,>The flow of electrons creates an electric current.<,>电子的流动产生电流。<,>This microscope can detect single electrons.<,>这台显微镜可以检测单个电子。<,>electr(电)+on(基本粒子)→电子<,>proton(n.质子)/neutron(n.中子)/photon(n.光子)
incline<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>/ɪnˈklaɪn/<,>v.倾斜/v.弯/v.倾向于/n.斜坡<,>The road inclines sharply at this point.<,>道路在这里急剧倾斜。<,>She inclined her head in agreement.<,>她点头表示同意。<,>I'm inclined to believe his story.<,>我倾向于相信他的说法。<,>in(向内)+cline(倾斜)→向内倾斜→倾向于<,>decline(v.下降/v.婉拒)/recline(v.斜靠)/inclusion(n.包含)  

truly<,>/ˈtruːli/<,>/ˈtruːli/<,>adv.真正地/adv.忠实地<,>I truly appreciate your help.<,>我真心感谢你的帮助。<,>She spoke truly from the heart.<,>她真诚地说出了心里话。<,>This is truly a remarkable achievement.<,>这确实是一项非凡的成就。<,>true(真实的)+ly(副词后缀)→真实地<,>truthfully(adv.诚实地)/loyally(adv.忠诚地)/genuinely(adv.真正地)  

cash<,>/kæʃ/<,>/kæʃ/<,>n.现金/n.现款/vt.把…兑现<,>Do you have enough cash for the taxi?<,>你有足够的现金付出租车费吗？<,>I need to cash this check at the bank.<,>我需要去银行兑现这张支票。<,>The store only accepts cash payments.<,>这家店只接受现金支付。<,>联想：ca(擦)+sh(刷)→擦刷卡取现金<,>cache(n.隐藏处)/dash(v.猛冲)/crash(v.碰撞)  

counsel<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsl/<,>n.律师/n.法律顾问/n.忠告/vt.劝告<,>The counsel for the defense made a strong argument.<,>辩护律师提出了有力的论点。<,>She counseled him to think carefully before deciding.<,>她劝他在做决定前仔细考虑。<,>I sought counsel from my mentor.<,>我向导师寻求建议。<,>count(计算)+sel(选择)→计算选择→建议<,>council(n.委员会)/consult(v.咨询)/console(v.安慰)  

item<,>/ˈaɪtəm/<,>/ˈaɪtəm/<,>n.条/n.条款/n.一条<,>Please check each item on the list.<,>请核对清单上的每一项。<,>The contract has several important items.<,>合同中有几个重要条款。<,>She bought several items of clothing.<,>她买了几件衣服。<,>it(它)+em(东西)→它是一个东西→条目<,>atom(n.原子)/idem(同上)/iter(重复)  

gene<,>/dʒiːn/<,>/dʒiːn/<,>n.基因<,>Scientists have identified the gene responsible for this disease.<,>科学家已经确定了导致这种疾病的基因。<,>Eye color is determined by genes.<,>眼睛的颜色由基因决定。<,>Gene therapy offers new hope for treatment.<,>基因疗法为治疗带来了新希望。<,>gen(产生)+e→产生特征的→基因<,>genre(n.类型)/genius(n.天才)/genuine(adj.真正的)  

liver<,>/ˈlɪvə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪvər/<,>n.肝<,>Excessive alcohol can damage your liver.<,>过量饮酒会损害肝脏。<,>Liver is a rich source of iron.<,>肝脏是铁质的丰富来源。<,>The doctor checked his liver function.<,>医生检查了他的肝功能。<,>live(生活)+r→维持生命的器官→肝脏<,>lever(n.杠杆)/lover(n.爱人)/livor(n.尸斑)  

suicide<,>/ˈsuːɪsaɪd/<,>/ˈsuːɪsaɪd/<,>n&v.自杀<,>The novel explores the theme of suicide.<,>这部小说探讨了自杀的主题。<,>He attempted suicide last year.<,>他去年曾试图自杀。<,>Suicide rates have increased in recent years.<,>近年来自杀率有所上升。<,>sui(自己)+cide(杀)→自我杀戮→自杀<,>homicide(n.杀人)/pesticide(n.杀虫剂)/genocide(n.种族灭绝)  

violet<,>/ˈvaɪələt/<,>/ˈvaɪələt/<,>adj.紫色的/n.紫罗兰<,>She wore a beautiful violet dress.<,>她穿了一件漂亮的紫色连衣裙。<,>Violets are blooming in the garden.<,>花园里紫罗兰盛开着。<,>The sunset painted the sky violet.<,>夕阳把天空染成了紫色。<,>vio(暴力)+let(小)→暴力的小花→紫罗兰(传说中紫罗兰是暴力所致)<,>violent(adj.暴力的)/violin(n.小提琴)/viral(adj.病毒的)  

hollow<,>/ˈhɒləʊ/<,>/ˈhɑːloʊ/<,>adj.空的/adj.空洞的/adj.沉闷的/adj.虚伪的<,>The tree trunk was hollow inside.<,>树干里面是空的。<,>His apology sounded hollow.<,>他的道歉听起来很虚伪。<,>We heard a hollow sound from the cave.<,>我们听到洞穴里传来空洞的声音。<,>hol(洞)+low(低)→低处的洞→空的<,>hallow(v.使神圣)/follow(v.跟随)/holler(v.喊叫)
trunk<,>/trʌŋk/<,>/trʌŋk/<,>n.树干/n.大衣箱，皮箱/n.汽车后备箱/n.象鼻<,>The elephant used its trunk to pick up the fruit.<,>大象用它的鼻子捡起了水果。<,>She packed all her clothes into a large trunk.<,>她把所有的衣服都装进了一个大皮箱。<,>The car's trunk was filled with groceries.<,>汽车的后备箱里装满了杂货。<,>trunk(树干)→像树干一样粗壮的东西→象鼻<,>truck(n.卡车)/drunk(adj.喝醉的)/trick(n.诡计)  

saving<,>/ˈseɪvɪŋ/<,>/ˈseɪvɪŋ/<,>n.节省，节约/n.储蓄金，存款<,>Switching to LED bulbs results in significant energy saving.<,>改用LED灯泡可以显著节省能源。<,>She has a savings account for her future expenses.<,>她有一个储蓄账户以备将来开支。<,>His frugality led to considerable savings over the years.<,>他的节俭多年来积累了可观的存款。<,>save(节约)+ing→节省的行为→储蓄金<,>savior(n.救世主)/savor(v.品尝)/salvage(v.抢救)  

rely<,>/rɪˈlaɪ/<,>/rɪˈlaɪ/<,>vi.依靠，依赖/vi.信赖，指望<,>You can rely on me to keep your secret.<,>你可以相信我保守你的秘密。<,>The project relies heavily on government funding.<,>这个项目严重依赖政府资金。<,>She relied on her intuition to make the decision.<,>她依靠直觉做出了决定。<,>re(再)+ly(绑)→反复绑住→依赖<,>reply(v.回答)/rally(v.集结)/relay(v.传递)  

hospitalize<,>/ˈhɒspɪtəlaɪz/<,>/ˈhɑːspɪtəlaɪz/<,>vt.就医<,>After the accident, they had to hospitalize him immediately.<,>事故发生后，他们不得不立即送他就医。<,>The severe flu symptoms required her to be hospitalized.<,>严重的流感症状需要她就医治疗。<,>Patients with contagious diseases are often hospitalized.<,>患有传染病的患者经常需要就医。<,>hospital(医院)+ize(动词后缀)→送医院→就医<,>hostile(adj.敌对的)/hospitable(adj.好客的)/hostel(n.旅社)  

slide<,>/slaɪd/<,>/slaɪd/<,>v.滑/v.悄悄地移动/n.滑动/n.滑道，滑面/n.幻灯片<,>The children love to slide down the hill on sleds.<,>孩子们喜欢乘雪橇滑下山坡。<,>She slid the document across the table to him.<,>她把文件滑过桌子递给他。<,>The presentation included several slides with charts.<,>演示文稿中包含几张带有图表的幻灯片。<,>sl(滑)+ide→滑动动作→滑道<,>glide(v.滑翔)/slit(n.裂缝)/slice(n.薄片)  

utilize<,>/ˈjuːtɪlaɪz/<,>/ˈjuːtəlaɪz/<,>vt.利用<,>We should utilize solar energy more efficiently.<,>我们应该更高效地利用太阳能。<,>The old factory was utilized as a community center.<,>旧工厂被利用作为社区中心。<,>He utilized his connections to get the job.<,>他利用自己的人脉得到了这份工作。<,>util(用)+ize(动词后缀)→使用→利用<,>utility(n.效用)/utensil(n.器具)/futile(adj.无效的)  

sticky<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>/ˈstɪki/<,>adj.黏性的，胶黏的/adj.湿热的<,>The tape became sticky in the hot weather.<,>胶带在炎热的天气里变得黏糊糊的。<,>August in Tokyo is notoriously sticky and humid.<,>东京的八月以湿热著称。<,>Her fingers were sticky from eating cotton candy.<,>她的手指因为吃棉花糖而黏黏的。<,>stick(粘)+y(形容词后缀)→黏性的<,>slick(adj.光滑的)/tricky(adj.狡猾的)/stocky(adj.矮壮的)  

prevail<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>/prɪˈveɪl/<,>vi.流行，盛行<,>A sense of optimism prevailed after the election.<,>选举后乐观情绪盛行。<,>This custom still prevails in rural areas.<,>这个习俗在农村地区仍然盛行。<,>Justice will prevail in the end.<,>正义终将获胜。<,>pre(前)+vail(价值)→价值在前→盛行<,>prevent(v.防止)/reveal(v.揭示)/avail(v.有益于)  

waist<,>/weɪst/<,>/weɪst/<,>n.腰，腰部<,>She tied a colorful sash around her waist.<,>她在腰间系了一条彩色腰带。<,>The dress was fitted at the waist.<,>这件连衣裙在腰部很合身。<,>He put his hands on his waist and sighed.<,>他把手放在腰上叹了口气。<,>waist(腰)→身体中间部位→腰部<,>waste(n.废物)/wrist(n.手腕)/waiter(n.服务员)  

excessive<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>/ɪkˈsesɪv/<,>adj.过多的，极度的<,>Excessive sugar consumption is bad for health.<,>过量摄入糖分对健康有害。<,>The police used excessive force during the arrest.<,>警方在逮捕过程中使用了过度武力。<,>She showed excessive enthusiasm for the project.<,>她对那个项目表现出过度的热情。<,>ex(出)+cess(走)+ive→走出去太多→过度的<,>successive(adj.连续的)/accessive(adj.可接近的)/recessive(adj.隐性的)
flesh<,>/flɛʃ/<,>/flɛʃ/<,>n.肉/n.肌肉/n.肉体<,>He cut the flesh from the bone.<,>他把肉从骨头上切下来。<,>The flesh of the fruit was sweet and juicy.<,>果肉香甜多汁。<,>She was more than just a pretty face; she had strength of flesh and spirit.<,>她不仅仅是外表漂亮，她的肉体和精神都很强大。<,>flesh(肉)与fresh(新鲜的)发音相似，但意思不同<,>meat(n.食用肉)/muscle(n.肌肉)/body(n.身体)

jungle<,>/ˈdʒʌŋɡl/<,>/ˈdʒʌŋɡəl/<,>n.丛林/n.密林/n.莽丛/n.乱七八糟的一堆<,>The explorers hacked their way through the dense jungle.<,>探险者们在茂密的丛林中开辟出一条路。<,>His desk was a jungle of papers and books.<,>他的书桌乱七八糟堆满了文件和书籍。<,>The jungle is home to many exotic animals.<,>丛林是许多珍奇动物的家园。<,>jung(谐音"壮")+le→壮观的丛林<,>forest(n.森林)/woods(n.树林)/tangle(n.混乱的一团)

portion<,>/ˈpɔːʃn/<,>/ˈpɔːrʃn/<,>n.一部分/n.一份/vt.分配/vt.把...分给<,>She only ate a small portion of the meal.<,>她只吃了一小部分饭菜。<,>The money was portioned out equally among the children.<,>钱被平均分配给了孩子们。<,>A large portion of the budget was spent on education.<,>预算的一大部分用于教育。<,>port(部分)+ion→一部分<,>part(n.部分)/share(n.份额)/allot(v.分配)

settle<,>/ˈsetl/<,>/ˈsɛtl/<,>v.安排/v.安放/v.调停/v.支付/v.核算/v.安家/v.飞落/v.停留/v.安定<,>They settled their differences peacefully.<,>他们和平解决了分歧。<,>She settled in a small village after retirement.<,>退休后她在一个小村庄安了家。<,>The dust slowly settled on the furniture.<,>灰尘慢慢落在家具上。<,>set(放置)+tle→安放<,>solve(v.解决)/reside(v.居住)/deposit(v.沉淀)

pattern<,>/ˈpætn/<,>/ˈpætərn/<,>n.型/n.式样/n.模型/vt.仿制/vt.使照...样子<,>The wallpaper had a floral pattern.<,>墙纸上有花卉图案。<,>She patterned her behavior after her mentor.<,>她模仿导师的行为方式。<,>The weather pattern has been unusual this year.<,>今年的天气模式很不寻常。<,>pat(拍)+tern→拍出模式<,>model(n.模型)/design(n.设计)/imitate(v.模仿)

harsh<,>/hɑːʃ/<,>/hɑːrʃ/<,>adj.严厉的/adj.粗糙的<,>The teacher's harsh criticism upset the student.<,>老师严厉的批评让学生很沮丧。<,>The fabric felt harsh against her skin.<,>这种布料摸起来很粗糙。<,>The desert climate is harsh and unforgiving.<,>沙漠气候严酷无情。<,>har(谐音"哈")+sh→哈，好严厉<,>strict(adj.严格的)/rough(adj.粗糙的)/severe(adj.严峻的)

connexion<,>/kəˈnekʃn/<,>/kəˈnɛkʃən/<,>n.connection的英式拼法<,>He has strong connexions in the business world.<,>他在商界有很强的人脉关系。<,>There is a direct connexion between the two events.<,>这两个事件之间有直接联系。<,>The train connexion was delayed by an hour.<,>火车换乘晚点了一小时。<,>con(共同)+nex(连接)+ion→连接<,>connection(美式拼法)/link(n.链接)/relationship(n.关系)

vehicle<,>/ˈviːəkl/<,>/ˈviːhɪkl/<,>n.车辆/n.机动车/n.传播媒介/n.工具/n.手段<,>The city is trying to reduce vehicle emissions.<,>该市正努力减少车辆排放。<,>Television is a powerful vehicle for advertising.<,>电视是强有力的广告媒介。<,>Art can be a vehicle for social change.<,>艺术可以成为社会变革的工具。<,>vehi(运载)+cle→运载工具<,>car(n.汽车)/medium(n.媒介)/instrument(n.工具)

scrape<,>/skreɪp/<,>/skreɪp/<,>v.刮/v.擦/n.刮/n.擦/n.刮擦声<,>She scraped the mud off her shoes.<,>她刮掉了鞋子上的泥。<,>I heard a scrape as the chair moved across the floor.<,>我听到椅子在地板上移动的刮擦声。<,>He barely scraped through the exam.<,>他勉强通过了考试。<,>sc(谐音"撕")+rape(强奸)→撕扯刮擦<,>scratch(v.抓挠)/rub(v.摩擦)/abrade(v.磨损)

hardship<,>/ˈhɑːdʃɪp/<,>/ˈhɑːrdʃɪp/<,>n.艰难/n.困苦<,>The family endured many hardships during the war.<,>这个家庭在战争期间经历了许多艰难困苦。<,>Financial hardship forced him to drop out of school.<,>经济困难迫使他辍学。<,>Overcoming hardship builds character.<,>克服困难能塑造性格。<,>hard(艰难)+ship(状态)→艰难状态<,>difficulty(n.困难)/suffering(n.苦难)/adversity(n.逆境)
confuse<,>/kənˈfjuːz/<,>/kənˈfjuːz/<,>vt.使困惑/vt.把...弄糊涂/vt.混淆/vt.把...混同/vt.混乱/vt.搞乱<,>The instructions confused me.<,>这些说明让我很困惑。<,>Don't confuse the twins.<,>别把这对双胞胎搞混了。<,>He confused the dates of the meetings.<,>他把会议日期搞混了。<,>con(共同)+fuse(流)→流到一起→混淆<,>refuse(v.拒绝/n.垃圾)/diffuse(v.扩散/adj.分散的)/infuse(v.注入/v.泡制)

cushion<,>/ˈkʊʃn/<,>/ˈkʊʃən/<,>n.垫子/n.坐垫/n.靠垫<,>She sat on the cushion.<,>她坐在垫子上。<,>The sofa has soft cushions.<,>沙发上有柔软的靠垫。<,>He put a cushion behind his back.<,>他在背后放了个靠垫。<,>cush(软垫)+ion(名词后缀)→垫子<,>cousin(n.表兄弟/n.堂姐妹)/cushy(adj.轻松的/adj.舒适的)

scold<,>/skəʊld/<,>/skoʊld/<,>v.责骂/v.训斥<,>The teacher scolded the noisy students.<,>老师训斥了吵闹的学生。<,>His mother scolded him for breaking the vase.<,>他妈妈因为他打碎花瓶而责骂他。<,>Don't scold the child too harshly.<,>不要太过严厉地责骂孩子。<,>s(加强语气)+cold(冷)→冷言冷语→责骂<,>scald(v.烫伤/n.烫伤)/scowl(v.怒视/n.怒容)

glorious<,>/ˈɡlɔːriəs/<,>/ˈɡlɔːriəs/<,>adj.光荣的/adj.壮丽的/adj.令人愉快的<,>It was a glorious victory.<,>这是一场光荣的胜利。<,>The sunset was glorious.<,>日落非常壮丽。<,>We had a glorious time at the beach.<,>我们在海滩度过了愉快的时光。<,>glory(光荣)+ous(形容词后缀)→光荣的<,>gorgeous(adj.华丽的/adj.极好的)/laborious(adj.费力的/adj.勤劳的)

civilize<,>/ˈsɪvəlaɪz/<,>/ˈsɪvəˌlaɪz/<,>vt.使文明/vt.使开化/vt.教育<,>They tried to civilize the native tribes.<,>他们试图教化土著部落。<,>Education helps to civilize people.<,>教育有助于教化人们。<,>The Romans civilized much of Europe.<,>罗马人开化了欧洲大部分地区。<,>civil(文明的)+ize(使...化)→使文明<,>civilian(n.平民/adj.民用的)/civilization(n.文明/n.文化)

physician<,>/fɪˈzɪʃn/<,>/fɪˈzɪʃən/<,>n.内科医生<,>She is a physician at the local hospital.<,>她是当地医院的内科医生。<,>The physician examined the patient carefully.<,>内科医生仔细检查了病人。<,>You should see a physician for your stomach problem.<,>你应该去看内科医生治疗胃病。<,>physic(医学)+ian(人)→医生<,>physicist(n.物理学家)/physical(adj.身体的/adj.物理的)

architecture<,>/ˈɑːkɪtektʃə(r)/<,>/ˈɑːrkɪtektʃər/<,>n.建筑学/n.建筑式样/n.建筑风格<,>He studied architecture in college.<,>他在大学学习建筑学。<,>The architecture of this building is unique.<,>这座建筑的风格很独特。<,>Gothic architecture is very impressive.<,>哥特式建筑非常壮观。<,>arch(主要的)+tect(建造)+ure(名词后缀)→建筑<,>architect(n.建筑师)/archaeology(n.考古学)

stress<,>/stres/<,>/stres/<,>n.压力/n.强调/n.重要性/n.应力/n.重音/vt.强调/vt.着重/vt.重读<,>Too much stress is bad for your health.<,>压力太大对健康有害。<,>The teacher stressed the importance of practice.<,>老师强调了练习的重要性。<,>You should stress the first syllable in this word.<,>你应该重读这个单词的第一个音节。<,>s(加强)+tress(拉紧)→压力<,>distress(n.痛苦/vt.使痛苦)/press(v.压/n.新闻)

grip<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>/ɡrɪp/<,>v.握紧/v.抓牢/v.吸引住/n.紧握<,>He gripped the railing tightly.<,>他紧紧抓住栏杆。<,>The movie gripped the audience.<,>这部电影吸引了观众。<,>She has a firm grip on the situation.<,>她对局势有很好的掌控。<,>gr(抓)+ip(小)→抓紧<,>gripe(v.抱怨/n.牢骚)/grit(n.砂砾/v.咬牙)

explore<,>/ɪkˈsplɔː(r)/<,>/ɪkˈsplɔːr/<,>vt.探险/vt.探索/vt.仔细查阅/vt.探究<,>They explored the ancient ruins.<,>他们探索了古代遗迹。<,>Scientists are exploring new treatments.<,>科学家正在探索新的治疗方法。<,>The book explores many interesting ideas.<,>这本书探究了许多有趣的观点。<,>ex(出)+plore(流出)→探索<,>explode(v.爆炸)/exploit(v.开发/v.剥削)
display<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>/dɪˈspleɪ/<,>vt.陈列/vt.展览/vt.显示<,>The museum will display the artist's latest works.<,>博物馆将展出这位艺术家的最新作品。<,>She displayed great courage during the crisis.<,>她在危机中表现出极大的勇气。<,>The screen displays the current temperature.<,>屏幕上显示当前温度。<,>dis(分开)+play(播放)→分开播放→展示<,>disclose(vt.揭露)/dispose(vt.处理)/displace(vt.取代)  

electricity<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɪsəti/<,>/ɪˌlekˈtrɪsəti/<,>n.电<,>This machine runs on electricity.<,>这台机器靠电力运行。<,>The storm cut off electricity to thousands of homes.<,>暴风雨导致数千户家庭断电。<,>He studies electricity and magnetism.<,>他研究电和磁。<,>electr(电的)+icity(名词后缀)→电<,>electronic(adj.电子的)/electric(adj.电的)/electrode(n.电极)  

climate<,>/ˈklaɪmət/<,>/ˈklaɪmət/<,>n.气候/n.风土/n.地带/n.风气/n.气氛<,>The climate here is mild all year round.<,>这里的气候全年温和。<,>We need to address climate change urgently.<,>我们需要紧急应对气候变化。<,>The political climate is tense before the election.<,>选举前的政治气氛很紧张。<,>cli(倾斜)+mate(伙伴)→地球倾斜造成的伙伴→气候<,>weather(n.天气)/temperature(n.温度)/environment(n.环境)  

conductor<,>/kənˈdʌktə(r)/<,>/kənˈdʌktər/<,>n.售票员/n.列车长/n.指挥/n.导体<,>The conductor checked everyone's tickets.<,>售票员检查了每个人的票。<,>Copper is a good conductor of electricity.<,>铜是良好的导电体。<,>The orchestra followed the conductor's lead.<,>管弦乐队跟随指挥的引导。<,>con(共同)+duct(引导)+or(人)→引导者<,>semiconductor(n.半导体)/insulator(n.绝缘体)/rector(n.教区长)  

bore<,>/bɔː(r)/<,>/bɔːr/<,>vt.使厌烦/vt.钻/vt.挖/n.令人讨厌的人<,>His long speech bored the audience.<,>他冗长的演讲让观众感到厌烦。<,>They bore a hole through the wall.<,>他们在墙上钻了一个洞。<,>Don't be such a bore at parties.<,>别在聚会上这么扫兴。<,>bore(钻)→钻孔让人烦→使厌烦<,>bored(adj.无聊的)/boring(adj.令人厌烦的)/boar(n.野猪)  

crust<,>/krʌst/<,>/krʌst/<,>n.面包皮/n.硬外皮/n.外壳/n.地壳<,>I like the crust of the bread the most.<,>我最喜欢面包的外皮。<,>The Earth's crust is constantly moving.<,>地壳在不断运动。<,>There was a crust of ice on the pond.<,>池塘上结了一层冰。<,>crust(壳)→像壳一样硬→硬外皮<,>crusty(adj.有硬壳的)/crustacean(n.甲壳类动物)/trust(n.信任)  

disorder<,>/dɪsˈɔːdə(r)/<,>/dɪsˈɔːrdər/<,>n.混乱/n.杂乱/n.骚乱<,>The room was in complete disorder.<,>房间一片混乱。<,>Eating disorders are serious health problems.<,>饮食失调是严重的健康问题。<,>The protest led to public disorder.<,>抗议引发了公众骚乱。<,>dis(否定)+order(顺序)→没有顺序→混乱<,>order(n.顺序)/disarray(n.混乱)/disorganized(adj.无组织的)  

criticize<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsaɪz/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsaɪz/<,>vt.批评/vt.评论/vt.非难<,>She criticized his careless mistakes.<,>她批评了他粗心的错误。<,>The film was criticized for its violence.<,>这部电影因暴力场面受到批评。<,>He criticized the government's new policy.<,>他批评了政府的新政策。<,>crit(判断)+icize(动词后缀)→做出判断→批评<,>critic(n.批评家)/criticism(n.批评)/critical(adj.批评的)  

organization<,>/ˌɔːɡənaɪˈzeɪʃn/<,>/ˌɔːrɡənəˈzeɪʃn/<,>n.组织/n.团体/n.机构<,>She works for a charitable organization.<,>她为一个慈善机构工作。<,>The organization of the event was flawless.<,>活动的组织工作完美无缺。<,>He joined a professional organization.<,>他加入了一个专业团体。<,>organ(器官)+ization(名词后缀)→像器官一样运作→组织<,>organize(vt.组织)/organ(n.器官)/organism(n.有机体)  

rage<,>/reɪdʒ/<,>/reɪdʒ/<,>vi.狂吹/vi.汹涌/vi.激烈进行/vi.发怒/n.狂怒/n.盛怒/n.时尚<,>The storm raged all night.<,>暴风雨肆虐了一整夜。<,>He flew into a rage when he heard the news.<,>他听到消息后勃然大怒。<,>This hairstyle was all the rage last year.<,>这种发型去年风靡一时。<,>rage(愤怒)→像愤怒一样猛烈→狂吹<,>outrage(n.愤怒)/enrage(vt.激怒)/rampage(n.暴怒)
width<,>/wɪdθ/<,>/wɪdθ/<,>n.宽阔/n.广阔/n.宽度<,>The width of the river is about 20 meters.<,>这条河的宽度大约是20米。<,>She measured the width of the table.<,>她测量了桌子的宽度。<,>The road has a width of four lanes.<,>这条路的宽度有四车道。<,>wide(宽的)+th(名词后缀)→宽度<,>breadth(n.宽度)/widen(v.加宽)/widespread(adj.广泛的)  

dairy<,>/ˈdeəri/<,>/ˈderi/<,>adj.乳制品的/n.牛奶场/n.乳制品<,>She works at a local dairy farm.<,>她在当地的奶牛场工作。<,>I prefer dairy products like milk and cheese.<,>我更喜欢牛奶和奶酪这样的乳制品。<,>He is allergic to dairy.<,>他对乳制品过敏。<,>dair(牛奶)+y(场所)→牛奶场<,>diary(n.日记)/daily(adj.每日的)/daisy(n.雏菊)  

board<,>/bɔːd/<,>/bɔrd/<,>vi.搭伙/vi.膳宿/n.板/n.牌子/n.木板/n.纸板/n.委员会/n.董事会/n.伙食/vt.上<,>He nailed the board to the wall.<,>他把木板钉在墙上。<,>The board of directors will meet tomorrow.<,>董事会明天开会。<,>She boards at a local school.<,>她在当地学校寄宿。<,>b(木板)+oar(桨)+d→像桨一样的木板→板<,>aboard(adv.在船上)/broad(adj.宽阔的)/border(n.边界)  

economic<,>/ˌiːkəˈnɒmɪk/<,>/ˌɛkəˈnɑmɪk/<,>adj.经济的/adj.经济学的/n.经济学/n.经济状况<,>The country is facing economic challenges.<,>这个国家正面临经济挑战。<,>She studied economic theory in college.<,>她在大学学习了经济理论。<,>The economic growth has slowed down.<,>经济增长已经放缓。<,>eco(家)+nom(管理)+ic→管理家庭的→经济的<,>economy(n.经济)/economical(adj.节约的)/economics(n.经济学)  

stuff<,>/stʌf/<,>/stʌf/<,>n.材料/n.东西/vt.装/vt.填/vt.塞/vt.让…吃饱<,>She stuffed the turkey with herbs.<,>她用香草填塞火鸡。<,>There's a lot of stuff in this box.<,>这个盒子里有很多东西。<,>He stuffed himself with pizza.<,>他吃披萨吃得很饱。<,>st(站立)+uff(填充)→填充站立的东西→填塞<,>staff(n.员工)/stiff(adj.僵硬的)/snuff(n.鼻烟)  

arrest<,>/əˈrest/<,>/əˈrɛst/<,>vt.逮捕/vt.拘留/vt.停止/vt.阻止/vt.吸引/n.逮捕/n.拘留/n.扣留<,>The police arrested the suspect.<,>警察逮捕了嫌疑人。<,>The new drug can arrest the spread of the disease.<,>这种新药可以阻止疾病的传播。<,>Her beauty arrested his attention.<,>她的美貌吸引了他的注意。<,>ar(加强)+rest(休息)→强制休息→逮捕<,>assert(v.断言)/asset(n.资产)/assent(v.同意)  

widow<,>/ˈwɪdəʊ/<,>/ˈwɪdoʊ/<,>n.寡妇<,>The widow lived alone after her husband's death.<,>丈夫去世后，这位寡妇独自生活。<,>She became a widow at a young age.<,>她年纪轻轻就成了寡妇。<,>The novel tells the story of a wealthy widow.<,>这部小说讲述了一个富有寡妇的故事。<,>wid(分开)+ow(人)→与丈夫分开的人→寡妇<,>window(n.窗户)/widower(n.鳏夫)/widen(v.加宽)  

distinction<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkʃn/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkʃən/<,>n.差别/n.不同/n.区分<,>There is a clear distinction between the two theories.<,>这两种理论之间有明显的区别。<,>She graduated with distinction.<,>她以优异的成绩毕业。<,>He made a distinction between right and wrong.<,>他区分了是非。<,>dis(分开)+tinct(标记)+ion→分开标记→区分<,>extinction(n.灭绝)/instinct(n.本能)/distinct(adj.不同的)  

mature<,>/məˈtʃʊə(r)/<,>/məˈtʃʊr/<,>adj.成熟的/adj.成年人的/adj.深思熟虑的/adj.到期的/adj.应支付的/vt.使成熟<,>She is very mature for her age.<,>就她的年龄而言，她非常成熟。<,>The wine needs time to mature.<,>这酒需要时间成熟。<,>He made a mature decision after careful thought.<,>经过仔细思考，他做出了一个成熟的决策。<,>mat(成熟)+ure(状态)→成熟的状态→成熟的<,>immature(adj.不成熟的)/nature(n.自然)/manure(n.肥料)  

navy<,>/ˈneɪvi/<,>/ˈneɪvi/<,>n.海军<,>He served in the navy for ten years.<,>他在海军服役了十年。<,>The navy protects the country's coast.<,>海军保护国家的海岸。<,>She joined the navy after college.<,>大学毕业后她加入了海军。<,>nav(船)+y(集体)→船的集体→海军<,>naval(adj.海军的)/navigate(v.航行)/navel(n.肚脐)
fee<,>/fiː/<,>/fiː/<,>n.费/n.酬金/n.赏金<,>The entrance fee for the museum is $10.<,>博物馆的入场费是10美元。<,>He received a hefty fee for his legal services.<,>他因法律服务获得了一笔丰厚的酬金。<,>There's a small fee for parking here.<,>这里停车要收一小笔费用。<,>fee和free(免费)发音相似，但fee是收费<,>fare(n.车费)/fine(n.罚款)/feeble(adj.虚弱的)

section<,>/ˈsekʃn/<,>/ˈsɛkʃən/<,>n.部分/n.章节/n.部门/n.科/n.截面/n.剖面<,>Please read section three of the manual.<,>请阅读手册的第三章。<,>She works in the finance section of the company.<,>她在公司的财务部门工作。<,>The cross-section shows the internal structure.<,>这个横截面显示了内部结构。<,>sect(切)+ion→切出来的部分<,>segment(n.部分)/portion(n.部分)/fraction(n.小部分)

influence<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>/ˈɪnfluəns/<,>n.影响/n.作用/n.影响力/n.势力/n.产生影响力的人/vt.影响<,>Her teacher had a great influence on her career choice.<,>她的老师对她的职业选择有很大影响。<,>The moon's gravity influences the tides.<,>月球的引力影响潮汐。<,>He's a bad influence on younger students.<,>他对年轻学生有不良影响。<,>in(进入)+flu(流)+ence→流入→影响<,>affect(v.影响)/effect(n.效果)/impact(n.影响)

whip<,>/wɪp/<,>/wɪp/<,>vt.鞭笞/vt.猛地移动/vt.搅打成糊状/n.鞭子<,>The jockey whipped the horse to make it run faster.<,>骑师鞭打马匹让它跑得更快。<,>She whipped the cream until it was stiff.<,>她把奶油搅打至浓稠。<,>The flag was whipping in the strong wind.<,>旗帜在大风中猛烈飘动。<,>whip和ship(船)发音相似<,>whisk(v.搅拌)/lash(v.鞭打)/flog(v.鞭打)

protocol<,>/ˈprəʊtəkɒl/<,>/ˈproʊtəkɑːl/<,>n.礼仪/n.礼节/n.草案/n.议定书<,>Diplomatic protocol must be followed at state dinners.<,>国宴必须遵循外交礼仪。<,>The countries signed an environmental protocol.<,>各国签署了一份环境议定书。<,>There's a strict protocol for handling emergencies.<,>处理紧急情况有严格的规程。<,>proto(第一)+col→第一重要的东西→礼仪<,>procedure(n.程序)/etiquette(n.礼仪)/convention(n.惯例)

whale<,>/weɪl/<,>/weɪl/<,>n.鲸<,>We saw a humpback whale during our boat trip.<,>我们在乘船旅行时看到了一头座头鲸。<,>Whale watching is popular in this coastal town.<,>观鲸在这个海滨小镇很受欢迎。<,>The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth.<,>蓝鲸是地球上最大的动物。<,>whale和wail(哀号)发音相同<,>dolphin(n.海豚)/shark(n.鲨鱼)/porpoise(n.鼠海豚)

provoke<,>/prəˈvəʊk/<,>/prəˈvoʊk/<,>vt.对...挑衅/vt.激怒/vt.激起/vt.引起<,>His rude comments provoked an angry response.<,>他粗鲁的评论激起了愤怒的回应。<,>The article was designed to provoke discussion.<,>这篇文章旨在引发讨论。<,>Don't provoke the dog or it might bite you.<,>别招惹那只狗，它可能会咬你。<,>pro(向前)+voke(喊叫)→向前喊叫→挑衅<,>evoke(v.唤起)/invoke(v.援引)/revoke(v.撤销)

threaten<,>/ˈθretn/<,>/ˈθrɛtən/<,>v.威胁/v.恐吓/v.预示快要来临/v.是...的征兆/v.构成威胁/v.可能发生<,>The manager threatened to fire him if he was late again.<,>经理威胁说如果他再迟到就解雇他。<,>Dark clouds threatened rain.<,>乌云预示着要下雨了。<,>Pollution threatens marine life in this area.<,>污染威胁着这个地区的海洋生物。<,>threat(威胁)+en(使)→使威胁<,>menace(v.威胁)/intimidate(v.恐吓)/endanger(v.危及)

talent<,>/ˈtælənt/<,>/ˈtælənt/<,>n.天才/n.才能/n.人才<,>She has a remarkable talent for music.<,>她在音乐方面有非凡的天赋。<,>The company is always looking for new talent.<,>公司一直在寻找新的人才。<,>His artistic talents were evident from an early age.<,>他的艺术才能从小就很明显。<,>tal(看作tall高)+ent→高人一等→天才<,>gift(n.天赋)/genius(n.天才)/aptitude(n.才能)

percentage<,>/pəˈsentɪdʒ/<,>/pərˈsɛntɪdʒ/<,>n.百分比/n.百分率<,>What percentage of students passed the exam?<,>有多少百分比的学生通过了考试？<,>A large percentage of the population owns smartphones.<,>很大比例的人口拥有智能手机。<,>The bank charges a small percentage as service fee.<,>银行收取一小部分作为服务费。<,>per(每)+cent(百)+age→每一百的比例<,>proportion(n.比例)/ratio(n.比率)/fraction(n.分数)
negotiate<,>/nɪˈɡəʊʃieɪt/<,>/nɪˈɡoʊʃieɪt/<,>v.洽谈/v.协商/v.顺利通过/v.成功越过<,>The two companies are negotiating a new contract.<,>两家公司正在洽谈一份新合同。<,>She successfully negotiated the difficult terrain.<,>她成功越过了那片难走的地形。<,>They negotiated a peace agreement.<,>他们协商达成了一项和平协议。<,>neg(否定)+oti(空闲)+ate(动词后缀)→不空闲→忙于协商<,>navigate(v.导航/v.航行)/narrate(v.叙述/v.讲述)  

strain<,>/streɪn/<,>/streɪn/<,>v.扭伤/v.拉伤/v.尽力/v.拉紧/n.拉紧/n.过劳/n.极度紧张/n.张力/n.扭伤/n.拉伤/n.旋律/n.品种/n.家系/n.气质/n.个性特点<,>He strained his back while lifting the heavy box.<,>他抬重箱子时拉伤了背部。<,>The strain of the job caused her to feel exhausted.<,>工作的压力让她感到筋疲力尽。<,>This is a new strain of wheat developed by scientists.<,>这是科学家培育出的小麦新品种。<,>s(蛇)+train(火车)→蛇缠火车→拉紧<,>restrain(v.抑制/v.约束)/constrain(v.强迫/v.限制)  

hunt<,>/hʌnt/<,>/hʌnt/<,>v.打猎/v.搜寻/v.驱逐<,>They went hunting for deer in the forest.<,>他们去森林里猎鹿。<,>She is hunting for her lost keys.<,>她正在寻找丢失的钥匙。<,>The government is hunting down illegal immigrants.<,>政府正在驱逐非法移民。<,>谐音"汗特"→打猎出汗特别多<,>haunt(v.萦绕/v.常去)/hint(n.暗示/v.提示)  

violin<,>/ˌvaɪəˈlɪn/<,>/ˌvaɪəˈlɪn/<,>n.小提琴<,>She plays the violin in the school orchestra.<,>她在学校管弦乐队拉小提琴。<,>The sound of the violin is very beautiful.<,>小提琴的声音非常优美。<,>He has been practicing the violin for five years.<,>他练习小提琴已经有五年了。<,>vio(紫色)+lin(线)→紫色琴弦的小提琴<,>viola(n.中提琴)/cello(n.大提琴)  

remonstrate<,>/rɪˈmɒnstreɪt/<,>/rɪˈmɑːnstreɪt/<,>v.抗议<,>The workers remonstrated against the pay cuts.<,>工人们抗议减薪。<,>She remonstrated with her son about his bad behavior.<,>她就儿子的不良行为提出抗议。<,>They remonstrated the unfair decision.<,>他们对不公平的决定提出抗议。<,>re(再)+monstr(展示)+ate(动词后缀)→一再展示不满→抗议<,>demonstrate(v.证明/v.示威)/remind(v.提醒)  

package<,>/ˈpækɪdʒ/<,>/ˈpækɪdʒ/<,>n.包裹/n.包装/n.一揽子交易/vt.打包/vt.包装<,>I received a package from my friend.<,>我收到了朋友寄来的包裹。<,>The company offers a complete software package.<,>公司提供完整的软件套装。<,>She carefully packaged the fragile items.<,>她仔细地包装易碎物品。<,>pack(打包)+age(名词后缀)→包裹<,>packet(n.小包)/parcel(n.包裹)  

visible<,>/ˈvɪzəbl/<,>/ˈvɪzəbl/<,>adj.可见的/adj.看得见的/adj.有形的<,>The stars are visible in the night sky.<,>夜空中可以看到星星。<,>Her disappointment was clearly visible.<,>她的失望显而易见。<,>We need to make our efforts more visible.<,>我们需要让我们的努力更加可见。<,>vis(看)+ible(可...的)→可见的<,>invisible(adj.看不见的)/audible(adj.听得见的)  

crisis<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>/ˈkraɪsɪs/<,>n.危机/n.存亡之际/n.关键阶段<,>The country is facing an economic crisis.<,>国家正面临经济危机。<,>The patient is in a crisis situation.<,>病人处于危急状态。<,>This is a crisis of confidence in the government.<,>这是一场对政府的信任危机。<,>cri(哭)+sis(谐音"死")→哭死→危机<,>critic(n.评论家)/criticism(n.批评)  

rail<,>/reɪl/<,>/reɪl/<,>vi.责骂/vi.抱怨/n.栏杆/n.横杆/n.铁轨/n.轨道/n.铁路<,>She railed against the unfair treatment.<,>她抱怨不公平的待遇。<,>Hold onto the rail when going down the stairs.<,>下楼梯时要扶着栏杆。<,>The train runs on the rails.<,>火车在铁轨上行驶。<,>r(人)+ail(小病)→人因小病而抱怨<,>sail(v.航行/n.帆)/mail(n.邮件)  

survival<,>/səˈvaɪvl/<,>/sərˈvaɪvl/<,>n.幸存/n.幸存者/n.残存物<,>Survival in the wilderness requires special skills.<,>在野外生存需要特殊技能。<,>He was the only survival of the plane crash.<,>他是飞机失事的唯一幸存者。<,>These are survivals from ancient times.<,>这些是古代的遗存物。<,>sur(超过)+viv(活)+al(名词后缀)→超过别人活下来→幸存<,>revival(n.复兴)/arrival(n.到达)
germ<,>/dʒɜːm/<,>/dʒɜrm/<,>n.微生物/n.细菌/n.幼芽<,>Wash your hands to remove germs.<,>洗手可以去除细菌。<,>The germ of an idea grew into a successful business.<,>一个想法的萌芽发展成了一项成功的业务。<,>Seeds contain the germ of future plants.<,>种子含有未来植物的幼芽。<,>联想记忆：germ和gene(基因)有关，都与生命起源相关<,>gem(n.宝石)/germane(adj.有关的)/germinate(v.发芽)

inner<,>/ˈɪnə(r)/<,>/ˈɪnər/<,>adj.内部的/adj.内心的<,>She struggled with her inner demons.<,>她与内心的恶魔作斗争。<,>The inner workings of the machine are complex.<,>这台机器的内部构造很复杂。<,>He found inner peace through meditation.<,>他通过冥想找到了内心的平静。<,>in(里面)+er→内部的<,>inter(adj.埋藏的)/infer(v.推断)/intern(n.实习生)

market<,>/ˈmɑːkɪt/<,>/ˈmɑːrkɪt/<,>n.市场/n.股市/n.行情/n.销路<,>She went to the market to buy fresh vegetables.<,>她去市场买新鲜蔬菜。<,>The stock market crashed yesterday.<,>昨天股市暴跌。<,>There's a good market for organic products.<,>有机产品销路很好。<,>mark(标记)+et→做标记交易的地方→市场<,>mart(n.商业中心)/marker(n.标记)/marketing(n.市场营销)

keen<,>/kiːn/<,>/kin/<,>adj.热心的/adj.激烈的/adj.敏锐的/adj.敏捷的<,>He's keen on photography.<,>他热衷于摄影。<,>There was keen competition for the job.<,>这份工作的竞争很激烈。<,>She has a keen eye for detail.<,>她对细节有敏锐的观察力。<,>联想记忆：keen和king(国王)一样都有"敏锐"的意思<,>keep(v.保持)/knee(n.膝盖)/ken(n.知识范围)

glimpse<,>/ɡlɪmps/<,>/ɡlɪmps/<,>vi.看一眼/vi.一瞥/vt.瞥见/n.一瞥/n.一看<,>I caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.<,>我在人群中瞥见了她。<,>He glimpsed the truth before it was hidden again.<,>在真相再次被隐藏前，他瞥见了真相。<,>The book offers a glimpse into ancient cultures.<,>这本书让我们一窥古代文化。<,>glim(闪光)+pse→像闪光一样快速看→一瞥<,>glance(n.扫视)/glimmer(n.微光)/glisten(v.闪光)

detective<,>/dɪˈtektɪv/<,>/dɪˈtɛktɪv/<,>n.侦探/n.私人侦探<,>The detective solved the mysterious case.<,>侦探破解了这个神秘的案件。<,>She hired a private detective to follow her husband.<,>她雇了一个私人侦探跟踪她丈夫。<,>Detective stories are always fascinating.<,>侦探故事总是很吸引人。<,>detect(侦查)+ive(人)→侦查的人→侦探<,>detect(v.发现)/defective(adj.有缺陷的)/protective(adj.保护的)

transfer<,>/trænsˈfɜː(r)/<,>/trænsˈfɜːr/<,>v.搬/v.转移/v.调动/v.转学/v.转让/v.过户/v.乘车/v.转乘<,>She transferred to another department.<,>她调到了另一个部门。<,>We need to transfer these files to the new computer.<,>我们需要把这些文件转移到新电脑上。<,>You'll need to transfer buses at the next station.<,>你需要在下一站换乘公交车。<,>trans(跨越)+fer(携带)→携带跨越→转移<,>transform(v.改变)/transmit(v.传输)/transact(v.办理)

footstep<,>/ˈfʊtstep/<,>/ˈfʊtˌstɛp/<,>n.脚步/n.脚步声/n.足迹<,>I heard footsteps approaching.<,>我听到脚步声越来越近。<,>Follow in your father's footsteps and become a doctor.<,>追随你父亲的足迹，成为一名医生吧。<,>The snow preserved the footsteps of the animals.<,>雪地保存了动物的足迹。<,>foot(脚)+step(步伐)→脚步<,>footprint(n.脚印)/footstool(n.脚凳)/footwork(n.步法)

veteran<,>/ˈvetərən/<,>/ˈvɛtərən/<,>n.老兵/n.老手<,>My grandfather is a Vietnam War veteran.<,>我祖父是越战老兵。<,>She's a veteran teacher with 30 years of experience.<,>她是有30年经验的老教师。<,>The company hired a marketing veteran.<,>公司雇佣了一位营销老手。<,>veter(老)+an(人)→老的人→老兵/老手<,>veterinary(adj.兽医的)/inveterate(adj.积习难改的)/venerate(v.尊敬)

indifferent<,>/ɪnˈdɪfrənt/<,>/ɪnˈdɪfərənt/<,>adj.冷漠的/adj.不积极的/adj.一般的/adj.平平的<,>He was indifferent to her feelings.<,>他对她的感受漠不关心。<,>The food was indifferent at best.<,>这食物充其量只是一般。<,>She gave an indifferent performance.<,>她的表现平平。<,>in(不)+different(不同的)→没什么不同→一般的/冷漠的<,>different(adj.不同的)/indifference(n.冷漠)/indigent(adj.贫穷的)
outside<,>/ˌaʊtˈsaɪd/<,>/ˈaʊtˌsaɪd/<,>adj.外部的/prep.在…的外面；向…的外面；除…以外/n.外部，外表<,>The outside of the house needs painting.<,>房子的外部需要粉刷。<,>She stood outside the door, waiting for him.<,>她站在门外等他。<,>We have no information outside what was reported.<,>除了报道的内容，我们没有其他信息。<,>out(外)+side(边)→外部的<,>inside(adj.内部的/prep.在…里面)

nerve<,>/nɜːv/<,>/nɜrv/<,>n.神经；勇敢，胆量<,>He has a lot of nerve to speak to the boss like that.<,>他真有胆量那样跟老板说话。<,>The dentist hit a nerve when drilling.<,>牙医钻牙时碰到了神经。<,>She kept her nerve during the crisis.<,>她在危机中保持了镇定。<,>nerv(神经)+e→神经；勇气<,>nerve(n.神经)/nervous(adj.紧张的)

affection<,>/əˈfekʃn/<,>/əˈfɛkʃən/<,>n.感情；爱，爱慕<,>She has a deep affection for her grandparents.<,>她对祖父母有着深厚的感情。<,>He showed no affection towards his children.<,>他对孩子们没有表现出爱意。<,>The puppy craves human affection.<,>小狗渴望人类的关爱。<,>af(向)+fect(做)+ion→对…做出一感情<,>affectation(n.做作)/infection(n.感染)

eagle<,>/ˈiːɡl/<,>/ˈiɡəl/<,>n.鹰<,>The eagle soared high above the mountains.<,>鹰在高山上空翱翔。<,>The eagle is a symbol of strength and freedom.<,>鹰是力量和自由的象征。<,>We spotted an eagle's nest in the tree.<,>我们在树上发现了一个鹰巢。<,>ea(看作eye)+gle(看作gleam闪光)→目光锐利的鹰<,>beagle(n.小猎犬)/eager(adj.渴望的)

cruise<,>/kruːz/<,>/kruz/<,>vi.航游，巡航；缓慢巡行/n.航游，游弋<,>We went on a Caribbean cruise last summer.<,>去年夏天我们去了加勒比海巡航。<,>The police car was cruising the neighborhood.<,>警车在附近缓慢巡逻。<,>The ship will cruise at a speed of 20 knots.<,>这艘船将以20节的速度巡航。<,>cru(十字)+ise→在海上画十字→巡航<,>bruise(n.淤伤)/cruse(n.小罐)

elementary<,>/ˌelɪˈmentri/<,>/ˌɛləˈmɛntəri/<,>adj.基本的，初级的<,>She teaches elementary mathematics.<,>她教基础数学。<,>This is an elementary principle of physics.<,>这是物理学的基本原理。<,>The book is written in elementary English.<,>这本书是用初级英语写的。<,>element(元素)+ary→元素的一基本的<,>elemental(adj.自然力的)/elementary(adj.初级的)

topic<,>/ˈtɒpɪk/<,>/ˈtɑːpɪk/<,>n.题目，论题，话题<,>Let's change the topic of conversation.<,>我们换个话题吧。<,>The topic of the lecture is climate change.<,>讲座的主题是气候变化。<,>This is a sensitive topic in our society.<,>这是我们社会中的一个敏感话题。<,>top(顶部)+ic→文章的顶部→题目<,>tropic(n.热带)/topic(n.话题)

solemn<,>/ˈsɒləm/<,>/ˈsɑːləm/<,>adj.庄严的，隆重的；严肃的<,>They exchanged solemn vows at the wedding.<,>他们在婚礼上交换了庄严的誓言。<,>The judge had a solemn expression.<,>法官表情严肃。<,>A solemn silence fell over the crowd.<,>人群陷入了庄严的沉默。<,>sol(太阳)+emn→像太阳一样庄严<,>solemn(adj.庄严的)/sullen(adj.闷闷不乐的)

perceive<,>/pəˈsiːv/<,>/pərˈsiːv/<,>vt.感知，感觉，察觉；认识到，意识到；理解<,>I perceived a change in his attitude.<,>我察觉到他态度的变化。<,>She was perceived as a threat by her competitors.<,>她的竞争者视她为威胁。<,>Children perceive the world differently from adults.<,>孩子们对世界的感知与成人不同。<,>per(完全)+ceive(拿)→完全拿到→感知<,>conceive(v.构思)/deceive(v.欺骗)

omit<,>/əˈmɪt/<,>/oʊˈmɪt/<,>vt.省略；遗漏<,>Please don't omit any details in your report.<,>请不要在报告中遗漏任何细节。<,>They omitted his name from the list.<,>他们把他的名字从名单中漏掉了。<,>This chapter may be omitted for beginners.<,>初学者可以省略这一章。<,>o(看作out)+mit(送)→送出去→省略<,>emit(v.发出)/admit(v.承认)
embarrass<,>/ɪmˈbærəs/<,>/ɪmˈbærəs/<,>vt.使窘迫/vt.使为难<,>She was embarrassed by her mistake.<,>她因自己的错误而感到尴尬。<,>His loud laugh embarrassed everyone in the room.<,>他大声的笑让房间里的每个人都感到难堪。<,>I don't want to embarrass you in front of your friends.<,>我不想在你朋友面前让你难堪。<,>em(进入)+barr(阻挡)+ass→进入阻挡状态→使窘迫<,>embarrassment(n.尴尬)/harass(vt.骚扰)/barrier(n.障碍)

option<,>/ˈɒpʃn/<,>/ˈɑːpʃn/<,>n.选择/n.选择权/n.选择自由/n.选择的事物或人/n.选课<,>You have the option to take the exam later.<,>你有选择稍后参加考试的权利。<,>What are my options for dinner?<,>我晚餐有什么选择？<,>She chose the vegetarian option from the menu.<,>她从菜单上选择了素食选项。<,>opt(选择)+ion→选择<,>optional(adj.可选择的)/adoption(n.收养)/opinion(n.意见)

erroneous<,>/ɪˈrəʊniəs/<,>/ɪˈroʊniəs/<,>adj.错误的/adj.不正确的<,>The report contained several erroneous statements.<,>报告中包含了几处错误的陈述。<,>His conclusion was based on erroneous data.<,>他的结论是基于错误的数据得出的。<,>It's important to correct erroneous beliefs.<,>纠正错误的信念很重要。<,>err(错误)+oneous→错误的<,>error(n.错误)/erratic(adj.不稳定的)/errand(n.差事)

raid<,>/reɪd/<,>/reɪd/<,>n.袭击/vt.袭击/n.突入查抄/vt.突入查抄/n.劫掠/vt.劫掠<,>The police conducted a raid on the drug house.<,>警方对毒品屋进行了突袭。<,>Vikings used to raid coastal villages.<,>维京人过去常常袭击沿海村庄。<,>The bank was raided by armed robbers.<,>银行遭到武装劫匪的抢劫。<,>raid(与ride同音)→骑马袭击<,>braid(n.辫子/vt.编织)/afraid(adj.害怕的)/radiant(adj.发光的)

politics<,>/ˈpɒlətɪks/<,>/ˈpɑːlətɪks/<,>n.政治/n.政治学/n.政纲/n.政见<,>He has no interest in politics.<,>他对政治没有兴趣。<,>Her politics are quite conservative.<,>她的政见相当保守。<,>He studied politics at university.<,>他在大学学习政治学。<,>poli(城市)+tics→城市管理→政治<,>politician(n.政治家)/policy(n.政策)/polite(adj.礼貌的)

acute<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>/əˈkjuːt/<,>adj.严重的/adj.急性的/adj.灵敏的/adj.敏锐的/adj.精明的<,>She has an acute sense of hearing.<,>她有敏锐的听觉。<,>He suffered from acute appendicitis.<,>他患了急性阑尾炎。<,>This is an acute problem that needs immediate attention.<,>这是一个需要立即关注的严重问题。<,>acu(尖)+te→尖锐的→敏锐的<,>cute(adj.可爱的)/accurate(adj.精确的)/acuity(n.敏锐)

limitation<,>/ˌlɪmɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ˌlɪmɪˈteɪʃn/<,>n.限制/n.限度/n.局限<,>There are limitations to what we can achieve.<,>我们能取得的成就是有限的。<,>The study has several limitations.<,>这项研究有几个局限性。<,>He accepted his physical limitations.<,>他接受了自己的身体限制。<,>limit(限制)+ation→限制<,>limited(adj.有限的)/eliminate(vt.消除)/illuminate(vt.阐明)

sponsor<,>/ˈspɒnsə(r)/<,>/ˈspɑːnsər/<,>n.发起者/vt.发起/vt.资助/vt.赞助/vt.支持<,>The company sponsors several sports teams.<,>这家公司赞助了几支运动队。<,>Who will sponsor your visa application?<,>谁会为你的签证申请提供担保？<,>She sponsored a child in Africa.<,>她资助了一个非洲的孩子。<,>spon(承诺)+sor→承诺支持的人→赞助者<,>respond(v.回应)/correspond(v.符合)/spontaneous(adj.自发的)

kindergarten<,>/ˈkɪndəɡɑːtn/<,>/ˈkɪndərɡɑːrtn/<,>n.幼儿园<,>My daughter started kindergarten this year.<,>我女儿今年开始上幼儿园。<,>The kindergarten teacher is very patient.<,>幼儿园老师很有耐心。<,>They built a new kindergarten in our neighborhood.<,>他们在我们社区建了一所新的幼儿园。<,>kinder(儿童)+garten(花园)→儿童的花园→幼儿园<,>kindergarten(德语来源)/kindness(n.善良)/kindred(n.亲属)

unexpected<,>/ˌʌnɪkˈspektɪd/<,>/ˌʌnɪkˈspektɪd/<,>adj.想不到的/adj.意外的<,>Her visit was completely unexpected.<,>她的来访完全出乎意料。<,>We had some unexpected expenses this month.<,>我们这个月有一些意外的开支。<,>The movie had an unexpected ending.<,>这部电影有一个出人意料的结局。<,>un(不)+expect(期待)+ed→没有期待的→意外的<,>expected(adj.预期的)/unexpired(adj.未过期的)/unexplored(adj.未勘探的)
crucial<,>/ˈkruːʃəl/<,>/ˈkruːʃəl/<,>adj.至关重要的/adj.决定性的<,>This meeting is crucial for the project's success.<,>这次会议对项目的成功至关重要。<,>Her role in the team is crucial.<,>她在团队中的角色至关重要。<,>Time management is crucial in this job.<,>时间管理在这份工作中至关重要。<,>cru(十字)+cial→处于十字路口→决定性的<,>critical(adj.批评的/adj.关键的)/crucify(vt.折磨/vt.钉在十字架上)  

contribute<,>/kənˈtrɪbjuːt/<,>/kənˈtrɪbjut/<,>v.捐献/v.捐款/v.投稿<,>He contributed generously to the charity.<,>他为慈善事业慷慨捐款。<,>She contributes articles to the magazine monthly.<,>她每月向杂志投稿文章。<,>Everyone should contribute to environmental protection.<,>每个人都应该为环境保护贡献力量。<,>con(共同)+tribute(给予)→共同给予→捐献<,>distribute(v.分配/v.分发)/attribute(v.归因于/n.属性)/retribution(n.报应/n.惩罚)  

faith<,>/feɪθ/<,>/feɪθ/<,>n.信任/n.信心/n.信仰/n.信条/n.忠诚<,>She has great faith in her doctor.<,>她对她的医生非常信任。<,>Different people have different faiths.<,>不同的人有不同的信仰。<,>He kept faith with his promises.<,>他信守承诺。<,>音似“费事”→建立信任很费事<,>fate(n.命运)/faint(adj.微弱的/v.昏厥)/faithful(adj.忠诚的)  

generator<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪtə(r)/<,>/ˈdʒenəreɪtər/<,>n.发电机/n.发生器<,>The hospital has a backup generator.<,>医院有一台备用发电机。<,>This machine is a random number generator.<,>这台机器是随机数发生器。<,>The power plant has several large generators.<,>发电厂有几台大型发电机。<,>generate(产生)+or(物)→产生电的机器→发电机<,>generation(n.一代人/n.产生)/degenerate(v.退化/adj.堕落的)/regenerate(v.再生/v.重建)  

insert<,>/ɪnˈsɜːt/<,>/ɪnˈsɜːrt/<,>vt.插入/vt.嵌入/vt.登载<,>Please insert the key into the lock.<,>请把钥匙插入锁中。<,>They inserted an advertisement in the newspaper.<,>他们在报纸上登了一则广告。<,>The surgeon inserted a tube into the patient's throat.<,>外科医生在病人喉咙里插了一根管子。<,>in(进入)+sert(加入)→加入进去→插入<,>assert(v.断言)/desert(n.沙漠/v.遗弃)/exert(v.施加/v.运用)  

remark<,>/rɪˈmɑːk/<,>/rɪˈmɑːrk/<,>vt.说/vt.评论说/n.话语/n.谈论/n.评论<,>He remarked that the weather was nice.<,>他说天气很好。<,>Her rude remark offended everyone.<,>她粗鲁的话语冒犯了所有人。<,>The professor's remarks were insightful.<,>教授的评论很有见地。<,>re(再)+mark(标记)→再次标记→评论<,>mark(n.标记/v.做记号)/remarkable(adj.非凡的)/demarcate(v.划界)  

forbid<,>/fəˈbɪd/<,>/fərˈbɪd/<,>vt.禁止/vt.不许/vt.阻止<,>Smoking is forbidden in this building.<,>这栋楼内禁止吸烟。<,>I forbid you to see him again.<,>我不许你再见他。<,>The law forbids discrimination.<,>法律禁止歧视。<,>for(禁止)+bid(命令)→禁止<,>forget(v.忘记)/forgive(v.原谅)/forbear(v.忍耐)  

microscope<,>/ˈmaɪkrəskəʊp/<,>/ˈmaɪkrəskoʊp/<,>n.显微镜<,>We observed cells under the microscope.<,>我们在显微镜下观察细胞。<,>The scientist adjusted the microscope.<,>科学家调整了显微镜。<,>This microscope has high magnification.<,>这台显微镜放大倍数很高。<,>micro(微小)+scope(看)→看微小物体的仪器→显微镜<,>telescope(n.望远镜)/periscope(n.潜望镜)/stethoscope(n.听诊器)  

necessarily<,>/ˌnesəˈserəli/<,>/ˌnesəˈserəli/<,>adv.必要地/adv.必然<,>Expensive doesn't necessarily mean better.<,>贵不一定意味着更好。<,>You don't necessarily have to attend.<,>你不一定要参加。<,>This will necessarily lead to changes.<,>这必然会导致变化。<,>necessary(必要的)+ly(副词后缀)→必要地<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/necessity(n.必需品)/unnecessary(adj.不必要的)  

highlight<,>/ˈhaɪlaɪt/<,>/ˈhaɪlaɪt/<,>vt.强调/vt.突出/vt.使显著/n.最精彩的部分/n.最重要的事件<,>The report highlights the main issues.<,>报告强调了主要问题。<,>The concert's highlight was her solo.<,>音乐会的亮点是她的独奏。<,>He highlighted the important sentences.<,>他标出了重要的句子。<,>high(高)+light(光)→用高光照射→突出<,>spotlight(n.聚光灯)/delight(n.高兴)/enlighten(v.启发)
candidate<,>/ˈkændɪdət/<,>/ˈkændɪdət/<,>n.候选人/n.投考者/n.申请求职者<,>He is the leading candidate for the presidency.<,>他是总统职位的主要候选人。<,>She was a candidate for the scholarship.<,>她是奖学金的申请者。<,>The company interviewed several candidates for the position.<,>公司面试了几位该职位的候选人。<,>can(能)+did(做)+ate(人)→能做的人→候选人<,>nominee(n.被提名者)/applicant(n.申请人)/contestant(n.参赛者)  

billion<,>/ˈbɪljən/<,>/ˈbɪljən/<,>num.十亿<,>The company made a profit of two billion dollars last year.<,>该公司去年盈利20亿美元。<,>China has a population of over one billion people.<,>中国有超过十亿的人口。<,>The project will cost billions to complete.<,>这个项目将耗资数十亿才能完成。<,>bill(账单)+ion(名词后缀)→巨大的账单数字→十亿<,>million(num.百万)/trillion(num.万亿)/dozen(num.十二个)  

parallel<,>/ˈpærəlel/<,>/ˈpærəˌlɛl/<,>adj.平行的/adj.类似的/adj.并列的/n.相似处/n.平行线/vt.与…平行/vt.与…相似<,>The two roads run parallel to each other.<,>这两条路相互平行。<,>There are many parallels between the two novels.<,>这两部小说有许多相似之处。<,>Her career parallels that of her famous mother.<,>她的职业生涯与她著名的母亲相似。<,>para(旁边)+llel(彼此)→彼此在旁边的→平行的<,>similar(adj.相似的)/perpendicular(adj.垂直的)/analogy(n.类比)  

reject<,>/rɪˈdʒekt/<,>/rɪˈdʒɛkt/<,>vt.拒绝/vt.拒纳/n.次品<,>The committee rejected his proposal.<,>委员会拒绝了他的提议。<,>The factory rejects defective products.<,>工厂拒收次品。<,>She felt rejected after not getting the job.<,>没有得到这份工作后，她感到被拒绝了。<,>re(反)+ject(扔)→扔回去→拒绝<,>refuse(v.拒绝)/accept(v.接受)/eject(v.喷射)  

patient<,>/ˈpeɪʃnt/<,>/ˈpeɪʃənt/<,>adj.忍耐的/n.病人<,>Be patient, the results will come soon.<,>耐心点，结果很快就会出来。<,>The doctor is seeing his next patient.<,>医生正在看下一位病人。<,>She has been very patient with her children.<,>她对孩子们一直很有耐心。<,>pati(忍受)+ent(人)→忍受的人→病人/忍耐的<,>impatient(adj.不耐烦的)/physician(n.内科医生)/tolerant(adj.宽容的)  

cashier<,>/kæˈʃɪə(r)/<,>/kæˈʃɪr/<,>n.出纳<,>The cashier gave me the wrong change.<,>收银员找错了零钱。<,>She works as a cashier in a supermarket.<,>她在超市当收银员。<,>Please pay at the cashier's desk.<,>请在收银台付款。<,>cash(现金)+ier(人)→处理现金的人→出纳<,>teller(n.出纳员)/accountant(n.会计)/banker(n.银行家)  

sheer<,>/ʃɪə(r)/<,>/ʃɪr/<,>adj.完全的/adj.陡峭的/adj.极薄的/adv.垂直地/vi.急转向<,>It was sheer luck that we found the keys.<,>我们找到钥匙纯属运气。<,>The cliff was a sheer drop of 100 meters.<,>悬崖垂直落差达100米。<,>Her dress was made of sheer silk.<,>她的连衣裙是用薄丝绸做的。<,>sheer与shear(剪)同音→像被剪过一样→极薄的/陡峭的<,>steep(adj.陡峭的)/transparent(adj.透明的)/utter(adj.完全的)  

miracle<,>/ˈmɪrəkl/<,>/ˈmɪrəkəl/<,>n.奇迹/n.令人惊奇的人<,>Her recovery was a medical miracle.<,>她的康复是个医学奇迹。<,>The child's survival was a miracle.<,>这个孩子的幸存是个奇迹。<,>He worked miracles with the failing company.<,>他让这家濒临倒闭的公司起死回生。<,>mir(惊奇)+acle(事物)→令人惊奇的事物→奇迹<,>wonder(n.奇迹)/marvel(n.奇迹)/magic(n.魔法)  

profit<,>/ˈprɒfɪt/<,>/ˈprɑfɪt/<,>n.利润/vi.受益/vt.有益于<,>The company's profits increased by 20%.<,>公司利润增长了20%。<,>We should profit from our mistakes.<,>我们应该从错误中吸取教训。<,>The new policy will profit all citizens.<,>新政策将使所有市民受益。<,>pro(向前)+fit(做)→向前做→获利<,>benefit(n.利益)/gain(n.收益)/loss(n.亏损)  

original<,>/əˈrɪdʒənl/<,>/əˈrɪdʒənəl/<,>adj.最初的/adj.新颖的/n.原件<,>This is the original manuscript of the novel.<,>这是小说的原始手稿。<,>She has a very original way of thinking.<,>她有非常新颖的思维方式。<,>Keep the original and send the copy.<,>保留原件，寄送复印件。<,>origin(起源)+al(的)→起源的→最初的<,>creative(adj.有创造力的)/copy(n.副本)/authentic(adj.真实的)
wit<,>/wɪt/<,>/wɪt/<,>n.风趣/n.妙语/n.智力/n.才智/n.智能<,>His wit and humor made the party lively.<,>他的风趣幽默让派对气氛活跃。<,>She is known for her sharp wit.<,>她以机智著称。<,>Wit is the ability to think quickly and make clever remarks.<,>才智是快速思考并发表巧妙言论的能力。<,>谐音“维特”→维特是个聪明人→才智<,>wit(v.知道)/witty(adj.机智的)/witness(n.目击者)

handful<,>/ˈhændfʊl/<,>/ˈhændˌfʊl/<,>n.一把/n.少数/n.一小撮<,>She gave me a handful of candies.<,>她给了我一把糖果。<,>Only a handful of people attended the meeting.<,>只有少数人参加了会议。<,>A handful of students were selected for the competition.<,>一小撮学生被选中参加比赛。<,>hand(手)+ful(充满)→一把<,>handful(n.一把)/handful(adj.难控制的)/hand(n.手)

assignment<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>/əˈsaɪnmənt/<,>n.任务/n.指定的作业/n.分配/n.指派<,>The teacher gave us a new assignment.<,>老师给我们布置了新作业。<,>His assignment to the project was unexpected.<,>他被指派参与这个项目是意料之外的。<,>Completing this assignment will take a week.<,>完成这个任务需要一周时间。<,>assign(分配)+ment(名词后缀)→分配的任务<,>assignment(n.任务)/alignment(n.排列)/appointment(n.约会)

nylon<,>/ˈnaɪlɒn/<,>/ˈnaɪlɑːn/<,>n.尼龙<,>This jacket is made of nylon.<,>这件夹克是尼龙材质的。<,>Nylon is a strong synthetic material.<,>尼龙是一种坚固的合成材料。<,>She bought a pair of nylon stockings.<,>她买了一双尼龙长袜。<,>谐音“尼龙”→直接音译<,>nylon(n.尼龙)/polyester(n.聚酯纤维)/cotton(n.棉花)

yawn<,>/jɔːn/<,>/jɔːn/<,>vi.打呵欠/n.呵欠<,>He couldn't stop yawning during the meeting.<,>他在会议上忍不住打呵欠。<,>A yawn is often a sign of tiredness.<,>呵欠通常是疲倦的标志。<,>She covered her mouth when she yawned.<,>她打呵欠时捂住了嘴。<,>谐音“要嗯”→要打呵欠了<,>yawn(v.打呵欠)/dawn(n.黎明)/lawn(n.草坪)

electric<,>/ɪˈlektrɪk/<,>/ɪˈlektrɪk/<,>adj.电的/adj.电动的<,>We need an electrician to fix the wiring.<,>我们需要电工来修理电线。<,>He bought an electric car last year.<,>他去年买了一辆电动车。<,>The room was lit by electric lights.<,>房间被电灯照亮。<,>electr(电的)+ic(形容词后缀)→电的<,>electric(adj.电的)/electronic(adj.电子的)/electrical(adj.电气的)

terminal<,>/ˈtɜːmɪnəl/<,>/ˈtɜːrmɪnəl/<,>adj.晚期的/adj.不治的/adj.末端的/adj.终点的/adj.极限的/n.终点/n.终端/n.接线端<,>The patient is in the terminal stage of the disease.<,>病人处于疾病的晚期。<,>Please proceed to the bus terminal.<,>请前往公交终点站。<,>Connect the wire to the terminal.<,>将电线连接到接线端。<,>termin(界限)+al(形容词后缀)→终点的<,>terminal(adj.终点的)/terminate(v.终止)/terminology(n.术语)

kingdom<,>/ˈkɪŋdəm/<,>/ˈkɪŋdəm/<,>n.王国/n.领域/n.界<,>The United Kingdom consists of four countries.<,>联合王国由四个国家组成。<,>He ruled his kingdom wisely.<,>他明智地统治着他的王国。<,>The animal kingdom is diverse and fascinating.<,>动物界多样且迷人。<,>king(国王)+dom(领域)→王国<,>kingdom(n.王国)/queendom(n.女王统治)/dukedom(n.公爵领地)

differ<,>/ˈdɪfə(r)/<,>/ˈdɪfər/<,>vi.不同/vi.相异/vi.发生分歧<,>Our opinions differ on this matter.<,>我们在这个问题上意见不同。<,>The two versions differ slightly in details.<,>两个版本在细节上略有不同。<,>They differed over the best approach.<,>他们对最佳方法产生了分歧。<,>dif(分开)+fer(带来)→带来不同→不同<,>differ(v.不同)/defer(v.推迟)/refer(v.参考)

various<,>/ˈveəriəs/<,>/ˈveriəs/<,>adj.各种各样的/adj.不同的<,>We offer various options to choose from.<,>我们提供多种选择。<,>The museum has exhibits from various cultures.<,>博物馆有来自不同文化的展品。<,>She has worked in various fields.<,>她在不同领域工作过。<,>vari(变化)+ous(形容词后缀)→各种各样的<,>various(adj.不同的)/variable(adj.可变的)/variety(n.多样性)
latter<,>/ˈlætə(r)/<,>/ˈlætər/<,>adj.后者的/adj.后一半的<,>Of the two options, I prefer the latter.<,>在这两个选项中，我更喜欢后者。<,>The latter part of the movie was more exciting.<,>电影的后半部分更精彩。<,>He arrived in the latter half of the day.<,>他在下午晚些时候到达。<,>late(晚的)+er→更晚的→后者的<,>later(adv.后来)/letter(n.信件)/ladder(n.梯子)

depression<,>/dɪˈpreʃn/<,>/dɪˈpreʃən/<,>n.抑郁/n.沮丧/n.不景气/n.萧条/n.洼地/n.凹陷<,>She has been suffering from depression for years.<,>她多年来一直患有抑郁症。<,>The Great Depression affected many countries.<,>大萧条影响了许多国家。<,>There was a small depression in the ground where the ball had landed.<,>球落地的地方有一个小凹陷。<,>de(向下)+press(压)+ion→向下压→抑郁<,>impression(n.印象)/expression(n.表达)/compression(n.压缩)

reduction<,>/rɪˈdʌkʃn/<,>/rɪˈdʌkʃən/<,>n.减少/n.缩小/n.下降/n.降低<,>There has been a significant reduction in pollution levels.<,>污染水平显著下降。<,>The company announced a reduction in staff.<,>公司宣布裁员。<,>This coupon gives you a 20% reduction.<,>这张优惠券可以打八折。<,>re(回)+duct(引导)+ion→往回引导→减少<,>production(n.生产)/introduction(n.介绍)/deduction(n.扣除)

extent<,>/ɪkˈstent/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnt/<,>n.广度/n.范围/n.程度<,>I was surprised by the extent of the damage.<,>我对损坏的程度感到惊讶。<,>The extent of his knowledge is impressive.<,>他的知识面令人印象深刻。<,>To some extent, I agree with you.<,>在某种程度上，我同意你的观点。<,>ex(出)+tent(伸展)→伸展出的范围<,>extend(v.延伸)/extent(n.程度)/extant(adj.现存的)

equivalent<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>/ɪˈkwɪvələnt/<,>adj.相等的/adj.等量的/n.相等物/n.等价物<,>This amount is equivalent to one month's salary.<,>这个金额相当于一个月的工资。<,>The two words are roughly equivalent in meaning.<,>这两个词的意思大致相同。<,>What is the dollar equivalent of 100 euros?<,>100欧元相当于多少美元？<,>equi(相等)+val(价值)+ent→价值相等的<,>equality(n.平等)/equilibrium(n.平衡)/equivocal(adj.模棱两可的)

gaol<,>/dʒeɪl/<,>/dʒel/<,>vt.监禁/n.监狱<,>The thief was gaoled for three years.<,>小偷被监禁了三年。<,>He escaped from gaol last night.<,>他昨晚从监狱逃跑了。<,>The old gaol is now a museum.<,>那座旧监狱现在是一个博物馆。<,>同jail(美式拼法)<,>goal(n.目标)/gall(n.胆汁)/gale(n.大风)

conversely<,>/kənˈvɜːsli/<,>/kənˈvɜːrsli/<,>adv.相反<,>He is quiet, whereas conversely, his brother is very talkative.<,>他很安静，相反，他的兄弟非常健谈。<,>Some people like hot weather, but conversely, others prefer it cold.<,>有些人喜欢热天气，但相反，其他人更喜欢冷天气。<,>Conversely, if you don't practice, you won't improve.<,>相反，如果你不练习，你就不会进步。<,>con(共同)+verse(转)+ly→转向另一面→相反<,>converse(adj.相反的)/conversion(n.转换)/conversation(n.谈话)

sauce<,>/sɔːs/<,>/sɔs/<,>n.调味汁/n.作料<,>I like to put tomato sauce on my pasta.<,>我喜欢在意大利面上放番茄酱。<,>This sauce is too spicy for me.<,>这个酱对我来说太辣了。<,>What's the secret ingredient in your special sauce?<,>你的特制酱汁的秘密成分是什么？<,>sau(盐)+ce→加盐调味→酱汁<,>source(n.来源)/saucer(n.茶托)/sausage(n.香肠)

ban<,>/bæn/<,>/bæn/<,>vt.取缔/vt.查禁/vt.禁止/n.禁止/n.禁令<,>Smoking is banned in this restaurant.<,>这家餐厅禁止吸烟。<,>The government imposed a ban on plastic bags.<,>政府实施了塑料袋禁令。<,>The book was banned for its controversial content.<,>这本书因其有争议的内容而被查禁。<,>同forbid(禁止)<,>pan(n.平底锅)/fan(n.风扇)/bin(n.垃圾桶)

fascinate<,>/ˈfæsɪneɪt/<,>/ˈfæsəˌneɪt/<,>vi.有吸引力/vi.迷人/vt.迷住/vt.强烈吸引<,>The magician's tricks fascinated the children.<,>魔术师的把戏迷住了孩子们。<,>I've always been fascinated by ancient history.<,>我一直对古代历史很着迷。<,>The way spiders weave their webs is fascinating.<,>蜘蛛织网的方式很迷人。<,>fascin(魔法)+ate→像被施了魔法一样被吸引<,>fascination(n.魅力)/fascism(n.法西斯主义)/fascinator(n.迷人的东西)
suffer<,>/ˈsʌfə(r)/<,>/ˈsʌfər/<,>v.遭受/v.忍受/v.容许/v.受痛苦/v.受损<,>She suffered a great loss in the accident.<,>她在事故中遭受了巨大损失。<,>He can't suffer such insults any longer.<,>他再也无法忍受这样的侮辱了。<,>Plants suffer when they don't get enough water.<,>植物缺水时会受损。<,>suf(在下面)+fer(承受)→在下面承受→忍受<,>buffer(n.缓冲器)/supper(n.晚餐)/offer(v.提供)

diplomatic<,>/ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk/<,>/ˌdɪpləˈmætɪk/<,>adj.外交的/adj.从事外交的/adj.策略的/adj.有手腕的<,>He handled the situation in a diplomatic way.<,>他以圆滑的方式处理了这个情况。<,>She works for the diplomatic service.<,>她在外交部门工作。<,>The two countries resumed diplomatic relations.<,>两国恢复了外交关系。<,>diplo(双)+mat(行动)+ic→双面行动→外交的<,>automatic(adj.自动的)/democratic(adj.民主的)/dramatic(adj.戏剧性的)

bat<,>/bæt/<,>/bæt/<,>n.蝙蝠/n.球棒/n.球拍<,>The bat flew out of the cave at dusk.<,>蝙蝠在黄昏时分飞出洞穴。<,>He hit the ball with a baseball bat.<,>他用棒球棒击球。<,>She bought a new tennis bat.<,>她买了一个新的网球拍。<,>b(形状像球棒)+at(在)→在击球→球棒<,>bet(v.打赌)/bit(n.一点)/bad(adj.坏的)

neighbourhood<,>/ˈneɪbəhʊd/<,>/ˈneɪbərhʊd/<,>n.四邻/n.附近/n.接近<,>There's a good school in our neighbourhood.<,>我们附近有一所好学校。<,>The whole neighbourhood was talking about the incident.<,>整个街区都在谈论这件事。<,>She lives in the neighbourhood of the park.<,>她住在公园附近。<,>neighbour(邻居)+hood(状态)→邻居的状态→四邻<,>brotherhood(n.兄弟关系)/likelihood(n.可能性)/childhood(n.童年)

draft<,>/drɑːft/<,>/dræft/<,>n.草稿/n.汇票/n.征兵/n.通风/vt.起草/vt.征募<,>He made several drafts of his speech.<,>他写了好几版演讲稿。<,>The bank issued a draft for $500.<,>银行开出了一张500美元的汇票。<,>They drafted him into the army.<,>他们征召他入伍。<,>dr(拉)+aft(后)→向后拉→起草<,>craft(n.工艺)/daft(adj.愚蠢的)/drift(v.漂流)

complex<,>/ˈkɒmpleks/<,>/kəmˈpleks/<,>adj.由许多部分组成的/adj.复合的/adj.复杂的/adj.难懂的<,>This is a complex problem that needs careful analysis.<,>这是一个需要仔细分析的复杂问题。<,>The new shopping complex will open next month.<,>新的购物中心将在下个月开业。<,>She has a complex personality.<,>她性格复杂。<,>com(一起)+plex(折叠)→折叠在一起→复杂的<,>simplex(adj.单纯的)/duplex(adj.双重的)/perplex(v.使困惑)

rank<,>/ræŋk/<,>/ræŋk/<,>v.给...评定等级/v.列入/v.占特定等级/n.军衔/n.职衔/n.地位/n.社会阶层/n.排/n.行列<,>He was promoted to the rank of captain.<,>他被提升为上尉军衔。<,>This university ranks among the top 10 in the country.<,>这所大学位列全国前十。<,>The soldiers stood in ranks.<,>士兵们排成队列。<,>ran(跑)+k(king国王)→跑向国王→军衔<,>bank(n.银行)/sank(v.下沉)/tank(n.坦克)

assumption<,>/əˈsʌmpʃn/<,>/əˈsʌmpʃən/<,>n.假定/n.臆断/n.担任/n.承担<,>Their argument was based on a false assumption.<,>他们的论点基于一个错误的假设。<,>She will take up her new duties upon assumption of office.<,>她就职后将承担新的职责。<,>Don't make assumptions about people you don't know.<,>不要对你不认识的人妄下断语。<,>as(加强)+sumpt(拿)+ion→拿住→承担<,>consumption(n.消耗)/presumption(n.假定)/resumption(n.恢复)

pension<,>/ˈpenʃn/<,>/ˈpenʃən/<,>n.养老金/n.抚恤金/vt.发给...养老金<,>He retired and now lives on his pension.<,>他退休了，现在靠养老金生活。<,>The company pensions its employees at 65.<,>公司在员工65岁时给他们发养老金。<,>She receives a widow's pension.<,>她领取遗孀抚恤金。<,>pens(支付)+ion→支付的费用→养老金<,>tension(n.紧张)/dimension(n.维度)/extension(n.延伸)

giant<,>/ˈdʒaɪənt/<,>/ˈdʒaɪənt/<,>adj.巨大的/n.巨人/n.巨物/n.才智超群的人<,>They built a giant statue in the city center.<,>他们在市中心建了一座巨大的雕像。<,>He was a giant in the field of physics.<,>他是物理学界的巨人。<,>The company is a giant in the tech industry.<,>这家公司是科技行业的巨头。<,>gi(拼音"巨")+ant(蚂蚁)→巨大的蚂蚁→巨人<,>grant(v.授予)/plant(n.植物)/gland(n.腺体)
fluid<,>/ˈfluːɪd/<,>/ˈfluːɪd/<,>adj.流动的/n.流体/n.液体<,>Water is a fluid that takes the shape of its container.<,>水是一种能随容器形状变化的流体。<,>Her movements were fluid and graceful.<,>她的动作流畅而优雅。<,>The patient was given intravenous fluids.<,>病人被注射了静脉输液。<,>flu(流动)+id(形容词后缀)→流动的<,>solid(adj.固体的/n.固体)/liquid(n.液体/adj.液体的)

bay<,>/beɪ/<,>/beɪ/<,>n.湾/n.分隔间<,>The ship anchored in the bay.<,>船停泊在海湾里。<,>She parked her car in the bay.<,>她把车停在停车格里。<,>The bay was surrounded by steep cliffs.<,>海湾被陡峭的悬崖环绕着。<,>bay(海湾)与day(天)押韵<,>gulf(n.海湾)/cove(n.小海湾)/bay(月桂树)

outlet<,>/ˈaʊtlet/<,>/ˈaʊtˌlɛt/<,>n.出口/n.出路/n.发泄途径<,>The river has several outlets to the sea.<,>这条河有好几个入海口。<,>Exercise is a good outlet for stress.<,>运动是释放压力的好方法。<,>The store is an outlet for factory seconds.<,>这家商店是工厂次品的销售点。<,>out(出)+let(让)→让...出去→出口<,>inlet(n.入口)/outlet store(折扣店)

neglect<,>/nɪˈɡlekt/<,>/nɪˈɡlɛkt/<,>v.疏于照料/v.疏忽/n.疏忽<,>He neglected his duties as a father.<,>他疏忽了作为父亲的责任。<,>The garden was in a state of neglect.<,>花园处于无人照料的状态。<,>She neglected to lock the door.<,>她忘了锁门。<,>neg(不)+lect(选择)→不选择→忽视<,>ignore(v.忽视)/overlook(v.忽略)/negligence(n.疏忽)

addition<,>/əˈdɪʃn/<,>/əˈdɪʃən/<,>n.加/n.加法/n.附加物<,>The child is learning simple addition.<,>这个孩子正在学习简单的加法。<,>The new wing is a welcome addition to the school.<,>新建的侧楼是学校可喜的增建部分。<,>In addition to English, she speaks French.<,>除了英语，她还会说法语。<,>add(加)+ition(名词后缀)→加法<,>subtraction(n.减法)/edition(n.版本)

gang<,>/ɡæŋ/<,>/ɡæŋ/<,>vi.聚集/vi.结成一伙/n.一帮/n.一伙<,>A gang of teenagers were hanging around the park.<,>一群青少年在公园里闲逛。<,>They ganged up against the bully.<,>他们联合起来对付那个欺负人的家伙。<,>The gang was involved in several robberies.<,>这个团伙参与了几起抢劫案。<,>gang(帮派)与hang(悬挂)押韵<,>group(n.组)/crew(n.全体船员)

shrink<,>/ʃrɪŋk/<,>/ʃrɪŋk/<,>v.起皱/v.收缩/v.退缩/v.畏缩<,>The sweater shrank in the wash.<,>毛衣洗后缩水了。<,>He shrank from the responsibility.<,>他畏缩不敢承担责任。<,>The economy is shrinking this year.<,>今年经济在萎缩。<,>shrink(收缩)与drink(饮料)押韵<,>expand(v.扩大)/contract(v.收缩)

ancestor<,>/ˈænsestə(r)/<,>/ˈænˌsɛstər/<,>n.祖宗/n.祖先/n.原型/n.先驱<,>My ancestors came from Ireland.<,>我的祖先来自爱尔兰。<,>The steam engine was the ancestor of modern locomotives.<,>蒸汽机是现代机车的原型。<,>We should honor our ancestors.<,>我们应该尊敬祖先。<,>an(在前)+cest(走)+or(人)→走在前面的人→祖先<,>descendant(n.后代)/forefather(n.祖先)

textile<,>/ˈtekstaɪl/<,>/ˈtɛkˌstaɪl/<,>adj.纺织的/n.纺织品/n.纺织业<,>She works in the textile industry.<,>她在纺织行业工作。<,>The museum has a collection of ancient textiles.<,>博物馆收藏有古代纺织品。<,>This region is famous for its textile production.<,>这个地区以纺织生产闻名。<,>text(编织)+ile(形容词后缀)→纺织的<,>fabric(n.织物)/cloth(n.布)

former<,>/ˈfɔːmə(r)/<,>/ˈfɔrmər/<,>adj.在前的/n.前者<,>He is a former president of the company.<,>他是公司的前任总裁。<,>Of the two options, I prefer the former.<,>在这两个选项中，我更喜欢前者。<,>Her former husband lives abroad.<,>她的前夫住在国外。<,>form(形状)+er(比较级)→更早形成的→前者<,>latter(adj.后者的/n.后者)/previous(adj.先前的)
panic<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>/ˈpænɪk/<,>v.恐慌/v.惊慌失措/n.恐慌/n.惊慌/n.慌乱<,>The crowd panicked when the fire broke out.<,>火灾发生时人群惊慌失措。<,>She felt a sudden panic when she couldn't find her passport.<,>找不到护照时她突然感到恐慌。<,>Don't panic! Everything will be fine.<,>别慌！一切都会好起来的。<,>pan(潘神)+ic→潘神引起的恐惧→恐慌<,>picnic(n.野餐)/panicky(adj.恐慌的)

extend<,>/ɪkˈstend/<,>/ɪkˈstɛnd/<,>v.延长/v.扩大/v.提供/v.给予/v.伸展/v.达到<,>They decided to extend their vacation by one week.<,>他们决定将假期延长一周。<,>The company extended an offer to the candidate.<,>公司向候选人提供了工作机会。<,>His influence extends beyond the local community.<,>他的影响力超出了当地社区。<,>ex(出)+tend(伸展)→伸展出去→延长<,>expand(v.扩大)/extent(n.范围)/attend(v.参加)

fold<,>/fəʊld/<,>/foʊld/<,>v.折叠/v.合拢/n.褶/n.折叠的部分<,>She folded the letter carefully before putting it in the envelope.<,>她把信仔细折好放进信封。<,>The map folds neatly into a small pocket.<,>这张地图可以整齐地折成小尺寸放进衣袋。<,>There's a fold in this paper that won't come out.<,>这张纸上有道折痕去不掉。<,>fold(折叠)→与hold(握住)对比记忆<,>unfold(v.展开)/folder(n.文件夹)/mold(n.模具)

globe<,>/ɡləʊb/<,>/ɡloʊb/<,>n.地球/n.世界/n.地球仪/n.球体<,>We need to protect the environment of our globe.<,>我们需要保护地球的环境。<,>The classroom has a large globe for geography lessons.<,>教室里有个大地球仪用于地理课。<,>The lamp was covered with a glass globe.<,>灯上罩着一个玻璃球。<,>glob(球)+e→球体→地球<,>global(adj.全球的)/lobe(n.耳垂)/robe(n.长袍)

interpretation<,>/ɪnˌtɜːprɪˈteɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˌtɜːrprɪˈteɪʃn/<,>n.解释/n.口译/n.艺术处理<,>His interpretation of the poem was quite unique.<,>他对这首诗的解读非常独特。<,>She works as a simultaneous interpretation at the UN.<,>她在联合国做同声传译。<,>The director's interpretation of the play was controversial.<,>导演对这部剧的艺术处理有争议。<,>inter(在...之间)+pret(表达)+ation→在两种语言间表达→口译<,>interpreter(n.口译员)/interruption(n.打断)

ax<,>/æks/<,>/æks/<,>n.斧子<,>He chopped the wood with a sharp ax.<,>他用一把锋利的斧子劈柴。<,>The lumberjack carried his ax over his shoulder.<,>伐木工人把斧子扛在肩上。<,>This old ax still cuts well after years of use.<,>这把旧斧子用了多年仍然很锋利。<,>ax(斧子)→与axe(斧子，英式拼写)相同<,>max(n.最大量)/tax(n.税)/fax(n.传真)

folk<,>/fəʊk/<,>/foʊk/<,>n.人们/n.家属/n.亲属/n.大伙儿<,>Folk music is very popular in this region.<,>民间音乐在这个地区很受欢迎。<,>How are your folks doing these days?<,>你的家人最近怎么样？<,>Alright folks, let's get started.<,>好了各位，我们开始吧。<,>folk(人们)→与fork(叉子)对比记忆<,>folklore(n.民间传说)/folksy(adj.随和的)

applause<,>/əˈplɔːz/<,>/əˈplɔz/<,>n.鼓掌/n.掌声<,>The performance received thunderous applause.<,>演出获得了雷鸣般的掌声。<,>She took a bow amidst the applause.<,>她在掌声中鞠躬。<,>His speech was met with warm applause.<,>他的演讲赢得了热烈的掌声。<,>applaud(鼓掌)+se→掌声<,>applause(n.掌声)/applause(v.鼓掌)/applause(n.喝彩)

frank<,>/fræŋk/<,>/fræŋk/<,>adj.坦白的/adj.直率的<,>To be frank, I don't like your idea.<,>坦白说，我不喜欢你的主意。<,>She has a frank and open personality.<,>她性格直率开朗。<,>Let's have a frank discussion about this issue.<,>让我们坦诚地讨论这个问题。<,>frank(源自Frankish，意为自由)→坦白的<,>blank(adj.空白的)/flank(n.侧面)/frank(adj.坦白的)

abuse<,>/əˈbjuːs/<,>/əˈbjus/<,>vt.滥用/vt.虐待/vt.伤害/vt.辱骂/vt.毁谤/n.滥用/n.虐待/n.伤害/n.辱骂<,>He was accused of abusing his power.<,>他被指控滥用职权。<,>Child abuse is a serious crime.<,>虐待儿童是严重的罪行。<,>She suffered verbal abuse from her boss.<,>她遭受了老板的言语辱骂。<,>ab(偏离)+use(使用)→滥用<,>accuse(v.指控)/amuse(v.娱乐)/abuse(v.滥用)

prove<,>/pruːv/<,>/pruv/<,>v.证实/v.证明/v.结果是<,>Can you prove your innocence?<,>你能证明自己的清白吗？<,>The theory was later proved correct.<,>这个理论后来被证明是正确的。<,>His advice proved very useful.<,>他的建议证明非常有用。<,>pro(向前)+ve(看)→证实<,>approve(v.批准)/improve(v.改善)/prove(v.证明)

scheme<,>/skiːm/<,>/skim/<,>v.密谋/v.策划/n.计划/n.方案/n.阴谋<,>They schemed to overthrow the government.<,>他们密谋推翻政府。<,>The company has a new pension scheme.<,>公司有一个新的养老金计划。<,>He was involved in a fraudulent scheme.<,>他参与了一个欺诈阴谋。<,>scheme(源自希腊语skhēma，意为形式)→计划<,>theme(n.主题)/scheme(n.计划)/schema(n.图解)

affect<,>/əˈfekt/<,>/əˈfɛkt/<,>vt.影响/vt.感动<,>The bad weather affected our travel plans.<,>恶劣天气影响了我们的旅行计划。<,>Her speech deeply affected the audience.<,>她的演讲深深打动了观众。<,>The disease mainly affects young children.<,>这种疾病主要影响幼儿。<,>af(向)+fect(做)→影响<,>effect(n.效果)/affect(v.影响)/infect(v.感染)

deaf<,>/def/<,>/dɛf/<,>adj.聋的/adj.不愿听的<,>He was born deaf in one ear.<,>他生来一只耳朵就聋。<,>She turned a deaf ear to my advice.<,>她对我的建议充耳不闻。<,>The school provides special education for deaf children.<,>这所学校为聋哑儿童提供特殊教育。<,>deaf(源自古英语dēaf)→聋的<,>death(n.死亡)/deaf(adj.聋的)/deal(v.处理)
admire<,>/ədˈmaɪə(r)/<,>/ədˈmaɪər/<,>vt.钦佩/vt.羡慕/vt.赞赏/vt.称赞/vt.夸奖<,>I admire her courage and determination.<,>我钦佩她的勇气和决心。<,>He was admired for his honesty.<,>他因诚实而受到赞赏。<,>She admired the beautiful sunset.<,>她欣赏美丽的日落。<,>ad(加强)+mire(惊奇)→让人感到惊奇→钦佩<,>adore(vt.崇拜/vt.爱慕)/aspire(vi.渴望/vi.追求)

consequently<,>/ˈkɒnsɪkwəntli/<,>/ˈkɑːnsɪkwentli/<,>adv.因此/adv.因而/adv.所以<,>He didn't study hard, and consequently failed the exam.<,>他没有努力学习，因此考试不及格。<,>The roads were icy; consequently, driving was dangerous.<,>道路结冰了，所以开车很危险。<,>She was late and consequently missed the beginning of the movie.<,>她迟到了，因此错过了电影的开头。<,>con(共同)+sequent(跟随)+ly(副词后缀)→跟随其后→因此<,>subsequently(adv.随后/adv.后来)/frequently(adv.频繁地/adv.经常)

virus<,>/ˈvaɪrəs/<,>/ˈvaɪrəs/<,>n.病毒/n.病毒性疾病/n.病毒病<,>The computer was infected by a virus.<,>电脑感染了病毒。<,>She caught a virus and had to stay in bed.<,>她感染了病毒，不得不卧床休息。<,>Scientists are studying the new virus.<,>科学家正在研究这种新病毒。<,>vir(毒)+us(名词后缀)→毒→病毒<,>viral(adj.病毒的/adj.病毒性的)/bacteria(n.细菌)

drain<,>/dreɪn/<,>/dreɪn/<,>v.排去/v.放水/n.耗竭/n.排水沟/n.排水管<,>Don't forget to drain the pasta.<,>别忘了把意大利面的水沥干。<,>The long illness drained his strength.<,>长期患病耗尽了他的体力。<,>The drain is clogged with leaves.<,>排水管被树叶堵住了。<,>d(向下)+rain(雨)→雨水向下流→排水<,>train(n.火车/v.训练)/grain(n.谷物/n.颗粒)

isolate<,>/ˈaɪsəleɪt/<,>/ˈaɪsəleɪt/<,>vt.使隔离/vt.使孤立<,>The patient was isolated to prevent the spread of infection.<,>病人被隔离以防止感染传播。<,>She felt isolated in the new school.<,>在新学校里她感到孤立。<,>Scientists isolated the new chemical element.<,>科学家分离出了新的化学元素。<,>i(不)+sol(单独)+ate(动词后缀)→使单独→隔离<,>insulate(vt.隔离/vt.使绝缘)/desolate(adj.荒凉的/vt.使荒芜)

sailor<,>/ˈseɪlə(r)/<,>/ˈseɪlər/<,>n.水手/n.海员<,>The old sailor told us stories about his adventures.<,>老水手给我们讲了他的冒险故事。<,>She wants to become a sailor.<,>她想成为一名水手。<,>The sailors prepared the ship for the storm.<,>水手们为暴风雨做好了准备。<,>sail(航行)+or(人)→航行的人→水手<,>tailor(n.裁缝/v.定制)/sail(n.帆/v.航行)

amuse<,>/əˈmjuːz/<,>/əˈmjuːz/<,>vt.逗…乐/vt.给…娱乐<,>The clown amused the children.<,>小丑逗乐了孩子们。<,>She amused herself by reading.<,>她以读书自娱。<,>His jokes never fail to amuse me.<,>他的笑话总能逗乐我。<,>a(加强)+muse(缪斯女神)→缪斯女神带来欢乐→娱乐<,>abuse(vt.滥用/n.辱骂)/accuse(vt.指责/vt.控告)

inward<,>/ˈɪnwəd/<,>/ˈɪnwərd/<,>adv.向内/adj.里面的/adj.内心的<,>She turned her gaze inward.<,>她把目光转向内心。<,>The door opens inward.<,>门向内开。<,>He kept his inward thoughts to himself.<,>他把内心的想法藏在心里。<,>in(内)+ward(方向)→向内<,>outward(adv.向外/adj.外表的)/forward(adv.向前/adj.向前的)

responsibility<,>/rɪˌspɒnsəˈbɪləti/<,>/rɪˌspɑːnsəˈbɪləti/<,>n.责任/n.责任心/n.职责/n.义务<,>It's your responsibility to finish the work.<,>完成这项工作是你的责任。<,>She has a strong sense of responsibility.<,>她有很强的责任感。<,>Taking care of children is a big responsibility.<,>照顾孩子是一项重大责任。<,>re(回)+spons(承诺)+ibility(能力)→回应承诺的能力→责任<,>response(n.回答/n.反应)/responsive(adj.响应的/adj.反应迅速的)

enquire<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪər/<,>v.询问<,>I'll enquire about the train schedule.<,>我会询问火车时刻表。<,>She enquired after your health.<,>她询问了你的健康状况。<,>He enquired the way to the station.<,>他询问了去车站的路。<,>en(使)+quire(寻求)→使寻求→询问<,>require(vt.需要/vt.要求)/acquire(vt.获得/vt.学到)
civil<,>/ˈsɪv.əl/<,>/ˈsɪv.əl/<,>adj.公民的/adj.文职的/adj.民用的/adj.民事的/adj.文明的<,>Every citizen has civil rights and responsibilities.<,>每个公民都有公民权利和责任。<,>She works in a civil service job.<,>她从事文职工作。<,>The civil engineering project was completed on time.<,>这项民用工程项目按时完成。<,>civ(公民)+il(形容词后缀)→公民的<,>civilian(n.平民)/civilize(v.使文明)/civility(n.礼貌)

popularity<,>/ˌpɒp.jəˈlær.ə.ti/<,>/ˌpɑː.pjəˈler.ə.t̬i/<,>n.普及/n.流行/n.声望<,>The popularity of social media has grown rapidly.<,>社交媒体的普及迅速增长。<,>His popularity among students is undeniable.<,>他在学生中的声望是不可否认的。<,>The song gained popularity overnight.<,>这首歌一夜之间流行起来。<,>popular(流行的)+ity(名词后缀)→流行度<,>population(n.人口)/popularize(v.普及)/populace(n.平民)

subsequent<,>/ˈsʌb.sɪ.kwənt/<,>/ˈsʌb.sɪ.kwənt/<,>adj.随后的/adj.后来的<,>Subsequent events proved her right.<,>随后的事件证明她是对的。<,>The subsequent chapters are more interesting.<,>后面的章节更有趣。<,>He arrived subsequent to the meeting.<,>他在会议之后到达。<,>sub(下面)+sequ(跟随)+ent(形容词后缀)→随后跟随的→随后的<,>sequence(n.顺序)/consequence(n.结果)/sequential(adj.连续的)

indicate<,>/ˈɪn.dɪ.keɪt/<,>/ˈɪn.də.keɪt/<,>vt.标示/vt.表示/vt.表明<,>The sign indicates the direction to the exit.<,>这个标志指示出口的方向。<,>Her smile indicated happiness.<,>她的微笑表示快乐。<,>Research indicates a strong correlation.<,>研究表明有很强的相关性。<,>in(里面)+dic(说)+ate(动词后缀)→在里面说→表明<,>indicator(n.指示器)/dictate(v.口述)/predict(v.预测)

scarcely<,>/ˈskeəs.li/<,>/ˈsker.sli/<,>adv.几乎不/adv.简直不/adv.决不/adv.刚刚/adv.才<,>I scarcely recognized her in that dress.<,>我几乎认不出穿着那件衣服的她。<,>He had scarcely arrived when it started to rain.<,>他刚到就开始下雨了。<,>Scarcely had I sat down when the phone rang.<,>我刚坐下电话就响了。<,>scarce(稀少的)+ly(副词后缀)→稀少地→几乎不<,>barely(adv.仅仅)/hardly(adv.几乎不)/rarely(adv.很少)

outstanding<,>/aʊtˈstæn.dɪŋ/<,>/aʊtˈstæn.dɪŋ/<,>adj.突出的/adj.杰出的/adj.未解决的/adj.未偿付的<,>She is an outstanding student.<,>她是个杰出的学生。<,>The outstanding debt must be paid.<,>未偿付的债务必须偿还。<,>His performance was outstanding.<,>他的表现很突出。<,>out(出)+stand(站立)+ing(形容词后缀)→站出来的一突出的<,>standout(n.杰出的人)/understanding(n.理解)/withstand(v.承受)

charge<,>/tʃɑːdʒ/<,>/tʃɑːrdʒ/<,>v.索价/v.控告/v.充电/v.充满/v.向前冲/n.费用/n.管理/n.控告/n.指责/n.电荷/n.充电<,>They charge $50 for the service.<,>这项服务他们收费50美元。<,>The battery needs to be charged.<,>电池需要充电。<,>He was charged with theft.<,>他被指控盗窃。<,>char(车)+ge→车需要充电→充电<,>change(n.变化)/discharge(v.释放)/recharge(v.再充电)

oval<,>/ˈəʊ.vəl/<,>/ˈoʊ.vəl/<,>adj.椭圆形的/n.椭圆形<,>She has an oval face.<,>她有一张椭圆形的脸。<,>The mirror is in an oval shape.<,>镜子是椭圆形的。<,>The track is an oval.<,>跑道是椭圆形的。<,>ov(蛋)+al(形容词后缀)→像蛋一样的→椭圆形的<,>ovary(n.卵巢)/ovation(n.热烈欢迎)/ovum(n.卵子)
column<,>/ˈkɒləm/<,>/ˈkɑːləm/<,>n.柱/n.支柱/n.圆柱/n.纵队/n.栏/n.专栏<,>The ancient temple was supported by massive marble columns.<,>这座古庙由巨大的大理石圆柱支撑。<,>She writes a weekly column for the local newspaper.<,>她为当地报纸撰写每周专栏。<,>The soldiers marched in columns towards the battlefield.<,>士兵们以纵队形式向战场行进。<,>col(共同)+lumn(线)→排成直线的物体→圆柱<,>volume(n.体积/n.音量)/solemn(adj.庄严的)/colon(n.冒号/n.结肠)

sample<,>/ˈsɑːmpl/<,>/ˈsæmpl/<,>n.样品/n.试样/n.样本/vt.从...抽样/vt.品尝/vt.体验<,>The company sent us free samples of their new products.<,>公司给我们寄来了新产品的免费样品。<,>Researchers sampled water from different parts of the river.<,>研究人员从河流的不同区域抽取水样。<,>Would you like to sample this new flavor of ice cream?<,>你想尝尝这种新口味的冰淇淋吗？<,>s(看作see)+ample(充足的)→看到充足的样品→样本<,>example(n.例子)/simple(adj.简单的)/temple(n.寺庙)

partner<,>/ˈpɑːtnə(r)/<,>/ˈpɑːrtnər/<,>vi.做...的搭档/n.伙伴/n.合伙人/n.搭档/n.配偶<,>She partnered with him in the dance competition.<,>她在舞蹈比赛中与他搭档。<,>The two companies became business partners last year.<,>这两家公司去年成为了商业合伙人。<,>My partner and I have been married for 20 years.<,>我和我的配偶已经结婚20年了。<,>part(部分)+ner→成为一部分的人→搭档<,>pardon(v.原谅)/portion(n.部分)/pattern(n.模式)
