diagnose<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnəʊz/<,>/ˈdaɪəɡnoʊs/<,>vt.诊断<,>The doctor diagnosed her illness as pneumonia.<,>医生诊断她的病是肺炎。<,>Early diagnosis can greatly improve treatment outcomes.<,>早期诊断可以大大改善治疗效果。<,>Special equipment is needed to diagnose this condition.<,>诊断这种情况需要特殊设备。<,>dia(穿过)+gnos(知道)+e→透过现象知道本质→诊断<,>prognosis(n.预后)/ignore(v.忽视)/agnostic(adj.不可知论的)

clarify<,>/ˈklærəfaɪ/<,>/ˈklerəfaɪ/<,>vt.澄清/vt.阐明<,>Could you clarify your statement?<,>你能澄清一下你的声明吗？<,>The teacher clarified the difficult concept.<,>老师阐明了这个难懂的概念。<,>He clarified his position on the issue.<,>他澄清了自己在这个问题上的立场。<,>clar(清楚)+ify(使)→使清楚→澄清<,>classify(vt.分类)/simplify(vt.简化)  

furnace<,>/ˈfɜːnɪs/<,>/ˈfɜːrnɪs/<,>n.炉子/n.熔炉/n.鼓风炉<,>The metal was melted in the furnace.<,>金属在熔炉里熔化。<,>It's as hot as a furnace in here!<,>这里热得像火炉！<,>The furnace needs to be repaired.<,>这个炉子需要修理。<,>furn(火)+ace(名词后缀)→火炉<,>fireplace(n.壁炉)/oven(n.烤箱)  

ditch<,>/dɪtʃ/<,>/dɪtʃ/<,>n.沟/n.沟渠/n.渠道<,>They dug a ditch to drain the water.<,>他们挖了一条沟排水。<,>The car skidded into the ditch.<,>汽车滑进了沟里。<,>Farmers use ditches for irrigation.<,>农民用沟渠灌溉。<,>di(分开)+tch(名词后缀)→分开的沟<,>trench(n.壕沟)/channel(n.渠道)

scare<,>/skeə(r)/<,>/sker/<,>v.吓/v.使害怕/v.受惊吓/v.感到害怕/n.惊恐/n.恐慌<,>The loud noise scared the baby.<,>巨大的声响吓到了宝宝。<,>She had a scare when she saw the snake.<,>看到蛇时她吓了一跳。<,>Don't scare me like that!<,>别那样吓我！<,>s(死)+care(关心)→死关心→害怕<,>scar(n.伤疤)/stare(v.凝视)
thunder<,>/ˈθʌndə(r)/<,>/ˈθʌndər/<,>vi.打雷/vi.轰隆响/vi.大声喊/vi.吼/n.雷/n.雷声/n.擂鼓般的响声/n.轰隆声<,>The thunder roared loudly during the storm.<,>暴风雨中雷声轰鸣。<,>He thundered at the children to be quiet.<,>他大声吼叫让孩子们安静。<,>The thunder of applause filled the auditorium.<,>雷鸣般的掌声充满了礼堂。<,>thun(拟声词)+der→雷声<,>lightning(n.闪电)/blunder(n.错误/v.犯错)  

observe<,>/əbˈzɜːv/<,>/əbˈzɜːrv/<,>vt.注意到/vt.观察/vt.评说/vt.遵守<,>Scientists observe the behavior of animals in the wild.<,>科学家观察野外动物的行为。<,>She observed that the project was behind schedule.<,>她评论说项目进度落后了。<,>We must observe the traffic rules.<,>我们必须遵守交通规则。<,>ob(加强)+serve(服务)→加强服务→观察<,>reserve(v.保留/n.储备)/deserve(v.应得)  

humorous<,>/ˈhjuːmərəs/<,>/ˈhjuːmərəs/<,>adj.幽默的/adj.诙谐的<,>He told a humorous story at the party.<,>他在聚会上讲了一个幽默的故事。<,>Her humorous remarks made everyone laugh.<,>她诙谐的评论让大家发笑。<,>The movie is full of humorous scenes.<,>这部电影充满了幽默的场景。<,>humor(幽默)+ous(形容词后缀)→幽默的<,>serious(adj.严肃的)/glamorous(adj.迷人的)  

furnish<,>/ˈfɜːnɪʃ/<,>/ˈfɜːrnɪʃ/<,>vt.供应/vt.提供/vt.装备<,>The hotel furnished us with all necessary amenities.<,>酒店为我们提供了所有必要的便利设施。<,>They furnished the house with modern furniture.<,>他们用现代家具装备了房子。<,>The company furnished the data for the research.<,>公司为研究提供了数据。<,>fur(皮毛)+nish→提供皮毛→供应<,>finish(v.完成)/punish(v.惩罚)  

bet<,>/bet/<,>/bet/<,>vt.打赌/vt.敢说/vt.确信/n.打赌/n.赌金/n.赌注<,>I bet it will rain tomorrow.<,>我敢说明天会下雨。<,>He placed a bet on the horse race.<,>他在赛马上下了赌注。<,>It's a safe bet that prices will rise.<,>价格会上涨是十拿九稳的事。<,>bet(谐音"别赌")→打赌<,>debt(n.债务)/pet(n.宠物)  

contact<,>/ˈkɒntækt/<,>/ˈkɑːntækt/<,>n.接触/n.联系/n.交往/vt.与…接触/vt.与…取得联系<,>Please contact me if you have any questions.<,>如有任何问题，请联系我。<,>The two surfaces are in direct contact.<,>两个表面直接接触。<,>She has many business contacts.<,>她有很多商业往来。<,>con(共同)+tact(接触)→共同接触→联系<,>contract(n.合同)/contrast(n.对比)  

rare<,>/reə(r)/<,>/rer/<,>adj.稀有的/adj.冷僻的/adj.珍奇的/adj.出类拔萃的/adj.稀薄的/adj.煎得嫩的<,>This is a rare species of bird.<,>这是一种稀有鸟类。<,>She has a rare talent for music.<,>她在音乐方面有非凡的天赋。<,>I like my steak rare.<,>我喜欢三分熟的牛排。<,>rare(联想"瑞尔"货币)→稀有货币→稀有的<,>rear(n.后面/v.抚养)/bear(n.熊/v.忍受)  

discharge<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑːdʒ/<,>/dɪsˈtʃɑːrdʒ/<,>v.释放/v.排出/v.卸货/n.释放/n.放电<,>The factory discharges waste into the river.<,>工厂将废水排入河流。<,>The patient was discharged from the hospital.<,>病人出院了。<,>Lightning is a natural electrical discharge.<,>闪电是自然的放电现象。<,>dis(不)+charge(充电)→放电<,>recharge(v.充电)/overcharge(v.要价过高)  

exclude<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>/ɪkˈskluːd/<,>vt.把…排除在外<,>They excluded him from the meeting.<,>他们把他排除在会议之外。<,>This price excludes tax.<,>这个价格不含税。<,>No one should be excluded from education.<,>任何人都不应被排除在教育之外。<,>ex(出)+clude(关闭)→关在外面→排除<,>include(v.包含)/conclude(v.结束)  

scary<,>/ˈskeəri/<,>/ˈskeri/<,>adj.引起惊慌的<,>The horror movie was too scary for children.<,>这部恐怖片对孩子来说太吓人了。<,>She had a scary experience last night.<,>她昨晚有个可怕的经历。<,>The dark alley looks scary.<,>那条黑暗的小巷看起来很吓人。<,>scar(伤疤)+y→有伤疤的→吓人的<,>scar(n.伤疤)/stare(v.凝视)
criticism<,>/ˈkrɪtɪsɪzəm/<,>/ˈkrɪtɪˌsɪzəm/<,>n.批评/n.批判/n.评论/n.评论文章<,>His criticism of the project was harsh but fair.<,>他对该项目的批评严厉但公正。<,>The article provides a detailed criticism of the novel.<,>这篇文章对小说进行了详细的评论。<,>She faced criticism for her controversial remarks.<,>她因有争议的言论而面临批评。<,>critic(批评家)+ism(主义)→批评<,>critique(n.评论/v.评论)/criticize(v.批评)/praise(n.赞扬/v.表扬)  

utmost<,>/ˈʌtməʊst/<,>/ˈʌtˌmoʊst/<,>adj.最远的/n.极限<,>She did her utmost to finish the project on time.<,>她竭尽全力按时完成项目。<,>This is a matter of the utmost importance.<,>这是极其重要的事情。<,>He pushed himself to the utmost to win the race.<,>他竭尽全力赢得比赛。<,>ut(外)+most(最)→最远的<,>utmost(n.极限)/extreme(adj.极端的/n.极端)/ultimate(adj.最终的/n.终极)  

image<,>/ˈɪmɪdʒ/<,>/ˈɪmɪdʒ/<,>n.像/n.形象/n.映像/n.形象的描述<,>The company is trying to improve its public image.<,>公司正努力改善其公众形象。<,>The mirror reflected a clear image of her face.<,>镜子清晰地映出她的脸。<,>The poem creates a vivid image of the countryside.<,>这首诗生动地描绘了乡村景象。<,>imag(想象)+e→形象<,>imagine(v.想象)/imagery(n.意象)/imitation(n.模仿)  

consultancy<,>/kənˈsʌltənsi/<,>/kənˈsʌltənsi/<,>n.咨询公司<,>He works for a management consultancy firm.<,>他在一家管理咨询公司工作。<,>The consultancy provided valuable advice on the project.<,>咨询公司为项目提供了宝贵建议。<,>She set up her own consultancy after years of experience.<,>她在多年经验后成立了自己的咨询公司。<,>consult(咨询)+ancy(状态)→咨询公司<,>consultant(n.顾问)/consult(v.咨询)/counsel(n.建议/v.劝告)  

ribbon<,>/ˈrɪbən/<,>/ˈrɪbən/<,>n.缎带/n.丝带/n.色带<,>She tied her hair with a red ribbon.<,>她用红色丝带扎头发。<,>The gift was wrapped with a beautiful ribbon.<,>礼物用漂亮的缎带包装。<,>The printer ran out of ink ribbon.<,>打印机的色带用完了。<,>rib(肋骨)+bon(带子)→丝带<,>rib(n.肋骨)/ribbon(n.丝带)/ribald(adj.粗俗的)  

garbage<,>/ˈɡɑːbɪdʒ/<,>/ˈɡɑrbɪdʒ/<,>n.垃圾/n.废物/n.废话/n.无用的资料<,>Take out the garbage before it starts to smell.<,>在垃圾发臭前把它倒掉。<,>Don't listen to his garbage; he doesn't know what he's talking about.<,>别听他的废话，他根本不知道自己在说什么。<,>The folder is full of useless garbage.<,>文件夹里全是无用的资料。<,>gar(衣服)+bage(废料)→垃圾<,>rubbish(n.垃圾)/trash(n.垃圾)/waste(n.废物)  

complain<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>/kəmˈpleɪn/<,>vi.抱怨/vi.诉苦/vi.控告/vi.投诉<,>She complained about the poor service at the restaurant.<,>她抱怨餐厅的服务差。<,>He complained to the manager about the noisy neighbors.<,>他向经理投诉邻居吵闹。<,>They have no reason to complain; everything was perfect.<,>他们没有理由抱怨，一切都很完美。<,>com(一起)+plain(捶胸)→抱怨<,>complaint(n.抱怨)/explain(v.解释)/plain(adj.简单的)  

mainland<,>/ˈmeɪnlənd/<,>/ˈmeɪnˌlænd/<,>n.大陆<,>They traveled from the island to the mainland by ferry.<,>他们乘渡轮从岛上到大陆。<,>The storm caused disruptions on the mainland.<,>风暴给大陆造成了混乱。<,>Mainland China has a diverse climate.<,>中国大陆气候多样。<,>main(主要的)+land(陆地)→大陆<,>island(n.岛屿)/peninsula(n.半岛)/continent(n.大陆)  

homogeneous<,>/ˌhɒməˈdʒiːniəs/<,>/ˌhoʊməˈdʒiːniəs/<,>adj.同种类的/adj.同性质的/adj.有相同特征的<,>The population in this area is quite homogeneous.<,>这个地区的人口相当同质。<,>The mixture should be homogeneous before use.<,>混合物在使用前应均匀。<,>They come from a homogeneous cultural background.<,>他们来自相同的文化背景。<,>homo(相同)+gene(基因)+ous(的)→同种类的<,>heterogeneous(adj.异质的)/homogenize(v.使均匀)/homonym(n.同音异义词)  

anxiety<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>/æŋˈzaɪəti/<,>n.焦虑/n.忧虑/n.渴望/n.热望<,>She felt a lot of anxiety before the exam.<,>考试前她感到非常焦虑。<,>His anxiety about the future kept him awake at night.<,>对未来的忧虑让他夜不能寐。<,>They expressed anxiety to see their families again.<,>他们表达了渴望再次见到家人的心情。<,>anx(痛苦)+iety(状态)→焦虑<,>anxious(adj.焦虑的)/eagerness(n.渴望)/worry(n.忧虑)
temptation<,>/tempˈteɪʃn/<,>/tempˈteɪʃn/<,>n.诱惑/n.引诱<,>He couldn't resist the temptation of chocolate.<,>他无法抗拒巧克力的诱惑。<,>The temptation to quit was strong, but she persevered.<,>放弃的诱惑很大，但她坚持下来了。<,>Money can be a great temptation for some people.<,>金钱对某些人来说可能是巨大的诱惑。<,>tempt(引诱)+ation(名词后缀)→诱惑<,>temper(n.脾气/v.缓和)/temple(n.寺庙)/temporal(adj.暂时的)

adjust<,>/əˈdʒʌst/<,>/əˈdʒʌst/<,>vt.调整/vt.调节/vt.校正<,>It took me a while to adjust to the new time zone.<,>我花了一些时间适应新的时区。<,>Can you adjust the volume, please?<,>你能调节一下音量吗？<,>The mechanic adjusted the car's brakes.<,>机械师调整了汽车的刹车。<,>ad(加强)+just(正确)→使正确→调整<,>adjoin(v.毗邻)/adjourn(v.休会)/adjudge(v.判决)

popularize<,>/ˈpɒpjələraɪz/<,>/ˈpɑːpjələraɪz/<,>vt.普及<,>The internet has helped popularize many new ideas.<,>互联网帮助普及了许多新观念。<,>This book aims to popularize science for children.<,>这本书旨在向儿童普及科学。<,>The TV show popularized this dance style.<,>这个电视节目使这种舞蹈风格流行起来。<,>popular(流行的)+ize(使...化)→使流行→普及<,>populate(v.居住于)/population(n.人口)/popularity(n.流行)

burst<,>/bɜːst/<,>/bɜːrst/<,>vi.爆裂/vi.爆炸/vi.挤满/vi.突然打开/vi.突然发作/vt.使爆炸/vt.突然打开/n.爆炸<,>The balloon burst with a loud pop.<,>气球砰的一声爆了。<,>She burst into tears when she heard the news.<,>她听到消息后突然哭了起来。<,>The dam burst after days of heavy rain.<,>连日大雨后大坝决堤了。<,>bur(燃烧)+st→突然燃烧→爆炸<,>burst/bust(v.打破/n.半身像)/burden(n.负担)/burn(v.燃烧)

vigorous<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>/ˈvɪɡərəs/<,>adj.朝气蓬勃的/adj.有力的/adj.用力的<,>He made a vigorous speech at the conference.<,>他在会议上发表了有力的演讲。<,>The plants grew with vigorous health.<,>这些植物生长得生机勃勃。<,>She gave the rug a vigorous shake.<,>她用力抖了抖地毯。<,>vigor(活力)+ous(形容词后缀)→有活力的<,>vigor(n.活力)/rigorous(adj.严格的)/verdant(adj.翠绿的)

debt<,>/det/<,>/det/<,>n.债/n.债务/n.欠债<,>He's struggling to pay off his student debts.<,>他正在努力偿还学生贷款。<,>The company is in deep debt.<,>这家公司负债累累。<,>I owe you a debt of gratitude for your help.<,>我欠你一份人情，感谢你的帮助。<,>发音类似"贷的"→贷款→债务<,>debt/debit(n.借方)/doubt(n.怀疑)/debut(n.初次登场)

refrigerator<,>/rɪˈfrɪdʒəreɪtə(r)/<,>/rɪˈfrɪdʒəreɪtər/<,>n.冰箱/n.冷藏库<,>Please put the milk back in the refrigerator.<,>请把牛奶放回冰箱。<,>We need to buy a new refrigerator.<,>我们需要买一台新冰箱。<,>The laboratory has a special refrigerator for samples.<,>实验室有一个存放样品的专用冷藏柜。<,>re(再)+friger(冷)+ator(物)→使再冷却的机器→冰箱<,>refrigerate(v.冷藏)/frigid(adj.寒冷的)/friction(n.摩擦)

necessity<,>/nəˈsesəti/<,>/nəˈsesəti/<,>n.必需品/n.必要性/n.需要<,>Food and water are basic necessities of life.<,>食物和水是生活的基本必需品。<,>There's no necessity to hurry; we have plenty of time.<,>没必要着急，我们时间很充裕。<,>The necessity of wearing seat belts is well known.<,>系安全带的重要性众所周知。<,>necessary(必要的)+ity(名词后缀)→必要性<,>necessary(adj.必要的)/necessitate(v.使成为必需)/accessory(n.附件)

fog<,>/fɒɡ/<,>/fɑːɡ/<,>n.雾/n.烟雾/n.尘雾<,>The morning fog made driving difficult.<,>晨雾使得驾驶变得困难。<,>London is famous for its thick fogs.<,>伦敦以其浓雾而闻名。<,>A fog of confusion surrounded the new policy.<,>新政策被困惑的迷雾所笼罩。<,>发音类似"雾"→雾<,>fog/frog(n.青蛙)/foggy(adj.有雾的)/smog(n.烟雾)

frame<,>/freɪm/<,>/freɪm/<,>n.框架/n.框子/n.构架/vt.给...镶框/vt.陷害/vt.诬告/vt.制定/vt.表达<,>She put the photo in a beautiful frame.<,>她把照片放在一个漂亮的相框里。<,>The police say he was framed for the crime.<,>警方称他是被诬陷犯罪的。<,>The building's steel frame is very strong.<,>这座建筑的钢架结构非常坚固。<,>fr(自由)+ame→自由活动的结构→框架<,>frame/flame(n.火焰)/fame(n.名声)/framer(n.制定者)

industrialize<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəlaɪz/<,>/ɪnˈdʌstriəlaɪz/<,>v.工业化<,>The country is trying to industrialize its economy.<,>这个国家正试图使其经济工业化。<,>Many nations industrialized in the 19th century.<,>许多国家在19世纪实现了工业化。<,>The government plans to industrialize the rural areas.<,>政府计划使农村地区工业化。<,>industry(工业)+alize(动词后缀)→工业化<,>industrial(adj.工业的)/industrious(adj.勤劳的)/industry(n.工业)

clash<,>/klæʃ/<,>/klæʃ/<,>vi.发生冲突/vi.不协调/vi.砰地相撞/vt.发出刺耳的撞击声/n.冲突/n.不协调/n.刺耳的撞击声<,>The two groups clashed over political differences.<,>这两个团体因政治分歧发生了冲突。<,>Her dress clashes with her shoes.<,>她的裙子和鞋子不协调。<,>I heard a loud clash of metal.<,>我听到金属刺耳的撞击声。<,>cla(碰撞)+sh→碰撞的声音→冲突<,>crash(v.碰撞/n.撞车)/flash(v.闪光/n.闪光)/smash(v.打碎/n.破碎)

compel<,>/kəmˈpel/<,>/kəmˈpel/<,>vt.强迫/vt.迫使屈服<,>The law compels citizens to pay taxes.<,>法律强制公民纳税。<,>His illness compelled him to stay in bed.<,>他的病迫使他卧床休息。<,>She felt compelled to tell the truth.<,>她感到不得不说出真相。<,>com(共同)+pel(推)→一起推→强迫<,>expel(v.驱逐)/repel(v.击退)/propel(v.推进)

capable<,>/ˈkeɪpəbl/<,>/ˈkeɪpəbl/<,>adj.有能力的/adj.有才能的<,>She is capable of handling the project.<,>她有能力处理这个项目。<,>He proved himself capable in the crisis.<,>他在危机中证明了自己是有能力的。<,>This machine is capable of performing complex tasks.<,>这台机器能执行复杂的任务。<,>cap(拿)+able(能)→能拿住的→有能力的<,>incapable(adj.无能力的)/capacity(n.容量)/capability(n.能力)

depress<,>/dɪˈpres/<,>/dɪˈpres/<,>vt.使沮丧/vt.使不景气/vt.削弱/vt.抑制<,>The bad news depressed her.<,>这个坏消息使她沮丧。<,>The recession has depressed the housing market.<,>经济衰退使房地产市场不景气。<,>This drug can depress the central nervous system.<,>这种药物会抑制中枢神经系统。<,>de(向下)+press(压)→向下压→使沮丧<,>impress(v.留下印象)/express(v.表达)/suppress(v.镇压)

parade<,>/pəˈreɪd/<,>/pəˈreɪd/<,>v.游行/v.列队前进/v.招摇而行/n.游行/n.检阅<,>The soldiers paraded through the town.<,>士兵们列队穿过城镇。<,>She loves to parade her new clothes.<,>她喜欢炫耀她的新衣服。<,>The annual parade attracts many tourists.<,>每年的游行吸引了许多游客。<,>para(旁边)+de→在旁边展示→游行<,>parade(v.游行)/parade(n.游行)/parade(v.炫耀)

burden<,>/ˈbɜːdn/<,>/ˈbɜːrdn/<,>n.重担/n.精神负担/vt.加重压于/vt.烦扰/vt.负担/vt.装载<,>He carried the burden of supporting his family.<,>他背负着养家的重担。<,>Don't burden yourself with unnecessary worries.<,>不要用不必要的忧虑来烦扰自己。<,>The truck was burdened with heavy goods.<,>卡车装载着沉重的货物。<,>burd(负担)+en→负担<,>burden(n.负担)/burden(v.加重负担)/burdensome(adj.繁重的)

precaution<,>/prɪˈkɔːʃn/<,>/prɪˈkɔːʃn/<,>n.预防/n.防备/n.警惕<,>Take precautions against theft.<,>采取预防措施防止盗窃。<,>She took the precaution of locking the door.<,>她采取了锁门的防备措施。<,>It's a good precaution to wear a seatbelt.<,>系安全带是个很好的预防措施。<,>pre(前)+caution(小心)→提前小心→预防<,>caution(n.小心)/precautionary(adj.预防的)/precautious(adj.有防备的)
lemon<,>/ˈlɛmən/<,>/ˈlɛmən/<,>n.柠檬/n.柠檬树/n.柠檬黄/n.淡黄色<,>She added a slice of lemon to her tea.<,>她在茶里加了一片柠檬。<,>The walls were painted a bright lemon color.<,>墙壁被漆成了明亮的柠檬黄色。<,>He planted a lemon tree in his backyard.<,>他在后院种了一棵柠檬树。<,>联想：lemonade（柠檬水）<,>lime（酸橙）/melon（甜瓜）

personality<,>/ˌpɜːsəˈnæləti/<,>/ˌpɜːrsəˈnæləti/<,>n.人格/n.个性/n.人物/n.名人<,>Her cheerful personality makes her popular.<,>她开朗的个性使她很受欢迎。<,>He is a well-known personality in the entertainment industry.<,>他是娱乐圈的知名人物。<,>The test measures different aspects of personality.<,>这个测试衡量个性的不同方面。<,>person（人）+ ality（性质）→人的性质→个性<,>personal（个人的）/personnel（员工）

plot<,>/plɒt/<,>/plɑːt/<,>v.密谋/v.计划/v.绘制平面图/n.故事情节/n.计划/n.小块土地<,>They plotted to overthrow the government.<,>他们密谋推翻政府。<,>The novel has an intricate plot.<,>这部小说的情节错综复杂。<,>He bought a small plot of land to build a house.<,>他买了一块小地来建房子。<,>联想：pot（罐子）→plot（密谋）<,>plod（沉重地走）/pilot（飞行员）

sanction<,>/ˈsæŋkʃən/<,>/ˈsæŋkʃən/<,>vt.批准/vt.认可/n.批准/n.认可/n.约束因素/n.国际制裁<,>The government sanctioned the new policy.<,>政府批准了新政策。<,>Economic sanctions were imposed on the country.<,>该国受到了经济制裁。<,>Social norms act as a sanction against bad behavior.<,>社会规范是对不良行为的约束。<,>sanct（神圣）+ ion→神圣的批准→认可<,>sanctuary（避难所）/satisfaction（满意）

rate<,>/reɪt/<,>/reɪt/<,>vi.被评价/vi.被列入特定级别/n.速度/n.比率/n.价格/n.等级/vt.评估/vt.定级/vt.值得<,>The hotel is rated five stars.<,>这家酒店被评为五星级。<,>The crime rate has decreased this year.<,>今年的犯罪率下降了。<,>What is the exchange rate today?<,>今天的汇率是多少？<,>rat（计算）+ e→计算的结果→比率<,>ratio（比率）/rant（咆哮）

alert<,>/əˈlɜːt/<,>/əˈlɜːrt/<,>adj.警觉的/adj.留神的/vt.使认识到/n.警戒/n.警报<,>Stay alert while driving at night.<,>夜间开车要保持警觉。<,>The security guard was on high alert.<,>保安处于高度戒备状态。<,>The news alerted the public to the danger.<,>这条新闻让公众意识到了危险。<,>all（全部）+ ert（活动）→全部活动起来→警觉<,>alarm（警报）/alter（改变）

await<,>/əˈweɪt/<,>/əˈweɪt/<,>vt.等候/vt.期待/vt.将降临到<,>We await your reply.<,>我们等待您的回复。<,>A surprise awaits you at home.<,>家里有个惊喜等着你。<,>He awaited the results anxiously.<,>他焦急地等待着结果。<,>a（强调）+ wait（等待）→等待<,>wait（等待）/awake（醒着的）

sin<,>/sɪn/<,>/sɪn/<,>vi.犯戒律/vi.犯过失/n.罪/n.罪孽<,>Lying is considered a sin in many religions.<,>在许多宗教中，说谎被视为罪孽。<,>He sinned against his own principles.<,>他违背了自己的原则。<,>They confessed their sins to the priest.<,>他们向神父忏悔了自己的罪过。<,>联想：sing（唱歌）→sin（罪）<,>sign（标志）/sink（下沉）

client<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>/ˈklaɪənt/<,>n.委托人/n.当事人/n.顾客<,>The lawyer met with his client.<,>律师会见了他的委托人。<,>She is a regular client of this salon.<,>她是这家沙龙的常客。<,>The company values its clients' feedback.<,>公司重视客户的反馈。<,>cli（依靠）+ ent（人）→依靠的人→客户<,>customer（顾客）/patient（病人）

prosperity<,>/prɒˈsperəti/<,>/prɑːˈsperəti/<,>n.繁荣/n.兴旺<,>The country enjoyed a period of prosperity.<,>这个国家经历了一段繁荣时期。<,>Economic prosperity depends on many factors.<,>经济繁荣取决于许多因素。<,>They wished the couple prosperity in their new business.<,>他们祝愿这对夫妇的新生意兴旺发达。<,>pro（向前）+ sper（希望）+ ity→向前有希望→繁荣<,>posterity（后代）/property（财产）
divide<,>/dɪˈvaɪd/<,>/dɪˈvaɪd/<,>v.分/v.分开/v.分配/v.分享/v.除/v.产生分歧/n.分歧/n.分界线/n.分水岭<,>Divide the cake into equal parts.<,>把蛋糕分成相等的几份。<,>The river divides the city into two parts.<,>这条河将城市分成两部分。<,>Opinions are divided on this issue.<,>在这个问题上意见有分歧。<,>di(分开)+vide(分开)→分开<,>divert(v.转移/v.转向)/divine(adj.神圣的/n.神学家)  

contrary<,>/ˈkɒntrəri/<,>/ˈkɑːntreri/<,>adj.相反的/n.相反<,>Contrary to popular belief, cats are not aloof.<,>与普遍看法相反，猫并不冷漠。<,>He acted contrary to my advice.<,>他的行为与我的建议相反。<,>On the contrary, I think it's a great idea.<,>相反，我认为这是个好主意。<,>contra(反对)+ry→相反的<,>contrast(n.对比/v.对比)/contradict(v.反驳/v.与…矛盾)  

lump<,>/lʌmp/<,>/lʌmp/<,>v.结块/v.将…归并在一起/n.块/n.肿块<,>She found a lump in her breast.<,>她发现乳房有个肿块。<,>Lump all the expenses together.<,>把所有费用归在一起。<,>The sugar lumped in the coffee.<,>糖在咖啡里结块了。<,>lump(块)→像一团的东西<,>bump(n.肿块/v.碰撞)/plump(adj.丰满的/v.扑通落下)  

digital<,>/ˈdɪdʒɪtl/<,>/ˈdɪdʒɪtl/<,>adj.数字的/adj.数位的<,>We live in a digital age.<,>我们生活在数字时代。<,>She prefers digital watches.<,>她更喜欢数字手表。<,>The camera has a digital display.<,>这台相机有数字显示屏。<,>digit(数字)+al→数字的<,>analog(adj.模拟的)/dial(n.表盘/v.拨号)

historic<,>/hɪˈstɒrɪk/<,>/hɪˈstɔːrɪk/<,>adj.历史上著名的/adj.具有重大历史意义的<,>This is a historic moment.<,>这是一个历史性的时刻。<,>We visited the historic castle.<,>我们参观了那座历史悠久的城堡。<,>The treaty was of historic importance.<,>这个条约具有历史意义。<,>histor(历史)+ic→历史的<,>historical(adj.历史的)/hysteric(adj.歇斯底里的)  

oven<,>/ˈʌvn/<,>/ˈʌvn/<,>n.炉/n.烤箱<,>Preheat the oven to 180°C.<,>将烤箱预热到180°C。<,>She baked a cake in the oven.<,>她在烤箱里烤了一个蛋糕。<,>The bread is still in the oven.<,>面包还在烤箱里。<,>oven(烤箱)→发音类似“欧文”<,>stove(n.炉子)/microwave(n.微波炉)

stroke<,>/strəʊk/<,>/stroʊk/<,>n.中风/n.一举，一次努力/n.划桨，划水/n.击，敲/n.报时的钟声/n.笔画，一笔/vt.抚摸<,>He suffered a stroke last year.<,>他去年中风了。<,>She gave the cat a gentle stroke.<,>她轻轻抚摸了一下猫。<,>With one stroke of the pen, he signed the contract.<,>他大笔一挥，签下了合同。<,>str(街道)+oke(看作open打开)→在街上打开心扉→抚摸<,>strike(v.打击/n.罢工)/stroll(v.闲逛/n.漫步)

breed<,>/briːd/<,>/brid/<,>v.繁殖/v.养育，培育/v.酿成，产生/n.品种<,>They breed horses on their farm.<,>他们在农场养马。<,>Rabbits breed quickly.<,>兔子繁殖得很快。<,>This breed of dog is very intelligent.<,>这个品种的狗非常聪明。<,>b(看作baby)+reed(芦苇)→在芦苇丛中养育幼崽→养育<,>bleed(v.流血)/bread(n.面包)/breath(n.呼吸)

publish<,>/ˈpʌblɪʃ/<,>/ˈpʌblɪʃ/<,>vt.公布，发表/vt.出版，刊印<,>The research was published in a scientific journal.<,>这项研究发表在科学期刊上。<,>The government published the new regulations yesterday.<,>政府昨天公布了新规定。<,>He has published three novels so far.<,>他至今已出版了三本小说。<,>pub(公共)+lish(使)→使公开→出版<,>punish(v.惩罚)/public(n.公众)

correspondent<,>/ˌkɒrɪˈspɒndənt/<,>/ˌkɔːrɪˈspɑːndənt/<,>n.通讯员，记者<,>She works as a foreign correspondent for CNN.<,>她是CNN的驻外记者。<,>The newspaper has correspondents in all major cities.<,>这家报纸在所有主要城市都有通讯员。<,>He filed his report as a war correspondent.<,>他以战地记者的身份发回了报道。<,>correspond(通信)+ent(人)→通信的人→记者<,>respondent(n.应答者)/corespondent(n.共同被告)

avoid<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>/əˈvɔɪd/<,>vt.避免，躲开/vt.撤销<,>Try to avoid making the same mistake twice.<,>尽量避免犯同样的错误。<,>He avoided eye contact with her.<,>他避开了与她的目光接触。<,>The company is trying to avoid bankruptcy.<,>公司正试图避免破产。<,>a(不)+void(空的)→不让空着→避免<,>avow(v.承认)/void(adj.空的)

renew<,>/rɪˈnjuː/<,>/rɪˈnuː/<,>v.重新开始，继续/v.更新/v.恢复/v.延长有效期<,>We renewed our friendship after many years.<,>多年后我们重续友谊。<,>Don't forget to renew your passport.<,>别忘了续签你的护照。<,>The rain renewed the parched earth.<,>雨水滋润了干涸的土地。<,>re(再)+new(新的)→再次变新→更新<,>resume(v.重新开始)/renovate(v.翻新)

bid<,>/bɪd/<,>/bɪd/<,>n.企图，努力/n.喊价，出价，投标/vt.喊价，投标，出/vt.祝，表示/vt.命令<,>They made a bid for the contract.<,>他们投标争取这份合同。<,>She bid farewell to her friends.<,>她向朋友们道别。<,>The company is bidding on the construction project.<,>公司正在竞标这个建设项目。<,>b(看作buy)+id(身份证)→用身份证购买→投标<,>bad(adj.坏的)/bed(n.床)

prompt<,>/prɒmpt/<,>/prɑːmpt/<,>adj.敏捷的，及时的/vt.促使，推动/vt.提示/n.提示台词，提示<,>Thank you for your prompt reply.<,>感谢您的及时回复。<,>The alarm prompted them to evacuate the building.<,>警报促使他们撤离大楼。<,>The actor needed a prompt to remember his lines.<,>演员需要提示才能记住台词。<,>pro(向前)+mpt(看作empty空)→向前空出时间→及时的<,>promote(v.促进)/pomp(n.盛况)
astonish<,>/əˈstɒnɪʃ/<,>/əˈstɑːnɪʃ/<,>vt.使惊讶/vt.使吃惊<,>Her sudden appearance astonished everyone.<,>她的突然出现让所有人都大吃一惊。<,>The magician's tricks never fail to astonish the audience.<,>魔术师的戏法总能令观众惊叹不已。<,>It astonished me to learn that he had won the competition.<,>得知他赢得了比赛，我感到非常惊讶。<,>as(加强)+ton(打雷)+ish(动词后缀)→像打雷一样→使震惊<,>astonished(adj.感到惊讶的)/astonishing(adj.令人惊讶的)/astound(vt.使震惊)

comprehensive<,>/ˌkɒmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>/ˌkɑːmprɪˈhensɪv/<,>adj.广泛的/adj.综合的/adj.理解的<,>The school offers a comprehensive curriculum.<,>这所学校提供全面的课程。<,>She gave a comprehensive explanation of the theory.<,>她对这一理论进行了全面的解释。<,>This is the most comprehensive study on the subject so far.<,>这是迄今为止对该课题最全面的研究。<,>com(全部)+prehend(抓住)+sive→全部抓住的→全面的<,>comprehensible(adj.可理解的)/apprehensive(adj.忧虑的)/incomprehensive(adj.理解不深的)

tunnel<,>/ˈtʌnl/<,>/ˈtʌnl/<,>v.挖/v.开/n.隧道/n.坑道/n.地道<,>They are tunneling through the mountain.<,>他们正在开凿穿山隧道。<,>The rabbit disappeared into its tunnel.<,>兔子钻进了它的地洞。<,>The train entered the tunnel with a loud roar.<,>火车轰鸣着驶入隧道。<,>tun(桶)+nel→像桶一样的通道→隧道<,>channel(n.频道/n.海峡)/funnel(n.漏斗/v.汇集)/tun(n.大酒桶)

withdraw<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>/wɪðˈdrɔː/<,>v.收回/v.撤回/v.撤退<,>He decided to withdraw his application.<,>他决定撤回申请。<,>The troops were ordered to withdraw from the front line.<,>部队接到从前线撤退的命令。<,>She withdrew some cash from the ATM.<,>她从自动取款机取了一些现金。<,>with(向后)+draw(拉)→向后拉→撤退<,>withdrawal(n.撤退/n.提款)/withdrawn(adj.孤僻的)/withhold(vt.扣留)

assign<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>/əˈsaɪn/<,>vt.指派/vt.分配/vt.布置/vt.指定<,>The teacher assigned homework to the students.<,>老师给学生们布置了家庭作业。<,>He was assigned to the marketing department.<,>他被分配到市场营销部门。<,>The judge assigned a lawyer to the defendant.<,>法官为被告指定了一名律师。<,>as(加强)+sign(记号)→做记号→分配<,>assignment(n.任务/n.分配)/design(vt.设计)/resign(vt.辞职)

elaborate<,>/ɪˈlæbərət/<,>/ɪˈlæbərət/<,>adj.复杂的/adj.精心制作的/v.详述/v.详细制订<,>She wore an elaborate costume to the party.<,>她穿了一套精心制作的服装参加派对。<,>The scientist elaborated on his new theory.<,>科学家详细阐述了他的新理论。<,>They are elaborating a plan for the project.<,>他们正在为这个项目详细制订计划。<,>e(出)+labor(劳动)+ate→辛苦劳动做出来的→精心制作的<,>laborious(adj.费力的)/collaborate(v.合作)/elaboration(n.精心制作)

feather<,>/ˈfeðə(r)/<,>/ˈfeðər/<,>n.羽毛/n.翎毛<,>The bird preened its feathers.<,>鸟儿整理着自己的羽毛。<,>Her hat was decorated with ostrich feathers.<,>她的帽子上装饰着鸵鸟羽毛。<,>Light as a feather, the box was easy to carry.<,>这个盒子轻如羽毛，很容易携带。<,>feath(飞)+er→鸟类飞行用的→羽毛<,>leather(n.皮革)/weather(n.天气)/heather(n.石南花)

corridor<,>/ˈkɒrɪdɔː(r)/<,>/ˈkɔːrɪdər/<,>n.走廊/n.回廊/n.通路<,>Her office is at the end of the corridor.<,>她的办公室在走廊的尽头。<,>We walked down the long corridor to the exit.<,>我们沿着长长的走廊走向出口。<,>The hotel rooms are arranged along a central corridor.<,>酒店房间沿着中央走廊排列。<,>cor(共同)+rid(笑)+or→大家一起走过的地方→走廊<,>corrode(v.腐蚀)/corridor(n.走廊)/correspond(v.符合)

decade<,>/ˈdekeɪd/<,>/ˈdekeɪd/<,>n.十年/n.十年期<,>He has been working here for over a decade.<,>他在这里工作已经超过十年了。<,>The city has changed dramatically in the past decade.<,>这座城市在过去十年里发生了巨大变化。<,>This technology was developed in the last decade.<,>这项技术是在过去十年里发展起来的。<,>dec(十)+ade→十年<,>decade(n.十年)/decadence(n.颓废)/decagon(n.十边形)

expert<,>/ˈekspɜːt/<,>/ˈekspɜːrt/<,>adj.熟练的/n.专家<,>She is an expert in ancient history.<,>她是古代历史方面的专家。<,>His expert advice saved us a lot of time.<,>他的专业建议为我们节省了大量时间。<,>With expert hands, she repaired the delicate clock.<,>她用熟练的双手修好了那个精致的钟表。<,>ex(出)+pert(尝试)→尝试过很多次的人→专家<,>expertise(n.专门知识)/inexpert(adj.不熟练的)/export(v.出口)
select<,>/sɪˈlekt/<,>/səˈlɛkt/<,>adj.精选的/adj.挑选出来的/adj.优等的/adj.第一流的/vt.选择/vt.挑选<,>She wore a select outfit for the party.<,>她穿了一套精选的服装去参加派对。<,>Only a select few were invited to the private event.<,>只有少数精选的人被邀请参加这个私人活动。<,>He selected the best apples from the basket.<,>他从篮子里挑选了最好的苹果。<,>se(分开)+lect(选择)→挑选出来<,>elect(v.选举)/collect(v.收集)/neglect(v.忽视)

fulfill<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>/fʊlˈfɪl/<,>vt.履行/vt.实现/vt.完成/vt.满足/vt.使满意<,>She fulfilled her promise to visit her grandmother.<,>她履行了去看望祖母的承诺。<,>The project fulfilled all the requirements.<,>这个项目满足了所有的要求。<,>His new job fulfills his career aspirations.<,>他的新工作实现了他的职业抱负。<,>ful(满的)+fill(填满)→完全填满→实现<,>fill(v.填满)/full(adj.满的)/fulfilment(n.实现)

crowd<,>/kraʊd/<,>/kraʊd/<,>v.聚集/v.挤满/v.挤/v.推/n.群/n.一批<,>The fans crowded around the celebrity.<,>粉丝们聚集在名人周围。<,>The market was crowded with shoppers.<,>市场上挤满了购物者。<,>A crowd gathered to watch the performance.<,>一群人聚集起来观看表演。<,>crow(乌鸦)+d→像乌鸦一样聚集<,>crow(n.乌鸦)/crown(n.王冠)/crowded(adj.拥挤的)

congress<,>/ˈkɒŋɡres/<,>/ˈkɑːŋɡrəs/<,>n.代表大会/n.国会/n.议会<,>The congress will discuss new policies.<,>国会将讨论新政策。<,>She attended a medical congress in Berlin.<,>她参加了在柏林举行的医学代表大会。<,>The bill was passed by Congress.<,>该法案由国会通过。<,>con(共同)+gress(走)→走到一起→代表大会<,>progress(n.进步)/aggress(v.侵略)/digress(v.离题)

advanced<,>/ədˈvɑːnst/<,>/ədˈvænst/<,>adj.先进的/adj.高级的/adj.年迈的/adj.后阶段的<,>The country has advanced technology.<,>这个国家拥有先进的技术。<,>She is taking an advanced English course.<,>她正在学习高级英语课程。<,>My grandfather is at an advanced age.<,>我祖父年事已高。<,>advance(前进)+d→前进的→先进的<,>advance(v.前进)/advantage(n.优势)/adventure(n.冒险)

mechanical<,>/məˈkænɪkl/<,>/məˈkænɪkəl/<,>adj.机械的/adj.机械制造的/adj.机械学的/adj.力学的/adj.呆板的<,>He has a mechanical watch.<,>他有一块机械表。<,>The problem has a mechanical solution.<,>这个问题有一个机械的解决方案。<,>His movements were mechanical and unemotional.<,>他的动作呆板且不带感情。<,>mechan(机械)+ical(形容词后缀)→机械的<,>machine(n.机器)/mechanic(n.机械师)/mechanism(n.机制)

recommendation<,>/ˌrekəmenˈdeɪʃn/<,>/ˌrɛkəmənˈdeʃən/<,>n.推荐/n.推荐信/n.建议/n.优点/n.可取之处<,>I wrote him a letter of recommendation.<,>我给他写了一封推荐信。<,>Her recommendation was to start early.<,>她的建议是早点开始。<,>The restaurant comes with high recommendations.<,>这家餐厅获得了高度推荐。<,>re(再次)+commend(推荐)+ation→推荐<,>commend(v.推荐)/command(v.命令)/comment(n.评论)

welfare<,>/ˈwelfeə(r)/<,>/ˈwɛlˌfɛr/<,>n.幸福/n.福利/n.福利救济<,>They are concerned about animal welfare.<,>他们关心动物福利。<,>The government provides welfare for the poor.<,>政府为穷人提供福利救济。<,>Her welfare is our top priority.<,>她的幸福是我们的首要任务。<,>wel(好)+fare(状况)→好的状况→福利<,>farewell(n.告别)/warfare(n.战争)/well-being(n.幸福)

flourish<,>/ˈflʌrɪʃ/<,>/ˈflɜːrɪʃ/<,>vi.繁荣/vi.茂盛/vi.兴旺/vt.挥动<,>The plants flourished in the sunny spot.<,>植物在阳光充足的地方茂盛生长。<,>Her business is flourishing.<,>她的生意蒸蒸日上。<,>He flourished his sword dramatically.<,>他戏剧性地挥舞着他的剑。<,>flour(花)+ish→像花一样盛开→繁荣<,>flour(n.面粉)/floral(adj.花的)/florist(n.花商)

output<,>/ˈaʊtpʊt/<,>/ˈaʊtˌpʊt/<,>n.产量/n.输出/n.输出功率/vt.输出<,>The factory increased its output this year.<,>工厂今年提高了产量。<,>The computer's output was displayed on the screen.<,>计算机的输出显示在屏幕上。<,>The device outputs data to a printer.<,>该设备将数据输出到打印机。<,>out(出)+put(放)→放出来→输出<,>input(n.输入)/outcome(n.结果)/outlet(n.出口)
fatigue<,>/fəˈtiːɡ/<,>/fəˈtiɡ/<,>v.疲劳/n.疲劳/n.劳累<,>After the long hike, he felt extreme fatigue.<,>长途徒步后，他感到极度疲劳。<,>The soldiers were suffering from battle fatigue.<,>士兵们正遭受战斗疲劳。<,>Chronic fatigue can affect your daily life.<,>慢性疲劳会影响你的日常生活。<,>fat(胖)+igue(谐音“一个”)→胖的人容易疲劳<,>faint(adj.虚弱的)/figure(n.数字/v.认为)/fortitude(n.坚韧)

striking<,>/ˈstraɪkɪŋ/<,>/ˈstraɪkɪŋ/<,>adj.显著的/adj.突出的/adj.惹人注目的/adj.容貌出众的<,>There is a striking resemblance between the twins.<,>这对双胞胎有着惊人的相似之处。<,>She was wearing a striking red dress.<,>她穿着一件引人注目的红色连衣裙。<,>The contrast between the two paintings is striking.<,>这两幅画的对比非常显著。<,>strike(打击)+ing→打击人的→显著的<,>stricken(adj.患病的)/striker(n.罢工者)/strikingly(adv.显著地)

vessel<,>/ˈvesl/<,>/ˈvɛsəl/<,>n.容器/n.船/n.飞船/n.管<,>The blood vessels carry blood throughout the body.<,>血管将血液输送到全身。<,>The ship is the largest vessel in the harbor.<,>这艘船是港口里最大的船只。<,>She poured the liquid into a glass vessel.<,>她把液体倒进玻璃容器里。<,>ves(携带)+sel→携带东西的→容器<,>vassal(n.封臣)/vessel(n.容器)/vestal(adj.纯洁的)

majority<,>/məˈdʒɒrəti/<,>/məˈdʒɔrəti/<,>n.多数/n.大多数<,>The majority of the students passed the exam.<,>大多数学生通过了考试。<,>He won the election by a large majority.<,>他以压倒性多数赢得了选举。<,>In the majority of cases, the treatment is effective.<,>在大多数情况下，治疗是有效的。<,>major(主要的)+ity(名词后缀)→大多数<,>minority(n.少数)/major(adj.主要的)/majesty(n.威严)

drag<,>/dræɡ/<,>/dræɡ/<,>v.拖/v.拉/v.迫使/v.硬拉/v.拖着脚步走/n.累赘/n.一吸/n.一抽<,>He had to drag the heavy box across the room.<,>他不得不把沉重的箱子拖过房间。<,>She dragged her feet when it was time to leave.<,>该离开时，她拖着脚步走。<,>Don't be a drag on the team.<,>不要成为团队的累赘。<,>dr(谐音“拽”)+ag→拽→拖<,>drug(n.药物)/dragon(n.龙)/drape(v.悬挂)

inquire<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪə(r)/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪr/<,>v.打听/v.询问/v.调查<,>I will inquire about the train schedule.<,>我会询问火车时刻表。<,>The police are inquiring into the incident.<,>警方正在调查这起事件。<,>She inquired after his health.<,>她询问了他的健康状况。<,>in(内)+quire(寻求)→向内寻求→询问<,>require(v.要求)/acquire(v.获得)/enquire(v.询问)

issue<,>/ˈɪʃuː/<,>/ˈɪʃu/<,>v.发行/v.分发/v.发出/n.问题/n.发行/n.分发<,>The magazine is issued monthly.<,>这本杂志每月发行一次。<,>They discussed the issue of climate change.<,>他们讨论了气候变化的问题。<,>The government issued a warning about the storm.<,>政府发布了关于风暴的警告。<,>is(是)+sue(控告)→问题是控告的原因<,>tissue(n.纸巾)/pursue(v.追求)/rescue(v.救援)
vain<,>/veɪn/<,>/veɪn/<,>adj.徒劳的/adj.自负的<,>All their efforts were in vain.<,>他们所有的努力都白费了。<,>She is vain about her appearance.<,>她对自己的外貌很自负。<,>He made a vain attempt to fix the broken machine.<,>他徒劳地尝试修理那台坏掉的机器。<,>vain(空)→徒劳的<,>vein(n.静脉/n.纹理)/gain(v.获得/n.收益)/pain(n.疼痛/v.使痛苦)  

lower<,>/ˈləʊə(r)/<,>/ˈloʊər/<,>adj.较低的/adj.下面的/vt.放下/vt.降低<,>Please lower your voice.<,>请降低你的声音。<,>The lower shelf is for children's books.<,>下面的架子是放儿童书籍的。<,>He lowered the box onto the floor.<,>他把箱子放到地上。<,>low(低)+er(比较级)→较低的<,>flower(n.花)/glower(v.怒视)/slower(adj.更慢的)

fry<,>/fraɪ/<,>/fraɪ/<,>vt.油煎/vt.油炸/vt.油炒<,>She fried the eggs in butter.<,>她用黄油煎鸡蛋。<,>I love fried chicken.<,>我喜欢炸鸡。<,>He is frying some vegetables for dinner.<,>他正在炒一些蔬菜当晚餐。<,>fry(煎)→与dry(干的)对比记忆<,>fly(v.飞行/n.苍蝇)/fret(v.烦恼/n.烦躁)/fury(n.愤怒)  

youngster<,>/ˈjʌŋstə(r)/<,>/ˈjʌŋstər/<,>n.青年/n.年轻人/n.孩子<,>The youngsters are playing in the park.<,>孩子们在公园里玩耍。<,>He is a talented youngster.<,>他是个有才华的年轻人。<,>This program is designed for youngsters.<,>这个项目是为年轻人设计的。<,>young(年轻的)+ster(人)→年轻人<,>younger(adj.更年轻的)/youngest(adj.最年轻的)/youngish(adj.稍年轻的)  

odd<,>/ɒd/<,>/ɑːd/<,>adj.奇特的/adj.临时的/adj.奇数的/adj.单只的/adj.剩余的<,>He wears odd clothes.<,>他穿着奇特的衣服。<,>She works odd hours.<,>她工作时间不固定。<,>Three is an odd number.<,>三是个奇数。<,>odd(奇怪的)→与add(加)对比记忆<,>odds(n.几率)/ode(n.颂诗)/old(adj.老的)  

lung<,>/lʌŋ/<,>/lʌŋ/<,>n.肺<,>Smoking damages your lungs.<,>吸烟损害你的肺。<,>He has strong lungs.<,>他的肺活量很好。<,>She took a deep breath to fill her lungs.<,>她深吸一口气充满肺部。<,>lung(肺)→与long(长的)对比记忆<,>lunge(v.猛冲/n.弓步)/lug(n.把手/v.拖拽)/lull(v.使平静/n.间歇)  

conservation<,>/ˌkɒnsəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌkɑːnsərˈveɪʃn/<,>n.保存/n.保护/n.守恒<,>Conservation of energy is important.<,>能量守恒很重要。<,>They work in wildlife conservation.<,>他们从事野生动物保护工作。<,>Water conservation is necessary in dry areas.<,>干旱地区需要节约用水。<,>con(共同)+serve(保持)+ation→保护<,>conversation(n.谈话)/conservative(adj.保守的)/conservatory(n.温室)  

distraction<,>/dɪˈstrækʃn/<,>/dɪˈstrækʃn/<,>n.分心的事/n.心烦意乱/n.精神错乱/n.娱乐/n.消遣<,>Noise is a distraction when I study.<,>噪音会让我学习时分心。<,>He needed a distraction from his worries.<,>他需要消遣来摆脱烦恼。<,>The movie provided a welcome distraction.<,>这部电影提供了愉快的消遣。<,>dis(分开)+tract(拉)+ion→分心<,>destruction(n.破坏)/distraction(n.分心)/extraction(n.提取)  

supplement<,>/ˈsʌplɪmənt/<,>/ˈsʌplɪmənt/<,>n.增补/n.补充/n.增刊/n.副刊/vt.增补/vt.补充<,>She takes vitamin supplements.<,>她服用维生素补充剂。<,>This magazine has a monthly supplement.<,>这本杂志有月刊增刊。<,>He supplemented his income with a part-time job.<,>他通过兼职补充收入。<,>sup(下)+ple(满)+ment→补充<,>supply(v.供应/n.补给)/implement(v.实施/n.工具)/complement(n.补充物/v.补充)
contrast<,>/ˈkɒntrɑːst/<,>/ˈkɑːntræst/<,>vi.形成对比/n.对比/vt.对照<,>The colors of the painting contrast sharply with the white wall.<,>这幅画的颜色与白墙形成鲜明对比。<,>In contrast to her sister, she is very quiet.<,>与她姐姐相比，她非常安静。<,>He contrasted the two theories in his essay.<,>他在文章中对比了这两种理论。<,>con(共同)+trast(站)→站在一起形成对比<,>contract(n.合同/v.收缩)/contest(n.比赛/v.争辩)  

paragraph<,>/ˈpærəɡrɑːf/<,>/ˈpærəˌɡræf/<,>n.段/n.节<,>Please write a paragraph about your summer vacation.<,>请写一段关于你暑假的文字。<,>The first paragraph introduces the main idea.<,>第一段介绍了主要观点。<,>Each paragraph should focus on one topic.<,>每个段落应该聚焦一个主题。<,>para(旁边)+graph(写)→写在旁边的独立部分<,>photograph(n.照片)/telegraph(n.电报)  

judgement<,>/ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/<,>/ˈdʒʌdʒmənt/<,>n.意见/n.审判/n.判断<,>In my judgement, this plan will not work.<,>依我看，这个计划行不通。<,>The court will pass judgement tomorrow.<,>法庭明天将作出判决。<,>She showed good judgement in choosing friends.<,>她在择友方面表现出良好的判断力。<,>judge(判断)+ment(名词后缀)→判断的结果<,>adjustment(n.调整)/acknowledgement(n.承认)  

proportion<,>/prəˈpɔːʃn/<,>/prəˈpɔːrʃn/<,>n.比例/n.部分/n.均衡<,>The proportion of women in the workforce has increased.<,>劳动力中女性的比例增加了。<,>Mix the ingredients in the correct proportions.<,>按正确比例混合原料。<,>His head is out of proportion with his body.<,>他的头部与身体不成比例。<,>pro(向前)+portion(部分)→各部分的关系<,>portion(n.部分)/apportion(v.分配)  

widen<,>/ˈwaɪdn/<,>/ˈwaɪdn/<,>v.加宽/v.变宽<,>The road will be widened next year.<,>这条路明年将拓宽。<,>Her eyes widened in surprise.<,>她惊讶地睁大了眼睛。<,>The gap between rich and poor is widening.<,>贫富差距正在扩大。<,>wide(宽的)+en(使)→使变宽<,>broaden(v.变宽)/lengthen(v.变长)  

crystal<,>/ˈkrɪstl/<,>/ˈkrɪstl/<,>n.水晶/n.结晶体<,>She wore a necklace made of crystal.<,>她戴了一条水晶项链。<,>The wine glasses are made of lead crystal.<,>这些酒杯是用铅晶玻璃制成的。<,>Salt forms crystals when it dries.<,>盐干燥时会形成晶体。<,>cry(哭)+stal(看作star星星)→像星星一样晶莹的泪滴<,>crisp(adj.脆的)/crust(n.外壳)  

occurrence<,>/əˈkʌrəns/<,>/əˈkɜːrəns/<,>n.发生/n.事件<,>Earthquakes are rare occurrences in this region.<,>地震在这个地区很少发生。<,>This is a common occurrence in large cities.<,>这在大城市很常见。<,>The police recorded every occurrence in the logbook.<,>警方在日志中记录了每起事件。<,>occur(发生)+ence(名词后缀)→发生的事<,>currency(n.货币)/current(adj.当前的)  

inflation<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃn/<,>/ɪnˈfleɪʃn/<,>n.通货膨胀/n.膨胀<,>The government is trying to control inflation.<,>政府正试图控制通货膨胀。<,>Inflation has reduced the value of savings.<,>通货膨胀降低了储蓄的价值。<,>The inflation rate rose to 5% last year.<,>去年通货膨胀率上升到了5%。<,>in(进入)+flat(吹)+ion→吹入空气→膨胀<,>deflation(n.通货紧缩)/reflation(n.通货再膨胀)  

thinking<,>/ˈθɪŋkɪŋ/<,>/ˈθɪŋkɪŋ/<,>adj.深思的/n.想法<,>He is a thinking person who considers all options.<,>他是个深思熟虑的人，会考虑所有选择。<,>What's your thinking on this issue?<,>你对这个问题有什么看法？<,>Critical thinking is an important skill.<,>批判性思维是一项重要技能。<,>think(思考)+ing→思考的状态或结果<,>sinking(adj.下沉的)/blinking(adj.闪烁的)  

cycle<,>/ˈsaɪkl/<,>/ˈsaɪkl/<,>n.循环/v.骑自行车<,>The water cycle is essential for life on Earth.<,>水循环对地球上的生命至关重要。<,>She cycles to work every day.<,>她每天骑自行车上班。<,>The business goes through cycles of growth and decline.<,>企业经历着增长和衰退的循环。<,>cycl(圆)+e→循环运动<,>recycle(v.回收)/bicycle(n.自行车)
disposal<,>/dɪˈspəʊzəl/<,>/dɪˈspoʊzəl/<,>n.丢掉/n.销毁/n.处理/n.排列/n.布置<,>Proper disposal of waste is essential for environmental protection.<,>正确处理废物对环境保护至关重要。<,>The disposal of old furniture can be a hassle.<,>处理旧家具可能很麻烦。<,>He is in charge of the disposal of company assets.<,>他负责公司资产的处置。<,>dis(分开)+pose(放置)+al→分开放置→处理<,>exposure(n.暴露)/dispose(v.处理)/proposal(n.提议)

settlement<,>/ˈsetlmənt/<,>/ˈsɛtlmənt/<,>n.解决/n.协议/n.居留地<,>The two parties reached a settlement out of court.<,>双方在庭外达成了和解。<,>This area was once a Viking settlement.<,>这个地区曾是维京人的定居点。<,>The insurance company offered a fair settlement.<,>保险公司提出了一个公平的解决方案。<,>settle(安顿)+ment→安顿下来的地方→居留地<,>statement(n.声明)/installment(n.分期付款)/settler(n.定居者)

literature<,>/ˈlɪtrətʃə(r)/<,>/ˈlɪtərətʃər/<,>n.文学/n.文学作品/n.文献/n.图书资料<,>English literature was my favorite subject in college.<,>英国文学是我大学时最喜欢的科目。<,>There is extensive literature on this topic.<,>关于这个主题有大量文献。<,>She has a deep appreciation for classical literature.<,>她对古典文学有深厚的鉴赏力。<,>liter(文字)+ature→文字作品→文学<,>literacy(n.读写能力)/literal(adj.字面的)/literary(adj.文学的)

sphere<,>/sfɪə(r)/<,>/sfɪr/<,>n.球/n.球体/n.范围<,>The earth is not a perfect sphere.<,>地球不是一个完美的球体。<,>This matter falls outside my sphere of responsibility.<,>这件事不在我的职责范围内。<,>Bubbles form perfect spheres in zero gravity.<,>在零重力下气泡会形成完美的球体。<,>spher(球)+e→球体<,>atmosphere(n.大气)/hemisphere(n.半球)/spherical(adj.球形的)

inquiry<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪəri/<,>/ɪnˈkwaɪri/<,>n.询问/n.打听/n.调查<,>The police conducted an inquiry into the accident.<,>警方对事故进行了调查。<,>I made an inquiry about train schedules.<,>我询问了火车时刻表。<,>The committee launched a formal inquiry.<,>委员会展开了正式调查。<,>in(进入)+quir(询问)+y→深入询问→调查<,>enquiry(n.询问)/require(vt.要求)/acquire(vt.获得)

prejudice<,>/ˈpredʒudɪs/<,>/ˈprɛdʒədɪs/<,>n.偏见/n.成见/vt.使有偏见/vt.对...不利/vt.损害<,>We should judge people without prejudice.<,>我们应该不带偏见地评判他人。<,>His comments showed racial prejudice.<,>他的评论显示出种族偏见。<,>This incident prejudiced her against the whole company.<,>这件事使她对整个公司产生了偏见。<,>pre(预先)+jud(判断)+ice→预先判断→偏见<,>judge(n.法官)/justice(n.正义)/prejudicial(adj.有害的)

dissolve<,>/dɪˈzɒlv/<,>/dɪˈzɑːlv/<,>v.溶解/v.解散/v.消失/v.减弱/v.结束<,>Salt dissolves easily in water.<,>盐易溶于水。<,>The parliament was dissolved by the king.<,>议会被国王解散了。<,>Her anger dissolved into laughter.<,>她的怒气化为了笑声。<,>dis(分开)+solve(松开)→松开分开→溶解<,>resolve(v.解决)/absolve(v.免除)/solvent(adj.有溶解力的)

digest<,>/daɪˈdʒest/<,>/ˈdaɪdʒɛst/<,>vt.消化/vt.领会/n.文摘/n.摘要<,>Some people have difficulty digesting milk.<,>有些人难以消化牛奶。<,>It took me a while to digest the news.<,>我花了一些时间来消化这个消息。<,>Reader's Digest is a popular magazine.<,>《读者文摘》是一本受欢迎的杂志。<,>di(分开)+gest(携带)→分开携带→消化<,>suggest(v.建议)/congest(v.拥挤)/ingest(v.摄取)

bacon<,>/ˈbeɪkən/<,>/ˈbeɪkən/<,>n.咸肉<,>I love to eat bacon with eggs for breakfast.<,>我喜欢早餐吃咸肉和鸡蛋。<,>The smell of frying bacon filled the kitchen.<,>煎咸肉的香味充满了厨房。<,>She prefers turkey bacon over pork bacon.<,>比起猪肉咸肉，她更喜欢火鸡咸肉。<,>ba(拼音“吧”)+con(convention会议)→在会议上吃咸肉吧<,>beacon(n.灯塔/v.照亮)/baton(n.指挥棒/n.接力棒)

likewise<,>/ˈlaɪkwaɪz/<,>/ˈlaɪkwaɪz/<,>adv.同样地/adv.也/adv.又<,>He nodded, and she did likewise.<,>他点了点头，她也同样点了点头。<,>I'll miss you, and likewise, you'll miss me.<,>我会想你，同样地，你也会想我。<,>The manager thanked the team, and likewise, the team thanked him.<,>经理感谢了团队，团队也同样感谢了他。<,>like(像)+wise(方式)→以同样的方式<,>otherwise(adv.否则/conj.不然)/clockwise(adj.顺时针的/adv.顺时针方向地)

slender<,>/ˈslendə(r)/<,>/ˈslɛndər/<,>adj.细长的/adj.苗条的/adj.微薄的/adj.不足的<,>She has a slender figure that many envy.<,>她有着许多人羡慕的苗条身材。<,>The chances of success are slender.<,>成功的机会很渺茫。<,>A slender thread of smoke rose from the chimney.<,>一缕细烟从烟囱升起。<,>s(形似蛇)+lender(出借人)→蛇一样的出借人身材细长<,>slander(n.诽谤/v.中伤)/tender(adj.温柔的/v.提出)

conscious<,>/ˈkɒnʃəs/<,>/ˈkɑːnʃəs/<,>adj.意识到的/adj.自觉的/adj.神志清醒的/adj.有意的/adj.存心的<,>He was conscious of being watched.<,>他意识到自己被监视了。<,>The patient is fully conscious after the surgery.<,>手术后病人完全清醒。<,>She made a conscious effort to be more polite.<,>她有意识地努力变得更礼貌。<,>con(共同)+sci(知道)+ous(形容词后缀)→共同知道的→有意识的<,>conscience(n.良心)/unconscious(adj.无意识的)

fur<,>/fɜː(r)/<,>/fɜr/<,>n.软毛/n.毛皮/n.裘皮/n.毛皮衣服<,>The cat's fur is very soft to touch.<,>猫的毛摸起来很柔软。<,>She wore an expensive fur coat to the party.<,>她穿了一件昂贵的毛皮大衣去参加派对。<,>Animal rights activists protest against the fur trade.<,>动物权利活动家抗议毛皮贸易。<,>fu(拼音“服”)+r(形似毛茸茸)→毛皮衣服<,>furrow(n.犁沟/v.犁)/fury(n.愤怒)
auto<,>/ˈɔːtəʊ/<,>/ˈɔːtoʊ/<,>n.汽车<,>He bought a new auto last week.<,>他上周买了一辆新车。<,>The auto industry is booming in this country.<,>这个国家的汽车工业正在蓬勃发展。<,>She prefers to drive an auto rather than a manual car.<,>她更喜欢开自动挡汽车而不是手动挡汽车。<,>auto(自动)+mobile(移动)→汽车<,>automobile(n. 汽车)/automatic(adj. 自动的)/autonomy(n. 自治)

sigh<,>/saɪ/<,>/saɪ/<,>vi.叹气/n.叹息<,>She let out a deep sigh of relief.<,>她深深地松了一口气。<,>He sighed heavily when he heard the bad news.<,>听到这个坏消息时，他重重地叹了口气。<,>The old man sighed with contentment after the meal.<,>老人饭后满足地叹了口气。<,>sigh(叹息)与sign(标志)发音相似<,>sign(n. 标志/v. 签名)/sight(n. 视力)/sighing(adj. 叹息的)

constant<,>/ˈkɒnstənt/<,>/ˈkɑːnstənt/<,>adj.经常的/永恒的/忠实的/n.常数<,>Her constant complaints annoyed everyone.<,>她不断的抱怨惹恼了所有人。<,>He remained a constant friend throughout my life.<,>他是我一生中始终如一的朋友。<,>The speed of light is a fundamental constant in physics.<,>光速是物理学中的一个基本常数。<,>con(共同)+stant(站立)→始终站在一起→永恒的<,>instant(adj. 立即的)/distant(adj. 遥远的)/consistent(adj. 一致的)

pants<,>/pænts/<,>/pænts/<,>n.长裤/内裤<,>He forgot to zip up his pants.<,>他忘记拉上裤子拉链了。<,>She bought a new pair of pants for the party.<,>她为聚会买了一条新裤子。<,>Don't forget to pack extra pants for the trip.<,>别忘了为旅行多带几条裤子。<,>pants(裤子)与pant(喘息)发音相似<,>trousers(n. 裤子)/jeans(n. 牛仔裤)/underwear(n. 内衣)

mislead<,>/ˌmɪsˈliːd/<,>/ˌmɪsˈliːd/<,>vt.使误解/带错路/误入歧途<,>The advertisement misled consumers about the product's benefits.<,>这则广告误导了消费者对该产品好处的认识。<,>He was misled by false information.<,>他被虚假信息误导了。<,>Don't let appearances mislead you.<,>不要让表象误导了你。<,>mis(错误)+lead(引导)→错误引导→误导<,>mislead(v. 误导)/misled(adj. 被误导的)/misleading(adj. 误导性的)

split<,>/splɪt/<,>/splɪt/<,>v.分裂/裂开/分享/n.裂口<,>They decided to split the bill equally.<,>他们决定平分账单。<,>The wood split when he struck it with the axe.<,>他用斧子劈柴时木头裂开了。<,>There's a split in the political party over this issue.<,>在这个问题上，政党内部出现了分裂。<,>s(撕)+plit(劈)→分裂<,>spit(v. 吐痰)/splat(n. 啪嗒声)/splint(n. 夹板)

orchestra<,>/ˈɔːkɪstrə/<,>/ˈɔːrkɪstrə/<,>n.管弦乐队<,>The orchestra performed Beethoven's Symphony No. 9.<,>管弦乐队演奏了贝多芬的第九交响曲。<,>She plays violin in the school orchestra.<,>她在学校管弦乐队拉小提琴。<,>The conductor led the orchestra with great passion.<,>指挥家充满激情地指挥着管弦乐队。<,>orche(舞蹈)+stra(地方)→跳舞的地方→乐队<,>choir(n. 合唱团)/band(n. 乐队)/ensemble(n. 合奏团)

publication<,>/ˌpʌblɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/ˌpʌblɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.出版/公布<,>The publication of his first novel was a great success.<,>他的第一部小说的出版非常成功。<,>The research findings are ready for publication.<,>研究结果已准备好发表。<,>The magazine ceased publication after 50 years.<,>这本杂志在发行50年后停刊了。<,>public(公共)+ation(行为)→公开行为→出版<,>publicity(n. 宣传)/publish(v. 出版)/public(n. 公众)

sufficient<,>/səˈfɪʃnt/<,>/səˈfɪʃənt/<,>adj.足够的<,>We have sufficient evidence to prove his guilt.<,>我们有足够的证据证明他有罪。<,>Make sure you have sufficient time to complete the task.<,>确保你有足够的时间完成任务。<,>The food was sufficient for all the guests.<,>食物足够所有客人享用。<,>suf(下面)+fic(做)+ient→做到足够<,>efficient(adj. 高效的)/deficient(adj. 不足的)/proficient(adj. 熟练的)

claim<,>/kleɪm/<,>/kleɪm/<,>vt.声称/索取/值得/n.要求/声称<,>He claims to have seen a UFO last night.<,>他声称昨晚看到了不明飞行物。<,>You can claim your luggage at the baggage claim area.<,>你可以在行李领取区领取行李。<,>The insurance company denied his claim for damages.<,>保险公司拒绝了他的赔偿要求。<,>claim(声称)与clam(蛤蜊)发音相似<,>acclaim(v. 欢呼)/exclaim(v. 呼喊)/proclaim(v. 宣布)
antique<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>/ænˈtiːk/<,>adj.古时的/adj.过时的/n.古物/n.古董<,>She collects antique furniture from the 18th century.<,>她收藏18世纪的古董家具。<,>His ideas are considered antique in modern society.<,>他的想法在现代社会被认为是过时的。<,>This shop specializes in selling antiques.<,>这家店专门出售古董。<,>anti(前)+que→以前的→古时的<,>unique(adj.独特的)/ancient(adj.古代的)/authentic(adj.真实的)  

sow<,>/səʊ/<,>/soʊ/<,>v.播/v.播种<,>Farmers sow seeds in the spring.<,>农民在春天播种。<,>You reap what you sow.<,>种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。<,>She sowed the field with wheat.<,>她在地里播种了小麦。<,>sow(播种)→与sew(缝纫)发音相似<,>sew(v.缝纫)/sow(n.母猪)/saw(v.看见)  

widespread<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>/ˈwaɪdspred/<,>adj.分布广的/adj.普遍的<,>There is widespread support for the new policy.<,>新政策得到了广泛支持。<,>The disease has become widespread in the region.<,>这种疾病在该地区已经普遍传播。<,>Widespread use of smartphones has changed our lives.<,>智能手机的广泛使用改变了我们的生活。<,>wide(宽的)+spread(传播)→广泛传播的<,>wide(adj.宽的)/spread(v.传播)/breadth(n.宽度)  

petroleum<,>/pəˈtrəʊliəm/<,>/pəˈtroʊliəm/<,>n.石油<,>Petroleum is a vital resource for modern industry.<,>石油是现代工业的重要资源。<,>Many countries depend on petroleum exports.<,>许多国家依赖石油出口。<,>The price of petroleum fluctuates frequently.<,>石油价格经常波动。<,>petro(石头)+leum(油)→石油<,>petrol(n.汽油)/petrochemical(adj.石油化学的)/petrology(n.岩石学)  

communication<,>/kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>/kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃn/<,>n.通讯/n.交流/n.交际/n.通信工具/n.交通联系<,>Effective communication is key to a successful team.<,>有效的沟通是团队成功的关键。<,>The internet has revolutionized communication.<,>互联网彻底改变了通讯方式。<,>There is a breakdown in communication between the two departments.<,>两个部门之间的沟通出现了问题。<,>com(共同)+mun(服务)+ication→共同服务→交流<,>communism(n.共产主义)/community(n.社区)/commune(n.公社)  

directly<,>/dəˈrektli/<,>/dəˈrektli/<,>adv.直接地/adv.正好地/adv.截然/adv.立即<,>He looked directly at me.<,>他直视着我。<,>The sun was directly overhead at noon.<,>中午时分太阳正好在头顶。<,>She went directly to the manager to complain.<,>她直接去找经理投诉。<,>direct(直接的)+ly(副词后缀)→直接地<,>indirectly(adv.间接地)/direction(n.方向)/director(n.导演)  

tolerance<,>/ˈtɒlərəns/<,>/ˈtɑːlərəns/<,>n.忍受/n.容忍/n.忍耐力/n.公差<,>He has a high tolerance for pain.<,>他对疼痛有很高的忍耐力。<,>Cultural tolerance is important in a diverse society.<,>在多元社会中，文化包容很重要。<,>The machine parts have a tolerance of 0.01mm.<,>这些机器零件的公差是0.01毫米。<,>toler(忍受)+ance(名词后缀)→容忍<,>intolerance(n.不宽容)/tolerate(v.容忍)/tolerant(adj.宽容的)  

kneel<,>/niːl/<,>/niːl/<,>vi.跪/vi.跪下/vi.跪着<,>He knelt down to propose.<,>他跪下求婚。<,>She knelt in prayer every night.<,>她每晚跪着祈祷。<,>The knight knelt before the king.<,>骑士跪在国王面前。<,>knee(膝盖)+l→用膝盖着地→跪下<,>knee(n.膝盖)/kneel(v.跪)/needle(n.针)  

porter<,>/ˈpɔːtə(r)/<,>/ˈpɔːrtər/<,>n.搬运工人/n.看门人/n.大楼管理员<,>The porter carried our luggage to the room.<,>搬运工把我们的行李搬到了房间。<,>The hotel porter greeted us at the door.<,>酒店的门童在门口迎接我们。<,>He works as a porter in the apartment building.<,>他在公寓楼里当管理员。<,>port(搬运)+er(人)→搬运的人→搬运工<,>report(v.报告)/import(v.进口)/export(v.出口)  

fasten<,>/ˈfɑːsn/<,>/ˈfæsn/<,>v.扎牢/v.扣住<,>Fasten your seatbelt before driving.<,>开车前请系好安全带。<,>She fastened the brooch to her dress.<,>她把胸针别在衣服上。<,>The door was fastened with a heavy lock.<,>门用一把大锁牢牢锁住。<,>fast(牢固的)+en(使)→使牢固→扎牢<,>hasten(v.加速)/listen(v.听)/soften(v.软化)
contest<,>/ˈkɒntest/<,>/ˈkɑːntest/<,>n.竞赛/n.争夺/vt.争夺/vt.与...竞争/vt.对...提出质疑/vt.辩驳<,>She won first prize in the singing contest.<,>她在歌唱比赛中获得了一等奖。<,>They contested the will in court.<,>他们在法庭上对遗嘱提出了质疑。<,>The two teams are contesting for the championship.<,>两支队伍正在争夺冠军。<,>con(共同)+test(测试)→共同测试→竞赛<,>context(n.上下文)/content(n.内容/adj.满足的)

author<,>/ˈɔːθə(r)/<,>/ˈɔːθər/<,>n.著作家/n.作者<,>J.K. Rowling is the author of the Harry Potter series.<,>J.K.罗琳是《哈利·波特》系列的作者。<,>The author will be signing books at the bookstore tomorrow.<,>这位作者明天将在书店签售。<,>He is an established author in the field of science fiction.<,>他是科幻小说领域的一位知名作家。<,>auth(增加)+or(人)→创作内容的人→作者<,>authentic(adj.真实的)/authority(n.权威)

dirt<,>/dɜːt/<,>/dɜːrt/<,>n.灰尘/n.土/n.污物/n.污垢<,>Wipe the dirt off your shoes before entering.<,>进门之前把鞋上的灰尘擦掉。<,>The children came home covered in dirt.<,>孩子们回到家，浑身都是土。<,>There's some dirt on your collar.<,>你的衣领上有些污渍。<,>dir(肮脏的)+t→肮脏的东西→污垢<,>dirty(adj.脏的)/shirt(n.衬衫)

astrophysics<,>/ˌæstrəʊˈfɪzɪks/<,>/ˌæstroʊˈfɪzɪks/<,>n.天体物理学<,>She's studying astrophysics at university.<,>她在大学学习天体物理学。<,>Astrophysics helps us understand the universe.<,>天体物理学帮助我们理解宇宙。<,>The new discovery has excited the astrophysics community.<,>这一新发现让天体物理学界兴奋不已。<,>astro(星星)+physics(物理学)→研究星体的物理学→天体物理学<,>astronomy(n.天文学)/cosmology(n.宇宙学)

greenhouse<,>/ˈɡriːnhaʊs/<,>/ˈɡriːnhaʊs/<,>n.温室/n.暖房<,>We grow tomatoes in the greenhouse during winter.<,>冬天我们在温室里种植西红柿。<,>The greenhouse effect is causing global warming.<,>温室效应正在导致全球变暖。<,>This greenhouse is made of special glass.<,>这个暖房是用特殊玻璃建造的。<,>green(绿色)+house(房子)→种植绿色植物的房子→温室<,>greenroom(n.演员休息室)/hothouse(n.温室)

preserve<,>/prɪˈzɜːv/<,>/prɪˈzɜːrv/<,>vt.保护/vt.维持/vt.保存/vt.腌制<,>We must preserve our natural resources.<,>我们必须保护我们的自然资源。<,>This method helps preserve the food for longer.<,>这种方法有助于食物保存更长时间。<,>Grandma preserves fruits in jars every summer.<,>奶奶每年夏天都用罐子腌制水果。<,>pre(预先)+serve(保持)→预先保持→保存<,>reserve(vt.保留/n.储备)/conserve(vt.保存)

plus<,>/plʌs/<,>/plʌs/<,>adj.表示加的/adj.正的/prep.加/prep.加上/n.加号/n.正号<,>Five plus three equals eight.<,>五加三等于八。<,>He got a B plus on his test.<,>他考试得了个B+。<,>The temperature is plus ten degrees.<,>温度是零上十度。<,>pl(多)+us→多的状态→加<,>minus(prep.减去)/bonus(n.奖金)

establish<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>/ɪˈstæblɪʃ/<,>vt.建立/vt.设立/vt.确立/vt.证实<,>They established a new company last year.<,>他们去年成立了一家新公司。<,>The theory has been established by numerous experiments.<,>这个理论已被大量实验证实。<,>He quickly established himself as a leading expert.<,>他很快确立了自己作为领先专家的地位。<,>e(出)+stabl(稳定)+ish(使)→使稳定出来→建立<,>stable(adj.稳定的)/institute(n.学院)

expansion<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>/ɪkˈspænʃn/<,>n.扩大/n.扩充/n.扩张/n.膨胀<,>The company is planning an expansion into Asia.<,>公司正计划向亚洲扩张。<,>Heat causes the expansion of metals.<,>热会导致金属膨胀。<,>The new edition includes an expansion of chapter five.<,>新版包括第五章的扩充内容。<,>ex(出)+pans(伸展)+ion→向外伸展→扩张<,>expense(n.费用)/extension(n.延伸)

relevant<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>/ˈreləvənt/<,>adj.有关的/adj.切题的<,>Please provide only relevant information.<,>请只提供相关信息。<,>His experience is highly relevant to the job.<,>他的经验与这份工作高度相关。<,>That question isn't relevant to our discussion.<,>那个问题与我们的讨论无关。<,>re(再)+lev(举)+ant→再次举起的→有关的<,>irrelevant(adj.无关的)/elevate(vt.提升)
entry<,>/ˈentri/<,>/ˈɛntri/<,>n.入口处/n.登记/n.进入/n.参赛者名单/n.条目<,>Please use the side entry to the building.<,>请使用大楼的侧门进入。<,>He made an entry in his diary every night.<,>他每晚都会在日记中写一条记录。<,>There were over 100 entries in the competition.<,>比赛有超过100名参赛者。<,>entr(进入)+y(名词后缀)→进入的地方→入口<,>enter(v.进入)/exit(n.出口)/envy(n.嫉妒)

license<,>/ˈlaɪsns/<,>/ˈlaɪsəns/<,>n.许可/n.执照/vt.准许<,>You need a license to drive a car.<,>你需要执照才能开车。<,>The restaurant is licensed to serve alcohol.<,>这家餐厅有酒水经营许可。<,>The software is licensed for educational use only.<,>该软件仅限教育用途使用。<,>lic(允许)+ense→允许的证明→执照<,>licence(英式拼写)/illicit(adj.非法的)/leisure(n.闲暇)

synthetic<,>/sɪnˈθetɪk/<,>/sɪnˈθɛtɪk/<,>adj.综合的/adj.合成的/adj.虚假的<,>This jacket is made of synthetic fibers.<,>这件夹克是用合成纤维制成的。<,>Her smile seemed synthetic and forced.<,>她的笑容看起来虚假而勉强。<,>Synthetic rubber is widely used in industry.<,>合成橡胶在工业中广泛应用。<,>syn(共同)+thet(放置)+ic→放在一起的→合成的<,>authentic(adj.真实的)/sympathetic(adj.同情的)/systematic(adj.系统的)

headquarters<,>/ˌhedˈkwɔːtəz/<,>/ˈhɛdˌkwɔrtərz/<,>n.司令部/n.总部<,>The company's headquarters are in New York.<,>公司的总部设在纽约。<,>The general stayed at the headquarters during the war.<,>战争期间将军一直待在司令部。<,>We need to report this to headquarters immediately.<,>我们需要立即向总部汇报此事。<,>head(头)+quarters(住处)→首脑住的地方→总部<,>headquarter(v.设立总部)/headrest(n.头枕)/headstrong(adj.固执的)

expand<,>/ɪkˈspænd/<,>/ɪkˈspænd/<,>vt.扩大/vt.使膨胀<,>The company plans to expand its business overseas.<,>公司计划将业务扩展到海外。<,>Metals expand when heated.<,>金属受热会膨胀。<,>She expanded her knowledge by reading widely.<,>她通过广泛阅读扩展了知识。<,>ex(出)+pand(伸展)→向外伸展→扩大<,>expend(v.花费)/extend(v.延伸)/expandable(adj.可扩展的)

gaze<,>/ɡeɪz/<,>/ɡeɪz/<,>n&vi.凝视/n&vi.盯/n&vi.注视<,>She gazed at the stars for hours.<,>她凝视星空数小时。<,>His steady gaze made her nervous.<,>他持续的注视让她紧张。<,>The child gazed in wonder at the fireworks.<,>孩子惊奇地注视着烟花。<,>联想：gaze→"盖着"→眼睛盖在某物上→凝视<,>glare(v.怒视)/glaze(v.上釉)/graze(v.吃草)

essay<,>/ˈeseɪ/<,>/ˈɛseɪ/<,>n.短文/n.散文/n.小品文<,>He wrote an essay about environmental protection.<,>他写了一篇关于环境保护的短文。<,>Her essays are published in a literary magazine.<,>她的散文发表在文学杂志上。<,>The teacher assigned a 1000-word essay.<,>老师布置了一篇1000字的文章。<,>es(出)+say(说)→说出想法→短文<,>assay(n.化验)/essence(n.本质)/easy(adj.容易的)

survey<,>/ˈsɜːveɪ/<,>/ˈsɜrveɪ/<,>vt.俯瞰/vt.检查/vt.测量/n.调查/n.勘察/n.测量/n.全面审视<,>They surveyed the damage after the storm.<,>他们在暴风雨后勘察了损失情况。<,>The survey shows that 60% of people agree.<,>调查显示60%的人同意。<,>From the hilltop, we could survey the whole valley.<,>从山顶我们可以俯瞰整个山谷。<,>sur(上)+vey(看)→从上面看→俯瞰<,>surveillance(n.监视)/convey(v.传达)/purvey(v.供应)

plug<,>/plʌɡ/<,>/plʌɡ/<,>n.插头/n.插座/n.塞子/n.栓/vt.把...塞住/vt.用...塞住<,>Pull the plug before cleaning the appliance.<,>清洁电器前要先拔掉插头。<,>She plugged the hole with a piece of cloth.<,>她用一块布塞住了洞。<,>This is a three-pin plug for safety.<,>这是安全的三脚插头。<,>联想：plug→"扑拉个"→扑上去拉住→塞住<,>pluck(v.拔)/plunge(v.投入)/plum(n.李子)

bunch<,>/bʌntʃ/<,>/bʌntʃ/<,>vi.集中/vi.挤在一起/vi.形成一束/n.群/n.伙/n.束/n.串/n.捆/vt.使成一束<,>She picked a bunch of flowers from the garden.<,>她从花园里采了一束花。<,>The kids bunched together for the photo.<,>孩子们挤在一起拍照。<,>We met a bunch of interesting people at the party.<,>我们在聚会上遇到了一群有趣的人。<,>联想：bunch→"绑起"→绑在一起→一束<,>bunchy(adj.成束的)/hunch(n.预感)/lunch(n.午餐)
thermometer<,>/θəˈmɒmɪtə(r)/<,>/θərˈmɑːmɪtər/<,>n.温度计/n.寒暑表<,>The doctor used a thermometer to check my temperature.<,>医生用温度计测量我的体温。<,>The thermometer showed that it was 30 degrees outside.<,>温度计显示室外温度是30度。<,>She bought a digital thermometer for her baby.<,>她为宝宝买了一个数字温度计。<,>thermo(热)+meter(测量)→测量温度的仪器<,>thermostat(n.恒温器)/barometer(n.气压计)/speedometer(n.速度计)  

tense<,>/tens/<,>/tɛns/<,>adj.拉紧的/adj.紧张的/v.拉紧/v.绷紧/n.时态<,>She felt tense before the interview.<,>面试前她感到紧张。<,>He tensed his muscles before lifting the weight.<,>他在举重前绷紧了肌肉。<,>The present tense is used in this sentence.<,>这个句子用的是现在时态。<,>ten(伸展)+se→伸展的状态→拉紧的<,>dense(adj.密集的)/intense(adj.强烈的)/tensile(adj.可拉伸的)  

postpone<,>/pəˈspəʊn/<,>/poʊˈspoʊn/<,>vt.延迟/vt.延期<,>They decided to postpone the meeting until next week.<,>他们决定把会议推迟到下周。<,>The flight was postponed due to bad weather.<,>由于天气恶劣，航班被推迟了。<,>I had to postpone my dentist appointment.<,>我不得不推迟牙医预约。<,>post(后)+pone(放)→往后放→推迟<,>prepone(vt.提前)/postposition(n.后置词)/postscript(n.附言)  

bride<,>/braɪd/<,>/braɪd/<,>n.新娘<,>The bride looked beautiful in her white dress.<,>新娘穿着白色婚纱看起来很漂亮。<,>The bride and groom exchanged rings.<,>新娘和新郎交换了戒指。<,>She will be the bride at tomorrow's wedding.<,>她将是明天婚礼上的新娘。<,>b(谐音"白")+ride(骑)→穿着白纱骑马的新娘<,>groom(n.新郎)/bridesmaid(n.伴娘)/bridegroom(n.新郎)  

favourable<,>/ˈfeɪvərəbl/<,>/ˈfeɪvərəbəl/<,>adj.有利的/adj.赞成的/adj.顺利的<,>The weather conditions were favourable for sailing.<,>天气条件有利于航行。<,>He gave a favourable review of the book.<,>他对这本书给予了正面评价。<,>The results of the test were favourable.<,>测试结果很顺利。<,>favour(喜爱)+able(能...的)→能让人喜爱的→有利的<,>unfavourable(adj.不利的)/favourite(adj.最喜欢的)/favourably(adv.有利地)  

hammer<,>/ˈhæmə(r)/<,>/ˈhæmər/<,>v.锤击/n.锤/n.榔头<,>He hammered the nail into the wall.<,>他把钉子锤进墙里。<,>I need a hammer to fix this shelf.<,>我需要一把锤子来修理这个架子。<,>The blacksmith used a heavy hammer.<,>铁匠用了一把重锤。<,>ham(火腿)+mer(谐音"么")→像火腿一样的东西→锤子<,>mallet(n.木槌)/sledgehammer(n.大锤)/hammerhead(n.锤头)  

candy<,>/ˈkændi/<,>/ˈkændi/<,>n.糖果<,>The children were given candy as a treat.<,>孩子们得到了糖果作为奖励。<,>She put a bowl of candy on the table.<,>她在桌上放了一碗糖果。<,>Too much candy is bad for your teeth.<,>吃太多糖果对牙齿不好。<,>can(能)+dy(谐音"迪")→能让人开心的东西→糖果<,>sweet(n.糖果)/chocolate(n.巧克力)/lollipop(n.棒棒糖)  

seal<,>/siːl/<,>/sil/<,>n.封铅/n.封条/n.印/n.图章/n.海豹/vt.封<,>She broke the seal on the letter.<,>她拆开了信上的封条。<,>The document bears the official seal.<,>文件上有官方印章。<,>We saw seals at the aquarium.<,>我们在水族馆看到了海豹。<,>sea(海)+l(形似"1")→海里的动物→海豹<,>sealant(n.密封剂)/conceal(vt.隐藏)/peal(n.钟声)  

mental<,>/ˈmentl/<,>/ˈmɛntəl/<,>adj.心理的/adj.精神的/adj.思想上的/adj.精神病的/adj.智力的<,>He has good mental health.<,>他心理健康状况良好。<,>She's studying mental development in children.<,>她正在研究儿童的心理发展。<,>The patient needs mental treatment.<,>这位病人需要精神治疗。<,>men(人)+tal(谐音"头")→人的头脑→精神的<,>physical(adj.身体的)/dental(adj.牙齿的)/fundamental(adj.基本的)  

decent<,>/ˈdiːsnt/<,>/ˈdisənt/<,>adj.像样的/adj.过得去的/adj.体面的/adj.宽厚的/adj.大方的/adj.正派的/adj.合乎礼仪的/adj.得体的<,>He earns a decent salary.<,>他有一份不错的薪水。<,>She always wears decent clothes to work.<,>她总是穿着得体的衣服去上班。<,>That was a very decent thing to do.<,>那样做很正派。<,>de(得)+cent(分)→得到每一分→体面的<,>descent(n.下降)/recent(adj.最近的)/indecent(adj.不得体的)
storage<,>/ˈstɔːrɪdʒ/<,>/ˈstɔrɪdʒ/<,>n.贮藏/n.贮藏量<,>We need more storage space for our belongings.<,>我们需要更多的储物空间来存放物品。<,>The storage capacity of this device is impressive.<,>这个设备的存储容量令人印象深刻。<,>Food storage is essential for emergency preparedness.<,>食物储存对于应急准备至关重要。<,>store(储存)+age(名词后缀)→储存<,>store(n.商店/v.储存)/storeroom(n.储藏室)

investigate<,>/ɪnˈvestɪɡeɪt/<,>/ɪnˈvɛstɪˌɡeɪt/<,>v.调查/v.研究<,>The police will investigate the crime scene.<,>警方将调查犯罪现场。<,>Scientists investigate the effects of climate change.<,>科学家研究气候变化的影响。<,>We need to investigate this matter thoroughly.<,>我们需要彻底调查这件事。<,>in(进入)+vestig(足迹)+ate(动词后缀)→追踪足迹→调查<,>inspect(v.检查)/examine(v.检验)/research(v.研究)

racial<,>/ˈreɪʃəl/<,>/ˈreɪʃəl/<,>adj.种族的/adj.人种的<,>Racial equality is an important social issue.<,>种族平等是一个重要的社会问题。<,>The school promotes racial harmony among students.<,>学校促进学生间的种族和谐。<,>He experienced racial discrimination at work.<,>他在工作中经历了种族歧视。<,>rac(种族)+ial(形容词后缀)→种族的<,>race(n.种族)/racist(n.种族主义者)/ethnic(adj.民族的)

switch<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>/swɪtʃ/<,>v.转换/v.改变/n.开关/n.电闸/n.转换/n.改变<,>Please switch off the lights when you leave.<,>离开时请关灯。<,>He decided to switch careers after ten years.<,>十年后他决定转行。<,>The train will switch tracks at the next station.<,>火车将在下一站换轨。<,>s(蛇形)+witch(女巫)→女巫用蛇形开关施法→开关<,>twitch(v.抽搐)/stitch(n.针脚)/snitch(v.告密)

niece<,>/niːs/<,>/nis/<,>n.侄女/n.外甥女<,>My niece is coming to visit us this weekend.<,>我侄女这周末要来看我们。<,>She bought a gift for her niece's birthday.<,>她为外甥女的生日买了礼物。<,>Her niece looks just like her when she was young.<,>她侄女长得和她年轻时一模一样。<,>niece与nice(好)发音相似→好侄女<,>nephew(n.侄子/n.外甥)/cousin(n.堂兄弟姐妹)

considerable<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbl/<,>/kənˈsɪdərəbəl/<,>adj.相当大的/adj.重要的<,>The project requires a considerable amount of time.<,>这个项目需要相当多的时间。<,>He made a considerable contribution to the field.<,>他对该领域做出了重要贡献。<,>There's been a considerable improvement in her health.<,>她的健康状况有了显著改善。<,>consider(考虑)+able(能够)→值得考虑的→重要的<,>considerate(adj.体贴的)/inconsiderable(adj.微不足道的)

auxiliary<,>/ɔːɡˈzɪliəri/<,>/ɔɡˈzɪljəri/<,>adj.辅助的/adj.附属的/adj.后备的<,>The auxiliary engine kicked in when the main one failed.<,>主发动机故障时备用发动机启动了。<,>She works as an auxiliary nurse at the hospital.<,>她在医院做助理护士。<,>We need auxiliary lighting for the event.<,>我们需要为活动准备辅助照明。<,>aux(增加)+iliary→增加的→辅助的<,>auxin(n.植物生长素)/accessory(n.附件)

heal<,>/hiːl/<,>/hil/<,>vi.愈合/vi.痊愈/vi.恢复健康/vt.使愈合/vt.治愈/vt.使康复/vt.调停/vt.消除<,>The wound will heal in about two weeks.<,>伤口大约两周后会愈合。<,>Time heals all wounds.<,>时间能治愈一切伤痛。<,>They are trying to heal the rift between the two communities.<,>他们正试图弥合两个社区之间的裂痕。<,>heal与heel(脚后跟)同音→脚伤愈合<,>health(n.健康)/healthy(adj.健康的)/heel(n.脚后跟)

reserve<,>/rɪˈzɜːv/<,>/rɪˈzɜrv/<,>vt.保留/vt.留存/vt.预订/n.储备/n.保留/n.拘谨/n.矜持/n.替补队员/n.后备部队/n.自然保护区<,>I'd like to reserve a table for four, please.<,>我想预订一张四人桌。<,>She has a great reserve of patience.<,>她有极大的耐心储备。<,>The army called up its reserves.<,>军队召集了后备部队。<,>re(再)+serve(服务)→保留下来再服务→保留<,>preserve(v.保存)/deserve(v.应得)/conserve(v.保护)

somehow<,>/ˈsʌmhaʊ/<,>/ˈsʌmˌhaʊ/<,>adv.由于某种原因/adv.不知怎么的/adv.以某种方式<,>Somehow, I forgot to bring my keys.<,>不知怎么的，我忘了带钥匙。<,>We'll get there somehow, even if we have to walk.<,>即使要走，我们也会以某种方式到达那里。<,>Somehow, the project got completed on time.<,>不知怎么的，项目按时完成了。<,>some(某)+how(方式)→以某种方式<,>somewhat(adv.有点)/anyhow(adv.无论如何)
dive<,>/daɪv/<,>/daɪv/<,>vi.跳水/vi.潜水/vi.俯冲<,>He loves to dive into the pool from the high board.<,>他喜欢从高台跳入泳池。<,>The eagle made a swift dive to catch its prey.<,>老鹰迅速俯冲捕捉猎物。<,>She learned to dive when she was just five years old.<,>她五岁时就学会了潜水。<,>di(向下)+ve(动作)→向下动作→跳水<,>drive(v.驾驶/n.驱动力)/dove(n.鸽子)

heap<,>/hiːp/<,>/hiːp/<,>n.堆/n.大量<,>There was a heap of clothes on the floor.<,>地板上有一堆衣服。<,>He has heaps of money but no happiness.<,>他有很多钱但不幸福。<,>The information came in a heap all at once.<,>信息一下子大量涌来。<,>h(高)+eap(堆积)→高高堆积→堆<,>leap(v.跳跃)/heat(n.热量)

consumer<,>/kənˈsjuːmə/<,>/kənˈsuːmər/<,>n.消费者/n.用户/n.消耗者<,>Consumer rights should be protected by law.<,>消费者权益应受法律保护。<,>The product is popular among young consumers.<,>这个产品在年轻消费者中很受欢迎。<,>Electric cars are better for the environment and the consumer.<,>电动汽车对环境和消费者都更好。<,>con(完全)+sum(拿取)+er(人)→完全拿取的人→消费者<,>customer(n.顾客)/producer(n.生产者)

rescue<,>/ˈreskjuː/<,>/ˈrɛskju/<,>n.营救/vt.救援<,>The firemen rescued the family from the burning house.<,>消防员从燃烧的房子里救出了这家人。<,>A rescue team was sent to the earthquake zone.<,>一支救援队被派往地震灾区。<,>She rescued the drowning child.<,>她救起了溺水的孩子。<,>re(重新)+scue(安全)→重新获得安全→救援<,>pursue(v.追求)/request(v.请求)

highly<,>/ˈhaɪli/<,>/ˈhaɪli/<,>adv.高度地/adv.非常/adv.非常赞许地<,>She speaks highly of her colleagues.<,>她高度评价她的同事。<,>This is a highly sensitive issue.<,>这是一个高度敏感的问题。<,>The professor is highly respected in his field.<,>这位教授在他的领域备受尊敬。<,>high(高)+ly(副词后缀)→高度地<,>likely(adj.可能的)/lightly(adv.轻轻地)

keyboard<,>/ˈkiːbɔːd/<,>/ˈkiˌbɔrd/<,>n.键盘<,>She plays the piano on an electronic keyboard.<,>她在电子键盘上弹钢琴。<,>My computer keyboard is not working properly.<,>我的电脑键盘工作不正常。<,>He types very fast on the keyboard.<,>他在键盘上打字很快。<,>key(键)+board(板)→键板→键盘<,>blackboard(n.黑板)/cupboard(n.橱柜)

recover<,>/rɪˈkʌvə(r)/<,>/rɪˈkʌvər/<,>v.重新获得/v.挽回/v.恢复<,>It took him a month to recover from the illness.<,>他花了一个月时间才从疾病中恢复。<,>She managed to recover her lost wallet.<,>她成功找回了丢失的钱包。<,>The economy is slowly recovering from the recession.<,>经济正在从衰退中缓慢复苏。<,>re(重新)+cover(覆盖)→重新覆盖→恢复<,>discover(v.发现)/uncover(v.揭露)/recovery(n.恢复)

determine<,>/dɪˈtɜːmɪn/<,>/dɪˈtɜːrmɪn/<,>vi.决意/vt.决定/vt.查明/vt.使下决心<,>She determined to study abroad next year.<,>她决定明年出国留学。<,>The investigation will determine the cause of the accident.<,>调查将查明事故原因。<,>His encouragement determined me to pursue my dream.<,>他的鼓励使我下定决心追求梦想。<,>de(加强)+term(界限)+ine→定下界限→决定<,>terminal(n.终点/adj.末期的)/terminate(v.终止)

nature<,>/ˈneɪtʃə(r)/<,>/ˈneɪtʃər/<,>n.大自然/n.本性/n.性质<,>We should protect the beauty of nature.<,>我们应该保护大自然的美丽。<,>It's not in his nature to be rude.<,>粗鲁不是他的本性。<,>The nature of the problem is quite complex.<,>这个问题的性质相当复杂。<,>nat(出生)+ure→与生俱来的→本性<,>natural(adj.自然的)/nurture(v.养育/n.教养)
