precious<,>/ˈpreʃəs/<,>/ˈpreʃəs/<,>adj.珍贵的/宝贵的<,>Time is the most precious resource we have.<,>时间是我们拥有的最宝贵的资源。<,>She keeps her precious jewelry in a safe.<,>她把珍贵的珠宝放在保险箱里。<,>The photo album contains precious memories of my childhood.<,>这本相册包含了我童年的珍贵回忆。<,>preci(价值)+ous(多...的)→很有价值的→珍贵的<,>previous(adj.先前的)/precise(adj.精确的)/precipice(n.悬崖)

observation<,>/ˌɒbzəˈveɪʃn/<,>/ˌɑːbzərˈveɪʃən/<,>n.注意/观察/言论/评论/观察资料<,>The patient is under close observation in the hospital.<,>病人在医院接受密切观察。<,>She made an interesting observation about human behavior.<,>她对人类行为做了一个有趣的评论。<,>These observations will be recorded in our research report.<,>这些观察资料将被记录在我们的研究报告中。<,>ob(加强)+serv(保持)+ation→保持看→观察<,>conservation(n.保护)/reservation(n.保留)/preservation(n.保存)

tremble<,>/ˈtrembl/<,>/ˈtrembəl/<,>vi.发抖/哆嗦/摇动/n.颤抖/摇晃/摇动<,>Her voice trembled as she spoke about the accident.<,>她讲述事故时声音在颤抖。<,>The leaves trembled in the wind.<,>树叶在风中摇动。<,>I could feel a slight tremble in his hands.<,>我能感觉到他的手在轻微颤抖。<,>trem(颤抖)+ble→颤抖<,>tremor(n.震动)/tremendous(adj.巨大的)/tremulous(adj.颤抖的)

suspect<,>/səˈspekt/<,>/səˈspekt/<,>adj.可疑的/不信任的/vt.疑有/推测/对...表示怀疑/n.嫌疑犯/可疑分子<,>The police suspect him of stealing the money.<,>警方怀疑他偷了钱。<,>I suspect that she's not telling us the whole truth.<,>我怀疑她没有告诉我们全部真相。<,>The suspect was arrested at the airport.<,>嫌疑犯在机场被捕。<,>sus(下)+pect(看)→向下看→怀疑<,>inspect(v.检查)/respect(v.尊重)/aspect(n.方面)

apologize<,>/əˈpɒlədʒaɪz/<,>/əˈpɑːlədʒaɪz/<,>vi.道歉/谢罪/认错<,>I want to apologize for my rude behavior yesterday.<,>我想为昨天粗鲁的行为道歉。<,>He apologized to his boss for being late.<,>他为迟到向老板道歉。<,>She refused to apologize, even though she was clearly wrong.<,>即使明显错了，她也拒绝道歉。<,>apo(离开)+log(说)+ize→说开→道歉<,>apology(n.道歉)/logic(n.逻辑)/dialog(n.对话)
inhabitant<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪtənt/<,>/ɪnˈhæbɪtənt/<,>n.居民/n.住户<,>The inhabitants of the small town were very friendly.<,>小镇的居民非常友好。<,>The island has only a few hundred inhabitants.<,>这个岛上只有几百个住户。<,>Many inhabitants left the city due to pollution.<,>许多居民因为污染离开了城市。<,>in(在)+habit(居住)+ant(人)→居住的人→居民<,>habitat(n.栖息地)/inhibit(v.抑制/v.阻止)  

fraction<,>/ˈfrækʃn/<,>/ˈfrækʃən/<,>n.小部分/n.片断/n.分数<,>She only ate a fraction of her meal.<,>她只吃了一小部分饭。<,>The glass broke into tiny fractions.<,>玻璃碎成了小片断。<,>Can you simplify this fraction?<,>你能简化这个分数吗？<,>fract(打破)+ion→打破的部分→小部分<,>fracture(n.骨折/v.断裂)/fiction(n.小说/n.虚构)  

filter<,>/ˈfɪltə(r)/<,>/ˈfɪltər/<,>v.过滤/v.透/n.滤纸/n.过滤嘴<,>We need to filter the water before drinking.<,>我们需要过滤水再饮用。<,>Sunlight filtered through the curtains.<,>阳光透过窗帘。<,>Change the oil filter regularly.<,>定期更换机油滤纸。<,>fil(线)+ter→用线编织过滤→过滤<,>falter(v.蹒跚/v.支吾)/philter(n.春药/n.魔药)  

sunlight<,>/ˈsʌnlaɪt/<,>/ˈsʌnlaɪt/<,>n.日光/n.阳光<,>Plants need sunlight to grow.<,>植物需要阳光生长。<,>The room was filled with golden sunlight.<,>房间里充满金色的阳光。<,>She loves reading in the sunlight.<,>她喜欢在阳光下阅读。<,>sun(太阳)+light(光)→阳光<,>moonlight(n.月光)/starlight(n.星光)  

site<,>/saɪt/<,>/saɪt/<,>n.地点/n.场所/vt.使坐落在/vt.设置<,>This is the site of the ancient battle.<,>这是古战场的遗址。<,>The company will site its new factory here.<,>公司将把新工厂设在这里。<,>The wedding site was beautifully decorated.<,>婚礼场所装饰得很美。<,>sit(坐)+e→坐落的地方→地点<,>cite(v.引用/v.传讯)/sight(n.视力/n.景象)  

emotion<,>/ɪˈməʊʃn/<,>/ɪˈmoʊʃən/<,>n.情感/n.感情/n.激动<,>She couldn't hide her emotions.<,>她无法隐藏自己的情感。<,>Love is a powerful emotion.<,>爱是一种强烈的感情。<,>He spoke with great emotion.<,>他非常激动地讲话。<,>e(出)+mot(动)+ion→流露出的感情→情感<,>motion(n.运动/v.示意)/promotion(n.晋升/n.促销)  

massive<,>/ˈmæsɪv/<,>/ˈmæsɪv/<,>adj.大的/adj.大而重的/adj.大块的/adj.大量的/adj.大规模的<,>They built a massive statue.<,>他们建了一座巨大的雕像。<,>The box was too massive to lift.<,>这个箱子太重搬不动。<,>A massive crowd gathered in the square.<,>广场上聚集了大量人群。<,>mass(大量)+ive→大量的<,>passive(adj.被动的)/massage(n.按摩/v.按摩)  

cease<,>/siːs/<,>/siːs/<,>v.停止/v.终止<,>The rain finally ceased.<,>雨终于停了。<,>They agreed to cease hostilities.<,>他们同意停止敌对行动。<,>The factory ceased production last year.<,>这家工厂去年停产了。<,>ceas(停)+e→停止<,>seize(v.抓住/v.夺取)/lease(n.租约/v.出租)  

assess<,>/əˈses/<,>/əˈses/<,>vt.对估价/vt.评价/vt.评论<,>They will assess the damage tomorrow.<,>他们明天会评估损失。<,>How do you assess his performance?<,>你如何评价他的表现？<,>The teacher assessed our essays.<,>老师评论了我们的文章。<,>as(向)+sess(坐)→坐下来评价→评估<,>access(n.入口/v.访问)/excess(n.过量/adj.多余的)  

asset<,>/ˈæset/<,>/ˈæset/<,>n.资产/n.财产/n.有价值的特性或技能/n.优点<,>His house is his biggest asset.<,>房子是他最大的资产。<,>Good communication is an important asset.<,>良好的沟通是重要优点。<,>The company sold some assets.<,>公司出售了一些财产。<,>as(向)+set(放)→放好的东西→资产<,>assent(n.同意/v.同意)/assert(v.断言/v.维护)
owe<,>/əʊ/<,>/oʊ/<,>vt.欠/vt.应把…归功于/vt.感激/vt.感恩<,>I owe you ten dollars for lunch.<,>我欠你十美元的午餐钱。<,>She owes her success to hard work.<,>她把成功归功于努力工作。<,>I owe a great deal to my parents.<,>我非常感激我的父母。<,>o(看作“我”) + we(我们)→我欠我们→欠<,>own(v.拥有)/owl(n.猫头鹰)/ode(n.颂诗)

scarce<,>/skeəs/<,>/skɛrs/<,>adj.缺乏的/adj.不足的/adj.稀少的/adj.罕见的<,>Food was scarce during the war.<,>战争期间食物匮乏。<,>Jobs are scarce in this area.<,>这个地区工作机会很少。<,>This type of bird is becoming scarce.<,>这种鸟变得越来越稀少。<,>scar(伤疤) + ce→伤疤是罕见的→罕见的<,>scare(v.惊吓)/scarf(n.围巾)/scary(adj.可怕的)

minimum<,>/ˈmɪnɪməm/<,>/ˈmɪnəməm/<,>adj.最低的/adj.最小的/n.最低限度/n.最小量<,>The minimum age for driving is 16.<,>最低驾驶年龄是16岁。<,>We need a minimum of ten people to start the class.<,>我们至少需要十个人才能开课。<,>Keep noise to a minimum during the exam.<,>考试期间请保持最低噪音。<,>mini(小) + mum(拉丁语最高级后缀)→最小的<,>maxium(n.最大值)/minimize(v.最小化)/minimal(adj.最小的)

queue<,>/kjuː/<,>/kju/<,>vi.排队等候/n.长队/n.行列<,>We had to queue for hours to get tickets.<,>我们不得不排队几个小时买票。<,>There was a long queue at the bus stop.<,>公交车站排了长队。<,>Please queue here for the exhibition.<,>参观展览请在此排队。<,>que(看作“queen”) + ue→女王也要排队→排队<,>cue(n.提示)/quest(n.寻求)/quay(n.码头)

mathematical<,>/ˌmæθəˈmætɪkəl/<,>/ˌmæθəˈmætɪkəl/<,>adj.数学的<,>He has a mathematical mind.<,>他有数学头脑。<,>This problem requires mathematical precision.<,>这个问题需要数学精度。<,>She is good at mathematical calculations.<,>她擅长数学计算。<,>math(数学) + ematical(形容词后缀)→数学的<,>mathematician(n.数学家)/arithmetic(n.算术)/geometry(n.几何)

apology<,>/əˈpɒlədʒi/<,>/əˈpɑːlədʒi/<,>n.道歉/n.认错/n.谢罪<,>I owe you an apology for being late.<,>我为迟到向你道歉。<,>He made a public apology for his mistake.<,>他为自己的错误公开道歉。<,>She accepted his apology gracefully.<,>她优雅地接受了他的道歉。<,>apo(远离) + logy(说话)→说远离的话→道歉<,>apologize(v.道歉)/apologetic(adj.道歉的)/analogy(n.类比)

magic<,>/ˈmædʒɪk/<,>/ˈmædʒɪk/<,>adj.有魔力的/adj.魔术的/n.魔法/n.魅力<,>The magician performed amazing magic tricks.<,>魔术师表演了惊人的魔术。<,>There's a magic in her voice.<,>她的声音有种魔力。<,>They believe in the power of magic.<,>他们相信魔法的力量。<,>mag(看作“magnificent”) + ic→像壮丽的一样神奇→魔法<,>magical(adj.魔法的)/magician(n.魔术师)/magnetic(adj.有磁性的)

argument<,>/ˈɑːɡjumənt/<,>/ˈɑːrɡjumənt/<,>n.争论/n.辩论/n.理由/n.说理/n.论证<,>They had an argument about politics.<,>他们就政治问题发生了争论。<,>His argument was very persuasive.<,>他的论点很有说服力。<,>There's no argument against this evidence.<,>这个证据无可辩驳。<,>argu(争论) + ment(名词后缀)→争论<,>augment(v.增加)/segment(n.部分)/fragment(n.碎片)

reveal<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>/rɪˈviːl/<,>vt.揭露/vt.泄露/vt.展现/vt.显示<,>The investigation revealed new facts.<,>调查揭露了新事实。<,>She revealed her true feelings.<,>她表露了真实感受。<,>The curtain rose to reveal a beautiful scene.<,>帷幕升起，展现出一幅美丽的场景。<,>re(重新) + veal(看作“veil”面纱)→重新揭开面纱→揭露<,>conceal(v.隐藏)/veil(n.面纱)/revile(v.辱骂)

data<,>/ˈdeɪtə/<,>/ˈdætə/<,>n.资料/n.数据<,>We need to analyze the data carefully.<,>我们需要仔细分析这些数据。<,>The research is based on solid data.<,>这项研究基于可靠的数据。<,>Please enter your personal data here.<,>请在此输入您的个人资料。<,>dat(给) + a→给出的东西→数据<,>date(n.日期)/datum(n.数据单数)/database(n.数据库)
theoretical<,>/ˌθɪəˈretɪkəl/<,>/ˌθiːəˈretɪkəl/<,>adj.理论的<,>His argument was purely theoretical.<,>他的论点纯粹是理论上的。<,>Theoretical physics can be quite complex.<,>理论物理学可能相当复杂。<,>She has a theoretical understanding of the subject.<,>她对这门学科有理论上的理解。<,>theory(理论) + etical(形容词后缀)→理论的<,>practical(adj.实际的)/hypothetical(adj.假设的)

adequate<,>/ˈædɪkwət/<,>/ˈædɪkwɪt/<,>adj.足够的/可以胜任的<,>The food was adequate for all of us.<,>食物足够我们所有人吃。<,>He is adequate to the task.<,>他能胜任这项任务。<,>Her performance was adequate but not outstanding.<,>她的表现尚可但并不出色。<,>ad(加强)+equ(平等)+ate→足够平等的→足够的<,>insufficient(adj.不足的)/sufficient(adj.充足的)

utter<,>/ˈʌtə(r)/<,>/ˈʌtər/<,>adj.完全的，彻底的/vt.发出，说，讲<,>It was an utter disaster.<,>这完全是一场灾难。<,>She didn't utter a word during the meeting.<,>她在会议期间一言不发。<,>He uttered a cry of pain.<,>他发出痛苦的叫声。<,>ut(出)+ter(比较级后缀)→完全说出的→彻底的<,>mutter(v.咕哝)/butter(n.黄油)

onion<,>/ˈʌnjən/<,>/ˈʌnjən/<,>n.洋葱/洋葱类植物<,>She chopped the onion into small pieces.<,>她把洋葱切成小块。<,>The soup has a strong onion flavor.<,>这汤有很浓的洋葱味。<,>Onions make my eyes water when I cut them.<,>切洋葱时我的眼睛会流泪。<,>on(在...上)+ion→一层层的东西→洋葱<,>garlic(n.大蒜)/shallot(n.青葱)

vibrate<,>/vaɪˈbreɪt/<,>/ˈvaɪbreɪt/<,>v.颤动<,>The phone vibrated in his pocket.<,>手机在他口袋里震动。<,>The strings vibrate when plucked.<,>琴弦被拨动时会颤动。<,>The whole building vibrated during the earthquake.<,>地震时整栋楼都在震动。<,>vibr(振动)+ate(动词后缀)→颤动<,>vibrant(adj.充满活力的)/vibration(n.震动)

drum<,>/drʌm/<,>/drʌm/<,>v.有节奏地敲击/n.鼓，鼓状物；圆桶<,>He drummed his fingers on the table.<,>他用手指在桌子上有节奏地敲击。<,>She plays the drum in a band.<,>她在乐队里打鼓。<,>The oil is stored in large drums.<,>石油储存在大圆桶里。<,>dr(拟声词)+um→鼓声→鼓<,>drummer(n.鼓手)/trumpet(n.小号)

sausage<,>/ˈsɒsɪdʒ/<,>/ˈsɔːsɪdʒ/<,>n.香肠，腊肠<,>I had sausage and eggs for breakfast.<,>我早餐吃了香肠和鸡蛋。<,>This German sausage is very tasty.<,>这种德国香肠非常美味。<,>He made homemade sausages last weekend.<,>他上周末做了自制香肠。<,>sau(盐)+sage(香草)→用盐和香草腌制的肉→香肠<,>sauce(n.酱汁)/sandwich(n.三明治)

hopeful<,>/ˈhəʊpfəl/<,>/ˈhoʊpfəl/<,>adj.有希望的<,>We remain hopeful about the future.<,>我们对未来仍然充满希望。<,>She gave me a hopeful smile.<,>她给了我一个充满希望的微笑。<,>The test results are hopeful.<,>测试结果很有希望。<,>hope(希望)+ful(形容词后缀)→有希望的<,>hopeless(adj.无望的)/wishful(adj.一厢情愿的)

tremendous<,>/trəˈmendəs/<,>/trəˈmendəs/<,>adj.极大的，非常的；精彩的，了不起的<,>There was a tremendous explosion.<,>发生了巨大的爆炸。<,>She has a tremendous amount of energy.<,>她有惊人的精力。<,>That was a tremendous performance!<,>那是一场精彩的演出！<,>trem(颤抖)+endous→大得让人颤抖的→极大的<,>enormous(adj.巨大的)/tremble(v.颤抖)

condense<,>/kənˈdens/<,>/kənˈdɛns/<,>v.冷凝，凝结；浓缩，压缩，简缩<,>Steam condenses into water when cooled.<,>蒸汽冷却时凝结成水。<,>The editor condensed the article to half its length.<,>编辑将文章压缩到原来的一半长度。<,>Condensed milk is very sweet.<,>炼乳非常甜。<,>con(一起)+dense(密集)→使密集→浓缩<,>compress(v.压缩)/dense(adj.密集的)
barrier<,>/ˈbæriə(r)/<,>/ˈbɛriər/<,>n.栅栏/n.检票口/n.屏障/n.障碍/n.隔阂<,>The police set up barriers to control the crowd.<,>警察设置了栅栏来控制人群。<,>Language can be a barrier to communication.<,>语言可能成为交流的障碍。<,>There is no barrier between the two gardens.<,>两个花园之间没有隔断。<,>bar(阻挡)+rier→障碍物<,>barrel(n.桶)/barren(adj.贫瘠的)

realistic<,>/ˌriːəˈlɪstɪk/<,>/ˌriəˈlɪstɪk/<,>adj.现实的/adj.实际可行的/adj.现实主义的/adj.逼真的<,>We need to be realistic about our chances of winning.<,>我们需要对获胜的可能性持现实态度。<,>The special effects in the movie were very realistic.<,>电影中的特效非常逼真。<,>She has a realistic approach to problem-solving.<,>她解决问题的方法很实际。<,>real(真实的)+istic→现实的<,>idealistic(adj.理想主义的)/artistic(adj.艺术的)

justice<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>/ˈdʒʌstɪs/<,>n.正义/n.公正/n.司法<,>The judge is known for his sense of justice.<,>这位法官以正义感著称。<,>We must fight for social justice.<,>我们必须为社会正义而战。<,>The justice system needs reform.<,>司法系统需要改革。<,>just(公正的)+ice→正义<,>justify(v.证明...正当)/adjust(v.调整)

create<,>/kriˈeɪt/<,>/kriˈeɪt/<,>vt.创造/vt.引起/vt.产生<,>God is believed to have created the world.<,>人们相信上帝创造了世界。<,>The new policy created some problems.<,>新政策引发了一些问题。<,>She created a beautiful painting.<,>她创作了一幅美丽的画作。<,>cre(增长)+ate→创造<,>creative(adj.有创造力的)/creature(n.生物)

criminal<,>/ˈkrɪmɪnl/<,>/ˈkrɪmənəl/<,>adj.犯罪的/adj.刑事的/n.犯人/n.罪犯/n.刑事犯<,>He was charged with criminal negligence.<,>他被指控犯有过失罪。<,>The criminal was sentenced to ten years in prison.<,>罪犯被判十年监禁。<,>Criminal law deals with offenses against society.<,>刑法处理危害社会的行为。<,>crime(犯罪)+al→犯罪的<,>civil(adj.民事的)/critical(adj.关键的)

tag<,>/tæɡ/<,>/tæɡ/<,>vi.尾随/n.附加语/n.标签/vt.给...加上标签<,>Please tag your luggage before checking in.<,>请在办理登机手续前给行李贴上标签。<,>The children played a game of tag in the park.<,>孩子们在公园里玩捉人游戏。<,>He tagged along with us to the concert.<,>他跟着我们一起去听音乐会。<,>t(贴)+ag(做)→贴上标签<,>bag(n.包)/rag(n.破布)

notebook<,>/ˈnəʊtbʊk/<,>/ˈnoʊtbʊk/<,>n.笔记本<,>She wrote the meeting minutes in her notebook.<,>她把会议记录写在笔记本上。<,>I need to buy a new notebook for school.<,>我需要为学校买一个新笔记本。<,>He keeps all his ideas in a small notebook.<,>他把所有想法都记在一个小笔记本里。<,>note(笔记)+book(本子)→笔记本<,>textbook(n.教科书)/workbook(n.练习册)

curious<,>/ˈkjʊəriəs/<,>/ˈkjʊriəs/<,>adj.好奇的/adj.奇怪的<,>The child was curious about everything.<,>这个孩子对一切都很好奇。<,>There was a curious noise coming from the attic.<,>阁楼传来奇怪的声音。<,>I'm curious to know what happened.<,>我很好奇发生了什么。<,>cur(关心)+ious→好奇的<,>furious(adj.愤怒的)/serious(adj.严肃的)

indirect<,>/ˌɪndəˈrekt/<,>/ˌɪndɪˈrekt/<,>adj.间接的/adj.婉转的<,>She gave an indirect answer to the question.<,>她对问题给出了一个间接的回答。<,>The road to the village is indirect.<,>通往村庄的路是迂回的。<,>He made an indirect reference to the scandal.<,>他间接提到了那个丑闻。<,>in(不)+direct(直接的)→间接的<,>direct(adj.直接的)/incorrect(adj.不正确的)

individual<,>/ˌɪndɪˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>/ˌɪndəˈvɪdʒuəl/<,>adj.个别的/adj.独特的/n.个人/n.个体<,>Each individual has different needs.<,>每个人都有不同的需求。<,>She has a very individual style of dressing.<,>她有非常独特的穿衣风格。<,>The teacher gave individual attention to each student.<,>老师给予每个学生个别关注。<,>in(不)+divid(分开)+ual→不可分开的→个体<,>divide(v.分开)/indivisible(adj.不可分割的)
resource<,>/rɪˈzɔːs/<,>/ˈriːsɔːrs/<,>n.资源/n.财力/n.应付办法/n.谋略<,>Natural resources are vital for economic development.<,>自然资源对经济发展至关重要。<,>She used all her resources to solve the problem.<,>她动用了一切办法来解决这个问题。<,>The country is rich in mineral resources.<,>这个国家矿产资源丰富。<,>re(再)+source(来源)→反复利用的来源→资源<,>source(n.来源)/recourse(n.求助)/resort(n.度假胜地)

ugly<,>/ˈʌɡli/<,>/ˈʌɡli/<,>adj.丑陋的/adj.可怕的<,>The old building was ugly and dilapidated.<,>那座老建筑又丑又破败。<,>The situation took an ugly turn when violence erupted.<,>当暴力爆发时，情况变得很可怕。<,>She made an ugly face at the mirror.<,>她对着镜子做了个鬼脸。<,>ug(丑陋)+ly(形容词后缀)→丑陋的<,>hugely(adv.巨大地)/bugle(n.军号)/juggle(v.玩杂耍)

nuisance<,>/ˈnjuːsns/<,>/ˈnuːsns/<,>n.讨厌的东西<,>The noisy construction work is a real nuisance.<,>嘈杂的施工真是讨厌。<,>Mosquitoes are a nuisance in summer.<,>夏天蚊子很烦人。<,>He considered the paperwork a necessary nuisance.<,>他认为这些文书工作是必要的麻烦。<,>nuis(伤害)+ance(名词后缀)→造成伤害的东西→讨厌物<,>annoyance(n.烦恼)/nonsense(n.胡说)/nurturance(n.养育)

tax<,>/tæks/<,>/tæks/<,>n.税/n.税款/n.负担/vt.对...征税/vt.使负担重<,>The government plans to increase income tax.<,>政府计划提高所得税。<,>The heavy workload taxed her strength.<,>繁重的工作耗尽了她的体力。<,>Tax evasion is a serious crime.<,>逃税是严重罪行。<,>tax(税)→来自拉丁语taxare(评估)<,>tack(n.大头钉)/tact(n.机智)/tux(n.燕尾服)

earthquake<,>/ˈɜːθkweɪk/<,>/ˈɜːrθkweɪk/<,>n.地震/n.大震荡<,>The earthquake destroyed many buildings.<,>地震摧毁了许多建筑。<,>The scandal caused an earthquake in political circles.<,>这起丑闻在政界引起轩然大波。<,>Earthquake drills are important for safety.<,>地震演练对安全很重要。<,>earth(地球)+quake(震动)→地震<,>heartquake(n.心悸)/earthwork(n.土木工程)/quake(v.颤抖)

excitement<,>/ɪkˈsaɪtmənt/<,>/ɪkˈsaɪtmənt/<,>n.刺激/n.激动/n.兴奋/n.令人兴奋的事<,>The children were jumping with excitement.<,>孩子们兴奋得跳了起来。<,>The game provided plenty of excitement.<,>这场比赛令人兴奋不已。<,>She could hardly contain her excitement.<,>她几乎无法抑制自己的兴奋。<,>excite(使兴奋)+ment(名词后缀)→兴奋<,>incitement(n.煽动)/enchantment(n.魅力)/enticement(n.诱惑)

nightmare<,>/ˈnaɪtmeə(r)/<,>/ˈnaɪtmer/<,>n.噩梦/n.可怕的事物/n.无法摆脱的恐惧<,>I had a terrible nightmare last night.<,>昨晚我做了个可怕的噩梦。<,>The traffic was a complete nightmare.<,>交通状况简直糟透了。<,>War is a living nightmare for civilians.<,>战争对平民来说是活生生的噩梦。<,>night(夜晚)+mare(母马)→中世纪传说中夜晚出现的梦魇<,>nightshade(n.龙葵)/nightcap(n.睡前酒)/nightfall(n.黄昏)

cord<,>/kɔːd/<,>/kɔːrd/<,>n.细绳/n.粗线/n.索/n.灯芯绒裤<,>She tied the package with a cord.<,>她用绳子捆扎包裹。<,>He wore brown cords to the casual party.<,>他穿着棕色灯芯绒裤参加休闲派对。<,>The spinal cord is part of the nervous system.<,>脊髓是神经系统的一部分。<,>cord(心)→来自拉丁语chorda(弦)<,>chord(n.和弦)/cordage(n.绳索)/accord(v.一致)

ending<,>/ˈendɪŋ/<,>/ˈendɪŋ/<,>n.结尾/n.结局/n.死亡<,>The movie had a happy ending.<,>这部电影有个圆满的结局。<,>His story came to a tragic ending.<,>他的故事以悲剧收场。<,>The ending of the novel was unexpected.<,>小说的结局出人意料。<,>end(结束)+ing(名词后缀)→结局<,>bending(n.弯曲)/mending(n.修补)/tending(n.照料)

core<,>/kɔː(r)/<,>/kɔːr/<,>n.果实的心/n.核心/n.要点<,>Apples have hard cores.<,>苹果有坚硬的果核。<,>The core issue is lack of funding.<,>核心问题是资金不足。<,>Remove the core before eating the pear.<,>吃梨前要去掉果核。<,>core(心)→来自拉丁语cor(心)<,>corps(n.军团)/corpse(n.尸体)/corn(n.玉米)
council<,>/ˈkaʊnsəl/<,>/ˈkaʊnsəl/<,>n.理事会/n.委员会<,>The council meets every month to discuss local issues.<,>理事会每月开会讨论当地问题。<,>She was elected to the city council last year.<,>她去年当选为市议会议员。<,>The council decided to increase funding for education.<,>委员会决定增加教育经费。<,>coun(共同)+cil(召集)→共同召集→理事会<,>counsel(n.劝告/v.建议)/consul(n.领事)/cancel(v.取消)

enforce<,>/ɪnˈfɔːs/<,>/ɪnˈfɔːrs/<,>v.实施/v.执行/v.强制/v.强迫/v.迫使<,>The police are here to enforce the law.<,>警察在这里执法。<,>The new rules will be enforced starting next month.<,>新规定将于下月开始实施。<,>Parents should enforce good habits in their children.<,>父母应该让孩子养成好习惯。<,>en(使)+force(力量)→使有力量→强制执行<,>reinforce(v.加强)/endorse(v.背书/v.赞同)/effort(n.努力)

embassy<,>/ˈembəsi/<,>/ˈembəsi/<,>n.大使馆/n.大使馆全体成员<,>He works at the American embassy in London.<,>他在伦敦的美国大使馆工作。<,>The embassy issued a travel warning for the region.<,>大使馆对该地区发布了旅行警告。<,>All embassy staff were evacuated during the crisis.<,>危机期间大使馆全体人员都被疏散了。<,>em(在...内)+bassy(基础)→建立在外国的基础→大使馆<,>ambassador(n.大使)/embarrass(v.使尴尬)/embark(v.登船/v.开始)

departure<,>/dɪˈpɑːtʃə(r)/<,>/dɪˈpɑːrtʃər/<,>n.离开/n.起程/n.出发/n.背离/n.违背<,>Our departure time is scheduled for 6 PM.<,>我们的出发时间定在下午6点。<,>His actions represent a departure from tradition.<,>他的行为违背了传统。<,>The departure gate will be announced shortly.<,>登机口将很快公布。<,>de(离开)+part(部分)+ure(状态)→离开的状态→出发<,>department(n.部门)/depart(v.离开)/apart(adv.分开)

concrete<,>/ˈkɒŋkriːt/<,>/ˈkɑːŋkriːt/<,>adj.实在的/adj.具体的/n.混凝土/n.具体物<,>We need concrete evidence to support this claim.<,>我们需要具体证据来支持这一说法。<,>The sidewalk is made of concrete.<,>人行道是用混凝土铺的。<,>Let's discuss concrete steps to solve the problem.<,>我们来讨论解决问题的具体步骤。<,>con(共同)+crete(生长)→共同生长→具体化<,>abstract(adj.抽象的)/discreet(adj.谨慎的)/discrete(adj.离散的)

distinct<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>/dɪˈstɪŋkt/<,>adj.与其他不同的/adj.清楚的/adj.明显的<,>There is a distinct smell of coffee in the room.<,>房间里有一股明显的咖啡味。<,>His voice was distinct even in the noisy crowd.<,>即使在嘈杂的人群中，他的声音也很清晰。<,>She has a distinct way of solving problems.<,>她有独特的解决问题的方式。<,>dis(分开)+tinct(刺)→刺分开→明显的<,>instinct(n.本能)/extinct(adj.灭绝的)/distinguish(v.区分)

motion<,>/ˈməʊʃ(ə)n/<,>/ˈmoʊʃ(ə)n/<,>v.打手势/v.示意/n.运动/n.手势/n.眼色/n.动作/n.提议<,>He motioned for me to sit down.<,>他示意我坐下。<,>The motion of the boat made her feel sick.<,>船的晃动让她感到恶心。<,>She proposed a motion to change the rules.<,>她提出了一项修改规则的提议。<,>mot(移动)+ion(名词后缀)→运动<,>emotion(n.情感)/promotion(n.晋升/n.促销)  

limited<,>/ˈlɪmɪtɪd/<,>/ˈlɪmɪtɪd/<,>adj.有限的<,>We have a limited amount of time to finish the project.<,>我们完成项目的时间有限。<,>The offer is available for a limited period only.<,>这个优惠只在有限的时间内有效。<,>His knowledge of the subject is rather limited.<,>他对这个主题的了解相当有限。<,>limit(限制)+ed(形容词后缀)→有限的<,>unlimited(adj.无限的)/limitation(n.限制)  

idle<,>/ˈaɪd(ə)l/<,>/ˈaɪd(ə)l/<,>adj.空闲的/adj.懒散的/adj.无用的/v.虚度/v.无所事事<,>The workers were left idle when the machine broke down.<,>机器坏了，工人们无事可做。<,>Don't idle away your time playing video games.<,>不要虚度时间玩电子游戏。<,>The factory has been idle for months.<,>这家工厂已经闲置数月了。<,>谐音“爱抖”→爱抖腿的人可能懒散<,>idol(n.偶像)/ideal(adj.理想的)  

confidence<,>/ˈkɒnfɪd(ə)ns/<,>/ˈkɑːnfɪd(ə)ns/<,>n.信任/n.信赖/n.信心/n.自信<,>She spoke with confidence during the presentation.<,>她在演讲时充满自信。<,>I have complete confidence in his abilities.<,>我对他的能力完全信任。<,>The team lost confidence after several defeats.<,>几次失败后，团队失去了信心。<,>con(完全)+fid(信任)+ence(名词后缀)→信任<,>confident(adj.自信的)/confidential(adj.机密的)  

arbitrary<,>/ˈɑːbɪtrəri/<,>/ˈɑːrbɪtreri/<,>adj.随心所欲的/adj.专断的<,>The decision seemed completely arbitrary.<,>这个决定看起来完全是武断的。<,>He was criticized for his arbitrary management style.<,>他因专断的管理风格受到批评。<,>The rules are not arbitrary; they have a clear purpose.<,>这些规则不是随意的，它们有明确的目的。<,>arbitr(判断)+ary(形容词后缀)→武断的<,>arbitrator(n.仲裁者)/arbitrate(v.仲裁)  

fearful<,>/ˈfɪəf(ə)l/<,>/ˈfɪrf(ə)l/<,>adj.害怕的/adj.可怕的/adj.不安的/adj.忧虑的<,>She was fearful of walking alone at night.<,>她害怕晚上独自走路。<,>The storm was a fearful sight.<,>暴风雨的景象很可怕。<,>He gave her a fearful glance.<,>他忧虑地看了她一眼。<,>fear(害怕)+ful(形容词后缀)→害怕的<,>fearless(adj.无畏的)/fearsome(adj.吓人的)  

accent<,>/ˈæks(ə)nt/<,>/ˈækˌsɛnt/<,>n.口音/n.腔调/n.重音<,>She has a strong French accent.<,>她有很重的法国口音。<,>The accent in the word "record" depends on its meaning.<,>单词“record”的重音取决于它的意思。<,>He put on a fake British accent.<,>他装出一副假英国腔。<,>ac(加强)+cent(唱)→强调发音→口音<,>ascent(n.上升)/assent(n.同意)  

passive<,>/ˈpæsɪv/<,>/ˈpæsɪv/<,>adj.被动的/adj.消极的<,>He took a passive role in the discussion.<,>他在讨论中扮演了被动的角色。<,>Smoking has passive effects on non-smokers.<,>吸烟对非吸烟者有消极影响。<,>She gave a passive response to the criticism.<,>她对批评做出了消极的回应。<,>pass(忍受)+ive(形容词后缀)→被动忍受的<,>active(adj.积极的)/passion(n.激情)  

fertilizer<,>/ˈfɜːtɪlaɪzə(r)/<,>/ˈfɜːrtəlaɪzər/<,>n.肥料<,>Farmers use fertilizer to improve crop yields.<,>农民使用肥料来提高作物产量。<,>Organic fertilizer is better for the environment.<,>有机肥料对环境更好。<,>The soil needs more fertilizer to be productive.<,>土壤需要更多肥料才能高产。<,>fertile(肥沃的)+izer(名词后缀)→使肥沃的东西→肥料<,>fertilize(v.施肥)/fertility(n.肥力)  

lorry<,>/ˈlɒri/<,>/ˈlɔːri/<,>n.运货汽车/n.卡车<,>The lorry was carrying a heavy load of bricks.<,>卡车载着沉重的砖块。<,>There was a long queue of lorries at the border.<,>边境排着长队的卡车。<,>He works as a lorry driver.<,>他是一名卡车司机。<,>谐音“劳瑞”→劳瑞开卡车<,>truck(n.卡车)/van(n.厢式货车)
carrier<,>/ˈkæriə(r)/<,>/ˈkæriər/<,>n.运输工具/n.运载工具/n.带菌者/n.载重架/n.置物架<,>The aircraft carrier is a massive naval vessel.<,>航空母舰是一种大型海军舰艇。<,>Mosquitoes can be carriers of malaria.<,>蚊子可能是疟疾的携带者。<,>The bike has a rear carrier for packages.<,>这辆自行车后部有一个置物架。<,>carry(携带)+er(人或物)→携带者或运输工具<,>courier(n.信使)/career(n.职业)/currier(n.制革工人)

fragment<,>/ˈfræɡmənt/<,>/ˈfræɡmənt/<,>v.成碎片/n.碎片/n.破片/n.碎块<,>The glass shattered into tiny fragments.<,>玻璃碎成了小碎片。<,>He tried to fragment the opposition by sowing discord.<,>他试图通过制造分歧来分裂反对派。<,>Archaeologists found pottery fragments at the site.<,>考古学家在现场发现了陶器碎片。<,>frag(打破)+ment(名词后缀)→碎片<,>segment(n.部分)/flagrant(adj.臭名昭著的)/fragile(adj.易碎的)

corresponding<,>/ˌkɒrəˈspɒndɪŋ/<,>/ˌkɔːrəˈspɑːndɪŋ/<,>adj.相应的/adj.符合的<,>There was a corresponding increase in sales.<,>销售额出现了相应的增长。<,>The results were corresponding to our expectations.<,>结果与我们的预期相符。<,>She received a promotion with a corresponding pay rise.<,>她获得了晋升，工资也相应提高了。<,>cor(共同)+respond(回应)+ing→共同回应的→相应的<,>responding(adj.回应的)/corroborating(adj.确证的)/correlative(adj.相关的)

response<,>/rɪˈspɒns/<,>/rɪˈspɑːns/<,>n.回答/n.答复/n.反应/n.响应<,>Her response to the question was immediate.<,>她对问题的回答很迅速。<,>The patient showed no response to the treatment.<,>病人对治疗没有反应。<,>We're still waiting for a response from the company.<,>我们仍在等待公司的答复。<,>re(回)+sponse(承诺)→回应承诺→答复<,>responsible(adj.负责的)/responsive(adj.响应的)/sponsor(n.赞助者)

treaty<,>/ˈtriːti/<,>/ˈtriːti/<,>n.条约/n.协议/n.协定<,>The two countries signed a peace treaty.<,>两国签署了和平条约。<,>This violates the terms of the treaty.<,>这违反了条约的条款。<,>They negotiated a trade treaty between nations.<,>他们协商了国家间的贸易协定。<,>treat(处理)+y(名词后缀)→处理问题的文件→条约<,>entreaty(n.恳求)/retreat(n.撤退)/treatise(n.论文)

responsive<,>/rɪˈspɒnsɪv/<,>/rɪˈspɑːnsɪv/<,>adj.响应的/adj.敏感的/adj.易受影响的<,>The new material is highly responsive to temperature changes.<,>这种新材料对温度变化非常敏感。<,>The audience was very responsive to the speaker.<,>观众对演讲者反应热烈。<,>A good teacher should be responsive to students' needs.<,>好老师应该对学生需求反应灵敏。<,>response(反应)+ive(形容词后缀)→能反应的<,>responsible(adj.负责的)/responsive(adj.响应的)/respective(adj.各自的)

ounce<,>/aʊns/<,>/aʊns/<,>n.盎司<,>Add two ounces of sugar to the mixture.<,>在混合物中加入两盎司糖。<,>He doesn't have an ounce of common sense.<,>他一点常识都没有。<,>The letter weighed less than an ounce.<,>这封信重量不到一盎司。<,>发音类似"盎司"→重量单位<,>bounce(v.弹跳)/pounce(v.猛扑)/announce(v.宣布)

challenge<,>/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/<,>/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/<,>n.挑战/n.邀请比赛/n.艰巨的任务/n.怀疑/n.质问/vt.反对/vt.公然反抗/vt.向...挑战/vt.对...质疑<,>She accepted the challenge to climb the mountain.<,>她接受了攀登这座山的挑战。<,>The lawyer challenged the witness's testimony.<,>律师对证人的证词提出质疑。<,>This job presents new challenges every day.<,>这份工作每天都有新的挑战。<,>chall(喊叫)+enge→喊叫对抗→挑战<,>change(n.变化)/charge(v.充电)/chancellor(n.大臣)

emit<,>/iˈmɪt/<,>/iˈmɪt/<,>vt.散发/vt.发射/vt.发表<,>The machine emits a high-pitched sound.<,>这台机器发出尖锐的声音。<,>The sun emits light and heat.<,>太阳发出光和热。<,>The official report was emitted yesterday.<,>官方报告于昨日发表。<,>e(出)+mit(送)→送出去→发射<,>omit(v.省略)/admit(v.承认)/remit(v.汇款)

category<,>/ˈkætəɡəri/<,>/ˈkætəɡɔːri/<,>n.种类/n.类/n.类别<,>These books fall into the fiction category.<,>这些书属于小说类。<,>There are five main categories in the competition.<,>比赛有五个主要类别。<,>Which category does this product belong to?<,>这个产品属于哪一类别？<,>cate(向下)+gory(集合)→向下分类→类别<,>catalog(n.目录)/cater(v.迎合)/cathode(n.阴极)
rival<,>/ˈraɪvl/<,>/ˈraɪvəl/<,>adj.竞争的/adj.对抗的/n.竞争对手/n.敌手/n.可与匹敌的人/vt.与...竞争/vt.与...匹敌/vt.比得上<,>They are rival companies in the same industry.<,>他们是同一行业中的竞争公司。<,>She has no rival in the field of classical music.<,>她在古典音乐领域无人能及。<,>He vowed to rival his opponent in the next match.<,>他发誓要在下一场比赛中与对手一较高下。<,>riv(河岸)+al→站在河的两岸→对抗<,>revival(n.复兴/n.复苏)/arrival(n.到达/n.到来)/riven(adj.撕裂的/adj.分裂的)

intend<,>/ɪnˈtend/<,>/ɪnˈtɛnd/<,>vt.想要/vt.打算/vt.意思是/vt.打算使<,>I intend to finish the project by Friday.<,>我打算在周五前完成这个项目。<,>What do you intend by that remark?<,>你说那句话是什么意思？<,>The book is intended for beginners.<,>这本书是为初学者准备的。<,>in(向内)+tend(伸展)→内心伸展→打算<,>intent(n.意图/adj.专心的)/extend(v.延伸/v.扩大)/pretend(v.假装/v.伪装)

snap<,>/snæp/<,>/snæp/<,>v.咔嚓折断/v.啪地绷断/v.吧嗒一声/v.猛咬/v.厉声说话/v.怒声责骂/adj.仓促的/adj.突然的/n.吧嗒声/n.快照<,>The branch snapped under the weight of the snow.<,>树枝在雪的重量下咔嚓一声折断了。<,>She snapped at the waiter for being slow.<,>她因为服务员动作慢而厉声责骂。<,>Let's take a quick snap before we leave.<,>我们离开前快拍张照片吧。<,>sn(蛇)+ap(阿婆)→蛇咬阿婆发出啪嗒声<,>slap(v.拍打/n.掌击)/snip(v.剪断/n.剪下)/snapdragon(n.金鱼草)
